title: Extremely Poor service with Swiss when something goes wrong.
review_text:
Looking forward to my Swiss flight on the 21st November. My troubles started with the cancellation of my flight to Zurich due to adverse snowfall there. I went to the Swiss Airside representative, they were under a lot of pressure. As I was on an interconnecting flight to Sao Paulo they took details and passed it on to a rebooking clerk. Please note that the re-booking clerk had absolutely no clue or care of the size/logistics of Heathrow. I was rebooked on a flight to Paris with Air France from Terminal 4, whilst I was in Terminal 2. This wouldn't be a problem if they adequate time between terminals, navigating security, and getting to the boarding gate. I had less than 30 minutes to do this, which clearly was not possible. Bear in mind I was airside at terminal 2 at the time. I went back to the check in desks, to ask there advice, they cancelled the Air France flight and arranged a LATAM airlines flight to Sao Paulo, however the rebookings clerk really didn't have a clue or care or both. I was sent to terminal 3 which is close (5/10 minutes apart), HOWEVER the reservation had NO booking reference or ticket number, the checkin staff at LATAM had already left checkin as it closed 90 minutes before departure. I had no way of getting on the LATAM flight as I couldn't obtain a boarding pass. 

My wife who wasn't travelling with me had found a British Airways Flight to Sao Paulo on the airlines website with availability to fly at 22:10 that night. Plenty of time to get on the flight. I then returned to terminal 2 to the Swiss Air check in. Other customers were also there that had been allocated new flights that were impossible to catch. By the time I was seen, over 25 minutes later, I was told the only flights avialable would be the following night. I asked them to check the BA flight, which they said was now sold out.

This is a very abridged version of events. Whilst I absolutely accept that weather events happen, this is when if this was even half managed properly, I would have been on a flight that night and not missed a days holiday in Argentina and the ongoing consequences.

To add insult to injury I did place a complaint with Swiss, along with expenses and twice the response has been dismissed.

It is when something goes wrong that the measure of a business is brought to the fore. This goes to show that SWISS falls short, and is not a quality Airline who resects their customers.

title: Horrible experience - no food left in business class
review_text: I fly 250 hours a year and I love Switzerland and the Swiss way so I thought I‚Äôd book my family on Swiss air business ,  I booked 2 business and 3 economy seats.  Absolutely horrible in both sections. My kids and wife in the back said the flight attendant was swearing in French, moved my daughters medical supplies to another cabin to find space for another guest - then in emergency we couldn‚Äôt find our medical bag. In business they didn‚Äôt have enough food for my mother who sat next to me. They had four options and by the time they got to us they said ‚Äú sorry all the guests in front have taken all the meals, only meat options left. ‚Äú. Then I asked about how to drop my arm rest and was told‚Äù you can‚Äôt ‚Äú then I did it myself after 2-3 mins of playing with it. Talked to the manager and supervisor and he didn‚Äôt care either and said ‚Äúour flight crew don‚Äôt even have enough food we just eat the left overs ‚Äú. That was their response. I spent $25,000 cad on this flight for 11 hours.  Emirates is the best and they ruin your experience with every other airline.  Sears were horrible too,

title: SWISS AIR CREW PUT OUR BABY‚ÄôS HEALTH IN DANGER ü§±üèª
review_text:
Swiss air‚Äôs stewardesses took out of the airplane our baby bag just minutes before take-off LEAVING OUR BABY WITHOUT HER SPECIAL MEDICAL FORMULA, DIAPERS and necessities FOR 8+ HOURS. 
The reason for that? A Swiss lady wanted to occupy our (!!) seat at the window, so while we were a few meters away (talking to my husband who sat in different row, whereabout the same stewardesses were informed by me at boarding) according to the lady, the stewardesses assisted her and without asking, removed from our dedicated seat (!!!) our butterfly shaped baby bag and full baby bottle and gave it to the airport staff just closing the door and sent it back to the airport, not caring about our desperate complain. üò¢ 

In our final destination our checked-in luggage was also missing, including rest of our special baby formula, leaving her without her nutrition at night in a foreign country. ü•∫

DOES SWISS AIR CARE ABOUT BABIES and will take the responsibility for their stewardesses of flight LX2255 or let them ruin other families‚Äô trip again? üòû

Are Swiss stewardesses entitled to remove the onboard passengers‚Äô belongings from their designated seats without their consents? Are Swiss stewardesses allowed to let a passenger to occupy other passengers‚Äô seat while it is standing a few meters away?

title: Thank you! Great job !
review_text: I haven't had such a great experience of punctuality, friendliness, simplicity and professionalism in a while. I will prefer Swiss Air from now on. Thank you. You made traveling agr√©able these days.

title: Never experienced SUCH A TERRIBLE customer service
review_text: If I could give 0 starts, I would. INSALY BAD customer service!! No help at all with my questions about adding sport luggage. Unclear and contradicting policies on the website. When contacting customer service (through phone and chat, have probably contacted them at least 10 times over multiple weeks), they did not even try to answer the question and kept sending me to other airlines while my flight is operated by Swiss. Even ending the chat of hanging up mid-conversation. Never experienced SUCH BAD customer service!!!!!

title: seems that Swiss systematically cheats customers when they book seat reservations
review_text: Swiss sells seat reservations but doesn't deliver the promised service. This happened 4 times in a row (Sept 3.. and Dept. 23.) Swiss makes no refunds and doesn't respond to complaints but charges you for the reservations (4).

title: Absurd price for luggage
review_text:
I am writing to request a refund for the absurd fee I was forced to pay at the airport. 

The situation was as follows: I bought a ticket and it only included a 23kg bag, but I needed to add another 23kg bag -  I tried several options on the Swiss website, but it would only allow me to upgrade to Business and not add another bag because I had a flight with another airline.

That's when I decided to call and they told me that it would be possible to add another bag but that I could only do it at the airport. I called another airline too to check about it and they said that they didn't even have access to the flight details (because I had bought it with Swiss). On the phone with SWISS, they assured me that I could buy the second 23kg bag and put in a Request note that I had requested the bag before but it wasn't possible to add it because I could only do it at the airport, but they assured me that they wouldn't charge the airport fees because I had requested it before the 48 hours. At the airport they charged me a ridiculous fee of ‚Ç¨260 to check in an extra 23kg bag. Not even the things I have in the bag are worth that amount, but I needed to take all my clothes with me. 

I explained everything that had happened to the lady at the airport and she told me that it would be possible for me to have added the bag over the phone (but they told me no) with this attendant and that even if I went to the airport to buy the checked bag days before the flight, they would charge the same amount because it was the airport fee she said and it wouldn't make any difference if I had gone earlier. She said that I did have the right to complain writing the email and she encouraged me because n it even the crew staff agreed of this fee, that this was absurd what they did to me. What option would I have???? I tried to add it days before the flight and it would be blocked in the system, the lady assured me that it would be ‚Ç¨70 to check it in (which is the normal price) I demand that they evaluate my case and refund me this outrageous amount and be fair with me).

I paid money that I couldn't afford to check in this bag, I'm in a very bad emotional state because I had to make this trip and they still do this to me. 

Please be aware of your real customers, I continued to use Swiss and I hope you value your service, I am really sad about this situation.

Hope to hear from you soon with a solution,
Kind regards,
Amanda

title: Most appalling service ever. OK if you manage to get on your plane, but no customer service or care if you don't. Avoid,
review_text:
The worst customer service possible. Our flight to South Africa was connecting in Zurich. Our flight from Manchester was delayed and we did not make or connection. We told staff at check and asked what would happen, they were totally indifferent. When we arrived at nearly 10.30 in Zurich, it was chaos, no one could tell us what we should do. We received different information from swiss air representatives. Eventually we were told to book a hotel, pay ourselves and we would be re-imbursed. We would also be booked on the following days plane. 
We were. Rather than a direct flight, we were booked to Milan. Addis Ababba and then Johannesburg. We were all split up (party of 4) and had to sit individually. All we asked told us our bags would arrive. We decided to get them back and book them back onto the Ethiopian Airways flight we were being put on. Only to find our luggage was lost and they didn't know where it was! We arrived a day and a half late onto a dream safari holiday.
Swiss Air would not pay for the delay, because they said it was not their fault. They did however agree to pay our overnight expenses, although for some reason it wasn't the amount we provided receipts for - and they sent links that did not work. After 4 months, I have still not been able to get them to pay the money they agreed to pay. There are no numbers to ring and emails are not responded to, other than there is a long delay in responding due to the high workloads - no surprise with the customer service they provide. It is no joke.

title: Unreasonable and profiteering
review_text: Incredibly bad customer experience. I purchased flights using my married name but couldn‚Äôt update my passport in time (for reasons outside of my control). They refuse to update the name on their system nor will they refund my flight. I paid ¬£870 originally for a London-Cape town economy ticket and replacement now costs ¬£2,000, so I need to pay ¬£2,870 for one flight! Their customer service is abrupt and rude and they cannot be bothered to address any issues to assist a customer. Never using them again.

title: Economy seats passing off as business class!!!
review_text: First the plane was Air Baltic on the first leg which I didn't anticipate though my company paid for SWISS business class. The second leg was operated by SWISS. However in both legs the seats were purely economy with limited leg room and the only difference is the middle seat is blocked. No TV no entertainment and the food sucks. One hard bread, salty quiche and diluted coffee ( o cappuccino ). These are the worst business class seats I've ever taken and no way I will take Swiss again on business. Over priced and a scam!!!

title: Not the SWISS that once was
review_text:
Swiss - What happened to your Customer Service???
Outsourcing your call center to India wasn't a smart move. Your booking system on your website says one story, your Customer Service people say another!End result? YOU are responsible for BOTH!
Train your people, partners and outsourced representatives BETTER. You should be ashamed of the drop in the level of customer service you used to be famous for.

title: Dont fly Swiss Air.
review_text: 8h+ delay. rerouted tru Bryssel. Making 14h travel to 24h travel. They refuse compensation. Flight was from Cape Town whit one stop in Zurich. Now tow stops and 24h. and no Compensation. Flight ticket was 600Euro so not free.

title: Never again! Watch out people!
review_text: I want to complain about my flight from Zurich to Buenos. The entertainment on board wasn't working for the whole flight, which I can understand bad things happen sometimes, but on a 17h journey, really? It was such a long flight and we were told about that when we were already queuing up at the gate. So I had no time not even to download netflix shows or whatsover, the least you could've done was to offer free wifi plus the food was spoiled. As soon as I had dinner, I felt sick and I had food poisoning for the next few days, which disrupted my trip in Buenos Aires. I'm flying back with you in January and I'm already anxious to think about that. I take anxiety medicine and can't sleep on planes, so the journey was a complete nightmare as there was nothing to do, feeling sick. I've always heard nice things, and there were even cheaper options but I wanted to fly with you for the first time and by faaaaar it was the worst experience I've ever had. I'm trying to get in touch with them to complain and ask for a compensation, their chat assistant is a complete joke, they're so useless and rude!! Instead of helping you out, they send copy and paste messages and try to end the chat every minute. Then I try to complain on the link the assistant provided, and the feedback message doesn't send when you click submit. I'm shocked with Swiss Airlines service, honestly. Awful experience from the flight experience to chat assistant.

title: Unprofessional handling with passengers
review_text:
The worst approach ever, today the 07 of December 2024, we arrived a bit late due to train delays and we were looking stressed and tired.
We stood at the line for check-in. It was our turn at the counter and the guy at the check in desk said what's wrong? What's wrong??? Nothing wrong we want to check in, he said yeah but you look stressed out, I say yes sir we had a couple of train delays. He was so rude and mean for no reason to us just because we looked stressed out ?? Why?? We talked to him very respectfully. To be honest I also work in hotel as receptionist but I never approach people with this unprofessional way. Educate your employees please really that's shame.

title: No meals, no snacks, and no flight on time.
review_text:
Ticket promised a meal, but they will not give you meal as promised. No snacks nothing. They are looking to save money.

One meal from Montreal to Zurich. No snacks.

No Meal from Zurich to Cairo. And no snacks.

They don't fly on time, late 1 hour 40 minutes from Montreal flight. 

I will never fly with them again.

title: Don't fly Swiss!
review_text:
Complete lack of integrity. Promised reimbursement for our rebooked flight from Zurich. # people in our party. We had to pay for overnight stay in Zurich, not cheap, with a promise of reimbursement. Spent over $1000.00 and only $330.00 reimbursed.
They do not follow-up on communications.

title: Swiss Airlines forgot that they don't only "deliver" people, they are supposed to deliver their luggage at the same time
review_text:
Landed in Barcelona with Swiss Airlines last Monday after a long personal trip from Singapore, to visit my elderly mother before Christmas. Made it through the Zurich stopover on time, but my priority-tagged luggage (including Christmas gifts!) was, for some reason, booked in the following flight, 5 hours later.ü§∑‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è

That was the last I knew about them...

Fast forward four days and countless calls with customer service: each rep tells me something different. First, my bags are "en route" with delivery in 48-72 hours, despite the initial information telling me that they would be delivered the next morning. Then, they're "still within the 72-hour window" (which apparently has no defined start time and seems to be different from my landing time). One rep says a local company is delivering my bags, another says it's Groundforce delivering them. I even got a second email TODAY saying the delivery company NOW has my luggage... four days after the first email said the same thing. ü§Ø Honestly, it feels like they're either clueless or lying to my face. Either way, it's not a good look. This isn't even about delayed luggage; it's about broken promises and a complete disregard for the customer experience.

Swiss Airlines, you delivered me safely and on time (thank you,) but you failed spectacularly on bringing my baggage at the same time which, remember, is ALSO part of the service. And your customer support? Let's just say it needs a serious upgrade. And this also looks bad for Star Alliance as a whole.

As of now, my bags are still lost in some kind of Swiss Airlines/Groundforce timespace distortion vortex, and I'm flying back to Singapore tomorrow. Whether the suitcases show up today or never, you've lost a customer Swiss International Air Lines.

Brands live or die on the strength of their perception among customers.

hashtag#DelayedLuggage hashtag#CustomerServiceFail hashtag#FeelingLiedTo

title: Avoid SWISS on longer flights as they operate aircraft from stone age
review_text:
Well well. Okay, in the end, SWISS is Lufthansa Group that should have been warning enough. Its a pity but I read some good things about SWISS in advance, and so I was not prepared for what I discoverd. First of all, they operate those nearly 7 hours flight from Zurich to Dubai with an Airbus A330-300 aircraft that has been assembled shortly after the end of stonage. Ok, using old aircrafts thats typically part of Lufthansa DNA.

This plane has so little seat space its rediculous ‚Äì under your feet there is hust half the normal space, as they have placed a metall box there that contains I think the entertainment systems electronics. So, if you are taller than 1,65 m, you wont find much space for the next 7 hours of flight. The reason ‚Ä¶ when this aircraft was taken into the fleet, passengers entertainment ment just radio programs that a pax could find and direct from his armrest and there was a CRT monitor on the ceiling showing movies for all the eco guests. When SWISS updated the cabin, they went for personal tv screens however it seems they had no other solution than putting the needed electronics below the seats. This could be a tolerable solution in the year 2010 but in 2024 its rediculous. An airline that offers its passengers on a 7 hours flight such a torture with lack of foot room can't earn any positive points.

Plus, the seats are small as well. As a passenger sitting on  the aisle seats, the arm of my neighbor from the left all the time touched my breast und my left arm was sleeping after the fli flight as I found no place where to rest it. And I am not tall, I am small !

title: Service Disaster
review_text:
The hotline of SWISS (Senator Service) is getting worse and worse, I had to change a flight and had to call several times to solve the problem. Some agents just hung up once they realized the issue was a bit more time consuming, some were absolutely not able to solve the issue and some did not even listen to me, although I asked them to listen. Just a disaster, at the end I had to give up‚Ä¶.

I understand the CEO of Bulgari and his review that made a big round in social media. A pity Swiss is not able to improve their service level - at the moment they are worse than any low cost carrier.

title: Amazing
review_text: First time I have flown with this company. We were sat in economy! It was absolutely amazing. Lovely comfortable seats, super clean, lovely staff, but the food for me was the best food I have EVER had on a flight. Better than Emirates and virgin. I will always be using this company if they fly to places I want to go. The tomato juice they served was amazing.

title: Broken seat - no refund
review_text:
I initially booked an economy seat and paid an additional 132 CHF for extra legroom‚Äîa premium cost, but I wanted a more comfortable flight. At boarding, Swiss announced an opportunity to upgrade to premium economy, which I decided to do for an additional 480 CHF. At the gate, the staff informed me that I would be eligible for a refund on the previously booked economy seat reservation.

Unfortunately, my experience in premium economy was far from satisfactory. The seat I was assigned was broken, repeatedly returning to the upright position, leaving me with a very uncomfortable flight. While the staff attempted to assist, there was no resolution, and I had to endure the broken seat for the entire journey.

After the trip, I contacted Swiss to address the issue. After some time, they responded, agreeing to refund the seat reservation fee for economy but declining to compensate for the premium economy upgrade. Despite several emails back and forth, I am still waiting for a resolution. I believe it is unfair to pay for a premium seat that was faulty. I did not request a refund for the entire flight, only the difference for the upgrade, but I feel ignored and extremely disappointed. I am still awaiting a response.

title: Makes Spirit Airlines look like a luxury airline
review_text: Horrible!!!!!  We were scheduled to fly Dublin to Zurich, Zurich to Tampa, USA.  As we are boarding the first leg, we find out the second leg is canceled.  No one and I mean NO ONE had answers.  Once we get to Zurich, we waited in line 4 hours at Transfer B counter with everyone else from this flight to rebook.  Sure, they gave us a hotel and meal voucher, but their level of service is abysmal.   They finally rebooked us on AA the following day missing a day of work and having to pay for more airport parking.  Nope, never again.

title: Rip Off
review_text:
My wife and I were scheduled to depart Zurich for Los Angeles connecting to a flight to San Diego, our home.  Four hours before boarding we received a text from Swiss air telling us our flight is cancelled.  We called Amex who we had booked the round trip flight through,  and they arranged for us to fly the next day on United Air, one of the Swiss Air  "partners",  but to San Francisco and on to San Diego. There were no First Class seats on those flights, so we were put in Premium Economy and Economy.  It was the first time we had ever booked First Class.  We went to Swiss Air at the airport and they looked at other options for us, but none was better. They told us the reason for the cancellation was there was no airplane!  We got the dinner voucher and the one night hotel stay as the airline is required to do.  However Swiss Air has refused to compensate us for 1) the Flight Cancellation within 5 hours of departure, 2) the missed connection to our original United flight from LAX to SAN and 3) the downgrade of our original purchase from Business class on both flights to Premier Economy and Economy class  all of which are outlined in the Passenger Bill of Rights we requested and received at Zurich airport. When we called Amex and asked about a refund their response was, "well, you got home, didn't you. We could have booked the flights with a broker for less money, but chose Amex travel as it seemed a more reliable option. We have appealed to the Swiss Aviation authority but have yet to hear from them.
I will never book Swiss Air again.

title: Strange Encounter
review_text: had a strange encounter with a steward here. dropped my phone in between the cracks of the seats so i had to bend over from the aisle inwards on the floor to the seats to grab it. my leg was jutting out onto the aisle. this one steward just rammed the serving caddy straight into it and kept going at it as though it was something that was meant to be rolled over. when i told him my leg was there he did not say anything but gave a poker face. i had to tell him twice before he realised. he didnt say anything about it though. it didn't hurt but i thought the standard was to apologise or at least say something like not noticing? i'd be okay with either. he just kept quiet about it. the fact that they expected to just roll over something they thought was blocking the caddy was just so strange to me. 2 other ladies got red wine spilled onto them by accident during the after-meal cleanup. service recovery for them was great though; they were offered first class PJs to replace their wet pants

title: Horrible Customer Service
review_text: Swiss airline is absolutely horrible at customer service. They have no understanding whatsoever of their own airline. We had a flight changed because their flight had been delayed so we got a complimentary change, everything was confirmed and we were set to go then all of a sudden we get an urgent email asking to call them. We call them and then all of a sudden we don‚Äôt have a flight back even though my whole booking has been confirmed, the guy on the other line was not helpful at all just kept asking us to fill out a form of complaint or refund the ticket meaning that we would have to rebook at double the price. I have gone on their website and they have plenty of space on planes flying out on the exact same date but they are not willing to change it due to rebooking flights are different to direct booking flights. Absolutely disgraceful I don‚Äôt recommend less

title: A disastrous experience on all sides of the flight
review_text: This review is on behalf of my Dad as he flew this airlines to Geneva for family related matter. Unfortunately his experience was very poor. Seats were very uncomfortable and tiny, not wide enough, food was not good, The price for the ticket was very not worth the price. Staff were polite but were noisy when handling food. Food had absolutely no taste to it. I would not recommend this airline at all. Also, they did such a poor job making the amenity kit, We will most likely not be flying with this airline again. This airline has completely went downhill. If you want to fly to Geneva I would stay away from Swiss Air and use a different airline at all costs.

title: Airlines not meant for COPD Patients with Breathing Machines
review_text:
I am a COPD patient carrying a Oxygen Concentrator.
Swiss Airline Airport Officer refused that I carry this very important Machine with me.
This Gaghet has no Gas bottle, nor liquid Oxygen.
This Gaghet is approved by FAA but Swiss Airport officer being very arrogant didnot intrested what FAA recommends. He said we are not FAA but Swiss. 
After more than an 30 minutes, we contacted the Captain and Crew of the Plane, who finally decided that I could fly with my Breathing Machine. Therefore the flight was 30 Minutes delayed.
The serice on the plane itself was quite OK.
The seats are extremely narrow and unconfortable.
Swiss Officer must learn to respect the customer. For this reason I will not fly with Swiss again. For COPD patients should have to go through lot of burocracy and fill in forms with endless stupid questions and have it confirmed and signed by the Doctor.

title: Standby seat nightmare without compensation.
review_text:
Terrible service. Ticket didnt have  a seat allocated on it after printing. Was told I was on standby with a business class ticket. After the whole plane boarded I was told I could sit in an economy class seat and would be compensated. Upon lodging compensation I was told there is no compensation.

Terrible service will not be using again.

title: Swiss Air, remover the old days?
review_text: I would never travel to Europe again on any American airline. I have flown SAS, Lufthansa, Italian Airlines and KLM in the past and now I add Swiss Air. My flight landed in Zurich where I had a short layover. It has been a long time, way before Covid since I was treated so royally. The service top notch, the food fantastic and the comfort excellent. Granted I was in business class but it felt like first class. And to top it off, the Zurich Airport was like a five star hotel.  Modern, clean, comfortable, with updated technology everywhere for everyone. Courteous staff, helpful and efficient. This is the only way to fly to Europe IMHO

title: Swiss changing flights and then ignoring refund request (no money, no communication)
review_text:
On 19th August 2024 I purchased a flight from PRG to SSH from Swiss for 1st November 2024.  I did not use any dealer, I bought the tickets directly on the Swiss web site. I payed around 4000CZK. I payed in CZK. The receipt was also in CZK.

On 2nd October 2024 Swiss sent me an email that they want to change my flight. The change was more than 3 hours. They changed my flight to land at SSH at 18:15 (previously it was supposed to be 14:40). In the email they offered either to accept the itinerary or request a refund. Three and half hours is a lot so I decided to ask for a refund. Swiss confirmed the refund request on 2nd October 2024.

I did not receive any money for following 2 week so I filled their form and ask what was happening. They replied they I am not qualified for a full refund and that they will return only part of the money and in CHF (not in CZK). What??? Honestly, it looked more like an AI generated reply.  I replied to them that I do not agree. Since that I filled another form and ask what was happening.

Today is 23rd November 2024 (52 days after the refund request). I have no money and no reply from Swiss. Absolutely nothing. No information online. My experience is that even low cost air lines treated me better than Swiss. Most likely, this was most my last purchase with Swiss.

title: Poor experience with Swiss
review_text:
Swiss became a really bad airline. Honestly, prices went up significantly since 2020 but the service is a misunderstanding. The flight we were supposed to take was canceled on the day of travel. We got rebooked to the next day, super early flight via Warsaw. No information about the hotel. Tried to contact Swiss, long waiting times and no answer. Went to Lufthansa since it's the mother company, answer: pay hotel yourself and then request reimbursement on Swiss website. They couldn't propose other connection despite on that day there were multiple flights to Warsaw, Munich, Frankfurt or Dusseldorf where it was totally possible to change to Zurich. 
To me, this was a final call to write a public review; I have traveled with Swiss over 10 times in last 4 months. Not a single flight was on time. It's very disappointing and I know I will look for alternatives to Swiss flying to/from Z√ºrich.

title: Flying with swiss was üëå love swiss airline
review_text: Swiss flight was brilliant, quality service, friendly efficent staff. I would recommend anyone to fly with them for high standards of service.

title: Awesome Experience
review_text: I just wanted to leave a good review for this airline as the service was incredible. It was a standard economy flight with a connection in Zurich. Our flight left about 30 mins late, and I didn‚Äôt think there was any way in hell I would be making the connecting flight as we landed at 5:10 and the next flight was scheduled to depart at 5:15. When we landed though, the 7 people with that connecting flight were escorted directly by shuttle straight off the plane via the tarmac to the next gate, and they delayed the flight until we arrived. It was very smooth. And even more to my surprise, my checked luggage made it as well! Great job Swiss Air. Also, the food was great on the flight as well.

title: Don‚Äôt take Swiss unless you want to be harassed and lost luggage.
review_text: Disgusting airline. I had a blanket they gave us around my neck and the host ripped it off my neck. For one don‚Äôt touch me. For two ask for it back. That was TO Greece . And they cancelled the flight hours before from Greece to Toronto, and put us on a really disorganized makeup flight where they lost our luggage. Never go with Swiss. They won‚Äôt compensate us either and it‚Äôs been since September. They don‚Äôt care about their customers.

title: The "excellence" of the bottom.
review_text:
Very sad..Swiss Air has become one of the worst airlines in Europe after the covid. 
Everything is bad! Price, seats, legroom, stewardess behavior,  awful food,offered chocolate changed to the cheapest chocolate quality, business Lounge in airports , customer service general...Bad , bad, bad..They advertise themselves as excellence and what you actually get is arrogant behavior and cheapy services.

title: Very bad customer support on refund process
review_text:
My flight was canceled a few hours before the departure, and when I requested the refund (because the alternative didn't fit our schedule), it took 4 months to have all refunded.
During that time I was unable to get a proper answer from the customer support, either via e-mail either via phone. (I did more that 2 dozens of e-mails, ticket and calls....). Right now I am on my way to sue the company.

title: Swiss Airlines, Lost of Swissness
review_text: This was our return flight from Zurich to Bangkok. The check in is wonderful, professional and in time handled. The airline lounge in terminal E is great. We had middle seats and because my wife is short, she could not reach the floor (not the first time) but the crew was helpful to provide extra pillows to overcome this. Be an overnight flight leaving Zurich just after 6:00 PM, one is looking forward to the meal service, which is to put it mildly an absolute disaster, no taste, no flavour, dry and so called designed by a well known Swiss chef. The overnight kit is a joke, a thin plastic pouch with the essentials which is totally not business class oriented. Sleep arrangements are basic. The entertainment option is with old movies and little choice. Breakfast is the hammer. Another disappointment. Old and rubbery bread, eggs lukewarm and the entire presentation is average. In my case not served as ordered on the form submitted by departure. I think the airline needs to readdress what Business Class means, who flies that class, what are their expectations and see what the competition does.

title: Swiss Aireline
review_text:

title: Don‚Äôt use Swiss
review_text:
Please do not use Swiss International Air Lines!

Their service is absolutely appalling and communication is atrocious!

We have filed for compensation 23rd of September and we was disappointmented with the unfair outcome and the appalling response from their consultant Unaisi Gaunavinaka.

Our flight was delayed on their behalf which made us miss our connection flight. On our arrival to our connecting flight, we received no help, no accommodation and were stranded at the airport for the night.

After waiting the night, we were finally able to get some sort of help,however, the member of staff was rude and not apologetic. After confirming the flight that we rebooked over the phone, they advised us to contact Swiss customer care online and give us the EC 261/2004 compensation information to get compensated.

Not to mention, on our return flight, our first flight was delayed too. Fortunately we made our connecting flight, however our suitcases didn't and we didn't receive our suitcase until a week later.

When the suitcase arrived, we were missing one and we received no further communication regarding it, until another week passed and we finally received our missing suitcase.

The consultant said we are not entitled for compensation because of the country was that your journey departed and arrived in countries in which the regulation EC 261/2004 does not apply and that consequently said the regulation does not apply to your itinerary.

The consultant was not able to provide us with the EC 261/2004 policy on their website and answer why the airport staff gave us the
EC 261/2004 information to get compensated if we are not entitled to it.

Instead of asking our question, the consultant decided just to close my case, which I found very rude.

I have sent the appeal for the compensation since 22nd of October (NEARLY A MONTH) and not still not responded and ignoring us.

This whole thing has been going on for almost 3 months now and all we after is a reasonable compensation for the trouble we experienced which is not our fault!

title: CREW DOES NOT SEEM TO HAVE EXPERIENCE WITH BABIES!
review_text: I travelled from Brazil to Zurich with my 5-month daughter. The crew asked me to woke her up every tiny single detail. There was a situation that crew touched my daughter without my permission, as well touched her hands. Probably they do not know how many times a baby on her age put her the hands in the mouth. It was disgusting. I flew with #Lufthansa (Frankfurt- Sao Paulo), which the crew has so much more experience with babies, It was a far away better experience.

title: Worst airline overall
review_text: The worst  Airline i ever been. Boston-Zurich-Dubai on business class. Totally wasted my money but that was my LAST one. Zero Star

title: Far from the best
review_text: Call me a spoiled customer, but my experience with Swiss Air demonstrates that they are very, very far from the standards set by the likes of Singapore Airlines. Swiss Air indeed offers clean cabin, decent food and beverage selection, and convenience from technology advancement; but these are no longer a plus, since every airline is able to do it. What's lacking here is a cabin crew with the basic passion in taking care of customers, a.k.a. doing their job. How about putting on some smiles and starting to treat customers equally? If not, at least pretend to.

title: the nastiest crew member nathalie
review_text:
My partner and I decided to treat ourselves to a small holiday. Our airport journey was without any problem until we entered the Swiss Airlines aircraft and were met by the nastiest crew member reiffers.
An incredibly rude woman with the worst attitude possible. It was absolute chaos! 
nathalie was extremely unprofessional and tried to harass us in the maximum possible way. Her behaviour was so disappointing. She was really arrogant and extremely difficult to contact or obtain any basic support. We were shocked by the poor service and disgusting attitude of this lady.
reiffers refused to give me her name due to the fact she knew she was being vile and we would be making a complaint about her. When I asked for her name to report her vile behaviour, she refused and hid her name tag. Clearly, this is a tactic to avoid accountability for her rudeness. I heard her colleague call her nathalie. reiffers if you ever read this, we cannot fathom why you felt so empowered to act so disrespectfully towards paying customers. We hope your job gives you some sense of importance because your behaviour was disgraceful. The worst employee in attitude and a horrendous flight attendant.
For anyone flying with Swiss Airlines - reiffers is an abusive person, who looks down and violates the rights of people who do not dress or look a ‚Äúcertain way‚Äù.

title: Bad customer service and lots of cancellations
review_text: Two cancelled flights and rebooked to a 10h flight (normally 2-3h). Still in the process of a refund but only receive long respond times and bad answers. Definitely would go for KLM next time.

title: Beware

title: Don‚Äôt buy flex tickets‚Äîit's a scam!
review_text:
This is the worst company we've dealt with so far. We booked flexible tickets specifically to have the option to change our return date if needed, paying extra for the assurance that we could rebook easily. According to the policy, date changes are supposed to be free with this type of ticket‚Äîonly requiring us to pay any fare difference for the new date. However, this feels like a complete scam: the flights they offered for rebooking were nowhere near the website‚Äôs standard prices. While we found flights on their site for ‚Ç¨1,200, the lowest fare they proposed us was ‚Ç¨6,200.

Ultimately, we had to cancel our flights, losing half the cost, even though the cancellation was supposedly free of charge. They seem determined to find ways to exploit customers at every turn.

To make matters worse, customer service was completely unhelpful.

title: No refund for booked premium economy and re-booked standard economy due to Swiss flight being lat
review_text: Avoid this airline at all costs. The customer service does not exist, shame for an airline that praises itself as one of the world‚Äôs best. We booked premium economy for our last overseas trip to the US, but due to Swiss plane not taking off at all, we had to be rebooked to another flight, and not to Premium Economy but to a standard economy, last row of the plane. So, just to recap: paid for 2 tickets premium economy, flew regular economy: Do you think Swiss Airlines will reimburse? Well, think again and try to talk to their non existing customer service. Lost easily 1400 CHF if not more and flew very uncomfortably for 11 hrs. I will never NEVER fly Swiss again, and would encourage you to book with someone else, anyone else. Just pathetic and incompetent, real shame.

title: Rude and Over-rated.
review_text: Rude flight attendants who really don't know the rules.  It was a hot sunny day while the plane was at the gate and boarding passengers.  The plane was still parked at the gate. Evidently, no one told her in training that this is required only for taxi, take off and landing.  So the plane was just hot as hell with all it's window shades up.   Just plane dumb.  Swiss is highly overrated as its Trip Advisor score indicates - just "fair".  Fly it's partner Singapore Airlines - they run circles around Swiss

title: Worst Airline ever - Rude and Arrogant staff running a scam
review_text:
I had booked a flight with Swiss Airlines from Delhi to Birmingham, with a layover in Zurich. Unfortunately, our journey was marred by multiple issues that I believe Swiss airlines already knew about and hence they are running this scam.

1.Missed Connecting Flight:  Due to a delayed departure from Delhi, we missed our connecting flight in Zurich, resulting in an 8-hour delay. We were stranded at Zurich Airport , Despite our inquiries, we received little support or assistance from the airline staff at Zurich Airport.
2.
Rebooking Only to London
: Instead of rebooking us directly to Birmingham, as per our original booking, Swiss Airlines only managed to rebook us on a flight to London, causing further complications in our travel plans.
3.
Confusion and Delay with Ground Transportation
: Upon arrival in London, I was informed that our onward travel from London to Birmingham would be by train. However, after passing through immigration and collecting our baggage, I discovered that the arrangement was actually a bus transfer instead of a train. This unexpected change, combined with only 90 minutes to manage immigration, baggage, and ground transport details, added substantial stress and delay to our journey.
4.
Delay in Arrival at Final Destination
: Originally, we were scheduled to arrive at Birmingham Airport at 8:00 am, but due to the series of delays, we did not reach home until 9:45 pm‚Äîa delay of nearly 14 hours.
5.
Unprofessional Conduct by Airline Staff
: Throughout this ordeal, we encountered rude and unprofessional behaviour from both the in-flight crew and the ground staff at Zurich Airport. This treatment only added to our frustration, as the staff seemed indifferent to the concerns of passengers affected by the delays.

Its defiantly a scam and Swiss Airlines are running this scam to steal money from its victims. The flight from Delhi LX-147 delays giving very little time to catch the connecting flight to Birmingham (LX-420) which is from another Terminal at Zurich Airport , even if the flight lands on scheduled time 06:20 AM , it is not possible to catch the connecting flight which departs at 07:00 AM. Even if someone manage to reach the gates, it is never possible for them to transfer the luggage to other airplane in such a short time, hence its a scam. Similar is the case with connecting flights to London Heathrow airport.

I have registered the complaint but have no trust in this scam airlines if they'll refund and compensate me.
Because of them, My wife and myself missed our offices, my kid missed his school and was extremely distressed .
I want refund and compensation for my family for this harassment, distress caused and precious time lost.

title: Appalling: Swiss air tried their best to ruin our honeymoon.
review_text:
- We paid over ‚Ç¨1500 each months in advance for two return tickets to Sri Lanka from Berlin and NOT ONE SINGLE FLIGHT was operated by Swiss Air.

- Firstly, when our honeymoon was meant to begin, they denied boarding to my wife and I in Berlin because they'd overbooked the flight and they claimed the whole time that it's standard procedure and legal for them to do it. Despite us pointing out that we had two other connecting flights, they denied boarding to us and about 10 or more shocked, distraught, and horrified passengers who couldn't understand why this so-called reputable European airline was treating them like dirt. Swiss Air's practice of "legal 10%" overbooking is utterly disgraceful and completely unethical - a fact they did not deny, but instead dryly pointed to their assertion that it's legal for them to do it - perhaps to quiet those who have their lawyers on speed dial. Swiss Air are essentially selling you something they cannot or will not deliver and are therefore employing scam tactics.

I have never been treated with such contempt by an airline, and that's including the likes of the notorious low cost European airlines. So well done, Swiss. You're officially the worst.
 
- Back at the BER Lufthansa check-in in search of a desperate second option after having been dealt the trauma that our honeymoon is likely in tatters, plus the further embarrassment of exiting security and being forced to pick up our own bag, Lufthansa couldn't offer us anything so they instead approached the good graces of QATAR. It was a lovely, understanding guy from QATAR Airways who ended up delivering a last minute miracle by squeezing us onto a much better and faster QATAR Airways flight. 
In the end, we actually arrived in Colombo earlier than planned due to the great connection with QATAR. This one employee from single-handedly saved our trip whilst nobody from the Lufthansa group seemed willing or able to assist us out of a nightmare situation.

I wish that were the end of my review, but the journey home, which was also meant to be with Swiss Air, was almost equally as awful. 

- Our SriLankan Airlines flight to Mumbai was cancelled so Swiss rebooked us with a SriLankan Airways flight to Frankfurt, but only to Frankfurt. We booked at return trip from Berlin! They also completely failed to notify me of the flight changes. I only noticed because I wanted to make sure we were guaranteed a seat by checking in online, as I assume with great confidence this was their initial unspoken reason for denying us boarding in Berlin (because we didn't give them extra revenue by choosing seats or adding any extras to already overpriced tickets)

- Frantically, with my phone and hotel Wi-Fi, I was able to get through the useless Swiss Air AI-chatbot and explain to an actual human being that they still needed to get us home to Berlin, not Frankfurt.

- If you're still reading this, you're probably as perplexed at how poorly we were treated up to this point.

- The only positive thing I can say about Swiss Air is that they gave us 250‚Ç¨ compensation each, which we used as spending money on our honeymoon, but this aside, I will never, EVER book with Swiss Air again. I'm even going to apply for more compensation since a 17-hour journey with SriLankan airlines is not what I paid for and thought they got us home, it was 12 hours later than planned. (SriLankan is also an airline I'd stay far, far away from)

Bottom line: Swiss Air will take your money then outsource the actual flying to other airlines. They are the worst, the absolute worst. Avoid at all costs.

title: Taking Back Control
review_text:
I write this review to express my deep dissatisfaction with the service my family and I received during our flights and the handling of our subsequent compensation claims. Over the last two years, Swiss Airlines has been our airline of choice for business travel, with my family having exclusively booked, or flown, with Swiss in Business Class, completing 16 Business Class segments from 2023 to 2024. I have been loyal to your airline, even opting for Swiss on a recent transatlantic journey in May. However, after my recent experience, I regret to say that this loyalty has been broken due to what I consider unfair treatment and deceptive practices.

In June, I booked Business Class tickets for my family and me from Malaga, Spain (AGP), to Nice, France (NCE), for the dates June 30 to July 10, 2024. The reservation, totaling ‚Ç¨1,250.37, included four flights operated by Brussels Airlines: SN3734, SN3621, SN3618, and SN3737. Despite making the booking via the Swiss Airlines application and selecting Business Class, Brussels Airlines failed to deliver the promised level of service and subsequently denied compensation. Here are the issues encountered on this trip:

1. Diversion and Denied Assistance
On June 30, our flight to Nice was diverted to Marseille (MRS). Despite being ticketed to Nice, the supervisory flight attendant (Purser) announced in three languages that Brussels Airlines would not provide transportation assistance to the final destination, insisting that all passengers make their own arrangements and submit receipts for reimbursement. This situation left us stranded in a foreign city without the support expected from a Business Class ticket. The Purser, upon noticing passengers recording this announcement, became visibly agitated, which further highlighted the lack of transparency in their handling of the situation. Forced to rent a car, we arrived in Nice 5.5 hours after our scheduled time. I later submitted a claim for compensation and expenses totaling ‚Ç¨258.71 (for car rental, fuel, tolls, and parking), which was denied.

2. Failure to Deliver Business Class Service on Return
On July 10, during our flight from Brussels to Malaga, I was seated in Business Class (Row 1) when Brussels Airlines seated a newborn baby in a car seat in the middle seat beside me. The baby was wonderful, but occupying the middle seat directly contradicted the Swiss Airlines Business Class guarantee of an empty middle seat, as per my reservation and your website. Both flight attendants on board acknowledged the error and agreed that this seating arrangement violated my ticket class terms. Nonetheless, my request for compensation or a refund was dismissed.

This experience did not meet the standards I have come to expect from Swiss Airlines and Brussels Airlines. The contract of service for Business Class was not honored, and both Swiss and Brussels Airlines have declined to offer due compensation for the inconvenience, additional expenses, and breach of the ticket agreement. This is not about tyhe compensation money, but rather the disrespect and disregard for my family. 

Reservation Details and Claims
Reservation ID: WZGHZG
Flight Numbers: SN3734, SN3621, SN3618, SN3737
Claim References: SWISS 2407-LX-06456 and Brussels 2407-SN-03209
Swiss Airlines' denial of my claim disregards the clear violations of service standards and lacks the customer-centered approach I once admired. I understand that I cannot control the outcome of my claims with Swiss and Brussels Airlines, but I can control my future choices. Disappointed by this experience, I have since chosen to purchase transatlantic business class tickets with British Airways instead of Swiss Airlines, representing $2,700 in lost revenue for your airline. This is the only power us passengers have against big airlines like Swiss. I will continue to take my business elsewhere.

title: Refundable ticket not refunded
review_text: Apparently refundable does not really mean refundable for swiss air. Even though #1 I bought a refundable ticket #2 Nowhere in the booking process it says that seats are not refundable despite any refundable ticket you may have bought. Still they will not give me my seat $ back? How am I supposed to know that the seats were not refundable? I would not have bought them had I known. Besides its misleading to have a refundable ticket which is not really 100% refundable without explicitly stating so (not even in the fine print of the terms and conditions). title: Bad experience
review_text: The worse airlines I recently flew with . That  was my first and absolutely last time booking my flight with Swiss airlines. I had a layover in Zurich . The first flight was delayed, so I had to worry for my connecting flight. But this is not even the worst part . They are the strictest airline about the carry on baggage. So I had to check in my small carry on suitcase . And it got delayed in Zurich . It flew to LAX the next day , but they still didn‚Äôt deliver it to me . I had to call few times just to know that they were never even going to deliver my bag to me , since they didn‚Äôt have all the information. And I provided all my information at the airport. So I am praying that I get my baggage soon. But I definitely learned my lesson not to fly Swiss airlines ever again .

title: Very Rude Host
review_text:
Our experience on Swiss Airlines flight LX 161 from Tokyo to Zurich left us disappointed. Originally, we were booked on a direct KLM flight to Amsterdam, which was canceled, forcing us to reroute through Zurich with Swiss and lose a day of work.

The service was notably rude. A specific stewardess (initials G.M.) was dismissive from the start. When my friend politely asked for a snack during this 14-hour flight, she gave him a lecture on why passengers should bring their own food. Eventually, she gave him a sandwich but later insisted he couldn‚Äôt have another, even though the same sandwiches were handed out to other passengers with plenty to spare.

Further, when I requested tea during a water service, I received a sharp ‚Äúabsolutely not.‚Äù Moments later, we saw another passenger receiving Baileys from another steward. This led to a tense exchange where the stewardess scolded her colleague openly in front of all passengers. Throughout the flight, she showed similar disregard for others, lecturing passengers about minor issues and creating an overall uncomfortable atmosphere. A smile was notably absent the entire flight.

While we understand the demands on cabin crew, this level of unprofessionalism was surprising. We hope Swiss Airlines addresses this kind of behavior, as it fell short of basic service standards and made the journey unnecessarily tense.

title: Urgent Complaint about Seating and Humiliating Experience on Flight
review_text:
I am writing to express my deep indignation and dissatisfaction regarding the unacceptable experience I had on my flight to Zurich, number OCAAZG, last Wednesday.

On the morning of my departure, I received my electronic boarding pass confirming my seat 5D. Throughout the day, I received no communication or notice regarding any changes to my reservation, which left me feeling secure about my seat. However, after comfortably settling in, I was abruptly interrupted by a flight attendant who informed me, in a disrespectful manner, that I should not be seated there as that seat belonged to business class.

The shock and embarrassment I felt were immense. I showed her my boarding pass, but she insisted there had been an error, claiming the aircraft's configuration had changed during the day and that I had not been informed of the alteration. How could this possibly be my problem? I did not care about the class of my seat; what troubled me was the fact that the airline had failed to update my reservation correctly!

Instead of receiving a respectful solution, I was forced to get up, exposed and humiliated, while all the other passengers looked on. This situation not only left me embarrassed but also made me feel like an intruder in a place where I should have been welcomed. The lack of consideration and care from Swiss was unacceptable.

It is simply intolerable that an error on the airline's part resulted in such a degrading experience for me. I sincerely hope that Swiss takes the necessary measures to ensure that no passenger has to endure such a humiliating and disrespectful situation again.

title: Atrocious Inflight Service
review_text:
Awful inflight service received from the cabin crew. 
1. Did not receive my dinner (gave them the benefit of the doubt thinking they were just busy so I waited but still nothing) 
2. Got up to speak to someone on the way to the restroom only to find them eating and was told there was only one option left which I agreed to (as if I had a choice - it was either that or starve). Not to mention the flight attendant I spoke to acted as if I was being completely irate for saying ‚Äòyes I would like my dinner please‚Äô in a stern manner.
3. When I returned to my seat, a tray of food was left with a bread roll that was hard as rock and a half eaten salad with the cling wrap clearly torn open which is a massive health violation.

Absolutely unacceptable considering the amount of money spent on that ticket alone (round trip from South Africa to Rome). Needless to say I will not be using Swiss Air in a hurry for any of my international flights.

title: Never book with Swiss Air or Lufthansa

title: Forced to check in hand luggage which is now damaged and irreparable. Offered less than half of the value to replace it.
review_text:
To Whom It May Concern

This was the last response we gave regarding our luggage claim.  The airline admitted they damaged our luggage to no repair after forcing us to check in our hand luggage.

All we asking is for a fair compensation of our damaged luggage. 
¬† 
The value you they offered does not allow us to replace the luggage quality the¬†airline¬†had damaged. They are not taking responsibility for the damaged luggage which they have admitted to damaging.  They insisted we check in our hand luggage due to their plane being to small, the ticket we bought was for 1 check in and 1 hand luggage.  
Our hand luggage would not have been broken if we had been allowed to keep it with us on the plane, this is what we paid for - hand luggage.  On top of this, our luggage set is ruined. On top of this. They should at least pay in full the luggage they broke.  All we are asking is a replacement of the exact piece or similar quality in the same brand.¬†I can't even go into the site (not getting access)  to see what the measly amount they are offering to replace our luggage allows us to buy,¬† I think it is a cheek of the¬†airline, expecting us to "pay in" to replace luggage the¬†airline¬†has damaged.

title: Swiss Air has huge charges for flight changes
review_text: Be aware that Swiss Air  charge 58CHF for each change made to a flight.  I had to make 2 changes so my 50 minute flight ended up being ridiculously expensive.  Be sure to read the fine print when booking.

title: Sloppy, cheap and nasty
review_text:
Plane was supposed to fly from Geneva to Zurich, then from there another flight to M√°laga. Almost 2 hours after boarding we were informed that the flight was cancelled. Staff spoke no French and only bad English/German. They were more concerned about their own inconveniences than passengers'.
After eventually arriving in M√°laga, baggage was missing. Found after two days, but I had to pay for necessary items. Never got a refund nor any apologies from either airline - blame was simply shifted from one company to the other. Sloppy, cheap and unprofessional.

title: Felt like a squished sardine in a tin can
review_text: 4 of traveled roundtrip from Boston to Brindisi, Italy with a stopover in Zurich. The seats are so squished together in economy, we barely fit. I'm on the tall side, had to sit sideways .. for 8 hours! (I've been on much more comfortable seats in the US for much shorter flights.) When the person in front reclines, I had only about 4" of space in front of my nose. Really? I was so miserable that I had an anxiety attack. On our flight to Zurich, we were so late that we had to be rushed through the airport to make our connection. Yes, we made it .. but our luggage did NOT. NOT for 3 days!! Imagine being in Puglia with perfect weather and not being able to swim. And when it finally did arrive, mine was destroyed and my husband's luggage was damaged. We finally were transferred to a luggage company who agreed that our brand new luggage was destroyed and agreed to give us credits .. not cash .. but credits only to buy new luggage from THEM. (We are still waiting for 2 new pieces to arrive.) Then on our return flights, another bag from one in our group did not make it to Boston. It took 5 days for it to arrive at their home in Colorado. Needless to say we will not be flying Swiss Air again. Must say one positive thing though; the food was good and the stewardesses were very nice. Still not enough to make us fly Swiss Air ever again.

title: Swiss quality is no longer - how to improve
review_text:
My experience on my recent long-haul flights was mediocre. On the plus side, the cabin crew was friendly and responsive to passengers' requests. On the flight to Boston, the cabin personel were experienced, whereas on the flight back, they were very young and, though always polite and well-intensioned, rather inexperienced. I would recommend more thorough training of cabin personel, plus a higher proportion of more experienced staff.
On the negative side: The seats were narrow and too closely spaced; average to worse even than some of Europe's short-haul, budget airlines (Ryanair, EasyJet). Dropping things on the floor in front of your seat means that you will have trouble picking them up again, simply because the spacing is so small. The box with the electronics for in-flight entertainment under the seats takes up about a third of the foot room for some seats, severely limiting foot- and legroom, depending on where you sit. Please mount these boxes somewhere else (!) and increase the distance between seats! The choice of inflight-entertrainment, the quality of the entertainment screens and the breadth of  in-flight information on Swiss has decreased markedly over the years. Fix these deficiencies, please! The main dinner was ok, though definitely not up to the standards of the past. The small meals (snack before klanding, breakfast) were eminantly forgetttable, in the case of the 
Check-in in Z√ºrich was fast and very good, in Boston it was efficient, but the personel  serving me there spoke only limited Engish, and zero German or French (surprising for a Swiss airline).
In short, Swiss (especially its predecessor, Swissair) was an exellent airline. Unfortunetyl, standards in Economy Class have fallen and the airline seems to be concerned with competing with some other airlines in a race to the bottom. A first step to improvement might be to take better arilines as positive examples (e.g., Turkish Airlines).

title: Newark to Naples - Swiss Airlines is Terrible
review_text:
If you are flying from Newark to Naples Italy DO NOT CHOOSE SWISS AIR. 
WE had a 50 minute connection in Zurich and didn‚Äôt make the connection. More importantly when we arrived five hours late via Austrian Air through Vienna Swiss Air refused all our claims for compensation. I can‚Äôt help but think this poor management and condescending attitude is problematic for other Swiss Air routes. All the jokes you have heard about the Swiss being snooty are true.
Avoid this dog like the plague

title: AWFUL EXPERIENCE
review_text: Paid extra for extra leg room and changeable flight.  When I changed the flight way ahead of time, SWISS charged $360 for the change, and insisted I pay an additional fee for ANY seat assignment at the time I made the change.  I refused. (I was able to book a seat at check-in time for free).  SWISS refused to refund the unused fee for the extra leg room for the flight I did not take.  FYI: I searched and they were charging $360 for all the flight date changes around the time of my flight.  Their customer service is HORRIBLE as well.

title: worst flight of my life
review_text: I was mistreated and humiliated with my baby by a Swiss flight attendant. I reserved the seat that gives the right to the bassinet and I made the reservation for the bassinet. When the flight arrived, I requested the bassinet and the flight attendant asked me to wait. She started serving dinner and didn't bring my bassinet. I asked again and she said that I hadn't requested the bassinet in advance. I said that I had. She simply turned her back and said that it wasn't her problem and that she didn't have the bassinet. There I was, with my baby sleeping on my lap in an uncomfortable seat. If I hadn't requested the bassinet, I would have chosen or paid for another seat. On top of everything else, the flight attendant was very rude and unsympathetic!!! I don't recommend anyone to fly with this airline. On the return flight, they transferred me to Lufthansa and they simply lost my stroller. So far, no one has given me any feedback about this!!

title: Airline in Steep Decline; Dont Fly
review_text: The worst . Flights were cancelled without any reason provided; I was forced to stand in numerous lines (without resolution of my issues) for more than three hours; on line management of my booking was not permitted and I was told that to make any changes to my reservation by phone I would incur a $30 fee. To top this off I booked a fully refundable ticket (for a massive upcharge) and when I requested a refund for a segment of the flight in accordance with their rules I was told that for an $800 ticket I was only eligible for a $40 refund. When I asked to speak to a customer service supervisor I was told there was none. As a pilot, when I see an airline performing in this manner, I immediately question all other aspects of their operation including flight safety and maintenance competence. Do not fly.

title: Disappointed
review_text: We have reserved extra legs room for long flight and paid extra 90$ per person. But we don't get our extra paid seats we were at basic seats. We have conversations with crew and they promise us to get money back and that they wrote report so we just need to send email and reservation number. There was problem we got mail that we couldn't get money back. We choose Air Swiss for better comfort but we were wrong, for next destination we will choose Turkish Airlines.

title: Air travels starting to suck more and more.
review_text: Why does Swiss air not have the ac  running in economy section??? We sweated pretty much the whole dang flight. The new Boeing 777 doesn‚Äôt have to overhead fans on their planes now. No air movement‚Ä¶ 12 hours of no air movement. Yet when I walked up to the premium seats‚Ä¶ they had air going. This is a problem!! Hello! Quite a few elderly passengers were complaining and nothing got done. Also‚Ä¶ the new seats are stiff & hard ‚Ä¶ my back side was hurting after a couple of hours. Corporate air lines are squeezing and squeezing the public for more and more $ to where‚Ä¶ it‚Äôs just not affordable and comfortable & fun anymore.

title: Not worth paying extortionate fares

title: Not a good experience!
review_text:
Our original flight was delayed and then later cancelled with less than 12 hours prior to our original flight time.
Swiss airlines rerouted us to a flight leaving over 2 hours after our original flight time, and instead of 1 layover we had 2, eventually arriving over 3 hours after the original landing time in Manchester. 
I had paid for luggage and extra leg room seats on the flight. When we arrived at San Francisco airport, we were now flying with united airlines and as they were a different company we had to pay extra for our luggage (which we had already paid for!), we didn‚Äôt have any choice but to pay. And because we had paid for extra leg room seats on Swiss the new airline wouldn‚Äôt accommodate this. 
I have raised a ticket with Swiss airlines, and when I rang last week to ask about progress I was told it would take about a month just for them to look at it! I am about ¬£300 down currently, not everyone has the luxury to wait for this kind of money. To me, as we didn‚Äôt end up on the original flight, the luggage and seats should have already been refunded! 
I am really not happy with the customer service, and it put a bit of a downer on the end of our holiday. Would not book with Swiss again

title: Worst experience ever because of lacking swiss air
review_text: During the flight I got a 4,5 hour delay, missed my connection to Umag, didn't get any help whatsoever from swiss during the delays. They we're all pointing towards eachother, and didn't want to move me to another flight that could have made my delay only 2 hours. On the way back it was also only delays. Get your planning in order.

title: Worse than Frontier!
review_text: This is the biggest excuse for a flagship airline. Not only did they deny my rightful law to compensation for a completely avoidable 5 hr delay under EU261, but when I tried to get mileage credit for the flight flown they claimed I was a no show! I am premier United customer (partner airline) and United tried contacting them 4 times to credit my miles, and they denied me every single time saying I was a 'no show'. I called their support 4 times they said there is no record on their end saying I was a no-show, however when I try to get miles for my flight they claim I was a no-show. What a complete joke I will never fly this airline again. Worse than Frontier!

title: Don't count on Swiss
review_text:
I really enjoy flying United to Europe - Swiss Air is a Star Alliance partner so I assumed the same level of service when we booked our connections and return for the end of  a month of touring the Mediterranean. Wrong! First, you have to pay to book your seats in advance. No guarantee. Over the course of 6 months Swiss/Lufthansa changed our seats on our flights 15 times (I'm Not kidding) Even our travel agent was perplexed. Our flight to Palermo was a battle with the gate agents that our carry ons were TOO big ...despite other passengers with same. They stuck us in the most cramped seats behind the 1st class wall.

Unlike UA there was no Premium Economy on any of their equipment. I'm a big guy and willing to pay for the extra room. The flight from Nice to Zurich was actually good on an new Airbus 200 series with quite spacious economy seats.

The Zurich to IAD flight was a nightmare. An old Airbus 300-300. Seats with armrests that didn't move. Horribly cramped Inflight entertainment controls on a wired remote in the arms. Stale entertainment ....horrible Swiss food and beverages (I've traveled Switzerland extensively....a Big Mac would have been good). Packed plane...indifferent attitude. Couldn't even walk a lap on a 9 hour flight. The only saving grace was it was non stop to  DC. Lots of very cranky passengers.

Bottom line........chose carefully (fly United) ......I heard the First Class experience wasn't great either.

title: WORST EXPERIENCE in 50 years of flying
review_text: It was one of the worst business-class trips I've ever had. The seats were EXTREMELY hard and cramped, and the return flight connection was horrible. Our flight to Zurich was late; therefore, we had exactly 30 minutes to get to the opposite side of the airport. About 400 people were in the same situation. We were herded, like cattle, down 1 escalator and then required to squeeze into a train. This was a very hazardous situation but the staff did not seem to care. They started yelling at anyone who tried to get ahead of the line because they were going to miss their flight and stated EVERYONE was trying to get to their flight. NEVER AGAIN WILL WE USE SWISS AIR.

title: Worst airline ever
review_text: I traveled with a 1 month old baby (only because i had to) and i booked a bassinet with the seat that I selected. When I came to the airplane, 2 men were sitting next to me. I was in the middle and they didnt have the bassinet, because nobody brought them one. So the whole big plane did not have 1 bassinet on board. I was traveling alone and had to hold a baby for 6 hours. I couldnt eat properly, nothing was doable. Thank god my baby was feeling alright, she didnt cry at all. I had to breastfeed between the men next to me, there was no other space, the flight was full. On top of all of that, my luggage (with all the baby stuff) was 1 day delayed because of my connection. I hate lufthansa and swiss airline, the worst of the worst!!!!

title: Constant delays on Swiss Air
review_text: It is quite ironic that the four flights I have taken with Swiss Air this year have all been late. The inconvenience caused each time is indescribable. The Swiss are renowned for their timing. We expect better.

title: Swiss Premium Economy ........ not worth the additional cost!!
review_text:
I was quite excited about our Swiss Air flight from Zurich to Hong Kong, especially as we were flying Premium Economy this time. 

The Premium Economy seats looked great, with their own boxed in area, and clearly better appointed than the normal Economy seats further back.

How mistaken I was ...... being a big guy (6'4"), the first fail point were the seatbelts with shoulder straps. It was too tight to keep on my shoulder, so I actually unhitched the shoulder strap for the duration of the flight, take-off and landing included. The seatbelt lock buckle strap was also so short it was a struggle to clip in the latch without me having to move completely sideways, and then the belt became very tight and limiting.
Next, the legroom ..... it was great while sitting normally upright, as one would expect from Premium Economy, but as the seats are encapsulated within a boxed in area, as soon as you try to recline the seat (which does not recline back towards the passenger behind as normal) ..... there goes the legroom completely ...... would have been OK if I was able to remove both legs!!

Service was very good however, as was the meal selection and entertainment system. 

So, notwithstanding the discomfort of the seatbelt and not being able to recline the seat for 12 hours, the flight did pass ........ had to stay awake most of the night though, and watch movies!!!

title: Very poor business class cabin
review_text: Nearly a 13 hour flight so expected similar business cabin to previously used airlines but this business cabin was poor. Every second row had a window and aisle seat which meant I still had to climb over the poor person in the aisle seat to get put. Very difficult when they have their airbed flat. Very disappointing cabin for the business class and I will not use them again. I booked with Singapore airlines but this flight was operated by Swiss.

title: Avoid if you can
review_text: Terrible ground staff, terrible crew, uncomfortable seating, super strict about hand luggage and weight. Sadly no humane treatment by anyone. Avoid if you can

title: Worst Cabin Crew ever!!!
review_text:

I'm a frequent flyer and i fly a lot every month. I totally agree with the Bvlgari CEO that Swiss Airline is the worst!!!! They charge you  a high amount with a budget airline service.
