title: Refund process on refundable tickets
review_text:
I decided to cancel (my decision) our holidays in UAE, so after spending many minutes on their customer service FAQ and discussing with their silly chatbot, I managed to find their phone number.
I had bought (for 2 passengers) refundable tickets with 260.- Swiss francs refund fees.
These are the steps of the whole process :
1) 15 min on the phone with a lady : you need to get your reservation code ready
2) She will tell you the amount of the refund fees or the amount of the refund amount (this was not very clear to me as her French was so so)
3) The reservation disappears from your account, so be cautious to save the document with all the details of your tickets (reservation number, conditions for change/refund,...)
4) No e-mail or whatsoever to confirm the cancellation and the refund to come
5) Second call : they could confirm that the process was completed, but no e-mail received
5) The day after my second call (so after a total of 8 days of worry, because no e-mail received), the refund was on my credit card : total amount paid less twice 270.- ; they won't refund the extra options you paid (seats, extra luggage,...)

Overall I'm happy with the refund process, it was quick and I didn't expect to get "only" twice 270.- as fees. I tought I would have to pay twice 270.- per passenger.
I just would have appreciated to have a confirmation by e-mail.

title: Swiss - Zero empathy for passenger difficulties
review_text: Flew Swiss LHR-Zurich a month ago. Neither of my two bags showed up, I was told I would get Euro 100 per day of delay. One bag was delivered to my temporary residence 3 days later, another a week later. I am 65 years old, was without change of clothes and medicines for the entire time. As I was staying 3 hours away by train form Zurich, I had to make 2 trips to Zurich airport to try to recover my bags, incurring considerable expenses, Swiss is refusing to pay a dime without receipts! The last thing I I had on my mind was to go shopping in a Swiss village, preserve receipts, etc. I was in a strange place without even my medicines. Delta Airlines paid me $200 for a 2-day delay in delivering my bags when I returned home to the US, they didn't demand any receipts. Aren't airlines required to pay compensation by EU or Swiss law? Can I complain to some agency in Switzerland? Given all the facts, shouldn't Swiss acknowledge that I was clearly put to a lot of difficulty in a foreign country entirely due to their fault?  Even if there are no rules, as a matter of courtesy for a passenger, some amount should have been paid. I guess US airlines are way better in doing the right thing by their passengers.

title: Terrible customer service both from Swiss Air (And Generali travel insurance.)
review_text:
Ok, actually I didn‚Äôt get go on this trip because of an injury. I had travel insurance with Generali and made a claim. I got all the info they needed to them in a timely manner, but they closed my case anyway, stating they needed a letter from Swiss Air confirming I wasn‚Äôt awarded travel credit, even though my ticket clearly stated it was a nonrefundable economy class ticket. So I wrote Swiss air for said letter and then fell into a black hole. Meaning you have to fill out as contact form and then No One Ever Responds. This department, I was told, is inaccessible by phone. And here I am, 4 months later, still waiting for a response. Of course I am pretty sure Generali Knew Swiss Air wouldn‚Äôt come thru, which is undoubtedly why they directed me to this impossible. After all, they already had a copy of my  ticket info which clearly stated the ticket was in refundable 

So this review is as much for travel insurer Generali  as it is Swiss Air‚Äôs pathetic customer service. FYI, I have called both and was told they would expedite my case to no avail. So now I have no choice but  to trash both. 

In all likelihood I will never attempt to travel Swiss Air again nor will I ever purchase travel insurance ever again, at least from the relatively highly rated Generali.

title: Outdated inflexible policies that make lose-lose deals for customer
review_text:
I have to agree with the one star reviews here. In this post-COVID era, airlines need to offer customers more flexibility with booking. $199 USD to change your flight - WHA??? And that too, you cannot change the destination - just the date. So they lock you in, and you're left with the choice either to lose hundreds of dollars or pay ridiculous amounts just to change dates. And they don't care if it's a lose-lose for the customer. What a sucky policy. 

This archaic airline needs to wake up and see how they are losing customers left and right. It's not 1990's anymore Swiss Airlines! Your age is showing - in both your outdated policies and the lack of enthusiasm in your representatives.

title: Worst, most uncomfortable flight experience in my life, frequent traveler, both US domestic and international
review_text:
I fly a LOT and this was, by far, the worst experience I've ever had. We paid $92 per person to upgrade for extra legroom, which gave us barely more legroom than a cheap seat on Delta. The whole plane was such a hot box everyone was dripping w sweat. The seats felt like wooden folding chairs and the smallest person our party (wears a size med men's US) filled his set entirely. This meant the rest of us were basically sardines in our uncomfortable, over heated chairs. The staff were friendly enough, though every time they brought the carts down the aisles, they bumped it along the seats all the way down. The aisles are so small everyone had to walk sideways down them.

To top it all off, they forced us to check our carry on, stating it was "too large" (which was the same exact size as everyone else's, and I measured in advance for compliance). They then promptly lost all of our luggage. We have no clothes and no toiletries, the replacement of which, even for a couple days in hopes they find our stuff, is costing us into the hundreds. (Large party of 6) There's no live person to speak with on the matter, so we had to place an online report. They located our luggage but the report says the "rush delivery" won't be for another day, possibly two. They offer no compensation and refuse to work with us in any way. I'm actually crushed that we have to fly home with this airline because I already know it's going to be torture again. If I could afford to book on another airline and just eat the cost, I 100% would. We will NEVER fly this airline again. And, the group we met up with at our destination won't either. Altogether, I know it's a small number, but in 2 days, swiss airlines has lost 15 customers forever. More, once I tell folks back home. Absolutely hate this airline. Criminals!!!

title: Do not fly swiss the worst customer service!
review_text:
May 27th we started our trip home with 3 delays in Athens. Finally reaching our layover in Switzerland we were sure we would miss our connection only to be informed that too was delayed. After 3 more delays they cancel our flight leaving us to stranded in Switzerland. I had to book my own hotel get my luggage pay for transportation to & from the airport to hotel plus meals. At this point i have submitted 4 complaints, left multiple voicemails on their ‚Äúcustomer service ‚Äú line & have sent inquiry dms on their instagram 4 months today i have still not seen a dime!!! Their is no human being that will speak to you in customer service. What kind of airline is this . United was the only ones to respond. 

Never fly swiss they do not care about their customers!!

review_text:

title: Deplorable Customer Service at Zurich International Airport
review_text:
I had an incredibly deplorable experience with SwissAir customer service at Zurich International Airport on September 15, 2024 while connecting to my flight to Geneva.  The behavior of the two gate agents- particularly the male agent was absolutely disgraceful. Their lack of basic customer service skills and professionalism was shocking, and in my opinion, their actions were racially motivated.

The male agent pulled me aside and demanded that I check in my carry-on suitcase, claiming it was "too big."  I calmly informed him that my bag was within SwissAir's stated size limit even showing him the official email with the exact measurements.  Yet, instead of offering any explanation or engaging in a proper dialogue, he repeatedly insisted it's big, ignoring the fact that other passengers with similar or larger carry-ons were allowed through without any issue.

When I pointed this out and questioned why I was being singled out, the male agent became visibly hostile, raising his voice, rudely asking, "What's your problem?"  His dismissiveness and aggression escalated the situation.  He falsely claimed to have checked every other passenger's luggage, which was clearly not true.  He pointed out that I have 2 carry-ons which I explained that I have one carry-on, one personal bag and a medical device, in line with SwissAir's allowance, yet this did nothing to improve his treatment toward me. 

When I called out the male agent's rudeness and asked why he was treating me like a nuisance instead of a paying customer, he became visibly upset and even threatened me, asking if I "wanted to fly" and warning that he would weigh my bag and make me pay extra.  His aggressive attitude, lack of professionalism, and outright hostility were unacceptable.

What stood out to me during this entire interaction was that the other passenger who was similarly pulled aside and asked to check his bag was an Indian male.  I an Asian female was subjected to the same treatment. 

To make matters worse, when I finally boarded the plane, I noticed that the flight was far from full, with many empty luggage bins available.  I asked the flight attendant about the situation, and she casually told me that the carry-on selection was random.  This only added to the frustration, as it was clear that there were no real reason for singling me out, further reinforcing my opinion that my treatment was discriminatory.

This experience left a bitter taste in my mouth. It felt like SwissAir was not only ignoring its own policies but also discriminating against passengers based on race.  I will seriously reconsider flying with SwissAir in the future, and I urge others to be cautious of the appalling level of customer service at Zurich International Airport.

title: Swiss worst experience
review_text: Vey poor services provided by swiss, I was very surprised that such a rich company will provide such horrible services.

title: Swiss flight cancelled - Zero service for next steps
review_text:
Just experienced the worst flying experience ever. I booked the Swiss flight ZRH - WAW. at 12.10pm. Arrived at the gate. At 11.45, time of boarding, we are told next info at 12.10. At 12.10, I receive a notification on my phone that the flight is cancelled. But at the gate, no such info. After 5 more min., info at the gate: flight is cancelled. There is nobody at the gate, no possibility to obtain any information, what to do next, what is the plan, zero service. After 45 min. with nothing happening and 200 people stranded, we slowly decide to go to the transfer desk. There, we are told, all direct afternoon flights to WAW are fully booked, only possibility is through Frankfurt with 5 hours overlay. I decide to rebook myself for the next morning at 7am. The lady at the desk assures my luggage will be rerouted, no problem. I arrive 9am next morning at WAW and of course my luggage is not there. It finally arrived at 9pm at my hotel in WAW. 
The worst in this experience is the complete lack of info and service at the gate.

title: Better organisation eventually
review_text: Late departure (eventually 25 mins) with multiple suggested times and departure gates had me a bit frazzled.   The Embraer E195-E2 (operated by Helvetic for Swiss) had adequate legroom (2+2 configuration) and was a nippy machine taking us to Zurich.  I had just an hour left to clear EU passport control and change terminals, where I boarded another Swiss flight to Singapore.  There was no security screen this time, unlike the serious attention paid in Berlin (my carry on bits were spread across four tubs). This international flight was a Boeing 777-300ER.  It had good leg room and printed menus.  The food was great.

title: Absolute scam
review_text:
The worst airline I have ever dealt with!
My flight was delayed and I ended up having to stay in Heathrow for the night. The airline said they were unable to book me a hotel but to book one myself and they would reimburse me. title: I need to warn for Swiss Airlines.
review_text:
Warning for flying with Swiss Airlines.

After a wonderful honeymoon in Italy, on our way home from Naples to Stockholm, we had a connecting flight in Berlin. The flight from Naples was delayed, causing us to miss our connecting flight from Berlin to Stockholm, and we were forced to buy new tickets. We chose to book with SWISS (booking reference L7MUHA), which, for this flight, used an Austrian Airlines plane.

Upon reviewing our booking confirmation email, we discovered a significant error, a booking bug or technical glitch: my husband's name was listed twice on both tickets, and my name was entirely missing.

The following morning, when we arrived at the airport to check in for our flight, we were informed that neither of the two tickets (both issued under my husband's name) could be used for me. As a result, I had to purchase a new ticket at a cost of just under ‚Ç¨1000, even though the original tickets had cost approximately ‚Ç¨1314 combined.

Since then, we have called both Swiss and Austrian Airlines numerous times and sent several emails. Austrian Airlines has repeatedly redirected us back to SWISS, and vice versa, for almost two months. We have filed two complaints and refund cases with reference numbers 2408-LX-18828 and 2408-LX-18831.

During one of our calls with SWISS Airlines, we were even advised to physically return to Vienna Airport (!) because the flight reference number (L7MUHA) had been canceled from the SWISS system and could no longer be retrieved by their staff. This was despite the fact that the flight had taken place just last month and was still visible to Austrian Airlines earlier that day.

Their customer service has been completely unacceptable, seemingly aiming only to delay the process in the hopes that we would eventually give up. We haven‚Äôt seen any genuine intention from either airline to resolve the issue or to refund us for these tickets.

When we arrived in Vienna, which we had to travel through to get home, it was highly uncertain whether I would even be allowed to board the flight (due to being fully booked) despite the sum we had already paid for the tickets.

Ultimately, this entire ordeal, resulting from a delayed flight, has cost us approximately ‚Ç¨2,400 ‚Äî a problem that should have been incredibly simple to resolve.

title: Horror experience with Swiss: Cancelled flight,False justification  for refusal to Pay Due Compensation
review_text:
I recently had a deeply frustrating and unpleasant experience with Swiss Airlines on a flight scheduled to depart on August 21, 2024, from Bukarest to Z√ºrich. After boarding and being kept on the plane for over 30 minutes, while the plane was rolling away from terminal for take-off, the captain informed us that the lavatories were not functioning. He then suggested that anyone who couldn‚Äôt "hold it" for two hours should disembark. Strangely, the plane was already rolling on the tarmac, and the captain had just announced we had received permission to take off.

Despite this, the cabin crew asked passengers if they wanted to disembark. After several of us protested that we couldn't endure a two-hour flight without functioning toilets, the captain finally decided to taxi the plane back to the gate. Once we were in the terminal, we waited for another hour, only to be told that the toilet issue had still not been resolved. After four hours of delays, the flight was canceled.

At no point were passengers provided with water, food, transfer back to city or any form of logistical support. There was no assistance in organizing overnight accommodation or transportation. Passengers were left completely on their own, with no help whatsoever from Swiss Airlines. I had to personally pay for transportation back to the city, accommodation for the night, and meals and transfer to airport next day which was an added frustration to an already stressful situation.

Arriving in Z√ºrich with a 24-hour delay caused me significant problems and financial loss. The lack of any support from Swiss during this entire ordeal is absolutely unacceptable.

Following this, I attempted to submit a compensation claim, as is my right under EU261 regulations. However, Swiss Airlines makes this process unnecessarily difficult. The compensation form DOES NOT EXIST on their Switzerland page. It is hidden within the Germany page, and I only managed to find it after calling customer support, who first advised me to use a "refund" form, which is not the same. Making it impossible or hard to place a compensation claim is completely unacceptable for an airline of this size.

After finally submitting the claim, I received a response from Swiss Airlines' Customer Feedback Services, denying my request for compensation and reimbursement of expenses. Their justification? The flight was canceled due to "unforeseen safety issues." This excuse is entirely false. At no point did the captain, cabin crew, or ground personnel mention any safety concerns. The plane was almost taking off, the captain  wanted passengers to "hold it for 2 hours" while he got ready to fly. So obviously he had encountered no  "unforeseen safety issues." The only issue ever communicated to passengers was the malfunctioning lavatories. It is absurd to claim that a toilet malfunction is an   "unforeseeable safety issue." just in order to deny paying due compensation according to EU261 regulations. 

Swiss Airlines‚Äô attempt to use this excuse to avoid paying compensation is not only dishonest but also a violation of passengers' rights under EU261 regulations.

Overall, my experience with Swiss Airlines is deeply disappointing. From the poor handling of the delay and cancellation to the lack of any logistical support and the "hidding" and making hard to apply for compensation and the dishonest response to my compensation claim, Swiss Airlines showed no care for its passengers. The 24-hour delay caused me great distress, financial loss, and serious personal inconvenience. I strongly urge others to reconsider before flying with this airline, as their treatment of passengers is far below acceptable standards.

title: Swiss Business Class Didn't Let Down!
review_text:

Priority boarding went really smoothly, cabin crew was very friendly and welcoming. Business class seat was pretty spacious (really essential for me as I'm a tall person). Crew was present and attentive offering the assistance. Meal was tasty - it was a salmon, Swiss cheese served with fresh bread as far as I remember. There was also a juice selection as well as tea and a mineral water. 
We have arrived in Zurich on time and it's a pity the flight was too short as the service was truly enjoyable.
I highly recommend Swiss (particularly their business class) to everyone and will definitely fly with them again!

title: Stay away from the horrible airline
review_text:
Words cannot describe what a horrible airline this is. The staff, the customer service, their policies, everything about it. They should be shut down. I had to change one part of my flight due to a medical situation. I couldn‚Äôt find a customer service phone number to contact them only an online chat. The experience chatting was awful i barely got my flight changed. I paid the difference in fare plus fee and was told
I‚Äôd receive the new ticket information via email sometime in the next few days. My new flight was 6 days away. The evening of the 5th I tried to check in and was unable to access their website booking manager with my code. It said my flight had been cancelled. I went back on the chat and was told by the representative I was connected with that the ticketing office was late in reissuing my ticket, never did it and so therefore the flight was canceled. The representative replied the only option was for me to pay a second time. At this point i honestly thought I had been in a scam. I googled Swiss air and the same site came up. So then I thought maybe I had been hacked and they were asking me to pay again because this sounded crazy to me. The airline refused to issue my ticket. Finally after telling them I thought it was a scam since they were extorting me, they said ok upon further checking we will reissue your ticket. At the check in at the airport I explained the situation of what happened and that I had a medical situation requiring special seat assistance the airline staff refused to assist me unless I paid a large upgrade fee. After all the stress they caused me, having to stay up all night with no ticket and not knowing my information they asked me to pay again. They said to talk to the station manager. When I arrived at the gate I asked for the station manager and it took talking to 4 people and 1 hour later he finally arrived and he did absolutely nothing to assist even though I explained about my medical situation. I will be filing a complaint with this airline and seek compensation. Will avoid flying with them in future. Seeing these reviews confirms it‚Äôs not just me. Swiss Air has unethical and maybe even illegal business practices

title: Swiss Air First Class to JNB
review_text:
LHR-ZRH- typical middle seat empty, style Business Class. I slept for part of the service, and upon waking, not one Flight Attendant asked me if I wanted anything- there were four of them servicing the Business Class cabin. The Crew in general were not engaged.  
ZRH-JNB- The First Class Terminal E gates lounge was exceptional. I was greeted and asked immediately if I would like a beverage as I stood outside on the viewing deck. I had a meal in the dining room which was very nice as was the Server.   Boarding was quite organized for the ZRH-JNB flight and I was acknowledged at the boarding door.  There were two Flight Attendants in the First Class cabin on this A340-300 aircraft. Although pleasant, I found one to be robotically friendly, and unfortunately witnessed her and two male passengers in row 1 flirting throughout the flight. I preordered the Sole and was never offered any appetizers ( was looking forward to the Balik salmon and more- quite disappointed  ). The dessert was difficult to cut into with a fork.  I did enjoy the flat bed and the privacy of the seat ( 2A ).  
Breakfast was a bit unusual, although I had seen in others' vlogs that there are items not mentioned on the menu, some were shared with me, and I decided on a light offering, yet did not receive everything I requested.  The Captain walked around the cabin and only thanked about half of the passengers, which I found not only awkward, but so obvious- he flirted with a female passenger sitting in 2D, and spoke with someone in length in 1D. It was so blatant...   If there was a different Crew, I would consider flying Swiss again.  Not a very positive/memorable journey.

title: Swiss nightmare cancellations
review_text:
I have never in my life opened my phone to write a bad review but this experience was so horrible I‚Äôm compelled to do so. I booked a flight home August 29th from Corfu, Greece, to Boston with a layover in Frankfurt. I booked this flight through swiss, which is the airline I flew with to Greece, but for the flight home they booked it through discover airlines. I‚Äôve since learned that there was some sort of pilot strike in Germany that began August 27th, two days before this flight occurred, which felt like they could‚Äôve been more proactive in rebooking flights in advance but that‚Äôs honestly the part that irritates me the least about this experience. We were automatically assigned a new flight, for August 30th which was a day after we were originally supposed to leave. We called Swiss customer support trying to remedy with this, each person offered either no solution or different  solutions that all ended in us leaving days later than intended which no place to stay, I was looking up flights myself and saw 3 different options for leaving for the intended day. They were able to put me on a flight for the 29th and then told us the flight was full and recommended my friend be put on a waitlist and that all that they had to do was call someone to get it  approved and then she would get in. They described that the whole process would take less than an hour. When it took more than an hour we called again and the next person told us the waitlist never works and that they didn‚Äôt know why anyone would recommend that. By putting her on the waitlist they took away the flight they re-booked her for leaving her with no way home. They later tried to claim she refused the flight that she rebooked (likely to void her of being able to get a refund, further help?) which was not the case. They also indicated we had to go to the airport to get hotel accommodations or be rebooked through another airline so we went to the airport that night in Corfu and everyone was incredibly rude in the office, telling us they are unable to rebook flights in that airport (which Swiss said was impossible when we called and that that was our only option). They also told us there was no flights until September 2nd anyway. And then asked if we just wanted to end up somewhere in America like Atlanta or Chicago. Despite also saying they couldn‚Äôt rebook which felt contradictory and also no we don‚Äôt want to just be stuck in Atlanta ??? When asked about hotel accommodations they recommended we sleep on the stairs outside. This whole experience was making me start to lose faith in humanity. We went back to the airport at 6am, were offered no help again until my friend ultimately had to buy a nearly $1000 plane ticket home and hope that Swiss would refund her for giving her no way home and no way to get accommodations in the country we‚Äôre in. Her flight didn‚Äôt even go all the way to Boston it ended in New York. Only once she got to her layover in London, the connecting flight was delayed until morning and she ended up stuck in London overnight with still no help, and having to book a hotel. My flight back through Swiss at 3:50pm was then delayed by an hour, making me miss my connecting flight to Boston and meant I had to spend the night in Switzerland. When I got to the Zurich airport I went to the transfer desk, which when I called, was told that was the place to go for accommodations and  any concerns relating to my issue. The first woman I spoke to was immediately unhelpful, between not allowing me to finish a sentence and walking away from me before I was done talking to speak to her boss and then come back and tell me she could offer me no accommodations (I had never even gotten the chance to explain half of the delays because of her cutting me off) when I finally did she then told me to leave past security and that there was an office out there I could speak to. This is when I started to feel broken down by all this. I told her I don‚Äôt want to go through security, because If truly no one can offer me accommodations I may want to stay in the airport. She tells me she‚Äôs worked here for 25 years and knows what she‚Äôs talking about. Okay then. I walk away from her and find two employees walking through the airport and ask if it was true that there was an office past security that could help me with accommodations. They told me that the only people in this whole airport that could offer accommodations were the people at the desk I was at originally, and that those people would know that and that I should absolutely not go through security. Those employees even gave me a pep talk, seeing how tired I was at this point telling me to be strong and not take no for an answer and speak to everyone I could. I truly had to collect myself and prepare for yet another contentious interaction which is all I‚Äôd been experiencing the past 20 some hours at this point.

I go back to the desk at this point just begging someone to listen to me fully. I explain the situation to a new employee and he immediately recognizes that none of this was my fault and even asks ‚Äúwhy didn‚Äôt you come here first‚Äù and I responded I did, your colleague told me to practically leave the airport. within minutes he has a hotel and meal vouchers, tram card, my boarding pass. I wish I got his name because this was genuinely the first person in 24 hours who was actually kind to me and acted like they were going to at least do what they could to help. My flight the next day was meant to be at 12pm, and was delayed to 1pm and all I could imagine was having to sleep in the airport that whole time, all because that first woman refused to really listen to me. When I finally got service later I saw that my Swiss app even updated to tell me to go get accommodations at that office! I don‚Äôt know what the problem was that that women was so adamant and dismissive with me . 

I understand things happen but the way we had to constantly fight to be helped in any way in a helpless situation, 4,500 miles from home was so disconcerting and draining. I know to never fly Swiss again. And I truly hope they do the right thing and reimburse my friend, I would appreciate a refund too because this whole situation was beyond ridiculous.

title: Early Morning Flight Enjoyment
review_text: We booked an early flight to  Alicante Spain, departing Zurich 06:20. To our surprise the check in is smooth, fast and within 10 minutes from the airport arrival we were on the way to the departure gate. The flight was on time. We flew with a new A320 aircraft, the seats are comfy and so is the in-flight service. In less then 2 hours arrived  to our destination.. Luggage on arrival was on the belt in a timely manner.

title: Measurable airline with no customer service
review_text:
My bag damaged, they compensate me with a new bag only after I topped up the new bag price, the major frustration is that their agent deliver the bag on August 30, 2024, 2 months from my claim. Furthermore, despite of my fully paid order for the new bag is included delivery charged, the delivery agent charged me AED 53.50.  
It was very bad experience with Swiss air agent called Dolphin and spent too much time in sending e mails forth and back for no action, they did what they want not what the customer wants. No body cares, this delay in delivery and extra charges for the new bag and delivery agent might be on purpose to make you never send future claim to Swiss air. However, I‚Äôm strongly recommend to try another airline like Emirates, Etihad, or air Canada. 
Regards
Laith

title: Outstanding quality
review_text:
Excellent outstation service, very friendly crew, IFE is better than in Lufthansa but the seat is bit less welcoming. They have a door of sorts, if you have social issues.
Arrival service in ZRH was a bit expeditive and maybe not up to what you should expect in first class-
Arrival terminal is a great thing... even if they don't stack the "Reportagen" Magazine anymore...

title: Hate pets
review_text:
My return flight from Bangkok is with them unfortunately, booked via Austrian airlines. never had problems with Austrian, but they didn't have suitable return flights, and so they offered Swiss.
It took multiple attempts to reach Swiss, and finally they denied my request to bring back my cat with me. So, I have Austrian who let me take my cat to Bangkok and then Swiss told me that I can leave my cat there :-D Why? Because "quota is exceeded" Quota on my leg space under a front seat? I actually not sure :-D I wrote to them in English, they replied in German... Never again with them, now have to reschedule everything.

title: Scam Company
review_text: Yesterday I had a flight from Berlin to Barcelona with a stopover in Zurich, the first flight was delayed for 1 hour and a half and we missed the second flight to Barcelona. I arrived in Barcelona at 12 pm when I should have arrived at 7 pm. Because of this delay I had to spend the night in Barcelona because I'm not from there, missing a train to Zaragoza (my city) and spending 100 euros on a taxi (at that time there were no trains or buses) and missing my train having to buy other tickets for the next day. I was lucky that in Barcelona I have family with whom I was able to spend the night there. This 5 hour delay has caused me to lose 100 euros apart from my time without any compensation. This company does not have customer service for these cases or telephone numbers or emails in its own country and when trying to request this compensation for its website or its application it gives errors and does not stop because of its fault. If someone from the company can help me to give me the corresponding compensation that would be great and for those of you who are not from the company, think about it before traveling on it.

title: Terrible customer service.
review_text:
Terrible service.
I join the quire and would have given a zero.
Will never fly again.
Swissair cancelled our return flight, but I have had to contact them 3 times to have a refund. Still not received nearly two months after the cancellation.
Must be illegal and should be prosecuted.

title: Swiss Air Never Again
review_text: Our baggage did not arrive with our flight. We got an email asking for address to deliver the baggage which arrived in a later flight. We waited all day with no update so decided to go back to the airport. After making multiple calls and asking around we finally found a counter where we were guided to our luggage. A day meant for tourism wasted in tracking our luggage. Never flying Swiss again

title: Very poor service, avoid if you can
review_text: We do not recommend Swiss Airlines. We are a well-travelled family of 5 (3 children)  and  on July 23rd 2024 we were on our way to Singapore (and then Tokyo) via Zurich. Since we had several connecting flights, we had chosen to use carry-on luggage only, and carefully respected their size and weight according to Swiss Airlines policy. We used several air companies during those holidays and never had a single problem... except with Swiss Air: on July 23rd in the evening, when we queuing to board the Zurich-Singapore portion of our trip, an arrogant young man at Zurich airport forced us to check our carry-on baggage, even though they did not exceed the weight and size limits, we had 3 children and it was a connecting 13 hour flight. I explained him we wanted to spare the children the extra-time of waiting checked luggage at the carrousel but he became even more arrogant and even sarcastic. I travel often and have accepted several times to check my hand luggage last minute (even though I still think this should be avoided, it does not happen that often with Asian companies). But for a long-haul flight, there is no reason to pick a family with 3 children to do that effort, and the rude attitude of this responsible of the boarding room in Zurich was clearly inappropriate. We will definitely avoid Swiss Air as from now and have already told our family and friends about our experience. Besides, food was really poor quality. When you spend about 3500 euros to a company, you expect it to be more professional.

title: DELAY CAUSING MISS CONNECTION
review_text: DELAY LX138 CAUSING MISS CONNECTION. TAKES EXTRA TWO DAYS TO ARRIVE FINAL DESTINATION. POOR SERVICES OF CABIN CREW.

title: Very frustrating experience with SWISS
review_text: Very poor service and unfriendly personnel. Flight has been cancelled last minute, no information, no support. I had to arrange a hotel for my family myself and did not receive any compensation. Unfortunately Swiss is not the same anymore.

title: A true scam and careless airline.
review_text: Horrible airline. We have 500¬£ per person , the food is extra prices, and our return to our homeland was cancelled. They sent us to a hotel 2 times. They rebooked our flight for TWO DAYS LATER. My holiday was ruined. Customer service was useless and they didn‚Äôt let us rebook an earlier flight.

title: The worst - you have been warned!!!
review_text:
I booked round trip from SFO to Italy.   We needed to change the date of the flight.  Call ‚Äòcustomer service‚Äô.  They said no problem there would be a $50 per ticket change for the date change.

But what they in fact did was book a completely new round trip flight instead of just changing the date.  So now I have TWO round trip flights and am charged for TWO flights no , one for the original date and  another one for the new date.  Thousands of dollars!

I call ‚Äòcustomer service‚Äô and they said ‚Äòyou have two flights, what is the problem?‚Äô, I explained that I just wanted to change the dates and that I was told it would be $50 per ticket to change, but instead I was given a completely new booking.   Customer service says ‚ÄòI can‚Äôt help you sorry‚Äô.  I say ‚ÄòI want to speak to a supervisor‚Äô  Customer service says ‚ÄòThere are no supervisors here‚Äô.   I say ‚Äòhow can I then talk to a supervisor who can help‚Äô.  Customer support ‚Äòyou need call this other number‚Äô.

I call other number, same thing, no supervisor.

I call next day and demand to speak to a supervisor.  They say what is this about.  I explain again, I get put on hold for 20 min.  When they come back they claim that they now understand the mistake and that I will get a refund for original booking as it was only the flight date that was to change.

After 2 weeks I do not have refund.  I call again and this time they say ‚Äòwe do not have a record of a refund to be issued.  What is the refund for?‚Äô   I go back into same explanation.  Customer service says ‚ÄòI understand I will issue refund for the mistake‚Äô

3 days later I get a refund but only for the base flight and not all the seat charges for the flight.  I call back, they  say ‚ÄòOh, sorry, will refund the seat charges.

I still do not have the refund for the seat changed.  I can customer service, they say ‚ÄòI can not help you‚Äô.  
‚ÄòCan I speak with a supervisor?‚Äô
‚ÄòThere are no supervisors here, sorry‚Äô

This airline is terrible and unethical.  Look at the other review.   It is not just me.  SCAM.

DO NOT TRUST THIS AIRLINE, YOU WILL BE SORRY

title: Piece of Sh** Airlines. Save your money and go somewhere else!
review_text:
Piece of sh** SWISS airlines. Was supposed to transfer from Zurich to Copenhagen, and SWISS airlines decided to delay 2 times (total 3 hours), and then when passengers were all on board, they kept their passengers on the plane for another 2 hours!!!! Then the pilot made an announcement that due to the clouds, they are cancelling the flight when all the passengers were on board!!! However, because all the ground staff was busy, they kept us on board another 1 hour (total 6 hours delay already).

Then after getting off the flight, they had a 2 hour wait line to the Help Desk. They ran out of hotel vouchers to give out to passengers, and it was already 10 pm! So they told people to get their own hotels and no one got their luggages. People were rebooked to flights 2 days later!! How atrocious of an experience.

Fast forward, 1 month after the flight, their customer service is DECLINING TO PAY for the hotel fee reimbursement. They are claiming that they had to do it for weather reasons, and the weather was only cloudy!! omg.

Their atrocious customer service, terrible organization and management of the flight, leaves a TERRIBLE EXPERIENCE and I would advise everyone to avoid this Airline at all costs. This is worst than anything I've experienced.

Save your time and money, and try to transfer at another country and city !!!!!

title: The Worst Flight Experience in My Life EVER
review_text:
I sat in business class and happen to like the atmosphere so i filmed the air hostess doing a safety demonstration, she got so mad that she came and shouted at me saying I should delete my video immediately. 

I was like is this the kind of service you give to your business class customers?
I didn‚Äôt know better back then, but i‚Äôd this ever happened to me again, I‚Äôm going to report her. I still remember what she looks like , so i‚Äôll report her if i ever fly again with her.

I flew so much, this is the worst airline experience I‚Äôve ever had in my life , and I think it‚Äôs precisely because I‚Äôm Asian that she did it to me. What a disgraceful experience, it totally ruined my experience with them. One star is even too much for this review.

title: Never again
review_text:
We had a flight from Rome to Zurich, with a connection to Geneva. Unfortunately, our flight arrived late in Zurich, forcing us to run to catch the next one. When we got to the gate, we were the last passengers to board. The staff member at the counter was extremely rude and impolite. We were already stressed because of the delay and unsure if the plane would still be there, and the person checking our tickets made the situation worse.

Despite the fact that we spoke both German and French fluently, this agent chose to address us in English, seemingly because we are Asian. His attitude was clearly unpleasant, and his tone was very aggressive. I am deeply shocked by this experience. If we weren‚Äôt Asian, would we have been treated differently?

To make matters worse, when we arrived in Geneva, we discovered that our luggage hadn't arrived with us. We were told it would arrive within 24 hours, but it took three days, with no communication or apology from the airline.

Never again.

title: Horrible behavior
review_text: The most awful airlines known. Denies not informing client of important information about transit countries and pushing the narrative that it is the customers own fault to know. Lack of information on their website. They did not even try to inform anybody of visa requirements even to just transit in zurich needing schengen visa. Not even a mention at all but they will take all our money and not even refund the tax. Hang up the phone. Refused to let me talk to a supervisor and just hanging up on my calls. Horrible customer service. I have to travel with two small children. Wasted my time, my money. I cannot take back! You are horrible people!

title: Service at Athens Airport
review_text: I was very disappointed that the check in counter was not open when I arrived to the airport. We arrived 3 hours before our flight only to find that the baggage drop counter was not open. We inquired and were told that they open 3 hours before their first flight for the day. This was not the case. There were people with earlier flights in the line with us. We waited more than a hour before employees opened the window. The line was huge at this point. It was very stressful to worry about potentially missing our flight because of this delay.

title: Tight seats like packed sardines. Salty food. Unpleasant Check-In.
review_text: 10 hour flight seating like a packed sardine, uncomfortable to move arms and legs. Seats hard as bricks. NOT PLEASANT!!

title: Premium Economy - Poor execution
review_text: We flew Premium Economy and compared to Cathay Pacific and Singapore Air, the offer is mediocre at best. No preference check-in but preference boarding was available. Seats are uncomfortable and not worth the extra cost.  Service and food was good.  Entertainment on outbound flight was average and on return flight non existant - screen did not work and crew could not (be bothered) fix it.

title: Avoid Swiss Air at all cost if you can
review_text:
We've traveled all around the world on numerous different airlines, but Swiss Air takes the crown for the worst Business Class experience.  

Check in process at LAX was horrible.  The counter personnel were not friendly and it was very obvious they did not care about customer experience what so ever.  Very inefficient process in checking in customers.  We've never waited this long in a business class line ever.

Boarding process was another disaster.  The most inefficient boarding we've ever witnessed.  Of course it's the same crew that checked us in, so go figure.

Plane is delayed 1.5 hours.

Food on board was average.  Possibly the most uncomfortable business class seats we've been on.

Arrive in Zurich and 2 out of our 3 luggage's don't arrive.  Around 30 people in the same predicament.  We are told to file a baggage delay claim on their website and wait until further notice.  Luggage arrives in Zurich 3 days later!  We are in St. Moritz and have to pay for a taxi ride back to Zurich which is 3 hours away to the tune of 690 chf.  

Flight back to LAX.  Flight is delayed again, but this time for 3 hours!  

Same again, extremely inefficient boarding process.  Never seen such a slow boarding process.

Flight crew on board this flight is absolutely the worst I have ever seen.  Not attentive and too busy socializing with each other.  I go to use the restroom and come back to see an extra blanket in front of my seat on the floor.  I ask my wife and she says there was someone's blanket in the aisle and the flight attendant came through and just moved it with her feet to in front of my seat.  For starters how can a flight attendant kick someone's blanket instead of picking it up?  I push the blanket back into the aisle to see how they would address it.  Two flight attendants pass by to go socialize with a passenger behind me and just walk over the blanket in the aisle!  Wow!  They do it again on the way back.  I stop them and asked why they put someone else's blanket in my seat and why would they just walk past it like this.  Their response?  Oh ok, and they just picked it up and left.  No apologies whatsoever!  I stop a second attendant to address the same issue and responds by saying, did you talk to my colleague?  I respond, yes I did and she says ok then.  Do you want some chocolate?  REALLY?

The restrooms?  Wow!  They don't bother cleaning them up during the entire flight!!!  Airlines like Korean Air have flight attendants go inside the restrooms after every customer leaves to tidy things up.  Swiss Air?  They don't bother the entire 12 hour flight!!!  It's absolutely disgusting!

It is very obvious that this was not just a case of a bad flight.  This is a corporate culture where the customer experience is not at the forefront of how they conduct business.  Processes are there for the employees benefit and not the customer.   Needless to say, we will never fly on Swiss Air or it's corporate affiliates like Austria Air or Lufthansa.  When we go back to Switzerland (and we will because it's such a beautiful country), we will go back to flying Air France through Paris like our previous visits.  The direct flight through Swiss Air is just not worth the torture.  Stay away from this airline if you can and save yourself a lot of grief.

title: Don't Fly Swiss Air
review_text: So when my flight from London to Zurich was delayed meaning I missed my connection  overnight to Johannesburg, I had to stay the night in Zurich to catch a flight the following evening - which also didn't happen! I had to spend TWO nights at Zurich Airport  and as a Business Class passenger, was told to book my own hotel. This I did but now Swiss Air will not cover the entire cost of my hotel and have only offered part of the money. Why? It was the nearby Radisson - the only hotel with a vacancy. Their Customer Service is dire and I would caution against using this airline.

title: Ignored by customer service!
review_text:
Flight delayed, missed connecting flight to Singapore.
No swiss air staff at airport. Only ground-staff from airport who gave us 2 forms and told us to find a place to sleep and rebook our flight.
Eventually found hotel and was instructed to claim hotel costs and taxi travel costs back.
Will spare the nightmare regarding rebooking and lost luggage for later, but my claim for hotel and taxi expenses is still not handled after more than one month since the incident.
Worst service ever as no response to questions regarding update. Just staying silent!

title: Avoid this Airline
review_text:
I strongly recommend avoiding Swiss Air if you can fly with other Asian airlines. I recently needed a round-trip flight from Singapore to Zurich. To save my company some money, I opted for Swiss Air instead of Singapore Airlines. Unfortunately, this turned out to be a mistake.

My direct return flight from Zurich to Singapore was abruptly canceled at 6 PM on the day of departure, with no explanation provided. I was told to retrieve my luggage and that they would assist me in booking another flight on the same day. I ended up wasting three hours waiting for my luggage, which I never received.

After two rebookings that evening, they finally put me on an indirect flight with Lufthansa the next day around 10 PM. Still, my luggage was nowhere to be found. The only compensation offered was a night's stay at an average hotel (not the Hyatt at the terminal), and by the time I arrived, the restaurant had already closed, so I missed dinner.

Upon returning home, I filed a claim, thinking that EU regulations would protect me in this situation. After waiting a month, I received a nonsensical response citing a "cargo door problem" and was offered no compensation.

I understand if cancellations occur due to war or natural disasters, but if your plane has a mechanical issue, it‚Äôs a maintenance failure on the airline's part, and passengers should be compensated accordingly. I highly advise against flying with Swiss Air unless you have no other choice.

title: Horrible Experience. Took 3 days to get home.
review_text: By far worst travel experience. On the way there and home missed both connecting flights because of delays that were unknown. Got stuck in Naples an extra night because a canceled flight. Got stuck in Switzerland 2 nights because a missed connection. Took 3 days to get home because of their inconvenience. Will never travel with them again.

title: Terrible service. Choos another airline if you can
review_text:
I traveled with them from Gothenburg to Valencia at the end of July.
my luggage was delayed by 30 hours. I had to call their number in Switzerland and pay over 250 Euro to get the zero help I got. My luggage was delayed by 30 hours and the bag damaged. They referred us to a company called Dolfi for handling of the broken bag. They had zero understanding of my situation and where I was. Dolfi had several agents who answered emails as they don't have a phone number to call de. They tried to tire me out with unreasonable suggestions of solutions.
Ryanair's customer service handles matters better than Dolfi and Swiss air.
I regret traveling with them.

title: I expected much better from SWISS
review_text:
SWISS struck out on everything for a business class flyer.

1) Prior to being able to board the flight, they required that you stand in an extra line to have someone check that your passport matched your ticket.  What is the purpose of having all of the passengers (economy and business) stand in a common line and then go to their boarding lines?  It would have made more sense for the gate agent to make this check for the special (not economy) boarding lines.

2)  The food was tasteless and cold.  The menu made it seem that we were getting a Michelin star meal.  The only thing with flavor was the raspberry that came with the desert.  

3)  The plane was in poor maintained condition.  The carpet at my seat was not even secured to the floor.  Where is the Swiss pride?

4) The layout of the business class seats must have been done by someone who never had been on a plane. The row in front of me had one seat, while our row had two seats offset to that single seat.  My seat was the only seat in that section that you could not get up with out having the person next to you move.  I thought that every airline with any common sense switched to the staggered business class seating.   I guess SWISS did not get that memo.

I do not recommend nor will I fly SWISS for a business class again.

title: Pick a different airline
review_text: This airline sucks. They are not good at communication or customer support which is all an airline really needs. The website is the least intuitive software in the world. Pick another airline

title: Unacceptable practice of lastminute paid seat change!
review_text:
This is not the first time that Swiss allow themselves to change my seat number although i have paid for it. This time they changed me from 9 to 19!  Excuse is that aircraft changed, ok fine but why am i not getting the same raw number, any aircraft has the raw 9, and of course the change is always for worse, never for better. On top of it, they advise your seat change just 1 day before departure day and if you contact their live chat, there is nothing they can do for you, and they tell you to try to change at the airport.
I am travelling a lot, but this last minute practice of seat change i saw it only with Swiss. I am Swiss and i always knew that Swiss is the synonym of guarantee of high quality, unfortunately i am forced to admit that these times are gone, especially reading so many other negative reviews.

title: Avoid at all costs.
review_text: Avoid this airline. Delayed flights , missed connections and lost luggage. No Customer Service. An absolute disgrace of an airline.

title: Don‚Äôt use Swiss airline Zurich
review_text: Both connections flight delayed & missed the next flight. No help from unfriendly stuff. The money you pay for this flight is waisted they are so unorganized!

title: Flight cancellation experience
review_text:
This was my first time booking with Swiss Air and I was very disappointed with the experience. Both flights were cancelled, due to technical problems. I received an email when I arrived at Heathrow airport, informing me that I have been booked onto an alternative flight to Dubai where I live, with Turkish airlines, which will go via Dubai. This change would mean that I would arrive in Dubai 3 hours later, which was inconvenient, however I was okay with this as I understand these things happen sometimes. However, when I went to check-in for the Turkish airlines flight, I was informed that I am in fact on a standby ticket, as the flight is full, which meant that I would have to wait until check-in is over to see if there is space available on the flight - this meant that in total I was waiting for 5 hours before I could check-in, with the stress of not knowing if I would actually get on the plane. I went to the Swiss Air service desk at Heathrow for help, but the only option they gave me was to book me on a different flight from terminal 5, but it would mean going on 2 different airlines to Dubai which is risky when it comes to delays etc, and would also mean I would have to get a train from terminal 2 to terminal 5, which I would then have to pay for and did not have much time for either, so this was not a good option. I then communicated with an agent online via the Swiss Air live chat, and they said the only other thing they could do was book me onto another flight the following day. So I was left with no choice but to wait and hope for the best. Turkish Air informed me that there was nothing more they can do, they have a full flight - that Swiss air should not have booked me onto this flight without checking if there was space. Fortunately after waiting for 5 hours I did get a space, but I am sure you can imagine it was a very upsetting and stressful experience. If a flight is cancelled, this should not be there rebooking experience - 5 hours of waiting, not able to check in, not sure if when the time comes, there will even be a space available. I could not even eat anything for those 5 hours because I was going between turkish air and swiss air service desk to see what could be done. The rebooking process should be more thorough for customers in future, this was an awful experience. At this point, I do not feel I would like to book with Swiss air in future if this is the customer service.

I have completed a feedback form with a complaint on the website on the 7th August, and have still had no feedback. I followed up on the 9th August via the live chat and the only response I got was that I need to wait for feedback following the form I completed. Whether in person or on live chat, it seems throughout this whole process, the customer service has been extremely unhelpful.

I had two flights initially booked: LX317 and LX242

title: Don't travel with Swiss
review_text:
I am extremely dissatisfied with my experience with this airline. In January 2024, I purchased tickets for a trip scheduled for July 2024 directly on their official website. To my great surprise, in May 2024, the same tickets were being offered at half the price! Despite numerous attempts and several emails sent to customer service to obtain an explanation, I never received any response from them.

This situation is simply unacceptable and gives the impression of fraudulent business practices. Moreover, this airline dares to use the word "Swiss" as a mark of quality, while their service is deplorable, and there is no after-sales service whatsoever.

I strongly advise against traveling with this airline, which not only shows a lack of respect for its customers but also seems to completely disregard transparency and customer satisfaction. Avoid at all costs!

title: Swiss air not great experience
review_text: Lounge experiences at JFK and Zurich was below par. Flight from Zurich to Mumbai had option for vegetarian main course but had only 3 no‚Äôs of meal and thus had no choice. Can‚Äôt think of ever travelling again on Swiss air.

title: Bags lost, terrible service
review_text:
Bags did not make it to connecting flight, so we got an email for one bag saying it would be on the next flight. Ended up being delivered by courier the next day. Second bag we never got an email about but it did not arrive in Lisbon so put in a baggage missing form for. 24 hours later they are still ‚Äòlooking for‚Äô the bag and we have had no update. Have tried to contact Swiss airlines and they just bounce me to different numbers which then say I need to email Lisbon airport. 
Terrible service, would strongly recommend avoiding this airline at all costs

title: Cheap airline at high prices and poor service
review_text:
At 300 CHF for a short-distance flight I expect some service and quality, but besides of the super narrow seat rows, a small bottle of water and a chocolate I get to fly a chartered plane that is not from Swiss. Not even the staff is Swiss.
With Swiss you are just paying for the direct destinations and a decent flight times - it's a monopoly with the known result of ever lower service quality.

title: Horrendous customer service and a faff to deal with if you want to change your booking.
review_text:
Had to rebook my flights as I had suddenly received a surgery date close to my trip. I was completely happy with paying some fee for it to be rebooked, but Customer Service told me to send my doctors documents to them and I might get it rebooked for free. Obviously who wouldn't want that? 

After putting my hopes up, the documents team continued to ignore me for 3/4 weeks, I kept getting emails for an "urgent callback" even though I've never received a call, and the phone number on this email isn't even a valid number. When calling Customer Service for them to direct me, I'd be met with very fed up people who would blow me off and tell me to wait. I would have no idea what to wait for seeing how to this day I have never received any emails nor phone calls.

     ‚ÄúMy refund is now complete after 41 weeks (more than 3/4 of a year) and I am finally done forever with your absolutely pathetic airline. Astonishingly, a simple search will reveal the horrific treatment that I experienced at the hands of Swiss Air is not the exception but rather part of a larger pattern of corporate abuse.  I feel sorry for elderly or otherwise compromised passengers who may not have the stamina to fight for what‚Äôs rightfully theirs.  I travel frequently in any given year and have never come across an airline such as yours and truly believe I would still be fighting for my money had I not gotten the Department of Transportation involved. title: Disappointment with Swiss and Austrian Airlines: A Business Traveler‚Äôs Struggle
review_text:
Swiss, as well as the group to which it belongs, is deteriorating more and more, especially in the disrespectful way they treat their customers before the flight, even when we travel in business class. In this case, it is a flight with Austrian Airlines but booked through Swiss, so I have to deal with Swiss.

I receive a terse message from Swiss informing me that on the return from Thailand with a stopover in Vienna, the last flight from Vienna to Geneva is canceled. I would therefore have to spend the whole night at Vienna airport and take the flight the next morning.
On their website, we have the choice to either accept or get a refund, with no other alternatives. (I should remind you that the closer we get to departure, the higher the fares; getting a refund means paying more with another airline than if we had booked on the date of our booking with Swiss).
They do not even offer to provide us with a hotel night.
I spend two hours with their online chat. I manage to get them to book the return flight on a Swiss flight, passing through Zurich. I see that the flight appears on my account in the app. I am happy and thank them.
Four days later, I find that the flight from Bangkok to Zurich has disappeared, and there is the flight forcing me to spend the night in Vienna. I understand that the chat agent did not have the right to transfer me from Austrian to Swiss, even though the ticket had already been paid by Swiss.
I write through their form, specifying that the flight via Zurich had been booked during the chat, and that they removed it without even bothering to inform me.
They reply by saying that they can do nothing and that I must call a premium rate number to discuss it (an 0848 number).
Disgusted, I request a refund and look for a flight with another airline.

title: Beware if you think there is a chance you might need to change your flight
review_text:
I haven't yet flown with them, so can't share that part of my experience, but be very careful if you think there is a chance you will need to change flights on Swiss Air. The way their algorithm works for repricing tickets is really unethical, and the customer experience on that front it awful if you can't self-serve online. This is what I wrote to them in my complaint and waiting for their reply: 

Dear Swiss Airlines,

This is the first time I have flown with Swiss Air and before getting on the flight, I have just gone through the worst flight change experience I have ever experienced. Please see the background below: 

(1) I used your chat system to reschedule my outbound flight to one day earlier. Landing in Nice at the earliest time possible and taking the same class. Given it is a very short trip, I elected to stick with economy. 

(2) The bot offered me a flight that would land after 9am, and would cost around SGD220. I accepted and clicked continue. The bot then redirected me to the website to finalise my confirmation and make payment, to which I immediately agreed. 

(3) Upon landing on the website, I tried to proceed right away. The website then displayed an error and suggested me to contact the system again if the error were to repeat itself. I tried again and the same error was shown. 

(4) I went back to the bot to repeat the entire process. The same flight was offered, but now the price was now SGD440. I was really taken aback by the systems sudden repricing and price hike, and honestly annoyed. It has been a matter of minutes with me following Swiss Air's guidance. If I had come back a few hours later or the next day I would understand, but to witness a price hike like that mid transaction, when I had simply followed the instructions felt to me as both unacceptable and unethical on Swiss Airlines part. 

(5) So I elected to speak to your live chat to explain what had happened and to see if they could resolve this. The individual tried to explain that pricing is not guaranteed, that it can change, and it won't be the same if it isn't the same class. I explained that it was mid-transaction, that the system called an error, and that I had not changed the class of the flight. 

(6) The agent accepted and offered to try to make the change for me on their end. The agent was however unable to offer me the new time I had tried to book, so I accepted a later flight. The price was still however SGD440 now, and the agent couldn't do anything about it. 

(7) To add insult to injury, when I simultaneously went back to the website, I saw that the flight I wanted was still there for SGD440. Given how much time had been wasted, I just went ahead to book it and pay the money. 

(8) I explained to the agent and he/she said they can only see what is on the system, and they also could not see the history of my first chat with the bot (and that it was not necessary). 

I have the flight I want. but this whole experience has left a very bad taste. If the original price I was given was SGD440, maybe I would have felt it was expensive but just have proceeded. It is the fact I felt the SGD220 was reasonable, tried to transact, the system failed and was immediately quoted double that makes it feel terribly unethical. And then after the fact, the fact the agent gave me poor justifications or no justification for the higher rate, was then going to sell me a later flight for the higher fee and couldn't actually help me more made it so much worse. 

I don't blame the agent though, because they can only work with the tools they are given. I am more disappointed with Swiss Airlines. What a horrible customer experience.

title: Anyone But SWISS -   simply don't care about you - it's as simple as that....
review_text:
After flying 35k miles in the last 6 months on a number of airlines with great customer service we now experienced the worst .

A joke of an airline with no customer facing staff - when it goes wrong you are on your own !

Due to leave at 5pm, announcement of delay for up to 2 hours whilst sat on plane. After 1 hour Captain said further delay 50 mins ( just to get you under the 2 hour window for comps). 10 minutes later I got a text saying flight cancelled - 2 minutes later the captain announced flight cancelled as they could not land back in Zurich after 11pm - and how the fluck is that my my problem????

A  rep came onboard and advised the same - we asked about hotels and she said they will do nothing, no meals, transport, etc. you are on your own !  Then it dawned on us - there were no hotels available as Taylor Swift was in Town that night - Swiss simply didn't care - not their problem.

So, off to collect our bags and get a text saying rebooked for for 2 days later via Frankfurt and bags checked all way through. What ???? what will we do without our bags? asked at the baggage centre and they said there are no bags as they are in security and will be sent on next flight.

So - no flight, no clothes, no hotel/food etc. and SWISS did nothing to help - no staff around whatsoever - absolute chaos.

We eventually found a hotel miles away at Horgan but the prices had been doubled/trebled due to the aforementioned TS concert - fortunately we had our cards with us so booked and travelled by train.

BUT - no clothes, only t shirt & shorts for 2 nights and days in Zurich, no toiletries no nothing - so had to buy the whole lot and a case to take them back home - just totted up a total spend of 2460 Swiss, about ¬£2122 - which will be submitting a claim to SWISS to pay.

Our replacement flight to Frankfurt 2 days later was also delayed, as was the connection to Manchester - and guess what - our bags were still in Frankfurt. so now 4 days after last seeing them they have arrived in the UK - but now will take until Tuesday to get them to us - that's 6 days in total since we had them - so I rang SWISS - guess what - they simply don't give a fluck - its not their problem.

....and neither will I when I choose another airline and remember ABS - Anyone But SWISS !

title: We lost our seats - overbooked flight
review_text:
My husband and I booked and paid for our flights in full many months before our actual flight, and as were scanning our boarding passes to board our flight from Zurich to Nice, both our tickets flashed ‚Äúunable to board‚Äù. The attendees said we do not have a seat and we we‚Äôve been put on standby. They said the flight has been overbooked by 5 passengers and we no longer have a seat. I argued that we booked, paid for, and even manually selected our seats well before the flight date, and they did not care. They told us the airline overbooks flight IN CASE people don‚Äôt show up!!! SO money hungry!!!! How can they assume people won‚Äôt show up and then inconvenience innocent customers who have done all the right things?!!

We weren‚Äôt late to board the plane, we had our boarding passes and passports ready - we did everything we were meant to and we were still kicked off the flight. They offered us a flight at 7am the next day, and we said no way. They then compromised for 9:30pm flight that night. 

We completely wasted a day in Zurich airport and were given NO explanation as to why we no longer had seats. Apparently there were ‚Äúmultiple factors‚Äù that meant we were on standby. We asked why the people who booked their flight last aren‚Äôt the first to go on standby, and they had no answer. 

Such disgraceful service! To kick 2 paying customers off a flight for no reason other than the fault of their own. 
Absolutely would NOT recommend and WILL NOT be flying Swiss Air again!

title: I will never board a plane again that says Swiss Air
review_text:
I used Swiss Air to travel home from Dublin, but it was a huge mistake. I booked my tickets about 10 days before the flight, decided to go with one connection via Zurich, it was somewhat cheaper. Well, I will definitely won't do it again.

Got to the airport with my 1,5 old child, went through the security check, all good, then about 15 minutes it, it says 1,5 hr delay (which was our time to get to the connection in Zurich), so the Airline re-booked us, got the text, all good, instead of our 19.15 arrival we will get there at 23.35, but now not with 1 but 2 connections via Zurich and Munich. Which I was still OK with, until we landed in Zurich, and found out that the re-booked connection by the Airline originally, was cancelled. Got another text, our flight has been re-booked AGAIN leaving in the morning (next day), with final arrival time of 12.40 (which again, departure from Munich was delayed with a good 40 minutes, but we were so used to it... lol ) So the total journey was about 20 hours...

We both survived, but the customer service all through the airport was a huge disappointment, the way they handled the whole situation, which turned out been going on in the last 3 days, due to weather conditions apparently... was just very poor, sometimes even unprofessional.

There was no separate lane to help people with small children, and everyone was a dog, one lady basically turned her back at me and my screaming child, because I wanted to ask a question from one of the staff, out of line, to see if there is someone who could help for people like me who is travelling with small humans with zero patience, but the answer was no. Sorry, there was a family room, which we couldn't use, because then I cannot stay in line to get some 'no use' help. The help with accommodation was only a flyer, tells you to book it yourself and then you will get that refunded by the airline.

And last, no strollers at the airport that you could use, so from us, Zurich Airport along with the Airline receives a big ZERO. We will not chose this airline ever again.

review_text: My family and I had a terrible experience with Swiss Air. It all started when our departure flight from Boston was delayed due to lack of available gates. We spent 5 nights in Naples with no luggage and my wife's bag finally arrived in Naples the day we left for Positano. Naples airport said they would deliver the bag to Positano but they never did. My bag finally arrived in Naples 3 days later never to be delivered to Positano. After spending 11 nights with no luggage we were able to pickup our bags in Naples only to check them for our flight home. The most frustrating part of the experience, besides no luggage and wasting time shopping for essentials, was the lack of communication with Swiss Air. They took no responsibility and just passed us off to Eurowings even though we paid hundreds of dollars extra to Swiss Air to check bags.

title: Try Swiss if you want to robbed

I am Swiss and I am shocked by the appalling service. I called to see if I could cancel my flight as I waited to decide if I needed a luggage and when I finally decided I needed one, the price was ¬£220 pounds just to add a luggage 6 days before travelling, really???? 

I called Swiss to discuss the luggage fee and cancellation fees, I was told
by the agent that I could cancel my flight and get a full refund and he was on recording. 

I trusted the agent and cancelled, 3 days later on a Saturday another agent called to let me know I wouldn't get my money back as I wasn't in the grace period anymore. I reminded him that his colleague was the one who told me I would get fully refunded and he was recorded, the thing is now, nobody cares anymore, they just want to take your money, disgusting!!!!!! I am so shocked that this type of behaviours is becoming totally normal. Not professional, no morals, not customer focused, no accountability nor respect. I am soooooo done.

title: Extremely bad experience with this airline, recommend that you avoid
review_text:
My fiance√© and I booked a return trip from Dublin to Geneva with a 90 min layover in Zurich each direction. The first flight leaving Dublin was delayed by an hour, which meant we had to literally sprint through Zurich airport to get to the next flight. 

We barely arrived at the next gate in time to find the second flight had already been delayed by 90mins. This delay soon changed on the TV screens to 2 hours and then more than 2 hours. When we asked the staff member at the gate what the reason for the delay was and what the likelihood was of the flight being outright cancelled he had no information to provide and directed us to the flight transfer desk. At this point we noticed that 10+ swiss air flights departing Zurich appeared to have already been cancelled and we became concernedthat ours would be next. Also, our flight arrival time in Geneva was being pushed out from 7pm to almost 10pm, which would leave us stranded in Geneva and unable to reach our hotel in Chamonix that night.

We asked two additional Swiss Air staff members if our flight would be cancelled and they said anything was possible. We then asked if it was possible for us to take a train to Geneva instead as a result of the very massive delay and if the cost of this would be reimbursed by Swiss Air. The Swiss Air staff members said yes, so we went ahead and did this on their recommendation and they gave us information on how to claim the reimbursement.

Both of our return flights to Dublin 5 days later were also significantly delayed, causing us to miss our bus home in Dublin. My carry on bag was also checked under the plane despite being a standard size and there being loads of free overhead lockers on the plane but at that point we were too worn out to disagree.

I honestly would have been able to get over all of this, as sometimes things just suck and you get unlucky, but by far the worst thing has been that Swiss Air is now refusing to reimburse us for the train tickets despite their own staff informing us that they would. We explicitly only took the train based on their recommendation and now they have done a 180 turn, leaving us with the ‚Ç¨200 cost of two train tickets from Zurich to Geneva. 

Incredibly stressful experience from start to finish. I feel bad for the staff on the ground as they really appeared to not be getting enough support from upper management either.

title: REALLY BAD AIRLINE, WOULD NOT RECOMMEND
review_text:
I heard great things about Swiss Airlines and was EXTREMELY disappointed in my experience. I arrived at the airport well ahead of my flight and checked in through security. My girlfriend and I got to security and were turned back to the counter because the Swiss employee didn't print our Boston to Zurich boarding passes, we only had the connecting flight in Zurich. I then checked in with the staff member at the gate counter for a seat assignment who informed me the seat scheduler was not there yet and they would call me on the intercom to get a seat assignment. I never got a page and when I returned 20 minutes later after eating the scheduler told me I should have checked in earlier and they did not give me a seat. I paid full price for a ticket and was somehow being treated as a standby passenger. I was traveling with my girlfriend who did have a seat and they told her she would need to fly without me while they rescheduled me which we declined because she did not want to fly to multiple different countries with connecting flights alone. The whole team at the gate was unprofessional and continued to blame us for Swiss Airlines overbooking the flight saying we should have checked in earlier even though we did. They also shamed my girlfriend for not wanting to remain on the Swiss flight by herself. They finally rescheduled both our flights for over 5 hours later with a different airline and had to sit in the airport the whole time. 

They said my girlfriends luggage was already loaded and they couldn't get it off the plane so they sent it to Zurich and it was never transferred over to the Porto flight so she was without all of her belongings for several days forcing us to spend our vacation time shopping for clothes and necessities. Not to mention we were flying to Portugal for a wedding and she was without her wedding dress.

On top of the nightmare that was our trip to Porto with Swiss, the return flight was also delayed over an hour and when we finally landed there was no gate available so we sat in the plane on the runway for 30 minutes to deplane.

I was excited to fly with Swiss in the future but was completely disappointed in the way this trip went and how it was handled by their staff. The WORST.
