title: Would Not Recommend
review_text:
It seems fruitless to review an airline as customers really don't have much choice, so customer satisfaction isn't a high priority. However, my recent experience with Swiss made me rethink my stance as I think others should be able to hear about your experience if they seek it out.

Let's start with the primary issue that soured my experience: For the first leg of my flight, I lined up early so was in the first ~ 30% to get on the plane. I know my carry-on was well within the size limit, but the person who scanned my ticket immediately told me it was a full flight so I would need to check in my bag. So I had to scramble to make sure I had what I needed for the next  19 hours of traveling in my personal bag. The gate agent told me that to check the bag in would be "on them" as if it was a great favor.

The other gate agent scanning tickets didn't make any of her passengers check in their bags (same sizes as mine) For some mysterious reason I was singled out. I intentionally pack strategically because I never like checking in bags. To get on the plane and see rows and rows of empty overhead space and watch literal dozens of people with larger bags than mine get on after me was incredibly frustrating. In fact, the FA's let people stow their carry-ons under the seat of empty seats!

I had two flights with Swiss, 3 hours and 12 hours (international connecting flights):

-- fairly on time and the flight attendants were nice.
-- For the 3 hour flight, not even free water was offered - I've never encountered that on a non-budget airline. On the 12 hour flight, a lot of food and snacks were available.
- the seats felt really, really small. Unfortunate as this was a full flight. I'm a below average to average size person. The man sitting next to me could barely sit straight.
--The planes are old. Like, really old. The first plane had a bathroom the was juuust wider than me - literally the smallest plane restroom I've ever been in. 
--The seats recline the most I've ever seen on a plane - it felt like the person was almost in my lap. It's so extreme that for meals flight attendants would tell people to put up their seats so people behind them could put down their trays and eat. Very nice of the FA's to do that.

Overall, I would never elect to fly long hauls on this airline again - it was a truly uncomfortable experience.

title: It‚Äôs time for a reform.
review_text:
Swiss airlines took my brand new, never used, north face bag, even though it was of carry on standard, while I was patiently waiting at the gate for my flight. I was forced to check in my carry on luggage, the penalty for being early, I was promised it would be there when I arrived.

Was the communication bad for 3 days while I sat in a hotel room waiting for my bag from Thursday night to Sunday night.

Yes.

Hope you don‚Äôt plan on vacationing using  Swiss Airlines cause that would have sucked even more.

But the theft and/or damage to personal property is where I draw the line. Brand new $300 bag returned destroyed. Ripped. Torn. Dented. Broken.

I kid you not Swiss said it was fine. ‚ÄúOptical Illusion Defect‚Äù was the exact legalize they used.

What reasonable person can read this and think there shouldn‚Äôt be a reform?

My coworker is actually convinced it was a bag swap and the returned bag wasn‚Äôt my bag. I also think this is highly likely.

Customer service then proceeded to treat me like garbage. Every decision they made revolved around how they can profit and how I had no rights.

What reasonable person can read this and think there shouldn‚Äôt be a reform?

So to me something has become crystal clear from this experience with Swiss Airlines. Airlines have gotten away with too much. The mergers take away people‚Äôs ability to get a good product at a good price and frankly seems to have broken capitalism. The lobbying has made profitable businesses while taking all power from the customer. It‚Äôs time for a reform. The abuse needs to stop now.

What reasonable person can read this and think there shouldn‚Äôt be a reform?

It‚Äôs time.

title: Terrible
review_text:
**Terrible Experience with Swiss Air - Avoid if Possible**

My journey with Swiss was a terrible ordeal, further exacerbated by the length of my travel, though I do not blame them for that aspect. Here‚Äôs a detailed account of my entire journey to provide context to my complaint.

I was travelling from Cordoba, Argentina, to London, UK, returning home. I managed to get my return ticket altered by Lufthansa at a reasonable price, which switched my airline to their Star Alliance partner, Swiss. The flight had one stopover and another changeover, making the journey from Buenos Aires to London quite complicated.

On Friday, 21/6/24, at 20:00, I started an 8-hour overnight coach journey from Cordoba to Buenos Aires. With my limited Spanish, I navigated my way from the coach station to Ezeiza (EZE) Buenos Aires Airport. I arrived at the airport with a 6-7 hour wait to check in. Since I had luggage, I was not flexible in exploring and had limited options for food and hydration.

Eventually, I checked in online and managed to check my main luggage, which allowed me to eat something properly. Security was relatively smooth compared to Heathrow (LHR). However, the flight was slightly delayed. We eventually took off, landing a couple of hours later in S√£o Paulo (GRU). Although this was a stop, we had to disembark, navigate the entire airport, and go through security again to reboard the same plane and seat. By this point, I had been travelling for nearly 20 hours.

Boarding the plane was another drama. The group boarding process, intended to assist those with privileges, vulnerabilities, or seats at the rear, was not followed. The staff at GRU seemed to misunderstand the logistical concept of boarding, leading to congestion and delays. Groups 5 and 6 had no space to queue as airport chairs obstructed the area. The lack of customer care was evident.

Let me explain this in more detail. The priority boarding was completed properly for business class, the vulnerable, and the elderly. However, economy boarding should always be done by boarding the rear passengers first if the front doors are being used. This prevents congestion in the gangway. If passengers seated at the rear of the aircraft board first and place their hand luggage in the overhead bins, it won‚Äôt hinder others from passing. However, if you board passengers in seats 22 and then 44, you can see the issue. Your staff do not seem to understand this concept at all.

After another overnight flight, we arrived in Zurich (ZRH), where I had only one hour to reboard my connection. The pilot reported computer issues with the plane, which were promptly resolved. However, I was concerned about my luggage, and my fears were confirmed when I arrived at Heathrow (LHR) without it. I had to wait another 3-4 hours on Sunday, 23rd, for the next flight to collect my luggage. This extended my travel time significantly. One Heathrow staff member even admitted this is a regular occurrence with your airline.

Overall, my experience with Swiss was extremely disappointing. From the poor boarding process to the mishandling of my luggage, the entire journey was fraught with issues. I hope they take this feedback seriously and make the necessary improvements.

title: Just an absolutely awful experience from start to finish. Worst people/crowd management I have ever seen.
review_text:
Absolutely terrible management from start to finish.

We boarded our flight about 30 minutes late at 7pm which is fine. Boarding was complete. The entire flight was sat down for about 2 minutes when one of the cabin crew picked up the microphone to do what I assumed was the safety briefing. But no, he announced that the flight was cancelled, due to bad weather. Bad weather happens but it seems completely bizarre and completely infuriating to board everyone then immediately unboard them.

This was just the beginning. We we told to go to the front desk to get alternative solutions booked. I got to the queue for the front desk at about 7:30pm, already 30th in the line. By 8pm there were a further 100 people behind me at least. 

Two people were at the desks to manage this, with each interaction with a customer taking about 10 minutes at least. 

The online assistent on the Swiss Air website was totally hopeless, could not find alternative bookings and would not connect you to an actual person to chat with.

The telephone line to Swiss Air would not connect. I witnessed one woman in discussion to Swiss Air on the phone trying to make alternative arrangements get hung up on by Swiss Air just when she seemingly started to make progress.

After queuing from 7:30pm to 10:00pm, I was a couple of people from the desk. When they suddenly announced that they were closing. This is just hilarious purely from a crowd management perspective because obviously the 100 people behind me were furious as we had all been there for over two hours, standing. At this point people were being told to go downstairs in the airport were there were beds apparently, this was never really clear, and come back to the desk at 4am to attempt to get an alternative. I saw a woman who had a very young child literally be told to wait around until 4am, obviously no food available anywhere in the airport and seemingly no where to sleep, and come back to maybe try and find an alternative arrangement.

We were told that we could be reimbursed 150 Francs for a hotel, in Geneva, 150 francs would barely cover half the cost of any hotel in Geneva at that late notice.

It seemed that no one could make alternative arrangements with Swiss, there were alternative flights available on the swiss air website for the next day and following day that were available to purchase (obviously very expensive at this point), that the Swiss Air people were refusing to rebook people onto. 

I eventually managed to get to the desk, i had found a route to Belfast ran by Swiss Air which I found on the Swiss Air website for the following day. I could book it on their website, but i was told at the desk that I could not be booked onto this route in no uncertain terms, that it was sold out despite me being able to purchase tickets on their website. The earliest alternative flight I was offered was the 1st July, this is 5 days after the flight I was meant to take, which is quite obviously pointless given I needed to be in Ireland over the weekend. I was then told to get a refund and book another flight in the next coming days. Obviously all of these flights now costed at least 500 Fr, many upwards of 1000 Fr, which was at least 3 times the amount I would get refunded.

I left because I was fed up, but people were completely at a loss as to what to do, where to stay, how to claim any money back or get an alternative flight, witnessed people being told by staff aggressively that they didn't know what people should do.

An unfortunate situation, that was made worse by absolutely horrendous people management from start from finish. Not making it clear that the desk would be closing at 10pm, when obviously more than 100 people were told to go to the front desk as we left the plane and then queuing for hours expecting the desk to be open for as long as would be required, being the worst offender.

Also Swiss Air seats are incredibly uncomfortable in general, Ryanair seats are better, to put it into perspective how bad they are. 

Would recommend avoiding Swiss Air as far as possible.

It is completely unfair as well how the Swiss Air employees are treated by Swiss Air. Two people were clearly not tasked to deal with situation and should have had literally anyone available in Swiss to assist at that point. They also didn't seem to have any tools to actually help people find alternatives, unable book alternative flights from other airports, provide information or confidence that we would get money back that we spend on hotels or taxis, and no information in general on how to reach any kind of resolution.

Bad weather happens, this isn't an uncommon occurence so this whole situation is completely inexcusable in my view. Other airlines like Easyjet will very clearly state exactly what you can do when your flight is cancelled and the process is really as simple as it could be. I can't help but think that surely Swiss Air could have just run the flight the next day, especially given we are flying out of Geneva airport. That surely would be cheaper than having to reimburse people for the flights and booking people onto other planes, and obviously would have avoided creating 150 people who will never fly on Swiss Air again.

title: Avoid them at any cost
review_text:
We had a connecting flight with them: Bucharest-Zurich, Zurich - Ljubljana. Only 3 hours before leaving for the airport (00:13), we received an email saying that our flight has been cancelled. I opened the chat to see what rebooking options do we have and asked the customer agent to find us a flight which departs same day. At this point, the agent rudely replied: ‚ÄúHow do you think I am going to rebook you if there are no seats available?‚Äù. I replied angrily that he should rebook us same way they let us know about the cancellation only 3 hours before. He simply said that if I don‚Äôt want to add something else, he‚Äôll end the chat. He did not wait for any reply, just ended the chat. I opened another chat and ask the same thing, this time with another agent. This new agent, found was another flight the same day, but we didn‚Äôt take that option because we would have arrived at our final destination only the day after. In the end, they rebooked us onto a flight which departed after 24 hours from Bucharest. I asked if we should do the checkin again, and they said we can‚Äôt, we need to go at the checkin counter. Later that day, I tried to do the check in online and was able to do so, even though there were two different agents who told me otherwise. The next day, our first flight was on time, but the second one, had another delay of 2 hours. All this time, they kept us inside the plane, with not even water provided.

On our return flight, we passed the security gate in Ljubljana and after 10 minutes, we received email that our flight was again delayed. This delay resulted in us missing the connecting flight in Z√ºrich. I opened the chat and asked them to rebook us. The agent rebooked us on a Lufthansa flight to Munich and said we should receive the new tickets in 10 mins. I waited 15 mins and nothing came. Opened another chat and the new agent told us that there is no record of such conversation where we have been rebooked. I told him I have screenshots with the conversation, but you‚Äôre not allowed to upload things to the chat so it was useless. Then, I asked him to book us onto those flights and he did. We went to the security and asked them to let us exit and go to the checkin counter to pick up our boarding passes. When we arrived there, the lady from Lufthansa, told us that we don‚Äôt have seats, as they are overbooked. I couldn‚Äôt believe it‚Ä¶she said she is sorry and admitted that Swiss is the most hated airline at the moment.

Conclusion: I am rating this as 1 star only because it‚Äôs not possible to give a negative number of stars, bit this has been the worst experience I had with an airline and the worst customer experience I‚Äôve ever had in my life.

title: Unsafe experience, poor cleanliness and customer service
review_text:

Review:

Very disappointed and concerned about the poor service and lack of safety awareness. Many issues encountered on my recent flight with your airline, flight number LX176 on 30th May 2024, from Zurich to Singapore:

1. Lack of Stickers Indicating Fragile Items: This is a basic service provided by most airlines to ensure that delicate items are handled with care. Also, when we sought advice from one of the staff (didn't manage to catch his name) at the check-in counter on how to rectify this issue, he repeatedly insisted, without providing any helpful solutions, that there was no way to indicate that our luggage contained fragile items without offering any helpful solution. 

Moreover, this particular staff was also nonchalant in all his replies to us and didn't bother to tell us that the check-in procedure was done - he merely placed our passports on the countertop and assumed that we knew it was done. 

2. Poor Cleanliness: Upon boarding, I found plastic bottles and other trash left behind on the seat and in the seat pockets. The overhead storage compartments were also full of brown debris of questionable origin (see 1st image). I understand that the staff might have limited time to clean the planes quickly before the next flight. But, if even budget airlines such as Scoot and Jetstar could do it, why couldn't Swiss Air do it as well? This suggests a lack of training and competency from the ground staff. 

3. Lack of Safety Awareness and Initiatives: The most alarming issue. During landing, an overhead storage compartment opened likely due to tremors during touchdown, and luggage almost fell out. My parents were seated below the storage compartment that opened. The cabin crew did not address this potentially dangerous situation. Instead, all of them sat at their seats without any concern. I had to quickly unbuckle my seatbelt, stand up, and close the overhead compartment myself, all in the middle of landing. Additionally, I observed that the crew did not check if the overhead compartments were securely closed before takeoff and landing, which is a critical safety measure. When I raised this concern, one of the cabin crew claimed, "this happens all the time during landing, all airlines do not do this," which is both incorrect and unacceptable. Based on my experience with other airlines, such as Singapore Airlines, Scoot, and Thai Airways, ensuring that the overhead compartments are securely closed has always been part of the safety protocols. Moreover, never in my life have I seen a overhead compartment open up during landing. 

Given this experience, this is the first and last time we will be taking Swiss Air.

title: One Star for Swiss Airlines' Service and Lack of Communication
review_text:
I had a long-haul flight from Singapore to Zurich where the sound on my screen wasn't working. I was given the option to sit alone in Economy Plus, but the chair couldn't recline.

Upon arriving in Amsterdam, my luggage was missing. I was informed that it would arrive on the next flight and be delivered to my address. However, it did not arrive that day or the following days. I spent many hours trying to contact them but was always redirected to another office, business, or person.

I filed a complaint and received a response saying they were trying their best. A week later, I received a message stating that the luggage would be sent that day by express from Zurich and delivered as soon as possible. Again, nothing happened.

We travelled to another country the following Monday, forcing me to buy more clothes and necessities. Out of the blue, on Thursday, they delivered the suitcase to the previous address after we had already left for the next country.

I finally received my suitcase after 18 days. Swiss Airlines reimbursed me only 306 euros, which is laughable. I spent around 1,200 euros on clothes, shoes, and necessities during this period. Swiss Airlines' explanation was that I could still use the items I purchased.

The flight back home we missed our last connection because, the pilot waited for 30 min. for passengers that had a delayed flight, then a thunderstorm came over and  we had to wait on the runway for another 30 min. Due to having to stay-over in Singapore  we missed a wedding the next morning. Overall our first experience with Swiss and our last.

title: SWISS airline refuses to pay compensation required by EU regs for late arrival.
review_text:

SWISS refuses to pay compensation on these terms.
Flights were delayed without explanation, as were seat changes.
Ground staff chaotic dealing with delayed passengers.
Will try to avoid Swiss International Air Lines (SWISS) in the future.

title: Your Carry On Will Be Checked, and Then Delayed
review_text:

If I had known Swiss Air would separate me from my bag, I would have packed an AirTag in my luggage. I‚Äôll never fail to do this in the future. 
There‚Äôs a reason people travel with luggage‚Äîit contains items necessary for them to have a successful and enjoyable trip.

title: A sad story with Swiss airlines.
review_text:
Me and my girlfriend travelled to Bali for a 3-week holiday and this trip was supposed to be my 40th birthday celebration and proposal to my girlfriend.
We chose to fly with Swiss Airlines as we trusted that travelling with this airlines would make this holiday a very special and pleasant event from the very beginning.
Sadly, this was not the case and both the proposal and birthday celebration got ruined.
Here are the two main reasons:

1. The service on board was terrible.
We paid ‚Ç¨2600 for the flight ticket (for both), and we didn‚Äôt even get the dish served. 
We were told they run out of available choices (2 dishes) and after lengthy, miscomprehended discussion with flight attendant we got lasagna for my girlfriend (which we said we can‚Äôt eat) and leftovers from breakfast for me.
The seat in front of my girlfriend‚Äôs seat was broken and whenever the passenger sitting in front of her tried to lean backwards, it almost fell on her.
The entertainment system in front of me had a broken audio jack and it was not working properly. This means I could not listen to music and watch movies.
3 lavatories went out of order during the flight.
To sum up, this is not what you expect from a ‚Ç¨2600 flight.

2.	My girlfriend‚Äôs luggage was not delivered to Singapore, and it got lost.
After landing in Singapore, we were informed (via e-mail) that her luggage was delayed (for unknown reasons) and that it should be delivered with the next flight. She had all the essential things (clothes, cosmetics, medicine, sunscreens, sunglasses) in the checked luggage and we could not continue to Bali without it. We decided to extend our stay in Singapore by 2 days because we were convinced that the luggage would be delivered soon.
This incurred additional costs to us.
We didn‚Äôt hear back from the Swiss Airlines, nor did we receive any further communication or status on the lost luggage, and we had no other choice but continue to Bali without it.
My girlfriend urgently needed all the essential things and we had to visit the local stores and buy them.
As this was another unexpected cost we only focused on the bare necessities: basic clothing needed for 3 weeks, swimsuits, sunglasses, cosmetics, sunscreens, medicines, new luggage (suitcase).
	
This accident made the whole holiday experience miserable.
It is needless to say that any woman feels comfortable when she has all the things that she needs with her. My girlfriend is no exception and she was not in the right mood to enjoy the holiday, because all her belongings were gone missing.
It was her first time in Asia and instead of enjoying the trip and time off, we had to spend days with stressful shopping and spending the money that we saved for this trip (and not for shopping). Unfortunately, it‚Äôs time consuming, not easy and not cheap to buy essentials a woman needs for 3 weeks.
The proposal to my girlfriend was ruined because her dress got lost and she had nothing to wear for a fine dining dinner. As a result of this, we cancelled the table reservation, and months of proposal planning were wasted.
On top of all these atrocities caused by one lost luggage, my 40th birthday celebration was ruined too, because again, all the stuff needed for the celebration (including gift) was in the lost luggage and we had to spend time trying to solve this unpleasant situation.

After the holidays, we requested compensation from Swiss Airlines for lost luggage. Although the communication with Swiss Airlines was quick, it was unsuccessful (since one is communicating with AI instead of a real person), meaning there was no empathy, just cold, formulaic, pre-programmed responses with a result we were not satisfied with. Swiss offered us compensation in the form of half of all expenses due to the lost luggage. I assume the Montreal Agreement means nothing to this company.

To make matters worse, my luggage missed the connection and was delayed for 37 hours. Despite receiving an email stating my luggage would be delivered to my hotel the next day between 2-4 pm, I only received it at 10 pm, causing significant inconvenience.

review_text: I traveled twice with this company and was the worst experience. First time they lost our luggage and second time was delayed and missed my connection flight! Never again !!!!!!!!

review_text:
Swiss downgraded the TLV-ZRH flight from a medium-haul flight (4 hours) to a short-haul flight, and even basic services were not available.

It's like dealing with a black hole ‚Äì all my efforts to reach them are met with silence and indifference. Save yourself the agony and avoid SWISS like the plague. title: Zu Teuer geworden und kein Service
review_text:
There was a time where I used to love flying with Swiss airlines/Edelweiss.
Nowadays it has become one of the worst if not the worst fly company in Europe.
They have the highest price of all European airlines and they don‚Äôt even give you a meal anymore. My last flight was on May 7th to Beirut. We flew for over 3,5 Hours, they only gave us a bottle of water and we couldn‚Äôt even RECLINE our seats because it was not possible in this new aircraft! Most of passengers have complained about it. The prices are at least 3 times more than other airlines and we get the lowest services! My friends and I won‚Äôt fly with Swiss anymore, we rather go to Basel, stuttgart or Milan.

title: Ancient aircrafts, and poor service/choice of meals
review_text:
Our family recently flew Swiss Air economy on Mum-Zur-Lon. My observations 
1. Online Check-in - Fairly smooth; Option to pick available seats at no extra cost which was very convenient
2. Check-in at Airport - No large queues at Mum/Zur/Lon; however, check-in personnel at Mumbai was very keen to check-in even our hand luggage and kept repeatedly asking to the point it got annoying. She insisted on seeing our hotel reservations in London which was a first!
3. Flight - Seat pitch is average, and the Mum-Zurich aircraft (same for return) is like an ancient museum piece. Worn seats, 2 of our 4 seats did not have working remotes and very little space in overhead cabins for luggage
4. Meals - Pathetic !! For a 1 am departure and 9 hour flight, you are offered 1 veg/NV roll, Real Active/Tropicana fruit juices (seriously !) and a breakfast (absolute garbage) which has to compete for the worst international airline meal award ! in fact I think kids breakfast was the best and would suggest booking same irrespective of age ! The Zur-Lon leg offered no meals/drinks and had to be purchased. Hello ! A warning this was the case would have helped us plan better !
On our return leg, they ran out of Non-veg, and cabin crew gave some logic of only 12% meals being non-veg on Indian flights. Who cares ! Its not my mistake you have erred in forecasting !  To top it off, they gave my kids' meal to someone else ! And promised my kid a first class / business meal to make up for their mistake and returned with an economy veg meal ! Pathetic !!
5. Beverages - Usual fare but be prepared for Real/Tropicana juices !
6. Saving grace - Flights were on time

title: Overbooked flights
review_text: Had an extremely unpleasant and unprofessional experience with the Swiss airways. After arriving at the check in desk before the departure, they informed us that they have overbooked the flight and hence we cannot board. Initially, they tried to blame it on us for being late, one of their employees pointed out that we have in fact been waiting at the check in counter since 6:07 pm (check in was supposed to close at 6:15 and flight departure at 7:30 pm) and then they acknowledged the mistake on their part. First, they made us wait for 30 minutes to see if something is possible and after the flight departed then they informed us that we will have to find another flight. We explained that all our travel plans have been finalized and paid for including hotels, trains, airfare etc. and this is a mistake on their part. After waiting at the counter for more than 3 hours, they eventually booked us for the next day with Air Canada. Now, we are supposed to arrive at the destination 24 hours later. We pointed out the compensation we were entitled per the FAA rules, however their manager declined to talk to us and instead asked us to call customer service. Their customer service informed us that we were in fact listed as ‚Äúno show‚Äù and hence they cannot do anything. Having them change our status to show as ‚Äúinvoluntarily declined boarding‚Äù took another hour and despite that they declined us compensation. The meal vouchers they gave us did not work as the hotel restaurant had closed. This has been the worst air travel experience we have had so far and Swiss ruined our whole vacation. Shout out to Air Canada for being so great and helpful the next day!

title: Hands in the air for Swiss Air!
review_text: My first flight on Swiss Air and it did not disappoint.  I was in Premium Economy which I highly recommend if you can't quite swing Business class.  Lots of leg room, great footrest and sliding/reclining seat.  Huge screen and the meals were massive.  Practically a buffet.  The flight staff was very attentive and the overall flight itself was smooth.  This will be my preferred airline for future flights.

title: Worst airline to use
review_text: The absolute worst airline I have ever experienced of dealing with. I had to  cancel one round trip due to wrong dates and did within 24 hours. Their policy states this is refundable in full. I received an email on 22nd April for confirmation of the refund. For 2 months I have heard no word from Swissand have recieved no refund. Pathetic. I called three times. Never using again. British Airways is what I will use continually from now on.

title: Swiss airlines Nightmare trip
review_text: On a trip from Zurich to Singapore and back. Flying with Swiss Airlines was a nightmare! First flight Zurich to Singapore cancelled right before boarding. Rescheduled for the following day. There was no Swiss airlines personnel that could help anywhere. Flight back from Singapore to Zurich cancelled the day before flying. They sent me an email. I tried to check in for my new flight but Swiss apparently did not complete my booking so when I got to the airport to do the check in at the counter with the new flights, I had to wait for 15 min that they find me and my partner a spot on a full flight. We are not sitting together. The most awful experience. I will never fly Swiss airlines again.

title: Cancelled flight - stranded in Copenhagen - no reimbursment of costs
review_text:
My 07.20 a.m. flight to Copenhagen was cancelled due to technical issues after waiting almost two hours at the gate. Whilst I was booked onto another flight in the afternoon to Copenhagen, I missed my connecting flight to the Faeroe Islands and had to spend a night in Copenhagen. Submitting my claims for the caused expenses (e.g., accommodation), as advised by the staff taking care of my re-booking, the answer from Swiss was that the 'irregularity to be extraordinary circumstances' and hence, my claims are being denied. 
I not only missed a full day of vacation, of which I spent half of it at the airport in Zurich, but also was left with the costs to carry myself.

title: Absolutely disgusting experience
review_text: Horrible service. I upgraded to business class and the ticket agent at the gate switched our seats to economy and then lied to my face about aircraft reconfiguration. Then upon boarding, the purser also lied stating all seats were taken. We moved to economy and our paid business seats remained empty during the flight because of lies by multiple airline employees. I have receipts of payment, I have all the proof but yet their feeble brains could not process the information. Deplorable people.

title: Worst service ever
review_text: The worst airline I have ever used to travel. I will never use it again. They cancelled my flight due to a delay that they didn‚Äôt explain, then it took 3 months for them to respond to an email where they denied my compensation for no reason.

title: Terrible service
review_text: Terrible experience with Swiss Air!! We selected our seat way before the flight and the day before the flight they changed our seats without giving any explanation. Giving us the worst seats ever separating our family while I am pregnant travelling with a baby.  This is the second time travelling with Swiss Air and both times we had terrible experiences.

title: Swiss are is TERRIBLE!!!
review_text:
Swiss Air is the worst airline I've ever traveled on!!!  They lost my bag.  Found it 2 months later.  Refused to reimburse us for expenses for clothes and cancelled flight.  Terrible customer service.  The still owe me close to $1,000 and they refuse to pay.
When I returned to the US I read Swiss Air flew 124 passengers from Zurich to Bilboao and left ALL the luggage in Zurich.  My advice...NEVER fly Swiss Air!!!

title: terrible customer service
review_text: we had a 50 minute delay and then were supposed to get on a connecting flight and they couldn‚Äôt hold the other plane, that was also operated by them, for 20 minutes so we could get on. Terrible experience

title: horrible customer support.
review_text:
Flight was cancelled last minute. 

SWISS only reimbursed the ticket and that's it. No excuse, no word, and they rejected claims to reimburse the lost hotel bookings and car rentals. So holidays lost, but still partially paid for.
Apparently, EU laws does apply to SWISS Air only when to their benefit.

If you want customer protection when flying to or from another EU city / country to or from Switzerland, make sure to avoid SWISS Air. It is only good as far as all is going well. If there is an issue, you are on your own !

(Inside note : I live in Zurich for the last 6 years and fly for work at least twice a month. Believe me when I say I tried to switch to SWISS from another frequent flyer program, as it will definitely save me stopovers and travel time,  but after 3 similar occurences like this last one where I'm left without either assistance or compensation, I'm through).

Anyway, go direct if you fly from Zurich as it makes sense, and hope your flights don't get cancelled :-)

title: Nice and Quick Flight to France
review_text: I was very satisfied with my experience flying with SWISS as they give you a free water bottle and chocolate on this short haul flight between Zurich, Switzerland and Nice, France.  I enjoyed this flight and is a great value for money!

title: Worst experience
review_text: Tried to book a trip online using the Swiss website and Swiss airline. However the website said there was an error. I never received the tickets. However, saw a ‚Äûpending‚Äú transaction on my card. I called the airline and they told me the transaction was cancelled. I could not rebook as the same price for the flight was no longer available. I went to book with another airline as the service I was receiving was not acceptable. 2 days later I found my card was charged although the airline clearly told me the transaction was cancelled and the tickets were never sent. I called the airline and they said they could not do anything about it. I called my credit card and it they said unfortunately this happens often with Swiss. I had to file a claim and I am still waiting for my refund. Luckily I can afford to wait for this to be resolved. But on top of the charge this has taken a full day of me calling back and forth with the airline and credit card company. The service with Swiss is not friendly and they almost sound like it is my fault. Very frustrating. Worst experience. Save your nerves.

title: Swiss Air is a crappy airline
review_text: Well, when I say I flew with Swissair, I never got the experience, as they canceled my flight, and never offered me an alternative. I had to arrange another flight with KLM, whom I have used many times before, with a great deal of satisfaction. Booking another flight messed up my plans and cost me hundreds of dollars more, in order to fly to Europe near enough to my previously arranged schedule. I had never flown with Swissair before, and after this experience never will. I would encourage everyone to avoid this crappy, unhelpful and uncaring airline.

title: Terrible service standard and reliability issues
review_text: Flight was cancelled with less than 24 hours notice. Refund is partial and hotel reimbursement was not done. Non existing service standards with no communication from the airline and despite repeated attempts to contact the airline, no response or reply. Avoid at all cost.

title: Worst support service I have ever experienced in my life!
review_text:
Shocking service from a particular support staff. I was so traumatised from the service that i will never ever go with Swiss airways again. Even the name of the airway makes me cringe now, and I want to save others from making a mistake that can ruin your whole travel experience. We booked one of the most expensive flight from Italy (cant remember which airport, but we were in Napali) flying back to Sydney, to avoid any travel issues and we paid more expensive price when we chose Swiss Airways because we thought it'll be better cos Switzerland usually produce quality stuff and the more expensive the flight, the more reliable, etc.. WRONG!!!

The year after covid there was a lot of flight delays and chaos with connecting flights and everything. Swiss airways decided to make changes and delays, which results in us missing our connecting flights. All they had to do was move our flight to another one, which is possible. However, when we called support, this guy with an accent did not want to help us, I dont know how to identify him because he wont give his name either. He basically deny us of changing anything and no refund for anything and leave us stranded in Italy, because when we try to look for another flight online even if we have to pay, it costs at least AUD 5000 - 25,000 one way around that time of the year, no joke! We decided to call again to get another support staff, but our call keeps routing to him and he kept holding us on the line for hours arguing that it's not possible to change our flight, without giving any reason except it is just how it is. We decided to hang up and keep calling in, hoping to get another support staff because he wouldn't transfer us to anyone, not even a manager or anything. Finally my partner used his phone to call support with his phone while we have him on my phone so we got through to a lady who was able to help us immediately and got us to another flight straight away with no issue and no additional costs because they were the one that screwed us over with their changes to begin with.
When I reported this issue to their supervisor about this particular support staff, he just said sorry and he will look into it and he had a tone that just didn't really cared too much and he doesn't seem to realise how that service from 1 person can impact on our whole travel experience. I asked for updates on the investigation result but he never got back to me about this guy. I really want to sue them legally for not giving a f*ck but it's just been too stressful that it was healthier that I let it go. For your own sake, don't book this airway, ever!! If they find it acceptable to have a support staff providing this level of service, I hope they start losing business because that is no way to charge premium cost and provide such horrendous service. Also, the plane itself is less than average, nothing special and not worth the price!

title: Super
review_text: A very enjoyable flight. The cabin was clean and comfortable. The on line crew were helpful and polite. Have flown with Swiss air several times and have always found them to be ideal.

title: Most Basic Business Class with Compacted Seat Arrangement
review_text: The worst business class seats for long haul flights we have experienced among the major airlines we have flown so far (UA, AA, ITA, AF, BA and KLM). Congested cabin, a 2-2-1 and 2-1-2 layout. The ONLY reason we chose SWISS is  because they are the ONLY non-stop from the west coast to Switzerland. Cramped 5 seats in a row where every other major airline (mentioned above)with their aircraft class has 4 seats! Seats are narrow, uncomfortable and the couple's seat by the window lack ANY work space area and minimal storage. The dining tray is a primitive design of a pullout from the small divider between the seats. With the exception f the "lie flat" feature, the seat is much closer to a "premium Economy" seat. The shoulder belt cuts right into your neck as 2 FA's admitted to this defective design! Narrow seat handles with zero privacy on the isle seats.

title: Its a real shame...ZERO Support after Flight cancellation
review_text: April 13th, at the gate in Boston 5 Minutes prior boarding. No personell at the gate. agent came, logged in Flight cancelled to dashboard. Announced, that the flight is cancelled due to Codeshare Partner problem. There will be no help with Hotels. Claim your bags downstairs. Bags received. After 2 hours waiting at 11pm on the Swiss counter, help on a flight back to Z√ºrich the day after. No help or voucher for a Hotel room. Booked a Room via mobile app, no problem. Claimed Hotel and Taxi after back in Switzerland. Swiss declined, because of a technical problem cancellation......, remember, codeshare Partner Problem. Its a shame dear Swiss, its a shame...

title: Delays, lies, and extremely poor sevice
review_text: High prices inversly proportional to their terrible service. Again delayed, again dont even know for how long as they lie with times. Really sick of Swiss.

title: Avoid this airline at all costs - anyone else is better!
review_text:
Recently booked a ski trip landing in Geneva. I booked an Economy Light Fare as I anticipated I‚Äôd need to purchase sports baggage to transport my snowboard -  I didn‚Äôt need any other type of luggage. There was no option do this. After reading their policy back in December 2023, I was pleased to find out they transfer sports baggage at no extra cost to your checked luggage. Great! I added on the checked luggage on to my booking and flew out from Heathrow no issues. 

Coming back through Geneva, I was stopped at the check-in desk and was told I hadn‚Äôt paid specifically for my sports baggage and that I‚Äôd need to pay 90CHF to return home. I explained that the policy on the website said that this could be transferred at no extra cost - however upon returning to the website a new policy was in place, stipulating Economy Light Fares could in fact not transfer their luggage at no extra cost.

There was not a single SWISS airline employee in the airport. All were agency staff and all were rude and unhelpful. 

I was told I could not board my flight without paying. I saw my bag left on the runway for 45 minutes and was held to ransom until I paid. I had already paid for 22kg luggage. No payment no flight. 

1. I had no issue at Heathrow airport, and their only response is that they have nothing to do with how airports choose to operate / not operate their policy. 

2. It was a new policy. I researched exhaustively at the time and did not see any Economy Light Fare stipulation. 

3. When I booked, there was no option anywhere to purchase sports baggage anyway. How could I have bought it, if it‚Äôs not even an option on their website? 

4. SWISS have no duty of care to their passengers. All they employ is agency staff who clearly don‚Äôt care about their organisations reputation. 

5. Their customer complaints department is abysmal. 

I‚Äôd implore you, if you‚Äôre travelling on a ski holiday, there are so many other providers that won‚Äôt try to extort you the way SWISS did. A relatively cheap flight quickly became very expensive for me. I‚Äôd recommend EasyJet, BA (or anyone else really).

title: Cancelling flights
review_text: Cancelled my flight and gave me only 2/3 the refund. Dont fly with them - you may not go on your trip. There was no one to talk to

title: Lies, underperforming product & service, no one to talk to.... shoddy
review_text:
A complete mess. Booked on Skyscanner, but the prices didn't match, so there's a glitch in Swiss booking system, plus when I chose my flight on Skyscanner I didn't realise Swiss had bumped my return by a day with no recourse!!!! 

Having counted to 10 and sucked that up through gritted teeth, when I can to check in the night before they wouldn't issue my ticket to Zurich, or jo'burg as I was "on a waiting list"! In business class at these prices? I've never come across this before!  

Rang their ticket desk and was assured, no all fine you're checked in , so I  asked them to email me confirmation which they wouldn't/couldn't do. The next day at lisbon airport check in told me business class was OVERBOOKED on the Jo'burg leg - 48 seats booked and only 42 available!! What kind of airline does this to a business class customer???

I am now stressed out to the max for the last 24 hours to see if I get on and their supervisors I Zurich don't want to know plus the website makes it impossible to complain. Fine, I'll just bite with my feet never use them again, will tell my friends and will ban my staff from using them. absolutely awful way to treat any customer let alone business class when I'm paying for stress free travel due to  a bad back that they have made 10 times worse! Awful airline.... awful. On a par with Rwanda air.

title: Bad customer's care
review_text: Flight booked through a cruise agent with one stop in Zurich. All our suitcases (two) were lost and we didn't get them for the 3 days we had booked to stay on a city break holiday in Athens. They were finally delivered to the cruise ship directly shortly before it left port! Obviously all our stuff, including medications, were in the bags. Luggage had actually arrived at the airport the day before but people in charge of them had no driver and refused to pay a taxi to deliver them to the hotel. They were very obstructive. I complained to Swissair and asked to be compensated and their reaction was a brief email to say that it wasn't their problem and I just should accept it! Bad luck!

title: Waste of Money upgrade
review_text: This was to be a treat ( after our house had burnt down ) so booked Premium Economy. What a disgrace and waste of money. So we paid more to travel Premium and had to pay even more to pre select our seat. Believe ths is a trial by Swiss  ? - well my response is simple. Our seats 21A and B did NOT tilt or give any extra comfort. The premium economy rows were merely created with packed economy seats behind. Effectively all you got was a little more legroom. Nothing else. As for the food. the drinks and especially the crew - zero rating. The crew were dis interested . I like Swiss but honestly this was a complete let down and a waste of money. Does anyone care ? I doubt it !!

title: Never again.Not even for free.
review_text: Worst flight ever.Small seats,no leg room,food was trash, 1 flight attendant was just useless.They actually use steel utensils,knives and forks.I am230 lbs @5.11 and it was difficult to get out of the seat .

title: Economy nightmare!
review_text: Worst international flight ever, seats in economy literally on top of each other. As soon as women in front reclined her seat I was wedged in no space to move legs. Only thing good was the food and drinks.

title: Zurich-Singapore- fantastic experience with Swiss
review_text: I flew with multiple carriers NZ-Florence rtn and Swiss was by far the best-  in a completely different class. I did book extra legroom, and felt like I‚Äôd slipped into premium economy. The staff were friendly and efficient, the food and coffee were great (unusual for economy!) the toilets were kept clean, and the inflight entertainment was really good. It was the most comfortable leg of the journey (Zurich- Singapore) and I didn‚Äôt want to leave the plane. Will definitely be sticking with Swiss from now on.

title: Don‚Äôt travel with dogs with Swiss
review_text: My friend took two dogs with her. One in the cabin  and one in Cargo. She was supposed to go to Germany and had a layover in Z√ºrich. The pilot changed his mind and landed in Geneva to refuel and then go onto Z√ºrich. She missed her connection flight to Germany and was told that she has to stay overnight in Z√ºrich and can only bring the one Dan cabin. She was not allowed to get the other dog out of cargo or her luggage. She had no way of finding out, how the dog is and where the dog is. They just refused the information. This is unacceptable and a big liability. So if you travel with docs, don‚Äôt you Swiss

title: Disappointed
review_text: The Swiss are renowned for efficiency but that ethos clearly wasn‚Äôt passed on to their national carrier. On the initial flight they left my luggage behind and on the return flight they tried to double charge me for an upgrade then denied me the upgraded baggage allowance, the supervisor accused me of starting a revolution! The flight is now delayed despite 2 onward connections which are now in jeopardy. Stick to a professional airline who have better resources.

title: Inflexible and rude staff
review_text: Terrible costumer service - not just on this flight but several Swiss Air flights. Generally rude staff that doesn‚Äôt care for their costumers - starts from boarding to flight - do better Swiss Air

title: A very bad experience with the customer service
review_text: I was on the flight going to Beirut from Zurich, and for security reasons they go back to Vienna while many other flights landed the same day and the same time in Beirut, I lost a work meeting that day, I tried to contact them when i came back but to reach them is like a mission impossible, the customer service is terrible, if you are travelling for work I do not recommend them otherwise you can take the risk if you are not in a hurry!

title: Do not use Swiss Air
review_text: I had booked my Swiss Air flight through Booking.com.  The option to purchase seats and extra luggage were not available through booking.com.  I then purchased my premium seats and luggage through Swiss air directly.  I was notified by booking.com that my flight had been canceled by the airline and there were no other options to put me on another flight.  I was told I needed to contact Swiss Air directly for a refund on my seats and luggage.   I was informed by Swiss Air that my seats and luggage were non refundable.  So a flight that I had zero control over being canceled cannot receive a refund on my luggage or seats.  I will never travel with Swiss Air again. I do not even comprehend how that is legal. To reiterate I did not cancel my flight, the cancelation was Swiss air.

title: Nightmare Swiss Air flights to and from Delhi
review_text:
The whole experience  has been very disappointing and we will never travel with Swiss Air again . 
We had booked straight  return flights to Delhi going 28/03/2024  returning 15/04/2024.Swiss Air cancelled these flights   and alternative flights were offered : outgoing via  Munich  with Lithansa and return via Zurich with Swiss Air .  We accepted  the changes because we could only fly on these dates.
One member of our group had an Indian passport .On rearranging  our flights Swiss Air failed to inform us that  she needed a transfer visa for Germany on the outgoing flight via Munich . We were only told  on arrival at Heathrow Airport We had to spend a further ¬£500 on a new ticket for her to travel directly to Delhi  with a different airline .We were not the only group affected by this another traveller with an Indian passport on same flight arranged by Swiss Air was told on boarding that she required a transfer visa .As a result she was not allowed on the plane and the plane was delayed while they removed her baggage.Ourselves and 15 other passengers   then nearly missed our Munich connection.

Our return journey from Delhi to Munich on 14/04/2024  via Swiss Air  was even more problematic .
The flight was initially delayed and rerouted  to avoid Iranian airspace.This we can understand  but it was not initially  explained.They did however  tell us the plane was oversubscibed which did not inspire much confidence.
The delay meant  we would miss our connection flight at Zurich ( for which SwissAir had already  been given us boarding passes for) .We realised there was a problem   when we were going through security on recieving an email saying that our connection  flights were to be changed .Racing back to checkin we were given new connection  flights . 15 hours later than previous .We were lucky as we knew about these changes  before we flew from Delhi but so many other passengers had no idea until they landed at Zurich .Their new flights were  24 hours later .
Further expense and inconvenience ensued  as people had to find hotel accomodation whilst waiting for their flight A number of our group had to take forced leave from work

 We were given just  5 swiss franc meal vouchers each for food .

To cap it all ,on finally returning  to Heathrow  they lost  highly valuable baggage that included my husband's medical reports needed for imminent surgical treatment  

Avoid this airline if possible

title: Avoid this airline for long haul flight
review_text:
I booked my ticket through Austrian Airlines website, but my flight was operated by Swissair with a long layover in Geneva which made me book a hotel near the airport as my connection was on the following day to Pristina Kosovo.

The boarding at Geneva airport is chaotic with no proper explanation. First, you have to get your stamp because without it you can't go onboard. I have to go back to get the stamp and line up again.

It's an old aircraft from Swissair. The leg room was tight couldn't even fit my small backpack under my feet. I'm very thankful that was just a short flight. I definitely avoided this airline for long-haul flights. The flight was at 7:00 AM and no complimentary coffee you have to pay for it, it is such a terrible airline.

title: Negligence and damage of property
review_text:
Forces to check in a carried on bag, lost the luggage. When the bag was found absolutely terrible communication on delivery. Could not leave my hotel for three days due to having no idea when or if my luggage would arrive. The communication they do have is so generic that it does not give the customer information requires. 

When the bag did arrive it was heavily damaged. This was a brand new expensive north face bag never used until this trip and I received it with a tear, giant gash in the plastic and heavy damage all over the bag. 

The irresponsible behavior, respect, and negligence is bad. However, the destroying and damaging of property and clear act of recklessness as to property leads me now to believe this should result in a guilty criminal offense. If there ends up not being a criminal charge then there should be a major reform to what the airline can get away with and they should not be above the law of that of any other citizen.

title: They ruined my business trip
review_text:
have business meetings.. my flight departed 2 am.. I arrived exhausted and drained.. their cabin crew had an attitude problem.. I put my bag in the cabin above my seat and 10 minutes later the attendant took it out through it in my face asking me to put it under my seat.. given that their seats have very tight spaces it meant that I don‚Äôt have a space for my feet.. she didn‚Äôt do that to any other passenger.. I had only one bag while other people had more.. but apparently she didn‚Äôt like how I look or something.. she just chose to do that to me
I arrived to Hamburg to find that my baggage was lost!! On Sunday!! No single open stope .. I asked their employee where to buy essentials he said try the airport shops,, I looked for shops everywhere and that was more exhausting to find out there‚Äôs no such thing.. stores and free duty are only available for departing passengers not arriving ones
The current situation is: my bag is lost.. I have no clothes whatsoever to attend my meeting with the clothes I‚Äôm wearing for the flight have been on me for 16 hours.. instead of getting an hour to sleep and getting ready for my scientific meeting I had to take a taxi to a nearby city as everything in lubeck is closed on Sunday.. it‚Äôs freezing here but it‚Äôs April so the few open stores Vorderreihe didn‚Äôt have coats.. now because of you; I spent around 700 euros and still missing many essentials.. am I still look so underdressed for my meetings.. no single sign that my bag is expected to be here anytime soon.. I‚Äôm freezing with not a single store selling coats 
I wouldn‚Äôt recommend them at all.. especially if you ‚Äúlike myself‚Äù don‚Äôt have blue eyes.. you will probably be treated in a very weird way and bags been thrown in your face to allow space for other passengers

title: Swiss / Miserable very bad airline
review_text:
Swiss is miserable airline
Lost my bag and it got delivered damage, open and missing lot of my personal stuff 
If you save in the airline fare you will spend more in Al the lost items ‚Ä¶..

title: Swiss Amiss
review_text: I have flown with Swiss twice (as part of a Lufthansa booking) and can conclude that it is definitely one of the worst long-haul flights I have ever had.  Their seats are probably the smallest and most uncomfortable in the industry.  Being crammed into a claustrophobic 3-4-3 configuration on a 777 for over 12 hours was utterly dreadful! The onboard service was also hit and miss.  Definitely profits over customer comfort.  I will never fly with Swiss again and will do everything in my power to avoid them in the future.

title: Great Service When It Mattered Most
review_text: I wanted to let everyone know about the great service I received on a Swiss Air flight. In particular, I wanted to point out flight attendant MICHAEL SOTOLO-NIEDERER.  I got dizzy on a flight from London to Zurich and felt as if I was going to pass out.   Michael quickly came to my aid --- giving me oxygen and fluids and allowing me to lay down across an aisle.  His professionalism and care was amazing.  Quickly I felt better.  By the time the plane landed I was back to normal and was able to continue on with my trip.  I'm not sure I would have recovered so quickly without Michael's help.  When things really count, Michael and Swiss Air came through for me!

title: Disappointing Experience with Swiss Airline: Unprofessional Service and Inconvenience
review_text:
I recently had a highly disappointing experience with Swiss Airline during my scheduled flight from Dubai to Berlin on April 2, 2024. Despite booking my flight well in advance, with flight numbers LX243 from Dubai to Zurich and LX974 from Zurich to Berlin, I encountered a major issue during check-in. The airline informed me at the last minute that there were no available seats due to overbooking, rendering me unable to check in for my flight as planned.

What made matters worse was the unilateral decision made by Swiss Airline to rebook me on a different flight and airline without my consent or confirmation. This lack of communication and disregard for my preferences was incredibly unprofessional and left me feeling frustrated and powerless. Despite reaching out to their customer service overseas for assistance, I was met with no viable solutions or support, forcing me to accept the unexpected changes to my travel plans.

Furthermore, the airline failed to compensate for their mistake by offering any form of upgrade or additional amenities for the inconvenience caused. I even requested a ticket upgrade considering the significant change in flight details, but this request was denied without any reasonable explanation.

As I prepare for my upcoming flight from Berlin to Dubai tomorrow, I can only hope that Swiss Airline will uphold their commitment to providing satisfactory service and ensure a smooth and hassle-free journey. However, based on my recent experience, I remain skeptical and disappointed in the level of professionalism and customer care exhibited by the airline.

title: Worst flight ever
review_text: I travel quite often, and this was easily the worst flight I have ever suffered through. The seats are packed in so tightly it is absolute misery to be in them; we literally could not get out of our seats when the people in front of us reclined (and I am only 5‚Äô2‚Äù). Imagine being in these seats for 7.5 hours!  It‚Äôs an understatement to say it was claustrophobic. Avoid flying Economy if at all possible.

title: Just not up to par
review_text: Traveling frequently for business out of Zurich  Swiss continues to disappoint and brings me to go out of my way to use a different airline. Dated planes, seat comfort horrendous, small seats, overpriced fares, never (ever) getting the food order right, not providing PJs for overnight business class flights. Staff is bored and lazy. Edelweiss, the actual budget airline of the same group is outstanding in comparison.

title: Above and Beyond
review_text: Had the pleasure of flying Swiss Airlines from Malaga to Zurich and, wow, they really know how to make a flight memorable! Right from the start, you could feel the professionalism. The crew? Absolutely stellar. They struck the perfect balance between being attentive and giving you your space.What really set this flight apart was the captain. This guy wasn‚Äôt just flying the plane; he was making sure everyone on board felt welcome and safe. His communication throughout the flight was top-notch, giving us updates and insights with a level of clarity and warmth you don‚Äôt get every day.And the cherry on top? Being greeted and sent off with a genuine smile by the captain himself at the door. It‚Äôs those little personal touches that make a big difference, making you feel valued and not just another passenger.In every aspect, Swiss Airlines showed they‚Äôre not just about getting you from A to B; they‚Äôre about making the journey as pleasant as possible. Definitely flying with them again!

title: Never fly Swiss Air
review_text: I paid for a seat upfront (5D) to get a connecting flight to the US. The flight was overbooked so they switched my seat to the last row next to the bathrooms in a middle seat and they did not inform me until I was on the plane. When I showed my boarding pass the staff on the plane told me ‚Äúit‚Äôs not my job, sorry‚Äù. Unreal.

title: Racist staff
review_text: Flying from Zurich to Athens on 8 April. At boarding, staff singled out one female Asian passenger saying the carry-on luggage is too big and insisted it had to be checked in. One male non-Asian passenger stepped out and put that luggage into the measurement grid to prove that it was standard size, fit perfectly well. There were many other passengers with luggage of similar size. The only explanation one can give is that the female passenger was unfaitly singled out because she is Asian.

title: AVOID SWISS AIR AT ALL COSTS
review_text:
Absolute garbage airline avoid at all costs. Seriously NEVER fly with Swiss air. I have traveled with over a dozen airlines over the years and Swiss takes the cake on worst possible airline in existence.

They will cancel your flight and rebook you on a crappy flight that is 2x as long and you will lose all your upgrades, seat selection, and destroy your travel plans. 100% inept.

title: Sad excuse for an airline
review_text: Airline is chaos and doesn‚Äôt care about customers.  Connecting flight late and missed rerouted flight into krakow.  Transfer desk is not staffed to handle disruptions and airline does not seem to care.  Won‚Äôt ever fly this airline again and want to stay far away from Zurich and any connections at this airport.  A sad mess of an airline.

title: Invalid or Inactive Compensation Card Offered
review_text: I wouldn't recommend Swiss Airlines to any of my friends or relatives. I flew Swiss on the 23rd of March from Johannesburg South Africa to arrive in London Heathrow on the 24th of March. During the checkin at Zurich where I was meant to take the connecting flight there was a passenger who had an emergency and had to take our flight but unfortunately did not have a seat. I offered my seat to take the next flight wanting to assist this passenger and I was to be compensated with a Cash Voucher. On presentation, it was actually a prepaid Cash Passport which I was assured would work in the UK. To my dismay, this card has not been able to work either at till points or at ATM'S. I have called, emailed, submitted feedback forms to no avail. The only response I receive is that I should " use it at tills and ATM's " and yet I keep advising them that the card is not working. I feel this was disingenuous of Swiss Airlines because they had initially said it would be "Cash compensation " and on presentation I was offered a " prepaid card" which I was expressly advised not to attempt use until 4 hours after presentation. Would this have been to ensure that on when I was in the UK there would be zero to no chances of me returning to Zurich to request for Cash or a proper working card. Swiss has absolutely been dishonest and I will never fly Swiss or advise anyone to do so!

title: Excellent for the Price
review_text: Seat choice and checked baggage are extra.  Two adults and two children travelled to Rome and back for less than $2600 US dollars including the referenced seat choice fee and baggage fee. Carry-on up to 8kilos is included base ticket price. One meal and drinks (including alcohol) were included.  A light snack (artesian cheese panini) before arrival was also included.  Website is easy to navigate. *There appears to be very close partnership with Lufthansa as the (same) trip/booking code worked on that site as well.

title: Swiss Air - Stay Away!!
review_text:

World

title: Frequent change of paid seat selection for anxious flyer
review_text: I am a nervous flyer and just working on it with the help of a course. Which is why I usually pay and for a flight where I can select my seat over the wings. This is now the second time swiss airline just moved my seat to the back without any reimbursement of the cost and terrible customer service.the first time I even bought a new flight. This time I hope I manage. I am really disappointed to have experienced how disrespectful Swiss airline treats it's fearful flyers.

title: Don't care about clients, as bad as the cheapest airlines
review_text: As crappy as the cheapest airlines. SWISS doesn't live up to the reputation it once had. title: Not a pleasant experience.
review_text: We found the airline to be overall disappointing. Alcoholic beverages served on the flight were not complimentary (limited to tea, coffee, coke, water, apple or tomato juice). There were only 4 functioning bathrooms for a lot of people, and one not working. Gound staff working for Swiss air at both security and the boarding gate gave us incorrect information about the costs (30 swiss francs) when we accidentally left a device on the plane and were not able to retrieve it since they close the door back to plane immediately after you disembark even if the error is discovered before you get to security. Zurich airport is the worst airport to go through even as an English speaker, the signposting is terrible. Definitely not an airline I plan to give a second chance to get it right. There are better and easier options. Don't bother going into Zurich on a layover, there is nobody to assist you with a complicated ticket purchase for the public transport system. Zurich is designed for Swiss people who are born there and know the system not for foreigners, even English speaking foreigners and they are not afraid to impose harsh fines for genuine mistakes and errors. I think that this brief experience with Swiss airlines and Switzerland were enough to put my family off going back to the country. It's quite an impressive feat.

title: UNTRUST AND WORST COMPANY
review_text: The WORST COMPANY. They cancelled my flight 2 hours before the flight, without explanation. They moved my ticket to the next day. I lost my holidays. I had booked hotels, tickets etc and I lost everything without any explanation. UNTRUST COMPANY. NEVER AGAIN.

title: Unethical and deceitful
review_text:
Swiss airlines sold me 2 business class tickets

On the booking confirmation Swiss airlines noted that the carrier was Scandinavian Airlines and provided details on the seating arrangements which included the words ‚Äúempty middle seat included‚Äô. There was no requirement for me to reserve a seat to ensure the empty middle seat is included in the reservation.

However the middle seat was not empty as I sat in it and had people seated on either side of me. This was also true for my business class travel partner.

I claimed compensation from Swiss Airlines as they deliberately sold me a product that they knew would not be delivered. I know this because in correspondence to me after the flight the Swiss representative stated ‚Äúthat SWISS has no control over the type of service or cabin that our partner airline offers.‚Äù

This is a contradiction to the details on my booking. It is clear therefore that Swiss Airlines knowingly sold me a product it knew it was unable to unable to deliver.

Swiss airlines has refused my request for compensation and claims it is not responsible for deceptively selling me a service that it knew would not be delivered.

Swiss airlines is a deceitful and unethical company.

title: Absolutely diabolical

 Suffice to say I‚Äôm taking a better airline home and will avoid Swiss from now on. Business class seats were more like economy seats. No food for 15 hours and no lay flat seat as broken, and no response from Swiss  to my complaint. Hence the review.

title: Terrible, will not do this again. It‚Äôs unacceptable not to have seats next to each other automatically. Don‚Äôt book Swiss

title: Never Again
review_text: I had originally heard good things about Swiss Air from a friend, but after flying with them twice (connecting flights), I disagree. I flew Swiss Air going from Norway to Los Angeles in March. The day we flew out of the Oslo airport it shut down due to a snowstorm so our flight was delayed 8 hours, which the airline had no control over. However, once we were able to board again, the only consolidation prize we got was free coffee or tea, but we still had to pay for all other snacks and services‚Ä¶and  I‚Äôm pretty sure the coffee/tea was already free to start with. Like really, that‚Äôs the best you can do? Anyways, once we got to Zurich, we had to rebook a connecting flight back home to LA  due to the 8 hour delay. The flight from Zurich to LA was roughly 12 hours and was probably the worst flight of my life. At the boarding gate, they made us get special stamps on our boarding passes and if we didn‚Äôt have them then we couldn‚Äôt board. There was a bunch of confusion as to where to get the stamps and long lines started forming around the boarding area. It delayed our flight leaving by roughly 30 minutes. Once my family and I finally got up to board, they grabbed our bags and told us we had to check them. We were row 30 (only 3 rows behind business class) so it‚Äôs not like we were the last to board or like we were in the very back of the plane. After they took our bags I pleaded to keep them, and if we couldn‚Äôt find room for them overhead then we‚Äôd bring them back and they could be checked. I stressed how this would cause a big inconvenience to us because once we landed we still had a two hour drive home and baggage claim in LA can take an hour or more since it‚Äôs a busy airport. They didn‚Äôt seem to care and continued to tell us it was a full flight and they wouldn‚Äôt fit. The thing that really pissed me off was that they let people boarding after us walk on with their luggage AND once the boarding process was complete there were 4 completely empty overhead bins over our seats. I was livid. Then once we got in the aircraft it was like a swamp, it was uncomfortably warm, humid and smelled like sweat and feet. The Boeing 777-300 plane we were on didn‚Äôt have any overhead fans. I told the flight attendant I was feeling warm (I have a condition where my body overheats very easily and can make me feel nausea and faint) and she told me that air only circulates when the plane is in motion so I had to sit uncomfortably for 30-45 minutes before they turned on the air. Even after it was turned on during the flight, it felt very inconsistent, and would switch between hot and cold throughout the whole flight. I would also like to add that their economy seats are much smaller than an average plane. I fly internationally roughly 5 times a year, and I‚Äôve taken multiple airlines throughout my life and almost always fly economy. I could barely eat the meal they provided us because my elbows would be touching the people next to me when cutting up my food (I was in the middle seat). It was incredibly frustrating, I felt like I was boxed in. Their trash service was also inconsistent, and after every meal service, our trash was was left on our table for roughly 45 minutes to an hour. I counted and trash service only came by four times on a 12 hour flight. There were two times when I had to get up and throw away my own trash, because I wanted to use my tray table but couldn‚Äôt. Towards the end of the flight, I was so frustrated that I literally started crying an hour before we landed because I just wanted to get off that plane so badly. I‚Äôve truly never been so uncomfortable in my life.

title: R Schwade air hostesses ego problem
review_text: I took Swiss very 1st time from Mumbai to Zurich connecting flight it was 9 hours flight was getting serviced by name R Schwade air hostess very very rude to everyone even I asked her for water of bottle she said she can not serve particular 1 person and left then in the morning the. Breakfast was served other air hostess gave me veg meal again without even asking if I am veg or non vegetarian which was very spicy for my baby and I asked her again R Schwade if she can replace my meal with egg breakfast and she was dam rude said they don‚Äôt have it you have to eat what you got I said please check with other hostess because she was still serving the breakfast she just ignored me front of other people which was really disrespectful behaviour front of other passengers  the family members sitting next to me was also very upset she was literally scaring with her loud disrespectful behaviour i would never recommend this flight to anyone my closes family and friends.

title: Won‚Äôt fly Swiss again
review_text:
First and last time flying Swiss. 
The aircraft was so ridiculously hot that all 3 of us spent the entire flight trying to fan ourselves. My 2 year old toddler struggled to sleep and by the end of the flight was drenched in sweat. 
We sat in row 44 (for both our flight to Johannesburg and back to Munich) and both times we were uncomfortably hot - so I‚Äôm not sure if that specific row is just away from the cool air, but it was almost unbearable. 

I have flown other airlines and in Economy I had WAY more space. We were squashed like sardines. My toddler was even uncomfortable with how little space she had. Completely unable to get even a few hours of rest on both flights due to the heat and the lack of any space. 

My husband is 1.8m tall and he could not fit into the seat. He had to have one leg in the isle and one leg stretched to the side under my seat. 

The food is okay, but the children‚Äôs food comes ridiculously hot and microwaved so much that the pasta went rock hard and my toddler couldn‚Äôt eat it. 

Entertainment is okay, but not much for children to watch. Some tv shows have only one episode. 

All in all, I don‚Äôt think it was value for money and we will not fly with Swiss again.

title: Never again with Swiss Airlines

title: THEY CANCELLED MY FLIGHT
