title: Never again!!!
review_text: On the first flight from Z√ºrich to Porto they changed my seat even though I paid for my seat and on the second flight they put me in the middle of the last row even though there was a lot of space more in the front with two rows that were totally empty... thank you very much for that!

title: Not acceptable for this price!
review_text: Let me be clear and precise right from the beginning: Swiss International Airlines ‚Äì you could do it better. Right from the beginning I knew, that I would pay too much money for an old product and I really got what I deserved. For my flight from Zuerich to Bangkok and Bangkok to Zuerich, I booked Business just to be sure I have some comfort on this long journey. It was the very first time I took decision to go for Swiss Business since my friends told me long time ago it is not worth and I always choose other products. However, this time I tried it and of course got disappointed. It already starts with WYSIWYG ‚Äì Swiss is advertising they flatbed with the help of a photo on their homepage. You get the impression of a nice mattress offered for your bed including a nice duvet. Reality: it is a poor standard blanket and a pillow, but no mattress. So why advertising it wrong (see my pictures below ‚Äì fake). Swiss always tries to explain their seats are comfortable equipped with air-pillows, but fact it is, you do not feel and you still have some holes between the seats sections once flat. On top, it is not very cozy to sleep on a bed without something between you and the surface where hundreds of other people sat before. Paying 4500 Swiss Francs for these two flights is unacceptable with this quality. Let me come to the next disappointment. Of course, since it was a flight to Bangkok, the obligatory Asian Crew was onboard. We got asked for dinner and breakfast: in English. I fly Swiss, and I have to correspond in English ‚Äì well done, great job! Asking for a bunch of money, hiring cheap staff and let your customers adopt to the habit of the company ‚Äì unbelievable. However, it is no problem for us, but I am sure many Swiss people go for this Airline just to be comfortable and able to speak in their native language. We got asked to confirm our pre-selected dinner, which was onboard and later nicely cooked to perfection ‚Äì no complains at all, well done. For breakfast, we had to do a choice out of many components, which is slightly complicate and confusing for the staff. They had to do many unnecessary ups and down in the aisle just to bring these different breakfast choices to the people which was so time consuming that they were unable to ask you for another coffee or slice of bread. Breakfast can be done easier, also in Business Class. However, who likes it ‚Äì he/she will get it. For the boarding, we got cold nuts ‚Äì directly from the fridge ‚Äì Swiss, you have to learn a lot from other airlines, especially the Near Eastern one. As already mentioned, the dinner was excellent, but also there, room for improvement. Instead of serving all at once except main course and dessert, why not one by the other, why putting cheese on the starter, why not asking after. The amenity kit was nice, but also there ‚Äì why not offering slippers like it is done in other business class products? Instead you got the cheap economy socks, tooth paste and brush, nothing else. Etihad offers a Bulgari Set of Lotion and perfume. In general, the staff was attentive and helpful, toilets always clean. However, as mentioned, there is much room for improvement (also the Swiss Lounge in Zuerich does not offer much dishes compared to the Thai Royal Orchid for example. Well, next time again another airline.

title: CUSTOMER SERVICE WILL NOT TALK TO YOU, WORST AIRLINE EVER
review_text:

title: Vintage aircraft, indifferent crew, good catering
review_text:
The positive sides are the business class lounges in terminal E at ZRH airport. Great food and drinks varaiate available. The catering out of ZRH on the flight was really of top quality and well presented. 

The negative sides are: 
The Airbus 330 is vintage, the tv screen embarrassing small, the seat old and narrow. 

The crew did a standard very basic duty service. No extra mile, no honest hospitality impressions. Once the main service is over you don't see them again. The bistro service was not announced nor promoted. There was no water or drink service by the crew after the main course. Only when people start getting ready for landing (visiting the restrooms)  they realised the bistro concept- at the end you see the crew just throwing away the food and ice cream. What a waste / they should have pro active invited the passengers to enjoy it. Poor and indifferent service. They are not honestly interested - just fulfilling their job duty.

title: Avoid flying Swiss Air
review_text: Our Swiss Air flight was delayed because the plane arrived late due to having to wait for connecting passengers on the incoming flight. We were told this by our pilot. This delay caused us to miss our connecting flight in Zurich. We couldn't get a flight to Malaga until the following day. My wife and I were given a hotel room and two 20 Swiss franc vouchers for dinner that we had to use at the hotel. That's it.

title: "Chilling" on board
review_text:
I really don't know where to start. That our flights from Zurich to Tokyo and vice versa were not ideal would be an understatement. On the first flight, they simply didn't load our luggage and then decided to inform us only after we waited for what felt like forever at Narita airport. After the luggage disaster, I was really hopeful for a relaxed flight back home.¬† However, I wasn't expecting a "chilled" experience quite like this. All puns aside, since we flew over the north pole it seemed Swiss Air tried provide a special treat by trying to recreate 
the freezing environment: the AC was a nightmare - way too strong and cold for a 14h+ flight! I asked the staff multiple times to kindly turn it down a little or at least try to adjust it¬† - which they did for 30 mins or so. After that, the plane turned into a fridge again. I was not the only one - lots of people had to put on their winter coats again. Shouldn't be that way if you pay lots of money for a premium economy seat. To add to this, I thought, I'd treat myself by purchasing on-board wifi for a trip as long this. However, after something like two hours the connection broke down and couldn't be re-established the whole flight. I paid 35 CHF for it and this is what I got. When I notified the staff about it, they simply explained to me that we're on a plane - yeah, you don't say!? But why offering it in the first place, if you know it doesn't work? Feels a bit like a scam to be honest. I know it isn't the staffs fault but after these experiences, I'd never recommend Swiss Air to anyone interest in oversea flights. Sorry!

title: No fuss operation......
review_text: We enjoyed a more-than-serviceable intra-Europe business class flight experience with Swiss, flying from Dublin to Ljubljana via Zurich. The Airbus A220s with a 3+2 configuration were new and sparkling clean. The check in experience in Dublin was superb and actually having the Swiss rep say thank you for your business almost had me falling over in shock (as we know Swiss are part of the Lufthansa group). She was a delight and joined us on the flight. The lounge in Terminal 1 at Dublin was excellent - and conveniently named ‚ÄòThe Lounge‚Äô - great breakfast offerings and a bar and barista in the left hand half of the lounge.  The flight from Dublin left slightly late due to inbound traffic restrictions in Zurich - but we made up time. The in flight service and meal offering was fine - if you like your nitrates and fancy a souvenir cutting board - go for the cold cuts. We arrived into Zurich, cleared immigration and headed to the Swiss business lounge - it was hideously overcrowded and positively colonial in the savagery as any available real estate was snapped up. The person on the desk tried to send us next door to presumably the First lounge for a bit more space‚Ä¶ but something was wrong with the number on our boarding pass and ‚Äòcomputer said no‚Äô. This was a miles redemption so that might have been it. By the time we fought our way to the food/drinks and back downstairs to a tiny corner on a sofa, it was time to Go to Gate. When we arrived they were boarding Economy. We walked to the other side of the check in desk where there was a sign for premium and business and a woman started ordering me, repeatedly, to join the queue. She didn‚Äôt even look at the boarding pass and when I insisted she did she couldn‚Äôt bring herself to actually be nice but snapped that Business had already been called. Last time I checked, in the civilised world (apparently not a Swiss Flight in Zurich), boarding early and/or with priority is not an obligation on my part. She grumbled and said we could cut in the economy queue at the front - big of her.  Honestly, this one horrible staff member however we would not let ruin the Swiss Airlines experience which was otherwise top notch.

title: Not a business class standard for intercontinental flights
review_text:
Let‚Äôs start from terminal E of Swiss intero continental flights in Zurich. Shops and bar close at 10 pm and business class lounge also and amazingly close at 10 pm. Even if flights are due to leave far later - as it was my case. So, be prepared to wait in a desert terminal.
Then, on the plane; my business seat was ridiculously small. While others were slightly better served, mine, 7 G, had no place for anything else than basic stuff. Nothing to compare with most of Asian or European carriers that offer leg space, boxes to put shoes and blanket. Something just bigger than an economy premium seats. 
Food and staff was okey.

Again, she wouldn't check me in without a new carrier.  So I carried my dog in his perfectly fine carrier, because she'd told me dogs weren't allowed on leashes, to buy a new one.  All this, without one smile, one apology for the inconvenience, anything remotely nice or personable.  She spoke over me whenever I tried to respond or explain.  Way to make the stress and expense of travel much, much worse! Oh, and on their website, when I wrote to complain, the message doesn't go through.  Par for the course. title: Awful airline, mean and hateful employees in the Zurich airport

title: TERRIBLE AIRLINE! NEVERBOOK HERE IF YOU DONT WANT TO GET SCAMMED. RIDE CUSTOMER SERVICE!
review_text:
I booked a flight and paid $376 for specific seats but realized shortly after that I had chosen the wrong ones and contacted their customer service within 3 hours of booking to request a seat change. Anne, the representative, assured me that the modification could be made without extra charges. After modification, we requested for a confirmation number for the seat change just to make sure but Anne insisted we would receive it via email.

She also informed me that I had the option to cancel the flight without penalty within 24 hours of booking, this policy applies for all non refundable tickets. We were looking into this option if we were told that the seats can‚Äôt be modified or if we will need to pay extra charges for the modification. 

However, after waiting 2 days, I have still not received any confirmation. When I called back to get an update I was told that there were no modifications made and I now need to pay an additional $180 to change my seats.

Had I been informed correctly during my initial call, I could have simply cancelled the flight to avoid unnecessary charges, while i still can without penalty. Unfortunately, my recent interaction with another representative, named Hanah, only compounded my frustration. She was rude and refused to provide the name of a supervisor or allow me to speak with one.

title: Won't use again
review_text:
Coach class two part flight from Barcelona to Heathrow via Zurich. 
Late flight take off and arrival, primarily because over eager staff at Barca spent a lot of time checking cabin baggage and putting it into the hold.
Once on board the experience was fine with good staff and a comfy ride

title: Worst Customer Service
review_text:
Actually i was always happy with swiss. But if you need one time the customer service you have a resl problem! The most bad customer service ever! 
I paid one flight two times because of an failure in my onlinebanking. Now i wait and write every week since more than two months! To make matters even worse they also don‚Äôt have any telephone service‚Ä¶

title: Good experience with this company
review_text: Very good airline, the flights were on time, the planes very good and the flight crew helpful. Excellent experience, I recommend !

title: Poor IT, poor web application - and therefore to complicated for today‚Äôs needs
review_text: SWISS used to be a good airline by now, especially the ground services and their webpage and IT is horrible. Nothing works everything is redirected and then ends up in nothing - online check-in not possible. Change of the flight online did work but in the end the ticket was not issued And so on and so on you - need to call them three or four times to resolve an issue. The people are very nice on the phone but in the background the IT systems they work with are horrible - all in: poor service

title: USELESS STAFF
review_text: WORST Customer service. Dealt with 4 different reps got 6 answers. Nothing but aggravation and got nowhere. NEVER again will fly this airline. Absolutely no organization. Completely useless staff. Ask 1 question got 3 different answers depending on who answered the phone.

title: Reliable option
review_text:
6am coach class connecting flight from Heathrow to Barca via Zurich. 
A320 neo, reasonable boarding and left close to the time.
Uneventful flight without noticeable turbulence. On time arrival, efficient crew.

title: Feel cheated - but Swiss tickets get cheap airline carrier
review_text: Booked and  got confirmation of flights with Swiss, at Swiss prices. Three days before departure they send an email saying that on the way back tje carroer will be the cheap airline Air Baltic. I called them and asked to honour the contract and chnge us to a Swiss carrier flight. They told us that they have the right to change the carrier and if we qant to change we need to pay 544 chf per.person, i.e. they do have available spaces in some of the several flights they have out of M√°laga  but do knot want to change our tickets to that flight. We are really upset and feel cheated. If we had wanted to fly Aur Baltic or any other cheap airline that is what we would have booked and payed for. On top of that, today we read in the news that Aur Baltic has been flying radioactive material in a flight between Zurich and Barcelona... do we feel safe or comfortable about flying Air Baltic back home? NO WE DONT

title: Swiss makes couples pay, when they want to sit next to each other... on half full planes!
review_text:
My wife and I booked a trip to London and back. we booked it together, we had the same Swiss booking number. When making the Online Check-in on the Swiss website we were seated in different rows, even though the plane was half empty and there was even a seat available just next to my wife. To sit next to my wife, Swiss wanted us to pay 25 GBD (24.85 if I remember correctly). There were even still completely empty rows, but if we wanted to change both of our seats to one of these empty rows Swiss wanted us to pay to times the amount.
We payed for a regular tickets, no special offer or anything alike. It just looks like a scam from Swiss to place couples apart and let them pay for additional fees if they want to sit next to each other.
On the check-in desk they let us sit together in the end, but just after long and annoying discussions - For free!

In the end the plane was half empty! Great job Swiss (sarcasm)!

title: Not great
review_text:
I've been flying to and from the UK to Johannesburg for 9 years. First time on Swiss Air and probably last.

We had 2 seats to the rear of the plane. My food tray was broken and I had to hold food and drink down, otherwise I would have had it all over my lap.

Passengers had brought enormous hand-luggage, suitcases as big as normal checked in baggage. This caused chaos, with everyone trying to shove their bags in the overhead. Space ran out and there was so much faffing I thought we would never take off.

We were near the rear and food ran out, leaving us with a vegetarian biryani option. I thought this was a choice, not something you are left with as the airline didn't plan properly? Air steward seemed very put out when I didn't seem impressed.

Food was otherwise a stale roll and breakfast a stale croissant with watery yoghurt. 

Cabin staff seemed miserable and not happy to be working. This was a great atmosphere for 10 hours.

To top it off, after a 10 hour flight, the transfer from Zurich to Birmingham was a joke. We had literally 20 minutes to run through the airport. This meant our luggage was not loaded. Could have been worse, a lady on our flight has no luggage and has an onward flight. Have no idea when the luggage is expected. If the airline cannot sort bags in time, then don't offer the transfer?? It was extremely stressful, trying to find the boarding gate, cramming onto the train and several passengers had missing luggage.

title: Nightmare flight, stay away.
review_text:
While the flight itself was comfortable I will never fly with them again. Firstly my departing and return flights were canceled from Ottawa to Montreal and from Montreal to Ottawa. I was told to request a refund after the trip has been completed. They were not able to give me a refund amount. After calling 3 different numbers 7 times, and getting the run around. Being told to fill out online forms, not hearing back, and being told the form will not work in my case by one agent, and then being told to fill out the refund form again by another agent I have gotten nowhere. Every time I ask to escalate the case to a supervisor or manager I get hung up on (I am frustrated but calm and understand it is not the agents fault). I eventually got $70 refunded - for 2 cancelled flights for 2 people (this does not even cover the bus fair we needed to pay because of the cancelled flights). I spent over 4 hours on the phone talking to different agents being told different things. Now I am trying to confirm that if I am seriously only entitled to $70 for 2 cancelled flights for 2 passengers and they cannot give me any answers, only tell me to fill out the online form for a 3rd time and wait another couple months (I filled these out in October and again in December 2023).

This is all without mentioning that we had missed a connection as we were given 50 minutes to transfer in Zurich, there was a medical emergency on our plane, long customs lines, and needed to transfer via train to a different terminal. When I spoke with the agent he tried to blame this on us saying it was our fault we missed the connection and said we would have to pay for another flight. Eventually when I pointed out that many of our fellow passengers from the same flight were in the same boat as us, he relented and booked us on another flight free of charge (although quite rude about it). This delayed the start of our honeymoon vacation by over 6 hours and we missed a booking for a museum we had made. We have been told we are not eligible for any compensation for this. 

This was the most stressful flight I have ever taken, cancelling legs and missing connections due to things out of our control. The customer service has been terrible and they have done nothing to right this situation despite my best efforts contacting them multiple times spending much of my free time ($70 is an insult after what they put me though). It is a lose lose. Do not give this Airline your business, they do not care about your experience or what they put you through

title: Irrational Carry-on Policies
review_text: Absolutely irrational and ridiculous. Their need to follow the rules by the book is beyond ok. I travel with a few very expensive camera which also includes batteries, monitors, etc‚Ä¶ The flight was not crowded whatsoever yet the staff insisted that I check my carry ons regardless of the contents inside. They put everything into a plastic and send me on my way. Once stepping on the plane I notice that the overhead storage is virtually empty and could have easily held my luggage. Its first world problems however given that I travel this way every week with various other airlines, Swiss Air stands out as one of the silliest companies ever.

title: Backpacks under the seat to leave the space for the others?? No space for me. Yes, you are welcome for my cooperation.
review_text: Company that allows people to come with oversized luggages and others have to pay for that and put vig bags in front of them to leave free space for luggages?? I do not pay money for that. Do your job.

title: Unreliable - not worth it
review_text: I am extremely disappointed with my recent experience with Swiss air! They canceled my flight very last minute completely ruining a day of my much-anticipated vacation. The lack of communication and consideration for their passengers is unacceptable. I will definitely be reconsidering flying with them in the future and will be advising others to do the same.

title: Good experience overall
review_text:
We were a large group of 13 and were heading to Dubai coming from Manchester and were connecting from Zurich. 

Expectations were relative compared to what we paid and we were very surprised. The service and food was good and the plane was comfortable. 

This review would have been 5 stars if it wasnt for 2 members of staff who let the team down. 

The air hostess who was cleaning after snacks and meals seemed miserable, unfriendly and even angry. If she doesn‚Äôt like this aspect of her role ask to change it or find another job- no need to make me feel guilty for you having to collect the rubbish. I would happily clean my own but we are on a plane and that‚Äôs how it works. 

The second member of staff really IRRITATED me. It wasn‚Äôt  just him but his behaviour was more cringe. He constantly attended to this female who by the sounds of it had left a positive review from Canada I believe. Swiss air give commentary movenpick ice cream and chocolate (a great gesture and the best tasting) but as he gave me and my son one each-he gave this woman ariund 15 chocolates and these generous gestures were on  frequent occasions-just seemed unfair to everyone else. This passenger was even given champagne and regular drinks of her choice and sat right in front of me-it was a awkward feeling. This male host was a jackle and hide character as he would be so friendly to this lady and then within a second be very formal with us. He wasn‚Äôt rude and did his job-just got lost in the moment and didn‚Äôt appreciate how his kindness and fondness of a particular guest may have been perceived as unfair to the rest of us. I wasn‚Äôt even bothered about the chocolates (I lie I was they were nice) or the champagne as I do not drink, it was about having the awareness on how you look infront of other guests and portraying an element of favouritism, this can wrongly lead to presumptious conclusions, why is this person being treated differently: eg male host female guest, ethnicity etc and ultimately damage the company if not learnt from. 

This spoilt things in otherwise great experience. Hope feedback is taken constructive and implemented as this airline is great overall.

title: A good journey home
review_text:
This was our return journey to London having flown out to Johannesburg on Lufthansa (see separate review).
The seat was in some respects better than Lufthansa as it was not angled towards my neighbour. That said it‚Äôs still old school compared to other business class seats 
Bedding was a blanket and pillow whereas Lufthansa provided a proper duvet as well as pj‚Äôs.
IFE was fine as was the food 
Service was good although the flight attendant call button was ignored 
The flight was on a 777 which although reliable and robust is incredibly noisy compared to other airliners 
Transit at Zurich was painless and the lounge and shower room an excellent way to spend the time between flights 

The short flight from Zurich to London was excellent. Good service and a nice light meal 
A nice touch to hand out heart shaped chocolate on Valentine‚Äôs Day 

All in all a very good experience and would recommend

title: Harrowing experience Swiss Airline Ground Staff on Feb 13th at Mumbai between 9:40 PM to 12:05 AM at Gate F
review_text:
Had a harrowing experience with a Swiss airline ground staff at Mumbai airport while checking in 
I was traveling as a student to Dublin for the first time and she expected me to reduce weight in my laptop bag
I couldn't even pour contents from laptop bag into check in bag as laptop bag has laptops chargers and earphones and electronic devices which were required to carry.. Also it included college documents that were important to carry as a student.. she kept on insisting to reduce the weight while I constantly asked her to tell me what as a student is not important and I can skip carrying to which she had no answer. She was at the F gate in Mumbai airport T2 at Lufthansa belt.. she then asked me to compensate and add my cabin bag to the check in which I was against doing as it had a backup winter clothes which I would require incase my baggage is delayed.. I asked her to give me in writing that my bags wont be delayed and I'm ready to add all 3 bags for check in luggage but she said that isn't possible
Instead she started saying that the bag is heavy if it falls on someone's head due to turbulence who will be responsible? In reply to which I told her PPL will buy extra stuff at duty free and obv they can't return to chk in counter to check them in.. in that case what is the guarantee that a duty free bottle won't fall on someone n break his head.. to which she had no answer.. basically by creating panic she only wanted to extract funds worth 12 kg for an extra 3 kg weight in laptop n cabin bag.. I had my boarding at 12:50 AM n I reached the check in counter at 9:40 PM.. from 9:40 PM to 12:05 AM which is almost 3 hours she refused to hand me my boarding pass and I was yet to go thru security check and immigration.. I vacated most contents of my check in bags which as a student I thought it would ease my life in the beginning days.. I hope she heals soon must be a really sick person in her head to do that.. her senior manager came to my rescue and rushed me to the boarding gate ASAP and apologized on her behalf.. but being the person she was, even at boarding gate she rushed to the scanner while it was my turn to enter and said she would want to weigh my cabin n laptop bag and then her senior manager again came in and intervened and told her it's been dealt with n she doesn't need to be dealing with this anymore.. so yeah Swiss Airlines is amazing in terms of food, service, IFE etc.. but sure they can have better ground staff who know their job needs to make sense..

title: Worst airline ever, Ryanair goes long haul
review_text:
Worst airline I have ever flown with! As a 198cm guy (6'6) I always try to get extra leg space on short haul flights as I want fit between the chairs otherwise. This is normally provided. However on this 13 hour flight back from singapore I had to squeeze in these very small chairs with absolutely no more leg space then the worst budget low cost short haul planes. It feit like being on a Ryan air plane for 13 hours, i didnt even know this was allowed. I have had multiple long haul flight before (KLM, turkish airlines, qatar airways, Emirates and even surinam airways) but this was by far the worst experience. When I asked to get reseated they said they were fully booked which was clearly not the case. 

On the flight there it started off with a delay on Schiphol due to understaffing. We arrived late on Z√ºrich airport and it was not clear whether we would make the connection so we had to run like crazy through the airport only to find out they were nice and relaxed waiting for everybody to then start clearing the airplane of snowfall. Why not already start so we could depart still on time? The captain tried to make up for lost time but when we arrived we had to stay in the air for over an hour so we missed our connecting flight to penang. We had to stay overnight in singapore as the airlines that flew that same evening did not have a contract with Swiss airlines. On the airport we were send to 3 different desks before they managed to arrange anything. 

Overall worst experience ever and the last time for me with Swiss air. Don't do it!

title: The worst flight and the worst treatment
review_text: They canceled my flight and gave me a second reservation, but it was not activated. I could not travel with it. They are liars, and when you call to get help, no one helps you and they do not respect customers. I paid 23 kg of a baggage and they said they did not find it on the system and they ask me to pay more.

title: Awful seats and horrible food
review_text: We booked our flights from Zurich to Miami with Swiss airlines however very disappointed with the airline. The service was not as expected, the food was horrible and the seats awful. You didn‚Äôt even have and legroom. If you get the chance I would recommend you to get another airline.

title: Average, yet pleasant flight experience
review_text: I was honestly staggered after reading all of the terrible reviews regarding this airline. However, we were pleasantly surprised. We flew two flights (one short and one long international) and evening went just fine. Everything went as expected, flights were gentle and both on time. Fight attendances were all very polite. Food tasted fine and we had plenty (for the long distance flight ZRH-LAX we even had open bar with snack, sandwiches and drinks in the economy). Seats were bit old, but there was just enough space to sit/sleep comfortably for 12 hours.

title: Nice.
review_text: Comfortable seats, quite much legspace for economy. The landings aren't rough, compared to other airlines. It is quite expensive though. For rich people, it's a great pick. :)

title: DREADFUL !!
review_text:
A dreadful airline!! 

Unavoidable electrical delay in  Singapore Changi resulting in many passengers missing their onward connecting flights. in Zurich. For me, the Manchester flight, resulting in a  9 HOUR layover in Zurich airport.
Eventual boarding call to gate D. One of the 4 check in agents was stamping boarding passes with a purple stamp.
Long queue for 'purple' boarding passes to go through the 'purple' machine so frustrated passengers began to queue at the 2 non-purple check in agents who for some reason could not cope with this.
Once checked in passengers were sent up an escalator to board the plane.
Halfway up the escalator I realized that the passenger jam at the top was blocking my exit. I crashed into this people jam and fell on the floor as other folk were coming up the escalator and started to fall, luckily not on me; potentially a dangerous situation. Luckily someone hit the red 'escalator emergency stop' button and we all managed to get up, shaken and shocked.
It seems that the flight attendants were staggering embarkation of passengers onto the plane causing the jam further back.
The ground staff should be trained to anticipate and deal with this situation.

During the 12 HOUR flight my Premium Economy seat would not recline and the promised return to fix it by a flight attendant did not happen. So I sat upright for the entire flight.

The tv screen of every seat remained glaringly bright when the plane was not 'sleeping' and could not be adjusted.

The flight attendants seemed to have a problem with special meal requests. At one point two attendants were debating a problem OVER and on either side the middle 4 seats and then passed a tray OVER these 4 seats. Very unprofessional.

I've had similar experiences with Business Class Lufthanza,  Swiss Air's sister company, earlier in the year. I have only been offered a Swiss Air voucher as compensation. These are useless to me as I shall never, ever, fly with either of these two airlines again. They are just awful.

It's back to Singapore Airlines for me....if they can be efficient why can't these two?!

title: My worst long haul flight experience
review_text:
What can I say? It was a rather terrible experience. I will start of by saying that our flight to Zurich and back from Zurich to Johannesburg was probably the most uncomfortable plane I have ever been on for a long haul flight. The planes are old and outdated, little leg room, with a very limited entertainment line up.

Food....oh wow! we were towards the back of the plane and we had only a choice of vegetarian. From about 8 seats in front of us it was only vegetarian left. No meat / chicken options anymore. According to the website when booking your flight "vegetarian" is something that has to be pre-ordered. Why on earth would the last 8 rows on the plane only have an option for this......this was not the worst, with this we received a nice and stale bread bun....
 
it does not end here, breakfast has no selection, you eat what you are given....oh and guess what, once again a stale bread roll and a stale croissant which has turned hard all around the corners.

On the way back, once again no meat option left, oh and guess what another stale bread bun. 

The rush between the transfer is so bad, we actually had to run from one terminal to another. My bag did not even make the flight from Zurich to Barcelona. Lucky me we had to dock up another 80euros to and from the airport to collect my bag. 

I have done numerous long haul flights on Singapore Airlines, Cathay, Qatar and Qantas and have never been this disappointed. 

Good luck if you have booked with Swiss, be prepared and perhaps take some extra food and snacks, you might just not receive a meal at all.

title: Horrible customer service from 6B purchase seat to 20 E
review_text: I bought the seats in advance to help my mom who is 80 years old and the company did not honor the purchase and sat us one in the front and one in the back

title: OLD AIRPLANE NO LEG SPACE AT ALL
review_text: Ticket was not cheap for economy class and luggage was not included but this is not the issue, I used to travel with Swiss all the time before pandemic, this was my first time after pandemic and the airplane was nothing like they used to be. Was very old seat room was 0, table was broken, my chair was broken and was moving around. You can see the pictures how bad this airplane was for the price they charge least they can offer is some space for legs.

title: Terrible Experience pathetic service don't even deserve a one star disgusting!!!
review_text:
I purchased a flexible ticket directly from SwissAir website. There was a need to delay my return flight as I had an unfortunate serious accident whilst on holiday which left me with serious injuries! The start of my bad experience with Swiss Airlines was trying to change my return flight dates on this flexible ticket! For weeks on end struggling with their pathetic website not working! When calling in to their call centres is always an excuse claiming the website to be under maintenance and trying to deal with your call centre agents was absolutely atrocious and a level of unbelievable frustration!! They are just not interested and simply unhelpful! One agent sends me to another in circles and the attitude just shows a lack of interest!!! Eventually I found an agent who helped with my ticket change but which eventually has cost me a hefty phone bill calling International numbers over and over again! One of the phone calls I asked for wheelchair assistance specifically on my flight between Zurich and Manchester with the reason being the layover was short only 45 minutes and with my injuries I would not have the ability capacity or energy to get to the next terminal fast enough on my own so I asked please have wheelchair assistance ready for me on this stop over! Now this is where my experience with Swiss air becomes absolutely disgusting!! so we land in Zurich and before disembarking I asked two air hostesses who seemed more interested in there conversation with each other than paying attention to my question ‚Äúis my assistance waiting for me‚Äù instead I get this look from them ‚Äúlike what's wrong with you‚Äú and get told to go wait in the passage on exiting the plane!
So on exiting the plane there was a gentleman waiting with a wheelchair but claimed it was for someone else! I inquired from him where my assistance was. He looked at what seemed like a handheld device and said ‚Äúyes it shows your name and that you requested assistance‚Äù and told me to wait further down the passage from the plane someone was on their way and this is what I did! For 20 minutes I waited, left completely abandoned and alone, not one person in sight! No one arrived with help! Because I was running out of time I forced myself to try to move fast enough to the next terminal on my own struggling in pain! When I got to security desperate, your idiot security personal didn't even blink an eye to try to help! In fact, the pathetic fool checking my bag actually pretended not to understand English!! Luckily I just made the next flight with an extreme physical struggle!!! Then to top it all off my luggage was lost and I had to go through an extra inconvenience getting it back late the next day which left me running out of important medication!!!! This was honestly a horrible experience and I ask anyone considering using SwissAir to avoid them!!!

title: Bad experience
review_text: Worse company ever. They sent my luggage totally broken a day after my arrival. I made a complain they took my bank information but never compensate me since December. Their planes are also most of the time delays. Will never go with them again

title: Swiss air. First and last time
review_text:
First flight with Swiss air to Hong Kong, Normally use Cathy Pacific.
Flight was only OK 
In-flight food Nothing special
Bed seats, uncomfortable.
They managed to loose our luggage for two days, as we never had any spare cloths in our small carry-on bag, just a chang of underwear.
We were to told to go a buy a few essential items and submit the receipts, thats when we dicovered how unhelpful swiss air staff can be, still unable to submit a claim for a small amount

title: Nice surprise
review_text:
+ Very tasty food , good wine , kind staff on board , quite comfortable seats , very convenient transit at Zurich airport (45min is enough) 
- Small selection of movies

title: The worst of all
review_text:
The worst of all ever.
No reponse on the emails.
I had to go through a complicated procedure to take my pet in cabin.
Uncomfortable on the plane and very expensive ticket for the pet.

title: SHAMELESS
review_text:
Shameless customer service.

After 4 months since the request of refund from the third parties agency was made, SwissAir did not completed the refund.
I kept calling SwissAir several times and every time the operators keep promising that:

Where is the will to help to solve this?
Where is the service you should provide in order to help a customer that is only asking for his money back???

title: AVOID SWISS AIRLINE IF YOU DO NOT WANT TO LOSE YOUR CHECKED BAGGAGE! STAFFS ARE RUDE AND UNRESPONSIVE
review_text:
SWISS AIRLINE MUST be ashamed with budgeted airline from Asia like Scoot airline!

 The MOST HORRIBLE AIRLINE EXPERIENCE i have ever had and it totally ruined my holiday! Customer services are rude and unresposive! title: Total was of time and money!!
review_text:
First flight: 26th Jan (2 leg flight) CANCELLED 
Second flight: 27th Jan (3 leg flight) CANCELLED 
Third flight: 31st (4 leg flight) 

Helpline is a total waste of time.

title: Swiss airline is not anymore what it used to be
review_text:
Flight Attendants were very impolite, one of them throw  very irritated the breakfast box to us, and another fill just a half glass of water for me (instead a full one).
Also flight attendants didn't bring for 4-5 hours any drink to anyone in Economy class (water/juices) as it supposed to do on long flights. 
I would suggest Swiss Airline (in case someone from airline read our reviews!) to enter a satisfaction survey in-flight entertainment  (which by the way it didn't work properly both ways  ZHR - MIA and MIA - ZHR). That way maybe they will improve their future services, at least on long hauls.

title: The most uncomfortable flight of my life, phone jack inoperable
review_text:
This was a Boeing 777, which I've flown on before, although never in the middle aisle. I had an aisle seat (fortunately!) in the middle section given that no window or side aisle seats were available. 
I'm wondering if the already miserably cramped economy seats have been even further downsized on the middle aisle rows. The average-sized adult male stranger seated next to me had to turn sideways in my my direction to get his knees into the seat, and spent the entire 11 hour flight with one foot in the under-seat compartment in front of me that was supposed to be holding MY baggage, but he had no choice. He literally would not have fit in the seat otherwise. When the row in front reclined their seats the television screen was literally six inches from my face. The tray table was unusually short and sat at an angle so that what little could be fit upon it invariably slid off. 
I plugged my phone in, and tried to go to sleep. 3/4 of the way through the flight I checked my phone for the time and noticed everything was red-- it was on low power mode. The phone jack did not work. 
I went back to speak to the steward, explaining that I absolutely must have my phone available to contact my ride upon arriving in the airport. Was there anywhere else to plug in a phone? Nope. I asked if there were any empty seats where I might try the phone jack to see if it worked. There was only one on the plane. The steward accompanied me to it, and we found that multiple other customers were taking turns jacking their phones on it since so many of the plane's phone jacks did not work.

So, I landed alone in a foreign country with a completely dead phone.

The 2 hour flight I had to take to connect to my transatlantic leg was farcical. No complimentary services offered whatsoever, a literal tea bag to be dunked into a cup of hot water cost about 4 euros. No thanks. 

Boarding was ridiculous, on both legs of my flight. There is not even close to enough overhead storage on the plane, so customers were constantly turning around and heading back to the front to gate-check bags or look for a place to put their bags against a sea of boarding customers trying to reach their seats. It was a zoo.

Air flight continues to amaze me when I really thought it could not get any worse. I can not think of another service on this planet with such a high price tag in exchange for such deplorable treatment of customers. And Swiss is worse than average.

title: Worst flight ever!!!
review_text: 12 hours 40 minutes long flight and no leg room. Flying in economy is absolutely torture.  It was worst than any budget airline company. I am very disappointed.

title: Zero customer service
review_text: Swiss Air lost our luggage both ways - going to South Africa and returning to London. The agents responsible for handling their lost luggage in South Africa are totally incompetent and Swiss Air offered absolutely no assistance. I ended up spending two hours running around OR Tambo until I eventually found luggage with a domestic airline that flew it up from Durban. Nobody at Swiss Air or the lost luggage company had any idea where the luggage was. I do not recommend Swiss Air and will not travel with them again.

title: Horrible customer service, no swiss quality
review_text: flight cancellation (Direct flight) horrible callcenter service with crazy long waiting time and useless employer, hat to drive 2 h to the airport to get an alternative of a flight with 2 stops, starting vacation like that is really not fun! no swiss quality, its not a swiss company

title: Horrow movie flight!
review_text:
Of the hundreds of international long-distance flights I have taken, the worst in every way was the Swiss Air Boston-Zurich flight I took this month. I will never fly again with this airline whose sole purpose is to fraudulently take more money from its customers and offer less comfort.

The problems started when this company, which sold tickets with the promise of 1 suitcase allowance, demanded additional money at the airport. The economy class location on my ticket was changed to economy light at the airport.

At the Boston airport, an extremely rude officer demanded money in a very rude manner. When I showed him the ticket, he said it was not reflected in their system and closed the issue. We had to pay  total of $300.

The plane seats we got on were made for children. In order to accommodate more passengers, we traveled in seats that could not accommodate an adult. The seats were hard as stone. The pitiless, ignorant passenger in front reclined his seat throughout the journey, including meal time. When I asked for help from the stewardesses, I encountered the same rudeness and rudeness. Whereas it was a common rule for other airways to turning of seats to normal position during meal times. 

It was not possible to eat or drink anything. Although the food given did not look like it could be eaten. I returned it as is. In the end, my 9-hour journey was a torment. When I got off the plane, I thanked God and said never to swissair again.

My advice to you is to be very careful and take any negativity into account if you have to fly with this airline. Disgraceful food served and staff behavior including seat sizes.

title: Fly another airline
review_text:
I booked directly through Swiss Air. I paid for extra legroom and a seat assignment. I paid for extra baggage. I got the app, which is a complete joke. I get to LAX and then was told that I didn‚Äôt pay for extra baggage. I thankfully had my receipt that showed I did. I then had to pay an extra $285 for my snowboard bag. This is why I paid for the extra baggage. No where on their website can you pay for sports equipment. Then we board the plane, and on the plane it say that on Swiss Air ski and snowboard bags are free. I took a screenshot of this. Then on our return I showed the ticket agent this and he said because I had economy lite that wasn‚Äôt included. No where on the screen was this stated and no where on the website is either. Nothing about sports baggage. I showed that I paid for extra baggage again on my receipt. They said we don‚Äôt show it here and charged us $322 Swiss francs. I also checked on another bag. When we arrived, the regular bag had a wheel ripped off. We went to the baggage center at the airport and filled out a damage report. They said that we can get a new bag on this website using the damage file report number. Guess what. It doesn‚Äôt work. After being told to call three different numbers, the only way I can have this resolved is if I call Switzerland from America. The phone call is going to cost more then the bag. 

We also paid to upgrade to business class. None of my extra leg room or economy seat assignments were refunded. Again the only way is to call an international number. I did try to fill out the online refund form but there hasn‚Äôt been any action or response. 

Fly another airline and/or get ready to be charged an arm and a leg everywhere you turn. It‚Äôs like a mob airliner. Literally all the Swiss Air employees say, there‚Äôs nothing I can do. Go to the website or call this number. Both have led to dead ends and frustration.

title: The worst
review_text: The absolute worst airline I have ever flown.  I flew over a month ago, and our flight was delayed, causing us to have to rent a car.  They said they would reimburse us, and still have not.  We also paid for 6 seat upgrades for extra leg room, because we were travelling with mobility issues.  On the day of the flights they downgraded us to regular seats, and refuse to give us a refund.  Have contacted them so many times, and have had the worst customer service.  Do not fly with them, unless you want a giant headache.

title: Sadly, our last flight
review_text:
We could have written sergeantyork's review posted here yesterday.  I believe we were probably fellow passengers.  I would like to add my experience also.  We have travelled with Swiss air on this route several times the last trip being in 2020.  We couldn't fault the service back then but the experience we received this time bares no resemblance.

The boarding of flights is shambolic.  Both flights were delayed because they just seem incapable to getting people on and off in a timely manner.  Even our 6am flight out of Heathrow was delayed purely because they couldn't get us boarded in time! 
Our return trip arrived one hour late and my bag didn't appear on the carousel.   There were about 8 of us I believe missing luggage.  First we were told that the bags were stuck on the plane and they were working out how to get them off and then told some time later that they had been left behind in Zurich but would hopefully be coming in on the next flight.  We were staying in a Airport Hotel nearby rather than travelling home so I really needed my belongings that night.  The next flight came in - nothing.  I thought I'd ring Swiss customer services for assistance to explain the situation and to ask them if they could tell me if my bag was definitely checked onto a flight that night as we couldn't face spending all evening in the baggage lounge for nothing.  I got through quickly to a lady who said she could not help my and only option was to send an email from the Swiss website for advice.  I asked her how it would take for someone to reply to be told within 7 working days!  That's Swiss' customer services for you.

I am very pleased to report that my luggage did eventually arrive just after 8pm in the evening but there was no communication from Swiss whatsoever nor did they update the staff at Heathrow.  I can accept that things do sometimes go wrong but the lack of communication was dreadful.

Would we travel with Swiss again - no.  We were surprised at how much hand luggage was being taken onto the plane and this was definitely contributing to the problem of getting people on and off.  Reading these reviews of delayed luggage we can see why.

title: We have happy past memories, but not this time
review_text: We have had very good experiences with SWISS, albeit some years ago, so with that memory and a competitive price, we had no hesitation in using them for a skiing holiday in Austria, flying to Zurich. The outgoing flight was fine, although we thought the boarding process a rather slow affair. On both this and the return flight, we were notified the day before that our seats had changed, having paid for and not got the seats we especially wanted on the return flight, ie the emergency exit row  and seats C and D as we both like an aisle seat, it was disappointing that no refund is possible for other row seats allocated, we had seats D and E.I therefore conclude it is a complete waste of time, money and effort booking specific seats. The return flight was slightly delayed at outset by 30 mins which is hardly an issue, but again the glacial boarding process meant a delay of an hour, mercifully with no delay leaving due to a missed slot.  At Heathrow, the customary baggage reclaim games applied, my case was about the fourth delivered, unheard of in nearly five decades of travel, my wife's case did not appear and the baggage delivery seemed to slow to the pace of someone walking to the plane and then delivering one bag at a time. After an hour - with us having to update our taxi firm for our journey home - it was obvious that the missing bag was not going to turn up. Heathrow established that it had been left at Zurich by Swiss. I don't know how the baggage tracking service works, but her bag was delivered to our house within 24 hours, so I take my hat off to all concerned for that and thank them. I'm happy to retain fond memories of SWISS in past times, but the new SWISS is a different organisation and we will not be booking with them again.

title: LOST BAG AND TRASH SERVICE
review_text: Flying from London to Geneva to then take a transfer up into the mountains. Swiss air told us 5 mins before landing that they had not loaded all the bags as they they did not want to be late and therefor incur a fine. I however then had to wait for my bag to arrive in the next flight (4 days delivery if I had not waited) therefore missed my transfer and had to pay for an expensive cab to get to my accommodation. Swiss air said they would not reimburse me. The employee helping to find the bag was rude and tried to make the excuse that it would be difficult to locate the bag as ‚Äúthey had lost so many that day‚Äù. I will never ever recommend this airline or fly with them for the rest of my life. I will actively tell people not to fly with them.

title: Seat change
review_text: I was already onboard when changed my seat to give to a hon circle passenger. They took my seat 2k and gave me the 2G, I denied at first but if I did not change they would kick me out of the plane. I was even discriminated, she told my status wasn‚Äôt as heigh as from the other passenger. If you wonder to fly Swiss first you might pass this kind of situation, they are very unprofessional.

title: Targeted Family for luggage causing delays, unwarranted
review_text:
Our family was targeted to check for ‚Äòlarge‚Äô bags at the gate, and forced to check them in, despite our bags meeting the regulations stated upon purchase of our airfare. When other passengers with visibly larger, heavier, longer and awkward items were not even requested for the same ‚Äòinspection‚Äô

We tried to explain that we have a short connection, with a no -partner airline, and that this was extremely likely that we would as a result miss our flight.

The poor criteria from your agent at the gate, Mrs Solange will cause a loss of thousands, frustration and having to extend our travel unnecessarily, a difficult endeavor for a family traveling with 3 children

Added examples of awkward items allowed, people whom said it was business, and were not, and weren‚Äôt inspected. This is adicional to other passengers with visibly larger luggage whom were not asked the same as us.

title: Worst customer service in the airline industry!
review_text: I recently paid for extra legroom seating on a Swiss Air flight, and received a confirmation for those upgraded (legroom) seats.  When arriving at the airport to check in, Swiss Air had changed my seats to seats without extra legroom.  No explanation or refund was given.  When trying to resolve with Swiss Air after the flight, I was told to address the issue via email on line as no customer service phone number is available.  I did so, but after 10 days there was no response.  When I called Swiss Air again I was told it can take up to 3 months to address.  This is the worst customer service I have experienced of any airline I've flown, and will never fly Swiss Air again.

title: Worst experience ever.Not recommended at all.
review_text:
Worst worst airline to travel .Everything starting from their front desk representatives experience to flight experience was worst.I was traveling with my family and they were so unprofessional.had booked a vegetarian meal for my kid but they gave meatballs .
Front desk representatives were bossing around at every question asked.I had paid 18k for my mother's seat with extra legroom but they gave some other seat and said cannot do anything .I had the worst experience and already asked my company never to book swiss airlines for anyone flying for business.

title: Worst than easyjet‚Ä¶
review_text: Rude, unpleasant staff. If you are flying business, you are an animal joining a factory‚Ä¶ Swiss has changed, perhaps service is worst than easyjet while flight prices are still higher‚Ä¶

title: I don't recommend Swiss Air
review_text: My two suitcases did not arrive; one arrived the following day, and the other two days later. Swiss Air did not fully refund my $350 charges because I did not have documentation and paid in cash. They also did not deliver the suitcases to me, so I had to go to the airport to retrieve them. title: Customer service could be improved
review_text: I was unable to add an additional baggage to my booking using the system so reached out to the live chat agent for support to reset my booking, hoping for the issue to go away. After 2 days the issue still there, so reached out again, the new agent just insists that she/he could add it for me but I have to pay $111 instead of the standard $90 I would pay myself using the online website. title: Thank you for the holiday without my thing.  Swiss air sucks
review_text: Left my bag in Chicago.  Then didn‚Äôt leave gate for an hour due paperwork, but still left an entire pallet of luggage ( mine and other people‚Äôs). title: no customer focus
review_text: have 6 h delay and never pay - system of profit maximizing against European laws. have so many delays with this airline while they super expensive

title: Pathetic and unethical
review_text:
First and last time using this airline!
I am disgusted at the dishonesty and misrepresentation of this airline. When I booked and confirmed, Final price
CHF 1,495.00
(incl. taxes, fees and surcharges) should have been R32709.89 and this was the final price, however the transaction came off as total amount of CHF 1564,64 which was R34223,64 which I did not agree to nor authorised. I would like this rectified and refunded.

title: Not happy about swiss airline.
review_text: Sit are very tight and service is bad. It was my first time to fly at swiss . I would never take and never recommend this swiss airlines again. I pay extra leg room the customer service gave bad sits. Rip of my money.

title: Be careful with this airline
review_text: Had a very strange experience with this airline. They wouldn't allow my daughter to fly from Newark to Tanzania claiming that she needed a visa in advance of departing. This simply was not true. Per the Tanzanian embassy website US citizens can obtain their visa upon arrival. Created an incredibly stressful situation. To add insult to injury we have yet to be able to address the situation with the airline and get a refund. Their customer service does everything possible to prevent having a meaningful conversation and addressing the issue. I would not try this airline again unless it was the only option.

title: Charges for use of credit card!
review_text: Tried to pay for flight by credit card, which despite being approved by the bank was not accepted by the Swiss online system.  Called to be told that to pay by credit card would be an extra ¬£100 and there was nothing they could do.  Sounded more like a company in financial difficulty.  Best to avoid this cheap airline.

title: Worst airline in the world
review_text: One of rhe worst airline in the world. They are sooooooo cheap!!! They don't provide any amenties. You pay for everything even for coffee!!!! They only provided the passengers with a free mini water bottle and a freemini chocolate. Even if you want to order food or drinks, most food items are out of stock. Their planes are so old. I am not even sure how come they are still there competing with other airlines. Stay away at all costs.

title: THEY DIDN'T DELIVER MY BAGGAGE EVEN AFTER 2 DAYS OF ARRIVAL.
review_text: They are not delivering my baggage even after 2 days of arrival. They even messaged me that they may deliver it after 2 days. Worst airline.

title: Swiss Air, Business Class on B777
review_text: Travelled from Joburg to Zurich, service and flight smooth. Amenity kit very basic. They use Aspire lounge in Johannesburg and nothing much to offer in the lounge.

title: Booking all international flights with them!
review_text: Travelled back in April 2017. I didn't realize planes could look so nice and have such good service until flying with Swiss Airlines.

title: The best crew with an amazing plane Airbus A220
review_text: I flew at christmas Eve december 24 from malaga to Z√ºrich the flight was on time so we could boarding easily the crew was amazing and really kind.  I flew with a Airbus A220-300 and this plane is fantastic. Huge windows I fly a lot but I never saw so huge windows before. The legroom was amazing and I really love the 2-3 configuration the seats were very comfortable and I love the map above each row. All in all we had an amazing flight with a fantastic plane and with one of the world best cabin crew because theye were helpful young and really really kind.

title: Customer service? Not in this airline!
review_text:
We had booked a flight to Geneva on Aegean Airlines, it turned out it was operated by Swiss. Upon check-in we got a shock when we discovered that the 3 up-front seats we had booked and paid extra for had been changed and we were seated further back. We inquired why this change had come about and were told by the ground staff that there had been a change in the aircraft. However, later when discussing with Swiss and asking for explanations they told us this was not true.
The bottom line was that we bought up-front tickets and travelled in different seats than those booked and nobody seemed to care.
Need to point out that this is the third time that the customer service dept. of Swiss is totally absent when their assistance is needed and as a travelled I feel totally abandoned.

title: Inexisting customer service + Bad luggage management (delayed & destroyed !)
review_text:
It was a flight Boston-Zurich via CDG on Dec 22/23. At Zurich, the 2 suitcases were missing. The first was delivered 72h after at the airport and we succeeded to get it on Dec 26th. When we picked it up, we informed Swiss that we‚Äôre moving to France for the next 2 weeks. Finally, 5 days later the 2nd suitcase arrived to Zurich but, instead of delivering it to our new location in France and calling us, Swiss just kept it in Zurich and closed the case. Without any news,  we contacted them today by phone and the person refused to reopen the case or send an internal message to have it reopened.

Shame on Swiss : they are closing cases without checking that the customer has retrieved his property.

We had to buy clothes in Zurich and new Christmas presents, but Swiss did not offer any compensation.

Looking at previous reviews, it seems that the luggage management and the customer service are really consistently weak at Swiss.

Update 2024-1-3: 2nd suitcase delivered broken in a trash bag after 10 days. Impossible to contact Swiss Customer service by phone. The Luggage phone is a call center in Egypt and declared themself unable to help. No way to contact an human by chat. Nobody answers the claim !

title: Food Poisoning Swiss Airlines
review_text:
I had food poisoning during my flight from Zurich to SFO.
I wrote to them about. I was very ill and was bed ridden for 4 days. I have had food poisoning before but never this extreme. They wrote back and said, there were no other reporting of food poisoning on this flight and therefore, my ill - painful experience was an "isolated" one and insinuated  that it isnt their food. I replied that just because no other report which can be questioned, it doesnt conclude my meal box was not contaminated, and only mine. I had not eaten over 24 hours before this my flight and I know for sure, it was from the meal I had with Swiss Airlines ZH - SFO. I can always tell if I have had food poisoning. I immediately get a headache after some hours and start to feel very weak. This flight was 11 hours to SF0. As said,  I had not eaten anything before. Yes, even Swiss Airlines can have such issues. A simple apology and suggesting its not their food is a very poor representation of the company.

title: Fantastic Team and Customer Service
review_text:
The best flight I've ever been on. A testament to the team who went out of their way to make my journey as good as it could possibly be, I didn't catch everyone's names but thank you for making the experience so enjoyable. 

The plane was comfortable, good headrests and nice loos too :)

title: Flight canceled
review_text: I booked a flight from Paris CDG (FR) to Auckland Airport (NZ) via Zurich (SW) and Singapore on 13th September. The first flight from Paris to Zurich was canceled, causing me to miss all the subsequent flights. They were able to find me another flight more than 24 hours later. I requested a refund, received a positive response, and completed the necessary paperwork. They emailed me that the refund should have arrived by 31st October. However, on 3rd January 2024, I still haven't received any news about this refund. And it's not for lack of trying; I have contacted them by email and by phone.

title: Not impressed swiss
review_text: Basically a low cost airline charging premium prices, our meals were cold, the aircraft was unbearably hot and they refused to change it. Also if you are not swiss or German the cabin crew talk down to you like they doing you a favour 0/10 would not recommend
