title: The WORST airline in the world
review_text: I have found myself stuck at the Zurich airport without my belongings and did not received any support from the airline in terms of accommodation, F&B, amenities. I was told to go to the ticket office to find resolution and when I went there I spoke with the supervisor, BARBARA, horrible person that I wish I never met, she told me to choose between paying rebooking fee or completely lose my ticket for the 2nd flight. When I told her that I expect from SWISS to show some responsibility and not to charge me for rebooking fee, considering THEY made me lose my flight AND lost my luggage, she refused to take any responsibility and threatened me that if I won‚Äôt leave her desk she would call the police. Calling their support was also a waste of time as they shamelessly hung up the phone in my face the moment I‚Äôve mentioned the word ‚Äúrefund‚Äù or ‚Äúcompensation‚Äù. This is how I was treated as a business class passenger of SWISS. This is a corrupt airline that operates like a mafia and I‚Äôm going to take legal action against them because apparently the court is the only way to discuss with them.

title: Great business class product
review_text:
Was originally in 12K (direct aisle) but i swapped seat with one of the guests in 7K (Window/aisle)
Noticed that 12K has an extra compartment for shoes which 7K doesn't (the throne seat and all middle seats have that shoe compartment) but it didnt bother me much would much preferred a window seat to have maximum privacy.

I flown on Christmas day and they have a special menu on board, but I preordered my main in advance and i have had the beef tenderloin designed by Michelle Mueller which was great.

Flight landed 30 minutes in advance despite a late departure.
Would love to fly with them again.

title: Connecting flight - missed because of airline delays on first connecting flight. Customer service = poor.
review_text: Missed connecting flight because of airline delays, as usual airline claims it is exceptional circumstances because of the weather. Customer service at Zurich airport for Swissair is done through an intermediary managing several airlines so they don't even have a physical desk on their country! Poor customer service. In flight service was good.

title: It‚Äôs not worth it!!!
review_text: Honestly, what a sh*t show. I can‚Äôt get over how unfriendly the costumer service is and the fact that my flight got canceled and I never received any notification. I saw that it was canceled when I got to the airport

title: Gone downhill fast
review_text: Gone from one of the best airlines to one of the worst. Allocated seats, all the way back of the plane every time I fly, and I fly often. Then to change seat its 35chf for a 1 hour flight. Just ripping off the customer, and its another no frills cheap airline except its not cheap....

title: The Worst Business Class
review_text: Swissair  business class is old and tired, and definitely not worth the money. The staff a helpful enough, but the planes and their ‚Äòpremium‚Äô seating are simply out of date. Aside from the poor experiences flying Singapore - Zurich - Boston, we also had an awful experience with a cancelled flight Boston - San Francisco on a Swissair issued ticket.  They just did not want to know us and we were left totally to our own devices.  Will never fly Swissair again.

title: Worst flight ever
review_text:
Booked through Swiss and flew Swiss from Gbg to Zurich which was fine. Swiss partner Edelweiss operator for second leg of trip, Zurich to Montego Bay. This airline is inferior to Ryanair and Wizz, cramped uncomfortable seats, barely edible food and no complementary drinks. Flight total of 12 hours 45 mins with stop Dom Rep.
Called Swiss to upgrade flight home. Was informed that seats were available and I could purchase a new seat but no option to pay difference between seat already purchased and upgraded seat. Swiss totally inflexible and indifferent. Will not be using or recommending this airline again

title: Not friendly
review_text: The people who work for Swiss airlines are very unfriendly and not helpful. Flight got delayed and I had a connecting flight that I was most likely going to miss and I asked if there was anything they could do even just book another flight or let my family off right when the plan lands as our next flight is 10min after we land. The person who was working the desk for Swiss Arline‚Äôs said ‚Äúyou are not special and that will not be happening‚Äù just very rude way to say no and not friendly at all. Plane seats also have no leg room what so ever

title: Stay away!!!!
review_text: I picked Swiss because it used to be a great airline.  NEVER AGAIN!  We paid a horrendous amount for business class seats.  Could not get seat assignments anywhere near my husband.  They charged me $1700 to get us seats together.  The seat assignment never arrived before we checked in and when we checked in, my husband was in 5B and I was in 15B.  How does it happen in the same booking????  Nobody told us that Thailand changed their rules and we were not able to go for 6 weeks without a visa.  Had to buy a new ticket at the airport - going to meet my soon to arrive grandson so no option to just cancel the trip.  I orders vegetarian meal.  My dogs would not eat it!!!!‚Äô

title: Efficient!
review_text:
Scheduled departure at 0950 we arrived 25 mins earlier than expected which was perfect. There was a bit of wait for luggage after arrival but it was fine

Note that in economy meals on board are extra, only business class will be served for free

Was sitting in business the flight wasn‚Äôt full so I had the entire row to myself. Brilliant

title: Rebook emergency case
review_text: I bought this flight in an emergency and during my trip my father ended up passing away. I tried to contact the company to reschedule my flight because I needed to stay for a few more days to solve some bureaucracy and the company was not at all helpful considering my grief situation. They don't have a rescheduling system in case of an emergency that could exempt me or pay a minimal fee for that rescheduling. I realized that the company doesn't care about its customers. I don't recommend it.

title: Pay for the throne seat
review_text:
From online check in to arrival everything was smooth.
Paid extra for the throne seat was worthwhile it was so spacious and with top privacy, had a peek at their first class I think mine is worth more 

Just that they don‚Äôt offer pajama nor slippers even on a long haul red eye flight, and the amenity kit is very basic with only dental kit, socks, and lip balm (not even lotion or mist)

Meal option was top notch however it wasn‚Äôt as existing as it seemed. I ordered veal it was a little salty to my taste, and the chocolate as dessert wasn‚Äôt that exciting  

Blanket was a little thin but it was fine.
Overall a nice product could offer extra perks (ie the PJ and slippers)

title: Swiss -no legroom!!!
review_text: Horribly small seats and I‚Äôm 4‚Äô9- had little to no legroom- worst in all the airlines. Bathrooms in only one area instead of front and back of plane.

title: They don't compensate for lost luggage!!! avoid!!!!
review_text: lost my bag on august 20th - took 8 weeks to get it back - legally entitled to compensation under the Montreal convention - they have ignored me since I got my bag back - can't take them to court as they are not in the EU. avoid avoid avoid, the worst customer service I've ever received, they had me in tears on the line and genuinely, and I mean genuinely, gaslit me when I wrote down what another operator told me to tell them the next time I called... told me that never happened even though I opted for the call to be recorded. never ever again will I fly with them.

title: Uncomfortable and disappointing business class seat, I am still aching.
review_text:
The backbone of the Swiss fleet is the Airbus 330. 
This is an old aircraft whose interior is in need of being spruced up. 
The dark brown color is pervasive and unappealing. 
The overall look is dodgy and sad.

This review is focused on the poor seat quality and the lack of the ability to rest and sleep.

Service was excellent (kudos to the two male flight attendants), and food was objectively good, but this is beyond the point.

The business class seat is undoubtedly below standard and definitively uncomfortable. 
More specifically there is no padding and it felt as if I was on a boardwalk. 
The mechanism to lower the seat in the sleep position is antiquated, loud with creaks, feeding the fear that the seat would not fully recline.

No padding on (1) the back of the seat, (2) the base of the seat where your buttocks rest, and (3) the leg extension.
The cushion is overall thin and worn.
The padding must have disintegrated or was never thick from start.
Even to compare it with the Lufthansa business seat, the Lufthansa one has a much thicker padding, in the order of the 2-3 inches, versus the Swiss seat that must be a tenth of an inch.

The armrest doesn't recline like the Lufthansa one that goes down when the seat reclines to a bed.

Horrible experience, that is impossible to sleep on a wooden board.

I will not spend my money on Swiss again.

title: Dont fly SWISS!!!
review_text: Terrible company. They overprices everything. Changes costs as much as a ticket. out of 2,000 pound ticket, they agreed to refund 136 pound! Never again! Dont lure to their fake advertisement or discounts. They are super expensive with super bad service.

title: AWFUL luggage handling
review_text: Overall, my flying experience with Swiss Air was pleasant in terms of the flight itself. However, the luggage handling was severely disappointing. My luggage wasn't loaded onto my connecting flight at Zurich, despite ample time during the stopover. The tracking system proved ineffective, offering no updates or assistance. Upon its eventual arrival, my luggage was not only delayed but also damaged. This experience overshadowed an otherwise good flight, highlighting a significant area for improvement in Swiss Air's services.

title: Swiss Air double charged me by over $1k and my credit card refuses to do anything about it
review_text:
In June, I booked a multi-country trip for my family (4 people) so we could see our relatives in Fribourg, Switzerland. I originally booked from Dublin to Geneva, arriving around 10pm August 20th. The flights were $227 per person. My family said the late arrival wouldn't be a problem. Days later, my family called to tell me they couldn't find a single train or rental car. Since we had an early morning appointment in Fribourg on the 21st, I called Swiss air and asked to change to a flight leaving from Belfast. The internet site was down with 404 errors so I called in and asked for the least expensive flight. I was told the Belfast flight was 310.20 and this matched the price on the website as well. 

I was told my total charges would be $1504.80 plus a rebooking fee of $66. I said that was fine. Swiss air had yet to charge my credit card for anything, and this flight was only about $80 more, which was less than a hotel in Geneva. I agreed. I had  even mentioned to the agent that I couldn't afford a flight more than $100 over the old flight. Days later, I got all of these charges to my credit card:

June 22-$227.70
June 22-$227.70
June 22-$227.70
June 22-$227.70
June 25- $66
June 25- $66
June 25- $66
June 25- $66
June 25- $310.20
June 25- $310.20
June 25- $310.20
June 25- $310.20

The total was $2,415 in Swiss air charges on my credit card which is an overcharge of approximately $910.00 and comes out to $600 a flight.

Since then, it's been an absolute nightmare to work with Swiss air.

For the first 40 days or so, Swiss air maintained that the original charges of $227.70 would just "drop off" my account in a maximum of 30 days. They encouraged me to just keep checking, but in their email responses they kept referring to a bank account even though it was a credit card. They'd respond by calling me the wrong name or the wrong gender. They'd ask for banking information insecurely over email and I'd give them more than I wanted just to get through it. They'd then ask for this same information over and over again. Sometimes they would get whole flight details wrong. Sometimes they'd only talk about the booking fee which I didn't care about, thinking that was what I was upset over. I'd explain over and over again, I don't care about the booking fee, I care about being charged for TWO flights in full. Agents on the phone talked over me to the point where I had to yell to try to get a word in and then they'd hang up on me for yelling.

In August, I took my flight (from Belfast) and then immediately begin disputing the charges with my credit card. I spent hours a week on the phone with both Swiss air and Citi for 6 months, explaining the same information over and over again. Swiss air sometimes responded that 310 was actually the difference between the new flight and the old flight. This would make the new flight 537 and not 310. I asked for proof the flight was 537. Over and over, they'd send invoices that say 310. When I called and said that their own information proved what I was saying, they'd just stick to their story about it still being the difference, even though previously they'd told me I'd be refunded and mathematically, it doesn't matter how much you say 310 + 227 = 310, it's just not true. Sometimes customer service agents would tell me "well, thats how it's calculated, but the department that charges doesn't tell us the original price or the new price, but we know it's correct". So you don't know A and you don't know B but you know A + B = C and I should just take your word that C is correct.

Citi got a merchant response from their dispute and the merchant response again ONLY talked about the rebooking fee and not the charge I was actually disputing. I kept asking Citi to keep it open and finally in December, I got a letter saying the matter was closed because I "used the service" meaning the 227 flight. I called and said it was literally impossible because that would mean I was on TWO flights the SAME time, so now we're breaking math and physics. The Citi agent told me, well Swiss air has terms of agreements that no matter what they charged you, you can't be refunded.

I have been constantly told I AGREED to $2405 in charges even though no agent ever mentioned that amount, I was told it was a REBOOKING, not an extra set of flights, there was a REBOOKING fee (which, WHY even have a rebooking fee?. It would have been cheaper to outright buy a new set of flights. Is it just to throw people off so you can say they agree to two charges if you confuse them by calling it a rebooking?) 

I am exhausted. I have called, emailed hundreds of times. I have contacted the FAA, the BBB, the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau. This is the worst customer service I have ever dealt with with any company in my life.

title: Good and not so good.
review_text:
We were impressed that they had a vegan menu on the flight.  The attendants we busy and friendly.  It was a long flight between LAX and Zurich, they feed us several times, with the last time being breakfast very early in the morning to get us ready for day when we landed.  It would have been nice if the seats would be a little farther apart so there was more leg room.  The person in front of me, put the seat back and the screen was about 11 inches from my face, which was not comfortable.  There were many things to chose from in the free entertainment.  From TV shows to movies, Audio books to music.
I did see something that was concerning.  Before we boarded in LAX, I took a picture of the plane out the window of the terminal.  A moment later a luggage bag came flying out of the cabin, hit the staircase about half way down, bounced, hit again, then hit the ground and skidded to stop about 10-12 feet away.  An employee walked over and kicked it.  Two employees came down the stairs, one of them also kicked the luggage.  They laughed and talked, then one of them picked it up and walked away.  I would not like my luggage receiving this kind of treatment. Whether I forgot it in the cabin or not.

title: A real disappoint for an international airline
review_text:

They have miss placed my luggage which I understand can be possible. However it has been 5 days, I have no update and communication about the status of my luggage. I literally have to call they CS support everyday up to 3 times + to almost beg to get some info about luggage.

title: DO NOT FLY SWISS!!
review_text:
This used to be a great company. I had travelled Swiss air many times in the past. This won't be the case in the future.
Recently has become by far the worst company I've ever traveled with. One episode that says it all: My mom, who is an elderly person, was travelling from Milan to Boston via Zurich. The Milan-Zurich flight got delayed 3 hours (!!!) hence she missed her Zurich-Boston flight. The company simply rebooked her for the following day, without making sure she was ok and able to find a hotel. She was simply told to come bac to the airport the following day. She had to find the hotel herself (she does not speak English) and was told she will be reimbursed at some point. She finally gets to Boston  and her baggage is lost! (delayed , they prefer to say). I have registered the "delayed" baggage on their website and no update in 48h, their website still says "searching for your luggage". Last thing to mention: forget about calling their call center: Someone who does not even speak English or has such a thick accent that is impossible to understand will waste your time without helping you.

title: Do not fly with Swissair!!!!

title: Worst customer service, paid extra for ancilliaries, flight got cancelled never received my money back
review_text:
After writing 7 e-mails in the lenght of 2 months to ask for a refund, nobody ever responded. 

Bought 2 business class tickets from Amsterdam via Zurich to Singapore. From Singapore there was a codeshare flight to Bali with Garuda.

I purchased a ‚Ç¨ 229 "throne" seat in business class because it is their show horse. I wanted to test and try the product myself as I work in the travel branche. 

Because of my anniversary we have deliberately choosen to make a 1 night stopover at Singapore. I booked the very expensive Marina Bay Sands hotel for this special occasion as well as a taxi from the airport to the hotel v.v.

Already in Amsterdam we knew the flight to Zurich was delayed. And since we just had a one hour lay over we also knew we would miss the connection to Singapore. The staff told us that we had to get on board to Zurich and that we should figure it all out once there. So that's how it went. Once in Zurich we saw our plane to Singapore taking off. 

The Swiss staff at the desk were very nice and helpful and rebooked us to the next flight out to Singapore the next morning. They booked us in an IBIS hotel somewhere downtown and since it was middle of the nights there was no shuttle anymore. We had to grab a taxi and the price was 60 euro's one way, so we paid 120 euro in total.

We missed our stay in Singapore and it was non-refundable as well as our taxi as it was all cancellation within 24 hours. 

In total we lost almost ‚Ç¨ 1400 on taxi's from Zurich Airport to IBIS hotel v.v., for throne seats in their business class flight which we were never on and we lost our anniversary night in Singapore. 

I would expect SWISS air to give reaction to my emails but from August 2024 til december 2024..... nothing. There is JUST nothing. 

Only one first reaction (coming from a robot) that SWISS air is not taking responsibility and stays by her stance. There is no reason, no explanation, no clarification.... just this weird answer. I mean.... which "stance" are your talking about? Explain yourself at least.

I completely lost any kind of trust in this airline and wondering how they deal with other complaints.

title: I feel violated.
review_text: Awful airline. They checked me in into a flight that was clearly delayed. As soon as I got to the gate shortly afterwards they had a ‚Äúdelayed‚Äù sign displayed with no other info and no staff available. Had to call the customer service 3 times to learn that the flight was delayed at least 2 hours, which meant that I was going to miss my connection. Phone service agents were barely ineligible and simply read predetermined scripts without listening to my concerns or actually trying to provide any info or help me.  They refused to even try to reroute me on different flights. They parroted out that I would have to make a change of my flight at a transfer desk in Zurich. But this meant that I would have to attempt to find an alternative route at 9p in the evening (as opposed to early in the day) at a desk staffed with just two agents and with dozens of other people trying to do the same. After lengthy wait I gave up, bought a ticket myself on an alternative flight the following day, reserved a room in the hotel and left. I simply could not even deal with this anymore - felt treated as a cattle as opposed to a valued Star Alliance Gold member. In the future, I will avoid Swiss at all cost. Awful and disrespectful handling of delays.

title: Horrible service Hotline
review_text: Lost luggage and the service hotline is terrible, they let you wait 40 minutes to be unfriendly and give you wrong information.

title: Old plane horrible
review_text: Seats recline to far back the person in front of me was in my lap. TV remote and screen really old broken. Will never fly swiss again and will spread the word.

title: Poor Swiss Air Service
review_text: I am writing this review because of my baggage which was not reachable to my on 22nd Sept 2023 till 4th Nov 2023. There was no accountability from Swiss Air Consultant Feedback Service at all. Despite of my emails and even put up baggage delayed as being told by Swiss Air email. To my horror, they dont even bother to check my emails as I am replying to the Consultant. She requested for my receipts for my 4 days clothings, shoes, toiletries & etc but fell onto death ear.. till to date, this Consultant wanted to close the case and replied that I didnt reply to any of her emails!! For someone who is without anything to change for the next 10 days in Siciliy will she ever kept quiet and continue without change of clothings and etc. I have to simplify her work and tell her on how to search for my emails which were sent to Swiss Air customer service. No wonder this airline service is downward trending. Never will I recommend Swiss Air as I no longer wish anyone to have a horrible holiday which was caused by Swiss Air.

title: Obnoxious air attendant!
review_text:
I just came back from Italy to US by Swiss international air line. I am still processing what just happened to us! Horrible, Arrogant, Extremely Rude and Obnoxious air attendant that we have encountered during the trip! The passenger sitting behind me got special meals so he ate first. Before I realized he started his meal, a female air attendant asked me to straighten up my seat which was not all the way back but I immediately adjusted my seat anyway because I always ask passengers sitting behind me if I could push my seat back a little bit every time I travel by air, given how small and narrow legroom is on flights! However the passenger sitting in front of me pushed her seat all the way back and there was no way for me to eat my meal properly. So when my meal arrived, I was asking the attendant to tell this passenger sitting in front of me to straighten up her seat so that I could eat. This air attendant rudely responded to me that I could have asked the passenger myself! First of all, I thought this is air attendants job as passengers don‚Äôt listen to each other and may get into a fight which I would avoid as much as possible; secondly she asked me to straighten up my seat! Why was I treated so rude and differently? Was it because I am non white and both passengers before me and behind me are white?!

Before landing, my 6 years old girl threw up so we were asking the same air attendant (there was no other air attendant around us) where we should dispose the waste bag. Again, she refused to take and dispose the bag herself, instead, she was asking another air attendant to dispose the bag! Due to these two episodes, my husband told her that she did not have to talk to us so rudely!After that, she started shouting at us that she had been working for 8 hours, stop asking her to do the work! As if we were asking so much and making her work so much! The half of the flight could hear her shouting! I have traveled so much and have never seen that air attendants could shout at passengers! Has all this happened is because we are non white as she behaved very sweet towards white! We feel strongly disrespected, insulted and discriminated! I am still bewildered what we did made her behave like an animal barking at us! 

This whole experience with Swiss air crew staff has completely changed my mind that I would visit Switzerland one day! I will never visit this country nor take this airline again in my life! If you want to be respected, make every effort to avoid Swiss airline!!!

title: Very poor service from call centre operator
review_text:

title: No compassion following mums death
review_text:
Swiss Airlines processes are absolutely awful.  Following my mums death I had to change flight dates for my mums granddaughter and great granddaughter. I asked the agent that answered the call for the cheapest option to change the tickets, so that they could pay their final respects to my mum.

I asked whether they could wave the change fare, the agent advised that I would need to send in the death certificate- I sent this in and Swiss Air refused to waive the change fare as ‚Äúmy mums grandchild and great granddaughter was not related to my mum‚Äù. How they were able to jump to this conclusion from just the death certificate I have not a clue. I sent in proof, with all the  births and marriage certificates and still I was told that they were refusing to cancel the change fee. The agent on the phone passed me on to the supervisor who advised that the decision had been made and there was nothing that he and his team could do. So I had to pay over ¬£1000 to change the tickets so that
my family members could get here on time for the funeral.

I have complaint to Swiss Air so that they can look at their procedure, this is so that others don‚Äôt go through this at a time when they should be dealing with their grief. 

I have just summarised my experience with Swiss Air so that people can read the relevant information, the full experience was absolutely awful. I will say that it took several calls (some of which I got cut off), to several different people and it over 2 and a half days before time was no longer available for me to appeal to Swiss Airs decision or compassion for their customers.

I feel really let down by this company, especially at a time that I was feeling so vulnerable and distressed.

My sister who had to change her travel dates with Emirates took 10mins over the phone to change with no issues, just had to pay for the difference in flight (¬£60 for each ticket)

My family and I will never use Swiss Air again.

title: A Disappointing Encounter with Swiss Airline
review_text:
My recent experience with Swiss Airline has regrettably been far from satisfactory. It pains me to recount the numerous challenges I faced, coupled with a level of customer service that left much to be desired.

The primary issue revolved around a triple charge for a flight change, an ordeal that persisted for almost two weeks. Despite diligently following the advice provided and using the company's contact form, my attempts to address the matter were met with a prolonged and disheartening silence. This lack of responsiveness left me with the impression that the experiences and feedback of customers may not be as valued as one would expect.

The absence of a proper apology for the inconveniences and troubles I endured further compounded my frustration. Shockingly, upon reaching the airport, I discovered that my ticket had supposedly been changed, yet no ticket had been issued. The information and instructions provided by the airline were often confusing and unclear, making the entire experience needlessly distressing.

Remarkably, my worst travel experience during my recent trip, which included a visit to India, happened with Swiss Airlines. The airline's lackluster customer service, refusal to offer compensation, and the absence of formal apologies intensified my disappointment. 

In addition, the prolonged holding of my funds without clarity and the incomplete information provided during the resolution process only served to deepen my confusion and frustration.

Regrettably, I have made the firm decision not to utilize Swiss Airlines' services in the future. I feel compelled to share this experience, as transparency is crucial when selecting an airline. The lack of responsiveness and the overall dissatisfaction I encountered must be acknowledged and addressed to prevent further reputational damage.

In summary, my experience with Swiss Airline has been marked by a significant lack of professionalism, an absence of proper apologies, and a level of customer service that can only be described as abysmal. It is my sincere hope that the airline reflects on this situation and takes the necessary steps to improve its customer service standards.

Sincerely,
Aneta Jarosova

title: narrowest seats and smallest luggage space
review_text:
I  flew from LAX to Zurich and back to LAX with Swiss airlines. On both flights the seats are so narrow that when I saw my middle seat on the outbound flight I was thinking whether I'll fit in that space. And I'm not a big guy by any means (5':10" = 178cm tall, 155lb=70Kg). On the return flight I paid 44Euros and got an isle seat but when I boarded I saw an overweight lady sitting in the adjacent seat and the arm-rest was not coming down! Thanks got her husband was elsewhere and we changed seats.
The overhead luggage space is so narrow that you should put your carry-on sideways. Their planes are not really suitable for long distances. I guess rich Swiss people travel business class so they don't care.
As for the on-flight entertainment system,  It was showing advertisements and you where not given option to watch a movie or something until one hour into flight.
Their food and beverage service was OK like any other reasonable airline.

title: Lufthansa Swiss terrible
review_text: Worst booking process ever. Website designed by a toddler.  Impossible to get help but an actual person. Avoid at all cost

title: Poor Hospitality, petty customer services
review_text: I paid $16 to choose my seat for this flight. The airline changed the plane that was originally scheduled to fly and the airline then changed my seat.  I requested a refund and was told they will not offer it to me because they gave me a similar seat on the plane and tickets are non-refundable.  In addition, I was never offered a drink or snack on this flight. Not even a sip of water. The plane had no form or media entertainment either. Swiss airline charges you to take each bag on a plane. I would never recommend using this petty airline that has such poor hospitality. I highly recommend Turkish Airlines instead.

title: Convenient direct flight Bangkok-Zurich
review_text: Check-in at Bangkok airport was swift, part of the TG lounge has been renovated, much more comfortable and with more food choices. The flight to Zurich is operated with a Boeing 777, due to my experience with Emirates which offers 2-3-2 seating in business class not my favorite aircraft but SWISS offers 1-2-2 and I had booked a single window seat with sufficient space. Service by the flight attendants was ok (one male attendant was a bit rude, maybe he had a bad day), food was ok too (I had ordered a special meal which was so-so), with regard to size of the screen and the available range of entertainment SWISS can't compete with Emirates and Qatar which I use more frequently. All in all I had a satisfying experience on this direct flight.

title: TRAUMATIC
review_text: The most stressful travelling experience. Arrived at the airport in Rome only be told that our flight was changed to depart from Naples. When and how did this happen? No one at the airport could help us since swiss air customer service is not availabe there. The customer service on the phone was not helpful. We were going to miss our flight and had no choice but to buy 3 extra flight tickets. While at the counter we ran into another couple who shared the same terrible experience. We figured we'd try to get our credit at a later time. Swiss air customer service has been dreadful and we have given up on getting our credit and will forever avoid this airline.

title: Better go with the USA carriers nextime.
review_text: Tight seating, breathing down next seat person, rude flight attendants and old planes.  Better go with a US carrier to the USA.  At least you can be sure the seats will be bigger for the Americans who know how to enjoy food (the Swiss are basic non eaters......apples and water diet).

title: Swiss Airlines' Epic Fail: Utter Disarray, Lost Baggage, and Customer Abandonment
review_text:
My recent encounter with Swiss Airlines has been an absolute catastrophe, and I feel compelled to share this cautionary tale of incompetence. Brace yourself for a story that exemplifies the epitome of a travel nightmare.

In a feat that defies all logic, Swiss Airlines managed to lose my suitcase on a direct flight from Zurich to Amsterdam, catapulting it to a destination of its own choosing ‚Äì Cyprus. The absurdity doesn't end there; attempts to reach out for assistance have proven futile, as Swiss Airlines conveniently lacks a phone number for distressed customers.

Despite the supposed convenience of an AirTag, which showcased my suitcase enjoying an unscheduled vacation in Cyprus, Swiss Airlines appears to be indifferent to my plight. Their customer service, or lack thereof, has left me stranded, frustrated, and utterly abandoned.

Swiss Airlines, your level of incompetence is staggering. Losing luggage is one thing, but the complete absence of customer support is downright disgraceful. Your negligence has not only disrupted my trip but has also thrust me into a state of helplessness.

Consider this scathing review a public service announcement: Swiss Airlines is a sinking ship of irresponsibility and indifference. I'll ensure that this tale of woe reaches every corner of the internet, serving as a warning to potential passengers who might mistakenly believe you're a reliable airline. Shame on you, Swiss Airlines, for turning a routine journey into a harrowing ordeal.

title: Horrible experience with this terrible company. Swiss Air is far to be a recommendable Airline.
review_text: This is the worst airline that I ever flew with. There customer service ever. At checking at the  Newark Airport the supervisor was very rude. Made us checking our bags that any other airline would let us carry to the aircraft. This situation caused my wife‚Äôs luggage to be lost and yet to be found or returned to us. We are in Rome two days later and no response from this terrible company. Seen many passengers boarding the flight with similar or bigger bags. One of the agents told me flat out the reason I was seeing that is because more than half of the aircraft is business class. What a fool. I‚Äôm a pilot that flown the Airbus 330 for year. And no for fact that‚Äôs not true. Anyway I‚Äôll never recommend this company.

title: Delayed twice
review_text: Delayed twice with no updates. Only a 1.40 hrs flight, yet delayed over 2 hours. Not acceptable for such a short trip.

title: Holding the flight to Boston.
review_text: Our Swiss flight from Lisbon to Zurich was delayed for about 45-60 minutes.  We (my sister, her husband, me and my husband) only had 1 hour 15 minutes between our next  Swiss flight to Boston Logan USA.  Once we got off the plane in Zurich they had a driver on the tarmac to take us through a private customs area then to our plane to Boston.  They held the flight 10 minutes until we were able to get on the plane.   We arrived in Boston on time.  Our luggage did not make the connection, but all we had to do was fill out a form they sent us, and the next day at 8:00 am our luggage was at our home in Connecticut.   I don't think any other airlines would have gone out of their way so much to get us home.  We are so grateful and would highly recommend this airline.  Thank you so much!

title: Lost luggage
review_text:
Flight was delayed over 10 hours and being stuck at swiss airport that long is not fun for your credit card. 
On our way back they lost our luggage.
Oh and the worst thing- they don't have coffee!!!!

title: Avoid SwissAir unless you want to pay extra!
review_text: Really bad experience: I had Lufthansa flights but ended up with SwissAir as an Alliance flight. I had booked 30kg baggage for all my flights and contacted the airlines before to make sure I could check in 2 bags on all flights. Worked well all the way until SwissAir: The lady at the counter first said I couldn't take 30kg. When I showed her my booking, she corrected herself and said I couldn't take two bags. the fact that Lufthansa allows you to take 2 bags and that I was not informed that I would be flying with SwissAir until I arrived at the airport (!) did not change her opinion. They forced me to pay 90 Swiss Francs (over $100) to take my bags. I submitted multiple complaints and never heard back from them. Avoid SwissAir!

title: Swiss 777 Throne Seat in Business Class
review_text:
I loved my Business Class seat from Miami to Zurich (return). Getting there WAS half the fun. There was no wait for check in at both airports. Priority Boarding allowed me to skip the crowded lines. 
Turkish Lounge at MIA was delightful and not crowded , with decent light selections and complimentary drinks. (The men's restroom was too small.) 
I loved my Throne Seat. I did pay extra for occupying the entire space from the aisle to the two windows. I reveled in the amount of space and storage. I could put everything in bins or slots so there was no clutter. (There is actually more arm space than in First Class.)
The staff was friendly and attentive. Champagne before take-off. Wine and drinks throughout. Good to great meals.
The Zurich Business Lounge was quiet pleasant. I liked the self serve bar and light food selections. Nice mens' room - I enjoyed the automatic frosted glass doors - no germy handles to touch - plenty available stalls.
The 777 was a fine plane for Business. If traveling solo, be sure to shell out for Throne Seat.

title: Very poor client service
review_text: I wanted to bring special baggage for my vacation on the airplane and was advised to contact the call center. Very poor service - I had to call every day for a week and the last 2 days before my flight I called several times to see the progress of my request. Such a waste of time! In the end my luggage wasn't approved and I had to change my vacation plans completely! The call center agents even hung up on me several times!

title: Customer service, second to none as the WORST!
review_text: Possibly the worst customer service I have ever experienced. If you ever require an invoice‚Ä¶ not a particularly difficult request, do not fly with Swiss. Requesting an invoice online using your flight details presents you with an error message, so I emailed both technical support and general enquiries who referred me to another department to deal with the issue‚Ä¶ who to this day have never replied. I tried calling to resolve the issue and the woman I initially spoke to seemed very helpful and assured I would have the invoice within 3-5hours, once again, I am still waiting. The second woman I spoke to was very rude and unhelpful when I explained the situation and stated that they didn‚Äôt deal with my type of enquiry over the phone, which through previous experience, is a lie. Appalling service.

title: SWISS TERRIBLE BUSINESS CLASS - Don't fly with this company
review_text:
I am feeling totally uncomfortable on this sit, I cannot stay into the sit, my left shoulder is hurting a lot, I don't have space for my belongings, I purchased internet and does it work, the food here was a nightmare. What's going on? How can you sell tickets for sits like this? I am forced to do a 12 hours Flight without being able to sleep and take a rest. I am really shocked about this, it is the first time that happens to me and flew in business class at least 50 times with different companies. I really would like to have an explanation for all this, it is a torture! 
Shame on you

title: I'm a person, not a sardine.
review_text: Way too tight.  The tight seating was the only major issue.  For a trans-continental flight, it is not unreasonable to expect a comfortable seat and a little more leg-room than you get on a two or three hour commuter flight.  This was not the case.  We were packed in with less leg-room on the A330-300 than on their smaller jet from Zurich to Porto.  The meal was average.  The back-of-the-seat entertainment package was good.  All in all, a letdown.  Sitting for nearly 8 hours shouldn't be an uncomfortable experience.

title: It doesn‚Äôt worth to pay extra for Premium Economy.
review_text: I paid extra on an upgrade bid. Premium Economy is 3 rows in front of Economy, no separate area. Amenities kit is very poor and looks so cheap (made of recycled material).  Seats are very uncomfortable, there are wider than economy but they recline very little so you ending sleeping with a back-pain. Seat photo looks great but in reality they are not. Service on the ATH-ZRH flight was a joke, plane was an A320, and at least it was not an A220 that they sometimes use on the route. Service on B777 was professional but not friendly. Food was good on china plates. They distribute menu and welcome drink, there were 2 options of meal. Head phone were on an excellent quality. There was great selection of drinks. After dinner, during flight you could go to galley at the rear of plane for some snacks. IFE was good but selection of movies very standard, limited selection of Asian/Indian movies. One hour before landing there was the second service, just before landing they distribute chocolates.

title: turbulent airline
review_text:
I am very sorry that one of the best airlines in the world is turning into an ordinary carrier that no longer cares about the passenger. The Airline call  Swiss International Airlines.
From the moment you buy a ticket until you arrive at your destination you are facing -disgusting service, for such a price. The word Costumer Service and Swiss air are words that do not longer goes  together. Swissair now has practically no service - uneducated and unqualified personal in  costumer Service, conducted in a boorish manner‚Ä¶ you ask 3 people from Swissair Costumer Service about the same issue  they will give you 3 different, completely opposite opinions‚Ä¶  I have nicknamed them HangUp Service‚Ä¶ that is what they do.
A dirty, old airplane cabin, broken seats, disgusting entertainment service with very old technology, complete lack of care for passengers - that is what Swissair has become these days. I am talking about Business and First class, where you pay about 8 000 dollars( Swiss Francs).  I only can image how is Economy class. 
About myself - I and my whole family have been flying Swissair and Lufthansa Group  for 30 years, at least 3 times per year, only by First and Business class, members of the Senator. 
I understand that Covid has brought a lot of problems to the aviation industry... but it seems to have hit Swissair the hardest. It is a shame.

title: Absolutely shameful customer service.
review_text: This company is absolutely scandalous. The individuals on the phone provide contradictory and inaccurate information. The responses to emails are so impersonal and unhelpful that they could be mistaken for automated responses. It's a truly dismal customer service experience. They should be ashamed."

title: Great Experience On Swiss Airlines
review_text: My family of Four traveled on Swiss Airlines on October 23rd from Newark to Zurich on an evening flight (9:55pm) and it was a wonderful experience. The male flight attendant, whose name began with C was polite, helpful, and extremely warm and welcoming. We would most definitely fly on Swiss Airlines again

title: It was a very bad experience from the trouble in plan to the weird response of feedback services
review_text: We were on  board on 30.10.2023. A completelt drunk passenger , who was sitting just behind our seats and kicking the back of chair  , started creating some fuss to a flight attendant. he got scared and called captain. I also told captain that my wife is very scared. The captain tried to talk to him but he was not in his senses. After some time they took help of a body builder on board and forcefully tied him up to a back seat. Apparently it seemed that the matter is resolved. But after that this man stated screaming, howling, crying and using bad words. This was very disturbing and horrifying bcz we couldn't sleep for a minute. My wife is a migraine patient and she had a migraine attack throughout the way. At time of departure the captain gave us a card to write our grievances as feed back. After  2 days I wrote an email and told about that mentally nd physically tiring journey. Guess what? This BIG organisation gave us a compensation of 100 euro voucher for our next booking through them. It was disgusting. A passenger does not expect to be treated like a begger. I ddnt accept and returned the offer with thanks. We are never going to travel through this airline again. Other than this particular event   the food, seat comfort, entertainment... nothing was impressive.

title: Swiss Air Customer Service lacking
review_text:
Left with few direct flight options from Switzerland to Crete we chose Swiss Air. It's a 3 hour flight that left at 7:50a. Knowing this we used the Swiss App to pre-order food. 

The flight was only a quarter filled. We were seated in row 8 with no one seated in front of us, yet the flight attendants drew the class separation curtains and proceeded to hide behind them most of the flight. No we didn't get our pre-ordered food. No snacks or food was offered,  no drink options service, no staff presence except for the obliguatory bottle of water beginning the flight and a chocolate at the end of the flight. 

We got to our destination on time. Our luggage wasn't lost, but their customer service was really lacking. Unfamiliar with European airlines, maybe that's how most European flights are these days.

title: Worst Airline Fraud
review_text:
Swiss denied a full refund saying I did not pay rebooking fee calculated despite shared proof that the extortionate rebooking email (asking for nearly half my booking amount) was sent 127 hours AFTER Swiss illegally blocked my rebooking on call with ClearTrip. An email refusal was sent 56 hours after the Swiss call centre promised to rebook. No help from Swiss email, social media or web form. Their call centre kept hanging up on me without saying a word after they goofed up. 

It took 4 months to finally get a refund. This is just a warning to anyone else, book at your own peril. The airline will just ignore fraud even given proof of call centre recordings & emails from their service centre.

title: Swiss air inflight experience
review_text:
The food is good, but the seats are congested like anything. No space to move feet around. If the passenger infront flexes his seat behind, you won't even have breathing space. 

I took the flight as code share with Lufthansa to experience Zurich airport on my way return. But the 8 hr journey is hell. Would anyday recommend Lufthansa or air India over this. 

Don't compromise comfort for long haul flights.

title: Archived ticket after 3 day delay
review_text: After my original flight with Edelweiss has to turn around because of enginge problems, Swiss air wanted to reroute my handicapped husband over Boston with a nearly 6 hour overlay. After talking to them they gave us a flight the following day to Miami insteadt. While trying to board the airline, they refused to let me fly, since my green card had expired and even with a letter  from the US embassy they refused. They wanted me to buy new tickets, since the original where archived. I bought new tickets, but sure not with swiss air. Very unfriendly, stock up employees in Zurich. Never ever flying with Edelweiss or Swiss Air, and will never fly into Zurich again.

title: Lost Bag Nightmare
review_text:
Service on the flight was fine, but they lost my bag and tracking it down was a nightmare. Swiss was extremely unhelpful and unprofessional in (not) assisting with tracking down and getting my bag back to me. Thank goodness for Delta agents who stepped in and figured it out.

BUYER BEWARE IF YOU CHECK BAGS AND THEY ARE LOST OR DELAYED

title: Bad Experience with Swiss Air
review_text: My wife and I purchased flights from Zanzibar to Montreal and had paid for seats in Economy Class with Swiss International Airlines. Swiss booked us on 3 flights and 2 connections, one in Zurich and Vienna. We took the first flight from Zanzibar and made it to Zurich on time but we only had 40 minutes to catch our next flight. In order to catch the flight to Vienna, we had to take a train and change terminal, we also had to go through passport control and security again, while waiting in long lines. We therefore missed our flight. There is no way we could have caught that flight. Swiss should not book passengers on such short connections when passengers have to go again through passport control and security. When Swiss re-booked us on different flights to our final destination, they couldn‚Äôt get us seats together like the ones we had paid for and they declined to give us a refund. We are really disappointed about our experience and don‚Äôt recommend Swiss Air.

title: Terrible underpayment for loss of checked luggage violating the MONTREAL CONVENTION for delayed luggage.
review_text:
Somewhere between Boston, MA and Geneva, CH, Swiss Air lost both my wife's and my luggage... for a total of FIVE DAYS!
Upon arrival in Geneva, we purchased two pairs of "walking shoes" as we fly in lightweight slip ons, and my wife bought two T-shirts and two bras for a little more than 400 Euros.
On day three, with  no help on the status of our lost luggage,  we bought a large roller bag since we had no idea when/if we'd receive our luggage for 300 Euros plus a couple of blouses for my wife.
On Day Five, Swiss Air notified us our luggage was back in Geneva, while we were on a river cruise out of Lyon. We ended up paying a taxi driver 440 Euros to drive to Geneva airport, pick up our luggage, and drive it to the ship's dock in Lyon.
Under the MONTREAL CONVENTION, Swiss Air should have reimbursed us for "up to $1,700 per passenger for lost, damaged or delayed bags".
Swiss Air only offered to pay us $300 for "First, necessary purchase" in Business Class as we would be "able to enjoy our purchases once we returned to the US" according to their policies.
The difference isn't worth paying an attorney to resolve, and we received a check from Swiss Air, finally, on October 25, 2023 for just $820... a little more than half our out-of-pocket expenses; much less the terrible inconvenience during our otherwise, enjoyable, French river cruise.
We'll be certain to use other airlines for our annual, European travels henceforth, and will tell all our transcontinental-traveling friends about our experience.

title: Onboard service ok but terrible ground staff
review_text: Airline delayed sending my bags because first Swissair flight was late. Followed by comedy of errors and Swissair agent sbeing the most frustrating people to speak to .. might be easier to speak to a brick wall. Then with compensation, they are shirking responsibility. Worse experience ever

title: Delays
review_text: Horrible airline. They were very delayed. Missed my connecting flight and meeting the next day. I would not recommend this airline

title: Worst customer service ever
review_text: fly frequently and this is the absolute worst experience I‚Äôve ever had. We barely missed our connection from Zurich to Chicago because our flight from Heraklion to Zurich was delayed. We, along with several others, made it to the counter just min after boarding ended. We were denied boarding, and the staff was unbelievably rude. We waited in line at the transfer desk for three hours to rebook and were told we would be refunded for our upgraded seats since they were unable to book us in the same category. I spent weeks fighting with Swiss Air to try to recoup my $200 and they flat out refused to reimburse me. I will NEVER fly this airline again.

title: Swiss Bliss
review_text: The flight was on time, and comfortable.  Seats were spacious enough and the crew was lovely the whole flight.  They offed us food through out the flight.  And checked my carry on free of charge.  The restrooms were clean and sanitary.  I would definitely fly Swiss Air again!

title: Cramped Economy Class seating, however good service and on time
review_text: I purchased a return ticket to Europe from Australia with Swiss Air flying from Sydney to Rome & Dubrovnik to Sydney on the return.  There were a total of six flights in the trip & only one was with Swiss Air the rest was with their partner airlines.   The portion of the trip I flew with Swiss Air was from Singapore to Zurich.  The staff were friendly and accommodating and I found that the boarding went fairly smoothly.   Once in my seat I found that the economy seating appeared to be more cramped that other airlines.   The onboard service was okay as was the inflight entertainment. The flight was on time & other than being very cramped I couldn't complain.   Would I fly with them again, I'm not sure, however, I have to say whilst the majority of the flights were with their partner airlines, there was no issue with any of the flights and my holiday went smoothly.

title: An unethical immoral and dishonourable company .. don‚Äôt give them any of your custom.
review_text:
Due to the air traffic control issue on the 28th August I was stranded in Budapest and could not return to the UK to meet the Swiss air flight that I was catching the next day to fly out to Zurich.

I then bought another flight direct to Zurich thinking that my return ticket from Zurich to London would then get me back home.

Swiss air cancelled both my outgoing and return flights London Zurich as I had not boarded in London .and called it a voluntary cancellation.

I filled in a request for a refund due to the fact that I had not boarded in London because I was stranded in Budapest due to the air traffic control issue which was not of my making .

Swiss air made me pay ¬£840 to repurchase two return tickets from Zurich to London which I had already bought once already for ¬£550.

My request for this to be waived after a 6 week delay for them to take a decision was because it did not meet their terms of carriage.

Swiss have no ethics, no sense of customer care and no idea of what fair and professional is. Plus there is no recourse for me to try and chase this refund.

I would never recommend Swiss air to anyone they are a disgrace are dishonourable and exploitative when customers need help.

title: Unacceptable behaviour
review_text: I gave to Swiss a lot of opportunities to prove that they are at least professional, but they keep it always the same! They don‚Äôt care for the passenger and they are always rude and arrogant! Of course the problem starts already from the ground staff! Even if I told them that I need my luggage with me, because I had another flight with not a Star Alliance Airline, they took my luggage. This means that I had to go out of the security area, to take my luggage and then pass the security one more time. The same time they allowed to a lot of passengers to get in the aircraft with their luggages after me, even if they informed me that the aircraft ‚Äúwas full‚Äù.

title: Swiss Air beats SAS hands down.
review_text: Our SAS flight from Chicago to Copenhagen was cancelled after we sat for an hour and a half on the plane. SAS booked us on Swiss Air for the following afternoon.  What a bonus! Food was good (so much better) and wine was unlimited. Even though we had to connect through Zurich it was a much more enjoyable flight than on SAS which we took on our return home.

title: Not a good experience with Swiss airlines at the gate
review_text:
I have been using the same carryon since 2015 around the world including geneva Vienna route almost every 2 weeks and was never asked to check it in. I was singled out by the Swiss airline gate crew in a very impolite way. More than 90% of the passengers were carrying the same size carryons behind me and none of them were stopped and asked to check them in.

Moreover there was no one at the entrance of the plane to receive my luggage since they didn‚Äôt expect anyone to have this issue.

I ended up taking my carryon into the plane anyway and easily put it in my overhead despite that I was charged 70 CHF to leave it off the plane.

I always thought Swiss airlines provide good services but I am about to change that perspective. I am a world traveler and never been treated like this by any airline.

title: Stay away
review_text: Big zero customer service and they are dishonest they lost luggage and I was not the only when did find my luggage when I arrived and it has more than one month I don‚Äôt know where it is

title: Swiss airlines a fibber
review_text:
Here are a few tips before flying this airline:

This airline tricks you a lot on codeshare flights. They only restrict you only one checked baggage of only 23 kg and one carry on bag up to 8kg. Only HON Circle gets more kgs :(

Their cabins are old and need refurbishment. Inflight entertainment doesn't work the whole flight and they can't even fix the issue. The remote had an error message "PAC" which meant Passenger At Control which the crew can control your screen and select a movie.

The food service gets run out easily. I was either left with the vegetarian meal for lunch and dinner. But got sausage and omlette for breakfast.

The A330 has middle bathrooms, so if people accidentally walk to the galley while the crew is sleeping ?? 

I had gotten called to security because of a baggage issue which was first called out at Delhi. A portable fan which malfunctioned had to be checked before traveling

One positive thing to note about the crew and the food quality were so nice. I appreciated it.

title: Don't fly SWISS
review_text:
Pathetic check-in experience. Being routed from one Check-in gate to another. Then a huge but fast moving queue. Dash to the gates and then another passport check queue (which was a sham - coz when the flight take off was getting delayed they just waived us through after stamping our boarding passes).

While seats & infotainment systems were good, the crew was RUDE. They treated everyone with utmost contempt. Refused to fill in the water bottle of a co-passenger. My elderly mom-in-law needed water and the crew refused to give it when I went to fetch it in the galle area. I had to go again after 15 mins because the service was so slow and she grumbled and gave me a glass of water. A crew scolded me and my 5 yr old daughter (and others) for standing in the aisle while waiting in queue for using the washroom - as they had to commence service - no excuse me, no thank you. I wonder if that's how the airline culture is?

title: Bad flight experience with Swiss International
review_text: I've specially paid out of my own pocket for an upgrade to premium economy.  Seat supposedly tp he more comfortable than economy.  However the seat button isn't working and I'm unable to recline the seat at all throughout the whole 12 hours + travel. Asked the stewardess for help and she only say you have to use your body weight to push ... then she hurriedly went off without any help. Well I given my feedback to swiss intl air and they did nothing. Rude reply and not willing to compensate even for diff in the price for the upgrade. My last time taking this airline...seat sucks... service sucks probably coz I'm an Asian.

title: Beyond the call of duty
review_text: Outstanding baggage service. Mistakenly a passenger checked in her luggage but found she had left her phone in her hold luggage outside pocket. Swiss Air efficiently and swiftly located it and returned it to her before boarding the aircraft. All with a very professional and cheerful approach.

title: Missed connection, huge delay, no response from Swiss on my request.
review_text: Our first flight was delayed and we missed the connection in Zurich. we had to go over to Dubai before heading to Mauritius causing more than 10h delay. I have submitted a for for compensation but no feedback since March 2023. I have sent at least 5 emails no respond... tried to call but they only communicate with emails. very very disappointing from Swiss air lines..

title: Stolen money
review_text: This was the worst customer service ever. I had to cancel the flight due to sickness so all I asked was to get the credit for my ticket so I can reebok when I get better. After many phone calls an emails before and after I missed my flight I never got the money or credit back even though I followed their protocol and had a doctors note.... Such a terrible, customer unfriendly service. Very disappointed.

title: Unprofessional and racist conduct by male crew member
review_text:
One of the worst experience. Me and my wife boarded the flight from New Delhi to Vienna , Austria on 13.10.2023 at 1.15 am in the morning. It was connecting flight with 50 min layover at Zurich 
1. First of all the the first flight was delayed by 25 minutes , So it reached Zurich half and hour late . Everyone who had to take a connecting flight missed the other flight. It should be the duty of Airlines to guide us and to ensure that we don't miss flight of the same country. The departure and arrival segments of the airport are like 25-30 minutes apart. We were provided a new ticket of Austrian airlines which was 2 hours late and our luggage got misplaced and provided to us after 10 hours
2. Secondly special mention to one and the only male crew members on board on the Swiss airlines LX147 on 13.10.2023 . Sorry to say but he was the most racist person I have ever seen. The disgust on his face for Indians was evident. He was rude and wore the most artificial smile one could imagine. I didn't have any direct altercations with this guy but I did see many. For instance there was this one person traveling with 2 years old son . This person ( Passenger) was standing in a queue with his son waiting for his turn to the lavatory.  The kid accidentally brushed his back with this Air host crew member , this guy is with disgust and said - stay 2 feet away from me . I mean who treats a passenger like that. 
If someone from Swiss airlines is reading my review , kindly take note of this incidence , thus guy should be either banned or given a strict warning.

title: Swiss national carrier good service
Rebook flight
review_text: it was impossible to change the ticket to another person even if we had a doctor confirmation that flying was not possible because of health reasons. The customer  service was unfriendly and not helpful

title: Very bad experience!
review_text: Incompetent check-in staff in Singapore refusing me to put my laptop in my check-in luggage and insisted that I carry it with my Han carry luggage. She said that is Swiss Air's policy but checking with other airlines like Singapore Airlines, Qantas, British Airways, Lufthansa, their customer services said that laptops are allowed to be stored in check-in luggage provided they are powered off, viz. battery power off. So I have to go through several secut checks taking my laptop in and out, the hassle of which I was trying to avoid. Then, their turnaround times in Zurich are not more than an hour and most times, their incoming flights are delayed. In this instance, there was no turn for the luggage to be transferred to the connecting flights and more than half of the passengers did not have their luggage delivered upon arrival. What a mess! I will not be flying Swiss Air anymore. I am going to go back to Turkish Airlines or even Singapore Airlines.

title: Don‚Äôt fly Swiss Air!!
review_text: This is a rip off airline. Charged us $90 a bag or $180 for both of us for baggage fees. Don‚Äôt fly with Swiss Air. People are not helpful and down unpleasant.

title: As you wish for your 2.30 flight
review_text: In an age of pared-down products in the aviation industry (short haul), it is pleasant to be able to experience this today a bit old-fashioned in a positive way.Aperitif, salad, main dish, cheese and dessert on a tray with real glasses and china.The small Business Class consists of 2 rows of seats, the same seats as in Economy but offers a certain separation.What stood out, however, was a truly brilliant Purser who saw the individual in each passenger. Impressive considering that cabin crew in these times can manage up to 4 flights like this in one day.If it wasn't for ATC in Europe slowing down the inbound traffic, it would be an on time performance.

title: Avoid at all costs !
review_text:
Absolutely deceitful airline ! I know british standards are high and swiss are a totally different (lower) level but still  ,as soon as I stepped on the filthy old plane I thought i‚Äôve been ripped off . To top it all I did not feel safe , flight attendants were completely lost, not professional proper dim lights . As soon as they started service the cabin  filled with smoke smell from the oven , very reassuring for the other passengers that started to show panic and NOT a word from the crew. Descending filled the cabin with fumes again , mind you the plane looked like it had been used as a chicken coop for the past 3 decades and not a flying object. 
I think Swiss airline are sinking as a business yet again but they continue to rip passengers off for their substandard ,unsafe and horrible service . Considering the times we live in and how we are supposed to go ‚Äògreen‚Äô this airline should be banned from flying such old and polluting aircrafts . Not to mention swiss snootiness at recycling their garbage -it‚Äôs a different world outhere guys , Ein mann ein wort darlings

title: Getting worse one step a day
review_text:
Just getting worse ‚Äúone step a day‚Äù.
Ok, so i am a gold member of their flight programme. Each time you can choose any seat only for at least 30% of the price of the flight. And they always put you at the WORST seat possible, just for you to need to buy the seat. 
For a price of a premium airline you have a bottle of water‚Ä¶ that‚Äôs it‚Ä¶

title: Horrible,dishonest and rip-off airline
review_text: We have travel a lot on many different airlines, but our first Time on Swiss Air, and I think this is the worst, horrible and rip off airline that we have ever travel and glad to say that we as a family will never ever travel with them again, firstly from the moment we get the Heathrow Airport to check-in our luggage, very rude and disrespectful staff's, only to be told we have to pay for our check-in luggage after paying so much for our package holiday, the whole trip to Thailand was just unpleasant, horrible food and service, all the stewards was just plain rude and disrespectful, and our way back from Thailand was just the same not very nice staff's,  serving the food they just dump it on your table without explaining what it is, no choice whatsoever, she gave me a veg lasagne and when I told the lady that I can't have cheese as I have a dairy intolerance, she just said rudely you should've book online, a gentleman who was part of the crew saw and heard how rude she was, went and find a substitute for me  which was much appreciated and we as a family thinks he was the only professional and respectful staff member,  never again would we fly SWISS AIRLINE ever.

title: Rude Crew-- Old Aircraft
review_text:
The flight from Zurich to Mumbai had very rude crew. No one was bothered about the passengers. I had ordered non-veg meal but don't know how they got the veg meal for me and did not even apologise for the goof up. They seemed least bothered. I ordered water and the airhostess asked me to go and fetch for myself. I didn't have any problem with that but the way she spoke was so rude. This was the flight on 10th Oct, 2023. 
The aircraft was very old and seats were cramped. Not comfortable at all. On the rude behaviour of the crew was the cherry on top!!!

title: Don‚Äôt fly with Swiss or Lufthansa
review_text: Swiss air cancelled our flight and offered an alternative the following day or a refund. We selected the refund but two months later have not received it. Hours of phone calls, e mails have been met with evasion, smoke and mirrors and s total lack of accountability and responsibility. Disgraceful and illegal.

title: Just don‚Äôt care
review_text: Travelled to Brindisi to attend my brothers wedding. Bags were lost and couldn‚Äôt attend the events. What a waste of time and effort. No help from the airline despite travelling business and being a gold card holder. Poor service

title: Greedy and Expensive budget airline
review_text: We booked a roundtrip flight with United Airlines. One of the legs back (Zurich - London) was unfortunately operated by Swiss. They charged us $400 to transport 2 bikes, which are included in UA checked bag policy. UA confirmed that Swiss incorrectly overcharged us as the bags should have been free. Swiss refused to pay us back. It is safe to say we‚Äôd never fly with Swiss again.

title: AABSA = Any Airline BUT Swiss Air !!
review_text:
In my review dated September 8, I detailed the issues I and many fellow passengers on the same flight experienced entirely due to a 2-hour delay at LHR Terminal 2. In my case, this resulted in my checking into my Cairo hotel some 24 hours after having checked in my baggage the previous day. 

Since formalising my complaint on September 8th (Case no. 2309-LX-06197) to Swiss Air, no formal response was received until September 22nd. In addition to their obligation to refund Euro 600.00, I have asked for my expenses incurred because my baggage was delayed by 4 days, reimbursement of costs of food greater than the derisory 'food voucher' I was given and an ex-gratia payment to cover the untold stress and inconvenience caused by the delayed flight and appalling levels of 'customer care'. Needless to say, I am STILL (!!) awaiting even the common courtesy of  an acknowledgement close to 3 weeks after having responded to Swiss Air, far less a formal response addressing these remaining issues.

Manifestly, this is an attempt on the part of Swiss Air to block the matter with a wall of silence. Their shameful performance has made me all the more determined to pursue these outstanding matters as relentlessly as I have the time to do so. I don't recall ever having experienced such abysmally low levels of customer care.

BK

title: Bad policies, greedy company
review_text:
Swiss has a policy, that with Light tickets (that are still super expensive), you can't preselect seats.  That's fine.

What not fine is, that during online checking, just 10-12 hours before departure, you still can't select seats, and by default they intentionally put everybody in the very back of the airplane (even when there is full empty rows more to the front).  They only do this, to blackmail money out of people.

This policy is completely unacceptable and evil, nothing less than what we would have expected from this new budget airline, called Swiss.  Of course, as expected, they still charge the old non-budget prices for tickets.

Also very nice representation of their mentality: if it's free for us, and good for the customer, we will still under no circumstances help the customer in any condition at all.

They either has to start filling up rows from front to back, or make selection free for every ticket category let's say 10 hours before departure.

title: Absolutely Awful
review_text: Warning!! Do not fly this airline!!! They made multiple horrible mistakes that nearly ruined our international trip. There was a reservation error (my partner and I booked separate tickets weeks apart both were independently screwed up). They had to change our connecting flight and move us to different seats after we paid extra to be together. On the return flight they cancelled our flights because they thought we no showed the original flights (even though it was Swiss Air that changed the ticket to accommodate for their original booking mistake.) Thank God we figured it out the day prior to leaving but it still took hours to correct and we lost our seats together for a 9 hour flight which we paid extra to have. This airline does not have basic reservation systems that communicate. Bottom Line..pay extra with a US carrier or more established airline. It is worth it

title: Worlds worst Airline
review_text:
Flew with swiss air to jhb.bag didnt arrive.spent 36 hrs looking for it myself.had to pay bribe money to lady at jhb baggage company to look for it.
Returned to manchester 9 oct and myself and 8 others from jhb recieved no bag.
Dont have a single member of staff anywhere in uk.

title: Formerly great SWISS now unaccountable and unflyable.
review_text:
How the mighty have fallen. SWISS was our go-to airline for travel to/from Switzerland. I felt that the hefty premium paid to fly with them was justifiable for comfort, courtesy, reliability, and amenities. Those days are gone.

We flew from San Francisco back to Zurich last August. After a time of great personal challenge in our family, I wanted to gift our 11 y.o. daughter a business-class experience. We had already paid nearly $5,000 for two round-trip Premium Economy seats, but upon checking in online, we were offered an upgrade to Business class for CHF 300 per ticket on our journey from SF to Munich/Munich to Zurich.

When I clicked on the 'fixed price upgrade' box, it showed an upgrade option from SFO>ZRH for CHF 300 per seat. That includes both legs, from SFO>MRH and MRH>ZRH. It did not offer an option to upgrade each leg individually. I selected the upgrade for both tickets and paid CHF 600. When it took me to next to seat selection, it showed both legs, SFO>MRH and MRH>ZRH, but SFO>MRH was greyed out, and only MRH>ZRH was available. I made those seat selections; however, the Bombardier CRJ900, a commuter jet, doesn't have a first-class or business-class cabin.

There is no way I would have booked an upgrade on a 31-minute flight (for a class doesn't even exist on that journey), let alone for CHF 300. None of the customer service representatives I spoke with afterward disputed this.

I called the airline the following morning and the customer service agent said to get our seat assignments at the check-in counter.

We did as we were told. Adding extra complexity (or insult to injury, as it turned out) was that we were ticketed on SWISS by flying Lufthansa, which rates 1.2 on Trustpilot (1 is the lowest score). I think our customer service rep. was a trainee, but both she and her trainer said to check in at the gate for seat assignments, as they couldn't see our upgrade from SF to Munich.

A Lufthansa customer service representative in Munich later confirmed that we were indeed ticketed in Business Class for the entire journey from SFO to ZRH, but that the information was on a second screen, and undertrained employees didn't know where to look for it.

At the gate, we spoke to six different representatives, who said we only had an upgrade on the Munich to Zurich leg: all agreed that that didn't make any sense. I asked the supervisor, Ms. Bayarmaa, where the accountability was. She said, "There is no accountability here."

The chief flight purser Frau Nagel commiserated with us and said the same thing happened to her when Lufthansa said, "You didn't pay enough for an upgrade" and refused to seat her in her Business Class. She took a detailed statement from us, put it in the voyage record, and said I would hear back from the airline shortly. I never did.

I took up my concerns with Gerald Schloegl, Managing Director of Miles & More GmbH and a VP at Lufthansa. He replied, "first of all, I apology for the really bad customer experience. I will forward your request to the right internal contact person, so that your concern will be resolved as soon as possible."

That person was Silvia Reiner, Consultant--Premium Feedback Services. Her replies were courteous but continued to claim erroneously that we had only paid for an upgrade from Munich to Zurich. Since we were involuntarily downgraded, I invoked our right under European Regulation No 261/2004, entitling us to a refund of 75% of the fare paid for all flights since the journey was longer than 3,500 km. Frau Reiner refused but offered a credit of CHF 400 as a courtesy.

Then both Herr Schloegl and Frau Reiner ghosted me. I will receive my remedy by filing our EU Regulation form for involuntary downgrade and receive our 75% refund.

As far as Swiss (and their partner Lufthansa), Ms. Bayarmaa was correct: there is no accountability here. At least I should be grateful for her candor. As for SWISS, they are a shadow of their former selves and I will take my business elsewhere. I suggest you do the same.

title: Poor customer care
review_text:
Trip back to London from Johannesburg. Plane arrived late in Johannesburgh according to the captain hence the delay departing Johannesburgh. Arrived late in Zurich, big questions at security.
No assistance in arrivals to direct passengers to their correct gates.
My ticket showed 0705hrs as boarding time. I arrived at the gate E27 desk (after a long walk) at 0701 hrs.

Booked me onto a later flight (+ 3 hours). 
Obviously not impressed with this as they had a late flight and I actually arrived at the gate in time!
Had to spend more money while waiting for the next flight ¬£5 for a small coffee.

title: Never fly SWISS airlines again.
review_text: First my flight was cancelled they booked me and my wife in the Hilton Hotel with breakfast and only 20chf each for lunch. I xan only buy soup at the hotel for 14 chf. Simple burger is 34 chf. We were rebook to frankfurt the following afternoon @ 18h05. Now the flight is again delated to 19h00 and we are still at the airport waiting. My connecting flight is 22h05 which means we need to run to gate Z for my next flight and hope that we will make it. I do not have clean clothes or money as my bank cards do not work in Switserland. From what should be a connecting flight turns out to be a disaster!!! I will never fly SWISS airlines again. They also changed my Business class ticket to economy class due to no Business class seats avail. They do not offer me compensation at the airport or refund the differnece. They only say i need to email them and request compensation just to find out the email adress does not work. This is so bad!!
