title: it only got worse
review_text: the boarding gate had no organization - it was a mosh pit - no signs for boarding groups, no lines, everybody was trying to board at the same time - only to be turned away to wait for their boarding group.  The flight was delayed, the holding pit was very warm, crowded  and hundreds of travelers were struggling to hear the staff who spoke without microphones and heavy accents. The LAX airport police (aka the Lost and Found) told me to contact the airline directly.  Like being caught in an MC Escher drawing.  I used to hold Lufthansa and SwissAir in high regard.  Used to.

title: Worst experience ever
review_text:

title: Bad service
review_text: On the outbound flight, the airline was delayed for more than 1h30 and we arrived in Switzerland very late. title: Swiss charged me a penalty for a glitch in their app
review_text:
This is a complaint about Swiss charging me a penalty for a glitch in their own system. This is not a complaint about having to pay baggage fees, I understand that those are customary. But I find it pretty outrageous to be charged more, even though the Swiss agent agreed that the app was at fault. Please let me explain:

I checked in on the Swiss App the day prior to my Sept 28 flight from ZRH to ORD. 
During the process, I added one checked bag and printed the luggage tag at home.
At the airport, I dropped my bag with the assistance of a Swiss agent.
At no point was I asked to pay for the checked bag. This did not surprise me. I remembered having paid over $2,800 when I booked these flight back in June, but did not remember whether a checked bag was included or not.
When I noticed on the boarding passes in the Swiss app that our seat assignment had been changed and my wife and I were no longer seated together, I went to the Swiss agent at the gate. 
She advised me that the seat assignment on my Swiss app was incorrect, but still ok in the system. Then she proceeded to ask me to pay for my checked bag. This seemed weird to me since I had added the extra bag on the Swiss app and was not advised about a fee and was able to print the luggage tags without being asked to make a payment.
I thought this was strange, but agreed to pay for the checked bag after confirming that my fare did indeed not include a checked bag. The agent told me that the Swiss app should not have let me print luggage tags without asking for payment. Oh well, I understand that technology can be glitchy and I was willing to pay the fee that should have been charged when I added the bag. However, I was surprised to be charged the higher rate of CHF105 for paying at the airport instead of the CHF70 which it should have been according to the Swiss website when adding a checked bag online.

Really? Swiss is charging me a penalty for a glitch in their own system? The agent confirmed that I should have been prompted to pay before being able to print the luggage tags, but when I asked to be charged the online rate since I did add the checked bag online, she said she could not do this and I can complain about it if I wanted to. Not the service I had expected from Swiss. Very disappointing, less so because of the CHF35 difference, but because of the audacity to charge me for an acknowledged error in the Swiss app.

Bag Nr. 0724681669

title: Run, run, run from this airline.
review_text:
As others have noted, customer service is lacking in basic competence and ability to problem solve in an effective manner.  It will take multiple phone calls, multiple disconnections, and enduring a lot of Swiss arrogance to resolve your problem.  

Swiss cancelled my original flight and re-booked me on a BA flight leaving the next day.  Well, when I got to the airport BA had no seat for me on the flight, Swiss had never actually finalized the re-booking. 

When I went to the Swiss agent at ORD for their assistance, the first thing she told me was "you're a BA passenger now, I can't help you"

So here I am, now two days later, hoping to get on (yet another) re-booked flight for tomorrow.  I can only hope the third time will be the charm.  Folks love to knock US airlines, but I can't imagine enduring this level of incompetence from United, AA or Delta.

title: Try to avoid if you can
review_text:
Totally disappointed! Third-class airlines. Despite an international flight, outbound United did not charge for the suitcase, inbound, Swissair charged $75! When we paid by credit card the counter agent could not process the transaction and sent me to another counter, where it took 1/2 hour to process and print a receipt that I showed to the original agent! Nothing is free except water, not even a free soft drink! To read the airline magazine one has to download it! There was no video screen, entertainment, or earphone! At the Zurich airport, there was no one to direct me to the connecting gate, and the connecting flight was in one hour!

The flight from Zurich to Newark was late by one hour, due to "fixing the toilet issue". During the flight of 7+ hours, one toilet tap did not operate, and two other toilets were locked one hour before arrival that the attendant could not open! 

I would try my best to avoid this so-called world's best airline just a few years ago.

title: unfortunately not what it used to be...delays and paying extra for everything...
review_text:
several flights booked and done - ALL of them delayed! the service is not the same anymore either: swiss allocates you to a seat and if you want to change you pay 40 CHF! usually the seat is something like...38B....last row...
you can not board directly after business class as you would think it might be logical: last row first in so you do not have to wait for the ones in the middle rows to store their things...noooooo....last row last in, boarding group 5....honestly, flying with swiss used to be a pleasure, this is gone now...

title: VERY Disappointed!!!
review_text: I have selected our seats when I purchased our tickets, but due to changed of aircraft, our seat number changed too. Long story short, we were supposed to be seating before row 11 but moved us all the way at the back. I paid for our seats in the beginning so I could choose where to seat. review_text: Swiss air's baggage sizes are significantly less than most standard airlines. They made me pay 63 lb for a carry-on at the airport. This is a standard carry-on that I've used on Spirit, Delta, and Virgin. Rude gross pretentious people.  Switzerland is a beautiful country that is ruined by its people.

title: Horrible flight
review_text:

Therefore we made our check-in at the airport and all the good seats were taken.. we were assigned to the one at the back, no room for legs, barely impossibile to use the table for eating.

title: Cramped seats leaves one exhausted on arrival.
review_text: Seat 32F. Most cramped, uncomfortable seat ever experienced. Transatlantic flight, but have had more comfortable seats on short-haul regional flights.

title: Above average
review_text:
Good terminals at airports, punctual, and okay employee friendliness. 
The food during the flight was good, compared to other airlines.

title: Worst Experience EVER.
review_text: Absolutely the worst experience ever with an Airline. Due to a delay by Swiss Air, my bags were not transferred to my connecting flight. The app used to track the lost bags is useless and isn‚Äôt updated. Now I have no luggage, clothes and am a hundred miles from the airport. Travel plans ruined and no idea where my luggage is and when I will be getting it. No human phone number to call for help. Do NOT use this airline.

title: Great experience overall
review_text:
Pros: great layover in Zurich - you can easily get out of the airport, have a walk around, a coffee and get back again with plenty of time. There are secure lockers near the train station which are super handy for hand luggage and I even safely left my laptop there.  I felt the service from the flight attendants was good and if an emergency happened they would be prepared! My luggage came back on time - which I was a little worried about having read other reviews. The scenery is amazing. 

Cons: the first flight was delayed which wasn‚Äôt a massive problem for me but I can imagine if you had tight connection or needed to be on time for something it would be. The bigger plane for the longer flight did not have much room and wasn‚Äôt the comfiest.

title: Impoliteness, disrespect, unfair treatment
review_text:
My family (2A2C) and my friend family (2A3C). We traveled in same route, same time arrived Hong Kong. We also had baggage delayed. 
Excepted the numbers of family members, we happened all the same situation but the compensation was surprised me, the replied from swiss airline was EUR31 and my friend got over HKD 10,000.-

I did not ask same compensation and I only wanted to have a reason and told me how to count it.

I emailed Swiss airline several times between April 2023 to September 2023. After the email which about Swiss airline only willing to give my family EUR31, I did not receive any reply again. 

In my opinion, I don't think it's a respectful attitude.  I don‚Äôt think it‚Äôs possible for a family of 4 to buy 4 sets of underwear for only 31 euros! 

Can you imagine that when my family arrive at our destination airport almost 8pm, we only have our passport. We need to buy all necessary item in short time. We bought all thing were not we expected. It exceeded our budget but what dissatisfied me the most was the response from SWISS airline.

title: Luggage arrives 2days later
review_text:
We as a family of 3 did a transit flight to Mauritius. The flight left 1 hour late from Bhx.
So we had to absolutely run for our next flight and going through lots of controls and train is not easy. 
We eventually made it to the Mauritius flight.
We were called on landing and told that our luggages not arrived and will be there by this evening.
However 14 hours later no luggage. 24 hours later no luggage. Eventually at 1 am Monday morning we got our luggages.

Now on return to UK. I am trying to submit claim form for buying toiletries and clothes for 3 people.
The form is not accepting my Postcode.
I rang Swiss airlines yesterday and was told a technical glitch, Wil be resolved in 3 hours.
More than 24 hours later same.problem.
Swiss are telling me.to call USA to solve the submit problems.
What a load of rubbish.
So I will not have my extra 200¬£ I spent because of them.

title: Swiss Air leg room is the worst.
review_text: I paid extra for what I thought would be premium economy.  It does not exist on Swiss  Air.  All Economy Seats have minimal leg room - maybe 28" or 29" pitch.   I am 6'1" and could not put my knees in front of me, nor my feet under the seat due to an electrical box.   Do not fly this airline if you are over 5'10" tall.   Unless, you can afford Business or First Class.

title: Horrible customer service, never flying again
review_text: I had a business class flight from Miami to Milan stoping at Zurich with Swiss Air. One day before my flight Ive received an email that due to strike in Italy my connection was canceled but I would receive a voucher to go by train at Zurich airport. Arriving at Zurich airport I went to the Swiss air office as recommended in the email Ive received. Ive explained my situation at the counter to the Swiss air attendant that I was there to collect my voucher to Milan. She looked at me and was super rude saying that there was not voucher because the trains were already full. I've explained and showed the email that Ive received and she simply said there was nothing she could do and That I would have to find my own means to get to Milan. I was completely lost of words by the way she was treating me and also how can an airline promises you to get from A to B and not only they don't do that but treat you like garbage. Ive paid to get to Milan from Miami and Swiss air didn't even had that descence  to reimburse my flight. Never traveling Swiss air again

title: Customer support "stole" my compensation
review_text: I was recently denied boarding on a connecting flight. At the airport they offered me a prepaid cash card with 400 euros compensation, since the travel was over 1500 km and this is the standard amount. However the card malfunctioned and I couldn't take the money out. So I contact customer service. They had me send them the card numbers and CVV (which has to be at least shady, if not illegal, to ask for). Turns out they "analysed" my claim and the compensation was too much so they used the card details I gave them to withdraw some of the funds instead of offering an alternative form of payment. They didnt offer any alternative payment even after lowering my compensation. So now I am left without any compensation, and with a card that doesn't work. I had airlines refuse to pay their due compensations upon cancelling flights, but never had one lie about paying, and downright stealing money from their customer. What is wrong with these people? Why even bother to offer compensation at all?

title: They didn‚Äôt allow me to stop in Zurich unless I paid 5200‚Ç¨
review_text:
I had a flight from San Francisco to Milan with a layover in Zurich. Unfortunately, I encountered a last-minute work emergency that forced me to stop in Zurich, along with my luggage. To my dismay, I was informed that changing my ticket to accommodate this unexpected detour would cost a staggering 5200‚Ç¨ (five thousand two hundred euros). This pricing seemed exorbitant considering I had initially paid 850‚Ç¨ for my roundtrip ticket from Milan to San Francisco.

As a result, I had no choice but to continue my journey to Milan and, the following day, take a train back to Zurich. This situation left me feeling immensely frustrated, as I was stuck in Zurich without the option to leave the airport due to my luggage being redirected to Milan.

title: Don‚Äôt bother with Swiss
review_text: Not the first time I‚Äôm delayed on this airline. Today we had to wait for two pilots to arrive and because the airlines logistics are messed up, all the passengers were disenfranchised. Typical Swiss way is too shrug their shoulders and it‚Äôs just your problem now.

title: Incredibly, unbelievably, strikingly inhumane
review_text: So....me and my friends were travelling from Bucharest to Geneve. After boarding on our first flight (at 6:35am) we waited until after 8am to fly off :) According to the information our pilots gave us "the colleagues from the ground that were supposed to help us fly off...." were nowhere to be found :) Forgot to mention the best part of it all (dear parents, may I have your attention): we were waiting for the beloved ground crew in the exotic temperatures of 30¬∞C and all the children on board were crying because of these lovely conditions. Of course the staff gave us water but I think that is the absolute bare minimum in the given situation. Aaaaanyway, 8:30am we were already flying and the beloved plane crew politely asks us to go to the beloved ground colleagues if we had any questions for our connecting flights (which a lot of us had). I never saw them but since we missed our connecting flight because of the delay we decided that it is best to go to a transfer desk. We got transfered and waited 3 lovely hours at the Zurich airport for the next flight. And to our biggest most unimaginable surprise it was delayed üòÉ. Thank God (and not the Swiss company) this time the temperature in the plane was alright. And after all we arrived at Geneve 5hours later only to find out (yes, it doesn't end just with 2 delays) my friends didn't receive their luggage. So they turned to a special desk with their claim wich btw was handled with such disregard by the staff it was almost disgusting. On top of ALL of that we had prepayed train tickets to Lyon (France) for 11.30am - I guess you already know that we missed it üòÉ. To resume - 2 delayed flights, 2 delayed bags (that arrived 10 days later in plain daylight - 10:30pm) and 3 starved and underslept girls that arrived in Lyon 7hours later than planned. Would I recommend the company? You already know.

title: Shockingly, unbelievably bad.
review_text: Absolutely unbelievable service, and strikingly similar issues to some of thise offered below. A "transfer desk" that goes unstaffed fur large portions of fhe day, food vouchers that don't work  ;  zero interest or care shown for their own transfer passengers, and finally ending up it all, for the price of one of the most expensive tickets around, in losing my bags on fhe way to LHR ! What has happened to this airline? Avoid!

title: Comedic Customer Service
review_text:
Was flying from Miami to Zurich and then on to Milan, the day before my flight I get an SMS to say that there is going to be a strike in Milan airport but not to worry as they would put me on a train to Milan. 
When i arrive in Zurich the next day, Swiss air said "Sorry, there is a strike in Milan so there are no flights" I said: "I know, you told me about it yesterday and said i would be on a train?"  Swiss air said "Yeah, theres a strike so all the trains are full too. So, good luck getting to Milan. Next customer"
 
They then simply cancelled the Zurich to Miami flight from my reservation and act as if i never booked it. No refund. No apology. No compensation. And they just expected me to sort out how I would get to Milan, on my own.

NEVER AGAIN

title: Dirty Sock Smell
review_text:
Our flight from Newark to Zurich was canceled 5 hours before our flight. They wanted us to depart from JFK which was not possible for many reasons. I entered a claim and received the following response from them:

The aircraft scheduled to operate could not operate according to schedule as a result of dirty sock smell. Official instructions must be followed which cannot influenced them. Therefore, I must deny your claim for compensation.
Has anyone ever heard of this? We had to rebook with United at an extra cost. I will never attempt to fly with them again!

title: SWISS = Overpriced Ryanair
review_text:
SWISS = Overpriced Ryanair
Swiss has turned to rubbish. Honestly, it‚Äôs the worst air company these days. Not a single flight I‚Äòve taken recently was on time. Their ground staff are rude and unhelpful. One of them D.Mehrazi was particularly unfriendly. They enjoy a monopolistic hold on flights out of Switzerland. I wonder what Swiss antimonopoly authorities are doing. Asleep at the wheel?

title: Don't ever, repeat EVER (!!), fly Swiss Air connecting through Zurich.
review_text:
Original flight was delayed due to a discrepancy of 1 between the ground crew (LHR T2) and air crew (Swiss Air) passenger counts. An extremely protracted process accounting for the discrepancy could have been considerably shortened by an immediate match of boarded passengers to boarding cards and the seats we were all occupying. The departure delay of 2 hours (!!) on a flight which lasted considerably less caused many MANY passengers to miss their connecting flights from Zurich, including myself, missing my onward flight to Cairo. 

Ground crew, border control staff and security personnel  in Zurich were disinterested, in some cases unhelpful and in one case, extremely rude, all contributing to the profound stress experienced by every one of the many passengers who missed their connecting flights to many destinations

After locating 'Transfer Desk A' eventually, I stood for 90 minutes in line to be issued with a very small value food voucher, a Lufthansa flight ticket to Frankfurt and an onward connecting flight on Lufthansa to Cairo. Both of these flights were also delayed so I landed in Cairo some 22 hours after having checked in for the original flight from LHR Terminal 2. 

My suitcase which was checked in at LHR Terminal 2 has STILL not arrived, some 36 hours after having made my missing baggage claim shortly after arrival in Cairo. The local phone numbers (1 landline and 2 mobile numbers) to call with the claim reference I was given are not answered after repeated attempts.

Paying customers have every right to expect a considerably higher level of care, assistance and support from Swiss Air if and when their service is disrupted. How very disappointing to learn from this experience that they are simply not up to the job. I await with interest their response to the complaint I have formalised.

... stay tuned if interested.

title: Web and technology is useless with them
review_text: My review is regarding the systems and processes to check in for example. The website is very unclear, asking for API but when you click on the link it takes you to seat books etc. I have just tried to check in and it has asked for my visa number, but we don‚Äôt need a visa. Now after having to sit on the phone for an hour to find out that I have to check in at the airport. I hope the flights are better than their systems!

title: The Spirit of Europe
review_text: The humour of Germany, the cuisine of England, the organisation of Italy and the friendliness of a Parisian waiter

title: Horrible customer service and scam on refund
review_text: I had a flight to Portugal for a business trip. I flew Swiss into Portugal.  No luggage arrived.  I had business meetings the next morning,  I went and purchased as little as possible, around 47 euros of stuff.  I submitted all the receipts and did all the process.  Swiss sent me an email stating that they would reimburse me and asked me to fill out the information on the website for my bank info.  I did.  They wrote me like three days later to say that my bank info was wrong.  I sent a screenshot to show them the bank info, which was correct.  They NEVER responded again.  I have sent over 10 emails, I have called and there is NEVER anyone who can fix the problem by phone.  They just say they will escalate the case.  No money.  No refund.  No customer service.  A big scam.  Totally recommend you avoid this airlines.

title: The meanest people on Swiss
review_text:
My asthmatic daughter was flying alone with her service poodle.  Prior to the flight, we contacted SWISS fir all the requirement.  we fulfilled everything.  arrived at the airport.  were forced to pay a ticket for him despite their policy.   They inspected him and allowed her to proceed to the gate. 
She telephoned us from the gate, hysterically crying.  they would not all her to board due to ¬†¬ª the bag not being open on four sides¬†¬ª.  We were never told this was a requirement.  they showed no empathy, and told her she would have to leave. She said she did not know what to do alone i. Geneva with no money.  they did not care.  The agent threatened to call the police unless she left.  
Only after we threatened to sue them, and call the FAA for unreasonable denial of boarding did they allow her to board.  
A young girl should not have to endure such a harrowing experience with insensitive and mean people from SWISS. My heart was broken to hear her asthma attack due to the stress and threats they put her through.  
Never again with Swiss.  it is a terrible airline with cruel people.

title: Worse experience of my life
review_text: I went tu Zurich for 8 nights for a vacation and this lousy airline never sent my luggage to my hotel even though it was at the airport. For 5 days they kept my luggage. I had to look for it and pick it up myself. Every day they will tell me: we will send it as soon as possible. They shouldn't be allowed to do business in the USA.

title: Disappointing customer service and refund process
review_text:
I recently had a frustrating experience with Swiss Air's customer service that compelled me to write this review. I had to cancel a return flight, which I was well within my rights to do, and what followed was far from satisfactory.

Firstly, when I attempted to cancel the flight, instead of receiving the assistance I expected, I was directed to a chatbot on their website. This automated system left me with more questions than answers and failed to address my concerns adequately.

The most disappointing part was the refund they offered ‚Äì a mere 35 EUR for a flight that originally cost me over 500 EUR. This refund not only felt like a slap in the face but also seemed completely unjust considering the original ticket's cost.

I've always associated Swiss Air with quality and excellent customer service, but this experience has seriously tarnished that image. The lack of personalized assistance and the paltry refund offer left me extremely dissatisfied.

title: The most delayed company
review_text:
4 vols 4 retards - 4 flights 4 delays
Always late ! A shame ! Just unbelievable it‚Äôs the same situation every time. Don‚Äôt use this company

title: Avoid this airline
review_text: We arrived on time for our flight. There was a group of people in the waiting area so we joined them. They didn‚Äôt do or say anything to indicate that they were closing the gate. Apparently, all of the other passengers had boarded the plane but we didn‚Äôt know as there were people in the waiting area. They closed the gate without doing a final call or calling our names. They marked us as no shows even though we had gone through security and had checked in our luggage. They refused to refund us and made us pay significantly more than our the original cost of our tickets to rebook for later in the day.

title: Fly Swiss, just hope that all goes smoothly otherwise you are in the deep...
review_text:
Although the service itself was decent, this is the second time that I experience great inconvenience on a Swiss flight. The first one was years ago when the first leg of an Athens/Zurich/Singapore flight was cancelled and I was re-routed through Moscow airport with Aeroflot without being consulted. I ended up missing a day's meetings.

The most recent incident was last March when I arrived in Singapore and received a damaged suitcase. I filed a claim and was advised that the suitcase would be picked up from my hotel and repaired. I pointed out that Singapore was the first stop of a Far East trip with 6 stops, so my suitcase was badly needed in 4 days when I would take off again to continue.

The suitcase was picked up from the hotel 2 days later, only to be returned in 20 minutes advising that they did not have the neccessary parts to repair it. The local claims handling agency told me that they would not be further involved and I needed to sort this out with Swiss directly.

As I needed to continue my trip I was forced to buy a new suitcase and throw out the damaged one. I tried to find as close a match to my original suitace in size, make and quality. The replacement cost was SGD 329 or roughly 230 Euro. Having kept pictures I took the matter up upon my return with Swiss, filing a follow up claim. They re-directed me to another claims handling agency who, 2 months and numerous reminders later advised they would compensate me with 40 Euro! Alternatively they offered to pay for the repair cost but I advised them that the suitcase had been disposed as I could not carry it along on all my subsequent flighs. They then increased their offer to ‚Ç¨61.98.

Bottom line is that my bag arrived broken and Swiss was unable to either repair it or provide an alternative for me to continue my trip. I was forced to buy another suitcase and realise that a discount would be reasonable but 73% I believe is insulting. I was forced by Swiss' inability to provide alternatives to dispose of the broken bag and buy a new one so I find it unreasonable that I have to bear that cost.

title: Daft diversion
review_text: Absolute joke of an airline. I flew from Geneva to London City Airport and at the last minute they rerouted the flight to Birmingham because it was too cloudy at City Airport. It's always cloudy in the UK. There was no wind or rain. I live 10 miles away from city and spoke to friends and family and they all said it was just an average September day. in the end had to fight to get on a bus service back to City where planes were landing normally just a few hours later. If your pilots can't handle clouds please don't fly to the UK

title: Please dont fly Swiss
review_text: Terrible experience. Unprofessional crew and to top it of they lost all of our luggage. Not reimbursing any of the damage. No customer service possible.

title: Flight cancelled. Passengers abandoned by the airline
review_text:
The airline is run in a very disorganized manner. My flight was cancelled, after having onboarded every passenger on the plane and keeping us on the plane for over 1 hour!! 

When they did let us off the plane, there was no one at the airport to help the passengers as the Swiss Air staff decided to close their customer service counter and go home. Passengers were abandoned with no information. They also refused to fully compensate the costs incurred due to the flight cancellation, despite the customer service promising on the phone that they will be doing this.

Avoid this rubbish airline!

title: Stay away !
review_text: The myth os SWISS precision and professionalism is what IT is- a myth. Flight delays are common. Then you wait 40 minutes for your bags. They don't even give you a free sandwich, tea or coffee which LOT or LUFTHANSA gives you. Misers ! Charge you so much and give nothing in return. Avoid if you can. Use the others.

title: Worst Costumer Service ever experienced with Costumer Service Swiss Airlines, never again!!
review_text: This is a review not based on the airplane or the staff on the plane. These people are usually really great and I've been flying swiss due to family and friends who work for it my entire life with friends tickets. For the first time though I made a booking on my own on their website and experienced the most incredibly worst costumer service ever. My booking didn't go through correctly on the website and also not my payment. I contacted them by E-Mail/ phone many times. I even switched from German to english to see if I get a better costumer service but nothing helped. As in german someone even told me in the end, "ok he can't help me, I should ask the Chatbot on the website!" While some staff told me that there is nothing wrong with my booking and I just have to wait it's in process, but they don't know how long it will take. Others told me if it's not paid than there is no booking. Two of them offered me they can make a new booking but only for the current rate, which was more expensive by now. I obviously said no to that because 1. of all my other booking still existed and 2. they should for sure offer me the same price as it wasn't my issue to be solved and pay more. I tried and gave them my credit card information 2x but each time I received the wrong booking confirmation again and no payment taken off. I told them that not even a reservation appears on my credit card and thats not normal. My card wasn't the problem, I checked with the bank and everything and was always able to do bookings on other websites too. So it was clear, that the problem was their website or booking system. Yet no one was able to help. I gave them literally a month and each week I was trying to reach them for help. Therefore after an entire month, I had to make the decision to tell them to cancel all completely and I booked my flight with another company. Never again will I book with Swiss. Literally I had way better and faster costumer service on every single low-cost airlines I booked with. I never in my life experienced such a bad service. No one had a clue about their work apparently. I am very disappointed and just pity it because Swiss airlines used to provide good service but I guess those times are over.

title: Terrible lack of organization. Avoid!
review_text: The airlines lost the luggage of (I think) the whole plane. They haven't been found since Monday (and it's Thursday). Husband stayed in one T-shirt, one pants, panties and socks. It turns out that they refund 100% only for cosmetics, and 50% for clothes. We incurred a very high cost and it ruined the stay.

title: 2.5 hours delay and no compensation because is ‚Äònormal‚Äô
review_text: The worst company you can take. I fly a lot with them. Constant delays, bad customer services, rude and never think about the customer.

title: Uncomfortable even for Long Haul Economy
review_text:
I travel this route fairly regularly in economy class and tend to choose the best value option from one of the European carriers but I until now I‚Äôve never flown Swiss Long haul for some reason. I had heard positive things about Swiss long haul but that wasn‚Äôt my experience on this trip, mainly due to the seat on the long haul section (Boeing 777) which seemed very narrow, very hard with very narrow and hard arm rest. I was extremely uncomfortable after a very short time onboard due to how hard the seat was. The leg room was average and fine and was not a problem (I‚Äôm 6 foot). I had also read the food was good but again I found it below average in taste, quality and quantity. There was no offer of water from the crew during the flight other than meal times, in fact the crew just kept out of the way and spent most of the time chatting to each other at the back of the plane disinterested in the passengers. 

I was sold a very short connection in Zurich which turned out to be risky as the Manchester Zurich connecting flight is almost always late and in my case was over 1hr late with only a 50 min connection. The gate agent at Zurich was quite abrupt and rude which I couldn't understand as we literally ran to the plane it was the airlines fault we were late but he lectured me about being late and that if there hadn‚Äôt been so many of us on the late Manchester flight the Singapore flight would have gone without us (obviously happy in his work).

I would avoid Swiss long haul based on my experience, any of the other European Cartier options are better for comfort and in most cases service.

title: Horrible Airline
review_text:
Horrible airline. The cabin luggage size is up to the merci or the check-in/cabin crew personnel and has nothing to do with the size provided while purchasing the ticket. 
If you are on a business flight, make sure to leave some extra time as you may need to check in your luggage, just because.. 
Check-in and cabin crew stuff is ride. client service non existent.

title: IMPOSSIBLE TO CONTACT A CUSTOMER SERVICE, THEY SEND YOU TO THE SITE FOR A REFUND
review_text:
Good morning,
On August 5, 2023, my 5-year-old daughter and I were flying to Athene from Geneva by you SWISS Ariline.

During the flight, as we were flying over Rome, we are announced that the plane has engine problems.
As a result, it makes a turn in the middle of the sky to return to Geneva.
During the flight we find out that the flight could very well have made it to Athene, but it cost the airline too much money to make this choice. consequently they make us return to Geneva.

With 1h hour of terror knowing that we were flying on a broken plane.

Arriving in Geneva, half the passengers are grounded for 2 days. 
We are put on a flight to Vienna, 
that after what had just happened the idea of getting on a flight terrified us.

Delayed flight....
and as a result we arrive in Vienna at 23:00 instead of 21:40. At 10:20 p.m. there was another connecting flight to Athens, but which we missed.

At 11:00 p.m., we find my daughter and I now exhausted, and terrified in the Vienna airport not knowing where to go and what to do.

We are told that we have a hotel 1h from the airport with a bus that leaves every 20 minutes and that at 5 am we have to be back at the airport to board the 7 am flight
Arrival in Athens at 10:30 am on August 6....

completely overwhelmed destroyed plus I person my sailing vacation because my cruise had already left.

so I single mom had to re[agitate all the vacation for me and my daughter having lost 5,000 euros of Cruise.... plus all the things from the last-arranged vacation.

title: Terrible! Worst experience ever!
review_text: 6h delay, no excuses, no info, dirty plane,terrible sensation on my ears when landing (cabine pressure), canceled connection flight and the solution was a sleep in the floor of the airport of Zurich ou in dark rooms with several ‚Äúbeds‚Äù without any essential items.

title: Baggage is lost and nobody cares
review_text: My luggage was lost. I received the email that my luggage is located and they are waiting for my luggage at the airport but still no other news. I was calling and writing emails but nobody cares about it. They just replies that still don‚Äôt have any more information about my luggage. Thank you, Swiss airlines, for my damaged vacation.

title: Swiss Air = Spirit.   AWFUL!
review_text: Tried to reserve seats and online would not allow it.  Called service number to reserve.  First lady hung up on me.  Second said it was taken care of and I did not receive confirmation so I went to verify 2 weeks later and they were not reserved.  Wife had to sit in different row on one leg.  They are the worst airline.  Right up there with Spirit!!!  Congrats!

title: terrible unprofessional horrible  don't fly Swiss
review_text:
After booking a flight via the application from DXB to ZRH, I encountered several changes. I was required to modify my flight and despite my attempts to seek a refund, I was informed that I was marked as a 'no show' on the flight date. I had contacted their representative in Dubai, but unfortunately, the communication was hindered due to language barriers, as there was no proficient English, Arabic, or French speaker available.

Similar complications arose with Air France, but they were able to process a refund, even though the flight was initially non-refundable. I want to emphasize that I am determined to address this matter, and I am currently considering taking legal action. Please aim to enhance your service to match the standards set by Air France.

title: A total disgrace
review_text:
Do you have a confirmed, valid & paid for ticket purchased on Swiss.com? Well, sorry but that's not good enough to travel with Swiss (but of course they'll keep your money, anyway).

Then, when you challenge them, they will treat you as liar and refuse to accept any proof and evidence to the contrary. 

The blatant disregard and contempt of Swiss for its customers would be really hard to believe - until it happens to you. 

So just do yourself a favour, don't ever fly with them.

title: Bad experience
review_text: I have flown to Europe on Norwegian, Delta, KLM and Icelandic. This was my first time on Swiss Air and my experience was terrible. The pilot did a fine job but the plane was cramped and there were no air vents to adjust individually. The temperature was too warm and stuffy. I‚Äôm a short person but even for me I felt claustrophobic with little leg room. When the person in front of me reclined their seat, I was wedged in and could not focus on the screen in front of me. The flight attendants were unfriendly to say the lease. When I asked for wine, I was handed a bottle but no glass. Only one choice of dinner was offered and it was very sub par. At a time when airlines are trying to make passengers more comfortable, this airline doesn‚Äôt care!  Prior to our return flight, we checked in at the airport and presented our passports. Then again, at security we presented our passports. Then we showed them once again at passport control. I have never been asked to present it again at boarding but every single person had to present it one last time prior to boarding. This caused boarding to be very time consuming.

title: Now the perfect Swiss first flight
review_text:
Greetings ) This is my 6th flight in Swiss first this year 2023. And I wish to tell, that, when you get proper team without prejudice, you receive just amazing service and everything. 

First of all, I wish to tell, that Swiss lounge First near E gates is the really best 1st class lounge in the world. You can drink Macallan, that appeared in it once again after corona-crysis, eat michelin-star quality Swiss deashes, spent some time in private hotel-style room with shower, and finally taste a lot  of different whiskies in whiskey-bar for Senator lounge nearby. 

When I visited this lounge first time in 2019 actually I was so full of everything, that I just could not consume anything on plane, I just falled asleep and that's all :) 

I visited ANA first class lounge in Japan and many other lounges, and definitely Swiss is the best. 

Overall all Swiss 1st class experience - lounge + plane is unforgettable experience, which you could not meet in simple Switzerland. When you step out the airport - life is grey and quite depressive there. But in Swiss first you can feel sparkling luxury Swiss life, like no other. 

In a plane - Swiss finally renewed it's WIFI access conditions. Now First class passengers get unlimited good internet for whole flight. 

Cuisine is also awesome. The main and signature dish of Swiss first is Salmon Balik. I can promise you, that you never tasted such kind of Salmon, not in Norway, not in Ireland or somewhere else. It is really really good and wonderful taste Salmon. Of course there is no regular caviar unfortunately, but you can get in in a 1st quarter of the each year. And portions are quite amazing. 

Other food is also good and well decorated. 

Diamond of drinks in Swiss first is currently perfect Remy Martin XO. When I travel with my wife, we often consume right one bottle for 2 persons through the flight.. It is really good, you can drink it like water actually. Of course, there could be better options like Extra age cognacs, but regarding price/quality ratio it is amazing option for travelling in Swiss first and your condition after consumption. 

When you meet proper team on board that understand your needs, flight just becomes awesome and pure pleasure. 

We had such a flight just 2 days ago. 

Despite the maybe 2nd hardest turbulences in my life during flight, the flight team made the flight just amazing, comfortable and absolutely without any remarks. 

One more thing I wish to mention. Live in Switzerland is much more expensive than in OAE for example or even in Japan. But Swiss team managed to make such a great service that just as good or even better in some aspects (like lounge experience for sure) than first classes of the other developed countries for the same ammount of money or even lower.  Of course, sometimes I have some claims to Swiss First, like troubles in service or delayed luggage, but definitely not this time. Thank you once again for this amazing flight.

title: Terrible
review_text:
Terrible. Tray table broken and blocking my chair the whole flight.
Lights stayed on all thru the night 
Trays stayed for 30 minutes after food was done 
No offer for drink for an hour after boarding 
No hot nuts
No wash cloth
Amenity kit was terrible- socks and a pen
Chairs were cramped and hard as a rock with absolutely no privacy. 
Never again.

title: A Huge Disappointment
review_text: I have flown to Europe on several different airlines. I choose SwissAir this time due to a direct flight from Boston to Zurich. It was the worst flight ever.  I am a small person and the seats were incredibly cramped even for me, I can‚Äôt imagine how a taller person would even fit in the seat. The plane was uncomfortably hot and there were no passenger controls for the air vents. When I complained to the attendant about the heat the answer was ‚Äú there are a lot of people on board‚Äù.  Service was basic, and the food disappointing at best.  They didn‚Äôt come through to pick up trash, empty bottles etc. often enough. The passenger area was messy and smelly by the end of the flight. The plane for the return was marginally better, but the boarding process was a confused nightmare. Has SwissAir suddenly expanded with used planes and not enough staffing? I was expecting Swiss efficiency and comfort and my entire party of four travelers were very disappointed. Next time we will find another airline even if it means a connecting flight.

title: Lacking credibility
review_text: Swiss airline portal price extra check in baggage at $100. At airport they charged us $200 saying website was wrong. Do you believe that!

title: Very, very bad and not trustful Swiss Air
review_text:
We booked and payed extra for a window seat and the seat next to that in row 8, seat A and B (in the front part of the cabin) , on a flight of Swiss Air from Athens to Zurich on August 6, 2023. But when boarding we had to accept seats in row 24, seat E and F (no window seat and in the middle part of the cabin).
On our question to give back the extra money I payed for, Swiss Air refuse. This means that Swiss Air  is not trustful. It is a very, very bad company.
So, be warned everybody, for this very, very bad and not trustful Swiss Air company.

title: Poor customer service with lost luggage
review_text: Hello. My fianc√© and I flew at the end of May and our bags were lost for 12 days. We have tried every number and filled out every online document requested of us and still have not received a response to be compensated for our baggage issue. In all of this we found out that they have no number for lost luggae. They have poor customer service and at this point it appears obvious that we are just being ignored. I would not recommend this airline. Also, I have never written a review for anything, that should tell you how frustrating this situation really is.

title: Dishonest Airline That's Blatantly Violating EU Law
review_text:
Swiss International Air is a dishonest airline that's blatantly violating EU consumer protection laws. 

I booked a ticket and subsequently needed to change it in full compliance with the ticket rules. Those rules carry a reasonable 60 EUR change fee plus the difference in fare. However, the airline would not honor their own published price for the new ticket. 

There was no functionality to change my ticket on their website, so I had to contact the call-center. They tried to sell me the new ticket a price that was considerably higher than the price offered on their own website. When I complained and informed them that they were violating EU law, they told me there was nothing I could do about it and, ultimately, hung up on me without the matter being resolved. 

I'm filing a complain European Commission. If you have similar issues, I suggest you do the same. Or, better yet, just fly another airline instead of dealing with these crooks.

title: Can‚Äôt Rebook; Bad Website; Bad Service
review_text:
It‚Äôs been many months since I booked through Kayak to get on Swiss Air. What a terrible experience. I could not imagine worse.

I had to rebook the flight.  I had every right to do so based on my ticket.  I contacted Swiss Air with plenty of time to switch my trip.

The Swiss Air website seemed to be allowing the rebooking.  It was a long process.  When I got to the last window after having set everything up, I hit submit.  The website said it was having a technical problem and to try again.

I tried maybe three more times.  Went from start to finish of a long process. Each time, the website gave me an error message and told me to start over.

I got on the chat function sometime in the midst of it.  It was cumbersome too.   was continually cut off.  The chat function wasn‚Äôt working after restarting three times.  Each time I had to start from scratch and fill out the information before I could get a chat rep.

Sometime during all this, I took to the phone. I tried calling four times.  I was disconnected with no call back twice.  I realized that they were hanging up on me at one point.

I won‚Äôt go through every weird thing that happened, but the strangest was that when I did get a representative on the phone, I had to go to the website and explain from the list of alternate flights available for rebooking what I wanted.  I would identify the flight, and the rep would tell me one of two things‚Äîeither the flight I was made to lookup was indeed not available or that it was seven hundred or so dollars to do so though I had the right to rebook and it quoted online, where I was made to look by the rep, a rebooking price of little over $100.

This is nuts.  I never was able to rebook after trying for 3.5 hours.  I am not in any way exaggerating that time.

So I never was able to cancel or rebook.  It turns out the flight to Dubai was over a full day late in departing because I was still getting flight details and updates on my phone.  There were no odd weather events or worker strikes.  No reason was given for the multiple delays.

Had I taken the flight, I would have missed the meeting that was originally scheduled.  I would have been in the air and not on the ground.

I‚Äôm very surprised this airline has a 3.5 rating.  Maybe the flight itself, once in the air finally, was a pleasant experience.  Maybe they always are and so they‚Äôve earned a 3.5 rating.

I can say the website is useless for rebooking.  The chat function is likewise.  The representatives on the phone are no help and cut you off.  I am mystified why the rep can‚Äôt help me rebook and quote me times, dates and prices without me first telling him or her what flights I want to rebook to from the website‚Äôs own listings.  I do not know why the website information didn‚Äôt match the prices and times the rep quoted me after selecting a flight from the website.

Kayak is now in the middle of this.  They‚Äôre awful too.

title: Swiss puts passengers on standby to sell last minute business tickets! Not cool
review_text: Swiss puts economy passengers on standby in order to sell business tickets at the gate at lower prices (instead of automatically upgrading the  passengers). This is very frustrating as passengers on standby don‚Äôt know if they can fly or not until the last minute. The reason for creating this stress is for Swiss to sell business tickets at the gate . Those on standby are not even those ending up to be upgraded once the ticket sale is over, despite the emotional stress. Not the Swiss standard you would expect! Capitalism at its best.

title: No air vents. No power. No space. Terrible experience.
review_text: One of the most uncomfortable flights I've ever been on. We were coming back from Barcelona to SFO, and no direct flights were available. So, we had a brief stopover in Switzerland. The second flight was delayed 45 minutes after boarding because they said the "pilot was late arriving." The seats in economy were the least leg room I have ever had, the chair in front of me was literally touching my face when they leaned back. There were NO AIR VENTS for any seats, so I was cooking, literally feeling the body heat and smelling odors of the people crammed all around me and had to fan myself with the safety instructions card. There were NO CHARGERS, only a single USB port and mine and the seat next to me did not function. This was a ten hour flight!! DO NOT FLY ECONOMY. Terrible experience.

title: not worth anymore
review_text: Most of the times unpunctual. They lost my bag and never compensated, never even replied. Tickets are super expensive and no difference with Ryanair.

title: Decent transatlantic flight in economy
review_text:
Our flight was leaving from Terminal 1 at JFK. Flight number LX 17 with Swiss bound for Zurich. The plane was an A330-300 and my son & I were seated in economy, row 30 set up in a 2/4/2 configuration. There was just enough leg room for me. Check in was quick and easy once I had convinced the clerk that my bag needed a strap around it. She wanted to tell me that luggage with straps weren't permitted at JFK... Hello?

The flight was full. We took off on schedule and settled in for the long flight. Once we were well on our way up at the cruising altitude the crew served  snacks and drinks. I had a small bottle of red wine Pays d'Oc. Later they came around with the evening meal. I had beef and mushroom stew with mashed potatoes and mixed boiled vegetables, a salad with Italian dressing, a small brown roll with cheddar cheese and a small dessert cake. I washed this down with a 2nd glass wine followed by coffee. All good.

An hour or so before landing they came around with warm mini croissants and drinks. We arrived on schedule which was a relief as we had connecting flight over to Frankfurt which we just made. As to be expected, flying economy I couldn't lay the seat back so got no real sleep on this overnight service.  As this was a Miles & More Awards flight I thought that this was all OK.

title: Avoid Avoid Avoid
review_text:
Myself and my partner had flights booked for August. In an unfortunate turn of events my partner had a stroke and was unfit to travel. 
The Airline would only refund his ticket. There was nothing wrong with me apparently. If anyone is familiar with banking in Ireland. Ulster bank left the Irish Market. I booked my flights with a card from an account which is closed. Swiss Air refused to give me a refund to any other account. Their phone customer services rep said it wasn't there problem to get in touch with my bank. The bank which is no longer in the Irish market. I've now had to rebook the 2 flights because I can't get a refund. They charged me 35e to rebook flights I probably won't use. Customer services operators are rude. One hung up on me. They will not let you speak to a supervisor. I followed their complaints process and of course no one has replied to me. A stressful situation when I am trying to care for my partner who is unwell. THE WORST AIRLINE IVE EVER USED. AVOID.

title: Disgusting Airline
review_text: Absolutely awful Airline. Delayed flights, missed connection flights. Awful airport and staff. An absolute nightmare Airline.

title: Very good experience. I would definitely recommend Swiss
review_text: I travelled with Swiss in early February from athens to Zurich and it was very pleasant. First of all the check in experience was pretty good even though I had to wait for a long time because they didn't have enough workers. Secondly there was just a 5 minute delay. The cabin was very clean and the crew were very friendly and helpful. There was plenty of legroom and it had a small TV on the roof showing you where you are

title: Delay after delay
review_text: Delay after delay. First part of the trip 50min delay. Second part almost 2h of delay. Complete incompetence.

title: Holiday without Clothes
review_text:
Our arrival in D√ºsseldorf was Wednesday morning. Now it‚Äôs Sunday and we‚Äôre still waiting for our baggage. 
No communication, no compensation, nothing. 
Instead I‚Äôm the one trying to follow up, but the line given to me is I reachable even during work hours and the Swiss Hotline referred me to Lufthansa, who were equally not helpful.

title: Scammed out of 630 usd.
review_text: I booked a ticket. They charged my cc but I never received my ticket. No response from support. Scammy airline, avoid at all costs.

title: Too expensive for what you get.
review_text:
Very poor service for expensive price. They charged for tea and coffee, only bottle of water was for free. 

Planes are new but not any better than other airlines aircrafts.
FAs were speaking poor English. I'd honestly get a cheap airline instead of get British Airways / KLM next time where customer service is top.

title: Unusual event at the Boarding Gate on Swiss National Day
review_text:
Me and my daughter were seated in Zone 4 Seats 30 +. on 1st August -the national day of Switzerland
Within one hour of take off from Zurich both washroom sinks were clogged and had become unuseable. Not expected from Swiss Intl. Air lines.
At Zurich Airport while waiting for boarding at the Gate an announcement was made that passengers should get their passport and boading passes reexamined. Portable counters were brought near the Boarding Gate and a  huge Queue was formed-took almost one hour standing in the Queue. Unwanted harassment. No one explained the reason for double check after Immigration and customs contol was processed. Is it Swiss Airlines to be blamed or the Swiss Administration? In either case it was a rare happening. What a way to celebrate Swiss National Day

title: Luggage Lost
review_text: I am quite appalled by the service we encountered. The airline lost our luggage and it took us going on social media to get any sort of assistance. Their communication has been so bad that I will never use this airline again. We had a 5-day delay and that is just not acceptable. I am quite disappointed to say the least

title: Terrible company, be aware of the luggage limit they use to make people pay extra
review_text:
Terrible company, never again. 

First my flight was meant to be Swiss airlines with a stop in Zurich but half the flight was operated by their cheaper airline. Second, the staff in Switzerland was not very friendly and they made lots of people pay extra luggage on the second half of the flight. I had a small cabin suitcase and a hand bag (not even a backpack) and the lady told me that their limit for the bag is only 10 cm (not the usual 15cm as with other airlines) and for the cabin suitcase a maximum of 10 kg ( not the normal 23 kg other companies have).  I tried to explain that my bag was not even full and they made me re arrange everything at the gate (terrible experience). After showing them that I was not over that ridiculous limit they literally told me that is ok now because they made lots of other people pay so they have enough. I was shocked, it felt like they are incentivised for ripping people off. 

I would never fly with this company again.

title: Very poor customer service
review_text: Decent food and fair comfort for flight but that qualify their high ticket prices. Plus my luggage was lost and delayed and no one at Swiss Air was helping me, a handicap person with cerebral palsy.  I had to call every day for updates and received my luggage after 7 days. Attempting to get some type of reimbursement for the baggage irregularity per their Swiss Air website andinformation. Customer service in the mean time was nonexistent. The Swiss App and website are lousy and online forms are difficult to fillout and submit.

title: Inaccessible and discrimination for passangers with disabilities
review_text:
"I flew economy on Swiss airline in May from Johannesburg to Berlin with a layover in Zurich. It was my first time on Swiss airlines and I have to say it was my worst flight EVER.

When I arrived at the counter, I was told that they do not offer any assistance for visually impaired passengers. I told them that I had called and they said it was fine. The lady then proceeded to explain that they offer wheelchair assistance to "actual disabled and older passengers". I insisted that I called, no one told me and that I have a visual impairment, there's no way i can find my way. Rhe lady at the counter told me, "sorry you are going to have to go by yourself because we don't offer that service on swiss airlines. A lady who aparantly escorts first class passengers overheard and said she'd be willing to take. Problem solved? No. When we walked she was telling me that they help disabled passengers in wheelchairs and that if anyone asks I must just sit in the wheelchair to which I responded that it's discriminatory to assume that a disability only means being a wheelchair user and it excludes a lot of people who need help. She insisted that it's not discriminatory or exclusionary because I can just sit in the wheelchair. The worst part was not this, but that when we got to security and then passport control, I was told that she cannot go with me and I'll have to do those parts myself, I couldn't find the passport control counter of where the they were calling me and everyone laughed at me and rhe man checking the passports scolded me. I somehow managed to go through and the lady who helped me before was on the other side telling me that "I should just listen where to go next time" and again she told me to sit in a wheelchair when we get to the gate and when I get to my destination. So we get to the boarding gate and no one asks me to get into a wheelchair, they assist me to the plane everything's good and she tells the airhostess that I'm visually impaired and need assistance to my seat. The hostess then take me to my seat without saying a word and seemed very annoyed. The seat seemed pretty fair and I thought the worst was over. After a few minutes the hostess comes back and tells me that my seat has been changed. When I asked why she just told me to go and gave me the new boarding pass. I asked where to go to which she responded that I just get up. I get up,not having a clue where to go or where this new seat is. I stand in the aisle for a while until someone helps me to my seat. The new seat, at the back against a wall in what seemed like an area where everyone else had huge extra leg room, I do not know if this was a different class or what but I was in a row that is the smallest row and the smallest legroom trapped against a wall with the seat in front of me coming so far back that I can't see on my screen and the chair is pressing down on my knees (I'm 1.65cms). I felt so claustrophobic and pressed against a wall. After a while in this environment I started to feel sick. I vomited in the bathroom 3 times and a few times with a hostess walking by, I asked for water. The first person ignored me and the other times they told me they'll bring it but never came back with water. By the time I reached Berlin, I was feeling dizzy, dehydrated and as sick as can be. Upon arriving in Berlin, a man from the meet and assist team told me to wait as he needed to help passengers with disabilites. I told him yes that's me I'm visually impaired and need assistance to arrivals. He then responded yes but the older people and people with disabilities get priority. I did not know how to respond and just waited. After about 40 minutes he comes back and starts giving me advice on how to cope at airports. The wonderful advice is that I should listen where to go. Annoyed and sick I decided to tell him that I can't listen signs and written content, there's no sound to a boarding gate number or the aisle numbers or where literally anything is. Sound will only help me not to walk into a wall maybe. 
Finally I get to arrivals to my friend and nearly passed out. Never ever again will I fly Swiss."

title: Loved the whole experience
review_text:
From the moment we checked in at Miami airport until we got our bags in Venice, everything about Swiss Air was 5 star.

Jennifer escorted us from the MIA check-in desk to the Swiss lounge where she found us a place to sit before our boarding time.  Then another person came and got us and walked us to the gate to board.

On board, it was even better.  From Nadine the purser to Claudia Fuchs the FA to the captain coming by to say hello preflight, the Swiss team could not have been friendlier.

The food was delicious and they fed us so much we were stuffed before we went to sleep.  They made up our beds which were comfortable and soft.  The only complaint was it was a bit warm in the cabin.

On arrival into Zurich, someone collected the first class passengers on the jetway, escorted us to a waiting van and we were driven to private customs which took about 2 minutes to finish.  We were then escorted to the lounge to wait for our connecting flight to Venice.

Once in the lounge, we took a shower in the well appointed shower rooms.  It was lovely after a 9 hour flight.  We had a quick cocktail before heading to our gate for departure to Venice.

Swiss first class is on par with my all time favorite international airline, Emirates.  I will definitely fly Swiss again in the future.

title: Worst customer service !
review_text:
I recently had an incredibly frustrating and disappointing experience with Swiss Airline, and I feel compelled to share my distressing encounter with others. Despite being a loyal customer and having booked a business class ticket, the treatment I received was far from satisfactory, leaving me deeply disappointed and dissatisfied.

My journey began on 01 July 2023, with my flight scheduled to depart. To my dismay, the flight was delayed for a 1 hour and 30 minutes. Swiss Airline cited an alleged "unexpected flight safety shortcoming" as the reason for the delay (and so the reason why to not give a compensation), but this vague explanation left me bewildered and questioning their integrity as the pilot was mentioning the delay since the morning. I sought clarity and requested concrete evidence regarding the purported safety issue, but my efforts were met with repetitive responses that failed to provide any substantial proof.

As if the delayed departure was not enough, the subsequent series of events plunged me into an even more distressing situation. The delay resulted in an agonizing 24-hour wait at Zurich airport, and despite being a business class ticket holder, I was treated as an afterthought. To my disbelief, no hotel rooms were made available (if they knew we were missing the connecting flight and no hotels in Brussels, why not leaving us in Brussels?), and all I received was a measly 20 CHF compensation for a full day's worth of sustenance. This treatment was a far cry from the premium service I had expected, leaving me feeling undervalued and disregarded as a customer.

The ordeal did not end there. Due to the overbooking of the following flight from Zurich, I was subjected to further inconvenience and chaos. The airline rerouted me through Frankfurt, compounding the delays and causing me to arrive late for crucial meetings in Johannesburg. The additional transportation costs and the disruption to my carefully planned itinerary were both frustrating and costly.

Throughout this harrowing experience, I attempted to engage with Swiss Airline multiple times, seeking fair resolution and transparency. Yet, to my dismay, their responses only reiterated the same unconvincing explanation of "extraordinary circumstances," with no evidence to support their claims. Their lack of transparency and accountability in handling my concerns only added to my frustration.

I find it deeply disheartening and unacceptable that Swiss Airline seems to prioritize its interests over the well-being and satisfaction of its passengers. As a customer, I believe it is my right to receive adequate information regarding significant delays and the reasons behind them. The lack of communication and empathy demonstrated by Swiss Airline during this incident speaks volumes about their approach to customer service.

To those considering flying with Swiss Airline, I implore you to think twice before entrusting your travel needs to this airline. My experience has left me with little faith in their commitment to customer care and satisfaction. It is my hope that sharing this review will serve as a cautionary tale and prompt Swiss Airline to reflect on their practices and strive for genuine improvements in customer service.
Please keep in mind that this review reflects my personal experience, and your own encounters may vary. However, I firmly believe that open and honest feedback is essential for the growth and improvement of any industry, including aviation.
May your future journeys be more pleasant and stress-free than my regrettable experience with Swiss Airline.

title: Swiss air won't reimburse expenses
review_text:
Delays, delays, delays.... technical issues with the plane, unknown bag left near the boarding area, weather delays, then just a cancelled flight at midnight and no staff to provide hotel accommodation assistance, etc.  I asked the staff at the desk 5 times over 5 hours if our flight would be flying that night as I said I have to get home and would rather just rent a car and drive home.  Of course the rental companies were closed by midnight, so I took a cab back with a stranger to Ottawa for the last leg of my flight.  As I provided the stranger with 1/2 of the fare cash, and don't have a receipt Swiss air is unwilling to pay for my $180 share of the ride.  They say they would have paid for my hotel, expenses, beverages, etc., and had a plane for me 18 hours later, and would have paid for my expenses if I had receipts.  I said this would have far surpassed the $180 cab ride home, but of course they don't seem to care.

I guess people are just supposed to assume they can go to the Montreal Ritz Carleton, eat caviar all night, and get reimbursed?  Just don't expect to be compensated if you decide get a drive home at 12:30am, arrive at 3am and want to see your family in the morning that you haven't seen in 3 weeks.

Way to go Swiss

title: Worst flight of my life ü•≤
review_text:
Paid for a seat at the front of the plane and got randomly reassigned to the 25th row right before my flight. However, this was far from the worst part of the experience.

Myself and several dozen others were forced to check our hand luggage at the gate on extremely spurious reasoning‚Äîthey told me my personal item was too large, but when I requested they measure and weigh it, they refused, simply yelling ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs too large! It‚Äôs too large‚Äù at me over and over until I complied. Personally, I did not have a connecting flight but many others did, and were subject to similar treatment when they tried to explain why checking a bag would put them in an impossible situation. Maybe they had a good reason for needing to move bags from the cabin to the baggage hold (not enough space?) but why did they have to lie, berate and coerce us into compliance? In all my years of flying, I‚Äôve never encountered this level of unprofessionalism (not even on budget airlines like Ryanair and Easyjet!). I will never fly on this airline again, and recommend others stay away as well.

title: Not woth the price.
review_text: I had two very different experiences with Swiss this summer, one excellent the other horrendous. Like most comments here state, the flights can be delayed, the staff seems to be hit or miss, or too friendly or too rude. They overbook their flights, so you will see a lot of people being denied boarding. Most carry ons will not fit the bins and will be checked at the door delaying the flight even more. The A220 planes are brand new and well kept, the A320 are old. Only a free bottle of water and a chocolate at economy, for the price they ask, not worth flying Swiss in economy to be honest.

title: Worst airline in Europe
review_text: Another inadequate service by the most expensive airline in Europe. Our flight was cancelled because our flight was delayed and we lost the curfew in Zurich airport. They refuse to compensate even the drinks and food we had!!

title: Swiss Air We Dont Care
review_text:
Very happy with the flights.  No so happy when both my wife's and my bags did not arrive. We lodged the report as advised.  This is with a separate company as Swiss Air do not deal with customers for the first 5 days. We were told the bags likely missed the connecting flight from Zurich and would arrive the next flight.  That didn't happen. 24 hours after our arrival we found out, by me initiating contact, that my bag had been found but we would have to pick it up at the airport, at our cost, as it was too late to deliver. That was the first 2 examples of poor service.  We picked my bag up and saw the huge number of missing bags they had.  Some seemed to have contact details but we still in the lost area. How they managed to lose both our bags, to obviously different locations, is quite remarkable.
They provided a website to tell us the status of the lost bags.  Over the next few days we checked regularly but nothing changed.  It still showed my bag as awaiting pickup which was wrong.  Numbers that we were given to ring either didn't answer or were wrong. Customer support was useless, they only care about bookings. The best offer we had was to get a number in America to ring (we are Australians in Europe.) No use at all. Eventually we left it with our cruise director on the Viking ship we were on. They were chasing other bags as well. After a week we were told the bag was being flown to Frankfurt and would be sent to the ship from there. That never happened. I suspect it was sent, sat there and then returned. The next update was it was going to Munich. We had no further advice about it. After Viking eventually confirmed it was there they dispatched a driver to pick it up and bring it back to the closest port.  They then put it on a ship that would meet us in Vienna. After 14 days my wife got her bag, no thanks to Swiss air.
I lost track of the number of calls and emails we and Viking made trying to get the bag.  At on stage Viking spent over 4 hours on the phone trying to get answer. They we just totally unresponsive to nearly all calls and emails and the website updates were appalling and mostly non-existent. If not for Viking sending a car to Munich we would not have received the bag at all. We had our emails on our bag tags but that was no help.  How hard would it have been for someone, once the knew it was unclaimed, to open the tag flap, see the email and let us know where the bag was and find out where we needed it sent.
If you have got this far here are our tips
Photograph your suitcase because you will have to describe it if lost
Photograph the contents because you will have to describe that too
Get an electronic tracking tag
If they give you a number to call check it will be answered before you leave.  
Don't take anything they say on face value.
Get it in writing that once located they will have the bag delivered to you, wherever you are.
They did pay compensation for items purchased but there is a limit on that of $100.  Not a lot for a 14 day delay.

title: Terrible customer service

title: Budget airline priced as a full service airline.

We did receive a free chocolate, but would have preferred a more comfortable seat.

title: Great experience,

title: Higher prices, higher delays, extrely poor customer experience
review_text:
Plane delayed again! I do not remember the last time I flied with this company that the flight was not delayed. And they dont even inform the customers. Sent us to the gate but noone at the gate.

Yesterday flew into Zurich from Palma de Mallorca. Again delayed, already departed with a delay from Palma.
