title: A waste of money
review_text: Do not waste your time flying with these people. It was a terrible experience from the start. Long layovers in between connecting flights when other companies have shorter layovers. The tickets are so expensive and they even have the audacity to charge you to SELECT your seat. You can‚Äôt even select your own seat? Crazy

title: Symply wonderful flights
review_text:
We were happy to enjoy Business Class on the Boeing 777 for this flight to Chicago. Very comfortable and with enough space and a large screen. We had already checked in online at home, including baggage tag, so we only have to drop off our suitcase. As Zurich airport is always busy in summer, we were at the airport in time. The security check is separate for business passengers and so we were through surprisingly quickly. We also used the automatic passport control at customs without having to queue, and we were immediately in Dock E. We had plenty of time to go to the observation deck, which is very nice. If everyone was properly prepared, packed their hand luggage correctly and also went forward at the security check, there would be no long queues. 
We departed a little later, but still landed on time. The flight was very relaxed with nice weather. The crew had a lot to do with because a full flight and special requests from some passengers. Nevertheless, they always remained very friendly. The fact that you can choose your main meal from 9 menus days before the flight is a real bonus. Unfortunately, this only applies to departures from Zurich, as well as for the regional specialties from Switzerland. Meals from Zurich departures flights are always much better then meals on return flights. 
We enjoyed this flight and also the return flight very much from beginning to end. There was absolutely no complaint. 
We have never been disappointed by Swiss.

title: A very good airline
review_text:
The flight is very smooth and comfortable. The staff is extremely courteous.
The seats are quite comfortable and the leg space is decent too. Would love to fly again. Thank you.

title: think twice if you re choosing Swiss!
review_text:
I have chosen economy premium flight from Warsaw vias Zurich to Hong-Kong. At the start, here was a flight delay in Warsaw, and i have noticed, that Swiss almost every day offer flight Waw-Zurich with huge delay, so this is nothing extraordinary. 
We missed out connection in Zurich. We had to walk very far to the Transfer desk and wait ca 1 hour on line to get a new flight for next day. it resulted in 24 hours delay, and completely ruined my plans  in HK. We were offered a voucher and transfer by shuttle to hotel but without our suitcases, just with hand luggage, where i had just one tshirt and my pills, no toiletries etc. 
next day we were provided with breakfast in the hotel, then had a day to kill. Zurich is not most interesting place in the worls, this day was additionally extremely hot, so we decided to spend some time on boat trip around the lake, then had some beer in the city and back to hotel for kind of lunch.
on evening again we have been in airport. 
plane to HK started with more than hour delay.
Althought chair in premium economy was ok, food and service was below expectations and service provided by competitors like Cathay Pacific or LOT Polish Airlines. Both of them are offering better food in premium economy (LOT especially is offering Asia inspired menu and better selection of wines). Food is Swiss was just average, breakfast was exactly the same as in economy. service was totally uneficient, it looked that crew is working for punishment or so ;-) 
Really, not so often you so so uninterested in providing good sewrvice staf like in Swiss.
When in HK, i have put a claim for compensation for delayed flight and a lost  one day accomodation in hotel Royal Garden in HK.  They promptly responded declining my request, and argument was, that delay of flight from Warsaw to Zurich was extraordinary, what was not true, because at least since 10.07.2023 to  26.07.2023, flights nr LX  1353 from Warsaw to Zurich NEVER left Warsaw on time, and always there have been delays. So, delays of this flight are permanent!
If Swiss is aware, that plane  from Warsaw to Zurich is always in delay, as a reliable airline, they should reschedule my flight before it started in Warsaw. There were erarlier flights from Warsaw to Zurich that day.
Finally because they have refused my claim at all, i turned case to Swiis Aviation Authority and to my colleague Swiss lawyer to start procedures.
Hope this airline will bancrupt again and never be re-launched.
I would NOT recommend Swiss air to anyone in the future.
They lost me as customer.

title: Lost luggage!!!
review_text: Never use Swiss Airlines! My luggage was lost in transit from Dublin to Geneva originally coming from Newark.This caused me to have to wait at the airport and miss the last train to my hotel in Geneva. All my clothes were in there, and I have all the receipts of the clothing and necessity items I needed to get while on my trip. This is unacceptable and it left with no clothes in a foreign city. It was an extreme inconvenience, and I was stuck missing things I had planned in my itinerary because I was going around Switzerland trying to find things for both the summer and the winter activities. I lugged a trashbag around Switzerland for days until I found a reasonably priced bag that I could use to travel home. My husbands clothes were also packed in my bag. His luggage had the sneakers and winter coats. So it not only affected me, but my husband as well. This ruined our one year wedding anniversary trip and caused unnecessary troubles. We had to do laundry on our vacation, which we never have to! Not only did I not have my luggage for the trip, it still hasn‚Äôt even shipped and it‚Äôs been over a week. Flight was on 7/14 and the luggage still has yet to come to me and it‚Äôs 7/25.  I needed those clothes for work this week, and now I am again inconvenienced. I want more then just the reimbursement for the items I needed to buy while on the trip. I want compensation for the trouble it caused me and my husband. It turned into a 1 year wedding anniversary disaster. Their response to twitter is also unacceptable. They told me they can‚Äôt help me and that I can only file for toiletries! I‚Äôve tried calling, emailing, filing a claim that took hours and no answers and no money back! My luggage is still no where to be found!!!

review_text: I am so disgusted and appalled by the customer service associated wih swiss airlines. My luggages were lost, i was told to come in the next day to retrieve them, then proceeded to wait 5 hours for them to be ran through customs. Police apparently did nothing but watch them. The office just waited around. I then decided to get them shipped. 3 days later still no luggage, and fedex hasnt even received it yet. I tried calling swiss airlines, only to be hung up on 7x. title: Don't fly Swiss - they don't take responsibility
review_text: There was a flight delay in Venice. We missed out connection in Zurich. We had to walk very far to the Transfer desk and wait 4 hours on line to get a new flight. We were put up in a hotel but since we didn't have our suitcases, and we needed fresh underwear, toiletries for hygiene and some snacks to hold us over, we were advised to send our receipts for reimbursement. They promptly responded declining my request. I asked if they could extend some good customer service and give my travel partner and I SOME percentage of compensation. They flat out refused. Maybe it was a safety issue the flight was delayed. But After they rerouted us the next day back to Rome, that flight was delayed, and our connection to Newark was delayed 6 hours. Maybe all safety issues, but what about taking responsibility for it? Not one penny of compensation. I would NOT recommend Swiss air to anyone in the future.

title: Recommended
review_text:
Over the past year, we have travelled through Zurich airport multiple times. This was our most recent flight with Swiss. Overall, we find Zurich airport to be a very convenient stopover airport, although the prices are noticeably high. The airport's size is just right, not overwhelmingly big. We had a smooth experience with the airline without any issues.

On the other hand, Ljubljana airport needs to work on its services. Despite being a small airport, the waiting time for baggage retrieval is comparable to that of larger airports. Additionally, the practice of playing public announcements about departing flights in the baggage reclaim hall seems unnecessary.

title: Unnecessary Stress
review_text:
I seldomly write negative reviews when it comes to any establishment. However, with Swiss Air, I am quite frustrated with their discrepancy and inconsistency when it comes to carry on baggage.  While my suitcase, I can understand a little bit more but my husband‚Äôs, his was easily within the requirement.

Once on board the aircraft we became extremely annoyed to find many of the overhead bins had plenty of space and contained bags similar in size and I imagine weight to ours. Interestingly enough,  some of business select class were allowed to carry on bags that were larger in size and were able to fit in the overhead bins with no issue. 

With being forced to check our bags, our tight connecting flight became even tighter with a delayed landing and waiting for our check bags to go back through customs and security.  We truly almost missed our flight because we were forced to check our carry on bags. Surprisingly, we had no problem carrying on to any of our other 3 flights.

Aside from the carry on issue, the plane was extremely tight for leg room. I will say the one positive was the friendly flight attendants. I had very high hopes of flying an international airline because many friends and family members have spoke highly, I am not impressed with them.  In my opinion they caused quite a bit of unnecessary stress.

title: Swiss Oversmart Ground staff at Delhi
review_text: We had booked our flight LX147 from Delhi to zurich in june‚Äô23 through Air India since it‚Äôs a code sharing flight. Our Experience with swiss airlines airport staff was worst. He is a young sikh guy namely A singh. He has tried to HARASS us in maximum possible way. He was attendant at check in counter of the Airline. He forgot his duty at check in counter & acted like Visa officer,appointed by Swiss government. He even demanded proofs of our stay in switzerland( which is in no way his duty). He even checked our visas & enlightened us about his shallow knowledge about Visas. He has acted as OVERSMART to impress us,which he grossly failed. If swiss airlines is appointing such idiots at such an important place we shall avoid this airlines.

title: Dishonest, refuses to compensate for losses
review_text: Very frustrating experience. Our flight was canceled after hours of delay due to the weather, which on its own was perfectly understandable and not in their control. Everyone's flights were canceled that night and there were hundreds of people with nowhere to go. We were told repeatedly that we were not allowed to stay at the airport for the next flight. We were told to book our own hotel for the night and save our taxi/hotel/food receipts and that we would be reimbursed. My partner and I didn't have any internet and the airport staff were unwilling to let us use the wifi as we had used up our 4 hours of wifi (comes with the boarding pass). Thankfully a stranger let us Hotspot his phones internet and we were able to book a room for the night. We got to our destination a day late and laughed it off. Now Swiss is refusing to compensate our bills because they apparently don't have to when the cancelation is due to weather. So the airport staff outright lied to hundreds of people to get us out of their hair and all of us are stuck with the bill. Absolute scum.

title: Unsatisfactory customer service
review_text: Terrible customer service - no option to call anyone live. All you get is a ‚Äúchat bot‚Äù that is pretty much useless. Flight rebooking is near impossible . Would not recommend.

title: Avoid at any cost
review_text:
The once reputable airline has been experiencing a steady decline over the past few years. In the last two years, I cannot recall a single flight that was on time; there has always been a delay of at least 1-2 hours. Moreover, the staff's attitude has become increasingly arrogant.

During a recent Swiss flight, we were unexpectedly diverted to Dusseldorf instead of Zurich. Unfortunately, Swiss Airlines provided no assistance or support, leaving us to arrange accommodations on our own. They promised to provide a new flight number within 30 minutes but took an astonishing 6 hours to deliver it. To make matters worse, I am still waiting for a refund for the hotel expenses.

I sincerely wish I could avoid flying with this airline in the future. The level of service and reliability has deteriorated to a point where it is no longer a pleasant experience.

title: Horrible company, avoid if possible
review_text: Over 4 hour delay on an international flight and they refuse to pay any compensation stating that Switzerland is not part of the EU. When explained and linked eu air passenger law EC261 contradicting their refusal they stopped replying. The flight had a connection in Europe to which it was 20 mins late. The connecting flight (also Swiss) did not wait 20 minutes and we were rebooked to fly around Europe to finally reach our initial destination over4 hours later. Horrible company, avoid if possible.

title: Fly with SWISS !!
review_text:
We had great experience flying with SWISS. The check-in was very quick. Boarding was very smooth. We were welcomed with NAMASTE when we entered the aircrft by Swiss air hostess. It was a nice gesture. Since it was a midnight flight, we had finished our dinner in business lounge. The omelette breakfast was very good. The overall service was top notch. The flight landed on time. What else you need ?
Worth flying...

title: Swiss International Airlines Luggage Theft
review_text: During my flight from Tampa to Budapest with stops in Chicago and Zurich, my luggage was opened and items stolen from my bag. Because I didn‚Äôt know where exactly this happened I had no way to notify the police. Swiss Air refused to help me. Very poor customer care! Will not be flying them or their parent company Lufthansa ever again.

title: Great transfer airport, until you try the lounge
review_text: Accessing Europe via Z√ºrich is almost entirely a pleasure. Friendly security, charming passport control, efficient service. And then you hit the Swiss lounge and Merrill the self important gatekeeper. $40k on tickets, FF membership and she still delighted in denying an extra guest a seat and a glass of water. The guest was our six year old son. Get a grip Merrill and Swiss. Use some modicum of discretion to serve your customers well, otherwise you sour the whole experience when everyone else puts on such a good show. Is a seat, soggy sandwich and a glass of water really so special (or expensive to Swiss) that it‚Äôs worth leaving such a bad taste?

title: Most uncomfortable sests ever!
review_text: When I booked the flight, I chose two seats in a two seat row (one window sear). It looks like the aircraft was changed and we ended up in three seat row instwad of the original two seat row. There was SIGNIFICANTLY less space in those sests. I've been flying for decades and never travelled in a more narrow seat with bareky any leg room. I weigh 110 lbs (so, below the average) and can only imagine how an average weight or taller passengers must have felt. This was the most uncomfortable 10 hour flight in my life!

title: Not trustworthy company
review_text: We buy a ticket for Christmas and after a while they change the dates of the flights. This is very inconvenient for us as we have already organized activities and booked hotels for those dates. This has happened to us three times so we will not be booking with them any more in the future.

title: GOOD FROM LOUNGE TO LANDING
review_text: Into the Aspire Lounge for several hours beforehand. The toilet was unisex with a nice copper sink and facecloths. Able to get one of my two prong plugs to work. The fare, while nothing special, was good. There is a range of seating. Wifi was easy to connect to and strong. Lots of friendly staff around. Meals aboard the flight were good. Did not get much sleep but not the fault of the flat bed seat. The flight arrived on time. The vanity kit was largely typical items, the pen a nice addition. A Swiss chocolate to end things is a good marketing move. I would later find out my checked luggage did not make the flight but that was likely a ground crew issue.

title: Heisted by Swiss Air
review_text:
I have had just an unbelievably terrible experience with this airline and I have not even boarded the flight yet.  I am confident this airline is not the only one that has these absurd policies but here we go.  Family Vacation was booked in November to fly to Greece in July.  As the dates for our flight came closer I needed to change my departure date due to work.  I noticed that the name on my ticket is my common Alex and not the proper Alexander as on my passport.  I honestly did not feel this would/should be an issue.  Since I had time I called the Swiss Air customer care line to adjust. The agent said she was only authorized to add or remove 2 letters from my name, this would still leave me 3 letter short. I said ok what are my options to resolve this MINOR issue. Answer, cancel your ticket and rebook (in my case that meant receiving only the taxes back). Clearly not a good option. I said there must be something else.The agent said no that is it, I asked is this a law or something from the Air Authority.  Her response, no it is just company policy. 
 Wow, something that can be controlled by Swiss Air.  I asked for a supervisor or at least someone with more authority to help. I was put on hold for 45 mins to only have the line cut out. I called back a few times and oddly each time I had someone that seemed as thought they were in fact trying to help the line cut out. I was 1.5hrs into this. Finally I was given an email address to reach out to. I did this as well but no one came back to me without being prompted. I reached out again and then received help from a live agent that said Swiss Air document dpt approved the name correction. Success yes, hurray. No it was not, I was charged a name correction fee of $30, then some other fee of $150 and then the real kick in the teeth, I was forced to pay a fare difference. My total cost to change 5 letters of my first name was a whopping $1100 dollars. I find it beyond comprehension that this was the only solution.  It took over a week for me to get to this place and when the agent said is there anything else I can do for you. I said well can you offer something more for me such as a credit or upgrade just something. Her response was we can only book you the same ticket that you had before. In the end something really needs to change as it is ridiculous that an airline agent cannot help correct your name. Yes, it was an error in my part when booking sure, charge me for that part. However does one need to be taken advantage of by an Airline in this manner? I know 1st world problems but please.

title: Absolutely Atrocious
review_text: We were scheduled to fly out of Geneva on June 30, the day of the strike at the Geneva airport. The airline reissued our tickets for two days later and since we needed to get to Sweden that day, they had to be persuaded to instead give us a same day ticket from Zurich (this took over an hour). Then they refused to compensate us for the costs of a train to Zurich, or additional costs to get new tickets for ground transportation on the other end which were necessitated by our late arrival.

title: Do not fly premium economy on Swiss - not worth it
review_text:
The premium economy is absolutely not worth it..in the same cabine as the economy, the same food (we were told our choice is no longer available, but not to be worried they will bring us the economy one, its the same anyways). The toilet is small and was rather dirty. The premium economy seats looked very nice on paper, inclining forward with a fix back so your space is not disturbed by people in front (this was our main reason for choosing premium economy) and nice automatic legrest, but turned out to be extremely uncomfotable. Hard seats, very difficult to incline, and worst of all the legrest only came up halfway. There was no traditional legrest as in other airline's premium economy, so my legs started hurting 3h into the flight. Havent slept a bit. Worst premium economy experience ever. The stewardesses seemed to be learning on the job. Very disappointing.
Only plus was the punctuality and the tomato juice with salt&pepper, however you get that also in economy:)

title: Swiss air, give them a miss, poor punctuality!
review_text: Probably the worst air line I have ever come across for punctuality.  I travel every 3 weeks with Swiss air on business and have done so since Jan 2023.  Every flight has been delayed.  How can an air line charge premium rates and give such poor service.  It's hard to avoid them but I would recommend using another airline if can.

title: THE WORST AIRLINE , TOTAL DISASTER
review_text:
"My recent experience with SWISS airlines was nothing short of disappointing. From start to finish, the entire journey was plagued with issues and setbacks. First and foremost, the customer service was abysmal. The staff seemed disinterested and unhelpful, displaying a lack of professionalism that I found extremely frustrating.

Furthermore, the flight itself was far from satisfactory. The seats were cramped and uncomfortable, leaving me feeling cramped and restless throughout the entire duration of the flight. The lack of legroom was particularly unbearable, making it nearly impossible to find a comfortable position to sit in. Additionally, the in-flight entertainment was severely lacking, with a limited selection of outdated movies and TV shows. It felt like a step back in time rather than a modern travel experience.

To make matters worse, the food served on board was tasteless and unappetizing. The meals lacked variety and were of subpar quality. I was left feeling unsatisfied and hungry, which only added to my overall dissatisfaction with the airline.

Lastly, the airline's punctuality was highly questionable. My flight experienced a significant delay, causing me to miss an important connection. This lack of punctuality and disregard for passengers' time is simply unacceptable.

All in all, my experience with SWISS airlines was marred by poor customer service, uncomfortable seating, lackluster entertainment options, unappetizing food, and significant delays. I would strongly advise against choosing this airline if you value a pleasant and hassle-free travel experience. There are much better options available that provide superior service and comfort."

title: SWISS needs to upgrade
review_text:

Overall, their food was awesome and had metal cutlery, and were apologetic about the flight delays. They also gave swiss chocolates at the end of the flight!

Overall, the p

title: Another aborted landing
review_text:
This the airline that I have experienced the most aborted landings with. I have been a passenger for over 40

title: Horrible... AVOID!
review_text:
After flying with over 15 different airlines and traveling to numerous countries around the world, I can confidently say that Swiss International Air Lines is the absolute worst airline I have ever flown with. They have deleted my return ticket because I asked for a date change without my permission and didn't even inform me. 
I called them a few days before my original return date to see if I could change my return flight to 2 days earlier than planned. they said yes and went ahead and changed my ticket as well as sent me a confirmation email with the new dates. a few hours later I received an email saying that my credit card used for rebooking charge didn't process. I gave them another call and this time the customer service rep said that I actually can't change my ticket and I would need to fly back during the original return date. 
a day before the original return flight I couldn't login to see my booking using the reference number so I called them again to learn that my return ticket was 'deleted'. They said because I asked for a change and it was not possible there were two booking under my name and they cancelled both. They robbed me off the return flight that I payed months in advanced. 
I was told by the customer service rep this time that I could rebook my deleted return flight with a penalty and the fare difference if I preferred... it is unbelievable but this is what they told me. When I got frustrated I was told by the customer service rep that maybe I should 'go away and think a little bit'... 
I ended but buying an entirely different one way ticket home that costed me over $1,000 in addition to the $1,900 roundtrip ticket that I already paid for with Swiss. 
They are rude and they literally steal your money in broad daylight and don't even try to fix their mistake... Worst airline, worst customer service.. AVOID AT ALL COSTS!

title: Flight From HELL
review_text:
My AUTISTIC TATTOOED DAUGHTER had the WORST TIME EVER.

THE FLIGHT WAS DELAYED and SHE WAS SCAMMED BY LUFTHANSA!!!

SHE WAS FORCED TO SIT BETWEEN A BILLION PEOPLE LIKE CATTLE BEING HAULED TO THE SLAUGHTER HOUSE.

title: Swissport service for the delayed luggage was terrible.
review_text:
I flew from LX to Zurich on UA622 and UA9807, operated by Swiss Airlines, on May 31, 2023. After waiting for a considerable amount of time at the carousel, my luggage failed to appear, leading me to suspect that it may have been lost or delayed. Consequently, I approached the Swissport service staff for assistance. Despite my initial wait, the staff advised me to continue waiting. However, when I approached them for a second time, the same staff member informed me that they were unable to locate my luggage. They instructed me to fill out an e-form and assured me that they would contact me once they had additional information.

However, a day passed without any phone calls from Swissport. Growing concerned, I took the initiative to call them myself on the second day. The staff member I spoke to once again confirmed that they were still unable to locate my luggage and asked me to remain patient. Regrettably, the third day arrived, and I still hadn't received any calls from Swissport. During this time, while waiting for their call, I took it upon myself to search online for more information. Fortunately, I managed to find the necessary details and locate my luggage independently.
It is disheartening to think that I had to personally find my own luggage instead of the Swissport staff fulfilling their promise to contact me. Despite being repeatedly assured that they would reach out, I never received any calls from them.
While traveling from town to town, I wanted to ensure that Swissport knew my intended destinations. Therefore, I contacted them once again to confirm if they had received my luggage in Switzerland and to update them with my new address. Fortunately, they confirmed that my luggage was indeed in their possession. However, I was informed that I needed to contact the carrier directly to update my address. Following their instructions, I promptly called the carrier but was directed to email them my new address. I complied and sent the email, but my concern grew when I repeatedly called the carrier numerous times to confirm if they had received my new address, only to have nobody answer the phone.

Feeling frustrated, I reached out to Swissport once more for assistance. To my surprise, they informed me that it was necessary to provide them with the updated address, not the carrier. This contradicted the initial information given by Swissport staff, causing further confusion and inconvenience. Despite the fact that I was relieved to have located my luggage with my own efforts, the overall experience was marred by the lack of coordination and inconsistent instructions provided by Swissport.
Later in the day, the driver called me, the only call I get from whole dam process, telling me that the luggage was delivered, but to the old address where I had already left. I had to wait an extra day without my luggage on the fourth day. 

On the fifth day, I made another early morning call to the carrier to ensure they had received my new address and to coordinate with the landlord for access to my apartment. I was informed that my luggage was en route to Zermatt, and I stayed in regular contact with the landlord for any updates. However, despite the expected delivery time provided by the landlord, I received no calls from the driver, and the promised time came and went without my luggage being delivered. Frustrated and running out of patience, I decided to check downstairs myself. To my surprise, I found my luggage left unattended in a public area. It was only then, on the fifth day, that I finally retrieved my belongings. The entire experience was a nightmare.

The level of service provided by Swissport and their carrier was abysmal. They showed no regard for the inconvenience they caused their customers. There were no updates provided, no notification when the luggage was delivered, and a lack of communication throughout the entire ordeal. I intend to share this terrible experience with my friends and family, cautioning them to think twice before choosing Swiss as their travel option.

title: Incredibly bad service by Swiss air agents!!
review_text:
Incredibly poor service by Swiss Air agents! It is as if dealing with a 3rd world company! After their strike on 30th June, flights got cancelled. 
The agents are incredibly unprofessional with very poor English language skills. And they have no clear information about the situation or rebooking status. They have no clue about how to handle difficult situation per customer. There is no transparency within the company and no clear communication between Swiss Air and Lufthansa. I've been calling both companies back and forth with zero professional agent concern! Never expected Swiss Air to be that bad! As long as all flights go smooth, there is no problem. But if something goes wrong with your flight, brace yourself, because there is absolutely zero concern and customer care whatsoever!
Unbelievably horrible service!!

title: delayed as always
review_text:
Have been taking flight with swiss i think already 5 time from z√ºrich to luxembourg and back not even once they have manage to flight on time always with 30 to 60minutes delayed...
if your time is fix i dont recommend swiss for it.

title: SWISS simply DONT LIKE CYCLISTS WITH BIKES
review_text: I pre booked a second piece of luggage as I was bringing a bike. At airport check in I was told I had to register the bike as a bike. Nowhere on your website can I see that I have to identify that extra piece as a bike. The ticket agent at the airport registered it for me, but operations would not load it as there was already 3 bikes checked in (three being the maximum capacity...how can that be?). I spoke on the phone for 22 minutes with a Lina at Swiss customer services looking for a solution. The best she could offer, now after the flight had closed, was telling me to contact the cargo departure and book the bike separately. I then had to rebook my flight and travel on the 17.15 flight, paying a fare change fee of AED 561.22 and delaying our travel by 10 hours. I have never had such poor service from an airline and as compensation want at least a refund on the fare change charges

title: Swiss terrible customer service
review_text:
Booked business direct with airline Milan Zurich Singapore 
Got an email at the 11th hour saying flight canceled then a follow up saying rebooked China airlines via Shanghai. Immediately emailed Swiss saying I did not want to fly on the Chinese carrier or transit China given I had a bad previous experience. This message was ignored so had no choice. China requires a visa even for transit on the same airline which I didn‚Äôt have or even know about it never used to be a requirement and Swiss made no mention of it. So somewhat expectedly my passport was taken at Shanghai by immigration and I was to a room with no idea what would happen next. After a long anxious wait I was allowed to continue to Singapore without explanation and somewhat traumatised. After my trip was over I got a reply to my email to Swiss merely confirming my Air China flight and in no way addressing my concern. I had even offered to catch the train from Milan to Zurich to catch the Singapore bound leg which hadn‚Äôt been cancelled, no mention of this either. So I can‚Äôt say what‚Äôs it is like to fly long haul Swiss business and probably never will.

title: Worst ever
review_text:
For the first,  food on board on international flights is paid on flight although it is not a low cost airlines and with a very high price compared to the quantity such a cheap way compared to the ticket price. 
Arrived to Cairo on June 29, 2023 but at least 20 of the passengers did not receive their luggage, my families‚Äô bags did not arrive with the promise to send home in one or two days and we are at the second day with no sign or contacts as they have promised. We did not notice the fine letters saying that their responsibilities in bagging delay or loss is limited to 100 USD for economy passengers (cheap) reference number and telephone numbers given at airport either not answering or busy lines during the times were they have given us to call,  no any indication when our luggage will be handed to us even chatting service on their website is not operating. My advice do not ever use this failure airlines and run away from it if it was offered to you, I gave one star rating to them only because I cannot give lower.

title: Swiss = a disgrace
review_text: Horrible experience. My checked in bag did not arrive on my arrival on June 28th at 11.30 am. Have received no answer from the swiss staff what happened. Had to claim it online which I did. Tried to call several times and never got a reply. Received an email on the 29th explaining that my luggage was found and will now be delivered and that the courier would contact me to deliver. Now it's the 30th of June 9:35 pm and I have not been contacted and the luggage has not be delivered. This is outstanding, a fraud. It is sad to see how Swiss has developed from being a top class airline 25 years ago to a careless rubbish company. Avoid Swiss! It's a scam! I have a continuing flight tomorrow morning and have to cancel it because I did not recover my luggage yet! Swiss = a disgrace

title: Worst experience ever! Avoid at all costs.
review_text: Do not fly with them. The staff at check in were very unprofessional and poorly trained. At the boarding gate, flight kept getting delayed without any explanation. In the end they told us the flight is weight restricted so they deboarded many people. Finally got into the aircraft, only to told after waiting nearly 2 hours that the plane has been wrongly loaded so further delays. Avoid this cheap junk airline and pay little bit extra to fly with reputable airlines.

title: Claim for Damaged Baggage against Dolfi1920
review_text:

Very Interguiing situation to whom to contact. Irresponsible,untrustworthy, untrue and deceitful behaviour on the part of Dolfi1920.de At this stage,no further trust and reliability can be made against their untrue and deceitful assurances.

title: A flying sales pitch.
review_text: Wanna buy something while you sit in our uncomfortable seats?  That about sums up my experience on Swiss Air.

title: Overbooked flights and Supervisor Threatening to not let me in
review_text: Worst experience of my life. DON‚ÄôT EVER BOOK WITH THEM.! The staff and supervisor at the Dubai airport are so rude and they pick and choose who they let in the flight. After a long wait for check in they told me that they will not be able to give me a boarding pass or choose a seat until after midnight. My flight was at 1:15am and when I asked why they refused to tell me. I got really frustrated as me flight was in an hour and they were checking in everyone else. Then they told me that they over booked the flight and wanted me to wait until they check in other people to see if there‚Äôs enough seats for me and couple other people. They refused to tell me what are my other options and when I kept asking they would just tell me to wait. The supervisor was really rude and was threatening to not helping me or getting me in the flight if I continued to ask or refused to wait. The guy at the counter then told me that‚Äôs what the airline usually does, they book 20 seats over capacity and that I should not argue with the supervisor because I‚Äôm making my situation worst and he might let me wait longer. I had another connecting flight from Zurich to Canada and I had work the next day so I couldn‚Äôt miss this flight. Almost all of us who were waiting were women. I had to wait and not knowing what are my other options if I miss this flight. They finally let me in but there were other people who were still waiting. I had to run as fast as I can to the gate because they‚Äôve already started boarding. I‚Äôm Never booking with this airline again!

title: Worst experience ever!!!! Run away!!! Burglars and no respect for their customers
review_text:
In short: 2 flights canceled in a raw, no reimbursement, not even a sorry message!!  They are gross and don‚Äôt care about their customers.  
Flight LX2093, 26/06 boarding at 14:05 from Lisbon to Geneva got first delayed 30 minutes  because of a technical issue while we were already onboard, then they told us it was a software issue to print our documents and it would take an additional 20 minutes before take off, finally they cancelled the flight because of the initial technical issue that was supposed to be fixed‚Ä¶¬†
Proposed alternative flights were all for the next day (it was early afternoon!!) and with no direct flights - but okay this can happen‚Ä¶ so we were booked on the flight to Zurich (delayed from 15:00 to 20:00‚Ä¶) where we were supposed to spend the night and then flight to Geneva next day early morning. They sent us 2 vouchers (one each) worth 12‚Ç¨ each to get refreshment while waiting. They resulted to be worth 5‚Ç¨ for both of us‚Ä¶ 
We therefore waited from 15:30 until 20:00 in the airport to finally be told that our tickets, which were printed by one of the hostesses at the exit of the flight, got cancelled because of an overbooking!!! How can this happen?!? 
They left us there with no guidance, only saying Swiss air had no rebooking possibilities until the next day and that all hotels were fully booked so we should look for it ourselves. 
3rd attempt finally with TAP airlines was okay but the luggage policy being different, we ended up waiting for our hand luggage on the belt instead of the fast tracking. 
Needless to speak about the additional day off from work we had to take, all costs have been on us and so far not even one email/phone call/sms to explain how to get reimbursed‚Ä¶ chapeau Swiss air!

title: Worst airline
review_text: It was the worst experience. Paid extra and got confirmation for extra leg room. At the airport bumped to economy middle seat. Showed confirmation and was told they can do nothing. The same thing had happened to a couple behind us.  Very disappointing to randomly downgraded fir a 12 hour flight. I will never fly Swiss airlines again.

title: Flight cancelled - Refusing to pay any compensation
review_text:
My experience with Swiss Airline was incredibly disappointing.
They canceled my flight and caused a 14-hour delay on the alternative flight they arranged. When I tried to contact them for compensation, it was nearly impossible to reach them. They took 10 weeks to respond to my email and nobody was unavailable by phone for compensation complaints. It's unacceptable how they misuse their unavailability to avoid compensating passengers.
They also refuse to pay for any additional costs while they confirmed in an email before hand they will cover these.

title: Horrible Experience
review_text:
This was one of the worst experiences ever to book a Swiss airways flight. I travelled with my family to Switzerland in June 2023 and when we booked a return flight from Zurich to Delhi, we got connecting flights on a single PNR :
1) Zurich to Frankfurt (Swiss airways), 19:05 Departure, 20:15 Arrival
2) Frankfurt to Delhi (Air India), 21:15 Departure, 08:30 (+1) Arrival

The problems are many with this combination:
1) Swiss Airways doesn't allow more than one checkin luggage per person (even when they are within weight limits)

2) Swiss airways leaves you at terminal 1 but gate A while Air India departs from Terminal 1 only but Gate B. The distance from Gate A to Gate B is too large and if you are travelling with family with aged parents, let me guarantee you that you won't be able to catch the Air Inia flight. 

3) Since there is hardly anytime between 2 flights, there is no scope for delay.. however our Swiss flight departed 25mins late, and hence we arrived at 20:40 in Frankfurt.. imagine our situation as we were travelling with parents

4) I paid extra money to get the front row seats so that we will be the first one to exit from Swiss flight. But just 2 hours before the flight, we got the message that  the carrier has been changed. Now it's a new flight and we were assigned seats in the middle. Wow!!! Then why did we pay for the front seats? We were not provided any refreshments in the flight except a bottle of water and one small chocolate.

title: Sardines
review_text:
I don't often fly economy but did so as part of a family trip and it was a miserable experience. 
I called specifically to get window seats and they were confirmed but when we got our boarding passes someone changed it so we were all seated in the middle row. Yay. 
The seats were placed so close together that my boyfriend who is a very average height couldn't even squeeze his backpack between his legs to put under the seat, and even that was almost impossible to do because there was no under seat room. I'm 5'4" (about 165cm) and even I had a hard time sitting comfortably in the seat. On the positive it did have a good headrest so that helped during the little bits we were able to get shut eye. 
Food was terrible. I was served pasta and it was soggy and overcooked, it barely had any sauce, nor any flavour. The bread and butter were ok and the dessert was also gross. The only thing that was actually decent was the breakfast croissant. My boyfriend said his beef stew was pretty ok so if you're given that choice avoid the pasta. 
Another thing that's fun about flying on the Swiss airlines is that they wake you up on a red eye when they serve food so that the person behind you can eat but the lady was rather rude about it. As if my 11 year old daughter flying to Europe for the first time is supposed to know these things... so getting back to sleep was fun. Not really. We were trying to get sleep because of a 620am arrival, which meant barely any sleep. 
The only good things were that it's Swiss so the airplane was clean. I made a remark to my Swiss friends about how terrible the flight was and they replied "oh no! You should never fly swiss economy long distance! It's terrible." Good to know for next time - we will not be making the same mistake.

title: Lost bag on honeymoon - can‚Äôt get an answer from any of their support agents.
review_text:
We just arrived in Zurich for our honeymoon to be told that our bags were never loaded in Chicago. We flew business class and arrived at the airport over 2 hours before our flight so I cannot understand how this happened.

We have now spent several hours trying to get ahold of someone who can give us an answer on when our bags will arrive but we keep getting passed to different support agents who eventually send us to a wrong number and we get disconnected. This has been an absolutely terrible way to start our honeymoon. My husband and I are both so frustrated and disappointed and now have to cancel our plans for today as we do not have the belongings we need. 

The most frustrating part has been the terrible service we have received and how difficult it has been to get ahold of anyone to help us. I will never fly Swiss or recommend it to anyone.

title: Worst Airline Ever!
review_text: Absolutely ridiculous that you overbooked international flight by excessive amount including business class. Added bag to return flight and refused to correct it to departure flight or issue a refund. And the icing on the cake is the lost luggage! On top of that Swiss makes u check carry on bc it has wheels and doesn't fit in box....90% of carry ons have wheels!!!. Absolutely ridiculous, stick with United or Emirates!

title: Cramped long-haul flight
review_text: The twelve-hour flight from Zurich to Hong Kong is far from comfortable. The plane is full with everyone stuck in the narrow, cramped seats for the whole trip. Film selection is somehow limited with few Asian cinema options. Fortunately meals are fine and crew very helpful.

title: Terrible airline
review_text: Flight was delayed 45 min due to mechanical issues and we barely made our transfer flight to Naples. The plane was crap. For a plane used for an 8 hrs flight you had the room of a domestic flight. One of the head phone ports didn't work,  so I could only hear the movie with one ear. They did not load our luggage on the transfer plane to Naples, and we had to wait for 3 days to get our luggage. Never again...

title: Horrible experience
review_text: Lost our bags and cannot offer any updates 3 days later. Customer service is a joke, they do not care or have the desire to help in any way. I would avoid Swiss airline at all cost. Aircraft is very worn, flight attendants not friendly or attentive at all, after the meals were served no one collected the finished meal for over an hour leaving all passengers basically stuck in their seats with the food trays left down. Bathrooms were not cleaned.

title: Multiple bad booking and customer service experiences
review_text: Terrible to non-existent customer service with very different outcomes depending upon whom one speaks with. Online and digital services (booking/rebooking) are worse than some obscure 3rd world airline. Really surprisingly bad all around.

title: Terrible customer service
review_text: The absolute worst experience with customer service. I attempted to add my dog onto a flight, called the airline to make the request and spoke with several agents and none of them knew how to carry out this task. Swiss sent me to Edelweiss and then I was receiving emails from Lufthansa. There was no communication between the three.  After a week of calling everyday the issue was still not resolved. An agent put the wrong details into my booking request and it was then deleted a couple days before my flight. Also, misinformation about travel bans between the countries I was travelling to and from was given. I arrived 5 hours early for my flight to see if the airport staff there could confirm my booking, as customer service suggested. This was refused, they said they could not provide me with contact information with Edelweiss, who would be operating my flight that day, and then outright refused to attempt to contact them and help me make the booking. Eventually my dog was refused from the flight. The whole lead up to this flight, up to the last few minutes was exhausting and frustrating. The majority of employees I spoke to showed no problem solving initiative or care and lacked the necessary knowledge and training to be dealing with customers.

title: Swiss Air change flight schedule and take money for revised booking and don't refund seat reservation costs.
review_text: I booked a recent flight to Cairo  from London via Zurich.  Swiss Air twice changed the leaving time until the connecting time in Zurich became too tight for comfort.  I rebooked flights with a better interval and was charged a significant booking fee.  I also had to re-reserve seats for myself, my  wife and daughter.  Swiss Air will not refund the original seat reservations.  This is dishonest money-making.  The customer services are not helpful.  I will not use Swiss Air again.

title: Inept staff , inept customer service , literally this airlines deserves bankruptcy.
review_text: Our flight was honestly the worst experience.  Our flight was cancelled once. Then they insist they take our carry on bags. We complied to be nice. Get on the plane, and there is tons of space in overhead.  Ok. No big deal, it will be fine, we will make our connecting fight in Zurich then to milan.   On runway and now say there is an electrical problem and going back to gate.  So typical.  This is literally the THIRD time something similar has happened to us in a year with Swiss / United.  Once was to Japan a few months ago and we didn‚Äôt get our bags until the LAST day of trip. In the pics, I show my bag that they say didn‚Äôt meet carry on standards. What liars. I‚Äôve flown with this bag dozens of times.  This agent you see in the picture is the customer agent that told me the bag was too big. He also promised there would be no delays etc.   Now we won‚Äôt make our connecting flight without our bags.  The executives should resign for running such a poor excuse for an airline.

title: No comments. Website is misleading
review_text: Late 9 hours to destination. Customer service exceptionally poor, staff can't answer the question or solve an issue so they just hang up! 1 of a kind experience that wasn't expected from European airlines

title: Never Again
review_text:
Swiss lost my luggage on the outward trip and again when returning to Heathrow.  No help at either end, luggage finally arrived  unannounced with no apology.  Numerous emails to (so called) customer service (16 and counting) have brought nothing but nonsense replies.  
The business class experience was also poor so, whatever you do, don't fly Swiss

title: Really stressful.
review_text:
An easy request has been made very challenging due to an Edelweiss plane chartered by Swiss and sending emails through Lufthansa. They act like they're one entity but there is very little cohesion between airline customer service. 
If you like being batted between three airlines who all blame the next this is the service for you. They all sound confident in the job they're doing but they obfuscate the process to a point where they confuse themselves.
The amount of times I have been asked the same questions and offered solutions to be one day before my flight and unable to get answers still.

title: Avoid do not use
review_text: Its has been over 2 months since you lost all our luggage , and i have  had your email of admission and replied to that 10 days ago and still you do nothing .  You treat good customers like rubbish , your customer service is appalling you send emails from Ida Chingowa who never responds back , you lost us over ¬£9.600 .000 of lost luggage and ruined 17 days in cape town .  I am going to give you the opportunity of 24 hrs then this goes fully  legal

title: Horrible Customer Service
review_text: There was an issue with my credit card being charged, so I called the airline and they told me that the email I received saying there was an issue with my credit card was wrong and that there was no issue and my flight wan confirmed. Then I got another email the next day saying that my ticket had been suspended, so I called again. I talked to 3 different people, they all gave me different information, literally refused to let me speak with a supervisor, told me I had to call my bank, and then they cancelled my ticket 2 days before I was supposed to fly out. Their customer service is atrocious!

title: Very good
review_text: Flew premium economy from Zurich to Bangkok and was such a pleasant experience from start to finish. Very helpful crew, comfy seats and food was plentiful and actually very good for airline food. Bonus points for the Swiss chocolate as snacks

title: Targeted for carryon check
review_text: Flew Swiss airlines from lax to Zurich in June. Disappointed with boarding as felt unfairly targeted to have our bags checked. Was in line to board and was asked to have my carryon bag checked. It was within their guidelines but they refused to measure it and said it would delay takeoff. My wife has gone ahead and they asked for my passport but she had it, so when she came back they also told her her bag was too big even though they had let her on already and there were clearly others who had larger bags pass us. I don‚Äôt want to presume why I was targeted but it was clearly not bag size as I‚Äôve never had issue and have used same carryon bag for almost 15 years. Was my first time flying Swiss and I definitely will not fly again or recommend it to anyone who is not Swiss.

title: Rip-offs Artists
review_text:
Swiss and there partner airline Cathay pacific ripped us off by canceling our flight and charging us to purchase a more expensive flight on the same date + US$2000.

Noisy uncomfortable cabin from hong kong to Z√ºrich.

Called swiss support extremely unhelpful. Checked with legal advise - Swiss had done the cancelation just before they had a legal liability.

I will never fly Swiss again!

title: Extremely Dissatisfied with Swiss Airline's Communication and Service
review_text:
Swiss Airline made an unnotified flight time change without any prior notice or communication. I only became aware of the change when attempting to check-in online, and to my astonishment, the departure time had been moved forward by almost 6 hours. This kind of last-minute alteration is unacceptable and demonstrates a complete disregard for passengers' time and convenience.

Moreover, when I raised my concerns and lodged a complaint regarding the unnotified flight time change, the response from Swiss Airline's customer service team was deeply unsatisfactory. They tried to pass off the delay as an extraordinary circumstance beyond their control due to air traffic control restrictions. While I understand that such circumstances can occur, it is the responsibility of the airline to promptly communicate any changes or delays and provide suitable alternatives or assistance to affected passengers. Swiss Airline's failure to do so showcases a lack of customer-oriented approach and a lack of accountability for their actions.

title: Lost Baggage
review_text: The worst airline you can ever imagine. they lost my baggage in Orlando and the staff in baggage claims department is so rude. They say we will reimburse for the bag only if it is not found for 100 days (so stupid policy). Never travel with SWISS again in my life even if I get a ticket for free.

title: Terrible service after the airline cancelled our flight and left us with additional expenses and no refund
review_text: I always used to fly with Emirates, and decided to try Swiss air for the first time and I will never ever use this airline again! We have had the worst experience and such terrible service. The airline cancelled our flight and we have been emailing and contacting them to fix it for weeks with no response. No the airline rescheduled our flight and now only the day before our flight, we got rescheduled to another flight with no baggage allowed. We paid so much money for luggage and now we are told we have to pay again for bags with no guarantee of a refund. We did not budget for this and the airline has given us such poor service in assisting with the process!! We do not recommend this airline to anyone, emirates and even Qatar has provided us with excellent service for years and would never leave us with such an inconvenience!!! The service is poor and the additional expenses should not be our responsibility!

title: Oh Dear - Cabin Crew need much improvement in service
review_text:
Have been flying around the world Business Class with Star Alliance for more than a decade. 
I don't know if the cabin crew were trainees but the service was well below par.
It was bizarre.
Meals were haphazardly served, with some receiving their meals and drinks , while others were still waiting.

We asked for coffee and after 20 minutes I went up to the galley where the flight attendants were standing, chatting, eating snacks. 
I asked about our coffee and was told the order had been "sent up" (to where?) and they didn't know - it was coming!

So back in our seats, some time later, asked for a drink of coke. On her way back to the galley, she took an order from another passenger, never to appear again.
 I could see her standing in the other aisle at the galley drinking and eating.

So, I tried again and called the attendant - I never do this.
Along she came, a different one and I asked for a drink - Of course, she said and then like the others disappeared back into the galley, to never appear again.

How hard is it to serve drinks and meals?
They had to have been trainees with no supervision because they could not be this incompetent.

Such a shame because the aircraft was clean and comfortable but if you are paying business class, you expect business class standard.
I can only hope the economy was not as woeful.

title: Swiss air
review_text:
Flight LX1953-LX1852 
We were a group consisted of 23 people. 
At first they didn‚Äôt let us get aboard on the pretext of having overweight luggage.
We payed 200‚Ç¨ but they charged us for 300‚Ç¨.
The supervisor was very rude and in the end our luggage didn‚Äôt reach their final destination because they sent them to Mexico. 
I don‚Äôt recommend them at all.

title: Mr
review_text:
Lowest service provided among the economy class. 
I have travelled with numerous airlines and on 4+hour flight you would expect some service. There isn't even entertainment service provided. 
All you get is a bottle of water and a small piece swiss chocolate. 

New aeroplanes the swiss airlines use Airbus A220 is very cheaply made as you get up from your seat lightest pull will rock the front passenger or if you reposition yourself in the seat it like being on a fairground ride rocking back and forward.

title: Lost Bag Terrible Support
review_text: One bag made one bag did not. clunky claims filing. no information received. called multiple times. Got conflicting information with different phone numbers to call. It‚Äôs been two days no response. Where is my bag? These things happen it‚Äôs how it‚Äôs handled that matters. Never again.

title: Decent Onboard Entertainment, Good Food ,Courteous Staff,Average Legspace .Customer Service definitely needs to improve.
review_text:
We had a great journey from Mumbai - Zurich - Mumbai via Swiss Airlines.

The airport check in was fast, flight was smooth and on time , legroom  is very average, 6 feet tall person may have issue sitting in Economy.Food is good , entertainment choice is decent .
Staff on both flights was very courteous and polite .We even got complimentary swiss chocolates after the flight .

Though before our journey,we did face a lot of inconvenience in contacting their customer service in India regarding change in flight dates and info on ticket . Wait times on the call are extremely long .

title: WORST CHECK IN STAFF IN MANCHESTER AIRPORT, AVOID HER THE BULLY
review_text: I hate my overall experience with Swiss Airlines not because the on board experience but because the bad experience I got in the Manchester Airport. I was bullied by the lady in the check in counter who was threatened me to confiscate my luggage if I did not pay 200++ pounds for one of my cabin luggage. At first she said that she will give me a free of charge cabin luggage but after that she asked me to pay because it exceeds 8kgs. My luggage was 14kgs. Okay it‚Äôs fair, I told her I will dispose unnecessary things so it will fit 8kgs, but she won‚Äôt allow me, she said I must pay, which made me confuse and told her I don‚Äôt want to pay because supposedly I can take it to the cabin, if the issue was the weight then I will make it fit to 8kgs. The check in counter should be more educated people in charge. In Manchester airport there was an Indian looking lady looks very uneducated, rude and unprofessional. As check in is the gate for consumers to enter their journey, the check in process should be smooth and delicate so there will be no grudges during the on board experience. Because I got bad experience in check in process, it became very uncomfortable for me to continue the journey. I felt I was bullied by Swiss Airlines staff in the check in, thus to continue to have positive vibes was so difficult for me. Especially when I told the lady that the luggage should marked as fragile, but she did not do it, until I realised my luggage was damage in the arrival airport. I was so sad and depressed knowing that my luggage was broken despite I told her to put the fragile mark on it.

title: Worst overcrowding at an airport lounge I have ever seen
review_text: You would think Zurich airport lounge should be the pinnacle in the Swiss Air network, but it was the most over crowded I have ever seen an airport lounge with dirty dishes piling up. Food selection was poor, corn chips and dips. Entire lounge experience was very poor. Not the offering a premium airline.

title: WORST customer service EVER!
review_text: I had forgotten to add a checked baggage to my booking and so I called the customer service. The customer advisor i spoke to was very rude, she was clearly doing something else and not listening to my request, she then proceeded to say that she couldnt help me, couldnt transfer me to someone else, not even a manager, when i was expressing my frustration. Then I eventually asked for her name and she proceeded to hand up on me.

title: Don't call Customer Service Center, expect horrible customer service
review_text: I tried finding the customer service 800# on their website, had to google it instead. Customer Service was horrible, call was getting interrupted and Rep. was rude (ESMCO)  was her name, when I asked to speak with a supervisor about her bad attitude, she said to call back in 2 hrs, she also said no one was available....SWISS take note of this!!! HORRIBLE CUSTOMER SERVICE, when I asked for Agent ID the Agent Hung up in my face

title: Swiss Air is a dishonest company.
review_text: I firmly believe their policy is to save money by ignoring and abandoning requests from customers with legitimate customer service issues.  It is obvious that they do not want to interact with the customer - there is not even a customer service phone number - only an email address which is very easy for them to simply ignore.  THEY DO NOT REPLY TO EMAILS.  So the customer is literally talking to a wall with no hope of ever interacting with a Swiss Air person.  The only Swiss Air employee that you can reach on the phone are reservation agents that will not discuss any customer service issues.  Hard to believe they can survive and build any customer loyalty.  You better hope everything goes perfectly with your trip because it is hopeless if you have a problem and want to discuss it with Swiss Air

title: Massive disappointment
review_text:
Airline was late by a full hour.

Captain doesn't even mention it or apologize. Didn't seem to care.

On board service is non existing. Would have preferred Ryan air to Swiss

title: Unbelievably rude
review_text: I instantly regretted my journey with Swiss Airlines from the check in process. The staff is rude and really trying to make your journey as bad as possible. She checked my bags and then saying that she also can give me free of charge cabin luggage. After I handed it to her, she said I should pay additional for 280 pounds, I told her it is better for me to take it to the cabin but she said it is overweight 5 kgs. Then I said well I can pay the additional 5kgs only, but she is insisted that I must pay 14 kgs full. Then I was thinking, why did she offer me the free of charge if I should pay the full amount while I can take it to the cabin. I refused and she said your bags will be confiscated later in boarding. WTH?

title: Brussels-Johannesburg 24 hrs delay; SWISS not respecting EU261 reimbursement
review_text:
Flew from Brussels to Zurich with Swiss LX789 February 26th, 2023.
Flight was delayed due to preceding delay on arrival in Zurich from where it had to depart (was told by the lady at the gate in Brussels). Flight was delayed two more times after it was mentioned that airplane had departed Zurich (very strange as only further delay can happen when airplane is kept in holding pattern just before arriving in Brussels!).
Due to the accumulative delay chances were slim that i would catch my connecting flight LX282 from Zurich to Johannesburg but the lady at the gate convinced me to take the flight anyway.
As expected, i missed my connecting flight and there was no other option than to take the next scheduled LX282 flight 24 hrs later. Missed one day of meetings and conference due to this.
Have been mailing and calling with SWISS customer support for several months and SWISS has been doing everything to avoid compensation. Latest vague feedback was, that delay was due to operational circumstances and therefore not  in their control. Have asked copies of airplane logs which would prove the exact reason of the delay (operational delay can be anything and are no extraordinairy circumstances). SWISS refused to provide this proof but only would supply this if it was forced in a court case. Have now opened a case with my legal insurance company to get to the bottom of this.
Unbelievable how unprofessional SWISS is handling passenger rights! 
If they treat each of their customers like this they deserve the same faith as their predecessor Swissair!

title: Swiss Air: Worst airline I've flown in over a decade
review_text:
Swiss Air was a horrible service. The food on the flight was incredibly poor quality -- basically inedible. I understand having low expectations about Plane Food but this was a whole other level of bad.

What really upset me is I purchased roughly $50 of Internet Service and it only lasted me 8 minutes!! When I asked the flight attendant to address this they told me that's just how long I was able to use the internet. I emailed customer support and they told me the same thing. I cant imagine why anyone would spend $50 on an 11 hour flight for only 8 minutes of internet. 

It just wasnt an enjoyable trip. The interior was outdated, the food was inedible (something out of the 80s) and the customer service was not helpful.

title: EasyJet is better
review_text:
Haven‚Äôt flown with Swiss for a while and after finding myself unexpectedly on Swiss again because I happened to need to fly from Heathrow, I remember why. A desperate, grubby experience with an airline pretending to offer a full scheduled service but in reality cramming economy passengers in with less legroom than EasyJet and offering a schedule plagued with delays. 

The airline no longer recognizes my Miles & More card so I‚Äôm in group 5 getting on. By this stage my fellow passengers are being denied their one allowed cabin bag and the airline staff are desperately weighing bags to give them a justification to take cases away from anyone with the temerity to have one weighing 8.0001 kg or more.

The onboard staff on my flight were grim-faced and unhelpful, refusing to help an old woman struggling to get her bag in the overhead compartment. To another, who asked for help, they were curtly told to do it themselves. I know that‚Äôs probably some airline regulation, but really? 

The thing I can‚Äôt bear about Swiss is the incompatibility between their prices and their services. At least EasyJet doesn‚Äôt pretend to offer anything but a no frills service. The Swiss service is no frills in economy but you still pay a very full fare - fine if someone else is paying but if, like me, you pay your own fares then you have to admit there are better alternatives.

title: Worst Service, Rude, Unorganized
review_text: We paid extra to select our seats and when we got to gate they had split us up.  One in front and one in back of plane.   I am a 1ker so we were supposed to board first.   We ended up being put in back of plane after all but 7 people had boarded.  The entire business class (same size seats as economy) was empty with exception of maybe 10 seats.   They also took our carry on bags from us even though they are both airline compliant. This was before we ever found out about seat change.  There gate workers were rude and never once apologized.  We have a 12 hour day in front of us so this definitely has created more chaos than needed on vacation.  If you can avoid this airline - you should.

title: Avoid this airline
review_text:
First of all, I didn't get an email about checkin.  I couldn't check in ahead of time.  Counter asked me a million questions and was overly difficult about my luggage.  The plane took off way late with little communication.  The food was subpar.  The wifi was a complete joke.  20 CHF for 50MB.  They sent me a confirmation email when I bought wifi and this used up 25% of my purchase.  
This airline is completely out of it.

title: Do not fly with them
review_text: They take longer to let us get in the plane , the plane it‚Äôs old and Busisness class it‚Äôs a joke very old and ugly the seats are very small the food was the worst very bad , we have a child crying since we take off until we arrive, The internet 59‚Ç¨ for 200MB I can compared this people to Ryanair I will never fly with them again .

title: Horrible service on the hotline
review_text:
I had to make 3 call and wait 30' each time since finally the close the line. All that after receiving emails that they tried to call me and that i have to call them urgently back.
On top of that all 3 advisors were rude and when you ask to talk to the director, they say that you cannot! So why our calls are registered??

title: TERRIBLE CUSTOMER SERVICE!!!
review_text: After booking, I have tried calling to make changes - I have received responses from - you need to talk to a manager; you will get a call back in 20-30 minutes; you need to call back tomorrow at 10; you need to email - UGH!!! This is the worst, useless, worthless robots I‚Äôve ever dealt with in planning travel. STAY AWAY!!!

title: Terrible experience in business class
review_text: Mar 20th 2023, I boarded LX 14, from Zurich to JFK, everything was fine till about 2 hours in to the flight.  Had a lovely flight attendant serving me and I had 3 drinks then ate my dinner and had two more drinks....then I have never felt such prejudice from a flight attendant.  This man came up and told me that business class flights of 9 hours are capped at 3 to 5 drinks.  I have flown almost every major airline and always in business, I fly about 50 or more flights a year.  Is this Swiss Air policy I asked and he said yes it is, so I asked even though you can clearly see me speaking calmly and the fact that I am completely sober which I always am and I have never had one issue on a flight.  So, is this policy and where is it written??  I did not want to bring up the race topic as he was very friendly with all the swiss speaking people and non colored customers.  From that moment on I did not get offered anything, you are talking about 6 hours left in the air.  Even the second meal offering was not mentioned and no one even stopped at my seat.  When I got off the plane 2 gentleman came up to me and said "I can't believe that happened to you and how they cut you off after hardly any drinks"  and then they both had the same experience with the terrible service and both were shocked that a second meal was not even offered and that hardly anyone checked on us.  I got both their names in case I have to get this out to the media.  One is ex-government but broke his arm skiing so could not drink and said he would have lost it if he was told there is a 3 to 5 drink max per 9 hour flight.  Also, I wanted their names incase someone questioned if I showed an ounce of intoxication which I can tell you is impossible....In Canada we can drink 2 drinks an hour and still drive so saying 5 drinks in 3 hours with a meal is a max is unacceptable considering I paid for this service.  I own many corporations and understand employees can not be trusted and always like to give management a chance to rectify an employees terrible actions. I have a picture of this flight attendant he was the head one as he was in first class when we were landing and I have a video of how nice he is as he touched shoulders of the first class customers and a picture of him as well.  I am a 44 year old successful Arab/African man and the way I was treated definitely made me feel prejudice and frankly it was embarrassing for someone like me who is semi-retired and travels the world on vacation about 200 to 250 days a year.  Swiss air did nothing when I reached out and the fact I paid for drinks upfront and a certain level of service did not seem to matter to them.  We all agreed it is by far the worst long haul business experience you can have.

title: Recovery of misplaced luggage
review_text:
I lost a shoulder bag on this flight (no clue what happened).  It contained a laptop computer, personal documents, and some cash.
Despite numerous inquires right after the  flight, the bag was nowhere to be found.
3 months later I received a message from Swiss Air that bag had been found at the Berlin Airport.  Since I live in NYC, getting the bag back to me was another issue. Swiss was incredibly creative and helpful in figuring out how to do this - and at no costs to me.  I could not have been more appreciative of their helpful attitude

title: worst customer service
review_text: we made an upgrade to business from ZRH-BCN-RZRH. even with a written confirmation of 2 checked luggages they claim we did not incl. the baggage in the economy price?! we had no other choice than to pay for our luggages , otherwise they did not let us fly. and the flight in business class is almost empty. what great customer service. thank you for the 0 customer services and terrible incompetent staff...

title: The worst customer service support I faced in the long time
review_text: I couldn't finish my online check-in because their IT system is obsolete and requires VISA data even visa is not required for my citizenship. Firstly they haven't provided the support on time but I continued the mail discusion to provide the feedback to the company so they can change it and make it more convinient for future passengers in same situtation. They just ignored the mail saying they deal only with urgent requests.

title: Undoubtedly the worst customer support I have ever experienced
review_text:
Myself and my husband booked non refundable flights for our honeymoon. We found out due to unexpected medical reasoning we were unable to travel at that time. We called Swiss Air to speak about possibly rebooking and were told that wouldn‚Äôt be a problem and to call back with new dates. We rebooked our accommodation and when we called bask with new dates we were told we could no longer change our flights. This resulted in several calls over many weeks to Swiss Air trying to get clarification and escalate this given we had a doctors note. The experience was my worst ever customer experience before for the reasons below:
1. When calling Swiss Air, after waiting some time and when you finally connect with an agent, the phone disconnects after 5-10 minutes. This happens every time if you are on the line for over a few minutes. This means when speaking with customer service and explaining your case, the call will suddenly disconnect and you have no way of contacting the same person again. This resulted in hours and days of trying several agents and constantly getting disconnected and ultimately getting no where with a request. My communication went on for 3 months in mid 2023 so there is no way this is a once off. They are aware of the problem and are not fixing it. 
2. Each agent had inconsistencies with their narrative and solution. We were promised one thing from one agent and this changed many times depending on what agent we spoke with. There doesn‚Äôt seem to be a clear playbook of rules and guidance. This was extremely frustrating being promised one thing and then this changing several times over several calls. There was no consistency or accountability whatsoever. 
3. When we finally got an email address to send our medical note for them to look into (this took 9 separate calls with a different agent every time), no one responded. I followed up three times over 6 weeks and there was no response. 

The huge and seemingly intentional issue with their phone lines, lack of consistency and accountability in their communication service and general offerings and escalation process as well as the compete disregard and ignorance of our medical letter and emails easily makes this the worst customer experience we have ever experienced and unfortunately ruined our honeymoon. This was very disappointing and I highly recommend avoiding Swiss Air at all costs.

title: Lost luggage and Zero customer service from Swiss Airline
review_text:
When we arrived at the Edinburgh Airport, from Zurich, one bag out of three was missing. The baggage claim office at the airport was closed, also a note at the window rereferred to the airline as the the responsible part for the baggage. 

So we decided to fill out the Swiss online  "To Delayed Baggage Service" form at home.

But the online form didn't work and we got following message: 
"We are sorry but you must report your delayed baggage to the last airline you travelled with. Please contact the baggage tracing office of the respective airline at the airport to report your delayed baggage."

So we called Swiss Customer service to get some support:

1st Call: You need to report the lost baggage at the airport. After explaining that I cannot and also that the online form doesn't work, they gave me a number from Cita - 08000260142, the baggage handling company. Cita referred me back to the Airline as they aren't responsible.

2nd Call:  they hung-up on me after explaining them that we are in a deadlock situation as we cannot contact anybody at the airport or fill out the Swiss online form, and that I need Swiss Air to provide me a solution.

3rd Call: they suggested to give me the US baggage centre number, but it's closed now the lady said. She couldn't give me any number in Europe.

4th Call: Different person. I asked for the baggage centre number in Europe and I got one

5th Call: the number didn't work. The last digit was wrong, so I called again.

6th Call: I explained them that I called the baggage centre but they cannot help me without the reference number of the baggage claim. But I will only receive the reference number after successfully filing a baggage claim  online or at the airport, both ways don't work for me. 

7th Call: New strategy! I asked Swiss customer service adviser to guide me through the website on the fill out "To Delayed Baggage Service" form too. The adviser had the same issue.
