The final suggestions was to wait a couple of days then to fill out the online form again or to drive to the airport and to look around if I can find someone from the airline who can support me. Not very helpful! Gave up for today.

title: Don't fly with them!
review_text: That was my first time traveling with this airline, I bought my tickets with them hoping everything would be alright. I only came from United Kingdom to Brazil to see my grandfather who was at hospital and not enough, I had to deal with the stress of losing my luggage. They found my luggage after 4 days and then I contacted them with the receipts of my expenses which according to the law is my right to get reimbursed as it was their mistake. They replied me to contact the Latam Airlines which was the last airline I have traveled with because it wasn't their responsibility and they declared my case as closed. Their customer service was absolutely disappointed and if I could rate them under 1 star I certainly would. After that, I decided to contact Latam as they mentioned it and for my surprise and disappointment once again, the Latam said it's not their responsibility but Swiss. They play together against the customers. I think that's the way it works so I'm leaving here my honest review as an warning for you to think twice before booking with them. If something happens to your luggage I can assure you they will do nothing for helping you with the costs of your loss. That was my first and my last experience with them. I hope I will never travel with them again and I will never recommend them to anyone.

title: Never again Swiss airlines
review_text:
Traveled from USA to Zurich on May 3rd. 2023 with my 85 y.o who's blind and has disabilities when we're existing the aircraft she had the blanket that she's  giving on the plan on her hear and sholder to keep her warm, as we're existing aircraft  from the side door to the outside the tube using the arial lift the pilot and the crew we're at the door one of them which I assumed to be the pilot asked her to give them the blanket back because they ran out of them.
One way ticket cost her $1150.00
On our flight from Zurich to Cairo (4h flight) they did offer any complimentary drink such as coffee or juice.

title: Director
review_text:
Really disappointed.  Not able to do check in online.  Not able to choose seat while doing the check in.  Bad attention at the counter.  
Conditions of the plain

title: I cannot say that customer care is bad, because I cannot call that kind of "service" customer care.
review_text:
The last few times we flew with Swiss we were already discussing with my fianc√© how bad the service got the last few years.  Employees being disrespectful and putting the stress of delayed flights on passengers, employees getting upset at an old lady that was asking what was the menu and the flight attendant answering so upset "that was already announced it on the speakers", excuse me? And also discrimination.  Unfortunately I live in Zurich and I have to flight to certain places with Swiss Air but I would never choose it if I have another option.  What they call customer service on the phone is an absolute joke, they have no idea what customer service is and no intention other than transferring the problems of their own mistakes to the customers without taking any responsibility, always being authoritarian saying things like "this is the only option, are you taking it or not?" 
Uneducated, zero hospitality, a lack of customer service in general.
My rating is based on the last flights and the attention in the call center.

title: Unreliable, terrible customer service
review_text:
Unfortunately I have to confirm all the negative reviews here. We payed for the seat reservation as we are a family with two small kids. The day before the flight we got an email that our seats have been changed (all separated). It took us HOURS to speak to a person who understood our problem and changed our seats (we were still split, but the kids didn‚Äôt have to sit alone). And now comes the best part: this was later charged 280 CHF! 
On the way back, the flight had an hour delay and they acted as if it was completely normal and didn‚Äôt even apologize‚Ä¶ Many people missed their connecting flights‚Ä¶ My advice - if you can avoid SWISS, it‚Äôs completely unreliable and has a terrible customer service.

title: "This is not a discussion", they said to me.
review_text:
It was a very unpleasant experience at the gate. The crew from the plane was seen to be instructing the staff at the gate to announce to people that they have to check in the carry-on bags as there was not enough space on the flight for all bags. If we don't comply apparently the plane cannot take off. The announcement was made in Serbian so I had no idea.  As we were standing in the front, my husband offered up our bags for check-in and when I asked the staff why us and not others, she simply pointed me to ask the Swiss Air staff. I asked him and he said there was not enough space and if I didn't cooperate, we will not go to Z√ºrich that day.  I asked him who chose the bags and he pointed to the ground staff who didn't bother looking at me when I talked to her.

Finally, after all the discussions and unhappiness, I saw that only about 8 bags were taken while the rest of the passengers boarded with their bags.  

When I boarded the flight, I asked the staff why was my bag taken and the other 95% not, he said that because the bags were over 8kg and that he checked. I told him mine wasn't and that he didn't check mine. He simply told me off by saying that if we have this discussion, we won't go to Z√ºrich today. Was that a threat?

When we landed, the baggage claim was delayed by 20 min. All in all, we wasted very much time doing something that we didn't have to do and was being treated badly and threatened.

title: Seat reservation are useless
review_text:
My family is composed by 4 people: 2 adults, a 4 year old and a 1 year old.
Despite having reserved seats together, my wife and youngest child were forced to seat away from the rest of us.
No decent excuse was done as the cabin crew were clueless as well, but in the end they could not arrange anything for us to be together.
If we were only adults I wouldn't mind that much, but travelling with small children is very challenging.

Absolutely do not recommend Swiss Airlines because they are not reliable in regards to seat reservations.

title: Appalling
review_text: Appalling , service , lost all luggage delayed flight unable to contact a human being by phone or email ruined out trip totally , changed us to Lufthansa after a delay in malaga , to zurich , changed all our pre booked seats leaving our 14 year old daughter at the back of the aircraft to cape town , called them by phone cost me ¬£65 for 20 mins and no reply still cannot get a person to speak to  horrendous company with no customer care at all still unable to contact anyone , now will be going the legal route as no luggage for our 17 day trip to south africa

title: Admin issues, poor customer service and unable to see ticket number
review_text: We had issues with our departing and returning flights; the times on the flights were wrong, we did not receive compensation for our time or hassle. We were given a different flight on Swiss airlines, with a broken screen with one seat.

title: Terrible costumer service
review_text: Contacted costumer service a few weeks ago and still waiting for a reply. I can‚Äôt access my reservation through the website and they cannot solve this issue. Terrible service. AI Will never flight with SWISS again.

title: Swiss air LHW - BKK
review_text:
Family holiday to Thailand from London with Swiss Air - April 23.
Expensive to pre-book seats as a family of 5 however during online check in there were plenty of seats to choose from at no cost.
Flights were all on time with clean aircraft.
Staff were generally friendly but several episodes of unnecessary sarcasm on our flight out.
We pre-booked vegan meals via webchat with no issues and received vegan food on both flights (see pics). 
Pillows, blankets and ear phones were supplied. Childrens gifts and headphones also supplied.

No milk alternatives for tea or coffee.

title: Do not fly with Swiss Air
review_text:
I booked this very expensive one way flight with Swiss Air, after my return flight was brought forward to a time I could not make, by another provider called Travelup. I booked with Swiss Air as I thought they would be reliable, having been let down by Travelup.
When I arrived at Las Vegas airport, I discovered that my ‚ÄúSwiss Air‚Äù flight was in fact a United Airlines flight. There was no Swiss Air desk, no- one to ask, and my first flight was delayed so long that I could not make my connecting flight.
Booking with Swiss Air was a complete waste of time and money.
I was rebooked on a United flight and had to spend another night in Las Vegas. 
I was out of pocket to the tune of ¬£200 and no compensation from Swiss Air.

title: Better then I expected
review_text:
I can only speak from my experience as a first time flyer with Swiss air. I was supposed to fly with Lufthansa but with everything that was going on with them I managed to transfer onto another airline. I read some bad things about Swiss airlines (not as bad as Lufthansa) but I was surprised with what I got. 

London - Zurich. The staff were very friendly on this flight and the legroom was pretty good for me... I'm about 6'0. Chocolate at the end of the flight as a nice treat as well

Zurich - Singapore. I'm thinking the plane to Singapore must have been one of their newest planes because it looked and felt great. The staff again were friendly, I thought the food was very good and the entertainment system had a lot of films to watch.. 

All in all I was pleasantly surprised and enjoyed my flight. If I go Singapore again I'll probably try to go with Swiss Airlines again.

title: Some advice
review_text:
I learnt something that might be of use to others. Don't bother with online check-in or trying to pay for a suitcase before getting to the airport. That is a frustrating waste of time.  Also don't call customer service either, no matter which number you find. Either the voice at the other end is almost inaudible (call center in the Phillipines, maybe?) or they tell you what I am telling you now: Just get to the airport 4 hours ahead of your flight and figure it out there. Saves you standing in long line-ups too. You will hear some really creative excuses or get shrugs if you ask why online does not work. The check-in staff are much less under pressure then too.
 In the plane, don't bother pressing the button to call for a flight attendant. That button was there when the plane was built, before economy really meant economy.
My pros are: the food was much better flying out of Zurich (obviously?). Also, my carry on did not get weighed at check-in.

title: Will never fly with Swiss airlines again
review_text: the worst customer service .  Swiss Airlines scammed me for money. They canceled my flight then never refunded me. Even they said they will . Their customer service is horrible almost like a scam. Don‚Äôt fly with Swiss airlines they don‚Äôt treat you as valued customer. .

title: No reimbursment after 7 month
review_text:
My flight was rescheduled with the possibility of reimbursement. I selected this option, that was immediately confirmed by the company.
After 7 months I still have no money back, and they do not reply to emails.

Way too expensive for the service they offer (Ryanair-like).

title: Appalling customer service
review_text: Flight was cancelled 1hr before boarding. Zurich airport was complete chaos with no clear instructions and a 4hr queue to get to the service counter. Swiss Air automatically rebooked my flight to 2 days later, which is ridiculous. The chatbot initially said flight was cancelled due to weather, on the email later they said its a strike. Why the lies? To avoid compensation? And why the terrible customer service who offered no help? You are the national airline of Switzerland, take some pride in it.

title: Its worth Traveling via Swiss Air!
review_text: Their flights are punctual, I have traveled many time with this airline and there was never a delay! I enjoy traveling via Swiss Air!

title: Modificaci√≥n de reserva
review_text:
I was unable to travel and wanted to change my flight reservation to another day. I called their contact telephone number several times and after several hours, I managed to change the day of the flight after paying an additional 200 euros. 

However, when I called back to confirm the change a few days later, I was told that despite having received an email with the new dates for the flight, the booking had not been carried out and that an error had occurred. I wanted to change the flight again but however, the price of the change was 3 times more expensive than buying a new flight ticket. It does not make any sense. I was given no alternatives, no solution. 

Horrible experience.

title: Absolutely no help or service in lost luggage matter
review_text:
Swiss Air lost our luggage going from Copenhagen to Barcelona through Zurich. Our suitcases were recovered after four days while my baby stroller has disappeared. 
Swiss Air claims all has been delivered (we were told at one point that an agent was on his way with the stroller but he never showed up). Now I can‚Äôt get the documents necessary for insurance purposes and despite numerous calls and and emails nobody in Swiss Air seems to be willing to help me. For two weeks, I have been sent in circles between different departments and I just keep being referred to the next one. It‚Äôs a complete disaster and extremely frustrating to be treated with what seems like utter arrogance and/or indifference.

title: Awful Customer Service
review_text: My only request has been to receive an invoice with my company details on it, I have talked with 5 people from customer service already, no one has had an answer, I have been hunged up, asked to send an email and described the very lengthy process it will take to fulfill my request via email, refer to the webpage that issues invoices, just not for flights departing any other place than Greece, Italy or Spain. Most of them have no idea of the difference between an ticket receipt and an invoice. This is the first time I am really encouraged to  write a bad review of a company due to the very very poor customer service

title: Support the environment! Save (a ton of) your money! Don't fly Swiss Air!
review_text: Swiss Air has decided, maybe involuntarily, to be a big supporter of the environment. That's because when you have to pay the average net salary in Romania for being exactly 4 hours in the air you will think twice next time. Sure, maybe Swiss Air's first priority is not the climate change. It doesn't matter if it's Planet Earth, corporate greed or something else! Save the planet and a ton of money! Don't fly Swiss!

title: Terrible customer service -- still waiting for refund after 30 days !!!
review_text:
We booked on Swiss to fly from Portland to Zurich, refundable fare, business class.  Also forked out for an upgrade of our seat.
Shortly after we booked we had to cancel and were told 1) it would take at least 14 business days, and 2) any upgrades were, sorry, not refundable.  Its been almost a month and still waiting for the refund !!

Customer service has required long wait times on phone and been curt and rude once they answered.   Will NEVER consider this airline again.

title: great airline
review_text:
Very nice airline to fly with.
Free water and chocolate (easter) on a short flight.
Nice to follow up where you are during the flight on the different screens.
Cleaning of the tables could be done better.

title: Poor customer service
review_text:
My husband and I went on our honeymoon and our baggage was delayed. We were in Italy, far away from home without our clothes and toiletries. My husband is 6‚Äô5 and was very hard for him to find pants that fit especially without a car to drive outside of tourists areas. We bought the minimum. I received an email that night that they found our baggage. I was instructed to call between certain times but NO ONE answered. We spent a day and a half of our honeymoon paying international charges trying to contact someone about our bag and finally during one of our tours at 8:30 at night someone responds to our phone call. Almost 24 hours after we received our email. We were on our honeymoon, traveling all over Italy. We were told our baggage will take TWO DAYS MINIMUM to get to us. We finally got our stuff on Wednesday after we arrived on Sunday. 

I submitted our receipts to Swiss and they told us they can‚Äôt reimburse us because our baggage arrived the same day. Maybe the baggage arrived the same day but didn‚Äôt get to us until three days later. My husband and I did not have our things until half way through our trip and Swiss is refusing to help us.  I DO NOT recommend them to anyone.

title: Struggling‚Ä¶..as they used to be top‚Ä¶.until they became German
review_text:
Top and friendly service!
Food great when purchasing BUT super expensive 
Seat space almost worse than Ryanair (which I refuse to fly)
Economy light - worst product ever as they need to apply the German stuff rules and weight bags‚Ä¶.worse than EasyJet and Ryanair together. BA is doing a far better job on that end!
Connection times in Zurich - they allow these super tight connections which is great unless you have to switch from A to D and have a bus ride‚Ä¶.

Will I fly them again yes for sure BUT the German stringent rule book is seriously giving you a bad taste‚Ä¶.

title: no rule followed for extra baggage charges
review_text: no rules for extra baggage fee, worst air lines to travel with, staff on India airline counter was rude.

title: Late arrivals
review_text: After flying with Singapore airlines from Perth to Singapore, which was excellent, the Swiss Air flight was the exact opposite. There was certainly no luxury to this flight. To compound everything the following occured. The pilot spoke to the customers explaining that he was going to wait for late arrivals. Customers were upset as there was very little time in Zurich for connecting flights. We waited 45 minutes whereby the latecomers arrived! It took another 15 minutes for the flight to take off. This of course left no time in Zurich for the connecting filghts. Hours delays resulted by transferring to different airports. When approached Swiss Air administration said that it was as a result of ATC, a downright lie as all of the flyers would attest too. When will these Airlines be truthful and look after their customers who have paid out in inormate amount of money for the travel?

title: WAS HARASSED BY SWISS AIR STAFF AT ZURICH AIRPORT
review_text:
Was harassed at the airport of Zurich, insulted and humiliated in front of 171 ppl. by Air Swiss staff about checking my luggage. I WAS THE ONLY ONE ASKED AMONG ALL PASSENGERS.... 
Tried to communicate with customer support in order to share my abominable experience and the only answer I got was "oops we are sorry"...
Terrible, terrible airline.

title: Swiss Airlines are the worst!!!
review_text: Swiss Airlines customer service is the worst!!!! I have spoken to 8 agents today to simply reserve seats. Every agent has made an error. Two of the agents hung up on me. I demanded to speak to a supervisor several times, and they refused to connect me to one. I am so upset and aggravated. I can't believe they get away with this behavior. I reserved 4 seats $35 √ó 2 and $14 √ó 2, and they are charging me $168.  The total should be $98. All of their employees are idiots!!! I travel all the time and have never had an issue with other airlines. Never again with Swiss Airlines!!! ü§¨

title: No food after being ordered with bad attitude about it
review_text:
Absolutely terrible flight. I'm so frustrated and livid. I specifically called into Swiss Airlines the 9am the morning of our 22:40pm flight to ask for vegan meals for both my son and I. Time for good on the flight and the crew have no note of it. So one crew member asks me what is the difference with vegetarian and vegan, I then explain no dairy, eggs or honey. She comes back with the below for my 7 year old son and myself who is pregnant, to share. No cutlery, ice cold, and it's not vegan it's got cheese all on the top which makes me think if they can give me that as a 'vegan' meal then it's probably cooked with butter too. This they apparently scrapped together from first and business class. So I told him, now more frustrated and starving so they took it away. My son had an apple and banana for dinner, I had a pear and a kiwi fruit and a small quinoa salad they salvaged from somewhere.

Breakfast time hits, as they coming past serving everyone, the young gentlemen says they will look what's left over in first and business class when they don't serving. We've just landed, about to get off the plane and no one returned, not even with a piece of fruit for breakfast for us.

The attitude given was if I was an issue for them and its not their problem. I was just told, well sorry I have no note. So I said we'll that's a company problem, not mine cos I specifically phoned in to make sure we have food.

This is a long 24 hour journey for us in total.

This is an shocking. First time with Swiss Airlines and I'm not impressed. 

Booking VO6J6M

title: Very good
review_text: We flew Swiss Air back to Bangkok on Business class. The check-in was very fast and we enjoy very nice Swiss Lounge at airport. The seat was nice and spacious (for us). The food was OK but not good taste as we expected. The service by cabin staff was excellent. We enjoy some good sleep.

title: Excellent
review_text: We flew Swiss Air for the very first time and also the first time with Premium Economy class. The check-in was smooth and the flight was a little delay. The seat was very nice and we enjoy our privacy and comfort. Ther service by cabin attendants was excellent and the food was good. We also enjoy Swiss Air's snack service for all premium and economy class passengers with sandwich, chocolate bar, mineral water etc. We also tried cabin WIFI service which is OK but not cheap.  The flight was smooth and we arrived Zurich only 10 miutes late.

title: Avoid at all costs
review_text: If the Swiss are known for their time keeping the memo didn‚Äôt pass to Swissair. Rude and unhelpful staff who didn‚Äôt seem to care about their passengers. Half the plane didn‚Äôt make the connecting flight due to delays which saw little to no effort in trying to get us to our location. You might as well walk!

title: LOST LUGGAGE AND ZERO SUPPORT
review_text: Swiss Air firstly has no customer service what so ever regarding lost luggage or customer being stranded. After 72 hours of calling every number on their website and getting the worst verbal support mixed with nightmare chat bots seems to be designed to force or frustrate you to give up. Sadly my bags contained visa's for children in China and now i have no option that to follow my airtag back to Zurich after coming to Nepal and beg the airport/ airline to help. I will spend the rest of my life trying to inform everyone i know to never fly swiss. never.

title: I have felt so scammed in years..
review_text:
I arrived at check in, and hostess randomly starts checking different luggages. As I had 9 kilos together with my laptop backpack they made me pay 70eur for excess!!!!!!

This is just fk ridiculous. I am not flying again. It was so random the check that I even felt ashamed by the rude guy attending.

title: Totally bizarre
review_text: Missed the first flight of a return ticket due to illness. Booked a new flight on another day, but the airline cancelled my return ticket with no warning, email or explanation. When I could eventually get through to them on the phone (they are *always* experiencing high call volumes and long waits) the agent was rude and unhelpful. I offered to buy a new ticket, but they refused and said that the only way to buy a new ticket for a flight the next day was to go to the airport in person! Apparently they can‚Äôt even sell new tickets for their own flights. This was despite the ticket for the seat I had already paid for still being available on their website! These days we all understand that airlines are little better than scammers, but they wouldn‚Äôt even let me pay for a new ticket on a half empty flight. After five years as a regular customer I was left baffled, but at least I know I will save plenty of money flying with other airlines from now on.

title: Horrible Treatment
review_text:
Who thinks that everything connected with switzerland must be excellent is really wrong. My todays connecting flight from Zurich to Tampa has been cancelled 40 min after I checked in at Berlin airport. There was no alternative proposed at that time. We were a group of 3 and refused under those circumstances to take the first portion of the flight. We were already behind the security check and our luggage had to be unloaded from the plane. So far so good. But then we got our new connection. First they separated our group into 2 different flights but that‚Äôs not all: even in two different days. One tomorrow and one the day after tomorrow.
I was with customer service one hour on the phone but they were not willing to change anything so we could fly together on the same day. 
In my opinion this was a very disappointing attitude from Swiss in Zurich. It was their fault that the flight is not operating but they were not willing to move one step to compensate this disaster. They can be sure that I will die them for 3x 600‚Ç¨ indemnification.

title: SWISS Air: Tricking you at Check-in, to meet quota
review_text:
Swiss are a joke. Can't book extra luggage online, have call (hahaha!). Same for my bike bag, said I have to just come to airport and see when I get there - what!? So I just have to hope when I come to the airport that I can bring my bike?! And if not, do I catch the flight and dump my bag at the airport? Or do I go home and lose money on the entire trip? These guys are operating like its 1999! 

Also, on another trip, I checked my bag in and my hand luggage was also checked. All was ok. I walked 10 meters from the check-in desk and two SWISS Air staff were waiting around the corner, stopping many people who just checked in their luggage. They picked up my luggage and said it was too heavy. They sent many BACK to the check-in desk, to check-in my hand luggage.  This was INCREDIBLY frustrating because my initial checked baggage was BELOW the required weight and I could have easily transferred weight from my carry-on to my checked luggage. YET Swiss Air sneakily decided to let people through and then wait until AFTER they checked in their luggage before sending them back to pay again for checked luggage.

AND they treated me like a criminal throughout the process because my hand luggage was over the weight. yet their staff had just approved it. It is like they were working as a team trick people to earn more coin / meet the quota of a clearly failing Airline Company. TERRIBLE way to run a business guys.  TERRIBLE way to treat customers. If I can, I will avoid SWISS Air for the rest of my life.

title: Bad customer service
review_text: wanted to treat ourselves for good seats for extra $300. we never received them, got seats near the toilet, 10 rows behind that was like hell. upon sending a complaint we never received relevant reply accept that we got the seats we reserved. quite amazing how facts are not a factor. for the documents backup sent they never replied. untrusted airline, and definitely not customer oriented. will try to avoid them in the future!

title: Not what they used to be
review_text: Swiss used to be one of the top airlines in the world. Well, not anymore. There is an attitude all over the place. No idea why. They've lost my baggage. They don't have a phone number for support in the US (!). I had to call multiple times in Zurich, wake up at 5.00 AM in the morning to catch them, only to tell me that they can't find the baggage.

title: Worst customerservice ever!
review_text: The flight was delayed from the origin destination, so we had to wait 1h at the airport, 45min in the airplane without getting water. Then they had 1 person in the transit desk to get 30 people New flights and transit hotels... And there where 3-4 person behind the desks not doing anything.? I would not reccomand this airline!

title: Dont fly SWISS!
review_text:
Horrible service ! Allowed 8kg luggage, but no laptop bag. Laptop bag too big (<.5kg), therefore the hostess Shouts with aggressive tone on confused flyers to check in the luggage. Finally when giving feedback, threatens to throw you out of the flight. To make matters worse, there is no lock on hand luggage. 

Flying domestic and international since last 17 years, never witnessed such unprofessionalism.

title: experience long haul
review_text: for business class it was pretty cramped (I'm average height and width)  - I think the aircraft was a 777 - certainly much less room than on Etihad - next to no storage space and the seat configuration meant that (with a window seat) I had to disturb my neighbor several times. The toilet was somewhat smaller than on other airlines.  The cabin crew were pleasant and professional enough although the female cabin crew definitely looked like they would rather be elsewhere! The food - starters were really excellent - top quality - but my main course was very average. Entertainment - limited choices but adequate, and the headphones were pretty good. So overall, very average - and, but for the price, I would choose another airline. But it was the cheapest!

title: Worst airline
review_text: Zero quality for service, awful aircraft and extreme mishandling of suitcases. They almost broke my new suitcase and they only give you a water on a 2.30 hour flight. And all that for 350 euros

title: Seating is terrible
review_text: Do not bother to pay for preferred seating. The seats are incredibly small, spacing between seats is worse than many economy airlines. They are cramming every passenger they can into the cabin, comfort be damned. Attached photo shows the seat in front of me, I'm holding the phone 3 inches from my chest.

title: Worst Customer Service
review_text:
Swiss used to be a top level airline many years ago. However in the last few years their customer service has declined significantly. You just scan through the feedbacks here on TripAdvisor and see how many people complain.
For my flight booking, they made a mistake, which can happen. But when I called their priority line, they just said they cannot do anything. No apology, nothing. Flying Business Class and being a Senator member I would expect a bit more client orientation. It is very simple, just some nice words of apology would make the difference.

The difference to middle eastern and Asian airlines is getting bigger and more and more people will not fly with the once top Swiss airline, what a pity‚Ä¶

title: Cheap customer care. They don‚Äôt even have good food or they don‚Äôt give u a second round of whiskey. So cheap
review_text: The tocket cost as much as other airlines do. What I saw is cheap products. No second drinks. No good food. On top of all highly arrogant crew. This is the 4 th flight I took and I had a consistent experience. I may not travel again. If u guys want to learn how to treat a customer Middle East airways, American or the Indian airlines. Never ever Swiss in my life

title: Not customer friendly services
review_text:
I was planning to travel to San Fransisco but unfortunately I lost one of my closest family member so I needed to change my plan.
The ticket was not refundable but rebook-able. My original ticket price was 800 CHF.
After 1,5 week daily calls with the customer service I submitted all of the official document about the lost family member.
Finally, they come up with the solution I need to pay 300CHF for changing fee and the rebooking charge is 1200 CHF.
In this case I am not only lost 800CHF but I'd need to pay plus 1500CHF for a new flight ticket.
Thanks swiss air line I'll avoid to use you in the future!

title: Second time in a row my Swiss flight is overbooked
review_text: This is the second time in a row my Swiss flight is overbooked. When I asked how many passengers are in stand by the answer was ‚Äúnot many‚Äù. Last time I had to flight through two different cities to get to the end destination. Let‚Äôs see where they send me this time‚Ä¶

title: Racist attitude on Swiss airlines
review_text: Nice comfortable airliner, but the staff act racist, once going to Zurich and twice going back to San Francisco the air hostess ignored me and even seemed to be upset when I asked for a sandwich after being ignored, I filed a complaint and  almost 2 months later have not heard back. That‚Äôs probably their attitude towards dark skinned people

title: Class flight start to finish
review_text:
From booking to actual flight excellent service from start to finish. Originally booked Business Class at half the cost of Emirates and BA. Then upgraded return very cheaply, finally upgrading outward trip to First via the bidding process. My tip only bid what you can afford. On their bid grading it told me was fair not good or excellent but still won. So we ended up in row 1 for not too much money.

First part was using Helvetic from Manchester. Our Embraer 195 was very comfortable. Business class row 3 gave us 2 seats each. The food was a strange mix of vegetable omelette plus cheese and yoghurt but very tasty. Cabin crew very attentive and friendly. We departed 30 late arriving 20 late in Zurich.
Then the plus of First kicked in. Met by staff with private mini bus just for us as Helvetic flight arrived opposite side of airfield to the E gates for Dubai. Escorted to the departure level. As we were a little late straight to the gate where we were group 1 to board. First on the aircraft. Everything you do is VIP.

Onto the Dubai flight a Boing 330. Turn left and it‚Äôs your what seems like a private jet. Huge seats, large area of personal space. Massive tv screen. Top class champagne and warm nuts soon as seated. Personal service by the cabin staff throughout was top notch. On realising it was my wife‚Äôs birthday she received a gift and a card signed by all including the pilots. 
Top tip pre order main meal before flight to get bigger choice. Food was excellent on china. Never ending drinks , try the Swiss red , awesome.
Great choice of films.
Free Wi-Fi up to 50mb included plus fast track everywhere eg immigration 

All in all can‚Äôt fault Swiss at all. Use again at this level

title: Horrible Service - Avoid at all costs!
review_text:
This was our first and last time flying Swiss Air. 
The service on both of our flights was horrible and both phone agents and check-in agents were very unsure of basic procedures like seat assignments and checking bags.  The water was not working in one of the lavatories so no way to wash your hands unless you went to another one.  The breakfast we received consisted of yogurt and a small roll.  The seats in the economy cabin recline so far back that if the person in front of your decides to recline their seat you literally have their setback in your lap and face!  On our flight back from Zurich to Chicago after lunch was served the flight attendants closed the curtains at the back of the cabin and we were told we could not use the two back lavatories or go to the back to stand and stretch.  As a result the entire economy class was forced to use only two lavatories located at the front of economy class.  We figured out that the flight attendants were on break so they did not want anyone coming to the back of the cabin,  This lasted for well over an hour.  Only having two lavatories for an entire full economy class section is ridiculous.  The flight attendants only come back after a meal to collect refuse.  There was a cocktail napkin on the floor in the aisle and I watched flight attendants pass by for over two hours without bothering to pick it up.  
 My spouse and I had to pay extra for reserved seats just to be able to even sit together.  Was told no more $35 seats were available so had to pay $57 per seat.  The seating chart online showed many available seats in economy class.  When I called a few days before our flight the agent said we were booked in two middle seats for one of our flights, not the aisle and window seats that were originally confirmed.  The agent said she would move us back to or original seats (aisle and window) and send an email confirm.  We never received the email so had to call back again and found out we were still in 2 middle seats.  At the airport it took 25 minutes to check in with an agent due to the fact we had an extra bag we had to pay for and the agent could not figure out how to do this as we were part of a group.  The same thing happened on our flight back home.  Checking an extra bag is $100.  On our return flight the check-in agent told us there electronic payment system was not working so she had to call in our credit card number over the phone.  This took a long time and since the security line was long were barely made our flight.  
Our two friends had also booked economy class seats but they were crammed into middle seats in the last row of the business class section,  The last two rows of the business class section were economy class seats yet almost all of the business class seats were empty.  So they had the delight of watching the few business class customers receive a much nicer meal.  At one point during our flight my friend and I went to the back of the plane to stand and stretch.  A flight attendant quickly told us we "could not congregate" since the flight was heading to the United States and we were told to return to our seats.  On a flight that is over 9 nines long it is quite unacceptable not to permit someone to stand and stretch for a few minutes.  Avoid flying Swiss Air at all costs!  This the worst service we have ever had in many years of flying!

title: Very bad customer service
review_text: Impossible to reach. It‚Äôs been months I‚Äôve been told I‚Äôll be refunded in less than a week. The refund service can‚Äôt be reached via email, neither using the app and when I call, nobody will follow up. It‚Äôs a shame!

title: Horrible service on board.
review_text:
After 3h consumption of Remy Martix XO really good cognac with my wife in 1st class, we were declined of further alcohol serving, without any reasons, our condition was perfect, and behaviour as well. Just no reasons. 

the way steward team acted to us, lead to total misunderstanding, horror atmosphere and totally discomfort, 

I paid tenth of thousand EUR + for tickets, and for my money filled myself in as a fool, gaining red eyes . 

flight for me is a certain ceremony, which I appreciate and respect, for example I don't need any alcohol after sleep or before ending etc. 

For me this ceremony was totally broken during the mentioned flight, without any reason, or any sign from my side! Just based on  baseless prejudices and offensive assumptions

If Swiss have some official limit of consumption of alcohol in first class, Swiss should publish it officially on a website, what are criterias, based on weight and passenger gender? 

or if Swiss don't have, and the criteria is good passenger condition - let 1st class passengers go in a straight line or spell alphabet, like police in the USA do? 

In dubio pro reo principe was totally spoiled by Swiss team, 

I filled like a 1st class hostage on board, I filled like a boy, or student, that reached 1st class cabin accidentally, although this is my 15th flight in 1st class with Star Alliance... 

it's all very disgusting and disgusting, does not correspond to any level, I don't know what to compare with

The most wrecked situation became surrealistic, when a really drunk passenger from another 1st class seat started yelling standing over our seats, and woke my wife from sleep and the team did nothing without accenting the situation... 

There were a lot of other signs of non-professional service on board, but let's stay on what we had.

title: Amazing experience
review_text:
It was our first time flying with Swiss Air and it was by far the best experience flying my family has had. Plesant helpful staff, the pilot kept us updated on everything, the plane was immaculate. Complementary bottles of water & chocolate for everyone and sweets for the kids. 
Just fabulous experience.

title: I never got my luggage back
review_text:
Upon arriving at Heathrow Airport London, their luggage team Global Baggage Solutions and Swiss International Airlines refused to handover my own luggage. They said they have my luggage in their hand but refused to see me or give me access to receive the luggage myself. I waited at the airport for hours, and my only communication method with them was via airport telephone. I asked the Swiss airline staff to help me at the reception but they refused to help me and pushed blame on Global Baggage Solutions. Global Baggage Solutions later pushed blame on Swiss Airlines. I was forced to go home and have never ever seen my luggage again, despite endless emails and phone calls to their departments. Not a single person has taken up responsibility to do a simple search for my luggage. It's a nightmare! I have asked the simple question many times: Where do all lost luggages get sent to? They have repeatedly ignored and refused to answer this question.
The whole organisation is extremely unprofessional and have ruined mine and many lives. Please avoid flying with Swiss Airline at all costs!

title: Absolute the worst overall. THE WORST
review_text:
Absolutely the worst overall. THE WORST

Food, Entertainment, Service, Prices, everything is the worst of any airline. And something that beast even that, are the seats. It is so horrible. They should go out of business immediately. Arrogant, dumb, just stupid people. Every single person who flies it is telling the same, I've heard it every single time from every person. 

DO NOT FLY SWISS

title: Worst custemer service ever
review_text: Difficult to contact, no answering mails, false information, very unfriendly, totaly disappointed, very bad cost/ preformance ratio!!!!!!!

title: Lost our Baggage
review_text:
Honestly super disappointed in this airline. 

My husband and I landed in Ireland 4 days ago and were told they lost our luggage. We were told the first night that we would receive our luggage and a confirmation email would be sent to us the next day, which never happened. 
 
On day two we were told it would be "expedited" to our hotel at 10 pm, and again it did not happen. The next day we were told whoever we spoke to was misinformed and you do not have an expedite option. We were then given multiple phone numbers which were either out of service or invalid. 
 
Today, we were finally contacted by one of your Couriers via a man named Eduardo and informed our luggage would be out for delivery today. We left our vacation spot with family to drive home, and it has been 5 hours and no luggage has arrived.
 
Now, none of the couriers are answering their phones and we still have no luggage. It is 9pm. This has negatively impacted our trip, time with family, caused us to spend excess money to buy utilities we packed in our luggage and it is completely unacceptable. 
 

Thanks to Swiss International Air Lines we missed out on hours of family time and experiences and have wasted money buying things we did not need originally because we had packed them.

title: Won't Give Me My New Flights - Even Though I Paid For Them
review_text:
I paid for my flights to be changed to Swiss. They sent me a confirmation email saying that they have been changed. However ever since the customer service has been terrible. Every time I call asking for my flight EMD, they say they can't see my new flights. Even though I have paid and have the confirmation email. 

The vast majority of the customer service people hang up on me, because they can't be bothered. And the ones that do end up finding information about my new flights promise to send me the EMD in 72 hours and it never comes. I have honestly called them about 40 times and also sent numerous emails. All I want is information about my new flights but they can't seem to be able to provide it, or they won't. NEVER USE THIS AIRLINE, APPALLING CUSTOMER SERVICE, THEY JUST TAKE YOUR MONEY AND IGNORE YOU AFTERWARDS

title: Shouldn't be your first choice airline
review_text:
Previous long haul flights I've taken luftansa. Swiss is owned by luftansa so you would think similar service. The planes are similar interior, basic nothing fancy but luftansa is much more comfortable. The swiss flight from BCN to Zurich was smooth and no problems other than it was extremely windy during landing but the pilot did a great job. 

At the gate once in Zurich there was much miscommunication about what they wanted us to get stamped prior to boarding, multiple passengers were confused by their lack of communication. 

Previously I paid to upgrade my seats for my flight from Zurich to SFO once at check in they printed our tickets and the seats were separated and different than my original ones, I informed the front desk employee who seemed extremely overwhelmed she fixed it but upon boarding I realized the seats were still separated. Lucky no one was sitting next to me so my spouse could sit with me for our 12 hour flight. 

During the flight the seats were much less comfortable than other airlines I've been on. The wifi was not unlimited and even for $60 still not unlimited is ridiculous. Food was basic chicken or pasta. The flight attendant for our section, he was very impatient with everyone and rude commentary. 

For the price of the flight definitely look at other airlines.

title: Post pandemic airlines games update
review_text:
Well just a quick update on our Swiss Air experience. It was problematic from start to finish. Multiple delays on both the outward and return flights. 

Ground crew at Zurich were simply rude. 

On the return the aircraft broke down and had to be replaced,  and after listening to quite a few others who'd been bumped off flights, sent to Zurich from other destinations, they were at their wits end..

Never again!

title: Awful customer service experience and unresolved issue
review_text:
I originally purchased business class tickets through United Airlines on September 25, 2022 for an international trip from Chicago to Cairo and back. After checking the confirmation, I saw that we were assigned to economy class for the Zurich to Cairo flight operated by Swiss (LX238 on Friday, March 10, 2023 departing Zurich at 12:25pm and arriving in Cairo at 5:20pm). When I contacted United, they explained that the booking was a mixed cabin booking

So, I purchased upgraded seats to business class for Flight LX238 directly through Swiss Airlines on January 14, 2023 for $460 per passenger; I have confirmation documents of the upgrade purchases, I was able to pick seats in business class, and have already been charged by Swiss for these upgrades. Since then, I have called Swiss many times to confirm the upgrade, was repeatedly told by Swiss it was confirmed, and the upgrades were reflected on both the Swiss and United Portals. 

I wanted to make sure everything was set for our flights, so I logged into the United Portal on 2/28/23 and saw that the Zurich to Cairo flight was no longer listed on my portal; I checked through the Swiss Portal and saw that the flight was not on that itinerary either. 

I called the Swiss reservations number at 833-626-0737 and spoke to the reservation agent Rose; she said the flight was removed from our itinerary because the flight time changed from Zurich to Cairo, so she reissued the Zurich to Cairo ticket but booked us back into economy class - the flight number, time and aircraft was the same exact as when we purchased the upgrade. When I explained to Rose that I purchased upgrades to business class, she said she could not help us and to contact Swiss technical support. I asked to speak to the manager/supervisor and was told that the supervisor is not available at this time and to call back to speak to a manager and I can instead email customer.relations@swiss.com

I called Swiss technical support at 855-839-4499 and spoke to support team member Zain. He told us he is able to see confirmation of the upgrade purchases but he cannot change the ticket class because this can only be done by a reservation agent. Zain was able to make a note/memo in the reservation regarding the upgrade so that when an agent opened the reservation, they could see the purchase for the upgrade and told me to call the reservation agent again to have them manually associate the upgrade to the ticket. 

I called the Swiss reservation number again, and this time was connected with reservation agent JoJo who told me that United needs to reissue the ticket and upgrade so I would have to contact United. I asked to speak to manager, but was told they are not in. 

I called United and spoke to agent JoAnne, who told me that Swiss did not process the upgrade and left the ticket unsynced. Agent JoAnn from United confirmed all legs of our flights and connected us to Swiss in order to get our upgrade for the Zurich to Cairo flight. 

This time around, we spoke to agent Tamra from Swiss; Tamara told us that she cannot issue the upgrade (from Zurich to Cairo) because the flight from Chicago to Zurich has been changed and we are not confirmed on it, so she sent me back to United.  

I spoke to United agent Mike, who says we are indeed confirmed on UA Flight 3 departing from Chicago at 3:55pm on March 9 and both he and I can see this confirmed on the United Portal and Swiss Portal. He told me that Swiss has to process the upgrade for the Zurich to Cairo flight as this flight is operated by Swiss. 

I called Swiss back again, and spoke to agent Ray. This agent told me that the Zurich to Cairo aircraft was changed so we were booked onto the different aircraft but into economy class, and that in order to upgrade to business class, I would have to pay an additional $540 per passenger. I asked if I could apply the payment I already made of $460 per passenger and pay the difference of $80 per passenger, but she said no. When asked about getting a refund on the original upgrade I purchased, I was told it would cancel our entire trip so I can't request a refund until after the trip is completed. I asked if I could at least choose seats for economy class, and Ray told me I have to pay to pick seats. When I asked to speak to a manager or supervisor, Ray refused to allow me to speak to them saying that the manager cannot help. Ultimately, I paid the fee to pick seats in economy class  --- this was already in addition to the $460 per passenger I paid back on January 14, 2023 for business class. Only after I paid to pick our seats in economy class did Ray say she can now connect me to a manager, put me on a brief hold and then said the manager is not picking up the phone. Looking at this supposed aircraft change - it‚Äôs the same exact aircraft as before. 

The whole reason I purchased business class tickets is because I am 22 weeks pregnant and I wanted to be comfortable and have space given how long the flights are. Had I not checked the portals, we would have not known that the flight was even removed from our itinerary --- what would have happened, were we just expected to land in Zurich and then be told sorry we don't have you booked for the next leg of your journey? Then, when I tried to get my upgrade honored, I was told 4 different things by 4 different Swiss agents, I was not able to get my upgrade honored, and instead had to pay an additional fee on top of the upgrade I already paid for business all to just pick a seat in economy class. You can imagine how extremely frustrating this entire experience has been. 

Obviously there were errors made: flight was removed from our itinerary with out any notification, when I called to ask I was told it was because the ‚Äútime changed‚Äù and was reissued tickets for economy class by your agents instead of business, then was told it was because we were ‚Äúnot confirmed on the original departing flight,‚Äù and then it wad the ‚Äúaircraft changed‚Äù and would have to pay again to purchase a new business class upgrade. None of these errors were on my end - and now I am being left to deal with the issue through no fault of my own, with little or no valuable help from your agents or any reasonable solution. This needs to be fixed.

I also emailed Swiss at the email address I was provided but received a return email "address not found." 

Extremely disappointing experience.

title: I will never use Swiss Air Again
review_text: I booked via Swiss Air on United from Denver Colorado to Hurghada Egypt. My new Swiss profile requires a salutation of either Mr or Mrs. I chose Mr. Additionally Swiss asked for titles Including Dr. I chose Dr. and Booked and booked my flights, United to Zurich, Swiss Air to HRG arriving Thursday and return flights. Well, when United scanned my passport for check-in, I was rejected. The reason being my passport name did not match my ticketed name from Swiss. Swiss ran the salutations into my name making "Richard" into "Richardmrdr". I called United who said Swiss needed to fix the error, or I would not be issued a boarding pass. I appealed to TSA who told me the ticked name and the passport name must match exactly. "Richard" does not match "Richardmrdr". United was unable to make the name change because the reservation came from Swiss. Swiss said there should not be a problem...and I quote... "we will let you on our plane." Of course, but I have to get through security and United ticketing in Denver, before I can get on your damn plane in Zurich! don't I? After additional hours on the phone with Swiss they determined they simply could not make the change. I would have to go to the Swiss office at the airport, but DIA does not have a Swiss office. The Lufthansa agent at the airport was not at all helpful, in fact he was quite rude. So, the change could not be made by him either. My flight was from DEN  to HRG. As neither Swiss Air, Lufthansa or United can correct the error made by Swiss I was unable to make my SCUBA trip to the Red Sea. Now I am trying to get a refund for my missed vacation. Wish me luck.

title: Not great .. I‚Äôd look for an alternative
review_text:
Y review is a bit mixed.  Firstly the seating arrangement is odd, some seats are quite good, but others are poor as there isn‚Äôt the full business class type seats.  I had a poor one and my wife got the good one.   The configuration is strange and it‚Äôs a lucky dip.  Once you get the seat int9 bed mode, it‚Äôs not that comfy .. not sure why but just didn‚Äôt feel great.

Service was very average the staff were not that attentive and appeared a little disinterested, maybe they were on the back of another long haul, but that‚Äôs not my problem.  Food was average for business class.

Overall, a bit disappointing for the money and I won‚Äôt be doing Swiss again.

title: Very average business class product
review_text:
Lounge catering in Zurich reviewed in  brief...In my opinion the food and beverage selection was scant and what was on offer was low quality. The wines were an absolute budget selection and not a crumb of cheese in sight...quite a miserable offering to be honest.
Food on board...The selection and catering was awful. I actually left my flight hungry on the return sector from Zurich, because I found the food on offer to be sub standard. 
Business class seating on the European sector...this product is no better than economy class, even a premium economy seat would be better.
Having to pay extra for a single seat selection in the business cabin is laughable and with extra seats and rows crammed in the business cabin is overcrowded. 
I have flown 100's of business class sectors on a large variety of airlines and I would rank Swiss in the bottom quartile if I ranked them all. 
First and last time on Swiss for me, as there are plenty carriers that value their customers enough to provide a solid product.

title: RUDE, RACIST, HORRIBLE Customer Service especially if you‚Äôre Asian
review_text:
It‚Äôs so sad that the flagship airline of Switzerland is horrible when it comes to customer service. Switzerland is one of the best country I went to so far but I just had a horrible experience with this airline. Their phone agents didn‚Äôt finalized my booking so I have to pay an exorbitant fee on the day of my departure. I called them a day before to confirm my ticket and I was assured that I just need to show up at the ticketing counter and I‚Äôm good to go. The day of the departure, my hunch was right I don‚Äôt have a ticket so I have to pay the rebooking fee for that day. The male ticket agent and their supervisors were racist and rude. They would not looked and acknowledge me and they made me wait. When they talked to me, they made me feel that I was stupid. The lady at the check
In counter at that time was the only person who was nice. 

Horrible horrible customer service. Choose other airlines when visiting Switzerland.

title: New premium economy
review_text:
Just for home In This new service
Fabulous great food great seat
Plane so clean
Staff amazing 
Beats Singapore Airlines by miles 
Can‚Äôt say enough absolutely fabulous 
Nevertheless fly anything else it was amazing

title: WORST COMPANY
review_text:
This is more than 10 years I use frequently airlines company to go back to Europe . Swiss is the WORST. 
They don‚Äôt recognize their errors and treat extremely badly their customers . Never spend a dollar with them they are extremely unprofessional

title: Very rude proudful attendant checking us in
review_text: In 30+ years I have never had at checkin someone ask to take our carryon bags inspect them on the opposite side of the counter and then say they were 1kg overweight and that we could not bring them on. She said this with a rude telling. Gave our passports back as if we could not fly.

title: WAS TREATED LIKE A CRIMINAL AT NEW DELHI AIRPORT
review_text:
Today my fiance was turned away at the Swiss Airlines check-in in New Delhi airport. He was traveling from New Delhi to San Jose to meet me, we haven't seen each other in 3 years due to my lung issues and long waiting time on USA visa. 

During check-in they took his papers and said that they needed to verify them with the Swiss Embassy Representative. He brought my Costa Rica visa-stamped passport, police background check, accommodations, proof of USA K1 visa status just in case, everything!

The embassy rep looked at his papers, said "this is bs" to each and every page, questioned why he was going, asked him how much money he had (he had to show him credit cards), mocked him when he said the USA visa had been taking 2 years because immigration is running slow, told him there must be some issue, asked him why his checkin bag was 16kg instead of 23kg, then said "I don't believe your story" and said "leave the airport". My fiance begged him to allow him to produce any document that may convince him like a letter from my USA-based attorney, etc. He said he wasn't interested in talking and that I was not allowed to travel. 

They proceeded to threaten me with banning him from traveling again to any country unless I exited the airport.

THIS IS THE VILEST, DISCRIMINATORY, HORRENDOUS treatment him and I have ever received!!!!!. We are both distraught, crying on the phone, we lost thousands of dollars in bookings and Swiss Airlines says they DON'T TAKE RESPONSIBILITY for it. 

This airline and these people need to go out of business with the way they are treating innocent people who just want to see each other.

title: Tiny seats, nice flight attendants, unspeakably bad food
review_text:
OK, an exception to the bad food (mushy pasta with mushy peas) is the little slab of Gruy√®re, and the chocolate.

But where did they find this plane? The seats were teensy and - get this - the armrests in coach don‚Äôt go all the way up. Never seen that before (and no, none of the 7 of us flying were anywhere near an exit row).

The entertainment system doesn‚Äôt support such modern inventions as Bluetooth headphones - nor does it support wired headphones. They hand out those goofy ones (circa 1975) with the airplane-only headphone jack and dreadful sound. 

Nice flight attendants whose first pass through the cabin was to hand out bottles of water.

title: Met Expectations
review_text: To get from Rome to Serbia we had to go via Zurich. The flights were only about 1 hr 45 min each so there was no meals served so cannot comment on those. We were provided with chocolate and water which for such a short flight was fine. Service was efficient and friendly. At Rome we had a check in staff member that was actually smiling and making jokes with us. What a change.  As with all airlines getting on board and settled is always a problem but no worse then any other. They do need to reinforce the size limit on carry on luggage. The only real downside of the flights was that the flight from Rome to Zurich needs more toilets. There was only 2 toilets for the whole of economy class.

title: Boarding pass mess
review_text:
For some unexplained reason we could not get our boarding pass via the app for this early morn flight. We also found others in the same mess.
Otherwise an uneventful connecting flight from LHR to BCN via Zurich.

title: Worst two long haul business class flights in decades. Will never fly 777-300s again,
review_text:
Flew Business Class on 777-300 planes from Singapore to Z√ºrich and then changed planes to fly from Zurich to the U.S. 

While Swiss is more favorite non-U.S. carrier, both flights were awful relative to aircraft and service. A few highlights:

Seats are very uncomfortable. They do not lie flat. Cushions are weak.  Controls are limited and placed near where you easily press one by accident. Storage near or under seats is very limited, hard to find a place for shoes or a purse nearby. 

The SIN-ZRH plane was not very clean and smelled. The other aircraft seemed very new, and was clean, but my seat did not adjust downward as much as my companion; poor construction and quality checking. Washrooms were like in Economy.

Meals and beverages reflected cost-cutting, and I‚Äôve flown Swiss business for decades. Cheap new plastic trays are used, limited refills were offered, galley snacks on these long-flights were popcorn or crisps in small bags and a few small candy bars. Wines and liquors appeared downgraded, as were the menus. Meat was tough, and sides had to elan. Deserts were ordinary. 

Service was abysmal. First meal on a 10 hour flight was served three hours after departure. My companion ordered sherbet from a menu, was given ice cream even though both were on the menu. When asked to exchange, she was told there was no sherbet. I was served 10 minutes  later and received from a different attendant sherbet, and I asked for ice cream. This server told me there was no ice cream. Someone lied orbwasnlazy to care. And two people sitting together in center seats were served a long time apart.

Cabin crew was not friendly, but the ZRH ground crew wins a bad conduct prize. The gate attendant turned to a colleague, rolled her eyes and said softly to her colleague ‚ÄúAmericans‚Äù.

title: Untrustworthy company
review_text: My flight was from Athens to Amsterdam via Zurich with SWISS. The waiting time in Zurich was one hour and although we had a delay in departure from Athens, we made it to board the flight from Zurich to Amsterdam. When I arrived in Amsterdam, I received a message that "unfortunately my baggage could not be loaded on the flight to Amsterdam". A vague formulation, as if it was someone else's fault and not SWISS's, and of course I was not offered an apology either. When I reported the baggage to Amsterdam airport, I was informed that the baggage would be on the next flight that evening (after 3-4 hours). However, I could not wait because I was going to miss the last train to Groningen and asked for the baggage to be brought to my hotel. They informed me that the transfer could be done after one or two days!!!! After my strong protests and constant phone calls, that besides my clothes I also have the medication for a serious disease in it, I was informed that they would finally deliver my suitcase the next day from afternoon to evening. And despite my request to have it brought to me earlier, SWISS refused as I was informed by the transport company that delivered my suitcase.

title: Terrible customer service for flight rebooking
review_text: My flight back to Singapore got delayed so I needed to change my flight with Swiss Air from Singapore to Zurich. The website showed $460 for rebooking but did not allow me to proceed. I had to call customer service - took me 12 phone calls on international roaming over 5 hours to change a simple flight. They wanted to charge me 5-6 times the amount quoted and kept hanging up the call. My last call was 55 mins simply to push back the flight by a few hours. Despite telling the staff I‚Äôm on international call, she pit me on hold 15-20 mins at a time, i could hear her chatting and laughing to colleagues when I was on hold (she forgot to put the hold music on). I ended paying nearly $1000 on roaming fee, more than double what the original rebooking fee would have been, and wasted 5 hours as even when they said it has been sorted, no confirmation cane through for me to call back and found out nothing has been booked. I wrote to them afterwards to submit a formal complaint and was told they believe my issue had already been dealt with satisfactorily. Absolutely the worst experience I have ever received. Shame it is a national carrier with no sense of pride not service. I cannot imagine how many people who had had to bear a new flight cost in phone bill for their service (or lack thereof) not mentioning the various attempts to increase pricing any where from $900 to $3000 on rebooking fare difference depending on who I talk to. Utterly disappointing!

title: Awful airline. Avoid at all cost
review_text: They over booked 10+ passengers and kicked them out of the flight. How they can so grossly mismanage their booking, one would never know. They weren't even apologetic about it. Incompetent and awful.

title: Worst Airline customer service ever
review_text:
The worst customer service of any airline I have flown with. I flew first class from New Delhi to London. The bag missed transfer from 1st to 2nd aircraft. I have a tracker tag on the bag so know it was flown into Dublin airport (I live in Ireland) on February 9th. Despite hours on the phone and many emails I have not got my bag one week after it arrived in Dublin. Don't fly Swiss. Uncaring!!
Date of experience: 09 February 2023

title: Dolphi 1920, bad experience, terrible company
review_text:
So poor and clever company. Compensation is not working. I have to choose new luggage from their shop, and prices are so high. I have to pay extra, much more, to get the same size of luggage.
Best solution is to provide to me same size of luggage, or to pay back money with same rate or to repair my damaged luggage, but they are just ignoring me.

title: worst airline ever, Avoid at all cost
review_text: My girlfriend and I were flying with swiss and got flight got cancelled and delayed. We were asked to fly from Manchester to Zurich, Zurich back to London Heathrow, and flying to Malaysia afterwards. We were promised to have our expenses in Zurich reimbursed, including hotel and food, 150 Swiss Franc per person. Yet, we have submitted our claims after the trip and Swiss rejected the claims. Not to mention they refuse to compensate anything for the delayed and cancelled flights

title: Do not take SWISS
review_text: This company has no consideration for passengers. I placed a complaint dur to a terrible flight experience and only received a generic email leaving my questions and requests unanswered. Costumer service us ZERO! To make it worst, on the return flight, the demoted me!!! Changed my premium economy seat to a regular seat.

title: Out of pocket experience
review_text:
Experienced flight delays and Swiss Airlines lost my luggage which I paid over $100.00 USD. (2 suitcases).
Two-days later I received my belongings damaged. After filing a claim two times and waiting over nearly one full month I was offered a reimbursement of EUR $41.00. 
This is a massive disappointment due to the fact I spent near US $300.00 for new clothing and now have a nonfunctional suitcase. Do better Swiss Airlines!

title: Post pandemic games
review_text:
My wife and I will be flying with Swiss for the first and last time in a few days time.

Having made a mistake by booking the wrong dates (not always easy to spot when multiple flights are proposed) I went to modify the flights to the correct dates. I accepted 70 euro per person surcharge for changing dates, selected the correct dates and noted a slight increase in the overall ticket price. Prices were displayed as a per person price making it seem a negligible change. However, on receiving my next credit card statement I was in for a shock. 

Swiss had effectively charged double the original price. At no time was the full and true total displayed on check out.

A quick call to the local Swiss support line confirmed that the price was double and no way they would accept any responsibility nor refund any difference for the tickets.

Unable to cancel (loose almost the whole fare) or change (pay another 70 euro per person) dates, I find myself paying what is approaching transatlantic flight costs to travel to Spain in February with no baggage allowance. Ridiculous.

Lets hope the in flight experience is somewhat better, at which point I might reconsider my overall rating.

title: no service
review_text: the airline changed the flight from ZRH to FRA, therefore we had to stay in the "transithotel" at airport ZRH. It is a clear ripoff. 145 Euro per night in something like a prison cell, no toilet, no window, no aircon, no seat, no bathroo, And the customer service of the airline does not answer on email, calls nothing., not availabel by phone even for premium economy. Better avoid this airline and the airport zurich

title: Zero customer service / Terrible Phone management
review_text:
DO NOT USE THIS AIRLINE!! 
We almost didn‚Äôt make it to our destination due to Swiss. 
My partner and I had a flight from London to Zurich, with a connecting flight to South Africa. 
The day of our flight we got an email saying our flight is delayed and to call them if we need info to get to our connecting flight. 
Upon calling them they tell us our flight is actually cancelled and they recommend us getting to the airport as soon as we can. 
We get there 5 hours before our old flight. When getting to the help desk they tell us our flight isn‚Äôt cancelled, they have no idea why we were told that. HOWEVER, we‚Äôve been put on different flights IN CASE it is cancelled. This is fine, but they literally put my partner and I on two completely different flights. One was direct with BA and the other was with Qatar with a 4 hour layover. The lady at help desk told us maybe we shouldn‚Äôt come a bit earlier and it would‚Äôve been easier to sort out. Who arrives more than 5 hours before their flight! 
We spent the next 4 hours on the phone to Swiss, trying to get one of us switched to the others flight so we would arrive roughly the same time at our destination. Spoke to around 6 different people, kept getting put on hold for up to 35 min, their customer service is non existent!! No one handling the phones knows anything or can help in any way! 
Awful and stressful way to travel.

title: Worst / inexistent customer service. Avoid this airline at all costs!
review_text: Worst / Inexistent customer Service. Avoid this incapable carrier at all costs! Phone numbers provided don't work. Filed a complaint in May 2022. Finally received a response in Feb 2023 after leaving countless messages at their customer feedback email address. Paid $1800 for a 'last minute' ticket from EWR-ZRH-EWR for a bereavement flight. Flight was HALF EMPTY but 'customer service' responded that ticket prices are based on distance and availability - what a joke! Again, flights were HALF EMPTY with plenty of available seats! All it was, was price gauging because their ticket pricing algorithm noticed the short term 'emergency situation'. To put insult to injury, they requested an extra $75 for one piece of luggage because fare of $1800 was only an 'economy light' fare!

title: Cancel my fight
review_text: I will never travel again again with Swiss air, costumer service very rude, I don't recommend it to anyone.

title: Worst customer service, lack of professionalism & lack of customer service
review_text:
Worst airline to have ever flown with. Lack of professionalism, expensive and lack of customer service.

1. There was flight delay with not announcement. 

2. Most expensive flight ever paid for such a short distance. There were no drinks or snacks served on board the flight too for such expensive flight.

3.  Customer service replies are very tardy and robotic with standard responses. Constant chasing for response and till date, there is no response or resolution. There is also no receipt given for flight tickets purchased despite multiple emails.

Never to fly again with such an airline that only cares about taking in money with no heart for customers.

title: Terrible after flight service -- missing baby stroller
review_text:
After departing from Copenhagen we were strangely instructed by the Swiss Air check-in staff to check our baby stroller in the oversized luggage area. This was strange as when we flew to Copenhagen with Lufthansa, we were allowed to check our stroller in as sky check luggage. 
Upon arriving in Cape Town after our trip, we only received the bottom part of our stroller and for some reason the top part had been dismantled and not shipped. We reported this immediately to the baggage claims thinking the part should return within a week or two. It has now been 58 days with no resolution. Multiple emails, phone calls and  automatic bot replies with no concrete information or date of return. During this time we had no means of transporting our 8 month old and although this seems insignificant, I can only imagine the inconvenience if the missing luggage would have been a wheelchair.
We have since posted multiple social media posts, emailed up to 5 different "customer service" agents and  no solution. 
Do not fly with Lufthansa, Swiss or Edelweiss, they have zero customer service value.

title: Not anywhere close to expectations
review_text:
One has travelled with Swiss to many destinations in Europe from India in the pre-pandemic times. Their flights used to be marked by the usual and expected Swiss efficiency and quality of service. Unfortunately, however, unless urgent steps are taken by the airline, the same may no longer be true. 

Travelling  from Zurich to Delhi on LX 146 at the end of January 2023 was not the same experience. Many counts of disappointment were present ‚Äî shared by some of the co-passengers whom one spoke to. 

The departure gate itself was a forewarning of the fight. There was mismanagement for visa verification (not sure why that practice has been put into place) with insistence on a stamp-able paper boarding pass. Many (most?) in Europe no longer print a boarding pass but carry one on their mobiles, who were required to rush and get a printed one. Aside from this, one noticed at least 3 instances of queue jumping by some privileged passengers at the instance of the airline staff (that is when separate counters existed for the higher classes of travel!). 

Boarding was the usual confusion but the aircraft was not the expected usual from Swiss. A330-300 deployed on the route was a disappointment, and is desperately in need of upgradation. The seats are cramped and uncomfortable; back support almost non-existent. Even the blanket supplied appeared to be sorely in need of replacement. 

The reappearance of at least a decade-old entertainment system did not inspire feeling of nostalgia but despair. The earphones jack worked only for one ear, no matter how much one tried to make it work and the sound was extremely poor and tinny. The touchscreen was only touch in name and browsing the list of videos was an exercise in patience, besides the display being hazy. The ‚Äòairshow‚Äô was extremely dated and inadequate.

Food was another disappointment ‚Äî none of the things provided were tasty or adequate, be it chicken, mashed potatoes, green beans, rice or the brownie. Each of these items was unpalatable and tasteless. Same goes for the before-landing snack. Only exception was the pre-packed Gruyere cheese! 

The only redeeming feature of the flight was the crew who valiantly tried to make best of a bad situation. However, not being superhuman, all their effort was let down by the management of the airline. 

Swiss does need to answer a simple question: why is one of the busiest routes (and therefore, profitable since all flights are fully booked at a steep price) treated so shabbily? Dare one make guesses or is it that Swiss simply does not care?

title: WORST CUSTOMER SERVICE!!!
review_text: Flight was canceled just hours before with no explanation. We were supposed to have a layover in Zurich for 20 hours where we booked accommodations and had to forfeit the cost because we were rerouted to Singapore for a later flight. This meant we now had to wait at the Male Airport for 12 hours before our next flight!!! I tried to call Swiss Airlines multiple time, but waited for 2 hours and still no answer. Since a phone call was useless, I wrote at least 4 different complaints on their site and only received ONE email a month later which basically said your out of luck.

title: low cost behavior
review_text: The FLR-ZRH was on a Helvetic Airways  Em190 in excellent condition. Flight was in time and inflight service was only a bottle of water, The ZRH-ATH was on A320 plane on good condition, departed on time. There was no IFE. There was no inflight service, than a bottle of water and a small chocolate. You could not change your seat at e-check-in, unless you pay for it. I cannot see the difference with low cost companies. On LH you pay more but you get lowco treatment.

title: Soft and smooth travelling
review_text: Kind, efficient, on time and a bottle of water. The airbus A200 series is also my big favourite of the smaller planes, with a 2-3 seating. Sufficient space in the overhead lockers. I had, not asked, an emergency exit.

title: Flight attendant said hope the luggage hits your head
review_text:
Once I got on my connection flight from Zurich to LAX. Once I entered the aircraft, the flight attendant by the name of Astrid Hougue said that my carry on is too heavy. Side note: I have used that carry on many times to go to Europe and to come back. All of sudden it‚Äôs seemed an issue.

Anyways, she said it will hit someone‚Äôs head if doors for the overhead opens. I said why would the door open all of sudden?
