She proceeded to say ‚Äú I hope it hits your head‚Äù She said that to customer! I hope it hits your head. Everyone in the aircraft heard it. Unbelievable. Either she doesn‚Äôt speak English well or she is super rude. I asked for her name and she said ok ok am going to apologize but will take your baggage from you. I told her, so you‚Äôre going to make a situation that is bad to worse. I told her to not talk to me the rest of the flight. She said so you don‚Äôt want me to serve you food. The audacity of this women is real. I could count this as a threat and harassment on her behalf.

title: Shameful... Vergognosi...
review_text:
Flight canceled in October and they don't refund the two tickets. After numerous reminders, they refund us only part of the fee, less than half. We had spent ‚Ç¨600 and they only gave us ‚Ç¨285 back. Their call center says we are entitled to a full refund, but evidently there is someone in the administrative offices who follows other directives. DO NOT PURCHASE TICKETS FROM THIS AIRLINE.

Volo cancellato ad ottobre e non rimborsano i due biglietti. Dopo numerosi solleciti, ci rimborsano solo una parte della quota, meno della met√†. Avevamo speso 600‚Ç¨ e ci hanno restituito solo 285‚Ç¨. Il loro call center dice che abbiamo diritto al rimborso integrale, ma evidentemente negli uffici amministrativi c'√® qualcuno che segue altre direttive. NON ACQUISTATE BIGLIETTI DA QUESTA COMPAGNIA AEREA.

title: The worse airlines I have ever used service and standards atrocious.
review_text:
I flew out from Dublin to Zurich to connect to my onwards flight with swiss international airlines it was so unpleasant and staff so unfriendly and the prices was so expensive ‚Ç¨12.50 for a tiny bottle of wine .
On the long Hall flight the food was horrendous and I was hungry throughout the flight ,they came around with refreshments once.
They allowed me 3 alcoholic drinks and when I asked for another I was told the bar was closed,I could not believe that I paid almost ‚Ç¨1300 and was hungry and refused a third alcohol drink,what a bad start to a lovely holiday.
I will never ever fly with Swiss International airlines again and if I can get even one other person to avoid this rip off airlines then my job is done ,all the staff need to get customer service training.

title: Outdated and terrible airlines
review_text: What a terrible airlines in these days with terrible customer service and outdated baggage rules . No wonder original Swiss airlines went bankrupt and current one under Lufthansa flies empty planes.

title: Always delayed
review_text:
With no exception my flights with Swiss for the past year, which were frequent, have been delayed.  From 15 minutes to more that 2 hrs, with a range of reasons/ excuses of what the reason was.  It is a completely unreliable airline in my view and if you have a connecting flight you have to be mindful of the timings and consider a scenario that you might be stranded in a city you weren't planning too, like I was at some point last year...

Planes I flown with are fairly new, cabin is clean and fairly spacious, which for a short haul European flights is absolutely fine.  Food and drinks, or the lack of free food and drink can be an issue, so maybe buy your food and drinks before you board if you want to enjoy a decent snack or meal, at a reasonable price.  At least the still offer a free bottle of water.

Customer service, event though they try to be as polite and tentative as possible, sometimes might slip through the cracks.  As for boarding and disembarkation nothing wrong with that process.

Lets not discuss though off board customer care, which is non existent if you want to reach them by phone for example.

Overall, due to the consistent delays it is not a carrier of choice but necessity

title: Worst customer service
review_text:
Flight from ahmedabad to Delhi is from AirIndia and from Delhi to Z√ºrich is operated by Swiss Airline.

 I booked ticket for my wife and daughter together. My daughter, Suchi Parmar, is infant. When my wife and daughter came to India on 2nd November with booking number V2R9TA, swiss airline was not able to find combine ticket. They have started putting blame on AirIndia and Booking Agency. However, AirIndia and Booking agency was able to find it combine. I have contacted lots of times to everyone, and just day before fly, ticket booking counter of swiss airline accepted the failure in the system and combined it. 

Same problem I am facing now. Swiss airline is again denying. But this time I can not find ticket booking counter at Ahmedabad Airport. All other Agencies find it combined but not swiss airline. 

That is a big bug and shame on star alias. 

Thats the fact that first time problem was solved by swiss airline and accepted the failure. 

The problem is I want to book comfortable seat for my wife and daughter. Which is not possible due to swiss airline system bug.

title: Mr
review_text:
AVOID AT ALL COSTS!
Refused to let me board my flight for missing information i was not obliged to give!
Robbed me of 850GBP  and missed a once in a lifetime opportunity.
They had 0 sympathy even though it was their own mistake and made absolutely 0 effort to try and help me in any way.
I feel like my life is severely impacted by this action as it held me back and stole a dream years in the making.

Day light Robbery. Absolutely disgusting.
Shame on every one of them.

AVOID FOR YOUR OWN GOOD! HEED MY WARNING!

title: Flyin' SWISS in January 2023 ...
review_text:
Second week of January 2023 - a roundtrip flight to Zurich - from Budapest. 
What I can say about SWISS ? - well - the planes looked very new, both were having a very good leg room - even that those were small planes - well the A220-300 is actually not that small. 
On board service was the "new" style - where you get a bottle of water and you can purchase if you want something - on short flights is not an issue. 
The on-line check in , is a bit tricky but manageable eventually 
Flight was on time from Budapest - but departed with 30 minutes delay from Zurich on the return flight. 
Boarding went smooth ... so nothing to complain on the matter. 
Overall a very good experience with SWISS , I do recommend you try it. 
Safe flights!!

title: Booked extra leg room & so called Premium seats. Poor Food quality
review_text:
Our Premium seats were horrible. Middle row 4 seats were reserved and 2 of the seats had box under the front seat taking away half of the leg space. Extra Legroom was okay. 
We requested for Hindu Meal Non Veg and were served boiled veggies with hard boiled rice. When asked they said Hindu meal is only Vegetarian. Very poor quality and my kids did not even touch food. The staff had no control as they serve what is given to them.
On positive note flights were on time no delays. They were quiet good with boarding process but the premium seats and food were big disappointment.

title: Smooth flight
review_text: Not as bad as expected. Everything went correctly, although a delay of 20mn happened but luckily it didn't affect the next flight. Service was good as well.

title: Very dissapointed
review_text:
We expected a free of charge baby bassinet for our baby. I contacted customer service today and was told that, yes, the baby bassinet is free of charge, but in order to use the bassinet we would have to pay an additional 100 euro for a seat that would accommodate a bassinnet. This is ridiculous and should be considered a joke if it wasn't so sad.

To be fair, we haven't actually travelled yet and in case Swiss changes their mind, they are free to contact me.

title: Swiss Airlines: Incompetence and Indifference at its Worst
review_text: We flew with Swiss from Dublin to Belgrade with a stop in Zurich. They lost our bags, including our daughters push chair. We did not get any response from repeated complaints for months. When we finally got a response it was to refund a very small amount that did not even cover 5% of the value of good lost.  I will never fly with this terrible airline again and would not recommend them to anyone.

title: Premium Economy not worth it, Business Class was good
review_text:
Very disappointed with the Premium Economy class. Right behind my seat was a standard economy seat. There should be a separate cabin between economy and premium. Food was good. Seats were not so comfortable as I thought, very difficult to recline. I din't like the seatbelts, they are the same ones you have in your car. I must say that I realised later that you could easily take the upper part after take off. Great was the fact that you could take 2 suitcases weighing  23 kg each. 

On our flight from Bangkok to Zurich we flew business and I must say I enjoyed it. On landing we had some problems with our luggage which did not arrive plus a broken suitcase but the service was great. We received our luggage the next day at our home address free of charge and the broken suitcase was replaced immediately.

title: Airliner change schedule without possibility to cancel.
review_text:
I booked a flight from Ljublana to Prague via Z√ºrich the 29th of May 2023. The booking was done in November 2022 to get cheap tickets (200 euro). In December, Swiss changes the schedule  and claim that I have accepted the change, which is untrue. Therefore I will not get the tickets refunded.
Be carefull using this airliner, they can change the schedule and you have no rights to get the tickets refunded if the new schedule is not convenient for you.

title: Uncomfortable seats on LX181
review_text: The business seats are too small, with uncomfortable, pooly paded cushions and arm rests. Swiss tries to position as a premium carrier however the seating comfort level is substandard

title: My experience was different from most of these reviews
review_text: I have to admit I was a bit nervous for this trip after reading the reviews on here, but everything went perfectly, especially for the cost.  I booked flights for my husband and I to fly from Newark, NJ to Dubai with a layover in Zurich each way on United's website and 3 of the 4 legs were on Swiss International. The tickets were less than $600 each round trip,  so 2 tickets were less than one ticket on Emirates or Qatar for the same dates. I've traveled extensively in Switzerland (though usually fly over there from the states on American)  and found the same high level of service and efficiency on Swiss International Airlines that I see in the country. The staff was friendly and helpful, food was delicious and plentiful, seats and the TV were what you would expect for economy. All of our flights were on time and I was nervous about having just over an hour to connect in Zurich on the way over but it was no problem at all- we got to the gate with time to spare. Getting a piece of Swiss chocolate before landing is a sweet touch.

title: Worst airline
review_text:
Avoid this airline

We traveled from London to Hurghada. Transit from Zurich.
Our flight got delayed in London and missed the transit flight to Hurghada. Very unfriendly staff. We had to wait in the queue for hours to arrange a transit flight. We were given a flight on next day and transferred to a budget hotel to stay in Zurich with inedible food for dinner. Below is what we offered at the hotel in Zurich.
Tried to get compensation as we lost one day from our all inclusive holiday. Swiss Air rejected our request.
Rude and unfriendly staff in Zurich.

title: Sh**** Swiss Service
review_text: You have to go to ‚Äúswissport‚Äù and pay separately for a second bag. Cost was outrageously high for second checked bagWouldn‚Äôt give bag back to take on plane even though it was carry-on size. They call the Swiss in Geneva and have them give you a price for your bag. No set price‚Äîthey just rob ya. I‚Äôve been traveling internationally and been on over twenty flights in the last 3 months. AND THIS WAS THE WORST EXPERIENCE. I will pay more for another airline and better service next time.

title: Booked  Paid for Extra Legroom seats given to someone else!
review_text:
Booked and paid for extra leg room seats. When we arrived at Bangkok airport we were told without any explanation that our seats had been changed - and the ones we had booked (with confirmation) had been given to someone else. I assume this meant that Swiss Air were paid twice too??
The staff at airport were less than helpful and we had to endure a circa 15 hour flight (including changeover in Zurich) in cramped seats.
On return to UK, Swiss Air made every effort to make it as difficult as possible to complain with no sign of any refund or compensation.
Fortunately, Lloyds Bank were more helpful and refunded us in full. I am still waiting for Swiss Air to get back to me!
If you can find a different airline, I would recommend you don't use this one - particularly if you pay for additional service, as they may take your money and not provide it!

title: Terrible Airline
review_text:
If I could give Swiss Air zero I would. They cancelled our flight, didn't notify us, didn't offer us reasonable alternatives, didn't give us food vouchers, didn't give us any help. Disgusting. Trying to claim our money back and they are not engaging.

I will never, ever fly Swiss Air again.

title: Another good experience with SWISS
review_text: Great customer service. Delicious meals. Comfortable seat. Ticket was pricey but acceptable. One thing I didn't like was that they made me check-in my carry on luggage while there were plenty of room on overhead compartment. Anyway, I will definitely fly with them again.

title: Swiss is still got a lot of catching up to do
review_text:
Still a budget airline far different from its service and reputation from the 90s. You can find great deals with them, so if you are wiling to lower expectation you may not be disappointed. But with a long haul flight, service, leg room, all matter.

Basically, their planes are old, many seats have issue with the recline feature and if the person in front decides to fully recline, good luck trying to get up from your seats. Entertainment center is basically the same from 90s and far lacking from the other airlines.

Their Website is not friendly at all either.

title: No luggage for anyone on LX340 26/12
review_text: No Bags for any passengers flying from Zurich to London Heathrow on LX340 26/12/22 , and Zero help from customer services just Automated responses

title: Flights are almost always late, the chair is uncomfortable and the food a disaster!!!!
review_text: In the last 2 years I have been flying this route at least 10 times. The flights were always late with ONE exception, the seat is uncomfortable and the food a disaster!!!! If it has to be rice salad every single time, at least cook it through. Entertainment is non existent. Please, at least be honest and say that all these things do not exist (anymore....) on SWISS flights. SWISSAIR used to be great, SWISS is now just a very average high-cost low-cost airline!!!!!

title: head in the clouds
review_text: a great flight nice Fridley staff and good service good food and lots of drinks nice space in seating

title: Worst "New" Premium Economy seats
review_text:
It's a new "Premium Economy" (PE) seat but there's nothing premium about it. First of all, there's no separation between Premium cabin and Economy cabin. We happened to sit on the 3rd row of PE which is the last row and the way it was designed, the people sitting across on the middle seats are economy seats. 
Then, the seats do not recline. It's like a shell seat thus when your cushion recline, you are pushed forward and your extra legroom is non existent. Whoever designs this type of PE seats obviously has no reality check. 
The seat cushion was thin and it was very uncomfortable. I've flown on PE before with other airlines... Air New Zealand has the best PE seats but awful business class seats. 
Overall, it's better to sit in economy, in the front with extra leg rooms rather than paying for this PE seat which cost more than double of the economy seat.  In addition, these PE seats are not free. Cost US$60 for a lousy seat reservation.

title: Don't waste money on the "Throne" business class seat
review_text: There were no 2 seats together so instead of sitting with a stranger, we each decided to pay for so called "Throne" seats for $219 each. Boy! We both were very surprised ... not in a good way.  We hoped to have more rooms. Turned out that even if you sit in by yourself but the way the seats were configured, you basically sit in the middle meaning in between the 2 seats in front of you.  And if you are a big person, you would have a problem getting in and out of your seat. Just a poor seat layout. If I have to fly with Swiss Air again, I would choose to sit with a stranger, in the middle row, thus I would have aisle access. Bottom line is don't waste your money on these "Throne" seats. They are worse than the 2 seat together.

title: Booking bassinet
review_text:
Customer service is sucks! I don‚Äôt recommend to fly, if you have infants.
I called to request bassinet on the flight from Zurich to Miami, and they said I have to pay $90 for extra legroom. I said, that I won‚Äôt pay $90 as I paid $35 on Lufthansa (their seats are also $90, but I paid $35, because of bassinet).
So operator on the phone offered me to take a row behind. Just picture: your baby is in the bassinet next to strangers and you re seating behind!
Then she put me on hold and hang up.
When I called second time, operator told me, that she can‚Äôt book bassinet, because flight is too short, less than 1 hour. What? Its 10+ hour flight. She said, you leaving Zurich at 12 pm and arriving in Miami at 12.50 pm.
So the flight is short. I couldn‚Äôt believe my ears. She didn‚Äôt understand or knew, that Zurich is in Europe and Miami in US!!! And there are time zones!!! After my request to speak with manager or supervisor, she hang up!

title: Luggage destroyed and no compensation
review_text:
I flew with Swiss Air back in November from Malta to Prague with layover in Zurich.

In Malta I checked-in two bags and when I arrived to Prague I couldn't believe what I saw. One of the luggages was completely destroyed with damage in several sides, missing wheels. You need to treat a luggage with tremendous disregard to break it this way, which Swiss Air managed to do.

First thing I did was taking pictures and sending the information to the airline, asking for compensation of the luggage. Instead of taking care of the issue, Swiss Air redirected the conversation to a third party called "Dolfi1920", which I'm still yet to understand who they are. Then, an interrogation started, demanding detailed information about the luggage, specific measures. I told them, I'm on vacation, I don't have a tape to measure and for sure I'm not spending money to buy one, especially since I already had to buy a new luggage. 

After some emails back and forth, they finally move the process and asked for my bank details to proceed with the refund. However, in any moment they specified how much is the compensation, so I can either receive 1 cent or 1 million, it's up to them. This information was received December 2nd saying that I would get my money. In the first email they mentioned that I would get it up to 14 days, however, on a second one they said it would be up to 30 days. Nevertheless, more than 30 days have passed and no sign of the money.

It's pathetic how the airline destroys a luggage and still makes a person feel like they are begging for something they are entitled too.

As mentioned to them, I will never ever again fly with this airline. I have flied plenty of times with other airlines, including "low-cost" and never this happened to me.

title: Got COVID, notified Swiss ahead of time, no refund for trip
review_text: Last July I was supposed to fly to Munich on a business flight.  The day I was supposed to leave I contracted COVID.  I called the airline in the morning before a 7 pm flight.  The customer service representative said don't worry it can be rebooked.  I called to rebook and the airline was very rude and said I was a "no show" and would get $0 from by $3500 flight.  I am livid!

title: Downgraded our expectation
review_text: We expected better from Swiss air. We have taken it before the pandemic and was very happy with their seat space and service. But our recent flight was just not at that level. We paid extra for our seats and what we got are cramped seats that one hit one's head at the back of the seat in front of you if you have dropped anything on floor. A leg space is even used for a black box. They have reduced the seat space even for trans-Atlantic flight! It turned you off flying.

title: Awful experience
review_text: On my flight from Zurich to Cape Town (approx 11 hours long) the entertainment system was down. There was no prior warning of this so I could not prepare. I am a very nervous flyer, with terrible anxiety and watching movies helps to distract me and calm my nerves. Without this, I had a terrible experience on my flight. Had I been warned about it before boarding, I could have downloaded my own movies to my personal devices. The flight didn't even offer wifi so that I could download anything. Incredibly disappointing and overall and very distressing experience.

title: Lost luggage, then ignoring reimbursement request
review_text: We didn't get our luggage for two days, then reimbursement request for essentials went into a black hole.  It's been two months, and still not a peep.

title: Such a bad pre registration and check in  service
review_text: Extremely inconvenient. I was not able to check in earlier before a flight for staying in a business lounge. This is my first and the last time I buy SWISS airline. I hade abs option to buy and other airline abs cheaper. I made mistake.

title: Horrible Experience
review_text: Swiss Airlines had technical difficulties making our flight run 45 minutes late. Many people on the flight had connecting flights. This caused much stress on the passengers with connections. They did absolutely nothing to help get the passengers with connections off faster. The fight attendants reassured us all that they had notified our flights that we would be running late. That was a complete lie. We took off running as soon as we got in to our connecting airport because they led us to believe we had hope. We make it to our gate right as they had just closed the door to our other Swiss Airlines flight. The man working that gate was extremely rude said he did not hear anything about our flight running late and would not let us on. So we missed our flight and now we are scrambling to figure out what to do. I will NEVER be flying with Swiss Airlines again and am completely disappointed with my experience.

title: lost my bag and couldn't care less about it
review_text: 6 months without any meaningful communication regarding my lost luggage. Apparently still waiting in queue. Worst customer service ever.

title: worst customer service ever
review_text: The worst airline that I ever used. I have lost my luggage and it has been almost two weeks.  And they have no info to give me. They said we have located your bag and waiting for it to arrive in the final destination. It was supposed to come on 13th December. title: Failed company
review_text: I flew with Swiss on September 12th from Sofia to Dublin via Zurich, I checked two suitcases in Sofia and got just my small one in Dublin. title: Swiss efficiency is a myth
review_text: Swiss air happens to be truly the most appalling airline. Here is a short summary, and in no way comprehensive, of the ways Swiss air has failed me. I care not for the seats, aircrafts, service or the dumb little chocolates, it is their complete disregard for time that their gravest offence. For a nation that prides itself on their time keeping and obsession with it (one is regularly reminded of their own mortality in Zurich each hour, due the clocks which outnumber residents), they certainly did not get that memo. I have had a flight cancelled at the gate, 5 mins prior to take off. I was refused check in for a flight to the US despite a confirmed esta in hand which was very valid. They have on, not one,  but two occasions charged me twice for a flight which I booked just the one time. They then took close to two months to return the money - on both instances. And now. I am sitting on a plane that is not moving. I arrived at the gate to board. Again, funnily timed (at least they have a sense of humour about time, if they‚Äôre not great at keeping it), they delayed flight right during boarding, citing ‚Äòneeds for staff rest‚Äô. Why? What have they been doing? Are these things not properly scheduled? Should I be terrified to be on this plane? And finally we boarded a few hours later, and one hour in, waiting for them to load the bags ??? Also of course, no updates from cabin crew. Nothing. And they‚Äôre being stingy with the stupid chocolates. Send help.

title: additional costs because of lack of informatio
review_text: I have always been a loyal fan and guest of Swiss and have always been more than satisfied with their service. Unfortunately, my experience with my last booking to the US clearly clouded my opinion. As always, I booked my flight to Chicago via the Swiss Smartphone App on August 30, 2022 to visit my fianc√©. I wanted to take the opportunity right away to bring our two cats over. I knew that this is easily possible with Swiss and that I simply had to call the hotline after booking to reserve the places for the cats in the luggage compartment. When I received the booking confirmation, I found that the flight was operated by United Airlines, which was unfortunately hardly visible in the app. However, I figured if Swiss partners with United Airlines, the policies and services will be the same. I then called United Airlines to reserve the space for the cats in the luggage compartment. I was quite disappointed to find out that United Airlines no longer takes cats in the luggage compartment. My disappointment was enormous because I had booked a flight that is of no use to me. I then called the Swiss hotline and I had to book a new outbound flight with Swiss with additional rebooking costs of around CHF 270.-. About a week later I call again to make sure the cats are booked and they tell me they are on the Chicago to Zurich flight, which was wrong! After several calls i finally managed it to have them booked on the flight from Zurich to Chicago and not vice versa. The day before departure I went to the pet store to buy a suitable transport box for the cats and called the Swiss Hotline from the shop to make sure I was buying the right transport box. The person on the hotline assured me that soft transport boxes with a steel frame are also permitted for cats. So I chose a model for CHF 120.-. When I checked in the next day at Zurich Airport, I was told that these boxes were not permitted and I had to buy a new one for CHF 140.00 on the spot and had no other choice than trow the other one away. I had additional costs totaling CHF 530 for this trip, which I could have avoided if Swiss had communicated correctly and the informations on the app were more visible. Afterwards I have filed a complaint and i got a short and unpersonal answer back that they can't see anny mistake from their side. Partnerships with other airlines are legitimate, but it must be clearly stated that the policies and services are not the same. every time I called the hotline, I agreed to be recorded, so they should be able to find out about their misinformation, shouldn't they?

title: Rude, grumpy purser and flight attendants, damaged baggage with no resourse so far
review_text:
LX 52 from ZRH to BOS on Nov 21 in business class proved to be nightmarish, to say the least. You arrive at the Gate after passport and security controls in order to board, and then get told you have to go somewhere else to have your passport
authenticated once again!That was a joke, because the women stamped our boarding cards, before opening our passports. 
When I tried to discuss this with the purser on board, questioning this unnecessary bureaucracy, his initial glib reply was, "Well, this happens in the US as well, do you want me to show my passport to prove this to you? I emphasized that this wasn't the passport stamp, but this additional step of stamping boarding cards. His next glib reply was," Well now you have your seat!". I am not sure what he meant by that, but he walked off to grumble to other flight attendants about our conversation. The service went downhill after that, and apart from one younger male flight attendant who was courteous, the ones with seemingly longer tenure were just grumpy right through the flight. If they said anything to you, they made no eye contact, instead angling their faces about 90 degrees away, appearing that they were talking to the air. They only seemed courteous when communicating with some members of a SWISS ski/winter sports team who had been upgraded and seemed to break all rules, including the need to be seated when the flight was about to land, in order to continue conversations with these
sports persons.
Although our bags were stamped priority, the sports team's ski equipment made it out on the carousel much more quickly and when our bags arrived, they were damaged. There were no SWISS reps to take in any complaints on site; in fact, the
same in-flight team (who typically make it to the exit to catch their hotel shuttle) were just hanging out with the sports team, blocking passage for regular flight passengers to leave the airport. When I tried calling the SWISS customer service line to discuss how we could resolve these issues 1 833 626 0727, the line once spontaneously ended, and the second time it was picked up by someone called Belinda from Lufthansa. She was equally surprised as I was, as to how a call to SWISS reached Lufthansa and made some vague comments about calls looping over to Lufthansa if SWISS wasn't available
Finally, I was able to reach a tech support team in South Africa (Tom) who advised how I could fill in an online application. I also attached photos of the damage.
More than two weeks have passed, and I have not received any outreach from SWISS. SWISS is not a low-cost airline, and I think that, for all the discomfort that we endured, their customer service could be a lot better.

title: Not even the shadow of Swissair...... low value for money
review_text:
I've flown Swissair, and then Swiss since my childhood. Although they aren't the same company, it seems to they no longer even have the Swiss service edge either (could it be the German ownership?). Flying back from Asia in Business after a months of low cost airlines around the region should have felt like pure bliss. It wasn't much of a step up.

Half the staff were friendly and helpful, the other half seemed to have checked in their smiles with their luggage. After being spoken to in German (which I don't understand) 3 times by the same stewardess, she finally used English (although I had spoken to her in French) - looking exasperated.

The seats were narrow - my shoulders were compressed by the edges when in the "bed" position and although I'm not small, I'm by no means the biggest person out there. The seat itself was rather hard, not much more comfortable than some of the low-cost options we'd flown in the previous few weeks.

The entertainment selection was haphazard heavily leaning towards movies more than 20yrs old and didn't change between our flight to Asia mid October and return one month later.

The food was really not impressive. The vegetarian dish my wife had was tasteless, and the beef I had was chewy. The "selection of Swiss and International Cheese" (see  menu picture) was 1 small slice of mass production swiss hard cheese, and 1 small slice of mass produced french soft cheese. On the 11.5h flight there was only 1 meal served, however there was the option to order a few "Bistrot" items for those who were hungry. What we didn't know was that you could only order 1 of these items - which we found out 2h before landing when we asked for a burger (which came with the smallest excuse for a leaf of lettuce I have ever seen) after having had the pomelo salad (see pictures) - which was refused.

Paying a full-fare business class ticket on Swiss was clearly a bad idea, money would have been much better spent on a 5-star hotel the night before flying and a limousine drive home from the airport. Frankly for this level of service and comfort - if Easyjet did longhauls I would give them preference.

Swiss effiencency - really, leave it out - arrived and left late - they even built in about 20 mins to flight time to comepnsate so they can declar eon time arrival, a cheap budget airline trick 

Swiss is an expensive budget airline, if you can fly with others, my advice is to do so 

A lousy airline

title: Charging my card after the flight
review_text: Swiss air charged my card, out of the blue, one week after a flight, for a purchase I didn't make. I have no idea how this is even possible. Their customer service was more than useless, and directed me to their payments provider, taking NO accountability for the fact that they've effectively stolen money from me. Needless to say I won't be using this fraudulent service ever again.

title: Disappointing customer service
review_text:
Arrived at Zurich in the early hours, our flight was cancelled and not a single person from Swiss Air was around to help or guide the passengers.
Waited two hours in a queue to resolve our issue, and five hours for another flight.

Multiple emails were sent to Swiss Air to refund our flight according to Regulation (EC) No 261/2004, which entered into force on 17/02/2005.

Multiple emails have been sent and now Swiss Air customer support no longer responds to emails.
Their New Zealand phone number is just an answerphone which is a dead end.

title: Swiss on its way from great to lower average
review_text:
For many years I took the extra 30min to Zurich airport for business travel because flying from there with Swiss was very comfortable and relaxing. But Swiss is also changing.
The latest scam: Even on relatively expensive flights (ZRH - BER 450 EUR), and even as a Star Alliance Gold member, you are now assigned a middle seat at the back and have the option at check-in to select another seat for 30CHF. Most employers don't pay such an uplift. I cannot cancel this flight anymore so I will squeeze into row 28 in the middle tomorrow, but from now on, I will certainly not fly this route from Zurich and not with Swiss, but from Basel with British Airways. How are you with this latest innovation?

title: Mixed - but mostly good - bag
review_text:
First things first: it does seem like Swiss has had a drop in quality of their service. Growing up I flew with them a lot and they were synonymous with quality, even for their Economy customers.

One big blow to their quality and reputation is their choice to partner with some questionable companies, like TAP Air Portugal - which has a deservedly terrible reputation. In codeshare flights, this causes a lot of trouble for their customers - which happened to my parents this weekend.

The Lisbon-Zurich leg of their flight was cancelled last minute by TAP, and then we all spent 24 hours chasing everybody and their sister's dog up to get a resolution as they were stranded in Lisbon. Both at their desks at the airport and on their helplines, one kept passing us to the other, neither actually doing something to help two over-60s get out of a foreign country they were stranded in!

In what we found a shocking move for Swiss, they hung up on us several times, and also didn't seem to make any notes on our case - meaning we had to do the whole spiel from the top every time we called back.

Finally, we got a hold of a fantastic customer service agent called Tony, who actually stayed on the line for an entire hour, and managed to find my parents tickets for the next day - hurray! He saved us from endless circles ad infinitum, and truly did his job description justice. 

The other agents, while polite, didn't seem all too bothered, and put us on hold - at which point the call disconnected every time. 

So, tentatively 4 stars because I do think Swiss/Lufthansa overall is still a good company, but that's mainly based on Tony saving us from endless trouble. In addition, in my own flight a couple of months ago, they were punctual, polite and helpful - I couldn't walk due to an accident, and was taken great care of.

 Minus points for their insistence on working with that blasted TAP, though. Please rethink whom you do business with - you *are* partially responsible for the terrible treatment your customers get from your partners.

title: Delayed Baggage
review_text: Our Swiss flight was from Athens - Zurich - Newark with a 50 min layover at Zurich airport. Me and my husband each had 1 personal item and 1 carry on as per the airline regulations.  Also, we were aware that there has been baggage chaos since the summer due to lack of staff etc. etc and hence we decided to travel light. Absolutely NO CHECK-IN baggage, only so that we dont have to wait for our luggage or any issues with lost bag etc.  At Athens Airport, the airline staff looking at our personal item requested us to check-in our small carry on items saying the flight is full and there wont be space for our bags.  My husband explained to them that hes a Star-Alliance Gold Member and we are boarding Group 1 and we would not like to check-in our bags.  Also, very politely he told them that we have a short international connection to Newark, USA and the bag will not rch Newark airport.  We dont want to go thru the hassle of complain n then wait for the bag.  To this, the airline staff were rude in saying "Doesnt Matter, you have to check-in your baggage".  While this was happening, we saw many other passengers with similar or bigger bags in Group 3,4 or 5 having no issues.  Finally my husband agreed and sent his bag for check-in and they put a "PRIORITY" tag on the baggage. They insisted on putting my bag (7.8kgs and absolutely fitting into the carry-on baggage regulations) also into check-in which me n my husband strongly refused.  Now with all this our fears came true.  We landed at Newark airport with no sign of our bag and no Swiss representative or counter in sight. Finally found a lady with some pamphlet saying we need to complain online on some Lufthansa website for the lost baggage.  This is exactly what we were fearing and though we had put in all our efforts so that we dont have to be a part of this luggage chaos, we are now a part of it.   Thanks to the rude airline staff who, in the last moment, converted our carry-on baggage to check-in baggage and lost our bag.  Now we have filed our claim on the website and waiting for our bag to arrive.  Dont know when its coming. However,  I have given 3 stars only because though Swiss flight from Athens to Zurich was delayed, the next connecting flight to Newark was held at the origin as there were 10 of us running for the flight. Hoping to get my baggage soon.

title: one bottle of water for a chf 775.‚Äî flight, no service
review_text:
very poor service for such an expensive flight. meals have to be pre-order, no in-flight duty free
minimum minimum

title: On time, excellent service, very friendly!
review_text: Very friendly staff, excellent service, got breakfast and several drinks without paying for that, bagage all fine!

title: Lost luggage
review_text: On the way home from my honeymoon my luggage was lost. We‚Äôve contacted Swiss over a dozen times after submitting a claim for missing luggage. We can‚Äôt get any responses, a reimbursement, or even to speak with someone who can help us. On top of that, I ran my first marathon and want the metal that‚Äôs in my bag. I will never fly Swiss again. Not because they lost my bag but because of how they‚Äôve handled the situation.

title: Don't fly with them if you are flying with a pet
review_text:
BE AWARE!!!! This was my worst experience flying cross Atlantic in my 25 years flying Europe-USA. The customer service was already problematic after booking my flight. I had extra bags that I had to pay for which I had no problem. I called customer service on 1-800... number to book extra bags and to pay for them. They took my credit card information but I did not receive payment confirmation and my credit card was not charged. I was calling for 3 weeks trying to pay and always the same problem. A day before my departure I called again and all the customer service representative was able to do was to confirm the number of extra bags. He told me to pay for the extra bags at the airport where the cost was $120 higher for 3 bags than if I paid over the phone which I was trying for 3 weeks.
The worst experience happened during the flight. I flew with my 5.2 lbs dog. I prepared myself with the right size of bag for my dog, read all the instructions and requirements on swissair.com which said basically that the bag with the pet had to be stored under the seat during take-off, landing and turbulences. I followed the instructions I read but very rude stewardesses on the flight who informed me that the bag had to be stored under the seat the whole flight in very reprimanding way after they saw the bag in my lap. My dog is not barking or crying as long as she is with me. She caused no disturbance in any way yet the stewardesses were reprimanding me all the time and even had me changed the seats. When I could not tolerate their rudeness I asked to be upgraded which I wanted to pay for and I was refused of that as well. It was the worst customer service you could imagine which I had to deal with for 9 hours. I will not fly with Swiss Air ever again. When I complained about their customer service and requested to be refunded for the extra charge for the bags they told me there was nothing they would pay me back. They even didn't apologise for the staff being so rude during the flight. If you can, avoid them.

title: Being ripped off
review_text:
In September this 2022 purchased a return ticket from London Heathrow to Geneva. My wife who has vascular dementia  was due to go into a respite home the day before my departure,  whilst I was traveling for my 80th birthday with my family in Geneva.
However a problem arised with my wife's move and I had to alter the date of departure. when I tried to do this online myself, there was an administration fee on top of the new flight cast of ¬£70 Which in itself is sheer roberry as I am the one who spent the time online to arrange for this change therefore costing nothing to Swiss as administration.  I found another flight from Swiss departing on the day i needed for ¬£114 and I decided to take this flight and not bother to use the ongoing part of the return flight paid for and avoid the ¬£70 "administration fee". No problem so far and flew to Geneva and expected to use the return part of my original ticket to return to London at THE DATE AND TIME of my ticket.
However, to my great surprise, when I went to collect my boarding pass for my return flight, I was told that because I did not take the ongoing flight the return one was automatically cancelled and would therefor have to purchase another ticket at a cost of over ¬£400 (450swiss francs). As I had no choice and no access to the internet to try to find another flight with Easyjet on that day I had to purchase this ticket at that price. It appears this is quite normal to lose the return part of a ticket if you do not use the ongoing part. I have since tried to find Where that information was on the ticket conditions and found nothing to indicate this. I therefore consider that Swiss has breach a contract as I did not make any change to my ticket other than not taking the initial flight.
I am Swiss and leave in England and thought I would try to fly with Swiss to support my national airline.
I WILL NEVER AGAIN FLY WITH SWISS  and would advise people to avoid this airline.

title: No sense of responsability
review_text: Do not fly Swiss, is our new mantra. Never. For they can not be trusted to deliver as promised. And, upon complaining, they will deny involvement in car hire on Zurich airport, although it was booked in combination with the flight. Very disappointed indeed

title: Terrible Experience.  4 hours delay - false excuses by Swiss.
review_text: This flight was suppose to be 1.5 hours.  It was 4.5 hours.  They kept a full load of people on the plane without drinks/refreshments!!!  Even in business class. The pilot made an announcement there were 'thunderstorms' in Zurich.  I called my son and asked how the weather was in Zurich (he lives there), and he said it was just cloudy and no rain expected!  They made that excuse so nobody could claim reimbursement since 'weather' is a reason a passenger cannot do this.  They actually made false statements to 147 passengers!!  Business class was dirty, food rest on my tray, plastic bag stuffed on the side of the seat.  Really!?

title: Damaged my luggage and the reporting procedure sucks!
review_text:
My luggage was damaged. Asked the customer service officer at airport, she directed me to write an email to the airlines and said its useless to report it over the counter. After 2 weeks back from Zurich, finally they responded to my email and said nothing they can do about it, reporting can only be done in airport. Most rubbish airlines ever. 
During the flight, we pressed the customer service button, no one attended to us. All were sleeping. Sucks to the max! never encountered this with other airlines before.

title: Once was okay
review_text:
We flew on Swiss from MIA to ZRH. We were expecting the worst from having read so many of these reviews. Our problem is very small compared to what others have expressed. The flight from Miami was 45 minutes late, yet we arrived 20 minutes early in Zurich. Same on the return. Very good pilots! They know how to make up time. 

We booked premium economy seats and had boarding group 3. The ground crew at MIA set up 4 lines and group 3 was mixed with group 4. On AA with PE seats we get to board right after business class. The crew at Zurich airport was even worse. The ground crew called everyone in economy. No lines formed, just push your way to the front. You would think the plane was going to take off without these people that they were so desperate to get on. It was ridiculous. Very disorganized. 

The PE seats were not comfortable at all. This new idea of having the seat slide down was horrible. You could see a lot of people having a problem with it and finally gave up. I didn't even try. The seats were hard with no cushion whatsoever. The selection on the tv's was not good at all. The music options were even worse.

The flight attendants were nice. They did not come around for quite a while after meals were served. But after reading so many of their reviews, I guess that's what they're being trained to do.

We liked the food and the drink options. No problem there. The chocolates that were handed out were delicious. 

Overall we had a good experience, but we don't plan to fly with Swiss again, we prefer to pay for PE seats and fly on AA next time.

title: IF POSSIBLE DO NOT FLY WITH SWISS!!
review_text:
I flew with Swiss this month (first time!)  and had a bad experience starting from the tickets  . 
I flew in bussiness class and had to change flight dates and connecting flights inside Europe.
Swiss doesn‚Äôt have an office in my city so I can only talk to them through a call center. The thing is everytime I called I got a different agent from a different country and every call I made I got different information regarding the changes I needed to make. 
Besides that almost all of the agents were rude and one even yelled at me!! (which was unbelievable). 
Boarding wasn‚Äôt organized and the plane itself is
not that big of a deal. Food is ok. 
I have traveled in much better business classes in other airlines. 
Awful experience! Try not fly with them if you have another choice!

title: Had problems with the food
review_text: Am flying business over the last years to be more isolated and avoid COVID infection. Have chosen the vegetarian menu on October the 6th. Had rice and some hot vegetables. A few hours after landing in Zurich threw out twice  and had real problems with my digestive system  for the next couple of days.. Decided not to take any meals on prospective flights but to rely on bread, butter and cheese

title: Simple
review_text:
I flew from Marseilles to Hamburg via Zurich. Small aircraft, 2 seats in both side. A bottle of water and sandwich were served. No film or wifi service. At least there was electricity so I could charge my phone. Very simple and minimum service. Flight was on time.
