title: Paid extra for seat reservation but seats were changed.
review_text: I was shocked by how bad this airline is. Of the 4 flights we took (2 each direction) only one left on time.  The seats I paid extra to reserve had other passengers already sitting there and we were told to wait in the back until boarding is complete to find us seats.  The seats in economy are the most uncomfortable I have ever experienced.  It felt like sitting on a bench for 10 hours.  Also they are not sturdy as the passenger in front's movement in front while the seat was reclined kept the seat bouncing onto us.  The meal options were limited to vegetarian as meat ran out quick.  The staff were mechanical and frosty.  Never again!

title: paid 112CHF for extra legroom seat but given normal seat CS dont want to refund
review_text: I paid 112CHF for extra legroom for my 13 hour flight but was given normal seat instead. Wrote in to Customer Service and he replied aircraft was changed and even though I paid for seat reservation, I may not be able to get the seats reserved. why would they even offer that option during payment process if it's just a lie? There isn't even a pop up notification to highlight that the seat selection is not promised, obviously I would think by I paid for it, hence I have secured the seat. After all, that's why I paid in the first place right? And they do not even want to refund me for the additional fee i paid. there's totally no justice in this.

title: DO NOT MAKE A MISTAKE TO FLY WITH SWISS THEY ARE ALL SCAMMERS
review_text: My flight from Miami to Zurich was canceled and they refused to give me any money back. I was on the phone with their agents for two hours .  It took me several phone calls to get a hold of them and so many times they disconnected, after when I asked to speak to the manager they refused and on the next call they said they are not an airline ticket office they were instead a grocery selling coupon. The next day they told me to send them an email explaining the situation just so they can win more time.  THEY ARE SCAMMERS PLAYING WITH THE PEOPLE !!!! THEY ARE GOING TO BURN IN HELL !!!! GOD IS BIG THEY ARE GOING TO PAY BACK ONE DAY.

title: HORRIBLE   If you want to enjoy your vacation do not take Swiss AIr
review_text:
Excitied  to start our trip to Lisbon and at the Swiss Air ticket counter I provided the Swiss Air confirmation number and ticket confirmation along with seats that I had purchased.  I was advised I had no reservation even though I could provide proof of my reservation.  Ironicallly they had no reservation for me, but they put me on an Air Portugal flight... if I had no reservation why would they put me on another airlines at no expense to me.  Come to find out that the person who was in my seat assignment was a stand by passenger.  I was given no compensation.  
I wish I had read the reviews before I booked Swiss Air because it was a terrible experience.  DO NOT BOOK SWISS AIR you have no idea if you will make it to your destination or not.

title: Flight Canceled, Confused and Dazed
review_text:
Our flight was canceled from Boston to Zurich on our trip to Prague. We were informed only after the gate agents noticed passengers looking and pointing at the info board. They had started boarding families with children and called for no other passenger classes. We were all directed back to the service counter. 

There we were told they would try to get hotels but that we were on our own for rebooking the flight and any connecting flights. I was upset as we were traveling with our daughter's pup. I had no idea if there would be room for her. It turned out our flight was rebooked automatically and I was notified by email. I didn't check my emails as I was told we had to rebook ourselves. 

By that time I was waiting to speak to an agent about the dog. She offered to rebook for me. Get this. She couldn't see that ourflight was already booked for 10/19 and booked us on 10/20. She was pleasant considering the circumstances. When I checked email at home I saw the 10/19 flight. I called Customer Service and was told the flight was 10/19. I checked the app to check in and it listed 10/20. A call on the morning of 10/19 made it clear we weren't leaving until 10/20 and I couldn't rebook my return until I got to the airport. I couldn't even get seats assigned!!

I am not happy. I'm furious. This was poorly handled. When the gate agents found out flights had been rebooked automatically they should have sent one of them down to let passengers know and to hang tight. They also need to upgrade their computer systems so agents can see bookings in real time. This was a fuster cluck of humongous proportions.

title: Denied boarding because the flight was overbooked
review_text: I have been quite disappointed with Swiss air for a while now, especially for long haul flights I found the services very poor. However today I was denied boarding because the flight was overbooked. They just decided to leave passengers behind because they sold us more seats than they could offer. Unacceptable! The inconvenience is huge and the compensation the bare minimum. Swiss is probably the worst airline in Europe that is not low budget‚Ä¶

title: HORRIBLE!!!!! DON‚ÄôT FLY!!!
review_text:
Me and my friend we are frequent travelers and we have NEVER had faced such a TERRIBLE and MISCHIEVOUS service in our lives. Last year was my first time flying with SWISS and it was my WORST experience, so I was already dreading the return flight ‚Äî the HORRIBLE treatment did not disappoint. It‚Äôs appalling how you still have clients being so incompetent. The LEAST you must do is to pay our taxi transfer and food expenses ‚Äî but it does not include our stress, anxiety, and energy wasted. My friend has asthma and suffers from panic attacks and vertigo so it was VERY traumatic for her having to rush so much in order to catch an impossible connection. It all started from 2021:

- Countless hours wasted waiting to speak with agent over the phone to be often disconnected 
- Cancelled flight without previous warnings and after speaking with agent and confirming the new flight details
- Provided much higher fees for re rescheduling the cancelled flight
- Charged the wrong credit card
- Changed flight connection from GRU to CWB and refused to acknowledge flight choice over email
- Called to choose 07:30 option but agent said that the 07:15 had already been chosen, which we didn‚Äôt manage to arrive at the gate on time to catch it, of course!
- Agent at Zurich airport gave wrong information saying that we wouldn‚Äôt need to get our suitcases at GRU, but only in CWB
- Had to pay R$206 for a taxi from GRU to CGH  for taking an earlier flight connection at 12pm otherwise we would have to wait until 15:40.
- Agents kept trying to weight and check in my hand luggage despite it being within the allowed weight and dimensions
- My friend booked return flight and the connection was 2h apart leaving from different airports. When she called to change the flight after realising that they were not leaving from the same airport, the agent mocked her saying that Swiss wouldn‚Äôt have given this option if it wasn‚Äôt manageable ‚Äî note: just to transfer from CGH to GRU takes around 1h30min by cab  ‚Äî and not only did she have to pay a fee for canceling the impossible flight, but also had to pay an extra free for rebooking one leaving from GRU! Not to mention that the first price given was ridiculous high.

title: Not what Swiss used to be
review_text: Just flew to Kos with Edelweiss (which was great) and flew back with Swiss. Sadly Swiss has dropped its standards since covid, there‚Äôs an arrogance about the airline which gave me a bad feeling. No in flight services anymore except a bottle of water and a measly chocolate, pathetic. Topped off with an in flight video boasting about nonsense carbon neutral agenda 2030 compliance. Swiss need to concentrate on THEIR CUSTOMERS.

title: SWISS Zurich to Boston-Economy
review_text:
Hi,

We flew SWISS Zurich - Boston, non-stop economy flight on Oct 9th.  I'm not sure the plane type but it was fine. The economy section was tight we were on the left side row 26 A/B window and Isle. The service which included crackers & drink, then lunch and drinks, and at the end a light meal and drinks were good. Oh and the chocolate bar at the end. They came around several times with water and had bottles at the rear galley. We got up a few times and went back to get water and soda.

The lavatory was clean and had nice hand lotion and face mist spray. Don't see that on domestic carriers. 

 The entertainment was good but I found the screens and interface a bit slow and old compared to other economy flights I have been on.  The 2-pin headphone interface.  All in all it was a pretty easy flight with no hassles and good service for what we were in. I'd consider flying them again but hope they change out there economy seats with a bit more modern interface. But it's always nice to get a direct flight home and they were it coming from Switzerland. back to Boston.

title: Flying first class and being treated with rudeness and incompetence
review_text: My flight on Oct 5th was a nightmare from beginning to end.  At Lisbon airport I waited 1 hour for the Swiss counter to open with several other people.  Not a representative around for any information.  Finally someone wen downstairs and found that the checkin was with TAP a coshare with Swiss.  This was not on my booking and I would have missed the flight if Someone had not gone downstairs to check.  The flight to Zurich was delayed and the nice crew on TAP sent notice that I would be late with very little time to make my connection to LAX.  There was no one at the gate when I arrived, and I had to run a very long way to the tram which goes to Gates E with a broken kneecap.  I then had another excruciating long run to gate E26 where I saw the plane had not departed.  I was met with rude unsmiling gate agents who behaved as if it was my fault that their plane was delayed from Lisbon.  The agent refused to let me board saying that she had no booking for me on the flight!  She insisted that I was booked on Lufthansa the day before and she couldn't do anything.  I was in tears by then and she kept searching and at one point told me not to bother her.  I managed to pull up my booking on my iPhone and only then did she manage to find that I was indeed booked on the flight.  The Lufthansa booking was an old booking of more than a month!  I managed not to yell or cause a scene as I was sure they would not allow me to board.  No apology from this person and absolutely sour faces from all 3 agents.  The flight was okay but I was informed that my luggage would arrive on the next Swiss flight and delivered to my home.  Its been 5 days and many emails and calls later and conflicting reports about the location of my luggage.  I am told now that they are searching for my bags in Frankfurt.  That there are no matching bags found yet.  Some nonsense that there is only a 60% match.  I flew first class which has big red tags saying priority as well as large name tags.  This is all hard to understand.  I have flown Swiss and the former Swissair for many years as I lived in Zurich, always full fare and first class.  This experience has been absolutely the worst I have had with any airline, very disappointed and it was my last flight with Swiss.  Next time even ITA to Rome would be better!

title: My luggage is still missing since the end of July with SWISS. No response
review_text:
Hi everyone! I am writing this so everyone knows Swiss is managing things in the worst way possible. It has officially been my worst flying experience. 
I moved from Costa Rica to Berlin in the 21st of July, my 2 suitcases did not arrived at the airport. I spent hours trying to put a complain the same day. After a week I got back one suitcase, but he other one is still missing, it's about to be 3 MONTHS ALREADY. Today is October 10th. 
I have tried to called them several times, there is no solution. I have written around 5 complains, no answer and NO REFUND. I am moving from one country to the other, I really need my belongings. 15 days ago I received like a message from CLS express saying that they have found my suitcase and that they will bring it to my address. Wondering what happen? It never came.
There is no way to contact them or the delivery agency. I was also told that visiting the airport will be helpless. A friend of mine recently came to Berlin from Costa Rica with another airline and a more complex trip (more stops). They lost suitcases, but found them and delivered them in 2 days. This just reinforces the inefficiency and negligence of SWISS as an airline.

title: Delay plus unpleasant and unprofessional personal
review_text: I really can‚Äôt recommend Swiss Airlines not only that they were not in time they also have very unpleasant and unprofessional personal. It seems that they don‚Äôt appreciate their customers. Next time will choose more professional airlines both traveling for business and pleasure.

title: Very bad airline
review_text:
Good afternoon.
As an experienced traveler, flying across continents with diverse flight companies (KLM, Air France, Emirates etc.) I can only be highly disappointed by the travel quality with Swiss. Hereby a list of reasons for my complaint:

1. In spite of it not being priorly communicated, a face mask was required on the flight, which I can understand if it's a country requirement, but how inconsiderate having a flight attendant distributing face masks with no gloves and her finger directly placed on the part of the mask that is placed on the mouth and nose. This is a very improper use of the face mask.

2. The pillows and blankets found on the flight were unpacked and unsealed, which leads me to the very strong believe that they were not fresh. This is disgusting and hygienically hazardous.

3. On an 8 hours flight (departing at 1PM) only one meal provided and a small snack is absolutely insufficient. People were hungry on board.

3. A design flow of my folding table made impossible for me to put the tray or any class without it directly slipping towards my legs.

4. The entertainment screens were CONSTANTLY lagging and getting stuck, making it impossible to watch anything.

5. The very much advertised wifi on board never worked on this flight.

6. The airplane seats are the narrowest economy seats of all companies I've ever flew with.

title: They have people who answer the phones!!!
review_text:
The reason I want to rate Swissair is simple: At the moment, they are the ONLY airline I have been able to contact by phone and speak to a LOVING HUMAN BEING! It¬¥s like a bloody miracle these days. You can¬¥t get an answer or a solution to anything because it¬¥s all bots on email, chat and phone. 
I¬¥m not sure how this bodes for the future of humanity frankly! 
I just want to express gratitute and joy and boundless bigging up to Swissair for still employing humans.... I hope it lasts. I will now always try Swiss first for any new journeys.

title: Terrible airport design!
review_text:
Making a connection at Zurich Airport from Berlin to San Francisco flight.  Getting to the gate E is an absolute nightmare‚Äî I have never seen such a long line just to get to the Gate ( I took a video but can‚Äôt upload to TripAdvisor, it is at least 200 yards long!).    Then I have to go through passport check then get on to a super crowded tram (see the picture) to get to Gate E.   There are multiple up‚Äôs and down‚Äôs along the way.   

From the unboarding to my gate took a solid 50 minutes.  That‚Äôs with walking fast without any distraction including restroom break.  

Simply put,  Zurich Airport is NOT equipped to handle major international air hub traffic.

title: They deserve 0 stars. THE WORST!
review_text:
I don't even know where to begin with the nightmare that is Swiss Air / Lufthansa.

No one informed me when I booked wheelchair assistance for my mom at the time of booking our ticket, that she could not sit in the row with extra legroom AND receive wheelchair assistance through the airport. The Swiss Air employees at LAX REFUSED her wheelchair assistance, so my 82 year old mom who had back surgery earlier this year, had to WALK all the way through LAX to our gate. Despicable!! 

Swiss Air sent me 3 emails during our trip, changing our seats each time, due to "equipment changes." We purchased our tickets 3 months in advance, in order to ensure that we had one aisle and one window seat with extra legroom for each flight, due to her history of blood clots in the legs. And without any thought, they removed us from our seats and stuck us in middle seats with no legroom. 

I spent approximately 3+ hours on the phone, of which I was disconnected 5 times (yes, FIVE TIMES). Swiss Air told me they could NOT help me with my seats and that I would have to deal with Lufthansa. I called Lufthansa and they said they would NOT help me because I purchased the tickets on Swiss Air so I would have to deal with Swiss Air. A continuous loop of BS and unaccountability. NO ONE would help us with our ever-changing seat assignments. We even asked if we could change flights for our return back to LAX, and they said the fare difference would be $1350 PER TICKET.

The day before our return flight back to Los Angeles, we received yet another email stating that my mom had NO SEAT on the flight, AT ALL. When I called, I was subjected to one RUDE Swiss Air rep after another, all saying "sorry for the inconvenience, but there is nothing they can do" and that we would have to wait until we got to the airport in Milan. Swiss Air ALSO said that extra legroom fees are NONREFUNDABLE and they would NOT be able to refund the money from the seats that we originally purchased and were REPEATEDLY STOLEN from us. 

So let me get this straight. We paid WAYYYY too much money in the first place to purchase our original tickets 3 months in advance on through Swiss Air's website, paying extra for each segment in order to have extra legroom. Then Swiss Air changes our seat assignments 3 times, each time to a middle seat with NO EXTRA LEGROOM. Then you take my mom's seat away ENTIRELY ANDDDDD you tell us that we will not be able to get a refund for the extra legroom seat that we purchased. And to top it off, Swiss Air tells us we HAVE to go through Lufthansa and Lufthansa tells us we HAVE to go through Swiss Air. 

I was so disgusted with both Swiss Air AND Lufthansa (who owns Swiss Air) that we finally gave up and purchased one-way tickets home on Emirates Air, which was the airlines we SHOULD have flown to begin with. I will NEVER, and I mean NEVER fly Lufthansa or Swiss Air EVER again.

What they did is CRIMINAL and no one gives a you know what. We have no recourse, no where to go. Just a lot of lost money. They stole my precious vacation time and caused me an INCREDIBLE amount of stress and anguish, NOT TO MENTION, REFUSING TO PROVIDE WHEELCHAIR ASSISTANCE FOR MY ELDERLY MOBILITY-IMPAIRED MOTHER.

All I can do is pray that both airlines go bankrupt, never to be in business again. I hope you all rot in hell.

title: LATE + LOST OUR BAGGAGE NO REFUND
review_text: We flew from Denver to Amsterdam and Swiss Air lost our baggage. More than $1000 worth of clothes and presents for our grand children. It has been more than a month now and we have never been reimbursed for the loss and delay. We filled out all required forms and emailed several times but nothing. When I called Customer Service I got nowhere, because they said it is their baggage department that deals with it, so pretty much running in circles. Horrible experience.

title: Swiss air business class is like premium economy class
review_text:
The Swiss air Business class is so ‚Äòhuge‚Äô I have ever seen. It has more than 50~60 seats,  crowded and noisy. When I get in, I feel like I am in economy class. 
The leg room is ok, however the seat width is narrow, in a business class standard. 
They don‚Äôt pay attention to the meal preparation. Though you can choose one main course from 3 , but many guests on the bottom  rows got no choice but can only choose the left ones. Poor preparation and prediction about meal selection. 
The  worst part comes, Bangkok to Zurich flight is a long haul flight about 11 hours. But they serve only one formal meal,  and the 2nd meal is served by hamburger ‚Äòor‚Äô salad,  unbelievable ! So I landed on Zurich in an empty stomach at 7 pm. 
Never choose Swiss air business class!

title: Travel complaint
review_text: Of the 60+ different airline carriers I have flown over the years of travelling, Swiss was the worst - and that is to say there is a lot of competition for worst experience including Royal Nepal airlines who at one point had all planes (4 total) grounded in foreign countries while awaiting a technician to come from Brunei to service them.    My family (4 of us) travelled from Copenhagen to Zurich and all 5 bags were lost, 4 for 1 week and 1 bag for 5 weeks.  In addition, our car seats for our young children were lost - Swiss was unable or unwilling to provide replacement seats at the Zurich airport and we had to travel with the children without seatbelts from the airport - against Swiss law.   Swiss was the last carrier we took -a claim was filed on July 5 and six email exchanges later, we still have not received our compensation.  At first Swiss denied it was there responsibility, then subsequently has been giving us the run around - wait several weeks before responding,  then ask a question that they already previously asked us.  Our only resort was to file a claim with our home country transportation authority - as Swiss was clearly in violation of the Montreal convention.  It is still astonishing how poorly they have handled this.    I would highly discourage anyone from taking this airline - especially with children and certainly if there is any expectation with decent customer service.

title: Please avoid this airline at any cost.
review_text: This airline should not be in business , poor customer service and poor attitude of the staff. Please see our photo below to understand how we travel 3 hours not only us , about half of the passengers  on the, not sure if this allowed under international airline safety standard.

title: Customer service when baggage was missing was poor
review_text:
The flight itself was pretty good. Service was average but the airplanes were clean and looked relatively new. 

The issue I had was with the customer service when my baggage was missing in London City Airport. My suitcase had not arrived when I landed and I had to fill in a form and was then given a piece of paper with information such as a link to track my baggage, the reference number and a contact number. 

However, when I called the contact number provided, I was told that was not the right number and to call a different number (note that this happened multiple times and almost every time, the person I spoke to gave me a new different number to call). Note most of these different numbers didn‚Äôt help eg. one person said it was Lufthansa only, someone else said they were not baggage-related, someone said to call the airport, someone gave me yet another number. The link to track the baggage just has 3 options - whether the bag has been located, receipt of bag at the airport, delivery/collection. Hence, you don‚Äôt get given any idea of exactly where your bag is or how long it might potentially take for it to arrive at your destination airport. 

The only Swiss Air person I spoke to on the phone who was able to give me an actual response (rather than telling me to contact a different number) just told me that it i s still being located and I should just wait. When we called Singapore Airport, they were thankfully able to tell us right away exactly which flight it was on and when it would arrive in London. 

Why was this made so complicated by Swiss Air and why were they not able to share this with us? Surely a lot of distress could have been avoided by providing the information. I have also had to spend a lot of money to travel to and fro from the airport twice more (once to check about the suitcase as my calls were not helping me understand where my suitcase was and once to get my suitcase myself when it arrived as the staff at London City airport said it would take another 1-2 days for them to send it to me otherwise). The service has really been very disappointing and it would be great if you can provide greater support to customers in future if someone‚Äôs baggage has gone missing. My suitcase did arrive on the same day so I truly appreciate that it was all resolved relatively quickly (and I did get an email 2 hours after the flight with my bag arrived at the airport) but the issue was just that it was really hard finding someone who was able to assure me that they would find the bag and also let me know when I was likely to receive it.

title: Customer care...
review_text: This is a picture on where I was forced to put my trolley due to there wasn't enough space! Umbelivable!

title: No refound after canceled flight
review_text:
In April 2022, Swiss canceled 4 flights i had  had purchased to Cairo, worth ‚Ç¨1500. Flights were canceled 15 days before departure. I filled out all the refound forms, sent several emails and they never responded. I called the helpline and they said they don't handle it. I have to fill in the form and send it.
I don't know what to do anymore. It's been 7 months and I have no response. This is theft.

title: Very very bad customer service!
review_text:
All I can say about my experience with Swiss Airlines is that is very bad! I purchased my ticket online over the website which I do not recommend at all!! After sending me confirmation for flights, just one day before my flight I found out they canceled my tickets! After calling them and asking what was the reason they told me: It was a system error-there is nothing they can do about it..... Just a few hours before my very important flight I was not even notified about it they told me I do not have tickets... How is that possible??? After the customer service personnel hang up on me several times I was desperate and purchased another, a way more expensive ticket for the flight I already had the ticket for!!!  So please be careful because they are mostly scamming people like that so they can sell more expensive ticket!!
Swiss airlines should def not be a Star Alliance Member!!!

title: Not a good airline for business users
review_text: I travelled from Geneva to London earlier in the month on business. I would not use this airline again. The booking process is terrible. It isn't clear if the booking has been made, there is definitely issues with the website. The worst part are the call operators who just want to get you off the telephone. They gave me an email address that doesn't exist, when I called back I was told contradictory information regarding my booking status. I won't be organising any trips with this airline in the future. The planes are dirty and staff not friendly. Not a good quality airline for a national carrier. Use alternatives where possible

title: AVOID THIS AIRLINE AT ALL COSTS!!
review_text: AVOID THIS AIRLINE AT ALL COSTS!! They have the worst customer service I have ever experienced, and I am a frequent flyer. They changed the flight times and then gave me the option to change the booking dates, but said I needed to call. The airline said I was entitled to a full refund. They told me to wait and I would receive all the money back and could re-book. I told them that the terms and conditions stated I can't get a refund, but they assured me that there was a change in times so I would. I then only received 100CHF from the 2000CHF flights. They even admitted that I was provided wrong information but said 'the operator has been disciplined, however we will not give you any more of your money back'. They ignored emails, letters and phone calls. Did not care. I spoke to friends and this seems to be a common occurrence with Swiss Arline's. I had wrong info given by Easyjet in the past and received a voucher instantly. This company is awful. if you book flights with them, just hope there isn't a change or any mistake in the booking because you will NEVER recover money if they make a mistake with your booking. It is not worth the risk, use any other Airline aside from this one.

title: Cannot hold paid seat reservations
review_text: Insane that I have to keep on checking our paid seat reservations. They keep disappearing... TWICE. We booked one way premium economy seats from Los Angeles to Zurich and one way business class seats from Zurich to Los Angeles. The premium economy seat reservations keep disappearing even though we already pre-paid over 2 months ago.  Our flight is in another 3 weeks so in between now and then, our seat reservations may disappear again.  Who knows! Why did I need to pay if they cannot even hold the reservations??? Don't fly with them. Just fly with another airline.  Will not fly with them again in the future.

title: ‚ÄúUck‚Äù du lieber
review_text:
Since Lufthansa assumed control of Swissair, it seems as though they decided to make Lufthansa business class the star and Swissair the poor step-child. It‚Äôs just okay- glorified coach with lie flat seats. 
Food service is efficient but quality is mediocre and service uninspired.  On our flight today, I was given the impression that any interaction with the flight attendant annoyed her. Sadly she was not alone in her attitude.  The entertainment selection is paltry and aged.

I wish airline execs would go fly Qatar to experience a true business class product. They won‚Äôt and most airlines like Swissair will continue to peddle a substandard product and overcharge for it,

title: Avoid if you can
review_text: Swiss air.. a budget service airline for the price of a regular!! The offer you just a little bottle of water and thats all! Non smiling air hostess and the probably pilot‚Äôs first flight!!

title: I was literally stolen by them
review_text:
Beware of travelling with SwissAir.

 I travel with them back in July, and they took my luggage. I have never been delivered it, and they deleted my tracking file after I complained in this Facebooke page. I was never paid any compensation after more than two months. My holidays were ruined and after that I keep on accumulating expenses with international phone calls to just be compensated or having my luggage delivered. I also had to buy many clothes as I had packed my things for a three weeks holiday. 

This is by far my worst airline experience, and my luggage was delayed three time before. 

I tried to reach European Union about my situation, and they say they have no jurisdiction over the issue. I tried to contact the Swiss Consumer Council which so far has not been of any help. 

I can only feel that I was stolen. No one in this company has shown any good faith in handling this matter. So 

I would advise people to think twice before flying with SwissAir.

title: Lost Luggage
review_text: Do not fly with them!! My family was traveling from Newark-Zurich-Florence on Swiss Air. The attendant gate- checked our two bags along with 50 others and was very rude. The bags never showed up. We made countless phone calls where rude employees would hang up. No Swiss Air employee at the airports would help. No compensation and zero direction on where the bags might have ended up. I don't think they ever left Newark. I have read a lot about their policy to gate check too many bags and then leave them. I filed a complaint, I've been on the world wide tracker, I keep calling, nothing.

title: Hand luggage taken by crew and lost!
review_text:
The cabin crew took my hand luggage away to the front of the airplane for storage. But when we landed, she informed that the luggage was to be found at the baggage claim band. She did not give me a badge number for identification and then it was lost. I spent a day reporting, calling and completing lost content details. If I had known it was to be put with the checkin luggages, I would have taken my laptop out with me at least. groundforce is the 3rd party company that is taking care of the finding for the first 5 days in Spain. But their website didn't work and I filled the details three times before it is finally entered into system. Previously was server error. And then they don't work on weekends, which starts from the 2nd day of the flight. So the first 3 days I don't expect to get the baggage. I am still waiting. 
This is totally the mistake of the flight attendant. I regret that I didn't take a picture of my luggage and her face when she took it away.

title: Not cheap but nice.
review_text:
Cheap this airline ain't. Then again nothing in Switzerland is....

But cheeky jokes aside I had nil issues flying with this airline. Absolutely none. Everything from baggage, check-in, timeliness and cleanliness were top notch. The whole operation went like.... wait for it.... wait for it.... .clockwork.

Sorry, couldn't resist!

In short I found this airline reliable and efficient. Would happily fly with them again.

title: Missing baggage
review_text:
I'm so disappointed the way they treated my missing bag 5 days trying to call after we did the report no answer, we went to the airport called from black phones over 10 times for hours trying no answer ..went upstairs to departure asking for help or if they can do internel calls ..a team lead lady in Montreal airport  was so unprofessional and disappointed me more and more ..she was completely unhelpful and aggressive the way she spoke saying people wait for month to get their bags and my colleague working on the phone is busy and has other duties than answering your phone call and tell u the status of your bag she has more important things to do during her shift as there are millions of bags missing and so on ...she didn't show any care even the way she spoke with was completely rude ..
So stuff is not helping..no one is answering the phone and the website is not updated..completely unhappy and disappointed and will never use this airlines again definitely.

title: I would have put 0 if I could
review_text: Not Business class at all.  Lounge was jam packed at Zurich airport and smelled of cheap food no light and no ventilation.  Service on business class on the transatlantic flight was awful not one nice word from the air hostess who almost threw the food at me.  ‚ÄòBusiness class‚Äô to Nice was basically 2 economy seats on a very old level plane.  And we were then asked to move to sit in the emergency seat.  I thought I would give Swiss one last try.  But just shockingly bad.  United, BA, Virgin - all way way better.

title: I upgraded to business and...
review_text:
I purchased 4 upgrades to business class from Paris via Zurich to Thessaloniki after the customer representative told me it's 330 CHF per person. In the end, I found out they charged double (8 x 330 CHF). Exactly the same amount for the small flight and one for the longer flight.
They say they don't release any communication and there is nothing I could do.
Never seen such a non caring airline. On top of that, our luggage was not transferred in Zurich and we arrived without it in Greece. 
Would not fly ever again with Swiss, there are plenty of alternatives luckily.

title: A very good flight
review_text: My wife and I enjoyed a very good flight with Swiss. Even though Business Class was almost full, the service was very good indeed.

title: Jg
review_text: This airline lost my wife's luggage on our honey moon and is doing nothing about it. We are spending out trip trying to find clothes for her to wear. They do not care and are not helpful. I wish i could rate negative 100 stars

title: Worst experience and I haven't even flown yet
review_text:
I should have known how terrible Swiss was. My husband and I booked a trip to Switzerland for our honeymoon and booked economy seats. We saw the bid request upgrade feature and put one in. I still have the confirmation email. Lo and behold, it's 1-2 days before our flight and no word. I reach out and it looks like Swiss Airlines has lost our bid upgrade request and when we went to go and choose our regular seats, we could not do that either 

I called and they were no help. So we lost out on the opportunity to bid on an upgrade because of their technical incompetence, and then due to more technical incompetence, we cannot choose/book our seats on the flight until we check in. They barely apologized and made no effort on how to "make this right." 

Awful experience and I'm so glad the other legs of our flights is United. I will never fly Swiss again and I haven't even gotten to the airport. Watch our flight get cancelled with no recourse now - knock on wood. 

If you were a great airline, you would make it right with each of your customers. Instead, it's just, "oh well, deal with it" and I expected so much more from a European airline. We're from America and we're supposed to be the ones with the terrible customer service horror stories. Get your website updated to the 23rd century because it's like you're in 1990. 

Also, hire more competent people for your customer service team and give them super admin privileges or better technical support to fix your glitches. You had a chance to make more money from us but with your gross incompetence, that is unlikely.

title: Worst airline - Avoid
review_text: London City to Geneva. The worst airline I have ever experienced. Gross incompetence. I was due to fly with Swiss to Geneva. I was flying with 2 cats so expected them to care. They cancelled my flight whilst at the gate. No Swiss representative arrived for 20 minutes. The ground crew were outsourced and didn‚Äôt have a clue. Swiss had rebooked everyone on a flight to Zurich but failed to tell anyone. They then couldn‚Äôt find taxis for anyone and told people to ‚Äúfind their own way home‚Äù (against the rules). When requesting compensation they claimed that an fault with the aircraft is an act of god and they cannot accept the refund. Awful, awful, awful. They lied and lied. Eventually got us on a flight to Zurich (which was delayed) so we missed the connecting flight. Got the train instead. They promised a call back from a manager the next day. 2 weeks later still waiting for a call.

title: First experience of Swiss
review_text: The first thing we noticed was that no masks were required, however, on all other public transport they had been mandatory!  We were given a bottle of water and a tiny chocolate. There were no other complimentary drinks, not even tea or coffee. Everything had to be purchased. It was our first Swiss Air flight, so perhaps this is normal practice for this airline?

title: Swiss refused to compensate for a flight that was cancelled due to strike
review_text:
I bought a ticket via Swiss from Oslo to Zurich to visit my friends in Switzerland, where I used to live.  

The ticket was bought via Swiss, but the flight was operated by Scandinavian Airlines (SAS). The flight was cancelled due to SAS strike. From SAS I was instructed to contact Swiss, where I had purchased my ticket.

Since the cancellation was due to external factors, I should have been entitled to a full compensation - but Swiss refused to refund my ticket, claiming that the cancellation was "not due to flight irregularity", which is simply not true.

I will never fly Swiss again and recommend you avoid it as well.

title: A nightmare of a cancel flight
review_text:
My flight has been canceled and still don t have my money back.
I ask for a refund but it has been 2 months and nothing advance.
I WILL NOT recommand this one. Run away

title: Dealing with Swiss Air Ticketing Has been the Most Frustrating Experience
review_text: I have never been so frustrated dealing with any airline. In a nutshell, I had to have several one hour calls to sort out changing a ticket. There were so many obstacles and the pricing was ridiculously high. Once it was all set, I got an email saying I needed to call them back because the original refund for the ticket didn't go through. So, I had to buy another ticket and hopefully will get a refund for the original ticket. Too much time wasted!!

title: No leg room & no foot room on some of the seats.
review_text: It began with husband & I  getting to our seats.  There was a box underneath the seat in front of his that he could not put both feet underneath.  I was in 30J. Fortunately for us the row behind us was empty so he moved to that--but I couldn't because the other seat had similar box no room for my bag or my feet.  The leg room was the worst on this flight.  And the flight got worse as this was overnight & 2 rows in front of us was a bunch of family members traveling with young children. The baby cried almost the entire flight and then the family was up laughing & talking around 2am....no sleep for me as I couldn't get my noise cancelling headphones to work. Also they don't work well with folks who have allergies other than peanut. Good thing I brought my own snacks.

title: Far better than expected
review_text:
My tour was originally booked on BA to Zurich - when it was changed to Swiss Air and Geneva I looked at the reviews for the airline here (and on that other platform) and noticed that almost all the recent reviews were poor.
Needn't have worried, the whole experience (at least the outward flight) was first rate. Checkin at Heathrow was quick, the flight left and arrived on time, plenty of legroom in economy, cabin crew were great, and luggage arrived where it was supposed to. One star off for the return flight, which was from Zurich, where there was an hour-long queue at checkin (to be fair, they fast-tracked anyone whose flight was imminent). And we were put on a Helvetic flight in a plane with less legroom. Apart from that, all went smoothly again, so no real problem. Hopefully Swiss have put their problems behind them -  or was I just lucky?

title: My suitcase was vandalized and Swiss did not care
review_text: The flight went ok. When I picked up my suitcase after passport control, my suitcase was left open: its two locks had been torn off. I then went to the customer service: the queue was very, very long filled with people who didn't get their suitcase. I queued for one hour but gave up as I wasn't feeling well. I filed the online complain form the following day. I thought it was strange not to get a confirmation email but I didn't get any error message. As I didn't hear anything from Swiss, I filled another form about 10 days later to follow up: I was then told that they wouldn't help as the the online form had to be filed within 7 days 'according to airline regulations'. They couldn't care less about the fact that my suitcase had been damaged under their responsibility nor that I had actually send the form within the time set. I was very disappointed in their lack of care. Do not leave anything precious in your suitcase and be prepared for your suitcase to be destroyed if you are flying with Swiss!

title: Luggage took a trip  that we did not...
review_text:
Our return flight arrangements were horrid.  Wife book via Expedia. Return flight left on a Saturday and the connection to ORD was stated to be Sunday.. not my fav but ok.. we even got a reschedule email a week before the trip confirming Sunday but a few hrs later.. ok.. happens.  But when we arrived Sunday to take the flight we were told oh no your flight was Saturday.. ok where are our bags?  Oh they went ahead to ORD (note we asked upon checking in at BUD if we needed to collect bags.. no the will be on the connecting flight).  So as we are now scrambling to figure out WTF is going on we get berated by Swiss personal.. "did you not check the monitors for your Saturday flight?" NO as we were told flight not  until Sunday (we have emails to that effect) .. But but.. your bags cannot fly without you.. ok well where are they? SA says oh they went to ORD.. ok fine.. get to ORD of course no bags.. again we get berated by SA personal "Your bags cannot fly without you.." Yeah we know.. not like we are putting the bags on the plane ourselves.  So where are they? They are still in Zurich.. "Why then were we told they flew ahead? "  No answers of course go online and fill out claim.. ok.  day one did that.  Day 2 call SA to find out details.. nothing..Day 3 re-call..Zurich then ORD and back again.. again.. 
Day 4 finally get someone now at Luftunsa who says yes they are found and yes in Zurich. .will b on next plane.. Day 5 same same.. Day 6 finally get email that they are in ORD and will be sent to our home.. (200 miles away) when? Of course no clue.  Day 7 I get text from delivery guy.. on the way.. finally after 6 hrs on the phone with various drones in multiple countries we got our bags.  IF Swiss knew we were not on the Saturday flight they should of and did keep bags...however they also knew we did check in for Sunday flight.. where in they should have put our bags on that flight...but alas they did not.  SA is not what it  used to be nice chocolates aside.. So we are deleting SA from any future travel plans (Egencia is likewise on that list) .. may as well toss Luftunsa in there also.  The brothers Fine live and work as SA.  
The bags did arrive and on one piece.. wonder of wonders 7 days later.

title: Disgusting  booking payment system and lying customer service operatives
review_text:
We fly as a family of 4 in Business Class 3-4 times a year and on this occasion we reserved flights for the first time with Swiss Air. I then attempted to confirm and pay for the flights and after using 3 different Credit Cards and their Direct pay system, all of which authorized but failed to complete on Swiss Airs online system, I resorted to calling Customer Service.

The agent could see our booking and our attempts to complete the transaction but had no explanation as to why the transaction would not complete. He advised that he could not resolve the issue and that he had passed it to another department and they would resolve the issue and respond to me within 24-48 hours. 

I asked for an email confirming the situation but was advised all the notes were on the system against the booking reference and they could not send emails. At no point did the agent offer to take payment and so I assumed their payment system was actually down.

I subsequently received an automated email advising that my booking had expired and was cancelled. We therefore called Customer Service again and questioned why was happening and were told there were no notes on the system but they would reinstate the booking for us. They put us on hold and then cut us off.

When we called back again they then said they could not reinstate the booking and we would have to book again and it would be ¬£ 4000.00 more than our original booking. We asked to speak to a supervisor or manager repeatedly but were told none were available. We had to ask 5 times for an email address to submit a complaint.

We then asked them for our ¬£ 27.00 reservation fee to be refunded and after a 10 minute wait we were told that they could not refund it as we did not complete the booking.

It has become obvious during the course of the numerous telephone calls that their Customer Service is a joke. They have lied repeatedly and ripped us off for the reservation fee.

Ultimately it is their loss and seeing the other negative reviews it is obvious we are not the only ones suffering issues. In the end it is a blessing and we have booked with Gulf Air who we have flown with before and who were excellent is all respects.

title: Never flying with them ever again
review_text:

I was not offered ANY SUPPORT by them: no meals, no drinks, no accommodation nor transportation or other arrangements were provided. I had to cover all of these expenses at my own cost. I ended up arriving to my destination one day after..... 

By law I should be entitled to compensation yet they keep on ignoring my emails for weeks. Finally they told me that I am not allowed to compensation and that they could not give me a reason why. WHAT???? Why do we have law if we do not follow it????

Terrible.
Never flying with them again.

title: Most cramped and unpleasant experience ever! Never again!
review_text:
Flying economy on Swiss Air's Boeing B777 300ER was the worst experience I've ever had in decades of flying. 

This new plane was designed to maximize the number of people that can be crammed in economy. Shockingly, for a newly designed plane, it's missing or falls far short on a number of things including:

- Seats have very little legroom, the least of any flight I've been on

- Table trays are very small about half the size of other planes I've been on

- You cannot eat or use the tray very well if the person in front of you reclines. The airline attendants had to tell people not to recline during mealtime. 

- The aisles are more narrow than other airplanes. Rolling a standard sized carryon down the aisles is difficult due to it constantly hitting the side of seats next to the aisle

- This is shocking: carryon bags that meet Swiss Air's size limitation will NOT fit in the overhead bins unless they are turned sideways! Thus, instead of fitting 3 carryon suitcases in each bin, if placed bottom end towards the back and top end towards the front, only 1 carryon suitcase can fit (sideways) along with jackets and smaller duffle-type carryon bags. I helped the attendant arrange bags in a couple of bins by standing on a seat to squeeze in bags together. This is a perplexing shortcoming of the 777 since there is more than enough space for the airplane to have larger bins for luggage.

- Bin space runs out fast.  At least ten people in our section of the plane did not find space for their carryon bags. They had to have them taken by the flight attendant as checked-in luggage. I don't know if their luggage arrived when they did in Zurich.

- There are no air nozzles above the seats to aim air or adjust airflow. The cabin was kept warm, too warm for me. Air nozzles would allow each passenger some opportunity to customize the environment for their comfort. Many missed having air nozzles, especially before take-off when the air is not flowing well throughout the cabin.

 - The seats are difficult to recline. The bottom of the seat moves forward while the back reclines. It takes great effort to scoot your butt forward while moving your back rearward. Some passengers needed the flight attendant to push back on the seatback while the passenger scooted their bottoms forward. 

I felt sorry for the flight attendants who had to spend their time finding bin space for bags, checking in carryon suitcases when there was no more room in the bins, telling passengers to not recline during mealtime, and helping passengers move their difficult-to-recline seats backwards.

Here's the positive:
+ The flight attendants were friendly, helpful, and effective in doing their variety of responsibilities. 

+ Every seat had a small blanket sealed in a plastic bag, an unpackaged pillow, and ear buds.

+ The food wasn't great, but not too bad for airline food. 

+ The flight attendants came by often offering a variety of drink options

+ There was 1 USB-A outlet under the entertainment screen for charging. You'll need to bring your own charging cable.

Overall, this was the most uncomfortable flight I've been on mainly due to the cramped seats, tiny tray, and no air nozzles. Add this to limited bin space and narrow aisles ensures that I won't be flying Swiss Air again.

title: LOST BAGGAGE! DO NOT FLY WITH SWISS!!
review_text:
DO NOT FLY WITH SWISS OR THEIR PARTNER AIRLINES. It‚Äôs been 3  months since Swiss airlines lost our baggages. My friend and I traveled from Las Vegas, NV to Naples, Italy (connecting flight via Zurich) on June 16, 2022. We arrived in Naples a day later and no baggage. Then, we received an email stating that our baggage could not be located and to submit a claim for baggage content reimbursement. It‚Äôs been 3 months and no baggage or reimbursement for the lost baggage and it‚Äôs contents.  We attempted to contact the Serv√≠ce Center numerous times. They don‚Äôt know anything about lost baggage. This is the worse airlines I have ever flown with. I‚Äôve learned my lesson and will never flying with Swiss Airlines again. 

Our baggages remain lost and we did not receive any compensation. 

If you live in the United States, fly with a U.S. based airlines instead like United Airlines, American Airlines, Delta Airlines, that you can locally call and who will treat you better than international airlines.

title: Worst Airline Ever!
review_text:
Swiss Air

I was traveling from Italy to the USA to attend my mother‚Äôs funeral. I am disabled and had also injured my knee and was on crutches and requested wheel chair assistance. They treated her horribly and when I fought back they painted me like some terrorist! Shame on you Swiss Air! If you are disabled at all I highly recommend looking for another airline. title: Worst Air travel experience in 40+ years of traveling!
review_text:
Swiss International Airlines is the absolute worst airline travel experience that I have had in 40+ years of air travel and I will permanently avoid them!

August 12, 2022, on flight LX006 (ZRH to ORD) a 10-hour flight‚Ä¶We found the gate agent to be very rude when asked about checked luggage and this attitude seemed to be reflected in the dismissive manner in which the flight crew interacted with passengers. We were seated in the first row (row 22) just behind the bulkhead dividing business class. During the entire 10-hour flight the flight attendants made ‚Äúappearances‚Äù LESS than 4 times. 

‚Ä¢	We left the gate at Zurich at 9:30 AM local time.

‚Ä¢	Within 1 hour of takeoff to provide and initial beverage (only a small cup, would not leave a full soda); then 

‚Ä¢	2.5 hours after takeoff back to serve ‚Äúlunch‚Äù although they failed to serve my wife any meal. Assuming that they may have been serving ‚Äúspecial‚Äù meals first, we patiently waited. After 30 minutes and in looking around seeing all other passengers had been served, I pressed the flight attendant ‚Äúcall button‚Äù and it remained on for no less than 45 minutes without any sort of response! I turned it off after this time as it was clear I was not important. It was TWO HOURS after our neighboring passengers had been served, two flight attendants showed up to clear away the meal trays which by now littered the cabin floors and other areas as passengers had gotten frustrated with having no outlet for their trays and garbage. (See photos).
o	Once the flight attendants returned, I asked, ‚ÄúWhen will WE receive our meals????‚Äù and was told they didn‚Äôt have anything available, but they would check‚Ä¶he returned with two vegan meals.

‚Ä¢	4 hours into the flight, we were flying with the sun the entire flight, the flight attendants failed to advise the coach passengers to lower their window shades‚Ä¶as they advised all passengers in the business class cabin to do (I could hear as I was the first row in coach) ‚Ä¶so, it was next to impossible to get any rest in the bright sunshine.

‚Ä¢	6 hours into the flight the flight attendant returned to finally clear OUR meal trays and offer another cup full of soda or water.

‚Ä¢	8 hours into the flight was the last time we experienced the flight attendant where they handed out a silver dollar sized ‚Äúbreakfast pizza‚Äù and a US Customs form (with no pen‚Ä¶was told to borrow one from ‚Äúsomeone‚Äù around us).

‚Ä¢	We landed in Chicago and deplaned at 12:20 PM local time.

‚Ä¢	Baggage claim was #23 at O‚ÄôHare, we arrived at baggage claim at 12:45 PM (after passing through US Customs), the first bag to come down the conveyor belt occurred at 1:15 PM and about three bags would come out, then there would be a 5-10 minute gap before the next set of 3-4 bags would come off‚Ä¶there were approximately 4350 passengers on this flight, with on average of 2 bags per person, and this baggage flow continued for the next 2.5 HOURS! It was 3:45 PM before we retrieved our two bags and 40% of the passengers were still waiting at the time we had left baggage claim.

This was completely unnecessary and unacceptable ‚Äúservice‚Äù and I wonder if the maintenance crew has the same lack of concern to their job. Regardless, travelers beware of this lackluster airline!

title: Customer Service Is Horrible
review_text:
Swiss Airlines was once a reputable airline that I highly recommended to my clients, friends, and family.  Unfortunately, they have fallen far from their once prestigious levels of great Customer Service. 
Upon losing our luggage, the airlines took 3 days to deliver our lost luggage to our accommodations.  Upon receiving the luggage, one of them was severely damaged that it was beyond use.  (see photos attached)  I immediately reported the damage claim to the airlines and was provided with an automated response of "...please be patient".  A week later, I followed up via phone and email and was again told that they are too busy so I would need to still wait.  It has now been 3 weeks since the damage was reported and there is still no response.  From reading the Customer feedback on Twitter, Facebook, TripAdvisor, etc., many other clients are experiencing the same issues.   
On the Swiss Air website, I followed their online claim of damaged baggage.  It lead us to a 3rd Party website called Dolfi 1920.  Upon reporting our claim, we were given a credit of 63 euros for a suitcase that was less than a year old and we had paid nearly 100 euros when purchasing it.  The problem is that the credit must be used on Dolfi 1920's website and if anyone looks for themselves at this website, ALL luggage on this site is extremely overpriced.  I would not be surprised if Swiss Airlines is involved with this scheme in which to drive more profits for themselves.  
What makes matters worse is that I had paid a nearly $900 upgrade to these flights and this still happened.  To the date of this review, I have yet to hear back from any representative from Swiss Airlines.  I have requested to speak to their Management Team or Corporate Team to escalate the situation, but I have still not heard back.  It is disappointing when a company's own management or corporate structure avoid communications with their own clients.  Such a shame!

title: Worst part of European trip!
review_text: Flew to Rome and Connected in Zurich for flight to JFK. Worst part of the trip by far. Kosher meal ordered was inedible. One stewardess had a nasty edge. This was a combo Lufthansa /Swiss ticket . Lufthansa was fine ,Swiss not so fine!

title: Family unfriendly & awful customer service
review_text:
Plusses: our flights did not get cancelled. Legspace is OK. The chocolates are nice.

Negatives:
1. Customer service takes at least 0,5 hours to reach. Bad language skills, I've tried the Dutch speaking centre as well as the English speaking, so it was very hard to change seats (online doesn't work with baby <8 months). They emailed me an "urgent request to call back" without calling themselves, so I had to wait another 45 min to get to speak to someone. 
2. No guarantee that kids are next to their parents, unless you buy seats. As I was unable to check in early myself (to make sure the seating works) so I paid.
3. Bassinet for baby is free, but comes only with chair for 1 family member. Additional seats in the row were CHF140,-/chair. I understand these are nice seats, but with Alitalia this was free to all sit together (in the past?). 
4. The software to change seats is very buggy. I changed seats during check-in, but got my old seats in the confirmation. 
5. No meal choice. Twice they had beef only. I don't like beef. 
6. A large part of the time your personal screen shows commercials. 
7. Stopover times AMS - ZRH - JNB are too short with small kids. Both times we had to run & carry our baby, handluggage & 3 yo (bus, train, security check, passport check all squeezed in 1:20 hour, leaves no time for toilet or coffee). We got priority boarding, but we felt great we made it in time both times as one of the last people to board.
8. Maxi cosi on the way back didn't make it. I hope we see it again. 
9. Staff on flight & check-in at JNB is not very friendly.

For a budget airlines this would match, but than the ticket prices do not. I'm not flying Swiss again.

title: Worst than budget airlines
review_text: What has happened to Swiss? Absolute shambles since the pandemic. Flew with them over Xmas, cancelled my flight with 90 mins notice. Spent an hour on the phone to request a refund after they rebooked me a few days later - that won‚Äôt do! Then stupidly gave them a second chance and booked with them recently, and BAM lost baggage. Calling them does no good, since their agents just hang up on you midway through conversation - took 4 calls to even manage to speak to someone properly and even then they put you on hold for 15 mins every time they need to check something. Waiting for days now. Insanely bad service, terrible airline. Avoid!

title: LOST BAGGAGE
review_text: It‚Äôs been 9 days since I flew Swiss Airlines and still no update on my lost baggage. Totally unacceptable . FIND MY BAG : 1P524537

title: Overbooking flights (and then looking for excuses to kick you off)!
review_text:
We are a family who recently flew on a connecting flight from New York to Tel Aviv, with a stopover in Zurich. However, instead of continuing straight to Tel Aviv, the airline asked us for an entry form to Israel (Covid regulations), even though they knew that we can enter Israel without it, as we are Israeli citizens (to be sure, they could've done so in NY, before boarding, and they didn't do that). In addition, they didn't allow us to fill out the form on the spot (a process that takes around 30 seconds per person). Instead, they gave us a flight for 36 hours later! And when we finally enbarked that plane, they didn't even ask for that stupid form!!...

So we ended up staying at the Zurich airport - without our luggages, without fresh clothing and without formula for the baby. We were told by one Swiss employee that they were overbooking flights at the time (close to 20 more than the capacity!) - which explains why they were eager to kick us off the plane, since we were a big family with many kids. 

Finally, when boarding the plane from Zurich, they took away our hand luggages from us (overbooked flights. Remember?), where we had some cookies to nibble, after 36 hours without fresh kosher food. But then, to our final surprise, we found out that Swiss didn't even register kosher meals for us on the rebooked flight...

The situation was unbearable, but hey! Swiss only cared about their company and not about the customer. If you have kids, don't fly on a connecting flight with them! You will be targeted to be kicked off the plane at first opportunity!

title: Lost baggage
review_text:
I traveled to Zurich  from CNF, via GRU on flights(AD 4336, LX093) respectively, which arrived on 4th august, 2022  at Zurich. 

I had five checked luggages. One of these baggages  has apparently been completely mishandled and not arrived with  my other baggages at the final destination.

The ground staff at the Zurique lost baggage counter (Swissport informed me that it will be arriving only the very next day. 

I tried to call swissport (by the way, terrible. service, the personal (Daniel at least) was totally impolite and even. screamed on the phone.  unacceptable! and also. Swiss, with no success.

I've been waiting for a communication for 6 days.. no answer, nothing neither from Swisport neither from Swiss.

I just wish they find my baggage....

I would except some respect from Swiss.  I'm really disappointed!

title: Lost my luggage, sent me on wild goose chases, zero help, nobody cares
review_text:
The flight itself was no frills with minimal food, minimal service, no entertainement and reasonable seats. I don't care about that.
What I do care about is that it's been 4 days and I still haven't received my luggage, and I don't know if it's been lost, stolen, on its way or if it is already here because nobody cares and nobody is helping out. Called Swiss several times and each time they told me to call someone else, all of whem sent me back to Swiss. One time they even gave me an email address that DOESNT EXIST. This is the worst service I ever got in my life from any company. Will never travel SwissAir again.

title: Avoid this airline
review_text: I will not fly with Swiss airlines again. To begin, me and my partner were originally seated separately on a 12 hour flight and since we were given middle seats no one would swap with us so that we could sit together. Luckily, some people did not board the flight and we found two empty seats next to each other. My suggestion to anyone travelling with this airline is to check if they seated you and your friends/family together. Furthermore, the flight took off 30 mins late as we waited for people who were coming from Berlin. This lack of punctuality might mean that people who have connecting flights later miss their flight. To make things even worse, we were given one meal after take off and after that, it was 8 hours of no service. Having flown with other airlines before, there is normally snacks etc. delivered between the main meals to make the time in the airplane more bearable. This was not the case. In fact, the lights were dimmed for the whole 8 hours and we were told to keep our windows shut, making us lose all track of time. The plane was so cold that the one blanket they gave did nothing. I would avoid this airline and just choose another in the future.

title: Mediocre Service; Dilapidated Aircraft; Scrumptious Meals
review_text:
The SWISS experience is a memorable one for sure. The seat width was decent and you are spoilt for choice when it comes to the movie selection available on the in-flight entertainment system. The TV show selection, however, was rather poor. 
I flew on the older A330-300 and the aeroplane was quite dilapidated. The TV Sceeens and seats were worn out and for some reason the audio on my system wasn't functional.
Even though the staff were a bit cold and unwelcoming, the delicious food made up for that.
The meal includes a slice of a scrumptious local Swiss cheese and, in my opinion, that's the highlight of the meal. The long haul journeys end with ice cream and they serve delectable Swiss Chocolates at the end of each trip. 
Overall, not the worst experience but definitely not up to the mark! There is a huge room for improvement.

title: Ok experience
review_text: This was a small flight of only one hour. The service was good and we did not expect our kid to receive a plush airplane for such a small flight.

title: Swiss airlines is a mess
review_text:
We had to wait in 5 different queues of at least 1000 people. They had multiple bottlenecks where they required to check the same documents 2 or 3x. Their poor queue management made nearly every international flight in E gate late for departure. For a country that‚Äôs so expensive you‚Äôd think they could pay enough people move the lines along. 

Tl;Dr : Swiss airlines will take any opportunity to waste your time. They don‚Äôt know how to handle a queue. Only leave early morning or late night.

title: the pilot of Swiss deliberately leaves our luggage behind
review_text:
Seated in the airplane, our child, who was by the window seat, exclaimed looking outside: "Look, our suitcases are there!".And indeed, our suitcases (which had colorful coverings which made them extremely recognizable) were on an airport trolley right by the airplane. And at that moment, the captain announced: "Cabin crew, arm the slides". Almost immediately we observed the workers on the airfield starting to cover the trolleys with our suitcases with some kind of fabric.

I rushed to the flight attendant: "These are definitely our suitcases there right by the airplane. Would we not load them into the airplane?" The flight attendant promised to check with the captain and went to the cockpit at once. Returning back, the flight attendant (name Attenhofer-Patt) replied: "We are sorry. These are your suitcases, yes. We were given a time window to take off now and we don't have time to load your luggage into the airplane". Two other flight attendants (Sasivari and Bacher) witnessed our situation of total helplessness.
Right at that time the airplane starts moving backwards. Our child, seeing all that happening, starts crying: "There are our suitcases, aren't they gonna take them?" We merely had to observe our luggage staying behind and comforting our child the way we could.

Throughout the flight, I kept asking myself these questions:
 * It is minus 22 at our destination, and our child's warm clothes are not coming with us. Do they think that treatment of the passengers is normal?
 * I am the organizer of my father's funeral in a few days upon arrival, and my clothes for the ceremony are left behind as well.

Upon landing, there were around 15 families in total including us who did not receive their luggage, apparently all from the trolleys we observed being left behind. Of our 3 suitcases we registered for the flight, 2 were left behind. Each of these families had to spend additional ~2 hours registering the lost baggage, most of them with children like us, already in the late hour. At some point, we observed the whole crew of the Swiss flight just passing by, without caring to stop by. They all had their suitcases with them, so why should they at all care??

Fast forward, after numerous phone calls to the airport to check the status of our luggage, the suitcases were delivered to us 3 days later(!) at 2 a.m. in the night. That was the earliest time they could deliver our luggage, but I agreed on that and spent the sleepless night, because my father's funeral was next morning and I desperately needed the contents of my suitcase by then.

As a conclusion from our side, we are not using Swiss these days for our summer vacation. Having passed through that experience of ours, we are confident in our decision to not use Swiss ever again at all. As you are reading this, I am asking you for your support. We, passengers with luggage, passengers with children, should not tolerate that attitude from the airline company. For the sake of a child, who cried at seeing his belongings left behind, please refrain from using Swiss airlines for your next trip.

In the picture attached, you can see the trolleys full of suitcases of all the passengers who had their luggage also left behind.

title: Not punctual
review_text: A fly of one hour from Frankfurt to Geneva delayed 30 minutes. Swiss ponctuality is not applicable to this airlines. Remains just the name.

title: Nope...Don't Do It!
review_text: A never-ending, years long, Dickens-esque experience. Odd twists, turns and deceit. I've spent literally hours on the phone waiting, talking, begging and pleading. I talked to one rep who was based in the South Pacific for an hour and a half. She rebooked and then never sent the promised email with all of out information. They used to be so great. Now they just lie. Nope. (Date down is the closest we could get. Tripped is (was) planned for end of August. We flew them before , though, back in '17 or '18)

title: Hospitality at it's best!
review_text: Traveling around the world is never easy, but the superlative staff on this airlines made our trip a joy!

title: Awful customer service non existent
review_text: Stay well away from this airline. If you have any issues for example if they rip your bag, delay your flight so you miss you connecting flight, lose your bags to and from the destination for 8 days + you will not get an apology. When you try and speak to their customer service somewhere god knows where, they will hang up on you if they don‚Äôt feel like talking to you or helping you. I was hung up on 3 times, the person advised that they work from Fiji call centre ‚Äúthere are a lot of us here mam‚Äù well not enough to help or reply to your customers. title: worst customer service
review_text: I booked the flight but received the email asking me to rebook because their schedule change. but when I reached to customer service no one answers my call. and when I reached out to them via social media, they told me it has been refunded which is not true. and I just wasted my $3000!

title: Miss

Nobody from the company replied to us and is not taking any responsibility! We are having a terrible experience. This never happens to me before! No costumer service! No client care! And I just want my bag to be found and delivered to me

title: Move from "ahead of competition" to lower average
review_text:
I refer to several flights ZRH-BOM and back in 2022 in Business and First Class,
Swiss, in past well known as ahead of competition in terms of service excellence, hospitality cabin comfort and recognition of most frequent customers significantly dropped in price performance ratio at outstanding high prices since beginning of Covid although there is not necessarily a link to the pandemic situation which affected other airlines (frequently used) as well. Some facts:
- no personal welcome of most frequent flyers (cost nothing)
- no welcome drink after boarding (cost almost nothing)
- old, noisy and over-used aircraft model A330 (investment needed)
- significantly reduced menu and beverage list (may have brought some savings)
  this is not the case for first class, Menu still good, limited beverage, high price
- zero snacks during night flight, no staff visible (there is a shortage on personal)
- minimalistic service (might be linked to above)
- 50MB voucher when at First class for (poor) internet -> a joke vs economy in TK flights
- BUT, despite of all above, outstanding high prices (more than double vs AF/KLM on destination ZRH-GRU during Covid time (2021) at <30% occupied Business class)

title: Amazing
review_text: 10 hours 40 mins flight from Bangkok to Zurich was amazing. The service was great, staff were really attentive and the flight was smooth. Check in was also easy, birding and take off was on time. Cleanliness, leg room and everything was all 10/10. When we got to Zurich for the one hour flight to London Heathrow, we had plenty of time to take a breather and check in with no rush, with take off being on time again. Luggage was also all taken care of and came fairly quickly at the end. Amazing flight, amazing service. Good airline, will definitely use again

title: Worst experience traveling with a dog
review_text:
They are the most stacked in time company I've ever seen, and they have the worst customer service I've ever experienced. 
No answer on Twitter, Instagram, or email. On the phone, I had to have four calls (each one took an hour or more).
Also, on the flight, my dog got nervous because the bag was totally closed (because they made me), and they didn't allow me to open the zipper a little bit to calm him down. They treat dogs like objects, not like beings that are alive, and sometimes get scared, like everyone.
Oh! And they still your money, I paid for a special seat to have more space and being at the front to be able to catch my connection easily, they changed my seat to one in the back of the plane, no space at all and I had to run to catch my connection. And do you think they gave me my money back? Nop!

title: Decent service
review_text:
Flew with Swiss from Dubai to Palma Mallorca via Zurich, as there are no direct flights.
Have done Emirates to Barcelona and then a Vueling hop across, but Swiss has the advantage of carrying your bags straight through.
Flew business for the night flight  from Dubai to Zurich and then economy for the other three legs. Business flat bed was comfortable enough to sleep, though not as good as Emirates business. Economy fine for both the short haul and long haul legs.
Film selection not bad, food quite tasty and seats comfortable enough.
Will probably use this route again.

title: Not the top of business class options.
review_text: Sadly Swiss' business class doesn't hold a candle to many other airlines. The seats are mostly lie-flat, yes, but very uncomfortable, stiff, itchy, bumpy etc. The food was adequate but that's about it. Nothing memorable. Service was polite but as it was an overnight flight, not overly-present. I'd choose another airline's business class product long before trying Swiss again.

title: Worst airline!! Do not fly with Swiss!!!
review_text:
Worst airline in the world!!! Do not fly with Swiss airline!!
 been trying to reach them for 5 days and I‚Äôve had no response or representatives telling me they can‚Äôt help me and HANGING UP ON MY FACE!!!

We had a 1 hour delay for our flight from TEl aviv to Switzerland. We purposefully took only carry on luggage so that we wouldn‚Äôt have to risk losing our luggage or being delayed on our vacation. By the time we got on the plane, there was NO ROOM for carry on luggage!! instead of telling people to put their backpacks and smaller luggage under the seat, the overhead bins were full of small bags so we couldn‚Äôt put our carry on suitcase there. The stewardess pressured us to send one of our suitcases with the bigger luggage and PROMISED US IT WILL GET TO OUR DESTINATION. 
We then had to SIT ON OUR SECOND SUITCASE for 4 HOURS!!! this was a $500 flight!! And we had to sit on our luggage like ANIMALS!!! Our backs are killing us!!! Not to mention it is ILLEGAL and DANGEROUS!! 
We get to the second plane from Switzerland to PMI and AGAIN!!! They take our second carry on and reassure us that ‚ÄúTHERE IS NOTHING TO WORRY ABOUT‚Äù!! By the time we got to PMI, our suitcases were nowhere to be found. 
We were at the airport for another 4 hours and left empty handed, and of course- there was NO WAY to reach them! 
We got one piece of luggage at 12 o‚Äôclock at night!!! And we still didn‚Äôt get our second piece of luggage! I‚Äôve called 6 different numbers connected to Swiss airlines, one of them didn‚Äôt even work and the other two ended in representatives telling us with no hesitation: ‚Äúthis is not our problem have a nice day‚Äù and hung up.  

A representative just told me that people have been waiting for months to get compensation for lost luggage and haven‚Äôt gotten an answer yet so I ‚ÄúI am not the first one and have to wait like everyone else‚Äù and then hung up on me!! Disgusting service!  üò°

review_text:
