title: DO NOT TRAVEL WITH SWISS!!
review_text: I DO NOT RECOMMEND SWISS AIRLINES!!! We have not received our luggage and each time I‚Äôve called I‚Äôve either been hung up on, redirected to someone that redirects me elsewhere, or given a number that does not work. I asked to speak to manager once I finally got through and was told I cannot, this is absurd!! I would think twice about travel with Swiss.

title: SwissAir didn't inform us the flight changed days until the day of travel.
review_text: Our family booked in February to travel on Wednesday July 13 to Zurich on SwissAir. We went to check in, only to find out that the flight had been canceled 5 weeks previously, and we had been rebooked to fly Thursday July 14. Now I understand that these are fairly common occurences, where airlines change flights and rebook passengers. However, they always inform the passenger, but not in this case. The outcome is that we have an extra day before we fly, and we are paying for a hotel in Europe for one night that we will not use. It's disgraceful and irresponsible of the airline not to have informed us that our flights changed.

title: Great service on board.
review_text: The service on board was excellent, I sat in premium economy- comfortable footrest and recline. Meals were very good- snacks and drinks were more than enough. The stewards and stewardesses were extremely friendly and accommodating. The only issue I have with Swiss Airlines- is the inability to check in on-line. This took more than an hour in the airport- certainly could have been smoother if on-line check in was available.

title: London to Bangkok faultless service
review_text:
We loved our flight from London to Bangkok on Swiss airways.

The lounge at Zurich E terminal is comfortable, small buffet on offer and plenty of drink choices. One thing I would say by early afternoon it does get extremely busy.

Whilst the seating on the aircraft is a little dated, it is more than made up for by the exceptional service and food that we received on board. I can honestly say the crew couldn't have done anything more for us. I can wholeheartedly recommend Swiss Air.

title: Pure joy!
review_text:
I do not get why people get annoyed with this airline company. Lack of luck, lack of tolerance or something third?

I had 4 flights with SWISS. Belgrade/Zurich -  Zurich/Bangkok. And vice versa. Professionalism, kindness from the officials and on time flights (every single flight!). 2 fresh vegetarian MEALS each flight ZRH/BKK and BKK/ZRH (ordered for free), free snacks and beer, water, juice. Enough space for legs. Clean toilet. Even I beeped in Zurich airport, but officer lady on the check up was so kind and everything went fast and good (ahh, those magnet souveniers! ^^).

Special greeting to nice and very kind blonde work lady at "Zurich duty free"! 

10/10 SWISS, you are my #1!

title: SWISS Air keeps changing seats eventhough you paid to be in a specific seat
review_text: We had a terrible experience SWISS air changing our seats two times.Me and my boyfriend paid 24 euros only for seats so we can sit at a place we like. Do not pay extra for seats, they are most like to change.Ours changed a day before departure and just 30 minutes before departure too.

title: NEVER TRAVEL SWISS AIR - There are 40 % chances that your check in baggage will never arrive ! 17000 < bags LOST
review_text:

title: Delayed bags. My son needs his medicine.
review_text: Booked a flight from Miami to Greece with a layover in Zurich. Our bags have not arrived, no one can locate them or able to provide adequate information. My son has asthma and needs his medicine that is in the bag that got delayed. It has been 3 days on vacation with no clothing or medicine for my son. I have no words to describe such poor service. Do not fly Swiss air.

title: Overall a terrible flight experience!
review_text:
EWR - Zurich 

Cons: 
- Wifi not working (pretty annoying for a 8 hour flight). 
- Seat was completely broken: Earphone plug not working properly, Hand rest couldn‚Äôt stay in place when lifted and it was difficult to take the media screen out of the seat. 
- You get a lot of leg space but I didn‚Äôt understand why did the flight attendants were always going through our leg area, they interrupted us a lot and even one time one flight attendant almost tripped over with her tray because she decided to go through us yet she saw that we have bags on the floor, and she still did it. That‚Äôs ridiculous. (Seat 29B)

- Small breakfast (muffin)

Zurich - BOM

Pros: 
This flight was the complete opposite! 
Wifi was working properly. 
This time I received a proper functioning seat and most importantly the flight attendants were much more serious and didn‚Äôt pass through our lane at all! 
We even got a snack when we just took off and immediately after that received our first meal. 

Pros for both of the flights: 
- The meals were actually good! 

Final conclusion:
I‚Äôm not sure if I‚Äôll fly with Swiss again, at least not for long distance flights.

title: DONT WASTE YOUR MONEY
review_text: I have never in my life dealt with customer service as bad as Swiss Airlines. In Dec we had a trip booked to Zurich, but had to cancel due to a death in our family. I called Swiss and they said no problem, provide a death certificate and we will refund your money. I provided the death certificate as well as birth certificates establishing the relationship.  Six months later, I still don‚Äôt have a refund for the $3800 flights. Even worse, I‚Äôve been HUNG UP ON and laughed at 3 of the last 4 times I‚Äôve called.

title: worst cost benefit
review_text:
The worst airline, lack of food, alcohol, education and crew professionalism

Summary hunger, cold, bottled in the passenger's head and a lot of noise

title: No way to treat customers
review_text:
My sister and I flew to South Africa from the UK and we were due to fly back when we were told SA was going on the red list because of omicron and we had to leave a few days earlier than our scheduled flight back in order to avoid being stranded and also paying the isolatoon quarantine. My other half had a flight booked with BA at the same time us back to the UK and she requested a refund and straight away they gave her a full refund but when it came to Swiss Air they took over 2 months to do so and when they did they gave us back a refund considering our tickets were ¬£1200 for both of us, we only recieved ¬£130 as a whole and we felt really disrespectes and that they are cheap. How do you justify that? It's as if we were to blamed for Omicron and for choosing to leave early not being able to fly out with them.

Never again for us!!

title: Lost baggage
review_text: Almost 24 hours later no information on lost baggage.... Right now 58 minutes waiting for customer service to answer the phone..... Outrageous!!!!!! Shame!!!!

title: Over-books and Under-delivers
review_text:
Swiss Air over-books and under-delivers. 

1) They canceled our flight due to "administration issues" 
2) Left us at Layover in the most expensive city in the world for 22 days
3) Rebooked us in worse seating 
4) Ignored our requests to talk with customer service
5) Redirected all of our complaints to their customer relations "form" which is down at the moment.

The experience we had with this flight is enough for us to never book with them again, but I find it highly unethical for a business to hide behind an online form with no real accountability to top it off.

title: UNETHICAL COMPANY
review_text:
I booked two tickets on Swiss International Air Lines, but needed to reschedule.  I had my travel agent contact the airline to rebook, and they were told that Swiss would just convert the tickets to credit for ease of rebooking future travel.  This happened the third week of May.  We took them at their word, but then my agent was contacted the first week of June, and was informed that the tickets expired on May 31, so no credit would be given.

In other words, they ran out the clock under the false pretense of issuing credit, but were really just making sure that they would not need to honor my tickets by letting them expire.  This is highly DISHONEST and UNETHICAL!!!  I am now out about $2,600 because this airline lied to my travel agent and me.  I did elevate my request to parent company Lufthansa, but have thus far been ignored.  

There are many other airlines that operate with a higher level of ethics.  I will never take another flight on any Lufthansa/Swiss airline.

title: Lovely start and end to a Switzerland visit
review_text:
The journey started a bit slow but that was my fault because I queued at the wrong place. It was crowded/very busy and the directions/signs were not clear enough. Though the queue was smaller at the right place, it started slow due to fewer staff members present. It picked up when a staff member came and another from a different airline helped out. The security process was very quick and the Lufthansa lounge area was a nice place to rest until boarding time. The plane was delayed for around 30 mins. Not sure why. However, it reached Zurich on time. The plane itself was nice and comfortable. I sat at the wrong seat at first (no idea how I managed that when I saw the number) but quickly realised and went to the right one before taking off. I did notice some stains on the wall next to my seat and used the wipes provided to clean it, including the table tray. Apart from that, all was good. The food was tasty. The crew members were very friendly and helpful. They all had smiles which were nice to see. Same with the return flight. The Swiss lounge was bigger and very comfortable, though it was busy. The upper floor (quiet area) had fewer people. The plane was a different model (I think smaller) and to be honest, I preferred that one. The staff members were friendly and engaging. We left Zurich on time. The food was delicious though I would have preferred a little less salt in the meat. The plane and my seat were very clean. I was enjoying the flight so much I was shocked when they announced we would be landing shortly in London. My brain could not process how that was possible because we were in Zurich not long ago. I think we arrived early haha (~20mins). The plane must have moved faster or something. Though I was glad we had a good and safe flight, I wanted to enjoy it a bit more. I had to wait a while to get my bag because immigration clearance was quick and other flights had to get their bags first. The takeoff and landing were smooth. I was very impressed with both flights. Kudos to the crew members for making the experience enjoyable.
Ah, how can I forget the chocolates? We, the passengers were given Swiss chocolates on both flights.

title: Zero star rating! Swiss Air Misplaced, Found, then lost my Luggage
review_text:
My suitcase did not make it to Zurich when I did. I went to the Misplaced Luggage counter, where I was met with an incredibly rude representative, who sent me to another desk. When I arrived at that desk, I was met with a sign to go to another location to inquire about my luggage.  When I arrived there, I was met with yet another rude employee who gave me a card to scan and instructed me to "file a report when you arrive home after your trip." I filed the claim when I arrived at my hotel. I received an email the next day that my luggage was found and would be sent to the hotel. Didn't happen, so I arranged for it to be sent to the next hotel in Venice. It arrived at the Venice airport, where it stayed for weeks. I requested it be sent to my home, but was informed three weeks later that it was sent to the Venice hotel. 
Our trip was 13 days total.  I have emailed multiple times, called every customer service number I could find. No luck. I called the hotel where my suitcase was supposedly delivered, and was informed that my suitcase was not delivered there. Swiss Air has made zeroes attempts to rectify the situation. 
I find it ironic that Swiss Air guarantees to find and get luggage to customers within 24 hours.

title: Poor Swiss

title: Worst travel experience ever! Do not fly Swiss
review_text:

title: Not again

title: Zero customer service
review_text:
Note: flight was GVA-ZRH-SFO. Trouble GVA-ZRH to catch the United flight to SFO.

What a mess of an airline and severely lacking in customer service. Although there was an airline computer glitch on June 15, the flight was still listed as scheduled. Everyone was at the gate, boarding passes in hand, when it was announced that the flight was cancelled. What an uproar. Everyone was directed to head up to customer service to reschedule. (My booking was through United Airlines which has a co-share with Swissair).

I waited in line for just over 3 hours (yes three hrs). Finally, at the desk to receive help in re-booking a flight home only to hear the Swissair agent tell me that he could not re-book because I was flying on United miles/points. I was instructed to call United Airlines for assistance. Uh, hallo, CALL United when I'm in a foreign country? (An aside, my daughter was traveling back from Germany on the same day, also on points, also with a co-share--Lufthansa. Lufthansa easily took care of her, re-booked, even got her econ+ seats that same day. What a huge difference between Lufthansa and Swissair).

I finally was able to connect with United by phone (United's airport desk agents could not help since my ticket started with a short Swissair flight to Zurich). The United phone agent re-booked me on a flight the next day. Grateful for the re-booking, but not that helpful as I had no where to stay that night. She reminded me that my ticket was a contract with Swissair and since they cancelled the flight, they owed me a hotel room. Sigh, back to Swissair to again ask for help. The agent was reluctant, but I mentioned the ticket contract and that they had cancelled. She informed me that all their reciprocal hotels were filled. She finally told me to find a hotel and submit the receipt to Swissair after. Whether they reimburse me or not is yet to be known. 
So, overall a disaster with Swissair, I recommend  to AVOID SWISSAIR at all cost due to its ZERO customer service.

title: The worst Airline I have ever flow with
review_text:

title: Terrible customer service.
review_text:
Appalling customer service.

title: Terrible Customer Service
review_text: When making my reservation on line, I discovered that Swiss had double booked me and double billed me for the same flight. title: Did get one flight right
review_text: The worst airline I used and I normally fly with Wizz air. They didn‚Äôt get one out of our 4 flights right. Either late, cancelled or stuck in an airplane for additional 3 hours on a wrong airport. Transfer services super slow, I spent the whole day at the airport trying to get new flight tickets after my connection flight was cancelled. When I finally got them we found out my husband and I won‚Äôt be flying together. Absolutely useless, slow staff‚Ä¶ I won‚Äôt use your service ever again. Horrible experience.

Me and my partner bought tickets about 4 months before the flight Malta-Zurich-San Francisco and back. We had two options Swiss and Turkish airlines. Swiss were a bit cheaper, and the duration of the trip (including flight change in Zurich) was perfect in both directions. So we chose Swiss air. About two months before our trip I received an email that the return flight Zurich-Malta was canceled. They offered to return the money or rebook for the next day. We could not cancel all tickets and buy at another airline, because the trip had already been planned, and the cost of tickets at other airlines has already increased. So we rebooked for the next day.
I have to say, the flight Malta-Zurich-San Francisco went perfectly. And I give the highest assessment of the work of the cabin crew. They are incredible people. 
But on the return flight it was just an opposite. My partner does not eat pasta. This is the only product she does not eat at all. And for the first meal we were given a vegetarian pasta, with no choice. So for 10 and a half hours of flight, she ate only yogurt and a small cheesecake that was in the second meal. 
Since we had to rebook Zurich-Malta ticket, our transfer in Zurich took 26 hours. That‚Äôs why on a check-in we were denied of transporting our luggage straight to Malta. We had to pick up our luggage in Zurich and carry it with us. 

In  Zurich I found a Swissair representative and asked about the possibility of staying one night at the expense of the company. As I know some companies that are care of their passengers provide it. But I was refused and explained that we had been warned about the flight cancellation in advance. He also gave me an email address of customer service to request this service. When I said ‚Äúcustomer service replies to emails in few days, so it can‚Äôt help me‚Äù - he just waved his hands. By the way, I wrote them an email 5 days before flight, but did not receive any response. And today, when I‚Äôm writing this review, after more than 3 weeks I‚Äôm still waiting for the response. 
So we spent money on hotel room, food and we both lost our working day. As a result Swissair cost us much more than others, both money and inconvenience. 
So I can‚Äôt recommend Swissair, unfortunately.

title: First time booking and will be the last!!

title: Rude staff bringing down a good airline!! Come on Swiss Air!
review_text:
As an avid international traveler, let me share my incident with you all.
A perfect example on how rude, poorly trained staff is ruining an airline which was once decently good!
Surprisingly, I have heard about their rudeness by several friends and colleagues on the Indian sub-continent sectors!

Reference 2205-LX-00415
Me, my wife and my 3-year old daughter were travelling on LX154 from ZRH to BOM.
It was clearly visible at the beginning of the flight that the crew for economy class looked very unhappy. May be something to do with the sector!!!!

During meal service, the steward (a young male) completely forgot to serve meal to my wife and went ahead two rows. To notify the steward that he missed serving meal to my wife, I politely said, "Excuse me". I was very rudely and angrily replied, "Wait a minute", by the steward. Once he came to my seat I told him that he missed serving meal to my wife and also told him that there is no reason to be rude when I am being polite. To this he replied, "Please don't start", angrily again. He served my wife the meal and moved on.
Later the stewardess (caucasian with a single braid hairstyle) came to me in a very intimidating manner and sat on the armrest of seat 35C. She started by saying, "my colleague said there is a problem". I explained her that her colleague was very rude when I politely mentioned that he missed serving meal to my wife.

Everything she spoke after this was in a very derogatory response. She started by saying that they are understaffed thus what are they supposed to do. I replied that I understand but being understaffed does not mean the Swiss staff can be unnecessarily rude to their customers. She kept on complaining that the staff is also human and they are frustrated too. The most shocking part was that she clearly told me on my face that "Next time I should fly another airline instead of Swiss!!!". To that I replied that she is no one to tell me that. I told her that lets agree to disagree. She noted my seat number (I don't know what for) and left. The same stewardess loudly told a person sitting three rows ahead that "Sir this is not a restaurant"; when the customer asked for food options, politely.
The steward later apologized to me before leaving the flight but the stewardess needs to be sent back to customer service training, clearly.

As someone who is regularly travelling international for the past 18 years, this was the first time I have had such a bad experience with an airline staff. I completely understand if they are understaffed, but that gives them no right to be rude to me (a full ticket paying customer) when I was polite.

 To tell me that "You shouldnt travel with Swiss next time" directly on my face by a Swiss employee is the worst customer service I have faced in air travel. Unfortunately, the stewardess herself forgot that her salary comes from the tickets that people buy through Swiss Air.

I don't know how seriously this message will be taken, but I have provided the exact flight number, date, location, description so that this particular employee of Swiss Air can be tracked and taught how to behave with (polite) customers.

I want to have feedback regarding this incident or else I will be putting this incident online on social media as this behavior is UNACCEPTABLE

title: What's wrong with Swiss air?

title: Worst customer service ever!!! NEVER AGAIN, don‚Äôt book Swiss
review_text:
In June 2021 we booked a business class trip from Europe to Asia, travel date Feb. 2022. It was a business saver tariff and we were looking forward to the trip due to the positive image Swiss enjoys in terms of their business class being very nice.
However, when Omicron hit in Nov. 2021, we decided to rather not go due to concerns of issues of not being able to travel at all as we‚Äòve got a small child and Singapore is known for its fierce rules etc. - so Swiss offered us to put the ticket on hold/leave it as an open ticket that we could use at a later stage without losing our money. So far, so good.
We then tried to use the ticket to book a new flight numerous times and always had to do it via phone. Several times it seemed to have worked after spending hours on the phone, queuing, connections breaking down etc. - but every time there was this small error message in the App.
So we contacted customer service - only to learn that the booking never went through and that we would have to pay an additional 5k Euro for it to work. Tried multiple alternatives but they basically said the prices we see online are not correct as the ticket cannot be changed like that despite the fact that we were literally granted an open ticket that would serve as a ‚Äûvoucher‚Äú to its full value.
We then got another confirmation for the flight and information that the route had been changed, so we assumed that it had worked. However, there was still this tiny message popping up.
So we called again, only to learn that it hadn‚Äôt gone through again. No one ever gave us full information on the terms and conditions. But eventually we got the info that we could now also change the route, which was news to us and that whatever prices we saw online we could see as a basis for the new booking. So we went for a new booking, only to learn that we couldn‚Äôt do it as the date wasn‚Äôt fitting because it had to be within a certain time frame which we weren‚Äôt informed about earlier. On that note they also casually told us that we had to book until the next day, otherwise we‚Äòd lose all our money (3,600 Eur). We then re-booked accordingly and gave our credit card details for a 2,000 Eur surcharge and got a booking confirmation. However, there was still the same error message in the system and the company also only charged my credit card with 0.01 Eur which was weird. So we called - again! For the umpteenth time in several months - only to learn that there was no booking because they had changed the time frame and we would have to leave 3 days earlier otherwise we‚Äòd losw our money.
I then tried to upgrade to a flex tariff but was kicked out of the line several times in a row. That was commonplace before, too, and the agents, especially a guy called Wafiq who wouldn‚Äôt give me his surname, were extremely rude.
We never got any proper written feedback or calls that there was a problem. It was only because we wanted to reserve special meals and seats that we saw the tiny error message (but still everything worked - I was able to change seats etc. and had a booking confirmation). So if I hadn‚Äôt done that, we‚Äòd have ended up arriving at the airport without a booking.

Altogether I spent about 8 hours on the phone over the course of several months of this odyssey. I got a ton of grey hair from that and had to change all our other travel arrangements numerous times.

Honestly: I‚Äòll never book with Swiss ever again. Now all I want is my money back and then never see or hear from that again, but I doubt that I will ever get that money back.

MY ADVICE: don‚Äôt book Swiss! They may portray themselves as high-class friendly Swiss airline, but their customer service is just terrible and they don‚Äôt give a damn about customer satisfaction. They will leave you completely on your own without any advice or information and if they talk to you, you cannot trust that information as they tell you one thing today and another tomorrow. I travel a lot, in Eco and Business, using all kinds of airlines and I‚Äòve had issues with other airlines before, but none as bad as this.

title: Most horrible airline ever
review_text:
Hi

On Friday, May 20th, after a long flight with Untied from SFO to LAX and then LAX to LHR, I was supposed to have a connecting flight from LRH to Nice through Zurich with Swiis airline.
Unfortunately, the first flight was delayed and I haven't been able to catch my second flight.
I had to go to the transfer desk (no one on the flight crew help me to find it) and after one hour of waiting. the desk person told me that all flights to Nice were fully booked until Monday (it was Friday). So I had to ask him if I could fly to Marseille, and probably rent a car to go to Nice, but the first available flight was the next day.
So I had to stay for the night at the Movenpick hotel, next to the airport.

Few things I would like to share:
- I paid for an Airbnb that I haven't been able to use and the Swiss airline refused to pay for it.
- At the Movenpick, the TV was not working and the internet was barely working.
- I haven't been able to get my luggage, so get a refreshment kit, I have a few feedbacks about this kit:
¬† ¬† - The t-shirt in my kit was XXL, but I wear S.
¬† ¬† - The toothpaste was impossible to open.
¬† ¬† - I got a razor, but shaving cream.
Concerning the food coupon, no one told me that it was limited to 20 CHF, so I ended up paying an extra 45 CHF (I needed a couple of glasses of wine after this horrible experience).

On my way back from Nice to Zurich, I also experienced a lot of issues with your airline:
- Issue with the electronics on the plane, forcing the plane to come back to the gate in order to reboot the plane.
- Last-minute changes forced to renew the flight documents.
- Last-minute changes forced us to add fuel to the plane.
- Last-minute error on the flight documents that forced us to wait for a new version of the documents.
- And finally, when we landed in Zurich, the group staff was late, forcing us to wait on the plane. 

The result has been to miss my connexion plane, again.
The entire experience before, during had after the flights has been awful, and I truly recommend people to not use this airline.

title: Outrageous and rude

title: Wish I could give ZERO for reminding others
review_text:
My flight was cancelled by SWISS a week before the scheduled time, with a subject "Change of reservation".

I made my request of refund about a month later and received the last email from SWISS.

I started calling their office in HKG two and a half months later. Called the local  office number, pressed for Cantonese, they answered me with a Mandarin voice message asking me to call other offices. Pressed English, which I also tried for multiple times, directed me to somewhere no one ever picked up the call.

Then, I started calling the Switzerland office, which claims to provide 00-24 services. I called so many times again, Each time rang for half an hour to an hour. Before I gave up, someone answered. However, I was told she could not help and gave me another US toll-free number, coz I booked my ticket online (who's not??)

So, I repeated the calling and waiting for more times. The attitude of the person from the "Website Department" drove me crazy (the number I was asked to call is a department has nothing to do with CS...) and made me decide to wrote about all these and take legal actions. Absolutely UNBELIEVABLE!!! Far beyond unhelpful...

The word "International" of Swiss International Air Lines does NOT mean meeting the international standards, It means calling the local office, headquarters office and american office, but still receiving no chance to talk to someone responsible. I have not decided whether I would try the new number directing me to another unknown place on the planet Earth, but I decided to officially file the case with governmental organisations both in Hong Kong and Switzerland.

DON'T repeat what I have experienced.

title: Be aware of Swiss mask rules
review_text:
Before leaving and also at booking I had checked on Swiss' web site the rules concerning wearing a mask. In Canada mask are mandatory for all flights and I would not even consider getting on a plane where people are not wearing masks, given the fact that if anyone sitting around you has COVID after 8 hours breathing their air you are sure to become infected. So reassured in the Web site where it says for Canada, masks on board, I was shocked as as soon as the doors were closed, the crew took off their masks. I told them on Canadian flights they are mandatory but the head flight attendant said as soon as we close the doors we are on Swiss law which does not require masks.

Well I did check after the flight Transport Canada regulations and it is indeed only on inbound flights. But I really believe Swiss should make the Swiss rule clear to passengers as it appears nowhere I could see on the Web site. You cannot choose Switzerland as a destination where I assume it would tell you no masks, and when you chose Canada it should really mention no masks on outbound flights.

I understand the rules are evolving but passengers should be well informed so they can take their decisions accordingly. For now I will stick to flights were masks are mandatory.

Other than that, the food was good and the flight OK.

title: Swiss Customer Service Absolutely Terrible
review_text:

The booking/reservation system won't let me rebook my flight even though our tickets state they can be rebooked.

Then I called Zurich office, they don't answer the phone as well.
Sent them an email and a Facebook message just in case that might work, Facebook no response, email was answered 10 days later...
Luckily I managed to figure out why rebooking was not available and rebooked our  flights.
In the airplane they won't even give you the antiseptic wipe, is this really that expensive for Swiss?
During the flight we asked for information about our connecting flight (also Swiss airlines) and were told that 10 minutes before the end of the flight they'll give us the needed information.
That never happened and they avoided coming to our seat even though we called for a flight attendant.
After we landed I asked for assistance and was told that they have no information and that we should get all of the information when we leave the aircraft.

Swiss airlines proved on multiple occasions that they are just a 3rd class airline.
We wont use Swiss airlines again.

title: SWISS is the best airline in the Lufthansa group
review_text:
There are of course five huge airlines in the Lufthansa Group and they are Lufthansa, Austrian, Eurowings, Brussels Airlines and Swiss and Swiss is undoubtedly the best airline among them.

Deutsche Lufthansa the mother company was actually the very first airline I flew from Frankfurt to Newark and it used to be quite the solid product steaming of proud German industrial engineering and Bavarian efficiency. Their business class product used to be sophisticated and well worth the extra cost. 

But all that was indeed in the past and not anymore and the Lufthansa of today is just as every other low-fare airline in Europe these days. If given the choice to choose freely among these airlines I would strongly advice to chose Swiss as they are the most superior airline operating newer and better aircrafts, much better menu in flight, and better drink and beverages selection, as well as the bests airport for layovers in Z√ºrich at relatively competetive fares not often but every once in a while.

title: Very Poor Ground Service
review_text: I have flown more than 25 segments with Swiss in a 12 month period, but I have had enough. I always select my seats in advance, for which I am being charged ¬£ 30. I don't mind, because that gives me the opportunity to select the seat that I want. On at least 5 out of the 25 flights I was told either at the check-in or at the gate and once on the plane itself that my seat has been changed 'for operational' reasons, only to see somebody else seated in the seat that I have selected and paid for. I complained in writing that they should not charge me ¬£ 30 for a seat that I did not select and not want and asked for a refund. Swiss refused a refund, although very clearly, I was paying for a service which they did not provide. I was assigned a seat by Swiss but I was being charged for 'selecting' a seat. I have had enough. I have made my last flight on Swiss, luckily there are plenty of other airlines flying the routes that I regularly fly, and those airlines have a proper customer service that listens to customer concerns and do not charge for service that they do not provide!

title: Traveller Beware!!!!  NEVER  Travel with Swiss Air
review_text:
Having travelled the globe over many years I can hand on heart say we have never had such bad service as we did with this company. 
After booking a months breakaway in Thailand to see our daughter and new granddaughter and jumping through the many covid related bureaucratic hoops to get there, a week before our departure I checked  ‚Äú manage my booking‚Äù to find all six of our flights had been deleted.   We had no email or communication from the company.   
After some anxious hours and several very long phonecalls we were reinstated on the original flights.   We were told we had been sent an e mail changing the flights and because we hadnt responded to the alleged e mail they had deleted our flights. This would prove to be the first of many  fictitious e mails. 
A week befor our flight home I thought I had better check ‚Äúmanage my booking‚Äù again only to find the first of 3 flights deleted. I had to enlist the help of family back in England to help with the long phone calls to Swiss Air.  On a daily basis the flight was deleted and reinstated over the week prior to travelling home.  Our stress levels went through the roof and spoilt the last week of our holiday!!!  
When we arrived at the airport sure enough we were not on the  flight.   
To add to all our problems my husband has Motor Neurone Disease. We had checked with the carriers that we could take the scooter and they sent an e mail saying we could only to get told a week before we travel that he couldnt take it.  At this point it was too late to cancel our plans.  
To this day we have had no answers or communication from this company let alone an apology. 
I cannot tell enough people NOT to travel with Swiss Air.   We almost needed therapy when we got back!!

title: Not sure what to think
review_text:
I flew economy and was treated well and I appreciated their rigor about mask wearing. All was good, on time, super helpful and professional staff. The entertainment boxes under the seats get hot and mean you have to sit at an angle, bad for hips and lower back. However, the flight wasn't booked full and there was room to spread out. The IFE options are poor compared to some airlines, but whatevs. The food was good. Mainly the staff made it a pleasure. 

I flew business the same route and found the cabin very tight. Every seat was booked and I'd say that means they overbooked given covid. I was put in the middle w a stranger right next to me. Nothing, not even a small plastic thing to separate us. (Except the table.) Really odd. 

The seat became a flat bed which is always great. The blanket was really nice, kind of had a heaviness to it from the wool. The pillow was sitting on the seat, not wrapped, which is maybe better not to think about. The food was good. 

In that small cabin, about six people weren't wearing masks or were partially masked the entire time and the staff didn't enforce the policy even when another passenger asked them to. The woman next to me had her mask below her nose from the time she walked in throughout the flight.  The men behind me weren't masked. A guy to my left wore his below his mouth. One couple didn't even pretend. I'd say 75 per cent of the little cabin was fully masked and 25 per cent didn't/wouldn't wear their masks. 

So there was that. 

But overall I had a positive experience on several flights and will happily fly Swiss again, by preference.

title: Dreadful, unhelpful customer service
review_text: Swiss lost my bags and the baggage company they contract failed to deliver one bag containing ski equipment and each time I called them their phone rang out after 20 mins waiting. This happened three times and was after more than 2 days. In desperation I called Swiss (it is THEIR responsibility after all) and they claimed they could do nothing. Extremely disappointing- all it needed was the person at Swiss to take an interest and TRY and resolve.

title: NEVER FLY WITH THEM
review_text:
This is the worst Airline ever. 
1. Changed their policies and didn‚Äôt inform us
2. Changed our ticket to the following day 
3. Go back today and they tell us that are flight is not for another TWO DAYS 
4. We called them prior to get information on this flight and they didn‚Äôt give us a invoice 
5. Customer Service gave us a run around for 5 hours!!! One lady gave us a fake number to call, the last guy didn‚Äôt even care and i asked to speak to someone else and he goes ‚ÄúI‚Äôm hanging up on you‚Äù and hangs up on me. 

Never in my life have i ever experienced anything like this before. 

So save your money cause this could happen to you.

title: Bad treatment.
review_text:
I have not been flying with Swiss Airlines before this was the first time and will be the last time ever flying with Swiss Airlines. When I was boarding the plane the person who was taking care of the E-ticket told me that my handbag needs to be checked in?!!
I was surprised I asked him why he said that my bag is too big?!! I told him it was only a laptop and a little snack, he told me you will pick it up in Danemark Copenhagen.
when I got to the plan I saw bags way bigger than mine maybe twice as bigger as my bag?!!! anyway, I said to myself it's an airplane's roll. When I get off the plane I was asking for my handbag they told me you will pick it up in Sanfranssico ?!!! I got so upset with this situation and had to go to baggage claim to make sure it was on the way to SF. I had to get out of the transit and get back in again. it was very stressfull for me. I am not a happy customer and I will not give any stars to this company.

title: Do not fly with these guys. Never had such a bad experience with a airline
review_text: I haven't even gotten on the plane and I'm writing this,I dont even write reviews but this is bad and don't want anyone to go through with this. pre paid our snowboard bags, got to the front and they said we have to pay 100sf to put our bags on, after arguing with them for a hour, 2/4 of our bags got in no problem. So I asked again. How can 2 bags be paid for and 2 of them not. They refused to answer. So I said screw it and I'll just pay it. They sent us to 4 different locations to pay for our bag. All locations were wrong we ended finding where to pay. It ended up being the same location we started at. After we get there, he says it's going to be 350 sf  as we now have to pay for the other 2 bags that have gone through. So after more arguing I asked for the number to dispute this they refused. And said if you want your bags on the plane your paying. End of conversation. So now we are here, 500cnd down the drain for something we already paid for

title: Would fly Swiss again.
review_text: I used a broker to buy our Tickets to Israel.  Our Swiss flights were LX41 then LX256. We flew business class.  Seats and area were very good.  We had seats by the window.  Service was very good.  Both flights went as you would want.  We were both able to have good sleep ( if there is such) on both flights.  We would fly swiss again.

title: Spencer Kay
review_text: Wow, really like this airline. After reading the horror stories of reviews, I thought that I wouldn't be able to rebook to get from a family wedding to a funeral. The call operator was wonderful, very efficient and managed to send me an email immediately with the new booking date. Even after putting up with me.

title: Missed connection, misplaced luggage and lost luggage
review_text: Our flight from Rome was delayed (operated by Helvetic)  because they did not have the plane properly inspected!!! So we lost the connection in Zurich. In Zurich we were asked to pick up our luggage and my husband skis were nowhere to be found. The excuse was "we have been hacked for two weeks so everything is being done by hand"!!?? After 4 hours lost at the airport the skis showed up. The next day when we arrived to Miami our only bag was not found. As I am very stubborn I dedicated innumerable hours to make phone calls. The bag which had stayed in Zurich appeared 1 week later. Just referring facts, not even commenting on how useless and nasty their staff has been

title: Poor service and food
review_text:
When I booked the tickets with Swiss Airlines, I guess I had a bit of expectations, however I can't really say that they lived up to them.

The planes are clean and fresh. So far all good. But that's also

title: Canceled flight. No rebooking at airport. No one seemed to know what was going on.
review_text: Canceled flight. No rebooking at airport. No one seemed to know what was going on. all passengers  were told to pick up their baggage and come back to the airport the next day at 1pm if they didn‚Äôt get an email from Swiss. Called and was told multiple times that I couldn‚Äôt be rebooked cuz it was showing I was already on a flight (the one that took off and had to land due to issues with the plane). Nothing given for inconvenience. Asked for my return flight to be pushed back and was told I have to pay the fees. Never wrote a review for an airline before but this was absolutely ridiculous.

title: Worst airline i've ever used and the only time i've ever felt the need to leave a review to warn others not to to use.
review_text: Terrible, just awful, never been shafted so hard in my life based on their incompetence. Scam, wouldn't recommend to my worst enemy.

title: A graer lowcost company
review_text:
What a great low cost company in the price of normal airline company!
Normal ticket fares with low cost services. In economy class, they serve only a bottle (0.33ml) of water and one small piece of Swiss chocolate.

Think about to sell scratch like Ryan air...

title: All good
review_text:
Last leg of a connecting flight home, and all went smoothly.
Documents were checked before boarding,  and all was ready for an on time boarding.

title: They lost my bag
review_text:
Traveling with Swiss airlines has been a nightmare. A week has passed since my flight and I'm still waiting for my bag.

I submitted a claim, and after 4 days had passed they supposedly found my bag in Cyprus. I say supposedly because the information they give whenever I call customer service is not the same I see on the tracing system. Since I traveled to my permanent address they will not be covering any expenses. 

This is not the first time an airlines misplaces my bag -- and they usually return it within 24 hrs. 

I am tired, I am angry and I will not travel with Swiss airlines in the future.

title: Check in problems
review_text:
A320 coach class from Athens to Zurich. 
Usual check in mess on the app, but once at the airport a young lady on the desk did the job perfectly.
Slightly late boarding, but made up the time in the air.
Good legroom and professional cabin crew.

title: Swiss (International Air Lines ) Flight LX 1838 from Zurich to Athens (code-share flight)  was generally a good flight
review_text:
I have taken the flight LX 1838 of Swiss Airlines (a code-share flight with Aegean Airlines) from Zurich to Athens (a 3-hours direct flight) on February 2022 on board of an Airbus A 220 and the flight was generally a good flight.
We have done the check in online, and although we have been waiting in very long queues for half an hour to approach the check in counter in order to show all the necessary documentation for SARS-CoV2 / Covid-19 [ i.e. vaccination certificate and the Passenger Locator Form (PLF)] when we finally reached the check in counter they told us to proceed to the boarding Gate without any document examination.
The service of the Air Crew was good (e. g. friendliness, kindliness, helpfulness, etc.) and in a disappointing way, they did not serve anything free except of a small bottle of water (0,33 l) and a tiny piece of chocolate (everything was on a payment basis). 
SWISS Airlines is a good air-carrier (bought by Lufthansa Group) with zero accidents after its new start in 2002 (following a shocking bankruptcy of Swissair) and in 2019 Swiss has taken the first place in World Travel Awards in the ‚ÄúEurope‚Äôs Leading Airline -Economy Class‚Äúcategory.
I enjoyed my flight with Swiss Airlines from Zurich to Athens and probably I will fly again.

title: Mess
review_text:
A mess with their online check in meant my partner and myself could not sit together. 
Messy boarding, disorganized, and lack of direction from ground staff.
A320 front Zurich to Athens, reasonable legroom, clean plane, polite crew.

title: Check in mess
review_text:
I could not check in online while my partner could. I sent a message via Facebook, but was ignored.
Once at the airport all was well, and the flight was fine, including reasonable legroom and fast boarding.

title: Nightmare
review_text:
What a nightmare.. The food was bad, the seats uncomfortable, the departure was an hour earlier without bothering to let us know in advance by email. We found out at the airport ... 
Despite an hour earlier departure, we were 2 hours late and almost missed the connecting flight. Then they lost our suitcases in Vienna, Zurich and San Jose .. Only 2 people out of 12 had their suitcases .. Worst experience

title: Excellent airline
review_text:
Travelled from Johannesburg to London on 24th February with Swissair and would highly recommend them, having travelled TO Jbg on Lufthansa and had a bad experience.
Swissair had good leg room, food was lovely, drinks were flowing, staff were very friendly and fast with service, breakfast was good and plentiful too. Drinks plentiful too. 
Definitely travel with Swissair again!

title: Very Clean, Very Swiss, Staff a bit Snappy
review_text: Overall good experience, I love the Swiss flair of getting chocolate etc. Descent but not market leading entertainment system. Often the crews on Swiss can be a bit snappy in their way they speak with passengers, but overall I'd recommend their standard, safety and cleanliness.

title: Connecting flight to Heathrow
review_text:
I travelled from Thailand to London on 19th Feb 2022 via Zurich with Swiss Intl. the flight was ok. Nothing to write home about. Staff efficient but not friendly. Couldn‚Äôt use the toilets at one point because they were both closed off so shift change staff could use them - fair enough they need a bathroom but leave one for all the passengers at the end of the plane‚Ä¶ Anyway, the plane left late. As it was around a twelve hour flight you would
usually expect it to make up the time. It didn‚Äôt. It was due to land at 6.05am and in fact landed at 6.45am there was no explanation. The crew mentioned a couple of connections that would be tight but that everyone would be fine. My flight to London was 7.10. I asked for support to get there and was told just to go. They told me gate D36. Getting off the plane was a laid back affair, no urgency or prioritisation for passengers connecting, and there were quite a few. I disembarked and planned to move quickly, but no. There was a long queue, which I was at the back of, with a security check to exit the airplane. I spoke to ground staff about my connection and was told just to go again‚Ä¶ eventually we get through this random security check and I head for d36. You have to get a train. I head towards it and double check the departure board and it says my flight is e43‚Ä¶. More lost minutes‚Ä¶ I then go as quickly as I can and come to actual airport security. I am in another very long queue. I can see my flight out of the window from this queue. I eventually get to security and put everything through the scanner. I had a bottle of sealed duty free that I bought on the trip. They don‚Äôt know what to do with it and  I‚Äôm held back. The woman in front bought duty free cosmetics and she is also held back. They open her cosmetics (that are all officially sealed), agree that it is the product it says it is and then officially reseal it‚Ä¶ then of course they do the same to me. I eventually make it to my gate and of course it is deserted. It‚Äôs 7.30.. I look at my phone and I have a text from Swiss Air saying they booked me on another flight, to Brussels, at 7.20‚Ä¶. I ask someone who looks like air staff where I can get help and I have to go to the transfer desk, another train ride to terminal A. I arrive and get in another queue of all the people who missed their flights due to the late arrival of our plane. I am seen at 8.10am. The staff are nice and slightly apologetic but still it‚Äôs all so matter of fact. They go off to work out what to do for me. I am booked on a flight for that evening at 7.15pm‚Ä¶ I now have to spend the whole day in Zurich Airport. All weekend plans scuppered. They stamp my boarding pass and say it‚Äôs a voucher for 20Euros to use in some restaurants- I never did find anywhere to spend it and when I asked I‚Äôm Pretty later that day they said it wasn‚Äôt activated and I had to go back to the desk‚Ä¶ needless to say I didn‚Äôt bother. I paid for the business lounge and stayed there all day in the end. When I finally boarded my flight that evening someone as in my seat and it was an overbooked flight.  I was ready to have a nervous breakdown by now. The staff on this flight go off to find out what to do and come back with the news that I was upgraded to business but no one had told me. I had a nice flight home in the end but would never fly Swiss again. Yes, things happen but there was no customer service here or support. They could have helped us all make our connections and it should have been a priority that would have saved them and us all a lot of hassle and money‚Ä¶.

title: Single mother with 2-year old treated very poorly
review_text: My 2 year old son's and my flight was canceled through no fault of SWISS.  However, SWISS managed the cancellation terribly, making us wait in an extremely long line for rebooking that should have been done automatically.  We were given no consideration as a single parent with a very young child.  In addition, we had paid almost twice as much for tickets to go direct from Zurich to London City Airport.  We were rebooked on a flight from Zurich to Geneva, and then from Geneva on to London Heathrow (which in case SWISS is not aware, is obviously a different airport in a very different location!). We could have bought tickets to Heathrow for substantially less if that is where we wanted to go. SWISS promised we could get on a flight to London City, and I wasted many hours on the phone with incompetent call agents before they told us they couldn't give us tickets on the flight due to a mistake SWISS had made with our reservation.  SWISS then refused to compensate us the difference in the tickets.  Very poor treatment of families, will certainly avoid in the future.

title: A psecial treat? Choose Swiss International Airline!
review_text: As soon as you enter the plane, you will be treated like a well known friend! Friendly staff, outstanding service, and guess what? Beef filet was medium rare as it ought to be, but you almost never get it else where... Comnfortable seat that will become your bed, with adjustable firmness. 11 hours of a flight that seemed to be shorter that it was...

title: Avoid!
review_text: I will never ever fly Swiss again. It was a last minute booking due to a death in the family and I wish I booked with BA now. Terribly cramped and claustrophobic A340-300. The least leg room I've ever had on a flight and the most uncomfortable seat ever, it's like sitting on plywood for 11 hours. The food wasn't great but not too bad. The most disappointing (also the reason I will never fly Swiss again) was the awfully rude cabin crew. They had a gustapo like attitude about them. You would think the Swiss are classy with high standards but they are just rude bellends. Avoid flying Swiss if you can. They are about on par with EgyptAir who are also terrible

title: Good Storm Handling
review_text:
We were to fly to Cork from Geneva. 
Due to a pretty bad storm our flight got cancelled but I think the airline handled it well. 

After we heard that our flight got cancelled we received information within the hour via email about our new flight. 

We got new tickets, they were scheduled to fly into Dublin instead of Cork, which seem to have been a safer option as we could read on the news that other flights had had issues landing in Cork where the storm seem to have hit harder. 

When the plane landed they said on the speakers were to go for a bus the airline had arrenged to take us passengers to Cork.

Landing in the storm went well and felt stabile. 

All staff have been superb and friendly.

Sure, this took many of extra hours but considering the storm I think everything was very well handled and arranged. 

Thank you Swiss Air.

title: Poor service
review_text: Long delays.Low quality in service, at airport and  departure time scheduled  -too high price compared to quality.

title: ROBBED BY SWISS AIRLINES - THE WORST AIRLINE EVER!!
review_text: We booked our ticket to Vienna for December 2021 & Austria went on complete lockdown all of a sudden due to Covid-19. We tried calling Swiss Air a many times & finally spoke for hours for a refund. They would just NOT give us a refund saying that its not their fault nor is it OUR fault that a country is in lockdown. but instead they ask us to rebook to a later date which charged us an extra $400. We tried again because Austria had come up with new rules for a mandatory 10 days quarantine, so we decided not to take this trip & try again for a refund but no SWISS AIR just wouldn't budge and did not give us a refund even though this is something we cannot help with. They were just not helpful at all, they were RUDE, ARROGANT & just plain THIEVES!!!!!!SO NOW WE LOST $2500 FOR TICKETS AS WELL AS SEATS THAT WE PAID FOR, JUST BECOZ OF THEIR STUPID NO REFUND POLICY DURING A PANDEMIC. ROBBERS!! ROBBERS!! ROBBERS!! Never book with this airline ever!!!

title: ABSOLUTELY HORRIFIC
review_text: i was supposed to get on a flight at 4pm yesterday. I am now waiting for a flight that has just been delayed, 30 HOURS LATER WITH ZERO COMPENSATION. ABSOLUTELY DO NOT RECOMMEND

title: Swiss airline fraud
review_text: The WORST!!!!!We had a connected flight from Louisville to Chicago, then Chicago to Zurich and Zurich to Dubai . When we arrive to our first stop that was Chicago. we was told to get our boarding pass at the Swiss ticket counter ,when we arrived the lady at the counter first said that 2 of us didn‚Äôt appeared on the computer that only my 77 year old grandma who‚Äôs in a wheelchair and my 3 year old son who has autism had tickets. I then called my travel agency to confirm and was told that we are on the computer and that Swiss has to give us our boarding pass. Then when I said that to the lady at the counter I was told that the flight was over booked . They  close down all the  computers and left to the office they have in the back and left me talking . our bags was sent to dubai and are currently lost .i called the airline to see what I can do about my bags and to rebook my trip, but all they say is to file a complaint online for my bags and to get refund .  I had to rent a hotel to spend the night in Chicago and a car to drive back home which is a 5 hour drive . It‚Äôs been 7 days and  my bags are still in dubai , Swiss hasn‚Äôt brought them back . Then Swiss email me saying that my flight was never over booked that we didn‚Äôt showed up which is a lied because we did showed up our connection  flight arrived 2 hour before our second flight  and we had plenty of time all we needed was our boarding ticket with Swiss. Swiss doesn‚Äôt want to refund me for the trip nor for the car or hotel we had to get in Chicago and nor do they have any information on my bags . Swiss airline are either a racist or a fraud

title: Liars and thiefs
review_text:
We booked 2 flights with Swiss:
- Return tickets from Zurich to London
- Return tickets from a Zurich to Malaga 

Because of covid restrictions we decided to change our flights and go from Zurich to London, London to Malaga directly and then Malaga to Zurich.

We called the customer service before to ask if it was possible and he who told us it was not problem to cancel one leg of each flight and get a reimbursement if we paid administrative fees for each person (35chf per person).

The agent cashed the fees but didn‚Äôt make any change. 

Arriving at Malaga airport, we didn‚Äôt have a seat and they told us that because we didn‚Äôt take the flight Zurich->Malaga, they froze our seats and we had to pay another administrative fee (35chf each) to be able to board.

So not only did they lie to us, saying we would be reimbursed, they also stole from us by cashing administrative fees twice for doing nothing. 

I would never recommend them and will not fly them ever again.

title: Good trip
review_text:
A320 coach class flight from Zurich to Heathrow. 
Documents checked before boarding, all was smooth except a self service machine was not working, but manual check in did a good enough job.
Few minutes late departing, but caught up and landed on time.

title: Customers are just ignored
review_text: We booked flights for my wife and me for April 2020. Shortly before departure all flights were cancelled by the airline due to COVID. Our request for a refund was denied but we got a time limited credit. After no flights were available the credits were extended but shortly after the flights resumed our credits were terminated. Unfortunately we booked with Expedia - certainly never ever again - Swiss ignored our calls and emails or pointed the finger to Expedia even though our credit card was charged by Swiss! Calls to an Expedia call center somewhere in Asia were just a waste of time with incompetent people on the line - barely speaking English and just trying to extend the phone call until the line was interrupted.

title: prices on the website do not match what you would get if you rebook
review_text:
Swiss Airlines claims that you can rebook for free, but when you call to rebook the prices they give you are more expensive than what it's shown to you on the website for a new booking and they don't even explain it to you until you go dig into it yourself. 
This is very misleading. I went for a more expensive tickets with Swiss airlines to have the possibility to rebook for free because I had uncertainty on the dates and still each time I was fooled with a more expensive price which did not match what I would see on the website for a new booking.

title: Late leaving
review_text:
A321 coach class from Barcelona to Zurich  
Late leaving, a mix of the plane not ready,  then problems at the airport. 
They checked us into a corridor to wait for quite a time.

title: Vacation was nearly destroyed by refusal to help and cooperate
review_text:
This happened last summer (6 months ago) so this review is somewhat late. We had a very upsetting experience with Swiss International Airlines and we did file a complaint. I am writing this on behalf of our daughter (and us as well). With some distance to the event we still feel that the way we were treated by them was totally unacceptable and more importantly for other travelers; the way they operate when things do go wrong poses a problem to all customers. The issues I am talking about includes excessive wait times on the phone, a website that can‚Äôt be used in certain situations, being sticklers for Swiss Airline rules that prevent solutions for customers, and an unwillingness to cooperate and talk to other airlines, etc.

This is the story; our daughter went on a trip to Greece to meet up with her friends. We bought her very expensive tickets. We bought the tickets from United Airlines but the leg between Chicago and Z√ºrich and then Kos was operated by Swiss International Airlines. Swiss International Airlines canceled the flight and lost her bags, which contained some very expensive items. We don‚Äôt blame them for that but when things go wrong, that‚Äôs when you need customer service and that‚Äôs where things turned crazy.

When Swiss International Airlines canceled the flight they abandoned the counter at the gate. It was late in the evening. Our daughter was in the bathroom and when she came back everyone was gone and the screen said the flight had been cancelled. She went to the Swiss International Airlines main counter at the Airport to get help but no one was there. She was upset so we decided to help her. We called United Airlines first, after all we bought the tickets from them. They are not known for good customer service but they actually tried. They booked our daughter an alternative route. However, we were told that Swiss International Airlines had to release their booking first and they had not done so. We were informed that Swiss International Airlines wouldn‚Äôt talk to United Airlines and that we had to call Swiss International Airlines ourselves. To help us out United Airlines googled Swiss International Airlines and gave us a number, which unfortunately turned out to be a scam site that scammed us out of $200.00. It turns out Swiss International Airlines don‚Äôt want people calling them so finding their number is difficult, something scam sites take advantage of.

However, after finding the real Swiss International Airlines they put us on hold for one and a half hour just to tell us that they refused to release our daughter‚Äôs ticket. That could only be done at a Swiss International Airlines counter. Unfortunately, the Swiss International Airlines counters at O‚ÄôHare were closed. We had flights cancelled on us before and this has never been an issue with other airlines. We were baffled and in shock. I called United Airlines again and my wife called Swiss International Airlines and we timed it so that we got them both talking at the same time. We were lucky that it worked. United Airlines also had excessive wait times (up to an hour) but it was a bit better than Swiss International Airlines. By holding the two cell phones next to each we were able to get the United Airlines agent and the Swiss International Airlines agent to talk to each other. Yes it was quite comical. The United Airlines agent was able to convince the quite brusque and unfriendly rule-stickling Swiss International Airlines agent that the only way to rebook our daughter‚Äôs flight was for Swiss International Airlines to release her ticket and that they had to do it now. It worked, unfortunately the Swiss International Airlines forgot to release the Z√ºrich to Kos part so we had to repeat the process a second time. In the end United Airlines was able to rebook her and she got to Kos.

When she arrived in Greece her luggage did not. Swiss International Airlines had lost her luggage and had not returned it to United Airlines, so United Airlines suggested that she file a delayed baggage claim with them. We tried doing that on-line but Swiss International Airlines would not allow it since the ticket was purchased from United Airlines. I should mention that none of our problems could be solved using Swiss International Airlines website. Our daughter talked to the Swiss International Airlines baggage claim at Athens & later Kos airport who was not only refusing to do anything about the luggage, saying it was United Airlines problem, but they were also rude to our daughter and was yelling at her. United Airlines had to find the luggage despite the fact that Swiss International Airlines had not released her luggage to United Airlines and refused to talk to them. Luckily United Airlines was able to track it down three days later and she got it four days late. In my opinion, an airline refusing to help with baggage that is lost is confiscation of private property perhaps theft. We filed a complaint with Swiss International Airlines but we got no response.

Phew that was a horror story. Swiss International Airlines, never again.

title: Cancelled flights, Rude Incompetent Customer Service, Unauthorised Money Deducted
review_text:
What a pity flight crew are brilliant but Customer Service are the most horrific ever. 
Our issues started with Swissair cancelling the 3rd leg of our flight which was Zurich to London, alternative flight offered was not suitable as we‚Äôd arrive after the function we wanted to attend in London so we requested 3rd flight be altered Zurich to Berlin. Same distance, same cost, seats available.
 2 hours of dealing with difficult staff based in Fiji I decided to ring Zurich direct and was able to book seats if I paid an additional $1100 total for 2 seats.
I was unhappy but agreed, I was asked to confirm this by email, Swissair sent me an email stating I agreed to a SINGLE transaction of  $1100 for Mr & Mrs ‚Ä¶‚Ä¶I sent a reply agreeing to this alteration and charge.
 1 week later flights had not been changed. I rang and spent another 90 minutes with Fiji staff who told me to check my bank account, no transaction had taken place! I then arranged for the flights to be rebooked. 2 days later checking my bank account $2490 had been deducted. I rang again and finally spoke with a supervisor who not only was rude but left me for 40 minutes without coming back, I rang on a 2nd phone line and was told she was busy and couldn‚Äôt speak with me. 
I rang again the following day and was told the $2490. was the correct amount even though I had a Swissair email stating the single transaction $1100 was for 2 passengers.
Swissair then cancelled the large transaction and deducted TWO amounts of $1200 each.
I rang again and asked to speak with a supervisor and was told that supervisor was busy and couldn‚Äôt speak with me, I said I would wait, I was told I could wait but I‚Äôd be waiting until the next morning!
Such rude staff I have never ever dealt with, not only are they unable to resolve issues but they are rude and lie as well. Female staff were the worst.
I contacted my bank to dispute the amounts and today I‚Äôve been advised the additional payment will be returned 7 weeks after they deducted it.

My daughter also had her flight to Paris cancelled 3 days before departure and was going to be left in Hong Kong! She was told there was nothing they could do however she was able to find an alternative flight online whilst on the phone, asked to speak with a supervisor who agreed there was an alternative flight she could fly on.

Cabin Crew were lovely and Business Class comfortable.
However the 4+ hours spent dealing with bad customer service due to Swissair cancelling flights are too draining and upsetting.
I will never ever book with Swissair again.

title: LAX to Rome good food and wine
review_text: This was the first time I flew on this airlines and it was good. I wish I could go first class as economy was a bit scrunched but it always is on any airlines. Swiss provided good food and free wine so I was happy for such a long flight. Also on the 2nd flight from Zurich to Rome I got 3 seats to myself and fell asleep!

title: Worst customer service
review_text:
I am very unhappy with the way SWISS treated me, showing that clearly they do not value me as a costumer.

I booked a flight for my wife and daughter with inbound on December 27th and outbound on January 7th.

They went to the airport, on the 27th, waited 6 hours to have my wife tested for covid (Lisbon airport was chaos that day, and there were no other alternatives for testing), and when I saw they were going to lose the flight, I tried to rebook it online, the website didn't allow it. I tried calling SWISS, no one was answering. I then sent a message asking for the second flight not to be cancelled, since I would get another flight for inbound.

That message was only answered 10 days after, telling me that I had to call support, and pay an  'out of sequence fee'.

I called support. The operator told me she could not make an out of sequence rebooking, that had to do a normal rebooking with huge costs. I told her this was totally unacceptable. I told her to tell her supervisor, that either they give me an out of sequence rebooking, or if they forced me to accept this rebooking, I would no longer fly with SWISS. Apparently her supervisor said he was ok with that.

After that they called me back, saying something went wrong, and asked for more money. Finally when I checked the credit card, they charged more than they asked the second time. And I repeatedly asked for the final total price on all calls.

It is clear to me that:
- If there is a problem non related to the passenger that make them miss the flight, your support does not work, forcing the passenger to find other alternatives.
- They reply late.
- They reply with wrong information (email I received says I can get an out of sequence rebooking, support on the phone says I cannot)
- They do not value customers that fly with them almost every month.
- The supervisors do not care about the customers.
- They take all opportunity to get money, customer satisfaction is not important for them.

title: Very poor customer service
review_text: My flights were changed due to covid restrictions which is understandable, but the way it was handled was very poor. title: Amazing customer service!!

title: 4 star in the air, 3 star on the ground
review_text: LHR - ZRH - LCY In business class. Ground service at both Heathrow and Zurich didn‚Äôt feel particularly friendly or ‚Äòpremium‚Äô. Lufthansa lounge at Heathrow was spacious but had fairly basic food and drinks. Only one lounge was open at Zurich (A gates lounge) possibly because of covid but it was incredibly busy and people were queuing to get in as I left. Food/drinks were ok and staff super friendly but still nowhere near standards of Qatar, Cathy Pacific etc. Onboard was a lot better. Staff were attentive and proactive in offering drinks refills etc. Staff to LCY referred to passengers by name which was a nice touch. Nice light meal and good selection of drinks including champagne. Nice new planes and very clean. 4 star in the air 3 star on the ground.

title: Best Airline
review_text: I have a wonderful experience with Swiss Airline , the cabin crew are really helpful and nice and the flight was nice and the seat comfortable

title: Poor customer service from Swiss Air and Dolfi1920
review_text:
Flew with Swiss Air on 14th Jan 2022 but when I collected my luggage at the carousel and only after I arrived home I noticed that both wheels were almost ripped off from the luggage. I submitted and filled baggage claim forms for reimbursement / repair the following morning. 

I had sent multiple emails explaining that I have an onward flight with them and that I needed this resolved immediately. Swiss Air customer service and Dolfi1920 ignored my emails and didn't respond. I was advised by Swiss Air to deal directly with their outsourcing partner, Dolfi1920 to get the reimbursement or luggage repaired. I stated that since I flew with Swiss Air, they are still liable for any damages and liability, just because they outsourced it to Dolfi1920 doesn't make them exempt from their liability.

I subsequently got an email from Dolfi1920 after much pestering and with Swiss Air customer service department managed to get them to reimburse me for the destroyed luggage. During which time Dolfi1920 only asked for my IBAN and SWIFT and no other information was provided like how much was the refund, in what currency would I be paid as I had bought and paid the luggage in USD, etc. Note you will have no choice but to deal with Dolfi1920, another bunch of daft idiots that don't respond.

Dealing with Swiss Air customer service was a complete nightmare, receipts would be provided and nothing would be heard from them for 3 days, meanwhile I still have to catch my onward flight. Swiss Air assumes that because they have outsourced the baggage repair to a third party, the risk is transferred to the customer, unfortunately this is not how outsourcing works.

Its one of the worst airlines I have had to deal with especially the silence and lack of transparency shown by their customer service. At Swiss Air, it isn't customer centric, it's customers last! 

Don't fly Swiss Air if you can help it, this was just a simple luggage complaint that could have been resolved in alot less time than 15 days. I even sent an email expressing my disgust to the CEO Dieter Vfranckx but zero response, shows clearly if leadership is lacking at the top, it will also reflect the lackadaisical approach taken by customer service! Today is my last day before I fly off, still no email nor reimbursement.

Thanks for nothing Swiss Air customer "NO" service.

title: An airline with too much repetitive checks
review_text: I booked it with Lufthansa and ended up with these fellows. Too many redundant, repetitive checks throughout the process which were time consuming. To name a few, they checked all the documents while first checking in then they repeated checking the names with passports again before entering the gates and they made an X-ray and metal detector checks right after entering the gates which were already done by the airport security. All these with a total waste of time and with only one boarding gate open and with all these they couldn‚Äôt even sponsor a 5 cent surgical mask because they don‚Äôt accept our personal coloured masks. I had to pay a premium for the flights and they were no better than any other airline industry who run only for profits.

title: Disgustingly poor
review_text:
I never write reviews. However, this was such a shambles, and I felt so much that I'm being abused, that I had to write.

So much for Swiss efficiency. You should be ashamed! Obviously will never make use of them again.

title: Putrid, Robotic, Unfriendly Service!
review_text:
Unfortunately my experience with the Swiss Contact centre based in South Africa is the same as others on this platform. Extremely poor! If there was a negative score for customer service I would give it.

We spoke to Enaira on 26 November 2021 and needed to change our flight urgently due to the UK restrictions with flights to South Africa which came into effect the day we were meant to fly out. Enaira was very helpful but that's where it stopped. Anira also told us that since we paid the travel agency fee once we will not have to pay it again. She also said the new booking was now direct with Swiss air and this is why there will be no other travel agency fee if we changed the booking again.

We now find that there are no longer restrictions to SA from the UK so we wish to change our flight again.

We spoke to Kim last night who gave us a price for the fare difference and said there was no travel agency fee. After being on hold for 45min to get to Kim, she put us hold to check other cheaper dates. She left us on hold and never came back to us. We spent over an hour on the phone.

We called again this morning 9 January 2022 and spoke to Tyler (female) in a SA contact centre. She was the worst of them. She sounded dead alive and robotic. She kept repeating that we had to pay a travel agency fee again. We told her many times that this was incorrect and not what we were told previously by 2 separate agents. She kept repeating herself. We asked to speak to someone else and she said I must disconnect and call back. We asked for a supervisor and she said no-one was available. She said she will ask for a call back but couldn't tell me when that would be.

Absolutely poor and the worst thing is I don't think it will get better because Swiss air obviously doesn't monitor the calls to make sure agents are giving good customer service.

All we want is to change our flight without a travel agency fee like we were told and to be given a fair price to pay, especially when considering the price for a new flight on the website is less than what we originally paid. I'm not sure how there is a fare difference.

I will be looking to escalate this further to an ADR or the CAA if I do not get a response asap and a fair resolution.

title: Worst customer experience for rebooking my flight!!
