Thanks for nothing! :-)

title: Insulted by airline staff ignorant about their own Covid test rules
review_text:
We were checking in at Paris CDG for our flight to return to Hong Kong. In between there was going to be a transit in Zurich. The HK Gov is famously strict on arriving passengers' documents due to Covid (booked 21 days of quarantine hotel stay) so we got to the check-in counter 3 hours early.

We were one of the first in line. Before us, there had been a Chinese couple who seemed to get through, no problem. When it came to us, the Swiss Air staff member at the counter took a look at our Covid test and said, 'You did your test 65 hours before the departure time.'

To which we replied, 'Well yes, because the rule was within 72 hours. 65 is within 72, is it not?' (Swiss Air had sent us an email reminding us of this requirement. Do your test 72 hours before your final departure point, i.e. Zurich in this case)

And he gives us the most uppity look ever and says, 'It's risky to take the test 65 hours before the departure. Why didn't you take it closer to the departure time?'

We said we couldn't find a pharmacy in downtown Paris that we were sure would deliver results on a Sunday, so we played it safe. Anyway, we had followed their rules. He then said, 'The couple that came before you manged to find a pharmacy. They did their test 40 hours ago.'

At this point we are wondering what ridiculous, surreal situation we were in, and we simply reiterate that '65 is a number under 72 and well within the rules.'

He said, and I quote his exact words, 'You are playing with words.'   (?!!! Does he not know how to read his own company policy??!)

We of course ask to see the manager. For those of you who don't know, if you miss your flight to HK, you don't get any refund for the 21-day hotel quarantine stay that you booked, which amounts to a lot of money. Plus all the hotels were fully booked by then and we'd have to stay in Paris until a quarantine hotel in HK freed up a room.

His manager comes along, and we explain the situation. Naturally we're a bit flustered but we have never raised our voice. We are simply in shock that the rules are written black and white, and that this staff member has chosen to put their own spin on them. The first thing the manager says to us is, 'I need you to calm down, otherwise I have the right to stop you from boarding.' when we have shown no sign of rudeness at all.

Finally, they call yet another manager and we're OK to check in. We get no apology from the staff after they wasted our time and accused us of wordplay!

Only two counters were open for a queue of 70 people. We held up the line for 30 minutes. It's simply shocking that when rules are so simple, there are people out there who seem to want to give themselves more trouble and make their job even harder...I still don't understand why they did it. I get that HK has strict rules and not all airline staff are well-versed in this, but when there's a flight to HK, would they please put someone who knows what they're doing at the counter? Never mind - not even the manager knew how to read.

On another note, as with most other places we saw in France, all the staff members had their mask pulled below their nose, and when they needed to articulate, pulled down their mask completely to speak...

title: The  most horrible flying experience I have ever had

title: Never again. Disrespectful client service. Do not recommend travelling with Swiss airlines.
review_text:
In November 2021 I travelled from Zurich to Belgrade with Swiss Airlines. After my travel, I need an invoice for my voyage. I go to the dedicated page to get the invoice. However, after carefully filling in the form, I get this error: "An error has occurred.
Your request cannot be completed due to a technical error. (Internal Server Error)". Now the fun part starts. I contact the service client using two different numbers. Every time, I wait on average 1h30min (!) on hold before reaching a human that can communicate with me. I called 4 times. Spending 6h of my time listening to annoying voice announcing that all agents are occupied at the moment. Out of this 4 times, I managed to talk to someone only twice. First time, the agent told me: "We cannot help you because we have a technical problem here, try to call this other number." The second time, the agent told me: "I cannot do anything for you because you finished your travel and I can only help with ongoing reservations". Such communication is very disrespectful and scandalous. I will avoid travelling with Swiss airlines in the future at any cost. I definitely do not recommend to travel with this company.

title: The worst airline they take your money for no flight
review_text:
I booked two return flights to Zurich for April 2020. These were cancelled and as I've been prepared to 'work with' businesses and help them through the pandemic I accepted their offer of a voucher for future use.

These vouchers were used to book flights on the same route for 2nd December. I had to pay an additional amount of money as there was a fare difference.

At the weekend the Swiss government applied a 10 day quarantine to all arrivals from the UK.  On 29th November, Swiss air wrote to me advising I was ineligble to fly.

I tried to get through to them on the phone as the only online option was to book flights for a future date (how can you do this at the moment?) and pay them even more money.  After 115 minutes in the phone queue I was finally through to someone but no sooner had I spoken to them, they put me on hold then cut me off.  I tried a bit later that day to call again (who has time for such poor service?) On the second occasion I waited a little over an hour to speak to someone. I then had the most bizarre conversation where having advised me that I couldn't fly, they asked did I want to cancel and receive a taxes only refund? (approx 40% of what I'd paid) I said no I want a full refund as you have denied me boarding so you have cancelled me. At this point I was put on hold and then cut off for the second time.
 I decided the only course of action left to me was to contact my credit card provider (the first time I've had to do this for any booking with any firm all through the pandemic).

It gets even more bizarre though, on 1st December they checked me in "automatically", despite telling me on Monday that I'm ineligible to fly. I assume this is further sharp practice so they can say that the ticket has been used. I have passed this onto my credit card provider as further evidence in advance of my flight departing.

It's not surprising their phone queue is so long as they have no suitable options online to handle you as they only really want to get you into a type of ponzi scheme where you pay them more and more for a future flight that you may again be denied or alternatively just thieve you out of what you have paid them so far.

title: Bipolar Experiences In The Air and On The Ground
review_text:
I‚Äôve flown SWISS short haul on numerous occasions which really aren‚Äôt noteworthy, but just had the opportunity to experience them on a long-haul flight from Zurich. In short, their in-flight experience is second to none, but the ground experience in Zurich was a nightmare. 
No, it didn‚Äôt seem like an unusual day for them, nor was I an unusual passenger, it just seems like an incredibly overcrowded, understaffed airport with lots of unnecessary steps to get from the curb to the plane. I arrived 2.5 hours early, and did not have a moment to sit down- I literally spent the entire time waiting in huge lines of hundreds of other passengers to check in, go through security, go to passport check (all of which I understand), then inexplicably wait in the airline‚Äôs own ‚ÄúPassport Control‚Äù line just to receive a stamp on my boarding pass needed to then wait in the line to board. These latter two lines snaked all the way down the entire concourse for our booked full 777-300er to SFO. All their ‚ÄúPassport Control‚Äù does is glance at your passport, which the gate agent does again anyway, so why have this extra step? It just created a huge amount of confusion and extra time standing in lines. They then only leave 35 minutes to board 340 passengers, which is completely unrealistic, hence these flights depart late almost every day. United begins boarding widebodies an hour ahead of takeoff, which is really what‚Äôs needed to avoid a delay. Anyway, that‚Äôs my two cents on the ground experience in Zurich. 
Onboard, it‚Äôs a completely different story. Although legroom is rather tight in coach, the cabin is beautifully outfitted, very clean, has nice large lavatories with no lines to use them, and even on a completely full flight didn‚Äôt feel too claustrophobic. The seats are very comfortable with beautiful upholstery, a comfy pillow and large warm blanket, the inflight entertainment system is extensive, has a large screen, and is easy to use, even holding your place in a film midway through if you leave to look at the flight map, and best of all, has no ads like US carriers love inserting before every program. There was no wifi on board, despite signs on the seats stating the contrary, nor regular power outlets (only slow USB ports). However, 12 hours actually flew by thanks to the extensive inflight service. You won‚Äôt go hungry on Swiss! They came by with a delicious, large, hot meal (chicken or pasta with vegetables, salad, roll, Swiss cheese and dessert), then two rounds of sandwiches and ice cream, then a landing meal of bruleed Swiss cheese over a warm quiche. The flight attendants were very courteous and really made you feel ‚Äútaken care of‚Äù. So I do recommend Swiss for long-haul, particularly in-bound to Switzerland as opposed to outbound!

title: Its UNWISE to BOOK  flight with SWISS in Covid. You may loose Money & get Harassed
review_text:
Extremely poor display of Customer service & lack of empathy for passengers who have shown trust in booking flights with SWISS.

I had weekend plan with family to visit Switzerland & return in 3 days time.
The Swiss authorities suggest they wouldn't allow passengers from Netherlands to enter Switzerland if we're not residents of Switzerland.  Even to residents they require a mandatory 10 day quarantine.  Also Zurich canton suggested Airlines has been informed & that they'll soon be informing passengers that they wouldn't be able to honor the tickets.  BUT the Airlines claim they're waiting for Swiss Govt's final response & cannot refund before they get a response.

Customer service calls take 1-2 hour long waiting & you get added harassment.

Its a pity that such a reputed brand name is allowed to go in dust.  Passengers won't forget & may never return back in future.

Am just stunned.  Others please be CAUTIOUS of this Airline.

title: Don‚Äôt believe their online Covid policies
review_text: Don‚Äôt believe their website when they say that you can get a voucher if for any reason you need to reschedule due to Covid. I bought a ticket from Vienna to Zurich and due to the lockdown in Austria I can‚Äôt get into the country to take my flight. Now I‚Äôm not asking for a refund, just a voucher to use at a later date, and they absolutely refused. Save yourself the headache and book with an airline that understands the current climate and is adaptable instead of throwing away your money with this airline.

title: An absolute disregard of the current situation
review_text:
I was supposed to fly for a weekend to Switzerland, but then the Swiss government imposed restrictions on people flying from the Netherlands. 

Any sensible airline offers vouchers in this period, but Swiss does not. On the other hand, you can rebook your flight for a small fee equal to more than half the price of the original ticket! Yay!

Customer service just repeated that they are not responsible for the restrictions the government imposes. Well fair enough, but then why am I bearing the FULL responsibility? Am I responsible?! A voucher would have been the best compromise so we BOTH bear some responsibility. 

DON'T fly SWISS in this period, as their business model is flying empty aircraft powered by the non-refunded money of people that couldn't fly.

title: SWISS AIRLINES ‚Äì Terrible Customer Service
review_text:
I very seldom write a review, but I feel I have to here. Such rude unhelpful customer service. If you have any issues with having to rebook or cancel your flights due to covid restrictions, they will be completely unhelpful and just give you one-word answers, it was like being on the phone with a grumpy teenager. 

It took about 1:45mins to speak to someone, not great but I get it, Covid kicking off and everyone on the phone but then I get someone on the other end who is more frustrated than I am!! 

The worst customer service I‚Äôve ever come across in my life, in any industry. In the end, I‚Äôve had to let the flights go altogether. 

Covid has hit this airline hard and it shows.

title: NO CALL CENTER NOT EVEN FOR THE PAYING LINE !!!
review_text: Horrible airline , choose another for your next trip no one is there to help you !!! Incredible‚Ä¶.they will treat you like crap over 4 hours waiting !!!

title: no one answers any customer service call
review_text: literally no way to get through to customer sevice, french desk does not speak english when they answer the pjone at cdg

title: Economy in Business
review_text:
Let me start with the title of this review. There is an airline whose motto is First in Business and you get a first class service in business class. On this particular flight, LX181 25th November 2021, this was as I said economy in business. 
The most annoying thing on this flight were a couple sitting close to us that seemed to think that not wearing their masks for the flight was ok and the crew completely ignored the fact and did not at any time tell them to put their masks on. This particular couple also seemed to get more attention that any other passengers in the smaller of the 2 business class cabin on the 777  flight from Bangkok to Zurich. This, I believe, was because they were Swiss nationals.
I can not fault the seat, as this was large and spacious, although using the controls could be awkward at times. The table is also not the best but it dose the job. 
Entertainment, well I think I will leave it there as there was very limited choice.
Food, well probably a little better than what you would be served in economy class and of course served on proper plates and knives and forks.
This is a general complaint, not only of Swiss, but all airlines. WHY do they all seem to insist that the sweet is chocolate? This is one food that will keep you awake when you are trying to sleep.
Something else I found annoying was the fact the the aircraft lights were not dimmed fully, or even out like most other airlines on a night flight. Also the steward from the first class cabin did not give too hoots about the amount of noise he was making every time he opened or slammed shut storage cupboards where equipment was stored for the first class cabin in the business class area. No thought and certainly no care.
All in all the only difference between economy and business on this flight was the seat. I felt that everything else was a complete let down. This flight did not live up to earlier flights on Swiss, even when there was a technical problem on our outbound flight on an older A340. 
Just one last thing, where were the small Swiss chocolates after the meals???? none handed out at either food service on this flight. 
Not the best example of Swiss Air.

title: They charged 100‚Ç¨ extra for luggage that was already paid for and didn‚Äôt even attempt to help with the problem
review_text:
We booked our tickets through the agency eDreams and paid for additional bags in advance, but apparently the communication between the agency and the airline is extremely faulty, so they were not included in our final tickets. The airline ended up shamelessly charging us an additional 100‚Ç¨ at the check-in without even attempting to help us solve our problem. They even said: ‚ÄúOh, that happens quite often!‚Äù How is that ok? One might ask. I tried contacting both agency and airline afterwards, but to no avail. The agency turned out to be one with a lot of unsatisfied customers, but we expected at least Swiss to react in any way. After the first response on my Twitter post (of course they react when you confront them openly) I got them to respond privately but after a day or two they started ignoring me and left my problem unsolved. I ask myself now: would they have acted differently if I was a first class flyer?
Terribly disappointed and utterly appalled!

title: Late departure
review_text:
Large A330-300 for the short hop over to London. 
We were late going due to a backlog of document checking.
Staff friendly, and once in air all was smooth

title: Great legroom
review_text:
Coach class flight part one from thessaloniki. 
Superb legroom,  great boarding and helpful staff, all went well.

title: Horrible
review_text:
We had a horrible experience with Swiss Air!!!! We will never ever fly with them at all. 
Abusive Airport staff - I'm considering legal action because they caused us so much stress.

title: Nice flight, however terrible call center
review_text: We booked business class mostly to have more space on board and for more baggage allowance. However, we later found out that the seats and the legroom are the same as economy, the only difference being that in business the third seat in the row is not bookable, However the seating was comfortable. The onboard service and food were excellent, sorry for the economy passengers who had to pay for any food. Our worst experience was with the call center which we needed to contact for a booking change. After many tries and long waits we finally could talk to someone who hardly spoke English and who gave us partial and useless information which, we later found out, was even wrong. We were forced to travel two hours to Zurich airport to change our reservation and not lose our refund. Very bad service!

title: Delays, delays and delays.
review_text: Service  was friendly and efficient on board. However the overall experience was stressful with poor boarding management. Took over 40 mins to get everyone on the plane as there were too many carry on luggage and they did not follow the boarding group sequence.

title: Absolute pleasure!
review_text:
What an amazing experience!
Went on a family holiday with kids.
The entire journey, including the connecting flights were perfect. 

Even though we had slight delays on our first flight, we had a smooth transition to the connecting flight. 
Our luggage's even got to destination with us! 

The in flight experience was truly amazing. Friendly and helpful crew. 
Very friendly towards the crew. 
Rather than just handing them over, the crew member actually asked me first if he was allowed to offer the kids some sweets. 

The crew members even went as far to randomly stop by and ask if the * little passengers* were comfortable

Over head screens were an amazing addition. 
Gave timely information about where we were, distance to destination, time weather. 
It even gave us information about which gate we will arrive on, which gates the connecting flights were going to be from. 
Baggage arrival belt numbers.
And in between all that, inflight entertainment. Good ole Tom and Jerry

All this in between a simple flight from Naples to Amsterdam. 
This is what I value as high customer service. Classy, friendly, professional and enjoyable. 

Being a regular traveler, I am sure going to make it a thing to try and only travel with this airline.

title: Worst Support I ever experienced
review_text: Due to problems with my flight from Zurich to Naples i tried to call the customer support, but gave up after 30 minutes of waiting and booked another flight (so already paid double for my flight to Naples). Wrote an email to the support, which has not been answered ever since. When I wanted to check in for my return flight from Naples, I was told at the check-in that the two flights i booked together, were linked and thus my second ticket is invalid. So i had to pay double again for my flight back. When i asked for help at the check in, i was told to call the number for support, where people only spoke italien. Worst service ever. I will definitely not fly Swiss again. Paid 4 flights instead of two, and i did not get any answer from support until now. Sad to see how Swiss has become such a terrible airline in such a short time.

title: HORRIBLE customer service
review_text:
I tried to rebook one of my flights by calling your customer service. Your english-speaking colleague was a lady who was obviously in India (it's very obvious from the accent). That lady had major difficulties understanding what I was saying and how I wanted to rebook my flight. I had to repeat the details of the flight I wanted to book (date, time, origin, destination) about 5-6 times. During the process she was not sure what she was supposed to do so I had to wait about 5 times for her to contact her "support team". 

The worst part was that when she wanted to calculate the fare difference between the previous and the new flight, she said again she does not know how to do that and after contacting her support team again (and wasting my time further) she finally said I have to pay 1500 euro for the fare difference. That was for a flight from Athens to Zurich that costs less than 100 euro if booked online! It is really a SHAME that Swiss forces their European customers to talk to a team in India that clearly has no clue about what they're doing and do not even understand how much money 1500 euro is. After wasting about an hour talking to that Indian lady, I had to end the conversation and call again for the german-speaking customer support. One thing is for sure, I will be informing as many people as possible about how horrible Swiss' customer support is.

title: No new flights
review_text: I talked to one of your agents. the call took 1:15 min. I wanted to change my canceled flights due to covid19. I gave out my card number and everything but have not received any response. The agent said he had fixed everything. Very sad for me as I did not get any new flights.

title: Poor customer service
review_text: Most unfriendly airline I‚Äôve ever flown in. The employees are entitled and rude. Defensive when asked a question, unwilling to help and when confronted with their attitude they respond ‚Äòwhatever‚Äô WOW. Never again.

title: Swiss Customer Service is miserable
review_text: Our inbound flight from Gran Canaria to Zurich was cancelled by Swiss without further assistance - they did not provide any alternative flights. After >1.5 hours in the waiting loop of their Customer Assistance Helpline we gave up, heavily stressed out - we will never book with Swiss again. The name Swiss should be kept only for high quality - definitely not for Swiss Airline.

title: Terrible experience on a simple direct flight from Mallorca to Zurich
review_text:
SWISS mishaps delayed me by 11 hours: The flight I booked (10AM, from Mallorca to Zurich) was delayed multiple times (once every 1-2 hours), until I was later automatically rebooked onto another SWISS flight which was also delayed once before finally departing.

In total, the original booking should have lasted 2 hours (10AM to 12PM). I spent 11 extra hours in the Mallorca airport, and then another 30-45 minutes in the Zurich airport, waiting for my checked-in luggage. Absolutely unacceptable to turn a short two-hour trip into a day-long experience.

title: Excellent Customer Service
review_text: When recently booking for 3 Business Class seats I made an error in departure dates not once but twice. I contacted Swissair Customer Service, my call was answered promptly and my issues resolved quickly and efficiently. Previously I have traveled with Singapore and Qantas and no changes were permitted without paying a significant amount even when it was the airline who altered departures. Both customer service gentlemen were polite and caring. I was very impressed. I will definitely travel Swissair again.

title: bad company bad customer service
review_text: bad customer service mike guy answer phone and lin so bad customer service i never give any review but this airline dont use

title: Inhumane and harsh treatment
review_text: Our flight has been cancelled during COVID-19 and Swiss Government banned UK flights between 21-23 Dec 2020. First day of stucked in ZUR, they provided us food, drinks, and sleeping place. From the second day they STOPPED provided us everything, and we couldn't pass the border because during COVID-19. Asked for refund when back to UK, but they refused. Worst than in jail.

title: A horrible customer experience even before flying
review_text: Our national airline of Switzerland has become a disaster. During the months prior to flying the flight changed 3 times (which I can still understand as we are in a troubled situation coming out of a pandemic). But what I clearly do not accept is that after each change I have to call the Swiss hotline - it's not a free-of-cost hotline ! - and literally wait over half an hour each time just to be connected with an agent. I have to confirm each time the change with an agent over the phone and the agent tells me that i will receive the new electronic ticket per email within the next few days. In reality, I never get any electronic ticket and have to call back again and wait, wait, wait. I was used to this poor service from some 2 or 3 stars airlines, but not from our national airline Swiss. I can just recommend everyone: look for another better alternative for your next flight and don't loose your time with Swiss.

title: Unpleasant hassles
review_text:
1. My husband travels with a Portable Oxygen Concentrator.  Airline requirements vary, but all of them make you notify them in advance of this equipment.  I did this on August 5, 2021, per my notes.  The flight was Oct 2.  Swiss said they had no record of this which caused a big hullabaloo.  A supervisor had to be called.  We talked to her; she talked to the crew.  The result was we were the last to board the plane instead of near the first.  
2. There was a group of 53 young people (probably students) on this flight.  Instead of checking their vaccine status at check-in, they lined them all up at the gate and checked their documents one by one.
3. Swiss tells you you can only request a specific seat, but it's not guaranteed.  Ours were changed.  Things happen.  But I heard them giving one of our seats to the leader of the group of 53.

title: Overbooked flights and rude staff.
review_text:
Customer service is non existing, very rude staff, overbooked and very expensive flights for zero service. Not worth it, when I see swiss, I scroll further for another airline.
0/10.

title: Not what I expected
review_text:
Not what I expected.
Paid more than double what I had paid for the outbound flight on Alitalia, and was not impressed.
You get water and one (very little) piece of chocolate from unfriendly cabin crew

title: NOT RESPONSIBLE AT ALL CONCERNING YOUR LUGGAGE
review_text: When i arrived in ATH they sent me an email, that my luggage was delayed and that I had to provide them with an adress to send me my luggage. To this day 26 days later they have done nothing different that trying to disorient me and avoid their responsibilities. ABSOLUTELY NON PROFESSIONAL AND DECEIVING.

title: Good choice!
review_text: The check-in experience was very good and the boarding was very fast. Inside the aircraft the seats was very comfortable and the legroom space was fine. The only thing that  didn't please me was the in-flight food service...

title: Very bad customer service
review_text: Customer service is unreachable. Our return ticket has been cancelled and no other option is available. There is no customer care or complaint line.

title: Schlechter Kundenservice
review_text:
In the past I was always very happy with the Airline. 
Therefore we booked a  flight back in July 2021, Swiss cancelled us on it and we got time to re-book something till end of August 21.
We then had to do multiple calls to finally reach someone (up to 50min in line) to re-book a new flight for October 2021 which we thought will work. We also tried to contact by the website but always ends up we need to call. 
Fast forward, unfortunatly we cannot attend this flight due of corona and new work-shedules. Again multiple times in the calling line to finally reach someone, we also tried different languages but often after 30min we also had to do other things. 
We got only two options, cancel and get a little refund or call again and re-book till the day prior. Even we asked just for a voucher or at least an extended time to re-book, both a no. Nowdays with corona I expect this to be possible, as other airlines can do it too and give a voucher code with a validation of 1 year.
So in the end we decided to cancel - good ways on swiss how to make money nowdays because this customer service is very low standard right now.

For an airline I was proud as a swiss in the past, I am very disappointed.

title: Very bad customer care / poor refund policy
review_text:
I personally don't recommend Swiss Air to anyone.
Due change in my plans I canceled the flight 2 weeks before departure. Right away I requested a refund.
I waited for more than 3 months for a refund and in the end, I got 10x less money than I paid for my ticket with Swiss Air.
By the way, I needed to call them many times and send many emails in order to get someone to assist me with a refund.
What a ripoff and a scam!
This is not the way how you treat your customers!
Will never again use the services of this airline!!! The same goes for my family, friends and all people I know!

title: No Customer Service
review_text: First of all, trying to reach this airline on the phone you have to wait on hold for 3 hours.  If you go online and get a "Chat Window" there is no one on the "Chat Window"  I recently booked a flight from Zurich going to New York City and the system booked me twice on the same flight and charged my Amex twice.  When I called them to fix the error I waited 3 hours before someone picked up and rudely did not even apologize for the delay and told me they could not help me I had to e-mail my complaint about the two charges.  I e-mailed my complaint and never heard back from them.  I now am having to go through American Express, as their phone gets answered and their chat works, and am waiting to get my money back Swiss took for the duplicate booking.

title: SO DISSAPOINTED!!!!!!HORRIBLE
review_text: horrible service! they made an offer for a change of ticket and even sent the confirmation with mention of fees. then they sent message 12 hours before departure that our card didnt work. We called the bank, bank said that there is no problem and Swiss rejected the payment by themself.  We contacted swiss and they said that their employee did a mistake and fees are more that was announced. We said that we are not agree (because if we knew this amount we wont change a ticket) and that we would like to speak with manager, but of course manager never called us and without our consent they debited our card! we spent a lot of money and time (bieng on vacations) for calling swiss airlines and bank. And we received a refusal letter, saying that they are disspointed that its happend with us and that they debited our card without our approval and consent, that the employee did a mistake but they will not reimbruse us the difference in the fees. So really pay attention !!!! it s horrible experience!!

title: üòë
review_text:
I paid for my seat next to the window 7F and they gave me a seat in another row and next to the hallway. (16D) and first of all. You don‚Äôt know something about it. They will never helps you. So bad

Wenn you are sleeping they don‚Äôt give you your meal. 
NEVER AGAIN!

title: Horrible Experience
review_text:
I am horrified at how unevolved and rude the customer service department is. 
Each time having to wait at least an how with horrible waiting music and a voice repeating the same thing every 10 seconds, only to be met by a miserable and impolite person. My flights were changed and canceled and I was informed to contact the airline if I had any issues with the solutions they gave to me. However, speaking to a representative was no solution at all and I'm left waiting to be responded to from my only contact form. I am ashamed that I payed extra for what I thought was a reputable company only to be treated horribly and spoken to aggresively. Never again will I book with Swiss Airlines.

title: Not recommend it
review_text: Horrible experience, in a flight of 1 hour we had a 30min delay, I chose one seat in the front of the flight to go out quickly and the crew put my hand baggage in the cabin, even if I explained this was my fourth flight in this travel and it never occurred before, so I lost time just for nothing. I don‚Äôt recommend it.

title: Swiss Air will move seats around even after you paid for upgrades
review_text: My wife and I flew from Los Angeles to Malaga Spain via Zurich. The good: the flights were pretty much on time. The bad: We paid $450 extra to select premium seats. Did not make a difference as we got moved around sometimes not even sitting together. This would have only gotten me to remove one star except to enter Switzerland and Spain we needed to get Covid Healthforms with Q-codes. These forms needed seat numbers. As Swiss Air was playing musical chairs with our seating assignments they invalidated all our healthforms. This forced us to run around the day of the flights to edit Swiss and Spainish online forms and get new Q-codes issued. As our AirBnB did not have a printer I was running up and down the street trying to get a merchant to print out the new forms.

title: Horible, experience with Swiss
review_text:
Have flied Swissair a lot prior to bankruptcy in 2002 and Swiss (International) Airlines after bankruptcy (have over 5 Million miles between Star and One World Alliances). They are not heading in the right direction. Sep. 22 this year was flying from Chicago to Zurich, with my wife, in business. Day early we fulfilled all Swiss requirements, COVID and travel related, and printed boarding passes and luggage tags at home.
At the check in we were asked for Covid test results even though we are fully vaccinated, which was requirement for transiting via Zurich and entering our final destination, Belgrade, Serbia. We were harassed by the O‚ÄôHare Manager, Ms. Eky, despite the fact that I have shown her printouts of what is required. I had no choice but to take a cab to downtown Chicago and back in order to board the flight.
Needless to say, we finished our trip with vaccine certificates and doc that we had at the airport to start with.
Upon return, we wrote a complaint to Swiss, who now uses consultants, to address those. Not sure how the consultants are compensated by Swiss, but in this case Mr. Kaufuti, never addressed any fact from my complaint but just repeated many times that he is sorry for the inconvenience, but my request for cab fare reimbursement is declined, refusing to allow me to elevate the complaint.  
It is a shame how arrogant and ignorant Swiss ground personnel, nullifies great and hard work of the flight attendants.

title: Used to be...
review_text: You dont have to be an eternal romantic to feel sad seing what the airline has become. Customer service is deplorable, flights get cancelled without any reason given, staff is still mostly nice, but the company pays such lousy salaries that most don't stay very long. Lufthansa Group, which bought the airline for close to nothing temds to milk it's swiss cow with hardly any concern for passengers.

title: Terrible customer service in case of delays
review_text:
Terrible customer service in case of delays. My flight was delayed by 2 hours and I was late on my connecting flight. I arrived to my final destination almost 20 hours later then I originally planed because of that delay.  The airline blames everything on "exceptional circumstances" and do not take responsibility on anything. 
Worst air line experience ever. DO NOT USE SWISS AIR !!!!

title: Did not see mask use enforcement in flight for passengers - felt unsafe
review_text: I don't usually write reviews but I must really inform that mask wearing was not enforced during this long haul flight.  Many passengers spent the whole flight or parts of it not wearing a mask (they were not eating or drinking and were older than 2 years old).  Some boarded with the mask on their chins and were not asked adjust them. This airplane was very large and has at least 300 passenger, I would say about 20% were not complying with the mask wearing rules.  This is not fair for other passengers that do want to protect their health and do go through the hassle of wearing it for 8 hours. And yes, I am vaccinated, but never the less, to avoid infection all boarding the plane should be wearing it properly for most of the flight and be reminded when they don't .  I did not feel comfortable at all on this flight for this reason.  The other problem related to Covid, was that the stewardess allowed passengers to seat on other persons seats to see if by chance they didn't show up.  That meant for us that our seats were in complete disarray when we arrived and if there was any disinfection it was useless in this case.    It's a shame to have to write such a review, as the airline had some other positive aspects.  I was impressed by the fact that the captain was woman, she did a beautiful landing.  The food was pretty good for regular airplane standards. The seats had a reclining position that sometimes doesn't stop at the desired location and can be very bothersome when fully reclined for the person behind you. The lines for boarding were insane, but I think that this was not the airline's fault, it had to do with the entry rules changes to USA.

title: Terrible customer service in case of luggage loss
review_text:
Every airline is fine as long as things go well. What really matters is how they react when there are problems, and Swiss failed this test miserably.

When we arrived at our destination, our baby buggy was gone. This was a real problem for us because we need it on a daily basis even for the most simple errands. We repeatedly tried to reach someone accountable both through the customer service hotline and through the online form. The customer consultants kept telling us that they cannot help with lost luggage. The messages submitted through the online form went unanswered until after two weeks, someone was kind enough to let us know that Swiss will keep looking. Three logistically difficult weeks since our arrival, we were finally informed that our buggy could not be found.

Swiss was willing to pay refund for the buggy but subtracted 27% from the original price because it was four years old. However, we are not able to buy an equivalent buggy for this price. We politely let them know that we don't understand why we should suffer a financial loss from the airline's mistake after already having suffered weeks of significant inconveniences. Our request for a full compensation was left unanswered and we were sent the reduced refund without any comment.

title: Best European airline out there
review_text: European airlines suck. Americans don't know how good they have it. For example, Air Baltic has rude staff and took $150 out of my account without my permission and I have no idea what for. I can't get answers about the random charge. I've experienced other rude and greedy airlines while traveling though Europe. You could be on your death bed and they would charge you 8 euros for a cup of water. Swiss air is the best I've experienced. They were excellent. I won't travel with any other European airline if I can help it.

title: Business class lacking
review_text: Overall, a bit underwhelming mostly due to COVID measures. The lounge in Boston offered only chips, cookies, and sodas. If COVID were truly the reason why the offerings were lacking, they could have offered packaged sandwiches and other beverage options especially since the options in the airport for food are non-existent. We were really looking forward to our lie-flat seats on the BOS-ZUR segment and that was pretty much the highlight of the trip; the meal service was not up to par. I have had much better flight service and meals in economy on other airlines. On the plus side, our flights were on time and the flight attendants were pleasant.

title: Don‚Äôt bother
review_text: I booked my trip to Berlin through Swiss Air because I thought they were reliable and I could select my seats and check bags. I paid extra to select my seats and for baggage. My reserved seats were switched as they have been again for the return flight. The outbound flight was delayed by 40 min., about the only flight delayed that afternoon. Flight attendants were rude when I asked them to collect my trash.

title: The worst customer service I encountered in a long time
review_text:
This review concerns post-flight customer service.
I flew with Swiss Airlines on Aug 4 from Tel Aviv to San Francisco. Via Zurich. Since I was dreading the possibility of sitting in a center seat flanked by two strangers during the COVID pandemic, I purchased reserved seating to ensure an aisle seat on both flights. The reservation, for which I paid 70 US dollars, was made already in May.
Shortly before the flight Swiss sent me an email informing me that they changed my seat assignment. They did not disclose the position of the reassigned seat, but wrote that they have done their ‚Äúutmost to assign an adequate seat‚Äù. When I boarded the plane, I discovered that they have placed me in a center seat, flanked by two strangers who did not keep their masks on ‚Äì exactly the scenario I was trying to avoid.
On the official SWISS airlines website I see the following:
Might SWISS change the seat I reserve in advance, later on?
If SWISS has to change your seat reservation, e.g. due to a short-notice change to the aircraft type used, SWISS will do its best to automatically reserve you a new seat in the seat category you have booked. If it is not possible to reserve an equal seat for you, you may apply to receive a Refund of the charge online.
Upon arriving to my destination, I filed a request for a refund. I was answered 11 days later by a customer feedback consultant named Ilisapeci ****a. She flatly refused my claim. When I politely pointed to her that the official website states that I am entitled to a refund she gave this rude answer: ‚ÄúSWISS has responded adequately in your case. I therefore trust in your understanding that this message reflects our final position and that this file is now considered closed.‚Äù
I was shocked by her response, and asked her for contact information for her supervisor, which she completely ignored. I then tried calling the US customer service phone number. I tried twice, but gave up after waiting for 60 minutes each time. This airline has the worst customer service I encountered in a long time.

title: Ghastly, ghastly booking, ticketing, check-in and customer service systems
review_text:
On a positive note, based on our recent experiences, the actual experience of flying Swiss is pretty passable:   staff in the airplanes and at check-in are mostly friendly and courteous in person, food is good, inflight entertainment is good and ‚Äì most importantly ‚Äì we have had good experiences with their treatment of animals.

There is no way around the fact however that overall it is time-consuming and nerve-wracking to fly Swiss, as their electronic systems appear entirely dysfunctional and their helplines severely understaffed to the point of uselessness. These are not idle considerations; we have lost days of time and been subjected to severe and aggravation and stress as a result of this senseless dysfunctionality.   Here is one single recent roundtrip (Geneva-New York JFK-Geneva as originally planned ‚Äì i.e. not the world‚Äôs most complex travel route):

1.	February 2021: Reserved tickets by telephone (4 people and dog), for July-August travel, Geneva-New York JFK-Geneva; person on the telephone very helpful: she assisted me in making the booking, and conscientiously helped me understand the rules concerning bringing dogs to the US. She told me that I could confirm the reservation and pay within 3 days.    The possibility of direct travel was particularly important to us, because we were shipping our family dog in the hold, for the first time. On the basis of this reservation, we cancelled another reservation with Delta.

2.	Called back 24 hours later to confirm booking and pay. During a first attempt I was put on hold for 25 minutes, after which I hung up and called again. During a 2nd attempt, I was put on hold for 45 minutes, and then told that the fare I had been quoted yesterday was no longer valid, and that the total cost of the tickets would be 300-400 CHF more than I was told the previous day. When I stated that this was not acceptable and expected the quoted price, I was put back on hold, and then "transferred to my supervisor". After a further 1 hour and 10 minutes, someone picked up, said "ca va" and then hung up on me. 

3.	After three days of subsequent calling and emailing, I received the original booking and tickets.

4.	July 2: We went to Geneva airport on the day of our ticketed flight and discovered that it did not exist (!).   The entire Geneva-New York Swiss Air route had apparently been cancelled 3 months previously.   We had neither been informed nor re-ticketed.   Swiss staff at the airport asked how it was possible that we had these tickets.

5.	A Swiss agent re-ticketed us, routing via Zurich to Newark the same day. Family members with anxiety disorders had severe reactions due to the suddenly unexpected change in the shipping condition concerning the dog ‚Äì i.e. that she would not be travelling directly, but would spend many additional hours in transit, without us.  The rerouting also added significant additional cost to our travel to our final destination (outside New York), as we could not take regular ground transportation, but had to add an additional very expensive taxi.

6.	August 20 (the day before the return trip): endeavoured to check in online, because the Swiss government requires that seat numbers be provided in the entry form for entry into Switzerland, which one is required to fill out prior to coming to the airport.  The online system (1) had our tickets in a different price category and so knew nothing about our 4 checked in pieces of luggage; and (2) crashed repeatedly. Ultimately, we could not check in online.

7.	 August 21 (return trip): while checking in, the agent requests that we pay for a second time ‚Äì 400 USD -- for our dog, because she is not in the system, notwithstanding the fact that I have a print out of our original invoice.

That was only one round trip, between two heavily trafficked, developed-world destinations.

This is simply insane levels of systemic incompetence for a purportedly world class flagship carrier.   I am still in shock that we actually made it back to Switzerland.

title: Incredible incompetent personnel.

Second worst problem is that Swissair and Lufthansa "operate" together, and one can buy from Swissair Lufthansa operated tickets, when one buys with connections. The main ticket is on Swissair. review_text: My mom and i have rebooked our ticket by phone via swiss air on 1/8/21 for departure Napoli - Brussels on 2/8/21. Booking number JBFTW9 and RAVLE5. The check-in gate for flight SN3170. title: Very disappointed
review_text:
Very disappointed and sad to see how Swiss airline got transformed to very average airlines company that saves on customer service. It used to be a high quality airline, flying with which you could have been certain in care, punctuality and comfort. 
Now the planes dont leave on time, they dont arrive on time either (what IS a problem on already late Sunday flights). There is no more food or drinks on board, only mineral water and a small piece of chocolate. IMPOSSIBLE to reach customer service. Sometimes website has some technical faults that dont allow flight rebookings. By phone just impossible to reach anyone. And it continues for months now.... Still 3 stars due to new planes and nice plane crews.

title: NO MORE SWISS AIRLINES!!!
review_text:
After my last flight experience with Swiss Airlines, I just want to say no more Swiss Airlines for me. 

The reason for that is as follows.
On Sunday, July 25th, 5:45 pm, we were supposed to fly from Zurich to Stockholm (LX1254), and the plane was supposed to land in Stockholm at 8:10 pm.

For some reason, the boarding started at. 6:15. 

When the boarding is complete, the captain will tell us that we'll be late for a few minutes. Almost 75 minutes later sitting in the airplane, the captain tells us we need to change airplane and all passengers would go to another gate for bus ride to the new airplane. 

While we hurry upp to the new gate, I get a text message from Swiss Airlines with a voucher to buy food from restaurants that were located far from the new gate. I thought it was a joke from Swiss Airlines! Who had time to go away to the restaurants area when the captain said we'd hurry to the new gate???!!!! 

We had to wait another 30 minutes before they allowed us to get on the bus. We discovered then that they had only ONE bus to drive in several rounds from the terminal to the new aircraft, which was time-consuming. 

During the flight, we hoped that, as compensation, they would offer the passengers some beverage. No, they didn't. They offer to BUY food and drink. 

Eventually we landed in Stockhom at 10:40 pm and thought the nightmare was over. No, the next challenge came! One of our two checked baggage never showed up! 

The process of reporting missing baggage took a further time and eventually we leave the airport at 11:40 pm and get in a cab! 

Still five days after the nightmare trip, we stil have not recived our baggage and have not heard a word about when we can get our delayed luggage back!!! NOT A SINGLE WORD YET!!! 

Therefor, for me and my family, NO MORE SWISS AIRLINES!

title: Crew can't count, allow people to fly without masks
review_text: Had a good flight with them from Palma to Zurich but the representative didn't explain that my son's ticket had SSS (special security) on it and he would have an extra step when boarding the flight to Chicago. So, we lined up to board the flight to Chicago for 30 minutes when we get to the gate to board my son was pulled for this security check. (There were 6 in our party and the flight was due to leave in 20 minutes.) As the 5 of us boarded I explained that my son was at security and they assured me the flight wouldn't leave without him, his wife also asked and was told the same. We boarded the plane, sat in our seats and 5 minutes later they announced that boarding completed and everyone was accounted for. We immediately stood up and called an attendant and explained that their count was incorrect as our son wasn't yet on the plane. As a result, the plane was held and 15 minutes later our son boarded. My son said that there were 5 people from our flight that were in this security line - so somebody with this airline has a problem counting passengers. These 5 could have easily missed the flight. Three further counts were conducted that I saw. The man sitting behind me in 41B wouldn't wear his mask. The crew did remind him twice during this nine hour flight but he still didn't wear it. The crew were up and down every 30 minutes but only one of their team was willing to speak to this guy. There seems to be very poor liaison between the security of the airport and the airlines.

title: Unreachable customer service
review_text: You CANNOT rebook a flight with them. I am not kidding nor exaggerating. I had to push a flight back to next year due to COVID restrictions, which you are oh-so generously allowed to do according to their terms. Except you can't. The online service doesn't work, and you go to the airport they won't do it for flights that aren't the same day, so you can only contact them by phone (paid number, too!). By phone you will be left hanging for hours. I have tried for THREE DAYS NOW. Only managed to get through once and before we were able to change my flight, the customer service representative (using a crappy Skype connection somewhere in India) just hung up on me. This is intentional and pretty much fraudulent, most people will just give up and they will keep their money, Swiss know exactly what they're doing. The airline is now a shadow of what they used to be, their reputation has slowly been going down the toilet for the last 5 years and with COVID they've reached a nadir, they're just the budget wing of Lufthansa now.

title: Lost and in Limbo
review_text: We arrived in Chicago on LX 8 last Sunday. From arrival at Z√ºrich, we knew we were in for trouble. Scheduling major outbound flights on a Swiss national holiday left hundreds of us standing in a disorganized, sprawling line that almost filled the departure terminal stretching about 500 meters from E19. The COVID mandates in place are difficult for anyone to navigate, but holding up 3 fully booked planes for the unprepared, left almost all of us stranded at our destinations, causing us, and probably the airline itself, thousands of Euros. There was no effort to coordinate the bottleneck at Z√ºrich , and most definitely none on the receiving end in Chicago, where nothing was done to ensure that at least those who might get to their connections could get to the head of the line. It was 18 hours of grueling waits, with little information, much like I imagine getting over a border as a refugee might be. To boot, there was no clear path to getting layover vouchers for meals and hotels at the lightly manned desk in the ORD's check-in. That process added an additional hour plus a taxi ride due to the shuttle being unavailable. As a final insult, we arrived at the hotel only to find that there too was an epic line for food, shelter and services. The hotel was not expecting the surge of guests and rendred our dinner voucher irrelevant as the retsaurant could not meet the load. That being, said the service on the flight was impeccable. Let‚Äôs hope their ground game improves.

title: Hello, is anyone alive at the customer service office in USA?
review_text:
From my past experiences, SWISS Airlines lives up to an expectation of being at least a solid "4" with its services.

However, there is something bewildering happening right now with their service lines, since I've already several days in a row, despite staying on the line for dozens upon dozens of minutes in total, yet still cannot get anyone to respond from their USA regional customer service department. I remember calling them this Spring, when I bought a ticket from them, and they were able to respond more-or-less as expected, but now? It's like the whole department is extinct and the only thing that is remotely alive is automated response system that leads to nowhere. What is going on?

Besides, I've sent almost a week ago an email to their customer support even before calling and I still don't see any response from them in either spam or regular inbox. Is their main customer service department also extinct?

This is so infuriating, since I want to clarify crucial variables that have occurred before me, prior to my flight later this year, and not being able to sort this out just really makes me think that this is the last time I'm going to use any of their services. 

So from 4, as of now, it straight dumps into 1. I give it a 1 just because of faint memory of decent service from the past.

I will update when and if I get a response from them.

title: Absolutely catastrophic airline, please avoid and spread the word!

title: Rarely do I write a bad review - this airline deserves it
review_text:
We booked this trip months ago: JFK - ZRH-ATH.  At the time we were required to provide our US Passport numbers.  Several days before the flight we were requested to provide and upload health information.  In additon Swiss sent is arrival information for Greece, testing requirements, etc.  At no time did Swiss ever indicate there were any issues with our transiting through Zurich for our connection to Athens.  That is until we arrived at the airport and were denied boarding.

From that point on any Swiss personnel we came in contact with showed absolutely no empathy toward our situation.  It was like they were reading from a Policy and Procedure manual.  Completely uncaring.

We were told we could re-book with no penalty or receive a partial refund.  The refund was an appalling  2% of the total ticket price.  2%!  Shameful and, quite honestly, insulting.  We opted for a "voucher" to use toward either a Lufthansa flight or a Swiss flight.

Based upon this experience I will NEVER use Swiss and am posting this story on all social media sites to make people aware of Swiss' deceptive business practices and uncaring, unsympathetic staff.

title: One of my worst customer service ever! If I could score 0, I would !
review_text:
On the 14th March, I had a connected flight from Dubai (3:50am) to Zurich (8:05am) and then to Gen√®ve (9:20am), unfortunately Swiss Airline cancelled this flight from Zurich to Gen√®ve and instead to leave at 9:20am with arrival in Gen√®ve at 10:20, it was postponed at 16:20 with arrival in Gen√®ve at 17:15. I immediately contacted the customer service and asked them for another alternative, I really didn't want to wait all of this time in Zurich airport knowing that I was coming from a sleepless night due to the fact my flight was at 4am in the morning.
When they notified me via email in regard the new flight schedule, they offered the 3 options (postpone the flight/cancel the return flight with a refund/or get a partial refund). I had then enquired and asked the customer service the flight refund value for the trip from Dubai to Gen√®ve ....and do you know how much they offered me?45CHF....unbelievable!! I never felt so offended, I had the impression that Swiss Airline was thinking that I was begging for money.
When I got back to them, I explained that not even my train ticket from ZH to GVA would cost me so little, so how can a flight from DXB to GVA could cost 45CHF; then they offered me a train ticket as solution. When I enquired about the timing and confirmed one....would you believe me that they never got back to me, neither with an answer nor with a train ticket? There was not a time issue, as the flight was cancelled 2 weeks before and in 2 weeks they could purchase a train ticket in a second.

I have written back to them repeatedly and told them, that, if there was no longer a train, I would be happy to get the partial refund and buy my own ticket, and they finally replied saying they don't offered any partial refunds. I was seriously annoyed,  this has been one of my worse flight experience. I had then reply to them and attached the email where they offered of a partial flight refund and again I never heard back from them.

Conclusion, the day of my return flight, I paid for my own transportation to get home.

I was incredibly surprise for how ridicules the customer service had became.

Why do you even call yourself "customer service" if you never even get back to your customer???

title: Worst customer service
review_text:
We tried to change our booking online but an error message informed us that we had to do it through the call center as they needed to refund us. 
We called the number provided, selected the French option and got connected with someone who doesn‚Äôt speak French. 
She asked us our booking number, first name, last name, date of birth and that‚Äôs when the show starts: 
1) she said our flight was with Lufthansa and we had to call them: wrong it was with Swiss-Edelweiss 
2) she said our flight has already been reimbursed: wrong! And cancelled! Wrong again! 
After insisting (=time on the phone roaming), we finally realized that she was not on our file! How is it possible after all the screening information we had to provide? 
So we start again. She finally find our booking and informs us that we need to pay 900chf each to change the flight! When the website mentioned we would be reimbursed and not charged! So we decided not to change (it was cheaper to buy a new flight). I wrote to the customer service. Never got an answer. Few days later, just out of curiosity, I logged in again on the website and have been able to change our flights for 20chf!!!

title: Dishonest refund practices
review_text:
Even though flying with SWISS is still OK (it was surely better organized better before the COVID times - now they are clearly saving money at the expense of a timely and good quality service), they do operate very dishonest refund practices. From my own experience of trying to get refunds for the multiple flights they cancelled - it takes dozens of emails, phone calls and even visits to their office in order to get a refund you are fully entitled to. During that time you are being given promises that never materialize, sometimes told open lies and in general given run arounds in the hope that you just give up.

Everything is geared towards only the most persistent customers eventually able get a refund - and only after wasting a lot of their time and energy. This is disgraceful, and is of course much close to a refund scam rather than proper refund policy. They should not be allowed to operate like this in Switzerland.

If you are booking a flight with them - book it with your credit card. Then if they flight is cancelled and they are not returning your money within a month or two - dispute the transaction with your bank / credit card provider as you would do with any other unscrupulous merchant that takes your money but doesn't provide the service.

title: Top
review_text: I simply love the comfort, food and service. Feeling home already while boarding this plane B777, elegant and stylish minimal SWISS design. Helpful crew, sufficient information provided during flight.

title: Awful check in staff at Athens
review_text:
I had a connecting flight from Athens today. The check in desk staff were two extremely rude Greek women, yelling at each other and at me, because my dog could apparently not stand sufficiently at the box. I fly with my dog and this box for years and anywhere in Europe with a variety of airlines and I have never had problems before. I have never been treated worse, I cannot describe how rude they were and how they talked to me and my partner. Even after they were told by their superior the box is ok, they were so angry, they refused to give me a seat number saying the flight was overbooked, even though I booked my flight weeks ago and paid the crazy price of nearly 500 euro for a European flight; and even though the people after me were given a boarding pass...
I am shocked at how two rude bitter Greek employees can ruin a reputation Swiss has been building for years. I have flown with Swiss in the past and everything was ok, but after this experience never again!

title: Wings over the Atlantic
review_text:
I'm a frequent Miles&More SWISS flier who regularly flies between New York city and Mumbai/Delhi. My experience on my most recent flight was pleasant. My flight between Mumbai and Z√ºrich was on an Airbus A340-300 with new refurbished seats. The flight between Z√ºrich and New York City was operated by an Airbus A330-300. Both aircrafts had a 2-4-2 seating arrangement which made the flight a lot more comfortable. 

The cabin and the seating in the A340 was new and the seats had an adjustable leg support. The screen for onboard entertainment was sensitive and reasonably sized. There is a USB port provided for charging your device. The seat width and legroom is not particularly great for someone who is 6ft 1inch tall. You perhaps would want to book a bulk head seat. The seats on the A330 although old, are more spacious and comfortable. The entertainment screen on the A330 however as super old and are not very responsive. Overall, I'd rate the A330 experience better than the A340. The toilets in both aircrafts are clean and well kept. However, be sure to carry your own pluggable earphone with two pin adapters as the earphones provided are mediocre at best. 

Despite the space crunch onboard, the hospitality and the kindness of the staff make the flying experience good. Being a traditional Hindu Brahmin who is particular about a vegetarian diet, I always book a special meal. The cabin crew are deligent and always serve me the right meal. The selection of beverages for a teetotaller is reasonable. The crew offer small bars of SWISS chocolate by the end of the flight.

Overall, my experience on SWISS over the years has been great. I really hope they start a new service to Bangalore as well.

title: Complete mess
review_text: Just before boarding we have been informed by airport staff that we have to download health declaration form, which contain lot of personal information like, passport number,  address in China and a lot more. Part of this form was in Chines and with nobody to explain and help with the form and staff stating that we can't board the plane without this form make me feel like I am losing my mind. title: NEVER EVER USE THIS AIRLINES

title: Missing information by Swiss Air during booking but given no refund
review_text:
Today, our family with young children were supposed to fly from UK to Switzerland for my son's eye treatment at Bern. We are not EU citizens but holders of passports which normally do not require visa to travel to Switzerland. 

We bought the Swiss Air tickets few weeks ago successfully without ANY warning/information that only EU/UK/Swiss citizens can fly from UK to Switzerland.  We also had arranged and fully paid the accommodation in Bern, Switzerland using Airbnb.

Today at Heathrow though, we were told that we could not board the flight because ALL non EU/UK/Swiss citizens are not allowed to fly from UK to Switzerland. Since there is no such information at Swiss Air website or at Switzerland Embassy in UK website, we asked politely the check-in counter staff to double check the information. The staff then became very rude and condescending and accused us of not believing her.

Then we were directed to the ticket counter. The person in this ticket counter was also very rude when asked about refund. She told us that there would be no refund due to no-show. When we questioned, again politely, why we were considered no-show since we were already at Heathrow, the young lady became really unpleasant to talk to. 

Due to Swiss Air not showing in their website when we booked the tickets that ONLY EU/UK/Swiss citizens who can travel from UK to Switzerland, we lost more than half of our AirBnB payment on top of getting no refund from Swiss Air, a total of more than GBP 2,300 loss.  On top of that, my son also could not get his needed eye treatment.

title: Passengers WITHOUT MASK and crew did not do anything

title: Traveling During Pandemic
review_text: I booked my flight on August 8th from JFK to Poland, both ways. The flight was on schedule, both directions, despite delays in Zurich we still landed 5 mins before the schedule. Due to the virus everyone was sitting pretty much alone, I was sitting by myself in the row of 4. The stewardesses  made sure everyone kept their masks on during the entire flight. The food was amazing, just before landing, we were being served a warm cheese tart with vanilla ice cream!!! Plenty of bottled water and refreshments, disinfecting pocket towels. Thank you SWISS airlines, that was a great choice during this pandemic.

title: Still lack of client orientation
review_text:
The overall experience was not really great. The check in was a bit chaotic, a huge crowd checking it for economy so we had to go through this crowd to go to the Business / first Check in, but at least there were not too many people there so check in was quite fast. Busy security check but the business lane was ok. 

Long queue at the lounge, long waiting time. Lounge offers limited food which was not good at all. What surprised me, the cutlery is not covered which is not really great in pandemic times. Staff are not very helpful. When I asked a simple question, they sent me to someone else and even after having talked to 4 people my question was not answered, really disappointing. And what was missing most was a client centric approach. 
The Flight was ok. Food was not good. But staff was friendly. 

Overall I wonder why Swiss does not make any effort to be client oriented with their premium customer, despite their difficult times...I personally think I would do my best to ensure client are happy to push the business in such time!

title: The worst experience ever
review_text:
Hello, 
My son and I flew from Chicago to Switzerland with Swiss our final destination was Albania. I had a ticket already booked, my son didn‚Äôt have one. So we bought a ticket for him at check in. The ticket was double price but I wanted him to come to Albania. We arrived in Switzerland the next day in the morning. Around 7 am. We had a layover about 4 hours. We waited till the gate opened. As soon as the passengers started to go in they stopped us. Telling us to wait 1 more hour for their green light. We waited 1,2,3... no one was keeping in touch with us. We started panicking. What is happening?! What is going on?! No explanation. My 2 years old Started getting hungry and tired. The food stores closed 2 hours before our boarding time. I started buying chocolates from vending machines. Keep feeding my 2 years old with chocolates. Then everyone started buying everything from vending machines because there was no other choices. Finally someone from Swiss company comes and tell us that they having an issue with the Albanian government. We asked: what is gonna happen with us? When are we leaving? When are we gonna have something to eat? Especially for the babies. His answer was: I don‚Äôt know yet. We will try to do our best. Liar. We were about 150 passengers. It was 6 pm chaos everywhere. My son started getting hungry. No more food not even chocolates at vending machine. No water. Finally by 10:30 pm they brought some sandwiches and water. Can a 2 years old eat sandwiches?! No. I gave him a banana. They said you will stay here tonight and we don‚Äôt know what is gonna happen with you. I was looking at my son and I was very heart brokennnn. They brought us some mattresses to share with others when the COVID was around. Unbelievable. We stayed that night there at the airport. The next day the same thing. No answers for us. Sandwiches again in the morning. Asked them for kids food? He said we don‚Äôt have any üòû . I asked them I need pampers because I am out. He said we don‚Äôt have any üò© I asked him: sir please give me my carry on I have food and pumpers there. He said: I will try. Omg. Finally we had a green light to fly at 3 pm. We landed in Albania. They gave us there food and drinks. 
The worst experience with Swiss. Can‚Äôt believe a big company like Swiss actin that way. Unbelievable. Stay from them. Honestly they don‚Äôt care about us.

title: Do a charge back
review_text: We kept pursuing for refunds for flights cancelled. After no help from Swiss Air and being constantly ignored we went to our credit card company. We gave them copies of everything and showed our correspondence to them. Today we have received our refund via chargeback. Please use this facility if like us you to are getting nowhere.

title: Flight cancelled yet 5 months later reembursement incomplete
review_text: Due to Covid, my March 3 flight cancelled bySwiss. It took weeks to get through to them on the phone, and get a refund. However they failed to refund separate charge for seat preference ($70). I called again April 3rd, April 24, July 24 and again August 8th. Always told it was going to be reposted on  my credit card. Never happened, and have been disconnected at least 7 times, twice while waiting on hold for over an half hour. They are dishonest and stingy.

title: Before the Covid-19 pandemic, in Europe, 4 great flights with Swiss in February 2020.
review_text: In February this year, i flew 4 times with Swiss: Amsterdam-Zurich, Zurich-Hong Kong (from Hong Kong to Auckland and back, i flew with Virgin Australia via Melbourne/Sydney), Hong Kong-Zurich and finally Zurich-Amsterdam. Excellent and attentive crew from my personal experiences, with Swiss, but the Zurich-Hong Kong and Hong Kong-Zurich flights were not full (due apparently to the already ongoing Covid-19 health crisis at that moment in Asia). What happened post-Covid 19 pandemic in Europe, apparently involving the whole airline industry worldwide, i really can't comment. Have a nice evening.‚úå

title: Great Long haul trip in middle of Covid
review_text:
I wasn't sure what to expect flying in August due to Covid - but I had to get back to the Uk and choose to fly with Swiss as I have never had a problem with them before.

Bangkok airport was empty, check in was easy and very quick.
Boarding was complete within 10 mins as there were so few passengers on the plane - luckily this mean we were all spread out. I had a  whole row to myself (window seat to window seat) which was amazing as everyone could lie down and get some sleep

I flew Economy - food service was good and efficient - the main course. - veggie - didn't have much taste but the dessert was delicious and I loved the red wine! 
I really like how Swiss has the help yourself snacks section by the toilets  (chocolates, pastry, bananas and bottled water) - great for midnight snacks!

All staff were very friendly and wore face masks - passengers also required to wear face masks the whole time.  We were given disinfectant wipes as we boarded and before meal times.
Good selection of films and pretty comfy seats. usual small pillow and blanket provided 

No amenity kit, I'm surprised Swiss have't started doing economy ones by now. I know not all airlines do, but Philippines Airlines and Singapore Airlines both provide a toothbrush, eyemask and socks. I expected more of Swiss. 

I felt safe flying despite Covid and will continue to fly with Swiss.

title: Not perfect but not bad
review_text: Not a bad flight overall, although there were a few disappointing aspects to the flight. The USB plug for my seat didn't work so I couldn't charge my phone during the flight (this would be a problem for a longer flight...), and while we didn't have trouble with our reservations -- the airline had double-booked the seat of someone sitting next to us. Very unpleasant situation if it happens to you, especially when the flight is quite full... The seat tray was also very inconvenient, although I don't know if that's the fault of the airline or the airplane (we were on an Airbus A340-300), I don't know what the person who designed that tray was thinking... I was also left with VERY little space when the person in front of me reclined backward. The meal (breakfast) was fine, although we weren't given a choice -- it would not have been good for someone who doesn't like eggs. It was also very cold in the cabin during the flight. The flight attendants, on the other hand, were very friendly and the flight itself went very smoothly and arrived on time.

title: SCAM
review_text:
Swiss slowly but surely became a joke and do not care about the customer.
Confirming the flight and cancelling it the next day while keeping the reservation for the flight back is just terrible and the customer service telling the customer that it's not their problem how you will get there is just insulting. We just have the impression of being scammed.

We used to fly with this company a lot, but lately it is from bad to worse.

If you want to fly with them, just don't because you might be scammed by them.

title: Bad service for refund but ok flying experience
review_text: My flight got cancelled 1 week before flying, but luckily they found me a flight in the next day however weirdly, I will need to pay the additional luggage fee (50 EUR) for the new flight as they can't transfer that part of the money from the paid old flight but only able to apply for a refund, so I agreed. However, ever since then (mid May until now, more than 3 months) and I still didn't get the refund. Called them twice and the customer service just said they can't help but I just have to wait. Can't believe this is the service within Lufthansa group, even Vueling made the refund quicker....

title: Terrible boarding with App
review_text:
Nothing but problems with my boarding pass on their app.
Had my two passes for the connecting fights. Boarded ok in malaga, getting off the plane the next boarding pass was visible it even updated with the fate number.
Then the problems started,in the shop my pass had gone,leaving just the flight details. Causing problems with buying my duty free.
It was eventually treated at the gate by printing a physical one,which then refused to be scanned!
There seemed to be a lot of mix up  of seating on boarding,real mess.

title: Smooth
review_text:
A smaller five seat wide plane this time.
Boarding was smooth,fast,and we left on time 
Landed early,and the when experience was a good one.

title: Bad service
review_text:
It is sad that the coronavirus didn't shut down this company yet. I have traveled with Swiss just now. Paid 150 chf for 5 extra kilos of the luggage, because of their bug in the system. 

My experience with Swiss airlines is random. Sometimes they are just rude, sometimes they are greedy. During covid times they are rude and greedy. Avoid them if you can, if you don't want to pay a lot just to get cheap-to-no service. Those guys are unfortunately not competitive.

title: Messy
review_text:
Mixed bag this time,we were put on a wide bodied jet, normally used long haul,and it was almost empty.
No air bridge again,and being a big plane it was a long flight of stairs.
Staff excellent as always, seats and legroom average but comfy,the seats reclined.
We got an air bridge upon landing.

title: There are better low cost airlines
review_text:
Zero quality in customer service after randomly redistributing all the seats in the plane and no information provided (we were moved from raw 6 to 38 with no window).
Importantly, and despite being mandatory the use of mask, the crew did not use it during the flight (especially the attendant at the back of the plane in a yesterday flight LX2115)

title: Just experienced the worst service from an Airline
review_text: Thanks to Royston, I have experienced the Worst and a very rude experience  ever. I asked for an update on my refund and was given a Text book answer and when you follow it with another query, you get a customer agent who refuse to respond to you and wait as if he has not been asked a question. There was a very awkward silence which I found hilarious and when I gave up playing his game to my surprise he asked ‚Äúis there anything else I can help you with‚Äù. Dude, you just ignored all my questions with an Awkward silence stand off for 2 minutes. Swiss Air- this kind of service is appalling to top off the fact that I am still waiting months for my refund.

title: Expensive but efficient
review_text:
Connecting flight to Malaga,via Zurich.
