Boarding went well,safety was observed. Terminal 2 Heathrow being easy to navigate.
Downside was no reckoning seats making sleep harder.
On time,but slow disembark due to distancing

title: Flag carrier of shame.
review_text:
Cancelled my flights twice and still waiting for a refund.

Customer Service non existent. Any and all contact all you get it please wait. Wait until the sun goes out? Earth freeze over?

Do not fly with this airline.

title: No customer service at all - been waiting for refund for 5 months
review_text:
Flights were cancelled early March and my travel agency requested a refund. Swiss has not responded and it is soon FIVE months! Their customer service is a joke. 

I have reported the purchase as fraud to my credit company as I suspect that Swiss cannot or will not pay back my money.

I had several other bookings with other airlines and they were refunded. 
I fully understand that there are more refunds than usual but not even answering for almost five months is unacceptable. 

Shame on you. Take some pride in how you conduct business and act like a respectable airline.

title: Useless customer service - hotline impossible to reach
review_text: Swiss sold us a flight and canceled multiple times (even 2 days in advance), re-booking cannot be done online, customer service impossible to reach to re-book... Worst service I've ever experienced with an airline. Certainly will never fly with them anymore.

title: rude customer service
review_text: my flight was cancelled during covid 19 and i called the customer service...they had a very unfriendly mumbling guy that was not helpful at all on the phone.

title: Being insulted at the check in counter
review_text:
I arrived at the airport 2.5 hours before the onboarding time. My check-in luggage exceeded 3kg and I told the representative to let me remove a bag of items from the luggage so that it wouldn't be overweight. I have travelled on air many times in my life so I have a bag of unimportant items ready to be removed and even have a friend accompanying us for this purpose. I explained to your staff that I wish to remove a bag of daily items like shampoo and shower gel and more that would be sufficient to meet the requirement. Instead of giving me 30 seconds to do so, she held my luggage hostage and insisted on charging me for an additional fee. 

I didn't continue to argue with her on rightfully getting my own possession, then the Second problem arose here when I politely inquired about the estimated, if not the exact, price for adding the luggage. She refused to tell me by saying that she did not know and I was again surprised by her rude attitude. She ignored me and went ahead and asked to weight my hand carry and I quickly cooperated. I have travelled many times with this carry on and never had a problem getting it onboard. She said my carry on was oversized, took it and stapled a tag on it without asking for my permission. I then again asked her about the price for this piece and she refused to tell me again saying that she wouldn't know until the computer generated it. Firstly, I know very well that there is a standard additional charge for any oversized/overweight baggage, I only asked her because I didn't remember what was said on the website. This basic information should be well-knowledgeable for your check-in staff. Secondly, the computer had already done the luggage-checking job so I was confused about what else to wait for the computer to get the fees. 

Thirdly, besides the unprofessionalism, we were being ill-treated by more than one of your staff. During her inappropriate refusal for all my rightful request of having my luggage back for 30 seconds and basic information inquiries, she repeatedly made a scene on the floor by yelling at me "You are making my life difficult!" several times. She also gathered with her two more staff to join the bully, and one did not even wear a mask. It was extremely rude for a service provider and highly unacceptable during pandemic time. 

Lastly, I did not argue with them and let your staff do what they need to do to tell me the final price. she told me that she was going to charge me $173 for the additional 3kg and another $100 to check-in the carry on. I finally got the price and made a decision to not bring the carry-on with me. Your two staff insulted me by making me present to her and her coworker who my friend was and warned us at least 4 times not to bring it onboard as they would know. I again made a promise and cooperated with them the whole time but felt so uncomfortable. 

The check-in process was already unnecessarily long and torturous, we had to rush to the TSA even if we had arrived so early to the airport. I thought it was over, but when lining up to get onboard, the staff was there again fixating her eyes on us and our items. More than that, there were at least two passengers in line carrying the exact same carry-on with them to go onboard successfully. 

In conclusion, the original "problem" was something cannot be more common at the check-in counter and can be solved under 30 seconds by letting me handle my own possession. Instead, it got escalated to so many unwanted events and we had to live through the whole 30 minutes of embarrassment in public.  I strongly believed that we, and my friend who so kindly accompanied us through the whole three hours, were being treated extremely unfairly and unprofessionally.

title: Usual complacent Swiss service
review_text: Eventually managed to get to Athens after flights were cancelled twice and I was always left to sit on the phone for ages contacting them to sort out alternatives - no proactive approach at all. Flight was fine, but Covid was used as an excuse not to give us anything to eat apart from one chocolate on a flight over two hours. Aegean on the return flight were considerably better.

title: Not what I expected
review_text: Upon our return flight on 30 December, the flight was so over booked, that some of the passengers were seated in crew seats. this made for a very crowded area in the back of the plane. And then you still have to pay for alcohol beverages.

title: Three flights three cancellations
review_text:
I haven‚Äôt flown Swiss in many years and now that streak will continue!

Flight #1 SFO-Paris Canceled with zero (0) warning...United (who wrote the ticket) saved my but by flying me through Newark

Flight #2. Paris-SFO, canceled with zero (0) warning and pushed back a day.

Flight #3. All OK on United web site, but one call to Swiss, and, yes, you guessed it, flight cancelled with zero (0) warning!

Once again, it was back to United and a new flight via Frankfurt!  And the best part, United didn‚Äôt even know that Swiss (their partner) cancelled the flight.

Clearly, it‚Äôs time for United to rethink their Swiss strategy...what a bunch of dum koffs.  So much for Swiss efficiency.

title: No refunds from Swiss
review_text: Swiss cancelled my flights and offered an alternative which did not work with our connection. We declined the offer and asked for a refund. 4 months later still no refund. Swiss are a bunch of crooks. Don‚Äôt give them your money

title: Swiss Quality
review_text:
I was traveling from Paris to Mumbai this was a connecting flight from Paris to Zurich and Zurich to Mumbai. Great take off and landings 
Caring crew Indian food was on the menu 
Overall one must experience Swiss

title: Do not ever fly Swiss
review_text: cancelled flights in March and no refund or communication ever since. No other word but fraud. Complaints are not answered and call centres keep telling us different stories. No supervisors available. No refund.

title: Very good
review_text:
The Airbus A321, was a great jet, flight was very comfortable, the meal was great.
Boarding was a bit messy but that‚Äôs my only complaint

title: Terrible customer service
review_text: Airlines are fighting to survive during the pandemic, but Swiss still keeps going on with their horrible customer service. While I understand that the situation is difficult for them, they should take care of their loyal premium customer, but this is not the case. They make you feel really bad, you feel like you have to be grateful to fly with them...completely wrong approach- many customer will move on to better airlines...so will I...

title: Best Airlines Nice Staff Members
review_text:
I am a far cry from reaching my goal of reviewing every Airlines in every city I fly. This is a goal for 2020 to complete because my experiences are positive and I want to share.

I choose this pretty airlines much exclusively if I can. The number +1-855-{948}-(3661) one reason is they are most often on time. However a close second is that they are a company with a big heart. The staff from check in to flight crew are some of the best! Have I had mediocre experiences, well yes but it's uncommon. Also they often come in with excellent pricing. Finally the two bags fly free can't be beat.

My most recent flight was delayed due to snow. The grounds crew was efficient and cleared the runway with a 15 plow convoy. If you've never seen this it's pretty cool. Also the deicing machine had us taken care of in around 20 minutes. Time was made up in the air and the flight was only delayed 10 minutes into Atlanta.

Airline does things differently and they pride themselves on being a unique caring airline. I think the extra attention provided by the desk agent is indicative of the overall customer oriented culture.

title: Terrible flying through O‚ÄôHare
review_text: We recently flew from Zurich to Dallas-Ft. Worth thru Chicago on Swiss Air. Everything about the flight itself went okay with no big problems. The legroom was tight and the food, although not great, was edible. Check-in was smooth in Zurich and the flight attendants seemed friendly and professional. Flying through Chicago‚Äôs O‚ÄôHare Airport was a different story. It was terrible. We stood in long-long lines for everything. It took over 1 1/2 hours to get through customs, and then we had to wait in line another 45 minutes just to get on a bus to change from the international to domestic terminal. When I first booked the tickets, I wasn‚Äôt happy about the 3 1/2 hour layover between flights but as it worked out, we needed just about every minute. I‚Äôve flown through Chicago several times going to Europe without a problem, but I think this is the first time I‚Äôve ever flown back through O‚ÄôHare coming home. Hopefully, it will be the last.

title: NEVER AGAIN SWISS
review_text:
I didn't know that my flight was cancelled until the departure day. I didn't receive any information, the flight was still scheduled according to the airport departures.

Furthermore, I contacted the airline 5 times via online form and tried  calling at least a dozen times over a period of 4 months. I haven't received any kind of answer or reaction whatsoever. I'm still waiting for my refund.

Even though I'm living in Switzerland, I will never fly with this airline again. This is the worst customer service I have ever experienced. There is nothing "Swiss" about this airline

title: Briught joy to flying again
review_text: I want to highlight the excellent service and care shown to me and other passengers. Flying had become a very burdonesome affair, however the quality of service on this leg was one of the highest I experienced. Attendants were kind, very responsive, the food was very good and the seating great. But for me more than this, was the incredible care of the crew. That made it a genuine experience and I congratulate all concerned for the fine job they did.

title: Another great SWISS flight... pre corona
review_text:
I love Switzerland and I love the SWISS airline- classic and classy, sleek and smooth. 

Is it possible for a flight to be delightful?  

And hey- what about customer service: there were some changes in logistics and the several agents that I spoke to- on the phone and in the ground in both countries- were outstanding and helpful. 

All this is true, because....
I visited this airline.

title: Great short flight- but pre corona
review_text:
Hey!  I love Switzerland and I love SWISS as an airline, and that‚Äôs despite the fact that my current avatar is of the Eiffel Tower in Paris... but hey- look at my profile and contributions to see that I try to be a regular summer hiker in the Swiss Alps. 

Anyway- back to the flight- short and sweet and smooth and perfect. Good service and very pleasant experience.

title: Superb, as always
review_text: Travelled in middle of Covid epidemic and they proved to be excellent once again. No senseless boarding or disembarkation rules like Aegean or Volotea (if you can even call that an airline), great on board service, great attitude and a lovely, caring feeling about them. Well done!!!!

title: No Covid19 regulations
review_text:
I am flying from Prishtina to Zurich and I am seated with 2 people I don‚Äôt know. There is no distance regulations and this should change to safe some life‚Äôs immediately.
This should not happen because we are also human

title: Cancelled flight
review_text: Can I just say a big thank you to Swiss airlines it took them just one week to cancel my flight and give md a full refund .. top class airline!

title: No refund, worst customer service ever
review_text: My flight got cancelled in March and Swiss should refund me. It's July now and nothing of the sort happened. The customer service agents are blatantly lying when I ask how long it takes for my refund to process. Where is your decency Swiss?

title: Charge calls for keeping you wait hours to rebook!
review_text: pay attention as Swiss call line 0848 700 700 creates hefty charges. For rebooking my flight they kept me waiting over an hour an my phone was charged an additional $50!

title: Refund
review_text: Worst customer service I've ever known ... I've spoke to three people who tell me different stories ..with one thing in common... thats right dont know when I will get my refundƒ∑

title: worst customer service
review_text:
Rebookings flights and 50chf voucher with Swiss - WORST CUSTOMER EXPERIENCE i have had in a long time...

After spending more than 1hour with 3 different agents, trying to change my flight. I am still nowhere near a solution and with more bills to pay. Nice touch Swiss. 

Lets share some of my discoveries throughout my client journey:
1. The customer service line is NOT FREE. I discovered it by asking one of the many agents I talked to. However, i still dont know with what sauce i will be eaten as i dont know how much the cost per min is. Couldnt find that on the website either.
2. Now that it is established that its a paid phone service, youd assume that you wouldnt be on hold... and hung-up on... but it happened... after a 16min call my first agent just hung-up while I was waiting. 
3. The agents didnt have the same information. With my first agent, i could book intercontinental flights with my voucher and rebooking. With the second agent it was just impossible and the information i was given was the opposite (bookig national vs intercontinental flights with my rebooking)
4. It obviously would not have been a bad experience without the impolite customer representative. 
Agent 3 was utterly rude. I was interupted every 2-3 sentences. He was debating how much I paid my flights over and over and only realised he was wrong after 10min of discussion. He wasnt just debating he was mostly trying to teach me how i was wrong. But CHERRY ON TOP after 15min when the agent finally realised that i was right, we ended up looking at the prices of the destination i wanted to go to. 
IT WAS 2√ó THE PRICE THAT YOU CAN FIND ON THE SWISS WEBSITE. I am deducing that Swiss is tricking/making money on people using the customer service line? IT IS THE ONLY WAY TO REBOOK - THROUGH THE CUSTOMER SERVICE LINE...

BOTTOM LINE: I wasted 1hr trying to get some help with no success. I was advised to book my flight directly on the website to not pay double the price. This also means not using my rebooking and praying that one day Swiss will reimburse me.
Agent 1 hung up on me
Agent 2 not in line with agent 1
Agent 3 rude and borderline disrespectful

title: Damages baggage
review_text: Travelled from Athens to Stockholm with connection in Z√ºrich. My baggage was delayed with 3 days and arrived totally damaged and soaked. Some of the contents were also damaged. Swiss wanted me to have the suitcase either repaired (the suitcase is obviously irreparable) or if irreparable to have that in written by a repair shop and in that case provide them with the receipt I bought the suitcase (for some time ago) and then consider whether they would compensate me deducting of course 10%/year from the value of the case. So SWISS delayed my baggage, damaged it and some contents, want me to spend time to find and pay a repair shop to certify that the suitcase is irreparable, to find the receipt of a suitcase bought quite some time ago and then maybe compensate me with its value after deducting 10%/year. Smart business isn't it? And this is a well known popular Swiss air flight company. Total disaster and disappointment. They should be ashamed!

title: They messed up my flight back and they are not getting back to me...
review_text:
After cancelling the first leg of my flight back home, they apparently made a huge mistake and "closed" my other flights. As a result and to make it a short story, I couldn't take my flight from Hong Kong to Nice via Z√ºrich, though it was confirmed on my side. 
I spent 4 hours on the phone at Hong Kong airport with Expedia, with whom I booked the flight, and they were trying to understand with Swiss on their side why they had "closed" my flight.
I had to fly the next day back home with Aeroflot since Swiss didn't manage to figure out the problem in 4 hours on the phone!!!! 
I wrote Swiss an email on March 10th to complain obviously, but I haven't heard back from them after more than 3 months. And I always get the same answer that they will get back to me when I write again to know the status of my complaint: "we will get back to you..."
I will never ever fly with that company ever gain. They are not serious and don't care about you! 
AVOID!!!

title: No refund, no answers
review_text:
We were cancelled three times so we had to rent a car instead. They do not answer emails, messages, the phone....nothing
And on their website I tried to fill in their reclamation form but they require ticket number! We do not have that because they never send it to us, just the booking number!
We want our money back!

title: Would love to rate lower than one star
review_text: I am out almost $3000 because the super nasty customer service reps at Swiss Air (in person and via email) refuse to refund my money for tickets to London for my family this month.  They won't even do travel vouchers because they say that when I cancelled the tickets and requested a refund back at the end of April , the flight wasn't "officially" cancelled (even though Swiss Air is still not flying out of Dulles yet and likely won't again until July).  I am sick to death about the whole situation.  I want my money back.  It's bad enough that a trip we have saved for a long time is not happening, but the thought of them keeping our money makes it so much worse.  Any thoughts on what I can do?  I have already filed a complaint with the US DOT.  I am in Virginia, so not sure if I have any legal recourse.

title: Excellent Flight
review_text:
everything was Excellent !!!
worked English speakers a lot and good to respond for everything.
1 time, In-Flight Entertainment was broken but it's OK for me.

title: REFUSING TO REFUND FOR A FLIGHT THEY CANCELLED
review_text: Swiss cancelled my flight and have completely ignored all correspondence asking for a refund.  Total and blatant disregard for common decency, sensible customer service and the LAW.  Strangely they keep managing to send me marketing emails asking to book flights with them in the future.  Somewhere below Ryanair on the list of airlines I'd want anything to do with in the future.

title: Lufthansa's" daughter " looks like her mother.
review_text: Swiss was once an independent airline. Now it is the" daughter " of the Lufthansa. Swiss is so similar to its mother in standards, aircraft, and personnel that it is impossible to distinguish. The only difference is the color of the fuselage and a chocolate bar with a white cross on a red background. Not enough for separate positioning....

title: Expect treachery
review_text: Terrible company and customer service. Didn't get the refund, wanted to change an upcoming flight and now it has disappeared from my bookings on their website, telling me to contact the place where I bought the ticket (surprise : it was on your website)

title: Excellent
review_text:
I don't understand some of the negative reviews here.  We've flown with Swiss Air, business class, several times now and have always been very happy with the service.   Staff were extremely polite and friendly and we've always enjoyed a very comfortable flight.
I have to say that we were in Thailand when the Coronavirus struck and we were worried we would not be able to get a flight home.  We telephoned Swiss Air and they were wonderful.  We couldn't get an earlier flight home with Swiss Air themselves, but they offered us a business class flight home with Eva Air at no extra cost.  I cannot recommend them highly enough.

title: WORST SERVICE DONT TRUST THIS AIRLINETHEY WILL ROB YOU .
review_text: I had a flight booked march 17 from geneva to barcelona I even purchased the cancelation insurance ! And as you know covid 19 happend and spain went into full lockdown my accomadation in spain were cancelled and refunded a week prior too our flight . We called every day spent countless hours on the phone to getthrough only for it to cut out after being on the phone too long. It was next to impossible to get ahold of them the message on the phone kept implying due to covid 19 they have high call volume. Granted they must but a day before we booked to leave we finally reached someone when we asked to cancel they said they would put me on hold to get me to the right department for cancelation.only two spend over an hour and  a half on the phone for them to hang up.. I'm not joking .I was never able to get through again even when they claim 24 hours They never cancelled my flight it said they were still sending people to spain. And now that I missed my flight and I keep calling and when I finally get to someone this time they tell me since I missed my flight I have to email support for cancelation since it cant be done over th phone all of a sudden ? And when i say i have cancelation insurance they claim it doesnt cover pandemics... so now they wont give me a refund they wont give me credits but would give me a cancelation document but wont write in it that they airline wont provide no refunds or credits which my credit card needs those exact details to pay for my flight through the credit card insurance. It's a insane hassle trying to get them to reply to my emails I wait over a week for them to write back just to say theres nothing they can do.I Keep emailing them since I dont believe they cant just write me off .Its unbelievable I cant believe this robbery.

title: Good Service
review_text: It was my first time flying Swiss Air Lines and we had a good experience. The staff was polite and professional, the seats were comfortable and clean. We enjoyed flying with Swiss Air Lines.

title: Swiss International canceled my flight, did not offer any alternative and refused any compensation.
review_text:
As the world was locking down Swiss International canceled my flight.  I don't have a problem with that.  I called them on the phone and after a long wait they told me that I had to call the travel agent (Expedia) who sold me the ticket.  I called Expedia and after multiple tries and long waits got through to a helpful person who told me that Swiss International still had a flight scheduled for the same day from Newark rather than JFK.  I told them that would be fine and waited on the phone while Expedia attempted to rebook.  This proved impossible because Swiss International would not provide them the code they needed.  I gave up and was unable to fly anywhere.

After the fact I had repeated contact with Expedia, who unlike Swiss International would answer the phone, about getting a refund, voucher or whatever.  Expedia was good.   Swiss International is awful!  The final word from  Swiss International was delivered via email through Expedia that any refund was refused due to ‚Äúrules and restrictions.‚Äù

Swiss International is not to be trusted!  Flyer beware!

title: No reimbursement!
review_text: My flight got cancelled and I had the tickets that would have the right to 100% reimbursement or free cancellation. Swiss already confirmed that will reimburse, but has told me that they have no plans or date to do so! It's been almost 2 months!

title: unable to claim section 75 on my credit card as I paid through a travel agent
review_text:
I had booked a flight with swiss air and today i am unsure if it was swiss air who changed my flight or the travel agent. 

Be warned my credit card company santander told me all bookings for flights with travel agents are classed as third party transactions and are not able to claim section 75 on credit cards. therefore I suggest everyone should at all costs not use travel agents as you have no insurance on your credit card. I paid a 20 pound fee on my credit card thinking I was covered if something happened such as the company going bust or canceling my flight. 

I also complained to swiss air and never received any responce regarding my changed flight. therefore they may have changed my flight or it could have been the travel agent but ethier way I can rate them a one star as they never responded to me.

title: Absolutely shocking customer service
review_text:
If I could give this company 0 stars I would. The way they have handled the current climate has been abysmal. I have had to deal with about 8 companies about cancelled events and every single one of them has been absolutely brilliant except for Swiss Air. 

I had a flight booked for 28th April, and I rang on March 28th to try and get an answer of what would be happening. I was told I had 3 options:
1) Cancel the flight myself and receive only ¬£50 refund per passenger, I explicitly told them this was not an option
2) Rebook using their new rebooking policy, again I told them this was n out an option and we cannot rebook within the available timeframe, not do we want to 
3) In his exact words ‚ÄòWait and see, we might cancel your flight ourselves‚Äô. I told him this process was disappointing but that would have to be our option. 

I am now due to fly tomorrow, and so I checked the website for flight information - There is no clear indication on any flights that have been cancelled. 
I have received no communications that my flight has been cancelled via email or otherwise.

I then rang the company‚Äôs U.K. call centre, only to be told that the flight is no longer running, but more than that, that I myself had requested a cancellation previous to the flight being cancelled by Swiss Air. 

As stated above this was not the case, the agent I spoke to would not give me details on which staff member made the cancellation so that I could have it looked into, he would not pass me to a manager so that I could try and resolve the situation, and was completely unhelpful. 

The company is trying to cut me out of my ¬£500 refund in any way possible, and I absolutely disgusted with the way it has been handled. 

I will never fly Swiss Air ever again, and I will do my absolute best to ensure that ANY person I know avoids this company too. 

I understand that these times are crazy for businesses, but ripping people off and fobbing off their questions and complaints in unacceptable.

title: Discriminatory company
review_text: People that work in this company are acting discriminatory and xenophobic  towards other nationalities. I would highly recommend to avoid this company. Some of their staff are extremely rude and they insult people by telling them that they are pigs.

title: Left in the dark.
review_text: Very little information. E-mail flight cancelled and underneath told to enjoy our flight. We could not find out if we were getting a flight at a later date so had no alternative but to try and find another flight. Still trying to get a refund but like many others we are totally ignored as all they hope is we will give up and go away. We are intending to keep pursuing them and will not give up.

title: Again top notch
review_text:
This flight was great again. Check-in quick and easy. Boarding was not top as the first door of the plane was closed so we had to enter another door and find our way through the plane to the first cabin. All else was top as usual. Super friendly cabin staff. Seat and bed super comfy. Food and champagne/wine very good. I enjoy having a face to face dinner with my travel companion as the the table is big enough for 2 and its possible to use the foot rest as a comfortable seat. The bed is very comfortable on swiss. Breakfast is always great with bircher muesli and swiss yoghurt. 
On time landing. Looking forward to the next flight on swiss.

title: Best Service
review_text: Evelyn time a Clean Plane, friendly and good Service.. just in time..i always fly with Swiss. I am very satisfied.

title: The last flight to Miami
review_text:
We were lucky to be able to catch the last flight to MIA. The U. S. ban on international flights would have made our trip as planned impossible.
The SWISS crew members were impressive. Their impeccable schooling, friendliness and capabilities were evident. 
Despite the Coronavirus situation, the atmosphere was generally relaxed. Only the boarding school teenies heading back home were a bit restless. We find that Business Class is normally much quieter.
We prefer SWISS and Edelweiss when we fly. We know that we will be safe,  comfortable and (too) well-fed!

title: Perfect at the times of crisis
review_text:
Perfect customer care during the time of COVID-19. We were flying from London to Nairobi and back in March 2020. Our flight to Nairobi was changed once by Swiss and was still perfectly well managed, our flight back from Nairobi was amended about 5 or 6 times, i.e. due to changes in the countries we were supposed to have transit in and at the end because Kenya was cancelling all international flights, we had to change a date to the earlier one. 
We have met a huge amount of people, whose airline companies cancelled their flights and after never picked up the phone, neither provided them with further help - we felt really lucky to have chosen Swiss. 
Thank you you to all the wonderful employees of the hot lines in London and in Nairobi - we felt really save working with you guys.
All the best and we will most definitely book our next flights with you!

title: Best experience so far!
review_text:
My return flight from Male to Zurich was  a very pleasant experience. Very nice customer service. Very-very tasty food and drinks onboard. Amazing dinner, main course, additional meal (traditional Swiss cuisine), dessert (some cake), also the tastiest ice-cream I've ever tried. Also tea, coffee and other drinks several times during the flight. And this was economy class!! Swiss people know how to make a customer happy!

Very comfortable seats. Also onboard entertainment, free earphones for passengers.

Departure and arrival in time. Thank you very much, my favorite airline now!

title: Swiss Flight from LHR
review_text: Excelent check in and very friendly staff. At the gate and boarding the aircraft. The aircraft used on this flight was a new Airbus A-220 offering a free3. Great in flight service offering complementary bottle of water. There was also a trolley where you could purchase other drinks and snacks. Complementary chocolate towards the end of the flight.

title: dumped in Tanzania
review_text:
Swiss diverted our flight to Nairobi Kenya to Dar es Salaam Tanzania because of an imaginary "security situation" on the ground in Nairobi; strange that other airlines continued to fly in and out of Nairobi and no trace of any security issues anywhere on the internet!  We then experienced a 12 hour stretch of misery in a nearly abandoned Tanzanian airport as about 150 passengers tried to rebook anything going to Nairobi through the one person working the transfer desk.  Swiss promised meals, drink, and hotel accommodations but only provided 1 x 500ml bottle of water per passenger; no sign of Swiss after we disembarked. Lost a day from our safari and experienced a lot of stress during an all night nightmare because somebody at Swiss operations had a chicken little moment.  Asked for compensation and were summarily dismissed with a "sorry for the inconvenience"
Avoid Swiss, when you get dumped in a difficult situation because of their bad decisions and you really really need their help they just walk away.

title: Customer care
review_text: The crew has shown attention, reactivity and has been responsive to my needs all the way long. The sits could be larger though.

title: Too bad there in no 0 rating. Worst airline ever
review_text:
If you have booking with this airline and emergency such as COVID-19 happens, all they care is their money , forget about getting refund, rebooking or any human service. The call agents that answer after 5h holding, talk like animals and drop call without trying to help. Each and every one of them was talking vulgar, aggressive and dropping the call in the middle of the conversation.

SWISS quality ? More like SWISS no quality.  Never again

title: Best way to travel to Switzerland
review_text: Swiss is the best way to travel to and from Switzerland. Hands down the best value for the money. Although not always the cheapest, you get what you pay for and then some. Service is excellent, courteous and very helpful. The staff is kind and makes sure you are comfortable during the long flight across the pond. The captains are well trained and the flight is smooth. Meals are tasty, even for airplane food quality. The entertainment is first grade and works without a hitch. Legroom is good and air quality is good too. Overall, a very pleasant experience and one worth for repeating.

title: Excellent
review_text: It was short distance flight. Staff was very friendly, helpful, tasty food and on time departed from both sides.

title: Attentive  Service, Comfort plus
review_text:
This was the  second  last leg of our around the world trip and commencing with the assisted service to the  Lounge  in  Paris  and the comfy hop to Zurich all went extremely smoothly and on time.

If you need wheelchair assistance please ask for it as it  makes long distance  travel so much easier and more comfortable.

title: Excellent air line company!
review_text: My flight was amazing. I sat next to a Swiss Pilot from Swiss Air and it was very nice. I learned about mountains, fly tricks, etc. Also we had free drinks and a snack. Landing was smooth as well as take off. Will definitely recommend!

title: Charge for check in luggage
review_text: I didn‚Äôt know that Swiss air charges $60  for each check in bag on an international flight.  This hardly makes sense.  Neither British airways nor American has such fees (on  the return flight, I flew on these airlines).  For this reason alone, I would not book on Swiss from now on.

title: Excellent help in exceptional time of trouble
review_text:
Skiing stopped in Davos and hotel closed with CoronaVirus. Was trying to get back home( Manchester) but my return ticket was for two days hence and remaining flight
today (Sunday) was fully booked. Envisaged sleeping in the Airport. Swiss staff very attentive and proactive. They managed to get me home via Frankfurt with Lufthansa at no extra cost and all this done within 4 hours. In fact arrived home before I would have done on the direct flight.   I am very grateful for their 5 star service

title: All good
review_text: It was fine. No issues. What was expected. Nice staff, good movies, the plane was a little hot which was surprising since most flights are freezing!

title: Hands Down The Best International Airline
review_text: What a flight! The long-haul didn't seem long at all with the treatment that Swissair gives you. Friendly and cute flight attendants, fantastic food and amazing in-flight entertainment.  I love all the perks that even economy gets, the service is impeccable and I will always recommend going with this incredible airline.

title: Best airline by far ever experienced
review_text:
In a "short" flight they were punctual and efficient.
Even if the flight was not longer than 2hours I was offered a swiss chocolate a little snack and a drink, of course for free.
I do fly often yearly and this is the best airline I have ever used.
Congratulations and looking forward to repeat soon.

Also the staff was attentive and friendly.

title: Always a pleasure to travel with Swiss airlines
review_text: Comfortable seats, very clean plane, professional crew and quite decent food for being airplane food. It's always very nice to travel with Swiss!

title: Flight from Zurich to Tokyo
review_text: Had a brill flight from Birmingham to Zurich.  Check in was good as well.  Paid extra (¬£80 each way) to have seat behind the bulkhead in economy.  Was really surprised that a third seat had been installed closest to the window.  It didn't look as wide as the other 2 seats (the armrest was only half a length) plus it had NO window.  I checked online having arrived in Tokyo and it did state that there was a window and no mention of the seat width.  I had a fairly large chap next to me and I ws huddled in the corner - Not great for a 11.5 hour flight.  I checked on the internet on the way back.  Saw their was a window but decided to have the aisle seat.  Wasn't surprised that there was no window when getting on board.

title: Very satisfied with Swiss service
review_text:
A long haul with the AB 340-600.
A long aircraft so very quiet and stability in the front.
Even if this is a old aircraft model I still prefer it over both the B777 and 787 of man different reasons mostly due to cabin configuration and other details.
The only competition for is the 350-900.
Seat 4A, a so call throne seat, that is the best in the BC cabin.
Clean fresh cabin that feelt modern and new even if not just refurbished.
Crew was very service minded and friendly.
Very few people in the cabin so lot ur attention from the crew.
Menu was all over good and more than enough of everything.
This is swiss service and quality at is best.
Strongly recomended and will use again.

title: Disappointing booking system
review_text: I booked a flight in November to Z√ºrich, my flight was due in February 2020, when I booked the flights I paid for allocated seats (row 9) as I don‚Äôt like to be randomly allocated, when boarding the plane they changed our seats and said ‚Äúdue to operational issues‚Äù we did complain and they said it wasn‚Äôt the same category, well I doubt row 23 it‚Äôs same category as row 9. No apologies, no customer support.

title: member of miles and mores, but not  this level
review_text: The flight was full, they were not able to open the boarding on time, (the airplane was ready), doublechecked all luggage. (it was too late to do so). We arrived also later. The service was not good.

title: Quick and Efficient
review_text: Geneva airport's a bit disappointing - few food outlets and VERY expensive but Swissair flight was smooth and efficient.

title: Relaxing flight before a fortnight of holidays
review_text: We had relaxing flights on our way to and from holidays in Abu Dhabi and Musandam. Ontime starts, with some minor delays at arrival, due to a detour avoiding flights over Iran. Perfect and friendly service on board.

title: Very nice long distance flight
review_text:
A very nice experience of my first flight towards Asia. No full occupancy, so I was sitting alone on a row of 3.
The service was excellent and food was tasty.
From check-in to boarding, everything went so smooth. Also experienced the new digital passport check and gates at Zurich Airport.
All in all this was my better ride on long distance.

title: We were offered drinks, a croissant and .... for a 2-hour flight!
review_text: That's a less than 2-hour flight. The service we received onboard the flight was just as good as any other long haul ones. Normally for such a short flight, people only get water. However, with Swiss Air, we were offered drinks, a croissant, plus a very delicious piece of Swiss chocolate! The food was not enough if you were hungry, but I liked the way how they were offering to us passengers, good service plus something "sweet"!

title: Flight attendant on SWISS need more training and better dinner ( not PANEER WRAP?)
review_text:
Indian  flight  attendants on swiss not willing to tell my chair occupant ahead to straighten the chair while am having a drink  
EVEN CALLED THE SUPERVISOR..WHO REFUSED TO HELP 

She tells me to talk to traveller DIRECT  or change my seat

WE ARE PROUDLY INDIANS AND CANNOT BE TREATED LIKE GARBAGE 

MY DINNER ? .
A PANNER WRAP 
WE ARRIVED LATER NIGHT 11 PM

title: Best Experience
review_text: One of the most unique plane journeys I‚Äôm been on (flying to zurich). The are one of the best airlines. It has that standard that can only ever be associated with Switzerland. From the minute it stepped on the plane I my exp of Switzerland started - generosity and kindness without the CHF

title: Flying as it used to be...
review_text: Excellent and very enjoyable flight from start to finish: clean airplane, skilled and always helpful flight attendants, wide array of services.

title: Long Layover in Geneva
review_text: On the first leg of the trip, ZRH to GVA, we flew on an Airbus A321.  On the second leg, GVA to LIS, we flew on a Bombardier CS300.  Enjoyed both flights and service.  However, for our connecting flight to Lisbon, we had a 5 1/2 hour layover in Geneva.  It was a long day but we enjoyed it.  The Geneva terminal was relaxing and comfortable and everyone spoke english.  The Lisbon terminal was easy to navigate and to our baggage carousel and had no problems finding a taxi to our hotel.  Again, everyone spoke English.

title: Good flight
review_text: Good service. Friendly crew made the flight comfortable. Plenty of space between the seats.  A small chocolate is also offered.

title: Nice flight
review_text: It was a nice day flight. Nothing special to be mentioned. Good food, I got lots of high alcohol drinks due to the Corona virus thread.

title: Much better than BA
review_text: We fly regularly to Geneva and finally gave up on BA due to the poor quality of their Business Class service.  We tried Swiss instead.  There is much more space between the seat rows, enough to read a magazine, the cabin crew are a cut above and the refreshments are better.  Paying business class passengers get proper priority on boarding instead of being lumped in together with large numbers of executive club members as happens with BA.

title: Good flight
review_text: It was a nice flight. No matter of that an improvement is needed in some directions - like food quantity, notification clarity and legroom.

title: I always feel welcome
review_text: A really good and friendly service. The complementary drink is always appreciated and, although very simple, the snack also. And you always are offered a small bar of chocolate :))

title: Would fly again
review_text: I wouldn‚Äôt hesitate to fly with SWISS air again. The aircraft was very clean and looked almost new. The food was really not bad compared to some airline food we have had in the past. Staff were approachable and were really helpful as our son has nut and sesame allergies and we‚Äôre really good with him. I suppose the only thing that I wish they had in the toilets were sanitary items which other airlines do provide (some would say take your own, but please tell my body that, sometimes you just get caught short!). Things like the quality of cutlery and blankets were high which is nice. I would so love to be able to afford first/business class it looks so lush. Oh yes drinks that came round were fabulous plenty of choice and a good serving too. Coffee was lovely too.

title: Sitting is cattle car
review_text: Flight Crew: excellent, food: excellent. Seating: like a sardine. If the person in front of you lowers their seat they are in your lap.  8  hours of seating discomfort.

title: Only sardines are more cramped
review_text:
This airline is typical Swiss. Everything is bureaucratic. You can not check in like with other airlines, code and name. No, you need ticket number too; the sign indicated terminal 2, but had to check in in terminal 1. Nothing seems to be logical. 
We were travelling with a big group; had to do group check in; could not do online. No chance to upgrade. The seats were the most uncomfortable, cramped seats I have ever experienced. The staff was friendly and helpful, the food not worse than on other airlines. The movie selection was very limited.

title: Even better than the last time!!
review_text: My husband and I took this flight on 2 March 2020. What an AMAZING crew.  So happy, sweet, friendly and accommodating. Freddy and Malia are the best! Probably the best flight we've ever taken, and I doubt another will surpass. Not to mention all the standard loveliness of Swiss Business (which was on-point, as usual).  But the crew was what really made this flight unforgettable.

title: SWISS AIR HORROR
review_text:
We had our boarding passes in hand issued by Airline Attendant ( 6 of us ) to then be told our flight was just cancelled and we would be flown to JFK Airport instead. 15 hours later we arrived in Newark!!! 
Last Flight Ever on this airline

title: Mr A O Rijnen
review_text: On time, friendly and good service and a smooth flight. Just what you need when experiencing a white Christmas in Switzerland

title: Better than BA but still not ideal
review_text: Swiss flight for skiing trip, all good overall nice and punctual, lounge (Lufthansa) was very nice but a few things could be better. Cabin crew were very slow to serve breakfast and fumbled with the trays and trolley - you knew you could do a better job yourself!!  What training do they get? And the worse thing was there was no airbridge on arrival - so onto a bus to the terminal which is so frustrating. Surely LHR is one of the prime routes to ZRH so why do Swiss not get the right gate allocated?

title: One of my preferred crew
review_text:
I love this airline. The crew is so friendly with customers. They speak with you in different languages, they call you by your name, they always take care of you. Wathever the flight, the crew is friendly. They can be German or French native speakers, they really do the job with passion. 

I will come back SWISS Airlines because you find here a real service. You know that you spend money for something.

title: Good value vs service
review_text:
The advantage of the A340 2-4-2 seating when you are a couple is my wife takes the window and I have the aisle. Seat width is very narrow, however, and legroom is limited for over 6'. Can feel cramped nearing the end of a ten-hour flight. Friendly, efficient service. Above-average meals (vs BA). We were offered water during the whole flight (night flight). Good entertainment screens - but the sound is terrible (especially with the loud engine sound). The aeroplane was clean, and typical of Swiss (I think) took-off 15 minutes late but landed spot-on time!
Zurich airport is modern and very clean although expensive for non-Swiss (even more so than other airports).
Overall a good experience!

title: Feeling at home!
review_text:
The multilingual crew makes you feel as a guest in their home rather than just a passenger.
Food is very tasty and choice of wines very good.
Seats are also very comfortable and the extra large monitor makes watching a movie a pleasure.
All in all best first class in European carriers. Highly recommended!

title: Its like coming home
review_text:
Flying with Swiss is always an experience of fine travelling.
It starts with arriving at the airport and from there you are feeling welcomed from check in through passport control and security.
After that the lounge remind you more of a luxury hotel than an airport.
The aircraft was visible clean and the stewardesses and stewards as well as the captain were friendly and competent.
The flight itself including food and beverages gave me nothing to criticise even if I would try hard.
Swiss for sure is going to see me again

title: They only allow 23kg baggage or else you have to pay for anything Extra
review_text: I had to pay 400 Swiss Francs for my Extra luggage. Not anymore! We were supposed to fly from Nairobi to Z√ºrich on the first March and to my Surprise the flight was cancelled and were were booked in a hotel nearby we had to stay Extra one day in Nairobi. I paid for my luggage two times in Nairobi.

title: Excellent flights
review_text:
Excellent flight service. Flights comfortable and on time.  Staff pleasant and helpful.

On board service swift and good.  

No complaints, will definitely choose to fly with Swiss Air again.

title: Class act
review_text: The seats were comfortable, however if the person in front of you were to lean back, their seat back is very close to your face. Since I didn't have that occurrence, it wasn't  problem for me. The entertainment was decent, the food was very good and the personnel were extremely professional, multilingual, polite and very attentive. I would definitely fly Swiss again.

title: Swiss
review_text:
I often travel with Swiss. Always on time, clean and customer services oriented. Never had an issue with them. The best by far. 
I also appreciate the Swiss Chocolate we get on board :p

title: the indian route
review_text:
This route is quite a long journey. and I did it both ways. The type of airliner operated  by SWISS split the business class in two parts which, when travelling with friends is not pleasant.
Beside this the food was OK but not exceptional. The crew was excellent and helpful.
On the way back, I must point out a great desapointment on the Loung. Difficlt to find and not welcoming at all. This should taking of by Swiss.

title: A very good flight to Montreal on Swiss
review_text: We flew back to Montreal after a ski vacation in Zermatt. The standard maintained by Swiss is always commendable as it was on this flight. The meal that I chose was below average but I did not mind.

title: Good but not Great
review_text:
Flew out on Lufthansa and back on Swiss to good to compare.  LH was overall a better seat that was more comfortable and better service.  
Serivce on Swiss was good but not very attentive and not overly welcoming or prompt.  Sleeping quality on the LH 747 in business is better.  
Nothing horrible on Swiss but in future I would go with Lufthansa for my Europe flights when possible.

title: Comfortable flight
review_text: We flew from Boston to Zurich on a red-eye flight. We had opted for a roomier seat in economy. We had lots of legroom and the seat was comfortable. The flight attendants were helpful  and friendly, food was tasty and came with a complimentary alcoholic drink of your choice. Flight arrived on time  which was great as we had only an hour to make our connecting flight to Florence.

title: Customer focus
review_text: Great service, customer focus, friendly focussed staff, great meals - all in all a very very good experience

title: Turn around
review_text: The fly was just over 1 hour with a sandwich and drink service. In London was very windy and being the runway at LCY airport pretty short we expirienced a turn around... with another beautifull view of the city.

title: Cramped seats lackluster service
review_text:
We had traveled from Melbourne to Singapore on SQ228 to catch this flight to Zurich with Swiss airlines. The seats were cramped. More space on the short flight from Zurich to Valencia than this long haul 13 hour flight. 

The service was only just ok nothing to praise them about. 
One of flight attendants slipped food on me. 
I was given wipes to clean my clothes. And Pajamas from first class. I had no other clothes with me for rest of my journey. 

Disappointed in my experience.

title: Comfortable
review_text: Comfortable seat with built-in massage possibilities. You can also stretch the seat to a flat bed. Good choice of dining and fine wines. Very friendly staff.

title: A few small things need fixing
review_text:
A 12 hour flight so you notice the little things
Food trays and rubbish not cleared for an extended period. Normally a sign of inadequate staffing levels.
Headphones provided were poor quality. Couldn‚Äôt here movie dialogue over the engine noise.
Hand refresher towels were cold. Some airlines provide them hot.
Staff did an excellent job keeping toilets clean but need to use disinfectant given current Coronavirus outbreak.

title: European Vacation with the Family
review_text: We travelled to Europe starting in Melbourne (using another Airline) but then hooked up with Swiss Air to continue our journey from Singapore via Zurich to our final destination of Venice.  The flights although long were fantastic.  The staff couldn't have been more lovely..the food fantastic...inflight movies etc great.   I would highly recommend this airline for travel into and around Europe.  We used Swiss Air again to fly out of Europe from Venice via Zurich to New York...again a fantastic experience.

title: Bad Weather/Rerouted/Handled it well
review_text: Our ski trip to Geneva was rerouted to Zurich due to bad weather in Geneva.  Swiss Air had representatives ready at baggage area with train passes (along with food vouchers for $20) for us to get back to Geneva.  Our skis didn't make it to Zurich on time but Swiss Air tracked everything and made sure it was delivered to our hotel.  They kept me updated with e-mails to advise me where our skis were in transit.  I think overall they handled the situation very well even though they couldn't control the weather.

title: awful, my flight got cancelled and did not refund me. Every single person in Swiss gives me different information
review_text: awful, my flight got cancelled and did not refund me. Every single person in Swiss gives me different information

title: luggage delay
review_text: Our luggage was not transfered to the Zurich-Cancun flight and arrived to our hotel 3 days later. It was an awful start of our dream holiday.

title: Great as your ski's go free
review_text: Ok, so its been a while since  flew swiss and ive forgotten how good it is. Your skis go free which is a big plus given that many airlines gouge you on ski transportation. The service is simple and straighforward. and they still have the chocolate at the end of the flight. We flew from london city which is just great as its small and fast.

title: Delayed
review_text:
Flight from Manchester to Zurich left late. 
I landed in Zurich meant to be catching my next flight to Johannesburg - the ground staff told me I had missed my flight. It was 10:30pm at night and there wasn't another flight that night. Wasn't impressed with the help once I was in Zurich (maybe not swiss air's fault at that poin They put me up in a hotel-totally unimpressed with the way it was all handled with very little understanding.  
I tried to get compensation from them as my flight was WELL over a 4 hr delay,but nothing. They just said they would refund me any extra costs in Zurich. I did it through a company and in 2 minutes I had the money. 
Shame, thought Swiss Air had a good name. My experience wasn't a good one. And to be honest it has put me off flying with them again. On a positive note it was amazing to see the city of Zurich though! So if you're chilled with missing flights then this could be the airline for you!

title: Good quality
review_text: Good service & friendly staff. Comfort & good space. Have private & you can sleep like home. Enjoy every moment of it.

title: Excellent Crew
review_text: Efficient and friendly check in. Great lounges, both the one in Terminal A and the one in Terminal E. The crew on board was excellent, extremely friendly and attentive, always client oriented and charming. The food was very good as well as the wine. Really a good experience from the beginning to the end - I wish it was always that good!

title: GOOD AIRLINE
review_text:
I am a travel agent and I was with a group for a tour. The flight was punctual and the on-board staff very professional and helpful but the dinner with pasta was bad and I was very bad with intestine but it was a sporadic case but overall the airline was one of the best in terms of comfortable planes, modern and silent and very professional and helpful crew
I will recommend this airline to everyone for intercontinental flights

title: Transatlantic flight on SWISS, to Europe and back.
review_text: Excellent service, food and drinks; quick boarding, and easy exiting from the plane; very attentive and courteous flight attendants. My luggage came out among the first. A very enjoyable experience indeed.

title: Four stars
review_text: Flying Business Class is a wonderful experience especially when the travel is long and complicated.  Our layover was not great but having the opportunity to relax and shower in between flights was very refreshing.  The lounge in Amsterdam is very big and not the most comfortable.  Spaces are not isolated to provide a little privacy like some of the other airline lounges.  Otherwise, the service was attentive and the food was just OK.

title: Be prepared to run!
review_text: Transit time is too short 40-50 mins. Leaving Heathrow 30 mins late didn‚Äôt help. We are elderly and couldn‚Äôt run and anyway you have to catch a train so wait a few minutes for that. We just made both transits but our luggage didn‚Äôt on our return. It was very stressful. Otherwise the flight service was fine.

title: Made of Switzerland
review_text:
Although our final destination was Dubai, I wanted to share my thoughts on what was one of the most pleasant flights from Miami to Zurich. First time flying Swiss and decided to give it a try as it's a Star Alliance member; miles accrual matters!
The aircraft was a modern Boeing 777 - there's 2flights to ZRH out of MIA and one of them flies and older Boeing version. Planes were well kept and customer service was outstanding. Flight crew was very cordial, accommodating and all smiles. Complimentary meals, snacks & refreshments met (and slightly exceeded) expectations. Entertainment system was OK- there was quite a good selection of movies, however, me being a movie buff, I had seen almost all of them. I would definitely fly Swiss again!

title: Not family friendly
review_text:
If traveling with families and infant please avoid this airline. They charge parents if they want to book basinet for the baby, and in some other cases gives priority to sell those seats for a fee (for the extra legroom rather than infant comfort). The flight was late going out of LHR, while the help of Heatrow staff was good, there was no help in Zurich. We had a baby stroller and it wasn't delivered back at the aircraft gate, then there was nobody to ask for help, with little time for the connection because of the previous lateness we rushed with the baby on hands thru the airport. In Zurich for our next flight was already boarding and there was no help for families with children. The stroller failed again to be delivered at the gate in Tokyo-Narita, we had to carry baby on our hands thru whole airport again, finally stroller was delivered in the baggage belt. Confusion was evident with staff about baby car seat approved for aircraft use, while the flight attendant in London to Zurich approach was correct and we clarify, attendants in flight from Zurich to Narita was rude and was asking us to remove the seat where my baby is most secure because front passenger cannot recline, finally manager clarify and let us carry with the use of the baby seat. Swiss is not baby and family friendly airline.

While the A321 from London was a fairly new and nice aircraft, the 777 to Tokyo was a bit old but clean.

The call center is also disappointed, while I tried to book a basinet calling to London they claim it was not posible because all was used, surprise it was my baby the only one on flight, just they sold those seats. For the return flight I have also tried to book and they requested me 230 Swiss francs, when I asked to explain the charges I just stopped hearing the guy on the other end while still can hear some background conversation, waited for 5min saying hello hello and hanged up.

title: Great Flight
review_text: Superb service, comfortable seating, great food, flight on time, an executive minbus for business class passengers only transfered us to the terminal as we were not on an airbridge.

title: Perfect flight Miami-Zurich
review_text: That was my first trip through the Atlantic Ocean and I was a bit scared before,but the flight was excellent. I just checked the movies and I was enjoying my time sleeping afterwards. The staff is very polite,the service was high quality,so I definitely recommend this company to fly with!

title: First Class Quality Airline
review_text:
I've flown Swiss between LHR and ZUR many times over the past 18 months and have never been disappointed.
Lots of leg room, complimentary food and drink and first class service from a happy and friendly cabin crew, everything that BA is not and can no longer provide IMHO.

Would not hesitate to use again and is far superior to certain other companies that operate out of London Heathrow

title: Great Service, Great Flight---BUT...
review_text: Great service, great flight...but. The "But" is that we each paid $200 more per seat (there were 4 of us) to have extra legroom seats. However, someone from first class/business class were bumped... and they put them in our seats. Broke up our group and we lost the $200. Very unacceptable. I would rate lower, but the flight attendants did all that they could. My problem is with SwissAir as a company.

title: Like flying used to be
review_text:
From the moment you step on the plane, you are treated like an honoured guest.
The courteousness of the stewards/stewardesses is unbelievable in this day and age.
The standard of food and drink is akin to dining at a first class restaurant.
Please keep up the good work SWISS. I live in England but fly Swiss, even though it means changing planes.

title: Excellent
review_text: I am a travel agent. I was with a group on this flight to Miami. Everything was excellent. The economy class cabin was very clean, the food good and the crew on board very polite, professional and helpful. I was favorably impressed with this: the on-board staff came many times and offered many snacks. I recommend this airline to everyone

title: Superb company and service
review_text: Really did enjoy my flight; check in very efficient, staff very friendly. Despite economy i never felt unattended; food was excellent, snacks with fruits available and very clean toilets; only movies selection could be improved. Seats are very confortable and would recommend row 39 or first row after business.

title: LIKE A PRIVATE CLUB
review_text: Swiss uses the Thai first class lounge which has semiprivate rooms and excellent service. There is a very limited buffet yet an extensive a la carte menu. Not being a thai cuisine specialist, its difficult to decide‚Ä¶maybe a larger buffet would help. At the appointed time a special private escort came to pick us up and deliver us to the aircraft which was already fully loaded with its other passengers. Swiss offers only eight seats which are very comfortable and ample. Enormous TV screen. Service is top notch with very agreeable and friendly staff. Two toilets, one of which was especially spacious. Cuisine has a Swiss touch and all of what was served was delicious. All in all, a great flight which ranks among the top of my extensive prior first class experiences.

title: Be careful of seat reservations
review_text: Me and my fianc√© booked trip to Dominican Republic via flight to Z√ºrich airplane are good but we paid and reserved seats on both flights there and back as we checked in 24hrs before leaving we found out they changed one of our seats and no longer sitting together and on top of it all they won‚Äôt refund cost be wary people as is a con and very unacceptable will not use this airline again

title: Very acceptable considering the circumstances
review_text: Very strange circumstances with flight made in the Coronavirus problem. FA‚Äôs  wore masks thus making communication difficult. The flight was very quiet but we still enoyed the food on board. IFE was good and the seats, not as good as some airlines, but certainly comfortable,

title: Poor customer service
review_text:
I got to the SF airport on Jan 14th from Zurich and I was informed that my luggage has not been here yet and they will send it to me. after two days they dropped the luggage at my house but one of the suitcases was damaged and had lost one of the wheels. I followed their instruction on the website and submit all the doc necessary to get compensation for the damaged bag but instead, I received the email saying that:
.... I understand your disappointment and apologize on behalf of SWISS and its cooperation partners for the inconvenience you had as a result.
Please have your baggage repaired in the shop of your choice and send me the repair bill.

Should your baggage be beyond repair, please have this confirmed in writing by the shop. This confirmation should state its purchase date and price. Based on this information, we will proceed with the reimbursement of its actual value, i.e. apply a depreciation of 10% per year. 

...
to be honest, I don't mind to repair the luggage but literally I am looking for a place to repair it and found one in next town, 40 min drive, and since one of the wheels is totally missing I need to contact the company that made the luggage (located in Italy), they send me the wheel, take it to the repair shop next town to fix it! and send them the price of the repair. it is not fair and it is so irresponsible of the airline to do so with the customer. 

best,
Maryam

title: Pleasant experience on flight LX177
review_text:
Overall I had a pleasant experience on a Swiss Boeing 777-300ER). I had a single ‚Äúthrone‚Äù window seat (16A), usually at extra cost but I was lucky as it was available during the online check-in process.

The flight attendant forgot the pre-departure drink but after reminding her she came with a glass of champagne shortly after take-off.

The seat was very comfortable and food tasted good. I think Swiss could put more efforts in the presentation of food and I missed a separate cheese plate as dessert option after dinner (both as the middle eastern and premium asian airlines do).

Note: Swiss does not offer bedding (cover on the seat for sleeping), pajamas or slippers on their business class flights.

title: Excellent Airline
review_text: In my opinion one of the best service airlines that exists, staff are fantastic. Aircraft are in very good condition and the food and entertainment are excellent.

title: Very unhelpful with chikdren
review_text: Let all the business people in with hand luggage and then because we have 6 children try and take all ours off us despite there being iPads and medicine (especially as my son has a peanut allergy). Woman on desk very pompous. Next year we won‚Äôt go to Switzerland and we were even looking to fly to Australia via Zurich like we did last year but won‚Äôt. I paid for 8 people to fly but was made to feel 2nd class.

title: Gave refund then changed their minds
review_text: Terrible customer service. Arrange a refund and when you contact them to confirm when it will be processed they change their minds even though the flights are going to Hong Kong in the midst of the virus out break. Profit before passenger safety.

title: FULL FLIGHTS BUT GOOD SERVICE AT COMPETITIVE RATES
review_text: Over the years from Swissair to Swiss Air, the tradition of helvetic cleanliness and service prevailed and it continues. The flights are often very to full full, due to their competitive fares, but the cabin crew delivers service which is good. They are not the fastest, nor the most friendly, but overall they are consistently good. The aircraft on many routes like the JNB long haul is still the ancient A340's and so one hopes that the maintenance is done with the Swiss watch maker precision! Zurich is a very comfortable airport to arrive into Europe or connect.

title: Good cabin service, punctual but not commercial
review_text: Amazing lack of business acumen to blame ( in part) for declining results of Lufthansa group.? Whereas service on board and punctuality are what yo expect from a Swiss company, the commercial attitude of the airline is shocking. Where other airlines try to lure you with special offers for upgrades if business or first class have empty seats, Swiss when called the morning of my flight said business class was full.,when I boarded and wanted to join my friends in a business class with a number of empty seats I asked for a quote for an upgrade and got Sfr 1600 as an answer, which incidentally was more than one of my friends paid for a full business class round trip. Needless to say I stayed in Cattle class.

title: Dismissive of people with disabiliyies
review_text: Ground staff were so dismissive of my disability, being blind.  Unlikely I‚Äôd travel with this airline again given they need some training...

title: The fastest connection from Johannesburg (South Africa) to Wroclaw (Poland)
review_text:
This is my favourite connection between Johannesburg and Wroclaw. Used this airline  on the same route quite a few times and it was always on time. 
The original booking document quoted 2x check-in bags, online check-in only stated 1 suitcase, however the super friendly lady in Johannesburg allowed checking second suitcase.
Definitely will use this airline again.

title: Late...always very late & unpleasant ((
review_text: An expensive low cost airline with extremely disappointing performance and service. Almost 3 hours late, with very misleading information about the real delay expectations.  ((

title: SWISS air makes the venezuelan government seem organised
review_text: Titel explains it all + apparently their pilots cannot land when there is some sign of some light breezes.

title: Swiss air...what it promises versus what you get
review_text:
Swiss Air
(What it promises versus what you get)

I wanted to visit a good friend in Thailand this February (2020). Getting there by air means a non-stop flight of around 12/13 hours from the UK, or, as often advertised, by one of the major Middle Eastern airlines, with an average 3 hour transit. Both have advantages and disadvantages...the non-stop carriers are far more expensive but somewhat less tiring, while the one-stoppers pattern is about 6 hours to first stop and the disembarkation, followed by the transit time, the re-boarding of aircraft number two and another 6 plus hours to Bangkok.

In my mid eighties and disabled, doing either in an economy seat would not be possible, so my only alternative was to save-up my pennies, live more frugally for 9 months, search for an airline which could both lessen the overall flight times, with a minimal transit and offer a business class ticket at a competitive price.

My searches and recommendations from travel agencies, was to consider Swiss Air, because it had flights from London to Zurich in 1hr 45 minutes, then less than 2 hour transit onto aircraft number two, then non-stop from Zurich to Bangkok. The price was competitive...not the cheapest...but just within my planned budget.

So, booked the flights for all four legs in Business Class, selected aisle seats because of my walking problem, arranged for Special Assistance (wheelchair) throughout and paid in full.

Fast forward now to departure day...11th February 2020.

After a 3 hour car journey to Heathrow Terminal 2, check-in went smoothly. I asked if the flight was on time...the answer was ‚ÄúAs far as we know.‚Äù On reflection, I did think that was rather an odd response.

Anyway, wheelchair to the Lufthansa Lounge. Nice, spacious and relaxing with enough variety of food and drink to satisfy most appetites. Flight was due to take off at 13.45 hrs, so I had plenty of time to sit and read. Boarding was due to take place at 13.10hrs. When that time came ‚Äì and went ‚Äì I enquired at the desk. ‚ÄúOh, the plane hasn't even landed yet, the information board will keep you updated.‚Äù It did...to a point!

Many a disgruntled passenger was overheard as to what was going on. Eventually, boarding was announced at around 14.25hrs and the rush to the gate began (me being in a wheelchair). Boarding passes checked and passengers sent down the ramp to the aircraft's door. What then? OOPS!!! door barred because cleaning staff were still trying to make the plane ready for its new passengers. They failed. The plane's cleanliness was far from satisfactory.

After boarding and door closed, the Captain made an announcement to the effect of 'we should not worry, because there was a 250kph tail wind, which would get us to Zurich in good time for our varying flight connections.' What a forecast that turned out to be. More about that soon.

Surprise, surprise, there was NO Business Class cabin in this A320, only row upon row of triple economy seats without entertainment screens, virtually no seat adjustment...and...to make matters really bad for me...all aisle seats were taken, so I had to squeeze across to take a window seat. This so-called Business Class area was separated from the rear of the aircraft by a fabric curtain. Is this what I had paid for and been suckered into by false advertising as to the WONDERFULL Swiss Air Business Class offering?

The cabin crew acted in what I would say 'in a robotic fashion'...certainly their body language demonstrated that fact. For us, it was a case of grin and bear it.

On nearing Zurich it was certainly obvious to me (an ex Private Pilot), that our aircraft was merely circling in a holding pattern. So, folk, guess what? Round and round ‚Äì and round ‚Äì and round for over 30 minutes.

A screen attached to the ceiling sprang into life warning passengers that the new estimated landing time would mean many connecting flights would be missed. THEY WERE. Of course by the very fact that I am writing this, proves that we did land.

As to my onward flight to Bangkok...it was from another terminal. My wheelchair pusher was great (thank you man) and rushed me off the plane, along the corridors, onto the electric train and to the boarding gate. I was the LAST passenger to reach there and boarded only because that aircraft's departure time had been delayed by 10 minutes.

Talk about stress! Had my luggage been off loaded and reloaded? Another worrying factor but one over which I had no control.

To sum up Swiss Air's product from Heathrow to Zurich, was more like a script from a Fred Carno silent movie.

Now to the flight from Zurich to Bangkok.

The aircraft was a Boeing 777. It DID have a separate Business Class Cabin, with the accoutrements expected. A very good entertainment system, good quality and nicely served food and plenty of storage space around the seat. That itself, however, was a disappointment. Although a press button control system allow it to be positioned in many formats, the padding was well worn and uncomfortable to the point one's posterior was constantly aware of the metal structure beneath it.

The overall cabin design, I would say was hard edged, boxy with lighting not conducive to total relaxation or attempted sleep. When compared to the likes of the product such airlines as Emirates, Etihad, Thai and Qatar offer, Swiss Air pales into insignificance. The cabin staff worked as efficiently as they could but were certainly hampered by the lack of numbers. An example of this was. that there was some 30 minutes wait between the serving of appetisers to the main course and a similar wait to the sipping of a coffee or a liqueur.

The above is the account of my first two flights. True to say, I was relieved to reach my hotel in Bangkok. 

MY RETURN TURNED OUT TO BE VERY DIFFERENT STORY.

*

Four days later, after arriving at my friend's retreat, I, suddenly and in his presence, suffered a severe pain in my upper left chest. Unfortunately my location was over a 100 miles from the nearest Bangkok hospital. He, and other persons present, strongly advised me to cut my planned 21 day visit short and get my flight changed to the next day. It was a no brainer. My own common sense and logic shouted that such a decision was right.

My friend immediately phoned Swiss Air in Bangkok, who confirmed my credentials and booking references, also stating that space was available for the two flights back to the UK the next day. However, they stated, even such a simple administration alteration would have to be made through the travel agent with whom I had made the booking. Such was agreed.

My friend then contacted that agency, Business Class International and explained the emergency and requested the change of return date to the next day.

That agency's response almost caused the owner of the retreat to throw-up in anger. It was...Yes we can do that but the client will have to pay us UP FRONT, the fee to do so. It will be... ¬£1145.00.
Yes folk, that was the figure demanded. There was NO words of sympathy, no understanding. It was a case of pay NOW or don't fly.

Having no alternative, I paid. That means that Swiss Air have now charged me the full price EXTRA for a single leg when I had already paid for BOTH legs.

Is this a perfect example of Corporate Greed at it's very worst?

I won't say too much about the return flights, except that the final leg from Zurich to Heathrow saw me once again cramped into an economy seat when I had paid for Business Class. 

Finally, I want to say that this true account is meant to advise any UK passenger thinking of using Swiss Air to be very, very careful not to be misled by incorrect and glowing advertisements of its products.

title: Don't book with Swiss.  Instead choose the alliance partners such as United etc.
review_text: Swiss is a very expensive, inflexible, stingy, and unfriendly firm when it comes to customer service.  What a difference to US air lines when it comes to attitudes.  DON'T BOOK with them; you will pay a 20-35% premium for the same flights offered by their alliance partners!!!  Their customer service people (based in Fiji) are human robots, treat you like machines, and horrible to deal with.

title: Quality and Value
review_text: London to Zurich is just economy seating but with the centre seat vacant. The 777 leg to Singapore is 2-2-2 seating which is probably a little rare these days, however we found the seats to be comfortable, service efficient and food good, IFE isn't great be OK. Overall a good product for the price.

title: Avoid them .. unprofessional
review_text: Such an inhumane experience and incompetent staff ..
