I have had to deal with the most unprofessional crew and problem handlers.. my ETA was delayed by 18 hours and not even an apology.. the detour their unprofessional untrained pilot took was extremely unnecessary and all passengers were abandoned in a city we knew nothing of .. it‚Äôs such a shame that I have overpaid for a ticket with that horrible airline when I could have used a more professional service and paid way less.. avoid booking with them at all cost .. even if you have to take a train , otherwise expect a complete disappointment

title: Smart, classy.
review_text: Clean cabin, really good legroom and great entertainment system on the new planes. Food actually tasty!

title: Swiss is Sweet
review_text: Excellent service on board with free drinks and chocolates. More leg room than American flights. On time and comfortable. Bring a good head set for movies, and you‚Äôll be there in no time.

title: SWISS AIR
review_text: Excellent customer service by the Flight Attendants. They were always asking if you needed anything whether you're sitting in economy, business or first class.

title: enough space, friendly staff
review_text: Friendly staff. Enough space and leg space. Nice entertainent on board. Food is better then many other airlines.

title: Upgrade if you can
review_text: The business class seats are nice and recline all the way for a proper deep sleep. However, in line with the European method of stacking people one on top of another, the business cabin felt cramped as the airline tried to get the most bang for the buck. The first class cabins are incredible and looked much more roomy. The service was great and friendly. For the long flight I would have preferred a roomier flight as found with some of the other airlines I‚Äôve traveled on this route. Nonetheless, it‚Äôs a good direct flight that arrives early morning in time for the work day to continue.

title: Overall good company
review_text: Overall nice company. Punctual,  clean and elegant. Aircraft seemed to be safe the crew was pleasant. The price was awesome. Overall 5 stars.

title: Horrible Customer Service
review_text: The worst customer service....literally the worst.  Rude, arrogant, and the woman I spoke with "Jockey" went out of her way to be horrible.  I thought United was the worst airline but Swiss takes it to another level.  I fly to Zurich quite a bit so this is especially annoying.

title: Friendly staff, modern plane and more room
review_text: It just seemed more relaxed flying with Swiss compared to other carriers, particularly those in the budget range.

title: Mediocre business class experience
review_text:
The seats in business class look kind of outdated. Creaky and a little narrow. Not much privacy so if you are traveling alone try to pick a seat by itself. Screen wasn't properly calibrated and was frustrating to use. Tray table design is odd; just getting it out is a challenge. 

Food was decent, nothing to write home about. 

About an hour into the flight I noticed that the recliner function wasn't working properly. I couldn't use it as a result which was an inconvenience. 

To the credit of the staff, the service was great. They tried for a while to fix the seat but apologized profusely when they couldn't. They later offered to change my seat and also gave me a compensation voucher of 10k miles or 300 CHF (still not sure how much this will yield me) along with a delicious chocolate bar. 

I think it comes down to an outdated aircraft and the limitations that come with it. Overall I would recommend Swiss Airs business class but not as a first option for sure.

title: Great enjoyable service
review_text:
The service complete from check in; the lounge and indeed on the aircraft was enjoyable. The meal was excellent and timely

Well done

title: Very impressed
review_text:
First time flying with SWISS and would certainly use them again. Flights were on time and stress-free. They also have a very generous cabin baggage allowance. Aircraft clean and comfortable with plenty of legroom for the 90-minute flight to Zurich and then 55 minutes to Prague. Free drinks and snacks complemented the experience. Cabin crew friendly, efficient and professional.
Well done SWISS!

title: Damaged Luggage, Unattentive service, Good Seat
review_text:
Luggage broke in one wheel and a big dent on the identification tag on the luggage.  I find that they just throw the luggage around.

The service wasn't top standard as well.
I asked to clarify what time is breakfast and the steward just says, "I'll get back to you." Without getting back to me after he finished his drink serving.

Pressed the steward attention button a few times just to get a glass of water and they just ignored totally.

Service quality for business class is bad.

The only good thing about business class is only the physical seat itself which is much more personal.

title: If its their fault its none of their business :)
review_text:
Lost Luggage,  0 help, 0 compensation, 0 update for days. 
Easyjet = Swiss same on long haul 
from now on cheaper price > short flight pick

title: Best customer service!
review_text: I was having issues logging into the Swiss Airlines app to view my information. So I called Swiss Airlines expecting to be on hold for a long time. With in 30 seconds a live person answered and walked me through what I was doing wrong. They were so polite and patient. I would like to note the airline is reasonably priced!!!

title: GREAT Service
review_text:
WOW!!!!  Fantastic service, attention to detail is 2nd to none. The staff was absolutely amazing. Took GREAT care of all of my needs from Start to Finish, will definitely fly Swiss Air again
Customer for life
John S

title: Great airline
review_text: Great airline both flights on time comfortable seats plenty of legroom great staff would definitely recommend to anyone

title: Good Swiss Service
review_text:
Nice to fly even cattle class was roomy enough and crew happy enough 
Quick and easy boarding
Zurich airport really civilised 
On time and not too expensive

title: Bangkok to Zurich in Business Class
review_text: The business class seats on the Boeing 777 aircraft are among the most comfortable in the air. Storage space around the seat area is a little limited. The staff on our flight were attentive throughout the flight.

title: Nice flight
review_text: We took this airline from Rome to New York and the service was definitely top shelf. The stewardess were kind courteous and very helpful meals were timely as it was a 9 hour flight. Blankets and pillows were provided. In flight entertainment was provided at each seat and the seats were spacious.

title: ZRH BOM Flight
review_text: This was also B777 plane ride lasting more than 8 hrs and the seats were comfortable and the service crew was nice and friendly.  We started with champaign and light snack and after take off the usual meal with multiple choices including Indian vegetarian option.  On flight snacks were available tor rest of the flight which took off and landed in time, even though connecting gate took longtime to attach.  Entertainment in multiple cultural format was available including Hindi movies.

title: JFK to GVA in January
review_text: Large, comfortable seats, excellent service, and great (by airline standards) food. We flew in a large Airbus capable of holding almost 300 passengers. There were 48 passengers total on board. According to the purser, this is normal for this time of year and beginning in February the passenger count rises. Still, we were able to leave 30 minutes early. All good

title: Reliable, friendly, and on time.
review_text: Have flown with this airline on a number of occasions always been met by friendly helpfull staff, at check in,and cabin staff. Always made to feel welcome and comfortable. What's more they get you to your destination on time.

title: Swiss Airline is the worst airline
review_text:
The boarding is incredibly slow and the queue is long even though it's almost time for departure. And before me was a family of 4-5, and they were taking so incredibly slow. The other counter was free and there were tons of other staffs with nothing to do. Instead of checking me, they let me waited for that family. Then they were slowly tagging extra bags, slowly charging fee, etc, etc. The worst part was that when it's my turn, I gave them my passport and flight ticket and it was super fast, but right when I'm about to go through that escalator. An old senior staff stopped me and said to check my bag weight. That fine. I put it on the machine and it's fine. And just when I'm about to take the escalator. Then, she wanted to check the size of my bag. That's fine. I put it in the frame. It fits. Then, she suddenly said we have to check it in, because it doesn't slide into the frame, blah blah blah. First of all, I've never heard of the rule of "sliding into the frame". If it fits, it fits. Then I politely take out my huge jacket inside my bag and wear it. And she's like "You might as well as take out every nickel and dime", "I'm still going to check in your bag!". Even though after taking out my jacket, I can "slide" it into the frame. And she's all like  "I'm still going to check in your bag!",  "I'm still going to check in your bag!",  "I'm still going to check in your bag!". I have never seen anyone so hell bent on checking in a bag that fits the size with such a bad attitude as well. If it fits, it fits, okay? I was a little at awe with the situation and she's all like "Don't give me that face! I can still check in ur bag!" Even though, she's the one with the bad attitude.

I will never take this airline again. I would rather pay for an expensive one.

title: Perfection
review_text: Smooth, punctual and nice staff. I would improve catering snack. Staff ok. A321 very comfy and silent. Boarding ok. Seat ok. Really a nice flight. They should have more frequencies from ZRH to BCN. Inflight magazine could be improved

title: Operated by Helvetic :-(
review_text:
Flight on-time but poor customer service on board (Helvetic airlines). My seat back was broken and the hostess only said like a parrot "upright position" 11 times... 
Boarding and checkin perfect ;-) and connection in ZRH amazing

title: Not recommended for families with babies
review_text:
Months before flying to Manila, I have reserved and got a confirmation for the reservation of a bassinet. When I got on the plane, I was rudely informed by the world's coldest flight attendant that:

1. there are no bassinents on the flight

2. i should have reserved it earlier (which I did!)

3. other families did not get a bassinet either

I expected a tolerable flight since I was ASSURED that we would be getting a bassinet, but it was a hellish 13 hours from Zurich to Manila.

Never again.

title: Absolutely the Worst ever Business class I have flown
review_text:
I flew business class from Delhi-zurich-Paris recently, not only was the flight itself uncomfortable and horrible but I missed my connecting flight to Paris due to a delay and if that wasn‚Äôt enough Swiss lost my baggage and sent it to Dublin and took more than 2 days to find and deliver it back to me,

Firstly the airplane I flew from Delhi to zurich was some old Airbus A330 which was extremely noisy and vibrating a lot throughout the entire flight, everytime I tried to sleep a bit the noise and vibrations would keep me awake...the plane was NOT smooth at all and was rather SCARY, Secondly the seats in Business class were actually narrower than the seats in economy, which made them very very uncomfortable. The seat design is horrible, too much wasted space and still not enough room on the seat itself, it felt overall cramped and useless, perhaps their economy class is a better deal.

When I landed in zurich they already had a new itinerary for me as I was not going to make the connecting flight so I had to spend 5 hours in zurich airport. The airport and lounges are nice , quite good and I was impressed with it but my experience got further ruined when I landed in Paris but my baggage was missing. They tracked the baggage and it had been sent to Dublin by mistake , and only 2 full days later they were able to delivery my bag, as a business class passenger I had expected some courtesy and proactive help / treatment from swiss staff when I had fo file a complaint to locate my baggage but no, It was another horrible experience having to wait a long time to evn lodge a complaint and be treated badly, no consideration for the fact that I was in business class and expected to receive a ‚Äúcertain‚Äù level of service.

I had better expectations from the star carrier of a wealthy country like Switzerland but am sorely disappointed, this airline is a disgrace in todays times and at the very least they should update their fleet as well as offer more comfortable seats in Business class instead of the tiny narrow seats they currently have, For sure never going to fly Swiss again.

title: Tolerable
review_text: Not  a big fan of Swiss Air. Not exactly the best airline better than United of course - tolerable for a short flight- at least they give you one cup of beverage and a chocolate. Seats are ok- not toomany people so had the whole row to myself but in all honesty, wouldnt take this for long haul flights

title: Worst experience ever
review_text: I will try never to fly with swiss again ,poor customer service no intention to help at all ,never on time n awful food.

title: Swiss the worst company
review_text: I had a round trip ticket from Jfk->Berlin with stop in Zurich and return was from Athens->Jfk. my meeting in Berlin was cancelled so I got another ticket straight to Athens from Zurich with Swiss. Once the plane landed in Athens I got an email that says that my return flight has been cancelled. I then called customer service to ask them why and their response was because you didn't took the flight to Berlin from Zurich we went ahead and cancelled the return . They didn't care that I notify the clerk at JFK that the final destination will be Athens and not Berlin. They said they can't issue me another ticket or give me a refund for the ticket. On top of that the Airbus was outdated seats worn out and multimedia system very outdated. I will never recommend swiss to anyone . By far the worst experience I ever had

title: ECONOMY PASSENGERS MATTER  - A very negative Long Haul Airline Experience with SWISS AIR
review_text:
ECONOMY PASSENGERS DO MATTER.   My partner and I experienced our worse long haul flight ever.  It was a 13.10 hour flight.  1. The seats were incredibly uncomfortable, lit was like sitting on concrete for 13 hours.  There was no comfort whatsoever. 2.The spacing between seat rows were very tight.  My partner and I are neither tall or weighty yet our knees were nearly touching the back of the seats in front.  This was made worse by the people sitting in the bulkhead seats immediately in front of us flinging their seats  to fully recline the minute they sat down. 4.The attendants did nothing about that.    I understand seats are supposed to be upright on takeoff and landing for safety purposes.  
5. Trying to get in and out of our seats were a mission.  To make matters worse, a passenger next to me inflated a type of  mattress. He pushed it down between the back of the seat in front and the seat next to me. The cabin attendants did nothing about this.  ‚ÄúShould these inflatables be allowed in such a confined area?‚Äù   The row was tight enough without this additional obstruction.  He then sat his young child in the seat next to me.  The inflatable mattress was jammed hard up against my leg.  At times the father frequently left the young child on his own while he joined his partner in a bulk head row.  The young child lay sideways on his seat and his feet were constantly pushing against me.  I don‚Äôt know if a safety belt works sideways?  I felt sorry for the youngster as he whimpered whenever his father left his seat.  6. With the cramped space, incredibly hard and uncomfortable seats, narrow rows and indifferent attendants this flight deserves 01/10.  Given the 13+ hour flight sitting on a hard and uncomfortable seat and narrow rows Economy Class travellers have very limited ability to stretch, to get up and walk around etc.  I developed agonising back pain. Eventually I had to stand as it was too painful to sit.  I asked an attendant for an alternative seat where I could at least stand from time to time.  Eventually I was given a seat that allowed me to at least stand occasionally and stretch.  The seat was still awful but being able to move helped.  My partner also developed back pain..  
I believe all Airlines have a responsibility to provide safety and comfort.  Economy travellers deserve better.  We have flown on Swiss Air on five sectors  ranging from short haul  of nearly 2 hours and long haul flights of over 13 hours.  We have flown on many long haul flights with other airlines and have never encountered such discomfort on any other airline.  I would rate seat comfort as zero. 

Not everyone can afford to fly Premier Economy or Business Class.  That doesn‚Äôt justify treating Economy Class passengers as if they don‚Äôt matter.   After our experience on the 13 hour+ flight we requested  an exit row on the return trip.  Seats were still awful but at least we could stretch for an additional fee.

title: A good flight this afternoon with Swiss, with very lovely scenery from *up in the air*, during the journey!
review_text: I had a good and relaxed Swiss flight, from Amsterdam to Z√ºrich, with a good inflight team, with the passengers also getting good tips from the friendly pilot, on the best views from *up in the air*, when the plane was flying over Switzerland. I could not get a window seat so i missed taking the photos, from *up in the air* but managed to take two photos, after the plane had landed, at the Z√ºrich airport. I will also write about my longer connecting flight, also with Swiss, later this evening, via Tripadvisor, sometime in the near future. Have a great evening!. **By the way, the check-in (lady) staff at the Amsterdam airport earlier today was most professional, patient and helpfulüëç.**

title: Worst App Ever
review_text:
The flight itself was not to bad & they feed you a lot, most of the food was good. However there were a few issues. 

First the app is just awful. It didn't always work & sometimes it couldn't find my reservation. Boarding passes we suppose to be emailed automatically to me 20 hours before the flight but they were not.  When you are traveling you want a app that works. When trying to pay extra to select my seat I could not get it work, so I called in & happened to mention the app didn't work & the rep was rude & dismissive about it. 

The seats go back pretty far which is nice, unless your asleep & the person behind you gets food & they wake you up to tell you, you need to put your seat up. Also leg room in economy was not great. 

All in all it wasn't too horrible, if they could get the app working properly I would consider using them again but maybe for shorter flights.

title: Efficient service
review_text: The airline provided a good, solid service as would be expected, and hoped for, from a national carrier. Flight arrived early into our destination, legroom was reasonable and the cabin service was pleasant. Swiss still provide you with complimentary drinks (including alcohol) and a sandwich, the first time I‚Äôve had this on a short haul flight for some considerable time. A free bar of chocolate as you disembark the aircraft is a nice finishing touch.

title: Madrid To Chicago via Zurich
review_text: Swiss Air was a very nice airline that did an exceptional job on customer service!  Our two hour flight from Madrid Spain to Zurich had breakfast and drink service. Our long haul flight from Zurich to Chicago had two meals, 3 drink services, dessert service and finally they passed out Swiss chocolates. Each seat was provided with blanket, pillow, earbuds and the meals come with silverware (not plastic). Our Airbus 220 from Madrid was brand new, our Airbus 330 to Chicago was rather dated yet it had a freshened up interior. The only reason they don‚Äôt get a perfect 10 is because the inflight entertainment was sometimes a bit uncooperative. Not a ton of room in coach, but it‚Äôs what I expected for what I paid in the off season!  TIP: If you buy the ‚ÄúLite Fare‚Äù make sure you checkin online 23hrs before your flight and you can pick what seats remain for free. We did this and got good seats together at the window and isle!  Check-in 23hrs promptly.

title: Terrible refund policy
review_text: I recently booked a flight with Swiss airlines and, due to unforeseen circumstances, had to cancel very soon after. I had no problem gaining a refund from the travel agency I booked through, however Swiss airlines would not refund the additional baggage I purchased on their website. So I have spent over 75chf on baggage I will not use. Come on, refund your customers. Poor.

title: Very good re service and punctuality
review_text: Short flight so comfort leg room etc was not as that expected on long haul aircraft. Plane was punctual and despite a apparent short transit Of 55 minutes time we time enough fir the lounge!

title: Very good, food great and service first ckass
review_text:
Very comfortable, foi was excellent as was the service. Plenty of choices of wine during dinner.
IFE was more than enough content wise.  The only point which stopped a score of 5 was the rather flimsy blanket!

title: Keep your luggage close
review_text:
The Swiss planes and actual flight was nice in itself, though the flight attendants were a bit too strict and naggy in my opinion. The seating was fine, food ok and the swiss chocolate in the end a nice touch. 

The issues were more with everything surrounding the flight - 

* Their app, which I downloaded and installed especially before the flight, seems to not always function - it didn't offer online check-in while their website gave me access with no problem, and didn't offer me the boarding passes once online check in was completed.

* Having booked seats using the online check in and everything confirmed, we were surprised to have experienced so many issues with the tickets and seating on our flights - first off, in the airport we were told that one of the tickets was not issues properly. That took about an hour of wait. Afterwards, we arrived at the plane only to see that the seats we were promised were changed - this followed in the connection flight as well.

* But worse of all was the loss of our luggage - we took a stroller and baby car seat with us - on the outbound flight via a connection, we saw that our items were brought to the plane in the connection destination instead of the final destination. We felt lucky we caught this and the crew assured us it was an error and will be corrected and waiting for us in the final destination, but once we arrived - our luggage was missing. 
No help was offered from Swiss with the missing luggage as well, as they shifted the blame onto the connecting flight.

As if that was not enough - on the flight back we were also surprised when our baby stroller, which was promised to be the first thing off the plane, was not there waiting for us when we got off the plane. 
Again - no assistance was offered and it took about an hour of running around between ground crew people in the airport to finally locate our stroller and head back home.

All in all, very disappointed by the experience, so even though the flight itself was fine, everything around it lacked service and efficiency.

title: No thanks !
review_text: Careless Airline and arrogant crew , one of the worst European Airlines , one of the single Airlines who would not care to screen their crews for Corona who flew in the past weeks to China and likewise to drop one of their best chocolate vendors Laederach just because of some rumours which in fact if true, is nothing wrong about them bneither they have something to do with the quality of the chocolate maker, Stay away from this Airine

title: Book Swiss - Get Air France and no service
review_text:
WARNING - don‚Äôt book Swiss without reading all the little details with very small print.

I am Star Alliance Gold member flying 2-4 times a week. 

I mistakenly thought that booking a Swiss Air flight (paying 600 Euro for Economy GVA-CDG-GVA) meant that you were sure to keep your Star Alliance privileges. 

WRONG!!

Swiss Air dump you on an Air France flight - with zero service, they take your carry-on roller and check it in, no fast track, no lounge access etc. 

It‚Äôs a mystery how Swiss think they can treat their (ex)loyal customers like that.

title: Nice short flight
review_text: Boarding process was early and efficiently done with the selfboarding gates. Full flight but we still managed to depart on time. The crew was looked very young, but did a good job in serving quickly on this short flight. The cheese sandwich was nice and they do a bar service including beer/wine. The small SWISS chocolate is for us a looking forward to on the SWISS flights.

title: Good flight to Europe
review_text: We had an ok trip from Montreal to Firenze via Zurich.  The seats had very little leg room even though we had done an upgrade to have extra room.  I can't imagine what the regular  leg room was like.  When we arrived in Zurich we had to wait off in a corner for a bus to get to the airplane somewhere off yonder at the edge of the airport.  It was pouring rain and we waited at least 20 minutes for them to bring the stairs for us to get into the plane.

title: 4/5 for one reason
review_text:
We‚Äôve never flown with Swiss, but return flights to Bali were cheap (¬£537pp), normally ¬£700+.
The Manchester to Zurich 2 hour hop was fine, with a drink and a snack included.üëçüëç, and the 11 hour 50 minute flight was flawless, the service was excellent, the food was good, and the drink was plentiful, albeit, if you want more, go get it your self was the reply from cabin crew. That was the flight out to Hong Kong.
Coming home, we flew out of Singapore, again 11 hour 50 minute flight, same level of service, but the inflight entertainment is limited compared to the Middle Eastern airlines.
My main gripe is, on landing back into Zurich, we had only 40 minutes to get from one side of the airport to the other, including catching a train to a different terminal. If we hadn‚Äôt of ran the whole way, we would of missed our connection.
I think Swiss need to sort this out.
Until they do, we won‚Äôt be using them again.

title: Horrendous!!!!!
review_text: Bought the last minute ticket with my US debit card online via Swiss.com website, received confirmation of booking via email, and confirmed with the bank that the transaction was processed. 12 hours later my mom, the passenger, was turned away at the airport due to the flight ‚Äúbeing deleted‚Äù. Swiss agents at the check-in asked her to pay again if she wanted to board and there is nothing they can do otherwise. This is when the ordeal really began as I immediately called Swiss customer support and was routed to offshore outpost where Pritika and Sanjay in Bangalore (posing as Charlotte and Henry in New York) gave me the runaround when I asked why my -paid for- ticket was deleted for no reason and I wasn‚Äôt given ANY notification of this cancellation when they had both my cell number they used to send their confirmation code to and email where they sent confirmation of ticket purchase?! I then proceeded to call Zurich where Eloise made it clear that the new Swiss Airlines policy is -complete- disregard for their customers as the only thing she offered in the way of fixing this outrageous situation was a meek apology and an offer to sell me another, 6700(!) francs last minute ticket for the next Swiss flight! IN the meantime my flight departed, my money is still not refunded to me (takes 3-10 business days as the ‚Äúhelpful‚Äù Swiss support agents dutifully read of the given scripts and refused to put me through to their manager who I could have meaningful conversation with! NEVER again will I fly with Swiss and will also try to avoid Lufthansa/Austrian/Swiss group whenever possible, as this is how it turns out for consumers when corporate behemoths grow too large and powerful. Disgusting experience!

title: Visiting family
review_text: Well looked after. Food was of good standard  although choice was limited compared to others I have flown. Service was good. I found the lie flat seat a bit uncomfortable compared to  some but better than others.

title: Visit to family
review_text: Short flight to connect with flight to Hong Kong. Departed and arrived on time. Well looked after. Check in was quick and easy but boarding gate at CDG was cramped and space was very limited.

title: Stay away from Swiss
review_text:
One of the single Airlines in the world ignoring the current Chinese epidemy 
and mainly and foremost caring about his own pockets!  stay away !

title: Treated Us Very Well
review_text: The counter agent at the departure airport couldn't have been nicer or more concerned about our well-being.  She saw from our passports that we are senior citizens and offered to check a third bag (which was a carry-on for overhead storage) at no additional charge. Once on board, the seats were very comfortable (we paid a slight extra fee for additional leg room) and the flight attendants were very nice with seeing to our comfort.  The meals were excellent (two on this overseas flight) and the movie and program selection also very excellent.  The :"going to" trip was right on time and the return trip arrived home 30 minutes ahead of schedule.  Baggage service was also excellent with no delays or damage.  Should the opportunity arise again, we will have no qualms about flying Swiss again!

title: Fantastic Experience
review_text:
We travelled from Prague to Las Palmas via Zurich. First time we have travelled with Swiss Air & sister company Edelweiss from Zurich to Las Palmas.Total price for each person was just 6000czk ( approximately 240 euros) including cabin baggage ( 8 kg) & hold baggage ( 23 kg) Amazing value.Seats were  comfortable, On board food which was included in the price was excellent. Cabin crew were also so friendly.Free entertainment app you download to your tablet or phone so you can watch a great selection of movies.
The bonus was we arrived 25 minutes early.
The return journey to Prague was equally as good & arrived 20 minutes early.

title: Be cautious with carry-ons
review_text: The carry-on size allowance for Swiss air seems to be smaller than other airlines. I was required to pay an additional $65 to check in my carry-on, one that I have used for multiple years without issue. The staff members were quite proactive with measuring and even weighing carry-on baggage. If you are traveling with a backpack and carry-on, I would recommend either a different airline or be ready to check in your carry-on for an extra fee.

title: Staff is excellent but the Airbus 330 is not
review_text: The staff from the gate to the end of my flight was excellent. They were courteous and attentive. At the risk of being a Boeing snob, the Airbus 330 is too cramped for my liking and the seat comfort is subpar. This was the second leg of my journey. The first leg was on United Boeing 767. The two airframes do not compare in my book. The long flight to Nairobi was not comfortable.

title: Worth it if someone else pays for it
review_text:
I got randomly upgraded to a business class seat, which made my flight a lot more comfortable than an economy seat. The seat is huge and very comfortable, and even has a massage in it! And it's electronically adjustable. The TV screen is quite big. The area around my seat has a lot of wood which makes it feel more like your own space.

I've never flown business class before, so even though I enjoyed the luxury it offers, there are other airlines who offers a better Business class experience. While the food looked fancy, the taste was only okay. I have flown with Emirates and Singapore Airlines in Economy where the food looks better and tastes better. Also, even in Business Class you still have to pay for WiFi. Other airlines gives you a limited amount of data for free, if not to Economy passengers, at least to Business.

Browsing through the media system, I found a few movies that interested me, but I didn't get time to watch, including Detective Pikachu, Men in Black and MIB International. I ended up watching the first MIB movie. Headphones were provided, and they had the right amount of size and weight to them and they felt well built. I didn't use them though as I was bringing my own. Speaking of headphones, you don't need an airplane adapter if you're going to bring your own, so that's good at least.

Before my flight, I had watched Nonstop Dan's review on SWISS Business class, and he says they don't invest enough into Business and I agree with that. While I did enjoy flying in Business, I'm happy I didn't pay for it myself. If I were to pay for my own Business class seat, I would have chosen another airline.

title: Always perfect service
review_text: This is my tenth trip with SWISS air to Z√ºrich. I have never been delayed and the baggage always arrives swiftly. Cabin crew very attentive and meet your every needs. Highly recommended

title: The overall experience less satisfactory that I had expected to be
review_text: I took Swiss air for a business to Z√ºrich. Everything went well except that both times the aircraft had changed the last minute and the check-in I did  before was no longer valid. I was surprised that they offered us only a tart or sweet and coffee. The airport is Z√ºrich was of course excellent.

title: Travelers Beware of Overweight Baggage Inflated Charges!
review_text:
I would give a 0 rating but not able to.
This was the worst experience.  I was charged 333 euros for my 1 checked suitcase that weighed 72 lbs. (1 piece of luggage)  I am 72, requested wheelchair assistance and traveling solo.  I had no extra bags to shift things around.  I paid that outrageous charge because I had no choice in the matter since I did not want to loose my flight and be left behind.  I contacted Swiss (customer Service) which makes it almost impossible to communicate with them.  It‚Äôs now almost 6 months and I‚Äôm still getting the run around from them.  I‚Äôm out 333 euros (that‚Äôs approx. 370 USD) for 1 checked suitcase that was 2 extra pounds over.
I highly advise everyone to think twice about using this airline.  If your bags are a little heavy you‚Äôll pay through the nose.
The Swiss staff in Athens were useless, unsympathetic, and a disgrace.

title: TOTAL SCAM ARTISTS- MAJOR ISSUES WITH LOST LUGGAGE
review_text:
Did you know Swiss Air has no updated baggage tracking software? Therefore they couldn't tell me whether my bag had been scanned in Rome, or even on the connection in Zurich. Ready for the kicker?

They lost my bag for five days. And refused to fully reimburse me $400 for the items I had to purchase while my bag was lost. Apparently they have a policy that states "Any items that can be re-used will only be reimbursed 50%" 

Basically Swiss Air can be as negligent as they want and you as a consumer and passenger will have to absorb additional costs because " You can re-use the items".

Their customer service is AWFUL, they feel no empathy or concern for the misery they put their passengers thru by losing their bags. I talked to a number of people who expressed similar sentiments of Swiss Air having a terrible reputation of losing checked luggage.

BEWARE OF SWISS AIR- YOU WILL REGRET FLYING WITH THEM IF THEY LOSE YOUR LUGGAGE

title: Great Service..not so good space.
review_text: I flown from Miami through Zurich, then to Dubai with Swiss Airlines.  It seems to me as the plane was just old, perhaps it is the impression of the seat colors, perhaps it is that ..the tv screen look a bit oldie to me, fact is ...I felt the space was too reduce.  I was in a line of seats in the back of the plane, where ..I did not have a tv set in front of me..but two on the sides, it was as they reduce the space on that line, and I ended up having to turned my head in order to watch the movies played.  Service on the other hand was really good.  Flight attendants were not only beautiful, but also very nice and customer service oriented.

title: Short flight to London
review_text: An easy flight to Heathrow. The cabin crew were very courteous and friendly. The check in at Geneva was a trifle confusing. We were directed to go to the French side of the airport and were then directed back to the Swiss side which can be somewhat difficult with luggage etc. All in all a nice flight.

title: Not very comfortable
review_text: I know it's economy class but it looked like a low cost 2 hour flight seat... instead it was a 11 hour flight so really not.much leg room. I had the gluten free meal which was ok but they only served dinner and 1 small breakfast. Only 10 movies and 10 TV shows to watch... Overall it was fine for.the price but not so good. Didn't get much sleep. I took Emirates last year in economy and it was another story.

title: Not the most comfortable but pretty good cabin crew.
review_text: We had a connecting flight from Birmingham to Zurich and from there to Johannesburg.  We had booked a middle four, hoping for a spare to stretch out a bit but no luck.  Food not too bad on the whole but chocolate sadly lacking.  The last time we flew Swiss IAL we had little chocolates offered on a regular basis which we really appreciated.  On this very long flight we got one each!  The leg room was stingy and it was very hard to get comfortable and sleep was pretty well impossible.  It is a long way to fly and I think the airline should give a bit more thought to the comfort of their passengers.  I think we'll try another airline next time.

title: Great service
review_text: Seats on first leg of trip to Zurich were very close together and with very little leg room,Service was outstanding, good food, drinks, snacks scented towels all great. Second flight bigger seats and same great service

title: Long Haul Great. Short Haul Indifferent
review_text: We travelled Swiss Air business class from Heathrow to Mumbai for a holiday in Goa. I cannot fault the long haul element of the trip from Zurich to Mumbai, but the short haul connections on both the outbound and return trips from Heathrow to Zurich and Mumbai to Munich respectively were disappointing. The business class difference is no more than an empty seat in the middle of 3. It's just not worth the money. The long haul is a different story. Fabulous lie flat bed seats and wonderful attentive service with a delicious menu and plenty of offers of snacks and drinks. Would definitely recommend the business class for long flights but would think carefully before spending the extra on short haul.

title: Economy is extremely uncomfortable, invasive & lacks leg room - however they have good customer service.
review_text: My Husband & I were travelling back from Australia - so we‚Äôd already had an 8 hour flight with Cathay Pacific - and we were dreading the 12 hour flight with Swiss to Z√ºrich as we remembered how cramped it was on our flight going from Zurich to Singapore 4 weeks beforehand. We‚Äôre to start... The seats are so uncomfortable its unreal, economy class is literally the definition of ‚Äòpacked like tin sardines‚Äô and you just feel like you‚Äôre just a fragile helpless squashed little squid without anywhere to move. The seats are very hard - those with a posterior that doesn‚Äôt fair well on hard seats will suffer immensely and you wish you could sleep on a hard floor instead. (That‚Äôs If you‚Äôre lucky enough to get any sleep) It‚Äôs almost impossible to spread your legs out - especially if the passenger in-front leans their chair right back - as it‚Äôs so cslohterohobic (& with the tray out even worse!)- you feel like you can‚Äôt breathe. I was on my Monthly period too - so they need to re- think the design for women's medical needs (or anyone‚Äôs physical needs) especially as I was in a lot of pain - I dread to think what it‚Äôs like for pregnant women! I would have done anything for an upgrade or just a bloody lie down somewhere! But it seemed like there was no where for anyone in distress to go, & in economy you‚Äôre technically 3rd class citizens, so you kind of get the feeling you‚Äôre the cabin crews last priority (even though the customer service is great) but it‚Äôs all very money driven & you just feel like another number. Also the duty free announcement is very disruptive, I was just getting into my movie & 3 duty free announcements interrupted my switch off time.  You could tell nobody gave a hoot anyway about duty free - as who on earth is going to be buying that sort of stuff If you‚Äôre already most probably half jet lagged at 1am, starving, exhausted, squashed & peed off after having waited an hour to board the plane anyway! Lol!  On top of the fact you know you‚Äôre stuck in economy for the next 12 hours probably having to listen to some screaming baby whilst business class are sipping their complementary champagne! Although judging by the other reviews from business class customers - as nice as it looked I‚Äôm guessing that wasn‚Äôt very comfortable either. However the food was good, & the staff were friendly. It‚Äôs not the staffs fault the planes are designed to be one big money making scheme just so they can wedge as many people in as possible. The whole plane layout needs to be redesigned. For mental health reasons as well as physical too - take some chairs out either side of the aisles & move the seats forward 30cm - Then your customers will be happier & more likely to fly with you again. However where credit is due- I have to say the commercial  flight from Zurich to Heathrow was excellent, more comfy seats - more leg room & more modern atmosphere to the plane. However sorry Swiss International - I won‚Äôt be flying with you again for long hall flights if my Hubby & I can help it - & I‚Äôm renaming you ‚ÄòSquish international airlines.‚Äô Please sort out the space & comfort issue, as we paid a lot of money for our flights - & it‚Äôs just not right that we ended up feeling disappointed , in pain & upset with what we got. Please make the changes - you‚Äôre airline will depend on it, as your customers health should come first- not the money from our wallets.

title: Business to London City Airport
review_text:
The layout of this plane was 2 and 2 therefore for business class you had 2 economy seats each, I sat one side of the cabin and my wife sat the other side so we both had window seats, my first time!!!!
Seats were typical economy seats, but as we were in row one we had plenty of legroom, had a snack and a drink, usual for a short hall business flight.
Staff friendly.
We flew out with Swiss from Heathrow to Zurich in December, this return flight much more convenient to City Airport, no lugging suitcases on the underground. This flight was actually operated by the Swiss sister airline Helvetic or something but no problems. Would use again.

title: another good value business class flight
review_text:
I think our plane was an older one to the flight out in December, but the same layout in business class. We had seats 7A and & B on the way back and wished we had same seats as when we flew out 5D and G. The set of 2 seats together at the side of cabin (near windows) are not as good as the set of 2's in the middle of the airplanes cabin seating layout in business class. The area or space you have is not or does not seem as big with these 2 seats and we did not have the same amount of storage space around the seats as on our way out seats 5D & 5G.
Everything else was the same as previous review for the December 2019 flight. Food, entertainment, staff all ok/good and managed to get quite a bit of sleep despite these seats being in a more busier or open part of the business class section, more rows here than where seats on row 5 are, those seats you turn left on boarding the plane for 2 rows of business and the First Class compartment, these were turn right even though for the business class rows 6 upwards. Still felt a bit boxed in though.
But overall believe we would use Swiss Business Class again if they keep the prices down compared to other airlines.

title: Good value Business Class
review_text:
We had seats 5D and 5G and whilst not sure of them at first compared to Lufthansa Business Class seats we found them comfortable enough and would sit there again.
At first you think when the seat is flat that its was a bit coffiny! A bit boxed in, part of your legs are enclosed and the seats are not the widest of business class seats, but was comfortable and got some sleep. If going as a couple we think these are the best seats in business class. Food going out was good too. Entertainment ok. Flight on time. Overall for what we paid very good value.

title: Best Flight Ever!
review_text: If you're able to pay a little more for a Business Class seat on Swiss Air, do it.  I'm by no means a millionaire, but my husband is a pretty bad traveler, and I really wanted to make his first long-haul trip as easy as possible.  For our combo United and Swiss Air flights (United from New York to Paris and Swiss from Geneva to New York) we found a fairly reasonable deal for the comfort of a higher class seat, and I'll do that every flight going forward if I can.  The Swiss Air staff made us feel like VIPs the entire time.  I had to call the reservation agents twice, and they were very friendly, knowledgeable and helpful as well.  My travel-adverse husband slept four out of the seven-hour flight, and we both agree it was the best experience we ever had flying.

title: Swiss and Edelweiss
review_text:
More then correct service.
We didn‚Äôt expected nothing special but we received a great service. Really surprised and would book them again with no problem.

title: They never disappoint!
review_text:
I have been flying Swissair and Swiss International since 1971 
Although on this specific route the aircraft was not new but as always spic-and-span clean and the world's best and most attentive inflight crew you ever want to meet. Its ALWAYS like that regardless which class your fly. The only disappointment...the inflight amenities bag this time was xmas sock...yet I was waiting for some fabulous SWISS bag.. I suppose they wanted to spread some Xmas cheer around and it meant to be cute.

title: Good Flight, Clean and Comfortable
review_text: We boarded on time but departed about 45 minutes late.  The staff kept passengers informed.  Apparently it had to do with winds and having to use a different runway.  Once we took off, we made up some of the time.  The flight was comfortable, food was good as was the service. Would definitely fly Swiss Air again.

title: Quality airline
review_text: Had a return flight with this airline and as always had very comfortable flight. Very nice crew and food a drinks even for a short flight. One of my favourite airlines for short flights and have always had a good reliable journey. Always use if flying to Switzerland.

title: best company
review_text: The best flying company in the world! My kids were thrilled! They treated the kids so kindly! A huge plain, very comfortable, great food.

title: Do not planned to get reimbursed if you miss your connection
review_text:
As a seasoned traveler, I understand delays happen. What I can not understand is the "extraordinary circumstance" that SWISS airlines likes to pull out of the bag when they have not allocated enough time to de-ice a plane in Stockholm during the month of December when the average temperature is 0 degrees C. 

I was delayed for over 24 hours, missed my pick up and hotel night at my final destination (hundreds of dollars) and will not be reimbursed (along with not getting  600 euros of compensation) "due to weather" when in fact the plane was not delayed by bad weather, it was delayed because the plane had to be de-iced twice and lost our spot in the line. Disappointing. 

PS: There is also ZERO leg room on the long haul flights, but they do have great movies.

title: What happened here?
review_text:
Swissair was a glorious airline, often Airline of the Year.

Early 90's no help was given to support SR at tough time, so it went down in the early 90's with bad top management. there is a book and a film about it

Swiss took the air out oftrhe name to join with Crossair a decent small swiss airline, and as they were not managing, Lufthansa took over.

The flight was disappointing, Easy jet  return was better, please put up your act again, as we love CH and Swiss airline.

title: Business class service poorer its own economy
review_text:
I usually fly econ on Swiss and find their service and food to be warm and decent. This is my first biz with them, and likely last. Both hardware and ‚Äúsoftware‚Äù on biz will have you wishing you are flying with someone else.

Hardware: painfully small screen and cramped seats. See photo. The entertainment selection is mediocre too. Lounge at Zurich during transit was super packed. I went in and out in five minutes without anything to eat.

Service: The Chinese lady serving my aisle was decidedly rude. She spoke with the passenger next to me in English, and yet persisted on Chinese with me even though i spoke English with her. If she checked the flight detail, she will know that I‚Äôm not Chinese! While serving desserts, the guy next to me had the black forest cake. She did not offer me any or even ask. She just left after serving him. My neighbour gave me a puzzled look and I could only shrug my shoulders. 

When i woke up from my nap, i saw that ice cream was served, so i pressed the service button. When nobody came after 20 mins, i got out of my seat to request for it. This lady scowled at me each time she served me. I have no idea what‚Äôs her problem, but this is unacceptable. It totally marred my otherwise happy experience with Swiss all the other times I flew with them. There are plenty of better options for biz out there.

title: Good flight, on time
review_text: The airline uses very modern aircraft, the plane was clean and tidy with helpful crew. It was a Good flight, that landed on time.

title: Reliable airline and good customer service
review_text:
I am doing London to Geneva very often and rarely experience delays with Swiss. I had some issues with a damaged buggy and their customer service has been very helpful, providing quick compensation. Staff in flight is usually super nice.
I am just disappointed by their recent change in level of service for customers travelling on economy light (i.e. no luggage): we now have to pay for our drinks/meals.

title: Consistently poor
review_text: I live in Zurich so frequently, Swiss is the only option for most journeys or at least the first leg.  The airline itself is consistently late, I really don‚Äôt understand how they have such an on-time rating.  On-board service is fine but the ground staff, ticketing and the entire Swiss experience is consistently poor and makes the boarding process very negative. Also... zero idea how... I travel a lot for work and am typically moved to very bad seats even after booking and reserving.  Like all of Switzerland, the airline exists because of a lack of local completion. If BA would open the market, that would encourage them to take their jobs seriously.  If there is an alternative... take it!

title: Very good customer service
review_text: We were flying with Swiss Air from Zuerich to Auckland, via Singapore a couple of years ago. Unfortunately both of us got very sick (Noro Virus) as soon as the plane took off. The flight attendants were very professional and caring, looking after us for the whole flight. Swiss Air and Singapore Airport staff organised transport, a doctor, a 24 hour hotel to rest and new connecting flights to Auckland for us at no charge. I can't imagine any other airline (and airport) supplying that level of service. Also Swiss Airways uses slightly smaller planes on long haul flights. It's great for couples as there are two seat rows along the windows. Most other airlines have 3 seat rows which can be a little cramped.

title: View of the Swiss Alps
review_text: We took a short one hour flight between Florence and Zurich. The view of the Swiss Alps from the plane was incredible! We loved the chocolate they served on board our first flight, but on the return flight there were food handling issues. The male flight attendant offered guests a croissant and touch each one with his hands. We watched him pass out many unwrapped croissants and passed when he got to our row. He should have used gloves or a napkin to offer croissants.

title: All good
review_text: Even if short trip, at Swiss they take care of passangers. No issues on the airport, friendly staff also on the plane. Clean, new plane, enough leg room. Nice choice of drinks, local Swiss beer. Good snacks.

title: Amazing business class
review_text: Good seat, good entertainment system, amazig crew and excellent swiss food plus wines. The new 777 is a real treasure and provide maximum comfort.

title: Wonderful airflight
review_text: Overall the flight is pleasant and the staff is friendly. The food is good is good and there are fruits and snack on the counter to grab when you hungry! :)

title: Double charged us and never reimbursed us
review_text: Swiss Air cancelled our flight about 14 hours before it was due to leave and indicated that we needed to contact them. After trying to do that unsuccessfully for three hours I rebooked our flight because we had to be in the next city the next day. AFTER I rebooked the flight they rebooked us on the same flight. So we paid the original cost plus the cost for a second flight. After six months of trying to get reimbursed for either flight we have had no response. We tried to resolve this at the airport in Zurich - no help from their customer service there either. I will never fly with them again.

title: My favorite
review_text: I try to chose Swiss as often as possible when I'm traveling. Most of my flights with them have been perfect.

title: Faultless
review_text:
Family of 4 recently flew from Hong Kong to Switzerland in business class. 

Could not fault the service and food, wine and chocolate was fabulous. 

Will fly Swiss again without hesitation.

title: Cramped even at special rates
review_text:
It was economy but with some kind of extra "plus".

Not even space between the seats to make room for my legs (femur!).

Chair at the aisle. Result was being bumped by the stewardesses at every serving.

3 times spilled over with orange juice and other drinks.

Time in next is not correct due to lack of selection.

Me and my wife travelled 3 years ago.

title: Once again... a late plane nearly derailed my Christmas travels
review_text: In prior years, due to the fact that this flight from GVA to FRA is very often late, I have booked longer and longer layovers to avoid misconnecting during the busy Xmas season.  This year I booked 2 1/2 hours layover.  I still nearly missed my onward flight to Buenos Aires.  The flight arrived 90 minutes late, and then I had to walk from Terminal A to Terminal C, which required leaving the Security Envelope and being rescreened, plus Passport Control.  I arrived at the gate for my onward flight stressed out and sweating, and the flight was already boarding.  Very unreliable, very dissappointing!

title: Excellent airline to fly with
review_text: Frankly, I was expecting excellent service from Swiss airline and I wasn't disappointed. Everything was efficient and on time as you can expect from Swiss quality! The plane was very clean with comfy seats, the staff was very friendly and helpful. The food was very tasty with interesting choices, especially a signature Swiss ice cream "Movenpick" for a dessert - nice touch and very thoughful! Also, I am very glad the airline is environmentally conscious and is taking steps to reduce a plastic use by using a silverware instead of plastic utensils. Well done and thank you! It will be my #1 airline to travel with!

title: Clean and efficient
review_text: Not traveled Swiss Air for a number of years and am delighted there quality has not diminished.Friendly staff and complementary food and drink.Couldn‚Äôt ask for more.

title: Not too bad but could have been a lot better in business class
review_text:
We booked the business class because of the overnight flight.  the business class passport control and security screening at Dar Airport is a hell of a lot slower to get through than the normal passport control and security screening.
The flight itself was fine, but the business class seats were not the most comfortable. they do fully lie flat but they are so hard and ungiving that you move around all the time to try and find the most comfortable position. Fortunately the return flight seats were better.
The food was standard in quality and quantity. nothing special about it but it was not too bad. a good wine selection thought.
The biggest disappointment was the entertainment. Most of the movies on offer were old. and i mean old as in more than 5 years old. there were a handful of newer movies, but the majority were old. if the inflight entertainment was more up to date, it would have been better.

title: Fantastic airline
review_text:
Will definitely be flying with swiss airlines again in the future. Food and service was fab and the flight itself was very comfortable. We flew long haul with swiss airlines both ways and will definitely be booking flights with them again
 Food was also delicious.

title: If you have a choice to use another airline do so
review_text: Found the seats cramped and the food ordinary buthe most disappointing thing wasthe entertainment system only about 5 films to choose from and same with tv choice. Luckily we were on a nighttime flight so slept if this was business class I feel sorry for those in economy!! I would not use them again unless it was a very short flight or there was absolutely no other airline

title: Return from a holiday
review_text: Well, Swiss Air have managed to ruin the end of a holiday. The plane was over an hour late and they didn‚Äôt bother warning us, they just left everyone at the gate with no seats. The luggage then took over 90 minutes to arrive after landing, longer than the flight. Pretty pathetic all round. Travel with another airline if possible or avoid Heathrow.

title: Felt like my knees were crushed
review_text:
There was absolutely no room for my legs (if you are 1,68 meters or higher you‚Äôll have the same problem). It was the most uncomfortable long distance flight I have ever had. You should really reconsider it, if you‚Äôre thinking about booking this route. My knees were crushed when the seat in front of me was leaned back.

Furthermore the sound on the tv-system was horrible.

title: Uncomfortable Business Class
review_text: My partner and I booked a business class ticket to travel to Bangkok because of the distance and also, we are tall. We were hoping to to have leg room and a relaxed flight. Instead we had the worst flight of our lives. We really could not extend our legs because the leg room was so tight and we felt trapped. I had to keep shifting in my sit to find comfort. The worst business class I have flown. I will not use Swiss business class ever again.

title: Slow service
review_text: the flight was comfortable but despite the fact that the business class was only half full service was very slow. For every refill of my wine glass I had to "ring the bell", also to take the tablet away. Not really acceptable.

title: Swiss hospitality
review_text:
Flew in their business class on a trip to Zurich, the crew was lovely and had great experiences with them. They were welcoming, friendly, genuine and professional. The seat itself was good and comfortable, I was travelling with someone so we were able to sit together which was nice. One thing I dont like was when the seat was laid flat, it was close to the floor, and there wasn't a divider between the seat and the aisle, so I felt that I was sleeping on the floor. It was annoying especially if someone walked by. 
The entertainment system was nice and there was ample storage space. Food was good with nice presentation.

title: Outstanding flight
review_text: Even though the flight was long and crowded, the flight attendants were cheerful while providing snacks, drinks, and 2 meals. When we had a dinner, they came around with baskets of warm rolls. Near the end of the flight, they brought around warm, moist towelettes so we could freshen up. There is in flight WiFi and free movies and entertainment. The flight attendants made a long flight so much better.

title: Transits at Zurich Airport too short.Baggage handling very poor
review_text:
Flight was pleasant,plane was clean and enterrainment was good.I would have rated 5 stars if not for the incidents below.
I think Swiss shouldn't sell tickets with 45 mins transit at Zurich.We had to run between Terminal A/B and E on both trips..and it's not a short distance.
On the first leg,2 out of our 5 bags didn't make the short transfer and was left at Zurich Airport.Fortunately,it was delivered to us late that night.
On the return journey,all 5 baggage arrived safely but 2 had cracks on it.During my 3 decades of travelling,this is the first time I have 2 luggage damaged while flying.Probably not Swiss's fault..should be baggage handlers throwing luggage during short transit periods.

title: Swiss Lady
review_text: In combination with their Edelweiss service this was a very good and cheap option to visit Vietnam. Good service, decent aircraft.

title: Fly Swiss
review_text: Everyone was exceptional. The Lounge was clean and the staff very accommodating,in both directions. The flight was very smooth and the cabin crew knowledge and service excellence. I would prefer fly Swiss Air to Zurich all the time.

title: First Class Airline
review_text: Brilliant Airline,very efficient staff & Zurich airport Tops nothing is no trouble with the Swiss highly recommended in everyway

title: Treat Yourself to Business Class
review_text:
You simply must treat yourself to a luxurious trans-Atlantic flight in Swiss Air's business class.  You've worked hard, you've earned it.  So, do it.  In fact, on this flight, the upgrade from coach was just $480 at check-in time.  If I hadn't already gotten mine, there was a 100% chance I'd take that. 

This will not be a long review, but first things first, your business class ticket includes access to United's heralded Polaris lounge.  When you've got a layover, United Club is great, it really is.  But Polaris?  That's a whole 'nother level (review to come).  So, if you're flying out of an airport that has one, you won't want to miss it.  

Each seat feels like an individual compartment.  The seat is spacious and pretty comfortable, offering more legroom than anyone could ever use. The motorized controls are smooth and precise.  Most people will prefer lie-flat sleeping more than I will, but having the option to do so is terrific. 

Staff was friendly and attentive and the select-to-order breakfast was perfect.  

I'm passing out now, so I'll have to talk about Swiss Air's business lounge next time around. Oh la la!!

title: Smooth and neat
review_text: The usual - smooth boarding, excellent onboard service, some neat displays with live flight info, clean like I am in my own living room and just about as comfortable.

title: Wonderful Service
review_text: Great flight with helpful staff. The seats were relatively comfortable and had decent legroom with a good recline angle. Blankets and pillows were waiting on the seats when boarding. Food was better than expected and the flight attendants made multiple passes throughout to distribute drinks and very good snacks.

title: Just Okay Service from US to Zurich
review_text:
This airline has better customer service than the other two I flew (Transavia and Air Europa) from the US to Zurich. The Elderly, families with children and the handicapped are regarded. Once you get to Zurich going to other countries other than the US, the experience changes. 

The customer service changes from good to "I Don't CARE" this is Europe Deal with it. WIFI is not easily found, asking people for help the same and if you do find a friendly helpful soul, ask all the questions you can. 

No one is friendly there, and I went to three countries (Switzerland, France and Spain) Spain was the friendliest of the three. 

I will never bitch at our US airlines!!!

title: Excellent
review_text:
A great way to get from Europe to California.
The seats are great, the food and beverages tasty and fresh.
The service is on top, always some in the staff next to you.
A huge variety of music and movies.

title: Professional, kind and generous.
review_text:
There was a delay in the flight to Zurich, and the baggage didn't arrive at La-palma.
Swissair promised to take care about our allowances, till the baggage will arrive.

title: Love it!
review_text: Always great! Second time flying Swiss air this year and we are a happy customers! Great service! Entertainment, food, on time!!!

title: Won't Exceed Your Expectations
review_text: Staff is definitely polite and well-informed. Especially the Brazilian staff is super kind and positive. For some reason their long-haul flight economy seats are even worse than their domestic flight seats. The Western-vegetarian meal I picked was bland even for airline standards. Great customer support though. Definitely dependable. Just not much comfort.

title: New York to Tokyo with change in Zurich LX15 to LX 160
review_text: We picked this flight at a time when this was the least expensive option, knowing well that it would take almost a full day to get to destination. Boarding and services were well organized and efficient, plane was clean, planes left on time, food was reasonable. No real complaints. Seats seemed a bit tight especially in economy.

title: Mr Drayton
review_text: Just wanted to say that the experience me and my soon to be wife had was the best flight we have ever experienced. Marco Fiorini-Hamilton is the gentleman that made this possible hands down the best flight attendant i have come across. Has made me only want to fly with swiss airline moving forward! Top guy...top airline.... if your thinking of travelling with swiss airline then no need to worry....your in for a straight forward brilliantly executed flight !

title: Great Flight with Swiss
review_text: The flight was very comfortable and the flight attendances were very accommodating: I had with me my SERVICE DOG : small Pillion, but when i have arrived they booked in a seat were there was no place to put the dog's cage. Nicely they moved me to another sit with a window and the middle no one sat so I could place the cage on the floor. However, because the dog is Service dog i was told I could take my dog and put him on the sit if i had my a blanket under him. Of course they asked the passenger on the aisle sit if he is not allergic to dogs. We had a wonderful time, my dog was the grated dog who slept for 10 hours without any kind of medication, never barked once. So beside this, you can enjoy variety of entertainment, good food, good service and very clean toilets. My sit did not go backwards to much, so they diced to give  me a gift ..so all was really good and smooth. 5 stars I can give them.

title: Swiss air flights
review_text:
Highly recommend Swiss air as a carrier free carriage of ski‚Äôs and they are far more flexible if you are slightly higher on luggage weight.

Water and chocolate free of charge both Ways and pleasant easy gong staff. 

Good airline

title: Efficient and on-time service
review_text:
Whenever I fly to Europe my airline preference is with Swiss.  They are efficient.
The Zurich airport also has a lot to offer -including a gym, a hotel attached to the terminal, plenty of food outlets, shopping and even a full service grocery store.  The train can get you to downtown Zurich in about 10-15 minutes.  Completing transfers in Zurich is also quite simple.  One thing to bear in mind, Switzerland is not part of the EU which means you have to clear customs control separate from other European nations.  Have fun in Switzerland -  it's one of my favorite places to visit.

title: Worst customer service
review_text: It's tough when you have to use Swiss International airlines. but we have family in Switzerland and live in the US so often we don't get around but to use their service. In this case we booked a flight with UA, but one flight was a code share. Somehow the Swiss crew didn't see that we paid the pet fee already, we should them the receipt from United Airlines, didn't matter we had to pay again and they told us to call the customer services once landed. So we reached out to customer service, do you think they helped? Of course not, they give you the run around as usual knowing that you'll give up before they have to give you the money back. It's unbelievable that  it seems the only good airlines company are the once in flying to MEA and other destination in Asian, but the airlines in Europe and US are mainly just flat out bad. And because they're often equally bad they don't care because it's not like you have a good option. But maybe we need to just add more travel time and fly through Dubai from the US to Switzerland just so we can fly with an airline that still appreciates it's customer.

title: Better book Ryanair
review_text: The worst personnel ever!, arrogant and miserable behaviour! They are so board that they check the luggage and annoy you because it‚Äôs 400 grams too heavy. I transferred a book in my hand back and it was fine. They just love to take 1/2 people and just annoy them! This is what happens to my husband and myself and I will never fly again with this airline ever! I can eventually understand such a cheap behaviour from low cost airline but insane that Swissair is like that !!!

title: Terrible crammed seating and bad service
review_text: I fly frequently in between BKK and Zurich. So far with Thai. I fly economy as well as business. I am a Star Alliance Gold Member. I did not fly Swiss economy before but wanted to give it a try. To sum it up: the experience was terrible and extremely disappointing. I am 1,83 m tall and slim. The seating Swiss provides was very very crammed and extremely uncomfortable. My kneecaps were touching the seat in front of me. My shoulders were touching my neighbor. There was no way to reach a comfortable position. I have not in years experienced a more uncomfortable and crammed long range seating on a matured heritage airline. The seat recline was damaged also because of a broken button. When the person in front of me reclined his seat it was not possible to use inflight entertainment because it was right in front of my face and nobodies eyes are able to see at such close range. There were only two food options. Chicken or noodles. Strange and very limited choice. Chicken was out. No apologies from the crew. No condiments [tomato or chilly sauce]. The service was poor. There were no noteworthy snacks. The in-flight entertainment selection of films and movies was limited in comparison to other airlines. A lot of movies/films were not offered in English. The quality of earphones was low. No earplugs offered. There was NO happy face leaving the plane after touch down in Zurich [at least not in eco]. My seat neighbors felt uncomfortable so did everybody else I met and talked to. Because of the very crammed condition the mood of most passengers was frustrated and slightly aggressive.  Also: its Xmas. No matter whether I fly in eco on Lufthansa, Singapore Airlines, Thai etc. they take note of these season and add some nice touches. But the Swiss cabin and entire service was as grey and boring as could be. I still have to fly back with Swiss to Bangkok and it already dreads me. I find it  very sad and disrespectful of Swiss to expose customers to such a dreadful product. By the way: the crew is also frustrated. They admitted they felt uncomfortable as well, especially because a lot of passengers are unsatisfied with the crammed seating. I now had a good nights sleep but by body feels battered.

title: I love Swiss Air but not ground staff
review_text: I frequently fly Swiss air , it‚Äôs a non fussed clean plane. But the ground staff or check in staff both at Heathrow and recently Milan are not courteous and short fused. I speak Italian but only with my friends. My flight was booked through skyscanner therefore the flight details were not clear on baggage as it did not state ‚Äúeconomy light‚Äù. It stated Economy Class with is defined on Swiss Air website allocates you 23kg automatically. When asked to pay for extra baggage I said no I think it‚Äôs included , the ground agent/staff at Malpensa was immediately annoyed and mumbled in Italian that she had enough of this ‚Äúbs‚Äù and started banging around on the table. Her colleague was nicer and took a look at my reservation details and gave me more respect. All this while the original attendant  grumbled to her in Italian not bother explaining as it‚Äôs all ‚Äúbs‚Äù in Italiano. After I paid the extra baggage at the designated counter I went back to the nicer lady and made sure they both knew I understood Italian. I hope Swiss Air does something about this as your flight and flight staff are courteous and helpful. This is not the first time and it adds to the stress of traveling.

title: Good short flight.
review_text: A quick dash to get this connecting flight. 40 minutes is not enough time to catch a connecting flight and keep from collapsing. Airlines need to consider inevitable delays that make the "dash" from one gate to another quite stressful. Compound that with, in my case, a Pain-in-the A** Swiss passport officer (A story in itself), and connecting can be a challenge. The challenge happened on both my inbound and outbound connecting flights booked through AirCanada.

title: Average
review_text: Okay, my wife and I checked in more than 3 hours before departure to be told that we couldn't be seated together. After steadfastly refusing to have those seats allocated to us a supervisor kindly and I might say easily allocated two seats together. The seats in economy are closer together than some but by no means the worst in the industry. We found the food and drinks acceptable. However, upon arrival at Changi our bags were not put on the conveyor. This would be convenient if we had a connecting flight but we were staying the night in Singapore. Why the check in staff didn't check this with us is beyond me. I will check the baggage tickets at the counter next time. So it's now two hours since landing in Singapore and there is no sign of our bags. Thanks for ruining our stopover Swiss Airlines.

title: Service Returns
review_text: What a treat to spend some ten hours with the flight attendants of this Swiss Air flight, which actually involved a brief layover in Zurich.  While we would have appreciated some reassurance that our connecting flight would wait after the originating flight was delayed, the staff made up for this with kind, courteous attention that we are not used to as coach travelers.  Multiple beverage services, free wine, anything you could ask for.  I just wish the Airbus 330/320 had lavatories in the rear.  Great experience.

title: A lovely experience in Business Class
review_text:
While traveling overseas I received one of those bid on an upgrade emails. Best decision i could have made regarding my trip home after a holiday. 

I was a under the weather after two weeks in Italy. I didn't know that when i bid and won my seat. I was so lucky. Business class lounge was an oasis. Access to the fresh air, lovely vegetable consume, a place to nap and Ricola to sooth my throat. 

The business class seat was the equivalent of First on most carriers. Lay down flat seats. I had a window seat so i was alone on my side. No climbing over or other person in my space. The light massage was a nice surprise. Large screen TV. Food was good for me but then I couldn't really judge that well as i had a cold. 

I had a larger than normal second carryon as i had purchased some framed prints. No problem with over head in this class. Flight departed a little late but landed right on time. I would definitely travel again with Swiss.

title: Best late night choice Muscat - Dubai
review_text: Short flight from Muscat to Dubai, 50 minutes. Airbus A330 300 aircraft, 1st class well  designed, seat and space is large, welcoming and comfortable. Good storage space(s). Good selection of entertainment and controls work well. Crew, come across as professionals and very welcoming.

title: Flight from Zurich to Newark
review_text:
Excellent customer service and food.
Flights on time and aircraft in top shape.
Seats were comfortable and cabin staff were courteous.

title: Flight to Bordeaux
review_text: The flight was on time, swift boarding and departure. Service on board was very good for this type of short destination.

title: No special events
review_text: All SWISS flights on the Zurich-Tel Aviv-Zurich  legs are full. Hard to find a seat without a neighbor.  The Boeing 777 is quite packed with rows and seats on Economy and not very comfortable. The equivalent Airbus 333  is slightly more geared to human comfort. Flight attendants are well-trained and usually try do to their best. I admire their devotion since  they apparently get up early and serve on the plane on both its ways. Quite a long shift. Food is rather pedestrian. Drinks, the usual but the overall environment imposed by staff is comfortable. The fact that the flights end up eventless is their main asset.

title: I had the experience of two distinct flights
review_text: Two distinct, separate flights.  First leg was from Newark to Zurich.  The flight crew, as a whole were personable and very engaging.  Any time they walked down the aisle, they made eye contact and spoke.  They seemed truly interested that I was having a good flight.  The second leg was Zurich to Hong Kong.  This flight crew was almost the opposite of the first.  Very abrupt in their speach, hardly made eye contact, acted like they could care less if we were having a pleasant flight.  I look forward to flying with you again as a tie breaker of service to judge whether I got your airline again

title: SUPERB FLIGHT
review_text:
It was a long flight at night and arriving at the destination in the next morning...leg space was ideal...food I chose was given...it was a good meal (as expected)...quiet flight for a good nap...coffee was excellent...breakfast served was good...good and very smooth landing...
only minus point was that the toilet was dirty mid-flight...

title: A little  surprise
review_text: Wanted the little surprise bottle of champagne for my wife and her sister flying home.  Paid for it 5 days before the flight.  Surprise, no bottle was served them on the flight and my credit card was charged!  When I filed 3 written complaints and four phone calls in 2 weeks, I still didn't get an answer. Next call will be to a consumer advocate.  Swiss Air was right, it was a surprise!

title: ABSOLUTELY ATROCIOUS
review_text: Flew from Singapore to Geneva via Zurich and somehow they lost my bag as well as my families.
