Called their airports multiple time to locate it and when they finally arrived only 3/4 bags were here. (We drove from Geneva to Lyon and had the luggage delivered there.) So one bag is still missing and the airports can't even locate it and it could be in Singapore, Zurich, Geneva, Lyon, or Frankfurt (THEY HAD TO SEND THE LUGGAGE FROM GENEVA TO FRANKFURT TO LYON.) Still have not had any clothes to change into and they still have not reimbursed me for anything. DO NOT RECOMMEND. Honestly, I fear flying back home because somehow they're just gonna lose the luggage on the way back as well.

title: BABY FOOD ALERT
review_text: When we flown from Heathrow to Zurich this month, we've been asked to give the half consumed baby food pouch back, so it can be re-served to a disabled child sitting in front of us! We were stupified to see the cabin crew pretending she just opened the fruit pouch taken from us (which was given to and enjoyed by our baby) and then give it smiling to the crying child... Is this common practice or you were short on baby food that day!?

title: SEAT IS TERRIBLE
review_text:
Good staff
Good Airplane
Nice Meals
Flights were on time
The entertainment system is not a big deal, but its ok - on average.

It is also easy to book abd pay.

But one thing ruins everything if you are tall: legroom. Imagine the seat 48E - in the middle of the airplane. Completely crowded flight. You will want to scream.

How can they do it to a 11hr flight?
It is a shame. It ruined everything.

title: Excellent service. Unusually clean aircraft
review_text:
Although their business class doesn't offer complete privacy, it's still very comfortable. Unlike many airlines, their aircraft felt clean. 
Staff were amazing and made continuous effort to take care of the passengers.

title: Refreshing!
review_text: It was only a short flight, but it was so refreshing to have a drink(choice) and a snack(no choice) with no hard sell.

title: Flight change in Zurich was always going to be too close for my bag to make it to destination
review_text: Everything was fine, staff were great and free chocolates yummy. My flights both ways was half empty so I had an whole row to sleep in. The only problem was there was a 40 minute change over in Zurich. I knew from the moment I saw this that there was no way they was going to empty a huge plane flying in from Hong Kong and get my luggage to the Birmingham flight. This is probably why the flight was the cheapest available for this flight, but in reality they shouldn't be selling this with such a close change over. Bag was delivered to my hotel the next day so all was good in the end, except I had to wear the same clothes for nearly 3 days lol.

title: Perfect relaxing flight
review_text:
Both flights of the round trip were on time 
Boarding organised, quick and efficient 
Staff helpful 
Snacks ok

title: Lovely staff and delicious chocolates!
review_text: We flew business class. The flight was very pleasant. The staff were all friendly and helpful. The highlight however were the extremely delicious Swiss milk chocolates they were giving out during the flight. I was certainly not ashamed to ask for seconds as they were very moreish! The lounge in Area A in Zurich  was nice, but very crowded. The Lounge in area D was much quieter but smaller with less food selection.

title: Great welcome
review_text: As soon as we reached the check in area at Zurich Airport we were approached by a delightful & helpful young lady who asked if she could help us. (I am 81 & my wife 76). She provided the most efficient assisted check in that we have ever experienced. Our flight to Budapest was enjoyable.

title: It was good
review_text:
I flew from Dubai to Athens via Zurich, Switzerland. The flight to Zurich was ok. It wasn't the best business class experienced I had experience except the customer service agent in Dubai. The seats are small and outdated. The food was ok. I wasn't offered any drink other than water.
 
My flight from Zurich to Athens was a different story. The flight attendant was very friendly. The food was better too.

title: Smooth, On Time Flight
review_text: No complaints about this flight. Everything was on time. For one of the legs I was in an emergency exit row and it was a little cold, but otherwise all good.

title: Most pathetic flight and they've not changed in 15 years
review_text:
We flew from Boston to Lisbon via Zurich. By far the worst flight in my memory. The condition of the plane took me back 15 years. Quality of the TV Screens, no USB plugs, no electric plugs. This I compare to Emirates or Qatar Airlines. When we came back from Lisbon we use Air Maroc. For a developing or third world country the flight was air and shoulders above SwissAir. 
No wonder SwissAir went bankrupt and got acquired by Lufthansa.

title: Try at Your Own Risk!
review_text: Flight was delayed in Dusseldorf which caused us to miss the connection for LAX. We have lost 24 hours in Zurich and do not have our luggage because the employees would not get it for us. We were also mislead by staff with incorrect information from the flight attendants, pilot, and Swiss Air representatives misrepresented information like the availability of our flight, baggage, seating, and alternative connections. Moreover, we have a car waiting in LAX that is being paid for that wont be used due to the delay from the flight. Last but not least, we were provided with meal vouchers only for the hotel to say they do not make lunch on the weekends! Try at your own risk!

title: Great flight. Easy connections in Zurich. Professionalism plus.
review_text: The layover in Zurich was only an hour but as advertised, the connection was easily made. The pilots on both our planes (Rome to Zurich, and then Zurich to Boston) made the flights in less than time than the ETA.... fully a half hour early coming into Boston. Staff on both flights were professional and accommodating. And the meals and quick bites were far better than expected... I don't expect much from airline food but Swiss Air has worked with chefs to improve the food. They've succeeded.Overall a very pleasant experience.

title: No stress is the value
review_text:
I would like to thank you all the Swiss Airlines team for stable service for a years!
I got what I paid for. And I received what I expect. This is perfect!

title: a very bad expierience
review_text:
On the way to zurich everything was ok, especially as we paid more to get foot space   (my wife 180 me 1.85)
On the flight to Tel-Aviv, that we also paid for better seating and well in advance,  they changed into a smaller plane. We recieved the seats behind the business with no leg space at all and with a curtain in our faces.
Asking for an upgrading - the business was almost empty- the crew suggested we should pay the difference. They also suggested seats - not together  - in the back of the plane which we refused. we recieved the feeling they are not interested in us at all.

title: Another long ride
review_text: I‚Äôm an average size male 5‚Äô10‚Äô 160lbs, sitting at the window which I had to pay for. Middle guy 6‚Äô xxxl, last guy average. There just not enough room for the three of us. With the change in Z√ºrich, the flight was pretty close to 24 hours dood to door for me. The staff were fine, if a little busy caring for 350? passengers. Food was pretty good. Movies helped to kill the time. I do hate the class system they establish, enough that I would use another airline if competitive.

title: Brilliant airline
review_text:
Still sitting at the gate waiting to depart and the pilot announces that the flight is not fully booked, please feel free to move to another seat very close to you if vacant.
This meant I was able to have 2 seats, which was greatly appreciated.
I do find airlines such as Singapore and Swiss, Eurowings seating does not really have the required leg room for tall people.  Sure if you are willing to pay extra and book your preferred seat, go ahead.  I will say this, the further out the booking, the more one has to pay for this privielege, on top of the paid airfare!!
Premium economy, paying extras extra for an additional 2 inches of leg room!!  Question mark that.
Overall, a great airline, as this was my first experience with Swiss Air and would recommend them.

title: Really great company
review_text: The conditions are very good, even in economy class. Everything is clean and the seats offer a lot of leg room. The personnel is friendly.

title: First Experience
review_text:
First time flying with Swiss and I have to say they are as organised as you would expect the Swiss to be!  Flight was a tiny bit delayed but nothing to do with the airline - French Air Traffic Control again! After that everything went like clockwork;  all staff polite, helpful and so very smart.  The croissant served was not, however, up to scratch but everything else was ok on this short flight.

I have to say that the food served on our return flight was excellent - a small quiche which was warm and very, very tasty.

All in all a highly recommendable airline

title: it was really good
review_text: it was really good its worth the money and i got good food there was no dealy and the servrves.... it was the best ! the toilet was clean and i will fly there agian if i can!!!!!!!!!! 100% worth it!!

title: St Bernard to the rescue
review_text: Let down badly by British Airways (not for the first time) we managed to snare a flight o London to make a connection to Toronto. Time was  the wing, but Swiss lifted off on time, fed us a perfectly pleasant continental breakfast and even offered an early morning aperitif! Service friendly and professional - all you would expect from Swiss professionalism.

title: Spacious, Good services and customer care
review_text: I love Swiss because it is spacious and has good services and good customer care, always ready to help with their smiles. Non-gluten food is very tasty. I normally hate nin-gluten food in planes, but this one was tasty and fresh.

title: We traveled in Business Class and found it excellent!!
review_text:
We traveled in Business Class and found it excellent!!
Not only were the seats marvellous but food was also very good.
For the first time ti us they asked: What coffee would you like?
Answering a Cappucino please. Would you believe, after a few minutes there came a freshsly made wonderful Cappucino!!
After this meal we could sleep very well!! 
Leaving the airplane we wonder how much better could first class be??

title: Cheese cake
review_text:
I have traveled with Swiss Airlines on a number of occasions and they are great. Unlike Ryanair the cabin crew don‚Äôt use a cattle prod to get you on the plane. It is nice and relaxed. If I have to make one negative they only serve a Quiche or some other tomato savoury dish. There is no choice and both of these are not nice. Could Swiss broaden your selection please. 
Ps; a quiche is not a cheesecake.

title: Nice flight, on time
review_text:
No special issues whatsoever. Nice flight with on board movies etc.
slight delay at start.
food was average

title: Great flight
review_text: Got food, friendly crew and three seats for myself made this a great flying experience. A bit more legroom would have been perfect.

title: 1st experience with Swiss Airlines - Economy Seat
review_text:
I have been reading & doing homework on Swiss Airlines.  I was skeptical having reading all the negatives sharing. But I don't have a choice since I made a mistake upon booking our air tix.  I didn't read carefully, what I saw was the good pricing offered by SQ.  Only realized that the operator was SQ but the flight i booked was Swiss & Lufthansa.  

But I'm glad that I took that good offer pricing cos Swiss flight have a roomy leg room for an asian plus size lady like me.  Flight was smooth from Frankfurt to Hamburg.  We were given a cake & chocolate + drink for a short distance of 1hr+ unlike some other airlines that I have encountered before.  

My sharing feedbacks were (1) Muslim food from Zurich to Singapore was not served 1st as per norm, but its ok. (2) Do expect the Muslim food from Zurich to Singapore are not to your expectation (2) The landing at Changi Airport was rough & not stable.

Nevertheless I will travel with Swiss again :)

title: Zurich to SFO Flight
review_text: this segment  was excellent and the plane had bigger Leg room, wider upper storage bins, excellent ambiance.Hostesses were courteous,service was good , Flight was smooth. It flew in time and landed in time.However, The baggage collection was not declared in time and had to waste 15-20 minutes in locating the same. Also the Immigration form was not distributed in the Plane and no information was shared.

title: Flight from Delhi to Zurich
review_text: The United flight was operated by Swiss Air. flight was in time, Service was good. The sitting arrangement is rather poor in the sense that distance between seats is less which makes it difficult to move / get in or out. also the baggage holding bins are small. there is no control is storage space and as such some could 2-3 pieces there and for some, no space was available. this needs to be improved.

title: Pleasant flight
review_text: Despite some delays at departure due to mishaps by airport services, the flight was comfortable and the service was excellent.

title: very  good
review_text: finally new planes in  swiss air ,  congratulation,  a  lot  of  space  for  legs,  very  nice  flight attendants

title: Comfortable
review_text:
We travelled with our infant granddaughter. The flight was short and comfortable. The flight attendants were all very helpful & the free chocolates were a welcome addition. We had to catch a train from Zurich and were very impressed by the fact that we could take the suitcase trolley on the escalators! They are designed/engineered so that they grip the escalators & so getting to the train platforms is easier. No need to wait for lifts if you‚Äôre running late- as we were!
On our return journey we were delighted to see that we could check in to the flight from the train station-shopping centre complex and so did not need to lug our suitcases far. 
It would have been better if the flight had left London on time but unfortunately it was 45 minutes late which was difficult with an infant! However the return journey was on time. 
Thank you Swiss Air

title: The service is average on the plane
review_text: One thing I want to voice out that when I asked for a stirrer for my coffee during serving the dinner, but the lady crew said I have a spoon and she didn't give me a stirrer!  But my spoon had been used for my dessert.  Well, I didn't know if she saw my spoon had been used.  Even she didn't see my spoon had been used, she could gave me a stirrer, which is not high value and not an unreasonable request.  I was really surprised that she replied to me like this  I took many different airlines companies for my business, but this is the 1st airline I was treated like this...

title: usa travel 2019
review_text:
On time takeoff and landing.
Z√ºrich nice and clean Airport.
Nice service on board.
More place for leg ist not bad.
Enterternment on board is verry nice a lot of choice.
In back for flight everytime snake an drink free .

title: Cabin Crew cares for you
review_text: Everybody was caring for an on time departure, preparing the passengers to present the documents correctly at boarding point, helping passengers to store luggage and giving good advice. We left the gate early, so we are able to reach the destination on time with a long flight time of 12h 30. Although the business class meals have been redesigned, the taste was good and the drinking service (also reduced items!) well arranged. I was able to sleep for some hours and so I arrived happy on time at Zurich.

title: Excellent service
review_text: Excellent service. Personalized greeting by a responsible. Outstanding food. Great choise of menus and interesting wine list

title: Very pleasant flight
review_text: The seats are very comfortable with enough leg room, the cabin crew are also very cheerful and friendly . Overall had a pleasant experience. I will definitely travel with Swiss Airlines again !

title: Most miserable First Class ever
review_text:
This trip from JNB to ZRH in Swiss First Class was a total joke. For the amount of money we paid, we got the most miserable, crappy seat ever: no privacy, uncomfortable seating positions, hard bed, barely working controls. The IFE was smaller than my tablet and impossible to watch as it was so grainy.The movie selection was a joke.
Food was ok, but nowhere close other airlines' business class offering and staff was impersonal, distant and almost unfriendly.

The lounge in JNB was not great with limited food options, no champagne and packed with SA frequent fliers.

Worst of all: Despite the miserable experience with regards to the seat, IFE and food  LX even refuses to provide compensation. Never again.

title: Change seats while boarding for weight CoG airplane issues; very umpleasant flight attendant
review_text: Very umpleasant flight attendants changing seats to people without asking if it's good seating in a middle seat (my booking was for a window seat)

title: Comfortable seats
review_text:
The airline is supplied with new aircrafts with very comfortable seats at the economy class. The crew offers bottled water and swiss chocolates for free. 
F&B are charged extra, something that I did not expect from a Swiss company. However I tried a coffee and a sandwich which were ok.

title: Enjoy your flight go by Swiss
review_text: Very pleasent flight good service, excelent Aircraft ( 777 - ER ). Good food & wine. Staff very friendly.

title: Swiss quality service and comfort
review_text:
Great service from boarding to arrival. 
Meals and associated service was top-notch, flight attendants took great care and close attention to the details.
On-board Wi-Fi is on the expensive side of the scale and runs on volume of data usage rather than on time as opposed to the other airlines (39CHF for 120MB).

overall a great experience

title: Very good service
review_text:
We had some stress before our flight because we only had 50 minutes to make a transfer in Zurich.

A few days before our trip we contacted Swiss via Facebook to ask if there was enough time, they reassured us there.

On the flight we were offered a snack and a drink and the staff were very friendly.

I would like to fly again with Swiss.

title: Excellent flight, excellent service!
review_text:
The flight was smooth, taking of and landing very good, good timing.
The cabin service very good, flight attendants polite & careful, snack and drinks good (even chocolate :)).
It was a safe and relaxing flight! I definitely recommend!

title: Overall I am satisfied with their Service
review_text: It was a short flight. However, overall I am satisfied. Very economical and good Service. Big Flight. More Leg Room. Comfortable seats.

title: Had a great flight
review_text:
The Amsterdam - Bangkok connection goes through Zurich, Switzerland. Absolutely no problem because there is plenty of time to change planes. A fast (and funny) train rides between the terminals every 3 minutes. 
The flight to Bangkok was pretty good. Comfortable seats, friendly staff, a tasty, nearly perfect dinner and optional free chocolates and tangerines. The entertainment box is loaded with good and recent movies. I only missed some games like trivia, hangman, etc. but that's a minor problem. Had a great flight anyway!

title: Business class seat too small and tight
review_text: I just flew on Swiss to Sao Paulo and the business class seats on Boeing 777 are small and cramped. I liked everything else - connecting flight, lounge, food, service etc but the business class seats are frankly horrible. I am a normal size 172 cm tall woman and I struggled to get comfy sleeping. The seats and the whole arrangement in the business class section feels very boxed in and tight. Real shame as I was expecting more from Swiss. I also don't like that within business class there are different standards of seats.

title: First time flying Swiss
review_text: My final destination was Paris, the two flights were on time to the minute. The service was very good as the food was. I noticed that the seats space is more than in other airlines.

title: Excellent flight
review_text: Seats are comfortable, food is good variety and the portions are good size and simple,  great flight attendants, super landing.

title: 12 Hour Flight
review_text: Swiss Air had courteous staff, a clean airplane, and we felt safe during  our flight. Good in-air entertainment that included movies, TV shows, music and audio books. For airline food it was decent and they offered snacks and drinks at good intervals throughout the flight. It was a long flight, but I was more comfortable on this flight than some shorter flights I‚Äôve taken both domestic and international. I will fly with them again and highly recommend their airline.

title: Holiday to Temple/pilgrimage
review_text: Swiss Air fantastic airline. Service on board and by ground staff fantatic. We had 5 star treatment. Very easy to transfer from one flight to another minimum time required 25 minutes. They are very organized at Zurich Airport.

title: Excellent Business Class Experience
review_text: Courteous cabin crew. Excellent food and beverage service. Very comfortables lie-flat bed. It's not Emirates, but we didn't have to go home via Dubai. Swiss is the best trans-Atlantic carrier we've flown in the last few years. Better than American or British. Heads above Alitalia.

title: best service
As expected
review_text: This route to Dar is as convenient as they get, with a quick layover in ZRH and a station stop in NBO. Comfortable, friendly, good temperature in the cabin, good entertainment.

title: Chaotic boarding, medical incident handled
review_text: Boarding by zones absolutely makes sense, but not when it means one stressed ground staff shouting out the group numbers, no lines, no proper announcements. Took ages. A lady got sick during the flight and cabin crew asked for a doctor or medically trained person. A gentleman got up and said he‚Äôs a doctor. Cabin crew asked what kind of doctor (he replied ‚Äúa surgeon‚Äù) and she said I‚Äôm a nurse, if you need any help. I‚Äôd have thought credentials should be checked (anyone could claim to be a doctor), but well. Cabin crew handled well overall, brought equipment, moved the seat neighbours to the jump seats and stayed calm.

title: What A Surprise.
review_text:
Very comfort flight no problems on this 8 hour flight.  All the problems occurred at JFK.
If you can avoid flying into JFK NY would highly suggest that.  Booking flights from Gate one for the cruise tour you option choices for booking flight out of USA to Europe.

title: Comfortable planes and good airline food
review_text: My wife and I flew from Boston via Zurich to Florence , Italy on Swiss Air in October . The food and service onboard were excellent and the flights were on time . I was impressed with the condition and comfort of the planes and would definitely choose to fly on  Swiss Air again .

title: Two flights but different experience.
review_text:
The flight from Chicago on a LX9 was disappointing the seats were very narrow and the service and food were average plane fare at best.

Th flight back was the complete opposite, we were on the LX8 and were surprised at the  difference. The food was excellent and the attention to service by the flight crew was terrific. The seats did not seem as narrow an inch or two makes a difference.
We have flown Swiss air before and always found the service to be excellent and would fly the airline again.

title: Great service
review_text: I ordered an inflight surprise of a small bottle of champagne for my wife's birthday. Not only was this courteously delivered but the cabin crew went out of their way to make the most of a special occasion. Full marks to the crew for their attentiveness and kindness.

title: BEST COMPANY!!!
review_text: Loarded very quickly, really comfy aircraft, lovely cabin crew, VERY nice food and drink. VERY NICE SERVICE. Landed on time!!!! BEST ONE!!

title: Old aircraft, not very friendly staff, food not more than ok
review_text:
I was very dissapointed of Swiss overall. The Business Class in this A330-300 is due to renovation since years. Seats not very comfortable, very old entertainment system. Staff was not really friendly and I never felt being a good guest. Food was - compared with earlier years - not more than ok.
As a Senator customer other Staralliance Airlines - e.g. Lufthansa - are treating these customers unique, not Swiss anymore.
Hope it will get better in the future.

title: Swiss International Air Lines
review_text: It was a smooth flight. The flight attendants were courteous and accommodating. They kept you well fed and hydrated.

title: Convenient day flight with excellent service
review_text: The departure time 09h50 and arrival time 15h30 are convenient, but with 12h45 duration it was a somewhat long flight, I enjoyed an excellent, friendly  service in Eco.

title: Economy flight but treatment was first class
review_text: Family vacation to Malaga from Geneva. Economy flight but treatment was first class. From the Geneva check-in, through transfer in Zurich and flight to Malaga, was professional and customer oriented services. My spouse require wheel chair ssistance which was provided in a very pleasant way and a readiness to help. The flight crew in al l legs of the flight were excellent, helpful and pleasant.  Flight was timely and services were excellent. Highly recommend Swiss International..

title: 60th birthday
review_text: Great flight made special by a great crew. Top service excellent food on board, disappointing food in the lounge in Zurich, shame as normally the airport lounge in home hub is the best. Departure and arrival on time priority luggage came out first. Return flight left 25 minute late due to fog in London, amazing pilot made up the time so got back on schedule.

title: Beware Swiss Air
review_text:
This is a copy of a letter I wrote to Swiss Air.  They never responded.That also says a lot about their customer service. 
Let me preface this by saying I have 1.5 million miles on Star Alliance and approximately 500,000 miles on other carriers. This was, without a doubt, the worst flight experience of my life.  When informed that the flight was canceled, there was a rush to the counter.  No extra staff was brought to the site. The gate desk was swarmed and no order or progress was apparent.   As I had a connecting flight to SFO with a short layover in Zurich, I went back to the business lounge to see if they could rebook me.  This is a usual service provided at elite lounges.  I was told they could not rebook me but that this service could be performed at the transfer desk.  At the transfer desk, I was informed that I had to go back to the gate.  At the gate, we were informed that everyone would have to go back to baggage claim, collect their bags then head upstairs to check-in to be rebooked.  As we were traveling with another couple, we split up, half going to the baggage claim to wait, the others going to check-in to rebook.  At check-in we were issued new boarding passes and told to collect our bags.  However, we were booked on separate flights, one couple direct PRA>MUC>SFO.  One couple booked PRA>FRA>MUC>SFO.  I asked to be placed on the same PRA>MUC>SFO routing as our traveling companion and was told that was not possible.  Then we were told the bags would be brought up from baggage claim to check-in so wait here for the bags.  It would be approximately 30 minutes.  I noticed that my PRA>FRA flight was boarding in TEN minutes.  I told the representative of this and again asked to be placed on the PRA>MUC flight, only to again be told this was not possible.  Swiss Air said they would try to get our bags on our flight but had no idea if they could. I needed to head to the gate now.  My wife and I made it to the gate in ten minutes only to find this flight delayed as well.  As time continued to elapse I expressed concern about making the FRA>MUC flight.  Assurances were provided that this would not be a problem.  Then the pilot reported a bird strike on approach and that the flight would be delayed at least an hour.  This meant that we would miss our FRA>MUC flight and as a result miss our connecting MUC>SFO flight.  Again, I asked to be put on the PRA>MUC flight, and again was told it was not possible.  However, they could book me on a United flight FRA>SFO.  I was told to pick up my boarding passes at the gate in FRA as they could not be printed in PRA.  Losing confidence in your staff, I then called United to see if I was booked on the FRA>SFO flight, the answer was no.  I then called Lufthansa and was told I was still on the FRA>MUC>SFO routing.  It appears that the gate agent was willing to keep me on the same routing, knowing I would miss the FRA>MUC connection, abandoning me in FRA and letting me figure out my own way home from there.  I then went back to the gate, found a supervisor and explained the situation to him.  He was able to not only change my itinerary to United but also print the elusive boarding pass for FRA>SFO.  As our friends drove us to SFO on the outbound leg and they were still on the MUC>SFO flight we had to rent a car to get home from SFO.  
At a minimum, I would like an explanation as to why, despite numerous requests, we were not routed PRA>MUC>SFO with our traveling companions.  Reimbursement of the $56.43 car rental fee (receipt available upon request) should be forthcoming.  Additionally, if Swiss Air would consider a discount voucher as in incentive to consider your company in my future travel plans, I‚Äôd appreciate that.  But as it stands now, Swiss Air is on my Do Not Fly list. 
Sincerely,

title: Excellent SWISS Experience.
review_text:
PEOPLE.... TRAVEL BY SWISS IF YOU HAVENT YET. IT WILL REMIND YOU OF HOW CLASSY MOST AIRLINES USED TO BE LONG TIME AGO.
I had to make arrangements to take a different airline to go to Malta as the Air Malta prices have sored sky high and for no apparent reason. The planes are still old and uncomfy. The seats are tightly squeezed together. No more inflight meals that used to happen.The seats and head cloth are always disgusting. The crumbs in the sides of the seats. Used to be amazing until 2013.It has been downhill service and standards wise since but hiked up prices otherwise.
Behold.... Discovered a diffrent route via Zurich. SWISS! Works out ¬£100-200 cheaper and my my what a classy flight. They give you inflight swiss meal bursting with flavours. Free alcohol and drinks. Swiss chocolates after meals. Coffee and tea flowing anytime one wants. Children get entertainmant toys or booklet. The staff are amazing.
The planes are latest Bombardier CS300 aka Airbus 220.
Spatial, clean, tidy and READ THIS AGAIN: PLENTY LEGROOM.
What else can I say. The best shorthaul experience. Even the British Airways cannot match this as most airlines have now become followers of Ryanair when it comes to dry&dirty services. But even Ryanair has improved their standards. Now hows that for Irony.
So, I have been travelling with Swiss now since 2017. Its Swiss for me all the way.

title: So unexpectedly good.
review_text: BA has gone down the drain. This and Lufthansa are now at the very top of my list as ideal airlines. Good planes, good food, overall a very civilised - and civilising - experience.

title: On-time flight despite strikes in Paris!
review_text:
Friendly discrete service with a smile. 
Dinner cheese sandwich (tasty!).
very clean cabin, individual screens above each row's side, passenger announcements regularly. 
Flight captain came and made anouncement himself in 3 languages (this was a first for me)
Chocolate when you leave. Lecker!
Looking forward to my next trip with Swiss

title: Amazing service
review_text: Book my flight many months ago and got a great deal for RT to Barcelona through Zurich. Service was excellent, food, drinks, professionalism and cleanliness of the aircraft.

title: Flight ok
review_text:
Seating seemed a bit cramped. Food and service was ok and as we flew at night mostly tried to sleep. Were offered water during flight.
Would probably not fly long haul again with them.

title: Perfect schedule , tight seats
review_text:
The departure and arrival times are very convenient.
However, it‚Äôs mine and my colleagues opinion that Swiss Air is one of the airlines with the least leg space in the industry.  Tall people definitely have a hard time fitting in their seat.

title: Trip from Zurich to SFO
review_text: Thus  flight was a pleasure. The seats were comfortable, not cramped; the service was excellent. It was a long flight & the attendants continued to come thru the aisles offering water, snacks and anything else that people wanted. The video selection was good and the flight was on time both in take off and landing.....the Swiss efficiency! Highly recommend this airline for an overseas flight.

title: very good experience
review_text:
everything was running fine, punctuality, comfortable seats, good food.
I will recomend to a friend of mine.

title: Late Flights Coming & Going
review_text: The plane returned to Zurich due to smokey smell & potential engine problems.  Upon our return to Zurich, Swiss Air did not communicate where we supposed to wait, or what we were supposed to do to get on the replacement flight or when that replacement flight would happen.  People were wandering all around the airport.   Information that the flight was delayed was not updated on the airline web site so our limo that was to pick us up in Rome had no fore-knowledge of the delay,

title: Great easy and short flight from London City to Zurich
review_text: I have flown with Swiss several times and it's always a pleasure.  Very convenient and a short flight. Highly recommended. Only problem is the worry to get to the airport as have to go via Dartford tunnel which can be very slow.

title: Great service
review_text:
Long flight but easy
Comfortable seats even in economy 
Decent food and very nice staff
Liked the Swiss chocolates

title: Feel like home when entering the aircraft
review_text: I think this applies to all airlines in different countries, when you enter the plane of your own country, you almost feel at home again. Our Swiss flight was good, quiet and the service nice and friendly. For me, Swiss flights are associated with a constant quality and therefore preferred whenever possible.

title: relaxed travelling
review_text: very good service and food, filmselection sufficient. There is just a little issues. With all the spanish announcements around it is nearly impossible to hear or understand the boarding call. With Gates in area J, this will always be like that. And the plane never leaves punctual, but that is not really a problem as they manage to be in Zurich on time.

title: Just Excellent
review_text:
Compared to other Airlines, Swiss offers in its First Class more refinement, more "savoir-vivre", a higher level of personalization and less "bling-bling". Further, the airline is promoting local Swiss specialities, currently dome excellent dishes from the Canton of Grisons.
We had a personal escort from the check-in in BKK through special fast lanes to a dedicated lounge and then a drive to the plane without having to queue at any time until arrived to the seat. Pick-up in ZRH with limousine to First Class Lounge, excellent meal in its gourmet restaurant, then next flight to GVA.
Highly personalized, friendly, professional service on board. Personal welcome by the Captain, Mr. Ruprecht the Ma√Ætre de Cabine and the 2 hostesses in charge of the passengers occupying the 8 seats.
Extremely comfortable bedding and possibility to isolate oneself through a wall in order to increase the privacy during the flight.
Excellent meals and drinks throughout the flight and in the lounges.

title: Very friendly and professional.
review_text:
As usual:
We were addressed with our name.
Service was professional and efficient and friendly.
Special meal (pre-ordered) came automatically.

title: Beautiful, Clean Plane
review_text: Beautiful, newer planes that are well-maintained.  Staff was professional, friendly and efficient.  My husband's seat wouldn't stay up but the attendant was able to fix it quickly.  Flight took off on time.  My only complaint is that their carry-on luggage limit was a smaller size luggage than most other airlines.  We never check our luggage since we don't want it to go missing and because we want to avoid delays waiting for it when we land.  We were required to check our luggage and when we arrived in Copenhagen we had quite a wait to get our luggage.  Not a big deal, just not our preference.

title: Probably the most uncomfortable flight of my life
review_text: I have never flown on such an uncomfortable plane and the staff were just so cold and uncaring.  I was in a row of 3 seats behind a row of 4 seats.  The table was broken and I could not put a drink on it or eat a meal. I did not have a magazine or duty free booklet. The screen was at 45 degrees to my right and did not work despite being reset twice.  The staff must have bashed the seats with their trolleys about 6 times.  It made me think the row of seats had been squeezed in to make more money.  Dreading my flight home with Swissair.

title: Swiss Air Rocks!
review_text: I haven't flown with many different airlines; usually Air Canada and Westjet. In my opinoin, Swiss Air is far superior to both of these airlines. The aircraft and the service were amazing! If I ever have the option again, I would definitely choose Swiss Air!

title: Professional cabin crew | painful seating
review_text: Absolutely nothing but compliments to the cabin crew. However, shame on Swiss Air for the continued use of this seating plan on this route. The seats are uncomfortable, silly small, and "rude" to your lovely passengers. Senior administrators should be required to fly across the Atlantic sitting with the majority of their customers in Economy. Things would change. Very disappointed.

title: A True first class experience
review_text: First class flight attendants, first class service, unbelievably clean cabin. Comfortable pajamas and bed. Had a great 5 hours of sleep. Can't imagine ever flying any other way.

title: An OK Flight
review_text: I flew to Athens as part of a package tour.  There was a stop in Zurich.  It was a long flight.  The flight was typical for economy class.  There was nothing great or bad on the flight.

title: Paid for exit row, got middle
review_text: What a mess. I paid, well in advance, for two exit row seats only to get middle rubbish on check in. I did not notice the change until I arrived at the lounge and then started to work with the staff for a change, to very little avail. I then asked her to get me a cost for an upgrade to business . She told me the price which was acceptable, said she had to check availability. When I went back the price had gone up substantially so I quit trying to work anything further and took the crap seats they gave us (without a refund for what I had paid for and never got). Horrific service at the Logan Airport on the part of Swiss.

title: A very good airline
review_text: I cannot knock it. The staff and service were superb, seats and legroom was comfortable. The pilot offer a very comfortable flight. Check in and boarding was seamless. You can check luggage in swizerland upto 24 hrs in advance.

title: GOOD EXPERIENCE ON A SHORT HOP
review_text: Our first experience with Swissair and must say very pleasant. We flew Swissair flight LX1830, ZRH - ATH on 12/08 on an A321. Plane had no entertainment or electrical though. Breakfast was served about 30 minutes after departure, food was very good. Arrived at the gate at 1305. For a first experience it left a favorable impression.

title: Numb Legs - 777
review_text:
If you need a civilized legroom... forget Swiss. Its triple 7 is a shame.

Do you like numb legs? Swiss will proudly provide you.

I also ordered a gluten free meal... Needless to say that a I had no meal.

The Staff team tried to do their best - it was a good point.

I just don't understand how they configure a brand new triple seven with a Ryanair legroom and width (for a 11 hours flight)

title: Worst long-haul flight experience ever
review_text:
It started with a faulty seat - the control buttons at my seat were not working, and unfortunately ended up the most disturbing long-haul flight experience I ever had. Keeping 1 star for the food, removing 4 stars for the ineffective and cold service. 

Instead of solving the issue in the very beginning, the flight attendant first asked me to wait and 1 hour later she chose to manually adjust the seat to 150 degree (not perfect, but tolerable enough for napping). Towards the end of the long flight, when I tried to revert the seat to upright position, it didn't work. Naturally I reached out to a flight attendant who happened to be passing by for help. Nevertheless, this flight attendant started repeatedly scolding me for "manipulating" the seat and "endangering" the flight system; despite that I explained to her that it was done by the previous flight attendant. After several rounds of communication with different flight crew members, I was transferred to sit in an empty seat while waiting (indefinitely) for the first flight attendant who "knew" how to adjust seat to appear and rescue the "endangered" seat. After another 1 hour wasted in waiting, and I noticed that the seat was magically in upright position on my way to the bathroom. No one informed me that I could return to my seat, nor offered any apology for the false accusation. 

Overall, the awful experience could have been avoided if Swiss Airline has done any ONE of the following things : 1) airline checked to ensure that their seats are fully functioning before onboarding passengers; 2) flight attendant offered a new seat to replace the faulty one when first notified of the issue; 3) fight attendant at least listened to what passenger was saying before issuing direct accusations; which helped nothing in solving the seat problem. 

Compared to Qantas, BA and UA, Swiss Airline gave me the worst business class experience.

title: Never buy a ticket from Swiss airlines
review_text: My girlfriend bought a ticket. Got a mail it was confirmed. When she gets to the airport they say that the flight was overbooked and they refunded her money. Ridiculous. No compensation. No new ticket. Just a simple: buy a new ticket

title: Nice Flight Experience
review_text: The seats, food and service were good. What I liked the most about the airline was that they ensured that I reached the final arrival point (Basel) even if my flight to Zurich was delayed. They provided with a free flight ticket from Zurich to Basel, as my connecting train could have been missed.

title: Relaxing flight on Swiss Air
review_text:
Just had a great experience with a flight from San Francisco to Zurich overnight. Good food, friendly service and arrived early, what more can you ask for üòâ.
Legroom is a bit tight, but the seats were comfortable and the plane seems to be insight very well cared for. Will use SWISS again.

title: Swiss is the new word for perfection
review_text: Everything was beyond perfection on this flight. Food and wine was impressive and the seats was amazing. After dinner time for pyjamas and most likely the best bed in the sky on my list! WOW!!!!!

title: DO NOT TAKE THIS CROOK OF AN AIRLINE
review_text:
DO NOT TAKE THIS USELESS AIRLINE! 

My partner had a connecting flight in Hong Kong with Swiss Air from Sydney. She had an infected pimple which initially the airline said was fine to travel with. They then denied her boarding of the flight and left her in Hong Kong with NO Swiss AIr desk in the airport. She spent 12 hours in the airport trying to rebook a flight. She subsequently was told that they would preliminarily book her on a flight but not charge her until she was medically cleared. She did not get clearance but they charged her 700 euros anyway. She then ended up in hospital and I had to book her another flight for another 700 euros as they marked her down as a no show for the rebooked flight that she never consented to paying for. I spoke to at least three agents saying that under Swiss Air policy we would get a refund if we could show she was denied access to the flight due to medical reasons. We presented Swiss Air with all the evidence, doctors notes and all and they denied our claim for a refund of both flights (even though one was never meant to be charged in the first place) on the grounds that it was unfair to other passengers that she get a refund for one flight that they never should have charged her for in the first place and second flight that under European law and their OWN policy they should refund. They then subsequently proceeded to close our complaint and refund issue so that they did not have to deal with it. I should mention the other issues we have had with them; 
- whilst my partner was sick in the hong kong airport a Swiss Airline help centre person pretended not to speak english so he did not have to deal with her. 
-Swiss air refused to give me a receipt reflecting the correct amount for the aeroplane fee that I paid despite this being Australian law. This will be reported to the ACCC. 
-We had numerous contact centre people telling us that under Swiss air policy we would get a refund yet they decided to refuse it due to it being unfair to other passengers! 

Swiss Air you need to hold yourself to account for your appalling behaviour and your breaking of your own policy. We will be reporting you to the ACCC and the equivalent statutory bodies in Hong Kong and France. We will also be getting Cathay Pacific involved as they had to end up looking after my partner who you stranded in Hong Kong and subsequently thought it would be okay to charge for a flight that she never gave consent to you charging her nor did you get medical clearance for her to even book the flight. 

I hope you are happy with yourselves you crooks.

title: Good flight experience
review_text: Have not flown with this airline in years. Was glad fly with Swiss again. Was not disappointed. The service was very good, friendly cabin crew and the meal served was just right and tasty.

title: Loved the service and excellent menu on two long flights!
review_text:
As there is no direct flight from Tokyo to Barcelona, we booked on Swiss LX 161 from Tokyo Narita to Zurich and after a comfortable break in a Zurich international airport cafe, to Barcelona on Swiss LX1956.
We loved the service! Great meals on both flights and a beverage list to match!
Luggage was automatically put on the second flight and the whole exercise was seamless.

title: Note double passport control
review_text:
We were on a connecting flight originating in Barcelona going to Zurich.  We thought we had plenty of time to make our connection to Chicago, BUT note that there are TWO separate passport control checks going to the US.  The lines were outrageously long and apparently are always that way as officials in Zurich strongly urged that we get going due to the lines.
This not a reflection on Swiss Air, just a reality of the airport logistics.  The walk was very long.  Our Swiss Air flight was fine and there was no issue with baggage.

title: Swiss Air charged me money, but did not book my flight
review_text:
I was booking  a flight with Swiss Air from Skopje to Geneva on their official website The company charged my Visa Debit Card, but did not issue me a flight reservation. I called them to complain. Their customer service has been rude, arrogant and almost a week has passed and I am still waiting to get update from them.

In the meantime the prices of the flights went up and I am still on stand by to hear from them. They did not even try to offer to compensate for the higher costs of reserving a new flight.

Ver frustrating!!! I will never fly with Swiss Air again.

title: Swiss quality in both economy and business class
review_text:
Swiss air has a good reputation for good reasons.
Even on short flights you get food, snacks and drinks.
Good leg space and friendly staff.
Business class is also very good and the menu offered on long haul flights is great.

title: This is how an airline should treat its passengers.
review_text:
I was visiting friends in Firenze and in Piacenza. Linate is closed for a few months, but anyway, I was returning home and won't fly ELAL on principle. 
So I took the frecciarossa [express] train from Piacenza to Milano Centrale, then the Cisalpino to Zurich, stayed overnight at the hotel built onto the airport, and flew home to Israel the next morning.
The service was first-rate from start to finish. It was comfortable, courteous and efficient.
I look forward to my next flights on Swiss, in late Jan.2020, from Bangkok [in First] to Zurich, and then from Zurich [in Club] home to Israel.

title: Swiss Air Great flight , but uncomfortable seating .
review_text:
The Swiss Air departure & Arrival were on-time. the service was good and bath rooms
were kept in good condition during the long flights. But the seating place was very tide
and not suitable for eleven hours flights with fully crowded seats.

title: Great all around
review_text: Very impressed with the service.  Flight took off on time, great crew and very attentive.  Food was good and passed by often for snacks and drinks.  Great movie selection(free) definitely helped on the long flight and again no charge for earphones.  Also complimentary blankets.

title: so professional
review_text: I upgraded to business for an extra 50chf, with this my luggage was included, I got to choose a front row seat, included in upgrade. fast track through security, business lounge, free food and drinks. first on plane. arrived on plane, free water and free food and drink. sometimes a set menu or a la carte. wine topped up. service exceptional for a short flight.  a few of the UK based airlines should take a few tips from this one.  Thank you for a lovely flight

title: Better than average economy flight from Hong Kong to Zurich
review_text:
We recently flew from Hong Kong to Munich, including a first-leg flight from Hong Kong (HKG) to Zurich (ZRH) with Swiss Airlines. Flight was overall pretty good, meeting our expectations for a long distance carrier. 

Flight was booked with partnering airline Lufthansa earlier in the year. Received email confirmations and communication from both Lufthansa and Swiss Airlines prior to our flight. Check-in at HKG was quick and easy. 

Our overnight flight departed a few minutes late but was overall a very smooth and seamless flight. We were able to rest pretty well, sleeping a handful of hours in between watching movies on the flight entertainment system, which included a fair number of shows and tv programmes. Flight attendants where friendly, food served in flight was just ok, pasta dinner was average, morning egg and sausage, the same. 

Flight arrived in Zurich on time, transfer to our connecting flight to Munich with Helvetic Airways was rather straight forward in Zurich, luggage as transferred just fine to Helvetic, wrapping up a pretty good experience with Swiss Airlines, a carrier we'd have no problem using again for flights to Europe from Hong Kong.

title: Carry-on Nazies
review_text: This was the 2nd leg of our flight from Washington DC to Lisbon. The first leg was run by United. Swiss Air picked on my five year old daughter's carry-on. A barely 10 lb hard-cover baggage. I was told that it won't fit the airplane comportment so I have to check it in and pay 60 Franc for it. Mind you that United did not have any problem with any of our carry-ons. We get into the Swiss airplane and low and behold I see at least 20 carry-ons bigger than my daughter's sitting comfortably on the compartments. I will never ever fly with Swiss for breaking my daughter's heart, lying to us, and charging us 60 Franc for a non-issue.

title: Good flight
review_text: My experience with Swiss this time was good. Flight was on time and the service was good. They were trying a new boarding system of groups which was a bit strange as although I was sitting next to my husband we were not in the same boarding group. It seems all window seats bord first. I am not convinced this made boarding faster, but any new way to board is worth a try.

title: Nice airline!
review_text: Nice airline. Best snack on board i have had for a short European flight. Friendly and helpful staff on board.

title: It's always a pleasure to fly with Swiss
review_text: On time, smiling crew and very patient with many people ....would have never expected such a crowd to Spain in November! Flight was Geneva Zurich and Zurich Valencia. Food was cool on the longer hawl and everything on time.The only landing, a little bit harsh, was Geneva Zurich. The others velvet. The key point is the patience and kindness of the crew.

title: Arrogance and unprofessional attitude of the ground staff in Geneva Airport
review_text:
I do not have any complaints about the flight as such (the one which departed at 10:00 on 18.09.2019) ‚Äì it was a regular Geneva ‚Äì Zurich 35 minutes flight. It was on 18 September 2019, though I was booked for the flight which was departing at 11:00.

The problem was that I was forced by the Swiss ground staff, I guess that it was the SwissPort, to take earlier flight which was departing at 10:00.

I was blackmailed that, if I did not take the earlier flight, I would miss my connection to Corfu in Zurich (‚Äúmy‚Äù flight scheduled to leave at 11:00 left Geneva exactly at 11:00).

I can give more detailed account of what had happened (including the need to repatriate my car from the airport parking and bringing my wife by taxi to the airport within less than one hour before the departure), but I guess that it could be too late to go into all the details.

I have been the loyal customer of Swiss since 1984. Working in the international organisation based in Geneva, I used to fly from Geneva airport 5-10 times a year. It was for the first time I confronted on 18 September 2019 with such an unprofessional, arrogant and incompetent performance of the Swiss ground staff. These people simply did not care and were totally unprofessional.

As I mentioned I used to flew with Swiss from Geneva for 35 years and I considered it to be the best airline in the world. 

I‚Äôm afraid that I‚Äôm going to change my mind.

title: Best airline
review_text: Such a great airline.  The flight attendants passed by often with a lot of food and snacks. The meals were good quality and tasty. Snacks were also left in area by restrooms so people could help themselves,  I loved that they had cough drops out to help the dryness from flying.  Look forward to flying again.

title: First experience
review_text: It was my first time fliying in Swiss Airlines, but for me and my parents was the best flight we ever had, even in the economy class the tripulation was so kind with us, and the food was really great, we really enjoy

title: flight to Maldives with connection in Zurich
review_text:
great service, pitty they did not serve vegan meals , but, anyway, it was better than ok. Staff very pleasant and helpful, he wessel itself comfortable, good flight
.

title: Good flight
review_text: Very efficient flight attendants and comfortable flight. Flat bedding a bit cramped. The business lounge at Zurich was just OK. Didn't eat during the flight, just consumed many bottles of water. Nice flight.

title: Excellent Service!
review_text:
Overall great service! Blankets were also clean & Fresh!

8/10 Ratings imho! 

We did miss checked bags and they did not arrive till next day in New York, However staff was very helpful and we got out bags next day. Please make sure you check this with boarding gate before boarding the aircraft as they can tell if your checked luggage is loaded!

title: Easy travel -Courteous Personnel
review_text: The total experience was easy and the staff ( including counter personnel),  made the experience through Zurich memorable. They were even more helpful as the need for assistance was not a problem for them.8

title: Swiss Airlines Flight to UK from Australia
review_text:
Flew with Swiss Airlines from Singapore via Zurich to Heathrow International London.
The staf were excellent, the food was good seats comfortable, but the plane was a little old, and was showing signs of probably running its flight life a little too long. We had window seats , but a family in the middle row had an eternity of problems with there seat not converting to a bed for sleeping, the crew tried everything they could but the seats would not convert for this poor family returning back to Zurich.
All in all a pleasant flight but there fleet obviously needs some upgrades.

title: My first experience with Swiss Air and it was great.
review_text: I ended up on Swiss Air as a United Code Share flight. Having never flown them before I was nervous. The crew was great, plane in great shape. Business Class is standard European where they just block out the middle seat which is fine by me. Meal was very good, crew attitude amazing. Business lounge in Zurich is more than adequate (breakfast) and blows the US airlines out of the water. Will certainly consider Swiss Air for future travel in Europe.

title: Swiss Airlines SCAM
review_text:
When u get your boarding pass at check in counter they‚Äôll tell you it costs 50$ USD for your bag you have with you and you have to check your bag in With them no matter what it‚Äôs forced!... this is a scam

Hold on to your bag until you get to the gate and they will ask to check it for FREE...

Horrible service airline... would not recommend ... big scam... will never fly again... shame on you Swiss Airlines you are a joke

title: Leisure trip with friend
review_text: Flew Swiss Airlines from Prague to Zurich and Zurich to Chicago. The first plane was small and did what it needed to as it was not even an hour long flight. The long flight from Zurich to Chicago was not comfortable. The legroom was less than average & once the person in front of us reclined their seat we had no room to eat or partake in inflight entertainment due to the angle of the seat. When they reclined their seat back they were so close they knocked my friend‚Äôs drink into her lap. For a 9+hour flight this was claustrophobic and uncomfortable. The service was wonderful though. The flight attendants were very friendly & the food & drink services were well planned. The most important thing on a long flight is to provide enough water as swelling and dehydration are real concerns. I‚Äôve had other times where you feel like a burden requesting additional water, not the case here. Bathrooms attended & available. Could also use updated choices for inflight entertainment as there were hardly any new release movies or games.

title: Excellent and most friendly service
review_text: On this direct flight from LAX to ZRH we experienced one of the best and especially most friendly service ever. Maitre de Cabine Sonderegger and his crew were all very much dedicated to make our flight as comfortable as possible. Often you do not have the feeling that the cabin crew is really enthusiastic about their job. This was a totally different expirience. The only thing for me to moan about are the business seats. To short and the leg rest does not extend as one would wish while lounging or being seated. They are not wide either.

title: Cancelled my flight without notice
review_text:
Due to sickness of my grandmother, I decided to take an earlier outbound flight to Amsterdam to visit her. 

Upon arrival for my return flight to Z√ºrich at the airport, I was told I could not receive a boarding pass because my booking was cancelled. I was offered option to book a new one-way ticket for 450 Euros. No thanks!

I didn't receive any message of this beforehand. It's a horrible customer service and a shortsighted way of treating your (not anymore future) customers. The chocolate tastes good, but the service is horrible!

title: Average flight
review_text:
Check-in and boarding process was smooth and efficient. Boarding was by class of services but it turned out to be alright. 

Inflight entertainment is average as compare to most of the SE Asia or ME airlines. The food was slightly below average, but the crews were efficient. Crew constantly walked the aisle with water services, snacks and bottle of waters were provided at alley as well, definitely a plus for a 12 hours flights. Toilet was clean but with limited amenities. 

Overall, it was an average flight. Most of the crews were friendly and helpful (but not all). We got the ticket with good price so it is still a good deal for us.

title: Short haul flight but every bit as good
review_text: Having arrived from Nairobi we had several hours stop over before our flight to the UK. Fortunately we were able to use the Swiss airline lounge to relax, and for some time appeared to have it almost to ourselves. With food and drinks provided it was just what was needed after the long flight. When we left and arrived at our gate, although the queuing was a little erratic, boarding was smooth and we soon settled down for the flight home. Snacks and drinks were served during the short flight, by a friendly crew, keen to please. Our second flight with Swiss in relatively quick succession and every bit as good as the first.

title: Just an all round good reason to fly Swiss.
review_text: We booked 'code share' flights through United Airlines, with whom we hold 'frequent flyer' status, and although we were unable to choose our seats without incurring additional charges we were automatically allocated exit row seats, which otherwise attract an additional charge, allowing alternative seats to be selected at check-in if we wished. Staff on the plane were exceptional, friendly, helpful, polite and attentive, passing through the cabin regularly during the long flight with water for those still awake enjoying the entertainment channels. for those needing a 'chocolate rush' Swiss chocolate was served as a taster before we landed. Just an all round good reason to fly Swiss.

title: Extra leg room/entertainment
review_text: More of a question than a review. I‚Äôm flying from Geneva to JFK on Saturday 30th November and am thinking of booking extra leg room in row 22 or 29. My question is do you still have access to an entertainment screen? It‚Äôs an Airbus A330.

title: not suitable for families
review_text:
Our flight with our 1y old son was just really hard. He wasn't allowed to play on the floor (especially booked a place with more leg-space for an additional CHF 100.- p.P.). Nothing to play for him provided by the crew. Nothing special for a young child. The staff wanted to hand me over my food, while I was obviously holding him and didn't have a free hand to grab my food.
the baby cot wasn't available for him on this 10h flight, because, he's over one year old (not a kg maximum).

title: What happened to business class service SWISS
review_text: Punctual, yes. Clean and comfortable yes. But what happened to SWISS inflight meal service on this stretch. A few month ago there were imaginative little snacks being distributed. Now it was one croissant and a cup of coffee in a cardboard cup. Why this sudden dropping of standards to the budget airline level? What is next, we'll have to pay for our croissant?  Very disappointing, SWISS. Time to review your standards.

title: Excellent Flight
review_text: We took this flight from Rome to Zurich on our way to Chicago. The flight was short and for this reason the seats were nothing special but we felt quite comfortable as they leave the adjacent seat empty for business class passengers. The service was wonderful with a good breakfast during this one hour flight. Tomasz Pigan who was the flight attendant on that day was absolutely one of the best we had during this trip (we were on different flights during this tour). He paid constant attention to every passenger in our section and was wonderful to talk to. All in all, a very nice short flight to Zurich.

title: Nothing special
review_text:
Comfortable flight but prebooked seats  were moved from window and aisle to two aisle seats. Why did they separate us? This has happened before with Swiss. We flew via Zurich who did not get our luggage transferred. That came a day later. No kind of apology was received.
In flight snacks are very average. Sorry but the flights were nothing special and not cheap.

title: leave it to the Swiss
review_text: Flight with 50 minute connection in Zurich... and had to check a bag. Any other carrier I‚Äôd have crossed my fingers and toes... but not Necessary  with Swiss airlines. Me and my bag arrived on time and on the same flight. Bravo!

title: Swiss air
review_text: We took the Swiss air flight to Athens via Zurich and via Geneva on the return. For a Business class trip it was a very reasonable price.We used the airport lounges which all very good except Geneva where the food was very limited. The flight itself was fine and the service was extremely good. The only fault was our case ended up in Geneva instead of Athens although I not sure where the blame lies here. Otherwise I would certainly use them again.

title: Alles tip-top
review_text: Hat alles top-top geklappt. Sitzplatzresevation, Service, P√ºnklichkeit , Check-in sehr speditiv u.s.w.

title: Best Flight Crew!
review_text:
I would personally like to thank the flight crew aboard the aircraft 320 
(Flight LX1412) from Zurich (6:55) --> Belgrade (8:35) on September 24, 2019 for the warm birthday wishes and gifts :))
That was such a pleasant surprise in the early hours of my day. 
Swiss was always one of my number one choices but after this top quality gesture it's now my favorite. 
Thank you, Milan, Luca, Thomas, and Cus.

title: Super harsh, harassing experience if you're just 5 min late to check-in
review_text:
The biggest concern was the way Swiss airlines (LX 38) handled my check-in.  I arrived about 5m late and was refused boarding even though I was over 1 hr early to the airport.   In most cases, other airlines would have accommodated me though I was technically late.  The main reason I was 5 minutes late is because their signage at the SFO airport was entirely missing from the directory so I scoured the airport for 10 minutes looking for the counter.

In addition, Swiss refused to help me re-book the flight to the next flight.  Instead, they directed me to a phone to re-book where I had to spend more than $1600 additional to get on the next flight. I've never experienced this type of rejection and treatment before and it will make me use every effort to avoid Swiss airlines in the future.  I hope this type of treatment would not extend to other Star Alliance airlines.  

It appears that Swiss has made a corporate decision not to support re-booking at the counter and treat customers who are late by a few minutes as outcasts and penalize them with additional fees of thousands of dollars to get where they need to go.  In particular, I found the business manager to be harassing as well.  He paged me to lecture me on the check-in policy and threatened to pull me off the next flight after I paid $1600.

title: Horrible Customer Service
review_text: Recently we received two letters from Swiss Air Accounting services located in the Philippines. One took over two months to reach us, the other, which we signed for took nearly a month. We were threatened with a lawsuit claiming that their system had flagged us as not having paid for a business class upgrade we had bid on and purchased. This was a flight over TWO YEARS AGO! With an incredible stroke of luck my husband still had the original email receipts and e tickets from Swiss Air which we forwarded to them. This was not enough. We had to research every credit card we may have used during that time. Finally we located the charges on an Amex statement that Amex located in their archives and provided to us, again from two years ago. We provided Swiss Air with receipts, tickets, transaction details, credit card details and copies of statements repeatedly. They continue to ask for the same information we have already provided multiple times. This was their error which caused us hours of wasted effort under threat of legal action. We have dealt with the same team members and reached out to senior executives in Zurich without resolution. We have exhausted our time and patience with this matter with no end in sight. We have filed a complaint with the DOT which they have forwarded separately to the airline. We will never take a chance on flying this airline again. We were lucky enough to have our records but I think of my elderly mother-in-law who would have felt intimidated into paying them thousands of dollars she did not owe. You are never safe flying this airline. They can randomly come after you years after a flight. If anyone has any suggestions we would appreciate hearing them.

title: Long Haul flights-not a forte of Swiss
review_text:
I have had contrasting experiences of flying to and from Nairobi with Swiss. On the outbound flight the flight attendants seemed at best disinterested and at worst felt they were doing you favour by providing service (LX 294 on 13th November). On the return flight the service was markedly better (LX 296) and the flight attendants genuinely interested in providing service. 
Recently, I have had long haul flights with several airlines-Cathay pacific, ANA and QANTAS and generally they were better in terms of service, food and definitely leg space. The range of entertainment on Swiss was also relatively limited. i was genuinely disappointed by this experience as my first experience of flying with Swiss was from Nairobi to Zurich and it was really special!. Times have changed!

title: Good but not as good as it thinks it is...
review_text:
We flew business class from London to Zurich and then onto Hong Kong.  The short haul legs of the flight were efficient and smooth but the real test was the 12 hour flight to and from HK. Here the experience was mixed.

The cabin was clean and fresh but the business class seat configuration felt cramped. Although there were some nice touches such as the drawer under the TV screen. Media was average for such as long flight with a limited range of films and TV and compared to Emirates it was very weak here.  On our return journey the whole entertainment system had to be rebooted and too 25 minutes...hmmm.Food was well presented but not very special and the food on the return journey was especially pedestrian. Staff were friendly  but its very odd that for first 40 minutes of the flight out nothing happens - no drinks, no visible member of staff.

Of course the key thing is flight safety and here Swiss do really well. Overall a reasonable experience

title: What a well run airline!!
review_text: Well for those of you that follow my reviews you know I can be very direct and to the point. So let me not disappoint you here. This airline is fantastic!! As compared to Iberia Swiss Air is head and shoulders over them. Most German/Swiss Airlines are run efficiently, and with precision and customer service in mind. I cannot say that about Iberia as I have reported previously. We travel to Malaga frequently during the year and continue to look for the best airline to get there and return. During the off season of the Fall its more difficult, but during the season definitely try to fly Swiss Air. You will not regret this recommendation

title: Pleasure trip
review_text: Very good experience. Clean, punctual, non jerky, comfortable flight. Food options were good. Convenient timing.

title: Like a Swiss watch...
review_text:
It was a delight to fly on Swiss Air again. We haven't used this airline in several years due to the discontinuance of their direct Newark to Basel route. However due to a good fare we made arrangements to fly to Zurich instead to save some money. Much to our delight we received a free upgrade to Business Class on our first flight and were able to bid and win Business Class seats on our return also!

Swiss has nice "pod like" seating with comfortable seats that also convert to a full flat "bed". Seats also have built in firmness and massage controls. With plenty of leg room it was easy to enjoy the 8 hour flight. Meals were very god for airline food and were served hot and quickly. All beverages and alcohol were included and the fare. Extra snacks were also available if you were still hungry. Hit towels were distributed and the rest room had additional creams and other HBA's to keep you feeling fresh. 

Each seat has a small work space with plenty of outlets and USB connections so you can do whatever you need to do electronically. WiFI was also available. My return seat actually had even more work spaces that the first seat. Entertainment was "on-demand" and included many movies, music and TV choices.

The lounges were also a nice places to grab a meal and relax either before or after your flights. SURE beats flying Economy! Dont get me wrong Swiss Economy was not bad either but the lounges really make waiting around for you your flight a delight.
 lastly,,,Like a Swiss watch we were right on Schedule or a few minutes ahead on both take offs and landings in both directions.

title: More comfortable than most flights
review_text: We had flown on Swiss air previously but on a  much shorter flight. The plane appeared to be brand new with a taller cabin which made it feel much more roomy. The flight attendants were very friendly & accommodating. The seats were very comfortable and each passenger received a pillow, blanket & earphones to view tv shows and current movies on a screen which is  positioned  on the back of the seat in front of them. The food service was very good with a choice between two different options one being vegetarian. The meal also included free wine and beer. I would definitely fly with Swiss air in the future.

title: Holidays
review_text: The Aircraft and crew were amazing both outbound and inbound. Always love flying with Swiss. Special assistance services was great at both the airports.

title: Italy
review_text: Travel to Rome and Naples.  Pay for what you get. Economy very uncomfortable with seats that decline into your lap. Additional charges for checked bags and internet add to cost. Boarding process is everyone for themselves after initial first class boa ding.  Attendant in Naples was very helpful to ensure we and our luggage made our tight connecting flights. Flight departures and arrivals were close to schedule.

title: Nice airline - but watch for the carry-on requirements
review_text: This was a great airline but their carry on restrictions are strict.  When checking into my flight they checked the weight and you guessed it I was overweight so I ended up paying the $60.00 checked bag fee.  While I saw may passengers that had bags that were siimilar size and weight they did not have the same issue - it does make you wonder why some people are picked out and others are not (I was not alone in having to go and pay)

title: Consistently good service in the air, usually good service on the ground
review_text: I try to always fly Swiss, their service is the most consistent in it quality.  The seating is comfortable, the food is excellent and the crew are always friendly, knowledgeable and courteous.The only down point is Miles and More which is quite stingy with its points and although I have taken many business class flights, still cannot make it to gold.

title: Journey to Hungry
review_text: This plane ride was the worst flight. It was assigned to us through Viking. The width between seats was so small and cramped for a 8 hour overnight flight. The cabin had no vents over the seats making the ventilation scares and ver warm. They also provided an extra head rest area which was uncomfortable and just in the way.

title: Swiss Air flight to and from Zurich
review_text: Flight was fine - not the roomiest, but adequate.  The service was wonderful!  I was able to check in and grab a window seat online both ways.

title: Weak first class
review_text: Weak service. Not frist class. Same style since many yeras. Lack of innovation. Hektik environment although few passangers.

title: the best airline in my opinion.
review_text: In my opinion the best airline out there at the moment. I have flown with many different airlines but Swiss stand out for me. the customer service is great, staff are always happy and helpful. I'll always book Swiss given the opportunity.

title: Swiss is poorly represented with Aviapartner at Nice airport
review_text: Aviapartner gave me three(!) contrary price information for a Swiss ticket ait the Nice Airport. That makes Aviapartner absolutely unnecessary. They provide passenger #services Very poor!   I have ALWAYS good service experiences with Swiss, but unfortunately Swiss is poorly represented in Nice at the airport.

title: Not generous at all
review_text: It was last October 2019. We flew to Athens with Aegean and back to Geneva with Swiss and could not avoir to compare both. The Greek flight attendants looked like cheerful goddesses and we enjoyed a right and substantial meal although Greece is in such a bad financial state nowadays, absolutely independent from its inhabitants' own will. Beauty is a treat and I sure should not focus so much as I am a woman, and a woman who loves men. But the flight back was a disaster, attendants like little worn-out soldiers, just a tiny bottle of water and a chocolate-for-kids, although the flight was long and delayed. Greek passengers were patient and polite, but as I could not refrain myself from telling one of the attendants how very mean this flight had been from such a rich country - I am unfortunately Swiss myself - two Greek men nodded in assent, not feeling appropriate from them to say the same...

title: Cancelled my flight with no refund and then made me by a new one
review_text: Terrible service. Cancelled my flight WITHOUT TELLING ME and with no refund! They then charged me to buy a new flight. Will never fly with Swiss again.

title: Have to Pay to Reserve Seats
review_text:
Our flight from Johannesburg, South Africa to Chicago included an ~11 hour flight to Zurich, Switzerland and then a ~10 hour flight from there to O'Hare.  The food seemed slightly better than it had been on our originating airline of Ethiopian Airlines.

My biggest issue was that we had to pay extra to reserve our seats. It was $150 to reserve both of our seats for both legs of the flight. With as lengthy as our flights were, I didn't want to risk us not getting seats next to each other.

Once at the Switzerland airport, we got our first taste of Switzerland prices when the smallest size Starbucks PSL ended up costing $8.84 USD, so that is definitely the most expensive seasonal latte I've ever had!

title: Rude and disrespectful staff at London Heathrow
review_text:
I have never experienced the level of disrespect that I met with at Swiss Airlines in London Heathrow. The staff said her name was ‚ÄúEva‚Äù ( short, dark skinned ,middle aged, black women with braids is a circular form) tells me I have to wait because she cannot log into her computer.
