Then another man walks up and says he‚Äôs running late for a flight and the ‚ÄúEva‚Äù proceeds to log into her computer and assist this man ahead of me. I expressed my dissatisfaction with the lack of respect for me as a customer. Eva was rude and very condescending towards me. I could not help but feel there were great racial discriminatory undertones to this situation. The late passenger was a white man and I am a black female. 
 I snapped a picture of her and she went running. She yelled that she would have me removed from the plane. I told her I was taking her picture to report her atrocious behavior towards me. There was another white male behind me that supported my actions and even spoke up on my behalf to express that it was wrong to allow the late passages to jump the line. Thankfully a manger named Pria came and heard me out and said she would investigate. She understood that the whole matter could have been resolved by showing respect for all customers.

title: very nice flight
review_text: smooth flight with a good service, decent lunch with a good choice of drinks. Nice to get a very good swiss chocolate at the end. Good and easy boarding procedure, short flight but on time and luggage arrived well and good. Great swiss lounge in Zurich

title: Top Service
review_text: We had to use a bus to get to the aircraft. All service personnel was very friendly and  attentive. Plenty of space because the flight was not fully booked. Weather conditions were mixed so we had a rough landing. Is this a helpful review? Then please give me a "Thumbs up Thank FrankGeisler" by clicking the button below.

title: Luggage destroyed, claim ignored for 2 months and counting
review_text: My suitcase was bashed so hard with other luggage (or something) that the telescoping metal rods inside which form the handles were bent and flattened.  Of course, there's no way the handle will ever go up or down again, so the luggage is useless unless I want to lean over, and push it down streets and terminals. Swissair requires that a claim be filed within only a few days of damage, which I did, with photos and luggage cost receipt.  It has now been completely ignored, not even an auto-reply, for 2 months.  Advice: either travel with super strong hard-side luggage, or don't travel with Swissair at all.  Luggage is disposable at Swissair.

title: Excellent Timing and comfort
review_text: Excellent timing and comfort. Relaxed checkin experience. I would like have better food and beverage. Swiss Chocolate is excellent.

title: Great service!
review_text:
We had a stop in Zurich, so for this short flight we got a crossant and coffee (because it was morning). Then with our second flight to Naples we got lunch: A panini and white wine. and before landing some Swiss chocolat.
Never seen this before on a short flight.

title: Rude cabin staff and worn down business class experience
review_text:
- My beef dinner smelled like a foot.
- The staff was rude.
- Overall the cabin looked worn and sad.
- Swiss service is reminded me of Air India in quality at four times the price.

title: Ever so reliable Swiss Airlines - now warmer than ever before!
review_text: Swiss is an efficient flying eco-system. The flight in review was no different. The check in was efficient. Flight was eventless. My special meal request was respected even for a short flight and I got a veggie samosa for AVML breakfast. Business class seats in Europe are a joke. This was no different but this is also true for all airlines in Europe. Here lies the opportunity for the airlines. Otherwise all good!

title: About Swiss Air Flight Services
review_text: After a couple of months, I had to fly with this airline because I am a travel show host. Because of my career, I traveled a lot. The airline was very convenient and decent. Call customer service at +1-888-202-5328 for further data. We support us with immediate reservations and their hospitality was also amazing.

title: Uncomfortable seats
review_text: The crew was wonderful, but the seats were the most uncomfortable of any airline that we have been on. The cushions were thin and hard. I could not get comfortable during the entire 10 hour trip. We were scheduled to return from Zurich to SFO on Swiss Air, but they cancelled the flight the night before. We ended up having to fly to Toronto on Air Canada. Luckily, those seats were comfortable.

title: Travelling Cph to Z√ºrich for work
review_text: Swiss air is pure class! From not only being on schedule, but actually event ahead, an almost 2-hour flight, reduced to 1,5 hours, was the smoothest ride ever! A joy, with a lot of leg room, pleasant crew, and decent snack. Still and quiet flight; well recommended!

title: Good service, friendly crew but uncomfortable seats...
review_text: Visiting friends in L.A. and going for a 3 week trip in California we wanted to travel non-stop from Zurich. Therefore we had no other alternative than choosing SWISS. I am not particularly fond of their business seats on the Boeing 777. Despite not being extremely tall with my 180 cm, I find it very difficult to sit comfortably. The seat is very narrow and the leg rest does extend enough to rest your legs without blocking blood circulation. Same applies by the way to the business sears on the Airbus 330 or 340. I surely miss the comfortable seats on their Jumbo Jets... Service of the crew on board was very attentive and friendly. They tried to make the 11 hour flight as pleasant as possible.

title: Disappointing Experience
review_text: Customer service at the airport and on flight was excellent. Departure and arrival of the flight was on time. Luggage arrived at Zurich airport on time. However this particular air journey was disappointing because the aircraft was like a oven upon entering after boarding at JFK airport, as the air conditioning system was not in operation at that time. An explanation was given regarding same with apologies, but that was not acceptable. Moreover the leg space was extremely limited even for economy standards. Swiss Air has a very high reputation but did not live upto it's reputations for this particular leg of air travel.

title: Swiss Excellence!!!
review_text:
Swiss Airlines was used by Cathay Pacific to bring me and my wife to our final destination of Geneva.

The interior is super clean and the staff were all smile. The flight duration is only 30 minutes but they even give free bottled mineral water and free 3 Swiss chocolates!!! Wowww.!!!

title: Come back to Brazil
review_text:
No big differences from outbound flight, but the highlight is the ease of boarding at ZRH for those arriving by train [by SBB]. You get off the train, climb the escalators, and check in immediately. This is a value differential, allowing you to enjoy the airport without worrying about your bags.
In addition, Swiss follows its standard of good service and punctuality, with the facilities of being in its International Hub.

title: Switerzerland with chocolate
review_text:
Flying with Swiss you already know that you will receive a chocolate after your meals, but what I liked most about the Swiss flight was the efficient service, cleanliness of the aircraft [B 777], punctuality and an adequate arrival time in Zurich [10h30 am].
Although it is the only direct flight option from Guarulhos to Zurich, it would certainly be superior to the usual competitors, noting that Zurich airport is also practical for connections, strengthening this flight as an option for other destinations in Europe.

title: Outstanding
review_text: Took Lufthansa there, Swiss back. No comparison. Swiss was way better! Beautiful cabin. Incredible food. Wonderful flight attendants. Would definitely recommend!!

title: An airline you can rely on
review_text: whenever possible I chose Swiss, simply because it represents what I expect from an airline: clean cabin, friendly service, trust, speed and swishes, period. short distance or long haul flights, always perfect for me.

title: Round trip Chicago, Zurich, Vienna
review_text: For the most part, our experience with Swiss Air was excellent.  The flight crew were very nice and mostly worked with my wife with any gluten free options.  We did not order her a special meal and that was my fault, but, on our flight back, the flight attendant seemed frustrated that we didn't do that.  The food was OK and, with it being a European airline, they love their bread.  I mean, really, how much bread can one person eat, and I love bread.  I did like Boeing plane on the way back better than the Airbus we flew there.  I just seemed to have a little more room.  I have taken the Austrian Airline direct flight before doing this one and I would say I prefer doing the direct flight.  The Zurich terminal changes from international to direct are too far apart and you have to do through another US security check when boarding a plane going to the USA.

title: Said my name wasnt on the Computer
review_text:
I was taking this flight LX 561 from Nice to Zurich in Business Class  on 22nd Oct and had done web check in. The airline at the bag drop told me that my name wasnt on the computer . It wasnt on the list they insisted . 
I would have to talk to their partners and find an alternative flight maybe via Geneva.

Since I had the boarding pass on my phone i scanned it at the departure point and it let me in. I had to carry my bag . 
At Security also I scanned my mobile and it let me in though they threw away my expensive after shave, shaving foam and toothpaste as I was planning to check in my baggage 
At the Gate they again insisted - I talked to three different people including a supervisor that my name wasnt on the list and there was no seat for me. 
Even at this point I scanned my phone and the barrier opened . All this took time . There were a number of phone calls back and forth by the staff and clicking on computers. . 
They were helpful after this point and rushed me in a car to the plane . they would give me a changed seat A instead of D in the same row. 
The airhostess also told me there was no seat for me but she would give me a changed seat . There was no meal for me but she would see what she could do . 
Something seriously wrong with their digital interface  in this age of technology

title: SwissAir from Budapest to Los Angeles
review_text:
The service that Swiss Air provides is excellent. The food in Business Class, however, was very bad. Given that Swiss Air brags about their Michelin-level main chef, it was especially disappointing to the point that I would not fly this airline again.  In addition, this flight had a layover in Zurich, which turned into a nightmare. The passport cue lines
were long and unacceptable. I would not fly through Zurich again either.

title: Swiss Air Business Class Zurich to Boston Logan Airport
review_text:
Checking in at CPH was swift but on boarding, I found out seats on Euro Biz is really not worth the monies.The aircraft do not have any flat beds seats.Services with hot meals is not comparable to any asian airlines with the cold cuts served.
I tried this time to fly on SwissAir  long haul flight but I discover that their New seats is narrow and uncomfortable.
Singapore Airlines Business class is still Top as they have newer and better seats comparing to any European Airlines.

title: Rude and lost my luggage
review_text: When checking in at airport in Vienna the attendant was extremely rude.  I had to pay $50 for my luggage, which is fine, but she said she couldn't take my credit card and made me wait in line at another local nearby.  Flight was delayed.  When I arrived in San Francisco I discovered my luggage did not make it.  The attendant there had a note, so apparently Swiss Air knew my luggage would be delayed, but never informed me.  I called Swiss Air to ask for a refund for my $50.00 luggage fee, it seemed reasonable because it took at least an hour to look for luggage, missed a shuttle.  I was refused the refund.  I emailed and called.  I then called credit card company to dispute.  Swiss Air actually fought this and sent a receipt for my luggage to credit card company.   I did prevail in the end, as I had a note from Swiss Air stating my luggage did not arrive in San Francisco.  Credit Card com. sided with me.  My bag arrived about 5 days later.  Very displeased with lack of empathy or care.

title: Good comfort, free snack
review_text:
I wasn't expecting any free food or drink but what a lovely surprise to get a free hot quiche and it was tasty and a free non-alcohol drink.

Comfy seat, well worth it. No inflight entertainment but that's not an issue.

We were slightly delayed due to weather but we were informed which is the most important thing.

title: Mixed experience
review_text:
Flight (LX39, Oct. 29th) generally good, on time, smooth flight, comfortable seats, clean toilets, good wines. But there were a couple of negatives. The food was terrible, the smoked trout starter was dried out and hard, the main course sea-bass was tasteless and the risotto was a lumpy sticky mess (no finesse in the presentation either). 
The breakfast omelette was overcooked (for my wife inedible). The breakfast service was not consistent on booth sides of the cabin. On right aisle (G..) the service was friendly and efficient (especially by Kristina Roder) who did an excellent job. On the left aisle (from seat 7ABD onward) however the service was terribly, terribly slow. The flight attendant (french speaking) on this side only managed to serve one tray every 4 minutes on average. While the passengers on the other side had already finished their breakfast and the trays were removed my side was still not finished serving. It took her about one full hour to serve about 15 passengers! Very annoying!

title: No compassion
review_text:
I purchased tickets online from Swiss for a planned trip to the Balkans.  Some weeks before the trip, I visited my doctor with what I thought was pneumonia.  Following diagnostic procedures, it was determined that I had a cancerous tumor on my right kidney and that it needed to be removed quickly as there were also some cancerous nodules seen on my lungs.  
This meant no travel and my doctor wrote a medical report to substantiate my no travel situation for the time being.  
I forwarded this note to Swiss requesting a refund due to urgent medical reasons.  Swiss refused claiming that they have to stick to rules and if they give way to one, they might then have to give refunds to all who have medical issues.  Their suggestion that I should buy trip cancellation insurance was lame, to say the least.
I find this logic disgusting on many levels.  While people may attempt to make false claims, such claims are verifiable and should be verified before judgements are rendered.
I do not recommend Swiss International.  To me they are greedy and uncaring.  No one wants to be diagnosed with cancer!

title: Luxurious flying!
review_text:
This is my second time flying business class, so I am still smitten with being treated like a rock star. I didn't have any complaints about this airline. The food was so very good. They kept bringing me more food, as is the way in business class. Lots of meat, cheese, desserts, and drinks(we don't drink alcohol).real linens, silver wear and dishes.
Service was very attentive and helpful. Friendly staff. Bed was comfortable enough to sleep on, although there was lots of turbulence during the flight. My husband said the people in the bathroom kept him up, since our seats were by the bathrooms. I had earplugs on, so I didn't hear anything. 
Even our short term connecting flight to Paris was luxurious, although no flat bed seats. Again, the food was really fabulous.

title: Quality service for fair prices
review_text: Every time I fly, I try to get a flight with Swiss. They have fair prices if you book soon enough. The service on board is really good, includes free drinks and something small to eat :)

title: Excellent Service
review_text: My experience in Swiss international airport is comfortable, on- table , good foods and friendly service.

title: Ms
review_text: Swiss air cancelled our flight . Lost precious vacation time. Tried to claim miles for mileage club... impossible

title: Terrible customer assistence and Terrible experience flying with Swiss
review_text:
I had a problem during my flight, where one person was drunk (The guy drunk 4 to 5 doses of vodka 2 or 3 bottles of wine and more beers...how the flight attends allow that?), and he screamed put the feet up the seats, and a lot of really bad things. After that, the flight attends move some persons that were beside him to the seats beside me.  They wake me up to move the other people, so I supposed to sleep all the flight and in the I could not sleep almost anything, while the drunk guy stayed with 4 seats and lay down all the flight. And they did the same with the other passengers, that probably also didn't sleep during the flight.
No one from the crew came to ask excuses, or offer something demonstrating any kind of worries with us.
To finalize this beautiful history, they broked my bags. They promised to pay for it, but they are already delayed and didn't answer my contact.
I'm really upset with Swiss Air Company and for sure I never recommend to use this company, if is possible to avoid it.

title: Pleasant flight from LHR to ZRH
review_text: The 2005 flight from LHR to ZRH was delayed due to the late arrival of the incoming aircraft.  The Lufthansa Senator lounge at LHR was busy but seats were available.  Boarding was relatively quick with business and status customers boarding first.  The meal on the plane, whilst not large, was tasty and well prepared.  Deplaning was directly into the terminal in Zurich. Bags were quick to arrive.

title: Never use this airline
review_text:
Lost bags in transit. Airport ground staff clueless 

Tried to talk to Swiss air got a call centre with idiots gave me 3 numbers to call 2 discontinued and third where knowone spoke English

Went onto there web chat and no better spent first 20 minutes talking to a bot that sends you round in circles. Eventually got a human on the end who tried to help but failed 

Still no bags and think this company should not be allowed to trade

title: How do they stay in business?
review_text:
The pilot abandoned take off and the flight came to an abrupt stop just before taking off at top speed because of an engine warning - good call. I understand and respect the caution. 

The pilot initially announced the flight was cancelled due to engine problems and turned back to the gate - I get that. I expected to get off and go home.

We were held on the plane for about two hours at the gate because Swiss Air decided they might try takeoff again as they were waiting for an engine inspection. Instead of letting us off the plane at 10:30PM we got off at 12:30AM. After two hours they reconfirmed the flight was cancelled. Surprise. 

We deplaned and no one from Swiss Air had anything to say as we got off the plane except that we should expect an email - which by the way I never received. There were no hotel or transportation arrangements, nothing from anyone except shrugged shoulders. 

I was one of the fortunate ones who got a Lyft ride home and made arrangements with another airline to fly the next day. The lack of communication was terrible. I will never fly with them intentionally again, ever.

Mechanical problems happen, how you deal with it as an airline makes all the difference. Big fail.

title: Not on our recommended list!
review_text:
We had never flown Swiss Air before and probably wouldn't again. After being impressed with Swiss engineering with their ground transport systems, we were not impressed with the Swiss airline (although granted it is owned by Lufthansa). 

We booked our flight 8 months in advance. We were unable to do an on line check in so we hoped that logic would prevail and that they would have my wife and I sitting together. But no, we were randomly scattered amongst the aircraft and whilst we asked to be placed together this was too hard as the plane was full.

The plane was a Bombardier CS100 (Now branded A220). Not a brilliant aeroplane. The flight was like travelling in a bus as was the service. It was the sort of flight you do if you have to and there is no other better choice.

title: A trip to Zurich
review_text: This airline is well worth using, a beautiful new plane, very friendly staff and although the flight was a short one, lovely free snacks and drinks, also a cute little Swiss chocolate as a thank you for flying with the airline.

title: excellent service while flying with swiss internation airline
review_text: I flew from Paris to Mumbai via Zurich , we were at Zurich airport whole night , its quite clean and safe airport. in flight experience , crew was courteous , food was good , timely check-in , depart on time arrive on time, over all experience was excellnt

title: Incompetent
review_text: Lost bag then tried to chase they only had one general number for customer assistance phoned them 3 times each time gave me a number that was obsolete or wrong wanted to speak to a manager apparently none work at Swiss air what a joke company would avoid at all costs

title: Really bad service
review_text:
First class of swiss really sucks! 
The chef of cabin was very engaged and friendly, helpful.
It seems the teams of other service classes were doing much better. We got our first glas of wine after business class was served, 45min after take off! My wife had bags and also tried to help me with my stuff, crew of the first just watched and fid not make any efforts to help. Also food, excluding the mushroom soup which was delicious, was mediocre. Poor wine selection. But most disappointing was rhe team, they did everything to avoid work....

title: Good food and service
review_text: Food was good but instead of giving you 2 big meals, they replaced the last meal with a brown bag type of food.  But they served ice cream and sandwiches in between.  TV monitor works well.

title: Good but took money for things never provided
review_text:
Check in staff were fantastic, crew were fantastic from Manchester to Zurich.

Crew were abit disappointing from Zurich with being unfriendly and not as helpful as manchester to Zurich crew.

Planes were lovely with space and were comfortable and clean.

Internet didnt work though on the long haul flight and despite asking crew, they never came back with any information so extremely disappointed.

Paid ¬£24 for specific meal yet didnt receive. When asked they knew nothing and didnt have it!. Very disappointing. 

Dog arrived at sao Paulo with mo water, they clearly had allowed through and not topped up the water which made wonder how long they'd left like this despite expressed wishes that it be topped up regularly.

Flight took over 20 minutes to offload as they were offloading 350 passengers using only one door!. Delayed for next flight so missed it due to the issues. Had even told them that had connecting flight to get to and no assistance was offered. When contacted swiss they said to send an email to a specific email address and a letter of delay would be sent within 15 minutes, but when this was done an email was received saying to click on a link and then to wait!. They didnt seem to care about anything that had been said, the impact they had on a customer or the fact a customer hadnt received what they'd paid for.

Dont know why they have cabin baggage allowance as people were taking on whatever they wanted, over the actual allowances, which meant space wasnt available!. Why state one flight case and one handbag if swiss own staff dont enforce this rule!. 

Food onboard was lovely, very impressed.

Could have had more rounds with water, or for passengers to have better access to fluids.

Return flights were truly horrendous. Swiss work with Lufthansa who give an abysmal service and truly let swiss standards down.

For the planes and food swiss are highly recommended.

title: Comfy flight, great service
review_text: My first flight gave me a very good impression of this airline. Taking off on time, quick and short queues to board, newish aircraft with OK legroom. The best was the service though. Very pleasant cabin crew!

title: Seatin space and toilet too small
review_text:
Once again the seating is less than spacious. If you have to pull down the table and you are a little heavy then it is just about

Toilets are tiny at the back, a real disgrace. Snack, drinks served. Staff extremely friendly

title: Tight seating
review_text:
Swiss Air is very responsive to the needs of their passengers.  The food is good and there is plenty of it.  The problem is how small economy seating has become and the lack of space and legroom.  Paying for baggage is robbery as there is plenty of room in cargo and this is just another way for airlines to make money.  I also had to pay for my seats as there was no guarantee otherwise to set with my husband.  
TOO ANY ADDED ON CHARGES!

title: Cramped flight
review_text: Flight from Boston to Zurich was cramped and very uncomfortable, seat directly in front of me was fully reclined for the majority of the 7- plus hour flight making it impossible to utilize the table.  Flight from Zurich to Athens was much roomier although shorter (2 hours).  Would not fly Swiss Air again.

title: Smooth landings
review_text: First on this airline and even only a short flt the staff were extra helpful, the seat in between us was free to give us more room and the staff organised that we were able to eventually sit as a couple instead behind each other.

title: High class with best service
review_text: Swiss Air is a more expensive airline than others, but you notice the difference in service and the aircrafts. Aircraft is modern, clean and even economy class offers leg space and free snacks and drinks!

title: mediocre daugther
review_text:
love the layout of the 777 especially when you have a single . row seat.
the staff needs to go into training with Lufthansa crews. the level of professionalism and courtesy is unreached.  the sparkling wine they server before take of is always warm, I wish that warmth would extend to the crew. You really feel they do their job but nothing else, the catering from the US is always mediocre,

title: Flight cancelled and rebooked with a low cost carrier
review_text:
My direct flight from Berlin to Zurich was cancelled and an email with this information was sent few hours before the planned departure at 06:15. A facebook messenger chatbot service link was provided in the email, but when I clicked the link the following message appeared: " Sorry, I'm not able to help you with your booking this time. I'm still learning and I hope to be able to assist you very soon!". 
Swiss then sent another email informing that my flight was rebooked with the low cost carrier Eurowings with a stopover in Cologne. Despite purchasing the flight at Swiss website, I was simply assigned to a lower quality company with an arrival time 5 hours later than the original flight. Morever, I did not have the opportunity to make any choice. To make things worse, my luggage was lost at the stopover in Cologne. So we spent our holidays in Switzerland without our belongings and stressed out because we had to contact the company overseeing our luggage. The luggage eventually reached me when I was back in Brazil.
The flight delay was reimbursed by Swiss, however I feel like my experience in Switzerland was tremendously affected by the lack of professionalism of Swiss. I was not reimbursed for the additional expenses I had due to my luggage delay.

title: Zurich to Chicago 9 hours
review_text: Flight attendents were great.  Food was fantastic, as well as the chocolate!  Seats were comfy.  Loved that they brought out ice cream about an hour before landing....perfect timing.

title: Wonderful Experience
review_text: Flight departed on time from Zurich and arrived in Mumbai before scheduled time. Ground staff at check in counter was extremely friendly. Customer service in flight was professional and courteous. In flight entertainment was more than adequate. Meals served were adequate. Luggage arrived in timely fashion at Mumbai airport. Overall had a wonderful experience with Swiss International Air Lines for this leg of flight and would certainly recommend same to any traveler.

title: Swiss Air, on Swiss time !
review_text:
When a flight passes with nothing to note, it is always a good experience.
The flight was on time and service was as good as it could be expected for a short haul flight of this like. However, on this occasion the airplane took us to the end of the Zurich airport and we were taken to the terminal by buses. The walk from there to the baggage carrousel was unusually long (due to a strike of some airport staff, to my understanding).

title: Super Service
review_text: The flight from Zurich to Goeteborg was only a short one, but nevertheless very relaxing due to the great service of the crew, food was tasty service very good.

title: Swiss Air flight delayed out of Cairo 2:30 am flight
review_text: The flight was delayed coming out of Cairo.  The flight itself was good.  Delay was not a problem as we had 4 hours until our next flight from Zurich to Newark NJ USA.   Food was good.  Enjoyed Zurich airport.  Flew United so as a part of the Star Alliance group our bags were checked from Cairo all the way to final destination Nashville TN.  As a United card holder 2 checked bags for international flights are free.  Made our travel much more pleasant.

title: Swiss Air is Bliss Air :)
review_text: Fly the happy skies with a happy airline. Our family of four, which consists of toddler twins, flew back from London and the staff onboard was truly helpful and kind. The attendant helped us with our luggage on and off the airplane noticing we had our hands full with one year old twins. Tasty snacks to enjoy on the short flight and no issues checking in, boarding or with luggage. I fly Swiss Airlines all over the place and I‚Äôm never disappointed in their quality service. And of course I will continue to fly Swiss and always recommend them for a great flight.

title: when Swiss cancels their flight, they leave you at the mercy of their customer service - and it's not good
review_text:
The flights are nothing special which is fine in itself - but when things go wrong (aka SWISS cancels its flight while you are in the departure airport) and they ask you to contact customer service to rebook, then it becomes really bad. I had a terrible customer service agent who didn't know how to rebook my flight.  Eventually I spoke to another agent who took pity on me and put me on a different airline to Basel (I was originally travelling to Zurich) and from there I made my own way (and at my own expense) to Zurich. 

The entire experience was unnecessarily stressful because of SWISS' customer service.

title: Great flying experience!
review_text: Flight was on time. Food was outstanding. Washrooms were clean and equipped with face sprays and moisturisers.

title: Unfriendly staff and too little food
review_text:
for swiss standards and quality, this airline has declined sharply in recent years.
After the second beer I was refused my third beer.
The staff on the Economy was unfriendly to me. The food wasn't enough either. For this price that I pay and this quality with which they advertise and sell themselves, simply do not meet my expectations.

title: Timely flight.  Food not so great.
review_text: We flew from Boston to Zurich aboard SwissAir.  Staff are quite friendly.  Our seats were comfortable.  The food was not as good as we had on our last flight though.  Check in was easy.  I must say that this airline is much better than AirFrance.

title: Another pleasant flight home
review_text: Another very pleasant flight back home. The dinner was awesome. Apparently Hiltl is the caterer. This time also the salad was nice and fresh.

title: Pleasant flight
review_text: Pleasant calm flight, friendly crew, cold drinks and dinner was served, was okay. Salad was limpy though. No delay we were on time.

title: Disappointing refit/new cabin
review_text: I‚Äôm not sure if it‚Äôs a refit of the 777 or if the plane is new but it could be the first time I‚Äôve flown a Boeing with Swiss.  On the plus side there is more storage. I especially liked the shelves to the right side. On a negative, it seem they sacrificed space for the passenger because it all seemed a little more cramped. The most stupid design detail is placing the seat buttons right where you would rest your left elbow in a slightly reclined position. It really was irritating to adjust the seat each time I moved. The media system worked ok, but all I really wanted was the ability to extend my iPad of personally chosen movies to the larger screen.  You‚Äôd think that would be a priority today. Food was great, the people were lovely and of course we landed ahead of schedule. I happily fly Swiss but I might be avoiding the 777 in the future.

title: Great experience!
review_text: First time with swissair and I was very pleased.  Seats are comfortable, just could be a tad bigger for plus sized travelers.  Booked an exit row seat for more legroom. Flight crew was excellent.  We did have a passenger on board who apparently had some kind of medical emergency but the crew stayed calm and took care of the situation!

title: Rude, condescending staff
review_text: My daughter was flying Swissair from LAX to Florence via Zurich in August to study abroad for her fall semester. Her flight was on 8/24 and she had the appropriate visa that started on 8/27. The Swissair staff at first refused to let her on the flight because they insisted that the visa had to be for the same day that she arrived. They were going to make us pay for another flight 3 days later. We were referred to another Swissair employee who was similarly misinformed and couldn‚Äôt have been more condescending and rude (actually putting a finger in face and screaming at me!) When I finally went online and showed them that an American be in a country for three months before needing a visa, a group of them put their heads together, realized they were in the wrong, and, without an apology or acknowledgment, simply demanded my daughter‚Äôs bag to get on the flight. Needless to say, my daughter was in tears but ultimately was let on the flight. Alas, no apology from Swissair. I will never again book another flight with that horrible airline!!!

title: Flying the friendly European skies
review_text: The cabin crew is always easy to engage with and so friendly.  We also had a bit of a delay taking off on one of the legs but the captain stayed in communication with us.  And connecting flight information was readily available so everyone could relax or work on their plan B.  And the Swiss chocolate bars are a nice treat too!

title: Swiss
review_text:
I have been mainly flying with Swiss international Air lines from Cairo Egypt to the States in the last 6 years.
Any questions (baggage, food etc.) sent to them through twitter and other social media platforms are always answered in a very professional and detailed manner.
Service on the flight is great. You are always greeted with a warm and inviting smile. 
On-board entertainment could be improved by providing higher variety and range of movies, audio-books etc. 
On an transatlantic flight, wifi should be for free...charging people for such a basic service is almost ridiculous.And if no one else is doing it, then why not be the first one, the bench-mark setter?It could be a unique selling point..competitive advantage!
My special ordered fatfree meal was not present due to a defect in the logistics of the food service provider..but i found a good alternative.
Leg room and seat comfort was in my humble opinion a bit compromised, maybe due to plane model itself!
Last but not least, I hope they work on their weak spots and improve them asap.

title: Bought this airline as it offers direct flight back to Zurich but again cancelled. Horrible as always.
review_text: We bought a direct flight to fly back to Zurich from Manchester, UK. The flight was cancelled and we were redirected to a transit flight via Munich. Extremely troublesome. It took us almost 6 hours just to fly back. We purposely paid extra for a direct flight but then again got extremely disappointed.

title: great flight
review_text:
on my way to Germany via Zurich, this early morning flight was realy fine experience.
flight left right on time, arrival was few minutes early.
all in all great crew on board, smooth flight

title: Inconsistent Service
review_text: Inconsistent service, the crew on the NYC - Beijing flight were great and the food was decent. However, on the Beijing-Zurich flight the service was catastrophic. Unmotivated and unprofessional crew, bad attitude and poor manners. The focus was on selling duty-free goods and not on the customer...sadly.

title: Wonderful flight to Europe
review_text: First time using Swiss Air and was totally impressed. Because my flight was so long and during the night I deceided on bussiness class which has the very comfortable reclining seat on the longest part of my flight. I was treated you as if I were the only one on the flight (1st class all the way). The seats on my orther flights were also very comfortable, not cramped and very clean unlike other airlines.Great value for the money I paid.

title: Swiss
review_text: Terrible seat, very uncomfortable for a 12 hr flight. TV screen made around 2000, small, dark, system had to be rebooted many times, lost one channel audio. Poor selection of movies. Food mostly inedible. Only good snacks at the back of the plane.

title: Not a good experience the second time around
review_text:
The crew was very disengaged and anything you asked for....it seemed to be a bother for them.  So the business class onboard service was like economy.   You get your tray and that's it.  You had to ask for more water or for your dessert.   But check out the other frequent flyer reviews on Swiss Business Class.....seems to have gone down.  We would recommend Qatar, Lufthansa, AF or KLM for a better business class experience. 
The crews are much nicer.  Swiss seems to be riding on their reputation.

title: Business Trip
review_text: Top Service on Board. Check in very efficient. Nice on board service and very friendly staff. I always fly swiss to Moscow. Best connections

title: Swiss Air debacle
review_text:
I can‚Äôt even explain what happened to us last night at Newark but I‚Äôll try. A day before the same flight, LX 19 form NY to Zurich was cancelled because of engine problems. When we arrived at the airport and checked in, a colleague of mine and me begged for a any warning if there is any danger of yet another cancellation. We had to be in Europe the following day. We were traveling on business, business class.  
Everybody at Swiss told us, there is a delay but flight will take off for sure. Guess what.... and midnight they canceled it again. People were stranded at Newark airport with no flights left to catch. Swiss told everyone, pick your bags and get out. This is such a betrayal of paying customers. Under no circumstances, I or my company will entrain flying Swiss. It‚Äôs a disgrace. It‚Äôs one thing having issues on plane, which can happen to everyone but it‚Äôs a totally different thing keeping you customers hostage. That was unacceptable. Never again.

title: Swiss Airlines
review_text: Though the airplane staff, ticket staff were very helpful we did not receive our luggage until 4 days after arriving in Nairobi.  We of course needed to purchase personnel items and clothing.  Upon contacting the airlines for some reimbursement after many contacts we were eventually compensated with a payment of $20.  Will try to avoid ever flying Swiss Air again.

title: Operated by El-Al
review_text:
Red eye flight leaving at 3 am, plane was packed and after a few minutes i realized that the carrier is trying to save money where they shouldn‚Äôt.
Despite being a night flight there were hardly enough blankets for HALF the plane and no pillows. They offered a heated sandwich and water no other drinks not even coffee.
But rest assured they offered duty free products again and again...
And not to forget this was a regular flight not a low cost

title: Absolutely appalling service - never again
review_text: Flight was Nuremberg to London via Zurich. Checked-in at Nuremberg and got booked through to London. Was not told that our original connecting flight between Zurich and London had been cancelled. Did not pick up until we were on our way to Zurich. Not fatal at this stage but had plans for Saturday arvo and evening in London - critical to be in London for flight to Melbourne on Sunday. Boarded the later flight to London. Due to "system problem", after waiting to take-off on tarmac, flight was cancelled. Things started to get concerning re flight to Melbourne on Sunday, leaving at noon. Got to transfer desk - best flight on offer to London was 6.00pm Sunday. Advised desk we had 12.00 noon flight to Melbourne on Sunday. Told only option was the 6.00pm flight. While my wife was trying to sort out getting to London I went off and contacted airline re Melbourne flight. Was able to delay flight to Monday at a cost of $4,700. Walked past transfer desk and informed staff Swiss Air was going to get the bill. Having already changed arrangements, we were then encouraged to cancel the changes because miracle of miracles they had found an earlier flight. And they did, all too late of course. Oh and by the way we were told there had been 3 cancellations of this flight during the day, our original flight, the one at the end of the day and another in-between. We show up for a 7.00am flight on Sunday on which we were flying economy but that was fine - needed to get to London!!! We find that there were spare economy seats on that flight. How do we know? Because an announcement came over that Swiss Air had overbooked Business and were asking Business Passengers if they wanted to downgrade - for some money. Why were we not offered this option up front???? It would have saved everybody a lot of stess and us $4,700. Not a happy Swiss Air patron!!!! And the compensation that came through from Swiss Air - part of the price difference between business and economy. There was a full flight of passengers who had similar experiences to ours - a number of us exchanged "war stories" after the event.

title: rating on this airline
review_text:
I am shocked on why this airline gets so good ratings. I have flown many airlines on business class and when you compare swiss air it is probably just above some american airlines. 

The food was good and the stewardess were nice except for one but the maintenance up keep was below average. Both my wife's and my seat had no usb ports working. The outlets didn't work. I paid 9 swiss francs to get internet and it lasted at most 10 minutes. I complained to the stewardess but she couldn't fix it. She told to use their station in the front and only one of their usb ports worked. Some nasty stewardess up front started reading me the riot act that I was not allowed to use their ports when our stewardess came to the our rescue and notified her our ports didn't work. If you are planning to do any work on a flight don't take this airline.

title: Simply the best.
review_text: Excellent seating in business Class and perfect service, even the plane had a delay of 5 hours in Montreal due to weather conditions , the crew did the outmost to please the passengers. On arrival at Z√ºrich Airport all the passengers found their rebooking for connecting flights when immediately when the left the plane. As touroperator for our 35years this was my best experience ever in case of a late arrival.

title: Very comfortable and no feeling of economy class
review_text: Comparing premium class at Norwegian (And it‚Äôs a 400$ upgrade - tried it a couple of times) and economy on Swiss, I‚Äôd take Swiss any day...seats are very comfy, the entertainment is better, the on board service is far better, food is better...if at all possible we fly Swiss out of Boston. No matter how you travel, first class or economy, chances are you arrive at the destination simultaneously. But if you fly Swiss, it‚Äôs just feels a little better.

title: Good Service, on schedule but tight, tight seating
review_text:
The Airbus 340 left a little behind schedule but caught up and landed on time. The in-flight service was excellent and the food pretty good. But the seating was far too tight.
I had a 14 inches between my nose and the video display and when the person in front reclined their seat it was down to about 6 inched. I had to put my reading glasses on to watch a movie. Sleep on this overnight flight was next to impossible. I have been on many long distance flights to Asia and Australia and have never been as uncomfortable as on this airplane in this configuration.

title: Medicore and uncomfortable
review_text: Economy class was tightly packed--that's expected. But no warning that the airline had big metal boxes under many of the seats meaning no leg room or under seat storage. Was awoken by a duty free cart being pushed into my knee. And when I tried to get work done en route, Swiss Air uses a by-the-megabyte (overly pricey) price scheme which is just obnoxious and fares poorly next to other airlines.  I'd avoid Swiss Air in the future.

title: Excellent in comfort, service and on time
review_text: Swiss never fails you, whether you fly short distance in Europe or even better long range across the world, their Economy class comfort (Seat, food, electrical outlets, Video, etc...), food service, or their business class comfort or service is simply the best in Europe and compete with the top Asians. Their "On Time" is an asset, and the whole of their perks and qualities makes them one of the world best airlines.

title: Excellent service
review_text: I have not used Swiss previously and chose it because it was the best connection for me. I was pleasantly surpised by free food and drinks in economy. The planes were on time and Z√ºrich Airport is a really nice place to change planes wheater you have little or much time.

title: We've no complaints about this airline.
review_text: We transited at Geneva. That was a bit confusing  in this large Geneva airport as the gate had changed from the one that the ticket stated. . But just in time ( it took nearly two  hours) we finally got to the right section (E I think, not D). Went in an internal airport train during this process.  Nothing was well marked. However the flight, cabin crew and service made up for the confusing start.

title: Possibly the best airline to Europe
review_text:
we experienced the usual Swiss efficiency combined with the soft human side, which is a great combination.

Timely departure and arrival goes without saying. The airport lounge in Zurich was comfortable and well equipped. The servive on board was wonderful. Nothing to complain, thank you!

title: Excellent flight both ways
review_text: We traveled to Rome through Z√ºrich in September and returned via the same reverse route to Boston in October, 2019. Flight out was approximately 70% booked and the return appeared to be fully booked. Flights were on time, the attendants provided good service, and the economy seats provided reasonable spacing. Food service was good for an airline. Recommend for this itinerary.

title: Swiss International Privacy Seating Policy
review_text:
When booking an upper class trip on Swiss, they still charge extra for a "private seat" 
Was forced to change my flight to a later date. I am a United Platinum. Alliance Gold  flier. United waived any extra charge to change my flight, however Swiss would not credit the $140 pre paid for the "private seat"
Inflexible airline with awful customer service...........

title: Swiss Air Customer Service
review_text:
Apparently being loyal to Star Alliance (Gold on the alliance, Platinum United) and paying for upgraded seats doesn‚Äôt mean anything to Swiss Air.

Our flight was rescheduled and we were pushed to the back the plane.  Customer service had no desire to help me.

I will definitely avoid this airline going forward!

title: Not what you would expect from Swiss...
review_text:
We had 4 flights with Swiss Air: LX177 + LX724 + LX 735 + LX176.
First time with this airline, nice maintained planes, mostly friendly staff and meals were good as well. Downside was the entertainment was very Swiss focused and not as broad as eg Air NZ, Emirates or Singapore Airlines. Also, if you like to book a Seat in advance, it will cost you $68 per Seat per flight.The seats/legroom, was the cramped /smallest I have endured so far. The poor muscled up tall Swiss guy next to me, actually didn't fit in his seat so he had to 'use' some space of the next (mine) seat. Nothing wrong with my friendly Swiss neighbor, just to explain the small seats you have to deal with on a Swiss Air flight. I Felt sorry for all the other tall passengers who had to fold themselves up for 11 hours! 
From AMS to Zurich, LX 735 which is a smaller plane and I can't handle the pressure of the plane while descending. The pressure on my head gets unbearable but this can be solved with cups filled with warm tissues; it helps really well! I do it all the time on short flights/small planes. I asked staff to organise this for me and the (older) flight attendant lady told me there wasn't time to do this and she offered me a candy instead. I insisted to get these cups and another staff member handed them to me. Instead of warm, the tissues were boiling hot (!) and the hot water ran over my face while holding the cups onto my ears. It helped tho which was all I wanted so didn't complain at that time but thinking about it now, I find it very unprofessional! Sorry, no more Swiss Air for us anymore!

title: Dispicable airline
review_text:
What a complete joke and health hazard. I flew ‚Äòbusiness class‚Äô from Cairo to Zurich at 2am an a TINY domestic plane Swiss uses.

Zero service the smallest seats I‚Äôve ever sat in for business (it was economy seating with just an empty middle seat). 

There was no WiFi, no entertainment on almost a five hour flight between continents! They have the flight map shining the whole night in your face. You can‚Äôt control the air (there are two rows to one set of air vents) and the ‚Äòpillow‚Äô was dirty and flat.

Money making airline at its worst and they just don‚Äôt care.

title: Excellent Service, Reasonable seating & Good Menus.
review_text:
As a transit passenger, it's always good to begin by visiting the Swiss Airlines Business Lounge for fresh produce snacks.

Easy boarding & seat access. The only issue I have is lack of sufficient storage in the seat section. 2 little narrow areas under the table area don't take a small hand bag. 
Look forward to the airlines bringing in pods!

Cabin crew excellent & vey attentive. Meals were good as to be expected. Before arrival one crew member presented me with a lovely box of chocolates & a Swiss Air mug. I was quite overcome.

I fly with this airline often & will continue to do so.

title: Cattlecar airline
review_text: We flew economy on Swiss from SFO to Venice, and Rome to SFO. The jets were full. The worst part of the flight was the cramped seating layout. Swiss Air has decided to jam you in to make more money. The experience was like riding in a full cattlecar and it was uncomfortable. The seats leg room is so reduced that when the seat in front of you reclines, your knees get jammed and the seat is almost in your lap. Try this for 11 hours. The food and service was standard airline type food. Nothing special. I had a sense that the flight attendants were just putting in their time. We will look elsewhere next time for flights to Europe, as I just didn't like the cattlecar experience. This was not out experience on Lufthansa.

title: Lots of food & comforts, GREAT CREWS~
review_text: We bought out tickets on price (and safety), the 4 flights (SFO to Zurich, Zurich to VLC, and back) were 2.5 & 11 hours, VERY comfortable seats, more food than we could eat, gracious and accommodating crew, minimal bathroom issues, lots of water, all in all, just  a good experience. We slept going over, did not coming back. MASSIVE JET LAG! Not the airlines fault.

title: Great flight but lost bracelet.
review_text:
Really good flight but I lost my bracelet somewhere on the plane. Spent a fair bit of time at the back of the plane stretching (10+ hours on the plane due to weather delay). Hoping to connect with a young-ish gentleman with a beard who was back there as well and may have seen it. Not expensive at all but sentimental. Maybe you gave it to an attendant?

Zurich to Montreal. LX86 on October 10th. Me:black turtleneck & tennis bag. Thank you kindly!!

title: Not what I expected
review_text:
I expected more from the new or upgraded Swiss business class cabin. Its the same uncomfortable and crammed seat as before with little space - especially if you are two sitting next to each other. The table is however an improvement. 

Service was SLOW notwithstanding me ordering a quick meal. I expected more.

title: Dreadful this time
review_text: This was a bad experience. Everything seemed normal until one hour before the flight, when I had just gone through security and was heading for the gate. I received a sms to say the flight was to be delayed approx an hour. In the end after two other sms messages the flight was delayed by two and a half hours, which for a flight of one hour fifteen minutes is pretty awful. What was so frustrating is that I could not believe that they do not know sooner that it would be delayed. Late incoming was a vague rumour, but if so, even more reason to have known in advance and informed the passengers better. Not adding 40 and more minutes to the delay three times. We were offered a refreshment voucher which did not cover a drink and a snack, one or the other, which is pretty basic as well. I was not impressed. No further compensation was offered, the delay was not long enough.....

title: Expected more
review_text: Our flight from Boston to Zurich was not the best. Apparently, the Swiss Air app got confused and kept notifying travelers that the flight was delayed and then moved to a different gate - neither of which was true! Since there was no one at the gate until boarding time, there were lots of confused and anxious folks. The flight itself was uncomfortable for me because my seat wouldn't recline - and the person in front of me had a seat that wouldn't stay upright. The food was edible, but mediocre. What saves this review from being two stars is the fact that the crew was great and we had a safe journey. Our return flight from Budapest would have been a better story had it not been for the mayhem at check-in. There was not enough organization to manage the huge crowds at the check-in counter, so the "line" snaked all over the airport. Even though we had our boarding passes, we found out that there was no line for those only needing to check bags. Bummer! This was our first experience with Swiss Air, and I was disappointed.

title: Great food and friendly staff
review_text: The staff was absolutely lovely, they helped me with every problem I had. The food on board of the aircraft was amazing, I had a breakfast and especially the ‚ÄûBircherm√ºesli‚Äú wich is cereals with yogurt was very good. The flight attendant was very friendly and came 4 times to ask me wether I would like to get a drink or not. The seat was comfy and it‚Äôs awesome that the seat on my side wasn‚Äôt occupied. The lounge in Zurich has a great design and offers good food, I loved the selection of alcohol and the croissiants were very crispy. Only the toilets where to small for the amount of people that visit the lounge and unfortunately they were not clean (this is not acceptable on 9 o clock in the morning, but I guess that‚Äôs more the responsibility of the customers that the toilets aren‚Äôt clean).

title: Business class is a relaxing treat
review_text: We flew business class to Zurich then Budapest and return from Prague to Chicago and found the crews to be attentive and friendly.

title: Ontime, good AC, attentive and friendly staff
review_text: Nice, attentive friendly staff; good air conditioner in spite that is no individual regulation ( only central); quiet and calm atmosphere.

title: Paid for 1st Class Seating and was ripped off by Swiss Air
review_text: I am a disabled American Veteran who has had several back and neck surgeries. I paid for a First Class seat from Tel Aviv to Zurich which was a 4 hr & 20 min flight. I received a last minute text message that my seat had been changed. It actually was the entire PLANE that was changed. NO First Class/Business seating existed. The seat was 14 inches wide. I stood up for 90 % of the flight. There wasn't any first class accommodations that I paid for. Flight Attendant gave me a box of Chocolates for the trouble. I have asked for a refund of my money and I am getting poor return communication from Swiss Air. I paid extra money because of my physical issues and Swiss Air could care less. I will NEVER fly Swiss Air and I do NOT recommend you do either. I have pictures to document my experience I would LOVE to share with the CEO they are tell the story of my experience. I would also appreciate someone from SWISS Air to contact me.

title: Very nice airlines
review_text: I was flying from jfk to Barcelona with a layover in Geneva.  The quality of the plane,  the food,  send the flight in general was great.  The flight attendants were very polite.  The layover in Geneva in both directions was pretty long,  one was 10hrs, and the other 12hrs, we didn't mind because it gave us a chance to explore agn extra city in our trip.  If you will be going in swiss air and have time,  I highly recommend to add 2 or 3 days in Switzerland and explore Geneva and surrounding French mountain towns, or explore Zurich,  which ever you will be flying to.  Switzerland is a beautiful country with exploring.

title: Don't count on advanced seat purchases being honored
review_text:
We purchased advanced seating.  When we got to the airport we were informed there was no record of the payment for the seats.  They were paid for.  After a lot of back and forth with the airline and our travel company we were basically informed 

"Please kindly note that for any seats booked in advance with Swiss are non refundable and non dedicated, meaning that in case of any aircraft change, the seat characteristics remain the same. However, the seat number may not".  

This basically means even if the airplane is the same configuration, this gets the airline off the hook, they can seat us anywhere and we are out the advanced fee.

title: Superior business class -
review_text: The business lounge is a delight, with a terrace overlooking the airport.  The flight attendants' attention to passengers is above par.  The airline's food service is generous and varied.  My only complaint with this airline and with ALL other airlines is that the cabin is too cold for me.

title: Rude and unfriendle
review_text: Paid for an aisle seat as I recently had spinal surgery and need to get up and stretch my leg nerves periodically. Received online ticket with change notice to an aisle seat-- tried to change at gate desk told no aisle seats available-- no refund of pre payment offered-- inside seatvery uncomfortable with box on the floor under the seat in front of me that prevented me from stretching my leg straight out.  Pales in comparison see onto treatment on Jet Blue. Additionally asked two different gate desks for assistance on the US international code-- brusquely told they didn't know and wouldn't inquire for me. If using the Zurick Airport be prepared for a lot of walking and give yourself plenty of time. First time flying Swiss Air in about 15 years and not the airline I remembered--told since it came out of bankruptcy the quality of service has plummeted.

title: A very pleasant flight !
review_text: I like them because of the nice service, the chocolates at the end are a sweet end of flight and the choice of movies, seats were good.

title: First time on Swiss International Airlines
review_text: I actually booked Lufthansa but it was a code share with Swiss so I didn't receive any email for online check in for this leg but I was happy to see that I could still check in online using the booking ref and choose seats.  There was a delay in the first leg but we made it to the connecting flight because it was also delayed waiting for another connecting flight.  There was a hot towel given onboard but it was barely warm and it was dry when I got it.  The food service is very prompt and food is not bad.  Other than the delay, it was uneventful and we arrived at our final destination on time.

title: Overall, a very pleasant experience.
review_text: We chose to fly Swiss Air from Rome to Zurich. We chose Business Class, and consequently had access to the Star Alliance business lounge, which was very well appointed, and a great place to relax pre-flight. The check-in process was very efficient and uneventful. The seating on LX1737 was basically a standard economy class seat, with the centre seat vacant, and a small amount of extra leg room. In flight service was quite good.

title: Business class service
review_text: Business class was just a normal seats with space in the middle  going to Zurich, then on to the next leg the seats were quite tight for business and sharing an armrest in the middle.  the TV monitor is too small and food is nothing special, and they ran out of choices pretty quickly. I do not think it is worth the being on business, for this flight.

title: Average International Business Flight
review_text:
The cabin was average with reasonable but not great seats.  Having to pay to reserve a seat in advance in business is a bit outrageous but worth it to avoid the seats near the galley and the toilets.  
There were two business sections.  One above the galley (I think row 4 and 5) and the rest behind.  The single seats on the right aisle are the best for privacy.   
The food is average for business.  The service is very nice.

title: First Swiss airlines experience
review_text: Pleased by my first (of hopefully many) flight experience with Swiss airlines. I had a stopover at Dar es salam and a connection at Zurich which was smooth. My luggage got left behind in Zurich unfortunately due to the very short connecting time (45 minutes) but they delivered it to my hotel the next day and kept me updated all through. The meals were exceptionally good, polite staff, smooth take offs and landings and good in-flight entertainment.

title: Surprisingly good but long layover in Zurich
review_text:
Good airline.   Zurich is a nice place to spend a few hours, but it was a little too long.

On way back the Zurich airport lounge was in a different terminal and was superb.

title: First experience with Swiss International
review_text:
I had to book a last minute leisure trip to meet my husband in India. This airline came up with the best price and the least changes.
I had one change in Zurich. I fortunately had sufficient transfer time because with the airport not having proper signage for transfers, I found myself on the other side of customs and had to clear myself through security again.
Other than that the staff were lovely. I hit my doevial meal I ordered and everything went like clockwork. Everyone even got a goodbye chocolate.
I would definitely recommend this airline.

title: My new favorite
review_text: My new favorite airline! On time at every stop. In and out of Zurich (no more Heathrow or JFK!). Great food and service. AND no charge for your first checked bag!

title: Hated the airline
review_text:
$322 change fee, I felt like I'd been robbed.
Onboard service is spotty at best, you fly with robots not people. More like service with a scowl, forget the smile. I hated Swiss almost as much as I hated Switzerland.

title: Wonderful experience
review_text: We have flown Swiss in first class before but this time we chose business class. While their first class service is over the top great, their business class is a close second and substantially less expensive. Food and service were great. The flight attendants are very courteous and friendly. The seats are lay down style and very spacious and comfortable.

title: Great cabin crew
review_text:
Slight departure delay, on Oct 6. 
Flight seemed to be full with large group of teenage students.
Cabin crew were excellent.

title: A tale of Two Trips
review_text: We recently flew in business round trip.  The flight from JFK was basically OK but the service left much to be desired.  The staff served all parts of dinner so fast there was barely room on our tray.  It really seemed like the mission was to feed us as fast as possible and then they could turn off the lights and relax.  We were not very happy at all.  Then came our return flight and everything was perfect.  The food was better quality and the level of service was leaps and bounds better.  If we had a choice we would only fly the Z√ºrich to JFK portion.

title: Zurich Airport is a Pain
review_text: I had 50 minutes to get to my next flight and ihad 3 checkpoints and was about 10 mnutes from my flightand i then received a TSA check. Too many checks

title: 100% Recommended
review_text: We flew from Amsterdam to Zurich to San Jose, Costa Rica.  Economy seating had more leg room than other carriers I have used and the service was impecable.  The flight from Zurich was a long one and the crew made great effort to make the trip as pleasant as possible.

title: Excellent Airline
review_text:
Absolutely punctual depart and 10 landing 10 minutes before previewed landing time.
Excellent Crew, disposed to help you. Very clean and modern plane (always).

title: Long haul flights are better than European ones
review_text:
Swiss has two issues among its frequent flyers, of which I am one. The first is punctuality, the second is service in economy. European flights are to a great extent not on time. And the traditional excellent Swissair service in all classes suffered as a result of the acquisition of its successor airline, namely Swiss, by Lufthansa.
The flight I am reviewing, however, was punctual, and ok in every respect.

title: Swiss Air is not what it used to be. . .
review_text:
We have been taking this flight a few times a year since 1990.  In the past, we appreciated the direct flight to Zurich, the comfortable planes, good food and good service.  Our recent flight was a nightmare.   

I did not sleep for one minute. The plane was full and the seats are smaller and closer together than the last time I flew them. When the person in front of me reclined, I was unable to get out of my row as I was in the middle seat!  The person in the row in front of me kept his overhead light on all night which shined in my eyes.  

I complained to the flight attendant and she would not ask the person to turn off the light or to move forward.

The food used to be quite good.  It was awful!  It was a strange pasta with chicken with no connection to Swiss food at all.

Upon arrival, the next 24 hours were very difficult as I struggled to catch up on rest.  

I will not fly them again.

title: overall good service
review_text: flight was full, we left on time, swiss provides good service and free alcohol on international flights. food/snack/beverage service throughout the 11 hour flight. almost every hour...my seat sound on my seat monitor did not work. i played chess for 11 hours and slept and ate.

title: Horrible night i almost spent on the chairs of airpott
review_text: I was booked to travel from Tegel to Zurich to Johannesburg on the 02 October. I arrived in time but the flight got delayed. Swiss booked me in Qatar airwaves and unfortunately i was told the flight was full. When i went back to swiss they said there was nothing they could do, the next available airline is on the following day at night. I had to book my own accommodation and find my way out of the airport. I broke down, as i feared for my life. I can not wait to get home, and never use the Swiss airline again..

title: Very disappointing flights
review_text:
Traveled home on a  flight originating in Athens in very small seats, My friend sat on the aisle which had a metal box taking up half of the already small leg room.  Her entertainment screen didn't work for the entire flight, nor did the woman's in front of me.  There was no Wi-Fi on either legs of the trip.  

We weren't able to pick our seats online, so we called and paid for 3 aisle seats.  When we arrived, our seats were 3 in the center, with the aisle seat having the metal box.

I am pretty easy to please when it comes to food, but this was the worst selection of bad food I've ever eaten.  Had a horrid cold, curry and chicken dish.  I was hungry so I ate it.  I won't say it was the cause of my discontent, but on the next leg, I vomited at least 8 times on the plane.  I've never done that in my life.  I proceeded to become ill another 4 times carrying my barf bag to baggage claim.  The flight was totally full and it would have been nice to be able to be sick in private.  I'm sure the other passengers would agree.

The only bright side were the staff.  They were very empathetic and tried their best to help with what little they have to work with.

I don't know of any industry where you can treat your customers as the airlines do and still be profitable.  This clearly was the worst part of my 2 week Grecian vacation.

title: 11 hour agony
review_text:
Oh what horror I have been thru. The person who seated next to me was a big guy. His arm and butt were partially taking up my seat space. Behind me there was a couple with 2 little children. Their baby cried for at least half of the 11 hour trip. Cramped seats made this horror even worse. One of my worst travels ever. On the other hand the staff was nice, food was great, entertainment good. I didn't complain because there was no empty seat left in the whole airplane. But what an awful experience, I still feel sick form this trip even days after.
Cramped and narrow seats are so, so bad, it's a crime. Also something has to be done with little children who won't stop crying for hours. Not sure what but this was so stressful I don't want to fly again. Such a bad experience on this one.

title: Pretty good, but cramped
review_text:
Compared to my experience on other airlines, I thought Swiss Air did a lot of things right - e.g. great media interface, USB ports for charging, and clear communication from the staff and airline. 

One thing I wasn't fond of was how far back their seats go. The couple in front of us decided to relax to the max, which left the screen about two finger widths from my face. Not exactly an ideal viewing experience. While I could have reclined far back myself, this would have set off a chain reaction of reclined chairs, and even then, the space would still be insanely cramped when you account for food and beverages. Most of the 10 hour flight was spent in discomfort.

title: Nice n comfortable !!
review_text:
It was our return flight to Mumbai in the morning. The check-in was very fast, it hardly took 5 minutes. The business lounge was very spacious. They were serving full breakfast including live station. The boarding was very smooth. The flight was very comfortable. The Indian meal was very delicious. The in-flight service  was top class. The hostesses were very helpful.
Excellent airline, no doubt !!

title: EXCELLENT!!! The BEST!!!
review_text:
My wife and I, for years, only fly First class of two different Airlines: EMIRATES and KOREAN Air... we love both of them, but now, SWISS had very special fares for flights from London and why not? we wanted to try their First class ,(for the first time), and we were SO impressed with their service, that I have to be writing this review... in any case, here I am to tell everybody how good SWISS service was at the Airport and in flight. We had the best flight of our lives on September 3, 2019... b
The Capitan was Lukas Viglietti and the extraordinary Flight attendant taking care of us was Susanne Bown. While everyone was extremely nice and professional I really had the need to name these two people

title: Hot, tight and bad food
review_text:
I don't usually write bad reviews, but this time, the trip was one of the worst experiences with an airline.
Food was awful and one of the options ran out almost immediately. Second, almost impossible to eat when sitting in the middle. The seat is tight and very uncomfortable. Third, and worst of all, the cabin was extremely hot! The cree did nothing, although many complaints were made (not just by me.) I cannot recommend this company.

title: Hot, tight and bad food
review_text:
In general and don't write bad reviews, but this time the trip was one of the worst expericences ever with an airline.
Food was awful and one of the choices run out almost immediately. Second, almost  impossible to eat when in a middle seat. The seat is tight and very unconfortable. Third, and worst of all, the cabin was extremely hot! The crew did nothing, although many complaints were made (not only by me.) I can't recommend this company.

title: The flight was great, however the air conditioning in the plane and at Zurich airport was a bad experience
review_text:
The service is good, nice and courteous staff.
The seats are comfortable and quite spacious, the food is also good.
But as we sat in the plane waiting for takeoff, there was a delay.
It was on a hot summer day and they did not turn on air conditioning, only the vent was working and the cabin was hot and stuffy.
Despite my request and also, explaining that I'm having trouble breathing, they sent the chief flight attendant to see if I need a doctor, but did not rurn the aircon on.
Another difficult experience was at the airport, most areas are not air-conditioned and some even without ventilation.
People had to walk with their luggage between the halls, and queue for check-in nervous and sweaty.

title: good flight
review_text: very good service, competent cabin personal, in time, friendly and helpful stewardesses, reasonable ticket-price, go and fly with Swiss

title: Great flight on a new  Bombardier CS 300 now Airbus 220-300
review_text: Great seats, very clean smooth flight. These new planes are super efficient and the great thing for me is the pressure within the cabin. Obviously they have managed to optimize the air pressure in the cabin with the environment around the plane at high altitudes so my ears do not pop during takeoff and landing.

title: My best airline
review_text: Really i'm a big fan for this airline, flight was good, food was good and i think the best prices too, cheap flights recommended it

title: Great Service
review_text: Service is amazing. Food is not stop and great quality, Swiss cheese, chocolate, quiche, water to keep you hydrated, and this is in economy. Plane is older generation Airbus and the quantity and the quality of the entertainment, specially movies is good but not mind blowing. The quality of the headphones provided is really bad, actually they are painful. If you are bringing your own headset, this is a 10 hour flight after all, you need the old style adapter with two plugs. I assume this is standard practice in all airlines, but although my suitcase was a carry on, it exceeded the weight limit, a measly 8 kg, and had to pay for $60 because i could not take it in the cabin. Ground staff was very accommodating. Seat size and width are good. Highly recommend specially when compared to some American airlines.

title: Enjoyable direct flights LX8 (and LX9)
review_text: LX8 is the return flight from Zurich to Chicago. There are advantages to flying non-US airlines in some specific aspects: 1) On SWISS they offer Prosecco (individual bottles) even in Economy, at least in this direction (on AirFrance you can catch Champagne even in Economy, and they also have a very good hot chocolate.) 2) The choice of movies has a large selection for International productions. 3) It feels like vacation earlier. 4) Often the food is better. The SWISS arrangement of seats was good, but I have to say that there was more leg-room on a UNITED flight the month before. Both LX8 and LX9 are good flights as they are direct. If you are registered on the Swiss.com site with all the info, then you receive your boarding pass automatically by email or on your portable device, which makes things easier at the airport later. At Zurich we were registered and done in less than 15 min including wait time (of course being on Swiss time... i.e. a bit early rather than just in time or late!)

title: Swiss First Class is a world-class experience.  Second to none.
review_text: Flying in first class domestically (within the US), is like flying premium coach in Switzerland.  We had the pleasure of flying first class from Boston to Zurich in an Airbus with service second to none, food of impeccable quality, wines that were world-class, and comfort in all aspects.  Bravo - SWISS!

title: A Wonderful Experience
review_text:
The staff are all so friendly, welcoming and helpful - really adds to the overall experience.

The aeroplane is clean and the temperature is comfortable. The overhead storage is large, the seats are really comfortable and most importantly, there is a great amount of legroom. 

Both flights were on time and the food served during the flight was delicious. Not the usual, tasteless aeroplane food that you would often experience on other lines.

As a nice touch, towards the end of the flight, a small swiss chocolate bar if handed out. This is a lovely gesture and everyone really enjoyed it. 

Highly recommend this airline. Just a pity they don't do more routes from Ireland.

title: Great airline
review_text:
We flew from Zurich to Prague for a short holiday and were impressed with the swift service. Although it was a short flight service was excellent and fast. They served Swiss traditional sandwich and ended the flight with chocolates.
 Will definitely fly with Swiss again!

title: Husos
review_text: De Fl√ºge hed k√§ WLAN ond k√§ Wasser wtf. Us minere subjektive Secht heavy whack. Au hed de Flog 50 Minute versp√∂tig gha was au on geil esch.

title: Get your ground crew up to scratch SWISS!
review_text: SWISS operates an efficient flight between Zurich and Geneva. But passenger handling before and after could be improved. Because of a short connection I arrived at the boarding gate when boarding had already started. When heading with my business class boarding pass for the priority lane (all priority passengers had apparently already been boarded) I was ushered into the economy class lane for no obvious reason. Staff was more occupied talking to one another than assisting with the automated process.  On arrival my suitcases were obviously not selected for priority unloading - in spite of the red priority label they arrived about last. What is the point of polluting the planet with all these labels if they serve no purpose? The flight itself was smooth, with service oriented cabin staff and good punctuality.

title: Good flight but rushed to eat
review_text: Recently flew from Krakow to Zurich with Swiss Airways.  The overall flight was enjoyable.
