However, when it came time for the in-flight meal to be served (which was a snack - due to the short flight of 45mins) I felt like we were rushed to eat it.  I noticed some of the air hostesses were still clearing the rubbish away whilst were were landing.

title: Vacation
review_text:
Flew with Swiss Air as an experiment.
It was OK - Madrid to Zurich, business class was simply economy class with no-one sitting in the middle seat - I expected more from the airline
Madrid to Miami was better. Good but clinical service, clean modern plane (787-900), but the configuration was weird. Mostly 1-2-1 but the occasional 2-2-1. When I booked online, I booked a 2 (from the 1-2-1 config) but was reallocated a 2 from the 2-2-1 config unless I paid an extra $200!! ... and this was a paid business class ticket.

title: Would fly anywhere they do!
review_text: Hands down the best crew of flight attendants I have ever experienced! Attentive, friendly, engaging!!

title: Irritations marked the 11 hour flight back from Bangkok.
review_text: The larger parts of the flight were marked with irritations and a patronising even insulting stewardess. Limited leg space, especially if the persons before you lean back all the way and you don't really want to considering the persons in the row after you. These flights left me enough bad experiences to leave my first negative review of an airline.

title: Comfortable seat
review_text: Fast,punctual service. Seats veryomfy,lots of leg room. Ear plugs given for inflight entertainment. Good Choice of films.

title: Swiss Air Service/Flight Experience
review_text:
Great Service, Food. Snacks, Comfort Items and Entertainment on this airline. A bit more room in Economy section and I loved hearing, English, German, French and Italian announcements.
Would definitely use them again!

title: Safety flight
review_text: The Swiss airline cabin crew were outstanding ,the meal was good, even the snacks were good. I enjoyed the Swiss milk chocolate .

title: Exit row may not be worth the extra price
review_text:
The service was excellent so no complaints there. We were assigned to the exit row which usually means more leg room. We did have the extra leg room, but it was near the rest rooms which meant gathering of folks in queue. Had foot stepped on and the chatter around the bathrooms made sleep difficult. We were assigned these seats, so did not pay extra. Would never pay extra for exit row seats on an overnight flight.

I do give Swiss Air credit for boarding from the rear of the plane. That makes a lot of sense, but not all airlines do that. In fact, on our return trip, the "load the rear first" approach was not used.

title: great
review_text: very good service with excellent food. Flight attendants were very attentive and kept liquids refreshed. Food was very good.

title: Arrived feeling and looking terrible
review_text: Swiss trans Atlantic aircraft was a dated wreck. The back of my seat was broken both there and back. Faulty entertainment systems. Nowhere to hang a suit jacket, not even a peg on the seat in front (possibly a hook on the table switch - which means your suit becomes a napkin when you eat). Squashed in the overhead is not an option. Arrived feeling and looking terrible for meetings.

title: Turn Star Alliance into Swiss Alliiance!
review_text: I travel between Gdansk, Poland, and London Heathrow 5/6/7 times a year, usually with a stopover in Munich or Frankfurt. On this occasion, in September, I flew Swiss via Zurich.  The flights were excellent - punctual etc. - and the cabin crew were outstanding. Even the snacks were miles better than Lufthansa, And the cabin crew had learned how to smile - something Lufthansa might learn from their juniour partner  in Star Alliance. From now on, I am determined to fly Swiss.

title: Avoid overnight travel in uncomfortable beds
review_text: Wow, this was one of two extremely uncomfortable overnight flights on Swiss Air. My vegetarian meal was dried up spaghetti with what appeared to be tomato sauce in a small bowl fit for a child? The bed was too short for my height of 5'7''! There was little or no room for shoes and eyeglasses and earphones. Once was enough, but unfortunately we had to fly Swiss Air from Zurich back to Los Angeles also on an overnight and neither of us were able to sleep or enjoy anything close to a reasonable meal. Both planes were AirBus 330s and they are extremely uncomfortable despite costing a fortune.

title: Great services
review_text: I travelled from Dusseldorf to Athens via Zurich. I noticed significant improvements in regards with a previous travel flight with Swiss Air ten years ago. First of all, I travelled with 4 different types of Swiss aircraft during my journey such as the Bombardier CS100, an Airbus 321 & 320-200 and the Boeing 777-300ER. All the aircraft cabins were very clean and they had comfortable ergonomy in their seats. The cabin crew were very polite and the choises of meals I would say that were perfect for every route. I would like to travel again in the future with Swiss Air. Well done.

title: disappointing
review_text: Swiss with its A330 is an experience comparable to the low standard of some american airlines. compared to Asian and Arab airlines this is a real shame.

title: Wonderfully Different from US Carriers
review_text: Although this was a "code share" flight with United Airlines, the positive differences from US carriers were apparent beginning at the moment of entry, as the staff greeted us warmly.  We were served beverages throughout the eight hour flight -- plus a snack and two full meals.  Seat back entertainment options were virtually limitless.  And we were free to roam about the cabin thru most of the flight.  And all this was for those of us in economy class!

title: Good seats, but very poor entertainment (movie, music) package
review_text:
THe flight was OK: seats, catering, service ... but the entertainment on the flight is very poor compared to other airlines (the offered packages of music and movies are very
limiyed, othere entertainment is almost not available ... ) I did the same trip several times with other airlines (Turkish,...), and it was always a lot better.

title: Just a soso flight
review_text: Flight crew was so-so in welcoming for short hop passenger from dubsi to muscat. inflight entertainment was not working as i think its a short flight. No headset was given to listen for music. Flight got delayed

title: One of the worst airlines - connections always a problem
review_text: Had numerous problems with connections over the years. Recent flight from BCN-TLV via Zurich. BCN-Zurich delayed 1.5 hours (flight time less than that). So missed connection. Dumped in Zurich and next day forced to fly back via Vienna. Got back 12 hours late. Now still trying to get compensation - including the cost of the seat upgrade that I paid for and never got due to the missed flight. Apparently takes up to a month to get a response. Only correspondence by e-mail (unresponsive). Managed to get a response when posted on FB page but only that the complaint number had been forwarded and it can take up to a month

title: Still one of my favourites
review_text: Compared to most of the European airlines, I still prefer to fly with Swiss. Even if the flight is short, you will find a nice sandwich or warm pie in addition to drinks and Swiss chocolate. As usual, smiley and professional staff but we suffered from more than one hour delay from Zurich to Nice. Looking forward for my next flight with them

title: an airline I can recomend
review_text: Swiss International Airlines has provided me the best flight I have ever had. I was flying from Beijing to Boston, going home, a flight I have done a few times. The flight from Beijing to Zurich was in economy and as far as comfort was concerned it was no different from any other airline that I have taken. They are all uncomfortable and give you far from enough room there. But the service, food and check-ln were all very good. It was on the second leg of the flight that EVERYTHING got good. For some reason I was bumped up to Business Class. All was excellent. There was absolutely nothing to criticize there. I am recommending this airline because of their outstanding service and because there is a chance that you will get an upgrade from them. This is the only place it has happened to me and if it can happen to me it can happen to you too.

title: Flight was OK
review_text: The Swiss airline transatlantic flights are OK, the leg room is decent, though not great, the entertainment is OK , saw a couple of good movies and a food is very decent

title: Forget the business lounge in Z√ºrich
review_text:
Since Swiss Airlines do not offer direct flights from Geneva to Copenhagen, we had to transit through Z√ºrich. We had over one hour in Z√ºrich, so we decided to go to the business lounge in the Z√ºrich Airport. Unfortunately this lounge was so crowded that we could not find any seat for the two of us.I asked one of the attendants at the entry of the lounge if this was normal. The reply, in a rather arrogant tone, was yes, it's always so at peak times.
Apart from this, the service on board of the planes was quite good.

title: Sad
review_text:
Recently flew Swiss business class. It‚Äôs a bit like entering a time warp back to the mid 1990s. The screens and electrics are so old you wonder when was the last time they spent some money upgrading things. Ironically their biz class prices are as hefty as any other airline. Seat is comfortable and they have a good seat belt which I haven‚Äôt seen in any other business class service. 

Staff is overall ok. Functional, polite but not friendly. You get the sense it‚Äôs just a job and they are doing it with perfunctory efficiency. Overall it feels like Lufthansa- Swiss‚Äô owners - want to stick it to the Swiss. Kind of like saying ‚Äúwe own you so we will give you the absolute minimum to run your airline (which used to be good)‚Äù. 

Breakfast is terrible if you go for the cooked option. Ok is bread and cheese although again it feels pretty cheap.

title: Outstanding Service
review_text: Normally I wouldn't take the time to review an airline, but in this case, I have to point out the level of service the cabin crew provided me and my wife during our recent flight.  About 2 hours before landing in Zurich, my wife started feeling ill.  She got up to go to the restroom and completely passed out, falling to the floor.  The crew reacted immediately coming to her aid to help me get her up and stabilized.  It was not an easy thing to do given that she had also vomited while passed out.  We moved her to the restroom where she again passed out and started falling to the floor.  It took more than 30 minutes for before she was ready to get back to her seat.  Her clothes smelled and could not be worn so the lead flight attendant went into 1st class and brought back some clean clothes they keep on hand for emergencies.  The speed and attention given to us by the flight crew was amazing.  My wife was certainly feeling embarrassed over the episode and the lead flight attendant did her best to put her mind at ease.  We still do not know why my wife passed out, but we're extremely grateful for the service provided by this crew.

title: Swiss airlines
review_text: We flew from Bangkok to Amsterdam via Zurich and return trip from Copenhagen to Bangkok via Zurich. The air hostess and the stewards were very good with excellent service

title: Student
review_text: I've never been treated so unkindly by a flight attendant in my life. They made racist remarks and refused to answer my questions. If you have a bag with exact dimensions, they will claim it is too big, so avoid heading for the boarding area until the last moment.

title: Beware of weight of carry on
review_text:
FYI: Swiss Air does weigh baggage going into overhead bin . They allow 8K.
The leg room space is very tight on the seats on outside. On a long flight you might be better off in middle row and hope it‚Äôs not full!

title: terrible customer service
review_text: swiss left my baggage, it took them two days to deliver luggage, refuse to compensate for inconvenience and ruining my vacation. only refunded for basic toiletries.

title: Excellent flight, good economy class
review_text:
The flight was full, but the crew were efficient, despite a lot of turbulence,
Food was great , European and asian variety available in Economy.
Only negative thing about this flight : They ask you to pay for reserving seats and if you are a large family travelling together, you will end up paying 250 CHF/USD for good seats -as a minimum. Their greed for profit made me wonder -how low can the airlines fly?

title: Still reliable
review_text:
in this day and age it is nice to know that some airlines are still the same when it comes to service and quality. 
Two rather short flights on a very early Monday morning. Despite this friendly smiles and exactly the service you expect. 
Smooth boarding process and everything on time.

title: Swiss International Airlines The Best.
review_text: Flew with Swiss on 4th September to Zurich.  Brilliant Service and v professional. Cannot find anything not good to say.  Business Class super. Very relaxing and on time.

title: Terrible incident when boarding the Swiss flight at Hong Kong airport
review_text:
This time I let my wife, Yvonne Berariu Ioinovici to tell a terrible incident with Swiss :
‚ÄúAfter a flight from Taipei to Hong Kong with Eva Airways, I had the connection to Z√ºrich with Swiss ( flight LX139, July 31).
1) I went to the boarding gate with my two cabin handbags from the previous flight. When the business class passengers have been called to board the plane, The Swiss Duty Manager, Lawrence Low , wrested one of my handbags from my hand, saying that he was making no difference between economic and business class passengers ( despite the Swiss rule of allowing two cabin handbags for the business passengers). His gesture was so unexpected, that I‚Äôve almost fallen. These were my usual handbags with which I travelled hundreds of times with Swiss or Lufthansa. Never it was a problem : their dimensions are within the Swiss rules, their weight was within the Swiss rules ( otherwise, I could not carry them in my hands at my age). I showed him that the handbags could not be closed, but he did not care . He was speaking extremely rude.
2) when arriving home, I found that a few cosmetics that I bought at the free shop were not in the handbag which was checked by the Swiss agent when boarding the flight in Hong Kong ( probably they dropped from the bag which could not be closed), I phoned immediately Swiss which told me to fill a claim on-line by Internet. As I had more flights with Swiss in the following days, I filled the claim after a few more days. In their response, Swiss Customer Service wrote that it could not assume any liability,because the written claim reached them more than seven days after  the flight. They excused for the rudeness of the agent in Hong Kong , but, as they did not ask me his name, I understand that Swiss did not care to check the terrible incident and to take any measure.   
3) the tragedy was not the loss of some cosmetics of one-two hundreds US dollars. The tragedy is that in the handbag I had all my medical file containing results from MRI, ultrasounds, etc, etc made in the last years at different hospitals in Paris, Hong Kong, Taipei, Tel Aviv . At arrival, some documents were wet ( probably due to the rain in Hong Kong when the bag was introduced in the plane cargo) and are no longer readable. As I don‚Äôt remember which analysis was done in which country and in which year, even with all the millions in the world, I can not reconstitute all the medical file ‚Äú
Up to now it was the story of my wife. For me, it is unbelievable that such an incident could happen with Swiss. I am a Gold member of Miles@More, I fly every year tens of flights with Swiss, I considered them one of the best European  airlines . How was possible such an unruly  and rude behavior from the part of a Duty manager of Swiss ??? Just to mention that since then, I took by myself  12 flights with Swiss, Lufthansa and Austrian with exactly the same handbags ( including some flights with economic class ) . Never was a problem with these cabin handbags.
In the view of such a terrible incident, I think that not only that Swiss has to eliminate from its staff the guilty agent,but has to discuss the case with all its staff worldwide, to make sure that such incidents will never occur again with any passenger.

title: Fabulous service
review_text:
Fabulous service...good food actually, and great snacks. 
Always a smile on the attendants face and looked well put together and classy.

title: Surprisingly comfortable flights
review_text:
Pros:
- Fantastic choice of seats when checking in. I managed to get exit row seats on both legs of the Zurich to Singapore flight. On the way there I had a seat next to me free and it was no difference in space as being in business class.
- Price was great value. ¬£100 cheaper than competitors.
- All flights arrived on time.
- Transiting, even changing terminals, was so quick. On the way back it only took 15 minutes from being on the plane to arriving at the next gate.

Cons:
- Only thing that took this review down from 5 stars to 4 stars was the fact that my luggage got stuck in Zurich on the way back. Arrived back 8am Wednesday and didn't get my luggage until lunchtime on Saturday. 

That said I would definitely choose to fly Swiss again.

title: A surprise First Class SwissAir return
review_text: Having been upgraded into First Class on my return from JFK to Geneva, it's always difficult not to indulge in the facilities, comfort and care of those around. With only a few in our cabin, we were carefully looked after. Not over attentive or dismissive, we started with Champagne, then relaxed in an extra large seat. Once into the flight the seat opposite was converted into a full bed, after a light evening meal, I settled into a freshly made bed (yes, this was a bed), with duvet. A request for a late wake up worked a treat and I landed with a light breakfast in Geneva an hour early. If you don't want to get off the flight, I suggest, that's it's pretty OK or more than OK. Wonderful service and support from both SwissAir and their staff.

title: Always a pleasure
review_text: It is always a pleasure to fly with Swiss.  They are efficient knowledgeable and helpful.  Both at bagage drop and during the flight.  My friend had ordered vegetarian food and couldn't have been more pleased with what she received.

title: A LITTLE DISAPPOINTING
review_text: Connecting to Lufthansa First in FRA noted the lack of First Service at ZRH First check in area closed die to open at 0530 according to ground agents but never did Had to ask 3 bags to be tagged with Hon Tag for arrival service at JFK Used First Lounge A Gates which is very good but had to remind the agent I was connecting to LH First same day as per LH Gruppe lounge access rules Ala carte dining all day so had some nice lamb chops for breakfast LH only offer breakfast in their First lounges/terminal at morning times Good smoking cigar room with outdoor area Solid service on board and luckily we arrived at A Gates at FRA not on tarmac

title: "Business Class Is A Dream."
review_text: This was my first time on SWISS International Air Lines. Going in Business Class for such a long flight to Zurich made for a restful, peaceful and memorable experience.  The seats are really roomy, comfy and you can manipulate your seat with ease.  On all the flights (4) to and from Italy, the exquisite food and service was a true 5 star.  In Zurich, before the flight left for San Francisco, champagne was served and many of us stood to cheer and click glasses.  Now, that's a nice.

title: Excellent service / best price
review_text: Ground staff efficient & helpful & Knowledgable.  Flight left on time The aircraft was clean & light refreshment included was ample & the inflight complimentary milk chocolates were definatly Swiss ..Quick disembarkment & 2 minutes Our bags & skis Ready to Go...We alway do Swiss now cos for Europe trips Nobody touches Swiss..We'll be back Lol & Nuala Thanks x

title: Business Class Way to go
review_text: This flight was exceptional with the best service, the best recliners/bed and the best food, besides enjoying free baggage. Club lounge before the flight

title: Relaxing Hop
review_text: After a long day daytrip to an outlet in Vertemate, relaxing with some reasonable vino and food in the good Lufthansa Lounge at MXP A321 business reasonable short flight with the effortless ease of flying into/out of ZRH, one of the best and easiest airports on the planet inmy humble opinion Seat free next to you in C

title: SOLID
review_text: Daytrip to Como Vertemate Milano to visit an outlet Reasonable Senator Lounge at A Gates then a short friendly hope to MALPENSA airport Comfy seating in 1-2 configuration with seat next to you free This flight on CS300

title: Good value old aircrafts
review_text: I haven't taken a Swiss air flight in 15 years when it was a premier airline but it was surprising to see that the same aircrafts still flying with little upgrade. Very tight seats and shirt seat pitch,  knees can touch the back.of the seat in front and bad cushions that make it painful to sit comfortably for the.long 12 hours journey on the B777. Entertainment sucks with limited choice of movies. I had already seen all of the interesting ones on the flight from dubai to zurich which was even more tiring. The saving grace is the high level of professionalism of the flight crew and to some extent the food offered. I also used the business class lounge as I am a gold star alliance member and give the lounge a 10 out of 10. They need to work on auodatimg their aging fleet if they are to survive against giants of the industry.

title: SERVICIO DE CALIDAD
review_text:
I would like you please pass my gratitude on your  swiss team !!! I have no words to describe how excellent was the service for both of my flights. The difference could be noticed since you enter to the plane. The legroom, the comfortable seats,service, the efficent pilote, the food,etc.  I was surprise when food was serviced on board, the quallity was really good, looked like a homemade dessert. Also, i would like to thank for the chocolates on board, that was an extra memorable thing. And the last thnig that made the difference waas the smile from the crew member (even pilote) when you are leaving the plane. I can not finish this comment withouth mentioning the excellent work of the pilote, the flight was so comfortable all the time.

Maybe something that you could get better is the check.-in online. There was too many information required like ticket number or things like that.

I flight very often to Switzerland, but i have never gotten such a wonderfull service like yours.

Thank you for that beautiful flight !!!

title: Could not make seat selections without paying substantial money
review_text: Can't be more blunt.  I would like to have a window seat, but paying large sums to do so is just a rip off!!!  Come on Swiss air, you are better than that!!  Also had a lunch which was some vegetable sause in a peta.  Yuck!!!  It was awful.  The plane was on time but I got a middle seat which is not what I wanted.  Maybe next time.

title: Not up to expectations
review_text: Out first flight with Swiss was disappointing. We expected Swiss to be a cut above most of their competitors. Instead we were delayed by 40 minutes without explanation and the service well below other airlines. We were only served one drink and the food was dehydrated, chewy and largely unpalatable. Trays were not collected until at least half an hour after finishing, toilets were not checked or restocked, water was hardly offered in the first 6 hours of the flight. My monitor was broken and could not be set up for viewing. Spare seats for leg room in economy were usurped by a few young men and the stewardess laughed at their audacity but did not request they return to their purchased seats. I always thought Swiss was a superior airline but this recent experience challenges that supposition.

title: no wonder they went bankrupt
review_text:
can only book by phone
Hong Kong residents cannot book on line !!
Hong Kong has no zip code (postleitzahl auf Deutsch)
called 3 numbers, NOBODY KNOWS !!!
INTERNATIONAL AIRLINE, hahahaha

title: Great value for the fare we paid
review_text: We‚Äôve flown Swiss before and this time booked middle row seats so we both had aisle access. Staff are attentive and friendly, and the meals just fine. We enjoyed the seats with the massage function, also the inflate/ deflate feature. Foot room is a little tight when lying down, but that‚Äôs a small niggle. We chose Swiss as there business class fare was the cheapest of any airline, but their service was anything but cheap. Will fly with them again any time.

title: REGULAR FLATBED FROM TLVVEEE
review_text: Swiss maintain A330 and sometimes 777ER to from TLV Solid service on ground Thx to Laufer Aviation and good service on board Use of Dan Lounge prior to flight Throne seat 4A in Senator mini cabin  It really is the only way to connect to/from TLV If you want a flatbed and a comfy ride

title: Nice crew
review_text:
It was an airline in a holiday package deal; unfortunate then you couldn't reserve an seat, or organise a vegetarian meal, lousy! 
The staff was friendly, the food average, entertainment on board perfect.

title: Excellent
review_text:
Typically Swiss air doesn‚Äôt do much bragging but it is a quietly efficient and excellent airline  Service is brisk and super friendly and nothing was too much trouble for the hostess that served us.  We flew on new aircrafts which are clean and comfortable with lots of leg room,  the cherry on top was the delicious chocolates that they serve onboard,  thank you Swiss Air for a memorable start to my holiday.

Shaney

title: Amazing crew for everyone
review_text: Great flight with accommodating crew. Entire crew is very accommodating and taking care of passengers (not only myself but everyone on board) with their great sense of service.From water service to dinner followed by breakfast services, I must say the crew made the flight fly higher with their willingness to serve everyone; to the simplest gesture, a tray of apple and bottle waters available throughout the entire both flights. Besides, I had a stopover in Zurich for 11 hours and I was advised by the crew on what to do in Zurich for a short tour. I really had a great time with their recommendations. Thanks to SWISS team.

title: Very friendly staff, great experience
review_text: The crew was incredibly helpful and kind. Even though there was a delay due to weather conditions, they made sure every passenger could still get to their final destination. Would definetly recommend!

title: Amazing Staff
review_text: We took Swiss Airlines for our Honeymoon in our return flights (3 that we took) we sat with a flight attendant who was also flying and working our next flight. She was so friendly and amazing and was talking to us about Europe and places that are fun to visit. On the flight from GVA-JFK she surprised us with some chocolate, a small champagne bottle and an airplane stuffed animal. We were so appreciated of how thoughtful the staff was and really enjoyed flying with Swiss. It really gave us a special ending to our honeymoon before landing in NY a big thank you to the crews of Swiss flying GVA-ZRH-JFKLX22.

title: Quick and pleasant flight
review_text: Swiss Air Lines is obviously a big plus. Polite crew members, experienced pilot, snack and water offered during the 2 hour flight. Very satisfied.

title: Quiet flight
review_text: In August we flew as a party of 3 people from Zurich to Hongkong. The chairs were a liitle bit small and not so much space for legs. Otherwise service and food were very good. The airplane was clean. No problem with the luggage.

title: Zurich-Vienna unplugged
review_text: An uneventful, comfortable flight as one would expect from SWISS. Friendly and attentive service, nice champagne, a small but excellent dish of salmon, and on-time arrival!  Flying at its best!

title: all-in service in 41 minutes
review_text: The flight was delayed but considering it involved a change of A321 on the incoming flight from Zurich, not too badly - in principle 15 minutes. In reality our 10am departure flight finally took off from Geneva at 11am, for what the captain announced would be a 30 minute flight. Well, it ended up being 41 minutes as there was traffic congestion in Zurich. But still: the SWISS cabin staff serviced a full plane of 203 passengers in that short spell of time, and no-one missed their connection. Congratulations SWISS!

title: Overall a pleasant flight from Palermo to Zurich
review_text:
Pleasant flight, late departure beyond the control of the pilot yet we arrived on time.
Pleasant service from the flight attendants

title: feelin like at home
review_text: a smooth flight, excellent service.time just passed very quickly.so that means, again and again. was fun

title: Long-legged people stand clear!
review_text:
The aircraft for the flight was a brand new Bombardier CS 300. New airplane better accommodation, I thought. How wrong was I.

Compared to an Airbus it has less comfortable seats, shorter legroom and thigh support, very upright back of seats and limited adjustment. 

There is in-flight entertainment but, as you can see from the attached pictures, you need magnifying glasses to see anything.

The offered meal consisted of a small, mushy and gummy, cheese-only sandwich. Swiss advertises the bread as..."Swiss bakery tradition" baked fresh every morning in Geneva! 
Whoever wrote that definitely never set foot in Switzerland let alone tasted any of the multiple varieties of wonderful breads the different Swiss regions can offer. 
I join a couple of pictures of the sandwich packaging, unfortunately I thought too late of taking a picture of the sandwich.
A beer to help swallowing it set me back 5.00 ‚Ç¨.

And finally, if you thought that the Toilet in the old trains was rather small, once you saw the ones in the CS 300, you'll change your mind.

On the bright side, we left the gate almost on time and arrived in Geneva as scheduled.
The personnel did its job, no more no less than required.

We traveled a lot from the USA to CH and back, most of the times with Swiss. The airline used to be rated among the best airlines, if not the best.

I wonder where it stands today.

title: Great experience with swiss air
review_text: very professional, on time and comfortable airline, though took a short flight to Oman from Dubai yet the service was as per swiss standards. great experience, highly recommendable

title: It doesn‚Äôt get much worse .
review_text: I was supposed to land in Zurich for an hour layover at 11:40am. My flight to Rome left at 12:40 and we landed in Zurich at 1:00pm . Ok I had a connection in Rome leaving at 5:30 so there is still time to make the flight . No the flight won‚Äôt leave until after 5 so I was given this $20 food voucher to go eat . Ok so it was only good at a couple places and all I could get was a partial glass of wine and 4 little pieces of sushi . I‚Äôm vegetarian so that is all there was but it came to 20.50 and sir we don‚Äôt take dollars or euro ? My credit card is not turned on for Switzerland so I had to change 10 euros because it was the smallest bill . What the hell are these ? Swiss Francs so now I have 9.50 good for absolutely nothing but water but that is free in the fountain ? 5 o‚Äôclock came and went . And then 6pm came and went . And then 7 pm came and went . I‚Äôm totally exhausted and very hungry but I don‚Äôt eat junk food . Finally about 8 we are moved from gate 83 to gate 48. I‚Äôm dead tired but I made the trek thru the airport . There is no seating and if I sit on the floor I won‚Äôt be able to get up . Finally about 8:45 we are busses to an airplane ? We board and we are to land a little after 9pm ? More like 9:30 when the bus gets to us . So do I stay at the airport and spend $350 to book a flight to Palermo after I pay $250 for a room ? That is $600 and more than I can afford . So a taxi to the train station is about 50 euro and the driver says for 60 euro I can get you there in time to get a ticket on the night train to Palermo . Ok and we made it with 20 minutes to spare . 105 euro more so now I‚Äôm out 175 euro but there is nothing open at the train station to eat ? So I board the train with my stomach killing me . Thank god for kind Italian people because the gentleman in my car had 2- cookies he gave me to eat . We ride the train all night and finally arrive in Messina . It is now a bus ride and no longer a train to Palermo . The bus is outside and ready to leave so again nothing to eat . It was a slow bus that took 3-1/2 hours but it didn‚Äôt take me all the way to Palermo . So a few more euro and another train ride . I‚Äôm now 24 hours late when I finally arrive in Palermo . Guess what I paid 75 euro for my room I didn‚Äôt use . So now I‚Äôm up to 255 euro I‚Äôm out and I missed a whole day in Palermo . I am so hungry and tired now on Friday and I left on Wednesday when I started my trip . Saturday comes but I‚Äôm still dead tired . So I sleep and rest most of the day . For gods sake I‚Äôm 66 years old and no 21 year old college kid . I save money all year to take a vacation and I‚Äôve totally missed my first stop of Palermo and I‚Äôm out yet another 255 euro for NOTHING . So now I cut back on my trip and buy things from the grocery to eat instead of a nice rest. Oh I forgot to say , I scared the hell out of family and friends when I couldn‚Äôt contact them because I didn‚Äôt arrive on time . They called the Italian government trying to figure out if I was killed or in a accident. Thank you Swiss Air for ruining a vacation of a lifetime

title: Old plane with broken chairs
review_text: My flight back to dubai via swiss air was disappointing, once world number 1 flight carrier planes became very old, I was shocked to find my seat had broken back and sliding chair, how the cleaners or the detectors didn't notice it before accepting passengers, also the quality of food was low, it wasn't pleasant flight, the only nice thing to be find was the smily faces of the stuwardess . On the other hand the flight to europe by Lufthansa was much more pleasant, more clean planes, normal food, surprisingly both of them belongs to the same group.

title: No complaints
review_text: Comfortable seats, adequate leg room, friendly staff, no delays - I have no complaints at all about Swiss air.

title: SWISS offers great service in Business
review_text:
The decision to upgrade to business was due to flight length. . . . almost 12 daylight hours. The flight was full and although it departed 35 minutes late it landed at SFO slightly ahead of schedule.

The service level on this flight was exceptional.  The cabin staff was focused on client needs, friendly yet efficient.   The meal service was very nice and the main meal service (veal stew) was excellent as was the bordeaux wine.

Great job, Swiss.  Thanks!!

title: reasonable price-poor space in economy
review_text: Kind staff, good service, on time schedule. Although i am a short person :) the seats are really tight!

title: A poor experience
review_text: SWISS simply refused to change my business class ticket, and said they only way it could be changed is to cancel and rebook another at a significant cost. I already had paid a large amount for the ticket. I am a regular business traveller and top tier frequent flyer within a number of programs, but this is the first time an airline simply refused to allow a change to a business ticket. I wouldn't have minded paying a change fee, however there wasn't even that option. Their customer service in this instance was terrible with zero flexibility or understanding. I certainly will not be flying with these again, their behaviour is more aligned with that of a budget carrier!

title: Good, but..
review_text: Swiss is a solid airlines company, very secure and usually reliable. What I noticed though is that lately the food has become mediocre in taste and  smaller in portion. This I do not understand given the high prizes of the company.

title: Another great experience
review_text: SWISS AIR - again proved to be a great choice for flying cross the Atlantic.  The flight was on time, had good food, and the crew was just great.

title: Old aircraft. Argh
review_text:
I traveled biz class for work and brought my daughter. I thought, as she is a minor, she‚Äôd be allowed in the biz lounge. No way. You have to pay 47CHF to get in and pay online ahead of time. Strike 1. So I didn‚Äôt use the lounge. Then same doodoo in Z√ºrich. So we chilled around for 2 hours. Then flight Z√ºrich to Joburg was and OLD A340 and was crap. No usb key chargers, all was just ugly bud full flat bed ok. Tv screen was also horrid as hell, old style, bad, really bad, resolution, with so few choices. Food ok too. As for economy, crappiest food, also no usb, horrid screen etc. Only good this is she had 2 seats for her, but tight as h&$ll on return with lady falling asleep on her and every which way with head bobbing... 
I will not recommend on this route to/from Joburg to Switzerland. And as for lounge at JNB, great but couldn‚Äôt take my daughter. Lounge at Z√ºrich very nice, awesome showers but way too small. Hardly any space to sit!!! Very disappointed. Will avoid swiss in future.

title: Enjoyable
review_text: We travelled twice with Swiss Air from Budapest to Zurich and Zurich to Chicago on Aug 28th.  Both flights were enjoyable.  The first flight was short and early in the morning and we got a roll with the beverage service.  The flight from Zurich to Chicago was over 9 hours long.  We got great service with a friendly and reliable stewardesses and stewards.  We had four beverage services, a full dinner, pizza, ice cream and the usual pretzels.  We also had multiple movies, etc provided.

title: Best economic class 2019!
review_text:
It's always a treat to fly with Swiss Air! No fuss or frills but everything else are well thought through and of a high standard. I always love the dinner & breakfast (and the gin & tonic) but the highlight is the real Swiss chocolate afterwards!
The best thing about flying Swiss Air is the 2 x 23kg bag allowance.

title: just great as always
review_text: just great as always. usually using Swiss air for my business trips if possible. they have great service even in economy...

title: great Flight from Tel aviv to Dusseldorf
review_text:
I got an upgrade to Business for the first lag (TLV - Zurich) and it was amazing - the service was amazing as well as the seats are super comfortable.
Btw, the economy class seats and service is also really good.
For the  2nd lag, Zurich - Dusseldorf, was also really good.

title: Far East Holiday
review_text: Flying from Singapore to London via Zurich was one of the most comfortable I have ever experienced.  I even managed to get some sleep which is rare as I don't often sleep well especially on flights.  The food and service was very good and the crew friendly and helpful.

title: Hindu meal is worst preparation by any Airlines.
review_text: The Hindu meal is worst prepared by Hilti . It is not Indian and lacks any taste. I had to request another meal. It was full of rice with no curry. Some boiled okra with carrots. I will suggest to include Hindu vegetarian  and Hindu non veg with chicken. No other Airlines have the same menu. The best Hindu meal Is prepared bu Emirates or Air India

title: Quality standard flight
review_text: Smooth check in, departure on time, helpful staff, good food. The entertainment on the board is not bad but could be improved.

title: excellent
review_text:
excellent service / excellent food service (3 times in 9 hours flight)
plus drinks in between..blankets/hot wet towels ear piece for movie listening..nice size screen on the back of the seat with a lot of movies
very clean plane..very comfortable seats.

title: Enjoyable flight
review_text: Me and my daughter travelled to Milan via Zurich by Swiss airways. It was a good flight and really enjoyed it. The staff were nice. I liked Zurich Airport.

title: HOSPITABLE STAFF
review_text: apart from comfortable and massaging flat bed seats,the staff was exceptionally very pleasant and eager to serve.they served a gourmet meal with extended smile.and were eager and attentive to all the needs.

title: Best in every way
review_text: The service, cleanliness, equipment and professionalism is a cut above... They completely go above and beyond and it will be my choice every chance I get.

title: the worst flight ever
review_text: not only were the seats totally cramped, the covers were dingy. the video screens were cloudy and the food was unpalatable.  also, if you have to wait for a flight, the terminal is barren with poor food options. go SAA - much, much better.

title: Delayed but well looked after
review_text:
My daughter and I were waiting for a flight home from Zurich with Swiss. We were at the loading gate but no-one was telling us anything about what was happening. It was obvious there was a problem with the plane because the ‚Äòbonnet‚Äô of one engine was open. It transpired that this engine had developed a fault which couldn‚Äôt be fixed immediately. After a little confusion Swiss arranged hotel accommodation in 2 separate rooms in a very good hotel in Zurich where we were to stay overnight. We were transported to the hotel and given vouchers for food and drink. The value of the vouchers wasn‚Äôt huge but it was adequate for dinner and drinks. We were collected from the hotel next morning and taken back to join a different aircraft which flew us home.
I can only praise Swiss for the service we received and would recommend this airline to anyone.

title: Palermo to Zurich to JFK
review_text:
Exceptional Service, Exceptional Food, Exceptional Entertainment Options.

The only complaint would be about Zurich security.  Be prepared for a security line right before your gate, SURPRISE!, if you are leaving for the U.S.  IF you are lucky enough to get the random TSA second security check your plane may end up having to wait for you.  So, don't delay in getting to your gate if you have a short lay over and are leaving for the U.S.

title: Not worth the money
review_text: Technical problems was the excuse this time. Swiss airline fly the Bombardier 100/300 on this route and this is the second time I have had a problem. This led to missing our designated slot for take off, so a 1.5 hour delay.

title: the NEW rules of missing a flight
review_text: Never missed a flight in 50 years. My Mon Sep 2 flight from Charlotte to JFK was incrementally delayed (first 1hr, then 2...stuck on plane, tease about departing soon etc ) I was forced to miss my Swiss flight to Milan MXP out of JFK that evening at 9pm. Exhausted, I called Swiss to explain and find out if I could get on another flight next day. It was hard to hear the Swiss rep on my mobile but over $1500 was too much. So I found another way to get to my 90 yr old Mom quickly. Figured I could use the Swiss R/T return ticket. Sat Sep 7 I was ready to check in online with Swiss in Italy and had difficulty with mobile connectivity. Swiss had sent an email stating my seat assignment changed, but no reference that Swiss was planning to bill me an exorbitant  surcharge just to be able to use the return portion of my JFK MXP R/T. When eventually I was able to contact Swiss representatives by phone they were in full "legal statement response" mode. Swiss failure to contact me following the missed JFK flight means I would show up the Swiss counter at MXP last minute without many other options but pay Swiss hijack rate. I am hoping Swiss is able to see their way to refunding my full fare. I would have eaten the loss of the outbound flight due to unavoidable circumstance, had they simply allowed me to use the return fare

title: disappointing and rude
review_text: well this is not what you pay for - the attendant for the section was rude, condesending and questionable. at one point after being paged (the button you press when you call the attendant) she opened with there are 45 people in my section and i cannot rush to you when you need something. nothing like being scolded at 38000 ft in the air. food a disappointment, the seats are old and slightly uncomfortable, bring sanitary wipes to clean your space and the inflight selections limited. not what was expected.

title: Traveling on Swiss Airlines - Business Class
review_text: Excellent Service... First time I was on Swiss Air and would definitely consider them in the future.

title: business pleasure trip
review_text:
I used to fly BA whenever I went to Geneva which is 2 or 3 times a year. 
I now use Swiss as they are cheaper and I feel a better inflight service.

title: Smooth flight
review_text: The flight worked smoothly without a hitch. Staff professional, food nutritious, and passengers orderly and civil. The trains in Switzerland ran like clockwork, so I expected my flight will too, but my plane landed with some delay. Not a complaint, but a praise for their trains.

title: Swissair flight to Bangkok from London
review_text: First time on Swissair flight and though it was efficient, food was ok, the staff were relatively friendly but the seats were very small. It was not a very comfortable ride. I've done this trip many times before and will be going back to Emirates or Etihad as they are far better.

title: Great service with plenty of smiles
review_text: As Kiwi's looking to get from Eupen in Belgium to Zurich, we were a little overwhelmed with the online options available for flights. We opted for Dusseldorf due to the autobahn access at both ends of the journey and took up friends over to drive us. the flight itself was well organised, the staff  ultra friendly and the onboard entertainment was great and to top off an enjoyable experience we even got handed out Swiss Chocolate when exiting the plane!

title: An enjoyable experience
review_text: We flew from Larnaca airport to New York via Zurich. The first part of the trip was short and confortable with a late night arrival to Zurich. Our luggage was transit to New York and we spent the night on a handbag at the Airport Radisson Blue which was a great experience ( extra cost covered by us) Early morning we checked in for New York at a very confortable 8 hour- flight with an excellent service and deliscious in flight food. We will definately fly with Swiss any time this is possible.

title: A+ Airline with the best airline food ever!
review_text: Seamless boarding onto a modern plane. Extremely comfortable seats (even in economy class) made even more comfortable with footrests. Pleasant flight attendants and without a doubt, the best airline food ever!!

title: Baggage Delay by Swiss International Airline
review_text:
I flew from London City Airport, transfered in Zurich, to Beijing, on 23 August 2019. When I landed in Beijing at 5am 24 August, my check-in baggage was delayed in Zurich and no updates were given to me until I had to find out after queueing at baggage lost in Air China Airport Office (Swiss International Airline‚Äôs partner). Then I was told the baggage would be shipped by the same flight the next day and it would be delivered to me. After more than 30 hours of anxious waiting, still no news from anyone. I started to call Swiss International Airline office for updates. The operator answered me politely, but basically repeatedly stated that she knew nothing more than the info I can check out from their website, there was nothing they can do on their end, and all she could advise was to wait. 

Eventually after 35 hours, I got my baggage, everything was there. Through the whole process, Swiss Airline never for once contacted me either via email or telephone, they totally ignored and neglected the anxious, unsettling feeling of an ordinary passenger after 10 hours of international flight and another 35 hours of waiting, acting as if it was none of their business to get the baggage delayed for 35 hours. 

I then needed a Property Irregularity Report issued by Swiss International Airline for my travel insurance claim, I made my request through their website, on 25 August. Another 8 days later on 3rd September I received their arrogent reply, with no regret whatsoever and threw me a piece of pre-formatted statement with no baggage delivery time on it (which I specifically requested for), and remind me that was their worldwide standard form and cannot be modified, and I quote them ‚Äúhope that this information suffices to whatever purpose it may serve.‚Äù

Once again I sensed they did not care much about client‚Äôs interests at all, ‚Äúwhatever, whatever, whatever‚Äù through their cold machinery tone and the aloof way they handling the whole case. 

Maybe they are used to the scenario, but I am certainly not. I will seriously reconsider to book another flight with Swiss International Airline. (As a service provider, they are not so punctual, nor professional.)

title: Amazing!
review_text: The flight was amazing. I have never been on a more comfortable flight. I just didn‚Äôt want to leave!

title: I'll fly with them any time!
review_text: We were glad we got to the airport early - security was thorough.  I was told in the Swiss Air lounge to arrive at the gate early because I was subject to a random check - according to the code on my my boarding pass.  The lounge was a wonderful experience (great variety of food, lots of attentive people working) but we did leave early to get to the gate - a wise decision.

title: unexpected transfer
review_text: my partner and myself, arrived at barcelona airport terminal 2 eary due to poor weather conditions,only to be confronted will a queue for Lufhansa 30plus metres long. when we managered to get to the counter,aftter two an a half hours. the staff from Lufthansa(non apologetic)) said your flight to Munich has been cancelled due to a strike at Munchin airport.it seemed like all the staff for Lufthansa didn't have a clue what to do. and out of no wear the staff from lufthansa said your are now booked on Swiss air leaving an hour later than schedule and flying via Zurich.the flight to Zurich was uneventful and pleasant. Zurich was a rushed transfer to the boeing 777 but made very welcome, when we arrived for boarding.the 12 hour flight to Singapore we were given really good seat with the middle seat being vacant bonus.the Swiss staff seemed a happy bunch, which make for a good flight. all so often airline staff seem to  look down on there passengers as we are mere plebs.we had two meals both of good quality and drinks. i watch a couple of movies and a drifting sleep for 6 hours..the flight was so smooth and peaceful, that when we arrived at singapore niether my self or my partner suffered any jet lag. i put this down to the smooth flights we had from Barcelona to our destination, a total of around 14 hours. Swiss air get my tick of approval. the date flown was 28/8/19

title: Not complying with European Law
review_text:
Late arrival by 26 hours in Brussels. European law: compensation of 600 Euro. Swiss Air refuses to pay, knowing that customer will not make court expenses for this amount.
never fly this airline again. Crooks Air would be a better name for them.
BTW: video system didn't work during the leg Tokyo -Zurich

title: How flying should be
review_text:
Everything went exactly as booked, including requesting a special meal for an allergy, and for a gift to be presented on board.

Cabin staff very friendly and engaging, and they went out of their way to ensure our experience was nothing short of amazing.

title: Flight OK; Customer service is a nightmare
review_text:
Second time having a very disappointing time with Swiss airlines after a flight that went wrong because of error made by Swiss.

Flight from Zurich took off 25 minutes late because waiting for late passengers. As a result we missed a connection and arrived 24 hours too late to our final destination.

According to EU flight regulation, we are entitled a small compensation, which I asked Swiss customer support for. They kept a very inconsistent story and fed me different stories on how the flight was actually delayed because of problems at destination airport, and later they said it was because of weather. I could easily prove that both were falsehoods, which they acknowledged, but still refused to give any sort of compensation.

Had to hire a 3rd party to claim compensation for the airline. I do not recommend flying with swiss at any cost.

title: Consistency is key, and Swiss is the best!
review_text:
I'm fortunate enough to fly Swiss on a regular basis, and even more fortunate to be able to fly First Class on many of those occasions.  Without a doubt, Swiss is the most consistent airline in the sky.

Ground Experience ORD-
Connecting in ORD is a pain these days with the Automatic Transport System down, however recently the airside bus service has finally extended itself to Terminal 1 which means that those connecting from United (like I was from LAS) are now able to take a bus and save the replacement bus and security re-clearance experience (Previous the bus only served the AA terminals).  There was still a wait for the bus, however it saved much time compared to leaving the terminal and queuing for the busses.
On arrival at T5 I walked directly to the Swiss Lounge near gate M9.  The staff at the ORD lounge is consistently great, and this time was no exception.  A quick swipe of the boarding pass and I was showing into the First/HON section of the lounge (the Business section is a bit small and can fill up but this section is reserved for HON status customers and people flying in First).  
I found out I was the only passenger in F on tonight's flight so had a run of the lounge until an HON member showed up closer to boarding.  I decided to sample some of the food menu (photos included) and went for the ambitious crab stuffed, bacon wrapped prawns.  They were great!  I'll mention again the service is great, and it's quite good to see the same people around after having flown through ORD once every few months.

I was offered the chance to pre board or board late and decided to pre-board to get settled into the cabin.  The lounge attendant took me herself to the gate and handed me off directly to the agents right as pre-boarding started.  Within seconds I was onboard the Swiss 777.

Cabin/Seat
While Air France may have a slightly more private design in their 777s with the full length curtains they offer, I really love the spaciousness of the Swiss cabin, with its 2 rows and 8 total seats.  A huge improvement of the Airbus 333 is the addition of a second toilet (which is also being added during the retrofit of the redesigned A340s).  
The seat itself is similar in looks to the other Swiss First Class seats, very modern looking wood finish and a brown seat.  The TV screen is MASSIVE, and the locker and privacy screen on the side extend to become essentially a privacy door.

Service
As I was the only passenger I was even more spoiled than normal, the service was simply amazing.  I was greeted with a glass of champagne with some nuts, shown the menu, handed pyjamas and settled in as the aircraft boarded.  The captain came out to say hello and quickly describe the flight path,  which was a nice touch, and the Ma√Ætre de Cabine also stopped by to chat.   A few refills of champagne later, we were in the air.  

Typically I find that the food at outstations isn't nearly as decent as the food at the home airport.  With Swiss, this doesn't seem to be an issue.  I ordered only a soup to start and had a chicken  main course and a dessert.  The quality of everything was great, and most impressively I was able to complete my dining within 45 minutes of take off.  In the meantime a bed was setup proactively in another empty chair (and extra pillows proactively offered) and I was able to sleep for at least 5 hours of the 7 hour flight.  I woke up with about an hour to go, and they still offered a full breakfast service.  At the end of the flight I had my round of goodbyes (including a nice personalised note from the Ma√Ætre de Cabine who had unfortunately lost her voice overnight).  

ZRH Service
One of the great features Swiss now offers their First Class customers is a private transfer to immigration-- for anyone who flies to ZRH and doesn't have an EU or Swiss passport this is a huge time saver.  Not having to take the Heidi train or wait behind a few hundred people who arrived before me, I was able to arrive at the baggage claim within about 10 minutes of landing.  My bag took a bit more time to come out (because it didn't receive the HON tag as I started on a United flight), but I was still on a train home within 25 min of landing.

Room for Improvement?
While the service is amazing and the cabin is great, there are a few minor things that can be annoying iif one flies Swiss often.  First, the menu only changes every 4 months- this meant I had the same options as I did my last 2 flights through ZRH.  Not a huge issue, but would love some added variety.  Second, the entertainment, while impressive in quality and screen size, the movie selection is pretty poor and doesn't change often (I think maybe the older movies may change once a year even?).  This was less of an issue on the overnight flight where I slept, but it was hard to kill 10+ hours on the way over.

Those are however probably some of the most minor complaints to be had.  The experience itself was amazing.  I do think there's a good reason why Swiss tends to make First Class quite exclusive (Indeed only Senator and HON can book these seats as reward flights), it's simply worth it!   If you have an opportunity to experience it, it's highly recommend and they do occasionally offer some decent offers.  I certainly will look forward to my next flight!

title: Excelent service
review_text: Excelent service before, during and after the flight (I had to catch a connection on a very short span and they changed my seat to get priority on landing without problem). Very on time. Dinner was above expected, water provided in bottles on demand at all times. Breakfast 5 stars, with warm bread and pastries, cheese, yogurt, etc.

title: Excellent staff. Great meals:-)
review_text: Great meals. Good french wines. Kind staff. They are  provided pillows and  blankets. This was an efficient and easy trip:-) It is only a short flight, and with the service enhancements on the ground (fast-track security, lounge access & priority boarding), it was quite good value.

title: Flight with no fuss but plenty of prompt reliability.
review_text: Prompt and efficient, both at the airport desk and waiting to board.  As ever, the Swiss are meticulous at sticking to their time table and this flight was no exception.  No charge for tea, coffee or wine and we also received a complementary snack.  Heartily recommend this reliable airline.  The Swiss are masters in perfection.

title: Service level is great!
review_text:
Flying from Denmark to Z√ºrich and Z√ºrich to Venice (and back). Flights of 2 and 1 hour - and the service was more than expected! Nice crew and nice, spacious plane. 
Will definitely use them again.

title: Keeps you informed, fast.
review_text: With the Swiss-app it is very easy to get your tickets, online check in and you receive fast and accurate information about delays. Although my flight from Geneva was 1 hour delayed, I did get on the plane to Gothenburg i Zurich. Very service oriented staff on the flight. Best legroom I have experienced so far in economy.

title: Could be better
review_text: First of all I would like to thank Swiss air for their punctuality and professional pilots. The departure was with 10 minutes delay which is very good. Second If you are a star alliance gold member like me, you are not entitled to choose your seat online. The check-in and choosing seats is done at the airport. My flight was a co-share with Egypt air and it was operated by Swiss air. I booked my ticket through Egypt air website. Neither airlines allowed me to choose my seat nor to check-in online. That was surprising. It was a a waste of time to do all the procedures at the airport. Talking about the airplane, my seat had no handle so I was leaning on the window throughout the flight. I am not sure why the Swiss air is not working on seats‚Äô maintenance!!! The meals are horrible on board. When I booked my ticket I asked for a Muslim meal. I checked at the counter before I board the plane to make sure I will have the right meal as stated in my booking, they confirmed that my request had been processed. When the flight attendant offered the meal she had no idea that I have a special meal. Then she told me she might not have any extra moslem meal for me. What kind of service is this!!!!!! Luckily I had the right meal but after a while. Luggage was handled with care and came in priority as it should be for a star alliance gold member.

title: Food , beer and chocolate
review_text: After the intensive security of St. Petersburg airport Swiss Air to Zurich was an absolute delight.  Comfortable, reasonable food, free beer and those amazing Swiss chocolates.  At Zurich after a long walk to the connecting departure gate for the Geneva flight it was so easy to get WiFI and tune into Test Match Special to listen to the closing moments of Ben Stokes famous innings against Australia.

title: non stop direct- Miami to Zurich round trip
review_text:
Easy choice for non stop direct to Europe from Miami and non stop direct return flighThe price was reasonable.the plane was an Airbus 330 with individual viewing screens for movies ,tv, music during the flightThe service was excellent with meals, which you could choose from when booking(dinner).also continuous drinks snacks and breakfast going to Switzerland and lunch coming back to Miami
.Remember I took Economy so not as many perks as Business class.Swiss time arrivals. HIghly recommended!

title: Wonderful crew, great service
review_text: We just returned from an 8 day vacation to Switzerland and flew Swiss Air from Newark to Zurich.  We found the crews to be attentive, friendly, and very concerned about their passengers.  The food, I felt, was very good and we had enjoyable, smooth flights.  We paid the upgrade for bulk head seating (row 23 seats J and K) and there was more than enough leg room.  The seats are a little narrow but in general being able to stretch out was well worth the extra cost.  Great job Swiss Air.

title: Just a joke
review_text: Aircraft arrives late, then (as we take off 2hrs late) flight cancelled due to weather conditions. Hige chaos, zero guidance from Swiss ground staff, overvooked hotels, ridiculous cues to only find out you get nothing for hotel as this is due to wearher. Fair, but you need to manage the situation and make lifenof your guests bearable. Your business process, staff, communications and info booth where the worst I have seen in 40 years of travellling, Swiss.

title: Good Reliable Swiss airline
review_text: First time with this airline, nice maintained planes, friendly professional staff and meals were good as well. Downside was the entertainment was very Swiss focused and not as broad as eg Air NZ, Emirates or Singapore Airlines. Also, if you like to book a Seat in advance, it will cost you $68 per Seat per flight. Still a good airline to take in consideration! Can recommend!

title: Never again!
review_text: Dont bother paying for extra leg room..it doesnt have any! The air is centrally controlled and we died of heat but some of our party was wowards the front of the economy cabin and they froze. We wish we were up there or i  the back of the plane where it was also nice and cool. If someone reclines their seat in front of you its horrible!  It was the most miserable flight I have ever been on. The food wasn't bad.

title: What service on an Airline
review_text: Our flight was on time and the service was excellent, they remains me of the time when airlines were swear of the price it‚Äôs pasajera pay to flight ‚úàÔ∏è, we were given real food not and not made ya feel like those long hours were their opportunity for them to make money from us , I can not say enough good thing about this air line ,, we will continue traveling with them and will recommend 100%, please be sweat that a give the airline all this praise after I had a really long TSA mandatory boarding to Tampa from Zurich,, they even made the inconvenience seem small , Thank you Swiss airlines

title: Lovely air line
review_text: What a Joy! On time, nice smallish 2 abreast aircraft, no silly selling of goods. Air crew came along with a cardboard tray of a small wholemeal baguettes either cheese or ham and a choice of a soft drink. Then to finish a piece of lovely Swiss chocolate and all Free! Just felt nice and relaxed and professional.

title: Friendly service
review_text: Though it was a short flight, the flight attendants were very attentive, and did their best to ensure we were well taken care of. One of them got for me a vegan/vegetarian meal though it was not offered from the usual selections.

title: Good routine flight
review_text: This was a good flight. Everything went well. We left a bit late because of the rainy and somewhat inclement weather, but that was not the fault of the airline and it did no in any way disrupt or impede our flight and eventual arrival in Zurich.

title: Elderweiss Airline - Excellent!
review_text:
Flew on holiday with Swiss Air and Elderweiss.  The cabin crew on Elderweiss were excellent they worked non stop on the 9hr flight. They were very helpful and polite, the food and dnacks on the flight were very good too. I ha e read some reviews which did not speak very highly of this airline but I was very impressed.
It was the best economy long haul flight I've flown on 
Swiss Air from Heathrow to Zurich was very good as well 
Note that you have to buy alcoholic drinks on the flights.

title: Older plane but soft seats and good service
review_text:
Flew Chicago to Nairobi with a layover in Zurich. The plane was older, but seats were comfortable and service was great. One complaint was that seats either sat fully upright or laid fully back. There was no half-tilt option. 

Food and wine in economy were both very good.

title: Joelawless
review_text: Great airline, greeted by captain upon entering plane, video display above every seat showing exactly where you are, friendly staff, and free Swiss chocolate on every flight.

title: An Excellent Alternative Route from Beijing to Boston
review_text:
You take longer hours (8 hours + 10 hours) but you can have a good rest in between (Zurich). More importantly, the service of the economic class is better than many other airlines. For example, the food quality is beyond my expectation: The swiss cheese is delicious.

The only draw back is the departure time is 6:45am and you have to arrive at the airport about 4am.

title: First Class!
review_text:
Flying with Swiss in economy is like flying on first class on some airlines, the staff are so helpful, they even gave out refreshments on this short flight, and the seats are really comfortable and lots of leg space,
Highly recommended

title: Fly Swiss, but avoid sandwich
review_text: Overall a good service. The flight was on time and the personnel was kind and competent. The only negative comment is about the sandwich which was presented as  "an example of swiss bakery". I could not see what one should be proud of...it was cold, not tasty and the bread was hardly eatable.

title: None better
review_text: Our flight (three of us) from Warsaw to Zurich was sufficiently delayed such that it would have been impossible to make our connection to Tampa. We relayed our concern on the plane to a flight attendant. Just before we landed she informed us someone would meet us at the foot of the jetway. A fellow with a sign "Tampa" was waiting. He rushed us into a waiting van that delivered us to a special Immigration station where we were stamped and validated. Then into the van and off to another far distant section of the airport where again our passports and boarding cards were checked. Finally we were escorted to the gate and directly onto the waiting plane. My wife commented we felt like celebrities. The reply, "We try to make all our customers feel that way." Bravo Swiss Air and your sister airline Edelweiss. We are your number one fans.

title: International phone roaming charges
review_text: I have been to Europe many times however I got severely burned on international roaming charges on my recent flight. I made the mistake of charging my I phone on a Swiss Air flight and was not aware that this turns on my phone. Without my consent or request, my phone converted to satellite roaming charges to the tune of more than $400 for the eight hour flight. As a retired senior, I would never have requested or need such a service. Total rip off!  Beware!!!!

title: The early booking through the site worked well.
review_text: The early booking through the site worked well. Everything worked perfectly: the booking, boarding. The flights as scheduled. Food more than ok. Nice team. Transfer at Zurich Airport perfect.

title: Full recommended
review_text: Very helpful airways they treat your booking from beginning until you get your trip and so helpful company . Comfortable . Recommended

title: Great quick flight between Rome and Zurich
review_text: Great one hour flight.   Cost was only $140 each way.  Great way to visit Rome. No frills.  Cheese sandwich was just so-so, considering that I was landing in Rome.  Great views of the Alps too.

title: Very good Service. If travelling between Eire and Switzerland chose Swissair!
review_text: We flew from Dublin to Geneva on Aer Lingus and from Zurich to Dublin on Swissair. There is no comparison. Swissair wins hands down. The economy seats we had on Swissair were as spacious as the emergency seats(extra pay) that we had on Aer Lingus. Aer Lingus offer NOTHING free on board. Swissair have a wonderful service of a hot snack, a free drink( coffee, tea, soft drink etc) followed by Swiss chocolates.Old fashioned service. If the times are suitable, do fly SWISSAIR. Cabin staff extremely helpful.

title: Direct Flights
review_text: The ease of a direct flight makes making any domestic connections possible. Arriving in the morning is ideal for any further travel options. Highly recommended.

title: Strange boarding, good service,great plane, disappointing food
review_text:
After having enjoyed a few hours in the Swiss Lounge, boarding was somewhat lacking organization.  Plane was parked at the apron and when the bus got there we were kept in the bus due to some technical checks.  After we were able to board, we were met by a friendly crew.  This was  my first encounter with the Airbus A-220, and I loved it. Really large windows, and comfortable seats.  After, on my flight to Z√ºrich, having been offered a choice between hot meals, the food served on this flight was really disappointing.  Some blobs of a creamy substance, a few spoonfuls of chopped Tomatoes, tiny slices of cheese and a roll (which was pretty good), I was less than impressed.  
Despite the boarding, arrival was pretty much on time.

title: Not a good experience
review_text:
May be this could be one of my NOT GOOD experiences with a airline. 
I could say I flight with a low end airlines in some countries and anyone SIZED your luggage like them. 
For me, doesn‚Äôt make sense the way the did, after all I they took my luggage for me and put as an invoice one. 
In the cabin I can not put my bag pack in the compartments above me because it was ALL IN THE AIRPLANE OCCUPIED with HEAVIER and BIGGER than mine.

title:
Business class tickets nonrefundable non exchangable.
Only Swiss!
review_text:
U buy the tks couple of months ahead u pay them.Something unexpected turns up for medical reasons u ask Swiss to pay a penalty to change the travel dates they tell u imposdible.
U call their customer service in Zurich they tell u 1/2 of the airport taxes u paid .I call again and talk with their South Africn customer service they quote the full amount of airport taxes!
I ask why the International surcharges which basicly is fuel is not refunded since the ailine does not allow me to change with penalty the fair I paid they say NO.Realy what a robbery from a European Airline member of Star Alliance!
Luftansa that owens Swiss are collecting in the most manupulating way people's money.
Never in my life hv I heard that business class tkt cannot be changed even with a penalty fee.
What is the European consumers association doing to protect European citizens?!

title: Disgraceful flights
review_text: Old tatty plane, rattly, smelly loo, tiny seats (smallest economy seat I have ever flown in), no possibility of upgrades even when at the airport and yet business class was half empty, sullen staff would not even bring my wife a glass of water, told her to wait for the trolley later (it came more than an hour later), inedible food (not my words - the word of the gentleman across the aisle from me - and only vegetarian options available on the return flight. Disgusting very smelly and burned curry or dreadful soggy pasta. We ate neither. The only nice thing was the piece of swiss chocolate!!! Singularly the worst flights I have ever had in my life. Will never fly them again. They need to send their staff to Emirates or Turkish for lessons on service and how to serve decent food. No wonder the swiss have the reputation for being the worlds unfriendliest nation.

title: Pleasant journey
review_text: It was a short flight but we were impressed by the cleanliness of the aircraft and service by attendants.

title: It is a gamble
review_text: It does not matter what class you are flying, it matters ore what aircraft you are assigned to. The Airbus seems (on long haul) not upgraded and the Boing is. So when you buy a Business (or even First Class) ticket, you may make completely different experiences. Which I found not acceptable. Sure if it takes a year or tow, but these guys it takes them longer than that. Also, you need to understand that the on board system experiences non-stop issues. The seat will not work, the entertainment system is not working. I had a couple in front of me who were on their honeymoon. The disappointment in their eyes spoke for themselves. Swiss is not what it used to be and if they continue to go down this path, even American Airlines will bypass them. It is sad to see as the people on board constantly apologize for the poor experience. But that does not help. The issue starts somewhere else and management knows. Or at least should know... . Until then, make sure you ask what aircraft you will be flying with and if it has an old (very old) or a new class - from eco to first. You deserve to get what you pay for, not what they feel they should serve...

title: An unexpected response
review_text:
i am so sorry my experience is actually very depressing as we were a group travelling to Budabest via Zurich as transit . Around one hour before landing in Zurich a lady from our group fainted and fell unconcious in the aisle , a lady stewardess passing by tried to raise her in a most unaffectionate way just kicking her and saying i will call the police , no help to regain her senses , not even a piece of tissue with some colonge or a cup of water , no help at all ,continuing to say i will call the police ,bring an ambulance and cancelling her next flight . what a way to deal with a fainting  case . I just begged her not to take action promptly as we as a group could be in a very difficult situation ,cannot continue the trip and leave her as well cannot cancel all our tickets ,a very critical situation. luckily the lady could regain her senses and continue with the scheduled program . Thus said we all were very disappointed as no one even came to evaluate the situation and see that she is alright again . Asking about the lady stewardess someone said that she is the pilot assistant ,not sure of that. My review is not to complain but to raise awareness in this very trustful airline ,that some actions could be very destructive ,even if not meant to . My sincere wishes to the betterment of my favorite airline . 

 Dr Laila Maurice , Prof ,Faculty of Medicine , Alexandria Egypt.

email : lailasidaros@gmail.com

title: Civilized experience
review_text: Convenient departure and stop over times. Quick to get thru Zurich airport (requires short train ride), minimum delays. Clean airplanes.

title: Outdated planes and poor timing
review_text:
When we finally got to our flight ( after the previous also SWISS flight was late and made us have to RUN through the airport to catch this flight to the US) we realized we were about to spend 8 hours on an extremely outdated airplane, which is not comforting when flying over the ocean to another continent. The plane had NO outlets, nothing to charge anything, the games on the screen were from 2002 (that‚Äôs 15 years before our flight ) why would they send such an outdated plane with no outlets for people who have to fly for that long ? I don‚Äôt get that 

The plane that was late was also poor service. Rude, didn‚Äôt care that half the plane was about to miss their flights

title: Good experience
review_text: A refreshing change from Ryamair or Easyjet.  Very comfortable cabin with drop down screen showing the route. A light snack and drink inclused in the fare even flying economy,.

title: Changes paid seats without refund and notice
review_text:
We flew our first and LAST flight with Swiss Air from Nairobi to Zurich with a stop in Tanzania. 
We were leaving Nairobi after our vacation in Kenya - 24 hours prior to the flight, we went online to "check-in" to find the seats we had "paid" for (24J & 24K) were given to other passengers and we were sent back to seats 38J & 38K.
When we arrived at the airport I asked why this was changed and the Swiss Air agent in Nairobi couldn't care less - her response was that I must have done this myself and there was nothing she could do about it. When I explained this was a Swiss Air change, she said she knew nothing about it. Another passenger behind me in the line said the same thing happened to her - she paid extra for the extra legroom seats and she too had them changed by Swiss Air with no communication.
I talked to another Swiss agent when I checked in and the same response.
I then asked the flight attendant when we were on the plane. The first attendant told me the ground crew did it and there was nothing that could be done. I asked to speak to the head flight attendant - explained the whole thing again - he took pictures of my reservation proving what I had said and said he would pass this on to the next crew in Tanzania and that I should email Swiss Air with a complaint. I told him I wanted better seats but was refused because of the stop over.
No one on the next leg came to see us, no one gave us any contact information to deal with this situation - no one cared!
Swiss Air is off my list of travel airlines.
Dan

title: Nice and welcoming
review_text:
