Good and friendly service, everything looked and felt clean. Food and drinks were good. On the way back the flight was a bit bumpy, which of course isn't the airlines fault and the flight attendances were taking heartwarming care of a woman who was very afraid.

All in all good service and personally I enjoyed the free chocolate very much. :)

title: Great flight
review_text: Was nice to get upgraded and on top due to a plane change, got a seat in first class, nice touch for a flight of just under 3 hours. Food was great and as I did not expect it was even better. Good choice of movies and of course place enough. Pleasant service and good advice from them. Smooth flight with slight delay but made my connection flight.

title: Short & sweet flight
review_text:
The services throughout show that you are flying a top-ten airline. The check in was a breeze. It was a short flight (ca. 90 min.) and full to the last seat. The highly efficient crew wasted no time in serving snacks and drinks immediately after take off. 
What I like best about the flight (and for my tall husband) is the seat configuration - two seats on either side of the isle.

title: Two different flights
review_text: The flight to Switzerland was United Airlines operated by Swiss Airlines. We were packed in like sardines and the food was just adequate. The trip back was just with Swiss Airlines and it wasn't completely full so both my friend and I had empty seats next to us which makes all the difference in the world when flying internationally. Also they kept the food coming all the time and it was quite good. Very professional flight attendants that did a good job.

title: Great sevice even on a short haul leg
review_text:
We were impressed that even on the short-haul leg to Zurich we were offered breakfast on the way out and refreshments on the way back.

Everything operated most smoothly and we were even offered some Swis chocolate as a souvenir.

From Zurich to Bangkok was actually operated by Thai International with as usual great service, even cleaning the toilets mid-flight.

The food though was not that great and needs to be improved as the Middle Easterm airines are doing better. The sausage offered for breakfast was indigestably 'plasticy' . Pity because it used to be so good.

The last leg operated by Bangkok Aiirways was efficient, no frills but we got a nice sandwich and a drink.

title: Hey- a great flight return home
review_text: Hey- this was a great flight.  It was late at night and everything went smoothly.  except for the nice meal- I don't remember anything because I slept.

title: Great flight
review_text: This is a great airline and was a great flight- smooth and uncomplicated.  I enjoyed it and would recommend this airline.

title: attentive especially to family with  a baby
review_text: we took a fligh from tlv to zrh' 6 adults and a 6 month old baby. this is the only airline which allowed a suitecase, hand luggage a stoller and a car seat( sent in the plane_  belly ) without extra charge/ the baby bassinet on the flight was very cmfortable. the air attendants were so pleasant,  cleaned the bathroom twice during the short flight, kept checking we are all well,.

title: Goteberg
review_text: Flight was long haul ,great flight , friendly staff comfortable seats. Meals served were descent.. Would recommend

title: Better than most
review_text: Two flights to Dublin via Zurich, just enough time to change terminals and board second flight. Both short haul, business just 3 rows at the front with bigger seats and personal service. Cabin crew on both were courteous and efficient and turned economy passengers back from using the front toilet. meal on each and two of the best Business Class meals we have ever eaten, the fillet steak on the Porto-Zurich leg was superb.

title: A perfect flight
review_text:
I absolutely loved our flight with Swiss Air Lines. It was an all day  flight which usually makes it more tiring especially when it's such a long flight. But I loved it. The seats were very comfortable and the whole plane was so clean! I'm a bit peculiar with cleanliness and I usually find fault but this time it was impeccable.
The food was great. We flew on the Swiss national day and they had a special menu to choose from and souvenir to commemorate the day. 
The movie selection was immense, the 10 hours flight was not enough to see everything that I wanted. The crew was very polite, professional and everything was done meticulously well. It felt really good traveling with them.

title: Significant gaps in Price-Performance Ratio
review_text: We booked 2 first and 2 Business seats, excellent ambiance in the cabins, good service but disappointing reliability. One of the two booked first seats (next to each other) was not functioning so that the guest had to be relocated to another seat so that the couple got separated. Included 50MB internet voucher appear as Joke for such booking class, also the personal level of amenities has dropped during past years and appear poor versus other airlines. similar observation in Business class. Window-Seat reservation against fee of 240CHF!!!, folding table of one seat was blocked and not usable...which is very disappointing for such high cost class. Nevertheless the overall experience was ok thanks to excellent service of the crew.

title: Rude flight attendant
review_text:
We were flying business class with our 5kg dog for the first time, and expected the 12h flight in business class to be a positive experience. This flight attendant Nora came to our seats before departure and presented the rules for traveling with a dog in the cabin in a very unfriendly way. We clearly understood the dog was not allowed to be out of her bag and we were complying. After taking off, the dog started panting so we proceeded to unzip the access to her carrier and stick some water inside. The dog stuck her head out through the opening and that was the beginning of our bashing. Nora showed up out of nowhere like she was waiting for that moment and leashed out on us. 
"Sir, she addressed to my husband, the dog cannot be outside the bag. I made this clear to you and if I see the dog out again there will be consequences. Mam, I am talking to you too, you listen to me when I talk." ( I was shoving the dog's head back in the bag)
I looked at her in disbelief and she continued with an impertinent tone that was shocking not only for us but for the other passengers as well, who  looked at her shaking their heads.
"I gave you clear instructions, you failed to comply, if I see the dog out of the bag one more time, I will take her from you and put it at the bottom of the plane for the rest of the trip".
I tried to reason with her, and told her in a polite tone that the dog was not even for a second out of her bag, she stuck her head out as it is an animal who reacts like an animal. I insisted that we are polite people and respect rules and we will make sure the dog will stay in the bag, she just needed a little water. 
The dog was in the bag at our feet for the entire flight, and she was exemplary. Not a sound, not the slightest attempt to come out like she sensed your employee's hostile attitude. During the flight, another flight attendant came to our seat and asked how the dog was, nice and courteous, asked us if we needed any water for her. The woman next to us approached us and asked what kind of dog she was and pointed out how rude your employee was. In the morning, same nice flight attendant came to our seat to serve breakfast and asked about the dog, telling us she was the most well behaved dog they had on board. Nice, polite and professional. Nora Meringer passed by our seats giving us the same hostile look, didn't ask a question about how the dog had been over the night, and to top the rude attitude, while we were waiting to get off the plane she told my husband in a sarcastic tone: I guess your dog didn't suffocate in her bag.
We flew Swiss before and we were always pleased with the level of politeness and courtesy, this employee casts a bad image on your business. Hire people who understand respect for the paying customer and can leave their personal frustration at home. Nobody wants to pay over $10k to be treated like a criminal by a rude employee who plays God and excessively exercises her little power.

title: Items stolen from bags and bag damaged
review_text:
Travelled on Swiss (Zurich to Heathrow)our bags did not arrive on same flight, was told they are still in Zurich, bags were delivered and we noticed the padlocks missing from the zips on our bags, our bags were searched and items stolen, Swiss not accepting liability just fobbing is off that we shouldn‚Äôt put our belongings in checked baggage? Errm where else shall we put them Swiss?  Then I was told that authorities searched our bags real? I don‚Äôt think They pick locks or damage baggage, there also no stickers or tape by customs that‚Äôs it‚Äôs been searched, and I also think they wouldn‚Äôt have stole out items, try another excuse Swiss.
Fair to say I won‚Äôt be travelling with Swiss again.

My wife bought interior lights for the house they were also damaged, very good having them go through fragile goods rather than the belt.

title: Almost 30 minutes Late departure
review_text: The plane is pretty pack. We took off 30 minutes late because of error in counting between system and I have a connection that leaves 1hr 30 mins at Zurich. Not great way to start. Writing this while we are waiting at the gate for almost 30 minutes

title: Unfriendly staff
review_text: I was looking forward to fly with Swiss as they have a good reputation.the 777 was full, ok but the service was a nightmare.the crew let the food tablets for a very long time so that one could not relax.the heat became soon inbearable but nothing was done about it.when i complained about it when leaving the plane , i was rebuffed by the words: you should have said sth.when i said that i did, all i got was a snippish smile.i will aboid this company at all cost in the future

title: Passenger discrimination
review_text:
it‚Äôs not the first time that I fly with Swiss airline. It is not the first time that the last flight from Zurich to Athens is late. Actually the 2110 flight to Athens is ALWAYS late more than one hour and 30‚Äô! ALWAYS!!
Apart from the really bad food that it is offered in the flight which you can cope with, I have experienced THE WORST DISCRIMINATION incident that I ever had.
The airlines officer decided to count ONLY my luggage and another passenger‚Äôs luggage. My hand luggage was 2 kilos overweight and he decided to make me give my luggage downstairs. 
He didn‚Äôt count any other luggage no matter if there were other bigger (by appearance) luggage and he didn‚Äôt bother counting any other. Out of a whole flight he just decided to count one luggage only pretending that he is doing me a favor for not charging me no matter if my ticket was issued with luggage. Meaning that he wasn‚Äôt doing me a favor for not charging. 
Above all this I asked him if he could give me a ‚Äúfragile‚Äù sticker realizing that this company DOESNT HAVE a fragile sticker.
They have distorted my luggage two times in the past and I was really not in the mood to claim a new luggage again! Unacceptable discrimination and unfairness too!

title: Arrogant Staff
review_text: The aircraft (777-300ER) was modern and comfy. However, the staff was rude, arrogant and seemingly unwilling to help. Also, when spoken to in French they replied in English and a Swiss airline should have its staff at least knowing two of the official languages of Switzerland.

title: Not so comfy
review_text: I had a multi-city flight ticket from Cairo to Prague and From Vienna to Cairo. Our seats wasn't comfortable at all. And the delay happened in our Vienna to Zurich flight ( where we had a layover there) was a reason that our luggages didn't arrive until next day, No help had been given to us and we were running around the airport to catch up on our flight. That was so bad and stressful actually

title: Ruthless and uninformed chief flight attendant
review_text:
On August 16th 2019, I was abruptly talked down in front of my family by the chief flight attendant who did not allow me to enter the plane with my YoYo stroller. His argument was that i did not have a bag! I kindly told him that it was the first time in 8 years that I was not allowed in with my YOYO stroller and I requested him to show me the specific regulation on strollers. At this point, he got very annoyed as I was dubious about his action. It took him 20 minutes to find the regulation. His colleagues seemed also surprised as all airlines around the world Allow passengers carrying a YOYO stroller to bring it in any plane even on the smallest without a bag (i had just flown from Bordeaux to Zurich with Swissair in a smaller place where I was allowed to take my YoYo stroller!) 
 When folded the YoYo does not look like a stroller!!!
 After 20 minutes, he finally came with the regulation which was clearly saying that any strollers looking like a stroller when folded needed to be in a bag. Though i explained him that a YoYo was not looking like a stroller, he threatened me not to let me in the plane if I would not comply!
I ended up going to my seat  to realize later on when we landed that the passenger in front of me had his YoYo stroller without a bag which meant that some of other flight attendants judged that it was ok!!!! I immediately asked the chief flight attendant who gave his hand and said enough of this!!!! The rudeness and the condescendence shocked me! 
My family and I have flown all around the world with numerous airlines, never I have been treated this way! I would just say to learn their facts and infos on regulations before making it difficult to a family with small children!!!! I will be flying Oman air from Muscat and not Swiss air anymore.

title: Uncomfortable
review_text:
My journey from Zurich to Tokyo was a 12 hour flight, but damn did it feel longer.
I'm someone who flies relatively often and I have never felt more like a tinned sardine. It's bad enough when the person in front has there seat all the way back on you, but when the seating is physically so close to your own seating you can't comfortably put your feet on the floor, there's a real problem.

I caught a pretty nasty cold about an hour in due to raging air-con (out of my control) which also gave me a headache. I also got sick, but as I'd not eaten anything from feeling ill I was left to throw up mucus in the public loo. 

At this point I knew I couldn't squeeze back into my 'nice' 'cozy' spot between two people so I sought out the flight staff who initially did not want to help me at all. Luckily one guy was nice and gave me water and a doggy bag (finally). Just so you know I've flown 18+ times and I've never felt ill, but this was my fist long haul aside from 8 hours if you'd call it that.

I left the plane sick with two different things and severely dehydrated, and quite frankly wishing I hadn't gone to Tokyo lol cause I was sick for the whole time.

I don't know what model of plane I boarded but it's not suitable for long haul that's for sure.
I wouldn't have written this review if my flight back wasn't so so so much nicer. There was leg room, arm space, the meal was lovely, there was even a TV screen each, and best of all you could actually breathe!!!

So if you're going to Tokyo, fly with Ana. If you're going long haul, don't fly with Swiss Air.

title: WE FLY SWISS OFTEN
review_text: A very late night flight but still OK.  I had enough to eat and drink.  We arrived in a wet Geneva on time

title: Excellent voyage and service
review_text:
Always excellent service on Swiss.  Staff lovely, plane clean.  Food ok for Economy class.
Seating very tight and not enough bathrooms.  Compared to other carriers, above standard!  Thank you.

title: Perfect
review_text: I liked the punctual work.. smooth take off and landing with excellent cabin crew...I hope one day, swiss international airlines start to upgrade their planes to have private screens in economy class..

title: Terrible service with pregnant wife and small boy
review_text: When flying home on 30th of august from Cagliari to Copenhagen with Edelweiss and Swiss Air (tickets bought via Swiss Air) me, my pregnant wife and our 2,5 year old soon were denied online check in. Instead we were told by Swiss Airs customer service to check in at the airport at least 3 hours before our flight at 08.55 in the morning. So we had to cancel a dinner reservation in Cagliari and arrange taxi for 0430 in the morning instead. When arriving at 0450 in the airport we were told that the check in would open at about 0700 at the earliest. So unfortunately Swiss Air managed to ruin the last 2 days of our summer holiday. I will never fly with this crappy, but expensive company again. At least you now what your gonna get with Ryanair, Easyjet, etc. When arriving in Denmark I will ask my bank to charge back the amount paid for our return tickets for failure to provide the promised services.

title: Worst service and racist Staff
review_text: Super receipt staff! Avoid them and save itself the hassle. My experience with them was a nightmare that I cannot forget for Rest of my life. They humiliate you on purpose and speak loud to make you look bad swear at you in Dutch . Such morons the airline should SHUT DOWN !!!!!

title: WONDERFUL!!!
review_text:
SWISSAIR literally ... CAME TO OUR RESCUE!
We were STRANDED in Geneva airport , having missed 2 connections to Moscow, thanks to the UTTER INADEQUACIES OF UNITED AIRLINES! 
Not only did the SwissAir agent take pity on us and rebook our connections via Zurich to Moscow, but we had a wonderful experience in those flights! 
So courteous, so friendly! 
Zurich airport was beautiful too! 
THANK YOU SWISSAIR!

title: A Great Airline
review_text: It's been many years since I've had the pleasure of flying with 'Swissair', so was glad to have the opportunity to try out Swiss. We were not disappointed.  Punctuality, professionalism, service, announcements, cleanliness - all excellent.  Offering a full service we enjoyed our sandwich (its was a short flight), hot drink and cake.  The crew were outstanding, being efficient and friendly delivering the meal service and inflight shopping.  The announcements, given in Swiss and English, were relevant and given in a friendly manner.  If Swiss operate on a route I intend to travel, they would always be my first option.

title: Excellent from A to Z
review_text:
I booked an award ticket on Swiss to fly from TLV to MIA via ZRH. I flew twice the A330, business. 
The planes are a bit dated in terms of hard product, yet I found them to be more comfortable to sleep than many of the more modern planes. The screen in on the small side, internet is accessible but at stupidity expensive rates. 
In the air my experience was outstanding with the soft product: food was excellent, flight attendants went above and beyond.
Lounge in Zurich is nice and spacious, food selection is ok. I did find they did not have enough showers given the number of travelers with long haul lay over in ZRH.

Overall it is a very solid product, I absolutely can recommend them.

title: Lost bag on direct flight in Europe
review_text: They lost my bag on a direct flight from Budapest to Zurich. I have flown hundreds of times on other airlines and this has never happened. Otherwise the flight was ok, nice chocolate ice cream was served. Flight attendants were professional.

title: How to get rid of your frequent flyers
review_text:
I just learned how much the Lufthansa Group cares for its customers. I usually do about 50+ flights per year since several years with them. I took a Swiss flight in the morning from Zurich to D√ºsseldorf and was supposed to fly back with Eurowings to Zurich. Now the flight keeps delaying for hours without reason. 
So I thought I could get some help from the miles-and-more service as I'm quite a frequent customer and I learnt interesting things:
1. I have a Eurowings ticket on the way back which means I got two independent tickets.
2. The miles-and-more service can open tickets which are booked with miles or Lufthansa and Swiss tickets but not Eurowings tickets. (Interestingly even if you book Lufthansa you always get a Eurowings flight with significantly less service within Europe9
3. If I want any help I have to call Eurowings which does not help much as I spend a long time in the waiting queue.

So for me as a customer I really don't care in how many airlines Lufthansa Group wants to split itself up and for what reason but I care that if I book a ticket with any of them I get a proper service and I get the same one.
Maybe this is on intention to help people choosing other airline which may value the service more.

title: Lost suitcase, two times on standby tickets, rude service
review_text: I have never dealt with such terrible customer service in my entire life. Everyone was rude, and unwilling to help. I was placed on standby tickets for two of my flights. They lost my suitcase at one point. To top it all off I am speaking with customer service and they are not doing anything to right the wrongs. I would never recommend you take SWISS, you will be stressed out the entire time.

Hot on plane no air vents above,Food again pasta and chicken poor.Dessert again rock hard, and dry. In morning breakfast, cheese not nice, roll cold and hard, but coffee ok or tea.

review_text: The amenities and service on Swiss Air were amazing.  The food was actually delicious, while the flight attendants were friendly and professional.

title: Purely Swiss
review_text: This airlines is a class on its own , excellent service , friendly crew , and quality of food is second to none. Bravo!

title: SWISS's descent from first-rate Swissair to a second-rate nickel-and-diming operation
review_text:
I've lived in Switzerland for 35 years and have flown SWISS (and before it SwissAir) at least 50 times, so I am in a good position to give an accurate review.   SwissAir was a premium airline until its famous demise in 2001.  There is little to report before then, my 15-20 flights with it were generally on time, affordable in off-peak times but expensive at peak.  There was one 8-hr delay for a Zurich-Boston flight, with multiple apologies and a generous voucher, and some delays of less than 1 hr, all forgivable given the many flights I had taken.  SwissAir went bankrupt post 9/11, due to drastically reduced ridership at a critical time for its finances.  Officially it ceased to exist in order to avoid commitments to creditors, but its subsidiary CrossAir took over the international business, becoming the current SWISS in the process.  Thus one can objectively say that SWISS is the continuation of SwissAir, and, indeed, the former tries to live off of the legacy of quality of the latter.

SWISS was 'rationalized' with reduced international service, cutbacks in flight service, and cuts in pay for personnel (all documented in the media).  There were great prices off-peak, but coupled with large additional fees (like most other budget airlines. Still I had fair experiences from 2001 - 2014 (again 15-20 flights), with another 8-hr delay on Zurich-Boston (with a smaller voucher and no apologies), several delays of more than 1 hr, and jam-packed flights thanks to aggressive pricing strategies.  Good for SWISS: they seemed to have returned to the black.

But the fact is from 2015, SWISS has gone into a downward quality spiral, which can only be associated with a low-cost carrier, even if their prices are not low cost.   I live near Lugano, from which Swiss offers Zurich- and Geneva-bound flights, where connections can be made.  From 2015 onward these have been canceled regularly.  Since 2015 on about 10 flights I've had 6 major delays due to either missed connections in Zurich, or canceled flights to/from Lugano, along with minor delays (up to 1hr). Here is an overview:

	o A late arrival (>2hrs) in Zurich which caused a missed connection flight to Lugano, resulting in a night in Zurich.  Overall delay: about 12 hrs.
	o An on-time arrival in Zurich, but a canceled Lugano segment.  Swiss put me on a train to Zurich resulting in more than a 2-hr arrival delay.
	o A canceled flight from Hamburg-Zurich, due to inclement weather.  Frequent fliers in my party managed to rebook on an earlier flight, but Swiss claimed the flight was full when they passed the phone to me.  Due to an additional flight cancellations, this led to a 12-hour train journey from Hamburg to Lugano.  Total delay about 11 hrs.
	o A flight from Lugano to Zurich was canceled only 15 minutes before its alleged 'on-time' departure.  Swiss put us in a train to Zurich, with an overnight in Zurich, where the first flight on the next leg in the morning was canceled and the second was more than 1hr late.  Total delay: about 15 hrs.
	o Outbound flight from Zurich delayed more than 1 hr., and then on return trip, more than 1hr delay in the Zurich-Lugano segment.  But in this case, no missed connections.

Even if you believe I just have bad luck, our company has experienced so many delays and cancellations on the Zurich-Lugano segment that it is now our official policy to fly us out of Milan instead of Lugano.  Why all these cancellations?  Lugano can indeed have serious thunderstorms, but the flight cancellations occur frequently, also in good weather.  The better explanation is that this segment is not well patronized and loses money.  If a flight has too few passengers it is canceled, and any 'collateral damage' is dealt with.  Swiss outsourced the route to Adria a couple of years ago so the cancellations do not stain its reputation, but Adria's flights are cross-listed as a SWISS, and SWISS advertises and sells through-connections from Lugano on their website.  

Already the Lugano connection is indicative of the ice-cold 'rationalization' of Swiss in recent years, and my company's boycott is an appropriate response.  But on my last flight I experienced nickel-and-diming on a scale that I thought was reserved for cheapo airlines like Ryanair.  I booked tickets months in advance to the USA for my family. The price was not competitive, but at least SWISS offered direct flight from Zurich to Los Angeles.  In the booking I had used my wife's married name in her Swiss passport.  Unfortunately she asked for the ESTA visa waiver with her other passport, which is in her maiden name.  Not a problem, I thought: during on-line check-in I typed in her maiden name and proper passport number.  At the airport there was consternation because the check-in name did not match the booking name. SWISS staff tried to make a name change on the ticket, for which we paid CHF 25 (OK, fair enough, my wife and I got our signals crossed), but then said were not able to complete it. They told us to ask the transfer agent in Zurich for the boarding pass of the LAX segment.  We approached the agent in Zurich, worried that my wife might not be able to fly.  To our great surprise, he immediately printed out the boarding pass with her correct maiden name, and we were on our way.  What a great vacation!  Happy end, right?  

On the morning of our return I checked my email: automatic check-in from SWISS for 3 passengers: my sons and me, but no mention of my wife (with either name).  I logged in to my account: the booking had been changed to only us three -- my wife had been removed, probably part of SWISS's amateurish attempt to change the name.  No real concern, certainly a clerical error. During a call to the SWISS toll-free number, 'Noa' was overwhelmed by the problem, saying that there were only 3 in the booking and no indication that my wife had even flown to the USA (to which I replied "she is standing next to me; would you like to talk to her?"), and I would have to buy a new ticket from my wife.  I told her we would do that under no circumstances, and she promised to call back.  She did not.  Another call to the 800 number: 'Melissa' said that there was a booking in my wife's maiden name, but it had not been ticketed.  She said 'Noa' would call us back in 20 minutes, which she did not.  It was slowly time to head to the airport, and we were getting nervous.  Another call reached 'Andi'.  After many times on hold, she finally returned to say that 'Noa' had clarified with their ticketing department: we would have to buy a new ticket and apply for a 'partial refund'.  The nickel-and-diming was in full swing.   I explained that we would not pay under any circumstances: SWISS had accidentally deleted the return booking, and furthermore, since my wife is not a US citizen, SWISS was *legally obligated* to fulfill the requirement of transporting her back to Switzerland (fact checkers: see the ESTA rules).  She said that was their final decision, and I asked to speak to her supervisor.  "He will only tell you the same thing", 'Andi' offered.  But I insisted.  Another 20-minute on hold -- my wife was already on the other line phoning the ESTA help number -- not the supervisor, but 'Andi' was back.  She had what she felt was a great offer: SWISS would reissue the ticket, waive the price difference, I would only have to pay the service fees of CHF 45.  Given that SWISS had -- absolutely without any sensible reason -- canceled my wife's return trip, I was tempted to turn her down and let the US Immigration and Naturalization Service talk to them.  But realistically it is always bad news when US officials are are involved.  So I paid their ransom and am doing now what I promised 'Andi', namely giving SWISS the review it deserves. And my compliant letter will be in the mail soon. So much for the paying the extra money for a SWISS flight: you get nickel-and-dimed all the same!

For good measure, the flight international segment had an aborted start (due to a 'faulty warning light' according to the pilot), but we made the connection to Lugano, not canceled this time but which had a 45 minute arrival delay. 

SWISS is the empty shell of SwissAir.  It touts its awards for its First Class Lounge in New York, but that will not help you get where you are going on time.  It serves its Swiss satellite city of Lugano poorly (perhaps also Geneva, but I have no experience).  If you are an economy traveler, don't expect to be treated as anything more than an opportunity to squeeze out a few more Swiss Francs.

title: A Most Uncomfortable Trip
review_text: I‚Äôm sorry to report that Swiss‚Äô adoption of the Bombardier 100 into its fleet is a mistake. A retooled executive jet doubling as a sardine can for people, is a terrible way to fly. No leg room, uncomfortable seats, no entertainment system to pass the time. The Swiss Service people are great but their attentive service cannot overcome the planes‚Äô shortcomings. Did I mention the noise level? Do try and avoid this.

title: It‚Äôs faster and more reliable to take a dinghy across the Atlantic
review_text:
This company is run by absolute idiots. 10 days ago my return flight from Zurich to Vancouver was cancelled and pushed back. This meant my connection from Vancouver to Calgary had to be moved to the next day.  

I spoke to a representative, Andy, before I departed to leave on the trip and was reassured I would receive an accommodation voucher to be used for the night I know have to spend in Vancouver. I was told to pick it up in Split. 

Fast forward to this morning in Split. Now they tell me the voucher will actually be picked up in Vancouver. They called in front of me to confirm. 

My flight from Split to Zurich was delayed (shocking, I know). I finally get to Vancouver and all of the airlines representative have gone home ‚Äúhours ago‚Äù. Nobody else can help me, here in person or on their phone line, and now I‚Äôm sleeping on a bench like a peasant hoping my kidneys won‚Äôt get harvested in this run down, filthy airport. 

Prayer for Courtney

title: Decent European service on 2 long flights to Thailand
review_text: Good European service in Economy, i.e. food is on-time and enough, you are reasonably hydrated, and left alone most of the trip. 777 from Zurich to Bangkok was new-ish and super-clean. The 'Asian' entree was actually pretty decent, too, with a spicy kick. Pilots don't talk too much (take-off and landing). Everything else was fine.

title: Generally fine
review_text: Relatively comfortable seats, like all airlines not much leg room. Appreciated the monitor with the ongoing flight info. Food was acceptable, attendants friendly and helpful. The ongoing promo of watches seemed excessive.

title: Worst service ever experienced
review_text:
Despite my hand luggage was properly checked at the check in and i had the green light in terms of weight and sizes to bring it on board with me, i was forced to check it in right before boarding.
Of course i didn‚Äôt even have the chance to discuss it with the airline personnel which is evidently not capable of thinking but just to execute what they believe it‚Äôs right.

Had to board it without a lock as i didn‚Äôt have one for my hand luggage. 

As a result i‚Äôm on board, without any of my personal belongings, hoping that the baggage will arrive at my final destination.

I underline that the hand luggage was fully approved at the check in.

Shame on the worst service i‚Äôve experienced being a frequent traveler that takes 25+ international flights a year.

I truly hope i won‚Äôt ever take another flight with this airline

title: flying with Swiss
review_text:
I used Swissair 4 times this year, their website needs some improvement because got freeze and I spent 1 hour with customer service just to buy the ticket which was more expensive and I received the email confirmation in 4 days :(((
My experience on the flight very  pleasant, but my seat was close to business class and i needed to  walk all the way on back of the plain to use the toilet. Staff were friendly and helpful.

title: Average experience!
review_text: Swiss business class is not as enjoyable as other airlines! Food selection and quality is so so, the seats are ok but Lufthansa lounge in Dubai is disappointing! I think they could do much better and it seems the staff are overworked!

title: Fantastic flight
review_text: The first leg of the trip was 1.5 hr late , due to tech. issues. They held the plane leaving Zurich that amt. of time , and we still made it to Boston on time. It seems like you are always being offered food or drinks. Whenever we go to Europe, we always fly Swiss Air.

title: Business class is amazing
review_text: Enjoyed a very relaxing flight from Europe to the USA on Swiss. Very comfortable seats, fantastic service and cuisine, great selection of movies. Truly no hardship at all to cross the Atlantic this way! The seats in business class pull out so that you can lay flat and take a nice nap.

title: Excellent service and nicely appointed airplane. Connection in Zurich tremendously easy and efficient
review_text: I know SWISSAIR from years ago when it was independent. Was always a top quality airline, in my book within the top 3 I flew. Now the airline is called Swiss International and belongs to Lufthansa. The flight from New York to Lugano with connection in Zurich was outstanding. Boarding in NY as well as in Zurich was with clockwork precision. Service on the cross Atlantic and the short commuter flight from Zurich over the Alps to Lugano was a laudable experience. Top service, delicious dinner and lunch options. Highly efficient announcements from the cockpit and very comfortable seating (in business). Had to connect in Zurich. That airport is extremely easy to navigate, not cluttered or overcrowded and with very professional personnel. I shall use Zurich again on future flight with connection in Europe.

title: To expensive for what it offers
review_text:
The flight started delay and arrived also.
Very kindly the personal, but limited offering on the bird. No coffee, is it possible to one day flight?
Just an ice cream and a chocolate!
A little bit disappointed.
And the landing was a disaster!üòÖ

title: Absolutely the best
review_text: I‚Äôve flown with quite a few airlines, and I really like Swiss. A short flight in economy feels like just a few minutes in the clouds. Plus you can‚Äôt get anything better than those views close to landing near the mountains. I love the small touches like the cheese sandwich or Swiss chocolate right before landing. It‚Äôs the best.

title: Good experience
review_text: I travelled from Zurich to Mumbai via Swiss Airlines. I reached Zurich by a connecting Austrian airlines flight from Vienna. The halt at Zurich is rather brief (50 minutes) so for this particular travel itinerary we really have to rush to the correct gate and that is never a pleasant situation..maybe the airlines can look at a somewhat longer halt. The actual flight experience was mostly great and I liked the food too though I would say it is rather frugal even by economy class standards. The in-flight entertainment is also good..I actually watched two movies on the 8 hour flight ! Most of the cabin crew was nice, though towards the end, maybe about 20 minutes before landing when my visibly unwell co-passenger asked a particular lady cabin attendant for a glass of water as she had to take a medicine, the crew member refused saying we are busy preparing for landing and we have already passed by with water 5 times before..I think that it was quite unprofessional and inconsiderate, considering how reputed an airline Swiss Air is.

title: Pampering flights
review_text: Swiss, as always, didn't disappoint me. The staff friendly, the flight on time, the planes clean and in a very good shape. All what you need to have pleasant flight and a relaxed start of your business activities.

title: Muhammad Kamal Abdul Nasir
review_text: Extremely surprised with an excellent service. This was my first time using Swiss air. Very caring and professional flight attendants food and service and 12 hour journey was made comfortable.

title: BAD BAD BAD!!!!!!!
review_text: This Airlines has a terrible service they give you hard time on purpose. they like to humiliate you and try make a scene so that you will get scared. I almost died because f the mental torture they gave me. I got a heart attack because of the stress they gave me. AVOID FLYING WITH THIS AIRLINES

title: European flights
review_text:
Owned by Lufthansa, and part of the Star Alliance group, makes it a reliable airline. There are normally solutions at times there are problems. 
Swiss pilots are probably among the best. In the cabin, probably some works need to be done regarding efficiency, not at least speeding up the boarding procedure. Personnel is of course very friendly.
The food is good, slightly more innovative than other airlines, and a piece of Swiss chocolate is never wrong.
It seems, they currently have difficulties with their slots. Probably this is just a summer issue but happened on both flights this same day. Thanks to the A 321, they recovered most of the delay by flying pretty fast.
Best not to pack any heavy-Duty free goods, as bottles, prior to boarding, as you may have to open your hand luggage trolley at gate, just to prove to be right in that you don‚Äôt carry more than eight kilos.
Back packs are best removed before entering the aircraft, as anyone carrying a backpack often forgets they wear one, and when turning around, it is not unusual that they hit another fellow passenger with their added back part. This, not by purpose, but normally without even noticing. Furthermore, ideally back packs are placed under the seat in front, except for at emergency doors. That gives more space in the above shelves for hand luggage trolleys.

title: I would not recommend this airline.
review_text: They airline charged us baggage fees. Turns out they have a slimy category that has no baggage allowance, but this was only revealed after purchasing the ticket. Will never fly this airline or allow our string of businesses to use this airline. Cutting corners to make a quick buck should not be a business policy.

title: Super fly
review_text: Very nice and quiet fly both directions.  Crew were willing. Everything was clean. And also meals were delicious. Only on way to Cuba we had very cold inside plane.

title: European flights are mainly late...
review_text: The aircraft arrives on time. Boarding starts later than on the boarding card. 3 wheelchairs are pushed to the airplane and then the boarding of the other passengers starts. We wait again on the bridge, because the wheelchairs are not yet out of the plane. The official departure time is already history. Then the captain informs us, that we have to wait another 15 to 20 minutes because of arrival traffic in Zurich. Finally we take off about 45 minutes behind schedule and land 32 minutes late at Zurich. If you have connections, you will have problems, so take always an earlier flight, if available,  if you want to transit in Zurich!

title: Upgrade, it is worth the extra $, made the trip a lot better
review_text:
Business class, less worry about weight of bag, less hassle over carry on, access to business lounge while waiting at the Zurich airport, our own area for check-in, for business and 1st class passengers, snack on 2 hour flight, alcoholic beverages, and extra smiles from the staff.
Bring your own cords for connecting to the planes video, no power that I saw or used, Airbus.
Business and 1st class, scanned in, along with wheelchair and kids, boarded first.

title: Awfull service and delayed flights
review_text:
Flying Swiss is the worst thing I have ever experiened among my many business and holyday flight-tours.
All four flights were delayed. The self check in did not work and there was not enough personel to handle the passengers at the check in counter. Our luggage was left behind and we could not get in contact with anyone at all in order to get in diaglouge about status, suggestions etc. It took Swiss four days to deliver the luggage to our hotel - and we are talking Zurich to Lisboa.... 
Even the digital claim system is a disaster.
Tip: Chose another airline - there are many out there which are cheaper and more customer orientated!

title: A Surreal Experience
review_text:
To my surprise, I was upgraded to 'First Class'; I was going through the Boarding Security and the person on the desk said that I was upgraded to First.

What a super experience; the service was impeccable; the crew was very friendly and ensured that those in First had a wonderful experience. 

The meals were exceptional with a wide variety and served like one would get at 5 star fine dining restaurant. 

The Swiss hospitality was definitely present.... Highly recommend traveling in SWISS- they pay particular attention to detail.. which is rare in this day and age!

title: As Smooth as Chocolate
review_text:
I have flown Swiss Air many times in the past and, have always found them first class.

In recent years, the Middle Eastern airlines  have become very popular, but I find   European Airlines like Swiss Air much more suitable. Food, drink, attention  etc.,
very good.  Middle Eastern culture doesn't value service in the same way Europeans do.

title: Rude flight attendant
review_text:
On lx242 on the 16 of August, there was a slightly chubby flight attendant who was passive aggressive and rude. 
She questioned my drink choice once and gave me the wrong drink. The next time she came around, I made another choice and she acted like she couldn‚Äôt understand me. Then she speaks to are partner in another language in a hostile manner. When I point out my correct choice to her. She just talks back and did not seem to care.

title: Excellent service
review_text:
2 flights taken with this brilliant airline
Did the same trip last year and they were just 1st class
Always helpful , smile on their face and nothing too much trouble
We had complimentary fresh  cheese rolls and drinks , wine was also an option and some chocolate ( Swiss style )
Flights were on time and the planes were very clean
Thank you Swiss Air

title: Good travel
review_text: Excellent staff, the new Boing 777 provide enough comfort and privacy but what made the difference were the Galley and the Cabin flight attendant. They spoke so many languages we heard english, german, portuguese, italian... amazing! Very tasty food and a nice comfortable bed with a Bico mattress.

title: Beautiful planes, excellent friendly crew
review_text: This is by far the best airline I have ever flown to Israel.  .The airfare was very affordable, the planes were clean, modern and everything worked well at at your seat  The layover in Zurich was fun, with enough time  to take a train from the airport into the city of Zurich.  The airline automatically takes your luggage to be loaded on the next leg of your flight and provides storage for your carryon for a small fee so you can explore the huge, beautiful airport and Zurich without carrying them around. The food was decent and a piece of Swiss chocolate is delivered with each meal.  I highly recommend this airline for overseas flights.

title: Used to be good...
review_text:
Day flight from Duesseldorf via Z√ºrich to Dubai.
Flight from DUS to Zurich ok. Typical eco class seats, but with middle seat free. Gate personnel just ok.
Airport Zurich was packed, but all went fine. Lounge in E gates (Senator) good.
Plane was late because they could not consolidate the gate count with their own count ...for 45 min, after that, they suddenly solved the issue.
Seat was very hard - I mentioned it, no reaction at all.
With the hours going by this became more and more uncomfortable, so finally got a flight attendant to look at it ... -the back has about 3 mm upholstery - he didn‚Äôt show any real interest.
Another hour goes by, ask for Purser, who proceeds to play around with some buttons and then tells me that the air pump in the seat is not working ....and I should have told them earlier !?!
End result is that I had the ‚Äúpleasure‚Äù of spending a lot for a seat which was nothing but steel springs with come cloth over top.
Plane: 330 
I will seriously avoid the plane and the airline as they do not care.
Oh....total flight miles >2 million with StarAlliance alone...this, and the previous LH are in the top 2% for ‚Äúno value for money‚Äù.

title: A very good flight
review_text:
Excellent service given by especially Nadine Steinmann and Melinda D√∂nni.
Nadine went out of here way to provide us with our choice of the main course.
Melinda's knowledge of the wines served was extensive which made the experience enjoyable. 
Friendly staff, great service, good food.
All in all a very pleasant flight.

title: Extraordinary transfer service in Zurichü§ó!
review_text:
The flights were ok service wise as European Airlines on the SAS, BA, etc level goes. Things have changed the last 25 years..üòó. I had only 40 minutes between flights in Z√ºrich with additional paid for non refundable flights onwards from Johannesburg. Swiss said it was enough time even for exiting Schengen...

But with a sudden 35 minutes delay from Oslo because of late incoming flight, it could have became a nightmare start on my already delayed vacation. I ¬´pushed¬ª all buttons with the crew. We were 3 pax with this delay predicament, and the pilot kindly announced that he knew and would do anything possible etc. Thanks to him (July 23rd)! üòé

When we landed and got out of the plane at 22.35, Five minutes before the Airbus 340-400 was about to take off, we were met by a great guy (org. indian background..?) with a van, who rushed us to small policeboot, super quick and friendly service. Then rushed to the gate in the car, where smiling ground straff of Swiss were waiting with some big smiles. 

I was the last one onboard at 22.45. We took of at 22.52. Swiss and Switzerland at its very best!! Thank you! Merci! Grazie! Danke scon! ü§£ü§ó

title: Great service and timely arrival
review_text: Swiss long and short flights are good value for money. Both economy and business class alike. Great service and lovely staff. Good choice of snacks and yummy Swiss chocolate to go with it. If you are lucky, you may also get served some ice cream! Remember to check baggage allowance before you check in any luggage. It is more cost effective to pay for your baggage requirements online at the time of booking.

title: Comfortable Journey with Swiss Airline
review_text: This flight is under budget, comfortable, chic, neat and clean. One who is traveling through Salam Airline can also go with this airline almost same price with 1pc check-in baggage and 7kg cabin bag. Must recommend.

title: Great Airline
review_text:
I took a flight with Swiss on 9\8 from Tel Aviv to Copenhagen,
the flight crew was awesome,the attitude was excellent,the food was great.
On the way back to Tel Aviv the company upgraded me to businesses class,good surprise.
I have left a good memories from this airline and I will fly with them on next trip.
Thank you SWISS!

title: Fantastic First
review_text: A long flight I do yearly Lack of lounge options now the United Global First lounge is closed before   a new United Polaris opens Previously over years a First LX F assistant but this happens no more Peaceful sleep after the long trek from Australia La Prairie in now 2 toilets on 777300ER but sadly no La Prairie Sun Spray Good food but no free WiFi like you get in Lufthansa First, a rather meagre 50mb voucher. You can have a First Arrival Service landing in ZRH but I prefer to make my own way to the SUPERB Swiss First Lounge E Gates (rated best First Lounge worldwide by Skytraxx 2019 for good reason!) lamb cutlets for breakfast for me a La carte, good champagne selection and 2 hotel rooms with tarmac views St Moritz and Montreaux. Make your own way to A Gates, and  A Gates First Lounge with its own David off smoking room

title: Excellent
review_text: There is not a great deal to say apart from the fact that Swiss Air always delivers. Clean, efficient and friendly.

title: bad company
review_text:
old airplayne and small dont have enoth place to my legs 
cant do online checkin and choose place to sit only with money to fly 10 hours was the worst fly i have been 
in the flight back was batter airplayne the fly was ok
i wont fly again with this company

title: Summer Holiday
review_text: No problems. Flight was on time. Good service on board. Food was good. Selection of movies was poor (not enough choice).

title: First experience of Swiss business class long haul
review_text:
This week I had the pleasure of trying Swiss Air‚Äôs business class from Zurich to Singapore. The boarding and welcome experience was as expected, warm yet efficient. 
The cabin and seat was comfortable but seated in a twin seat configuration one side is snuggly surrounded by storage yet the other is very open to the aisle. The single seats are definitely the best. All seats recline (like Emirates) without the need to get up and haul the seat over (like Lufthansa or AirNZ). 
Unlike Emirates no mattress topper is available. Instead the seat has an inflatable feature. I found this less than satisfactory as the joint between the seat and seat back was still obvious and sadly not 100% comfortable. 
The food and drinks were very good and the service was great. I loved the mini Swiss chocolate bars they were so good!
The entertainment was as expected and overall I will happily travel with Swiss again.

title: Irresponsible
review_text: Swiss Air removed my bag from our flight.  I spent two hours in line to file report.  I was then texted and told bag was on it's way; it never arrived.  I inquired again at the airport, and then with Swiss Air representative at Zurich headquarters.  I was told only "I am sorry, your bag is gone".  I heard from courier service upon arriving home that in fact bag was returned to the very airport where I was told it was lost.  After 5 emails, and numerous phone calls, still NO ONE from Swiss Air has contacted me or gotten back to me.  They continue to say nothing or respond even to emails.  My flight was now 17 days ago.  I was traveling for my sons wedding.  I had nothing but the clothes I had on and a few items in my carry on.  I am also seeing on their website they will only reimburse $100; which barely covers the cost of the lost luggage let alone the dress I had to purchase to attend the wedding.  Swiss Air should be ashamed of themselves for their lack of communication.  At the very least they should be reaching out to ME to give apologies, but they do not even respond.  I will never again fly with them and will recommend to everyone I know that they don't either.

title: Worst staff and service Totally disgusting
review_text: Avoid choosing this Airlines if you can. They cancelled my valid tickets and didn‚Äôt let me fly. They don‚Äôt care and are Rude humiliating and scary!!!!!

title: BEST'f Switzerland
review_text: It was my first time traveling with Swiss International Air Lines and I truly enjoyed it. Customer service was exceptional! The food offered on board was quite decent. I traveled long distance and nevertheless felt very comfortable.Thank you!

title: One month in the Greek Islands
review_text: The flights service was good, but the seats in business are not as comfortable of as spacious as other airlines.

title: Great value for money
review_text:
So this  flight was the same cost as a Ryan air flight and I am so glad that we took Swiss. The staff were friendly and unlike other cheap flights these guys provided drinks a little piece of Swiss chocolate and some chocolate mousse for free. I must‚Äôve met I was truly impressed by this. 
Besides that the flight attendants spoke Swiss, high German and English. I would fly again!

title: An unusual flight concerning Swissair
review_text: This time wasn‚Äôt a really comfortable flight. Half an hour of delay, waiting in the plane, I had water running down on my window,  my seat got quite wet, I had to swipe it all the time with a tissue. The lunch was really minimal, although tasty. The real surprise was my suitcase! When I opened it at home, all my clothes were also completely wet!!! I informed Swissair, and all I got, was 80‚Ç¨ of voucher redemption for my next flight ! Not generous for clothes of 2000‚Ç¨ ! It‚Äôs really sad, and I am a really frequent flyer of Swiss.

title: Exceptional nice staff
review_text: I once again choose Swiss as in comparison with Emirates and Ethiad Swiss International Airlines offered the best price for business class. Everything was quite ok as well as the entertainment equipment and the seat handling should really be replaced. Food was nice. Flight attendants very helpful.

title: Lost Baggage
review_text:
I recently traveled to Mumbai from Nice, via Zurich on flight (LX 0565) & LX0154) respectively, which arrived on 30th at Mumbai. I had 4 checked in luggages.
 One of these baggages,  which was supposed to be checked all the way through to my final destination has apparently been completely mishandled and 
 not loaded with my other baggages.
The ground staff at the Mumbai lost baggage counter informed me that they had received information that this baggage would be arriving only the next day. 
Since i traveled to Trivandrum on the 31st of July, the baggage was later delivered to the Trivandrum airport from where I picked it up on 1st August evening. 
When i  collected my parcel from the Trivandrum airport , it was a sorry state of affairs and I was appalled by the callousness with which the bag had been handled. 
In fact, the authorities at Bombay airport also confirmed that they received this bag in an open state and hence had to wrap it in plastic before they sent it to Trivandrum airport.

There were lot of missing items and my baggage completely damaged and made unusable. and a Total estimated loss of more than 300 euros

Of course, the real loss is not just limited to the monetary aspect, taking into account the inconvenience caused, stress and the time spent purchasing and selecting these products.

Even after filing a complaint, there was no response from any of the authorities. Such a horrible service and irresponsible team.

title: Unresonable policy and rude staff - NEVER AGAIN
review_text:
Unreasonable and rude describes best my experience with Swiss air. 
I booked a return flight from london to Geneva to attend my sister's graduation. 
Last minute, i had to fly to Barcelona for work so flew directly to Geneva from there, missing my outgoing flight. 

My surprise was when arriving at Geneva airport for my return flight to london, where I am told i have no booking as it my reservation was cancelled. If you don't board the outgoing flight, they assume you never made it to Switzerland and cancel the full booking. No notice. No email. And no refund.  
The customer service lady at the airport is annoyed that she has to explain this to me. She says is tired of repeating the same to customers over and over after 10 years, and 'everyone coming with the same complaint when it is clearly explained when you book the ticket'. Well, clearly not so obviously if you have to explain this over and over for years.

Unfriendly and unwilling to help, had to book another seat, on the same flight for 300‚Ç¨ , plus an extra 60‚Ç¨ for booking at the airport (of course, wouldn't even consider waiving that).

Ended up booking two seats on the same flight, and yelled at by a unhappy woman that ALWAYS reads the 55 pages on the terms and conditions.

Of course, when I complain theres nothing offered, neither apologies, refund for my cancelled booking without notice, nothing. Surprise. 

My advice:
If you can't avoid flying with them - read all the small writing, they probably have a surprise for you there / or staff to (not)help you at the airport with it.

title: Swiss is always a great choice
review_text:
This was my 3rd trip on SWISS. 
Twice in Business and once in Economy.
This time we travelled again in Business class and the service was one more time just perfect.
SWISS is definitely a good and affordable airline - even in business class.
I will definitely be a returning customer ‚ò∫

title: Smooth flight and pleasant crew.
review_text: The Swiss flight was a good one.  It was very full but boarded quickly.  The only drawback that was despite having checked in online, there was over an hour long wait just to drop luggage.  This is probably due more to airport and local procedures than Swiss Air.  The crew was friendly and helpful throughout the flight.  It arrived on time and was a pleasant experience.

title: Swiss Top rated airline in Europe
review_text: I always tried to fly with Swiss or Edelweiss for leisure and business travel. It is very reliable airline. The flight crew always try to make it punctual as it depends on many factors. The service is the best in Europe, quality if service as well as inflight meals. My flight from Geneva to Mykonos and return were really nice flights. As usual I am satisfied with the reliability and quality of service.

title: Not enough entertainment choices
review_text: Seats seem smaller than Lufthansa... and for sure the movie choices are ridiculously limited - maybe there are 15, as opposed to well over 50 on most other long haul flights. Also very difficult to get in touch with anyone on the phone.  I would NOT choose Swiss Air again unless I had to.

title: Where is my luggage?
review_text:
I arrived in Spain last night, but my luggage did not.  The line at the Swiss help counter was long but after an hour or so in line, I was finally able to file a claim.  The agent was nice but it didn't seem very important.  I was told my bag was likely in Zurich and would be here this morning.  Morning has come and long gone and no luggage.  I've been calling the phone number provided but no one answers this number.  When i checked the website, it says my bag arrived this morning but nothing more.  Again, apparently not too important to them.  And read your claim ... they will only reimburse for $100.  That doesn't even cover my lost toiletries.  

This, coupled with the very narrow seats and terrible in-flight food lead to my below average rating.  The only thing saving this airline in my opinion is it's great stewards/stewardesse, the terrific ticket agent I had in San Francisco and the on-schedule flights.

title: Flight Cancelled - Sad and frustrated!
review_text:
I had a terrible experience in my first time flying with Swiss Airlines 
I booked a more expensive flight with them in order to fly from the most central airport in London (city airport) on a Friday night to see my family for the weekend ( they are from Brazil and were going to be in Zurich for a few days).
The flight was cancelled and I was rebooked to a new flight in the next day (Saturday) from a more distant airport (Heathrow) with a connection flight, which means I‚Äôll only get to my final destination today at 3:30pm.

There were plenty of other direct flights on Saturday morning which they kept saying it was fully booked , even though in their external website there was availability, and they didn‚Äôt give me much choice. The staff in the contact center didn't  seem to care at all about my personal situation.
I haven‚Äôt seem my family for a long time and my time with them will be a lot shorter now, which is something that no money can pay. 

Now my connection flight is even delayed! 
This situation caused and is causing me so much stress!
I‚Äôm really sad and frustrated! üòîüò¢

title: SWISS Air experience‚Ä¶huge disappointment!
review_text:
I recently booked a flight for 2 people with SWISS Air and below is a summary of my experience and interactions with SWISS Air when I had to cancel the booking:

1.	A few days after my booking I saw duplicate charges posted to my account (1 charge for each ticket) with ticket #s in the description, as well as Austrian Airlines (not SWISS Air!) stated in the description.

2.	Contacted SWISS Air by phone, who had no idea what I was talking about and asked me to put it all in writing.

3.	At the same time had to contact my credit card provider and lodge a formal dispute and investigation regarding the validity of transactions.

4.	A week later SWISS Air emailed back with proof that they only charged my account once i.e. duplicate transactions were not from them.

5.	Contacted my credit card provider to cancel my credit card.

6.	A few weeks later SWISS Air emailed back saying it was them who charged my credit card and they will organize a refund.

7.	Another week later got the refund, however, due to currency conversion, when the refund hit my account I was out pocket by $20+.
 
8.	Contacted SWISS Air regarding the payment shortfall, who said that it had nothing to do with them and it‚Äôs my Bank who translated the amount at the ‚Äúwrong‚Äù rate‚Ä¶

To sum up, even though SWISS Air charged my credit card without my authority (i.e. it was a duplicate payment), provided misleading information in the transactions' description, took more than a month to confirm that there will be a refund and only because I made a formal complaint to my Bank and also notified SWISS Air...somehow because of all of this I got penalised and have to be out of pocket! 

Somehow, SWISS Air thinks it is fair that I have to now pay for something that was not my fault to start with and are turning a blind eye to the fact that had these duplicate transactions never took place, Rate of Exchange used by my Bank would be irrelevant and not applicable, as there would have been no disputed transactions/transactions waiting to be refunded and, hence, converted from one currency to another‚Ä¶I am not even talking about the time spent and the inconvenience caused by me having to cancel the credit card that was not financially compromised to start with!
    
This was my first and last ever booking with SWISS Air‚Ä¶never again!

title: Flight delayed and it's not the first time.
review_text: It's not the first time that I travel with. The service is quite good but it's not the first time that my flight is delayed.

title: Nice flight
review_text: Lovely flight,  plane left on time, service was excellent and the food was good.  Lots of legroom and comfortable seating

title: Flying back from vacation
review_text: We flew on this airline from Zurich to Chicago.  For 9 hours, the drink service was great but when you needed to use the restroom, it‚Äôs hard to know when the bathrooms are available when you‚Äôre sitting in row 22. The attendants don‚Äôt want y‚Äôall to stand up by the restrooms to wait until one is open.  They get pissed off.  Even when you‚Äôre not talking to anyone in that area of a 777.  The inflight entertainment is great.  Lots to watch.  Food is excellent!  This airline would be my first choice if I ever get back to Europe.

title: Pleasant flight , Excellent service
review_text: This is the second time we have flown Swiss air, and will continue to do so. They are always serving food, dinner and breakfast. Soda , juice ,beer , and wine. The flight attendants are friendly and attentive to your needs. The flight was on time ,which allowed us to easily make our connection.

title: On time, great and pleasant service
review_text:
This was not a direct flight. From Tel Aviv to Zurich and from there to Dublin. The return flight - from Dublin to Zurich and from there to Tel Aviv.
The first 3 with Swiss the last part With El-Al (Israeli airline). The last one was not as good as the others. I know it is not "Patriotic" to say, but I had bad experience in the past with El-Al and this flight didn't change my opinion about it.
Never the less, the flights with Swiss were very good!
As for leg room, I paid only on the flight from Tel Aviv to Zurich. But the other 2 ordinary seats which were good. With El Al - less leg room

title: Flight classes of service
review_text:
Before my trip when I told friends I was traveling Swiss, they would say great airline.  Well not so much.  Previously this year, I flew business class with EVA Air - Taipei to Toronto.  Their service was impeccable.  The flight attendants would call me by name.  There was a large fold out table to accommodate the dishes. Even got pajamas with a larger bathroom making it easy to change.

This July I was on Swiss.  First be sure you check the seat map before selecting a seat.  Many do not have much shelf space.  Food was OK and served on trays.  Flight attendants did not learn you name.  And several other details that made this an overall much less enjoyable experience.  

BTW I was upgraded to Swiss first class for the Montreal Zurich portion of my trip.  This was almost equivalent to EVA's business class.

title: Great airlines
review_text: Overall service was goods it was a short flight the business class seats were not that premium...but overall hospitality, food was good

title: Good experience, but slight delay
review_text:
Delay in leaving BHX due to 'thunderstorms at Zurich' by about 15 minutes, but arrived on time. Flight attendants pleasant, had a coffee & croisant for the 1hr.40min flight, & a Swiss choccy as part of the experience.
Strangely the flight was delayed going back to BHX due to 'thunderstorms', but probably due to the fact that the plane wasn't ready & they had lost their time slot...

title: very poor compared to the price
review_text:
I fly since years several times from Z√ºrich to Mumbai. All the time you have something what you would not expect from this Airline. Several times was the enterteinment system not working.Not in the complete Airplane, but at my and other seats. Last time moved my back rest always backwards and they could not fix. Since years they serve you the same very bad cardboard tasting wrap on you flight back to Z√ºrich. With complaining the food, they recommended me to try one time business class.
If possible I avoid this Airline. The only advantage is the nonstop flight. But otherwiese any other option to fly to Asia is better and cheaper.

title: Visiting family
review_text: The flight attendants refused to help me place my small bag in the overhead hold. They were not courteous. The bed although flat seemed cramped and not enough space. On my outbound flight, although flying business, the attendants did not give me desert.

title: Airline experience great booking website awful
review_text: The flight was excellent, the cabin crew very friendly I would give 5 out of 5 if it wasn't for the awful booking website and the truly diabolical telephone help line. We booked flights in 2 steps for 2 passengers each. Try to do anything out the ordinary and its a nightmare. On our first attempt it included speaking on the phone to 3 different "customer service" operatives who gave totally conflicting advice this ended in my son booking his flights in total 3 times after doing what he was advised by customer services only to be told by another operative each time it was wrong and have to cancel it and start again. This meant he finally had no funds left in his account as it takes upto 14 days to refund the transaction. All he wanted to do was book a cycle onto the flight but this seems to be a major obstacle for Swiss Air systems. Why not make life easier and allow booking of an oversized item online rather than have to book your seats online then phone up to add the cycle in its bike box! Once you get to the flight though the staff are super and the flight very good.

title: Amazing Flying Experience !!!!
review_text: Wow is the word. The Experience was just amazing . Food was good , staff was amazing . Overall a great experience !

title: Flight
review_text: Nice flight, decent ratio of the price and quality. We had a small delay (approx. half hour), but in general it was O.K.

title: Family holiday
review_text: On time efficient performance:  Comfortable plane, good legroom, friendly staff but food was atrocius

title: excellent transfers and good space in economy
review_text: excellent seats in economy on both planes. We flew to Geneva and then on to Moscow.  We had a delay at Heathrow but there was a  person waiting to tell us where to go in order to transfer to the  plane to Moscow. It is easy to make the 45 minute transfer between planes at Geneva. We travelled Business class on the return which was superb. I would definately look to fly with this airline again.

title: My worst trip ever.
review_text: First the flight from Warsaw to Zurich was so delayed that I lost one day of my vacation because I went to Brazil via Milan on the next day. Now coming back they just cancelled the flight from Zurich to Warsaw and I have to wait 8 hours at the airport to get the next flight. This is the worst airliner but this is the last time I flight with them.

title: Website not working. Payment processing failed 10 times.
review_text:
I literally filled out the same credit card details 6 times. Got an error that the credit card details where wrong (they're not). Then tried another credit card, got the same error. Tried again, got a new error "internal servers down 500, please try again later". Tried again: it worked. 

Worthless. I literally spent 45 minutes trying to enter card details properly. My credit card details where correct from the very first try. The error I got was plain wrong ("wrong card number" instead of SORRY OUR SYSTEMS ARE DOWN). 

Besides that not many payment options are offered. Very very crappy experience. Did not expect this from a Swiss company.

title: Paid $3500 for business class. Got economy class and 24hours too late. No apologies
review_text:
Paid for a business class flight with Avianca that had its first flight operated by Swiss.

I missed my first connection because of a mistake made by Swiss. When they rebooked me on next flight 24 hours later they made another mistake in their booking system and downgraded my return trip to economy class.

I never got paid the difference in price and Swiss just copy/pastes the same response that I was downgraded because of bad weather. In the end I got no compensation from them.

title: Service top. Entertainment to be improved.
review_text:
Check-in was speedy and friendly.

Business Lounge in Dock E is well equipped and spacious.
Food and beverage choice is big.

I have had a good flight with top service on board.
Food is delicious and nicely decorated.
What I would wish is that Entertainment System would be updated and offer more variety.
The screen is quite small and the head set a old fashioned.

Landing was smooth and flight overall very comfortable.

title: High cost flights but proceed like low cost flights
review_text: Both flights connection go and back were delayed by 1 hour. The seats were very not comfortable. The distance between the seat and too small.

title: Bad service
review_text: This is my second time fly with Swiss air in business class, maybe it is China route, I am not sure why the seat is so small, very uncomfortable, and the travel kit was cost saving cheap stuff, the most awful thing was the Chinese cabin girl who never smile and offer any help. Looks like she hate her job, or she just pity herself for serving people. The cabin already very small, airbus 340 with 2-2-2 layout, the Chinese stewardess attitude just unbearable. Anyway, I will not fly with them again. Too bad.

title: One of the Best Airlines!!
review_text: On July 22nd/23rd 2019 my wife and I travelled from Montreal, QC, Canada to Larnaca, Cyprus. We were in Economy Class, and actually we are surprised about the excellent service that this airline offers once on Board; the Crew members are very polite; delicious food and drinks!! And of course, we did enjoy the flight!!

title: One of the Best Services I ever had
review_text:
Excellent Experience starting from Boarding , On Board and Landing. Comfortable seats and clean Cabin for both Economy and Business class. I had ordered Veg meal and it was served on priority while going and coming back . I have worked in Airlines for 17 + years and I will give 5 Stars to SWISS. 
And the best surprise is the SWISS Chocolates you get before landing to make your journey more sweat .

title: Cancelled flight at last minute and onward Swiss Air flight delayed causing connecting flight problems.
review_text: Terrible service from Swiss Air, cancelled flight at last minute and only two staff at Geneva Airport who were very slow and unhelpful. No help given for any additional costs for food or accommodation. Inconvenient rescheduled flights via email. Had to fly to Nice and get an onward flight to London, this Swiss Air flight to Nice was delayed by 75minutes meaning we would miss our connecting flight, thankfully our connecting flight was delayed meaning we could board(5 mins to spare). First flight cancelled, second flight delayed giving us a 7 hour delay. Poor after sales service from Swiss Air. Will never fly Swiss Air again.

title: Worst customer service I‚Äôve had
review_text: My girlfriend came to visit me in Amsterdam through Zurich. We went to Berlin after, we wouldn‚Äôt make it back to Amsterdam, so we asked if we can go directly from Berlin to Zurich - they asked us to pay double than the ticket! If airlines can‚Äôt be flexible with my travels I‚Äôm never going to use them again. Would not recommend to anyone.

title: Good standard for inter Europe Airline.
review_text: Good experience with SWISS except for seating which is pretty standard it seems with inter Europe flights. Standard economy seats with the only difference being the middle seat is left vacant. Service, quality of food and beverages was great and far better than some other inter Europe airlines. Customer Service/Reservations in Australia can be challenging to reach,  however standard of service was excellent when you finally did get to speak with them.

title: Great Flight
review_text: Seats were comfortable, nice in-flight entertainment, friendly staff, food served often and good. Overall very happy with everything.

title: Pleasantly surprised!
review_text: We had never flown Swiss Air and were unsure what to expect, but we were pleasantly surprised with the service. It was a short flight and we were seated in the exit rows so leg room was not an issue. The attendants first came around with mini Swiss chocolate bars and then again with croissants! We arrived in Zurich ahead of schedule. We will definitely not hesitate to fly Swiss Air in the future.

title: Very poor, inefficient service provided!!
review_text: Very poor, inefficient service provided today! Delayed flight and delayed luggage on arrival in Manchester!! Would definitely not recommend flying with Swiss Air!!

title: Nice new planes
review_text: Flight delayed but it was a global delay at Porto airport....Veryu nice aircraft C series. Problem with catering thus only water...Very kind crew...

title: Excellent customer service
review_text: Swiss is one of the best airlines I ever travelled. I am frequently flying for business reasons and giving preference to Swiss for several reasons: always on time, comfortable plans, good food, customer friendly. Their hub in Zurich is one of the best in the world.

title: Not for the claustrophobic
review_text:
This was a long flight so sleep was important. Seating configuration is odd and once you slide down to flat bed, you are partially under the seat in front and boxed in at sides. I felt like  I was in a coffin , not pleasant at all. One needs to look carefully at seating plan and request a seat that doesn‚Äôt share your space, look at rows 6 and 8 on the window sides.
Food and service was terrific, nothing was a problem.

title: Tiring flight
review_text: Don‚Äôt recommend economy seating your knees are in seat in front of you and no padding at all. Nice looking business class. Food was ok and service was good.

title: Denied departure-delay for all!
review_text: Based on my own experience and also that of friends of mine, it appears that is common for SWISS AIRLINES to denay boarding to passengers arriving just a few minutes after the BOARDING time (typically 30 min. before scheduled departure). As a result, there is much longer delay for passengers on board, waiting seated for the CHECKED IN BAGGAGES TO BE REMOVED. Complete non-sense

title: Please stop serving those dry & disgusting buns!
review_text:
Dear Swiss,
Please stop serving those dry, stale and boring tasting buns during your short haul flights!

I fly about 60 times a year and I am embarrassed for you. 

Claiming they are baked fresh every day does not make it better.  Change your supplier, chose something entirely different  (moevenpick icecream was good) or drop it all together.

title: Extremely poor service
review_text:
We had a miserable experience with Swiss International Airlines.  On an international flight, we were among at least 50 people who waited in line for over an hour and a half to file a lost baggage claim with airport authorities (there was NO Swiss Air Representative).
Three days passed without response to our calls and emails.  When the bags finally came, we were told they could not deliver them to our hotel.  We had to return to the airport to claim bags and pay a fee for airport storage and handling.
On our next trip next trip we will certainly avoid Swiss International Airlines

title: Perfect flights!
review_text: I took a Swiss flight from Brussels to Zurich (to go further to Havana) and back to Brussels.  The flight was perfect.  The staff was very friendly and helpful.  Even on this short flight we received a snack and a drink.  I would fly Swiss again in the future.

title: 8 hrs delayed without any reimbursment
review_text:
