I was traveling from Warsaw to Boston with transfer in Zurich. After sitting inside the airplane for over an hour we were told we couldn't take off because of technical issues. OK, it happens - I understand! I was waiting in line for 2hrs to find out my other options but they told us that now we had to pick up our baggage first. When I picked up my baggage and came back I had to wait in line again for 2 hrs  (lost my turn) and meanwhile lost another  flight I could take to Zurich. After all they offered me a flight to Chicago 8 hrs later and from there to Boston. That's fine too but I was 20 hrs late, at 3AM and without anybody to pick me up at the airport. I had to use Uber instead of my friend,  I have lost a very important day at work and only got $10 for the meal at airport !!!!!!!!!
Are you kidding me - this is called compensation for all these screw ups????
Swiss Air didn't really take care of their passengers when they needed the most !!!!
Sorry !!! No more Swiss for me and my entire family, friends and whoever ask me !!!

title: Excellent flight
review_text: This was part of about seven legs with Swiss Air across three continents. We were impressed with every aspect of the flights. Highly recommended. Tasty food, clean and good service.

title: Super
review_text:
I was actually travelling by economy. Flight was full so was upgraded to business class due to the silver card status.
Super service as always. Have been travelling for over 30years by star alliance especially Swiss & Lufthansa. Very clean, toilets were clean & perfect a/c temperature.
There was no vegetarian food request of mine in business class but the staff were so kind they gave me their part of veg food. 
Towards the end of my journey my thin optics reading glass fell in between the seat.  Arzan (Steward)& Jean Piere (Cabin chief) both actually opened up the seat & removed my glasses. Was really kind of them to do it. Really appreciated that else would have had to wait for their technical team to come after landing. Thanks once again to you'll both.
I will always continue travelling by Swiss/Lufthansa & recommend friends & family. üëç

title: Good value
review_text:
I have flown with Swiss multiple times in the past and have never encountered any major issues. Out of the 12 flights that I‚Äôve had with them in total only 1 was delayed by approximately 1 hour, which is not a bad score compared to other Star Alliance airlines. The legroom in economy is decent, the flight attendants are very kind and the Z√ºrich airport is a beautiful hub for connections.
Complimentary service in economy includes a drink and a Swiss snack which is a thoughtful personal touch.

title: Food awful
review_text:
Very friendly and attentative staff.
 Free beers and wines but have liked to pay for a decent gin and tonic.
Tasteless quiches
Better to serve sandwich with decent cheese.

title: Swiss efficiency...
review_text:
Dear Swiss,
I just want to share my last experience with your airline.
Flying business class from Shanghai to Milan via Zurich on July 27.
On-board of the Shanghai-Zurich Flight the entertainment system did not work for some 3 hours.
Many apologies, but ‚Ä¶ poor maintenance.
Arrived in Zurich (15:50) I discovered that my connecting flight to Milan (17:20) had been cancelled for ‚Äúbad weather conditions‚Äù. In Milan the weather was fine, in Zurich we had some little rain for about 10 minutes.
I wonder how the famous Swiss efficiency deals with snow when it happens‚Ä¶
Anyway I went to the Transfer Desk A  where, at the business class counter, I was told that there were no more flights to Milan so I should have stayed overnight.
I was lucky as, at the counter close to mine, the economy class one, there was a couple of Italians with the same problem, and they were proposed a flight leaving for Milan at 20:55.
So I asked the lady at my counter to check again; she looked upset, after all an Italian was criticizing a Swiss citizen, I had to ask one more time, but she finally did it and, oh miracle, she found the flight. A mystery why the flight did not show up at the first search; Indeed, the lady at the counter was another champion of the famous Swiss efficiency. ..
So I was re-booked on a same day flight.
I went to the lounge for my  more-than-4-hours waiting, and then, around 20:30, I went to the gate A84 to finally fly back home.
Many wannabe passengers were queuing there, but we all were told that our flight was delayed and our plane was still in Frankfurt, so we would have probably to wait another one or two hours.
I walked back to the lounge and, having completely lost any trust in the way Swiss organises things, I asked the lady at the entrance to check again at what time the flight to Milan had been postponed.
She said ‚Äú21:35‚Äù, and when I told her that the plane was still in Frankfurt ten minutes before, she said that no, the plane was already at the gate.
10 minutes to get from Frankfurt to Zurich‚Ä¶ WOW! Swiss is shortening the average flight time and setting a new world record: 10 minutes for a flight than normally takes one hour‚Ä¶
That‚Äôs efficiency!
So I walked back to the gate to board and asked the lady at the gate to be changed to an aisle seat as, while walking back to the gate, I had noticed that I had been rebooked on a windows set, which I do not like. ‚ÄúNo Sir, there are no free seats anymore, you have to stay where you are‚Äù
Fine;  after a 12 hours flight from Shanghai plus more than five hours waiting,  you can even accept a place in the toilet, I am sure that Swiss knows.
Once on board, I sat down on my seat and discovered that all business class passengers had been booked without any neighbour, so the seat at my side was free, and was of course an aisle seat. 
Swiss efficiency.. 
Landing in Milan at 22:32, so with more than 4 hours delay (my original flight was due to land at 18:15) we all went to the luggage delivery, and of course, after waiting the last baggage , I finally accepted the fact that Swiss had lost my suitcase.
Having had only five hours in Zurich to unload my luggage from the Shanghai flight to transfer it to my Milan one is indeed a short time‚Ä¶ 
Swiss efficiency..
Another long walk at the Lost & Found counter where I found some 40 people queuing but I saw the counter for Star Alliance Business Class passengers: 
No queue there!!! 
But nobody at the desk‚Ä¶
Yes, this is not handled by Swiss, but a good airline also chooses good partners, and indeed the level of your handling partner in Milan is the same as yours.
Back to the only one queue (one single lady at the desk for some 40 passengers, then augmenting to 50) around half past midnight I managed to finalize the Property Irregularity Report.
Yes, queuing for 2 hours, standing‚Ä¶
Swiss efficiency.. 
Of course after midnight there are no more trains to Milan, so I took the bus, leaving at 1:30 am and by 2:30 I was back home, without my luggage but with a growing sentiment of real admiration for Swiss.
The following day I wrote you through your website and immediately got a reply, WOW!
It was an automatic mail quoting the file number assigned to my claim. After this‚Ä¶ nothing, of course.
Swiss efficiency‚Ä¶
The end? No, of course. 
You have a tracking system for the lost baggage which works very well.  I used it, until the moment in which I was informed that my suitcase had been given to a company for the delivery to my house.
To which company? When will be the delivery? Total mystery, Swiss efficiency‚Ä¶ 
And of course the tracking system says that the matter is closed‚Ä¶ 
Oh, but yes, there is also a phone number‚Ä¶  Yes, it is a phone of your handling partner, not of Swiss, but as I said its level of efficiency is the same as yours, so no way to speak with any human being...
The following day (July 29), I received  a phone call in the late morning saying that the delivery was scheduled between 16:00 and 18:00.
So I stopped working earlier in order to be at home in time and‚Ä¶. waited. Waited. Waited. Waited.
At 20:00, while I was having  dinner,  I received a phone call asking me if I was at home around 20:30 for the delivery. 
Swiss efficiency‚Ä¶
Yes I was at home, so when the intercom rang I explained the delivery guy how to get to my door, but he said that no, I myself had to pick my luggage at the street level. 
Swiss efficiency‚Ä¶
What else? 
Nothing, as Swiss seems to ignore also the second claim I made online.
But meanwhile, as a final proof of Swiss efficiency, I got a mail (July 30) from Swiss Customer Feedback asking me to fill in a survey about my recent flight..
Are you joking? Swissair already went bankrupt years ago, but Swiss is not doing any better I am afraid‚Ä¶
With a lot of efficiency,
Giorgio La Ferla

title: Average in every way
review_text:
Check in was quick and easy, and getting to the lounge in D was simple. The lounge in D though is small and lacks any wow factor. The food offered was below par: a choice of overcooked pasta or overcooked spatzle with vegetables. There were 2 soups: the cold tomato soup was good but the hot soup was like salty water. There were a lot of breads but nothing to put on them / with them (no meats / cheeses / butter). They had a lot of Movenpick ice cream but every one was coffee flavour. I asked if they had any other flavours or butter and was told 'no'. The staff working the buffet were either not happy to be there or were having a bad day. They offer free wifi when you go in but it's just the airport wifi. Very hot as the AC wasn't working properly and they had to rely on fans. 
Our flight kept getting delayed and we did get an email about this. When I asked the staff member at the gate she did not know anything about it. When we eventually boarded it was again a disappointment - same as economy but with a spare seat. No welcome drink, no inflight entertainment. We were held on the aircraft for 30 minutes before we took off. Our connecting flight was also delayed so a member of Turkish airlines met us at the gate and ran with us to the departing flight gate. Crew were helpful onboard.

title: Grest experience
review_text: It was a quiet flight, the cabin crew was good and also  the servive . I was with my husband and there wasnt any problem.

title: Awful Policies, Poor Corporate Structure
review_text: Flying from Copenhagen to Boston on our return flight was cancelled due to hidden conditions on our flight on the way to Europe. The flight attendants were friendly but the plane seemed in very poor condition, too much rattling and loose wing materials for my liking. On our return, the flight issues were not resolved by anyone helpful and the demeanor was aloof and cold. I DO NOT RECOMMEND SWISS TO ANYONE. I know there are plenty of bad reviews, but the inability of this airline to treat its passengers fairly and with respect during a travel emergency shined through for us. This company lost two lifetime customers, and hopefully more that realize under the visage of complementary chocolate lies a predatory and elitist airline company.

title: Check in staff on Checkin in Zurich Airport
review_text: We were 10 passengers with small children but were badly treated as my wife had a trolley bag and its size was normal and she had travellled from London City to Zurich with that same hand luggage as she was allowed but from Zurich to Lon their was issue with the Checkin staff. The weight was abut 6 kilo.

title: I was upgraded to business class at the gate üòç
review_text: I was upgraded to business class at the gate which I thought was not much different from economy for a flight under one hour- yet breakfast so super nice and I can‚Äôt complain about the extra space in business class üòçüòç

title: Seats cramped
review_text: F;light to Lisbon not direct. Too long a flight.I would not do this again. The seats are too cramped.It is hard to get out of seat to use the facilities.The weight for carry-ons make it difficult to travel.Will try and find an airline with more of a direct flight.

title: How Flying Should be
review_text:
It was not smooth saling but they made it as comfortable as possible.
First, there is some design issue with the system that does not allow you to check-in online if there are infants on your booking. The support team explained it and we checked-in directly on the airport.
A few people were about to miss a connection flight because of bad weather in Italy. The ground staff dealt a lot better than most of their peers in keeping people informed about how things are going and attempting to help them get their connections.
For us, travelling with our daughter was made super easy - there is excellent service for families with babies all the way from the check in to the moment you leave the plane.
All in all, what could have been a really bad and frustrating trip turned into a pretty good one. Great service.

title: Quality and friendly in a swiss way
review_text:
We enjoyed a short flight from Brussels to Zurich.
The crew were very kind, especially for our 4 year old son.
We received good food & drinks. 
It is not singapore Airlines (where they smile a lot more), but you get Swiss quality in a more serious but friendly way.

title: Punctual, polite, and pleasant all the way
review_text: I made this round trip flight via Swiss' hub at Zurich.  All flights were on schedule and this made the transit in Zurich absolutely stress free.  Indeed, on my way back I was able to spend some time in the lounge above the boarding areas.  The views were splendid and it was spacious.  The bathrooms were very clean.  On board all the flights, ample food and drinks were on offer including vegetarian dishes.  The seat was a bit narrower than I would have liked and the touch-activated screens required you to stretch your arms out.  The business class on the Airbus 330-300 on the transatlantic flight has a 1-2-1 configuration which makes the cabin very spacious.  The Airbus on the Budapest route has standard 3-3 layout but the middle seat is left vacant.  The finishing touch is Swiss chocolates -- leaves a sweet taste as you disembark.  You earn frequent flier miles on Star Alliance.  Immigration and security checks at Zurich are smooth.  The Swiss lounge at Budapest is close to the gates from where their flights to Zurich leave.

title: An incredible airline for value and service.
review_text:
We flew on this airline when going from Geneva to Munich, and I can‚Äôt recommend it enough! 

Despite being a short flight (only 1 hour from memory), the seats were extremely comfortable. Despite not having any in-flight screens (which was understandable for such a short flight), the views from outside over the Swiss mountains were extraordinary. 

The in-flight food was amazing. They had a freshly baked roll with genuine Swiss cheese on it, with a bottle of water and Swiss chocolate. For an hour flight, I would go as far as to say it was some of the best airplane food I‚Äôve ever eaten. 

The only thing was that our baggage got mixed up at the terminal at Munich airport, but that was most likely just be fault of the airport, not the airline.

Overall, would 100% recommend to travellers for short flights. I don‚Äôt know about long-haul flights or if they use another type of aircraft with screens.

title: Their 777 Economy smallest sized space for humans ever
review_text: It is amazing how greed can create humans that will order a design of a plane that is so cramped and small for humans that if you are not 5'5" and 140LBS or less you do not fit properly or comfortably in the spaces.  An average person can not walk down the aisle without having to move in a sideward fashion as they are so thin.  A flight that lasts over 11 hours is torture and unhealthy to passengers no matter what great entertainment you have.  This is a great flying new plane with always a great crew, but please don't be so greedy with the space you give your passengers.

title: Swiss Breaks the Law and Not Pay According to Regulation EC261/2004
review_text:
We had a flight in business class BKK-ZRH then a few days before the flight I went online to check our seat assignment only to realize the flight had been cancelled because of a defective aircraft (leading to cancellations for several days straight) and NOBODY from Swiss even informed us, nor did they even bother to rebook us automatically to another flight.  By then other passengers had been rebooked on the most convenient flights and were full; we were out of luck.  We were eventually rebooked on Thai Aiways flight instead, at a very inconvenient time to us.  

Swiss must pay compensation of 600 EUR per person (=1200 EUR) as per regulation EC261/2004 because we got rebooked on a flight with arrival time /¬†date nowhere near what we were originally booked.  I submitted the claim, Swiss acknowledged they owe 1200 EUR and asked for my bank account information:
‚ÄúYour flight LX181 on 16 June 2019 unfortunately had to be cancelled at short notice. On behalf of SWISS and our cooperation partners, I apologize for the inconvenience you had as a result. I have checked the reason of the cancellation of your flight and can inform you that SWISS will grant you a compensation to the amount of EUR 600.00 each. On receiving your IBAN, the total amount of CHF 1 332.00 (EUR 1 200.00) will be transferred to your account within 14 days.‚Äù

I provided my bank account info on June 27, then on July 18 I still did not have payment so I sent another e-mail to the same Swiss e-mail address that we had exchanges in June about the payment.  I was stonewalled, I e-mailed again on July 23, 25, 26, all e-mails are being unanswered.  Swiss‚Äô strategy seems to ignore, therefore I must bring this case public.  They had their chance to do the right thing privately but failed.  

Shame on you Swiss, not only the cancelled flight notification was handled poorly (in fact, you did not handle it at all), but now you refuse to pay as per regulations and ignore customers.  I invite you to comment in here about your behavior.  It‚Äôs the law, you must pay, there is no debate to have.

In the future I will do my best to avoid an airline who cannot do the most basic things such as following the law.  Other readers on TripAdvisor should be aware.

title: Business in Chicago
review_text:
Traveling around the world in business, the choices are many as prices. Without any question the most critical elements for traveling for business purposes is the efficiency in time; fast track, smoothness in security, connections and transfers.
If this can be done in comfort and at a reasonable price is a bonus.
Quite frankly I believe that good food and the absolute comfort onboard is secondary.
That is why Swiss has a good product because they have Kloten and direct flights to important destinations at convenient times without waiting to much.

title: No connection flight when arriving in Zurich, Switzerland to fly to Kiev, Ukraine
review_text:
My husband and son traveled to Kyiv, Ukraine from JFK Airport in New York City on May 2, 2019. I expected this trip to be very smooth as they were traveling Swiss Airlines, a good airline according to previous experience. Unfortunately, they were for a very unpleasant surprise, when they got to Zurich there was no connection for the flight to Kyiv. Fortunately, a family member was able to put them in a LOT (Polish airline) flight, from Zurich to Warsaw and then Warsaw to Kyiv.  The luggage stayed in Zurich, which was an inconvenience as they received them in the afternoon of the following day.
 
My son wrote Swiss Airlines hoping for compensation as it was the airline‚Äôs mistake, but he didn‚Äôt even receive a letter of apology as this error was not supposed to happen. My son photograph the boarding passes as proof, but still, there was no response from the company.
 
I don‚Äôt recommend Swiss International Airline after the bad experience they had. I wouldn‚Äôt like anyone to be stranded in a strange airport without having a flight to take them to their destination, as it was my husband and son's experience.

title: Avoid  the company
review_text: I had connecting flight from Moscow to Paris with connection flight in Zurich. The plain to Moscow was late without any information. The department from Moscow was even more late. The board staff did not provided any information about gate of connecting flight. There was not any staff to pass me to the gate quickly and I have lost my flight Zurich-Paris and had a loss of booking fee of Paris hotel. At last Swiss refused to pay me the compensation and refund the hotel fee. I never will use the company again even for Swiss..

title: flight was OK but the check-in and boarding procedure was sub-standard
review_text:
- my wife couldn't check in online, because (a) this was a code share with United and we couldn't find out the Swiss confirmation code; (b) using the ticket number didn't work. I finally called their help desk and was told that I was writing her first name as "Jane" and it had to be "JaneEllen" with Ellen her middle name and no spaces. (!) They really can't figure out who it is even if you give them the ticket number plus last name? Or at least give feedback as to what they're looking for?

- my online check in didn't work either---I just got a message after completing the process saying "This is not a boarding pass. Please show this document at the check-in counter upon your arrival at the airport. It will be exchanged with a valid boarding pass." Some feedback would again be nice; I never figured out what went wrong. 

- at the airport there's an extra passport check at the gate due to TSA requirements. Most airlines handle this smoothly, but Swiss waited until 45 minutes before boarding time, then kicked everyone out of the gate area and made them line up, then spent 20 minutes slowly setting up little desks and gathering staff while 200 passengers, many elderly, stood in line, then checked all the passports again. Total waiting time in line about 30-40 minutes. Certainly this is the cheapest way to do the job, but treating the passengers like cattle is not good.

- at boarding all the economy passengers stood in a line on the left while the first class boarded from a line on the right. Then the staff member announced that economy passengers should board from the right. So 150 people moved over to the right, at which point another staff member yelled at them that this line was for first class and everyone should go to the left. Once again, treated like cattle for no good reason.

- and on the plane the entertainment system was broken, as was my seat back.

Having said this, the flight attendants were gracious and the flight left and arrived more-or-less on time. Swiss needs to pay a lot more attention to the pre-flight processing, both electronic and on-site.

The experience was summarized by the security official questioning me "why would you fly Swiss to Newark when you could fly United?" When just flying on an airline is suspicious the airline needs to do better.

title: Great Entertainment
review_text: For this being my first international flight, I was very impressed with how easy the overall flight was. Great customer service and snacks along the way. The best part was the entertainment onboard. Besides videos and movies, we also had games. Many say who cares about the games; however, who wouldn't want to play Tetris in the sky? It was nice because you could also play Battleship against someone else on the plane, so my sister and I took advantage of that. The best part of the trip was the little swiss chocolate they give you toward the end of the flight! The only downside was that when we had our plane change in Zurich on our way to Birmingham, our luggage never made it unto our plane and we went 26 hours without our clothes. Other than that, it was a good experience.

title: Almost like it used to be
review_text: I flew Swiss from Valencia to Zurich and then connected into Chicago. It was a regular economy seat on an A330. There was sufficient leg room. The food on both flights was actually very nice. The staff were super helpful and attentive. It was a full flight yet they were always available and helpful. One thing I really appreciated was that they kept the bathrooms as clean as they possibly could. It was very nice to fly with a crew that was not predisposed to ignore you. I will try my best to use them as my gateway to Europe and perhaps beyond.

title: Wonderful flight
review_text: The flight was great. We were in Economy Light. There was a little more leg room,but not a lot. The food was very good and the flight attendants were very attentive. We had no problems at all.

title: Unreasonable excess baggage tarriff
review_text: We were touring europe and couldnt weight the baggage for exact wt.  We had 4 check-in baggages and 3 of them was overweight by 2-3 kgs.   We did online check-in and due to some tehcnical issues from their side, the baggage tags could'nt be printed.   We were running late for our flight and told the check-in guy that we will pay excess baggage for one luggage so that we can keep moving.  One excess luggage is around 183 Frank, we had only 5 kgs excess luggage but still we were ready to pay but the check-in trainee didnt get it.   He called his supervisor multiple times, she was horrible in treating customers.    They made us repack all the luggages and made us throw stuff.   They checked in one of our hand baggages.   We had to run with our young kids to catch the flight.   On top of this, the security screening team was totally unprofessional, they didnt get that we have to catch a flight.   Very very rude staff and worst Airport in treating customers.

title: Awesome entertainment options and service.  No leg room.
review_text:
Great people.  Lady at the customer service desk in Geneva spent an hour trying and succeeding in saving us by finding inexpensive tickets when our other terrible airline (Easyjet) dropped the ball.

Tons of movies to watch - good ones!  Only downside is no legroom.  This made it hard to get comfortable and my legs were numb after the 11 hour flight.

title: Horrible, unfair treatment
review_text:
My wife and I travelled Budapest-Zurich-Delhi. 

Swiss re-routed us at Zurich (they had delayed Budapest-Zurich flight and we missed the connection) Zurich-Copenhagen-Delhi by Air India.

My 2 bags did not arrive and were delivered 2 and 3 days later.

For compensation Swiss pushes me to Air India and AI says they cannot compensate me because I do not have an Air India ticket.

What a pathetic state of affairs.

We had travelled business class. Never again with these horrible set of people.

title: Not what it used to be.
review_text: I found the service unfriendly. I didn't notice one smile. Food was so-so even if they had the food you wanted. I much prefer the pods versus the type of seats on this plane.

title: Dissapointing
review_text: Extremely dissapointing. The seats are old and not well maintained. For Business Class the TV is very small compared to other airlines. Also the choice of movies is very less. Service was pathetic.

title: Smooth
review_text: Very quick and efficient check in. The staff were informative too. The boarding process perfect. Cabin crew efficient and smiling. Only the breakfast was dissapointing.

title: Flying high from swiss air
review_text:
Swiss airlines is very efficient and nice all around. We had very long flights and enjoyed two meals, snacks, individual movies and entertainment. It was a clean plane and there was continual food beverage, and help from the flight attendants. 
We had a (purposeful) long lay over in Zurich and were able to leave through customs in only 15 minutes and re-enter in less time than I have seen any other airline.

title: Airbus 321 is really good in economy!
review_text: I‚Äôm always happy when I book Swissair - many boxes will then be checked:  clean, fresh, impeccable service, always a piece of chocolate or ice cream as an extra gift and the flight will be on time. Everything turned out as expected, but for the first time it was delayed. As a compensation, the Airbus 321 was really good with lots of legspace and felt very new and fresh. Also some old Tom & Jerry on the screens. Must say that the 321 is a lot better than the 320: legspace, screens, toilet in the middle etc. And the nicest and best service on board of course!

title: If your flight goes right.. it's great, if not, it's bad.
review_text:
I generally like to fly with Swiss. They are a great airline, have super nice staff und good planes. Also the Zurich airport is nice to hang around, have a coffee, although expensive. But you're getting good quality food and drinks, and it feels quiet there (for an airport). 
The inflight experience is good and I am happy how things are handled. 

The only bad thing, and this repeatedly happened, is when things go wrong. Meaning when there is a delay or a cancelled flight, the customer service is pretty bad. There is no one to contact, you're got no chance on having an influence on the changes, and after all that it takes ages to get a refund. So there is a lot to improve in terms of customer service when things go wrong. 

But ya, when things go right, it is a good airline.

title: Never experienced so many delays!
review_text: We flew on Jul 20th from Palma to Budapest via Zurich. Plane from Palma was delayed 1 hour. Adding on, on our layover in Zurich we had an over 2 hour delay... nobody said anything as to why we have to wait. Traveling with a toddler on this airline was the biggest mistake. Customer service was very low. This was the first and last time we travelled with Swiss Airlines.

title: We always travel with Swiss
review_text: We had a lovely flight with Swiss on board of a very big aircraft, with multiple classes, quite unusual for European flights. As usual the service was impeccable, although one flight attended kept calling her subordinates, male and female "Sch√§tzchen" quite loud, and displayed an unprofessional work attitude. We fly very often with Swiss because of the service and the comfort on board. Morning flights are usually punctual and delays are always due to the traffic or weather. We like the fact that Swiss feels responsible for the environment and has goals set to decline fuel usage. We strongly recommend this company.

title: Outstanding service
review_text: We flew with Swiss from Bangkok to Z√ºrich (11,5 hours in air) recently and I was amazed of the service level onboard. The crew made us feel comfortable and they kept offering great snack, drinks and delicious food. We even got ice cream and chocolate. Also the entertainment on the screen was good. Lots of great and new movies to choose from. The flight felt shorter because of the great service level. I can defiantly recommend this airline.

title: Miss Susan Zimmer
review_text:
Excellent service and very friendly cabin crew 
We will definitely fly again anytime with Swiss air
üëçüèª

title: No extra costs of hand-in suitcases
review_text:
Often people fly with a cheaper airline,  but I have just made another experience,  whilst accompanying a friend as a voluntary carer; she had to pay extra for our hand-in suitcases on the Alitalia. 
 So do check airfares carefully whilst booking. It's not worth it and the long stay over might be fun for the young and healthy.
That's why when I book personally; I fly Swiss

title: Excellent Service
review_text: I flew this sector with my wife. The departure and arrival timings of this flight are convenient enough. The checkin process was a breeze as was the boarding. The cabin crew was very polite and their service was quite excellent. The choice of food and drinks was quite nice and the quality of food was good. The aircraft was a 777 and the choice of entertainment onboard was okay. We thoroughly enjoyed the flight.

title: Excellent !!
review_text:
It was a great experience to fly Swiss Air after a long gap. The check-in and boarding was was very smooth. We could not enjoy the dinner as it was a late night flight and we had already eaten at club lounge. The in-flight service was very good. We had good sleep on a quite comfortable bed. The morning tea with some fruit was very refreshing.
Worth flying again !!

title: Very good +
review_text: Very nice cabin in the new Boeing 777-300ER. Very good dinner and ice cream. But the other meal was a small sandwich. The ife screen was new but it doesn‚Äôt have many movies.

title: Disappointing flight if you are looking for the friendly skies.....but organized!
review_text:
This really seemed like a bare bones flight to us. Our tour company told us to use this airlines above another competitor and we are sorry we did. There was very little legroom and I am only 5'3." It was very difficult to get comfortable on the plane. The food was pretty poor.The bathrooms did not seem to be checked regularly. The people that should have helped you feel more comfortable were very abrupt with their answers, actually cold. I did not feel that they even listened when they asked us a question. I am not one to write poor reviews but i do feel they customer service needs to be addressed. I never felt that the flight was unsafe or that the pilots did not do a very good job!

On the positive note, this was one of the most organized planes  I have ever seen. They managed to quickly get everyone boarded on also off the plane on both of our flights. I have never seen such good organization, no pushing, no conflict. They managed to get everyone ready for take off and landing. it seemed that eveyone listened as we did not see people getting out of their seats before they turned off the fasten seatbelt sign. I believe that if the took customer service more seriously, the flight experience woud be better for everyone.

title: One of the better European options.
review_text: I would definitely fly with them again.  Good food; good service.  Pleasant experience overall.  We flew four different airlines this time.  Swiss Air and Azerbaijan Airlines were definite repeat experiences.

title: Awful Customer Service!!
review_text:
We arrived at the airport in Budapest at 11:30 local time and had passed through security and were sitting at the departure gate by 11:55 local time.  We received notice from Swiss Airlines at 13:13 local time that our 14:15 local time departure had been moved to 15:10 hours.  At 13:48 we received a 2nd notice that our flight would not be departing until 15:50 hours.  (Please see emails below)
We went directly to the gate to ask the Swiss gate representative if we would still make our connecting flight to Newark.  He indicated that we woud not, but that he would book us on the same flight to Newark on July 6 leaving Zurich at 17:20 hours local time.  We asked if we would have the same or better seats on the flight leaving the 6th and he assured us that we would be very happy.  The Swiss Airlines gate attendant also assured us that once we got to Zurich, we should check in with Swiss Air personnel and they would arrange for meals and hotel accomodations.  At the end of this conversation he thanked us for being so easy to work with, and again assured us we would be very comfortable in Zurich.  Little did we know how dishonest he was and how little Swiss Airlines cares about their passangers!
When we arrived in Zurich our first stop was at the first Swiss Airlines desk we could find.  There we were told that Swiss Airlines would not be handling our rebooking documents or our overnight accomodations.  We were pointed down the hall to transfer services.  This Swiss Airlines Gate attendant did give us our first copy of our passangers bill of rights, little did we know what was POOR CUSTOMER SERVICE we were in for!
At the transfer services we found out that we had been booked by the Swiss Airlines gate attendant in Budapest to JFK airport in New York and not to Newark airport in New Jersey.  Our car was parked in Newark NJ at the airport.  Guest Service indicated that Swiss Airlines would not pay for a cab from JFK to Newark to pick up our car.  We indicated that this was not accaptable and requested we be rebooked on a flight to Newark NJ.  We spent almost THREE HOURS at transfer services, we were booked on flights that would get us to Newark NJ.  The lady at transfer services also gave us a copy of the passengers bill of rights.
The Nightmare begins‚Ä¶  Our bags were checked through to JFK so we, NOT SWISS AIRLINES STAFF had to go to baggage claim to recover our checked bags.  This took almost an hour, we were then told we needed to recheck our bags that evening since our flight to Brussels was so early.  We were told there would not be time in the morning unless we arrived at 04:00 to check our bags.  Once we retrieved our bags I asked a baggage check employee where to go to re-check the baggage, he yelled at me that it was not his job to provide directions, handed me another copy of the passengers bill of rights, and told me to find a Swiss Airlines staff member and walked away.
After we found a non Swiss Airlines person willing to give us directions we found our way to the Swiss Airlines departure area.  While checking our bags, I asked the Swiss Airlines attendant how we go about getting reimbursed for the fees we paid to pre-select our seats and for the premium coach seating we paid for, for the flight that left without us.  She indicated she had no idea and handed us yet another copy of the passengers bill of rights!  We then asked this Swiss Airlines attendant how to get to the tram to get to the hotel, she again stated she could not help us!!  We wandered around and found ourselves on the level for train service.  Lucky for us we found a gentlemen who indicated to us we were at the wrong type of train service.  We needed to be on a tram and should travel back up to the main concourse and ask for help.  We did this, found another Swiss Airlines employee who pointed in a general direction and handed us ANOTHER passengers bill of rights!!  While wandering around we found a gentlemen who walked us up two levels and out of the building and took us to the Tram station.  He stayed with us until the correct tram arrived, he WAS NOT employed by the airport, he was just a very kind person.
The next round of POOR CUSTOMER SERVICE begins!  We were given a voucher by the transfer services staff for a hotel and meal coupons for dinner and breakfast.  We were told once we had recovered and re-checked our bags we could go to the hotel for a meal and some needed sleep.  Once on the tram we found our way to the second stop only to realize we had a bit of a hike ahead of us.  I have a military disability, and her foot had been stepped on at the airport. The guest service staff never asked us if walking or climbing could be an issue for us!
We were greeted at the hotels front desk and given a terrific room, once we deposited our carry on luggage in the hotel room we headed down to the restaurant for a much needed and VERY LATE DINNER, it was almost 21:00 hours!  
In the restaurant we were told the hotel had a private group in the hotel that night and the only meal they could offer us was pasta or risotto!  Neither of us eat either food items offered, we asked to speak to the restaurant manager, who told us due to the size of the group they were feeding, these were the only two options available to us!  I then left the restaurant looking for the hotel manager, the front desk told me there was no manager on duty.
When I explained to the gentlemen at the front desk what was going on, he explained to me that the food coupon was only good for $20 in Francs each and NO drinks of any kind.  He also explained there were no meals on the menu under $20 Francs for that matter.  After much arguing we were given two side salads and water for dinner.
After our ‚Äúwonderful‚Äù dinner experience we asked about breakfast.  We were told that the restaurant did not open until 06:00.  We were offered a ‚Äúboxed‚Äù breakfast.  When we checked out at 05:30 on the 6th our ‚Äúboxed‚Äù breakfast was waiting for us.  Not only did we have to carry our luggage back to the airport we had to carry breakfast which did not include coffee because it was to early for the kitchen.  We traveled to the airport intending to eat our ‚Äúboxed‚Äù breakfast once we cleared security.  Only to find out security would not allow us to take it through.  So much for breakfast!
We feel that Swiss Airlines should compensate us for this TERRIBLE CUSTOMER SERVICE experience.  The passenger bill of rights states, ‚Äúpassengers are entitled to receive care while waiting. This includes meals and refreshments in a reasonable relation to the waiting time‚Äù‚Ä¶. We did not choose the hotel or the restaurant, Swiss Airlines chose these for us.  We should have been fed two meals each, we were not asking for lobster or filet mignon, we were asking for a meal.  Even on the flight we were offered a choice of three meals.
The passenger bill of rights goes on to state, ‚Äú You are entitled to receive compensation if you arrive at your final destination with a delay of more than 3 hours provided the delay is not attributable to extraordinary circumstances..‚Äù  When we boarded the flight from Budapest to Zurich the pilot indicated that they were late due to crowded runways, not due to ‚Äúextraordinary circumstances‚Äù.
We did not ‚Äúreceive care‚Äù as stated in the passenger bill of rights, from the Swiss Airlines staff as indicated, all we received were many copies of the passenger bill of rights.  We kept EIGHT Copies of the passenger bill of rights that were offered.  What we experienced goes beyond poor customer service, we would like to suggest that Swiss Airlines train their staff to help the customer rather than hand out the passengers bill of rights.
Swiss Air responded to this letter with:

In case of flight irregularity, SWISS of course compensate the direct costs incurred by our guests (e.g. for meals, beverages, calls). If you have incurred any direct costs, please send us the receipts of these expenses for reimbursement.
 
I understand that the rebooking you were offered was not ideal. However, alternative flights are subject to availability and agreement of cooperating partners. Please be assured, SWISS or our service partners will do everything possible to provide our guests with an excellent level of care and support.
 
You also mentioned of how poor the customer service you received from our staffs. In addition, I totally sympathize with you on the lack of care and prioritization you both received in regards to the accommodation and meals provide in which again, I apologize for this incident.
 
As an airline, we attach great importance to the fact that our valued customers receive a good quality of service at all of our check-in desks. Unfortunately, your experience gave you cause for complaint and for this we would like to offer you our unreserved apologies.
 
It goes without saying that we will pursue the points you raised with the relevant departments, so that we are in a position to prevent the particular service problems you described from recurring in the future.
 
Customer feedback, both positive and negative is a great help to us in assessing the quality of our services. Our Executive Management is also regularly briefed on the comments we receive from our customers, as well as the actions we envision to ensure that our product and services remain optimally aligned to our guests' wishes and needs.
 
We would like to assure you that our goals are to provide the best service and air transportation in the industry. We appreciate having had the benefit of your valued comments, and hope you will not be discouraged from calling on SWISS for future journeys.
 
Furthermore, please note that I have sent a request to our refunds department in regards to your seat refund.
 
Once again I am deeply sorry for the inconvenience caused. It would be our pleasure to welcome you on board again soon and to count you amongst our satisfied guests.
 
Yours sincerely,
 
Misaele V.
Consultant
Customer Feedback Services / R1S

title: Small legroom and mediocre meal
review_text: For my roundtrip to Prague, I picked Swiss Airlines especially due to their good reviews. However, I have to say that I am a bit disappointed. First of all, I had the opportunity to compare the seat legroom between United and Swiss on the long segments of the flight. Swiss Airline legroom is absolutely small, and to make matter worse, the middle seats have bars going down the middle, so you cannot stretch your feet completely. On the other hand, I flied Economy Plus on United outbound, and the legroom is at least 2x. Lastly, I thought United had terrible enough food for international flights, but little did I know that Swiss is also not much better. Our landing breakfast is only a pizza pocket. And dinner is also nothing to write home about. Overall, I think Swiss is not bad but definitely not the pack leader that I thought they were.

title: i accepted the change into my plans as requested by the organizator. they promised some compensation for this? when !?
review_text: i wish you will contact. The 150e woucher or 75 e cash would be nice - as you promised. Are you going to send me the contact or just let me know about the details of the refund !?

title: Horrible customer service - they couldn't care less
review_text: On arrival in Zurich their agent directed us to the wrong gate for our connecting flight.  We discovered her error and ran all the way to the correct gate.   Fortunately, the passenger shuttle was still there, parked just 20 feet in front of us.  Unfortunately, the gate agent (who I will not make because they told me it is illegal to do so), refused to let us on.  He gave the depart instruction while we were standing there.  Sent us to the transfer gate. They're just automatons as well.  Don't care at all about what happened.  Five hour unplanned and unnecessary layover as the start of our big trip.   Why oh why did I not take United or American?  This company is the absolute worst -- never again.

title: Economy class review
review_text:
Business class service is great of course since I'm paying premium for it. Whereas Economy is worse. 
I am of average height and normally I do not have issues on the seats but this one is too cramped so imagine how it is for western people. The cabin crew on this flight is not friendly at all. I was seated near the tail area and normally they hand refreshing towels before takeoff. The crew did this however they handed it out to only after 3 rows from the back. I do not get it, why miss the last 3 rows? While I understand that some cabin crews are not happy with their jobs but they shouldn't actually show it in their faces specially when serving meals! Although I am a frequent traveler and I am used to seeing different kind of facial expressions from the crew, at least HR could perhaps do something to encourage the staff. 
My impression is that Swiss Airlines is not up to par with Star Alliance standards. If I would rank the airlines under Star Alliance, they are at the bottom. Food is so-so even in business class. It could be different for long haul flights and I've never taken one from them since I always take Singapore Airlines but within Europe, I would rather choose a different airline if I can avoid it.

title: very good experience with Swiss airlines
review_text: Flew with family from Boston to Vienna and back from Prague to Boston in July 2019.  Excellent equipment.  Flights were on time.  Crew was very friendly and helpful.  Meals were very good.  The connection times on way back in Zurich were very tight and the airport officials were not sympathetic to our schedule and made us wait in long lines for passport  control.  Otherwise everything was very good.

title: Comfortable flight and excellent on flight service
review_text: The Airbus 330 is a comfortable aircraft and the flight attendants were helpful and friendly. The on flight snack and breakfast was optimum. A special treat included Swiss chocolates at the end of the flight. The ground staff in Mumbai was understanding of baggage service. For example if a passenger has a baggage allowance of 23 kgs as check in baggage and 8 kgs as cabin baggage and the passenger requests to checkin the cabin baggage as a matter of convenience Swiss Airways ground staff do consider your request and assist where possible. However, baggage allowances are followed stringently so expect to pay for the excess kilograms of baggage.

title: Swiss and Geneva airport
review_text: I have 40 years of international travel experience in developed and developing countries. This is the worst experience ever. Customer service is terrible at check-in and when you send feedback. Rude and abusive staff from Swissport handle the check-in for Swiss at the French sector of the airport. Swiss customer service is not capable of reading an email. Low class employees. you send a customer feedback to Swiss, If you have mobility issues, the service is so bad compared to other international airports and airlines. If you have elderly parents or relatives with a disability , spare them! It borders on harassment and discrimination. Passengers are treated like dirt.  The cabin crew and flight experience is acceptable. Overall, I have to say it is a shameful experience for Geneva and Switzerland, which otherwise is so beautiful and friendly.

title: Perfect service
review_text: Again booked in business and it was worth the money. More handbags, preferred boarding and check in if needed. Bottle of water and refreshing towel. Good meal with warm Swiss bread and soft drink, wine, beer or champagne to choose. I had a glass of red that fitted very good to the cheese and sausage ‚Äû Servelat‚Äú. Only disadvantage, there is no Lounge at city airport.

title: Swiss Air Z√ºrich
review_text: Exceptional service and kind caring travel partners. The meals and free wine etc was top notch. Plus the chocolate was exquisite

title: I had better!
review_text: First of all, the line at the check in was not organized, there was two lines facing each other, and we had to call someone to fix it. I was told that the flight is overbooked and there is a possibility that I will not able to fly that day. Their chairs were narrow and not much of legroom space. Their service was excellent.

title: LX1679 Florence to Zurich and then on to Bejing
review_text: Once again the "petite" Florence Airport... does its best to make ones flight as good as possible, got there a little early as always....., and check went like clockwork, staff  at desk, even if  in front of me the usual loud and pretentious that  expected for her 28 KG case and  14 kg trolley, and  rucksack  which she refused even to have weighed,  to flaunt regulations with what she defined as a little over the limit.?!?!  show us the best of her country's ambassadorial skills...So after this showdown, she  stormed off to complain somewhere...my turn and  the polite and helpful gentleman at check in got us through the system, and  as flight was  full, check in attendant asked if I would appreciate  hand luggage to  go as cargo, fine with me!  Short flight , legroom  as per economy, but acceptable and clean  aircraft,  cabin crew pro active, even with the  usual moaners and never happy  passengers, which being the holiday season, are out there in force! short  flight,  weather was nice so  Alps were as always breathtaking to see.  and snack coffee, and the chocolate,  makes you  understand the small but  nice details, that  one receives from Swiss. Ask for more, yes is possible, but  for  price and service offered, well  I am a happy teddy bear!

title: Friendly staff
review_text: Great flight. The staff were friendly and efficient. They looked after the kids and made sure they had things to do on the flight even though it was less than two hours. Swiss chocolate at the start of the journey is a great way to welcome us!

title: clean and comfortable with a meal on a 3 hour flight
review_text: nice airline. good service including a meal with wine on a mid day flight.  Would fly them again.  On time too!

title: Wow!
review_text: The service was out of this world. I felt like a queen. The food served on the plane was esquisite, they do not use plastic utensels. They had vast movies to watch on the plane. The flight was a great experience.

title: Business aisle seats are a little narrow
review_text:
The seats are a little narrow when you're lying down. Perhaps narrow isn't the best word but it is seat design perhaps. My only complaint is that when I am asleep my arm ends up in the aisle. I couldn't sleep well because I was constantly worried about getting accidentally injured.

If the seats didn't have open space under the arm rest, kind of like the pods on United and United Polaris, this would not have been an issue. It is more of a seat design matter and my preference rather than anything else.

I think the food and the airline otherwise are fabulous. Great service in business. This seat issue is something I've observed with the A380 seats in business on Lufthansa as well.

title: Superb flight experience, but off-flight service can be improved
review_text:
We started our trip from MXP to BKK via ZRH. The flight from MXP took off with a delay of more than 1.5 hours, which made us not only miss visiting the First Class Lounge in Zurich, but worse made us lose our luggage as it did not make the same flight - more to that later.
The inflight experience from ZRH to BKK was spectacular. Very personalised service, excellent food and very comfortable and clean seat spaces. Chapeau to this.
As already mentioned, our luggage did not make the connection and was resent to Singapore, with the effect that while we were up in the air, the luggage had already been redirected. Independent of my booking class, I can expect any sort of information about the whereabouts of my luggage, this did not happen.
In total we received the luggage more than 36 hours after our arrival. My complaint to Swiss had been rejected argueing that the luggage got stuck in BKK (it is worth to mention that our final destination was Phuket and luggage was checked through to HKT). Anyway, the luggage had never seen BKK from the interior nor exterior. I feel that Swiss Service was trying to blame others instead of taking over responsibility. Only after I wrote them again showing them pictures of the luggage tag, the Service department had to admit to their error. At least, I got a recompensation - however, the damage was done by not informing properly and keeping us for almost two days without knowing when to obtain the luggage. 
Our flight was in Business Class - here applies the same: great service and excellent food.
For the flight experience, I can only recommend. The service level outside the plane needs to be improved!

title: Impossible to submit comments to Swissair
review_text:
I travel quite frequently, more than 10 trips by flight a year, mostly in Europe. KLM, Lufthansa and Swissair have been my favorites. I have not noticed much difference of them until this year. In the beginning of March, I was on a trip to Namibia with Swissair but affected by irregularity. The trip was not pleaseant. On the 15th of March, I issued a complaint to Swissair via Swissair's home page and claimed the compensation I am entitled to. After the submission of my complaint, I received a message on the screen, "Acknowledgement of receipt. Thank you for your message. You will be receiving a reply from us as soon as possible ‚Ä¶". I saved a screen dump of this confirmation. 

However, days passed by and I received no response. About 10 days later, I called a support telephone found on Swissair's home page. There, I was told to send a mail to info.us@swiss.com. Following the advice, I did send a mail to info.us@swiss.com and I also received answers. The person who replied me told me that they are not working with public relations. However, if I supply them with my case number, they can have a look of my case anywhere. The problem is that I never received any case number. I sent the screen dump I saved but that did not help. I asked for the mail address to the right persons who are working with public relations but I did not receive any answer to this. Therefore, I came to an end there without being able to go further. Now, 4 months have passed. Still, no response from Swissair. At this moment, I do have good reasons to complain, but there is no way to get into contact with Swissair.

On the contrary, I also affected by an irregularity during a flight with KLM this May. I submitted a complaint to KLM via KLM's home page. Within 2 days, KLM responded to my complaint and the issue was solved very quick. A few years ago, I also affected by an irregularity with a Lufthansa flight. Also there, Lufthansa provided me a rapid and satisfactory solution.

title: Clean and comfortable
review_text: A bit expensive for a short flight but seats are clean (leather like, no dirty fabrics) and the whole experience from checking in to landing was smooth.

title: The worst airline ever!
review_text:
I took this airline in short and long haul flights and won't recommend this airline.
I have experiences with many other airlines, European, American, Asian. This one is the worst.

1. The worst customer service: 
-didn't help with questions via phone. She even raised her tone.
- The worst one: at check in counter, the staff refused to take off my passport's plastic without reason and asked me to do that. When I refused, she took off the plastic and said that she cancelled my flight because of this incident. I then asked another officer and she defended herself to her. The other officer helped me to check in in anpther counter. They didn't apologize. She lied by saying cancel my flight, there is no right to cancel my flight and her attitude was bad. No control from management. Very poor customer service and no help.
2. In my experience, the flights was always delayed by at least an hour, where at least 20 minutes delayed was inside the cabin.
3. Food was so poor, only sorbet to Z√ºrich.
4. For long haul flight, the entertainment was bad.
5. My baggage was scratched when I got it back. Really bad handling.
6. Bad handling on turbulence. Really scary.
7. Overpriced for their bad service.

Tips: avoid this airline.

title: Zurich to New York
review_text: A very good flight with a good aircraft-Airbus 330- and a friendly crew. All in all a good experience. I would fly again and I strongly recommend!

title: Left my checked-in luggage behind at Zurich airport!!
review_text: While flying from Newark, NJ to Zurich, Switzerland via United which got delayed from NJ and onward to Mumbai, India via Swiss Air on June 11, this airline left my checked in bag at Zurich airport, even though we all passengers (some 20-odd people on the United flight) could make it to our connecting flight to Mumbai! What was worse later was that it took almost 48 hours for my luggage to arrive in Mumbai and be delivered to me at my address in Mumbai! Further, the customer service personnel in Mumbai were horrible; they promised early delivery but could not keep their word. I was almost about to miss my connecting flight from Mumbai to Kolkata because of non-delivery of my checked-in bag! United/Swiss Air allows only 1 checked-in bag and that they cannot bring it on time! How is a passenger expected to survive upon reaching the destination without checked-in bag? No monetary compensation was provided for the delayed luggage arrival/delivery! I do NOT recommend this airline at all!

title: What a disappointment
review_text:
When my travel agent booked us on Swiss air from Greece to sa, I was trilled. My 1st time on a great airline and I was expecting it all. 
What a disappointment!  The infotainment system is ancient and took an hour to start up,  then the controls would not accept the command and I could not select the move to play. After much frustration the captain announces there is a problem and he needs to restart the entire system. 30min later it starts.....this is not world class, it‚Äôs an irratitation. 

Touch screen.....they think not. You need to use a remote....but wait 1 st you need to watch the training video on how to use the remote...uuurgh!

While waiting I needed to charge my phone......oh no you can‚Äôt as there is no usb cable to do so......how ancient is that. 

We normally fly Emirates and in comparison swiss feels like a low cost airline. What a disappointment.

title: Swiss below average business class seats.
review_text:
First leg Rome to Zurich 50minutes late and just made Z√ºrich to Hong Kong Flight. No assistance received to get to terminal and had to run with wife for 10 minutes to board.
Swiss business class seats on this flight were the worst I have even seen ( and I have travelled China Southern) very boxy and cramped. 
Amenity Kit contains basics with no ‚Äúbranded‚Äù goodies ( I used toothbrush and left everything else onboard when I departed)
Food served basically suburban restaurant quality
Cabin crew efficient but lacked warmth
 I flew Syd-Amsterdam and Rome-Syd this was code shared with Cathay and was cheapest flight I could find by far, and very economical
The Cathay flight to Sydney was far superior to Swiss.
You get what you pay for

title: Err in baggage charge - poor customer service
review_text: Charge baggage fees already covered in original ticket price.  First received phone call from Customer Service at 4:30am(my time) saying refund approved.  Next day received email saying no refund due.  Sent more proof; Customer Service again responded stated yet a different reason no refund due.  Sent more proof; yet more email with different reasons.  Deceptive online web check-in and VERY POOR CUSTOMER SERVICE>

title: Terrible
review_text: Worth airlines I have ever been, I lost my luggage for a week , they ruined my first week of my vacation, my luggage came back after a week, damaged and the plain is so dirty and disgusting . I don‚Äôt recommend this airlines and I promised I will never use it again

title: Perfect trip
review_text: Comfortable and very clean plane with an excellent team  . Special meal was tasty.  It was on time.  My only complaint when traveling is when serving meals why is it that you are asked to straighten your seat..Why? especially when sleeping or trying to.  happens wilh all airlines. this is frustrating when traveling on long haul flights over 8 hours

title: Professional cabin crew
review_text: The cabin crew is very professional and the flight was very enjoyable.  I would the seating to be a little more comfortable and spacious.  The flight was full but it didn't matter. I just feel more spacious.

title: Flying with a dog
review_text:
I was flying with the family dog and the ground were friendly and helpful as was the cabin crew. The flight was on time and the meal was ok (the first time I've tried an ok food in a flight) and my dog that travelled in cargo arrived well and appearing to have had a good flight.
The only bad thing is that until this day (45 days after the flight) I still wasn't reimbursed for the ticket I paid for my dog to fly in the cabin.

title: Great staff customer service, online service below average
review_text:
The Swiss webpage and app had intermittent problems and not great to navigate. It wouldn‚Äôt let me online check in on the way back, but the ground staff were very friendly and helpful when I arrived at the airport. The flight out there went smoothly, but the return leg was delayed due to the inbound flight. 
Food and beverages are all complementary and the staff and very friendly and helpful. 
It‚Äôs an expensive airline to travel with but their planes are very comfortable and you are paying for the extra comfort and service. 
Would recommend flying with this airline again. Especially if I was flying for business reasons.

title: LAX Zurich Business
review_text: When first reviewing  the flight to decide whether to book it, we noted the business class seats look smaller/narrower than those of competitors (American, Air Canada, Emirates). That is true. It's not a pod configuration. HOWEVER, the seats are very fine. They have massage option and can also be individualized to make them firmer or softer. Food was wonderful. We had the steak and pasta option. Salad was fresh. Service was attentive. Bathrooms were kept very very clean throughout the flight. In flight movies had great selection. Do keep in mind that if you choose seats that are by the windows, I noticed that the window person would need to climb over you (in aisle) if they want to leave. I sat with my companion so there was no problem. If you are traveling solo, pick the seats in the middle of the plane; that way, no one has to climb over you. One of my companions also got the throne seat without paying extra for it and yes, it did look like a throne. Basically she had the ONE seat in front of ours (where we were, we had two seats for the same size space). Her seat isn't bigger; it's just she has more space for storage. Very pleased overall with Swiss Air

title: Great Airline
review_text: Swiss Air was a delight for my 2 long flights, the food was good, the flight attendants were very accommodating and friendly, and the best part of it was the entertainment! There was such a wide variety of movies and shows to watch, I didn't have time to watch everything I wanted!

title: Good flight
review_text:
Stick to timetable
Friendly service
Must improve in entetairnment and food.
The food was too minimalistic and there was no movie

title: Travel in style!!
review_text:
A very comfortable trip with all amenities.  Lovely staff who address you by name.
Flight departed on time, seated and attended to in a reasonable time.  Good quality meals and choice of wines.

title: Are we there Yet?
review_text: Another pedestrian airline that was good in everything they needed to be.  Service, checkin, ease of process was all good.  Seats are typically cramped (no better or worse that most I've flown).  We were on a trans Atlantic flight (a long one), so if you need extra legroom, upgrade to a higher class or try to get an aisle seat.  The in-flight entertainment helped the flight time seem bearable.  There was a dinner and snacks served, so we didn't starve (probably a good thing).  We were late leaving (were told a "bird" had crashed into a wing and they were checking the wing for possible damage.  Must have been quite the bird!).  Seems like there is always something delaying flights these days.  I guess they super glued everything together as we finally got into the air and landed about ten hours later without losing a wing.

title: Great flight crews, terrible ground staff
review_text:
Let me start with the positive:

All six cabin and flight crews were absolutely excellent. The service and the catering first class.
The captain came into the cabin on two of the flights explaining the reason for the delay being due to air traffic limitations.

Now the reason for my low rating:

My bag did not arrive at London City on June 29. This has happened to me before so I was not overly fussed about it.
I saw in the pir that the bag was due to arrive at LCY on the same plane I was taking back to Zurich July 1.
The ground staff promised to intercept the bag and tag it to BCN.
I received a phone call the next day July 2 from LCY informing me that they had the bag and would send it to BCN that evening.
I furthermore received an email from Swiss baggage handling in Bern on July 4 stating the bag was at BCN and that I should already have received it.
I then received another call from LCY on July 6 telling me the bag was returned to them from Zurich!
They also promised to put it on the flight to Zurich later that day.
Still nothing. I then contacted Swiss again and after several contacts where they said it was not their problem, but it was up to the baggage handling company, they finally contacted LCY.
The bag was then allegedly sent to BCN on July 9, arriving at 14:44.
It is now July 11 at 21:12 and still no bag and no response from Swiss.

title: Excellent food regardless of ticket type
review_text: The staff is very pleasant, seats and entertainment perfectly fine, but their food surpasses that given on Canadian and American airlines.  There are standards for edible food and Swiss Air sticks to them.  It is nice not to have to find food in the airport to bring along for later.  You can count on Swiss and Lufthansa to make an effort for their passengers.

title: short connection time
review_text:
everything in flight was great.
problem was connection times were very short.
fly from Naples to Zurich then Zurich to Vancouver.
it was a short connection time between flights to begin with - and unfortunately we departed Naples 35 mins late - making connection almost impossible.
flight crew said connecting in Zurich was very easy - get off flight and walk to departure gate.
in fact had to take shuttle bus from tarmac into 1st terminal (bad)
then one in terminal 1 run like crazy to only then find out we had to go through passport control as we were now leaving the EU.
to be honest we had to cut this 40 minute line up - pissing off other travellers (rightfully so!)
then run like crazy down escalators to DOH! a frigging tram to take us to terminal 3!
Obviously Swiss Air crew knew that you couldn't just walk from one gate to the next.
Also, they held the flight for us (nice) but we NEVER would have made it if we didn't cut line and run like maniacs!

title: Low cost service with a flag on the tail
review_text: Completely full flight, very cramped and typical low-cost airline service - no eyeshades, no socks etc. Pretty dire food and limited drinks. At least the flight was on time, but nothing to write home about - maybe the Gulf airlines have spoiled me - even the business class didn't look specifically enticing. Zurich is a user friendly airport and my final destination so logical choice, but not a quality experience.

title: very good flights
review_text: we booked the flight in a very good price few months before the flight date. the flights were on time, good service and in the way to Zurich we even got exit seats for free!!

title: Never Fly Swiss Air
review_text:
Two weeks ago i flew Swiss Air to Zurich.  I usually fly United but to Zurich you fly their Star Alliance partner Swiss Air.  I thought that would be fine but it was not.  Usually I fly Economy Plus to get a little extra leg room but Swiss Air does not have that class (at least not on this aircraft.  The seats are cramped and god forbid if the person in front of you reclines their seat.  The cabin was warm, it never cooled down and the type of aircraft used did not have individual blowers to allow you to adjust the temp or air.  So now you are cramped and hot.  Next I had an aisle seat and on most aircraft the aisle arm rests swing up so you can swing your legs into the aisle and stand up.  But not on Swiss Air or not on this Airbus.  So in the middle of the night when I needed to go to the washroom I had to wake the gentlemen in front of me up so he could sit up and allow me to get out of my set.    

Also I want to comment on the flight crew, over all they were a business like efficient team, but they all seemed like they hated their jobs.  Never smiled, talked little other than the perfunctory questions, chicken or pasta, water or coffee, etc.

Not a good experience,  I would not fly Swiss Air again unless I exhausted all other avenues first.

title: Well worth it
review_text:
We had flown Air Lingus from Dublin to Venice but decided that, as we would be travelling back from Zurich, Switzerland that we would take advantage of the cheaper and greater checked-in luggage allowance offered by Swissair, in anticipation of buying bits and bobs during our holiday.
We were not sorry.
I would like to compliment Zurich airport on its very clear announcements for a start. Dublin, please learn.
The plane felt spaceous, comfortable and, of course, was very efficient.
We were especially impressed by the provision of a light lunch of a beautiful quiche with a choice of beverage all within the price, which was so much quicker and better than Air Lingus ( and others‚Äô) method of choices and fiddling about with change or fetching something which is not on the trolly so that the aisle is blocked for an interminable time with people crossing their legs wanting to use the toilet!
Speaking of which- they were also splendid!
Excellent altogether.

title: On time flight in the early morning.
review_text: I always like to travel with this Company and I have had very few bad experiences. I think it is no need serving food on a short flights.

title: On time flight
review_text: Zurich is a nice Airport, on time flight, friendliness of eco cabin crew was poor, service very slow and chaotic., not the case on return flight were cabin crew eco service was excellent and extremely friendly and attentfull.

title: Flew Los Angeles- Zurich- Paris
review_text:
Took a flight LAX-Zurich-Paris (CDG) on Swiss July 7, arriving Paris July 8. 
Luggage lost in Zurich, terrible customer service at CDG airport, had to go back to the airport to claim my luggage while Swiss said they would deliver it. Finally got my luggage on July 10. No apollogies from Swiss staff at CDG. On top of that my luggage is ruined: holes in it, maybe dog bites as well, cannot use it anymore.

For a "name" like Swiss one would expect better. Last time for me. 

Bernard

title: Best economy flight from Europe
review_text:
I would highly recommend swiss airlines to all friends. One of the best flights i had and the food served was really good.
Drinks are served frequently and unlimitedly.
Would love to fly more with swiss airlines.

title: Great services great food
review_text:
Loved the services and even more was surprised by the quality of the food served, we are far from a bag of pretzel.
I would recommend choosing swiss air, booked directly with them since the price difference was not very great.

title: Short trip from Zurich to Prague
review_text: The travel time between Zurich to Prague was approximately an hour and 10 min. The flight attendants in the business cabin were kind and looked after me well during the flight.

title: SWISSAIR TRAVEL
review_text: The airline crew for business class were courteous and helpful. They looked after me well. they kept my coat carefully.

title: Trip to Brussels
review_text:
The flight over was terrible. I had a middle seat and i could have paid the extortion fee of $35, got an aisle seat.  But didnt think it would be that bad.  My son sat on one side of me in the middle seat, a women sat next to me in the aisle seat.  Some of the seats seemed to be broken and leaning way back so close you couldn't even watch the screen in front of you, for movies or shows.
The plane was very warm, I do fly allot and it was warmer than normal. 
We had a change over in Zurich which was delay 1 hour do to heavy traffic in Brussels.  That flight was on an older plane but was fine, i had an aisle seat on this flight.
On the way back we were delayed out of Brussels missing our connecting flight in Zurich.  We did buffer a day to relax before getting back to work. Swiss air did put us up at a nice hotel which was a 20 minute train ride, paid by swiss air, to the Hotel.
Swiss air gave us $20 eu for dinner, not really enough, but it was ok.
Flight home was on a new airbus, I was on the aisle  this time :) and they sat my family in one row which was nice. we had plenty of room and the flight was on time and enjoyable, hence why i gave this three stars.

title: Pleasent business flight in ERJ-190
review_text:
This flight started With bus boarding in Zurich. The boarding was efficient. The Aircraft was an Embraer ERJ-190, With an 2 + 2 configuration. Busniessclass has Nice leather seats, With good seat Comfort.
The flight attendant was very attenativ and pleasent, and looked very well after the passengers during the flight. The meal service was good, and we were served a lot of delicious Swiss chocolates. 
There is no inflight Entertainment systems or WIFI on these Aircrafts.
The cabin came off as fresh and clean.
The flight was just as pleasent and comfortable as you can expect from Swiss. 
I do recommend this airline.

title: Very good
review_text: Very good service, it was a fligh bought with Lufthansa and the return was with Swiss. It was a very good experience.

title: Flight to Montreux Jazz Festival
review_text: Everything was good especially when you book the pair of seats on the port side! Better legroom than most. But unfortunately food and drink is extra contrary to KLM for example.

title: Is cheap, but you know why it is when you get onboard!
review_text:
I know if I pay 1.700‚Ç¨ round trip Madrid to Bangkok Business Class, I can not get Gold in Bars, but the Seat and service I get from this flight it was So Bad.
Firts of all the seat are not at all big if you compared with others Air Lines Business Class, I can understand Swiss made small seats to fit more costumers and give better rate.
Food, are ok.
Staff... well, because I am a young person and I normally do not use Suits or Tie, they didnt really take care lf me. They was more interested in talk with others or pay attention to anything ells than bring me the wather I ask 3 times, or help me with TV asking them others 3 times.
I dont know but, not good as I was thinking.

title: Great flight!
review_text: Will always look out for Swiss when flying as their service is impeccable and the team make you feel very special! Love the choc treats.

title: Would highly recommend
review_text: If you ever have the opportunity of travelling with this airline you will not be disappointed! I never thought I would find another airline as good as Emirates but Swiss Airline ticked all the boxes! Plenty of leg room, comfortable and exceptionally clean space, professional and friendly service by cabin crew and light snack (cheese or beef roll) with a choice of hot or cold drink was all included. Take off and landing was near perfect. It‚Äôs one of those .... would I choose anyone else? No .... 10/10 - booking on line was easy!

title: Comfort in the air
review_text: First time flying Swiss Air and I would do it again. Leg room and comfortable seats. Very attentive stewards. Food was delicious, drinks plentiful. On board entertainment was excellent.

title: First Class (even in "Economy"
review_text: A most pleasant experience.  The staff were very welcoming and polite.  The flight itself was faultless.  A light snack was served (no expense) and of course chocolates.

title: Swiss quality
review_text:
I traveled with Swiss many times and always found their service very good.  The flight are usually on schedule and the onboard service is excellent.  I really appreciate that they offer a small bar of Swiss chocolate with each flight, it's a local product and a mark of distinction.  Being a normal weight I found their sits comfortable.
The food is also decent (you can't expect a restaurant on a flight right?), there is always a piece of Swiss cheese.

title: Easy with teens
review_text:
I send my 15y son alone and everything went well..they are nice and approachable.
The food is the only negative thing but not a long distance so not really a problem. Its tasteful but always really similar and cold, also really small portions and not possible to buy anything on board.

title: Authentic Experience
review_text:
