Swiss offers their guests in July and August a great variety of Swiss cuisine and wines from the canton of Vaud with a special attention to the FDV ( Fete de Vigneron 2019. 
Try the Chasselas and lay back in your very comfortable seat.  
The service is really excellent and makes your journey unforgettable. 
Happy landing with Swiss

title: Quality Quality Quality
review_text: When you think about Swiss you think, quality, service and timing, and on this airline you get all of it and more. A great Crew ready to serve with a smile, good meals, on time departures  clean aircraft and easy connections in Zurich, ( I really don't know how they do it) 55 minute connection and never failed. With a choice I will always choose to fly Swiss.

title: Business trip
review_text:
Seat was malfunctioning, could not sleep. Food was not exciting.
Service was very professional. Entertainment system including the content outdated. General comfort and timeliness of flight in both directions good. 
Flight connection with Johannesburg is very good for a business trip because it's an overnight flight in both directions that doesn't disturb working hours.

title: pleasant flight
review_text: A pleasant flight  Could have enjoyed it more with more legroom.Food was average .Staff were obliging

title: Good decent flight. But was late and I missed interconnecting flight...
review_text:
I flew Swiss air recently for the first time and was pleased with the aircraft layout and overall service. The flight was delayed at Delhi which ensured that we boarded almost 1.5 hours late (around 2:30-3am). Since it was past mid-night it was inconvenient. The delay caused us to miss our connecting flight at Zurich and we were accommodated in a later flight leading us to reach Barcelona at 4:00 pm (rather than 8:45 am). So the whole day got wasted.
The in-fight crew made sure we were looked after well. The only thing I found missing on the flight was good entertainment system. Qatar or Emirates or even Air India for that matter has far better in-flight entertainment options. The limited option made sure that I didn't have anything left to watch on my flight  back to Delhi.

title: Was a long but relaxing flight
review_text: Was a flight that lasted over 32 hours + layover at the Kloten Intl. Airport in Switzerland.Was travelling with my 2 kids (12) and (5). Easy for me since there was much excitement about the whole trip.

title: Couldn't fault them!
review_text: Great flight times, great prices, couple of free hot or soft drinks each way, free breakfast croissant on the outbound flight and free sandwich on the return flight, screens to monitor the journey progress, lovely staff, a couple of free Swiss chocolates each and the seats were more comfortable than other airlines. Great communication too.

title: Business class - not the greatest
review_text: The business class seats were smaller than most business class flights on other airlines. The flight to Z√ºrich were regular seats and they just did not put someone in the middle seat. The long haul had the same smaller seats but they did lay flat.  For triple the price from economy, the value we have experienced on other airlines just was not there on the Swiss Air flights

title: pleasant experience
review_text: Flew from Palermo to Zurich then to Boston. The flight was delayed at take off so we landed late. After a nightmare trip with Lufthansa we were concerned about missing our connecting flight. The flight attendant kept us informed and Swiss Air provided monitor assistance while in flight. We were guided to the proper gate as many were rushing to catch connecting flights. Passport control in Zurich was helpful and we made our connecting flight. The employees at Swiss Air were polite, considerate and helpful.

title: Excellent
review_text:
As with a lot of internal European airlines, again Swiss Airlines are top of the class.

Very clean, good meals, excellent in flight service and entertainment. Staff are wonderful.

Comfortable seating was a bonus.

Would highly recommend this airline for anywhere in Europe.

title: Nice direct flight
review_text:
Good schedule out of Moscow, to be back in Geneva early enough to enjoy the rest of the Sunday afternoon
Friendly crew, service up to par with Swiss standards
The snack served could be more varied and elaborated

title: Bad
review_text:
Our lugage got lost but that was just the cheery on the cake. 
Mediocre flight convenience, bad food . Ordered vegetarian but didn't get it - they forgot Unfriendly flight attendants .
After our luggage didn't arrive we did not get any help and until today , eight days after the incident no one has apologized or even reacted to a complaint I filled .
Do your self a favor and pick anther air line .

title: Excellent seat made for great comfort
review_text:
Great comfort for a tall person. On time departure, good service, Nice hot snack.
And, for course, a bar of Swiss chocolate.

title: Truly a level above the common airlines!
review_text: Excellent airline! Offered the most comfortable arrangements for economy that ive had the pleasure of using in the past 10 years. Food was great and i wasnt cramped in my seat on an international flight like i have been on so many other! Truly recommend them above KLM, Delta, United, and AirFrance.

title: Great service
review_text: I always prefer to fly with anyone that isn't Ryanair and Swiss is always worth the extra money. It's great they fly directly from Cork as well because there are less direct flights out of here. Way to go.

title: very good flight
review_text:
we were surprised  with the service that we have with this air line company.
very friendly everywhere: on the ground and the hostess in the plane

title: Flyer Beware
review_text: My wife and I flew from NY JFK to Geneva with two checked suitcases and one carry-  on, on an A330-300 Airbus.  When returning to NY from Zurich on Swiss Airlines on another A330-300 Airbus we had the same luggage. After checking the two suitcases we were told we would have to check our carry-on because it was "too big."  No measurements were made. An arbitrary decision.  We explained there was no problem flying to Switzerland to no avail. We felt we were being held hostage.  We paid the $99.92 ransome so as not to miss our flight. We filed a claim with Swiss Airlines and was denied. Our credit card company is now handling our dispute.

title: Others are clearly better
review_text:
Trip was a code share with the Swiss travel from Singapore to Bordeaux and on the return trip to Hong Kong.
Seating on long haul sectors was poor as was the food with too many seats crammed into the area and to cap it off on the leg from Bordeaux to Hong Kong one of our suitcases was "lost".
This case had 3 ID tags which all disappeared in transit from Bordeaux.
It took several days to "find" and deliver the case which had been opened and to buy essentials in the intervening period we subsequently faced a grilling by Swiss staff requiring receipts for even disposable razors despite the set compensation being advised and confirmed at Hong Kong airport.
Needless to say we were less than impressed with Swiss but the other code shares with Quantas and Singapore Air were great in comparison.

title: always the same experience:EXCELLENT
review_text:
I fly as often as possible with this company.They are always excellent. 
I mean ground and flight crew are sooo efficient and nice.Seats are great.Food is tasty in spite of being in an aircraft.just a pleasure flying with them,be short haul,long haul,always the same quality.

title: Nothing special
review_text: If you are travelling to another country airlines should not be trying to gouge you extra for a suitcase. Swiss does this and it really annoys me as tickets are not cheap and paying more just to take your clothes with you is too much.

title: Comfortable Flight, Movies, Good Meals and More
review_text:
Flew Swiss Air NYC to Zurich and then on to Tel Aviv.  
Overall a pleasant experience.   Comfortable seats.  Very Good Meals.  Received Dinner and Breakfast in the Morning before  landing in Zurich.   
Hot Cloth hand towels for clean up after dinner.  Would definitely fly again.

title: Unfriendly staff
review_text: We were, not the first time, disappointed of the service and the space in the Business Class of Swiss. The Flight attendants were bad tempered and not interested in working. With simultaneous consideration of too small seats for long men, the Flight was much too expensive for the return.

title: Flight zurich-valencia (spain) - zurich
review_text: Good flight, on time for the flight to Valencia. Reurn flight to Zurich 1 1/4 hours delayed. Friendly crew. Good inflight information on screen.

title: We had a great time flighing from Zurich to Naples - just wonderful! Great service, fine dishes and great wines.
review_text: We had a great time and the service is very special and unique. We like the special care and the attentiveness at all times. Thank you SWISS üá®üá≠

title: Swiss Air is the best
review_text: Swiss Air is hands down the best. The flight was comfortable and timely, and the whole staff was great. If you have the opportunity to fly with Swiss, do it.

title: I wish I could use them for every trip
review_text: The service that Swiss Air gives is second to none. Everything about the flight was enjoyable, from finding that our boarding cards were automatically generated and sent to us, to recieving little Swiss chocolates on the plane. Thoroughly good service and for a price that was more than affordable.

title: Excellent food and service, BUT very tight seat arrangements in comparison to United / USA standards
review_text: Excellent food and service os SWISS, BUT very tight seat arrangements in comparison to United / USA standards. We have flown out of Newark to Brussels on a United 787 dreamliner and it was excellent, but on the way back, via Zurich, the SWISS flight was very tight seating. The food was much better on the Swiss flight though.

title: Never Again
review_text: This must be the worst airline for customer service. In Rome, 4 of us checked in at 5:30 pm for a 8pm  connecting flight to Johannesburg via Zurich. Whilst waiting at the airport an sms from Swiss arrived that said 2 of us had been bumped to Qatar airways and the other 2 to Alitalia. We then asked the customer service desk to put us on one airline we wanted to travel together. After waiting for an hour they said they could not help us . My 2 kids then proceeded to check in at Alitalia and were told the flight was fully booked and could not be accommodated. My wife and I proceeded to Qatar Airways and to our surprised our tickets had been downgraded  to economy as per Swiss Airline instruction. We were now in a dilemna and we went to the Swiss check in counter but it was closed and no one to help us. We then went back to Qatar counter and the only way to travel was to buy my kids very expensive tickets. I must say  Qatar Airlines was very helpful and courteous . They even upgraded the Swiss economy tickets that had been downgraded to Business. To our surprise when we boarded the Qatar airplane, there were about 20 vacant economy seats that could have been allocated to my kids when we requested Swiss to do so. Hows that for customer service. I sent Swiss an email whilst I was at the airport complaining about this , i havent had a word from them. Never again, i checked some postings on this site and I have realised that this is not new, it just a badly run airline

title: Rubbish.....Again
review_text:
Set off at 03.45 to get to Heathrow for our flight to Zurich. All well according to the flight info. Entered the airport to discover the flight was cancelled. No Swiss air staff on duty, No Swiss air staff on the information desk. Discovered by accident we had been put on a Austrian airways flight to Vienna, connecting to Zurich (it didn't happen)
Basically left to fend for ourselves. Swiss Air could not give a dam. Flight 19th June.

title: Clean
review_text: The aircraft was clean . Broken ear phone plug socket on both flights . Staff were unfriendly and unhelpful . Food was terrible. Dry hard buns were served at all meals . The staff kept trying to reset my video player as it didn't work

title: Excel in Disappointing!
review_text:
Overbooked flight with poor service to support getting it sorted. Why I booked with them I don‚Äôt know, as in just 12mnthe Swissair has left me stranded in South Africa, Barcelona and Amsterdam. I was rewarded a chf100 voucher to compensate, but sadly it is not accepted at any of the bookings I have made since. 
I fly Swiss cause it gives me the best direct connections and are competitively priced, but I am at the point where I am considering paying more rather than putting up with all of this!! 
One thing that is true is that their air staff are all really kind and friendly. But that only helps if you actually get to take off!!

title: First class service in economy
review_text: 10:00 am flight out of Zurich on 6 June; the flight steward was the perfect professional as well as friendly and efficient. He made the flight relaxing and enjoyable.

title: More passenger friendly than most
review_text: This trip had a layover in Zurich in the early morning hours. Zurich airport is not particularly passenger friendly but Swiss Air is. Food was good and heated. Flight attendants friendly. Economy seats crowded but all airlines are.

title: Great airline great service
review_text: This is the second time I have flown with Swiss Air from Canada to Norway and both times had an excellent experience. I would recommend this airline anytime.

title: Classy flight
review_text: Enconmy plus...nice confortable seats ,not too crowded .good food, good wine and excellent service ..

title: Business worked well
review_text: Delivered  the expectation. Seats 180 and good services. Clubs at airport worked well  as well the flights pontuality in both flights

title: Good. But laaaaate......
review_text: The service aboard on Swiss is fine. However, the flight was 3 Hours late. In effect 2:58 minutes, so that the legal limit for some refund was not given. Nevertheless would I expect something from the part of the Airline, be it only some voucher to get some drink. They do have the e-Mails and could easily do it. We were informed of the delay, however at that point we were already on the way to the Airport and since no roaming available, we only got to know at the Airport.

title: Terrific Flight
review_text: Great Flight. We flew economy. Seats for economy were comfortable, the food was good, and the service was excellent. We left on time, arrived on time, there was no turbulence and the pilot made a perfect landing. A perfect 10 out of 10 score.

title: clean and efficient
review_text:
on board entertainment was very good - a lot of variety.
food & snacks were okay.
service was efficient.

title: Horrible experience
review_text: In this flight happened an unique experience. After the door was closed, a man with not boarding pass and not passaport, was inside the plane. The stewardese didn¬¥t know how to handle the passenger the obviously was a mad man. How broke the control, we don¬¥t know. We stayed like an hour inside the plane, and the crew dealing with the bizarre man. After he went out, start a seach in the baggage. Resulted, we arrived Barajas after midnight. So I must to stay in the airport for my plane early morning to Miami. Only remarkable, the chocolate. My luggage  was recovered two weeks and because I decided to go to the airport in DR.

title: Incredible service
review_text: Service from all the staff on both legs of our journey were terrific. Food was very good, even accommodated gluten-free for my wife.  Business class is worth it + you can go to the Swiss Business Lounge in the airport too.

title: Wow, they cared
review_text:
Lots less turbulence, had a pillow and blanket, excellent meals and wine. Full service!
100% better than the Alaska flight we took from PDX toJFK!. Had in flight assist at airports.

title: Very punctual and stress free
review_text: I use this airline quite often and am always impressed with their check in as I often have them print my boarding card. The service in flight is always good and they are very generous with handing out chocolates

title: On time and with good service
review_text: The flight was fully booked but the plane left almost on time cause the ground crew did a good job organizing all travelers. The service on board was great, the food was good and the entertainment Programm very up to date.

title: Good Flight
review_text:
Really good company! It was a good flight, one of the best that I took.
I forgot to say that I'm alergic to nuts, and the dessert was made with almonds, I said that to the crew and the came with 4 differents kind of sweets for me. The food is good! They give cheese and chocolate in every flight!

title: Surprising treats for economy passengers
review_text: Nice and professional airline with a few treats for economy passengers also. It was a very pleasant surprise. Not only snacks and beverages, but also swiss chocolates! Much appreciated

title: Great service, excellent airplane
review_text: We traveled from Madrid to Zurich in Swiss Air.  There was a computer malfunction so our fly was delayed more than an hour.  When we arrived to Zurich they hold our flight so we did not miss it.  There was an employee waiting for us and since we were going to Miami, they unloaded our luggage and put it in a van that was waiting for us.  We left the plane before everybody else, and we were sent thru customs in a preferential status.  Never in my life  I have seen such service from an airline.  Needless to say the food and the service in our transatlantic flight was espectacular.  The food, the attention and the plane itself were impeccable.  I will flight with Swiss Air every time that I can.

title: Business trip to Germany
review_text: Perfect flight, on time, short and efficient boarding despite most people traveling with hand luggage, sandwiches & Swiss beer

title: All perfect !
review_text: Just all perfect ! Swiss food - Swiss Service ! Swiss precision and time-schedule, Swiss Respect and professionalism ... I love to fly with SWISS !!

title: 777 sardines
review_text:
Although this airline enjoys a world class spot and as one of major market operator, I did not like its seat configuration of 3+4+3 which makes traveller's journey very cumbersome and uncomfortable. To endure more than 10-hour flight under this condition is not something I would recommend to anyone. Plus this was a B777 ER which means lots of lots of sardines in one can.
The flight was spot on time, the main meal (dinner) was excellent and delicious, followed by snack and breakfast. All these were served with very courteous and friendly manner.
I did not like the check-in time spent on queue, and this was due to one queue for three airlines. I hate to pay for advanced seat booking and Swiss does not come cheap.

title: Swiss Air = Excellent Airline
review_text: Flew the lowest price available On time great service decent space good enough food . Layover in Zurich - the terminal is modern efficient and very handsome . Nice restaurants . All over an A+ experience.

title: Disappointing
review_text:
SWISS revamped their busibess class.
This is at first view impressive.
What is less impressive is he size of the seat/bed.
The bed is very narrow, the legg room when the bed is flat is not sufficient for the feet.
Medium size, 186 CM, I wqs very unconfortable.
The service was mediocre to good, the food was mediocre to good.
The lounge in Zurich and in JNB is a joke.
Swiss is long way from the old Swissair.

title: There is European standard and there is Swiss
review_text:
Great airline, on time, with new aircrafts and very helpful staff/at the airport and on the plane. 
Since we flew by economy class, the was a snack for the meal but there is a menu you can choose from.
What surprised me the most was the style of flying/we had several flights with Swiss, very sharp raising, and turning)) Professionals in everything! Thanx Swiss ‚ù§Ô∏è

title: Short Flight (Geneva to London City). Left a little late but time caught up,
review_text:
As usual an uneventful flight on one of the New Bombardier planes
Comfortable and much better than the Embraer 190.

title: Swiss Air Great Exeperience!
review_text:
Traveled with Swiss Air from Johannesburg this weekend to Vienna with a stop over at Zurich. I was pleasantly impressed with the service, aircraft cleanliness and the leg room of the aircraft. 

Service was available in 4 languages. English, German, French and Italian. Crew were very professional and polite. I highly recommend Swiss air.

title: Extremely friendly and comfortable seats
review_text: Was very happy we chose Swiss Air to fly to return  to Italy. It was extremely friendly and the food was good. The staff tried very hard to make everyone very comfortable.

title: Swiss business class
review_text: We used our Aeroplan points to fly with Swiss.  Very good service and food. Lots of leg room, but could have more recent movies to choose from.

title: Great flight!
review_text: The flight is probably as good as it can be...it's long and, as I'm assuming is the case with all airlines, you sit close to your neighbors.  But the service was wonderful, and has been on all four of our SwissAir flights in recent times.  The attendants were friendly and helpful.  The food tasty, and the Swiss chocolates delicious!  All personnel were professional.

title: Just OK
review_text: Our outward flight was delayed one hour and once boarded delayed again another hour so delaying our onward connection. Very annoying. In flight sandwich and drinks in economy is very basic. Our return flight was on schedule. Simple stuff really and all could be improved.

title: On-time departure and Arrival
review_text: In spite of a packed flight and an airport bursting at its seams due to holiday travels, SWISS managed to board the plane and leave Heathrow on time. Curteous and efficient on-board service for the short flight to Geneva.

title: Pathetic
review_text: Absolutely disgusting airline no sense of service and no sense of customer centricity no point travelling any class as any class you are treated as airline is god and u r there slave

title: Simply Awful
review_text: Absolutely the worst customer service I have ever experienced.  We had visa trouble with our destination a week before departure and they were absolutely unwilling to work with us on an alternative.  Apparently all you need to do to become a supervisor is being able to repeat the phrase "There's nothing I can do" until the customer finally gives up and ends the call.  Every reputable airline has some sort of change policy, especially when there are extenuating circumstances.  They took me for $1400 without even pretending to be interested.  Do yourself a favor and use another airline.

title: Great Airline
review_text: I have been flying Swiss on a regular basis especially since the service on airlines like American have fallen so low. I fly to Europe often and Zurich is an outstanding hub for any connection within the continent. Swiss' new 77-300ER service from LAX is outstanding, have flown F and J and both afre way above any US airline standard. Crews have always been cordial, professional and helpful. I am a fan and will be flhing Swiss as much as possible from now on .

title: Swiss Air - Great Service- Nice Plane
review_text: From Toronto to Zurich. 8 hr flight on a 777. Was a smooth ride. Fed two meals and a couple snacks. Free beer and wine. It was a newer plane with built in screens on the seat in front for watching good selection of movies and playing games. Lots of room.

title: Top class service
review_text: I travelled Swiss from London to Zurich to Johannesburg. The service was A1 in every respect-cost, efficiency, comfort, food, in-flight and airport service, and my bag came through, transfers. I shall definitely travel again!

title: The worst company I have traveled
review_text:
The seats of the tourist class are very small, the smallest I have seen in economy class. They have almost no movies to watch and in very few languages, I saw the same ones on the way back and forth.
We played in the queue of the plane both on the way and on the way back and on both occasions we could not choose the food because the other option was over and they gave it to us without giving an apology.
We had a lot of turbulence, we said that it was monsoon but we made 3 flights plus my partner and I inside Thailand and there was no turbulence ... it must be that the monsoon chases them.
On the return trip, my partner did not have a blanket and when we asked for a look that we had stolen the blanket that horrible!
Very bad experience! I will not fly with them again.

title: Great Service On Board- Call Center Customer Service - A Living Hell
review_text:
So you booked a flight on Swiss, spring for business class are confident that all will go perfectly-think again.
 When I booked our vacation flights on Swiss 6 months in advance, I booked business class hoping that all would be hassle free. Reservations- check, seat reservations-check (I even booked the same seats going and coming).  A few weeks before our flights, I wanted to ensure that everything was in order.  I logged onto the Swiss website and noticed our seats on the outgoing flight were not there. There were also no seats available on the seating chart to book unless I paid the $149 additional for the privacy seats.  I tried messaging Swiss on Twitter and they informed me I needed to call their online call center aka A Living Hell.
  I called the center and explained that I had reserved seats and was told by the agent that there was no record for the seats.  I asked how that could be, I knew I made the reservations for two longest legs of the flight (Mia-ZRH and ZRH-MIami).  The agent told me that I would have to wait until we checked in at the airport to reserve seats or I would have to pay $149 pp to reserve the privacy seats.  I explained that this was unacceptable as I had booked the seats and having paid business class which includes reserved seats, I should be able to reserve them.  After going in circles with her, I asked for her supervisor.  She said there wasn't one there . When I asked how that could be, she informed me there may or may not be one there in a few hours.   When I persisted, she said that since I booked online a travel website which which was code shared with United for the outgoing flight, I would have to contact United.  
 I called United and the agent was extremely sympathetic, but informed me she could not see the seating charts for Swiss on her system.     
  The service on the flights was very attentive and flight attendants were very efficient and friendly.  Once we arrived in Budapest, we waited for our baggage only to find that it did not make the connection.  We had to wait for the baggage on the next flight out of Zurich.  
  I hesitate to fly Swiss again simply because if something goes wrong and you  have to deal with their call center, it is pure hell on earth.

title: Excellent Company
review_text: Efficient, friendly staff and customer service from start to finish. Flight was on time. Would highly recommend this airline.

title: Comfort and superb service
review_text:
I started my trip in Dusseldorf Germany. Zurich airport is very friendly and efficient. 
The flight to Tel Aviv was with a Boeing 777 and as a matter of fact it is the only "real" business class comfort if compared to Lufthansa or Austrian on this line.
The crew is very friendly and the service is exelent. The only place for improvement is the meal.

title: Always late, plus inhumane practices
review_text:
We were a group of 7 people, and had total four flights with Swiss Air (connecting flights). They ALL were late, and that was a very stressful experience for us, as we had to RUN in order to be on time for our connections.
The space for the 10-h flight is downright inhumane, as it is way too narrow. Food was tasteless.
One more thing, that I believe it should be illegal: First & Business class should have more bonuses in terms of comfort, space, priority and food, NOT in terms of safety. It is unethical to state that those who pay more will have an extra belt for safety.

title: Complete contempt for passengers
review_text:
My wife and I recently flew from Florence, Italy to Zurich, Switzerland on Swiss airlines.
We arrived four hours before flight time and already the line at the ticket counter was a half-hour long.  By the time we got to the counter, the line must have been at least an hour long.  We were then told that, because we were early, we would have to check our bags at a different counter one hour later.  When we got there at the appointed hour, there was no one to accept our bags.  After waiting for a half-hour, we finally approached an agent at the ticket counter who took our bags.  Clearly, Swiss doesn't want to spend money on customer service and demonstrated complete contempt for its passengers.

title: I love Swiss Air!
review_text: Great lounges, great lounge food and wonderful service on board. As expected, a bit cramped in economy, but they did provide a good quality sandwich and choice of beverage in economy on this short flight.

title: Delayed bags and wont pay compensation
review_text:
Flew from Geneva to Barcelona and my bag does not show up. reported it and went to hotel. Called 6 times to check no luck it finally turns up 42 hours later. I am able to claim USD 200 compensation but they keep saying my bank account details are wrong. No one else has a problem transferring to my account so why does Swiss??? Every time I email them the same stupid reply.

They just lost a business class passenger over USD 200

title: First experience, good experience
review_text:
We chose Swiss as their timing suited us and the layover at Zurich was minimal, before the onwards flight to Rome. 

The check in and boarding were quite smooth. The cabin inside was quite spacious and well appointed. The staff were pleasant, attentive and cheerful throughout the nearly 12 hour flight. It was an overnight flight, so the nearly flat bed helped, though it was a snug fit leaving little room for sleepers like me who turn to our sides. I enjoyed the food, and liked that they took the breakfast order along with dinner. 

Overall, it was a comfortable flight and I‚Äôd fly Swiss again.

title: Swiss International Air Lines - always a pleasure
review_text: I travel to Zurich to visit my family at least once a year and I always find it a very pleasurable experience.   I always have easy check-in, meal as requested and good service - definitely right up there with many of the best airlines I have flown with.

title: Cancelled flights and delayed bags
review_text:
Was supposed to fly them for the last leg of a United ticket into Geneva.  They cancelled the flight into Geneva from London.  Eveyone had to scramble to the Swiss Air ticket dsk and they booked us on another flight that night on British Airways.  We take a 15 minute bus ride to another terminal; go though security; only to be told at the BA counter that Swiss AIr had not paid for the ticket.  Eventually BA gets it worked out and we fly out a couple of hours delayed but when we reach Geneva our checked bag did not arrive.  So didn't fly Swiss Air on this leg, but they could not get our bag to BA in time and we did not recive our bag in Geneva until 24 hours later!

Return trip home leaving Geneva this morning.  Check large bag and I bring carry-on that I have flown in US maybe 10 times without checking when a gate agent declares my bag is too big and I will have to check through to SFO via London.  Well guess what, my carry-on bag is still missing and has not arrived SFO even though I have been her 8 hours.  Somehow my bag got sent to Los Angeles!  

So I only flew one leg of two on Swiss Air and they manged to totally inconvenice us two times!  I will never fly this airline again which means I will probably never travel to Switzerland again. Disaster!

title: LEG SPACE HORRIBLE, BUT NICE SERVICE
review_text:
Was negatively amazed that a Swiss air long haul flight had the the smallest space I have experienced on any flight.. even compared to low budget short distance.
Even being a tall guy, I can always just fit my knees in even on short flights.. This was not possible on this Swiss flight..
And if I hadn't done an extra effort of getting an aisle seat, it would have been very awkward having to cross legs with the person next to me..
I think it's the first negative review I give to an airline... But I really find this an out of the ordinary disgrace for a Swiss airline, to deliver a banana republic kind of condition... and this on a long haul trip..

title: Average Experience
review_text:
Flight was Delayed by over 1.5 hours while going to Switzerland and also while returning. Seats were comfortable as we paid extra for front seats.

Limited food options for Veg. Airlines did not give an option to opt for Veg meal while booking tickets or checking in.

Most of the staff was helpful and warm.

While going our seats for close to toilets and usually their is a curtain and a little distance but the setting was a little odd while going. Return flight setup was much better.

title: Are You Kidding Me
review_text: I cannot begin to express how uncomfortable this 11 hour flight was.  What they did should be against the law.  I flew all the way from LA to Zurich with a seat plastered into my knees.  I'm only 5'9" and my poor 6'1" husband fared even worse.  He had his knees against the seat and the tray in his navel.  The person in front decided to recline, while he was eating.  First and last time flying Swiss.  Economy is generally pretty bad but this takes the cake.  Have never been on such a tight plane.  Didn't have room for arms, couldn't get bag under seat, and seat was very uncomfortable, lack of cushion.  On bright side received meal that was good and crew was pleasant.  But F- on transport I felt like cattle.

title: Great service just have to get better being on time.
review_text:
We had to take two flights on Swiss Air one from Heathrow to Zurich and the second from Zurich to Barcelona. When landing on time with Air Canada at Heathrow we noticed our flight on Swiss Air was delayed by 30 minutes. As we were pushing away from the gate we were over an hour behind schedule! 

Something for you to remember is while on the webpage reserving you seats it looks as there are only two x two seats in business class it is not different than economy with three x three with the saying spacing between each row. A little surprised and not overly impressed as that was not what we were expecting. This applies for both flights. The only difference was they do not book the middle seat for you. Personally would not pay the difference for business class based on the seating arrangements. 

The two flight attendants on our first leg were wonderful. The younger of the two constantly had a smile and really seem to be enjoying her position. While both were wonderful the younger just exuded a wonderful disposition it was a pleasure to meet her acquaintance. 

When mentioning we had a connecting flight the flight attendant indicated we would be getting connecting details on monitor ten minutes before landing. For this leg we were a little stressed as we would have less than 30 minutes to clear customs and get to our connecting flight. 

Finally, at the ten minute mark came before landing we received the details about our connecting flight and this to was delayed. While it was our first time flying Swiss Air and we were blessed with the delays as it made our connecting flights still work I can not believe two separate flights were delayed by a minimum of 20 minutes. Without getting into all the details we made the connection and were safely on our way to Barcelona. 

The second flight had two gentlemen serving us in the cabin and both did a wonderful job. On both flights we had a feeling of pride and enjoyment from the flight attendants. 

Another Kudo to Swiss Air is the Captain was present welcoming us on board on both flights and made sure he was also present as we left. Something we don‚Äôt in Canada these days. 

Overall 
Plane - A320 for both - a good reliable plane in good condition. Rating +

Seats - terrible 3x3 and not a lot of room between each row. Rating -

Food - first flight was sliced processed roast beef. Served with cheese and crackers. Second was prosciutto with potato salad and cheese as well. 
Rating - 

People - this is where Swiss Air goes above and beyond. The people were friendly and a pleasure to engage with. Between the Flight Attendants and the Captain coming out of the cockpit they thoroughly impressed us. Rating +++

Overall the people made the difference between many other airlines out there. Well done Swiss Air in creating a great team.

title: Good service and Food
review_text: Comfortable seats and adequate legroom. Good service and enjoyed a vegetarian meal. More water would have been good. Took off and landed on time.

title: Comfortable, good value for money and far less walking than with other airlines
review_text:
I've been travelling to London Heathrow by Swiss a few times in the recent months and I can truthfully say that the experience was a lot more pleasant than travelling with other airlines. 
The service is good, the staff well trained and the leather seats comfortable and you feel slightly less cramped than with other airlines. The food (in economy) is not much and frankly they might as well not bother, but otherwise it is good.  
What really makes this airline beat the others is the fact that they have good slots at Geneva and Heathrow airports and therefore the passengers do not have to walk miles either to drop their luggage or to go to the gate.  The planes I have taken haven't always been on time, but one gets to expect some delays these days and it was within the acceptable range.
Swiss offers good value for money if you take into account the fact that the fare includes hold luggage, two pieces of hand luggage (one under the seat) and you can choose your seat, all of which are usually charged extra by other airlines.  You can also change your reservation, for a fee and possibly a bit extra for price difference.
I wish they would allow checking in a few days before departure instead of 24 hours, as this is not always convenient when travelling.  I will definitely travel with Swiss to and from London again.

title: Worst flying experience of my life!
review_text: My flight BKK-Zurich was initially delayed, but, hey, just a small issue can happen, so this did not bother me much at the beginning.I went through the check in with my boarding pass with no problem; however my girlfriend was stopped for a while, as the Swiss Air attendant said my girlfriend's name was not appearing  in their system.  As a result, my girlfriend was hold for a some time, and she was asked to show her documents again to perform further checks. I found this a bit unusual and distressful, but, hey, 2 issues can happen, right? Once finally aboard, after a while, the crew started giving around a small snack to all passengers. Well, all except one: my girlfriend. I thought, maybe they did not see her, although she was sitting just beside me? But hey, 3 issues can happen, right? Later on, the crew start distributing the main meal...and once again they serve it to all....except my girlfriend, so I had to call the crew back to get her meal (and yes, it was included in her ticket, if you are wondering...).But hey 4 mistakes can happen right? Sure the fact that they happened all against the same person is unusual, though. The hours passed and the crew brought the ice cream to all passengers; well of course all, except my girlfriend. At this point, I went to the back of the plane where a group of hostesses are talking to one other (I would have preferred them to look after the passengers), and I asked if I could have had an ice cream for my girlfriend. One of them went immediately on a defensive mode, rising the voice against me (not to say yelling), saying she did not serve my girlfriend because she was sleeping (which I can assure she was not). I am not sure why this hostess had such bad attitude, and I told her I found it inappropriate. Also, I wondered why my girlfriend, who was the only dark skinned person (she is Thai) among many white passengers around us, was the only one to be repetitively ignored. A simple apologie would have sufficed, instead that hostess  (too bad I cannot recall her name) was acting in a very hostile manner, which I found very upsetting, to the point that I decided to return the 2  ice cream tubs that her colleague gave me, dropping them back in their plastic containers (at the point she made really upset making me lose completely my appetite). I decided then to go back to my seat and try and relax, closing my eyes. A few minutes later another hostess came, and although I had my eyes closed and I was clearly trying to get some rest, she did not bother to wake me up (but they did not not serve snack, mean meal and ice cream to my girlfriend, because, they said, it looked like she was sleeping..? So what is the company policy?). She told me she was the Maitre the Cabine, and asked me if I wanted to talk about the incident: I did not want to make a big fuss, so I said everything was alright, and that at the moment all I needed was to relax and rest. But she (her name is Susanne Kaufmann) insisted, then started yelling at me, accusing me to have been rude to her team. Furthermore, clearly abusing her power, she threatened me to get me arrested on arrival (for what, since I was actually the offended person, not the offender?). Although I do appreciate a manager that stick to his team and protect them when the team is right, this was definitely  not the case, so I found  it totally unprofessional. As I told Ms Kaufmann, she was not at the back of the plane, when the discussion happened with her team, so she could not really know what had happened there and accuse me of anything. I would have expected from a person in her position to at least ask for also my version of facts, before accusing me of anything and threatening me. This is a simple basic of management. The captain on arrival to Zurich did not contact me before leaving the plane, nor I have I been contacted by any customer service from Swiss Air  so far,  so I wonder if Ms Kaufman had reported the incident. The rest of the crew was actually nice, but my flying experience and the following holidays have been severely affected, pretty much ruined, by the appalling attitude of one hostess and her Maitre de Cabine. So, it did not come as a big surprise, when I saw so many other review regarding the terrible service with this airline.

title: Great airline
review_text: Comfortable, good services only flaw was my seat was changed on the way to zurich as rhey had changed planes. Coffee and a croissant was complementary. Overall a good airline. Flight was punctual and clean.

title: Terrible Business Class experience!
review_text:
I booked  a flight to my wife to visit her sick father to Sao Paulo. Only available was J class meaning full business fare (4500CHF+ on the way out) and she would have expected a better experience from Swiss. The misadventures were multiple including fear for her safety.
The flight was overbooked and didn‚Äôt manage to have a seat allocated at check-in, although the choice was made a time of booking. She was told she may have one at the gate. Premium passengers should not worry and be stressed in wondering if they will fly and if they do in the class they booked. 
Then after boarding, she thought she had taken someone else seat (4D right after First class) as it looked dirty and occupied. 
‚Ä¢	Sock on the floor
‚Ä¢	Used earplugs in the drawer.
‚Ä¢	Headphone off the plastic. 
‚Ä¢	She asked the crew what happened to the seat, and the answer was: ‚ÄúOh the seat may have not been cleaned‚Äù!

Finally, as it is not all, during TAKE OFF, the stack of magazines and newspapers fell on her head and her neighbour because the crew simply FORGOT to remove them before taking off. The crew just wondered after take-off why all those magazines and newspapers were on the floor. I am sure this is a breach of air safety. 

To conclude, she and I are very appalled that paying a full fare business she had to go through dirty seat and fear for her safety on a thought ‚Äúpremium airline‚Äù. 
We will have to fly often to Sao Paulo, I will hesitate to fly Swiss or Lufthansa Group (I had other bad experience with them) and will prefer other carriers with which I had good experience, even if it means paying more and/or fly via another hub. With my friends based in Geneva or Basel, we all agree that going to Brazil on business class KLM is the best. 
She is back in tomorrow and I hope her flight experience stays with a minimum discomfort, if not we will approach newspapers. Not a premium airline.

title: Worst longest flying experience.
review_text:
Most unfriendliest and the unhappiest cabin crews. Its so unwelcoming flying with this airline. These crews gave you the feeling as they did us a favor by flying with them.

Cleanliness of the toilets throughout this long flight was bad.

title: Another horrible experience with Swiss Air.
review_text:
As usual, super unfriendly staffs during check in at the counter, horrible service.
In the flight back, the flight was delayed twice. One was due to aircraft congestion. After a long wait, it was delayed again and they explained that the crew had to take their rest and they had to find another plane and crew.
Definitely would try the hardest not to fly Swiss Airline again.

title: The unhappiest staffs, terrible service.
review_text:
Whenever I flew with this airline, you felt like dealing with grumpy, unhappy people. Horrible crew and and terrible service.
You feel so unwelcome starting from checking in at the counter and cabin crews were always the worst.

title: Italy
review_text: Very clean and comfortable. Crew was very accommodating and try to make everyone as comfortable as possible

title: Too many mistakes!
review_text:
Paid $100 each for upgrade seats.  Got the bulkhead in the third cabin with no window (dark) with the restrooms and galley.  Although people were cautioned not to line up in those areas at the outset of the trip, nevertheless, they did.  All during the flight we had no privacy just people staring at us, helping themselves to drinks in the galley (would you believe?) and waiting to use the restrooms.  It was awful!  After complaining that the upgrade was not really an upgrade in our opinion since we didn't need the extra leg room, the attendant was extremely concerned and checked our reservation.  Then he offered us other seating which we declined since it was worse than where we were.

We also ordered diabetic meals which they did not have or did not even have it noted on our reservations.  Again, this same attendant took time to check it out, came back and apologized.  There was no such reservation despite my husband having it listed on his profile.  He shared that we must notify the ticket office at the time of the reservation to make that notation.  And if it wasn't on the first flight (which it wasn't) we should have notified them so we get it on the connecting flight.  Also, he reported that meals get messed up when a travel agent books the flight.
Another lesson learned.  

Note:  the attendant did a great job trying to see what went wrong and offered to fix it.  And we thanked him for being caring.

title: excellent
review_text: excellent customer service. some problems with my ticket but they were on it and sorted it out. lounge was good.  flight was comfortable.   flight attendants were great.  food was good. plane was little messy but still clean.    would reccomend.

title: New Plane and Great Service
review_text: We were from Bangkok to Zurich. It was long trip, but because the inflight entertainment and the service so nice, the flight is comfort us. The food are good and the flight attendants are helpfull. The flight schedule was punctual. Its a great experience traveling to Zurich by Swiss Air.

title: Boeing 777 new plane but cramped
review_text:
Took this airline to Sarajevo, and the Long leg from Singapore to Zurich was an overnight flight. We were supposed to leave at 11 but flight was delayed at least an hour and half. The only consolation was that they offered some drinks before takeoff and pacified us. The reason given by the captain was that the airspace over India was very crowded, not sure how true that was.
Now, the reason why I rated 2 Star is because of the cramped economy seats. I have flown on many triple sevens before but these seats are very cramped and will not suit European size at all. And then there are these light weight seats that are very thin at the cushions. When on Long flights, the buttocks will be sore from sitting on these thin cushions. These are very similar to Budget airline seats like Scoot or even lower tier airlines like KLM.
I would suggest for Swiss to relook at the seating configuration and to improve on the seats‚Äô cushioning.
Other areas like servicing is also not up to par. The crew members seems to be looking very stressed all the time, and one even spilled orange juice on another passenger when in a hurry to serve. The crews seem to be always in a hurry to serve everyone, especially when in a full flight situation.
Overall, the experience was not good and very unpleasant  as a passenger when faced with overworked and stressful crews.

title: Great service
review_text: It was a long trip home, with a stop over in Zurich, but the service was great.  Were were on "Swiss Air" from Athens to Zurich and "Edelweiss" from Zurich to Denver.  The flight attendants were very attentive and came thru frequently with water and juice.  We paid extra for seats with more leg room and were quite comfortable.  The seats without extra leg room were even more cramped than the typical standard seat on, say, United.  Since my husband is 6 feet tall, the regular seats would have been very uncomfortable for him on the long flight.

title: Not a great ending
review_text:
Returning from holiday is not normally something we look forward to for most people so our flight home can certainly cushion the experience if it goes smoothly.
Unfortunately for us returning from a holiday in Switzerland recently, our flight with Swiss Air ended rather badly. We took off with only perhaps a 10 minute delay and actually landed in Dublin 5 minutes early but then the problems began. We were left sitting on the tarmac for 1 hour and thirty five minutes before dis-embarking, one service announcement telling us very little, a refusal to use the toilets because ‚Äú we may move at any moment ‚Äú and no offer of water while we sat in the heat. One would imagine that after two hours they could have at least opened a door a fraction to air the aircraft, after all we were just sitting still, but  no, on health and safety grounds we should sit still, on full bladders and breath stale air. Eventually people decided they‚Äôd use the bathroom regardless of instructions and did so forming an orderly queue and within minutes we had an announcement to say we could use them and stretch our legs for a few minutes but to sit down if the seat belt sign came on... we could have done that 30 minutes earlier and people would have been a lot happier. Why an airline flys into an airport without a dis-embarking slot I‚Äôm not sure, is it their fault or the airports, who knows but your main priority as an airline should be the comfort of your passengers and that was not apparent here.
Finally after getting off we had a further 45 minute wait for our baggage... the whole experience being longer than the flight with one announcement of no value being their sole explanation.I was expecting an email of some type the following day explaining the delays but no contact of any type or post on their website.
I‚Äôll not fly with them again if I can help it, as I say I don‚Äôt know who is to blame but information is key to travelers and keeping them in the dark and expecting them to just accept a given situation without explanation is not the correct course of action...
Not an end to the holiday of a lifetime we had hoped for...

title: Flight was Great
review_text: The flight, planes and flight crew are AMAZING.  The customer service representatives one must deal with when booking the flight are AWFUL.  I was shocked!  Usually the Swiss are known for their customer service and graciousness.  Not these folks.  Don't call if you don't have to!  I certainly never will again.  RUDE

title: Excellent Service
review_text: We travel overseas once a year and have flown with many airlines. This would have to be the most clean, comfortable seats and great service by far.

title: Not horrible
review_text: Nothing to write home about, but also not the worst. As we had just flown on Norwegian and had a less than stellar flight, this was a slight improvement.

title: regrettable. where is my baggage?
review_text:
premium prices, snack and chocolates, smiles, uncomfortable seating, non-Swiss punctuality. 
The most unfortunate thing is not that Swiss lost my bags in zurich, the worst is that I am (right now) in Hannover for two days with the same clothes and there is a contact phone that nobody takes ... I do not know where my bags are and nobody in swis or at Hannover Airport doesn't matter at all.
Never again will fly with swiss.

title: Anniversary adventure return shuttle
review_text: First class seating was basically coach seating with the middle seat open. The trip was only ~1.5 hours. Just days prior to this flight, we experienced a similar shuttle flight from Zurich to Barcelona, where it appeared that something I ate on the plane didn't agree with me. I was cautious eating on this flight, but again had a very uncomfortable experience shortly during our following international return flight.

title: Anniversary shuttle flights
review_text: Just an "Okay" flight. The trip was ~1/5 hours duration. First Class seating was basically a standard a-b-c coach seating row, with the middle seat vacant. The crew was very nice and the plane was clean. Unfortunately, the food didn't agree with me and shortly after landing I experienced some issues. Luckily, this while after we checked into our hotel.

title: Anniversary adventure
review_text: Overall very comfortable flight. Clean seating and excellent flight crew. When in Tampa, Swiss Air did not offer any special lounge area for our business class, however offered us a voucher for use at the terminal while we waited. The Swiss Air lounge in Zurich was very nice and accommodating.  I have to say that we were not particularly fond of the food choices.

title: Easy nice flight
review_text: If you wanna travel to muscat you should always think about Swiss air as well. Very comfortable and nice service!

title: exceptional
review_text: exceptionl seat 10K from the most comfortable on any business fight . Stewardess Olivia Schudel was most kind and attentive.

title: Great flight
review_text: This airline is not bad for a flight. The seats are really comfortable except the fact that the headrest isn't adjustable. The entertainment system has a good selection of movies and TV shows. They also have a good range of music on there as well ranging from pop music to folk to country to classical. The food was about average nothing to impressive. The plane was insanely clean and the check in and customer service agents were very friendly and so were the flight attendants. Overall it was a nice experience and the Swiss Air is not to impressive among airlines but isn't a bad option for economy on a long-haul flight.

title: UNPROFESSIONAL!
review_text: We had a connection flight. From South Africa to Geneva to Zurich.  They forgot our luggage and sent it with the next flight.  We had to wait from 11 o'clock the morning until 10.30 the evening for it to be delivered.

title: Late again
review_text: Unfortunately late again and we almost missed the train. We had to run for it..... Staff was very friendly and apologised even though it is not their fault.

title: Late cancellation from airlines and not helpful customer service
review_text: We are travelling from malaga to Switzerland tomorrow.yesterday we found out that swiss airlines flight got cancelled.The only suitable flight they can give us will reach after 9hrs from our scheduled flight.I am 7.5mnths pregnant and due to this change all tour planning was spoiled.The most annoying thing is ustomer service does not have anything in their hand to help.They dont have any online complain number. Even i sent the complain i am really not sure if they will send me any compensation for my new flight ticket(expensive due to short time gap)and my accomodation for the delay or even send any response at allüôÑ.the whole situation is really frustrating.

title: Great business class !
review_text: The travel from New York to Zurich on business class was great.The seat was very comfortable and the service was #1.

title: HORRIBLE customer service
review_text: Because of Swiss Air's awful systems, we weren't able to check in to our flight online so we went to the airport EARLY to check in. We came to a ridiculously long queue to check in because it was combined with Lufthansa and Swiss and it took literally 2 hours to even check in. We needed to get over 500 eur of VAT refunds but because of their inefficient systems, we were unable to get our customs stamp in time. We even tried to ask the attendant for different flight times so that we can try to get our refund and the attendant completely and rudely ignored us and continued to process our checked bag. I filed a complaint about a month ago, followed up a bunch of times, and even tried calling them and STILL no response. In fact, the person who picked up when I called said I had to file my complaint online, which I did over a MONTH ago. OH and they even lost our checked bag. This has been, by far, the worst experience I've EVER had with any airline.

title: Flight changed
review_text: Our flight was changed and we had a 6 hour layover in Zurich. An email was went but was never received. Only picked it up when we were checking in the night before.

title: The worst customer service after flight cancellation
review_text:
I wish I could give the service a minus star. My flight LX2111 from Malaga to Zurich on June 23, 2019 was cancelled. The nightmare continues until this minute (17.44) as I am still waiting to get a new flight and hotel voucher.
There is nobody from Swiss Airlines, no information was given. I was sent between counters various times as nobody knows what to do.  My problem is not their problem.  
As much as I like Switzerland but Swiss Airlines will never again be my choice of airline. 
After waiting in line for over an hours I was sent to the other counter, back and forth without anybody knowing what is next.
The worst Customer Service ever. I can understand cancellation, delay, I have travelled enough but lack of information should not be.

title: Horrible experience. Please DO NOT book a flight through this airline
review_text: We were flying from Prague to Zurich. Our flight got canceled and we were not informed until we got to the airport. The people working said that no one had got notified so they had been receiving people with the same problem all day. They had ‚Äòbooked‚Äô us on a flight that left at 10am- but since our original flight was not until 2 and we never received any type of notice that it was canceled, we obviously missed that. Not only was the flight canceled, but they were not able to put us on another flight until the next day. We missed a full day of things in Switzerland we had booked, and we had to find our own way if we wanted to get there any faster. It was beyond frustrating. One of the airport staff even told us at one point ‚Äòthese flights gets canceled all the time‚Äô. They just did not really care. DO NOT FLY THROUGH THIS AIRLINE.

title: Affordable airline
review_text: Normal flight, efficient personnel, service was as expected. Nothing to complain about really. Too bad that the Prosecco was finished when they served the evening meal. Full flight .

title: Very friendly service
review_text: I felt almost home with this great airline.Whole crew performed very professional and discreet.They asked many times for any refills of drinks or special wishes.

title: Terrible Service - Luggage lost
review_text:
2 out of 3 checked luggage did not arrive when arriving in Lamezia Italy (SUF) 
We started our trip in Copenhagen with a connection in Z√ºrich. 
Furthermore, the plane was 1,5 hour late when departing from Z√ºrich. 
Now, at the third day of our vacation, we have heard nothing from Swiss and we still miss our luggage a lot. 
We made the missing luggage report at the airport upon arrival, but the service there was just terrible. We have heard nothing since then. 
It have been necessary for us to buy new clothes etc to continue our vacation. 
I can only recommend you to choose an other carrier than Swiss, because you‚Äôll be all left alone if something goes wrong. 

Ps. An other family in front of us were missing 3 out of 4 luggage. They lost all their food for their small kid, even though they had distributed the food into several luggage in case of a missing bag. 

Kind Regards
A very unhappy customer

title: Smooth trip, comfortable seats
review_text: This was a two-stage flight. Boston-Zurich and Zurich-Florence (and return of course). The aircraft was almost stereotypical Swiss - sparkling clean, well lit, on schedule. I had paid a bit (not a lot) more to select our seats for the trans-Atlantic portion.

title: GREAT SERVICE
review_text:
Swiss Business Class on 777 airplane far exceeds service on American or United Airlines. The flight attendants are far more friendly and professional.
The food service and food was lovely and tasty. The seats were comfortable with a massage mode. There was a very nice selection of movies.  I much prefer their service and attitude to the smug attitude of American Airlines flight attendants.

title: Swiss efficency .
review_text: modern airbus , v clean , on time of course , bussed to aircraft . Refreshments offered free choice of sandwich , soft drinks , & piece milk choc . Leg room fair, seats recline . Crew strict about cabin bags that were over size , taken off passengers & out in hold after boarding .

title: Substitute for United via partner Swiss Air/Helvetica
review_text: Because of a United unreasonably delayed departure for our nonstop flight home, we requested other more timely accommodations - and as United partners with Swiss Air and Lufthansa, we were rerouted from Zurich through Munich.  Swiss Air's flight was very quick (more like a commuter flight, and interestingly, boarded from an outside bus drop off to a stairway up to the plane), but efficient and all employees very gracious.

title: Great experience
review_text:
The most friendly staff and a flight on schedule.
The plane was clean.
We enjoyed good food and a large choice of entertainement.

title: Good service and hospitality
review_text: We had a nice travel experience with Swiss air on board. Check in and airport interface was good. In flight entertainment was good. Staff was having good courtesy. Food served was good, choice wise and taste wise.

title: American Adventure
review_text: From the moment we checked in at Geneva, our experience was amazing. We took advantage of the business class Lounge which was very comfortable and took away the normal airport drudgery .Once we were aboard our aircraft the real comfort and luxury began. A glass of Champagne was on offer as we sat in our seats. The food really was exceptional, it was prepared by a Michelin star chef. The crew were very attentive and really worked hard all flight. I would thoroughly recommend Swiss air Business class to anyone.

title: SWiss delivered beyond expectations
review_text: I must say that Swiss Air really impressed us, even though it was Economy. Legroom was ample ( and I am tall), food was better than expected and the flight attendants very friendly. I have flown on BA, Virgin, Lufthansa, SAA, but Swizz Air is probably tops for me!!

title: Always a good experience
review_text: Very good Airline, friendly staff , good service. They keep you hydrated (Water) on regular basis. Planes are modern and clean.

title: Family
review_text: lam start with luggage I pay 120$ for 2 luggage extra on way back I pay allmost 400 $ WHERE Ticket I can buy cheaper with another airlines and luggage not arrive spending 4hour going trough custom and dealing with swiss air up and down at airport now thank's for 1$ frozen meal from walmart and leg eperience next just transport people like livestock also won thank's Prague custom for trough away expensive creams Ihope person whoo take it get rash at least. At the and than'ks billionairs for wonderful memories.Do I get concepated I doubted becose I'm just Joe smoe.

title: Clean, modern, friendly and nice snacks!!
review_text: Had a great short flight with Swiss Air - it was really efficient boarding, check-in, friendly staff and a good snack (better than most for a 1 hour flight!). I would definitely fly with them again!

title: Return Journey
review_text: Flight was delayed, however we could spend our time peacefully at the airport. Ground staff was very helpful and we bought an upgrade to Business Class. Business Class was very nice and we had ample leg room, better food and drinks. Staff was very helpful. Only thing that needs to improve is the content of entertainment system.

title: Good Airline could be made much better!!
review_text: Flight was delayed unusually, Airlines ground staff was least helpful and they had no clue how to deal with the situation. Ultimately when flight was announced it was 3 hours late and they refused to give priority to people with young children despite repeatedly requesting them. On flight only a small breakfast was served with no drinks. Usually when a flight is so delayed, a heavier meal should be served and drinks should be offered. Seats were very tight in economy class due to 3-4-3 configuration rather than 2-3-2 or better configuration. It was very uncomfortable and entertainment had hardly any English selection and whatever was available was quite old. I wish they improve on these.

title: Long but comfortable trip
review_text:
As with all things Swiss, the flight was efficient. It took off on and landed on time. The meals were nothing to shout about neither was there any complaints. 

The flight staff were polite, helpful and accommodating. 

The seats were comfortable and the in-flight entertainment was good except that the music choices were quite European-centric.

Overall, a comfortable no-hassle experience.

title: Business class that isn't as good as I would have expected.
review_text:
1st trip on Swiss air.....most likely my last. The lie flat seats were shorter than those I've been on with other airlines...not sure why...

Choices for meals also were less than on other airlines. Requested the beef for dinner and it was too highly seasoned and tough. (I enjoy seasining). Flight attendants were not avilable unless you rang the call bell or got up out of your seat to find them.

Overall, not a great experience.

Entertainmentwise, I couldn't fnd anything to watch or any music that I would enjoy.

title: Laid additional charge
review_text: My wife and daughter traveling first time through Swiss. Air India cleared their baggage without any issue (traveling from Ahmedabad to Mumbai). But they said their is extra weight (the bags were already transfer to them by Air India, so we don't know, true or false). My wife saw they charged somewhere 7 people ahead of them. Twist is my wife was flyig bombay-zurich, zurich-chicago. Zurich-chicago flight they cancel and then change it to zurich-washington-dulles. I hope you got my point

title: Great seats, service, and food. Bad aircraft
review_text: Seats were really spacious and comfortable. All Economy seats have extra legroom. Food was great and service was great. The only downside was the aircraft, which all the compartments of the aircraft was shaking a lot like nothing was screwed into the shell of the aircraft.

title: Great service, seats, and food
review_text: Seats were comfortable and spacious with great legroom. No need for paying for extra legroom seats. Food was great. Flight attendants were friendly and helpful.

title: watch out for fine print and excessive fees
review_text: we booked a multileg trip from sfo to nice; sfo -> zurich, zurich-> nice, nice-> zurich, zurich -> sfo.  Due to a change on ur end we did not take the zurich -> nice leg, we found another way to get to nice.   Swiss then canceld the remaining legs of the trip.   We received no notiofication of this event until I tried to check in the day before leaving.   Calling the agents we got a run around ‚Äî no real attempt to help, just a repetition that those were the conditions of the ticket sale.   I‚Äôve heard of a change fee, but canceling an entire trip if you dont take leg I‚Äôve never heard of.  We ended up buying the return trip again, essentially doubling the cost of ourt trip.   Never again!   Please beware of this nasty and unfair policy if you take swiss air.

title: Nice
review_text:
Top service all the 11 hours from Zurich to Cancun. We paid like 120 euro extra for economy premium upgrade. It was all the money worth. 
I was not fan of the food on board but it's hard to find a airline company who serves good air food.

title: Luggage 5 days missing
review_text:
Going on a 7 day trip to Southern Italy, my luggage went missing for 5 days because the employee at Hannover Airport didnt put a baggage tag. 5 days in 40 degrees without anything. No toothpaste, no deodorant, no underwear, no nothing. You get the picture. I spent most of my vacation phoning after my luggage and buying stuff in far away places. And in the end, Swiss thought it was a cool idea to refund me with 88‚Ç¨ as their policies say and acting as if they were doing me a favor. 

Never again. As long, as everything goes smoothly, a nice airline. When problems occur, they totally leave you alone. Not what I would expect from a self proclaimed "premium" airline. At all.

title: Flew both business and economy Nice-Johannesburg, both very poor service/aircraft
review_text:
I had the 'experience' of flying Swiss from Nice to/from Johannesburg via Zurich in both business (outward) and economy (back). I have flown Swiss in the distant past and had memories of pleasant experiences - I was in for several disappointments.
On the positive side: the flights left more or less on time (except the Zurich-Jo'burg flight which was held back to wait for late connecting passengers). The planes were reasonably clean. That's it.
Business Class review - poor, and I do travel business regularly with other airlines. Seats were very hard and very narrow. Old technology - seats and in-flight entertainment system, e.g. VERY small screens. Airplane was REALLY old. Food was very poor for Business Class-level. Service (call that service?) was unfriendly, reluctant, distant and the whole thing was 'minimalist'. And expensive compared to other airlines - I only took Swiss because everyone else was booked. What a miserable bunch of people - the aircrew I mean.
The way back - Economy - of course was worse. On the Jo'burg-Zurich leg it was the same 'team' as the way out, just a different aeroplane (newer). The aircrew were even more cold and distant in Eco, unless you were one of the very few German-speaking passengers. Talking of which, the crew persisted in talking German to everyone, even though - after many hours - no one had actually learned German during the flight. Persistence to the point of rudeness. Not only that, my (old-fashioned, tiny, buggy) in-flight entertainment system would ONLY select German as the main language! Basically the crew had the same approach as a Swiss domestic flight where 99% of the passengers are going to be Swiss, and operating out of Zurich, probably speak German. But this is an intercontinental flight going through Zurich as a hub, with the majority being English-speaking (native or otherwise), and absolutely NOT German. On my flight it was probably 99% non-German-speaking.
Food service was very poor and disjointed, e.g. we got a drink and crackers 1-hour into the flight - OK. Then the crew disappeared for over 2-hours! Was that all we were getting for dinner, I thought? Got myself ready to sleep, and yippee, at 22:30 they started serving some food (3-hours into the flight). Food was 'OK' for Eco, I suppose, but the miserable faces and below minimal service dragged out the sub-standard dinner service to past midnight.
Very poor.
Here's an interesting point to note - please bear with me. A while ago I read some research about people's memories, and companies make use of this approach to manipulate us. Let me explain. People form opinions based on the last 5-10 minutes of an experience, like was it good, pleasant, bad, painful, etc. For example, if you go to the dentist for a painful treatment, as you leave he will be nice to you, give you a smile and maybe a candy(?), have a chat about the kids, etc. Then, later, what you remember is how nice he was, not how painful the treatment was - you get the idea?
Well, SWISS must have learned this and apply it. The whole flight was poor, uncomfortable, expensive, with cold, minimalist, rude, staff. BUT in those last few minutes, as we're queuing to get off, suddenly they are all smiles, warm and chatty (in ENGLISH and German), helpful, etc. So what will our memories be? Didn't work for me, as you can tell from this review.
I do NOT recommend Swiss.
Other points: Zurich airport - the business lounge closes (as do the shops) at 21:30, and the food etc. is gone long before that. On the way back (in Eco) passengers were forced to check in hand luggage if they had more than 2-pieces. This was NOT done nicely, politely, voluntarily (I actually remembered this from the past, but had forgotten). I could describe the manners, language and approach that would give you a good idea how she worked, but let me just say that she would have been ideal for a certain police service 80 years ago who liked to wear armbands and walked funny.
Avoid them all if you can. Take another airline, don't go through Zurich.

title: In Time
review_text:
The flight was well booked. The boarding procedure was good and fast and the slight delay was made up.
The crew was friendly and the quiche excellent.

title: No point in making seat reservation... it will change...also late.
review_text: Made reservations for flights in late May and early June in March but both seats were changed drastically on both flights.  If you can't honor seat reservations then go to open seating plan and charge less money.  The girl at the ticket counter said to complain to Swiss Air she couldn't do anything. Also flight was late and had to run to connections in order to make them.  I don't know why airlines in general are so bad at doing their job.  The only good thing I can say is that the flight crew was very nice and the captain tried his best to arrive as close to the expected time as possible.

title: Worst flight in sixteen years Zurich  a disaster airport
review_text: Airport in Zurich closes up  around 8 o clock cant even get drink water worst airport  I ever in never fly with them again

title: Not impressed
review_text: Check in at gate at Geneva airport was less than effective. Another round of passport interrogation after passing all customs immigration and security checks right before boarding. Person grilling me at gate I‚Äôm guessing to be airline employee. Rude, unprofessional, invasive! If this person were truly airline employee Swiss airline needs to retrain their people on courtesy. Obvious racist attitude towards Asian passengers. Claimed my wife was randomly selected for additional investigation via computer algorithm. Positive it was race oriented. It‚Äôs 2019 and this level of blatant racism still surfacing. In flight experience was no better as flight attendants clearly didn‚Äôt pay much attention to our needs, evidenced by accidental skipping of my wife and myself a few times during service rounds. Swiss airlines you need to reassess your staff trainings or face obsolescence like myriad of other legacy airlines.

title: Roomy this time, toilets too small
review_text:
Seating space was a bit roomier this time. It is important to take a flight when it is not full if possible. You are then likely to get a seat where there is nobody sitting beside you.

The toilets are not big enough. I wish I could put the person inside them for a sit down. The designer obviously is probably male and never needs to use the toilette on a flight.

Come on Swiss, you need to get better and be better than that

title: Do you ever on time?!
review_text:
Look, never wrote any airline comment so far. But now is just over my patience.

So, the fact of living in Zurich and having swiss as corporate official airline pushes to use it at least twice a week (or more if also travelling for personal reasons). So i can say, is never ever on time. There is always something even departing from ‚Äúhome‚Äù airport. Tonight flight to Nice just bits all records. ‚Äúthe flight is here but we dont know where the crew is... the board is empty... 5 mins later oh yes we just knew that crew which will fly there is still flying somewhere else so wait 2 more hours‚Äù. I mean don‚Äôt you have crew on guard at the airport?! And i dont tell the story of last week with flight canceled from Brussels to Zurich with no reason explained! Even low cost airlines flying in batter manner then swiss flag carrier!!

title: A horrible flight with Swiss
review_text: If this was a comedy, it would have been a hit! It seems that whoever designed the interior of Swiss aircrafts tried to cram an extra seat in the economy row: almost impossible to work due to lack of space, food rather bad. Cabin crew and transfer desk incoherent and conflicting communication leading to missed connections. Destroyed luggage upon arrival and a totally unprofessional crew in charge of the boarding gate in Zurich who literally mocked the clients who had to run for their life trying to catch the connecting flight that they never took. A goof of an airline that I leave for the brave only and that I will make my best effort to never try again. My two cent; a bit extra $$$ spent on any other airline (including Air China) is a fairly good investment.

title: Baggage‚Äôs destroyed and customer service sucks!
review_text: Accidents happen,  luggage gets lost and damaged, I get it.  3 weeks ago Swiss air lost our luggage, promised a deliver date, missed,  told me a customer service rep would contact me,  never happened (5 times) luggage arrived,  both shot cases have multiple rips and holes.  The contents,  they opened coffee,  ate candy and left the wrappers inside,  and damaged a laptop because or regulation sized carry on was to big....  I understand things happen.
