This is three weeks later.  I am still waiting on Swiss to call me,  I have filed three claims on their website.   First response was oh well luggage gets lost in the way home isn‚Äôt a problem because you are home.   Second response, go find a luggage repair shop to fix your luggage and submit a bill.  News flash there isn‚Äôt a repair shop in a three hour radius!!!    And the real amazing part they charged us for our luggage that was already paid for) then the rep at the airport billed my credit card $40 extra from the quoted price.  Just help your customer out!

title: Lies, all lies
review_text: I am in the Geneva airport marveling at the fact that my flight to Zurich, scheduled to have departed at 5:45pm, has not arrived by 6pm yet is being shown as ON TIME on all platforms. The smarmy and unapologetic employees will only tell us the plane is "in the air," coming from ... we don't really know. Will we make our connecting flight to Greece? We don't know, and Swiss Air is giving us nothing. They are, in fact, blatantly lying about the flight status. This is a new low in airline service. We'll go EasyJet next time.

title: Great service
review_text: Going to Tokyo from Manchester inevitably involves a connection, and there are worse places than Zurich to do this. Outbound on the second leg we had one of the newly refitted cabins, and very spacious it was too. The food and drinks were good, and the bed was flat and comfortable. The canin crew were attentive without being fussy and the time passed almost too quickly.

title: Very Good Business Class Cabin Experience
review_text:
I have flown Swiss on several occasions, each time in Business Class cabin. This trip was last minute and I literally found seats the day prior to the flight, so I took the last seat available literally! The configuration on the 777-300 is 2-2-2 (though there are a few rows with a 1-2-1). I was the last row and in the middle. This is my least favorite seat, but it was really decent and the rest of the appealing features of flying Swiss made up for it. Under normal circumstance, I would pay the small extra fee to have the lone window seats which afford more privacy.
The seat was comfortable, and even for a 6'2" guy like myself it was sufficiently wide for the 12 hrs flight. When reclined to a bed, its flat, with no bumps and creases and the feet well doesn't tapper too much which is good. There are also a fair number of useful storage areas within the seating are which offer good places to stash your belongings. The overall styling of the cabin is tasteful, and the seat upholstery is fabric which is comfortable and looks stylish.
I am not huge on plane food, so for me the food is always just average, but my steak was okay, and the array of wines etc., was good enough.

title: Bombardier is a nice aircraft. Seating not bad
review_text: Toilets are far too small. The flight attendant gave me a packet of chocolates for my grand daughter. Very nice gesture

title: Pleasant Flight
review_text:
The few times I travel with Swissair are normally good, planes have good leg room and they serve complimentary drink and a snack. Depending on the flight if you get one of their own branded planes then they are quiet new and have a good interior. 
They do contract out some less busy flights where you end up with an older plane but still comfortable. 
As they are part of the Lufthansa group it‚Äôs easy to swap to an alternative route if the flight is delayed/ cancelled which can happen from time to time. 

Z√ºrich airport is easy to get through, security is normally only a 10 minute wait max and passport 5 mins.

title: Wonderful Airline
review_text: This was a wonderful airline to fly. Great customer service! The personal entertainment system worked well, which is very important on such a long flight. Meal/Beverage  service was quick and efficient. Food was very good, for airplane food. Plane was very clean.

title: Nightmare beyond imagination
review_text:
Imagine this: you call swiss airlines a day before your flight to checkin to the flight, they tell you that you can go to the airport and you will be checked in. The day of the flight, you wait 4 hours in the airport for the swiss airline counter to open. After going to the counter you are told that your flight was cancelled! Yeah you‚Äôre stranded in a foreign country with no flight back home and your visa running out. Then you are sent to the ticketing desk where you are told that you can get the same flight flight if you pay $2,400 per person (my ticket was for 2 people) . Running out of options you book a return flight with a different airline for the same day.
After returning home you call swiss airlines to report this and hopefully get some kind of refund or at least an apology, instead the customer service representative tells you it‚Äôs all your fault and they can do nothing to help you. I pray to god I will never have to fly this god awful airline in my life ever.

title: Extrem disappointed
review_text:
The flight was canceled 1 hour prior to boarding. No announcement after and received email saying here are your replacement tickets...
Ok, but why do I have to fly alone via Moscow, my husband via Hongkong and my 2 year old alone via Vienna to Z√ºrich???
The boarding gate crews said I need to talk with Swiss Check In Counter. We followed the crew to re-Enter Japan and pick up the baggages and go to the counter again.
The crew was of course busy with other customers and always on the phone not being able to respond all the customer.
After waiting 3 hours, they suggested to call Swiss Airline customer service through the phone to coordinate our flights.
I tried to call the number which they suggested...again, busy signals for a while.
Finally our line got connected and spoke with the phone center and explained the situation. The operator suggested to fly with Australia air which departures in 1.5 hours from that moment... Well that is such a short notice and they did not even guarantee that my 2 years old can sit next to me or with my husband...
The operator suggested to fly on next day all together with other airline. 
I asked her if the hotel is paid the we can take the next day ticket. The operator said I have to ask the  Checkin Counter for the hotel.
The Check in Clerk said as long as within the budget, they pay the hotel and started to call some hotels.
After back and forth the check in counter and operator conversation for 5 hours, we finally settled down with the next day flight with the hotel paid by Swiss Airline.
Now back in Swiss and claiming the hotel cost etc, Swiss Airline refused to pay the hotel fee...
This is totally wrong. The announcement said this flight cancellation was technical reason so EU regulation should apply.
We have paid more to fly with Swiss Air (direct to NRT) but ended up via other country which was a lot cheaper. This difference is also not paid and the hotel fee which they said that will pay is not paid.
I will never fly with Swiss Airline.

title: Comfortable
review_text: Comfortable flight. Food was terrific, lie flat beds were nice for sleeping. Crew was very friendly and accommodating.

title: A bit pricey, but fantastic service, so no complaints =D
review_text: Unfaultable service all the way ;-) The economy section showed enough leg room to get comfortable and find your spot during the flight ;-) Overall the entire crew was very helpful and friendly =D The food was also well above average, as was the inflight service!!!! The choice of seat was paid for, but a fantastic option =D

title: Unfriendly & fleeting service
review_text:
I flew more than 12 hours from Singapore to Sarajevo, connecting in Zurich. This is my first flying experience with Swiss Air, I have to say, I did have expectations on the inflight service since Switzerland is known for its hospitality.

The flight was delayed, I couldn‚Äôt quite hear what the reason was as the First Officer was mumbling on the PA system. 

20 minutes have passed, water was served, so I thought, that‚Äôs not too bad. 

Finally, the plane took off and there was some ambiguity explanation on will the delay affect passengers with connecting flight. So not much help there. But luckily, when landed, the info. was published on inflight entertainment unit. 

The meals was served past midnight local time, since I couldn‚Äôt sleep, I ate supper. The service was not friendly, quite blunt and no smile. Surprisingly, the crew didn‚Äôt bother to ask but it‚Äôs up to passengers to order. When I asked for a bottle of water so that I can keep myself hydrated, it was begrudgingly given to me. 

Lavatory in the flight was filthy, wet and smelly. Somehow, the basin is tugged into the wall so when I tried to rinse my mouth while brushing teeth, it‚Äôs hard not to get the floor wet. 

During the connecting flight, I was resting my eyes during takeoff. Somehow, the crew managed to zoom past me when serving breakfast. So I didn‚Äôt have anything to eat nor drink. When I use the lavatory, I saw some passengers asking for water, the crew gave a grim face at first, then decided to shut the curtain all together so that nobody can find them. I find this service culture very odd. 

Overall, I didn‚Äôt miss my flight and arrived safely in Sarajevo but on an empty stomach because I didn‚Äôt get much to eat and drink. So much on Swiss hospitality.

title: Very pleasant trip on Swiss to Moscow
review_text: Even in the Economy section enough leg room. Crew very helpful and friendly. Meals above average. Good choice of films and entertainment.

title: Going to London
review_text: I took the cheap one, therefore I can not expect too much about good service, I fly to London one a year to see my friend. Anyway, bad thing about the flight is always delay. The last time was so bad, but this time was only 30 min. delayed.

title: Brief  Holiday in the UK
review_text: There was an online Promotion for Swiss Air tickets and was lucky enough to purchase a return flight ticket for less than USD 500. Email reminders were sent prior to flight date with updated information. Check in was a breeze and the flight itself was extremely comfortable and smooth. There was a delectable selection of meals, fruits and drinks served by very pleasant crew. One of the best take off and landing I have ever experienced. I definitely recommend this flight.

title: Great flight from Munich to Geneva
review_text: Only had one day to spend in Geneva so wanted to get there quickly. It would be 6 hours and expensive to go by train, so chose Swiss Air which was cheaper and only an hour and a half. Wonderful flight, so clean, such nice people, plane only half full. Great trip.

title: Excellence
review_text: The service of Swiss airlines and its crew is beyond excellence...The attention from the flight attendance and the Reservations and the food as well is nothing but thumbs up...It is a must fly Airlines....

title: The worst airline to fly
review_text:
This airline is hands down the worst airline I have flown over and over.  I've flown this leg multiple times and every single time it's miserable. I have never reviewed an airline before but this last trip was so bad that I wanted to speak out.  Here are the chief complaints.
- You can't change your seat - My flight was booked through a travel agency.  It was through a United bid because I can change my United seats but not SWISS.  Every time I go to board it's seat roulette. Sometimes it's an isle, sometimes middle.  The only thing that is consistent is that the representatives at SWISS have absolutely no desire to try and help me change my seat. They are extremely rude. 
- The food is garbage - I have a gluten allergy (not the fake, hey I think it's cool to be gluten free kind). There is no way with my ticket to tell them that I have an allergy so I just have to wait and see what slop they bring then I have to eat usually a garbage salad.  Although the passengers around me always eat about half their meal before getting turned off so I can't imagine it would be great either way. 
- My headsets or screens rarely work - I have flown this leg multiple times and almost every time there is an issue with the entertainment system. This last time I couldn't hear anything. Of course when I asked for a new headset the flight attendant said she would bring me one and never did. 
- The leg room is a joke - I am 6'3" and I can't even touch my knees together when I am in the seat.  This is why an isle seat is so important.  Of course I can't get an isle seat because hey that would be too convenient. 

All in all SWISS is a joke. I recently had the change to book my own flight to Zurich next month and I chose to take a flight with a stop over instead of a direct just so I didn't have to fly the airlines.

title: Service is fantastic
review_text: We are transit from Kuala Lumpur to Singapore via Malaysia Airlines and later 2 times Swiss Airlines from Singapore to Zurich and Zurich to Rome.. Swiss Airlines is fantastic. Seat are spacious. My hubby is a kind of obesity. He need extended seat belt every time sit in MAS or Air Asia. This is first time he no need extended seat belt to sit in. Crew are helpful and also polite.. Overall we are happy with Swiss Airlines

title: Mortifying experience... one of the worst airlines + worst customer service
review_text:
I used to travel a lot with Swiss Air and believed they were amongst best in the business, until they proved me wrong. End of May 2019, I flew with them to Mumbai. The flight was nothing less than a nightmare. Nobody was allowed to check-in (choose a seat) online. Everyone got their seats at the gate, right before entering the flight. The flight was full (which is not their fault) and I got a middle seat. Being claustrophobic, I literally cannot sit in the middle (or in a window seat). The flight staff could not help me with anything; luckily, the person sitting next to me offered me their seat, ending my nightmare. BTW, I had called all possible customer service-lines prior to checkin-in in order to book an aisle seat as I couldn't do it online, but nobody could help me!! Most of them were also very rude :O

Moreover, I had pre-booked gluten-free meals for all my flights, but I was given 'normal' bread on all my flights (to and from Mumbai). Upon asking, the flight attendant told me they were not gluten-free and took them back (all other airlines offer gf bread). I am really really really disappointed with their service. I would give them negative rating, unfortunately, one is the least option available. Cannot believe they used to be one of the best airlines :(

title: Good overall experience
review_text: My first Business Class flight :), so, I can't complain. Great service great food and wine, very nice privacy for 2 people sitting together. If I had 1 small complaint, I would say the seat when it went down to make a bed wasn't soft enough. Different airline on the way back had a separate mattress, these guys could upgrade their bedding a bit.

title: I enjoyed for most part
review_text:
I enjoyed the flight. Entertainment was great, flight attendants walked up and down aisle many times and left water out for the 6 hours they weren't walking.
they Spoke English even when we landed and the hot towels when waking up was a nice touch to customer service. 
They weigh your carry on. Food was very bad! amongst the worst I was ever given (couldn't eat more then a few bites).

title: flight good - food worst ever
review_text:
The flight was perfect - seat was good - but food was sub-standard- worst
airline food ever had - I ordered vegetarian - and the food was not edible-
When I asked what I was eating (as couldn't even figure it out) I was told
"I don't know" - I travel business class all the time and couldn't believe how
bad the lunch and breakfast was - Unfortunately I have my return flight in two days and will be bringing on food - I look foward to that experience as part of my business class flight and therefore won't fly SWISSAIR again -

title: Good luck with your luggage
review_text: Swiss air lost three pieces of luggage during our travel.  I filed a claim two weeks ago.  I have been promised a response to my claim a well ago,  two days ago,  and  today by ‚Äúsupervisors‚Äù.  Swiss continues to not contact me.  During the travel they destroyed three pieces of luggage,  our suitcases are ripped and have multiple holes,  they forced us to check a carry on which now has contents damaged. We were bringing back candy,  they ate the candy and left the wrappers inside the suitcase.  I understand accidents happens but the fact that I have spoke to five supervisors and was promised a response to resolve this issue and nothing has been done is ridiculous!  Also they claimed I needed to pay an extra fee for baggage at the airport then charge my credit card $40 extra!  Swiss,  I am so disappointed that you refuse to acknowledge me and get back to your customer!!!!  Travel with extreme caution!!!! Please respond to my claim 1906-LX-01053.

title: Swift with Swiss
review_text: The staff were very accommodating and efficient which made the journey much easier. The meals were OK. Generous portions though. A wide selection of in flight entertainment as well.

title: Quiet, relaxing and friendly
review_text:
We had a very relaxing flight from Jo'Burg to Zurich yesterday. The weather was calm and the cabin staff very friendly. 
We booked extra seats in the first row of the economy (more space) for EUR 105.00 per seat but that was definitively worth the money. You can stretch your legs same as in business class.

title: Not Bad Airline
review_text: The airlines carried me from Hong Kong to/back Zurich without any hecuup. Crews attitude are satisfactory. Foods are satisfactory too. Leg room of Boeing 777 is quite narrow and not comfortable for a 12 hours flight. However, price is rather competitive.

title: Very Disappointing
review_text: Knowing how the Swiss are so efficient at most everything, we were so disappointed with this experience. First, the gate boarding process was clumsy and confusing. We had to show our boarding pass and passport multiple times with no explanation as to why? Then, at the very last minute, we were told our personal item bags were too big? These bags fit easily under the seat, but we were forced to check these bags anyway. Very frustrating! On board, we experienced technical difficulties with the entertainment system. Overall, not what I expected. If I can avoid Swiss Air in the future, I will!

title: Be careful of connection times
review_text: We travelled economy class Singapore to London and return, via Zurich both ways. The legroom on the long haul flights was poor, something that seems to be happening more and more with all the airlines, Also, the airline headsets were the old style earbud kind, which are not comfortable. Food was OK, with a vegetarian option standard. Staff on the shorter legs were very friendly. The 777 is really noisy.         We booked a through fare from Melbourne and some of  the connections were very short. As we were late into Zurich on the way over and had to change terminals on to London, our luggage didn't make it with us, even though it was Swissair to Swissair. We didn't receive it until late on the arrival day. This can happen, of course, but we'd look for longer connex times in the future.

title: Friendly Professionalism
review_text: Excellent flights both ways via Zurich. Very comfortable long bed, 2 pillows and luxury duvet. Food was excellent ,especially light choice. Great choice of wines, friendly, smart cabin crew.

title: Great
review_text: Flying short distances, also airplanes are smaller. But new and really clean. With enough leg space. Friendly staff, on ground and in the air. Small snacks on the plane, but good. Swiss beer is also good. :)

title: Swiss Int'l Air Lines codeshare with Air Canada
review_text:
Our Swiss flight from Zurich to Johannesburg was half-full (Air bus 340).  Service aboard the flight was average, even though I had booked the wheel chair assistance.   
Had some added comfort, as the seat next to me was vacant (2-seat configuration  per row).  When I was returning, the night before I received a notice on my Iphone that my Swiss flight had been cancelled, due to mechanical issues & was rebooked onto their partnered airline Lufthansia.  I was to fly to Frankfurt instead of Zurich & then catch a 1-hr layover flight back to Zurich to catch my Air Canada flight back to Toronto, a nightmare flight if you have mobility issues to deal with.  I was flying back from Cape Town that early AM.  When I got to Johannesburg, I went to the Swiss Air customer service desk, as I was not allowed to change my flight on-line,  I explained that I knew their were 2-flights per day that leave from Frankfurt to Toronto with AC & if I could be booked on the AM flight, instead of flying back to Zurich.  I got a ticket, an aisle seat, middle-front section on the AM flight from Frankfurt to Toronto with AC.   When I got on the plane, there was only 1-available seat left, a middle seat (right side, front of the aircraft).  I arrived in Toronto the same time as my original AC879 was scheduled to land.

title: business class has class
review_text: Comfortable to the point of feeling guilty for all the poor souls flying regular.  Excellent food and service.

title: Very good service!
review_text: I am beyond impressed with Swiss airlines! First of all, one of the very few European airlines that automatically allow 1 checked in luggage! I was also taken back at the fact that Swiss airlines gave my 6 month old a plush toy!! Most of the other airlines discontinued this!!! It was amazing to see this and my son was so happy with this!!!

title: Surprisingly disappointing
review_text: I lived & worked in Switzerland for several years, made friends there, and have returned on visits fairly frequently (most recently in 2017). It's still the impeccably clean, organized place I've now been familiar with for 50 years. Imagine my surprise when taking a flight to Italy in May of this year, I found myself in one of the most constricted economy seats I've ever experienced (and business class didn't look too appealing either). Imagine also being fed food even more mediocre than on. . . United. This was on a 12 hour journey with uniformly slack, uninterested flight personnel who woke us in the early morning before our arrival & even before serving a horrible breakfast, with---a distribution of Kit-Kat chunky salted caramel fudge bars?! I'm a seasoned international traveller who doesn't carry a chip on her shoulder. However, I'd warn anyone choosing this airline (and unable to afford 1st class) to beware.

title: Not bad
review_text: A first advantage for flying Business Class from San Francisco to Europe is that you can use UA‚Äôs Polaris Lounge at San Francisco International, when waiting for your flight. Located directly behind the security-check area, you‚Äôll find in this lounge a very modern, comfortable and relaxing area with a great variety of (good) food, beverages and a very nice view. SWISS business class is quite good, service is very polite, quick but a little bit distant and reserved. Privacy is not so brilliant coz of the 2-2-2 seat configuration. The food quality is correct but not overwhelming... All in all, we had a quite good flight and experience which will not let us hesitate to fly SWISS again if necessary...

title: Easy flight to Zurich from London City Airport
review_text: Great flight and it's a short one to Zurich.  To my surprise I received a free sandwich, being a short flight I didn't expect that.  The Swiss check-in in Zurich is right next to the airport railway station with direct connections to Zurich so it's very handy.  There was a delay on the way out due to a late incoming flight but as the airport in Zurich has all facilities it was no problem for me.

title: First class service
review_text: I had the pleasure of flying back to the US on Swiss Air first class and everything about the experience was first class. From the lounge in Zurich to my on board greeting to the meal. The wines and champagne served were superb. For a ten hour flight and the flat bed comfort was worth the expense. I rated it a 9 because not everyone can do it. However if you have the means or miles, it‚Äôs well worth it

title: unorganized entry, but overall decent flight
review_text:
Food eh - not great, so bring your own.  Pasta decent - breakfast horrible.
VERY TIGHT SEATS and I'm small - I can't imagine anyone fitting their knees on these planes!!  Screen variety for movies - good, but not great.  HIGHLY unorganized way to board - not by class, row, just one big freakin' line for all economy, so beware.

title: Super flight
review_text:
Because of a delay from SAS we were rebooked to two flights with Swiss Air(Frankfurt - Zurich - Graz). The interior of the planes(bomardier) was outstanding with great space and I felt I was sitting in business class, but it was economy. Flights were on time, no problems.
Service was as expected and we got a swiss chocolate on landing.
Recommended!

title: Excellent service
review_text: Good boarding, great seat (towards the back of the A330), eatable food (which is remarkable in economy), friendly service, arrived on time.

title: Great service and good flight.
review_text: Easy trip made easier by using their App. Professional and friendly service and even an alcoholic drink and cheese roll on a short flight. Would be more than happy to use again.

title: As Always, A 5 Star Experience
review_text: I now travel with Swiss more than any other airline. It is a hassle free and very pleasant experience, particularly in Business Class where there is a choice of two hot main courses, all delicious and served with choice of either Swiss or Italian/Spanish wines of very high quality. The cabin crew member assigned to look after Business does not leave the cabin at any point and so the service is individual and focused on the customer - nothing is missed, glasses are refilled immediately and there is great attention to detail. Their fares are competitive also and Zurich Airport is the best transfer point in Europe, by far.

title: Nightmare - worth reading
review_text: Had a really bad experience going to Russia with Swiss. Had a connection in Geneva where they checked our visas to make sure they were good and we were on our way.  When I arrive at DME there's an issue with my visa and I'm not allowed in the country, they told me I would have to work it out if I wanted to return.  It was approximately 15:00, they told me a rep from Swiss would be coming to put me on a flight at 18:00 to zurich, then to NY and they placed me in a room.  Unfortunately the rep never came, I wasn't being given water and I was starting to get stressed.  Eventually at 19:00 the security guard came and told me I would be put on a flight back to New York the next morning at 9 am and I would be expected to just stay in that room, with no water, until then.  I asked if I bought my own flight if I could leave, he said yes.  So I quickly caught the next flight out of the country, to Baku, where I figured out my visa stuff.  I came back to Russia friday with no problems.  My original return flight was from Bergen Norway, I arrive at that airport a week or so later to find that my return flight had been cancelled.  I had refused the flight back to new york and since I never consented there was no reason that they should have cancelled my return flight.  A very nice woman from SAS called swiss and lufthansa and asked them to do something about it, they refused.  Then I wrote a letter to customer service at swiss and was also told it was my responsibility.  Those two additional flights cost me over $1700, and I'm sure if this were another airline they would've at least given me some sort of credit.  I'm not letting this one go and will keep fighting it until i've received some compensation.  Let me know if anyone has any advice or similar stories.

title: The  reservation system seems outdated, not integrated with partners and call centre are not at right level
review_text:
I was trying to book seats for a party of 4 departing from 2 different airports to go to Cape Town on an Edelweiss charter ,two in business, two in economy with a hope that accumulated miles could be used. In the end, I had to get my travel agent to take care of it. I agree that the set up was a bit complicated but I do feel that the way I was sent from the call centres of miles & more to Swiss to Edelweiss with nobody taking responsibility was a bit too much. We are in 2019, when systems are supposed to be integrated and customer friendly, when call centre staff are expected to take complex calls covering for system short comings, when partners work together to deliver a flawless customer support.
In addition to this, pricing is all over the place. A business travel seat was close to 8 times more expensive than economy. If you get the additional flight from Geneva, the cost is considerably cheaper than the single flight from Zurich.
To add insult to injury, I was finally told that my miles had expired but for some reason they are still reported on my monthly balance.
Really frustrating and definitely not impressed.

title: Family reunion
review_text: Excellent service, airplane very comfortable good room forlegs, the best I have tried so far. Very professional and friendly staffs. üòÅ

title: swiss unaware
review_text: Flight was ok, service was ok, safe flight. SA web site is not user friendly, wasn't working most of the time. When we called to reconfirm, they're systems were down on several occasions. We had our original seat locations charge without explanation.  One bright light was a helpful attendant who assisted with our check-in at the airport. Bottom line is we had a safe on time flight. Check out other options when choosing a light to from Switzerland.

title: Fantastic Flight
review_text: I loved this airline. we had a fantastic flight for a great airfare. The staff was nice and the service was great. In-flight entertainment was awesome. Loved the snacks and wine service. I would highly recommend this airline.

title: Avoid at all costs
review_text:
Flight into Mauritius was 3 hours delayed. Ground staff was not helpful at all. Then in a 10 hour flight they had no veg meals intact just one standard hot dish and were in no way apologetic.
On our way back the gate staff changed our seats randomly and when asked didn‚Äôt care to explain the changes.

title: Great cabin staff taking care of gold member
review_text:
On this flight I was very well taken care of by air hostess, whom able to give me good recomendation on whr to visit and dine in Mallorca . 

Business class between europe country is not like in Asia whr planes are full size or 1990s armchair business class. It is just economy seat wit middle.seat left empty, has  slight more leg room and finer services.

title: First class service when connecting flight delayed
review_text:
We booked to fly from Birmingham to Zurich and then a connecting flight to Montr√©al.  Unfortunately the incoming flight to Birmingham had technical problems, so our flight from Birmingham to Zurich was delayed.  On landing at Zurich, we had 10 minutes before our flight to Montr√©al was due to depart, and we had virtually lost hope that we would catch the flight.

However, the air hostess on the Birmingham flight told us that we would be met - and there was a minibus on the tarmac to take us direct to our connecting flight.  Before leaving the first plane, the driver got into the hold to find our suitcases (which he did).  He then drove us to the connecting flight, put our suitcases on board and escorted us to the Gate.  We boarded the plane, they closed the door, and we took off on time.

We were speaking at a conference the next morning, so we were relieved that we were looked after so well.  A third party has since approached us and said that we would be entitled to compensation for stress!  We were so pleased at the way that the Swiss staff looked after us, we declined to press for compensation.

title: Quality and comfort, solo traveller choose seat carefully!
review_text:
Swiss business claaa cabin is designed to feel quite humanised and to be at home with touch of natrual wood, cute lampshade and functional cabby holes whr their should be.

The cabin has a seating configuration with a dual window seats which doesn't allow window seat passenger to climb out to use bathroom without bothering a fella passenger. Unlike many other airlines the seating plan allow this freedom. Its ok if u travel as two but troubling if u travelling solo. 

In flight meal choices were swiss focus or western only. A lot of rich sauces and great protien prepared and served perfectly pink and tender- this is consistent on all of Swiss flights I must admit.

(Only other two airlines I flown which served beef cooked well-done with a shade of pink are ANA and Turkish- but still not always)

title: Just the best airline
review_text: Excellent valued service, professional staff, new aircraft, clean, excellent service. The leg room was above average, the traditional Swiss chocolate very much appreciated. Beat all low cost airlines, with a ticket price very competitive.

title: SERIOUSLY BAD ACROSS ALL ASPECTS!!!
review_text:
Never again...

First impressions count... And mine of SWISS AIRLINES (HELVETIC) were in a word.. BAD!

Staff apearance/presentation was poor; most in need of an pressed/ironed shirt or blouse and neatly groomed hair.

Staff attentiveness was in general very lacking and when in evidence was for the most part 'ungenuine'. Body language and periodic frowns and miserable faces could be seen. 

After a simple and friendly attempt to 'break the ice' and gain a little interest/attention from one male flight attendant; which failed and resulted in me letting him know I found him dismissive, even rude... I was immediately treated with him calling the police for when the plane landed. And this threat made infront of other dismayed passengers.

I was made to feel scared, bullied, profiled and extremely vulnerable to the suggestion my comment/behaviour warranted being arrested on arrival once the plane landed. 

I saw this as provocative and a serious abuse of power by a cabin member who was rightly told he was being rude. 

Needless to say I walked away immediately and duly reported him to the head cabin crew, who although seemingly understanding clearly saw the incident as not significant. 

Shock horror!!!!..for the remaining part of my flight I say numb, sickened and perplexed by what happened. 

EVEN my next flight from Zurich to Birmingham UK failed to impress. 

Clearly there is a seriously questionable institional staff culture within SWISS AIR that rightly places it well behind the likes of Emirates, Cathay Pacific etc...

Me? Never again with SWISS AIRLINES!!!!

title: Nice Travel
review_text: We travelled to USA through Swiss Air via Zurich and returned from NY via same stopover. The airline service was pretty ontime, except delay of one hour caused by stoppage of Pakistan airspace for India bound flights. Their in flight service was pretty good, food and beverages was excellent. Crews were charming, courteous and professional.

title: Very good service.Food quality. On time
review_text:
Very supportive cabin crew, Food served good. . But charged for sprits and wine 
Leg space in the economy class seats are ok compared to som e other air lines.
Luggage management were good.

title: Thieves and disrepect towards people
review_text:
Items stolen from baggage, including some cash which was kept between clothes ( meaning they thoroughly check your locked bags).
Despite having a confirmed ticket and boarding pass, they offload you stating "over booked", I'm sure they probably sold my ticket at a higher price to another customer.
And literally I had to beg them to put me on another flight, making the total travel time 30+ hrs. And they will not do anything to comfort you, by offering any meals or lounge services, for the problems they cause. 
Totally unprofessional and pathetic service. At this rate, it won't be long before they shut down services or sell to a middle east airline group!

title: Very good airline
review_text: This is very good airline, food onboard was delicious, better than emirates or qatar. Alcoholic and non-alcoholic beverage are included. We had good short connections between flights.  Only disadvantage is space between seats.

title: One of the few flights that was only 20% full
review_text: Flight was only 20% full so lots of room to spread out and be comfortable.  Service was performed often and while the two meals weren't great, they were better than the average airline meal these days.

title: Failed transfer of our bags and now nobody cares.
review_text: Flew Swiss Air from Chicago to Rome via Zurich. They did not build enough time in Zurich to Rome to get our bags on the plane. Because it was the early flight from Zurich to Rome they should have had plenty of time to get it resolved by putting‚Äã our bags on one of two of the next flights the same day. This would have made the situation just a hassle and inconvenience, instead now they have messed that up and nobody cares. Phone numbers are turned off after 8, the one number that you can talk to somebody they just don't care. Dinner plans the first night have been ruined because of no clothes and now our plans for the next day is lost due to not having clothes plus the fact there are medicines and basic necessities that we do not have. The luggage is not lost, we were told it was sent on to Rome, but they have chosen not to deliver it to us by being so incompetent. Crew on flight was great, too bad the rest of the business is a mess. Strongly recommend against Swiss Air for travel to Europe. Ironically it is their timing and attention to detail that is totally messed up.

title: Home Airline
review_text:
What a friendly welcome. a quick glance around and the flight attendant helped me with my carry on bags. The second pillow I requested was brought right away. And so on during the whole flight. The washrooms are checked regularly by the flight attendants, toilet paper and paper towels are immediately replaced. 
The food was good, I didn't expect a 5-star dinner, and didn't get one, but it was adequate. The wines were good and served in a friendly, professional way.
I had a good long sleep thanks to the comfortable and roomy seats.
I hope I never have to fly with any other airline than Swiss.

title: Swiss quality
review_text: Every time when I fly with Swiss, I get a great experience. The crew is really kind and the meals are delicious. I hope to fly with them soon.

title: Never again
review_text:
Absolutely worst airline . 12 hour flight no entertainment. Nothing working and even the steward said to complain as this plane had lots of issues and they knew before we even took off that there was no entertainment working . Not even a decent magazine to read . 
Lost our luggage twice . Had to fly with Swiss again during the holiday to Delhi and they were running late and bags missed flight . 
Appalling follow up to my complaint and no offer of compensation. 
Would not fly again with them .

title: Great flight
review_text: Had a great flight my wife and I had the first row bulkhead seats on the 2 seat side plenty of extra foot and storage space.  We pre ordered and paid for upgraded meals they worth the splurge I had the Swiss meal she had the healthy meal.

title: Reliable SWISS
review_text: I just flew back and forth from TLV to ZRH. Flew out from TLV on a Friday afternoon. No orthodox on the plane and in the back  there were empty seats. You could stretch out which is a  unique opportunity on the packed Triple Seven. Back from ZRH on  Sunday morning, the plane was fully packed. In both cases, the service is friendly and reliable.  I detest airplane meals and tend to equip myself with  sandwiches. In this case helped myself just with  the offered rolls and butter. It was Shimon Peres who, when asked what was his best meal in the numerous restaurants that he visited all over the globe, said that his best meal  is plain bread and butter. Planes left on time and landed on schedule.

title: Untrustworthy customer care
review_text: This is not about seat comfort, cabin Staff service, food & beverages, etc. We had missed a flight and then had to purchase a ticket from Zurich airport, Swiss airline counter. They mentioned that they are going to email our receipts, and didn't get back to us. We called several times so far spending heaps of international call charges. Every time they just say they are going to email it to us. However, nearly a month gone and we still didn't get our receipts. So untrustworthy customer care! We could not claim 1200 AUD tickets from the insurance without these tickets. Frustated! Be careful if you buy tickets from that counter. Don't leave the counter till you get your receipts...

title: 3.5 hours late
review_text:
Our flight was 3.5 hours late which was understandable.  At the gate in Los Angeles,
a customer service rep waited for us.  He told us 100% wrong information.  After going to 3 different airlines, I was able to sort it out.  Also, they didn't arrange to pay the hotel
like the promised upon landing.

title: SWISS AIR WAS HORRIBLE
review_text: HORRIBLE. Will never fly with Swiss again. I‚Äôve traveled near and far and every other airline I‚Äôve ever been on has had impeccable customer service in times of trouble. I flew from Amsterdam to Zurich today and my bag was lost somehow (even thought it was a direct flight only lasting an hour and my traveling companion‚Äôs bag was received immediately). When I first approached the customer service rep in Zurich airport baggage claim she was rude, unaccommodating and unapologetic. She offered no help in mending the situation. I am now in Switzerland with zero belongings, besides the books and charging cables which were in my carry on. After fussing with service reps I was told to file a report. Finally the bag was located STILL IN AMSTERDAM airport! The bag contained thousands of dollars of belonging and somehow SWISS is allowed to have a policy that only issues $100 of replacements to passengers flying in economy, BUT issues $300 to those in first class. ABSURD. I have been on and off the phone all day, completely ruined/wasted a day of my vacation, have been offered no reparations for the airlines mistake and here I am 12 hours later still waiting to find out when I will get my bag back and how. The worst experience I‚Äôve ever had while traveling and I will not advise anyone to use Swiss air again. There are far better airlines that have higher focus on customer service and are more apologetic for their mistakes as well as try to help you in mending them. I am not angry that the bag was lost, as I understand this is a risk any traveler takes when checking a bag however I am irate in the way it was handled both in the airport and on the customer service phone lines throughout the day. Also a $100 stipend could buy me a new pair of sandals and a bra here in Switzerland, an outrageous offering from a multi billion dollar company that obviously cares little about customer comfort and satisfaction. Hopefully my bag turns up soon. Do not check bags with Swiss air unless you fully understand their ridiculous policy surrounding reparations for lost baggage. I wish I hadn‚Äôt. I wish there were a zero star option

title: Zurich lounge worst food in industry
review_text: The food service at the Zurich lounge by the E gates was the worst I have encountered in several years.  My Swiss Air flight was delayed 4 hours so I thought I would at least have some decent food while waiting in the business lounge, or even some nice Swiss cheese and crackers.  Banish the thought.  There was some cheap white and red wine, along with ordinary beer.  There was no cheese, no crackers, no fresh fruit other than bananas.  They had some rolls that were edible.  There is a cook station serving up deep-fried glop.  My empty beer bottle and glass has been next to me on the counter for two hours now.  Perhaps next year someone will stop by and pick it up.

title: SWISS INTERNATIONAL AIRLINE
review_text: SWISS AIRLINE has also been considered as one the top airlines in Europe. The service is Good. The airplane is a bit Old But comfortable. The seats are good and legroom is good. The food is acceptable, BUT can be improved! The beverages is acceptable AGAIN can be improved both in choice and quality! The in cabin service is good. The staff are more seniors than some of the Asean airlines. The airlines DON'T provide over night items (slippers, eye mask, tooth brush...etc) as with MOST Western airlines for the Y-Class; UNLIKE Most Asean airlines, making this a NORM, REGARDLESS of CLASS! SO Do bring your own tooth brush, slippers...etc when You fly WEST !!!

title: Perfection
review_text:
I flew the newly refurbished A340 on this long flight to Japan. The new cabin offers a large personal space with separation walls that don‚Äôt cause claustrophobia. The seats are large, multi adjustable and the entertainment is flawless.
The service on board as good as I have seen. This flight was part of one of the 4 specials, featuring sushi and a wide selection of caviars.
The inflight staff is highly professional yet personable, as usual at Swiss. A very pleasant combination.
The bed, with extra mattress and duvet and a fluffy pillow, combined with Zimmerli quality pyjamas make the rest very comfortable.
The only thing to criticise is, by new Swiss regulations, a blueish light stays on during the night. That makes sleeping a little more difficult.
Thank you!

title: Still a good airline, but the food level has been lowered
review_text:
"In this month we serve vegetarian food" NO, in this month Swiss Air save money...

Good service level, and friendliness.

Punctual aswell as very clean.

A higher level of gastronomy, please.

Otherwise Swiss has very good connections.

title: Mr
review_text:
The business class seats on the old airbus operated on this route are unacceptable. The seat is not worth the money. I cannot recline without turning on my side.
Worst flight since the last flight I had on Swiss. Reading all their advertising I had incorrectly assumed the planes had been upgraded. 
The connecting flight to Palermo was better than my airline of choice, Air France KLM so I thought to give Swiss another try. It was a mistake, and I am dreading the return flight.

title: Comfortable
review_text:
First time we had used Swiss we booked seats and then got an email couple of days before saying our seats had changed so I checked online and they had given us new seats across the isle from each other with empty ones next to us I always thought the Swiss were efficient!! I changed one so we sat side by side for both outward and return journeys not the best of starts.  The outbound flight loaded on time and then there was an announcement that we would be delayed for an hour luckily it was not that long before we were found a take off slot and we were on our way.  Soon a free croissant and drink arrived followed by chocolate which was nice.  Seats comfortable with enough legroom, drop down tray and good magazine. The plane was clean.
Return boarded on time departed straight away again clean comfortable plane free drinks and sandwich + chocolate. Very nice efficient staff both ways. Both landings a bit rough possibly because plane long and thin not sure but didn‚Äôt expect it to be so rough

title: Not impressed
review_text: I spent extra to get a comfort seat in economy and was next to a mommy with two children. A bassinet was attached in front which was directly also in front of me. It blocked all the comfort which I had paid extra for. The food was mean - only one small dinner and two bread rolls. They ran out of sparkling wine and gin for fin and tonic - very old plane

title: Professional
review_text: Fast check in, Launch Open and nicely equipped, professional welcome in the cabin with professional staff.

title: Will Never book again
review_text: This airline has cost me valuable time, they cancelled the flight from Cancun to Munich on may 30 and changed it to May 31 without an explanation. I supposed to pick up my family on Munich on the 31 and my daughter on the 1st in Nuremberg now the whole plan is ruined as I cannot be in two places at once, thanks swiss airlines. Oh and by the way they wouldn't assist with flight changes they said we had to call the travel agency to change the flight. Well guess what you cancelled not the travel agency so you fix it. Never will I ever flight with you all. Worthless.

title: Wonderful staff, accommodations but
review_text: Flew from US/Tampa nonstop to Zurick, nice plane//staff. Then took shorter flight  to Barcelona, where some food offering did not agree. On return flight, now from Venice to Zurick tho Tampa, sick again after short hope to Venice. Besides an obvious dietary issue??, the plane/crew was great..

title: Smooth flight
review_text: Quick smooth flight from Madrid to Zurich. The only problem was having to circle in Zurich because of heavy air traffic. I was a little nervous about catching the connecting flight but everything worked out ok. Also, we exited the plane directly onto the tarmac to catch a shuttle to the terminal.

title: Changed
review_text: Been flying to gva from lcy for many years and always loved flying with Swiss . Enjoyed a free coffee and snack , it made them different from the rest. However this has now been stopped and you have to buy your drinks and snack and all you get is a cup of water pored from a warm open bottle.. it‚Äôs a real shame as it made the flight special and different from the low cost carriers. Up your price by ¬£5 and include this little gesture. Maybe this is why both my flights were half empty at a time they should be fully booked

title: Flight Diversion and Abandoned Passengers
review_text: This flight was an absolute nightmare! As we approached Florence the captain announced that, due to rain and wind, we were diverting to Pisa. The gentleman sitting next to us, obviously a regular on this route,  rolled his eyes and told us that Swiss always does this. He said they are the only airline that frequently does this. We were told that there would be buses available to transport us to Florence. When we arrived at Pisa airport the captain and crew said goodbye -- they should also have said "good luck, you're on your own now". There was absolutely no one at the terminal to give us any direction. We all  picked up our bags and assembled at a main exit, waiting for someone to give us direction.  After an hour there were no buses and no one had come to help us. Finally, someone saw two tour buses parked several hundred meters away on the parking lot. These buses were closed, with no lights or drivers visible, but we all walked in the pouring rain and assembled by these two coaches, hopeful but uncertain that these were ours. Finally two drivers strolled over, climbed in the buses and started the engines. Then it was a free for all! Everyone ran to the buses, where we had to open the luggage bins ourselves and load our bags underneath the coach.  For some seniors this was a terrible ordeal so I, and others. had to climb into the bins to help load and  organize the bags. The drive to Florence airport took over an hour and, once there, we were dropped off at the taxi queue and waited  another half hour to get cabs. By the time we arrived at our hotel it was 10:00 PM, almost four hours late. We will never, ever fly Swiss again!

title: Perfect Flight
review_text:
Very Good airline.
I travelled for the first time, I did my online check in first hence did not have to stand in a que for the boarding passes. The flight was perfect on time and reached Zurich 10 mins before time.
The food quality was good.
Good leg space and quality of seats.

Con: if you try & select seat prior to online check in then you need to pay approx 2500 Inr extra per seat. This is bit weird as Swiss airline is not a cheap option.

title: An exellent fligth
review_text: The  flight was very good. The service in the cabin was exellent. The movies was interesting. Time passing and we were at Los Aggeles on time. The transfering from the airport to our hotel was exellent. The driver of the van Mr. Eliseu Caleli was a kindness person.He offer us all the efforts he could.

title: If it weren't for the status miles...
review_text:
My third long-distance business flight with Swiss International Air Lines. I sincerely hope it will be my last.

Don't get me wrong. The staff were excellent. Friendly, fluent in English, and always available when one needed them. Nothing to complain about.

And that is really the only good thing to said about this flight. The lounge was good, but it is not a Swiss lounge.

The plane was vintage. As in "late 1990s, and never cleaned since then." Dirty seat and tiny, broken video screen included. Legroom was all right, but not great. 

The food was horrendous. I typically delight in writing glowing reviews of good restaurants (or in-flight entertainment). But this was simply atrocious. Let the pictures speak for themselves. 

If you absolutely need the status miles, fly Swiss. But prepare for the worst.

Otherwise, by all means use another airline. You will get better value for money.

title: Horrible people
review_text: Nice planes, very good lounges. I fly over 200 flight a year with Star Alliance and I can say that the gate people are the nastiest, most disrespectful, most arrogant people in the whole group. They have proven themselves to lie and exercise no judgement at all. Horrible bunch. They truly truly represent the airline extremely badly. I flew today mid day, the misrepresented a situation, lied, and made it clear to me the could. Or possibly care less. Distasteful. Lufthansa and United are so so much better. Buy your tickets through then instead. This airline should be, must be, better than this .. and spend time listening to their high frequency fliers. I don‚Äôt have the power to truly hurt them financially but, I will do my small share, but not allowing the 180 people I oversees to buy tickets through them. Small but only fair step I can take.

title: Brief trip to Poland
review_text: Swiss was really amazing. Everything was perfect- the crew were really polite and helpful and were extra cautious concerning the security. Landing as well as take off was very smooth. Food was indeed excellent! Very happy with Swiss air! I definitely recommend flying with Swiss air!

title: Short hop to Porto
review_text:
Short hop to Porto, boarding and on board service was excellent, plane is very comfortable.
Staff were excellent, service was on time both ways, very inexpensive

title: good flying for short distances
review_text: Short trip to Venice, what 9i like about the Swiss Airlines is that i always have plenty of leg space and ofcourse the chocolats...

title: Excellent aviation company!
review_text:
I had an excellent flight. Departure on time, arrival on time. This allowed me to reach an important meeting scheduled one hour after my arrival.
Excellent service for the arrival business passengers.

title: On time nice cabin crew
review_text:
As said in title mostly on time we are flying this route every six weeks and always good experience flying Swiss which we always fly also on our other flights when possible.
The last three times however we always have to checkin at the airport because automatic checkin and online is not working.
Complaining with Swiss is a complain worth by it self that is really a shame luckily there is not much to complain üò≥.

title: 10 across in Economy is not the ideal arrangement for B777 long haul.
review_text: Of paramount concern on long haul flying is some riggle room and fair leg space. SWISSAIR service was great and meals were served promptly and with free drink.  However economy seats on B777 were same size you find on a B737 and very little tilt.  Entertainment was fair but music choice limited. Plane was clean,toilets kept clean during flight but next time I codeshare on an SQ ticket it will not be on Swissair.

title: PUNCTUALITY AND COMFORT
review_text:
Great experience flying swiss air..we had seats in the premium economy class seats J K 23
and i found my seat broken before take off..the crew could not do anything at that moment ,the flight was ready and full..but the cabin crew and the team ,,resolved the issue for us in a very amicable manner..and we were satisfied ..flying happily...Thanks to the crew and the team ..

title: Seating comfort for 12 Hour Flight - Terrible
review_text:
Yes it was economy and very near the front of economy but the leg room was terrible.

My wife isn't tall and her knees were basically against the seat in front - not a good long hall choice

title: Tight seats even with extra legroom at exit row
review_text: Service and meals are very good.   On time departure and landing.  Extra legroom is a must but the seats are too tight even for a medium built person.

title: Swiss is going downhill
review_text: Our return flight was delayed for 4 hours due to a mechanical issue. Had to wait for another plane. Paid for extra legroom seats in the exit aisle($460.00). We were charged another $100.00 for some unexplained reason. The Swiss service person we called said they couldn't find the extra charge in their system, but it said Swiss New York on our credit card statement. Service charge for calling customer service? Beware of extra charges on your credit card from Swiss.

title: Swiss precision out of order
review_text: Flying with Swiss Airlines is not a to be missed experience. It is a average flight with that experience and service. Personal is more busy with themselves. However we only lost 15 minutes of the transit time. Curious for the long flight to Singapore

title: Great Business Class Service!
review_text: I travelled on Business Class Budapest- Zurique-Porto. It was fantastic. Zurique - Porto, the flight attendant was the nicest I have every found. The service at the lounges was also pretty good! Sometimes the price of Business is just a little bit more than economy and is totally worth it, especially if you have stops, you can use the lounges.

title: Good flight but boarding was dreadful
review_text: Awful boarding system in Zurich airport. Queue up at the gate to show your passport then sit back down only to queue again to board the plane. An absolute shambles. In saying that the flight was perfectly fine with once again very pleasant crew and complimentary snack and drink. Would fly with them again if I once again got such a good deal on the flight.

title: Very pleasant flight. Seat allocation is a nightmare.
review_text:
Boarding was swift and crew were extremely friendly. A small snack and drink was served mid-flight along with a chocolate which was all complimentary. A nice change for short haul economy flights in Europe. Would fly with them again.

Now for the bad....3 times Swiss changed our seats before we actually took the flight. We booked months in advance but later learned that seat selection is not guaranteed. I ended up ringing three times to sort this out.

title: Family trip from Mumbai to Zurich
review_text: Commencing with the check-in dest - nothing but courteous and swift.  Absolutely clean and such comfortable seats although we were in economy class.  The food served nothing but delicious with vegetarian options.  The on board airline staff was very considerate and courteous.  The actualy flight was so smooth. I have flown many airlines but I would rate Swiss as one of the best.

title: Kind and helpful
review_text: Passed so easy, the food was good and tasty, for flight food. The transition was smooth and the staff understanding.

title: Okay
review_text: Not the best not the worst. Not on time. We had a major delay given the fact that we had to change planes in Zurich. The crew was very okay, the snack a snack cold bread with cheese also to cold and some spread. Also not the worst and not the best.

title: Swiss ruined my two days
review_text:
1 - they were late.
2 - they lost my bags
3 - the whole next day I didn‚Äôt get my luggage
4 - when i called their customer service i received no help and a fake number to call

title: The absolute bliss!
review_text: If you want to start your vacation early, then start with a good airline like the Swiss. The hassle finishes at the airport- and Voila. From Service to amenities, room to programmes, food, drinks‚Ä¶ OHH I wish I could fly 1st all the time. My usual is business but there is loads of difference between 1st and Business class.

title: Short And Economical Flight
review_text: The flight was generally pleasant. There was a cheese sandwich that was served to us during the flight and it was fairly tasty. The flight gave me enough leg space, the landing was fairly steady too.

title: All fine until you have an issue... The crew nice but the desk clerks are a shame...
review_text:
I had an issue at the airport then I had arrived at the gate 8 minutes before the plain has to leave. First in an awful tone one of the clerks lie to me saying is too late the plain had gone (when I could see the plane in the back with the boarding stuff on it) she did not give the option to ask the captain in order to see if he let me in. 
After that I went to another desk to see what the airline could do for me; first, the clerk the only thing that said over and over again is "Your flight had arrived with enough time to you get your connection on time (What a new! I mean I had never stated that the flight had arrived late, I told her I had arrived minutes ago to the gate because I had an issue (10 minutes lost in nothing, also I was able to see that the plane I had to get was not leave yet) 
Ok, they send me outside in order to book another flight, the clerk (as the other ones) looked at me and said that if I want to get another flight I will need to pay because all was my fault (Once again I had never said was the airline fault, for sure were my fault I booked with them for the first instance)
In the end the clerk only could book me flights in dates that are out of my needs; so I asked her to look if there is another airline that has flights to my last destiny, she looked at me and draw a little smile saying "if you fly with us you need to pay little amount, but if you go to another airline they will give you a ticket but for a price you could not get the ticket" (I mean how much could be that 10 billion dollars or something. How she knows I could not afford to pay a ticket?) She told me Iberia, Air France, and British Airways could have tickets, but she could not buy them for me (normal, because she is from another airline) When I went out from the desk, I told her to thank you and I will go to the other airlines and she got back to me with "I will wait for you, when you could not book in another airline". In the end, thank God Iberia and British Airways have flights and the better one was Iberia, so I booked my flight and came back to my country. 
What annoyed me the most is not that I had to book another flight, what really got me on my nerved is that the staff lied to me and try to belittle me.
The last thing I would do in my life is to book another flight with this airline that has a "customer service" that try to blame instead of help, and then try to humiliate the customer just because they think we do not have the money to pay a service. I guess that I will fly with this airline if there is ANY other that offer the connection I need (Hope to not need it) 
And please people do not save 100$ in a ticket, use an airline that not only provides you with a good service on board, in the end when a customer has a problem is when we need GOOD SERVICE... (Not lies, or judgemental staff) By the way all the issues started when they were unable to give me a boarding pass (that simple)

title: Extremely overrated
review_text:
It was the first time I fly Swiss and I was extremely excited 
But the old plane and the food came as a huge disappointment
The flight attendants were very nice and the plane was clean 
A huge plus was the Swiss chocolate offered just before landing

title: Short International flight option
review_text:
We used Swiss airlines for our trio in May 2019. We chose this airline because it had the shortest layover in comparison to other airlines. It was my first time flying with swiss. It is a good flight is your flight duration is short. The seats are really uncomfortable and close to each other. take your own entertainment as they have like 22 movies all outdated - not good quality. The meals on board are standard however if you compare to emirates you see the vast difference in service. The second flight from Zurich was more comfortable and we even had food on the short flight which was a bonus. 

Will probably use this airline again for short flights. 

Hope this helps.

title: Not the airline for anyone over 6 ft tall
review_text: Space between the seats on the Swiss Air A320 is the smallest I have come across in my travels.  Even most discount and charter airlines offer more space.  Definitely will not travel Swiss Air again.

title: A  Nice Flight by LX 964 SWISS
review_text: I flew from Zurich to Berlin on 13 May 19 by LX 964 SWISS Flight. The flight was delayed by 45 minutes. However, in-flight services were simply excellent. They provided food and drinks during the flight. The take off and landing was smooth. Look forward to fly again with Swiss Air.

title: Nice Flight but watch the connection
review_text: We flew during the day.  Our previous flight was an overnight so I was wondering how much food would be served.  The flight as usual was very nice.  I appreciate the vegetarian options in the menu and the food is not bad.  Instead of a large evening meal and breakfast,  we were served a large lunch and a few smaller snacks.  Frequent drink service is awesome and so are the little Swiss chocolate bars.  The inflight movies are up to date with a lot of choices.  Our connecting flight from Nice was late however forcing us to sprint across the airport.  It is a long way from the arrival gates to the departure gates.

title: Limited variety of shows
review_text:
Bread is tasty. The headrest can be bent, making the neck more comfortable. 

Not many mainstream shows to select. No Harry Potter series, Hobbit series, or movies for children.

title: Comfortable flight, good food.
review_text: Great service, food is very good. Boarding time is quick and efficient. The plane is clean and service is prompt and courteous.

title: Not what you may expect from legendary Swiss quality
review_text:
I was traveling on a business trip to Poland flying to Cracow from NYC with the LOT Polish Airlines. My return flight was from Warsaw thru Zurich and back to NYC. It was my first time flying with Swiss, I usually fly either with Lufthansa or LOT on my trips to Poland. Although the Warsaw to Zurich is a short flight when you don't expect anything extraordinary from any airlines, the leg from Zurich to NYC was a pretty disappointing experience. I was seated in the 42E seat at the back of the aircraft (A 330)where the middle row narrows from 4 to 3 abreast. The seat was EXTREMELY narrow and tight, I had to literally squeeze myself into it with absolutely no room on either side and without any chance to shift even in the slightest. I am noty a particularly big man, wearing 38 size pants and being 5:10 tall. This was probably the most uncomfortable seat I have ever been on a long distance flight, far worse from either Lufthansa or LOT. during the flight I was planing to do some work, but it was impossible to open even a 15-inch laptop, so I had to abandon that before I even started.
Food that we were offered was only a vegetarian meal, and being a Texan it is not my particular kind at all, I do understand that some people are veggie-eaters but still vast majority aren't. Very disappointing. On the bright side, flight attendants were very polite, professional and attentive, entertainment and movie choice was satisfactory, and the  aircraft looked clean and well maintained on the outside and inside.
Overall, I was pretty disappointed, because this was not a quality of flight I was expecting from a Swiss company. I will not recommend Swiss for a long-haul flights and will stick with LOT or Lufthansa for my trips to Poland in the future, since I know already what to expect from both.

title: Amazing team
review_text: Super team and amazing cabin crew, food is great but please improve alcohol list in flight as per first class, please serve dom perignion insted of Lp and blue label or royal salute insted of chivas 18,

title: Poor customer service.
review_text:
Swiss air reschedules their flights constantly and don't take care of the passagers. 
When this happened to me, the only solution I was offer was to wait in the airport for six hours after 23 hour spent on plains. On my request to get the access to the lounge,  I've been told it's only for the first class passangers. I was flexible with the flight time and asked to look at multiple alternatives and to all offered options I received negative reply. 
Customer service is at a very low level and company's policy is unclear.
Be careful when choosing to fly with this airline.

title: lovely travelling Swiss
review_text:
Nice experience travelling Swiss once I had left the terrible Berlin Tegal airport

Swiss service and of food/drinks was fine

title: Uncomfortable
review_text:
The fly was ok. The staff were nice. 
But there were not too much space for legs. I¬¥m short, so it was uncomfortable for a trip that took almost 11 hours.

title: Nice travel
review_text:
I was happy to flight with this company. All fine. The screen and the equipment were new.
I'm really recommended this company.

title: Good for midgets
review_text:
My ‚Äúthree‚Äù is because the first plane was very, very uncomfortable.

The price was right and Swiss Air is a dependable airline. We flew from Boston to Zurich on a plane that felt more like a sardine can than usual. I am 5‚Äô4‚Äù and wear a size 00 and had no extra room in my seat, even at my shoulders. There is no leg room to speak of (audio equipment under the seats takes up lots of space) and the main aisle is so narrow there is room for one person to walk at a time.

The flight instead from Zurich to Venice was much more comfortable, but is a very short flight!!

title: Attentive Staff
review_text: Friendly, attentive staff that will try to accommodate your request. The small touches go a long way, such as the warm hand towels, the extra snack and chocolate. For economy seating, everything felt more comfortable. I fly Swiss whenever possible because I know that I will not be disappointed.

title: Flight SFO-ZRH, Swiss economy
review_text: little legspace in economy, uncomfortable seats, good food, nice interior design, however compared to other airlines i recently flew with (Air France, United) the comfort in economy is very poor. i would not choose Swiss again

title: Great service!
review_text: This was the first time we flew Swiss Air and we were very happy. Comfortable seats, very good three course dinner and attentive and friendly service. And the Swiss Lounge in Zurich was very quiet and served good food as well as nice wines.

title: Flight very confortable and good price
review_text: I bought the ticket using web site of Lufthansa.com go light with only one handbag 8 kgs. But you can also carry with you a little personal bag. Price was good, and seat very confortable. Only thing I had to wait 5 hours in zurigh for the connection but was up to the schedule. On board they provide a soft drink and 1 Swiss chocolate little tablet. From zurigh to Thessaloniki also was provided a salty vegetable pastry. The seat is very confortable and enough space for legs. The hand baggage space is good. The airplane was really well cleaned. You must be careful because especially in Zurich they carefully check weight and dimension of hand luggage but in case you have extra limited weight they do not charge you but put the luggage for free in the air as normal luggage.. Only disadvantage to go to wait for your luggage. All together a very pleasant experience at a very good price. If I will find good occasion I will use again Swiss Air.

title: Like clockwork
review_text:
Aircraft 737, 777,350
Ground crew at all airports efficient and friendly. Allowed into lounge at Geneva no extra cost probably because of not many on flight and 2hrs hanging around before flight to RSA.
Aircrew and onboard all flights very helpful attentive and friendly 
Transits between Geneva to RSA smooth and without problems.
Food very good
Entertainment good 
Everything onboard just exuded Swiss proficiencies.

title: Thank you SwissAir!
review_text:
Thank you SwissAir for holding the plane in Zurich until all connecting passengers arrived!   Haven't seen that since the 80's.   Strike in France had delayed our first flight from France and we would not have made the connection in Zurich for our flight home to the US if they didn't hold the plane.  Also appreciated the crew  providing a drink service while we all had to wait for another hour+ on the plane once the doors were closed for the restricted air space over France to clear.  

Sadly, tight legroom, very uncomfortable seat when in upright position, and once in recline, the seat in front of you really encroaches on your space. but the other factors overrode these concerns.  

Friendly, attentive service, plus had the best airplane meal ‚Äì it was vegetarian month and a special meal was ‚ÄúCreated by Hiltl‚Äù a family owned business founded in 1898 in Zurich.  In fact SwissAir always provides a vegetarian option that is not limited to pasta.

Will certainly look to SwissAir again for international travel.

title: Proper national carrier
review_text: Swiss is one of the last proper national carriers. Enough legroom, on time departure, snack and beverage (incl alcohol) and Swiss chocolate. We got Movenpick ice cream this time! I do not enjoy when it is operated on old Helvetica planes but still better than BA who give you nothing complementary to enjoy!

title: Exceeded expectations
review_text:
This was a typical European short haul with business class simply standard seats with each centre seat left vacant, actually the pitch was fine and  it was perfectly comfortable for 2 hours.

The FAs  and catering were nothing short of fantastic. Great coffee and a small snack of savouries and a sweet, all remarkably good. Then a piece of of chocolate marked ‚Äúthank you‚Äù - thank you too Swiss, top notch.

title: Of The Highest Standard
review_text:
The Service was impeccable on both flights, Johannesburg to Zurich and Zurich to Malaga.

Our two cats fly in the cargo section of the same aircraft as us and they arrived safely too.

title: Chocolates sweeten the deal
review_text: As silly as it sounds the swiss chocolate freebies after the flight really turned an ordinary flight into something memorable. Quite divine chocolate! For a short flight service was up to scratch. Hand luggage restrictions were a bit much however.

title: On Time!
review_text: The flight ‚úàÔ∏è was good,on time and the food was very good!The service was good.The crew was actually having a happy time serving the passengers.

title: Throne seat!
review_text: A333 ZRH-YUL in 10A.  Traveling  with my partner we were originally seated in 7AC together.  The most private Business class seats are kept reserved for Swiss‚Äô most loyal customers (HIN) so can‚Äôt be booked unless you pay a few extra hundred dollars on top of what you paid for your business class seat.  However, if they are still available at online check-in you can move yourself into them. We moved into 10A (throne) and 14K (mini throne).  Look at the seatmap and photos online to understand why these are much more private and give you more room than the majority of seats. All business class seats are not created equally on Swiss.  However, I think all seats would be good.  Note that the sleeping position is true horizontal lie-flat.  This is unlike Lufthansa‚Äôs angled lie flat.  The footwell is small and varied somewhat.  The footwells in the non-bulkhead throne seats are narrower than the average seat.  I believe any bulkhead seat has larger than average footwells.  Sleeping isn‚Äôt a high priority on this east to west flight but the size of the footwell is surprisingly important if sleeping, particularly if you are tall so this may be one reason to avoid the throne seat ( the other being not sitting beside your partner , however you are also not beside a stranger).   The IFE screens are a bit on the small side but adequate.  The crew, food and service were fantastic.  I was worried it would be underwhelming given there is a first class cabin on this plane but quite the opposite.  Significantly better than Lufthansa and noticeably better than Air Canada which I like.  The Swiss business lounge at ZRH was the best we have been in worldwide.  The food was really good and lots of choice.  The space is large and nice.  There is an outdoor area and the view is fantastic.  If you are a plane spotter you can watch activity on all three runways and for one runway the takeoff point is directly in front of the lounge, close and unobstructed.  Such a treat.

title: Great service - as usual
review_text:
Very good service. Always a snack and a coffee/beer on offer. Very competent cabin staff. Nice new Bombardier planes.

Announcements from the flight deck keep passengers up to date with progress.

Gates always never too far away.

title: Never again
review_text:
Our flight was on 9th May. We decided to use this airline even it was double price comparing with other low cost airlines because departing time was good (12h ish). We had a 2 yo boy, so timing is a big thing for us. After we booked a couple days, they changed our flight automatically to 19h without asking us anything. So we tried to fix it and apparently they canceled the 12h flight (I guess there‚Äôs not enough people to fly). So they offered us to take 11h flight, but transit in Zurich. We took it as we‚Äôd like to arrive Palma in the afternoon, but we were not so happy as we paid more (without luggage) expecting to have a good flight, but turned out the total time of traveling was worse than other airlines.
Anyway, the flight from Zurich to Palma was delayed for 1 and half hrs. During taking off time, my son vomited a lot. So once we were allowed to release the seat belt, I was blocked by the food trolley to go to the toilet to change. The steward was very nice, he went to ask the air hostess who took care of business class if I could use the toilet that i have to pass by business class, she allowed...Then I went there waiting someone came out of the toilet. She was preparing food there, and looked at me in the annoying way. Then she told me to go wait in the business section (more like, get out of my space, you annoy me). So I was trying to tell her I had vomit all over me, it would smell and look disgusting in her business class‚Äôs people‚Äôs eyes. But she didn‚Äôt listen to me, she cut me and repeat ‚Äúgo to wait outside‚Äù. I was like wow...what a great attitude!
On the way back, we took other airlines and we saw the board showed Swiss air, flight to Zurich was delayed again. I guess it‚Äôs their thing.

title: The absolute worst
