review_text:
Every time I interact with Swiss something bad happens. In the past they lost my luggage. Then yesterday they delayed one of their flights so we missed our connection and had to spend 24hrs in a hotel until the next day to continue our trip.

However when they rescheduled the tickets they actually switched one of the flights. Originally I had left a 4hr layover in the USA to have time to re-check my baggage and go through all security check. The Swiss employee scheduled a completely different flight with a 2hr layover. It took us 2 hours just to get to the next terminal without even going through the TSA checks. We completely missed the flight and they had to put us on a stand by list. We barely made it home with the last flight for that day. Absolutely disgusted with Swiss and the way they do their business.

title: The Only Way to Fly!
review_text:
I have never flown Swissair so decided to try them on my recent return from Italy.

What a great flight! 

The inflight service and flight attendants were excellent! I have been flying for over 45 years and this is one of the best flights I have ever taken.

Cannot wait to experience Swissair again!

title: Great On-Board Service, Awful Airport Experience!
review_text: Booked Swiss Air for the flight from Florence back to JFK.  The good news: excellent on board service.  Beverages were served many times during the flight.  When my wife was not feeling well, and the turbulence was getting to her, she was well attended to, for mild medication and water, and also follow-up checking in with her.  The vegetarian food was above average.  The pilot was good at explaining the actual reason for any delays.  The bad news: After already having our passports checked and processed on entry, we had to go through a SECOND time, JUST for Swiss Air, which left many people missing their flights, as this took some time.  Worse still, my wife's boarding pass was-allegedly- "randomly assigned" for a more detailed security check, which included a form of fingerprinting, not being with me while being insulted and told to "cooperate", and being left feeling like a suspected terrorist.  Vile and unnecessary, especially after we had already been processed.  Turned me off to using Swiss ever again.  It was not for "security", it was for some lawyers.  Poor!

title: Incompetent Flight Attendants
review_text: a man got sick on the flight and I‚Äôve never seen flight attendants so stressed or so unprepared for what to do. Also! The seats were smaller and my last flight was delayed by an hour and even though there was an earlier flight, they would not change my ticket to an earlier flight. I expect so much more from the Swiss.

title: Good but could be better
review_text: Kind and polite Flight Attendants, poor food, limited comfort, what happened to the toilets!!! Much to narrow, poor design..... good flight thanks to great and experienced pilots.

title: use to fly Swiss
review_text: I have been flying Swiss  until I found another airline that meets my needs much better in terms of comfortable seats, ease of scheduling a flight on their website, very accommodating customer service and actually serving the meals that I have ordered in advance. As a Swiss it takes much to move from Swiss Airlines to another Company. Just was not happy with the Price= Performance anymore.

title: Great on-board service- and horrible - noisy - business lounge E gates
review_text:
Really don‚Äôt know what to say between those two feelings. Flight and service amazing. Comfort and cabin food and drinks. Seats and amenities. 
However. Waiting for connecting flight 3 hours inside E business lounge was a hell. Do they know how to do a service ? There are 3 ladies that take care and clean tables. The way they do is that it is so noisy and so loud that all you can hear is plates and forks and glasses. On top they do not stop talking between them self‚Äôs and laugh very loud and make all of us uncomfortable. We are tired. We are between flights so many of us here being tortured by noise. People from this lounge please do something.  I wrote 3 times directly to Swiss and never got any reply or comment. 
Thank you

title: 11 hours to LA
review_text: Big 777 aircraft but feeling well in my seat. Many lavatories, nice service: hot meal, sandwich, snacks to pick up, ice cream and pizza before landing. Attentive staff and quiet atmosphere.

title: Excellence in first class
review_text: The service, attention, quality of meals and drinks was impeccable on this 7.30 hrs flight. The A330 layout is not quite as good as the B777 of Swiss, but no complaints, and the food and drink service left nothing to be desired. Refreshing to have the Grand Si√®cle champagne of Laurent Perrier instead of the eternal Dom Perignon. I arrived refreshed and satisfied.

title: Cheap with allure to be special
review_text: New airplane. But flight change was not even communicated. They rebooked me onto a later flight without notice nor compensation. Reaching support is impossible. There is no chat functionality either. Like a cheap airline. Just with other prices.

title: MMM!! First experience flying Anyway with this Airline
review_text: Our first experience flying with this airline, Swiss Air lounge was extra nice waiting for a few hours for our flight to Zurich. Business class was little unexpected after experiencing our first leg business with another airline. Seemed a little cramped and because it was a long flight we missed the extra space to spread out. Could not fault the crew and the food both excellent. All in all would give Swiss another try. We are not complaining as we had very economical Business Class fares. We were happy

title: Swiss Flight to Chicago, all great!
review_text:
perfect flight, on time, plenty of movies to watch, also in economy class!
Good selection of food, including Swiss specialties and chocolate
WiFi is generally available

title: Very good
review_text:
On time, a lot of legroom, very good price, modern airplane, very friendly staff and you get a small hot snack together with drinks of your choice. 
A lot better than most others.

title: Ooops!
review_text: I always hold Swiss Air in high regards but this time it fumbled on a detail. I was given a choice at dinner and made my selection accordingly. The attendant responded that he ran out temporarily of that option and it would take a minute to get it. So fine! But half an hour passed, he didn't come back and I already finished my salad. I proceeded to dessert and waited for the main course to come. Nothing happened after an hour, I was tired and not so hungry so I didn't bother reminding the attendant. I flew Swiss Air many times over the course of 40 years and always rated it 5/5. Now it's 4/5 to be fair to other high performers as Lufthansa, Austrian, Korean and Japan and Singapore airlines.

title: Don‚Äôt pay for seat reservations
review_text:
Over the past half year I took a few flights from and to Zurich with Swiss. I usually always pay for an early seat reservation. Unfortunately on my last 4 flights I got a standard mail from the reservation department saying that due to operational reasons my seat was modified. Of course a refund is not included.
It seems that the company is not able anymore to successfully plan their operative craft in advance. What a bad point for a company who used to be good...in the past. It‚Äôs just average now.
While the service on board is quite good, that can‚Äôt be said for the after flight support in case of any inconveniences.
So no need to give them extra money, it just doesn‚Äôt work.
There are many different options and as a Swiss citizen I‚Äôm sorry to say that I will refrain from flying with my national airline in the future.

title: Nice flight to Russia
review_text: I have been traveling with SWISS from Stuttgart to St Petersburg via Zurich. So, I have found both of these flights nice and cool. The only thing I did not like being a passanger of SWISS it a piece of bread in the on-board meal - it was not really fresh and hard. Well, nothing in this world is perfect and flawless.

title: Tight squeeze
review_text: I had two flights on e from. Boston to Zurich.. and then Zurich to Bangkok. The space between the seat was super tight. When the man in front of me reminded his seat it felt really claustrophobic! They had only 4 bathrooms for all of us...boooo

title: Airline Service and Food Quality
review_text:
Poor quality highlights this review.
Swiss sent me an email saying the seats I purchased were ‚Äúchanged‚Äù.   I had economy seats toward the front of the plane and was moved to the very back row, next to the bathroom, with no explanation or recourse.    This abusive behavior continued with the food quality, all carbs, no protein.  
 Clear down to the lack of friendliness of the staff, it felt like you were not guest but a burden to them.  
Learn my lesson, no more Swiss for me.

title: Solid business class
review_text: Connected to Thai first from this flight Solid service reasonable food and Duval Leroy NV champagne Good seat as Throne 7A which is OK for sleeping on side but these have been coined coffins as a taller person can't sleep on their back due to the narrowness of the seat Lots of storage at arms length as well as labelled overhead stowage. In this day this is good business class which leaves Lufthansa and United well below current standards Good Senator Lounge at E Gates ZRH

title: Friends travel
review_text: The flight was excellent! A good service on board and very confortable! The lounges in SP and iZurich were very nice too!

title: Flight was fine but bathroom too dirty
review_text:
Nice service and good VOD options. Food is nice. Children's meal was very good but had 3(!) desserts (shouldn't it be a balanced meal?). Biggest problem was the state of the bathroom, a tiny stall (hard to join a child!) and just filthy, don't want to go into detail. Suffice to say a clean bathroom must be dry all around. This happened on our way to NYC as well.
The terminal in Zurich is lovely.

title: Business class flight with fragile labelled luggage destroyed
review_text: Did BUSINESS FLIGHTS to hongkong then onto Zurich and then Amsterdam. On stop over picked up BAG which was labelled FRAGILE after swiss air part Of the flights and the bag was torn and punctured as if dropped from a height.Totally DESTROYED. Swiss air agreed with the dockets i had to run around and get from original baggage shop that the bag couldn't be repaired and said they would pay.  STILL WAITING FOR AGREED PAYMENT. Bag damaged 26th March.

title: Very good flight!
review_text:
This was flight to Madrid - Barajas via Zurich. The flight itself was enjoyable and relaxed with comfortable seats and good service. The staff was super friendly.

I would definitely fly Swiss again! üòä

title: Irresponsible airline, ruined our honeymoon
review_text:
My husband and I recently had an extremely upsetting honeymoon and very costly experience with Swiss regarding lost luggage. On April 22, 2019, we traveled on Flight LX139/LX1710 from Hong Kong to Zurich, Zurich to Naples Italy in Business Class. When we reached the baggage claim area, I discovered, after a 30-minute wait, that my luggage was lost. I immediately contacted the baggage claim representative, who assured me that it would be on the next plane though no one could even told us whether the luggage were lost while transit in Zurich or not. We were extremely devastated and furious as it was our honeymoon trip and we've arranged all activities and meals at fine dinning restaurants! 

We had high hopes on receiving the next day but it was a further disappointment, we had been calling every 30 mins and they simply said " it's lost, we can't locate and update any status at all". At that moment, i burst into tears in the street and our honeymoon has officially ruined by Swiss. It was extremely stressful mentally and physically to chase for an updated status while we are traveling. Repurchasing all our clothing etc was not the worst, it's the physiological damages and the stress killed our honeymoon. We also had to pay for our hotel in Capri for a private courier service to transfer the luggage to Capri at the end! It was 6 days later when we received our luggage and the trip is almost finished!

We paid so much to fly in business class and clearly this is unacceptable! We will never fly with Swiss nor recommend our family and friends to! DO NOT FLY WITH THEM, THEY WILL RUIN YOUR HOLIDAY

title: Always on time, impecable service!
review_text: Swiss is always perfect. Great service, very comfortable planes, delicious food, nice selection of beverages. Onboard entertainment is really good, too. I enjoyed every minute of the flight!

title: The New Airbus 200 Series is Perfect
review_text: On boarding which was a little late - due to the usual poor ground handing agents who get worse by the week - they have little experience while airlines are fighting tooth and nail to retain their passengers they should look at the poor quality of the agents they appointed - that said the captain got the paper work sorted out and we left on the 2 hour trip to Zurich - the service was first class and the food offering was excelent, washed down with some sparking wine we arrived almost on time , however parked miles away from the Terminal - the transfer however took me just over 20 mins and I was on my way to Dublin - all well handled having arrived at home base.

title: Old A340‚Äôs really need an update
review_text:
Flew Swiss A340 from Zurich to BOS in economy class.   The inflight service from the staff was very good, the issue is the age of the equipment and the inability to book seats in advance.  First, the seats are old and the cushioning is worn out.  Second, the inflight entertainment system didn‚Äôt work, and when I switched seats with my son, it was a relic from 15-20 years ago.  Poor quality of choices and sound quality was poor.  It was really outdated.   Third, avoid seat G where the under seat space is partly occupied by the inflight entertainment system box.   Fourth, we were unable to order a special meal in advance, adding further agony to our 8 hour flight.  Lastly, we had booked our flight several months in advance using United frequent flyer miles, but were unable to book seats.  I called 24 hrs before the flight departed and they said they couldn‚Äôt accommodate us then either.  This may have to do with our lack of status on Star alliance and our use of frequent flyer tickets.  If this is the case, it‚Äôs a poor policy given the number of flights we suffered through to accrue the mileage necessary for a redemption.  Very frustrating.

I have had better experience on the Swiss A330‚Äôs, but mostly this was a let down from a carrier that was once one of the best in the business.

title: Paid 250chf each for flight and should thank Swiss that I get a seat but cannot sit together??!!
review_text: Flying from Berlin Tegel to Zurich and first could not check in due to IT problems for Swiss, then booked on two separate seats as couple and now supposed to be thankful for even flying as the flight is heavily overbooked and I am frequent flyer status??!! Paid 250chf each for the flight and should thank Swiss for being completely unorganized and ruining a weekend away. Thank you.

title: Direct flight between Zurich and San Francisco
review_text:
After a trip to Europe we flew back from Switzerland back to San Francisco by LX 38. It was a direct flight operated by Swiss International Airline and also a Code sharing flight with United. It was a nice flight in general. However the seat space was very tight. 
The in flight services were excellent. Our flight to Europe was on United therefore our confirmation was an UA computer Code. However in Switzerland we could not find our reservation on Swiss Air system. There was no link between the two. As Star Alliance member airlines on a code share flight there was no link between the two it was unacceptable . This caused confusions. Hope it can be improved.

title: Flight cancelled due to technical problems 5 minutes before boarding (at 11 pm CET)
review_text:
Problems can happen and it was very unfortunate that the problem with failed oil sensor could not be fixed and we had to go back home.
But the way Swiss treated this and how they treated us as customers was shockingly horrible. 
They initially re-booked us to a flight 2 days later with 2 stops instead of our direct, non-stop flight which we had booked and payed.
The hotline number that was given to us was never reachable. I listened to the automatic voice for 2 full hours from 7 am to 9 am.
Swiss automatically cancelled our next flight from Singapore to Bali although that was 3 days later and by that time we had of course made it to Singapore. They did not even inform us about it.
When they added us to the flight again, they messed it up again and when we were at the check-in counter in Singapore, only 2 of us were ticketed.
Customer service on the phone was very unfriendly and hung the phone up on me.

title: Worst service ever
review_text: The worst service ever! The flight attendants even did not care about you even you call them. They only work like a robot, keeping meals time only. Even you have a headache they don't care. They said it's your concern, they only do meal plans. How suck the people in this swiss airlines!!!

title: Smooth and comfortable
review_text: Very good experience. Interesting congiguration in business class. I got the single window seat. Lot of space on both sides. Comfortable bed and good food and service.

title: Best business class in EU
review_text: It is definately the best inter Europe business class. The service was par excellent. They even served hot food which have not seen in any other airline. Loved the experience.

title: Excellent
review_text:
It was the first time in many years that I had flown with Swiss.
The check-in process through to the friendly and efficient cabin crew all worked in true Swiss style.
Precisely what I hoped for.
The food and drinks offered were great, the flight was on time and there were no problems.
Well done Swiss.

title: Not acceptable
review_text:
Sorry to have to contradict myself as the outbound flight from Paris CDG to Delhi via Zurich had been excellent. 
But what happened on our return flight from mIndia recently, is not acceptable.

Only a few hours before travelling from Delhi, we received a message cancelling the booked arrangements with SWISS. No reason given, only "sorry for the inconvenience" !
Furthermore, we received a series of contradicting messages with the new flights details on Lufthansa. Initially with 2 connecting flights in Germany, eventually only one in Munich.
As a result, we had no choice for our seats and although paying a premium fare to travel on business class, we sat next to the galley and toilets for a longer flight than expected. Again no reason given on board !
Been transferred from one airline to another, we felt like being treated as second-class citizens, Lufthansa crex being keener pleasing their fellow crew members travelling free than paying guests.
Of course, any further diet requirements were not passed to Lufthansa and when complaining about the situation, we were faced with rudeness and an extraordinary unfriendly and unnecessary attitude. (The following rating reflect the Lufhansa flight)

SWISS and Lufthansa are part of the Star Alliance group. This does not reflect well on any of the other members of the Alliance (esp with disastrous business class connections within India with Air India).
An experience not to renew. 
Next time, we'll travel with some serious airlines (those based in the Middle East for instance, that have a strong policy about customer service).

title: Swiss Delight
review_text:
It was raining in Nice and my flight LX561 was assigned a remote stand. We were bussed to the aircraft and had to walk up open stairs to the plane. We were all wet; but it was worse for moms carrying babies.

Crew on this flight were pleasant and were sincere in keeping the passengers comfortable. I truly liked the Indian food they served.

Swiss Lounge in Terminal E was a disappointment. Felt like a cafe rather than a lounge. I waited for over 2 hours and yet could not shower as there was 4 others ahead of me. Food was nothing special and the offering was modest. Swiss should learn from Singapore Airlines Krisflyer lounge.

On the flight to Singapore on the B77W, I managed to get the "throne" seat. The seat was good, space was ample and inflight entertainment was acceptable. 

The food was a disappointment. I had pre ordered and confirmed a Hindu non vegetarian meal. But they uplifted an Asian Vegetarian option which I did not like at all.

Breakfast on Swiss Business class was so small. Again I think Singapore Airlines has pampered me.

title: Absolutely horrible
review_text: By far the worst airline for first class service. It was the very worst and not a first class experience. Do not fall for the advertising or online videos, the service is very poor.  No attention to detail, no communication and swiss air dump you as quickly as possible, literally dumped us in a stairwell in the airport with no way out in a secure area and drove off. By far the world's worst first class service.  Do all that you can to find a better airline because this one is horrible. Not a word from management either. Not so much as a phone call to me with an explanation or apology. They took my money with no problem. Left us all horrified and fearful for our safety.  This is not the airline for me and I cannot recommend it to anyone. The fact that they leave you locked in a stairwell with no way out not knowing if security will arrive and shoot you on the spot speaks volumes. Much better air transport to choose from that treat you with a first class service that you pay dearly for.. My option is that this airline is horrible and do not use them.

title: Very disappointed with their service!
review_text: Delayed flight and missed connection at Zurich to Lugano due to a delayed flight from London. No update or automatic rebooking onto another flight, no one on board the aircraft to help direct me or inform me about a new flight. Help desk at airport was overcrowded so I ended up taking a train. I was told that my train ticket and missed flight would be compensated and reimbursed within 22 days. It's now way past that time and I am still waiting and have to keep e-mailing them. In my bank account they deposited 12 CHF. Is that a joke? That's not even half of the train ticket price. Still waiting and still putting in far too much effort into trying to get an answer from them!

title: Good Experience
review_text: We flew from SFO to Paris with a stop-over in Zurich. No complaints as the long flight went smoothly, and service on the plane was very good. Overall, a good flight experience.  I would consider Swiss Air in the future.

title: Superb Flight
review_text: I did fly Coach Plus and the service and flight was superb. The meal, comfort, amenities, and just everything was 100% Top Notch. And the ticket price was also very cheap..

title: Really good Airline
review_text: For those that read my reviews you will know my dislike for BA so we are always keen to use another Airline. We found Swiss to be efficient, good communicators, excellent staff, very clean aeroplanes and being Swiss run on time. Well recommended

title: Ignorant staff!
review_text: Even though I spoke to them in Swiss german, since it is my mother tongue they jusr wouldnt stop speaking either in english or high german to me. The service is very poor and the stewardesses have a arrogant attitude towards client who do not look swiss. They didn‚Äôt even help me store my lugagge, she just stood there and waited for me to finish up even when she clearly saw i was struggling. Flying back from Thailand where the people are displaying hospitality at its highest level, this is very disappointing. I will never fly with swiss again

title: Good flight on a nice plane
review_text: We flew from Hong Kong to Vienna through Zurich. The flight and service on the plane were very nice the transit was very smooth. A good flight experience.

title: service was poor
review_text: service aboard was poor. Food in business class was not available for all passengers. Our group, although booked as one party, was spreaded all over the plane. Crew was not friednly at all. European service is very poor and it seems that the difference towards cheaper airlines is getting very thin. Was it worth the price in business class : NO. Swiss used to have very friendly crews, special attention for children, business class was worth the extra price, .... Nowadays, service is much better in the lounge than onboard. Will I fly Swiss again ? Hard to say, but with this experience, I would certainly compare with other airlines.

title: Business only for long distance recommended
review_text:
I always fly with Swiss as I love the outstanding service on board. 

Today, I tried to reshedule my business flight because I could not do this online. You must know that I fly almost every second week with them. The call centre was first not reachable, and then not very friendly resp. helpful e.g. the person on the phone was harsh and has put me back into the waiting line. So - NO SUPPORT.

I might change to BA or only book the very cheap tickets - business within Europe is not of value anymore. 

Rating: 5 Star service on Board, 2 Star Service Centre

title: Great flight on a very nice new plane
review_text:
We flew from Z√ºrich to Hannover with Swiss on a Bombardier aircraft which was very nice. 

Good amount of leg room. 

Pleasant service. 

Complementary bar service and a sandwich were served on the flight. The beer that they serve onboard is not very good. 

No inflight entertainment but usual magazine.

title: Good flight but lacked extra attention and service was too perfunctory.
review_text:
I sat in 7A, Business Class travelling Delhi to Zurich to JFK on 1 May, 2019.
The aircraft seemed very noisy from the passage of external airflow. The power point at 7A was not working and I got no sympathy from the cabin crew. Overall, the service on this sector was mediocre at best! Quite different from our original flight JFK to Zurich when the crew genuinely could not do enough to ensure we enjoyed the trip.
Tip: The seat at 7A goes completely flat and I think it better and more comfortable than many other airlines.
Overall, a good experience but lacking in caring service and attention to detail.

title: Pleasant
review_text: Needless to say it was very neat and tidy, however the seats were very cramped and uncomfortable. It was quite disappointing, as I was looking forward to this flight. I found the food to be excellent - really good !! Better than their Asian competitors, it was just the seat that was the problem. Given that you choose to fly Business for comfort the seats need to be comfortable and spacious. The configuration is double seats and a single seat behind - obviously the single seats are a lot better (still uncomfortable but more room around you) we unfortunately were too late to book 2 single seats. In my opinion there are better Business Class options out there. I don‚Äôt like to say this because we fly Swiss Domestically all the time and it is a terrific airline, but long haul business class needs a bit of a shake up üòâ

title: Short hop in Economy
review_text: Way back to ZRH after a day at a factory outlet Used Lufthansa lounge and Fast Track Exit row booked on CS300 aircraft. Short flight with water and coffee offered. IF YOU NEED LUGGAGE BEWARE WHICH FARE YOU BUY LIGHT CLASSIC OR FLEX!

title: Short relaxing hop
review_text: Daytrip to Milan to visit a fave factory outlet CS300 aircraft comfy great legroom and seat free next to you in Business class Easy walk from Swiss Senator Lounge  Part of a conjunction reward ticket on Singapore Krisflyer

title: The website is a nightmare.
review_text: We booked through Gate 1 over six months ago.  No seats assignments were given in the final boarding documents.  When I tried to get them, I was given the option of "choosing" my seat for an additional $32.00, though I didn't know what seats had been assigned to the eight people travelling with me.  I was asked to re-enter the passport information for each traveler, along with their expiration dates.  When I finally got the seat assignments (without paying the $32.00 each) the boarding passes didn't come.  Very irritating.

title: What a difference an airline makes
review_text: Last week I pointed out the shortcomings of Lufthansa on out flight to Malta .. now I can report from the return flight that I was not just grumpy because our luggage got lost (to no fault of Lufthansa, and it was delivered the next day to the hotel), but from objective observations.  The seats in the Swiss business class are more comfortable and offer more space. The service is friendlier. And the food is better. Our flight to Zurich was punctual, very comfortable, the staff was engaged throughout the flight and we did get a Swiss chocolate at the end.  Swiss has well understood that good customer service means keeping contact with passengers throughout the flight, and it uses all opportunities to achieve that. Maybe some refresher courses for Lufthansa staff in Swiss training programmes?

title: It was like a freezer
review_text:
Boeing 777 ZRH HKG, as well the return flight.
I found most of the boarding in Switzerland (I did GVA-ZRH-HKG-ZRH-GVA) was quite messy. People wanted to line up but there was nothing or no one to guide them, it became a huge triangle from the gate. Luckily passengers were patient.
The entertainment service was good & very good quality with USB charger.
Seats in economy was good for average size people. Taller ones may not feel that comfortable.
3-4-3 seating.
The corridor was very narrow. I'm not that big but whenever I passed, I touched so many shoulders.
Food service was fine. Generous for the drink, most of the drinks were serve in cans & if you asked for 2, the crew were not complained.
An excellent point: I traveled with my 9 yr old son, they served him first with the kid's meal automatically. It was very thoughtful for the parents.
During the night, there were apples, 1 sweet biscuit, 1 salted snack & some cans soda & bottles of water in the galley, you helped yourself. I didn't really see any crew.
Toilets were running out of the toilet papers.
Time to sleep, the cabin temperature was so cold & the air was rushing to the face, it was far too cold to sleep even I put 2 of my own jacket + the scarf. 
You may also need bring your own neck pillow as the head dresser was a simple one without the folding section.

title: Just the best!!
review_text: We all know Swiss does widebody jets to Tel Aviv and that they are the best way to/from Ben Gurion Nice upgrade gratis to First with business service as  Lufthansa Senator Efficient service at Ben Gurion and effortless at Zueri FLUGHAFEN

title: Nice and Efficient Crew, Economy Seat legroom is unacceptable.
review_text: If you are over 4 feet tall and flying in economy on a transatlantic, go to another airline. When the person in front of you puts their seat back you are trapped. No extra legroom option available for less than a $1500 upgrade

title: Great service in best comfort
review_text: Again flying in A330, so comfortable and quiet for such a flight. Very nice and friendly staff, special service readily done. Will fly again with Swiss...

title: Great flight with good service üëç
review_text: After a weekend in Bern it was time to go home. Swiss Air is so far the only company I‚Äôve been flying with who had serve snacks and drinks for free üëçü•ñüç∑

title: great experience
review_text: I was hesitant to fly Swiss Air/Air Canada but i have to say i am a convert.  The airline couldn't have been better.  We were served 2 meals between Toronto and Zurich plus snacks.  We had to change planes in Montreal but they transfered our luggage so it was easy.  Free beer and wine and they came around often.  The seats were spacious enough and the movie choices on our flight home were current.  On the way to Zurich the entertainment system was down so we got a $50 coupon towards our next flight.  All flights were on time.  Well done Air Canada Swiss Air.

title: Excellent flight
review_text: Excellent flight. Great service. Very pleasant and courteous flight attendants. Great check in service at Mumbai.

title: Acceptable for 3-4 hours flight time
review_text:
Flight from Zurich to Tel-Aviv on 7 April 2019. I expected some troubles after reading dozens of very negative opinions about the configuration and minimum comfort of seats at the Swiss Boeing 700-300ER. Fortunately flight time to Tel-Aviv was just something like 3,5 hours ‚Äì in principle, it was not a big deal even to mention it. However, it is worth to mention an absolutely awful food which was offered at this flight and ‚Äúunobtrusive‚Äù service: the answer to the inquiry about bread was that it would be offered in due time. The ‚Äúdue‚Äù time appeared to be after coffee and tea.

Contrary to the above the quality of food and services on our flight back on 13 April (the type of the aircraft was the same or similar) was, in my opinion, absolutely perfect ‚Äì like in the Swiss in the ‚Äúold good‚Äù days. I agree with some opinions that the seats 50A and 50B are probably the best at this aircraft (Boeing 700-300ER).

title: Very Pleasant Flight
review_text: Quick efficient boarding, warm welcome from the crew. Cabin was spotlessly clean and the meal was tasty. Very attentive cabin crew, really polite and knowledgeable. Quick arrival in Zurich with a dedicated business class bus and luggage on the belt waiting. I got from plane to train in 25 minutes.

title: Bad service
review_text:
Waiting in Cork airport..our son 6 y old was put from swiss airline on stand-by, the explanation was that the flight was full and he could flight tomorrow! 
By himself???!!
Waiting..maybe an other flight tomorrow?

Why those things happen? Overbooking and stand-by for a chld in the same reference and ticket of the otherfamily members???!? Plus 2 staff were upgraded to business, and our 6 yr old son was sacrificed for that!#swissfly

title: Flying with Busy Flight Attendants
review_text:
Flight attendants looked TOO busy and TOO formal.
I wish there was Swiss cheeses presentation on the menu and not so formal and cold breakfast. 
I would prefer movies of different times and countries, not just modern Hollywood movies.  It would enjoy watching tourist information about various European destinations. 
From my personal experience --  New Zealand Airlines presented the best collection of downloads.

title: Love Venice
review_text: We went with Swiss Air because it was a package deal with hotel to Venice. We liked that it was a straight flight from Los Angeles to Zurich for a two hour stopover then another flight 1 hr or so flight to Venice. We flew on a Monday & the plane was not even half full. We were able lay down in adjacent seats. Food was bland reminiscent of bland daycare food in the 80s. Stewards were okay. On our way back to LA, was another story. We were at Marco Polo airport three hours early, so we checked in our carry-on baggage-one each and had our personal items- one each. We went to what we thought was our ‚Äúgate‚Äù and waited. Then all of a sudden, 30 minutes before boarding we hear our names, and we went to the counter. The Swiss Air lady is yelling at us to get to the bus because they are all waiting for us. We didn‚Äôt know we were riding a bus to the plane! It should have been noted on our ticket or something. We thought we were at our gate. We  were two hours early too. Other than that, we had a pleasant flight back to the US. We were actually served more food(snacks like ice cream & biscuits) and meals tasted better than when we were flying to Zurich. The stewardesses were more friendly and good service. We love the Swiss chocolate they give throughout the flight! My only main issue is baggage. I went to the website and it said with regards to carry-on baggage they had to be a certain measurement as well as the personal item. I was surprised to see others in economy who had both carry-on & personal items that were obviously larger than the required measurement. I think if you say one thing, it should be enforced because it‚Äôs not fair to others that stick to stated rules. I‚Äôm still open to flying Swiss but I read in another review that they are not helpful if you lose your luggage....

title: One of the best airlines!
review_text: This was a special occasion and we flew business class, which is not our normal class to travel. Every detail was outstanding! The service (every attendant so attentive, captain spoke in 3 different languages), the food (from a 5* chef), the wine (3 excellent choices), the equipment (comfort, comfort, comfort), the entertainment (great variety).

title: Swiss Air
review_text: I was traveling from the US To Thailand and flew from Chicago to Zurich on Swiss. I opted for the single seat in Business Class for the privacy - it was like being in First but not as expensive (and the food was not as good as Fitst, but was very good).  I will fly with Swiss again.

title: Everything was great about Swiss International... until it landed!
review_text:
I had always thought that Swiss International was a top airline and if you are basing your opinion on the pilots, it is! But buyer beware...
When you are printing your boarding pass they trick you into believing that a checked bag costs an extra $85, and so when I paid the extra $170 but only had 1 bag to check they would not refund my money! The website only mentioned that it was cheaper to pay on line rather than paying at the airport, and there was nothing that indicated that this fee was non-refundable! I was robbed!!! It‚Äôs a very nasty trick!

title: Common Flight
review_text:
We left Guarulhos for Zurich on March 1st. Fully airplane.
I asked for lactose-free food. I could not eat the chicken that had a lot of pepper. They should offer food with more neutral. The flight attendants was normal. Expected more from Swiss.

title: Flight was ok, Airport should be avoided
review_text:
My flight left at 1pm from Zurich Airport. I arrived at the Check-in area around 10:30am into a VERY busy and packed area. Considering that the Swiss Air staff directs everybody to check-in using the electronic kiosks, the wait to drop luggage off was ridiculous. Just to let you know, I arrived at my international gate (outbound of EU) with almost no time to spare. 

Anyways, the security line wasn't actually too bad, and right after security you get to the duty free shopping area of the terminal. I am glad that my habit is to scout out my gate first, because I did not see any information anywhere that my international gate (even though it's the same terminal) is in a completely different building, requiring you to take a tram. After I finally located where my gate is supposed to be, you end up at the Swiss Border check, and that line was insane; it was easily a 30 minute wait to get through. Up to this point I've basically already spent 1.5 hours in the airport.

Once through the border, the tram was fairly quick and then a few levels up, you end up at the international gates. There are shops (duty free, coffee, food, etc) here, but I was nearing my boarding time so rushed to my gate. Turns out, the aircraft wasn't here yet and the staff was trying to find out where it is. The aircraft showed up soon, and they opened yet another checkpoint due to USA/TSA requirements, which is another line of roughly 350-400 people (passenger capacity of a 777-300ER). By the time I finally boarded the aircraft it was close to 12:50pm. We left about 45 minutes late.

Now, finally, the flight. The aircraft is VERY clean and I love the brown colored fabric/leather seats; it's a change from all the blue that everybody is using lately. I had the seat in the very back of the plane, last row on the side, which only has 2 seats instead of 3; there is a lot of space to store extra stuff for the window seat (I sat aisle). The flight overall was comfortable (12 hours) and the restroom and galley is right behind me.

What bothered me was that the entertainment system was not available to be used until we were at cruising altitude. So, from the point of me sitting down and settling in, a 45 minute delay, take off and reaching altitude, nobody could watch anything, because a Swiss Air commercial was running the entire team. Also, I must have missed the Safety briefing ...

During the flight the flight attendants are great! Very friendly and professional. Only caveat about this last row indented seat is, they forgot to ask us a few times for beverages and my seat mate didn't get his lunch even until we asked for it. Oh well, it happens.

Otherwise the rest of the flight was very uneventful and we landed at LAX with only a little bit of delay (15 minutes).

Hope this helps.

Safe travels.
Wilton

title: Friendly service
review_text: very friendly and efficient service on board. Was nice to watch the special care of the crew for babies and infants.

title: Customer Service?? What a Joke!!
review_text: After checking in online I read that it would cost more for me to check my luggage at the airport, I tried to get in touch with costumer service to pay the  fee. For 12 hours I got no one.  I had to blow them up on Twitter.  Only then did I get a response.  The flight itself well the food was no good and the seats were very uncomfortable.

title: Don't waste money buying seat selection/reservation
review_text: We purchased the seat selection option 9 months before the flight.   The week before the flight we were notified that our seats had been changed from window and aisle at the front of the "cheaper seats" to a middle and aisle in the back of the plane (still classified in the cheaper seats category).  We have requested a refund of the seat selection fee since we made a purchase that was not honored.  They have denied the refund saying they have the right to change seats.  No where do they warn us that they may not honor the purchase and give us worse seats.

title: As good as Vueling but more expensive
review_text: Normal experience on board (Easter chocolate eggs for kids, nice detail I have to admit) ground staff not very nice. When calling for priority boarding only mention Business and First Class, not families with very small kids. Space between chairs, appreciated. The flight changes wasn't communicated on time to me, pissed off. For the rest, normal flight, like on Vueling but paying more. I had bad experiences in the past with Swiss, lost luggage etc. but had no choice but to take that flight. Not my favorite airlines.

title: None existent customer support.
review_text:
Flight was delayed several hours which delayed my arrival at final destination five hours.

Swiss Air Station Agent was nowhere to be found.  No Swiss Air customer service representatives available at airport or on phone - only online.

On 23 April I‚Äôm still waiting for a reply from my 7 April email.

Onboard service was fine.  Ma√Ætre de Cabine did excellent job assisting with flight change.

title: Very pleasant
review_text: We had a relatively short flight. Easy checking and reasonable wait time. The flight personnel were very personable. No stress at all on this flight.

title: first time on Swiss first class
review_text:
Our first trip in Swiss first class, and overall a good experience, large spacious and intimate cabin, ( flew A330), IFE was good but not an outstanding and diverse program list, music options were pretty poor and did not account for many tastes. Food and service was very good, FA's were warm and friendly without being too familiar or too aloof and distant.
Good flat bed, comfy mattress and duvet no shortage of space to roll around in.
Would certainly fly again.

title: Stressless
review_text: Swiss airline works like a swiss watch. No delay, no queue at checkin. No stress or hectic during the flight, neither at customs!

title: Upgraded to First makes the flight a great experience
review_text:
Fantastic service throughout the entire flight. Originally booked on business but got a free upgrade to first. 
The food was great and there was a good choice of wines for the meal. Could also have an 18 year old single malt with an expresso after dinner. What a pleasure.
I commend the crew for the attentive service.

title: Swiss flight
review_text: My daughter and I flew roundtrip from San Francisco to Zurich in December and flew back in January. I can't say enough about Swiss International Airlines. Not only are the flight times convenient, the operation is flawless.  The flight crew are well trained, no nonsense and perform their jobs well. I feel comfortable flying Swiss and in fact we will be flying it again this summer. Although it costs a little bit more than other airlines, the convenience is worth it.

title: 1 piece of luggage is an extra $100
review_text:
I used to fly a lot with Swiss because of the good quality service. I even paid a little more compared to other airlines just to travel with them.
This must be a new policy but I never experienced anything like this before. I just purchased a ticket to Europe and on the option to get the relatively cheaper ticket prices you have to opt out taking a luggage with you. This is a cross Atlantic flight not a local "traveling light" flight. 
It is absurd to charge over $200 so the airline will generously be able to take your luggage. On top of that the carry on is also limited to a midget size little box.
This is probably my last flight with this greedy airline. Swiss is the next Ryanair or Easyjet!?

title: Excellence in the air
review_text: Swiss Air could give lessons to every other airline on how to provide excellent customer service. They clearly care about the comfort of their passengers. Love this company!

title: Redirected to Swiss Air - Blessing in Disguise
review_text: Our Delta flight via Amsterdam was canceled thus necessitating a change at JFK.  Swiss Air proved to be exceptional with excellent flight attendants and food service.

title: Always a good decision and flight
review_text: We have been booking Swiss for years and feel they are always dependable  and the right choice. We like going thru Zurich to get to Warsaw. This  is a very easy and user friendly airport for transit and customs. Even with a late arrival into Zurich, we were able to make our Boston connection. Very smooth and uneventful flight. A real thank  you goes out to one of the flight attendants. My I-phone battery was dead and there were no USB ports on the plane. She took the phone and brought it back a couple of hours later fully charged. Above and beyond my expectations. SWISS is a great  and my favorite  airline .

title: Fantastic
review_text: Everything about this flight was great. Great cabin crew, good breakfast. Very clean new aircraft.  The seats were good but lacked extra legroom. The European view seems to be on many airlines to merely add a tray between the window and aisle of economy seats to create business seats. A short flight so not a really big deal. Boarding was efficient in the usual Swiss way.

title: Terrible Airline
review_text: I was working for week in Switzerland, my Partner decided to come visit me for the weekend. I booked and paid for return flights to Zurich for him with Swiss air. He texted me from the airport saying that he had not been allocated a seat as the flight was overbooked, and there was a chance he may not get the flight. It was extremely stressful, as we were uncertain if he'd be flying on the flight we had PAID for. He did get a seat, but there were many others who didn't thanks to Swiss Air overbooking their flights. We made sure to check him in for his return flight online to make sure we weren't in the same position on the way back, only for the flight to be delayed by over an hour. There was no apology, or remorse shown from the staff which makes me think this level of poor service is standard. Certainly would avoid any flights with them in the future.

title: Pampered with Ice cream and chocolates
review_text: I flew for the first time in this airline on their LX16 and LX147 Airbus A330-300. I was pleasantly surprised. The cabin was engineered to reflect the SWISS quality. The seats were comfortable despite not being the widest I've seen. The food was excellent. Being a vegetarian it's hard to get good food on a transatlantic flight. The legroom was manageable since I'm around 6ft 1'. The staff were very hospitable. They served beverages very often. They were very generous with their ice cream and iconic Swiss chocolate. The only miss in the airline is the amenity kit. But it was a very relaxing flight with well engineered mood setting lights for the cabin.

title: Horrible Airline
review_text: I could not believe how horrible my countries airlines are. The airplane was very old and dirty, the seats were stained with brown spots and caked in dust. The old broken airplane monitors were smeared in grease and barely responded to my touch. The resolution and quality of the screen was so terrible you couldn‚Äôt even watch anything. I gagged at the state of the airplane, and I haven‚Äôt even talked about the disgusting food. I absolutely do not recommend this terrible airline. I thought WOW and Pakistani Airlines were the worst in the world, but I was mistaken.

title: A very smooth trip....
review_text: The flight went smoothly. Lots of legroom. Flight attendants were very polite, helpful and quick. Check in took a lot of time because these airplanes are huge, it is to be expected. Getting out of the plane took some extra time, since my seat was at the rear end of the plane. The food was as mediocre as in most flights, but it was plenty. For entertainment, the selection was not to my taste but more importantly there were no English subtitles in most of the titles (I don't know about you, but on the plane I usually have trouble hearing anything, so I need to read the subtitles).

title: Pleasure flying with Swissair
review_text: Flew with Swiss Air from Barcelona to Zurich and connected on LX86 to Monreal. Very pleasant day flight. Business class seats have a massager. Good food options & quality.  One  of the better airlines I have flown. Keep it up Swissair.

title: Thankfully the flight was late
review_text: As my connecting flight from Helsinki was late and the transfer time tight, I was running all the way thru the terminal to get my Swiss flight to Zurich at the very end of the terminal. I like if gates close time and the plane leaves as scheduled but this time I was happy to see still a queue at the gate at departure time. Crew was friendly, I was too exhausted to eat some meal but I enjoyed a Quellfrisch beer. It was a nice flight.

title: Best European Business Class
review_text: Swiss Business Class is easily the best of all European airlines. On flights over two hours they offer a choice of two hot main course dishes, wines and champagne are of excellent quality and drinks are refreshed as soon as the glass is half full. Great attention to detail and service delivered by a dedicated and professional crew member. Zurich Airport is a great transfer hub and when we missed our connection they found an alternative flight and arranged everything without fuss. The large lounge in Zurich is very well run and has a relaxed atmosphere. We ended up flying with Edelweiss  from Zurich to Palma and their service is similar to Swiss as they operate a code share. Overall a great trip and will definitely pay a bit more and fly Business with swiss again.

title: Good Service
review_text:
My first time on Swiss Air and was pleasantly surprised. We paid $100 extra for the exit row,  which was well worth the additional cost. The seats are small but the added leg room made the overnight journey tolerable.  The Swiss Air attendants were accommodating and the service was quite good.  Even the economy meals were not bad at all.  
I would recommend Swiss Air for anyone traveling internationally, but consider the exit row upgrade if you are flying f overnight.  I didn‚Äôt give it an Excellent rating because of seat sizes.

title: Efficient airline
review_text: Regret it does not have premium economy but the flights I have had with them in Economy are usually are fine. I fly from  Geneva to Zurich to where ever,, have been to India , Vietnam, S, Africa,, Dar es Salaam in recent months ...a good airline to be on.

title: Plane interior in need of refurbishment
review_text: We were 3 friends traveling where I had reserved a seat (at extra charge) near an emergency exit for extra legspace. The interior of the plane not only looked at the end of its expected lifetime, also adjustments of chairs were in certain cases not possible anymore. Staff was friendly and the overall experience was OK, but is was not a brilliant experience.

title: Great airline
review_text:
Good airline. Safe, on time and lots of legroom.
Food was pretty good and you get some Swiss chocolate. Nice views of the Alps on our way to Zurich. Smooth landing in Moscow despite the bad weather

title: Unbelievable Seat Assigment Policy
review_text: As my daughter is getting ready for a language immersion program this summer, travelling for her first time internationally, on her own I made a change to her itinerary with United, as we used United to book her flights of which part are with Swiss Air.  Here's the kicker, initially to confirm seats, Swiss charges a fee, which was paid for all (4) Swiss legs of the trip.  The UA change eliminated one of the legs to reduce her number of stop overs.  United was AWESOME in helping us with this change.  when contacting Swiss to ask to refund the $50 for the assigned seat, the agent 1st said that that was out of policy and also refused to allow me to speak to a supervisor who was apparently not available.  REALLY?  I am stuck paying $50 for a seat on a flight which we are no longer using that is almost 3 months out?  As I have been booking flights for my entire family to spend time in Europe, the booking experience and this event with Swiss is by far the worst of the experiences I Have been encountering.  It's not about $50, it's about doing the right thing for the consumer.  Unless this is dealt with I will avoid Swiss Air at all cost for future travels.  Be careful when booking with this airline!

title: Great Fligth
review_text: Great Service on Board and also friendly Crew. I would recommend Swiss if you want to Fly from Zurich.

title: Dreadful
review_text:
Flew to Geneva on 2nd March for our ski trip. We were late boarding. Once boarded there was a lot of commotion then the captain said that they were going to take half of the baggage off the plane due to a problem with a fie panel in the hold.  Then they said they were going to take all of the luggage off the plane as taking half the luggage off would make the plane top heavy. Fair play. So why didn't they just get another plane! Then they promised that the luggage was going to come on a plane later that evening so we understood that we would fly to Geneva, wait at Geneva for our luggage. Liars. In Geneva were told that luggage wasn't going to arrive until the next day - by taxi sometime. We were given a form to complete. We had no clean underwear, nothing. Our ski pass had been paid for but we had no luggage. We were unable to go skiing. What a wasted day. We phoned Swiss air. Our luggage was still in Gatwick!!!!!!! Later that afternoon we phone Swiss air. Our luggage was lost!!!!! Later that evening our luggage was still lost!!!!!!!!! Later that evening we received our luggage about 11pm. Our friends luggage arrived at 3am the next morning. so nice to be woken at 3am in the morning with someone banging on the door of the chalet!!!!!

Our ski passes were pre-paid with the chalet. They cost 65 euros a day each. There were 6 of us. Swiss Air refused to pay us for the loss of our days ski-ing saying it was something they do not pay out for. Shame on you Swiss  Air.

title: Good service.
review_text: We have flown in this airline quite frequently over the past 15 years, and have found it to be a very good airline, with superior service, food & beverages, and ground facilities. Highly recommended.

title: St must be the only airline which offers something free during the flight. Snack, drink and Swiss chocolate.
review_text:
I think it is the only airline which offers snack, drink and Swiss chocolate free. Everyone should travel with them.

My recommendation is for the airline and not for a holiday in Zurich as the city is very expensive. Three to four times more than London. The quality certainly not 3 to 4 times more. Travel somewhere else . Better value for money.

title: Great flight but an unnecessary layover
review_text: The aircraft was comfortable and clean. The service was very good, especially if you compare it with American Airlines or other US airlines. The flight departed on time and arrived early at 8:00 AM. We got to Zurich with plenty of time to board a 9:50 AM flight to Athens; however, we had to wait for a 1:10 pm flight, and this flight did not take off until 2:30 PM. By the time we got to Athens we had wasted an entire day.

title: No wonder why is one of the best!
review_text: No wonder why is one the best airlines in the world, the service is outstanding across the classes; besides in 2019 was ranked 8th in the world for its clean fleet.

title: Italy vacation
review_text: The crew was exceptional and the seats were pretty tight but doable. The wine and food was good. I'd fly Swiss Air to Europe again.

title: One of the best Business Class Services
review_text: We really enjoyed Swiss' Business Class services.   Onboard the food and service were really top notch and it is certainly among the top European carriers. The seats were comfortable (lay flat) and the interior design of the cabin is among the most sophisticated. And the Zurich Lounge is a very enjoyable stay.   Better than Lufthansa Business Class in our humble opinion.

title: Poor IFE , mediocre food
review_text: Few weeks ago I had the chance to fly with Swiss from Amsterdam to New York via Zurich and back . Sadly Swiss was rather disappointing in so many levels . Poor and old IFE , small choice of movies many of those old . Food rather mediocre . Seat pitch on the A330 quite cramped , comparable to a Low cost airline .

title: Very nice service!
review_text:
I took a flight from Chicago to Zurich for business trip. Very nice service and comfortable seat. 
Movie selection was pretty good!

title: Clockwork style transportation
review_text: Flight to Miami via Z√ºrich was textbook or why not video manual of how it should be done. Smooth take off and landing, stellar service by professional and friendly crew. The food was actually really good. How often do you say that.

title: connecting flight from  Rome to Zurich to Newark ended up in geneva
review_text:
We were flying in February from Rome to connect in Zurich to return to Newark
The original flight was delayed 
We then missed our connection. We were then put on a flight to Geneva
we were given 2 tickets to travel on a trolly to a hotel outside of the airport
the hotel was supposed to honor a dinner cert. We were offered a dried pasta dish

we ended up spending $90 US for 2 Burgers and 2 Beers plus 20 Euro for a cab ride back in the morning

then another flight delay

While better than United (the worst) not impressed with the airline

title: Extremely disappointing claim handling!
review_text:
The best way to rate the quality of a company is to assess their handling of problems, as the way they deal with the customer in a situation like that can make all the difference between an excellent company and a business with poor customer service.

Delivering excellent service when things are going smoothly is not that difficult. What is probably even more important is how a service provider reacts when things go wrong.

In December 2018 I flew from ZRH to NRT. When arriving at my destination and opening my suitcase, I realised that it had been opened by Zurich Airport Authorities during a routine inspection. I found a notice inside, explaining that some flammable items had been removed for security reasons. Fair enough.
However, I was also missing a brand-new expense cashmere scarf, which I had brought along with me on my trip to Switzerland (still in its wrapping and with the tag on), but which I ended up not actually wearing due to the warm temperatures.

An e-mail inquiry with the Airport Authorities revealed that I needed to make a claim against SWISS, rather than the airport.

So I filed a claim through the SWISS Website in January, shortly after which I received an e-mail response from a consultant at their Customer Feedback Services, apologising for the incident, accepting the claim itself and the amount I had stated (estimated retail value of JPY 30,000, or approx. CHF 300), and asking me to provide details of my bank account, so that the funds could be transferred within the next 14 days.

That was about 3 months ago...

To this day, I'm still waiting for the money. On 25 February, upon further inquiry, I was told by the consultant that she was checking with their Accounting Department to find out the reason for the delay.

Since then the person has not responded to any of my further e-mail messages. And a second claim I entered through their Website (with reference to the original one) also prompted no response from the airline whatsover. That in my eyes, is extremely poor customer service!

I thought it might be easier to talk to Customer Services over the phone, to see what's going on. But I had to realise that SWISS does NOT maintain a phone number for Customer Services...
When talking to a representative, all I was told was to "file another online claim, as Customer Service personnel were not reachable via phone". When explaining that I had already done that, and that I had not received any response in almost 2 months despite repeated contact attempts, the answer was: "I'm sorry, but all you can do is to file another claim with the online form."

The most puzzling thing for me in this whole matter is that my original claim had been dealt with very efficiently, with a settlement offer being made almost immediately, and I remember thinking at the time how satisfactory it was to deal with an airline that was eager to keep their customers happy after an unfortunate event, and to offer a compensation without making a big fuss...

It almost seems as if the person I was corresponding with had acted without authorization in offering me that settlement, and now, upon realising or after being reprimanded, she simply decided to ignore my e-mails, hoping that I would eventually give up and go away. And knowing, of course, that I have absolutely no means of escalating this to anyone more senior at the airline.

If I had been told at the very beginning that the airline could not be held responsible for my loss, I would probably just have accepted it and filed a claim with my travel insurance instead.

But first accepting responsibility and offering compensation, and then simply not delivering on that promise, and instead just refusing to respond, that is not acceptable behaviour for any business, and less so for a reputable airline like SWISS, which prides itself on its customer service!
Moreover, if I now approach my insurance company for a claim, I will have to explain to them why I'm only doing so now, almost 4 months after the event, and then they will probably be rather unwilling to pay out, knowing that the airline had already promised to reimburse me...

Because I'm flying between Tokyo and Zurich a lot, and SWISS not only offers the fastest and most convenient route, but also at attractive rates, I will no doubt continue to use the airline also in future. But that doesn't hide the fact that I'm deeply, deeply disappointed in their handling of this matter, and I will be wary in the future.

title: Russian bound
review_text: Amazing quick, peaceful airline. Service and food were wonderful, and time went by quickly. Will look for Swiss Air again when traveling over seas.

title: Tightly squeezed cattle class
review_text:
Customer Service
The flight to Zurich, the staff were slightly more senior in age and because it's a red eye flight, they were probably more grim. I was thrown to the last 5 rows to the back on the side aisle seat (not much noise from the lavatory) but every time a crew passes me, they have to bump into my seat, arm or arm rest which I have absolutely no idea why.
12 hour flight. Water was not served as often (during lights out) as other airlines.

Aircraft
The seats are MUCH smaller than what I have experienced on other airlines (Cathay, Emirates, Singapore Airlines). The seats were really petite. So much so that when I was seated with a tall german lady (she was in the center), she was practically sitting on my seat too. 
Legroom for me is fine but for that tall german lady who is hovering a good 1.78m to 1.8m, her knees were practically touching the back of the seat in front of her. 

Personally, I would not pay for the airline myself.

title: good enough service
review_text:
We flew on a sunny Sunday from Zurich to SFO after a family vacation. The flight was long, but went by quickly, thanks in part to the good entertaining system on this aircraft, Boeing 770-300.
The seats are quite cramped, that seems to be the norm nowadays. Service was nice and quick. 
All in all a good enough experience.
The flights on this route seems to be very full, maybe because it's a shared flight with United. 
I highly recommend you book your seat, it costs to do so, but I think it's worth it.

title: If you value on-line check-in don‚Äôt fly SWISS
review_text: I travel regularly and Swiss is just OK, like any other national carrier. Just don‚Äôt choose them if you want to check-in on-line and avoid middle seats in the rear. I used this airline several times this year and just once the on-line check-in worked. And don‚Äôt expect solutions from the so-called support team

title: Very good service of any star alliance flight especially swiss & lufthansa
review_text: I have been over past 25 years a loyal customer of star alliance flights & mostly travel by Swiss or Lufthansa. I would highly recommend to all. They have a good frequent traveller card programme, good service & in my experience swiss has always been on time even in winters. My trip to dubai my swiss flight was cancelled & when i called them they immediately put me on the very next available flight of Lufthansa which was in 3 hrs. Thats what i like about them excellent service. Keep it up.

title: A little disorganised.
review_text: We booked muticity flights for a good deal with this airline. The leg space between seats was extra tight. Boarding process was a little disorganised. Flight was delayed by about an hour. Overall, an ok experience.

title: Safe feeling flying with Swiss beeing terrified of flying in general
review_text: As soon as I enter a Swiss plane I feel safe. Usually I'm terryfied flying and I have a big trouble making it throu the flight. It must be something with the seats, they make me feel comfortable and give me a safe feeling. When ever I have to fly I try to get a flight with Swiss.

title: Brilliant service in business class
review_text: I am a disabled passenger who recently flew Swiss to Athens via a brief stopover in Zurich. I cannot fault this airline! We felt welcome and valued. The food was divine. A cold platter of meat and cheese and potato salad plus dessert for the first leg and a hot meal of beef and polenta with fresh salad, dressing in a cute small bottle (but I found oil to be too bitter). Fresh warm bread on second leg (first leg the bread was not warmed). Lots of ice for our drinks and lovely champagne that I indulged in just for the sake of it, even though I am not a drinker. We sat on the first row which was spacious enough for a big person like me due to having a small armrest by window that your fatty bits can slide over and under. Only downside to row 1A-C is that the wall protrudes a bit in contrast with seats 1 D-F. As for legroom, there is plenty of knee room but you still have to keep your knees at 90 degrees angle which can be a bit tiring for people with large feet and week knees and ankles. Seat 1C has ample legroom as you can stretch your legs in the passage to the galley when there is no service cart but that is not normally available for PRMs. The middle seat is left free so I was able to use its armrest tray to sit my tray of food and my glasses (I am too fat to use my own tray. However, moderately fat people will be able to use the tray because it slides out far enough.) Talking of the seats, they are on the hard side which became an issue on the second (longer) flight but that was probable me, because I couldn't move to release the pressure. On arrival to Zurich, I had to wait for the other passengers to disembark and there was some confusion about the location of my wheelchair (Heathrow staffer had not explained she was putting the wheelchair all the way through to Athens) but the lady porter was reassuring and even dropped me off at the toilet. Zurich airport looks so pretty and it is a pity I didn't book a longer transit time in order to enjoy exploring it. Just for your information, a business flight with Swiss is just about ¬£40 more than an economy flight (depending on dates of course and demand) so for ¬£40 for two people, I'd say it is well worth it! Free luggage, free food and drinks, and real porcelain plates and glasses - that is the life!

title: A comfortable nights sleep
review_text: This was my first time flying with Swiss and I was very impressed.  I was seated in 10A, a king seat meaning it was a single seat positioned between two side tables.  This provides a lot of space and a lot of privacy.  The seat itself is an airbed, you can pump the air up or down to ensure maximum comfort.  I slept through dinner but before sleeping completed in a lengthy breakfast menu which was delicious.  The only element I thought could be improved was the amenity pack, which was a tin case comprising the bare essentials.

title: NEVER choose Swiss Airline EVER AGAIN
review_text: The airline has lost our luggages and fail to send it back to us during our stay in Switzerland. Worst Experience ever.

title: A really Terrible Experience with SWISS Airline
review_text: The airline has lost both of my friend and my luggage and BREAK the promise to deliver our lost luggage back to us within 2 days and till 4 days staying here in Switzerland we still haven't got back our luggage and our vacation are nearly to the end.

title: BEWARE CARRY ON BAGGAGE POLICY
review_text:
They have a DRACONIAN baggage policy.  10 KG for business class carry on total across all bags, very strictly enforced.  That policy plus a 90 minute baggage delay left me terribly late to business meetings.

I have traveled all over US, Asia and Europe and it is basically worse than most basic economy classes.

title: Amazing Experience
review_text: Friendly and charismatic crew who offered a very relaxed service. This was my first time traveling abroad the United States and they made the experience a lot less nervous for me. I would fly this airline again and again. Thank you!

title: Getting worse
review_text: I used to fly with Swiss all the time, and held 'Senator' status for several years. I returned to BA, despite the inconvenience of an additional stop-over in London, because of the poor attitude of the staff. I was made to strip my laptop, iPad & spare battery out of my bag so they could put my bag into the hold prior to boarding as they had a busy flight. I had combined clothes and work things into a single bag to save space. My colleague had separated into 2 bags and was allowed to take both on board while I had the embarrassment of unpacking mine at the gate. On this flight , just after the trolley had past I needed the bathroom. Seeing that I couldn't pass to the rear because of the trolley and 2 attendants I moved through business class to use the bathroom at the front. Despite holding senator status I was refused entry 'it's the rules' and had to return to the rear waiting several minutes for the snack Service to be completed, despite the forward toilet being unoccupied. Customer Service nil.

title: The flight was so late, phone agents are poorly trained.
review_text:
The trip was on Air Canada from Vancouver to London then on Swiss from London to Zurich. So the luggage rules of Air Canada should apply. Air Canada advised me to contact Swiss to reserve the space for my skis. And then I had quite an argument - how many ski sets I can have per passenger. Per Air Canada - a ski bag can contain many sets of skis, as long as they fit into one bag - it is one piece of luggage. Not for Swiss - only one pair per passenger. Despite the fact that the first leg is on Air Canada and the luggage will be checked in all the way from  Vancouver to Zurich. I just hanged up them.  It all worked fine at the end but the flight arrived more then 1 hour late. Was not as accurate as Swiss watch. They should train their phone people better so they know IATA rules.
i

title: A little bit disappointed with Swiss
review_text:
Last March I went to Spain, the flight to Barcelona was perfect. The service in the airplane was very good. The seat was comfortable. But, one day before to come back to Switzerland the Airline sent me a message communicating me the flight was cancelled without any reason. Give me another flight to one day later doing a transfer in Munich. The company don‚Äôt wanted to pay me the compensation for this cancellation and the all extra costs like Hotel, extra cost of my Parking in Zurich Airport, one day of my work lost. I used the AirHelp service to complaint for all this. In the end the company accept the complaint and paid me the compensation following the European Rules about inconveniences caused. I recommend to any person if have some issues in the flight like cancellations or long waiting‚Äôs, complaint about that and demand the payment for this inconveniences caused using company‚Äôs like AirHelp or similar. 

I was expecting some more serious and fair for Swiss, but probably most of the Airlines trying to do the same. 

Don‚Äôt be fear to demand your rights like a passenger.

title: Great service
review_text: Great airline, used to fly to Geneva for a short ski trip and would happily use again. Flight includes a little snack and bottle of water too. Beers available with two beers costing less than ¬£10

title: Comfortable and Efficient
review_text: Overall the trip was as comfortable as expected in economy.  The leg room is similarly restricted as with most airlines.  The staff is very friendly and pretty accommodating.  The food was standard fare with two options (meat or no meat).  The bonus is of course the chocolate.

title: Good experience
review_text: Oslo - Zurich - Oslo With a Bombardier airplane was a nice experience, feeling better then any Boeing or Airbus. Zurich airport very clean and a very good airport. Zurich - Bangkok - Zurich     From Zurich to Bangkok With Swiss Air Boeing 777 from Bangkok to Zurich With Thai Airways (codeshareflight) Boeing 777 , on economyclass near every company using Boeing 777 has more or less the same service. This time on Thai Air returnflight the food was just terrible. Conclusion for the overall flight, economyclass is near or less the same as any other Company, on this route I tried 9 Companies in 6 years. A big pro for choosing Swiss Air must be the transfer Zurich Airport, very clean, the best airport I ever bee for a transfer.

title: Accountability is the name of the game
review_text: With slight deviations, SWISS is reliable. Have had several times problems with on-line check-in at Zurich. Have been, however,  awarded reparations with apologies. It worked this time. Am not a vegetarian but try to avoid meat on flights. The vegan meals served in flight aren't bad but far from impressing. Apparently the  way  all meals are served on Economy.  Service is always nice like everywhere in Switzerland. We departed with a 45 minutes delay but landed just 20 minutes after schedule.  The traditional Swiss chocolates have not been offered on the flight and not for the first time on the route. The seats configuration on the 777-300 with 10 seats across on Economy  is far from being  comfortable. Definitely not on a par with the capacity of a big wide-body jet.

title: Friendly service - tasteful food
review_text: We‚Äòve enjoyed our flight from Zurich to Singapore: Business Class is very OK when you take the aisle seats. So you have not to disturb anybody when you get up for the toilets or whatever. The food has been tasteful as always - especially the breakfast is top - the best of all airlines.

title: What a surprise!!
review_text: We were delayed but still made our connections. The flight itself was great. The dinner dishes were okay, but was made up in fresh and warm bread, prosecco, swiss chocolate, great desserts!! Staff was very friendly as well. Legroom was fine, but the flight wasn't full so we had 2 seats both way :). Also very flexible with luggage.

title: Nice product but slow service
review_text:
Swiss airlines have consistently good service but oh dear, why does it take so long before the drinks are served‚Ä¶not to speak about dinner! 

When flights leave late evening then surely drinks and food should be served without delay to ensure a good night's rest. 

The pillows are very small and when compared to the new Lufthansa pillows in business class this item can be easily upgraded.

title: Swiss is always a pleasure to fly, when they fly
review_text: The first leg with Swiss from Montreal to Zurich was very pleasant and without any mishaps. At arrival in Zurich we transferred to the flight to Tel Aviv and after putting on our seat belts we were told to leave the airplane due to technical problems and wait at the gate in terminal E for further information. After 20 minutes the flight was cancelled and we were told to go to terminal A to rebook our flight. Arriving at the transfer desk we stood for 4 hours in line and were rebooked for the next morning. During these 4 hours we were not offered water or any food. We were rebooked with a connection since all direct flights were full, also for the next day. A hotel was offered with meals without any cost. Thanks for that.

title: Have seen worse & have seen better
review_text:
Swiss airline economy seats were normally tight as most airlines bottom line you get a great vein of the passenger head in front of you. 

I do have to give a great shoutout to the ticket agents. They were great in working to get us on the flight. But this goodwill was eaten away by the poor attitude of the flight attendants.   They just did their job. Blunt with no smiles and don‚Äôt expect anything else.

title: Swiss Airline should be the standard
review_text: I was very impressed with the comfort with economy. Food was excellent! Only draw back was no plugs in economy to charge devices.

title: Swiss Functionality
