review_text: Waited for me as I ran across the airport from a late connection, had sent someone to my connection gate to send me to the right gate and tell me to hurry. Extremely efficient service on the plane. And they give you chocolate :)

title: Worst customer experience
review_text: Recently flown Swiss Airlines from Zurich to Boston back in late March.  Flight was canceled due to technical reasons - at time of re-booking (keeping in mind I had to wait 3 hours to do so at the airport), they assured me I would be properly compensated due to the EU 261/2004 regulation for air passenger rights (600 Euros due to canceled flight, plus hotel accommodation / meals / transportation / etc) I would just need to contact customer service upon my arrival.  Everything else was provided, but shockingly they denied me compensation.  Spent 5 days going back and forth with customer service - please note they also won't discuss anything over the phone, only email - only to have them deny it.  I have heard similar horror stories to how Swiss Air treats customers regarding this and consistently denying unlawful and unethically these claims.  Will have to seek legal action.  Very disappointed with how Swiss air handled this - will no longer use their airlines.

title: Uncomfortable seating on international flight
review_text: I travelled in June & August 2018.  In short the seating size (width) and I am of average built & height but the leg room was atrocious and unacceptable!!!!!  Sitting straight up my legs touched the back of the seat in front of me.  The size of the chair is suited only for children. I do realise the airlines want to make money but really, this felt like being stuck in a chicken coop.......  My legs cramped a lot so the duration of the trip was extremely uncomfortable and unbearable. Thank you but no thank you, I will definitely not fly Swissair again.

title: Good final flight!
review_text: This was our last flight on the way to Germany. We landed in Zurich airport and took a shuttle train to Concourse A. The plane was a Bombardier Q400 in Star Alliance livery. It was great for a 45 minute flight. Swiss chocolate was handed out before landing, which was delicious.

title: avoid short layover
review_text:
First of all the flight was great, service was good, and the food was good.  The reason to avoid short layover is to avoid missing your connecting flight and also the stress.  
We had a 55 mins layover in Zurich coming from Barcelona, our destination is the U.S.  To make the story short, our plane left Barcelona late, meant we arrived late in Zurich.  We had to ran from terminal 1 to 2 in less than 15 mins in order for us to make it to our next flight.  Luckily our plane waited for us, and we were able to board the plane.  That part of our vacation wasnt fun especially with our 6 year old son.
Pls be mindful when booking your flight with a short layover especially with Swiss airline.

title: be ware and cautious
review_text:
Avoid short lay over from Barcelona to Zurich, if you have a connecting flight from Zurich to U.S.  We had a connecting flight from zurich to U.S. coming from Barcelona.  Our layover was 55 mins in Zurich, our plane arrived late and we only had 15 mins to board the other plane.  It was rough and stressful running from terminal 1 to terminal 2 in Zurich.  Luckily we made it, plane waited for us (bunch of us). Never again I'll take a short layover.
Other than that the Flight was great, service was great, food was good with Swiss airline.

title: Comfortable Business Class
review_text: I'm 1K on United so I don't often fly other international airlines, but this was a trip with a group of friends and we decided to go together and we ended up on Swiss home bound. It's a 12 hour flight Zurich to San Francisco and I was very happy with the movie selection as I was able to get 3 Academy award nominated movies in on the flight the weekend after the awards! Flight attendants were very available and polite. This was a day flight, so I expect that they would be. Food was acceptable but nothing special, I have yet to experience airline food that I would even call "good". .Overall, I was satisfied and would not hesitate to recommend if someone asked me. However, I have no experience with their coach product.

title: Good flight
review_text: Smooth flight. Friendly staff. The seats were good. The food was good. The movies were ok. And they gave chocolate to everyone.

title: Excellent flight
review_text: Excellent flight. Took off on time and landed early.Cabin crew efficient but not terribly interested in passengers.

title: Pleasant flight
review_text: Midweek morning flight from Zurich to Manchester. Our inbound flight to Zurich from Singapore arrived only 40 minutes before our onward flight was due to take off and it was touch and go whether we would make it but the ground staff the gate were aware that we had a connection and they expedited our boarding. Sadly there was a less helpful attitude from the airport staff at the security point through which we had to pass before getting to the gate.  We were seated in row 8 and enjoyed extensive leg room and comfortable seats.  The service was pleasant and the flight arrived on time.

title: Average Economy flight
review_text: I'm not a big fan / enthusiast of Swiss, I took them since it was the best connection from ZRH / SFO and back ... my reduced love goes back years and I don't see reasons to change my position. But to be fair, it was a good flight, met the expectation (clean, on-time and relaxed ... but also the tight leg room and the mediocre food / beverage service). I paid extra for being more in the front (to exit the plane quicker when landed) but these preferred seats had no extra leg room ... you just pay for sitting more in the front. The leg room is not great for a 12h flight.

title: Average long haul flight
review_text: I like the 777 plane, it's for me more comfortable then the A340 ... Though I have years of 777 experiences with Emirates and compared to a A380 a 777 is just too tight and less comfortable in economy class. Clean, average service, tight leg room and for a 12h flight from ZRH to SFO it's just a bit too tight. Entertainment system is better then in the past but not outstanding.

title: Very very good!
review_text: The plane was empty so I got 4 seats on a twelve hour flight! The food was also good and so was the movie selection! The only thing I didn‚Äôt like was how cold it was, but luckily I had 4 blankets so it was fine.

title: Almost Perfect, Yet Flawed
review_text:
The flight was from SFO to Zurich.  In Zurich, I took a connecting flight to the final destination, Nice. Swiss planes reflect the country.  Everything is quite organized, clean, and professional. Yes, the flight crew smiles and says hello.....There is an overall sense, that they are your smiling Swiss hosts.

What is interesting is my return flight was on Lufthansa (the parent airline). This provides an easy point of comparison for you. 

Yes, the crew was excellent, professional, and quite kind (rather like visiting a small Swiss town).  In fact, the crew was so nice, I almost feel guilty mentioning any negatives (Gulp). 

I only had 2 complaints with my Swiss Air experience. My issues are going to be difficult for the Swiss to fix.  First the seats (even on Business Class) are not as comfortable as you get with Lufthansa. Now considering that the seats are your actual contact  to the plane, this happens to be a fairly big deal.  I do not understand why Lufthansa seats should be so much better than Swiss Air seats, but they are!  There is a real quality difference. Given a choice, now, I would rather fly Lufthansa.

Issue number 2 could be cultural.  The planes are trimmed out with pegboard.  You remember this stuff.  It was often put on garage walls and little metal pegs are attached to it in order to keep garage rakes and hammers handy. If I were the designer, I would have selected a more upscale looking finish.  OK, this sounds petty, but this pegboard is just about ‚Äòeverywhere‚Äô.  You will even see it around your seat.  The look, to me, is close to what you would get if the plane was trimmed out with plywood.  

I would grade the food served at  a ‚ÄúB‚Äù.  It was nicely served, pleasant, yet, and nothing special or memorable.  

If you fly planes for the film selection, you could find a better variety and more choices elsewhere.  For me, however, a guy with just a moderate interest in film while flying, the choices offered were quite acceptable (again, like the food, if not memorable). 

Overall, and until Swiss Air improves those seats, I would likely select another airline, given the choice.  That is a shame and I hate to admit it.  Those kind Swiss people have me feeling guilty for this review.  The overall experience was close to what you might have flying British Air......Pleasant enough, but somehow, something, is lacking...20 years ago, I would not have made that statement.  

Perhaps the score is somewhat lower because I was able to compare and contrast my experience with the Lufthansa return flight.  Normally, Lufthansa scores highest among European airlines.  Still, an airline like Austrian Air (owned by Lufthansa) seems to be trying even harder and will impress you with their dining options.  Did I mention that pegboard?

title: Great seats, less great consideration
review_text: What impressed me was that the coach seats are the most comfortable for that level that I can recall. They are not too wide, but I was on the isle and though there was a big guy next to me it was wide enough. They recline a lot and though I am 6' 2" there was room under the seat ahead to stretch my legs. I slept well and did not cramp. Problem came when at my destination my doctor told me to come back before my return flight though I had bought nonrefundable. After two calls a Swiss person said they MIGHT change my return IF I got a note from that doctor. I ended up getting my doctor to relent and put off my appointment till after the return flight. Almost all other airlines allow one to simply pay a fee to change the flight date. Also, their coach is about the most expensive in the business and they still nickel and dime you to choose your seats. But the service in-flight is fine.

title: Fair to Middling
review_text:
Flew return from Dubai to JFK via Zurich in business with my family. 

The outbound journey was punctual, the on board entertainment mediocre and the seating layout just plain wired - do your research before selecting a seat. Some of the business class seats are like thrones with armrest consoles either side, whilst others leave you slightly exposed on the aisles and I would imagine by the looks of them that you‚Äôd be getting a feeling of being hard done by for the same price. 

The outbound journey had the most uncomfortable seats I‚Äôve had in business and they urgently needed an over haul. They also don‚Äôt go quite flat which for me (183cm) is ok, but not so comfortable for others. 

Return journey was a different story, same aircraft and layout but the seats were much better and far more comfortable. 

Lounge in Zurich is functional without being amazing, which is a reflection on Swiss as a whole. They were half the price (around US$ 10,000 for 2 adults 1 child) I‚Äôd have to pay on Emirates or Etihad, with more that half the value. 

Would fly with them again, but I‚Äôd also canvas other options.

title: Swiss airline ! No please No
review_text: I changed my flight a week before departure from Marrakech to Jhb. The website call canter nr was wrong but I got assisted by Lufthansa and got confirmation that the flight was changed and got the eticket . When I arrived at the airport in Marrakech I was refused boarding as the ticket apparently was not paid despite my proof of ticket and my credit card notification on my phone. I missed the flight and had to call Swiss again . I was put on hold for 63 min to be told I can rebook a single return flight  in Economy at the cost of a return in business class flight 2 days later . I then rebooked with Qatar for the same day and as I requested cancellation and refund I was told the flight was missed and I cannot do that YET I WAS REFUSED TO BOARD . I will avoid this ridiculous airline at all cost as maybe the flights are available, if you encounter a problem you will just loose and be left to sort your out THEIR mistake at your cost .

title: Not Good To Trust Swiss Airlines.
review_text:
The Airlines uses CheapoAir as there agents. They charge for every change and every delay.
Very Rude and Least Caring. I will never take this airlines in future.
My wife travelled with a baby 7 months old. The Staff was least helpful. They just keep blaming the passenger.It was a shock to have come across such a bunch of Rude and Lazy Staff.
I suggest you pull up your socks as there were a lot of passengers complaining.
Imagine if you are travelling across the goble with you 7 month old baby. Treat us the same way.

title: Great Service...Outdated Equiptment
review_text: Great airline...great service and cabin and flight crew were outstanding.  While the aircraft was excellent, economy seats were a little tight and not totally comfortable for such a long flight.  I should have spent more and upgraded.

title: Vol comfortable et personnel attentif
review_text:
When we travel to Asia, we fly Economy because we can easily have a stopover night in Dubai then continue our way with flights no longer than 5 to 7 hours maximum. But to go to South America, it‚Äôs not the same. And the long leg of the journey  is generally a night flight. And we can‚Äôt sleep sitting... So my husband and I made some research on internet and found a great deal with SwissAir. Of course it was not a direct flight (Bordeaux-Z√ºrich-Sao Paulo-Buenos Aires) but it was a small price to pay to be able to afford Business Class. The flight on the way out was with their partner Lufthansa. And the short flight from Brasil to Argentina was with Latham.
Anyway... We were very pleased with the flight. Comfortable and spacious ‚Äúpod‚Äù with flat bed for the night. Good food. The wine selection is not as extensive as on other lines but it was enough. Same for the choose of movies but as it was mostly a night flight it didn‚Äôt really matter.
Very attentive staff and thus with everybody. For ex, we had a Business flight recently with AirFrance and we noticed than you didn‚Äôt get the same level of attention if you were wearing a suit or a more casual outfit... 
The lounges were also excellent and it was such a joy to be able to have a shower on arrival in Zurich. The staff at the air was also very helpful and friendly.

title: A New Look
review_text: The Airbus A 340 of Swiss Airline has a New Look. The seats are much more conveniant and one has much more privacy then before. The screen is better to handle and also the sound quality is much better. The seating Surroundings offer a lot of Space for storage and one can now lock things like passport or glasses away safely. The only things that has not changed is the excellent sevice and the good Food. It was a very relaxing flight

title: Good service, seat's width is tight
review_text: I recently flew Swiss Air from LAX to Zurich and back. The service is good. Entertainment is about the same compared to other international airlines. However, the seat's width is tight. Leg room is sufficient. The aircraft has 3-4-3 configuration. It can be quite miserable if you are in the middle seat.

title: ALWAYS LATE!!!!
review_text: airline using SWISS name by pretending that it has to do anything with a good quality.  bad service - one of the worst airline in the West EUROPE!!! almost the same as polish lot or even worse airBaltic. disgusting

title: Nice for International Flying
review_text:
I've been flying directly to the UK for nearly 30 years on Virgin Atlantic; this was our first experience flying to a different European nation on a different airline - so my comments about Swiss come from that background.

Mostly, the two airlines' economy class service are comparable. The one place where Swiss exceeds VA is in the legroom provided for economy flyers - it was definitely more comfortable for my husband and me.

Overall, the flight was very easy (considering the fact that flying overseas in economy is no picnic). Fewer meal choices on Swiss, but that's not a biggie - food and beverage were adequate and the flight staff worked hard to make people comfortable. Fewer amenities in economy as well, but we were prepared for that. 

Entertainment options were not as wide as on Virgin either, but the selection included some very recent hit movies and TV shows, and we understand that the airlines are all moving toward allowing travelers to use their own devices, so that's probably moot. The flight to Zurich did not have wireless internet, the flight back did. There is a USB port on the entertainment screen that allowed my husband to charge his phone; it did not work for my tablet. I don't know if that was a power issue or if I just had a faulty connection. 

We would definitely use this airline again.

title: Shocking
review_text: The flights themselves were distinctly average. We were delayed in both directions, on the way out for more that 3 hours, entitling us to compensation under EU law. Since then the airline has been shockingly poor in handling our request for compensation, trying to wriggle out of payment by making completely ridiculous and ultimately meaningless statements about why the flight was delayed.

title: Safe flight but in a tired/outdated plane
review_text:
Firstly the positives. There is no doubt one feels in safe hands with Swiss Air. The crew too are professional, courteous and pleasant. I also appreciated the choice to take hand luggage only at a slightly cheaper price. And indeed we have flown routes with Swiss which have proven very pleasant.

Our recent trip to New York, however, did not come up to scratch. The Airbus A330 looked tired and badly in need of a good refurbishment (or simply put into retirement); the screens are miniscule by most reputable airlines' standards and the range of films and TV shows leaves much to be desired; while the food was pleasant enough, there are signs of budget cuts - witness a bit of iceberg lettuce with a few strands of shredded carrot as the salad entr√©e, and the tasteless sliver of packeted cheese. While I can't be 100% certain, it also felt as if the maximum number of seats had been squeezed in thus making it feel cramped on all sides. 

I know there's little competition for the Geneva-JFK route but surely Swiss Air, your passengers deserve better than this.

title: Assistance with a canceled flight
review_text: I was scheduled to fly back from ZRH to BOS on Swiss. The week before, I had taken a very bad fall on ice and my whole right side from knee to wrist was battered and bruised and pretty much useless, could barely walk a few steps. Swiss took care of me once I made it to the check-in counter. Super, super friendly, considerate and helpful! And then my flight got canceled - again they took care of everything like re-booking, hotel accommodations for the night, and transportation. They kept me informed every step of the way. I just can't say enough good things about them!

title: Gladly again
review_text: As always, good service from check-in to baggage claim. Friendly and attentive crew. Food was adequate, best of all the little bars of Swiss chocolate! Movie selection quite limited for a seven hour flight. I am small, so legroom no issue.

title: Non existing service
review_text:
We were on a flight with no other babies and we got no help in getting a seat with bassinet for our 7 months old daughter. They did not even make an effort to try to meet us in our need. 
Our experiences with all other flight corporations we have been met with very good and helpful service, even if we were not able to get just one seat for me or my wife to sit with the baby at a seat with a bassinet. And earlier I used to think that Swiss air was a top class flight company. Not anymore are we flying with Swiss.

title: DON'T BITE ON THE "BOGUS" UPGRADE OFFER
review_text:
This is the email I sent to SWISS regarding their bogus upgrade bid offer.  YOU WILL PAY MORE than if you bought business class originally.  Don't be sucked in by the upgrade offer.

To Swiss Air
I notice the lowest acceptable bid for an upgrade would make our ticket slightly higher than other family paid for business class on the same flight; and the top bid with exc. possibility to be accepted is thousands more than they paid.  SHAMEFUL.  I have a very poor opinion of SWISS after this and will review on various sites accordingly.  This is nothing more than tricking consumers into paying over the going rate that was available for business class when they bought their tickets originally. It really is disgusting.

title: Confi Business Class
review_text: The BC is quite new, and quite confortable. however the meal Quality was not top compared to similar Airlines (thus 1 star less). Most important, the Crew was nice, knowledgable.

title: Great flight
review_text: This was a great flight and we flew with an auctioned upgrade to business class with the whole family. Was a great experience and Swiss Airlines are really worth the extra money for the auctioned upgrade (400 CHF per person - family of 3). Great food and the service was impeccable. Tja is you Swiss Airlines!!!!

title: Efficient but mediocre meals
review_text: Bought the upgraded economy seating for the "extra" benefits ...there were none! Meals are boring and very basic staff are very courteous but robotic. Great flight crew on time and safe . I guess that is all you actually want from an airline .

title: Tight fit!
review_text:
Economy class seating was very cramped.  I am 5‚Äô6‚Äù, so not tall!  The space between my seat and the seat in front of me was very narrow.  When seated my knees were only 1-2‚Äù away from the seat in front of me (upright position).  It was a difficult struggle to get up to use the restroom especially is the seat in front is in a reclined position.  I felt bad for those taller during the 9 hour flight. Swiss does not offer extra legroom seating unless you upgrade to Business or First Class.

Flight attendants were friendly, professional and efficient.  Food was average.  Small bottled water are provided to passengers which was a nice touch as was the snacks and non-alcoholic beverages were made available in the galley after the meal service...help yourself!  

Above average overall.

title: Finally, an airline that wants customers to be satisfied!
review_text: They could not do enough for us!  Even though there was an unexpected problem in Zurich (one passenger had to be removed), and resultant delay, the cabin crew and pilots were bending over backwards to make us comfortable.  Very satisfied with the flight and comfort as well, but its the crew that makes this a special airline!

title: Great experience
review_text: I had never flown Swiss Air prior to this. Flight from Budapest to Zurich was easy, flight from Zurich to San Francisco was unexpectedly easy too!  The flight crew was attentive and helpful, food choices were good and plenty of snacks.  On board entertainment was current and great. I will seek out the opportunity to fly Swiss Air again. Highly recommend!

title: Great Flight and Attendants!
review_text: We had a wonderful flight to Zurich!  I rarely write reviews; however, the flight attendants were incredible!  Very attentive and just made the flight so enjoyable!  Thank you so much!!!!

title: Super as Always
review_text: I fly Swiss once or twice a year and I always find it very good.  seats are comfy and the Cabin Attendants are friendly and very helpful with anything you ask.

title: Classic & reliable
review_text: Departing from Zurich is always a delight, it's not the largest of airports but it gives you a taste of the Swiss products with world fame such as their watches and chocolate. Flying is Swiss is nothing exciting but rock solid and reliable. Beverage and meals are good and finish with a piece of Swiss milk chocolate. Those who love geography, landscapes and make pictures, pick a window on the left (east). You'll admire the vast Sahara desert and other great views that make the flight look shorter than it is.

title: Lucky switch
review_text: We had lovely food and drink in the lounge during our layover in Delhi, before we took off for New York. Our flight was smooth, with an excellent meal, the newest movies, and smiling attendants. This was a switch from the Lufthansa flight we had expected to take...but it was a lucky switch.

title: Poor customer service
review_text: Our first flight was late leaving Bordeaux, so we arrived in Zurich 15 minutes before our connecting flight was leaving. There were at least 10 of us trying to make that connection. The airlines provided a shuttle to take the two people that were connecting to another flight but made no effort for the ten of us. The next available flight was 4 hours later. We pain $1000 for two one-way tickets. I'll never use Swiss Airlines again.

title: Nothing extra-ordinary but nothing to complain either
review_text: I use this to travel to India each Dec. Its part of the star alliance and has got an extensive network. Food and service are good - nothing to rave about though. Good value for money

title: Best airline for short destinations
review_text: For me the best Airline for short destinations. I always choose Swiss if I have the possibility. Service is excellent. Friendly staff. Beverage and Snack for free. You do not find this any more on any short distance flights within europe as far as I know. They are doing a great Job!

title: Helpful, sympathetic crew, food surprisingly good
review_text: My wife and I had some hard luck in our travels, she breaking her arm and me with suddenly occurring severe back pain just prior to the flight. Swiss were sympathetic in accommodating us on the long flight with better seating, early boarding, and every request including being met by a wheelchair to be taken to our connecting flight. This overnight flight had two meals, the supper including a vegetarian (!) option that was quite good and breakfast simple but very nice.

title: Awful experience at Zurich Airport family check last week - never agai. Will travel Swissair!
review_text: My family (husband, son and daughter-in-Law) travelled with our 11 month Granddaughter and was told at the Swissair family check-in desk that no two piece buggy was to go through the terminus and had to be placed in two bags and go into the plane's hold, owing to Zurich Airport security. We were then instructed to rent a stroller, but there was no attendant on duty and we were reluctant to place a baby into a stroller, from a safety issue!! We then spent the next couple of hours in the airport terminus holding baby in our arms. When we arrived at the departure gate the check in attendant had placed all four adults in different seating rows. The plane was not full. We then requested we try and seat together and although this was achieved, it caused complete chaos to passengers because the seat numbers had been altered.  What was added to our dreadful experience was arriving at Heahtrow without a buggy and having to go through 5 travellaters, 3 escalators, passport control and the. Baggage reclaim to retrieve the buggy. As global travellers, this was a shocking ordeal that we never want to experience again. THANK YOU ZURICH AIRPORT & SWISSAIR for your customer service or NOT.

title: Swiss mediocrity
review_text: Just OK. Polite and professional service, but the usual cramped seat space and icky toilets. When Swiss Airlines was independent, it was much better.

title: Drama free travel
review_text: Do some air travel now and then, this time with Swiss. We were automatically checked in which was convenient. Decent service on board, coffee and a sandwich, for economy. Will probably travel with them again.

title: Not what it used to be
review_text: We fly Swiss almost yearly for international flights and we've noticed their service, cleanliness and over all satisfaction has gone down. The food on this specific flight was inedible. I don't expect gourmet meals, but edible would be nice. They don't serve ginger ale either. The flight attendants were cordial, although I can't use the word friendly. The cleanliness was a true disappointment. The seats were filthy, as were the arm rests and tv screens. A quick wipe with a sanitizing cloth was what I did and should have been done by flight crew prior to us boarding. The in-flight entertainment was the poorest choice I've ever experienced. It seems that Swiss Air is no longer a fierce competitor of the other major, finer airlines that provide the same routes.

title: "SHAME ON THEM"
review_text: I have put a Million Miles in over the past fifteen years with this airline.  Same flights Los Angeles to Zurich and Zurich to Los Angeles.  They informed me that the flight would be 4 hours late on departure 24 hours before.  IT really was 5 hours late, but more importantly, after paying a fortune to be in First Class got the worst service.  You would think the Flight Crew would be zealous to make everyone a little more comfortable (including all passengers not just the 6 passengers in First Class).  About 6 hours into the 11 1/2 hour flight I had to push the "help" button three times before an attendant arrived.  I asked for a glass with ice and water in it.  She brought me back the water in the old glass!  I pushed the button again and she said "Shame on me".  This company has gone back to its old ways before Luthansa purchased them.  I had a lot of time to think about this and I am boycotting this airlines.  "Shame on them"

title: Great as always
review_text: Zurich to Bangkok flight on Swiss was really great, cabin crew nice and efficient, with a full flight the cabin crew should clean more frequently the washrooms

title: Great Flight
review_text: Swiss airline is great, in economy still they serve my favorite Prosecco üòÇ, the cabin crew are not the friendliest (bkk to Zurich) a bit grumpy actually.

title: Same as raynair
review_text:
When I reserved the ticket, I thought that as a member of star alliance, the service would be excellent. I was completely wrong.

During the flight, we were served in the economy seat ONE glass of water and ONE chocolate bite.

I was informed that everything else was with an extra cost even though it was a 3 hours flight.

Afterwards, I found out that there was a policy change and the go light economy seat was not offered anything. This was mentioned with tiny letters in an paragraph of exceptions on the site (not in the app).

At least in raynair, you pay 10 euros for the ticket, not 50.

title: Good In-flight staff - bad seat reservation system & airport staff
review_text:
I visited Switzerland for 10 days last year, its truly one of the best places I've ever visited. On our return flight, I and my family went through the worst ever flying experience. We booked our seats well in advance but when we reached Zurich airport for our return flight to Dubai Swiss airlines staff at the airport changed our seats without asking us. 

They did not even bother to check once I was flying with my wife and we have an infant along with us. I got one front aisle seat and my wife got one in the last row. It was 7 hours flight and went through a lot of inconveniences. I recommend everyone to avoid Swiss airlines in case you do not want to spoil your trip. Overall food, service was average and staff at the airport was worst. In-flight staff was helpful and very professional and they tried their best to make up for the inconvenience caused to us.

title: Oh Chocolate!
review_text: My family has flown Emirates a few times and it is what we compare all our international flying to.  So far Emirates has spoiled us!  Swiss Airlines comes very close.  But there is one place where Swiss excels.  Chocolate!  At the close of the flight a tray is passed around and the chocolate is just heavenly.  Be a pig, grab a few pieces you will thank me later.  If I‚Äôm wrong, please feel free to mail me your chocolate!!

title: Flights rescheduled by 24 hours TWICE, zero help from customer service! Never again!!
review_text:
On two different occasions in the last year I booked with Swiss and they rescheduled by text. Change was to a DIFFERENT DATE both times and both times they tried to change me from a direct flight to an indirect flight. 
When I called the number in the text the customer service acted like I was booking flight for first time, no apologies from them whatsoever, seemed to think rescheduling was nothing to with them and were even rude on one occasion. I would NEVER fly with them again. Ended up paying an extra 200 euros with another airline to get into Geneva on the original date I had booked for and they offered no apology for the extra expense or inconvenience, let alone compensation.

title: not again............... same issue as last time.
review_text:
not again, just when the company lifted the ban flying with swiss they do it again, delayed flight and refused to pay compensation because they can. 

as an airline swiss are ok tyhe planes not the best, the biz lounges are ok, staff for the most part ok, 

but if your going to fly with them our bone of contention is that they do not follow rules. Rules that are laid down for your safety and wellbeing. so who knows how well the aircraft are maintained? esp if you pick and choose which rules to follow. 

now the company is putting swiss back on the blacklist for another two year punishment. and this limits how i get to travel.......

title: Great experience
review_text: I had a very pleasant trip thanks to Swiss Air. I would have missed my 1h50 layover due to the 2h delay, but they waited and the staff was extremely helpful. The flight attendants were very polite and made sure everyone's needs were met. Every thing you expect was on board, I even enjoyed the meals.

title: Probably as Good as it Gets for Economy Travelers.
review_text:
We only fly economy and if we have the option, and the price is competitive, we choose Swiss Air.  The economy seat space & comfort seems slightly better than others.  The entertainment system is OK.  The food is better than others.  The flight crew is good.  The plane is clean.

Best of all, we find changing planes in Zurich is a good experience.  The Zurich Airport is well designed and efficient.  Even when there is a line, they get you through in time.

Flights have been on-time.  We'll being flying Swiss again in June.

Check-in has been quick & easy.

title: AVOID this airline if you have food allergies!
review_text: AVOID this airline at all costs.  I spent over 1 hr 30 min trying to request a special meal for a nut allergy, only to find out 4 months ago they removed the ability to provide special meals.  They don't list ingredients on the foods and now expect me to carry enough food to last 12 hrs in flight!  I've never had such a bad experience with any other airline than the Lufthansa/Swiss Airlines group.  In a time when we need to be sensitive to special needs, this airline is NOT.

title: Good service for First
review_text:
The lounge in Zurich is very nice and classy.
The First cabin is trendy and nicely designed. 
The food is good and the service as well. The only problem is my seat didn‚Äôt work as a bed and kept folding back as a seat and I was downgraded in Business class as the cabin was full. 
The ground staff welcomes you at the jetty to ease the passport control, very good service.

title: Excellent Airline but bad service at New York JFK counter
review_text:
I always enjoy flying out of Zurich to JFK with Swiss and to see the pleasant staff at the airport in Zurich. Flight, service on board, drink service is always great. The return, however, is the pits from the friendliness in Kennedy at the counter and the cold treatment is really not to be proud of.  For the second time last year, I flew from Kennedy to ZRH and was asked to give up my hand luggage because it was not allowed as the aircraft was full. My luggage was a small samsonite much smaller than the permissible cabin luggage. Both times I boarded and could clearly see that the overhead bins had more than enough room for hand luggage. My hand luggage had medication which I was told to take out and I had nowhere to put it but to walk with my boxes of medication in my hands. Really ridiculous.  I had to stuff my boxes of medication in the seat pocket in front of me on the flight. Seems both times that they accommodated passengers from another flight who missed their flights. The staff at Kennedy need to be trained on how to handle Swiss passengers in a courteous and friendlier manner. The food on that segment is disgusting and tasteless. I got some kind of Asian food which tasted and looked bland! What's the deal Swiss why this terrible food compared to the ZRH/JFK route?  
As frequent traveler Itravel to other destinations with Swiss during the year and quite pleased otherwise. The rating here is based on the bad Kennedy experiences made!

title: Fantastic!!!
review_text: What a fantastic flight we had! Comfort, entertainment and staff all a big plus! Food and drink service were excellent! We even had Prosecco :)!! Only minor downside was that we couldn't check in online.

title: California to Europe  fastest non stop to Germany and other nearby countriesarea
review_text: 13 hour non stop flight and competitive price.  Going to Italy, Germany and Austria.  Arrive at Zurich airport (super clean and orderly) go down stairs to train and go to destination worry free.  Super comfortable........took train to Venice to start our trip.

title: Ski trip
review_text:
Flew with my family, (daughters and grandchildren )into Zurich, and then on to Geneva. 
The out bound flight went without a hitch with just a 50 minute connecting flight. Swiss Air staff were excellent. 
The return flight was very much the same, with a faultless service with both flights back to London Heathrow. 
Having had a clear run through passport control we walked into the baggage reclaim hall and as we approach the conveyor belt, our cases were the first up. Brilliant. 
However, we also had two ski bags to collect from the oversize baggage belt and that‚Äôs where our problem started. In short they were still in Geneva, but it took 2hours to reach that conclusion as the staff did not check properly to start with. When we finally spoke to someone that checked properly we were soon on our way with all the paperwork in hand and a promise they would deliver them to my home as soon as they got them back in the UK. To be fair they kept me fully updated with progress and both ski bags were delivered to my home within 48 hours all intact. Problem solved.

title: Good job
review_text: Nice flight. The remaining 100 charachters are for the idiot who designed this page. aslSKHFdskjlfhDSKLJFHsldkjfHLKFJHdslkjfhDSLKFJh;kljfHS;KDFJhdkfjHS;DKJ

title: Superb Service on Swiss
review_text: Our family enjoyed every moment of our Swiss flight from Zurich to Newark due to the very friendly  and helpful flight attendants,  the delicious gourmet  food selection, the tasty desserts and the fine wine.  Moreover, the  amenities concerning the latest technological aspects were quite abundant.    The flight attendants were always on the go, catering to all our needs, and our children were treated with much caring.    We will long remember a  highly pleasing and comfortable trip on Swiss Air International !

title: Excellent and very friendly service
review_text: The difference to our last fligh with Swiss was giant. Very friendly and helpful cabin crew deliverd a marvelous service and this translated also to the food. This was an excellent experience. I prefer however the business class chairs of Boeing over that of the Airbus.

title: Fly smart. Fly Swiss
review_text: It is by far one of the best airlines when it comes to customer service and comfort. Delicious food, comfortable seats, friendly staff, no delay in schedule, safe luggage. Would recommend this airline to all.

title: SFO-ZRH. The best way to go
review_text: Swiss is actually on the top on many routes and especially this one. The personal service provided by this airline makes the trip easy.

title: Good flight !
review_text: The flight went all on time was very comfortable. In the Airport Z√ºrich ,everything is very expencive , you must put the 4g of because mobile internet is very expencive , in a few minutes we had to Pay 35‚Ç¨.

title: Perfect
review_text:
i really enjoyed my internal trip through Swiss air line from Warsaw- Poland to Zurich -Switzerland , the take off was perfect and done by an expert pilot as well as the landing 
regarding the Service it was more than perfect through offering the passengers coffee , Tea and Juice 
we had traveled at morning they offered us a breakfast which was perfect it was a very fresh sandwich afterwards a tangerine fruit which was delicious , suits are comfort although the plane wasn't big as it was internal trip but i enjoyed it

title: Chocolaaaaaate
review_text:
It was morning flight so they offered us a breakfast. It was an omelette (awful one) and icy cold bun, some cheese and fruits. Well, it really depends on tastes and preferences. But i loved the fact that they do offer wine and chocolate. 
The cabin crew members were very nice and polite but when i asked about special meal i booked or for blanket they said that they do not have neither any other food on the board nor blankets though it was winter.

title: Flight Z√ºrich Amsterdam
review_text: Our flight to Amsterdam was delayed due to the weather this can happen of course. Hower the stewardess was very grumpy and unpolite to here passengers. She yelled to me I had to put my hand luggage on the belt. I told here to be a bit more politie to me but this was not accepted. I never experienced something like this and I flew with many companies!

title: Beautiful Airline
review_text:
Easy check in, flight on time, staff were attentive, friendly and offered Food and drink without charging you, nice to see an airline still offer this service, not to mention a little a Chocolate treat :)
Lots of leg room, plane was fairly new and showed that, I really enjoyed the flight 2hours I could have flown longer with the room I had within my seat, pitty other airlines not like this.
Used Helvetic on flight back older plane but again service was as good as flight out..

title: Cramped
review_text:
Airfare:  The airfare was verrrry reasonable, which probably explains why the flight was sold out and space was at a premium.

Seat/Comfort:  I was seated in the middle of the plane in between two men and felt almost as if I had to hold my breath for the entire flight.  I was able to choose a seat in the first row of economy which was behind a "wall" and not behind another row of seats so I had a decent amount of legroom, but the seat itself was verrrrrry narrow.  I had read reviews before my trip (about the lack of space) and unfortunately, I experienced the same discomfort that many reviewers describe.  I am tall, but very thin and this seat was outrageously narrow for an international flight.  I won't be taking Swiss Air again.

Service:  I wasn't really impressed with the level of service.  I wasn't offered any wine or a cocktail during beverage service and when I asked for one, the flight attendant begrudgingly gave me one.  Also, it seemed as if they ran out of dinner choices because when an attendant came by she said my only choice was pasta.  I asked if they had anything else and she said she would check.  I ended up getting some beef, but only after waiting for about 20 minutes and finally asking what the final verdict was about my options.  She was apologetic, so no complaints there.

title: Love Swiss!
review_text: Our flight from Venice to JFK was very comfortable.  The staff was friendly nd attentive and I would highly recommend flying with Swiss.  Flights were on time. Good entertainment selection and food was good as well.

title: Short bu excellent flight
review_text: Efficient board, great staff, good legroom. Really enjoyable flight from start to finish. Good work :)

title: Swiss standard
review_text: The flight departed and landed on time. During flight we got snack, drink and before landing swiss chocolate. Staff was very friendly and helpful. I like this airline.

title: Escaping to sunshine
review_text: Itching to play golf so we decided to assure no surprises and booked with Swiss. We weren‚Äôt disappointed ! Great short flight, great golfing in the Costa del Sol. Only regret was the hotel which was situated outside the town but friendly staff but had bad connecting with my Wi-fi (too slow). Maybe because we are spoiled in Switzerland with excellent services! Will go back for sure but at different hotel!

title: Great flight, no hassle stop over.
review_text: Great trip from start to finish. Check in was efficient and quick. Stop over for 1 hr in Geneva was straight forward as the airport was quiet. Service on the flight was very good with the staff friendly and helpful.

title: Assigned the most uncomfortable seat and row I've ever had
review_text: A few issues:  (1) headphone jacks are 2 prong which is idiosyncratic so we can't use our own headphones, big issue for my audiophile kid and (2) while the staff is nice, and food is fine, I'm rethinking Swiss Air (even though I usually seek out non-American airlines for a better experience) after my young teen son and I were randomly assigned a row toward the back where (a) there were 3 seats in our row and 4 in the row ahead of us, so the seatback TVs were half a seat away and the tray came out of the seat and (b) my seat was so narrow, that it was the most uncomfortable seat I've ever sat in (I checked the seat on the other side of the aisle and it was fine, my son's was slightly better than mine).  My son moved half the plane away for a better middle seat, and I sat in his seat next to a large man who spilled over into my seat.  Swiss Air was pleasant about it and I finally moved into an empty middle seat in the next row, but it was uncomfortably tight for an 8 hour flight and really not a good experience or value.  If Swiss Air thinks a plane like that is appropriate, with 2-prong headphones, I am seriously going to think twice before going with Swiss Air again.  This was our 2nd Swiss Air flight in 6 months and the other one was much better.

title: Not the same as in the past
review_text:
Highs and lows that were not the way I knew Swissair. Highs: Check in at the airport fast and attentive. Courteous and very elegant stewardess, very attentive to the passengers. Good quality of the food.
Lows: fairly uncomfortable seats. For the second time in a roll, delayed flight. This time, for almost two hours that almost made me miss an important commitment in Zurich. Slow service to deliver luggage.
I still have another flight to take with Swiss. I hope it will not keep disappointing me!

title: absolutely dont go near11 terrible
review_text: bloomin sterwdess ruined my passport by sticking luggage tag on picture and refuse to acnowlage the damage

title: again a fantastic airline and i love flying with them
review_text: this is the airline i will always use for my travels to japan,china and vietnam , i love this company and they make me feel welcomed everytime i fly with them, its worth its weight in gold is all i can say ....

title: Very efficient with very good service
review_text: Very good service from check in until disembarkation. However, I found there was very little legroom especially fro Zurich to Tel Aviv, although I paid extra for this seat

title: hong kong to London via Zurich
review_text:
mixed feeling about our experience, 
the flight there was terrible and the flight back was great! I don't think they have nearly as much legroom as some other airlines, and the seats aren't very comfortable. the hostesses were either extremely friendly or extremely rude.
over all a very average flight.
next time we"ll pay the extra to fly with virgin or BA

title: No, do not use it
review_text:
I bought a ticket to fly Swiss air based on my past experience, excellent service. I was faced with a huge disappointment:
- check in - no smile, weird questions about my trip purpose, really no customer service
- gate area full of trash, not Swiss air fault but they are working there and they should do somethings
- I selected a Kosher meal choise, it was not loaded in the flight, another big disappointment
- I buy the internet access - a vig waste of money, can not be use, the conection drops frequently and slow speed. Can be used only to write a negative review of Swiss air üòä
- Mechanical issues delayed the plane departure
 Sooo, no more Swiss air for me.

title: They care about you
review_text:
This is one the the finest airline I have the pleasure to fly. Let me tell you why: When I was going back to Brazil, after a conference meeting in Cyprus, I had to fly 4 legs (Larnaca to Munich, Munich to Zurich, Zurich to Guarulhos, and Guarulhos to Curitiba).

Although I had 1 to 2 hours between the first two legs, the Yellow Vest strikes in France caused a cascade effects in the Europe airports that affected flights in Germany. Therefore my flight from Munich to Zurich was delayed. I was simply considering I would miss my flight to Brazil and would be held in Zurich until the next day.

Surprisingly, during the second leg fly, the flight attendant asked for those who were in the next flight because Swissair would transport us directly to the aircraft in the soil. When we arrived in Zurich, they had a van that took us to a specific immigration room where our passports were checked, along with our luggage, and drove us to our aircraft, which was waiting for us.

Thank you for the lady that drove the van and care us all the way from aircraft to aircraft. Thank you Swissair for handling timely all the flights. I had a comfortable trip and surely I will be in your next flight from Brazil to anywhere in Europe!

title: Worst Business class ever
review_text: I fly often internationally and decided to try Swiss Air Business Class.  I was completely disappointed as it was equal to a premium economy flight with the other airlines I have flown with.  I was shocked and eould not recommend Swiss Air for Business Class.

title: Extra legroom worth every penny
review_text: Booked many months in advance and secured my seat in bulkhead on their A330 aircraft. I believe this seat is pretty unique as not only do you have no seat in front of you, there is a section cut into the bulkhead so you can fully stretch out. Really unique seat I have ever found in economy on any airline. Flight was on time, the food was good, my only criticism was that in between the two meal services, the crew were nowhere to be seen.

title: A quiet flight in a new airplain
review_text: We had a very quiet fligt in an new airplane. The Service was good, exept that my lasagne had mushrumes in it even I ordernd without. Also was the cabin temperatur quite cold. But we got some blankets as they couldn`t turn it up.

title: New Bombardier aircraft
review_text: We flew out on the Thursday late flight, and were surprised by the nice aircraft. The new Bombardies (2/3 confirguration) was very nice and modern. Each seatrow had their own display screen to follow the route, see the safe demo film and some commercial stuff. Seats were comfy. The Boarding agents were friendly and efficient, the cabin attendants did a smooth job and seemed very organised. Instead of the chicken or cheese Sandwich we received a warm cheese Quiche, which was actually a nice change. All in all a good flight, nice modern aircraft and friendly Crew, happy to fly again

title: Swiss Experience over the clouds
review_text: It was a great pleasure to fly with Swiss. The staff was attentive and the food was fine. The entertainment system worked well.

title: Convenient but unfriendly
review_text:
Flew LX180 on Jan 13th 2019.Flight delayed 40 minutes. Not a big deal especially since we prefer direct flights and the departure/arrival times of LX180 are perfect for us. But having taken this flight several times in the past, what was really disappointing this time was the low quality of the cabin staff and of the food.
The attitude of the staff was borderline unrespectful and rude. They would prefer to be elsewhere rather than making the experience enjoyable. I can see why some travellers prefer other airlines,even with stopover, but where staff lacks the arrogance of this LX cabin crew.
The food, alledgedly d√©veloppes by a star chef, was plain and totally unimaginative. Might as well dine in any cheap low fast food.

title: Very relaxing flight!
review_text: It was a lovely flight, considering almost 24 hours and three planes to get here. I was really amazed because time was passing by really fast! Comfortable seats, delicious meals, kind and helpful flight attendants, variety of movies, music and games, I had everything I needed! Excellent choice.

title: Pay for Business Class Get Economy Seats on Swiss Air!
review_text: We paid for a round trip Business Class flight to Egypt from JFK. On the Cairo-Zurich leg of our trip on Swiss Air we flew on an Airbus that was designed with ALL ECONOMY SEATS!! YES, we paid for Business Class and sat in economy seats!! The way to tell you are in Business Class is that Business Class is in front of the bulkhead, AND there is a sign that says BUSINESS CLASS!! And you pay a lot more!! The seat rows are economy..very close, and if you are tall your knees push on the seats in front of you. The other way you know you are in Business Class is that they provide an empty middle seat in the row of 3. This does not help tall people!! To add insult to injury we had a male flight attendant who seemed to wish he could be anywhere else!! He threw our meals at us as fast as he could and then disappeared! There was no inflight movie or music! A very long 4.5 hr flight! Don‚Äôt waste your money! We will never fly Swiss Air again!

title: Easy and convenient flight
review_text:
Hard to find fault with an easy and on time flight. Good seating, no electronic check in available at the airport for Swiss air in Manchester so had to queue with people with luggage. Next time I will check in on line.

Used the lounge with Priority Pass (not sure if I should or can mention it here) which comes 'free' with a major credit card. Very useful even fro seldom travel to be able to relax in a quiet lounge, usually with food and drink, plus places to recharge equipment.

There was duty free sales on board and I did not pay much attention but it seemed that if you bought you were given an empty plastic bag and a reference ticket then you have to wait to collect your duty free once landed. Looked like a real delay after landing, which is not always ideal.

Flight on time both ways, not much more to add.

title: Often cancelled flighzd
review_text:
Cause I am working and living in Z√ºrich and my girlfriend in London city we often commute. Direct flights by Swiss and BA. My girlfriend flies with  both companies and notices that much more flights are canceled by Swiss compared to BA. Also in regard to schedule,
However I apreciate Swissness and quality of service üòäüôè

title: Bombardier CS 100 is great
review_text:
This flight was also a great experience as this aircraft has a two seater row and I got a window seat as usual and there was once again nobody to my right.

My check in took about 2 minutes which is great. The flight was on time.

The snack and drinks were nice and the service pleasant.

I went to the toilet at the back and it is really spacious. Later in the flight I needed to use the toilet again but this time there is one on the side near the end. Whoever designed this toilet obviously never tried it. It is far far to small even for the smallest of people with maybe the exception of children. It is a disgrace. It would be better to have no toilet at all.

The table are adjustable and there is sufficient legroom. It was a pleaseant flight with arrival on time and baggage collection quite rapid.

title: Bombardied CS100 Great
review_text:
I knew in advance that I would be seated at the window in a two row seats. I was lucky again that there was no other passenger to my right.

I used the table and I am very happy to say that the table is adjustable. There was a snack and drinks served included in the price.

Service was good. The toilet at the very back is spacious. This is a really great aircraft and there was sufficient leg room

title: Good Service
review_text:
The service was excellent, the staff competent and courteous.
The flight was on time.
Very recommendable.

title: 4 excellent flights
review_text: The long haul flights had good food. Good beverage selection .Service was efficient and friendly and helpful .Seats were comfortable for economy .The inflight entertainment had some good new films .The transfer at Zurich went smoothly with no stress and both the short haul flights .Zurich to London Heathrow was pleasant no entertainment but good service with a sandwich and beveridge served

title: Flight to Johanasburg
review_text:
Normally fly with Emirates from Birmingham. Pleased we booked Swiss Air this time which went via Z√ºrich. Shorter journey and staff were very friendly and professional. 

Will definitely use them again next year

title: Excellent company
review_text:
Very good travel, on time for take off and arrived earlier than planned. On board, the crew is very sympathic, the service is perfect and the food rather good (with one vegetarien course available each time). The aircraft was rather new (A330) and comfortable. The screens for watching movies were completely operational (which is not always the case on other flights I did) and the film were recent. My only concern was about the temperature on board, which was too cold for me. (I asked for another blanket and it was OK).
I recommand this company (Swiss quality !)

title: Still a top airline
review_text:
Swiss was and still is a very professional airlines. They did not introduce most of the shortcuts other airlines did. Hence their is still a big difference between the service of Swiss and the ones of other international airlines.
Anytime again.

title: Swiss Air Lines is comfortable !
review_text: Swiss is a very Good Airline and when it was time to fly back the second Airline who should bring us from Cebu to Hongkong canceled all the flights . But Swiss send me an E mail to contact them . When I just called the emergency number my load was almost gone and before I knew what to do the call ended . But one Minute later the Service worker from Swiss called me back and gave us a new flight 2 days later . So even there is a big Problem Swiss Airlines will bring You back anyway !!!!!!!!! Great Service !!!!!!!!!!!

title: Don't book Swiss through UA as part of Star Alliance
review_text:
Booked award travel with United on Star Alliance partner, Swiss Airlines. 
Reservation looked good, but when Swiss issued the ticked they added MRS in front of my name, and truncated my granddaughter's last name (which is the same as mine). Swiss counter agent at SFO would not issue boarding passes since the names did not exactly match our passports. They said I had to call United, which I did, and United said it all looked fine in the system; so they conferenced someone from the Swiss call center on the line, and she said everything looked okay in the system on her end. But the ticketing agent in SFO said she couldn't see it and would not issue a boarding pass. We missed the flight. I finally had to have UA book us on Lufthansa with additional connections. UGGGHHH!

title: Nice pleasant flight
review_text: always nice to fly Swiss as they are a Golf friendly Airline. As a swiss golf traveller member they transport all Golf Clubs for free, what a great idea..

title: Not bad Airlines
review_text: Went to Europe via Swiss Air about 10 years ago, Nothing really special about the flight maybe it is because its 10 years ago, The crew were not that friendly. The food served were ok. The IFE were not really updated. Most of the crews were a bit old, veteran.

title: Noyhing special , nor even when you are Senator
review_text:
Noyhing special , nor even when you are Senator. Two flights to get to the destination with a transfer at ZRH. Same situation for the return as there was very little time to transfer at ZRH, no one helps and no one expect you to help you (even if you are Senator) ...so run !!! No time to enjoy the lounge... 

The food on board is not appealing , too many mousses and sauces. It is somehow gross...not appealing at all. I observed people not eating it, or just refusing the food. 
I hope the Swiss Chefs were doing better than this, too fancy for just not appealing food...

title: Reliable as usual
review_text: Used this flight several times in the past 10 years  - was always on time and service as good as expected. They now server a bit more food and even offer tomato juice.

title: As expected all fine
review_text: The flight to Barcelona at 7.10am was suprisingly cheap but still offered the usual good Swiss service.

title: Awfully uncomfortable seat, no consistency (place changed unilaterally), dreadful food, laughable customer service.
review_text: As per my title: the seat was so uncomfortable and small that I couldn't seat or get up without grazing my hips bilaterally. I am a normal size person and haven't ever had a problem with economy seatings. Swiss simply wants to make more money seating too many people, and does it at your expense. Simple. Plus, my seating was changed unilaterally (I wonder who they had to accommodate...). I wasn't accepted with my long-standing hand luggage (they said it was oversize even after it FITTED in their measuring "cage". They let me pass at the check-in but stopped me (the same lady) at the gate and shamed me for NO REASON in front of everyone as if I were carrying an oversize bag. I was forced to open it and empty it in front of everyone and it was sent with the checked-in luggage. It was offensive, WRONG (the bag was regular: so much so that I came back on the return flight with SWISS using the same pieces of luggage and no one had anything to say about it), uncivilized. On the return flight the airplane arrived late and departed later, making me lose my connecting flight. I was not placed on an early flight home - there were a few - but on one that departed 5 hours later. When I got home and I complained I was not given my money back as they should have. I am NEVER going to fly with SWISS (or with their partners, same policies) ever again.

title: Pleasant and nice service
review_text: Very hospital and pleasant cabin attendances. Always with a smile and efficient when serving. Still have something included in the ticket price; a snack, cold or warm drinks (including wine) and to top it off a piece of Swiss chocolate. Not much but enough to get through a 2 h+ flight and a lot more than other "ticket-price -comparable" airlines.

title: Brisbane to Manchester so easy!
review_text: What an excellent way to go!  Qantas to Singapore and a transit time of a few hours  then Swiss via Zurich with very short transit times.  Literally walked from one flight to the next and we were off again.  Arriving in Manchester to a no queue exit and we‚Äôd arrived. Worried at first about short connection times but was assured that apart from a major problem, we would be ok and so it was.  Overall trip was around 24 hours and would recommend this route.

title: Lean simple efficient
review_text:
An efficient service , with no frills, but to the point

We had a 50 minutes delay in otp which was not a problem because of the large connection time.

I was gently upgraded

The plane is a new boing 777. Which was due in the las t years

If i have to fly Bss I would take LHU because beds are more comfortable.

The Bss lounge in the E terminal is also to be noted. Slick and silent and large

title: Consistently Good
review_text:
I am a regular traveler on Swiss, usually from Geneva to London Heathrow or occasionally to London City, normally at least once a month averaging out at 15 or so return flights per year.

I always fly Swiss as I cannot stand Easy Jet or Gatwick Airport. I do have a Swiss Frequent Flier card which entitles me access to their Business Class lounges at the airport run by Swiss at Geneva and Lufthansa at Heathrow, which makes life much more pleasant.

As I do not actually travel Business Class the Swiss Flight Attendants are unaware of my Frequent Flyer status, but their treatment of their "ordinary" passengers is second to none, their in-flight service while restricted to a glass of water or a bottle of water and a cheese sandwich if you have checked in baggage, it is still exemplary, mustn't forget the complimentary small bar of Swiss Chocolate. In line with most short haul airline service these days, you can of course buy food and drink on board.

At "advanced" prices comparable with Easy Jet and next week's prices usually below Easy Jet's, plus the fact that they actually fly to London Airports and not those based in the Home Counties that somehow feel the need to add London to their name, I wonder when we will see Easy Jet flying to London Manchester.

title: Swiss airlines excellent!
review_text: I flew to Zurich and then onto st petersberg Russia! Both swiss air flights excellent service and ‚Ç¨120 cheaper than flying KLM direct from Amsterdam to st petersberg! Great service and value!

title: The Seat is comfortable for Asian
review_text:
the leg room is good for asian like us - big seat and comfortable. 
Like the thoughfulness of giving us chocholate on Flight

title: Fading Swiss cross though still above average. Worth trying
review_text:
Swiss carries the legacy and the fame of Swissair. A good airline but not anywhere close to its predecessor. Pretends to be the "airline of Switzerland" with crews who often do not even bother to speak the national languages of the country (French is almost banned out of Zurich) 
Practically two different airlines: On European routes Swiss is ridiculously spartan in service, obviously trying to align itself to its mother company Lufthansa who focuses on less demanding or sophisticated public. Cabin crew are often Germans who apparently can not always cope with a cosmopolitan multilingual and refined clientele.
On long haul flights the image is fairly different. Swiss multilingual cabin crews outnumber the not so agile Germans and cater for your needs. Food quality is good so is the entertainment. Swiss lounge in JFK is excellent

title: Great Airline :Our second and third  leg flying  around the world was with Swiss Air
review_text: First time I have ever flown with  Swiss Air and found them a first class company to fly with . Would fly with them again

title: Upgrade surprise
review_text:
When we travel, we prefer to pay an extra Charge for the larger leg room with Swiss Airlines.
Last summer , my husband had an complimentary upgrade as a Star Alliance Gold Card but he refused as we were 3 of us and he did not want to sit alone in the Business Class.

At the Gate we got an upgrade for all of us 3 and it was very surprise for us!!!

I have to say that Swiss Airlines is one of the best in Europe with their Service from European Staff. Unfortunately the Asian Staff was not really fulfill the expectation of the passengers.

title: Swiss style
review_text: efficient, punctual, no frills, comfortable seating, adequate legroom, interesting snack, and good choice of beverages.

title: Good airline
review_text: Good connection at ZRH, with a wide body service on the TLV-ZRH sector. The new 777 is a nice plane, although not as much as the A350 nor the 787. Service on board is good, and seats are quite comfortable. Good food and drinks selection

title: Another amazing flight
review_text: Crew extremely friendly and efficient, as ever that is the + when travelling with Swiss , Cabin attendants have different personalities, are imaginative and not clones as in FE or middle east airlines.

title: Surprisingly spacious
review_text: Lovely pleasant flight. Lots of space even in the bathroom and you still get an in flight snack. Would use again x

title: Reliable in all aspects
review_text: Whenever possible, I chose Swiss International Air Lines for my travel, simply because I appreciate its reliability. First and foremost, flights take place! Swiss employees will not strike. Second, I never experienced major issues with delays. Third, the service is good. Of course, nobody would starve without service, but I think feeling pampered a bit is nice, especially on long business trips.

title: oups
review_text: an old A330 with a really little crew, no place, a broken internet service and a really poor food. we choose them instead of emirates, to finaly pay more and having such a poor service

title: On a Road Scholar Trip to Italy
review_text:
Very disappointed: From Boston to Zurich the flight was good, even very good. However, on the flight from Zurich to Brindisi our flight was turned back due to problem with radar; back in Zurich we waited in line for 3+ hours trying to get another flight to Brindisi. Unfortunately, that turned out to be a flight the next day, but Swiss Air gave us a voucher for a nearby hotel and dinner and a ticket for the tram to get there. Then we spent another hour trying to track down our luggage.  Finally at the hotel we used our vouchers for dinner - a pasta dinner, no wine, no salad bar. 
      Next day flight on Alitalia, stopping in Rome, was cramped and bare bones, but fine.  Arrived in Brindisi exhausted and a day late.  Not a terrible experience, but not a good one either.

title: they are not sorry for being late and keeping you in the dark
review_text: Our flight was schedule for 1245 departure. The sign/board said "we will update you at 1245". It left closer to 1600. No "sorry" , no "we will keep you updated". We arrived in Montreal late , I missed my connection. No arrangement had been made for the next flight. I was told to start from scratch: lineup at the ticket counter and see what could be done. The flight was uneventful, bland food, bland service. I missed Air Canada excellent  service.

title: Excellent flight and service.
review_text: Even though I was flying in the cheapest economy class, the service i got was excellent.  The planes seats were spaced apart enough that my 6'1" frame did not have any comfort issues.  The was a nice snack and beverages on the flight and the crew were courteous and friendly.  This was a very positive experience and I would not hesitate to book on Swiss again.

title: The best customer service of any airline I've ever used.
review_text: The flight crew on Swiss International was the most considerate and  hospitable of any airlines crew I've ever dealt with. Always smiling and ready to accommondate the passengers even when they were serving dinner and passengers were in the way. Never did they give a frustrated look or say anything negative. They were truly a first class airline.

title: Very friendly flight attendants
review_text: Although our flight had to be diverted and was delayed because of fog, the flight attendants were very friendly and made the journey more pleasant. Would definitely use this airline again if going to Switzerland. The plane was very clean and the seats were comfy.

title: Great airline!
review_text: Everything went smoothly, with Swiss punctuality. Good airbus with nice configuration, 2 seats together, window and aisle. The food above what one can expect in economy. Nice wine. Smiling flight attendants. Would fly anywhere with Swiss Airlines.

title: Multiple changes that greatly affected our trip. Really poor service.
review_text:
Booked for LHR-ZRH a week before flight, travelling from Manchester via train as it was substantially cheaper. Flight got cancelled for unknown reasons and got auto-rebooked onto a Lufthansa flight to Frankfurt which then transferred to Z√ºrich, which added ~4 hours to our travel time. 

Called to attempt to shift to a Manchester-Z√ºrich flight which would get us in at the same time as originally planned. First person we called (using the UK number) asked for us to call back in fifteen minutes because her shift was about to finish and didn‚Äôt want to go over her scheduled shift time. I wish I was joking. Hung up on us. 

Redialled using the Australian number (seriously) and actually got to have a conversation. Asked to change to the Manchester flight (keeping in mind, at all times saying we‚Äôre happy to pay the difference in fare). Told it was impossible and that we could only be on the London-Frankfurt-Z√ºrich option. Asked if there were any flights that got us in earlier (was told there wasn‚Äôt). Increase in travel time affected things previously booked, meaning any cost benefit associated with flying out of LHR was wiped. 

Arrive at LHR on the day, check in attendant mentioned there was a direct flight to Z√ºrich available without extra cost, but would fly out fifteen minutes later. Helped cancel our flight and rebook, got us exit row seats and paid for our lunch for the inconvenience. If I remembered her name I‚Äôd give her a shoutout, because she was the gleaming diamond in the turd that was our experience with Swiss. Flew out the 25th approx 13:45, she was working the middle counter (not bag drop - inquiries/checkin assistance). Had the aura of someone who had been at the company for a while and was sick of putting out other people‚Äôs fires. 

Unfortunately one person who has it together does not overcome the sheer indifference and incompetence found beforehand. Would not recommend, and will not utilise again going forward.

title: Nice flights - great service
review_text:
Great flights to and from NICE via Zurich.

Very comfortable seats, clean aircrafts, polite staff.

Decent snacks- free drinks

Very pleasant trip will definitely travel Swiss again soon.

Excellent customer service.

title: More leg room than most and chocolate!!!
review_text: Roomier seats than most, great movie selection, flight attendants very attentive and accommodating, and they generously give out Swiss chocolate bars!  I would definitely travel Swiss Airlines again.

title: Disappointment
review_text: My wife and I decided to treat ourselves to a business class trip because we heard it was very good and the trip was extra long. We were extremely disappointed as the food was ordinary at best and the wine list had only one Swiss White and Red wines. Neither of which was near their best. The comfort of the sleeping room was mediocre. If I ever go this way again I will go economy with extra leg room and bring my own sandwich.

title: Excelent Airline
review_text: I recommend this Airline because everything from the service to the cleanliness and punctuality was excellent. The plane departed and arrived on time. The food and drinks on board were abundant and varied. The cleanliness of bathrooms superior.

title: Various flights to Zurich
review_text: I have flown with Swiss several times for business, I must say that the interiors in these flights were in very good conditions, the seats were stylish and comfortable, legroom was descent, of course it is not business and legroom will be the same whatever the class you are traveling in short hauls. Service is also fantastic, you are given a light snack and also the delicious Swiss chocolate! It is always convenient for me to fly with them because the airport in Lugano is not far from home! I recommend people to try Swiss!

title: Very professional with right value to customer satisfaction.
review_text:
Hi,

I have travelled in many airlines but this one with Swiss international airlines was a bit unique. Though it was a short flight, it was a wonderful experience. Firstly, the plane was extremely clean as if it was a new one. The seats were comfortable with spacious leg room. The staff was courteous and professional. The fly time was peaceful with very less engine noise and the take off and landing smooth. Also, I had an issue with damaged luggage which I am sure is not the fault of the airlines. It was also taken care to my satisfaction.
I would definitely recommend Swiss airlines to friends for international travel.

title: New planes but very little room
review_text: overall I liked it. the planes seemed new and clean, the crew were friendly, the food was good (maybe not as much food served as other airlines), there seemed to be very little room, like extra seats had been crammed in? the flight was very bumpy but i think that is common for the flight path over that part of world.

title: Great first experience at a cheap price!
review_text:
It was my first time to take Swiss air and it's a 5 star experience in a really cheap price!
all the flights were early or on time. Food was great. Fruits, drink and snacks in between. I highly recommend this airline!

title: True to the tradition
review_text: I have flown with Swiss both within Europe and on long distance. In my book, this company together with the Greek airline Aegean are top both in terms of choice of aircraft and in terms of service

title: Good quality airline
review_text: Swiss took good care of our ski equipment (carried for free as standard) and the experience on the plane was good - the staff are professional and efficient, and the included snack is nice.

title: Comfortable sleeping accommodation.
review_text: Comfortable, fully reclining seats. Good food and service. I didn't use the video entertainment, but it looked like it had an extensive collection of choices.

title: Smooth and Wonderful Flight
review_text: The crew did everything they could to make a long 12 hour flight as comfortable as possible. There was plenty of in flight entertainment, delicious items given for meals, and most important was the fact that the restrooms / bathrooms/ toilet area was clean.  I used the restroom towards the end of a 12 hour flight and the area was very clean. I highly recommend this airline for your travel needs.

title: Just OK
review_text: Flights were on time and planes were reasonably comfortable.  Service was fine.  Average rating is based on a couple of "demerits".  Ground staff in Athens and Zurich for our return flights gave us a hard time about the size of our carry on bags - the same bags that flew with no problem on Swiss International Air Line planes to Europe and, in fact, have flown throughout a good part of the world on other carriers.  In Zurich we were forced to check our bags which left a bad taste.  And speaking of bad taste, the in-flight meal on the Zurich leg back to Boston was sushi.  Not a meal that appeals to all tastes but luckily Swiss chocolate was also provided.

title: Always a perfect way to travel
review_text:
This was our third or fourth time in Swiss first class from Zurich to India, we have always had an extremely pleasant flight with perfect service food and very comfortable seating etc. From check in to arriving at our destination everything is perfect. And we would like to fly it every time but unfortunately can only do it when these seats are on offer. 
From Birmingham to Zurich it is business class which is superb as well. No other airline matches food and service as of Swiss air.

title: A little surprised
review_text:
