I hadn‚Äôt taken Swiss for a number of years. So I was quite surprised that flights coming and going were significantly delayed. Furthermore I volunteered to have then put my hand luggage in the hold at the gate since I wasn‚Äôt in a big hurry. In Berlin it took almost an hour for the luggage to appear - linger than the flight from Zurich. And it was so soaking wet that the contents were wet. And this is solid luggage. Very surprised and disappointed.

It is only fair to say that the planes were comfortable and staff courteous. On the Berlin - Geneva flight they held the Connecting flight in Zurich for delayed passengers, which was nice. The anxiety and running were not nice.

title: Awesome
review_text: Traveling with a 3 yo on overnight flight. Everyone made sure she was comfortable and went out of there way to make her feel special. Great flight! Great service!

title: GREAT STAFF!
review_text:
We always fly Swiss, excellent service, and considerate staff.   Example was they quickly came to my aid aid when turbulence left me soaked in hot tea!   They quickly noticed my predicament & brought towels etc without being asked.  Even in economy they take good care of passengers.
One small diffferent touch is that passengers are always offered swiss chocolate en-route

title: Flying to the heart of the city - not the middle of nowhere
review_text:
The problem with flying to london, espcially if your destination is North London or East London is that communications to and from Heathrow or Gatwich are pretty rubbish and Stansted takes forever to clear the imigration and get the train.  

So, for a few years now I have been using this flight to home from Zurich for the weekend about once a month.  The approximately mid day departure and arrival is really convient and weather permitting, you get a fantastic view of london as you fly in to land.  

The formalities at city are really quick and if you have hand luggage only you can be out of the airport in about fifteen minutes and on the Docklands Light Railway.

The Swiss fligh is eveerything you would expect, punctual, reliable, comfortable and with great service, and if you book in advance it is not more expensive than a typical budget airline

title: It looks like it was a business plane
review_text: We heard of it and now we did fly with it. The service was good vor a short flight and there was enough space for us. We flew with a lot of business people but the plane was not full. We did even got some snacks and drink. That for a short flight. We realy enjoyed it.

title: Problem with boarding due to incompetent staff (blamed their internal rule)
review_text:
Heathrow via Zurich and Singapore then Silk Air to Penang.
Swiss Air Staff said they coul;d not put me on flight as I didn't have a return ticket from Penang within 90 days. Normal for me as I am fully aware UK passport holders only get 90 days visa for Malaysia so I hop moff to Sinapore or Thailand within the 90 days and then fly back to UK from Malaysia within my next 90 days allowed stay.
Knowing Singapore to Penang was with Swiss air I told them to book the liggage through to Penang and give me  boarding passes to Singapore knowing Silk Air would not have a problem giving me a boarding pass tpo Penang which turned out to be the case. Airlines should be aware that experienced travellers know and don't break the rules.
As for the flights unaventful, food  ot very good, below standard for even economy. Onboard staff friendly. only 23kg luggage allowance stingy. Singapore Airlines allow more and give better food. Sort of given up with Malaysian Airlines (lost luggage and unhelpful staff making it a waste of time to get compensation)
Think I will try to swim next time!

title: No legroom at all
review_text: Worst long haul flight I ever had. The legroom is so little it was impossible for me to make myself comfortable enough. Service is nice and the food is ok, but due to the discomfort on the A330 I can only rate it with one star.

title: Can‚Äôt move at all, broken entertainment system
review_text: Like others have said, if the person behind you reclines their chair you can‚Äôt move at all. I‚Äôm pretty petite and the person behind me was reclined the entire flight. I couldn‚Äôt even get into my purse under the seat without banging my head and shoulder! My entertainment system was broken. They started charging for bags and seats even for long haul flight. I fly between the us and Switzerland pretty often and I‚Äôd way rather fly delta. The seats on Swiss are so tiny I don‚Äôt know how an average or larger than average person could even fit into them.

title: Horrible! Cramped and claustrophobic
review_text: They squeeze so many rows of seats into the economy section of the plane used for a 13 hour flight - I think it was a 777 - it shouldn‚Äôt be allowed. I‚Äôm a slim person, 170 cm tall, and I pity those taller and weighing more than me! I actually thought of disembarking when we got into our seats and realized how narrow the seats were and how little legroom there was. The food was tasty, but that really doesn‚Äôt matter when you have no room to move your arms and space for your tray. I think it‚Äôs a shame they sell this as a normal international flight. We actually had much more room on our last leg travelling home - the flight from Zurich to Oslo, just a quick 2,5 hours. I will never use Swiss for a long haul again.

title: Felt like flying a cheapo airline - cramped, narrow seats
review_text: The worst long distance flight I‚Äôve ever had! Swiss packs so many seats into the cabin that you can barely fit. I‚Äôm 5‚Äô6 and slim. I pity those who are even slightly overweight and taller than me! No legroom at all made the flight, which was more than 13 hrs, an absolute torture. I will never fly long distance with them again. The food was tasty, but when you barely have room to move your arms and space for the tray, it doesn‚Äôt really matter.

title: Very nice airline
review_text:
I have travelled several Swiss flights within Europe as well as cross-continental.

They surely have the best looking, and feeling seat fabric (!!) in the economy sections compared to other airlines.

Always presented with a Swiss chocolate and in the long haul ones, with a La Gruy√®re stick.

A few years ago, when my boy was only 1 and a few months and must have been feeling some sort of discomfort just before landing, the head stewardess took him and kept on trying to distract him from cockpit to the back of the plane...and it worked so well for him.

While we (probably we all) have been looked at or even instructed at to keep our too-little ones silent.

It is really not so much the food and the seats - but always a feeling of calmness and relaxing that is important for me in a flight. And their in flight stewards are one of the best in these terms. Which is why I think that Swiss Hospitality is not an over-rated thing.

It must be very nice in Business and First Class I reckon!

Totally recommend it as one of the first options while making travel plans that require air travel.

title: A premium experience in Ecconomy on CSeries
review_text: The crew on my short-haul flight on the CSeries was freindly and tried to stop some passengers from shouting across the airplane which was very welcomed. The snack was an apple tart which was freshly baked the same day. I would say that the quality of the service was a bit higher than that of Lufthansa and I will try to fly Swiss more often.

title: Good flight
review_text: From checking in to boarding the flight it was hassle free and good. The ground staff was very good and helpful. In-flight we also had a good experience. The seats were normal airline seating however I found it was slightly more comfortable than for in stance the Alitalia seats that we flew last time. The staff were extremely helpful and mostly greeted and served us all with a smile. Drinks were plentiful and their selection of red wine was great. However the food was a bit of a let down, very dry and not very tasty. The Swiss chocolates was a great gesture. The toilet on board was always clean. The flight was good overall and I would personally fly again

title: Unless you are flying 1st class, forget it!
review_text: I just flew back from India on British Airways, so I know what great leg room is.  This plane was equivalent or a bit worse than a commuter flight!  Sitting in the middle of the plane and in the middle seat in the row, was torture.  The food was also sub par.

title: Still very good
review_text: I flew many times by the old swissair. First time in the new Swiss. Not as perfect as the old one. Flight behind schedule, not very comfortable plane, but very efficient and friendly crew. Luggage arrived unharmed.

title: They are always the best
review_text:
Flown Swiss Air 3 times and EVERY TIME they exceed my expectations. From the great service to the pilots that land without you knowing you hit the ground, their service is what every airline should try to achieve.

Our flight originated in Rome but we had a changeover in Zurich. The 8 hour flight home was roomy, comfortable, and even the food was decent. Cant wait to go back to Italy or anywhere in Europe and fly Swiss again

title: Safe and pleasant
review_text: We ordered Asian Vegetarian and the food was fine but not exceptional, a bit bland and certainly geared to Swiss standards of what is considered spicy because it came from Hiltl Zurich. The flight was very smooth and we arrived almost on time. Since we had a 6h layover, it didn't matter to us.

title: Great airline!
review_text: Great airline with polite and friendly service. The sanwich we got on board was good and the little chocolate after was a nice touch. Well done!

title: With the accuracy of a Swiss watch
review_text: Excellent airline. I flew economy class on Swiss 1665 from Venice (VCE) to Zurich (ZRH). It was a 65-minute flight which left and arrived with the accuracy of a Swiss watch. I was pleased with all aspects of this short flight. The price was competitive, and it was the only airline offering non-stop service between Venice and Zurich.

title: Great Airline
review_text: Although I flew economy and had a long (15 hr.) layover in Zurich, I loved the airline. I opted to pay and additional $115 for the advance seating reservation. I forget the exact seat, but it was at the emergency exit right in back of business class. Boarding was a little hectic from CDG to ZUR because they changed that gate twice. Boarding from ZUR to SFO was a breeze. The leg room is just what I needed. I didn‚Äôt have to bother anyone when I had to get up to use the restroom and I could stretch my legs anytime I wanted. It seems like the attendants came often to bring drinks and meals. I declined a few times. The only minor complaint is that they don‚Äôt offer a wide variety of movies/tv shows to watch.

title: Smooth flight
review_text:
I'm travelling a lot with Swiss to and from Kenya.
The departing times are good when you want to arrive in Kenya early in the night.
Flying back to Europe means sometimes there are delays in Nairobi.
If you have a connecting flight at Zurich you'll have to run.
But the price and services of Swiss are in balance.
The crew is friendly and their information is up to date !

title: Fast Friendly Fun
review_text:
This was a great flight. In flight food was delicious. Cabin Staff was kind and attentive. Gate agents were great. Swiss Chocolate!  

My only issue was having to gate check my carry-on even though there were acres of space in the overhead. It was not over sized/weight, so there should have been no issue.

title: Leg of flight from Florence Italy via Switzerland
review_text:
What a wonderful airline. Staff, plane and overall service excellent.
United States airlines could learn a lot fro Swiss Air

title: VERY GOOD FLIGHTS
review_text: Swiss company very punctual. Check-in very fast. Staff on board very friendly and attentive to the passenger. Good food and possibility to book champagne and chocolates even in economy class, for payment of course. Landing smoothly in both directions. No worries about luggage. We will revolve with swiss.

title: Pretty good airlines.
review_text:
I took two separate long haul flights with them. One of the flights was in a B777-300ER and another one A330-300. Both the flights were good. B777 was better because it was newer. Both the flights had a good selection of entertainment options. One thing that stood out was that they allowed the passengers to keep the window shades open, many airline crews force passengers to close it. This allowed me and others to enjoy the view outside for an extended period of time. 
Crews were friendly and delivered my Muslim meal without any issue, which I had to order via email to their customer service.

title: Bait & Switch
review_text: Booked a non-stop flight from FCO Rome to Zurich paid for seat assignments at time of booking. I had trouble booking the advance seat assignments online and so called Swiss Air for assistance in booking our seats. We booked and paid for better seats on row 5 and even printed the receipts provided by Swiss. We have the Swiss App on our mobile phone and checked in with Swiss 23 hours before our flight and noted we'd been moved up to row 3 in premium class. A couple of hours before boarding, we received an update on our App stating we'd been moved back to row 9? As we boarded the plane, I noted that Row 9 was just outside of the premium seats which were entirely empty except for 1 person. I showed the stewardess our boarding passes printed earlier which clearly showed our seats on row 3 and also our mobile app now showing seats on row 9. She had no explanation and pulled out a customer chart showing our seats as row 9. I didn't make a big deal out of it but pointed to all of the empty rows ahead and also pulled out my Swiss receipts showing our seats were paid for months before. She apologized and said there wasn't anything she could do and they couldn't allow us to move ahead to the seats we purchased. She then shut the curtain and the entire 8 rows in front were empty except for one customer. We fly often internationally and have never experienced anything like this before. I will not book any future flights with Swiss and deleted their App. We will continue flying with Delta and Lufthansa who have always treated us wonderfully..

title: Smooth!
review_text: Went out on the Airbus 320 and returned on the new Airbus 220 series. Lovely comfortable aircraft with good leg room. Service was efficient and food adequate for such a short journey.

title: Good Airline :)
review_text:
No real complaints, I often use swiss air to fly to Switzerland, probably wouldn't choose any other airline to fly there, or hesitate to use them for other European destinations...offer very reasonable prices, comfortable flight. 
There wasn't any in-flight entertainment, but, not sure you really need it for short flights, so didn't comment on that point. Questionable sandwich provided for nourishment, however,  again, can't really complain for the flight time required..

title: Pleasant flight and flight attendants
review_text:
I was in economy class, back of the plane - flight attendants were all nice, kind, efficient and professional. 
I was particularly happy when I saw again flight attendant Babette J., who I remembered from previous flights as particularly kind and professional to all passengers. 
Since I had to do my work while I was on the plane, I appreciated very much having as many cups of coffee with milk as I needed - I emphasize "milk" since some airlines have only cream for coffee.  I must add that the little chocolates that we get are really nice touch. Also ice-cream which comes in different flavors,  is very good. I tend to choose Swiss whenever I can.

title: Good flight
review_text: Not the most legroom and a bit on the cold side. But otherwise a pleasant flight. We had chicken twice, but that might be due to us not eating gluten. The first meal was a little dry, the second was very good. No dressing for the salad.

title: A delightful fligh
review_text:
A pleasant  elite flight, excellent service,
 extensive menu, good food and a large selection of drinks
Comfortable seats lie in bed, comfortable and quiet flight
A selection of movies and great music
Business class

title: Very good Airline and nice Airport service in Z√ºrich
review_text: Have been flying with Swiss numerous times on short- and long haul flights and was always very good. was delayed a few times to my connections but always made it on time due to very good airport service in Z√ºrich. Overall very comfortable flying.

title: Efficient & Friendly Service
review_text: Annual ski experience once again comes off without a hitch!  Meals excellent even in economy.  Zurich airport is especially nice and is convenient to trains and Alberg Express to the slopes of the Austrian Tyrol.

title: Hopeless ground staff/'tell it to someone who cares' attitude of complaints staff
review_text:
I booked a ZH/Hamburg/ZH flight. Subsequently, my plans changed and I first flew to Helsinki with another airline before returning to spend a few days in Hamburg. When I arrived at Hamburg airport to return to Zurich, I was informed by check-in staff that my ticket had been cancelled as I did not take the outbound flight. However, helpfully the person told me I could pay an amendment fee at the Swiss sales desk to have my ticket reinstated and gave me the code number to pass to the staff at that desk.

Unfortunately, despite handing over the code to the sales desk staff, the junior staff member did not use it but spent 25 minutes on the phone, trying to get instructions on what he should do. Eventually, he received confirmation that my ticket could be amended (using the code I gave him at the outset) but advised that check-in for my flight had now closed. The upshot was that I had to buy an exorbitantly expensive one way ticket with Eurowings and arrived back in Zurich 2 hours late.

Despite multiple communications with Swiss' complaints department, I have received neither an apology nor proper recompense. This despite the fact that the issue was due to the incompetence of Swiss staff at their sales desk and the fact that my wife and I have flown Melbourne/ZH business class return on multiple occasions over the years.

title: Pleasant flight
review_text: Smooth flight especially the return. Attendants were friendly and helpful. Though a full flight but the passengers were mostly considerate. The only setback was no overnight kit given. Fortunately I had my own eye patch. On the whole I‚Äôm  pretty impressed with the Swiss International Airways.

title: Classy airline
review_text:
Over a period of four weeks I took many flights on various European airlines. Swiss was definitely the cleanest and most modern. I was also pleasantly surprised by the amount of legroom for economy class. The crew was friendly and professional and provided a coloring book and colored pencils for my 9-year old daughter. Best of all was the delicious Swiss chocolate they passed out toward the end of the flight.

Something to consider: The ticket prices for Swiss were generally more expensive than the other European airlines. But if you pay extra for more legroom anyway, it may be worth paying the extra ticket price, because this comes standard.

A word of advice: Swiss will not allow online ticket purchases within 24 hours prior to departure. If you find a great last minute deal, go to Lufthansa to purchase the ticket.

I highly recommend Swiss and will fly this airline again.

title: Ok, but probably wouldn‚Äôt fly with again long haul
review_text:
We flew with Swiss Tokyo to Manchester, changing in Zurich.
The long haul plane was very dated - I know the A340s are being gradually replaced but looked like it could have done with a good refurbishment. Entertainment systems (important, in my opinion, when you‚Äôre on the plane for over 12 hours!) were very dated, screens small and operated by a remote in your seat arms. Mine crashed 5+ times during the flight so I gave up using it. Notified the attendant and she just shrugged - a bit annoying, not sure if all seats on the plane were full. 
Legroom was the least of all long haul flights I‚Äôve ever been on in regular economy. We actually had more room on the small A320 plane from Zurich to Manchester! 

On the plus sides, crew were friendly on both aircraft and the food and drink selection was good.

title: Disappointing Flight
review_text:
I have been flying Swiss for many years. I used to be a Frequent Flyer, at one point with gold status. It always felt good to get on a Swiss flight anywhere in the world and feel like I was almost home.
Recently, I flew to Japan in an old airplane. Since not many passengers fly to Japan in January, I assume that an especially small and old airplane was deployed. 
The seats were uncomfortable, very narrow and not fully flat when in the sleeping position. The food was not good at all. The restrooms were old and stained (not unclean, but stained from old age) and very tight. The service was ok, but twice the menu we picked was no longer available. I know, I know, I am no longer a Frequent Flyer. I know, this time, I used miles to pay for the flight. And this seems to have made me a Passenger Second if not Third Class. Although ... quite frankly, if I have accumulated enough miles to fly to Japan in Business Class, this should make me a good customer, right?
I was very disappointed. I don't fly as frequently as I used to, but is this the new Swiss standard? The last flight I took to Los Angeles was a lot more comfortable.
The movies, BTW, were old, and the sound was terrible. The remote control didn't always work. In all, it was not a good experience. I will think again before booking my next flight to Japan with Swiss.

title: Good service on board
review_text:
Good service on board,  good leg room,  clean, tidy airplane,  shiny bright.   Even the restroom are so clean and fresh.
The problem was with the ground service in Ben Gurion airport.   The lady at the counter was totally unpleasant.   She was obviously not much helpful,  not complying to any of our requests.   She was such a pain, didn't even smile,  giving us a bad taste even before our journey began.

I took her name if someone from Swiss wants to touch base with me m

title: I‚Äôd try another airline
review_text: I was not very impressed. Their planes need an upgrade and their staff is less than accommodating. Their food is also less than desirable

title: Awful client service... or how they use you in a bidding process
review_text:
I travel long distance on Swiss & Lufthansa quite frequently for work and have been quite a loyal client and been a member of their hon circle for 8 years now. But have to say the customer treatment has deterioated over these year. 

It is now the second time that they have deducted miles for an upgrade, giving the impression that the upgrade has been succesful. Then on the day of travel and only at the gate I was informed that there is no upgrade. Thats after the staff at the NY JFK lounge confirmed to me verbally that the upgrade was ready at the gate! No apology or explanation, worse they make you feel like you did something wrong ... after my protest they told me that I was outbid! Thats after I spent a lot of money year after year flying with them...

I find this treatment completely unacceptable and I am seriously considering to plan my long distance travel such that I dont use Swiss or Lufthansa. I dont like to be spoofed & tricked! Not even sure this is legal, certainly not acceptable behaviour...

title: Great Flight
review_text: The airline staff were wonderful, customer service was very good, the food was great. I pre-booked a meal for the flight out which I didn't receive due to a glitch online but got it on the way back.Comfortable flight, highly recommended.

title: WORST AIRLINES EVER
review_text:
I travel very often and around the world (Singapour, Vietnam, Canada, France, USA) and I used many different airlines over the years. My sister is a flight attendant so I trust her opinion even more and she had the same feeling about Swiss Airlines. 
Btw, we are not princesses and don't have huge expectations, I promise!

This is the WORST airlines we've ever taken.
1. The team had no patience, was obnoxious to people on board and wasn't very accommodating when (2) happened.
2. It was a long flight (8hours) and the screen did NOT work at all ! Not even for a second!
3. NO SPACE AT ALL for your legs (I'm 178cm) 
4. They don't tell you the WIFI is not free when you book the flight, you'll know once you've boarded 
5. The voucher they gave us to apologise about the delay was 50CHF and did not work when we tried to use it ! (NB: you can't use it for additional luggage so we tried to use it for the WIFI on board, did not work either!)
6. I am one of these people who don't dare bending their seat so I don't bother the person sitting behind me. The guy in front of me was definitely not one of these people and bend his seat (which is normal! good for him for not feeling bad every time he moves!), I swear I couldn't even open my tray or fit my laptop on my thighs or anything.

That was my karma for being a cheapskate, but never again! 
Pay 200-300 more if you can, your back and sanity will thank me later.

title: Always great and on time
review_text: One of my favorite airlines. I love the convenience, leaves late at night and arrives early morning. The mid week flight from Johannesburg wasn‚Äôt full,but flying back on Saturday night meant no free seats! Flight landed on time or a few mins earlier both directions. Service is fairly okay. I think one of the flight attendants on my flight LX288 (9 Feb from ZRH) was a little harsh on a lady that went to the loo just 5 mins before landing. He blasted her for not listening to instructions and getting up when she should have been seated. He was right though, some people do silly things on purpose.

title: A great flight
review_text: Starting off in the Star Alliance Lounge made our trip special.  excellent business class cabin, with comfortable lie flat seats, making sleeping great.  arrived rested and ready to get started.  Good food and beverage service.  Those swiss chocolates!!!

title: Just ok for 4 star airline
review_text: Flight 41 LAX to Z√ºrich.  Seat controls are difficult. You have to keep pressing a button to get to your desired position. My wife‚Äôs chair had to be manually by the attendant. Aside from the normal overhead bin,  there is almost no personal storage space. A soft cover book just about fills it. The seats are quite comfortable. In flat position the feel is very good;  you do not feel any breaks in the cushions. You legs go into a well about a foot and a half high. No problem sleeping, but if you have to get up suddenly you have change the chair to sitting position to get your legs out.  The crew was very efficient. But no interaction unless you start it or you are Swiss. But very helpful if you need anything. The food tasted quite good. All in all, a very pleasant flight. What one expects from a long  haul business class flight.  I would certainly consider other carriers next time.

title: Probably best european carrier
review_text: I flew several times with Swiss to Nairobi, Kenya and back. I enjoyed every flight a lot. The service was fantastic as well as the meals the provided. Also the entertainment system did what it should. From what I can say the best european carrier.

title: Really good
review_text:
There was really good service, for a long distance flight 2 meals and several drinks included...
The stuff was so friendly... Concerning the comfort, about 5 cm more space would let you feel much more comfortable... You get what you book - but even in economy other airlines offer a little more space... 
I don't mind for a short distance flight, but for long distance some cm count a lot - for airlines some seats, for travellers some more comfort...Guess it's worth to think about it because comfort was very close to the limit...

title: A good bargain
review_text: Fantastic ride, not turbulence.  Food and drink was excellent.  Especially liked the lounge in Geneva for the layover.  Perfect accommodations for sleeping.  Arrived  fresh and ready to hit the ground running.

title: Efficient flight with correct service in a brand new plane.
review_text:
Everything timely and efficient. Correct service with a small sandwich and a coffee. The plane wasn't full, which was OK.
The plane was a Bombardier C300 series, now called Airbus A220 but this wasn't announced yet.
The leg space was too limited for me, what a pity for a brand new plane...

title: The Worst Airline- Business class was third class . Do not fly in business class!
review_text:
This was the worst airline I have ever flown. The business class seats looked tired and very old.  The food was so bad that we had to throw it away. We could not eat it at all. The snacks which they gave only once in 8 hour flight was samosas that were COLD!!
The butter they gave with bread was frozen. When I asked about these items, the hostess' answer was: "it is very cold outside". They did not even came to ask in such a long flight if we needed anything. The movie selection were equally bad,. Donot  fly in SWISS INTERNATIONAL AIRLINE.  I complained about all this to the Supervisor and all she said was :"sorry" and moved on. This shows that they DONOT CARE!!

title: As comfortable as ‚Äúeconomy class‚Äù can be
review_text: We actually felt a little ‚Äúspoiled‚Äù even in coach.  The amenities were very welcome on a long flight, and the food (and snacks) was great!  I would definitely try to book Swissair whenever possible.

title: Flight
review_text: Verry good flight and verry good service. Drinks and food on board was good. Easy to transfer on Zurich airport.we bookt 2 day‚Äôs before departure get all the information and boarding pass by email on time.

title: Superb
review_text: This was our first time with Swiss and we could not fault them the plane was immaculate and the complimentary bar service added to what was already an enjoyable and relaxing flight. We will without doubt fly Swiss again.

title: Impressive follow-through concerning delayed baggage - absolutely first-rate
review_text: Sometimes it is the manner in which difficulties are addressed that is the most important, and this is where Swiss International Air Lines came through admirably. Our connecting flight was delayed, and the Miami-bound flight waited for us as well as the baggage of other late-arriving passengers.   We did have to rush to the gate, but there was no problem at all getting through the border control.  Even though the plane was late in departing, it more than made up the time, arriving only 20 minutes behind schedule.   Very good information provided by the crew in terms of our schedule, and information for people who were transiting MIA for other flights.  Complete transparency.  Now, for the real difficulty that Swiss Air Lines handled in an exemplary fashion -  our baggage did not arrive with us in Miami.  We were notified immediately after going through immigration - no need to wait to see if our baggage turned up on the carrousel - we were taken to a special counter where we were told what to expect.  Our luggage arrived the next day ‚Äì delivered to us by courier, who sent regular updates as to when he could be expected.   The professionalism and efficiency of all persons involved was truly impressive.   Not that we are looking forward to having delayed baggage in the future, but at least with Swiss Air Lines, you know that they take it extremely seriously.

title: OK flight from Malaga to Geneva
review_text: Travelled with Swiss on a Sunday evening. Flight was full, which meant a long boarding. I was annoyed that back rows were not boarding before the front rows, which should make the whole boarding a bit smoother. Until everyone has stowed their bags and taken their seats, we had already 20 minutes of delay. Ok the flight was a bit late inbound, but it just seems not realistic to turn around a plane in 40 minutes only, with full cabin. The rest of the flight was pleasant enough, good crew, the seat on this new Bomardier is ok, but seat pitch is very limited; but their fares are not more than what you pay with the low cost airlines nowadays. Arrived in Geneva with 15 minutes delay.

title: Good value for money in economy in comparison to "low cost" carriers
review_text:
Swiss is always clean and neat. Perfectly acceptable leg room. A freshly made sandwich OK for this length of flight, in particular as you can get some wine to go with it, and even a second bottle, if you just ask for it, and when you do so, you will get the answer with a smile: "certainly". 
Home printed baggage tags speed up the baggage drop process.

title: Swiss Hospitality at 360000 ft.
review_text:
The first Swiss International Airlines flight of the day leaves at 12:55 AM from Mumbai to reach Zurich it Arrives 6:15 AM, It is 8.50 m. NON stop flight. The Swiss Crew is ever Smiling and very polite. The Quality of Food IN Vegetarian and NON veg. is exceptionally nice. They pour you Unlimited Drinks and Cocktails in Economy.
They have additional Food bar after Dinner Services.
Air Hostesses are very Quick to response. 
The Toilets are comparative bigger and very Clean with all the toiletry.
Storngly recommend to fly by Swiss Air.

title: Swiss  meet the highest standards
review_text:
The Swiss planes are clean and polished, the seats themselves are not the most spacious but very comfortable and pleasant, some of the electrical connections are old and not advanced but overall everything is very nice and excellent.
The staff is very polite and nice, but the attitude despite everything is cold and professional net and the smiles are not from the heart but the service is excellent.
As always, they are very strict about times, and in total, it is one of the best airlines in the world

title: Enjoyable Flights!
review_text: We were lucky enough to fly Swiss from Singapore to Zurich return with our APT cruise. The check in, lounge and flight were excellent. The seats were comfortable although a little snug and the food was delicious. The staff were friendly on board and accommodated us well although we were delayed due to air traffic. I would definitely fly them again and hope the experience is the same.

title: Standard service
review_text:
I find most Europeans airlines quite average if compared with Middle East and Asian lines. Swiss it is much like Lufthansa in terms of service, connections and fleet, although Swiss service and crew kindness it is of higher standard. Young fleet of aircrafts, decent airplane food , average seat pitch , good individual entertainment screen programs ; the usual European efficient but no frill service. 
Zurich Airport clean, organised , efficient with a good duty free offer.

title: Poor service for international customers
review_text:
Having flown with Swiss on mammy occasions, I can say that the service has been dropping down over the years to nothing special. 

On a seperate note, this review is actually motivated by my latest booking experience with them. I decided to book directly through the airline instead of a third party site like Expedia. I thought this would make service easier but when I needed to change my booking within 24hrs of making it, I encountered some issues.

Firstly the change in fare they proposed for the ticket was more than the price of an entirely new ticket that I could purchase at that moment on their own website. Somehow this fare class is unattainable for ticket "changes". I opted instead to cancel the booking and make a new booking since this was about 700 chf less. 

Swiss will refund a ticket but withhold a service charge of roughly 30 chf. That's annoying but to make matters worse, they issued the refund as a seperate transaction instead of canceling the original and charging the service fee on the side. For anyone paying with a foreign credit card, this means a roughly 6 percent loss (3% on both sides) on the entire ticket price, on top of the service charge.

So after all that, now I am struggling to get a receipt for the refund. The only department that can issue the receipt has no phone number and the general customer service is powerless to assist. One week has passed since sending an email request and almost two weeks since the original transaction and still unresolved. 

Choose your airlines wisely, I know I will be.

title: Can‚Äôt give zero stars.
review_text: I believed that booking with Swiss would ensure a fast professional service but in years of flying I have never experienced such chaos such as check in at Geneva Airport.  Despite arriving over two hours before the flight I had to queue jump to just make the flight.  The ground staff were just ineffective and there seems to be no management or control whatsoever. Their answer to every query was a shrug of the shoulders and walk away. Unfortunately it‚Äôs put me off ever using Swiss again. They really need to sort their act out or continue to lose customers. Even the low cost carriers offer a better service and customer experience. Use at your peril !

title: Reliable flight without surprises
review_text: With price competition in Europe, service in economy class is becoming more and more stripped of.Offered a quick bite and something to drink from sympathetic staff, seat configuration 3x3 on an Airbus.However, Negatively was the time-consuming check-in of ski luggage, which one would think would be a smooth thing in Switzerland.

title: Bad Choice for Long Haul
review_text:
I'm not entirely sure what to compare this to, but, it pretty much reminds me of economy flying back in the 80s. The seats are basically nice, service is very courteous but it's really done in an economy style presentation. Usually it's three or four attendants huddled around the food and drinks cart handing out food and beverages as quickly as they could. 

The FAs are very courteous and professional but the food choices, in flight entertainment and non-alocholic drinks are definitely sub-par compared not to the ME3 and Asian carriers but to other European carriers like Turkish Airlines.

I've created a profile on the website and made my meal and seat preferences known to the airline, but, to no avail. As a Muslim I've found their description of Halal meals to be rather insulting defining it as "doesn't contain pork", I was however, offered food prepared with Alcohol!!!

I've made the choice of this airline strictly on the basis of price and I now know my mistake.

title: Nice flight
review_text: We flew from Geneva to Zurich and from Zurich to Hong Kong. It was a 777 and the cabin is good, seats, food and flight entertainment are good too. The staff is friendly. I will recommend this airline

title: Beyond Poor Customer Service
review_text: We are flying Toronto>Johannesburg via Newark and Zurich.  WITHOUT ANY NOTICE to us, they changed the departure from JFK to Zurich, 90 minutes after our arrival in Newark.  We only noticed it by chance when looking for in-flight amenities on-line.  We called to change, spoke to 3 different people, no apology from any of them, and simply the worst customer service I've ever had from an airline.  Also, we had paid ~100 USD per ticket for seat selection on the Newark to Zurich flight (which we had to change to Air Canada and pay again), and Swiss refuses to refund the ~200 USD even though they changed the flight in the first place.  The customer service reps are very good at saying what they cannot do and entirely unhelpful in coming up with any solutions.

title: Polite employees
review_text: We really had a good flight, me and my family. The employees in the plane were polite and friendly..

title: Average but punctual service
review_text: Nothing missing and nothing special. The flight on time, the service friendly,drinks and food average. Nothing to complain, nothing special.

title: Disgraceful costumer service
review_text: It seems that you have an app for decoration as you can‚Äôt change your booking, upgrade whatsoever. After my first problem to get my check in, they sent me a voucher discount in december, which allows me to go to a restaurant and spend R$700, and i should sent the receipt and in ten working days it would be deposited. Well, we are in february, and no money still. I sent endless messages asking to change date of booking and upgrade but no information was given to me. I lost my appointment as nothing was done, I called the costumer service via telephone they didn‚Äôt do anything, asked me to send another email. And after I learned that it was empty places on business, still they didn‚Äôt help me at all. Impolite crew, they don‚Äôt learn to say good morning, excuse me. Not everything is about money. It‚Äôs the last time I travel with Swiss, unfortunately I don‚Äôt have this kind of problems with BA, I can change booking, upgrade with no stress and prompt response. Swiss is not reliable therefore I wouldn‚Äôt recommend for anyone.

title: Good air company and comfortable even in Eco class
review_text:
Pros:
1. quick and effective boarding
2. comfortable seats and sufficient room for legs, head side support
3. Good quality food and descent on board service
4. Personal entertainment system 

Cons:
1. departure delay up to 25 min
2. A list of movies is limited in the entertainment system

title: Other airlines are better
review_text: Very poor service between Manchester and Zurich. Small seats with poor leg room. The food service was awful with no choice of food. I was given a fish dish. When I told the staff that I could not eat fish I was told there was no food choice and it was that or a bread roll. It was the same on the return flight. Very very poor service. Even Ryanair offers a better service than Swiss.

title: Excellent in-flight service
review_text: Good meal service with real cutlery.  No charge for 'hard' drinks.   I only had one, wife had none.  The swiss chocolate was excellent.

title: Compared to past experience, really poor
review_text:
Haven‚Äôt flown Swiss for a while - changed job and moved country. And, in fairness I have generally flown long distance in first or business with Hon Circle status, so a European economy flight isn‚Äôt really comparable.
Nevertheless, this was a shock. The plane was OK, but in flight service (such as it was) was basically non-existent and what there was was surly.
I was also surprised that (other than a sandwich, more later) any food or drink was payable (for example, not the case on KLM). Swiss appear to have combined flag carrier prices with low cost airline service quality and ancillary charges - hardly a winning formula.
As regards the free sandwich, I was so astonished that after one bite I took a photo. The ‚Äúbread‚Äù was dry, very stale, with a tiny smear of some unidentifiable pale tasteless paste. Apparently ‚Äúfreshly made‚Äù?. Totally inedible and tasteless - possibly to encourage one to buy something else ..... ?
Given a choice, would certainly not fly Swiss again.

title: Very Smooth
review_text: My first experience of flying with Swiss International and a very pleasant, comfortable and punctual flight was on the new C-Series aircraft.

title: Let down with their service
review_text:
Lost my luggage/skies got them to me on the evening of my third day any chance of compensation NO!
Plane was diverted to Paris on the return Swissair were nowhere to help, so all passengers were left to find their own way home.
It cost me ¬£486.00 to fly to Heathrow tried to claim this back NO CHANCE.
Customer service with Swissair is nil!!
My advice DO NOT USE THIS TINPOT AIRLINE

title: Awful Food
review_text: My 8-hour flight from Zurich to Nairobi was OK.  But the food was terrible!  I tried Lufthansa on my return trip, but it had it‚Äôs own problems.

title: GOOD EXPERIENCE
review_text: An excellent flight . The seat comfort and service were excellent. the food  and beverages served were very good.

title: Better Leg
review_text: My wife and I flew from Zurich to Barcelona.  It was a much better experience all-around than our previous flight from Johannesburg to Zurich.  The plane was a lot more modern & our exit row seats were comfortable.  The check in process went well considering we were very last minute in boarding & their ticket scanner wasn't working.  The crew was very professional & customer-oriented.

title: Disappointing
review_text: My wife and I flew on Swiss Air from Johannesburg, South Africa to Zurich, Switzerland.  The ground crew experience on the Johannesburg, South Africa side was very disorganized & not very customer-oriented.  We were in economy class check in and we had to sit in a roped off area that was extremely small & had no room to walk around.  All of the passengers were forced to switch from one side of the aisle of the check in process to the other 3 times with no real explanation than one of the crew stated that was the way she wanted it.  We were placed in a passport checking queue that also had to be switched around when the queues weren't matching up with the class boarding signs.  Then, there was no announcement that we were free to board after check in until some of the passengers were just choosing to proceed down to the boarding gate.  Our extra legroom row of seats was extremely tight & we kept pushing on the remote for the viewing screens.  The food trays were too small & could not be moved away from your body so it was a cramped meal time.  The entertainment system was very old & did not have very many new movies being offered.  The entertainment system also had to be rebooted due to issues with playback of movies.  The seats were also not well padded so a couple of hours in the seats were not comfortable at all.

title: Felt like first class
review_text:
I haven‚Äôt stopped talking about this airline since I got back.  The service was excellent and to be able to drop off my ski‚Äôs, boots and helmet as soon as I got to the airport and check them in for free is unbelievable as other airlines charge a fortune. 

The flight was only 1-40hrs but still came with a meal and a beautiful Swiss chocolate. 
I‚Äôll will definitely fly Swiss again!

title: Very good flight, super landing despite heavy winds
review_text:
We flew from ZRH to NCE in a fully booked A319. The flight was on time and the service was good. 
When we approached Nice, there were some heavy winds. Despite that, the pilot made a very, very smooth landing. You couldn't even feel the touch down. Excellent job!

title: Most comfortable airline for inner European trips
review_text:
For me, Swiss Airlines is one of the best, maybe even the best airline for inner European trips. I have flown with them several times (Warsaw - Zurich , Berlin - Zurich, Paris - Zurich vice versa). You always get a nice sandwich or something equal, Swiss chocolate and hot & cold drinks. Which other airline does that while travelling within Europe?

Furthermore the flight attendants are always very professional, polite and helpful. 

Very comfortable trips with Swiss Airlines!

title: Great experience in coach
review_text: They just keep feeding you for the whole flight. There was a snack, a proper meal, a sandwich, and another snack. The seat was comfortable, the flight attendants were friendly, and the only bad thing was that the flight takes nearly 12 hours. That is a long time to sit!

title: A good low cost alternative
review_text: In Europe I have flown Ryan Air and FlyBe and I would rate SWISS as a much better alternative. Although not the same type of service as a major airline like British, Lufthansa, etc., SWISS does a good job of customer care at the gate and in the air. I suggest paying for a reserved seat for more comfort but it matter little for a short 1-2 hour flight.

title: Long flight
review_text: They feed you well and they are extremely polite. However in economy class you are pretty tight in there... it should be illegal in a flight that is more than 7hours to not have more space..

title: Baggage hell
review_text:
If Swiss Air loss your bag, don't expect any customer service.

At Heathrow Swiss Air could not open one of baggage doors of plan.  So they left 44 bags behind.

No explanation when we arrive.  We are all there waiting for bags that do not come.  We only find out what has happened after we queue to find out.

I am on a weekend ski holiday, so this is very bad news.

They promise me that they will deliver my bag by next day lunchtime.  But no show.  I email but no response.  I call and they say they can't say tell me what is happening.  There was no attempt to keep me informed.  I waited in for nothing.

They then send a message saying someone would call. No one calls.

Will my bag arrive before I go home?

My holiday is in ruins.  I don't have the clothes to ski. Or a towel for a shower. Not much of a ski holiday when you can't ski!

title: Cancelled flights!
review_text: Today has been an absolute joke. I started at London city airport, the flight from there was cancelled, and I was then shipped across to Heathrow. That flight was also cancelled, so I'm now waiting on the next flight that may or may not run. None of their staff could provide a decent explanation, with the best I got being "a rotation issue"

title: Disgrace SWISS airline
review_text: Absolute disgrace of an airline this!...after landing and queuing through border control, the Captain barges my wife out of the way sending her flying so he can get to the front of line and then once there he sticks his arm blocking anyone else showing their passports so all his crew can walk past.....needless to say they all thought he was a hero, laughing and giving him high fives as they passed....disgusting behaviour!!!

title: Swiss Efficiency in Action
review_text: A one way trip on basic economy fare for the 90 minute trip was very pleasant.  I was assigned a window seat and was able to bring my carry on bag and a back pack on board the Airbus 320 aircraft without needing to pay extra.  The plane departed and arrived precisely on schedule.  Boarding was smooth at Prague through a jet bridge.  A tasty cheese sandwich was served along with complimentary soft drinks and hot beverages.  It was a smooth flight on a clean airplane.  No in flight entertainment but the flight was short. My first flight on Swiss and was fully impressed.

title: Miami to Zurich with Swiss in First class
review_text:
This flight is great, the service is excellent, but there was 2 flights a day in winter, one with an A330 and one with a Boeing 777 much newer. 
Unfortunately they replaced the Boeing 777 by another A330, much older ! too bad.

title: Old planes
review_text: I have flown many times to Shangai and with different airlines. This time I was not pleasantly surprised as unfortunately the plane SWISS has chosen for the specific route was extremely old. We had to be reassigned to other seats as the video system was not working in a bunch of seats. Even in the new seats it was half working. One cannot avoid thinking that if such a simple thing as the AV is so dilapidated, what about the rest of the plane's systems. Fortunately we landed. To that I have to add that the crew did it's best to support the passengers, but even they could not avoid the remark: " The plane is old you know...".  It was extremely unprofessional of SWISS and I doubt if I ever will use it for long-haul flights to Asia.

title: SWISS is always my first choice!
review_text: nice flight with good service, even my preselected menu was there...however, the plane is not the youngest anymore and is offering limited space only; for my next flight I'm hoping for improvements.....

title: From Russia with Love
review_text: Swiss is famous worldwide for the high quality service offered to its passengers, even in economy flight seats. In a 3h30min Moscow to Z√ºrich flight I had the chance to eat a delicious Chicken in mushroom sauce with vegetables and rice, fresh bread with butter and jam, Tiramisu and a Swiss cheeseboard! No turbulences, extremely fast baggage claim once in ZRH. (In literally 10 min from the landing you could have already claimed the baggage and exit the Airport);

title: Very pleasant flight.
review_text: It was the first time when I have flown with Swiss and it was a very pleasant flight. The flight attendants were very polite and helpful. The aircraft was very clean inside.

title: Excellent
review_text: An empty flight so very comfortable. I was out of the terminal having collected luggage before the time we were due to land.

title: always delayed
review_text:
Swiss flights are always always always delayed. I never had a Swiss flight on time. 
even easy jet has better timing.

title: Short flight in a "Austrian" plane to a wrong location
review_text:
Well - weather was the reason for me ending up in Hannover instead of Bremen at 20:00. The flight was operated by Austrian and managed by Lufthansa. At least the magazine and tissues were Swiss. 
I should say Lufthansa did a great job in organizing a bus service to Bremen for about 100 people in less than 1 hour. We all made it there by 22:30 in spite of snow and ice. Great job ! 

Seating in these small planes on short distance is horrible for a 1,90m guy. Narrow, no legroom and a brutally hard seat. Not fun at all. 

Finding the cheapest flight it was overall my mistake but since there is no alternative with better quality it does not make a difference anyhow.

title: Professional and friendly
review_text: From check in to arrival Swiss staff were extremely polite and professional. Crew on board were very friendly and engaging, particularly our cabin manager. Meals were excellent. Although business seating was not as luxurious as on longer routes, (standard seats) for these shorter routes it was very pleasant and not expensive anyway. We really enjoyed this airline and will definitely fly Swiss again.

title: Great service excellent airlines
review_text: As title says, great customer service and very friendly staff at each point of the airline experience. Mobile boarding passes were easy to use, transfers seemless and food on board was amazing

title: Yup, if you can, always choose swiss
review_text: Fantastic service, fantastic food (which can rarely be said of inboard food). Lounge vegan options could be improved, but overall a great flying experience.

title: I usually quite like SWISS and I fly very often with them. This flight however was terrible. The plane was tiny and pack
review_text:
I usually quite like SWISS and I fly very often with them. This flight however was terrible. The plane was tiny and packed. Business class was ridiculous, they were regular seats with dinners thats it, im glad I didnt pay to be there. Economy was a nightmare though. the plane was boiling and the food looked terrible- first time I have seen a small snack box in one of these flights and not a proper meal tray. there was no SWISS choice (TV). On top of all these, the flight was delayed in almost an hour which at night, makes a big difference.

although I usually do prefer flying SWISS, I will definitely reconsider next time.

title: Seats could be more comfortable, service is very good
review_text: Food and service are good. The service is attentive, the food is tasty and the airline has a seasonal menu. The seats seem like they're from the 1990s; even though they are completely flat to sleep in, they're not very comfortable

title: Seat arrangement at Swiss is very disappointing!
review_text:
I recently booked a flight to Japan and realized that outbound flights are operated by Swiss (otherwise Nippon Airways). Since we are traveling as a family, 2 adults, 2 children aged 10 and 7 years old, I wanted to book seats for a long-hauled flight (Zurich - Tokyo) however I was able to do so only against payment. I called support service and they told me the same. They also confirmed that Swiss does not have any policy where minors must be accompanied by an adult (parent). 
So, if I do not pay extra 140‚Ç¨ to book seats it might happen that my 7 and 10 year old would sit by themselves on a long hauled flight for 12 hours with their parents away from them!!! This is not a problem if the flight is short(er) however for an overseas flight this is unacceptable. 

As Swiss is considered as one of the best airlines (No. 12 as per Skytrax) this is definitely a big and unwelcome surprise. Even Ryanair (ranked 64 at Skytrax!!!) which is considered as a low cost airline has a policy that a minor must sit next to a parent. I really do not understand how an airline like Swiss would allow that!

How a passenger sitting next to a five or six or 7 year old would feel when the child would need help with food or would be cranky and tired, possibly crying? How would parents feel if they would need constantly be going to kids seat or kids not wanting to stay at the seat without parents? I believe it is even more challenging for stewardesses/ flight crew with arrangement like that.

For return flight from Tokyo we had no issues of booking seats on the airplane free of charge (operated by Nippon&Eurowings). Actually this is the first case within all our travels (we are traveling overseas at least once per year) that we encountered needed payment for booking seats for the overhauled flight. If we were only adults or my children would be aged 15 and over this would not be an issue however as they are still minors it is very hard for me as a mother/ parent to accept that they would be surrounded by strangers for 12 hours and sitting by themselves. 
We are not even seeking to have all 4 seats together, 2 by 2 seats are completely fine- so if I do not pay, my kids might sit by themselves (seating based on the availability 24 hours before the flight). 
This is the first and the very last flight that I'm booking/ flying with Swiss! VERY unpleasant experience and very dissapointing!

P.S. This review is for the flight happening in June 2019!

title: Need more room
review_text: We (5) took an international economy flight from Newark to Rome with a stopover in Zurich.  The staff, food & beverage were top notch.  However, the room for 4 seats in the same row(middle) had minimal room.  Barely enough to eat the meals, and not enough to get slightly comfortable on a flight for over 7 hours.  We were lucky enough that we were together & knew each other, but we could see & hear the frustrations of other passengers in nearby rows. We were packed in like sardines.

title: One of my top 5 airline companies
review_text:
So far, Swiss airlines is amongst the companies I like to travel with. The service in the plane is good, hostesses are kind, meals where not bad.

The only negative point is about my seat. I've chosen one with no space under the front seat for the feet/legs. It was said limited space on the map, but I didn't expect this, so be careful when you pick up your seat.

title: First class service and flights
review_text:
spacious seats. 2 seats on either side of aisle on outward journey and 2 and 3 on return trip. Free drink and a lovely croissant which is most unusual. Also a snack and drink on way back. AND delicious Swiss chocs, what could be better?! Very nice aircrew. Flights on time.
The best check-in we have had at any airline-very efficient.

title: B777 / 300 Business seating less space
review_text:
For a long time I fly long-distance flights in the business class. This year I chose Swiss for the first time from Zurich to Bangkok (LX180). 
At Zurich Airport, I was served very friendly; quick check-in, pleasant stay in the business lounge, uncomplicated and fast boarding on a full plane.

Compare with other airlines, the seats on Swiss Business Class are narrow and have few storage space. My seat (8D) had little storage compartment. There was only a tiny drawer, just fine for a glasses case. The handbag and shoes had to be stowed at the foot. To compare: the Boeing 777-300 Thai Airway, according to "SeatGuru", 34 flat bed seats are listed, but 62 flat bed seats are listed on the same machine on Swiss. I made my seat into lie flat mode to prepare for some sleep. It‚Äôs disappointing that no mattress pad was offered; only a pillow and a blanket. The pillow was acceptable but the blanket was not as luxurious as I‚Äôd expect on Swiss. 

A meet very nice and courteous flight staff. The food was good, but with the description on the menu, the chef is also 'up in the air'.
All things added up, I‚Äôd say my experience wish Swiss B777-300 Business class was positive. 
Since I had already booked my return flight with Swiss, I hope that the helpfulness and friendliness of the staff can compensate for the mentioned small "mishaps".

title: Swiss' hospitality is no joke
review_text:
I had a flight with Swiss from Z√ºrich to Singapore in an codeshare flight (SQ2928/LX176). It was a really great flight. One of the best flight. 

There were not many passengers and many passengers got a whole row for themselves. Including me.
The 12-hours-Flight felt only like it was a 3-Hours-Flight. 

The foods were great, but lack some taste for me.
The flight attendants were really helpful and lovely. 
Definitely will fly again with Swiss if there are chances.

title: Good flight
review_text: i had a great flight, with good food, wine and entertainment. It was really calm and I could sleepp almost all flight from S√£o Paulo to Zurich.

title: Wonderful Flight
review_text: What can I say-the staff(  from check-in to landing ) were excellent-SeT was roomy and quite comfortable. Video very good

title: Superb
review_text: Swiss is one of (or) the best airlines out there, good service air prices and Swiss punctuality. Highly recomended

title: Swiss Air was a big help after our delay
review_text: A big snow/ice storm did not cause SwissAir to cancel our flight but the de-icing process (very interesting to observe!) delayed us enough to miss our connection in Zurich.  I was mentally figuring how and when the kids and I would be able to continue on to Rome, but once we arrived in Zurich, airline personnel greeted us as we de-planed and directed us to the appropriate desk where our boarding passes for a new flight were waiting for us! In the huge Zurich airport we found lots to see and do, including free wifi, as we waited, thankful that our next flight was all organized for us.

title: Disappointing after the hype
review_text: After 2 long delays, we finally boarded the flight (after a long international flight too) A stale snack was served, no dinner. Hard uncomfortable seats and stewards who were on the last flight out and wanted it to be over. We understand there were delays with ice in Milan, but the service in Zurich airport was below average, we had no access to wi-fi and no one to help us. very frustrating and I will do my best not to have to use it as a connection hub again.

title: Swiss flight Geneva-New York-Geneva in May 2018
review_text: Very pleasant flights, very smooth and we always feel very secure flying with Swiss.  We did not feel tired at all upon our arrival to NY and back to Geneva due to very comfortable seats  and pleasant flights.  Kind and efficient crew, excellent food, excellent movies, neat, comfortable, GREAT!  We will fly again with Swiss to NY!

title: very good food, on time, friendly staff
review_text: We choose economy class. We had space, not so much as in economy plus, but it worked quite well. The food  ( some meat), was really good, only too little (like other airlines). I missed that they offered more beverages ( e.g. water, softdrinks) during the flight. It wa spossible to go to the kitchen and pick up some, but they went not thru the plane activily despite in combination with food serving

title: A Swiss Delight
review_text: The first leg of the trip was Mumbai to Zurich in Business Class and Zurich to Chicago upgraded to First Class. Both portions of the trip were delightful, but I had forgot how good First Class can be. The level of service was perfectly calibrated to your needs. The cabin space was very generous if not exactly a suite.  The food service was perfection. Every course was well prepared and properly served. A fine restaurant could do no better. Two of the courses were so memorable that we asked for and received the recipes. Our compliments to the staff for a job well done.

title: 7 Hour Flight
review_text:
We flew with Swiss on a 7-Hour flight and there was absolutely no legroom. This is a trend among greedy airlines but on top of this, the entertainment system was out of order for the entire flight.

I have contacted Swiss directly and all I got was a written apology. Lame.

title: Very long flight but the great service helped
review_text: 12 long hours flight was hard but the flight attendants were very attentative. They constantly patrolled the cabin for passengers‚Äô needs and three meal services with drink cart service plus snack and drinks in between. Liquor was served plentiful and crew was very courteous. Normally I find these excellent service on European and Asian airlines but unfortunately not on US carriers.

title: Straightforward
review_text: We recently flew with Swiss Air from Zurich to Warsaw. The whole process was quite straightforward, with minimal fuss. Received electronic boarding passes, checked luggage in at the airport, and boarding was quite quick. Inflight service provided a sandwich and tea or coffee. Flight landed on time, and flight attendants were courteous without being overly friendly. Aircraft was a bombadier which was quite noisy, although we didn‚Äôt mind the seat configuration which was 2 + 3 (we had the 2 seats together). Overall our first time flying with Swiss was pretty good.

title: Another ski trip flight
review_text: I like that Swiss still serve cold & hot drinks free in economy and give you something to eat free as well as the Swiss chocolate. The flights normally take off on time and when there was a problem with Heathrow being shut with snow they put all the passengers up in airport hotels in Zurich waiting for them to open. Swiss, Lufthansa and Norwegian Airlines are the best economy airlines.

title: So classy and friendly
review_text:
What a relaxing trip we had coming back from Bangkok on Swiss first class to Z√ºrich.
THe hostesses and stewards were very nice and the food quite good for airplane food.
The choice of wine was excellent especially the argentinian wine.
Unless it was a day flight we still managed to sleep 4 hours and then watched some films.
We arrived in Z√ºrich very relaxed and the only agression was the air temperature 30 degrees celcius below Bangkok.
We will be back on Swiss soon ,no doubt.
Claude Hildenbrand

title: Awesome flight with awesome service
review_text: Although there was a take-off delay for almost an hour, but I was surprised that the plane managed to arrive at Zurich on time. The crews were very nice and the service isn't disappointing. This was my first time flying with Swiss Air and I felt very satisfied with the whole flight. The meals were awesome and legroom was quite spacious. The seat was comfortable and in-flight entertainment was awesome. This 12-hour flight with Swiss Air, for me, was worth the price.

title: Scammers
review_text:
Please beware! The flight are very often canceled,and you got 0 reimbursement, they ignore the eu rules. The only thing "swiss" is the name
Huge scam, low quality airlines with cheap tricks. Avoid these airlines as mucj as possible, they are real scammers. Highly overrated, avoid!

title: decent flight
review_text: as with most domestic flights, queues form early for passengers carrying (additional) carry-on luggage, and this flight within the EU is no different. service and seat space were decent, and the flight departed/arrived on time.

title: again a pleasure to fly with them
review_text: they always go out of there way to make you feel so welcomed and make sure you are well looked after, from checking in tot the lounge access until you board the plane then in flight they give you the best service , I truly believe...

title: Business class 777
review_text:
Seats comfortable for business class but 2-2-1 set up is not the most convinient compare to other 1-2-1 airlines. Not much privacy, quite squeezed. 
Service - compare to other airlines from Asia, lot of space for improvement.

title: Great flight spoiled by the hub-approach
review_text:
Unfortunately, my great flight ZRH-SFO was spoiled by the experience from Geneva to Zurich. Is Swiss wants to promote its hub in Zurich, it should make more efforts to consider its passengers coming from other locations.

My bad experience started at check-in, where the person at the desk did not know was the Global Entry Programme was. She had to call her superior and the whole process lasted 25 minutes until I was cleared to get my ZRH-SFO boarding card.

Going to the lounge, I was directed to the senator lounge even thoug I had a first-class ticket from ZRH. After discussion, the staff let me in in the first class lounge in GVA. 

In the lounge, good service, but unfortunately they have taken away the Nespresso machine (cost-cutting measures ?) and there were no magazines (cost-cutting measures ?)

In Zurich, we taxied to a remote location on the tarmack, no on a bridge. There was no service to the lounge. I had to take the bus to terminal A, look for the first-class lounge (not easy to find from this side). I then asked to be trasnfered to terminal E, but there was a waiting time of 15 minutes. I was finally driven in an 8-seated bus to terminal E. Time between getting out of the plane from GVA to the lounge : 35 minutes, same time as flying from GVA to ZRH. Since they drive you anyway from terminal A to E, why do they not get you at the plane ? This is a terrible client experience‚Ä¶for this kind of price

On a good note, the flight from ZRH to SFO was on time, great service, friendly staff, great food, comfortable pyjamas, excellent beds (the mattresses and the duvet are really great).

What is unfortunately still appalling is the movie catalogue : a disaster ! Or if you want to see the glass half full: it gives you time to work.

title: really good service
review_text: we bought the flight in delta , i did not want any stops in the us thinking about winter storms, it work out great , we flew to zurich and then to berlin . we had about one hour lay over .not bad at all. the seats were really comfy and the space also was very roomy . i usually fly American in businesses but this was much nicer. food excellent and the service was quick and effective . so i recommend flying swiss air !!

title: Amazing experience
review_text: The best airline I have experienced. Nice staff, decent meals and got to select my seat on ticket bookings.

title: Cant contact Customer Service!
review_text:
The flight was fine,but you better hope that they don't loose your baggage.
My flight was 6 weeks ago.  to date I'm still missing a bag.  I have tried to contact customer service to start a claim, but all you get is a phone number to a recording.
I went on line and 3 times I have filled out their customer service form to start a claim for lost baggage.  I still haven't received any responses to any of those. I finally started to call any phone number I could get from their website.  i finally reached a real person by calling a number for people that have concerns over disabilities. That person gave me an email address to send my info to.  Then several days later, I get an email back, telling me that I have to contact another person.  Instead of them just forwarding my email to the appropriate person, I now have to rewrite my request for a claim all over again! They are great when they want money from you, but are impossible to reach when something goes wrong.

title: Express review: As airlines go...
review_text:
It was as expected, swift and efficient for a short hop flight. Polite welcoming staff and easy check-in online.

I've flown with Swiss Air a number of times and their standards have always been maintained.

title: Not meeting expectations
review_text: Check in for this flight was rather straightforward and we were soon going through customs and security which was all rather brief as Zurich airport was rather desert late at night. Boarding was smooth and efficient and so far everything was going okay. Unfortunately things weren‚Äôt as impressive during the flight as I hoped them to be. As per usual the 777-300 was in a 3-4-3 formation. I did find in comparison to other airlines that Swiss leave a small gap between the window seat and the window seat which eliminates aisle space. This was a major pain for me in the aisle seat as it was nearly impossible not to be bumped by every person and cart that went past you. Unsurprisingly I prefer the window seat right up to the window as this means a wider aisle. The flight left on time and the seat belt sign was off quickly enough meaning the dinner service started rather quickly. The meals I must say we were one of the high points of Swiss airlines as food often has a terrible reputation in the sky. The lights were dimmed shortly after dinner as per usual which was when I started to browse the inflight entertainment in the hope of finding enough content to fill up the next 9 or so hours. What I did find was the most disappointing inflight entertainment selection I‚Äôve ever encountered. A very limited selection of tv,films and music meant I didn‚Äôt use the inflight entertainment full stop. Luckily I had hours of music and downloaded shows to fulfill my time. One good thing about Swiss was the amount of times the flight attendants came around with water during the flight to the point it seemed excessive but completely justified as one will usually find themselves drinking more than usual on a flight. Toward the end of the flight when it was around 1400 there was the second meal service. At 1400 BREAKFAST was the meal. I still can‚Äôt get my head around this, with this being the most illogical meal possible at this time. Anyway the breakfast tasted alright but certainly didn‚Äôt help adjusting time zones. Toilets are always the same in economy small and clean so nothing out of the ordinary about the toilets. Overall I had high expectations prior to the flight as I find their short haul flights in Europe very good. Unfortunately these expectations weren‚Äôt met meaning I‚Äôm not in a rush to fly them again. Although the price is cheap i will be looking elsewhere next time I‚Äôm flying long haul in and out of Europe.

title: Seating too tight & toilets a real pain
review_text:
Sometimes one can be lucky and fly on a plane that has an empty seat beside you and that was my fortune so I could manage the lack of space on the back back.

The toilets are just too small. They need to be slightly larger. Complete madness. However designed this did not have to use the toilet.

title: Not enough seating room & toilets too small
review_text:
As usual the seating is my big problem with Swiss. The planes are all modern and the staff are pleasant. There is a drink and a snack served which is good enough.

The toilets are getting smaller and smaller. Whoever designed them needs to be put in them and see how they feel when they have to use them.

For a man it is just about right but for a woman it would be a bit uncomfortable.

I am not impressed by this lack of consideration. A few centimeters more would not be too much to ask.

title: Worst airline
review_text: Terrible airline we lost our bags and they dont even know where did they leave it. We made a claim no one returned back to us we called a few times they dont pick up. Never gonna use it again.

title: Hope you have narrow hips
review_text: Have flown Swissair several times in the late 90's and early 2000's with awesome experience. This last flight had a 3-4-3 seating configuration which was more suited to a 5 year old's seat width, my wife is very average size and it was tight for her. I have heard of other airlines changing to this seat configuration, got to make every inch pay for itself, but not an experience I want to go through again. I think if they can convince the FAA to strap you in standing up position, you will see that pretty soon. Flight attendants were great and the pilots greased the landings both ways.( that means a very smooth landing)

title: C300 Bombardier plane
review_text: I had the chance to be on C300 from Bombardier, from Venice to Zurich, really great experience to appreciate legroom, commodity and confortable seat

title: My favourite airline
review_text: The best airline I have ever flown with. Really good service, good food, nice crew. Aircraft (B777-300ER) was almost brand new, really confortable and shiny.

title: Bland experience.
review_text: Check in was fairly quick and staff were mainly polite. Boarding seems chaotic,however, cabin crew seems overwhelmed by the number of carry-on luggage some passengers brought onboard and I had a suitcase forced on top of my laptop backpack in the overhead stowage. The seat was cramped for me and having a meal was uncomfortable to say the least. The meals served were average. The playlist on the inflight entertainment seems unfamiliar and centered on mainly euro-type dramas & movies. To top it all, though no fault of the cabin crew, there was screaming baby, throughout the flight, a couple of seats away. The toilet was also dirtied by mid flight, and upon landing, the cabin looked like ground zero with blankets, food, and all kinds of rubbish on the floor. I was quite glad when we finally left the plane.

title: Swissness bye bye
review_text: The service is compared to Emirates just a desaster. Unfriendly stuff, low service generally and a very narrow economy class. I have no clue why they bought their "Flagship" 777 Boeing instead of dreamliners or a A380 or similar. The Boeing feels just old and used already. Unfortunately this is not the only flight with this experience. I also flewn back from Miami to Zurich in Businessclass. I really must say, not worth the money.

title: An Amazing Experience!
review_text: Chicago to Zurich, flight LX9. Our family was visiting relatives in Germany for Christmas. Flying Swiss was an amazing experience! Our last flight landed in terminal 1 in Chicago O'Hare. We took the shuttle to terminal 5, where we waited about two hours, with not a single delay. We have flown this airline once before and the children liked it. The airplane was clean and new. They use an Airbus A330-300, for this flight. Staff were extremely friendly; one of the kid's seat top was broken, but a flight attendant didn't hesitate to help fix it. There was a limited amount of entertainment options, but our kids were fine with it. The food was good, and the seats were comfortable. At the end of the flight, the flight attendants gave the children a few toys and a chocolate bar. Overall, this experience was great and we will definitely fly with Swiss again.

title: Good
review_text: Very Good travel . Stop over in Zurigh it'S not a problem. it' S second Times situazione swiss. I recomand it

title: Horrible service
review_text: Our plane was late, so missed our connection flight to Asia. We needed to wait 3 hours in line, and got a hotel and dinner and booked for the next day flight to another destination. The food and staff is very low quality, airplane is not clean, I would expect more from a Swiss!

title: Worth the trip
review_text:
Worthy airline to fly long distance flights.
