Altough we flew exonomy class, still had an enjoyable time in the air with the airline. 
Could just be a litle better on ground organisation regarding boarding and check in @ zurich airport. 

Would definitely fly swiss again

title: Nice trip
review_text: Took a flight to Geneva in September 2018 and the experience was very good. My husband requires assistance so called swiss air and arranged things with them. They could not have been nicer. I had paid extra for some seats with more leg room and after learning my husband needed assistance they refunded the extra cost.....We had a change of plane in Zurich and everything went so smoothly. I will not hesitate to book again on SwissAir. The flight itself was fine, food was correct and the personnel friendly. I was very surprised by the whole experience

title: Everything was nice and easy.
review_text: Return flight from Z√ºrich to Warsaw. Inside of the cabin, nice and clean. Onboard staff very professional. Snacks as usual sandwich etc. some drinks.

title: Flight to Zurich
review_text: Business Class flight attendants were very nice and were around quit a bit to make sure your needs are met.  I was flying from ORD to Zurich and then on to Bangkok. The Swiss Air leg was ver enjoyable with no issues at all. Seat was comfortable.

title: Great flights
review_text: After a disastrous journey to Manchester with Austrian Airlines we were nervous about what to expect.  However the planes were modern, clean, roomy and had entertainment.  The food was quite good and the staff were great.  My only criticism is that when changing in Zurich, we followed directions for gate E without any indication that we would need a train.  The terminal was deserted and we has no idea what was going on until the train showed up. Other than that it was quick and efficient.

title: Ok
review_text:
This is not as good as other options, seats are uncomfortable, service ok. Next time I need to book this will not be in my top list.
You will thing it is a great airline, but I do not think so.

title: Very good experience at Swiss airline lounge in Zurich
review_text: Very good experience at Swiss airline lounge in Zurich. Business lounge was clean and convenient. Plenty of drinks, food, international press. Solid internet connection. Enjoyed the relax area. Restrooms and showers clean and well maintained.  Working area is bit small, couple of dark small boxes, but enough to manage basic admin . Very good location at international terminal, perfect for plane spotting. Also open terrace is available. Fast internet connection. Staff was friendly. In business hours it can get crowded. Definitely positive experience.

title: We were disappointed in Swiss Air
review_text: We have flown with Swiss Airlines before and sadly the second experience had been no better than the first.  The majority of the attendants came across superficially friendly - there were one or two who obviously did not mind helping and caring.  The rest seemed to be simply doing a job they had to do whether they liked or not.   This was also noticeable in the overall serving of food and beverages.  They were slow to start with the evening meal,  slow to move down the isles,  slow to offer second drinks/coffee,  slow to collect the dinner plates.  Not at all what we expected of the world wide impression of Swiss quality and efficiency.  One upside though, were the availability of soap, hand cream and spray in the toilets.  Not all airlines offer sprays.  The food were OK - not bad but not good either.   The choice of breakfast before we landed in Zurich, however, was a major let down:  we were served a COLD sandwich.  At the end of a 10 hour flight, a cold sandwich just does not go down well.   If the service and food were good, one could look past the aircraft being on the old side, with no USB port to charge a phone and old technology in-flight entertainment.  We will rather not opt to fly with Swiss again.

title: Stranded passengers then states it is Edelweiss Air problem
review_text:
Here is Swiss Air's reply to passengers being stranded on a flight booked on Swiss Air but flown by Edelweiss. Swiss Air took no responsibility and simply closed the matter.

"As clearly stated in my previous email, the flight was operated by Edelweiss Air and I kindly advised you to contact them directly. Many thanks for your understanding as your case is now considered as closed."

Swiss Air does NOT have my understanding.

title: It was fine
review_text:
There was nothing extraordinary , either good or bad. The staff was accommodating, plenty of beverages, snacks and food was offered. The movie selection was good. The seats were just like any other trans Atlantic flight, plenty of blankets and pillows. it left on time, it arrived on time. 
Swiss Air was fine.

title: The seats and the staff are dreadful
review_text:
I have an allergy to tomato so that I could not eat the offered meal...The stewardess said you are rejecting it and took it back...SHE DID NOT OFFER ANYTHING IN RETURN...not even something that was left over in another class....HER ATTITUDE WAS DEMEANING....I have never accounted such a lack of customer service from an airline....IT SHOULD BE AVOIDED AT ALL COSTS...FIND ANOTHER WAY TO FLY.

Several of the seats in economy were broken, ie. could not be pushed back, so that one was treated like an animal, i.e. front seat worked and yours did  not, so that you are trapped and find it hard to get out to go to the lavatory....AGAIN the stewardness did not seem surprised nor did  it appear that she/he would ever report the problem.  

I IMPLORE YOU TO FIND ANOTHER AIRLINE TO FLY TO ZURICH

title: ‚Äú‚ÄùThey screw you in the drive thru‚Äù (so to speak)
review_text:
I was originally booked on Lufthansa from Milan to Tel Aviv. When I realized they were flying the A321, I changed my flight to Swiss Air (almost 1,000 change fee for 3 tickets( because it would be a 77W going and  a A330 on the return. Less than three weeks before my trip, I receive an email stating my seats were changed. Including my privacy seat, which I paid nearly 100 euro for 
Well, hahahaha on me, they changed the whole damn plane to, you quessed it, an A321. Why would any airline use this bucket for more than an hour or two flight? 
A330- Lie flat seats, AC power, Wifi, personal tv screen. 20.5 width seat. A321, 17‚Äù seat, 4‚Äù recline.
It‚Äôs extremely unfair to the customer when they think they‚Äôre getting A330 perks and end up getting the, we‚Äôre going to fly it until it breaks bucket. They get your money and then they, we‚Äôll, I‚Äôll say screw you to remain somewhat respectful. I was told by them they have a right to change and I agreed when I bought the ticket. However. Looking at their website it shows that plane being used for Europe and the three newer planes beyond. However, they‚Äôre sneaky, when I looked at the planes specs they have deeper in their website, there, it states they use the bucket for Europe. Near East and Africa. Although no where at the sales level does it say that. Naturally. One would think, you change the plane, not all of the goodies as well. On a long distance flight, this plane is a throwback to the 70‚Äôs without the ashtray. If you like airplane food, it‚Äôs included, if you have time. You might get a seat in the lounge. Me personally, the seat is everything, especially after running from Lufthansa because I couldn‚Äôt bear the thought of a nearly five hour flight in basically coach. In my opinion, they have no respect for their customers or the expense they go through to travel. 
Needless to say, I won‚Äôt ever book a flight with this terrible airline again. Originally when this flight was booked, someone at Swiss inadvertently deleted my itinerary and they blamed it on Expedia. It literally took 6 hours on the phone between the two companies to correct and reissue.
It‚Äôs been a circus act since minute one. If you decide to fly with SWISS, I wish you well.

title: Just a Flight
review_text: The airport  was a expected by I found the food cheaper at the airport than in Zurich itself. The staff were fine, we boarded and flew without any real dramas. My only complaint was I was in the back row I did not get my food allocation. They had run out. Luckily I had eaten a bit extra at the Airport so although by the time I got dinner that night I had been some 12 hours without a bite to eat.

title: Compensation of delayed flight
review_text:
On 19th december 2018 We flew  from Delhi to Amsterdam via Zurich with Swiss Air. In Delhi our flt was delayed due to some technical reason as told by the crew. Because of the delay we missed our connection to Amsterdam from Zurich. We were rebooked on the next flight. We arrived in Amsterdam at 1440 hrs instead of 0910 hrs.  Our delay was more than 5 hrs. As per the regulation number  261/2004 we are entitle for the compensation, so we submitted our request. Surprised en  sorry to say  that the Customer Feedback Services of  Swiss Air says that the delay in Delhi was  due to external operational reasons to the airline and these circumstances are considered extraordinary. Which is completely not correct. As per the regulation 261/2004 the extraordinary circumstances are :  bad weather conditions, air traffic control strikes and acts of terrorism. There were  no such things happened that time. All the other flights were left in time from Delhi. 
This kind of response was never expected from such a reputated airlines. How can the airline make such excuses on the other hands they guarantee for complete satisfaction for the customer. I don‚Äôt think we will fly again with Swiss Air.

title: Horrible experience
review_text: I just want to say that my flight experience with you guys was horrible. First, when we got to the airport we explained that a family emergency occurred and that two of the passengers were going to be flying at a later date. We ask if we could take the coming back flight and they said it was ok. Next, the airplane we took to go to Paris, had no air conditioning and it was very uncomfortable situation to be in for 8 hours. Then, when we got to the airport in Paris, they let me know that my pregnant wife and mother's ticket was cancelled without any notice. I never received any emails or call to inform me about the changes made. You guys wanted to charge me 4500 more dollars to buy tickets to a plane that we already purchased. I had to buy ticket from another airline and miss the opportunity to spend New year's together as a family. I couldn't buy any more tickets because we didn't have sufficient money and we were traveling with our 5 year old son. My wife and mother in law had to take a connecting flight to Turkey and stay in a hotel in the airport to spend New year's to then be able to flight to Miami. Also I live 3 hours away from Miami and we had to make an extra trip to picked them up. On the second flight we were all worried and couldn't feel comfortable with having our family members traveling to another country and missing the opportunity to spend New Year's together as a family. Overall our flight experience was one of the worst I ever had and I hope you guys can make this right.

title: What a great carrier!
review_text: Everything was basically perfect -- comfortable seat, great food, and wonderful service. And ZRH is an efficient/easy connection hub...looking forward to flying Swiss more often.

title: Nice Flight, Friendly Staff
review_text: I flew with Swiss air during my holiday to Switzerland. The experience was nice and the staff very kind and friendly. However, the airline should increase its baggage limit as we were only allowed 23kgs free check-in.

title: Never book with Flight Hub
review_text:
I booked my ticket with Flight Hub. I was sold an economy ticket on their web page. The site advised to check for baggage allowance. I checked and an economy class ticket included one 23 kilo bag per passenger. When I arrived at the airport I was told that I had booked an econo-lite ticket and baggage was not included so my wife and I each had to pay $60. for our bags and were charged another $60. each for our return flight. 
I think that they are dispicable for misleading customers and will never book with them again. I feel that Swiss Air should disassociate themselves with Flight Hub as they are misleading their customers.

title: Countless flights, >200k miles, consistently superior service
review_text:
As a US expat in Zurich, Swiss Airlines was my go to.  Whether it was short hops in Europe with the family in economy, or many long hauls to Asia or the US in business class, I always found the airline service to be great.  I was rarely disappointed in the non-stop flight options to many cities

No airline is without delays or challenges, but it is about consistency and how the service makes up for those issues.  The little things were great.  Whether it is the Swiss themed menu options, the toys/puzzles for the kids, and of course the Swiss chocolate before landing.

title: Unlimited drinks :)
review_text: The aircraft was small, however service was good only flew with hand luggage, Early morning flight, croissants and unlimited drinks and before landing a swiss chocolate.

title: Fine. Watch the Z√ºrich transfer
review_text: Swiss was a nice and functional airline. Good service and food (cold plates given our time of day). While the Zurich airport gets good reviews on transfer times that was not my experience. Long walks and walking runways that did not work. The business class lounge was so full that we struggled to find a seat. Perhaps we hit at peak time. Food and beverage good but the atmosphere was not calm.

title: On time
review_text: TripAdvisor insists that we review flights, but there is very little to say about them, unless things really go wrong. This was an uneventful flight. On time, like we like them. Of course, economy food could have been better than the pretty boring ham or cheese sandwiches.

title: Swiss precision, I don‚Äôt think so!
review_text: Delayed more than 1 hour. Lazy staff and little onboard service. Not worth repeating. Swiss really need to upgrade their service.

title: Good nights‚Äôs sleep
review_text: The business cabin has flat beds, which is good because the entertainment is seriously lacking. Very limited options and a poor selection. Way behind the competition. Food and service is excellent.

title: no compensation for major flight delays and problems
review_text:
Last year I flew with Swiss from Zurich to New York in March and in August. I have never written a review of an airline before, but I was so disappointed with the lack of compensation from the airline that I am now motivated to write something.

In March, the flight had an initial delay of about 4 hours. After taking off, there was a warning message related to one of the engines, so we were not allowed to fly over the Atlantic Ocean. In order to burn the fuel before re-landing in Z√ºrich, we flew in circles for 5.5 hours. This was extremely uncomfortable because the pilot would accelerate the plane and then slow down and then accelerate again, in order to burn the fuel faster. All of the passengers were very uncomfortable. After sleeping for a couple of hours in Z√ºrich, I was able to take a different Swiss flight. I arrived in New York the next day about 18 hours later than my originally scheduled landing. This flight even made the news. TripAdvisor doesn't let me post a link, but one article in the NZZ is "Swiss-Maschine nach f√ºnfst√ºndiger Zwangspause in der Luft gelandet."

In August, I waited for 5 hours for my flight to take off while Swiss investigated a mysterious green fluid in the cargo. It turned out to be a "cosmetic item" that was not dangerous at all.

Swiss has offered no compensation for either of these trips, despite the major inconveniences just 5 months apart. I will certainly look to another airline next time I travel.

title: Expedia - scammers and scammers
review_text:
Good Day
Never fly Swiss Air or Work with Expedia.com.I enjoyed a great vacation to morocco only to end it completely stressed out. I booked my flights via Expedia, an online travel agent via the Sky Scanner website. My return flights were Marrakesh ‚Äì Geneva ‚Äì Zurich ‚Äì Beijing. As I was going to be in transit and had no intention to leave the transit area, I saw no problem. On arriving at the airport to depart, I was told I could not take this flight. The explanation was that there is a rule stating that one cannot transit in two Schengen areas for more than 24 hours. I was less than 24 hours but it was on two different days. This was unknown to me and there was nothing told to me via Expedia or Swiss air. I had been in contact directly to Swiss air with regards to other aspects of my flight, so there should have noticed this before. The staff at the airport gave me this reason and said they can‚Äôt help and were quiet rude about it. Directly telling me its my own issue and walked away. I asked for help at the Swiss air office to call the customer care and they refused to allow me to do so, again saying it‚Äôs my own issue as I did not buy it from them directly. As I see it, they set the route and times of the flight and have an obligation towards customers even if I did not buy it directly from them. On contacting Espedia, the agent said they can‚Äôt assist as they get the tickets directly from Swiss air and they set the routes. At the end of that day, I was forced to buy a new ticket from Swiss air at 700 USD.  Both Airline and travel agent denied accountability for not having any disclaimers and say I need to know my travel laws. To me, this is an easy way to get out. 
The next day, after spending close to 100 USD on calls and sleeping on a friends couch, I went back to depart. I was the first to arrive and first in line but the last to board. Once again the rude Swiss staff had issues about my flight. This time I bought the ticket directly from them and only had 2 hour stop in Munich. They had no idea if I could take that flight now and made me wait 2 hours. What was worse was that management was called down to help me but never did. The lady issuing tickets had to go up after half an hour of waiting to state my case. After another 45 minutes of no one telling me anything, I decided to go up and speak to management who brushed me of stating I should have patience. At 12.28, 2 minutes before boarding can close, they said: ok go in. This was without even an apology. On the flight they mixed my meals and all together was the worst flight and experience ever. 
Swiss air, besides being incompetent in knowing their laws and getting meals right were the rudest bunch of staff I came across. Its easy for big airline companies to push customers as they see fit, especially when you are desperate.
