title: seat reservation useless?
review_text: Seems to be, that booking seats with Swiss is useless. 2 flight, both flight I reserver 9th row, not sun side seat. 1st flight, Swiss change me to 9th row sunny side. the second flight they change me from row 9 to row 36, Thx Swiss team, great job!

title: Great way to fly
review_text: Did Bangkok - Zurich - Bangkok over the Christmas week.  The flight out was excellent, staff all charming and all was smooth running.  All that was expected was delivered and I would certainly fly Swiss again.  On the way back all was the same as on the way out so no problem there.  Alas the flight was packed and the 30 something couple sitting beside me could not keep their hands off one another, this was tedious!  Clearly not fault of the airline just rather dull as it turned a nice flight into a chore.

title: Outdated and overpriced
review_text:
I travel between Tokyo and Switzerland a couple of time of year, and overtime the quality of Swiss has just been declining and is just bad. Their fleet for the LX 160 and 161 is really old. No charger for your phone at your seat which is really annoying given the fact that the TV almost never work on their flight, so be ready to spend 13h bored if you didn‚Äôt plan a book or a good sleeping pill. It happened to be twice that my TV wasn‚Äôt working on their flight, no offer to change my seat and all I got was a 50.- Chf voucher for a flight that cost me more than 1000chf. The in flight entertainment is also quite poor and doesn‚Äôt change frequently. 

The food is bad, although I never expect a gourmet meal in a flight, other companies like Air France do a much better job. We were given a disgusting pasta cheese and apple sort of dish for breakfast. 

The service is also not good, with some honestly very rude young Swiss German hostesses who talk badly to the other Japanese hostesses. They just are very entitled and ‚Äúknow it all‚Äù .Would not recommend this flight to anyone

title: Good short flight, check in opens very early....
review_text:
We were very early at check in about 3.5hrs before our flight and to our delight we could check in our bags and roam free in the airport. This was a short flight with a light refreshment, not entirely needed in my opinion. It was delayed by bad weather, but though no fault of the airline. The whole airport was in chaos as passengers rearranged flights. The staff were wonderful, friendly and helpful.
We took a second flight Geneva to Vienna and this was on time and another great short flight.

title: Cramped seats, feels like low cost airline
review_text: The staff were lovely, the food decent,but I could not believe how cramped the seating was for a 10 hour flight, I felt like it should have been for a one hour flight. They have obviously added several rows to the original aircraft. Lufthansa, Air France, etc are a world away from this, sorry but it's not worth feeling like a sardine for 10 hours when other competitors do so much better.

title: My first time on Swiss Airline
review_text: we loved it. extra legroom. the food was good. would love to fly with them in the future. the cabin crew are friendly.

title: Good Airline
review_text: It was a short and smooth flight, enough leg room and comfortable seats.Overall it was good swiss service. The food option wasn't the best, but it wasn't so important for a short haul flight.

title: Excellent hospitality from airport to destination.
review_text: I am fortunate to have only flown in Business or First Class with Swiss for at least for 20 years. I cannot speak too highly of the airline's lounges, especially in Zurich, their hospitality on board and their cabin crew. Another bonus is the single window seating in long-haul business class for that extra privacy. Other nice touches are seasonal treats. Last Easter, the airline gave wonderful gift packs of coloured boiled eggs with a delicious spicy salt to take away. In summary, a subdued but outstanding service and efficiency - much like the rest of Switzerland.

title: Made to sit in vomit for over an hour
review_text: This is a terrible airline with terrible service. My next stop is the BBB. I was on the flight from Zurich to Los Angeles on December 17. The flight was 2 hours late leaving Zurich and we experienced 2hours of extreme turbulence flying over the UK, right after food service. I experienced severe motion sickness and used 2 air sick bags. When I requested another one I was, basically, ignored and left with vomit all over my face. I asked for some sprite to calm my stomach and the extremely rude flight attendant told me I am having coke instead. I contacted customer service by phone and email, nothing was resolved. I posted on FB and Instagram with no resolve. They are the absolute worst airline I have ever flown and I will not fly them again. Because we lived in Asia, we never had to fly them. Now that we are in Switzerland, I would rather fly a US carrier rather than Swiss. I hate US airlines, but, I hate Swiss air more. Good luck if you fly them! They don‚Äôt care about their customers.

title: Good Flight
review_text: Flight was on time. Flight attendant was great and very nice to us. The seats was a bit small since its exactly like economy seating but the middle seat is empty. Maybe we are so used to Asian and Middle East Airlines where when you travel in business class its really huge.

title: Comfortable flight
review_text:
We flew from Zurich to Paris C.D.G with Swiss International Airlines in Business Class.

We were attended promptly upon arrived at the check-in desk and less than five minutes we had received our boarding pass.

I think Zurich Airport is one of the best airports in Europe to kill your time while waiting for your flight. There are lots of shops to see and the airport itself is beautifully designed.

We also had the opportunity to enjoy the LX lounge. The foods and beverages are located on the second floor.

Once boarded the aircraft we were greeted by friendly cabin crew and seated on the last row of the business class section. 
The seat arrangements are 3x3 (same like Economy Class) with the middle seats kept empty in order to add more space for the two passengers seating together.

We pushed back on time and once airborne light meals and drinks were served. 

The flight time from Zurich to Paris was only 55 minutes.

Prior to land at the C.D.G Airport, all business class passengers were given free Swiss Chocolate, whereas the Economy Class passengers were allowed to take by themselves when leaving the aircraft.

To sum it up, we really had a comfortable flight with Swiss International Airlines.

title: Flight to Dubai
review_text: Being a member of Swiss/Star alliance since 1979 I am always trying to fly with Swiss or members from star alliance program. Although the competition is getting hard and crual some time Swiss is trying to keep its legendary service and hospitality on board. Over the years these services have evolved following the trend attacked on cost but overall Swiss is standing up. Planes are old and seat confort could be improved with new design and space. But reliability and punctuality are their strength and hope they will continue to keep it up and maintain their core values despite head winds

title: Overrated
review_text:
Flew Swiss from HK to Z√ºrich - Oslo was cancelled - NO reason.
Swiss commercial on infotainment for 10-12 minutes before take-off. Total hostage situation. 
Service medium at best.
Flight Z√ºrich - Oslo cancelled without reason. 
Total disaster and unrealiable airline - NOT recomended.

title: weren't sure with this airline due to never hearing about them
review_text:
Our travel agent had got us to Europe and back using four different airlines and we hadn't flown on three of them before, so three quarters of this trip was going to be a mystery.
Swiss International was a dream airline with superb crew and service, we had no issues and the on board meals were great, we didn't know what to expect, on board entertainment was also great and plenty of decent movies to watch for an overnight 12hr flight. Clean amenities and plenty of service through the night, we also had a Swiss connecting flight in Zurich that was seem less, will definitely travel Swiss again for our family visits.

title: Swiss Air flight
review_text: Super friendly people.  Food pretty decent.  Surprisingly, however, NO air vents for parked times loading and seat allotment SO SMALL!  Flight attendant had to tell passengers in front to sit directly up while we ate.  Their seat backs would literally be in your face.  Unfortunate because staff very friendly... Just an uncomfortable flight for international.

title: Efficient and Good Service
review_text: First time on Swiss Air, a 13hours flight and we were comfortable on the last two rows (of course we paid extra for the couple seat) but that was a good decision made as we slept 7 hours on board this flight! Pre ordered Halal meals and was served as requested. Crew were kind and polite. Flights from our last holiday was also frm Zurich to Berlin and from Budapest - Zurich - Singapore. All went well. Good flight landing too.

title: Don‚Äôt book Swiss Air in the future! Warning...
review_text:
Swiss Air lost my only luggage at a first class flight from London via Z√ºrich to New York in October.
In London they let us sit in plane for more than 2 hours before take of - technical problems with the baggage computer system.
I had no hand luggage and was stranded in cold New York with only light sports wear on, that is very comfortable for traveling.
The customer service desk told me I can shop what I want because luggage will arrive in 2 days.
I did it trust them and wrote an email to Swiss customer service and asked for the amount I can get clothes, underwear etc. - no response at all. Finally I went to a discounter and bought the minimum necessities items, all on sale and for a total of $1500,-. 
When I sent the original receipts in, they offered me less than $400,-. I asked to get in touch with the supervisor and received an email with less then $800,- confirmed.
The Swiss employees wrote me, they will cut amount in half because I can wear goods more than one time!!!!!!!
I‚Äôm notinterested in this items at all and will with pleasure return them to Swiss when they cover the full amount of my expenses. 
I have not heard back from them since, nearly a month ago!

I have not only paid a premium price for a first class ticket, I also had to suffer a financial loss of $700,- cause by Swiss for not delivering my luggage and am stuck with cheap clothes I will never use again.

Swiss Air performed a systematic rip-off that has a patern with its customers.
I highly recommend to fly and financials support other airlines  -  stay away from Swiss! 
Not worth the money!
Staff is disrespectful and company tries to financially benefit from customers miseries. 
Don‚Äôt fly Swiss!

title: good service and lovely staff
review_text:
We flew from London to HKG with a stop at Zurich. We only had less than an hour to connect so it was a bit rush - and given the extra customs check it wasn't ideal. The long haul flight from Zurich to HKG (and back) was not comfortable as the seats are very small and space is limited. The level of arm rest is too low for anyone to feel comfortable. 

However, when we were back from Zurich to London City, the flight was much more comfortable as the seats arrangement are 2+ 3. This is much better than those 3+3 in SAS or any other airlines with the same cabin. Well done Swiss Air.

In all flights, the crew members are very friendly.

My rating below is taken from the average of the two flights.

title: Check in service
review_text:
We were being served at the bag drop counter when halfway through the process of weighing and putting labels on our checked luggage the lady at our counter was interrupted by a colleague who was having trouble checking in some other passengers. The whole family then came over to our counter and had a full on discussion for almost 10 minutes with the lady who was completing the bag drop for us. We asked to move to another empty counter but we were unable to as the lady had already started the bag drop and had our documents.

I would have appreciated it if the lady completing our check in advised her colleague that she was in the middle of our bag drop and would be able to help her and the other family once ours was completed.

title: well fed
review_text:
my wife and i thought that this flight was long enough (10hrs) that meals including snacks were amazingly tasty and had more food than what we expected. we first had refreshments post take off, then hot meal and another round of refreshments. several hours before landing, there was another round of small snack with refreshments. water for rehydration was serve quite frequently and on demand  
hats off to all the flight crew that made this flight a gratifying experience that we are planning to board its subsidiary airline-edelweiss air from san diego to zurich for a visit to switzerland next year

title: Never again
review_text: Never again. Flights were delayed. Nothing was communicated to the passengers. Half of us missed our connections. My luggage was lost for 3 days and every time the hotel called the airline, we were told the bags were "on their way". For three days. They must have walked the bags over from Zurich. Food was substandard. I expected more form an airline with such a great reputation. The flight back was so stressful that I almost forgot how great Budapest was.

title: Comfort with a View!
review_text: When we boarded this short flight, we had hopes of viewing the Alps. The holding pattern for landing provided that opportunity and more. Our pilot took us south toward Italy, then northeasterly toward Germany, guiding our views port and starboard. Take off and landing felt smooth as the acceleration and stopping at a traffic light. What an airline!

title: Great experience!
review_text: The Swiss air lounge was nice and accommodating with a great overall view of the jets, the airport and the mountains. The flight crew and comfort of our jet were great.

title: Via Z√ºrich to Russia
review_text: Amsterdam to St. Petersburg, via Z√ºrich. Only 1hour in Z√ºrich a smooth transfer. It was the cheapest option at the time form booking, but probably the best. The foot was also really good. P.s. it is my iPad, not the in flyd entertainment:)

title: Great service and good comfort
review_text: Can recommend Swiss Air for all travels. Always a nice exprience with great service and superb on-time performance. I have found legroom to be surprisingly good on the routes I've flown and I am 2 m tall. Will fly again!

title: Actually stealing things from you and assuming no responsibility
review_text: They forced me to hand over my hand luggage which included my brand-new computer. That was the last time I saw my computer. They stole it and when I went to the airport lost and found, they said it's not their responsibility and I should contact customer support by email. I emailed them, they said they assume no responsibility and went MIA - they also ripped my hand luggage apart.

title: Fabulous flight
review_text: If you can possibly upgrade to business class, do it! Flight attendants, amenities, space, cleanliness were all among the best I've experienced. And the food was excellent! My flight was on a 777 with an interesting configuration along the windows. Alternating rows with either 1 or 2 seats and I was lucky enough to get a "1" seat window which gave the same amount of space as the "2" seats window. Storage galore, great privacy.

title: No flight - CXLD  - What more can go wrong ????
review_text: An hour and 15 min prior to departure my night flight with my beloved airline just canceled - as simple as that.  The formal reason without any other explanation - Technical problems.  My voyage back home took me to a connection flight with a different airlines, causing me a delay in arrival for more then 15 hours. Not mentioning a lost of a work day, a cancelation of prearranged appointments.. The Transfer Desk at Zurich airport did the best and outmost they could to arrange a hotel for the night and to book to each and every passenger a flight to the destination ‚Äì that was a great positive thing in the whole story.  - Well, I guess it does happen even to the best, but I still expect from one of the leading airlines in the market to have a customer service to resolve the issue of compensation according to the EU cancellation law of flights, but sadly there is to respond, feedback - just nothing.... - sad, I expected more.

title: Exceptional attention to detail
review_text: In May, our return flight from Rome to Zurich was dalayed one hour making our transfer in Zurich impossible to connect to Boston.  Flight arrendants allerted crews in Zurich who picked us up on the jetway, drove us across the tarmac to our Boston bound flight in time for takeoff.  That type of attention is very rare these days and kudos to Swiss.  Additionally, their lounges are wonderful and inflight service is top notch.

title: TOO SMALL
review_text:
this flight is too small and not convenience, toilet not clean. and less entertainment if you compare to another airlines. 
and the staff in counter check in Zurich (16 Dec LX 176 ZRH-SIN) refuse to help me to baggage check in through to CGK with SQ. she said "it will take long"
so my group must take luggage at changi airport and check in again to Jakarta.
the good thing is only nice cabin crew inside plane.

title: BP
review_text:
London to Geneva to Chamonix 
Efficient, on time, great service, helpful. Will recommend and definitely fly again with same airline.

title: Swiss efficiency sorted out a cancelled flight in under 1 hour.
review_text: In gate area, 20 mins to flight due to take off, announced flight cancelled. Very cross but hey, safety first. Told to follow a ground staff, collected bags as if we had just landed and directed to Swiss desk. By the time we got there we had been allotted new flights, a breakfast chitty and tickets that would have us arrive in T>A> 3 hours later than expected. Admittedly, we had to phone our hostess for the evening dinner party and cancel . Had we been in a wheelchair or had young children or a business meeting that would not have been so easy. For us, it was a neat solving of the problem

title: Malaysia to germany
review_text: service was ok.food ok. was a bit peeved cos my coca cola came from a large bottle poured to me as compared to having the tins given to me directly like emirates. i guess to save  cost.

title: Good airline, except for seats.
review_text: This was a nice flight. The food was good.I ordered a special meal and it was comparable in size to what others received. In the beginning of the flight kids were given a small toy or coloring book. My kids just received a magazine although it was a long flight. However in a shorter flight they received three toys. I noticed on some flights they do not give toys to kids unless asked. The entertainment was okay, although it would be nice to have a choice of a news channel. I had problems with the reclining seat, I could not get up to use the restroom.

title: Amazing staff, and food, pure Swiss quality
review_text: The whole trip was exceptional even in economy class. Plane was on time and staff was very accommodating & friendly. One of the high points were the food they served. Everything was very tasty & delicious. There was Appenzeller cheese and Movenpick Ice-cream. They even offered people in the economy class warm wet towels at the end of the flight! Best flight experience I've had, definitely recommend

title: Top from start to landing
review_text: Very friendly and worming cabin crew. Clean and tidy plane. Entertainment very good, the only thing i missed was free wifi. Bussiness lounge in Zurich is super!

title: A major cock up
review_text:
Having booked my flight well in advance, this is the second time now that I have found my flight delayed on the tarmac due to congested airspace. However, this is first time that the aircraft actually started, taxied around the airport before returning to its starting place.
We were then told that Swiss had decided to cancel the flight since it would not be able to make it back out of London City inside of the airport curfew.
We were then unloaded and left to work out for ourselves what we had to do. Absolutely no one was there to tell where to go nor what to do. Thus, my wife, son and myself made our way to baggage reclaim and then to an information desk which told us where we needed to go. My sister-in-law on the other hand went a transfer desk where she had to wait some 2 hours before being booked on what turned out to be a nonexistent flight which she was then later transferred to a scheduled flight. This meant she only just made it for a musical we‚Äôd booked.
We were all booked into separate hotels.
What really pissed us off was the total lack of information and attention from Swiss. For me I shall be reviewing my future bookings with them.

title: Absolutely nightmare
review_text:
I made a booking via Expedia 10 months in advance choosing Swiss for past experience and for offering the a330 aircraft as a carrier. 
While booking I made a mistake and chose Am instead Pm , price was similar, and the line in Expedia were close . 
Upon check in, I discovered the mistake and contacted Swiss customer service, 
They told me to talk to Expedia, and I did 
Expedia said that Swiss don‚Äôt allow the change unless I will pay 600$ for new ticket. 
I asked if one of their business partners can offer something (knowing that they work with Austrian and Lufthansa) the option was on the table yet Swiss refuse. 
I depart from Tel Aviv to Zurich on the 13.12.18 , I‚Äôm an a321 , (not a330) so no entertainment system though it was promised. 
Connection flight was in a bombardier aircraft, that was so small so when other passenger opened the storage above it hit my head. No assistance from swiss staff though I was clearly injured! 

According to Expedia guidelines I contacted Swiss again after I arrived Berlin , and was told there is no problem and the flight will change to 18:45 Pm with a ticketing price of 70‚Ç¨ . I agreed and approved the offer. And hour later I saw the new ticket on the website. 
24 hours before the flight I tried to check in on line and discovered my ticket is canceled, 
Immediately contacted Swiss again I was told that the payment was not approved (why no one told me? Nor sent me an email? Only god knows) 
The hotel staff spoke with Swiss representatives and they promised to switch to evening flight free of charge as an apology. 
At 14:30 I tried to check in again and no ticket was found. 
Contacted Swiss again and this time they told me I was no show for morning flight so the change was not approved! Asking me to pay 111‚Ç¨ fine which I agreed to pay since I was on a situation that I can‚Äôt argue ! 
Gave them another credit card and a local number for information in case of a problem. 
Arrived the air port, no ticket was found, contacted the ground staff that took care of it and charged me with no problems and guess what again Swiss didn‚Äôt inform me about the payment problem! 

Regardless, 
Flight was delayed and I was stuck in Zurich for the night . I can understand that but not the rest of if . 

Very disappointed!

title: First time with Swiss International air lines
review_text: It was round trip from Boston to Kiev, Ukraine with one stop at Zurich. We didn't have any problem  when flying to Kiev. Food was good. But return flight was terrible. We flight from Kiev to Zurich had transfer there, but delayed flight for 4 hours in Zurich. We were with two small kids. They can't wait to long, they want to eat. We were given a voucher for food, but only coffee and chocolate could be taken for it. We were really dissatisfied and frustrated.

title: Great Flight with Swiss Air
review_text: We flew from Shanghai to China and this was my first time flying Swiss Air.   The food was great and the flight attendants were great and very friendly.   I love the way they set up snacks in the back of the plane so you can get up and walk around and grab a small bite to eat.

title: Efficient but very average
review_text:
This actually the 1st time ever I flew business class with economy seating arrangement. The seats were exactly the same as economy, 3 seats in a row. The only differences were seats only 2 leaving the middle row empty, and served food.
Why not just install 2 seats in a row like all other airlines? 
I understand that my flight was short flight between nearby countries. But still it‚Äôs not business class like. 
The service was also average. Efficient and helpful, but not felt friendly. Considering the modest price, one could claim it‚Äôs just right. But still it‚Äôs better to call it Premium Economy.

title: Poor service, delayed and no compensation or help from staff
review_text: Swiss air has been completely useless, first of all the flight was delayed by 45 minutes, then they found a suspicious device on the plane so we had to disembark after an hour and a half waiting on ground level on the plane. When we finally reboarded the plane and arrived 3 hours late to Geneva our bags were then delayed and there was no apology from any of the staff. When we went to seek advice at the helpdesk at Geneva airport they simply said it was not their responsibility that we had now missed our connection and are forced to get a hotel in Geneva tonight and will miss ski lessons tomorrow. The help centre have had me on hold for 42 minutes with no response I will not be flying Swiss air again and I‚Äôm deeply let down with the unhelpful service and rude staff.

title: The Best airline
review_text: The Best economy Class I have ever tried. Excellent food, premium swiss wine, cheese and chocolate, kind staff and comfortable Seats.

title: Courteous Service
review_text: I had a good experience of friendly service. The courtesy and patience is good. The team on board displayed good co-ordination.

title: Better than expected
review_text:
I read some of the reviews and was a bit weary... but in the end it turned out to be a reasonably good flight. The aircraft was new and the seats are good, but as always with any ariline, not enough leg room. The pitch of the seat is better than average, but since the rows are so close together it becomes a nuisance when the passenger in front of you leans all the way back. Impossible to continue watching a movie and when you are eating you bump your head into back of the seat in front of you. A real challenge! They really should do something about this. Having said this, the food and service are better than what you can expect on a flight with any airline. So all in all we were pleased. One thing however that almost ruined our holiday had to do with a wild strike of Swissport luggage handlers in Brussels. They refused to unload the incoming aircraft... As a result we arrived in Z√ºrich with 20 min. to spare. We had to run like crazy to get off the plane, go through border security, take a train, up the stairs to reach gate 59, literally at the other end of the airport. With 5 min. to spare we boarded our flight to Dubai, being the last passengers to board. On the bright side, our luggage made the flight. I don't know how they did this, but everything arrived on time in Dubai. Maybe they should have done this for the passengers as well... Both my wife and daughter have health issues and I can assure you getting there was an ordeal. We were exhausted.

On our return flight I complained to the senior officer (a Woman) at the check-in desk explaing what had happened and kindly sollicitating for a free upgrade. She agreed that were were fully entitled to an upgrade, but that she didn't have the authority to offer this to us. Apparently there is a lot of red tape to go through and you have to do this well in advance (read you will never get an answer)... The senior Employee however offered us two middel row seat (2 x 4) so that we would have a little more space for the 4 of us. This was highly appreciated (and my sincere thanks to this wonderful woman) but an upgrade would have been more appropriate. The idea was that my wife, daughter and grandchild could sleep occupying 3 seats... Sadly this turned out to be impssible since the armrests dont fold all the way back and up. What they have done is make the backrest wider from the middle to the top, to create the impression (illusion) that the seats are really wide (which is not the case). Nice trick but if you are on a flight which is not fully booked as was the case for us, forget about lying down... Anyway, all in all still a good review for this airline. We had worse, even in a A380! 

Before you book check out the legroom and pitch and very important how many seats there are across.  In a triple7 from boeing i.e. which was designed to have 9 seats across, many cramp in one extra seat, also Swiss, to carry more passengers. High time that airlines start to realize that some passengers like me, 1,85 m tall don't fit in these chairs. The synonym 'cattle class' was not invented by me, but accuratly describes what flying long haul has become these days. So airlines... do something about it and start listening to your customers. Not all of us can afford to pay for business and first. (:-)

title: Just in time
review_text:
Besides the fact of having a safe feeling to fly with Swiss International Air 
lines, the value for money is very reasonable. The crew on board is very nice. The food is acceptable. Whatever you ask for will be answered with a big smile.
Thanks for your great service.

title: Best cabin crew, but so uncomfortable seating.
review_text: I must say the cabin crew has been one of the best we have come across. But the actual seating must be the most uncomfortable experience yet. The plane is dated, with hard to move arms and hard to use in flight entertainment, Along with no space to go and stretch your legs, I dont think i will be using Swiss air again.

title: IMPROVED SERVICE from New Delhi to Zurich; Long haul flight felt short
review_text:
This review starts with the ground crew in New Delhi who were not only efficient but friendly and sympathetic to the passengers waiting for very early morning flights. This was in stark contrast with the ground crew in Zurich International Airport.

The air crew were just as great if not better. They were well synchronised in providing in-flight service, beverage and meal services were in puncto! No disturbances during down time.The crew was a mixture of young and more experienced and they were ALL courteous, friendly and helpful. A good crew makes a difference in long haul flights. In flight entertainment was sufficient. Seats and air conditioning were sufficiently comfortable. This long haul flight felt short.

They have won my heart back. I will continue to fly with Swiss Air again and I hope they continue this good service with a smile and EXTEND this good service and attitude at Zurich Airport...

P.S. This flight was delayed but my review is the same.

title: Amazing
review_text: It was a very good flight. Crew was very nice. And I really like the fact that they always give something, even some small chocolate. It make really a huge difference.

title: Flights in Time
review_text:
Since several years used Swiss Air again. Several positive and negative things.
1. Positive: Flights in time and luggage received. 
2. Negative:
Premium Eco nearly empty but they did not offer upgrades.
11 hours flight, they gave a very light breakfast very fast than 7 hours no food till they offered lunch. Actually first time i was hungry in a long flight.
3. Flight entertainment video selection not good and space of seats little.
All in all compared to russian airlines (where i fly premium eco for same price) much worse. Will not use anymore now the next 15 years. Flight back to Beijing with Austrian, hope better

title: Cramped seats in Row 5
review_text: The A350 had quite the variety of sizes of seats in business, which was quite unusual. My wife and I were in 5a and 5b, probably the worst available.  We only had one small armrest area and felt a bit tight.  The middle aisle of seats were a better choice as there were two wide seats with wide armrests.  Or if traveling solo, choose 4a, as it is a single seat with two wide arm rests.  Food was just OK, nothing special for business.  The entertainment system was mediocre, and unavailable until you have taken off and reached altitude, whereas most of the on-demand systems nowadays are available as soon as you board in business.  Pillows are tiny, almost nonexistent, too.  Row 5 is also right in front of the toilet, so you hear it all the time.  The seat did lay nearly flat, which was good, even though there is very little room to maneuver.

title: Fight back! ECC helps you!
review_text:
Having problems with swissair (or another airline) you should contact the ECC (European Consumer Centre)!

Concerning the non respect of your passenger rights... (for example for delayed/cancelled/rerouted flights) you can contact ECC and get help for free!!

"Swiss" is the word that doesn't fit with this airline! Normally "Swiss" stands for ponctual and clean.... but not here :((

title: Good services - nice experience
review_text: It was quite a nice flight - nice planes, the cabin crew very attentive; even I have been on Business Class, still the experience was good. Maybe the food  was a little too precious, but OK this is all the time depending on each of the passengers. The chocolate was exquisite. I had all the information I need, where the plane will land, at what gate, what were the gates for the transit flights, how much time to arrive between the gates,etc. Very precise and everything you would need to arrive safe. The airport in Zurich quite complicated, we had to walk a lot - poor signs, at one moment I had the impression I am coming back to the plane. When I was coming back I had the experience of the high prices in the airport - probably the first time I had bought only chocolate ( of course) ; the sales people are like robots...quite odd...

title: Zurich to Boston
review_text:
Routing:  LX332 London to Zurich then LX52 A340 aircraft Zurich to Boston U.S.A..  

I am comparing my experience to British Airways and Virgin Atlantic

SWISS onboard is excellent and happily, as of December 2018, it is the traditional legacy carrier service for trans-atlantic long-haul flights: drinks service after take-off, main meal service, snack service consisting of pizza and ice cream, another drinks service.  All inclusive including baggage in the ticketing price.

Main meal was well-prepared turkey with red cabbage and potatoes, all very good and tasty.  There was a salmon and potatoe salad starter and small parfait desert thingy.   There were three (3) trolley drink services and I made one trip to the galley for an additional glass of wine. 

Cabin seating and space is average but nice seating material throughout the cabin making for a smart appearance.

More than adequate number of attentive cabin attendants to take care of a full flight.  Attendants were accommodating and provided the expected legacy-type of onboard service. 

Only complaint was the inflight movie system stops mid-way through the movies and you have to restart the system which will reset to the point in the movie that it stopped.  Problematic but not terrible. 

Why SWISS?  I live in London and use BA and Virgin for trips to the eastern U.S..  Economy fares in December were running +¬£800 rountrip excluding baggage . . another ¬£60 each way per bag and then the onboard ridiculous costs for drinks, food, etc..   Swiss was running a special for ¬£376 (I waited at first and then finally paid ¬£431) all inclusive if you flew via Zurich.   

Highly recommend SWISS for trans-atlantic journeys.

title: Xenophobic and Unprofessional
review_text:
This was a two-fold mess. Firstly, my luggage was lost in transit and I lost a full day in a foreign country to retrieve the luggage from them. There was no offers to deliver my luggage and I lost a day of travel and I had to pay out of pocket to get back to the airport. This is a risk with checking-in luggage but the lack of professionalism around it was really frustrating.

The flight itself was less than average. There were two flight attendants that were pointedly condescending and rude to my mother. She is visibly muslim and wears a headscarf.They were completely discourteous towards her and embarrassed her at one point over water‚Äîshe had only ONE water bottle and each occupant was allowed at LEAST two; she didn't even ask for a second water bottle but they went out of their way to tell her that she wasn't allowed more water. When the stewardess was done making a scene, my mother politely told her that she didn't ask for more water, to which the stewardess was like "But I need you to know you cannot have more, OK?" It was so redundant and unprofessional.

title: Always a great experience
review_text: I been flying with Swiss for quite long time and I have to admit that is the best airline among all the others ones.  Everything during the flight is made with little details that even on a long flight makes a good experience.  The flight attendant crew, the food service, the seat, and so on.

title: Excellent !
review_text: It was a long flight (12 hours), but it was okay. The services during the flight were great and the staff very nice. Maximum satisfaction with Swiss Airlines. I highly recommend!

title: Very comfortable
review_text: It was eight hours long flight. The seats are comfortable, the service is great. The food was delicious and the drink was constantly served. Staff kindly. I recomanded this company for a long flights.

title: 13 hours of hell
review_text:
Usually I fly with another company that has direct flights from NY to TLV. This time, because of the holidays rush I too a Swiss via Zurich flight.
The first flight -from NY to Zurich was in an ancient airbus. The only good thing I can say about this flight is that the food is eatable. Seat were extremely bad and leg space was incredibly small. The touch screen has some internal issues and you have to use the little device inserted under the arms. The push button did not release back the chair and I had to sit straight during the 7 hours flight. I though to myself "Swiss still thinks we are cattle!" little did I know that on the second flight (which was late!) the space for the legs will be even worse and there will be no screens at all! On both flights there was no air condition directed to each person - so you can imagine the stench. Altogether the flights were absolutely terrible. 
  
 There's a lot of competition around and the fact we can use this platform to report this - may help to change things. 
*Dear Swiss*- both planes needs to retire or re-organized. Leg space is crucial - along with air conditioning and media systems upgrade. Since we are in 2019- an electricity plug is highly important as well.

title: Stranded in Zurich
review_text: My fianc√© and I were flying from London  to Johannesburg for Christmas via Zurich. The initial flight was delayed so the 50 of us on the plane with connecting flights missed them. We were directed to three different places before any staff would ‚Äúhelp‚Äù us. All that we were told is that we would not get our luggage, to find and fund a hotel ourselves (at midnight!) and to call a number the next morning to see if we could get on another flight. 48 hours after we were meant to arrive, we will get to Johannesburg with no luggage. What a great Christmas from the least caring airline.

title: Very good
review_text: All good. Brand new Bombardier airplane, clean, good seat, good staff. Nothing to complain about....

title: Top Airline in Europe
review_text:
Top Airline in Service and comfort. Very professional with a touch of Swiss charme
Modern and new aircraft (777-300).

title: Very Attentive, good food, comfortable seat
review_text:
Enjoyed comfortable seats in first row of Economy with the possibility to stretch the legs and rest them on the shelve ahead of us. Had to pay extra, but totally worth it. Also are the first to be served. Only draw-back: monitor is not as good and is stowed in the arm rest.
Interesting to observe: each time the service and food is exceptionally good is when they have a survey afterwards! I would be happy to participate in a survey each time, if I could get superior service! Though must admit, on the return flight, the attendant was very helpful and nice.

title: timely like Swiss clockwork
review_text: Nice shiny Bombardier with 5 seats in a row. Comfortable, clean and less than an hour underway. Uneventful, which is laways good for a flight ...

title: Nothing special!
review_text: Nothing special. Airline crew not very welcoming. Lack lustre service with average, bland  food. Nothing special about this airline.

title: Anniversary Flights
review_text:
A warm welcome on board on the outward and return journey. A smooth flight on both trips. Even in Economy, there was enough leg room and you did not feel squashed.
There was no inflight enterainment, which was not a problem as I had a good book. 
Will use the Airline again when flying to Switzerland.

title: Problematic on-line check-in
review_text: I usually fly 4-5 times a year between TLV-ZRH. Swiss is mostly a reliable and accountable airline. I prefer it vs. other airlines working on the line for its wide bodies and acceptable legroom. However, on my last three flights in a row from ZRH to TLV, in May, July and December 2018, was unable to complete the online check-in at Zurich. 23 hours prior to departure, as advertised by the airline as a major feature, the check-in didn't provide me the expected and promised seat allocation. My 1st two complaints in this regard didn't yield a reasonable answer. In December, have called Swiss service's phone number  and after almost 15 minutes on the line have received a seat. The official mentioned the fact that am blocked for the feature but couldn't provide an explanation. My written complaint wasn't answered yet. Three cases in a row hint at a statistically significant snag. It definitely dents the airlines reputation and unless, the problem resolved, I might go for better fish to fry.

title: Great Airline
review_text:
Once again a delight to fly Swiss Air
My preferred choice from Canada to Europe 
My one complaint was the timing of our arrival in Zurich and outgoing flight to Warsaw
Too tight and we had to hustle to make connection
Our flight Warsaw different airline as we were using points
Love the service ,seats and food on the overseas flights
We think a superior overseas flight to
Air Canada

title: One of the best airlines
review_text:
, 
 I usually fly Star Allinace airlines
Swiss is one of the best
Service is great , the business class seat is full bed
Always on time

title: Flying smiles and a lot of attention
review_text:
I took 2 flights in a row, going from Warsaw to Paris through Zurich with Swiss International Air Lines and on both flights it was the same smiling and joyfull faces from the staff, a lot of attention to simple passengers. Altogether, a high level of professionnalism, not to mention the calm and skills of the pilots.
Not to mention that they use Bombardier planes which are really comfortable
A little Swiss cheese sandwich or croissant in the morning, together with their delicious white wine. And at the the famous Swiss chocolate.
These people live differently so they are different.
Congratulations to them.

title: Service?????
review_text: Swiss airlines, an airline one should expect good service of, is lacking more than one of it's services on this flight. Cabin staff serving a Hot meal, guess, that's not hot!!!! at all, but serviced cold. How can a responsible cabin crew make such a mistake. And for the record, forgetting to serve people with drinks and moreover make their passengers feeling that they are cattle in stead of clients!!!!! This airlines reputation for me down the drain

title: Good experience
review_text:
We travelled from London Heathrow to Zurich, on our way to Colombo, Sri Lanka a few days ago. Although we were delayed by 2 hours, due to bad weather, once on board the flight staff were excellent, apologising for the delay, although clearly not their fault. The seat pitch was not great for me at just over 6ft, but the food and service was not at fault. If there was a criticism, it was that we could have been kept informed of the actual time delay at the airport, instead of staring at a 'delayed' message for nearly 2 hours. However, this is likely to be an issue for Heathrow's staff. Unfortunately, we missed our connecting flight to Colombo, but the ground staff organised a good hotel, transport and food in an efficient manner.

I would definitely recommend Swiss Airlines.

title: Not a high-flying experience
review_text:
While I usually choose SWISS for my flights between Tokyo and Zurich mainly because of the direct connection and the attractive price, the experience in recent years (at least in Economy class) is not as good as what I think it should be for an airline that prides itself on its high quality. A few things that left a bit of a sour taste on my latest flight:
- Second time in a row that I was in a seat where the Entertainment System wasn't working properly (sound only on one side). Replacing the earphones didn't make a difference, so I assume it was the equipment in the seat. It's not much fun to watch a film if you hear only half of the sound!
- Toilet seat seemed to be falling apart. Couldn't lift the seat (i.e. it didn't stay up).
- Whenever I put the table back up, the cup holder came crashing down. Very annoying.
- My seatbelt buckle was dirty. 
- Cabin attendants on SWISS flights always hand out chocolate shortly before landing. I was wondering this time why they didn't. Until I got up from my seat when getting off the plane, and saw the chocolate lying on my seat. I have to assume that they put it there while I was in the bathroom. Not a very intelligent choice, and for me a bill from the dry cleaners, as I was wearing beige slacks and only noticed at my destination that it I couldn't wear them for the rest of my trip because of the dark brown spot the melted chocolate must have left there!

I get the feeling that the maintenance and cleaning of SWISS aeroplanes leave quite a bit to be desired. Or perhaps they should think about investing in new planes...

As for the choice the cabin attendant apparently made with the chocolate, I'm not really sure what to say...

title: Class all the way
review_text: The boarding was good the seat amazing real beds.  Food very good. The staff polite and efficient.   Drinks were a good choice.

title: Poor service
review_text:
Travelled with Swiss Air from Dublin to Zurich and back. For each leg I paid ‚Ç¨10 per person per flight to pick a seat. (‚Ç¨40) On both outward and inward trips I was sent an email informing me that my seat had changed. Why did I pay ‚Ç¨40 to pick a seat for it then to be changed by Swiss Air. 
On the flight back to Dublin the air vent above my head was broken which meant cold air was blowing on me constantly. I asked a member of cabin crew could I move and she said she would be back to me. But never did. For the duration of the flight I wore a hat and had to cover myself with a coat from the draught. 
When I returned home I complained to Swiss Air. They did absolutely nothing.

title: Return flight from Zurich
review_text:
I have flown several times on Swiss and the service has been very good. My only negative comment was that I was blocked on selecting certain seats.
My last flight was to Chicago but not by choice. I prefer Newark but there was no connection. I don‚Äôt care for Chicago changing terminals is the worst.

title: Fell short of high expectations
review_text:
We had very high expectations of SWISS based on friends' experiences. The staff was generally good but they seemed to forget about me and my wife more than a couple times especially after we've requested for something (a cup of water, a fork, etc.). They even failed to wake us during breakfast service so we landed quite hungry. Maybe it was because it was too close to landing time but they weren't able to accommodate our request for breakfast which was very disappointing.

The plane unfortunately was an older model so the hard product also failed to live up to expectations for business class. Bad luck on our part I suppose that we ended up an older plane.

I'm hoping our experience was just a one-off as other friends who've flown business class with SWISS had nothing but high praise for them. Although I will add, SWISS Business Class Lounge in Zurich is absolutely amazing!

title: Flight review
review_text: Fair comfortability for economy seats. May want to check the screens work; a few were not working. The airline hosts and hostesses were warm and helpful

title: One Area the Swiss Do Not Excel
review_text: Not a good experience all the way around. Home coming flight was delayed 3 hrs then cancelled. Totally unresponsive and insensitive customer support in arranging an alternate flight home. Sent to a totally different airport more than 2 1/2 hours away from our home. Total delay more than 16 hours.

title: Swiss Air
review_text:
Great service, all questions answered which made travelling less stressful.

Booking in advance we had a good price for the flights.

The food was nice and fresh.

Staff were polite and professional at all times.

Would definitely fly with them again.

title: Very good at transatlantic flights
review_text: The flight from Israel to swiss was terrible in compare to the second flight, from Swiss to Miami: the stuff was not nice at all, nervous and grumpy. The food was not to eat

title: The Flight Was OK but the Ground Service Was The Worst
review_text: The flight was delayed in Zurich and arrived at LAX with insufficient time to make our connection. No representative of Swiss Air met us on landing to advise us of alternative options. Instead we two elderly people were left stranded with me in my wheelchair. We took matters into our own hands and had the wheelchair pusher take us to the Swiss Air                                                                                                                                                   counter in the main terminal.  We had a very helpful agent who advised that there was no flight to our connection destination of Palm Springs and she presented two options. One was to stay overnight at LAX and fly to Palm Springs the next morning via San Francisco.  The other was to take a cab to Palm Springs.  We opted for the cab and were given information as to how to claim our reimbursement for the cost of the cab.This all happened on September 4th. We filed our claim on September 7th and got a response of receipt. When nothing happened we contacted them again and they did respond. As of a few weeks ago they just ceased responding to my queries as to the status of my claim. There was no mention of any dispute and all documentation had been furnished. Now Swiss Air is just ignoring us.  I have never experienced such a cavalier attitude particularly when traveling business class on a cash paid ticket. I tried contacting their Resolution people and spent an hour filling out their form only to find that there was no "Submit" choice at the end. I have close to 2 million air miles and know what kind of service to expect. Swiss Air will never see me again as long as there are other choices.

title: Swiss Business
review_text:
Swiss Business Class product rates a 3.5, but the staff push it to a 4.  Middle-of-the-road seats/pods, but service was wonderful.  Meals matched the service.
Upgrade the seats on the A330 (I have not been on their B777), and the flight crew pushes it to a 4.5+.
Transiting through Zurich is a breeze, which is a real advantage.

title: Hospitality in the Air
review_text:
This was my first flight with Swiss Air.  The 11 in-flight hours spent with them included gracious service from the crew, tasty foods, drinks and snacks: pizzas; ham and cheese snack sandwiches; Swiss chocolates; ice cream sundaes;  roast chicken with sides of buttered pasta, creamed spinach,rolls and cheese..very delicious.  
I appreciated the warm and attentive hospitality from the crew throughout the flight. I  would fly with them again.

title: What a surprise!
review_text: Well, I thought it was a low cost airlines, but sure it wasn‚Äôt! The food was excellent and during the 10hrs of flight they continued offering us more food, water, refreshmentes etc. Business class has small seats, no where as good as other airlines.  Excellent service throughout my flight.

title: average flight
review_text: I was expecting a better service from Swiss Airlines but I saw that they are very cost oriented. The meal was average, not offering more than minimum variety. Drinks were also average quality. I do not think that this flight was deserving the same price range with other airlines  for this route.

title: direct to st petersburg
review_text: surprised with the efficiency of all aspects and the friendly service we received.  the grub on board could have been better.

title: No best travel
review_text: Hostess not really friendly. Airplane was an old type, movie list was very poor and screen monitor was small one.

title: Had a serious problem 2 hours before take-off
review_text:
My wife and I checked in time for our midday flight Zurich - Boston after we had called the airline if everything was OK, or whether we needed something special. 
Answer negative.
At check-in, they asked for a new US Immigration Paper for Swiss citizens - a form which did not exist on our last flight to the US (5 years ago). We did not have it because nobody mentioned.  The Swiss staff was very helpful and did the tedious computer work for us. Departure time got closer and closer and the US Immigration server did not accept the Swiss clerk's entry. 
He had to start the 45 minutes procedure (for 2 persons) all over again. Of course, we missed the plane. The Swiss staff went out of their way to find 2 seats on the evening flight to Boston, it worked. I had to return home for some frequent flyer PIN for the ticket change and made it by taxi just in time for the 6PM flight. 
I would not know any other airline which would be so helpful to passengers in such a friendly and professonal way. Warm thanks to Swiss!
 
Swiss ha always been - and will remain - our preferred airline.

title: Decent
review_text: Decent services in good price. I enjoyed flying with Swiss I. Airlines and I would trust it  for any future trips.

title: Horrible
review_text: The central economy cabin was quite literally upwards of 80f (26c) degrees, while the rear economy cabin was closer to 70f (21c).  We asked repeatedly for them to correct this.  We would get relief for ten minutes or so then it went right back up.  The they brought one meal and one light snack.  This was actually a blessing because the food was also quite horrible.  we arrived in SFO 45 minutes early.  Then we were treated to sitting on the ramp for 45 minutes until our gate became available.  We all really enjoyed sitting in our sweltering seats waiting...  I will be avoiding Swiss Air in future travel planning.

title: Flight ok and almost on time, food again below average
review_text: Plane and flight quite ok, staff friendly. What is far below average (I'am flying at least 20 tmes a year) is the food. What Swiss is serving as "breakfast" is kind of a bad joke. Very poor in-flight-entertainment system, comparet to other airlines completely outdated.

title: Excellent service
review_text: Flew this route from Zurich to Los Angeles and found the cabin and seats very comfortable. The service was excellent as well as the food and drink options. Highly recommend

title: Great service
review_text: Excellent flight, great service, great food. Love it. If possible I would take Swiss International Airlines everywhere.

title: Awesome service with smile
review_text: Flight departed on time and landed on time, no hassle. Crew was so polite, made me comfortable. Take off and landing was smooth, I didn't feel anything in my tummy. Food is good. Entertainment was limited but was sufficient for my 8 hours flight. Overall it was perfect.

title: non-existent communication around delay and options
review_text: Flight was delayed for over 2.5 hours but information boards were not updated beyond an hour delay. boarding time represented came an went without so much as an announcement. Kept all passengers in the dark until the last minute. Consequently, I missed the last train out of Geneva and had to find a last minute hotel.  Swiss air rep would not accommodate with hotel voucher.  Disappointing for a country that has built it's brand around efficiency and accuracy.  With timely communication I could have made alternative arrangements.

title: Outstanding Service and a relaxed flight
review_text: A great welcome and full attention to detail.  Professional and attentive service from Check-in through inflight.  Still lack of coordination at disembarkemnt

title: Luxury economy class
review_text: Although I travelled economy class, the food was very good (it actually tasted like food!) and the hostesses' treatment was top class. Seats were comfortable and there was enough space between rows of seats not to feel claustrophobic. Highly recommended.

title: good service and food, nice crew
review_text: I love flying with SWISS. Service is always good and staff very friendly. Delicious food and chocolate

title: A dayflight with less jetlag
review_text: Leaving in the morning, arriving in late afternoon same day, very convenient and I have less jetlag.

title: An efficient company
review_text: Very professional staff, respectful treat, timeliness, tasty and reasonably priced food, and swiss chocolate bonus. Excellent!

title: safe and comfortable
review_text: smooth flight, kind flight attendants, delicious meal and big verity of drinks. departure and landing on time

title: Refused to take responsibility.
review_text:
Our connecting flight from Manchester to Zurich (outbound onto Singapore) was delayed by 1 hour and so we missed our onward flight to Singapore at 23:00. Nobody at arrivals to advise where to go so ended up at a deserted check in area where we eventually found someone to help arrange our overnight accommodation and reorganize our onward flight the next day.  However on closer inspection of the tickets we discovered the flight to Singapore we were booked on was in 2 days time!!??? After urgent phone calls from the hotel in Zurich (This is now 1:30 in the morning) Swissair decide they have a flight the next day and booked us onto that flight. 
On our return having missed a days holiday and lost 1 nights booking at the Hotel in Singapore, Swissair refused any responsibility and after initially offering ¬£40 vouchers they advised us of a German Conciliation Organisation and then retracted the voucher offer. 
Well after a prolonged period of time we won the claim and were refunded the full cost of the flights. A result but without any cooperation from the airline. These companies have a policy of refusing to pay their lawful and rightful compensations hoping that the majority of people will be put off from claiming. It's disgraceful. Never again will I fly Swissair.

title: Nice service buy economic class with short space
review_text: New aircraft with nice board service. Good food and beverage. But economic class with really short space.

title: My favorite European airline
review_text:
I love Swiss.
Fabulous service, excellent planes and tasty food.
Traveled with an infant and the service was attentive and always lovely.

title: Very courteous crew, always on time and very efficient
review_text: Very efficient courteous crew. Always on time. Long haul also good with good food choice. Swiss chocolate a bonus too

title: Nice plane with amazing staff
review_text: The flight was very nice, on time with a nice Swiss chocolate offered at the end. The plane is new and clean and was very comfortable for the class. Also the price was great with options to choose if you have only a carry on or a luggage so different price ranges.

title: The best airline company
review_text: It is always a pleasure flight with them. They are very polite, they provide some snacks and coffee during the flights. They are on time mist of the times. I always flight with them when I am going to the alps for skiing. The best one

title: Swiss Air
review_text: Easy check in.   Staff Excellent.   Not a problem for us, but there is a small staircase leading down and out from the terminal to the plane.    Flight, and cabin crew excellent.   Bus waiting from the plane to the terminal at Zurich Airport.   Could not fault it.

title: Fabulous airline
review_text: We fly out of Manchester to visit Zurich. Swiss airlines were excellent you get a drink and snack included with the price. I would class the airline as midprice but at a low cost and will definitely use them again. The service on board is excellent.

title: Check in bad
review_text: At check in agent was most unfriendly. He simply said you are staying longer 30 days and have not got a visa forThailand I  cannot check you in. I explained I had 6 hours in Bangkok before connecting to Hanoi. He just said computer will not check you in. I showed him my onwards ticket at which he agreed to go go and talk to someone. He came back still not happy. I showed him my visa for Vietmnam for the next day. He wen off to talk to someone again. Came back and grumpily agreed to check me in. No smile or apology. Flight was delayed but made connection. Cabin crew not that friendly.

title: basic flight
review_text:
we flew in bussiness class but got regular poor seets in an old plain.
 very disappointing. nothig to compare to a normal bussiness flight

no entertainment at all. could suplly ipads or something different

title: Always a pleasure
review_text: For short distances we usually fly with Swiss, because they have the best value for money. Staff is usually friendly and you get swiss chocolate.

title: Two classes:  First, and Sardine
review_text: I‚Äôm a tall guy and tried to get a economy premium seat,but this isn‚Äôt offered.  I don‚Äôt know the pitch of Swiss seating, but the flight was my worst of forty years of flying.  Very tight seating on the 777.  Good thing the flight was 65% occupied, and i could move around.  The twelve hours onboard was still terrible.   Service was very lean, and we felt dehydrated at the end.  We were onboard more than three hours before the drinks cart appeared.  I would never choose Swiss Air again.

title: Worst flight experience ever
review_text: Customer service is clueless. Gives information that staff will meet in Z√ºrich will meet up and facilitate transit. Not a soul. It‚Äôs midnight and the lights are turned off when we land - 20 minutes late. Fifteen people ran like hell to make it to connecting flight. We made it because one guy held the shuttle train doors apart. Cabin crew rude and cannot answer the simplest questions. Laughs at passengers. Food; imagine someone pouring a can of preserved tomatoes on top of overcooked pasta. This airline is so bad it makes you laugh. I recommend walking over flying with them.

title: Swiss efficency
review_text: Flew to Zurich via Manchester. Everything went smoothly and check in painless. Flight comfortable and ikn flight snack ok. Worth paying that bit extra for

title: Swiss Quality
review_text: Love the Swiss chocolate that come around without fail on each flight. Also like the fact that they do listen to you and meet your needs in your best interest. Thumbs up!

title: Great Flight - very scenic over the Swiss Alps
review_text: We recently flew with Swiss International Airlines and found them to be extremely good value for money. Although we only had a short flight flight from Milan Malpensa Airport to Zurich we experienced very good customer service, a new Bombardier Jet Aircraft and a very scenic flight over the Swiss Alps. Their check in was extremely fast at the airport and the plane left left on time and arrived on time.

title: Flying Swiss Air
review_text:
In general Swiss Air is a good company and I took their flights many time. But unfortunately during the holiday season they tend to over book their flights which means it takes for ever to board a plane. Many issues regarding the carryons that there are no space for everyone. And last but definitely not least our bags didn‚Äôt arrive only 30% of the passengers‚Äô bags arrived, which means we need to go through the hassle of trying to find our bags. 
Good airlines, try to avoid during holiday season, especially overseas trips

title: Top rated experience!
review_text:
Amazed by the quality of service of this airline! Check in was simple and easy and you have the option of choosing your seat without extra costs. The airplane was super clean and very comfortable with spacious seats. Flight attendants were all very kind. A small snack was offered (water + sandwich + chocolate)! The flight in general was very smooth!
Looking forward to travel with them again!!

title: Smooth flight on time
review_text: Check in was painless, and was able to use lounge thanks to my status with Air Canada Altitude. Flight left on time and arrived in Zurich on time. Meals were very bland. The crew operated very quietly and I even slept a little. Video screens did not respond well to my touch, and my neighbor had the same touble.

title: Pilot had a great sense of humor; made the trip more enjoyable.
review_text: Small airline so not much leg room or space. Really nice crew & they actually served a complementary snack box to everyone. Biggest compliant was the plane was 2 hrs. hour late arriving for the trip to Jamaica & then an hour late for the trip to bring us back home. Made us miss our shuttle home & left us stranded at the airport for 4 hrs. before another shuttle arrived.

title: Pleasant flight
review_text: This is our first time flying with Swiss to Europe and this turned out pleasant despite the negative reviews i read. We booked the front row seats so the extra leg room helps for the long haul (at extra charges). Punctuality - a little delayed and not too bad for winter months weather. Service: Pleasant. They put out bottled water and snacks after meals for passengers to help themselves which I thought was nice.

title: Pity... used to be one of the best
review_text: Rules have changed from Geneva hub... for an 2,5 hours flight paid full rate in economy class (chf 600.- ) you get 1 plastic bottle of water and a ridiculous sandwich, I would rather call a piece of sponge bread with something undefined in the middle. Everything else is to be paid extra (coke, coffee, tea,...). I do not fly to eat and drink but when I fly with a regular company (not a low cost) I expect a minimum, at least a cup of coffee ! And this is the economy rate... with the "economy saver" you just get water in a plastic glas ! What's the advantage of flying with a regular airline ? The flight was delayed (3 hours) and there is no more service onboard. Better fly with a low cost one, at least you know what to expect !!! It's really a pity

title: Swiss Air
review_text:
On time, polite. Good service. And a very good price. My flight was cancelled and they rebooked me on a similar itinerary no fuss, no muss.
Will use them again
Both flights arrived on time and the connection in Zurich was convinient.

title: Good but not Great
review_text: First off we used United FF miles, so how can you complain.  Check in and Service was excellent.  Food was good, not great.  Beer and wine flowed freely.  Business class seating is kinda strange, look over the seat map and pick a center seat for two or an outer window if you are flying single.  Pods and seats were kinda "Ikea"  not super comfy, but good. Connections to flights were good going and coming from LAX.  I would fly them again to Europe

title: Great flying experience
review_text:
Excellent airline with a can do attitude Efficient in all areas and runs like a Swiss watch
On time departure and arrival Food was above what is usually on offer served with a smile

review_text: The airplane was fully booked but we left on time.  The plane was clean, and the service was exceptional.  The flight attendant was attentive and friendly.  I even liked the food (I always give mine to my husband).  They even give you chocolate and a warm cloth at the end.  Plenty of legroom too.  I would definitely fly with them again.

title: Comfortable flight
review_text: As we were traveling with a toddler and it was his first such a long flight, but the crew was vry goos with kids and very helpful also. They make sure to serve you everything for the kids before so that you can have your meals on time. Highly recommended for traveling with kids also.

review_text: We flew Swiss Air to visit my Sister-in-law who lives in Nuremberg, Germany on November 28 - December 12, 2018.  All flights where timely we weren't delayed on any leg.  The leg room was tight, but not too uncomfortable.  The service was super and the flight crew was always there to assist when needed.  I would highly recommend Swiss Air for any international travels.

title: Miami to Dubai - well worth the flight time
review_text: Seats tight and almost impossible to get out of if someone in front puts their seat back.  Held prisoner!

title: Smooth change over in Zurich
review_text: A very efficient and caring service. The team on board were very helpful and the service was good. Good standard and space between seats was as expected.

title: Mr
review_text:
Swiss Airways,,,,very clean/sharp/friendly/on time/modern and all with a good attitude...
Food was also tasty for airline cuisine.Well done.

title: Best service
review_text: Fantastic meals and constant attention!  The cabin crew was efficient and took care of all of us. Meal and snacks, they kept coming.

My flight with Swiss made a refreshing and comfortable change and 8ne I would gladly repeat. Encore Swiss airlines.

Flight to Rome was smooth. Great service as always. 

Thank you Swiss Air for making flights smooth for families. Makes flying with our little prince so much fun.

Their seat selection process is lacking, the attendants are stiff-upper lipped cordial but not overly pleasant and the food was good but not excellent.  The lie-last seats are comfortable enough but not industry-leading with a non-descript institutional decor. title: Comfortable flight, great food
review_text: early am flight, left Cairo 3am.  Got a small snack early, then a breakfast tray--not very big, but beautiful presentation and very tasty.

title: Positiv experience
review_text: To celebrate my husband's birthday we flew to Venice by Swiss. It was only a short, one-hour flight but we were throughout satisfied with check-in, on-time flight, clean plane, simple-service, etc. As frequent travellers we always fly Swiss whenever possible.

title: Business class in SWISS - an excellent experience
review_text: I traveled from Dubai to Zurich and then Zurich to Chicago in business class on SWISS. The flight from Dubai left at 2:15 a.m. so after a drink, I used my lie-flat seat and slept most of the way to Zurich.  At Zurich I had a 6-hour layover that I spent in the SWISS business lounge which was mostly empty while I was there.  They offer a wide variety of food and beverages including breakfast cooked to order and then at around 11 a.m. they switch to a lunch service.  The flight from Zurich to Chicago was very pleasant.  There was a beverage service with an excellent selection of wines and liquor and a multi-course lunch with extremely tasty food.  Prior to landing in Chicago, there was another meal service - not as elaborate as the first meal, but very good as well.  The service on the flight was excellent.

title: good flight good food good price
review_text:
top  experiene and nice service price is so reasnable
food ok and inflight options are top
prices 312.00 round trip

title: Swiss Air - A very pleasant experience!
review_text: Our experience on Swiss Air was very nice.  The Swiss run airlines offers good service, friendly flight attendants and on-time departures and arrivals.

title: Go Swiss
review_text: Left on time. Great and friendly service. Decent food. Small amenities. Easy connections. Zurich is a great airport. I've flown Swiss before and I'd definitely fly them again.

title: Very smooth take off and landing, both ways, skilled pilots.

title: best overall airline
review_text: most airlines focus on one or a few issues to be a 10 (1-10, 10 being  highest) and tend to neglect other areas of service and flight. Swiss on the other hand i would not say in each specific area they are a 10, id give them in every category an 8-9, they focus on everything from seat comfort, food taste and presentation, staff manors, flight cleanliness, bathroom sizes, airport, and up keep of the flights. over all its my favorite over every other airline. and preferred star alliance group over others as well.  for the combined ability to have such high marks in every category i would give them a 10 out of 10.

title: Swiss Air
review_text: The best Airline. Booked a Flight combined with a train ticket. Everything worked fine. My luggage was booked double by mistake and I do not realize it. Swiss repaid me the money and write an excuse E-Mail without any action from my side. This is how it should work.

title: Great, efficient, on time
review_text:
Very good first time experience with this airline. Booked the flight in February to get the best fare for a September departure date. (Used Google flights to identify and track the fares for this particular flight. )
Booked directly via Swiss Air web site. Keep in mind that published fares for this airline does not include your seat. So if you want a specific seat you need to purchase it. I purchased two seats so my husband and I could sit together and be over or near the wing. 
When I booked the flight I also requested a special meal (Gluten free). On the day of the flight as well as the return flight they had the meal on the food cart and they knew I was the person who requested it. A much better experience in this regard vs US airlines. 
Food was good, seats were comfortable (as best as they could do in coach class) and their selection on movies, etc. was good. 
I would use Swiss Air again for European travel. 
Recommended.

title: Best timing for my needs, but there are cheaper options
review_text: I checked all the flights and the Swiss Air ones fitted my schedule the best.  I entertained the idea of FlyDubai and other budget airways, but it wasn't worth it timewise and with our baggage.  The flight was originally from Zurich, stopping in Dubai, terminating in Muscat.  The flight was basically empty, and being a long haul aeroplane, was comfortable and spacious.  The 2am arrival time also meant that the queues were not overwhelming.  I would happily do the trip again.

title: Low Budge
review_text: If you are not flying First Class or Business, you might as well be on a 737 flying to Vegas. Except you're not, and you are treated like a loser for 13+ hours. You are so crammed in, you have to LITerally get out of your seat to reach anything from the seat space in front of you. They have made economy so tight, to make room for the Lazy Boy recliners in Business class, you are practically in the fetal position for a long flight. As for the service, super sporadic, and when I did want to snack, the attendants put out a small spread of cheese and crackers, which was gone in seconds, I requested something else, but they were in the kitchen area, sitting in a circle, eating off the fine china from First Class. Good times. Oh, and our flight got cancelled and we received no text/notice to that affect. Bottom line? This is a typical United airlines flight, with a red cross on the side of the plane. Buh bye.

title: Professional service
review_text: Very quick check in, pre booked seats, clean cabin, not a lot of choice for refreshments (but it was a short flight ) very polite cabin staff. Return flight  check in luggage yourself, no long queues.

title: Very Good indeed üëçüèΩ
review_text: Simoly the Best. Service Beyond expectations. Will always try to arrange any trip with Swiss. Tickets are a little more expensive - but you get full value for money.

title: Always great service
review_text: Went to Nice for a wedding . Love flying through Zurich, never any issues . Flights leaving and returning were all on time . Service on board is great .

title: One of the best airlines undoubtedly..!!!
review_text: Amazing service, professional staff and high quality of food and drinks served. Nothing to complain about. Smooth and informative transfers leading to fewer delays and inconveniences. Ground staff were pleasant as well.

title: LEGENDARY Airline Simply SWISS
review_text:
Awwsome service fantastic crew , The Indian flight attendents need a special applause and a appreciation.
The meals are scumptious and the service par excellince

unacceptable

review_text: My wife and I were travelling Economy Class and as she had a bad back, she asked the Stewardess if she could have a pillow.  The Stewardess went to get her a pillow which was stored in the Business Class but she was stopped in her tracks by the Chief Steward who asked her why she was taking a pillow. When the Stewardess explained that it was for an Economy Class passenger, he hissed venomously:"Pillows are only for Business Class Passengers". review_text: Employers are very unfriendly and do not want to help, you cannot reach anyone and no one is responsible

title: Very Accomodating
review_text: The flight was overbooked in economy. I had a letter from my doctor asking for a bulkhead seat in economy due to recent hip surgery. The airline assigned me to a business class seat with a reclining seat and the extra room. It made a great start to my vacation.

title: Worst Service airline that I have ever experienced
review_text:
For 2 weeks I tried to book with Swiss air to visit my family for Christmas this year and I got the most mixed messages I have ever received. As some background information Swiss is the only major airline to fly to where my family lives. I booked business class to make it as comfortable for myself as possible and since I knew that had requests to add on to my booking I found it fair to do this. After 2 calls to Swiss Air, and 2 calls to the airlines that were operating the flights, the third person I spoke to at Swiss airline confirmed to be that everything was done and booked, took my credit card details and said that everything was done. It was not! 2 weeks and several hours of calls later I found out that they could not accommodate my requests, even though they had charged me and booked my tickets. I proceeded to cancel my ticket, did not get an explanation, apology or any information what had happened. Just that it I wanted them to accommodate my requests I would have to rebook my tickets from scratch, for more than twice as much money as my booking had cost. 
DO NOT FLY WITH SWISS!! I will never ever ever book with Swiss Airlines ever again and I will ensure that no one that I know does it either.

title: Swiss precision
review_text:
