On the short flight from Denmark to Switzerland they served a soft drink and a chocolate bun. I don‚Äôt like sweet bread, and our stewardess imidiately got me a loaf of bread from business class. Nice move, thank you!

title: comfortable flight
review_text: Zurich to Moscow. A very comfortable flight, good food, the plane was clean,  calm landings and takeoffs, staff are nice and friendly. gonna be flying again. Recommend

He was yelling at me in front of the other passengers, trying to make me feel bad with sarcastic comments about my ‚Äúlight fare ticket‚Äù and before we even sort out the issue he asked for my credit card in order to charge me for the extra weight!!! As far as I‚Äôm concerned, things that are bought at the airport are not included in the weight limitation of the hand luggage. Not only was this Swiss employee rude, unfriendly and aggressive but he was also violating the regulation regarding purchases at the airport! When I tried to explain him the situation, he gave me the inappropriate response ‚Äúthat is not my problem!‚Äù Well, it is going to be now since I am planning to file a report against him for his unacceptable behavior! Employees like him defame the name of a company that was supposed to be reputable! A very unpleasant experience at Zurich Airport!

title: Reliable, Professional
review_text:
Very obliging cabin crews, great food, but very limited IFE - on a tiny screen.

cf Emirates or  Qatar!

title: Good as always
review_text:
I fly Swiss very often to Africa and Asia.
Great service on the ground and on board. Zurich lounges are  great, very comfortable and big variety of food and beverage .
Plane seat is very comfortable and food is good.

title: Good service, quick transfer at Zurich
review_text: I was nervous when I realized that the layover at Zurich from my Budapest flight was only 45 minutes, but all went smoothly. The long flight to Newark was on a very comfortable Airbus with 2-4-2 seating in economy. The food, wine, service and movies were all excellent. My only gripe was with young woman seated in front of me who felt entitled to recline her seat fully so she could lounge while watching her programs and eating her meal. I asked her politely to raise the seat back a bit, and she seemed quite resentful, so I repeated my request to the flight attendant and got some results. It's a real problem with the tight seating in economy on all airlines. Passengers really need to have some regard for the people seated behind them. Either that, or the airlines need to fix the seats so they don't recline as much.

title: Surprise!
review_text: As frequent flyer I booked with SWISS because departing from LUX there was not really much choice. Lucky me!  Service & comfort are fantastic, value-for-price is excellent. Looking forward to get on board again in December.

title: Excellent service
review_text: Our flight didn't even take 40 min but still the service was prefect.A drink and a little sandwich.And the aircraft was a nice stylish decor.

title: Very helpful and courteous staff - on ground and on board
review_text:
Swiss - always punctual, comfortable and helpful. 

Suggestion: The Indian meals can be improved, in taste and selection of dishes.

title: Struck By Lightning
review_text: Flight was delayed for 4 hours follow by another 30 minutes. Ground crew were not able to provide a reason. The pilot, however, announced on the plane that the delay was because the previous flight was "struck by lightning" and ground service was needed. What a lame excuse! It was obvious that they were consolidating two flights due to low occupancy. There are still a lot of vacant seats even after the consolidation. They were trying to cover up with an "extraordinary circumstances" so they don't have to dish out any compensation. By EU law, airlines has to compensate 600 Euro for each of their passengers for any delay over 3 hours unless it was due to some "extraordinary circumstances". The same thing happened to me last time with Westjet. I guess this is a pretty common practice with smaller airlines.

title: Unhelpful staff
review_text:
I made an inquiry about the current food menu on the board due to my complicated food allergy issue. But the first guy I spoke on the phone was just not helpful to provide me with any information and he kept telling me that 'the menu will only get provided on the day of flight' which it was not on the website. so I had to ring them back a few times to ask for a help from other staff. One of the phone calls, I spent 55 mins and I only spoke to an operator for 5mins in this call and the rest was just waiting on hold. After waiting for a long hold, the staff still could not give me the answer to my question. In the end, she told me  'you can find the information online' or 'you can call the airport directly' instead of actually finding out the information and providing it for me. 
So many calls were made and I was put on hold and I ended up spending lots of money, but nobody really helped me and gave me the answer I needed.

I flew with Asiana, BA, ANA, Emirates, Virgin..many airlines in past but this was the worst Air Line I dealt with. They really need to learn how to deliver good customer service!

title: Row all to myself, what luck
review_text:
I was extremely lucky as the flight was not full and I had chosen the best seat near the window. I love looking out the window. I have probably flown at least 200 times or more in my life and I have always loved the window seat. I heard it means you are adventurist

I was the only person in the row. The only thing I calculated wrongly was the side of the plane. It would have been better on the other side in order to see the Alps.

Airbus A321. Toilets are just a disgrace. Tiny. I have seen seedy bars with better toilets. I cannot believe that whoever ordered these thought it was acceptable. There is a pull down for people to change children. In this restricted space it would be nigh on impossible.

title: Window seat nobody in the middle
review_text:
I was so so happy to be seated near the back at the window. The middle seat was free so I could use it for my coffee and drink.

Considerably better than most other airlines. Always like flying Swiss. Airbus A321.

The toilets are terrible, tiny. It is a real disgrace as both toilets at the back are unacceptably small even for a kid. Whoever made them this size deserves to travel in them

title: Good flight
review_text:
My first travel with an european airline.
It was alright and there is nothing I could complain of but also nothing that I would say: "wow".

title: Swiss cheese
review_text:
Too many holes in their service!!! First off I hadn‚Äôt seen my wife , children or sick mother in twenty months. So after a long wait, naturally I collected many gifts for them. Enough to purchase three additional bags to check in. 
I arrived early at the airport as to weigh the luggage and make any adjustments to comply with their standard twenty three kilo or fifty pound limit per piece. Four of the five were over the limit but I was willing to pay the extra weight. After all, these are my families items they‚Äôd been waiting for. 
Upon arrival at the counter, the agent and her luggage assistant weighed everything and calculated my extra weight to cost $806!!! My ticket was for that much!! I asked if there was anything I could do like buy an extra piece from the shop and disperse the added weight there. She said ‚Äú no, it‚Äôll still be the same!‚Äù Even though the extra piece of luggage checked at the airport is $287. I became frustrated but had no choice until her supervisor arrived. Luckily he knew better and allowed me to buy the extra piece at $287. I checked in and proceeded to the gate.
On the plane, I purpose pre-checked and selected the last window seat in a three seat row after noticing the flight wasn‚Äôt full. My hope were to be able to lay down across all three seats. Of course that didn‚Äôt happen, oh well.
The actual seats weren‚Äôt comfortable as the cushions were old. Additionally, there was no leg rest underneath the chair in front of me to rest my feet on as not to slide forward.
The food....we were told there‚Äôs a meat option and vegetarian one. By the time they made their way to me, the chicken was finished and I there was left was macaroni and cheese!!! With a bit of broccoli... what??? Growing up in the states, I rarely ever ate that because I don‚Äôt like it!! And I‚Äôm not a kid!!!
The second leg was surprisingly with a company call Edelweiss. A sister airlines to Swiss air. This plane didn‚Äôt have tv monitors or charging plugs for cell phones. 
Long story short...never again!!

title: Amazing experiance flying with Swiss
review_text: I purchased a flight in Late October, Roundtrip from LA to Barcelona with a layover in Zurich. I could not believe the price. I quickly planned a vacation. The flight was great. I added on check baggage. I was able to print my luggage tog at home. When I got to LAX, they Swiss staff gave me a reusable luggage tag took my luggage. I was able to board on the second group. The seat itself was comfy and had a bit more room than other airlines I've flown before to Europe. The flight crew was very attentive. More than I expected for an Economy ticket. The food was great. They brought me snacks multiple times, as well as drinks. I would highly recommend.

title: Best Airline Ever
review_text: Swiss International is the best kept secret ever. We had the most enjoyable flight - the airplane was clean and the flight crew were friendly and very nice. It helped that the flight wasn't full, but the service was excellent and the airplane had all the amenities we needed to make a 10 hour flight bearable.

title: New aircraft, efficient service, impressive
review_text: We flew from Manchester to Amsterdam via Z√ºrich (don‚Äôt ask) and were impressed both flights were on new aircraft, both had electronic screens to allow you to see you progress on the maps, leather seats, chrome trim all in all very nice. Snacks were served on each flight even though they were only an hour or so each. We were a little concerned as we had less than an hour transfer time originally and then had a further delay of 15 minutes, our concern was compounded when we realised it was a dreaded bus transfer. It was however very efficient and dropped us virtually at the gate for the next flight, passport control took seconds and we made the next flight with time to spare. Overall very good.

title: visit to switzerland
review_text: was a comfortable flight. flight was delayed because of the ice and snow. in zurich we were waiting about 2 hrs to receive our luggage. finally one was lost....

title: Manchester to Zurich business class - the only way to do it
review_text: Easy online booking, easy online check in, good service from ground staff and cabin crew. Very attentive over breakfast (outbound) and lunch (inbound). Aircraft clean, tidy and relatively modern especially the Bombardier coming home. A very smooth flight with excellent service throughout. Swiss lounge at Zurich T1 near gates D was very good.

title: No flight but great Service
review_text:
On the 9th of November, I was supposed to fly from Amsterdam to Mauritius via Zurich. Just when I was driving to the airport, I got a notification from Swiss AIR over the mail, that my flight from Zurich was canceled. Instead of being upset, I went to the helpdesk and asked if they could arrange anything for me, and they did. They managed to get me on a flight with KLM to Dubai, and from there with Emirates to Mauritius. The service was great, and my flight was even earlier than my booked flight. 

Thank you Swiss Air for your great service, I will definitely not be afraid to book with you for my next times.

title: There was a time in my youth when Swissair was Legendary.
review_text: We have been flying Swissair a few times within the last year, but have been increasingly disappointed. If you fly economy, and are booked by a travel agent, it might appear less expensive than going through their website, but they get you when you realize you cannot choose your seats ahead of time, on a longish flight to Europe. Their entertainment options are far inferior to some of the other carriers, Food for 8+ hour flights is underwhelming. Seats in economy are not for people over 60. The attendants were helpful, polite and pleasant. The planes were clean and relatively modern. Landing & take off were decent. They are still pulling out from gate like clock work and arrive on time.

title: Not Economy for Economy Prices
review_text: Lovely service, great staff, on-time arrival after late take-off due to connection flights, good food, and plenty of snacks and drinks for free.

title: Fantastic flight
review_text: The only thing that gave this flight an 8 instead of a 10... was the sleepless travel home due to 5 crying, coughing babies! That‚Äôs economy I guess! On the upside... they served plenty of free wine!

title: love that swiss chocolate
review_text: plenty of leg room, flight attendants were very attentive, I didn't have to ask for anything. Snacks served were more like a meal and the flight was less than two hours long.

title: Great Seats
review_text: Really nice seats in economy with decent legroom, I'm 6'5. The Bombardier planes are particularly nice.

title: Trip to Hong Kong
review_text: Excellent experience. From on line check in to arrival could not fault service. Plenty of leg room in planes, and food was excellent.

title: Surprisingly super flight, super food, Swiss timing!
review_text:
I traveled from Montreal to Zurich and Zurich to Nairobi on 30 November 2018. Both flight were on time. The food was much better than the usual airlines I take for this itinerary. There were metal utensils and what to say about the warm croissants we received from breakfast and the ever smiling service in the plane. Out of this world experience ;-)
Thanks to Swiss!

title: Not a pleasant experience...
review_text:
I was flying on Swiss from November 29 to December 4, 2018 to get into Valencia for the Marathon on December 2, 2018.  I booked my flight on kayak and didn‚Äôt realize that I was booked as eco light, which apparently meant that a checked bagged is not included for an international flight from USA (which I was completely unaware).  Basically upon my arrival from USA to Zurich before my transfer to Zurich, one of the Swiss air representatives decided to randomly select me to weigh my bag and basically told me that I was forced to check my bag in because it‚Äôs over the 8kg weight limit for carry ons.  Interestingly enough where I left from in USA, they did not weigh my bag and I had no issues with bringing my carry on as is during the international flight.  Not great........ 
Then prior to coming back to USA, I thought it would be wise to check my bags in because I knew that the baggage weight would exceed the 8kg carry on limit, especially with the amount of things I bought to bring home from Valencia.  So the website said that if you purchase check in baggages before three hours of your departure that there is a ‚Äúspecial price.‚Äù  I thought that this was an option when I was checking in and of course it was not.  I tried multiple times to purchase the check in bag option so I would not be over charged as written on the Swiss website at the airport.  After multiple unsuccessful attempts, I decided to call the 1-888 number and I was ‚Äúassisted‚Äù by Melissa.  Her ‚Äúassistance‚Äù was more of giving me pushback and telling me that purchasing check in bags prior to my flight is not an option because I had already checked in (which was absolutely absurd because there was no option during online check in to purchase the bags).  She told me I would have to pay the higher price at the airport.  I literally read what the Swiss website said word for word and then she retracted and said she would go and ask one of her colleagues for help and finally helped me figure out how to purchase the check in bag online before three hours of my departure time.  
Definitely not a fan of their customer service considering she gave me pushback times 2 and I had to read to her the policy of Swiss from the website and be forceful about it before she actually started ‚Äúassisting‚Äù me....

Oh and not to forget to mention that my flight back from Zurich to USA that they constantly ran out of non vegetarian meals when they got to me (I do love veggies, but I really needed the protein as I was recovering from the marathon 1.5 days ago...) Really?! I guess that was my fault that I did not realize that eco light means that you get treated basically like second class...

Not planning on ever flying Swiss again unless I have no other options.

title: no expected swiss quality
review_text:
well, i was quite early at zrh airport & at the check in. at least no queues. i showed the quite unfriendly swiss staff lady my on-going ticket with BKKair to siem reap. check-thru or transit was not possible, since i booked bkkair online separately. but no sorry would she utter...despite me being a business ticket holder & paying around 3'000$ for a return flight to bkk.
well, it took me a while to find the SWISS lounge. there is an underground toy train to bring you there. good choice of newspapers & magazines. poor choice in good SWISS wines. BUT: the hot cheese cake you can get is really excellent!
in the 777 there were 62 business seats, 8 first class & the rest is wooden.
cleanliness was low. there were old red socks&stuff from previous passengers in the compartment as well in mine as in my neighbor's!!!
food was actually good...incl. an excellent salad & a beef tenderloin you rarely get anywhere so soft & melting in your mouth. nice choice of swiss wines from the rhone valley [Valais}.

title: Lost Baggage and very bad customer service followup!
review_text:
I was flying from Stuttgart to Cairo on Swiss Air, and when I arrived to Cairo I didn't find my luggage, I filled an immediate complain at the airport. the bag had some very important staff that I urgently needed.

I started following up with their customer service representative via e-mail and phone and they were very slow in responding and very much careless about the impact of this delay or possible loss on me!

after many calls and correspondence the bag came back and their customer service agent is refusing to admit that this is a fault from their side and claiming that this is normal thing to happen on all airlines. 

this seems to be a repeating issue as they are dealing with our communication with only repeated words without any consideration to peoples' interest. 

this is one of the worst Airline customer services that I have seen and they are surely losing customers starting with me and my family...

title: First time flying with Swiss Air
review_text: Great and safe trip.  Everyone is professional, kind and attentive.  The food is amazing for airplane food.  Everything tasted fresh and clean.  The seats were amazing however I wish they had given us free wifi, seems a bit expense $40. for 9 hour flight.   Highly recommend them.

title: Hot cabin
review_text: Overnight flight from Miami on a Boeing 777. My wife and I got different seats than what we picked online. We got stuck in the center 4 seats, in the middle 2 seats, with 2 sleepers controlling the isles. To top that...the cabin was hot (sweat down your back). When we complained that we were sweating for 10+ hours, the flight crew said they were not going to lower the temperature. If they did then people would complain that it's too cold...isn't that what the free blankets are for? The Boeing 777 does not have individual A/C over head spouts that you can control. The 777 has a long A/C vent running along the length of the plane, that the crew controls 100%. The leg room was tight on this plane. The same airlines on the way back home flew a Airbus 380 and that to me is a much better and more comfortable plane. Recommend you check your seat assignment at the counter, so you don't end up sandwiched in the middle for 10+ hours.

title: Good flight experience but not enough seat room for my liking
review_text: Clean and comfortable seats, until the person in front of you leans back. It's hard to even get out of your seat. The only way I didn't feel claustrophobic was to also lean my seat back as far as I could. This seems to be happening on all airlines. Flight staff was good. Food provided wasn't bad (I don't expect great). Pretty much on time. Just wish business class seats would be more affordable. Our 8 hour trip home was really rough due to shrinking of room in economy class.

title: Great crew, cold cabin
review_text:
This was my first flight on the new and very much hyped Bombardier CS300. Though the flight was a short one and the service by the crew was excellent. 
Unfortunately the plane did not live up to it. I found the seats rather hard and uncomfortable but what was even worse was that the temperature on board was so cold to the point that I got my coat out to cover my legs. The passenger behind me even wore his jacket. A real pity as the service overall was great.

title: Rude ground crew
review_text: Very rude and unhelpful ground crew.  They enjoy way too much unfair power over the passengers. It was a huge inconvenience traveling with a baby on their flight. Spend about $6K on travel costs every year. Will be taking my business elsewhere. It was the second time we faced harassment at their hands.

title: Good Service - Hard Seats
review_text:
I flew Swiss from ZRH to LAX and I had booked the flight through United which served the other legs of the flights, along with Austrian.
Coming in from Stockholm on Swiss Air they announced that TSA precheck would be offered on my flight to the US. Great!
A few days later I was going through security at ZRH and asked several officials at the airport about TSA precheck. Nobody had an idea what that was. There was only the general security, which, luckily was fast enough. So far, so good. Then came boarding. I was surprised to see such a mass of people at a relatively small gate. It was difficult to see which line (or cluser pof people) was waiting to board and which line was trying to get the extra security sticker. Boarding itself was just plain chaotic. I am used to boarding groups being called, or, at least, lines being arranged for the passengers - no such thing here, just 400 people shoving and pushing through the one gate with the scanner for the boarding passes. In 20 years of flying I have rarely seen such chaos.
On the plane, I had the chance to ask two flight attendants about the boarding experience. Both were flabbergasted and pretended not to have noticed anything. Also, boarding groups did not seem to ring a bell. Needless to say, the flight was delayed from the beginning because of the unorganized boarding.
The airplane itself was clean, and service was really good. Several meals were served, and people came by non-stop to offer more water, coffee, etc.
The entertainment system offered a good variety of European movies, which I always enjoy, because you never get to see anything from that part of the world in the US.
After 3 hours I noticed that the seats were unusually hard. I am used to sitting 8 to 10 hours on a transatlantic flight, which I am doing 2 - 3 times per year,. This time was different: I had to get up and stand for a long time. I would have preferred to not sit down at all, and the rest of the trip was painful.

title: A340-300 Business Class ZRH-NRT (12hrs 25min)
review_text:
A340-300 Business Class ZRH-NRT (12hrs 25min). 

SWISS is one of those greedy airlines, flying on business and I could not reserve a seat because I would have to pay 250$ plus to reserve one of the single seats. I did not do it. 

Then I waited till the 24 hrs before departure to choose a seat during the check-in process. They had asigned me an aisle seat in the middle with no window. At the check-in in NRT they weighed my hand baggage and told me that I had to get rid of 2 kgs... may be she was right but for the price the ticket costs, two kgs and the few cabin baggage in Business Class...it should not be a problem. 

The cabin is outdated. The seat it is not comfortable. The screen is really small and outdated. Service is nothing special. The entertainment system was not working , my screen had to be rebooted 5 times. I just managed to start 5 movies and I just manages to complete one. 

For the same price and if it is an A340, I would recommend any other airline. I do not specially like the SWISS crews, generally have an attitude issue , specially if you were travelling in Economy. 

SWISS is way far from the Qatar Airways Business Class (that most probably would be comparable to the First Class of other airlines), QR is definitely way much better. 

After arriving ZRH (approx 16 hrs) I had a transfer flight out of Terminal A. The lounge was modern but so crowded and no seats, then I decided to leave the "lounge" furthermore , the food was not appealing. 

Next time, I would like to try another airline... (Air Canada new Business Class is stunning compared to the outdated and uncomfortable SWISS Business Class)

title: My go to airline for all flights
review_text: Swiss is consistent in their service. Professional, efficient and courteous. I feel calm and relaxed flying with Swiss.

title: As expected, good service
review_text: On time, good service and acceptable  offer of films (a little outdated from a technological  point of view). Select a seat beside corridor and at front as much as possible

title: Horrible Customer Service
review_text: I attempted to check my bag online 2 hours before my flight as per the regulations to receive the reduced rate. However, after many attempts their was no place on your website or my online check-in/profile to check my bag. I asked several Swiss Air employees if they knew how this worked, but none were helpful. In the end I was charged the full price for my bag. When I made a complaint I received an arrogant response with no resolution. I tried calling the customer service hotline, but there was no answer at all.

title: Silly carry on lagguage policy
review_text:
What a pity that a reputeted airlines offers a poor service on lagguage policy (poorer and less efficient that the one that European low cost airlines apply today).
I bought a light fare (carry on lagguage only). Because I had to carry a Christmas gift (a bottle of champagne I received at very last), I asked to check in my only piece of lagguage. Because the weight was 0,8 kg above the allowance, they asked me to pay GBP 35.00 to check it in. I complained saying that the flight was overbooked and having 1 piece less in the cabin would have been if great benefit for all the passengers (considering also that I was assigned an emergency exit door). The attendant answer that he could check it in for free if I made my lagguage below the allowance. Thus, I had to take my suite jacket off from lagguage, carry it on my arm... That seems to me (a frequent flier on gold status within stars alliance) just a poor and silly way to make just less uncomfortable my flight experience.
I really wish Swiss will review its inflexible way to apply policies.
BTW, the flight departed 40 minute delayed... and -obviosly on a fully booked flight- the crew had to dolve problems and discusdions to fit all the carry on lagguage in the overhead beans...
How silly (and poorly managed).

title: Very good
review_text: A very good experience with Swiss. We flew the new 777ER and its coach seat are comfortable. Entertainment display very friendly and fast. Has USB charger and touchscreen. We ordered vegetarian/Vegan meals and they were very good. Flight attendants were a delight. Super friendly and well trained. Also what I enjoyed the most is the lack of annoying PA you usually get on US based flights. It was a nice welcome, and an even shorter thanks for flying with us coming from the captain. Clean baths and great checking service. Good job Swiss!

title: THE WORSE CUSTOMER SERVICE!! They talk to you like you have ZERO value to them.
review_text:
THE WORSE CUSTOMER SERVICE!! They talk to you like you have ZERO value to them.

Book with a different airline as these people are patronizing, unfriendly and very badly trained in customer services. 

They will go out of their way to avoid helping you and they will never take any of your complaints seriously. Having travelled the world for thirty plus years I can honestly say this is the worse aniline I have used.

I can not comment on the actual flight because I never boarded the plane.... this is purely a resew relating to my experience of how customer services spoke to me and handled my complaint. Trip adviser's review page forced me to fill out ratings for the actual flight but please ignore them.

NEVER AGAIN!!!

If you want a good service then Please avoid Swiss Air!

title: Pleasant and helpful!
review_text: I have flown Swiss airlines a few times and have found their service pleasant and very comfortable.  If I have a choice in which airline I fly I will always choose Swiss.  I've recommended it several times to my colleagues.

title: Total Scam
review_text: Terrible service told me I was going to have to gate check my carry-on (which was a normal regulation carry-on) because it was too big. It fit perfectly fine on the way to  Zurich and every other flight I have taken in the past four months (about 30 plus flights). Tried to charge me 60 franks for gate check my bag but after I gave them some well-deserved attitude there was no time to charge me so they let me do it for free. Be careful with carry-on luggage.

title: Disgrace on business class
review_text:
One of the key reasons for flying Swiss business class is being granted access to the business class lounge; Particularly prior to a long flight where I like to chill in the lounge to relax for 2 to 3 hours. (Catching connecting flight LX176 from ZRH to SINGAPORE). 

On the first sector I checked in at Geneva airport 3 hours before my flight and asked about the Swiss Lounge location. Instructions were given regarding the location. (no indication was even hinted that it was not ready) 

Upon my arrival in the Geneva Swiss Lounge; I was told it was under renovation where a voucher was given to me for just 1 drink & 1 sandwich at a designated cafe. 

At any Swiss lounge there are no such limits. 

Why was no alternative lounge arranged ?

This arrangement is absolutely not compatible to the usual Swiss business class service. 

I was told by Swiss staff the cafe was 2 minutes away. This proved to be not true; even if you could run there. Struggling with my 2 heavy hand luggage (with no wheels) the journey actually took 10+ minutes to walk there; where there was no signage how to get there. (and why are there no trolleys at the GVA airport after security clearance !! ) Swiss is the second largest customer of GVA after EasyJet. Swiss has the power to insist to GVA senior management that they should provide trolleys to passengers. 

To add insult to injury, the cafe was packed full with no tables to even sit down to rest, after my struggle to eventually get there. 

I was totally exhausted & frustrated. 
I gave up ! 

I struggled back to the gate waiting for 2 hours with no drink or food. I could not leave my luggage at the seating area alone, whilst getting some refreshments from the cafe. It‚Äôs obviously not possible to carry my 2 hand luggage; plus getting drinks & some food. You need 4 hands for that. 

It was my worse experience with Swiss. 

I felt very let down. It‚Äôs a disgrace. Your competitors would never treat a business class passenger with such disregard. 

I was Super-stressed, exhausted and angry. 

All this could have been avoided. 

I must protest in the strongest manner & I want this complaint to be elevated to Swiss Senior Management to get their House in order. 

Alan Leong
Singapore 
TripAdvisor Level 6

title: Terrible customer service
review_text:
Where to begin...you arrive for a international flight at least 2 hours before the flight to then find out your flight is delayed during the boarding time. The boarding time was continuous pushed at 10minute increments. The gate keepers then announce there is a technical difficulty on the flight, which resulted in doors not working. They then selected rows 14-26 to cone up to speak to the desk. I was then told my seat was fine- and hour went by and they called up all of the guests that they told the flight was OK to tell them they can't get on a flight tonight. Christian was one of the men at the gate that was extremely unprofessional. The whole airline had terrible customer service and nobody was willing to help the customers that pay them thousands of dollars to get on these flights. 

After this we were all told to get on line to try to find a new flight. I was told there were none to then have to push back to get on a flight more than 24 hours later. There was no discount offered, I was giving a worse seat then my flight I had originally paid for. Then I was told to go to the carousel to pick up my luggage- which went without me to the final destination. I was told that the airline was under staffed and that was the excuse for them not getting everyone's luggage to them.

title: Not as good as it sounds
review_text:
The very word Swiss conjures up images of a rich and beautiful country with world class living standards. So it was but natural for us to decide to fly Swiss airline with high expectations to Zurich for a holiday.  That logic was flawed. Swiss airlines was as bad as any other low cost International airline despite being the flag carrier of the fabled country.

The problem was not the service from the ground staff or the air crew ;they were all well trained and carried out their duties as per their training. Many reviews have also mentioned delays but  both our Delhi to Zurich and Zurich to Delhi landing times were quite punctual although there were some delays during take off. 

The problem as I see was the airlines management who have tried to save money by cutting costs at every turn.  The plane was old and the cabins,seats and  toilets were all ill maintained. Seats were ultra cramped , the entertainment material was limited and stale and recycled, The display screen was small and just a few inches from my nose when the seat in front was reclined. The entire  row shakes and creaks  when a passenger shifted in his / her seat. It was impossible to watch any thing. Switching to music I found the ear buds hard and the sponges worn out. The sound was deplorable. Both Video and music were more a pain than pleasure. 

On both flights, food and refreshments like roti rolls and pasta were well packed and served efficiently but I discovered later they were unappetizing  and was better left packed and returned . These food can be better described as some kind of fast food which I never eat.

The chocolates and cheese were an exception but not the ice cream.

I would most certainly visit Switzerland again  I would take any low cost flight if I wanted to save money and put up with the inconvenience or pay more and travel a better airline like Emirates or Singapore.

 I would never pay more and put up with inconvenience . I would never fly Swiss airlines believing it to be of the same standard as their fabled country.

title: Redirected flight
review_text: The flight was redirected to Pisa because of big winds in Florence, we had to take a bus to Florence. The flight was good but the organization in Pisa to get the bus was silly. We all waited at the terminal and then there was an announcement that bus will be waiting in front of the terminal. Everyone rushed there and it was hard to find the exact place where the bus was in the dark. It would have been helpful to have some Swiss representative to come and direct people to the bus.

title: Late flight
review_text: The flight was late getting into Zurich but we still managed to get the next connection. The actual flight was nice, food and drinks and even a chocolate bar supplied.

title: Excellent experience
review_text: The seat is one of the most comfortable and attractive of any first class products. And the quality of the service is excellent.  Love the balik salmon served and the Laurent Perrier Grand Siecle. The first class lounge in Zurich is also delightful.

title: Great comfort and a wonderful ride!
review_text: We are frequent travelers and rarely enjoy a flight as much as this one. Almost everything was perfect on this short-haul adventure to London. The food, seats, amenities and staff were exemplary. The only downside was that one of our bags got lost enroute home. This was )of course) the one with all our souvenirs in it. we have been told it was found and is on its way to us - fingers crossed it will arrive safely.

title: May-going and comfortable
review_text: Flying Business Class during school holidays is always good. The booking, baggage, Business Lounge and boarding are so easy-going, it's well worth it. Even though it's not a long flight, it is lovely to have a meal on board and usually have priority baggage pick-up at the destination. Unfortunately this didn't work in Malaga. In fact the priority luggage were the last to emerge!

title: Surprised gentle staff
review_text: The trip was very comfortable and the staff seems more gentle than usual in being helpful and also making our flight the more comfortable possible! Seems better trained now! Congratulations!

title: Wish we didn‚Äôt choose to fly Swiss for our honeymoon!
review_text: We flew Swiss airlines last month for our honeymoon, with a final destination to Dubai, UAE. I honestly wish we would have paid the extra money and flown Emirates. We didn‚Äôt know what to expect because neither one of us had flown Swiss before. We moved our seats since we‚Äôre both tall, and got a row behind the exit. To say the least, if your in economy, the fit is tight. Really tight even for an average person. To add insult to injury, the seats move all the way back, so if you have a rude and completely mindless person in front of you(sadly,we did) your at a complete loss. I tried to politely ask the flight attendant if we could move our seat, and didn‚Äôt make a big deal, but spoke to her privately. Business class had almost half a dozen empty seats and she said we had to pay an extra 1,000 Swiss franks, which is about the same as a 1,000 US currency. They were empty the whole flight, yet they would rather keep them empty instead of accommodating two extremely uncomfortable passengers. We sat back in our seats, and endured a 7.5 hour flight to Switzerland praying the connection flight wasn‚Äôt as terrible as this one. We are newlyweds and honestly, had a fantastic honeymoon once in Dubai, but never again will I travel Swiss air again. Sometimes you have to learn the hard way,but I hope this review helps other travelers before booking their next flight. Beware of Swiss Airlines ‚òπÔ∏èüòïüòü

title: Good experience
review_text: Very comfortable flight with friendly service. The food was average and so was the entertainment system. We left on time and arrived a little early. All in all a good experience.

title: Terrible customer service for miles and more program
review_text: My Mom is visiting me for 25 years one or two times a year and is always flying with Swiss and previously Swissair. She is also a Miles and More member. My Mom is now 78 and it is probably the last time she will come to visit me. So I just wanted to upgrade her with her miles - but to my dismay I discovered that she doesn't have enough miles! That after 25 years of flying SWISS!!!!  Because she doesn't want and has any credit cards her accumulated miles always expire (Miles and More Program). I tried to contact the SWISS and Miles and More customer service but after 7 different attempts still didn't get anybody on the phone that could tell me if it would be possible or not. Terrible customer service for a longtime loyal customer. VERY DISSAPPOINTED!!!

title: Always punctual always nice !
review_text: we always like to fly Swiss it is more expensive than the other airlines and the inside of the plane is getting old ! There is an early and a late flight to Miami when you arrive with the early flight the wait in Miami is much longer because Air France from Paris arrives at the same time (its a very large airplane) but they are very well organised at the airport and this time we got through in 30 Minutes !

title: Good service, no space
review_text: The service was good, but you have almost no leg room, could not move and if the seat in front of me would go back a bit, it would have insured my knees.

title: Class Airline
review_text:
Full A320 LHRZRH with an adequate 31‚Äù pitch for the relatively short flight and just 5 minutes late in arriving. I liked the way in which Gate staff monitored each passenger‚Äôs baggage as we entered the airbridge, taking some oversize/extra bags for the hold and weighing others which appeared over the 8kg limit: a great policy which speeds up the boarding process and allows maximum room in the cabin for small luggage.  Professional and cheery cabin crew with a cheese baguette served with tea/coffee and soft drinks.  Two updates from the Flight Deck with a nearly continuous update on the route etc.  via the overhead screens.  The usual Swiss Chocolates were distributed as we descended into Zurich with information on connecting flights announced by the Purser.  Always a pleasure to fly with SWISS, the best European airline in my experience.
The originally planned A320 for ZRHCAI was replaced by the A321 with extra accommodation for the greater passenger load, giving me three comfortable seats to myself with satisfactory space to wriggle around.  A full range of drinks was served by friendly and professional cabin crew with a warm quiche, salad roll, cheese and cake ‚Äì quite appropriate for the late evening departure from Zurich.  Overhead screens displayed our updated route details although, annoyingly, this was punctuated with short needless videos on SWISS and travel without sound unless one used their own headsets.  Flight deck announcements lacked any fruitful information and were superfluous.  Feedback cards were distributed on our descent into Cairo with an invitation to provide information online regarding our flight.

title: Comfortable but not my first go-to airline
review_text: This is my third long-haul (non low fare) airlines I've been on so take that into consideration. The flight is comfortable, seat is okay, food is so-so, no amenity kit for Economy class (unlike Qatar and Etihad). Check in process is okay. So I guess, 4 stars out of 5 just because of the amenity kit. Sorry.

title: Comfortable flight
review_text: This was an overnight flight. The seats were comfortable with lots of leg room. The meals were hot and good and service was efficient. The staff were helpful and friendly. It's tough to keep the bathrooms in decent shape but they managed fairly well.

title: I would not fly with them again
review_text: I actually reserved ANA but it was a code share flight with Swiss International Air. If you are Japanese, you may not be satisfied with your trip. They don‚Äôt have enough entertainment in Japanese. Also I needed help and rang the bell but nobody came. I rang it 5 times and waited for an hour. Finally I had to look for a flight attendant and asked her to help me. Whenever I fly with a Japanese airline, this never happened. If I ring the bell, someone come to help me iimediately.

title: Nice flight
review_text:
Nice quiet flight.
Comfortable seta, quick and accurate service. Could sleep a bit after lunch, but the flight was just 7h 20, so after lunch they came again with the second service just 3 hours after...

title: Although Precised ......
review_text: Although short flight ‚Äò‚Äòtwas only for one hour & 30mins? it left On time, precised, good customer service. The pilot was good, I hardly felt when the wheels touched the ground..it was a smooth flight.

title: Great flight, great service
review_text: I try to fly Swiss whenever I go to Europe.  This flight was on time, service was fantastic, food was great and we arrived early.  One of the best.

title: Great Service
review_text: The lounge in Zurich is great, the flight was fast and efficient with good service.  The lounge in Paris was ok but we were expecting more, however Zurich was simply wonderful

title: Great service and premium feel
review_text: First time with Swiss in business class, and I have to say it was great, compared to Air Canada Swiss's business class is superior in every way (better food, better service, better beds, ...)

title: Premium airline
review_text: We flew with connection in Zurich. Exceptional service. Outstanding. In Zurich we were taken from the plane by luxury Mercedes to a terminal. To hassle free zone where you can reach all gates. The business lounge in Zurich also very nice. Prices are adequate for tickets.

title: Perfect a always!!!  :-)
review_text: We always choose Swiss if possible, the service is perfectly friendly, the food is great (I had a vegan meal) all is in top quality and from Zurich there are dozens of direct flights to destinations all over the planet

title: Great flights!!
review_text: The sears are comfortable and roomy. The service was wonderful. The prices were very reasonable. Would definitely use this airline again!

title: City hops
review_text: Very Good service from Dusseldorf to Zurich and later on from Zurich to London Heathrow. Check in Dusseldorf  was fast and efficient as to in Zurich. The flight is short and the service also very good. The aircraft cabin interior is well maintained and clean. The arrival into Zurich was good, not too long walk. This was more or less the same for the trip to London, however unfortunately with no interline agreement with Aer Lingus I was unable to check by bag through to my final destination.

title: Swiss assurance at its best
review_text:
Well the Swiss flight from Zurich to Mumbai leaves Zurich at 9.45 am and reaches Mumbai at 10 .30 pm local time Mumbai. 
We were a family of 4 and the flight was very comfortable .
The flight has Indian cabin crew and also Swiss crew . The food and beverage quality and service is extremely good and they go out of there way to make you comfortable. 
My only grouse is the leg space which is very limited and the seats are too narrow apart from this no complaints .
Special mention must be made of Ms ROOIE JALGAONKAR who took good care of us and is an excellent air hostess .
The vegetarian food is also top notch 
I would recommend this route on Swiss airline for direct reach between india to Switzerland 
Will fly this airline again

title: Service with a smile
review_text: The Airbus 330 that they fly is a comfortable aircraft with decent legspace even in economy . Vegetarian food was very nice . The staff was friendly. Customer Service was also very prompt . Good selection of movies and shows for entertainment . Convenient timings in and out of Mumbai was an added plus .

title: Meet our expectations
review_text:
Feel good, I like to travel with them.
Seats are more comfortable than Air Transat,
food is Ok, wine not so bad, free chocolate provided ,
of course we travel to Switzerland.

title: Unexpected and wonderful surprise upgrade in Business Class
review_text: I had a wheelchair assistance and was about to get through the Boarding gate when the Ground Steward gave me a paper indicating a new seating. I was about to protest when he informed me that it was my lucky day. I did not understand at first till he smiled and said I was upgraded to Business class. I had an unbelievably comfortable flight, the crew were attentive, ( I have been a frequent traveler in economy class and the crew is equally attentive) but a a comfortable space, a place to lie down and get a restful sleep during the long flight was really wonderful. Thank you, Swiss Air !

title: Flying backwards isn't my idea of fun
review_text: I guess it was my fault for not paying closer attention, but it never occurred to me that a flight from Nairobi to Zurich would begin with a backwards leg to Dar es Saalem, making an eight hour flight into an eleven hour flight.  Also, the lack of access to the back of the aircraft restricted my ability to stretch my legs during this long flight and the fully reclined seat in front of me made the eleven hours quite uncomfortable.

title: Lovely experience
review_text: Seats were comfortable, service was lovely, food was very nice and plentiful (even for a vegan like me). Blankets and pillows were provided and the temperature was comfortable. One small complaint is that the entertainment system was poor quality and outdated; I'm glad I had my iPad with content download from Netflix.

title: I had a terrible experience with Swiss Air. It was my first and most definitely the last time flying this airline.
review_text:
On August 06, 2018 my family (two adults and two underage children) was taking a flight from Newark to Moscow with two connections (in Zurich and Vienna)

Our flights have been delayed multiple times ‚Äì not just at the original point of departure but also on the connecting flight as well. Overall, the delay time exceeded 10 hours above the expected travel time.

There were no meals or refreshments offered. No assistance provided. More than that when a request for assistance has been raised it was denied at the airport counter.

My repeated requests for the issue to be addressed have been left unanswered or answered in an inappropriate manner. My attempts to contact the airline both online and over the phone have not yet received an adequate response.

I have never seen such appalling customer service and lack of communication.

title: Great comfortable flight
review_text: Traveling from Newark to Zurich is an eight hour flight, but the flight attendants and service made it seem less. Comfortable seating . Good meals and snacks. Great service. Would fly them again!

title: compare with USA side airlines companies
review_text: Service attitude is better than USA side airlines companies.  Food is better, too. But, same thing happen as US side airlines which overbook. But, they solved the problem fast and make everybody happy.

title: Comfortable and swift
review_text:
We took the Swiss flight to JFK via Zurich. This was the first time to take our son on an international vacation and that too such a long distance. One of our priorities were to ensure this long journey to be a comfortable one for him and also we reached our destination in a reasonable time. Only Swiss Air could ensue both of  these were met, albeit at a slightly higher cost.
The gate for the connecting flight being at the same terminal E at Zurich, was like an icing on the cake. Lesser connecting time (3 hours layover) and less distance to cover is absolutely ideal. Moreover, the Zurich airport is very quite and pleasant unlike the other busy hubs like Frankfurt & Heathrow. Also, my earlier experience through Abu Dhabi was not so memorable.
We reached JFK at 2pm, and were well within time for a couple of drinks and dinner will our relatives.
The only thing we could point out for improvement is that the airline staff could have been cordial especially towards  families travelling with children. 
Overall aGreat experience!!

title: Poor Service or Harassment?
review_text: I live part time in Switzerland and I am a Miles-and-More Senator member, hence I shouldbbe flying Swiss a lot more frequently.  Unfortunately in recent years I have avoided flying Swiss because the service is really poor compared to other StarAlliance airlines.  The crew is often arrogant and rude.  It is impossible to redeem free tickets during popular travel months.  And now it costs extra to have my preferred business class seat.   My latest experience just adds to the list.  Yesterday my husband and I were on LX3558 (code-shared with Austrian airline) from Zurich to Vienna.  When we were waiting for boarding, a Swiss ground staff came over and told me that my carry-on bag was too big for the cabin hold and had to be checked in.  I had never had any problem taking my carry-on into any aircraft but he insisted and said the flight was full.  It was nearly 8pm so we were already late for a 7:50pm scheduled departure,  I really did not want to have to wait for checked luggage at Vienna but I agreed thinking if the flight was full, we should all contribute a little.  However, after he made a big show of making me check in my carry-on, he hassled no one else.  I looked around and saw that several passengers had bigger carry-ons than I did but were not bothered.  I seemed to be his single target for some reason.  Unhappy with this revelation, I decided to take my carry-on into the plane anyway.  My case fit into the overhead compartment without any problem.  Thankfully the crew was from Austrian airline.  Not only did they not make a fuss about my case, they even helped me remove the checked luggage tag.  I don't know how else to call this incident other than pure harassment.  Is it because I am Asian or a woman?   I have no idea but I do know I will try even harder in the future to avoid any flight associate with Swiss.

title: cheerful service .. comfy flight
review_text: On time .. Cheerful service .. Flight was quite empty so had plenty of space for hand baggages .. Didn't bother us for 1 Kg over 23 Kg checked baggage .. Gave a kid kit for our 3 year old

title: Old aircraft with poor facilities.
review_text: The service was very good and food was satisfactory but for a 9 hour flight the aircraft was terrible. It was an old plane with a very poor entertainment system which had to be continually re booted as it kept breaking down. My seat belt did not work, the seat was uncomfortable, the toilet did not flush properly. For such a long flight a very poor choice of aircraft.

title: Still a treat to fly business
review_text: This was my first time in Swiss business class and it still feels such a treat. We experienced the A330 going to Boston and the A340 flying back to Zurich. The A340 is one of my fave planes (nerd) but the A330 seemed to offer a better experience

title: My worst flight ever
review_text: It was my worst (night) flight ever :( Flight was delayed for more than 40 min. Headphones didn't work, so using "entertainment on board" was impossible. Seats were completely uncomfortable, it was impossible to even doze off, not to mention sleeping. A small piece of bread with cheese was called "Dinner" by Swiss. So when we landed we were very hungry and angry. It was our wrong choice to fly with Swiss :((((((

title: Should be better for the price
review_text: The flight was canceled and I had to wait about 2 hours in a long queue to have another flight arranged. Limited food with no meat and bad on board service.

title: top rate airline.....back to its old format before it went bust but now part of Lufthansa...super staff and service .bea
review_text: TOP RATE SERVICE FROM VERY SLICK AIRLINE ...no airs and graces like some airlines just top quality attention ..

title: Swiss International - Great International Airline!
review_text: I travel internationally once, sometimes twice a year.  Swiss International is the best airline I've flown.  If I can make connections, I'll book with them again!  Michael Struermpler; Fort Collins, CO  USA

title: Good flight
review_text: Late departure and not well organised boarding. Overall, service on board efficient and crew helpful and attentive.

title: Very friendly staff . The flight was on time . Excellent dinner . Recommended !
review_text: Our flight was was on time . The staff was very friendly . Dinner was excellent . Even with free  wine . The Swiss chocolate they offer is great . Highly recommended !

title: Very good airline
review_text: Loved this airline , Timing and inflight service, excellent food and professional Indian airline staff takes care nicely. Seats are ok .

title: Good service
review_text: Our trip was comfortable and relaxing, the personal were always nice with us and helpful. I just think that they can do it better for example with the food and the airplane was old. But anyway a nice trip!

title: Good Service
review_text: Service was good. Had a safe journey. Staff were very nice. We felt very much comfortable though it was short journey.

title: Do not use
review_text: Do not use if you have connection flight as they tend to be at least an hour late. They also handle very bad the handbag situation so people will just fill in the cabin with bags. The comfort in the plane is comparable to cheep, low cost airlines. There are many other bad comments I would make but I consider this ones the most important.

title: On time
review_text: The flight was on time. For once,very friendly staff. The seats were ok, not more. Dinner excellent, breakfast a disaster/joke.

title: Ridiculous
review_text: Flying from Geneve or Zurich  to London seems that makes differences for Swiss Airlines in terms of services on board even if both cities are important and similar for mileage  from UK. If "drink and snack" flying from Zurich means a selection of soft drinks and a little sandwich plus the famous "welcome chocolate thin", flying from Geneve this means a glass of water (a choice between still or sparkling) and the unmissable welcome chocolate that automatically became "the snack". Other food is free for first class travellers or available to buy to the on board shop. √áa va sans dir that the service on board of one of the best European flagship airlines is something that should be a company standard like the chocolate. Otherwise the difference of price from a low cost company is not justifiable.

title: The ONLY way to/from Tel Aviv!!
review_text: Do this a few times a year and having travelled on many airlines I must say the only way to and from Israel is on board Swiss First class seating on an A330 with business class service Can't wait for my next trip to Israelüá¨üá∑üáÆüá±

title: FIRST CLASS WITH BIZ SERVICE
review_text: Connecting from Swiss First from Hong Kong now to Tel Aviv from Zurich First class seating with Business Class service Good food wine and departure as well as arroval in Tel Aviv lack of refresher towellettes in bathrooms  It simply is the best way to fly to Tel Aviv

title: loooooong trip
review_text: flight to Moscow was excellent ,no delays, no problems whatsoever, the return flight was so cramped, the people in front of us was rude and had the only extra seat on the plane, my mother in law, turned sick over the Atlantic and I asked if I could use the extra seat so my mother in law could stretch  out, they said no and the stewardesses would do nothing except tell me I needed to sit down, so I continue to go the restroom for about 7 hours

title: Helpful for disabled passengers.
review_text: This airline was SO helpful to my disabled mother. Staff were really friendly, and assisted in any way they can. The snacks they offer is great, and they have chocolate! We flew 4 times as we had to catch a connecting flight to Zurich, and they were great all four times! Would fly with Swiss again.

title: No delays, pleasant flight.
review_text: Pleasant flight without delays. Very helpful staff and good food. Plenty of new movies to watch. Everything as it should be in economy class.

title: Worst check in ever
review_text:
Worst check in ever. The swiss staff at Berlin TXL airport didn't even try to be polite.
The flight was late so I had to run to get my connection flight.

title: Wonderful service
review_text: We flew from Zurich to Rome maybe an hour and a half. We received more food and beverage in a short flight than we did with US carries for 8 hour flights.

title: Awful
review_text: Long flight and the least leg room I have ever had on a flight. We were offered an up grade for extra ¬£150 each. As the total journey was going to be in excess of 11 hours we said we were interested. We were shown the upgrade seats and decided against it. At most the extra leg room was a further 4 cm. The crew had to be the most miserable and unhelpful group I have ever encountered. Very surprised at Swiss Air (it was Edelweiss plane) I expected much better. Will not travel with them again.

title: The only airline running a decent business class between Asia and Europe
review_text:
For many reasons, I do not really like LX as I have found them inflexible if something goes wrong and they make me nervous about itinerary changes.  

But there is one important point for tall people. The business class on the 777 is the only one that gives adequate leg room and comfort. The so-called flat beds on the 380 and other Airbuses are miserable and cause me pain after 2 hours.

title: Good but with room for improvement
review_text: A good flight experience overall which was marred by poor transfer management: We had over 1 hr for transfer in Zurich, and we just barely made it: We sat far back in the place from Hong Kong, there was a random passport check upon exiting the plane. And Swiss personnel made absolutely no effort to even check if there were any passengers on the plane who had to catch a connecting flight. Also, inflight entertainment was not accessible until about 45 minutes after take-off - that is how long the Swiss ads took. I would fly Swiss again, but I would make sure to tell cabin crew about my connection time.

title: Swiss Air really look after their passengers.
review_text: Swiss air still serve free food and drinks on their flights. They hand out chocolate and look after children very well with colouring materials, stickers. Our 5 year old grandson was on his first ever flight and was able to go and see the pilot in the cockpit after we had landed. He even had his photo taken wearing the captains no hat!

title: Great Service
review_text: I felt like I had gone back in time to a service level airlines used to provide. The food and drink was outstanding and the flight crew was friendly, professional and responsive. Highly recommended!

title: Avoid like plague.
review_text:
Old, outdated fleet and tiered, uninspired and rude cabin crew. Same experience on two connected flights (Shanghai- Zurich and Zurich - Stockholm). 

Certainly not the level of service and comfort one would expect when traveling business class.

title: well structured company
review_text: polite stuff; service above the average; quite good 'food'; sit very clean and flexible with enough 'space'

title: A joy to fly.
review_text: A very comfortable trip, with lie flat beds for the longest part of the journey from Israel to Zurich. The service from all their staff is warm and friendly. The menu choices are very tasty for airplane food. take off and landing were on time.

title: Very well geared for a long night-time journey
review_text: The entire 8 and a half hour flight was at night. Thoughtful service allowed us to easily choose whether to eat,watch a film or sleep. The fact that we had minimal jet lag at the end is thanks largely to the crew and the seats

title: Professional and in time
review_text: Professional, on time, good service, clean, booked a row with extra legroom, so comfort was better than business, still have a frequent flyer card, so check in without waiting.

title: Swiss Air. NEVER AGAIN
review_text:
DO NOT FLY SWISS AIR!! WORST FLIGHT OF MY LIFE
the flights are relatively cheap but just pay a little more and you can get so MUCH better!
* THE FLIGHT ATTENDANTS SUPER RUDE!!! I fly a lot on loads of different airlines but I have never come across such rude flight attendants! they are ignorant and do not care about your requests!
* The airplane I flew in was very small and old also dirty and did not smell good 
* THEY MAKE UP RULES LAST MINUTE! So I was traveling with 2 bags one mini backpack and one overhead suitcase which went in the aircraft perfectly fine on my first flight but on the r second flight you were apparently only allowed ONE bag so they took AWAY my small suitcase LAST MINUTE WHILE I WAS BOARDING saying i wasn‚Äôt following the rules and you were only allowed one handbag! which left me with a tiny backpack that could fit on my lap, i offered to put my small suitcase under my feet because it would fit but the VERY RUDE check in assistant said NO and THEN ASKED ME TO MOVE OUT OF THE WAY BECAUSE I WAS DISRUPTING BOARDING! 
        THE STAFF WERE SO RUDE I WILL NEVER AGAIN STEP A FOOT ON SWISS AIR AGAIN!!! AVOID THIS YOU CAN FIND MUCH BETTER!
(oh and note that the food was absolutely trash to me and they don‚Äôt have vegan options they give you an old sandwich that has been sitting somewhere for a week)

They are arrogant and do not admit they can‚Äôt organize themselves so they blame the fault on you.

title: Swissflight
review_text: its not my first swissflight, as usually i take singapore airline or emirates. for me swiss is ok, thats all. not faire to compare with singapore or emirates.

title: Professional and Efficient
review_text: It was a pleasure flying with Swiss. There aircraft was clean and comfortable and everything about the journey was professional and efficient - just what you want when you are traveling on business.

title: Excellent Airline
review_text: This is a first class Airline, great service and you get free food and drink on-board - BA pay attention.

title: ‚ÄúDelayed but not Derailed‚Äù
Nice servive and crew
review_text: Traveled with two kids and they took great care of us. Kids even received toys and stuffed airplanes.

title: Off to Prague
review_text: Just a wonderful experience from check in to flight. Everyone was pleasant and helpful. When I travel I will try to fly Swiss Air every time.  Thank you.

title: Swiss quality everywhere
review_text: Everything was of Swiss quality from the first check-in in Bucharest to the last sip of red wine... Food is excellent, beer and the red/white wine - of very good quality. During the very long flight (12/13 hours) between Zurich and Singapore there were free water, fruits, cookies on the corridor. Selection of movies/music is very good, staff are extremely helpful, polite and even friendly. I would probably fly again Swiss, especially on long routes.

title: easy , smooth and comfortable
review_text: online booking was easy; checking in fast and smooth; flight comfortable; good inflight service; nice and friendly staff.

title: SWISS hospitality with good food even in economy class
review_text:
Being a frequent traveller between Europe and the US (California) I have tried out several Airlines, mostly travelling with the German Carrier Lufthansa. This time I picked Swiss because they offered a really good price. I liked especially the good food, offering also a vegetarian dish. The entertainment performance was not as good as the Lufthansa standart but that didn‚Äòt really matter, I had brought a good book.
All in all, a good value for a low price.

title: Really Good
review_text:
We took Swiss Airlines to fly to New York during our holidays (leaving and coming back to Geneva) and it was really nice. Price was 400‚Ç¨ to go and come back, tickets bought 2 months ago, timetable of both flights really convenient.
On time, excellent food and service on board.
The space for legs was not crazy and the plane wasn't top new but it was quite OK.
We will use this company again in the future !

title: Leg room better on Bombardier CS300
review_text:
The flight from Dublin to Zurich was on a Bombardier CS300 I think. I took a photo of the safety brochure but cannot find it.

The Bombardier has three seats on one side and two on the other. I choose the seat at the back near the toilets as it is more practical and I wanted to take photos so the wings do not block me taking reasonable photos.

I was lucky on the way back at the seat beside me which is an aisle seat was vacant. I could use the table to put my drink and coffee. There is also a small quiche.

Service is good and one of the toilets but I now not sure on which flight was really spacious. First time ever.

I am quite impressed by the new planes from Bombardier.

title: Space still a problem, otherwisw not bad
review_text:
I traveled this time to Dublin with Swiss. Their timings are better as they fly at 12.00, Aer Lingus is late evening and if the incoming flight is late, you can get stranded in Zurich.

Swiss have a baggage allowance of 23 kgs while Aer Lingus is only 20 kgs. I like to bring back some sausages, black and white pudding, rashers and brown bread which I cannot get here. Swiss also offer a drink and something to eat.

I have only the complaint that the leg room or room one has when the table id down is not great and when you are a little bit of a tummy then it is uncomfortable.
 
Toilets are also quite small and very uncomfortable. I like Swiss never the less more than other airlines.

It was an Airbus but I cannot remember what model.

title: Cancelled connection flight twice during my second time traveling with Swiss - No Reason
review_text: I arrived from New York (JFK) to Geneva (GVA) on time as per itinerary via SWISS airline. As soon as I got there SWISS told me that the flight is cancelled without giving any specific reason. They took my connecting flight boarding pass. They told me you need to figure this out with Swiss or call them. I didn't have phone working there internationally in Geneva and no SWISS person helped. I was stuck there without any help, I had to get out to customs to go to swiss terminal. At the terminal, I told SWISS I have another flight from Moscow (DME) to Krasnoyarsk (KJA) at 10pm the same day, they provided no help. They told me it is your responsibility even though SWISS cancelled the flight. I was re-routed to London then to Moscow (DME) but arrived way too late and lost the second flight as well and all money. I had to spend the night at the hotel in Moscow and call the next flight pay money to book a morning flight. I had requested SWISS if they can give me an earlier flight but no help, I had a 14 hours difference for my Moscow flight and they could have helped. This is the second time SWISS has done this to me at Geneva, I had a connection flight last year and they cancelled as soon as I arrived at Geneva. This is ridiculous and they are not helping or taking responsibility. I had to spend entire day in Geneva, Many hours in re-route London without food, missed my flight in Moscow, had to make international 2 hour call to get a new flight from Moscow, had to pay for hotel and food. I have spent a lot of time and money and lost 2 days of my vacation time. I have travelled a lot but I have never had any airline treat me like this. My flight info: Online Checkin Number: WFLEX9 | E-Ticket Number: 724712274685152 Flight One LX23 - JFK - GVA - Sunday, September 09, 2018 - Monday, September 10, 2018 Flight Two Cancelled LX1336 - GVA - DME - Monday, September 10, 2018 - Monday, September 10, 2018.  This is the worst airline as they can cancel flights on a normal day on your connection without notice. This airline has done this to me twice and provided no resolution or took responsibility.  I even informed BBB and as you can see they don't care, this is the only airline with an a E rating and no communication! - I will never fly this airline and told all my friends as well!

title: Comfortable long haul with transfer in Zurich
review_text:
We a family of 3 consisting of 2 adults and 7 year old child was flying to Orlando with stop at Zurich, we found staff very pleasant helpful and polite, Staff went that extra mile to ensure children were comfortable and even gave them a bag containing cards, pencils and colouring pad which my little one loved and used during and after flight, transition from one flight to another was smooth and families able to access plane first making easier to manage children and get them seated comfortably and quickly. Tablets provided at seating and little one enjoyed flicking through films and games selection using own head set able to have his own snacks in front of him. Plane food was not to bad but what can do you expected pretty standard but tasteful. 
I would recommend Swiss air for any family travelling with children. Leg room is average and no Que for toilet able to more around a little

title: only good for safety record
review_text: Again - Swiss never ceases to negatively surprise me. While other airlines make it really easy to book, use miles, use their customer service line, Swiss keeps adding obstacles to the process before and after the flight. Today I found out that booking by phone is more expensive than via online even thought the website was down today. No problem, customer pays for the problem - not Swiss.

title: Swiss always delivers
review_text: Swiss is in my opinion the far best air travel provider irrespective of traveling 1st, business or economy.

title: Short flight from Barcelona to Zurich
review_text:
Grabbing a good deal with Swiss Air while booking well in advance and luggage allowance we needed. Check-in was quick and trouble free and some time to spare before departure. To our surprise the incoming flight was 25mins delayed which means also our flight got delayed, unexpected for Swiss.
However, boarding took also longer and wasn't announced by seat rows which makes it faster. Flight time was approx. 1.5hrs and weather was ideal to watch the scenery below us with the mediterrean sea and alps later on. A light snack a drinks were served swiftly and of course some swiss chocolate. Overall a nice experience.

title: Boarding not by rows - Not very friendly staff
review_text:
The boarding in Montreal was completely "open" once First and Business class passengers were on the plain. No first entries for families with small children, no calling out by rows a.s.o. - just nothing! Thus the boarding in Economy was quite chaotic!

Being Swiss I expected the flight a bit "like comig home already" (Swiss has an advertisment going in that direction), but was quite disappointed. In the Airbus A330-300 the room between rows was narrow. The man in front of me reclined all the way and when dinner was served he wasn't asked to get his chair in a upright position. Eating squeezed in like that was very difficult! 

In the time between the servings of dinner and breakfast, no-one ever came by with a class of water or juice - no FA to be seen. At least one toilet ran completely out of paper before an FA even noticedl 

For breakfast we were served a box that contained all the things Swiss probably considers us to need for breakfast (ratzher poor choice!). Only the croissants were warm but nothing else (e.g there was no omelette or similar)! No one was asked if the box provided was the thing they wanted - it was just given to you without commentary. 

For me "being already at home a little" surely looks different!

title: Incredible small pitch
review_text:
We chose Swiss as we were looking for a cheaper option to a direct flight and the shorter flight from Europe to Asia.
There were  several problems:
1. You do not board by numbers but en masse so the people in row 20 are blocking the access for those in rows 40+.This must delay departure as we were always late in 4 flights.
2. The pitch of the economy was incredible small .I am  not tall 5 10 (1.78) but it was painful for me to get in and out .Good job my bladder was strong doe an 11 hour flight. Coming back I managed to get a n aisle seat which meant I could expand into the aisle  at the expense of being trollied on a regular basis.
I did get offered the option to make a bid for the up market seat but the minimum offer was around ¬£1000 so considering that we only payed ¬£1000 for us both for there and back so to pay ¬£2000 for one leg  made no economic sense.
3. The flight from London come sinto one terminal and leaves from another  one whih requires time and effort to find.Once you left the immediate area of the palne you were on your own to find the connection. Especially difficult on the reurn journey as the transfer time wasonly 20 odd minutes and we had to go through security (shoes of f /belt off) and then get down the terminal. Very stressful.
The good news was that our bags did not make the flight but were delivered safe and sound the next day 120 miles away from Heathrow.

Did we pay too little and should have expected the problem? I don't think I have seen such a small aperture for  a seat even on Ryan air and Easyjet so to have this little  space for over 11 hours is too little..

title: On Our Way Home
review_text:
Very friendly staff.  Flight was on time. 
Seats were ok for short flight.  My first time on this airline. Not much leg room which is normal in economy.

title: Refused upgrade on miles because there was no "Biz Class" meal available.
review_text:
Econ class ok.  Travel for quick family visit instead of on business.  On return leg sought upgrade to biz using miles as a status traveler.  There were seats available (which I saw on flight) but I was told if there was no biz class meal available they could not upgrade.  Other airlines have told me this before, but if I said econ meal is okay, the upgrade granted.  Even purser was puzzled when I told him as I boarded.  

Convinced me to avoid Swiss legs on personal travel if this is the sort of excuse you get.

title: Ok flight but seats were cramped on the 777-300ER
review_text: Other than the B777-300ER, my other short haul flight with Swiss was ok. This one however, the boarding at Zurich Airport was a free for all. Meaning the boarding procedure was messy. Some people were even cutting the queue. Another bad thing was that the FAs dont ask the person infront of you to recline their seat during meal service, the FA just asked me to adjust the way i eat?!?! SERIOUSLY? The guy infront of me was on full recline while i tried to eat during meal service. And no, the person infront was not sleeping. While the IFE is good, the seats on this configuration (B777-300ER) was super cramped. On other airlines, the economy on the 777s would have a 3-3-3 configuration, Swiss has a 3-4-3 configuration. Im 1.79m in height and the legroom wasnt so good. I am comparing based on my SQ and LH experience which had way better legroom. To be fair with Swiss, the Food was very good. Both dinner and breakfast. Hope they fix the boarding procedure for large aircraft at Zurich Airport. Also hope they train their FAs to ask people to recline their seats during meal service.

title: Very friendly staff
review_text:
The best thing about this flight were the friendliness of the whole staff. Very attentive and kind at all times.
The food wasn‚Äôt very good tho and the seats very narrow but overall a very good experience!

title: Will do everything to avoid cancellation fees!! Flights are always delayed ...not very Swiss at all!!
review_text:
I have had now few Swiss air flight cancellations from london and delays of over 7 hrs. Besides lack of clarity and infomation given by Swissair...
They will do everything to avoid paying out compensation, customer care is poor, evasive and slow to respond.

At least you know where u stand with easyjet, whereas Swissair are very fake!

title: Great flight from Chicago to Tel Aviv via Zurich
review_text: Wonderful configuration  with individual seating. Seats were easy to adjust to flat beds on Chicago to Zurich portion. Beautiful airline club in Zurich for Business Class travelers with great breakfast buffet. Easy to use entertainment device. Friendly and efficient Swiss service

title: It was just an OK flight.
