review_text: This flight was on a Swiss Air 777.  We were upgraded to the single "throne" seat in Business Class.  This is normally a $199 upgrade.  I am glad I did not spend the money for the upgrade I don't feel it is worth it.  You are by yourself, with no one beside you, but it felt a little claustrophobic and I don't feel like you had as much leg room as the regular 2 across business seats.  The food was rather exotic and I can't say I cared for it.  The food in lounge prior to boarding was great.

title: BIG disappointment
review_text:
Flew business class from Zurich to Tel Aviv.

The crew was antisocial, not even one small smile from any crew member

at dinner I ordered my choice and was forgotten. only when they went by to clean the trays they realised that I was not served the main dish. of course I have pushed the call button few times but no one came.

Movie collection is very old and not updated

SWISS used to be one of the best airlines, the crew on this flight made me feel un wanted and un welcomed.

value for money very low

title: Average airline
review_text: Flights were slightly late and food was not great. Staff was nice and the had great kid offering like coloring book and sticker activity. Good movie selection too!

title: A unique flight over the alps with mountain comments from the pilot!
review_text: It was a beautiful, sunny and very clear day and the pilots have been advised to fly "low height". Thus we could enjoy a fantastic view on the Swiss and French Alps in the afternoon sun. The pilot preannounced the respective icon mountains like Matterhorn or Mont Blanc and most of the passengers took pictures through the windows. Beside, it was a very good quality service and the landing in Palma outstandingly smooth - cudos go to the pilots!

title: Excellent and On Time service
review_text: Flew SWISS International Air Lines from Delhi to Zurich and back. It was a great experience on their A330, with wonderful food, delicious wine and of course, Swiss chocolates in the flight! SWISS contrasts a very Switzerland like experience, with its on time service, hospitality and compulsory Swiss-German greeting at the door of the aircraft.

title: Class system is misleading
review_text: I paid (relatively) high rate for tickets and received only 50% of frequent flyer miles. The flight was good but seat room was terrible. Movies VERY old!

title: Very old movies, poor food
review_text: Food was SO limited and not too fresh! Entertainment system was problematic to operate and movies were VERY old!

title: no room, no miles!
review_text: Why didn't we get miles for this flight though we paid regular amount? Swiss and God only know. Movies VERY old!

title: Too crowded
review_text: Although I paid extra for better seats (more room) we had very limited space. This made the whole flight to be a nightmare/ movies were VERY old and chip.

title: Limited weight for carry on luggage
review_text: We always travel with just a carryon suitcase and have never had a problem with weight as the size is not a problem. Each of our carryons were over their weight limit, so we had to check our bags. Besides that, our flight was nice. Real food - even served wine at no extra charge.

title: Beware Swiss Business class in Boeing 777-300ER!
review_text: The configuration of the Business Class seats in this plane is unusual in that all seats are definitely not equal. The seats on each window side of the plane alternate single with double seats but the double seats have only a small table between them to share and combined take up the same width as the single 'Throne Seats' in front and behind, which have massive 'arms' on either side for spreading out belongings. These small double seats also have no other storage space so everything has to be thrown under your feet on the floor. The middle section of the Business class cabin has two seats side by side for the entire length but these have more space, with individual side tables for each passenger. Look closely at the seat configuration before you reserve your seats and definitely don't book the double window seats unless you're a couple and don't mind sharing the small table space available between you (and also don't mind climbing over your partner to get out if you're on the window!) Cabin service was only fair and food uninspiring.

title: Don't waste your money on business class
review_text: This was my first time on Swiss as it was the only option to get to Greece.  The business class seats are narrow, in order to accommodate a 12" console separating the seats. When trying to shift the seat to bed mode, there is an armrest that jabs into your back or stomach, depending on which side you lie on.  Tight, narrow and plenty uncomfortable for my 9.5 flight, not to mention every food selection had allergins: nuts, fish, oats, with no simple selection. I'll never fly on Swiss again.

title: Keep it up
review_text: Flew first time with swissair and I must say it was better than I expected. Seat to me is comfortable compare to other flights. Food and service is good. Will definitely fly with them again for Europe tour.

title: I miss the 2010 Swiss Airline
review_text: My seat was broken (8K). It did not recline at all. I pressed the bottom as soon as I realized that my seat was broken. It took some time before they come. A flight attendant from another section came to adjust my seat with her knee (this fight attendant provides a great service).  The service deteriorated since the last time that I traveled with this airline. The presentation of the food is low. In addition, when the flight attendant was serving me my dessert, she hit the top of my dessert with the food cart and she served it to me like that anyway. The true, I did not enjoy the flight.   I will scored 9 based on recommendation because I can not judge the other flights.

title: Overnight Flight to Zurich.
review_text: Had seats right in front of the bathrooms.  Although not having to worry about the person behind me when I reclined my seat was nice, the toilet flushing all night was not.  Also had the isle seat so my arm and shoulder was bumped into all night as well.  Also the person in front of me reclined their seat as far as it would go and was very restless so his seat was bouncing in my face a lot. Didn't sleep much on an overnight flight.

title: A Pain
review_text: A pain.  I booked a ticket through expedia that had a checked bag included.  At the airport coming home, they claimed I did not do this.  I had all the receipts of my booking saying I did with me (and could access it online), but they still would not honor the checked bag and charged me 393 DKK.  The customer service basically shrugged at me so instead of keeping a customer by NOT seeing through the old bait-and-switch technique, they get this review.

title: Improving timeliness
review_text: Compared to my previous review there is a great imprpvement that Swiss achieved at area of timeliness. The service on board is still extremely polite and careful. Quality of catering is also excellent. I highly recommend to fly with Swiss as you receive some Swiss excellence during your tiring journey which differentiates this company from its competitors. Well done Swiss.

title: Consistent good service
review_text: I flew with Swiss Air twice in one month and the second flight was better than the first. They have officially become my preferred service provider. Friendly staff, excellent condition of planes. It was my pleasure flying with them!

title: Best Economy
review_text: Having travelled extensively on economy and business class. I found Swiss to be best for economy flights. Decent leg room, with pleasant and professional staff.  The new bombardier 100/300 was also a nice design. Definitely recommend.

title: Good airline
review_text: I flew with swiss from delgi to dublin connecting in switzerland. It was a night time flight. Plane is very comfortable to fly with long haul and food is adequate. Only problem i had both flying to and from delhi was my monitor did not work to watch anything for the duration of the flight.

title: Zurich to San Francisco - less than comfortable
review_text:
First off, the flight crew were great. Pleasant and appropriately talkative. If I was only rating them, the rating would be higher. The food was also better than I was expecting.

I was flying economy and I was expecting there to be little in the way of space or comfortable cushions and this was, in fact, the case. My personal problem happened when the gentleman seated next to me was huge, 6'6" or taller. It was impossible for him not to be spilling into my seat and space (the way Swiss Air seats are supported means that the two inside seats in the central seating area have shared space underneath). I can't blame him for being so large, but I can be annoyed with Swiss Air for not creating a better design for shared space; or seeing that a person that large would have to take up more space than the seating provides and coming up with some sort of  a solution. 

In the future, if there is another decently reviewed airline available for our flights, we will likely take them.

title: Too close for comfort
review_text: Everything about the flight was fine except that there is absolutely no leg room and on a flight for 8 hours plus that's a problem. Add to that the person in front of me was in full recline for the entire flight. I know people like to recline, but I couldn't even move my legs.I think Swiss Airlines should look into shortening the the amount a seat can recline. That or remove a row or two of seats to add leg room. I won't ever fly abroad on Swiss Air again. Because we were traveling with a group we were told we couldn't upgrade. I don't know how true this was.

title: flight from Montreal to Zurich
review_text: As usual the Swiss efficiency. We push back exactly at 1750. Dinner and breakfast were both excellent. The only complaint I have is the plane temperature was almost hot. we had to fan our shelf most to the flight. Other than that very thing was perfect.

title: They handled the cancelled flight very well
review_text: We got the email cancellation of the flight when we were already in the airport, so we went to the service desk right away. They told us that everyone in the cancelled flight would be moved to the earlier flight, so we're safe (our luggages as well). The transfer process was a bit long because their system had an error, but all the staff in the service desk were very helpful. We arrived in Zurich with sufficient amount of time for our connecting flight to Singapore. The downside was the legroom was really narrow and the movie selection was rather old.

title: Swiss flights are always delayed
review_text: I often flight on Swiss and they have been consistent only in one aspect - each and every single time delayed. Last flight was delayed by 1h20 and the plane was making circles around Zurich. In future whenever I can I will flight other airlines.

title: great aircraft B777, attentiv and caring service on board, good quality of food , served in time
review_text: Great crew, good meal , high comfort of seat, meal service in time , movie selection could be more update.

title: Awful
review_text: I‚Äôm going to keep this short since the story is so long but AWFUL AND RUDE airline! We were promised by three Swiss Air representatives that a 50 minute connecting flight would be fine and plenty of time, after concern about it being a short connection. Ended up missing the connection due to the first flight being delayed as the pilot showed up late. Informed customer service and they informed us ‚Äòwhy did you buy a connection that short‚Äô. (Although originally we were promised it was ample time). They told us to get an overnight hotel in Switzerland, and didn‚Äôt even apologize. Every Swiss Air employee we spoke to about the issue was rude. Almost everyone in the line was complaining about their service and how awful of an airline they are, as about ten people on our fight had the same issue. They also lost our luggage,NEVER taking them again.

title: Excellent service
review_text: The comfort of the cabin is very good, helped by a knowledgeable crew. Only downs are the lack of information in French (although a national language) and a just OK catering. But I will fly again as most other airlines are becoming more and more low cost.

title: Very nice airline
review_text:
This is a very good European airline, comparable to some premium Asian airlines.  The services are good, foods are good (better airline foods) for long haul flight.

The only drawback is that the seat pitch is considerably narrower and the leg room is slighter shorter than her major counterparts from the U.S.  I wonder how an overweight person can possibly sit in comfortably.

 Other than those, Swiss air is a very nice airline.

title: Zurich to Chicago
review_text: Usually I fly to Newark but my connecting flight wasn‚Äôt available. I had no issues flying and the food and service was fine.

title: Superb Customer Services - Pleasured Delay
review_text:
Due to weather delays in Budapest, I missed my connecting flight in Zurich to Barcelona. Upon arrival, I was escorted to the transfer desk, issued a new boarding pass for the next flight and with the same preferred seat
The meal on board was above par and the Swiss wine (first time for me) was superb. It was a flight that one did not want to end really. Excellent crew supervisor.

title: Truly an experience!
review_text: Much recommend to travel with Swiss Airline. They are really professionals in the services and for most people important thing it is highly punctual (nothing new if you are Swiss) but really appreciated. Food offering was good and drinks options were enough as well.

title: Very good flight on Swissair
review_text: After a trip to Russia we flew business class from Moscow to Zurich and then Zurich to Johannesburg. The flights were both comfortable with excellent service and food onboard. The only disappointment was the business class lounges at Moscow and Zurich airports. The lounge at Moscow was small and very hot with no working air conditioner. The selection of food was also limited and quite disappointing. The lounge at Zurich airport was better but still not entirely what I expected from Swissair. The food was adequate but not very good and service was limited. The excellent flights were somewhat countered by the poor lounge facilities.

title: A good European airline
review_text: It was a good flight  made even better by the small bars of Swiss Chocolate  they give you. Being Swiss everything was neat and tidy and on time. But as usual for inter European flights no  back of seat  entertainment.

title: Fine Dining Sky High
review_text: It is the first time I have ever been asked how would you like your steak cooked! And, medium rare it was with a fine glass of red wine. The food and service was first class.

title: An excellent first class product on an excellent airline
review_text:
This recent long haul flight in first class was very impressive. Service was warm/genuine, attentive and extremely professional. The food and wine was of a very high standard and had real wow factor which is always important in first class. What‚Äôs also refreshing is that everything is so very ‚ÄòSwiss‚Äô, staying true to the airline‚Äôs identity which makes it a more interesting experience. 

Lunch starters were served from a display trolley including beautiful hand carved Balik salmon and an array of other exquisite dishes. The soup was delicious as always and the main courses were equally good, as were the desserts. The meal finished with fine Swiss cheeses and the best chocolates I‚Äôve ever had, from Sprungli. The whole meal was a real ‚Äòexperience‚Äô. 

The amenities were of high quality and the cabin was very comfortable. Seats are spacious but only semi-private. Bedding is excellent.

The only element of the journey that was slightly disappointing was the ground experience in Zurich - it could be so much better. There is no ground service for first class as such, unless your incoming flight meets a bizarre set of specific criteria in which case private transfers to/from the aircraft are offered. If you wish to go from their first class lounge in A gates to their lounge at E gates, then a rather unglamous minivan will take you at set shuttle times like catching a bus. Zurich is also an irritating airport to connect through despite its positive reputation, which makes the lack of a comprehensive first class ground service even more obvious. Their newly renovated lounges are an improvement on what was available before but quite stark/cold and not the most luxurious I‚Äôve experienced. They do have high quality a la carte dining options though. 

Overall I wouldn‚Äôt hesitate to recommend Swiss in first class if you are looking for a high quality first class experience on a long haul trip. Their onboard service is excellent in every way. They are definitely one of the best and offer a level of quality/sophistication that many of the Middle East carriers can‚Äôt match, however they are not THE best. After Air France, they come a close second with Cathay Pacific, for me.

title: Good Flight, Goat Rodeo Boarding!
review_text:
The cabin crew were hardworking and very professional.  The food and service were good, but as expected seat pitch in economy was very tight, overall a good flight.

However, boarding Swiss in Zurich is awful, they do not board by row (unlike their boarding out of O'Hare).  It is every man/woman for themselves, creating a chaotic situation with everyone pushing and shoving to board in order to get the limited overhead space.  Folks in the back of the plane are blocked by those closer to the front that take their time getting situated.  I've experienced this on a number of occasions with them.

title: Another amazing trip with Swiss air and a toddler
review_text: I can not even express how amazing the whole experience it was to fly with Swiss air. I flew by myself with 15 months old daughter. All the personnel was super helpful and very sweet. It was 12th flight for my daughter, but by far, the best one. It was the first time I flew with her without my husband, but thanks to Swiss air crew, I didn't even knew, he was not there.

title: Even more delays around the globe - but service is excellent
review_text: I am flying quite frequently with Swiss International Air Lines due to its excellent brand reputation and the service offered on ground and on board. Unfortunately due to the increasing number of planes and passengers, Swiss flights are departing with more and more delays as it happened with me in April. Our flight from Budapest departed with almost 90 minutes delay due to technical difficulties but no one from the ground personal in Budapest airport approached the pax to provide clarification or any ground service / compensation for the interim period. Luckily, I did not have any transfer in Z√ºrich at this time but several passengers were pissed off due to the increasing frequency of similar delays. All in all, the company is providing a unique experience and excellent service, but this phenomenon must be solved in a short run in order to not to lose customers due to lack of punctuality.

title: Very neat and friendly
review_text:
Possible an old A330 but very comfortable seat and more importantly very friendly staff and hostess. 

The food and drinks were flowed all through the journey and all of this with a smile. 

Wonderful flight. Better experience than Emirates from Mumbai to Paris.

title: Out of 20 flights that I took this year with Swiss 17 were delayed
review_text: This is really a horrible airline when speaking about punctuality. I am often on the road between Brussels and Zurich and unfortunately -due to a monopoly- only Swiss flies between these two cities. I also sometimes have to use Swiss for other destinations. It is frustrating that hardly every Swiss flight I take has a delay. When I use Brussels Airlines, Air France, KLM, Aegean or even Alitalia I hardly ever have a delay. As managing partner of my firm we try no everything possible to avoid this airline but not easy if you are based in Zurich. When complaining to Swiss they said it had to do with the capacity of Zurich airport, which is a bad excuse as the other airlines don't seem to have that problem. Hoping for a more fair competition or imanent bankruptcy of this airline and replacement by a more efficient one.

title: Rude customer relations at the boarding gate
review_text:
We had travelled with carry on luggage only on three previous flights in just a few days without any issues. At the boarding gate we were taken aside and told we must check in our luggage. Our luggage was weighed and placed in the sized container. Our luggage was within the weight limit and fitted in the container. By which time the ground crew had printed baggage tags. There were many passengers with more hand luggage than ourselves - we refused to have our luggage loaded in the hold as it was well within the requirements. Our luggage easily fitted in the overhead lockers on the aircraft, the flight was not full and other passengers had no difficulty stowing their luggage.
We remained polite at all times and had the approach of the ground crew shown more courtesy , I might have agreed to our bags being loaded in the hold.

Other than the ground crew, the short flight met our expectations

title: Always worth it's money
review_text:
I use to fly Swiss a lot due to the excellent service, the kindness of the crew, the absolute punctuality and the overall quality of onboard services.

Recently I was flying from Shanghai back to Z√ºrich with an older version of the A330 from Swiss. The flight departed from Shanghai with a little delay but arrived ahead of the schedule in Zurich. 

Although it has been a 12hrs flight, the stay on board was very nice and I always felt very comfortable. The crew always tries to make the stay as comfortable as possible for everyone. 

The only weak point during this journey was the older version of the onboard entertainment system. It was not working for some of the passengers so that it was restarted during the flight. Still, I was experiencing some issues. Having said that, it was still ok - had plenty of time :-) The selection of movies was good.

title: great experience
review_text: First time flying with Swiss air, with a layover in Zurich, great experience, very polite staff and good accommodation.

title: Poor service/uncomfortable seat
review_text: I recently travelled business on Swiss from Zurich to HK in one of their prized "throne" seats. Although I had plenty of flat surfaces to rest things on storage was actually very limited. I found the seat in bed mode to be quite restrictive and enclosed. The service on this flight was very poor. Attendants were very keen to get the meal service over as quickly as possible-I had my meal removed before I had finished eating. After the evening meal service the cabin crew disappeared completely until breakfast service just before landing. The seat configuration in business class was also weird. Some seats had far less room and storage space than others. Whether or not you got a good seat was a matter of luck or being in the know.

title: Great value for a good price
review_text: I'm flying Swiss regularly and have never been disappointed. The service is always attentive and friendly. My mother is disabled in her mobility and is always assisted with care. The aircraft is clean and tidy.

title: Lufthansa Group + G. (Service) + Unique Box (Meal) + (2+3) Seat Row = 8.0/10
review_text: Meal: Served in Reuse Ready Plastic Box with Internal Partitions contains quality  little qty. (But enough) + W.\ Hot (Like a Pizza) in External box + Open Bread + Finish w.\ small Swiss Chocolate + But serve BR meal in Diner time (22:00)?! _Brilliant Seat with a Nickel metal strip + Unique Row (2+3) seat leads more wide Aisle + Also, Bath Room w.\ unfamiliar water faucet?

title: Good Flight
review_text: We normally fly Swiss from Greece to Boston, USA and are generally pleased with the accommodations.  We flew Swiss for our return flight most recently.  The food was hit or miss.  For example, on the shorter flight from Athens to Zurich, they served smoked salmon over lentils, which seemed odd as that type of palette probably doesn't appeal to many people.  On the longer connecting flight, they ran out of the chicken (second time this has happened to me on Swiss) and only had vegetarian available, which is normally not a great option.  I'm not sure if this typically happens on airlines but would advise to not sit near the back of the plane if you want a food selection.  We found out after that you can pre-select your meal on their website.  Because the connection time is so short, there is not really any time to grab food so it was quite disappointing when our only dinner option for the 8 hour flight was the vegetarian.

title: Very Good International Experience
review_text: Have flown Swiss Air a couple of times and have not been disappointed.  The service is friendly and attentive.  The seat area is clean and has several good storage spaces.  Their lounges have great seating and food/drink options.  The meals offered on the flights differed a bit - going from San Francisco, the food was okay.  Returning from Zurich the food was much better.  Business class seats were comfortable and reclined to flat for sleeping.  Would recommend this airline.

title: The worse airline service, 1 star is too good to give them
review_text: Worse experience encountered, treatment is disgusting! I wish they go bankrupt, One day a person with lots of money can afford to make this public and show their true colours. Unacceptable!

title: Rude check in people in Los Angeles
review_text: I came to the counter in Los Angeles with my carry on luggage, and small backpack size smaller than laptop or purse. They pushed me to check my carry on! ~~ I cant take both on board!! I was arguing over this with the manager i was under weight didnt reach 12kg together and still had to check in. Every time I fly anywhere I measure to make sure I avoid any of these issues, BAD customer services, AGAINST customer not for them to assist. I contacted swiss never heard back.

title: Excellent service!
review_text: One of my favorite Airlines. From Singapore to Zurich I use this plane. Although the journey is far but not felt because of the comfortable seats and good service

title: Very efficient
review_text: Check in done online, which sent my Boarding Card to my I-phone, very easy. The whole Boarding process was quick and efficient, the ground staff did a good job here. On board some passengers had big bags - more than allowed - which caused the cabin Crew some hassle. In the end we departed five minutes late, which means flying into Z√ºrich is actually early/on time. During the flight we received a drink and a pretzel roll with butter on it. The pretzel roll was ok, not very exciting and I rather have their Sandwich cheese, but he ho, you get served what you fly. We arrived early and the typical Swiss chocolate was offered on disembarkment. All in all, great flying Swiss, early arriving and no problems

title: Ok experience!
review_text: The seats were pretty cramped.. and food and service was ok... though food quality was better... overall average experience..

title: NEVER EVER FLYING AGAIN WITH SWISS AIR! THE RUDEST FLIGHT ATTENDANT EVER!
review_text:
The rude flight attendant:

Black long hair, length on the shoulder a little bit down. Quite not young. Crock nose and thin lips. 
Becareful if you fly with this flight number. Try your best not to interact with her! I know her name but I still respect her no matter what she did to me.

My son (10yo)felt a little bit unwell. Suddenly he felt a stomach pain.

So, i was thinking that would be on dinner time. That would be too long for him.

Actually this was the second time i flew with SWISS AIR. Both journey are unpleasant. She made me felt so uncomfortable a whole 13 hours flight! I was SO AFRAID to ask anything. Very bad bad rude rude service. 
Singapore airline is the best in the world!!

title: Frequent travelers: avoid!
review_text:
I have to fly frequently to continuously changing destinations for my job, and I am thus using a broad spectrum of airlines. Swiss International Airlines stands out as one of the least reliable major airlines with the worst customer service. Based on my own experience (arguably with limited statistics), it is clearly the worst airline among more than 40 airlines that I have used in the last 10 years. In average there is a medium or major problem with every second flight I take with SWISS - far more frequent than with every other airline.

The only airline that repeatedly puts me on stand-by status despite holding a regular ticket is Swiss International Airlines. Repeatedly SWISS has not allowed me to take carry-on luggage on the airplane, although it clearly conformed to the respective rules. Some of its check-in software did not work at times, causing me quite some inconvenience, but the compensation was not worth the time that it took to redeem it. 

Particularly shocking experiences include a pilot having a meltdown and shouting at all seated passengers before departure, and a flight attendant shouting at customers who politely asked for tea during the in-plane service time (luckily not at me, but it felt very uncomfortable anyway). 

On the occasion of a cancelled flight at an Asian airport, they made all passengers wait at the airport for an entire day to announce alternative travel and accommodation arrangements - something that can take minutes or at most up to one hour with other airlines. More recently, a flight had a delay of more than two hours, but no compensation in form of food vouchers was given prior to departure as required by European law. Emails in this regard have remained unanswered to date. 

The pitch and width of the economy seats are average in the industry, thus there is a very little space. Business class seats for long-haul flights also are mediocre in comparison with other airlines. Business class for short flights consists of a slightly improved meal and seating in front of the plane, and is clearly sub-average. The customer service has a very long response time, which can take from several months to never, and mostly consists of boiler-plate answers - quite different from other airlines (with the exception of Lufthansa). I presume that the miserable quality of its customer service caused by a high number of complaints from unhappy customers. 

Because I am based in Switzerland I can not always get around SWISS for European flights. It is clear that SWISS profits from such a captive audience. For long-haul flights there are good, and usually cheaper alternatives: For flights from Switzerland to Asia most of the big Asian carriers are very reliable and offer great service. For flights to North America, there are some direct flights from Switzerland by North American carriers. The service is similarly mediocre service but they have much higher reliability, better customer service and much better frequent flyer programs. Scandinavian airlines are also great, if you do not mind a stopover in Northern Europe. The Middle Eastern airlines are a great option for Asia and Australia if you do have some extra time and do not mind changing planes in the middle of the night.

title: The best Business Class in Europe
review_text: Wonderful experience, very tasty food with a selection of Swiss or Italian wines served with panache by excellently trained professional crew (ex Swissair). They personalise the service using customer names and are genuinely interested in offering a true business experience. Inflight service nicely paced, lots of smiles and attention from the crew, on time take off and early landing on a pristinely clean aircraft. No European airline can match Swiss.

title: Cancelled flight from Z√ºrich to Los Angeles--- No Service
review_text: Two flight were cancelled at this date. One to LA and the other to NY. What is going wrong with this Airline. Ok security first, that's great and good. They offered us Prior to take off a flight on the next day over Stockholm at 6am to Los Angeles. Either the poeple reatranging the flight have no Children - as we booked - or just ingnorent. Leaving at 6am with a flight over Stockholm would have taken us an Incredible amount of time. So we had - with lot's of pressure - to arrange our own flight. Horrible service...

title: like a sardine in a can
review_text: Left a few minutes late  but arrived on time. In flight service was excellent, the cabin crew was efficient and pleasant. But the economy class seat was on the small side and legroom was minimal. The food was nothing worth writing about- I liked none of it. This was a shared flight (Star Alliance-  booked with Air Canada) -" my mistake".

title: Plane Ok, Service not too bad
review_text:
New Boeing 777 is nice and the Pilots did a super Job. Flight was on Time and Food was good. 
After flying with Singapore Airlines i have to say it was OK. Cabin Crew have not been as good and friendly as you like them to be. very stressed and loud and bot as friendly and welcomed as in other airlines. 

Thats why 3 stars from me.

title: Flight basic didn‚Äôt honour Star Alliance Premium Economy
review_text: Flight was late and they didn‚Äôt honour our premium economy tickets. We had to reorganize our luggage in order to get on the plane. Priority boarding was not honoured.

title: Comfortable and well managed
review_text:
The flight from Mumbai to Zurich is a direct flight which takes about 8 hours . I choose this flight as I was travelling with kids and I did not want a stopover.
The drawbacks with Swiss when compared to other flights connecting Mumbai to Zurich like ethihaad and emirates is the check-in baggage allowance. Swiss allows only 23 kg whereas others allow 30 kg .
Having travelled in a similar route in other airlines , The leg room is pretty low so legs become cramped quiet often especially for taller people.
The flight is punctual . There is no in flight Wifi . The in flight entertainment is limited.
Inflight meals are ok and limited if you are vegetarian .
The flight attendants are ok and  prompt.
All in all it‚Äôs a good flight if you want to reach Swiss in quick time . The overall value for money is good in emirates, however it involves a break journey .
I will again travel by Swiss airlines if given a choice.

title: Kid friendly way to Europe
review_text: Swiss Air did a great job of taking care of our family from checking in, on-boarding, during, and post flight.  They provided colored pencils, coloring books, and games for the kids to play.  The seat back entertainment systems were chalk full of games and shows that were child appropriate, and the food was suitable for picky taste buds too.  The only knock is the seats in economy are very close to each other and when fully reclined you are very close to the person behind you if they aren't reclined, less than 12 inches.  A reality in flying in cramped planes, makes the experience awkward with your neighbor at times.  Swiss Air staff was great, thank you for making our trip enjoyable.

title: Swiss Airline Treats You Well!
review_text: In October 2018, I took Swiss to fly from Chicago to Zurich and everything went well! Onboard, all flight attendants were always courteous and attentive. The food and beverage offerings were all excellent and plentiful. If a good price comes up again, I would definitely book with Swiss again! I had a great flight experience. Thank you!

title: Nearly painless way to return from Europe
review_text: It was a pleasant flight, nice flight attendants and decent food (no small thing!)  The seat was comfortable.

title: The only way to travel
review_text: Superb service , Zurich 1st class lounges and transfer to your flight optimise what service should be. Flight extremely comfortable. Unfortunately our return flight was with BA 1st class ( not ). Travel Swiss 1st to make your trip.

title: Worst Customer Service and Airline to trust and Fly with
review_text:
Airline is beyond unreasonable and disgustingly arrogant.

Made my friend and I miss our connection flight because of Immigration reasons they did not help us with. Then after missing our connection flight they charge us $600 to continue onto our destination, ethical? Things get better! We arrive at our destination after missing our zurich to Greece connection, we miss our Athens to kefalonia connection and a hotel night stay. We arrive in Athens to find out guess what the bags we were "promised" and a phone call was made right in front of us were LOST.

Now we've spent over $900 because Swiss dint check our passports correctly. They then lose our luggage so we have to go purchase clothes, toiletries etc. Costing $400. No one at Zurich could find our bags or contact us...
Now I have filed a complain TWICE and each employee (Mereoni) sent me a check for $176, never replying to my concerns and emails after I never confirmed that this okay to send or ENOUGH! Then to tell me the matter is closed and SWISS has done their job adequately. Ignoring my emails and just sending me a meesly check for $176!!

I will tell everyone I know to never fly SWISS Air because they have no understanding on customer service and their staff is not trained professionally and correctly for million dollar business.

Worst experience of my life and I'm still paying for it because of SWISS AIR

title: Average flight........
review_text: I think we all know that a long flight like this is generally going to be uncomfortable in economy. The flight attendants were very pleasant and courteous but I am surprised that the little "goody bag" was not offered. Just the toothpaste/tooth brush would have been welcomed. The ablutions were not in a great state as the flight progressed. I flew Swiss Air a couple of years ago and was very pleased...... not so much on this one.

title: Nice experience
review_text: Professional staff, decent food, clean. I was pleasantly surprised by the fact that there was in-flight entertainment (TV, movies) available

title: Excellent airline
review_text:
Probably one of the best airline I've traveled with.
The staff were excellent and very welcoming. Food was good for an airline. The check-in was very smooth.
I highly recommend.

title: Not pleased
review_text:
Not pleased
All was good with the Swiss boarding and actual flight. 
However, we arrived late in Chicago and missed our scheduled flight.
After rescheduling we went to transfer our luggage to the next flight, to find one piece of luggage missing from the Swiss air flight. After searching, we had missed the second scheduled flight. 
After going back and forth between terminals and having to reschedule for the next day, we ended back at the Swiss air desk located in the international terminal.
We were told by Swiss air personnel  that Swiss air would cover our hotel, taxi, and food. Swiss air personnel  gave us the Swiss Air card with their internet site.  We selected one of their designated hotels with free transport and had a snack in the hotel restaurant. 
1 week later, I sent the necessary documents to the web site for reimbursement. 
The response was, they are not responsible for the need for the hotel and to have my insurance cover the cost.

title: rude and utterly inefficient
review_text: since june 2018 we have been promised a refund on our lost luggage. they never reply to emails and when they do they keep bringing up excuses for not paying. They keep asking the iban details which are correct. its a shame as one cannot even call the customer care and no number is available to call any other office that one can speak to. When I did call the head office they told me that I couldn't be passed through and that they receive millions of calls like mine for complaints... great airline it is ha!? I suggest one never travels with them as if something goes wrong no chance of your refund.

title: Business Class with economy service
review_text: Recently I travelled through Europe and used Cathay Pacific, Aegean, and Lufthansa airlines. They all provided excellent service, especially Aegean airlines. Yesterday's flight to Hong Kong with Swiss Airways was very disappointing, none of the staff in business class were friendly or interested in welcoming you onboard. Our group of 4 all agreed that we had experienced better service in economy on other airlines. Based on my experience flying business class over the last few years Swiss Airlines needs to pick up there game as the competition has left them behind.

title: Great flights and the Zurich Lounge is superb
review_text: I flew with SWISS from Berlin to Zurich then onto Naples last week. What an excellent experience it was and my first time with Swiss. I had 2 short flights and while the aircraft seating was standard, I paid a little extra for what they term 'business' which simply means a row up front with a guaranteed empty seat next to you. The crew and aircraft were very good, but a highlight was the time spent between flights at the SWISS Zurich business lounge. Superbly designed it was a pleasure to spend some down time there. While very busy, there was still ample room for everyone with great food and a variety of drinks on offer.

title: Reliable Efficient Service
review_text: All announcements are made in three languages, which takes a little while, particularly on a short flight. However, they do manage to serve drinks and a small meal. Service very friendly. The flight left a little late but arrived on time!

title: Perfection in the sky
review_text: Punctuality and courtesy as once. Information during the flight. Facility and clarity in the transfer at Zurich Airport. Excellent the chocolates......

title: This is now one of my favorite airlines
review_text:
The long lines in LAX are the only downside to this airline, but they do have people that will actually help you find your way and direct people to the correct line.
Once in line, the checkin process id is quick and very friendly. They are careful with your luggage, explain everything, and are quite pleasant about it. The boarding process is organized and fast. Seats are comfortable, the meals are properly prepared with taste, drinks are often given out. The quiet plane makes it easy to fall asleep, it does have more leg room than more airlines. 
We also used this airline for a shorter flight, and the standards are just as high as the longer flights. And the swiss chocolate bars that are handed out are delicious!! And they give you extras, all done with a smile.

title: Comfortable and reliable
review_text: We had an open jaw flight from SFO-Milan / Bordeaux-SFO. Reliable airline. Good service and acceptable food.

title: A bit dated
review_text: First time flying with Swiss. Flew in their flagship A340-300. I was a comfortable flight and meals were reasonable. In flight entertainment very dated with poor screen size and resolution. I would fly with them again if this was improved.

title: Baggage
review_text: My baggage got destroyed by swiss airways + didn't reach on time Dubai, writing complaints each day + no reply from their side + no compensation given to me + worst service ever + as Swiss is not replacing my luggage, I have to buy another one to get back to Warsaw ... Thank You Swiss, for good service.:(

title: very comfortable seats
review_text: Checked in on line and very efficient bag drop at Zurich airport. The seat were the most comfortable seats we have had on economy airlines with plenty of leg room and very efficient cabin staff. We have travelled on Swiss on a number of occasions and enjoyed but this is first time we had so much legroom.

title: reliable as always
review_text:
Check-in in Z√ºrich perfectly allright. The only back-draw is that if you travel with your guns, Z√ºrich Airport now charges 50 CHF for the gun check for outgoing flights.
Besides that everything went smooth and we were treated very freindly.

title: Swiss airlines rocks
review_text: Everything was a stellar experience for us. Cabin crew were very nice always has smile on their face. Meals and snacks were great. They offered us meals and snack frequently which we loved‚ù§Ô∏è. Snacks and beverages were awesome. Service was fabulous and our flight from Zurich to LAX was amazing (no delays). Highly recommendedüëèüëèüëèüëçüëçüëç

title: Very good
review_text: I had the luxury of flying business class compliments of my hosts. The service is indeed very very professional. Personal? Maybe slightly less so. But it is the Swiss ;-) The quality of the plane (everything was working, and the comfort of the seat was really great) was beyond reproach.

title: Off to Russia
review_text:
We flew from Zurich to Moscow in September of 2018. We began our journey by taking the nonstop train from Lucerne to Zurich Flughafen(airport). We got our luggage together and took the elevator from the platform to the airport concourse. Signage at Zurich airport was very good; everything was clearly marked.  We found our terminal and quickly lined up in front of the Swiss counter. Several agents were available and so we had no waiting time.  A very friendly agent immediately checked us in and very soon we were headed for security. The Swiss agent also told us that the airline was part of Lufthansa, another of my favorite carriers.  As usual, the friendly but meticulous security staff cleared us and very soon we were in the departing lounge waiting for our flight to Moscow. Because it was an international flight there was a second passport check at the gate.  Once cleared, we boarded the aircraft, an Airbus 320. The seats were quite comfortable and the cabin crew were stationed at various points inside the aircraft to help passengers get settled.  A nice lunch was served along with choice of beverages and very soon we were looking forward to our destination, Moscow.  All along, the cabin crew kept checking on the passengers in case they needed an extra coffee or a cold drink.  After a smooth flight we landed in Moscow on a sunny afternoon, full of great expectations at the start of an eight-day tour of the city and St. Petersburg. 

1

title: Clean and timely short flight
review_text: We flew Swiss for the first time to get to Milan to pick up an Emirates flight back to JFK. The airport was nice, plane was very clean and staff were all dress well and friendly. The flight was not too full which made it a bit more roomy even for a shorter flight of 1-1.5 hours.

title: Very professional service
review_text: The flight was late leaving but had professional gate and cabin service. The aircraft itself was not as up-to-date as I would have expected. As with all airlines, the economy class is cramped and you look forward to getting to your destination.

title: Surprisingly good
review_text:
The flight was only above an hour and although it was absolutely good. 

The space was pretty generous if we regard the flight time, they served cold beverages and the service was very friendly. I wish I had this kind of a flight on a longer journey. 

Everything was on time, the boarding was quick and good organized.

Good short flight.

title: Great service!
review_text: Flying with Swiss was a pleasant experience. The seats were comfortable, good selection of movies to watch, hot towels to clean our hands,  Swiss chocolate passing around, and the French red or white wine served with food was excellent.  And the best thing was, our round  trip flight was on time.

title: Good Service and New Aircraft
review_text:
I had a bad experienced when taken Lufthansa Air 8 years ago. It's from Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia to Porto, Portugal via Frankfurt. The service of the cabin crew was bad and rude, the 747 aircraft was old and dirty.
After so many years, i would like to try again with Lufthasa air from Kuala Lumpur to Hannover, Germany via Bangkok and Zurich (September, 2018). I found that the Lufthasa air is code share with SWISS Airlines. First time i taken Swiss Airlines and surprisingly found that the service was extremely good and the aircraft is new (B777) and clean. Cabin Crew is trying their best to serve the guest and make sure the guests are satisfied. Food quality is good ! Will choose SWISS Airlines when i wanted to go Europe !

title: Be careful which Class you book
review_text: I booked a later flight to make sure to clear immigration after arrival from SFO (via United Airlines).  I was cleared quickly.  The next flight was in 2 hours.  Mine was scheduled 6 hours away.  There were seats available and my flight was sold out.  Instead of allowing me to go standby on earlier flight, they wanted to charge 577e.  I hung out in airport lounge....but I thought this was ridiculous.  I had carry on and was booked on Economy LIGHT....no changes, no refunds.

title: Never Again
review_text:
We booked our trip through United in April for September flights. After booking through United, I went to the Swiss Air website and paid to reserve our seats. Fast forward to our day of departure. Upon checking for the first leg of our trip on a United flight, I noticed the seats on the tickets were not the seats we selected and paid for. I then called the ORD Swiss desk, and the rep who answered told me that ‚Äúmy agent canceled our seat assignments‚Äù. When I told her that I booked through United, she said that United canceled the seats. After asking multiple times what can be done, they offered to reverse the fees and nothing else. After getting off the phone, I went to the desk for our United flight, and the agent there confirmed that there was no way United could have changed our seat assignments, as they do not have access to Swiss‚Äô systems. The United agent also told me that Swiss should have offered additional compensation. When we got to ORD, we went to the desk there to see if anything else could be done. They offered to page the passengers in the seats we wanted and see if they‚Äôd be willing to switch. I wasn‚Äôt optimistic, but I said yes, I‚Äôd like to try. The agent never followed through and we were stuck in the middle seats. Apparently, it wasn‚Äôt just us whose seats were reassigned. We sat close enough to the desk and overheard a number of other people complaining about the same thing. 

When we got to ZRH, our next flight was delayed a couple hours because the plane failed the safety inspection...

Finally, after getting back home after our trip, I checked my credit card. We were never refunded the fee. When I called Swiss again, they gave me a specific email address to contact to request a refund. While they did finally refund the fees, they didn‚Äôt even bother to reply to my email to let me know it was done. 

I understand that problems come up. But Swiss‚Äô terrible customer service, multiple lies and total disinterest in trying to resolve the situation means that I will never fly on their airline again and will tell everyone I know to avoid them at all costs.

title: Would not fly again
review_text: First off they have a contract with United so I thought I was going on United but it was Swiss Air. I give them 3 stars as they accommodated me with a better seat. Other than that I would give them 2 stars. The flight was very smooth so that gives them the 2 stars. the service was almost not there. They were not very friendly. I'm not asking for a conversation but when you serve food or drinks a nice gesture would be appreciated . I always make sure that I say please and thank you. A smile would work, no problem would work, you're welcome would work. It is a small gesture. I flew on Lufthansa last year to Spain and I cannot say enough nice things about them.

title: Unacceptable treatment after cancellation of flight
review_text:
On 20/09/18, I was flying from Athens to London through Zurich. My flight LX326 from Zurich to London was canceled shortly before boarding.
We were later informed that no seats were available on flights of the same day.
We were driven to a hotel far away from the airport, and we had to wait 1 hour to get on a shuttle bus! 
We were given a 20CHF voucher for dinner which wasn‚Äôt enough for a proper meal
(and I don‚Äôt speak about a three course meal of course!!)

Generally, to my surprise, the level of service from Swiss, can at least be described as inadequate! No timely information! The staff seemed lost and had no specific instructions! Œùot œÑŒø mention that there were only two employees to serve such a large number of passengers!

title: Poor Show, but Tolerable
review_text:
Been flying this route for years and recently noticed the increase in delays. This time it was 2.5 hours in Z√ºrich. See photo for a picture of the complimentary refreshment. It's called a Swiss Pack_1, costs, 3.45 from the  bistro and is included on the QR code of your boarding card, so you get it for free.

Reason given for delay by pilot was a safety/comfort issue so he knocked back the original plane, so they had to get another aircraft organised.

I've also noticed the increase in toilet smells, so the cleanliness is faultering as I got frequent wafts of faeces on outgoing and return journeys. Return was on HB-IOC, which had a serious incident on 09.03.14.

Poor show, but tolerable because it's a short flight.

title: Short Trip
review_text: We flew with Swiss as part of a Singapore Airlines trip. We had unnecessary hassles at the airport in Venice, as we were told that we had top pay for our luggage, even though it had been pre paid. After a lot of arguing, and stress, it was found that we had indeed paid. Ground staff issue, not the air crew. The flight was short, but quite OK, with some wonderful views of the alps.

title: appalling snack
review_text: flight itself was reasonable, although nothing special which was disappointing given the hype on the web site about how special they were, the provided snack was horrible, a very dry roll with no butter and a brief sight of the filling!!

title: Very nice
review_text: Very well kept airplane. Great in seat entertainment. The flight staff was very courteous. Their was a lot of snacks and a nice dinner. They only downside was they ran out of the chicken dinner and some people had to settle for eggplant. And of course the seating on long flights can get uncomfortable. Other than that I would defiantly fly Swiss again.

title: The CS 100 is deceiving
review_text:
The commercial comments about this plane may give you the feeling this is the best airplane in the world. It is what I thought. The reality is meanwhile quite deceiving. The seats are in very high density. Unbelievable. I never saw that, even on low-cost planes or urban buses. I am not a tall guy (1m72), but it was impossible to put my legs in front of me. So the flight was seating in lateral position. This is possible in Business Class as the nearby seat is free. But I imagine the difficulty in Economy Class. No physical separation between classes. The plane is not noisy, but Airbuses are not noisy as well. I had asked for a diabetic breakfast, which included... sugar (not sweetener) for the coffee. Objectively, the EMBRAER planes are much more comfortable. 
The flight was 30 minutes late in Zurich, with transfer by bus to the airport and no information given about the connecting flights whereas the majority of passengers on this flight are not going to Zurich.

title: Tight seating
review_text:
On this flight from New York to Zurich the seating was again in the middle of the cabin and in the middle of the middle row.

Once again not the best location because similar to our flight to the US I was squeezed in between two heavy-weight passengers which made it very difficult for me to find space and relax.

At least the entertainment was very well so i found time to distract myself with several movies.

On top all flight attendants have been very friendly and professional and the food (chicken) tasted great.

Is this a helpful review? Then please give me a "Thumbs up Thank FrankGeisler" by clicking the button below.

title: Small plane but first class service
review_text:
Genuine care and warmth
Cute little chocolate given for flying with swiss
Not a long or uncomfy flight was stressed but made to feel good by staff so thanks for a pleasant flight
Would fly with swiss again
And recommend to others too

title: flight on 7 Set 2018
review_text:
The seats are so narrow. Paying full fare but having only budget airline seating.
Booked this because of the direct flight . Never again would I fly lSwiss airline. And service was terrible.

title: Squeezed in
review_text:
On this flight from Zurich to New York the seating was in the middle of the cabin and in the middle of the middle row.

Not the best location because I was squeezed in between two heavy-weight passengers which made it very difficult for me to find space and relax.

All flight attendants have been very friendly and professional.

Is this a helpful review? Then please give me a "Thumbs up Thank FrankGeisler" by clicking the button below.

title: Smooth once again
review_text: Flight was on time.  Crew were very friendly and helpful.  The flight was smooth on the new Airbus.  The seating configuration was 2 4 2.  Making it a little easier to up from the window seat.

title: Can't Do Better
review_text:
This airline surprised me! Excellent service, quality of in-flight food and entertainment,
and overall experience was very, very good.

title: The service doesn't follow the name
review_text: I took this flight from Athens to Luxembourg on the 4th of September 2018. There was a delay annonced for half-an-hour, and a new announcement of a further delay. As it was an early afternoon flight we hadn't lunch, waiting to eat in the plane. Though, not satisfied, I would call it "plastic food". There was a WC just in the middle of the plance, just next to our seat and a long queue waiting all the time to enter. I can remember in previous years Swiss being on of the best worldwide companies, but not any more.

title: ALWAYS THE BEST!!!
review_text:
Connecting to Tel Aviv in ZRH Swiss First HKG-ZRH Half full flight Seat 1K window and bed in Seat 2K window Fantastic service on the 777300Er Good food, lots of Laurent Perrier Grand Siecle champagne Make sure to use the First Lounge at E Gates upon arrival Had the day in Zuri before connecting to TLV on Swiss Hotel room in First lounge E Gates  St Moritz to sleep for a few hours before heading to First Lounge at A Gates for baby lamb chops for lunch before heading downtown
Arriving in First there is a new arrival service but dont make use of this if you want to try out the exoteric First Lounge E Gates and  when rechecking in to Tel Aviv make sure you ask to sit in First (with business class catering) from ZRH-TLV It really is the ONLY way to fly to Switzerland, and if you like further afield!!!

title: Fantastic staff and seamless connection at Zurich airport
review_text: Excellent service, wonderful new aircraft between CDG and ZRH, and hassle-free connection at Zurich airport.

title: Very tight seats and narrow aisle
review_text: We switched from United Dreamliner to the Boeing 777 flight because this flight leaves after lunch, which we like. Food and service is better than average, but the seats in economy are so cramped and the aisle so narrow. The premium economy which was not available at the time is not much better. Entertainment system is good.

title: TA  LESS THAN HELPFUL
review_text:
After calling swiss airlines 1 day before flight , I was told my wife was in a seat selected by Swiss and I could not make any changes if we did not like it until we got to the Airport .
 When we got to the Airport the TA told us we would be given the seat number at the Gate checkin .
 Having never heard of such a thing, I asked for a Spvr. 
 who reiterated the same thing . When I complaind again , I got to a higher spvr who said the same thing .
She said the Policy of the New Group   Swiss , OS<  LH , now charge for online seat selection. Plus they weighed my wifes carry on which was 13 Kilos and told her iit was overweight also and forced her to check it in 
It was the gloating on the part of the SPVR that was really rude seeing my wifes anxiety , that he made much worse. 
They said thats true of the entire German Group, which is a lie , because when I got home I checked and I did seat selection on my May Business Flight on Austrian over the phone , and it shows in my reservation . I will complain to Swiss when I have time . 
 I am withholding the names of the 2 employees and if anyone at Trip Advisor thinks I should add their names , let me know.

title: Very Swiss
review_text: Seats a bit narrow to sit comfortably, service was ok not spectacular, but flight was on time and arrival on time

title: On time
review_text: All went well and they took a good care of my sensitive wheelchair. This is the most important thing for me.

title: Better than I expected
review_text: This was the first time we flew with Swiss. Given that it limited check in baggage to only 1 bag per person and no more than 23kg, I was wondering if this would be a budget conscious airline (for economy class passengers anyway) and the trip might not be that user-friendly. To my surprise, the service was quite good and the seats were fine, not as cramped as I had experienced in other airlines. The flight was not full and that might explain I did not feel claustrophobic as experienced in an earlier flight to Singapore with another carrier. The food was good, quality and quantity wise. They also provided small packets of snacks near the galley where passengers could help themselves. The toilets were clean but with a limited range of amenities.

title: Professionals
review_text:
All went well and smooth. Just a small delay on departure gate, because of many passengers...
Service was ok.

title: Smooth overnight Flight
review_text: Long Haul Flight was running on time, technical stop in DAR was smooth and timely.  IFE did not work for flight between NBO and DAR which was disappointing. Aircraft was clean and staff were polite.  Food and drinks served were decent.  Good price.  Had a 50 min connection in Zurich which was easy to make even with the stress of security.  One suitcase got damaged and replaced at LHR, another did not make the connection and got couriered home.

title: A little less comfortable than Business Class
review_text:
Good Service, Good Food. Good Inflight Entertainment.
Not as much leg room. 
 
On the website - use the Automated Check in option.

title: The comfort of Business Class
review_text:
The service starting with the check in facility and the use of the lounge at Muscat International Airport was impressive. 
Business Class from Muscat to Zurich was excellent. Attentive, friendly, efficient and very professional are apt descriptions. 
Love the sleeper seats and the privacy of the layout. Very comfortable.

I Recommend the Automated Check-in facility.

title: Great airline
review_text: I have flown with Swiss several times going to Europe.  All Flights were a great experience I have even chosen to not fly direct to my destination and take an additional flight to my final stop just to fly this airline.  All flights I have taken have landed in Zurich and then I have taken another flight to my final destination; extra time, but worth it,.

title: Cancelation: Delay in flights, Delay in Customer Feedback, Delay in Refund Payments.
review_text: A total nightmare it‚Äôs a miracle this airline is still able to attract paying consumers. I will never fly with this airline again.

title: Comfortable and punctual flight
review_text: Night flights are always problematic, but not so this time. We left on time as one of the last departures of the night. The service was done quickly and the food was good. After that the seats/beds were comfortable enough to get a full night of sleep. The crew was very attentive.

title: We had one day of delay, being compensated
review_text:
I made the reservation for 2 people Valencia-Munich and back Munich-Zurich-Valencia. The first one was fine but about 20 hours before the way back I received an e-mail telling that our flight had been cancelled but they had found an alternative Munich-Amsterdam-Valencia. 
Unfortunately there was overbooking in this one and we couldn't fly, so, they found an alternative by flying in the first flight but one day later.
So, we lost one day of work (I had to ask for an extra holiday) but at least they are compensating.
Ah, for the rest, the company offers some food and the service is very good.

title: Excellent Service
review_text: My boyfriend and I received exceptional service after we encountered a passport issue when attempting to board an international flight. The attendants went above and beyond by walking us through the step by step process to obtain a new passport and moving our flights to the next day free of charge. It was a difficult situation but they made it as easy as possible and have earned customers for life!

title: Do Not Use This Airline
review_text: They cancelled the flight with no reason given with less than hour before it was due to take off. Delayed the flight to the following day 08:30 and took all passengers to a poor hotel overnight. This is the fourth flight that has been cancelled for me with no proper reason given at the time in the last six months. Customer service is non-existent in Zurich and at best they just don't care. Trying to claim compensation is impossible because they use the excuse that allows them not to pay. My guess is that it is cheaper to cancel the flight if its not full and then not pay compensation. From now on I will use BA or EasyJet if at all possible.

title: One of the best airlines
review_text: For me is the best Airline at this time.  Great service for everything, nice airplanes, friendly staff, good food and drinks, they don¬¥t charge for it.  No delays, no problem with baggage.

title: comfortable flight
review_text: Staff was attentive.  Flights were on time.   Food was delicious.   Really enjoyed having an ice cream waffle cone as a snack.  The on flight movie selections were very good and current.

title: connecting flight from Zurich to London then onto Vancouver
review_text: Flight was awesome but they did not leave enough time between layovers .  We were stuck in security and almost missed our connecting flight to Vancouver.  When I booked we had a 3 hour layover but they changed the time and only gave us 1 hr to go through security and head to our connection.. Very stressful!  Otherwise the airline crew were amazing and the flight was good. So just watch out for connection times otherwise we were pleased with the flight itself.

title: Via Zurich
review_text: goood service on ground and on board, there were no delays, cabin crew kind and helpful. bagage missed, but arrived very soon next day in the morning.

title: There'\s no better way to fly .....
review_text: If you can afford it, and even if you can't,  you must try this top of the line service on Swiss, and exceptionally the Business Class service on long hall flights with the Boeing 777-300ER  ultra new seats.  The service is as always Swiss quality, the food, the ambiance and the whole package is just great, worth to pat for an 11+  hours of flight .One should try it :-)

title: Extortion
review_text:
I'm not one to post negative reviews online, but my husband and I have tried to talk with representatives from Swiss Air 5+ times now, have sent an email in to the Swiss Air website at their request, and have yet to find a resolution to this incident. (As an aside, nothing makes me more frustrated than when a human in customer service says "that's not my job.") 

When we arrived at Athens to check in for our flight home, the representatives let us know that your system hadn't closed our flights there, and since they were open still we'd have to pay a penalty of $400 euro. We have explained many times that we were on those flights and that it must be a system error on your company's behalf, but the representative said the only way to get home that day was to pay that extra fee. She even asked us for evidence that we were on the flights over, and I was able to provide one of the boarding passes, but this wasn't enough. The experience was insulting, frustrating, and honestly felt like extortion. Buyer beware - not only is this a terrible customer service response from Swiss, it is a safety issue. What if our plane had crashed but their system didn't show we were on the flight?

title: Mediocre at best
review_text: Well I normally fly first class and fly one class on delta and other airlines internationally. I say this for comparison purposes. So Swiss Air is just OK, they need to either buy new planes or retrofit their own because their business class is average at best. Now their service and service folks are wonderful but it is sad because their lie flat seats are horrible the foot bed is hard and and the bed itself for someone who‚Äôd is only average in height is underwhelming and tight. The flight was warm the whole time and I complained but they did nothing and you do not have your own air vents so dress for warm weather environment. In any event they do fly like all others LATE!!!. The Zurich airport is precision like a fine Swiss watch but candidly try other airlines they jay be better suited for you.

title: Friendly, relaxed and on time
review_text: We had a very nice flight and it was on time. 5* Airline of choice for business travel to Canada. A330 was very quiet and calm plane, service was very friendly. For next Trip to Canada Swiss would definitly an option.

title: Nice Change !
review_text:
It was a Friday - I always travel LH but this week I arrived and they had booked me on Swiss to OTP with a change in ZRH- Settling into my seat  first water arrived then Drinks and a Hot Meal - a choice even was nice to note on what is only a two hour hop.
The staff were attentive - the flight was full , the food tasty and we arrived on time although every flight out of Zurich appeared to be delayed for 15/30 mins - never found out why.
I would consider this as a changed way of getting to OTP .

title: Swiss International Air Lines
review_text: on the short flight from GRZ to ZRH we travelled economy, small snack and drinks included; leg space was ok; one thing I want to mention: our captain came out from the cockpit to the cabin and held his talk before take-off in front of us passengers - this was very very kind (haven't seen that before!)

title: Flying Swiss Air was a pleasure
review_text: Really enjoyed the experience. Zurich airport was incredibly spread out...if you are mobility challenged you may want to seek airport assistance. They seem to choose quite a few passengers for extra security screening. Only complaint I have is at the boarding gate...if you have stood by the gate in line they can switch entrance points (for boarding) and allow the entire group to surge in and create a unpleasant situation. Flight crews were wonderful!  Chose: Economy seats with extra leg room.

title: Nicht mehr die Swissair
review_text:
The flight was more or less in time on both ways. The flight attends are friendly und the service efficient. To Valencia the pastrie was ok, to Zurich the sandwich was old, dry and poor. 
The seat comfort is for a tall men a mess. The knies allways in the back of the frontseat. Like a charterflight.

title: Great flight from start to finish
review_text: Everything was perfect,good service comfortable seat and great food!Flight was a delight!Also great entertainment screen with plenty of movies series and documentaries!

title: Swiss high-class quality.
review_text:
The service was great. The check-in and the baggage claim were very fast.Only two or three people in line!!!
The seats were very comfortable.The pillow and the blanket of high quality. Short time after the takeoff all the kids on board a plane were presented with some toys.Also,the passengers traveling with kids were the first to get the drinks and lunch.The drinks and the food were of good quality.Those who wanted to sleep slept,those who didn‚Äôt ,could watch a movie or listen to music.Before the landing we were offered some swiss chocolate.Yummy!
The crew ,who were young,beautiful and dressed nicely were great:caring,helpful and efficient.The plane was very clean.
I would highly recommend trips with Swiss International Air Lines.

title: Great
review_text:
Fantastic flight and service on board.
Everything is perfect when you fly with swiss in business class.
Food is great and you can relax a bit before you arrive.
Also the priority lines are great never have to wait to long.
Staff on board is amazing and very friendly.
I love to fly with swiss.

title: Worst flight ever
review_text: We bought this flight when considering that it was a long haul flight (nearly 10hrs) and therefore we wanted a comfortable flight expecting Swiss standards. But boy what a disappointment. This was the worst flight I have ever been on and that's saying a lot when considering that I'm a frequent flyer. Forget about leg room because even budget airlines used for short trips have more space. Please note that I'm only 1.57m so if you're any taller than that (which you probably are) goodluck with that. My boyfriend was literallt crouched during the whole flight and therefore neither of us could catch any sleep (first flught ever that I didnt sleep). Our airhostess was like airhostessess you see on comedy movies keeping her very very fake smile even when we adressed her with problems. One instance was when we were given a vegetarian meal and told that they had no chicken left when we asked for it. I mean I have nothing against vegetarian meals but I cannot say the same for my boyfriend. Afterall did we not pay the same price as the other passengers? This shows a lack of planning and experience. Never again!

title: Professional and welcome service for a business traveler. Excellent business lounges in Zurich
review_text:
A small plane between Berlin and Zurich.  A very efficient and welcome service on board. Nice selection of beverages served on intra-European flights.
Big, newly renovated lounges in Zurich airport with cold and hot food served. Variety of alcoholic and hot beverages. Excellent tea.  Great view of the tarmac and planes parking and taking off.

title: Crowded trip
review_text: I was flying on a new CS300 / A220 to Z√ºrich, the service was ok, but everything on the plane was small.

title: Swiss quality indeed!
review_text:
We started from Rome-Fiumicino going to Zurich on flight LX 1737 to connect with flight LX 18 for final destination in Newark. LX 1737 was delayed for unknown reason and we barely had 20 minutes to to connect with LX 18. We thought we will never make the connection because of the distance between the 2 gates and the passport control/security check  that we had to get through. Amazingly, upon landing in Zurich the airline had an agent waiting with a car to zip us through all the hoops. We boarded just in the nick of time before gate closing.

That was the good part, the bad one was that our checked-in luggage did not make onto LX 18, so we arrived in Newark without luggage and we are still waiting for them to be delivered to our house.

I think it is a mistake for SWISS to allow such a short time interval (in this case 45 minutes) for international connecting flights. The reservation system must be fixed. The company made a heroic effort to get us through but not our luggage. Moreover no passengers care for the harrowing suspense of delayed flight and inadequate time to make connection.

It was just too bad for SWISS. The service was great, the seat comfortable, the staff courteous, my rating could have been a 5 but was held at 4 because of the reservation glitch.

title: Unbelievably awful
review_text: Old planes, some passengers have a single seat and others you are virtually on top of the person next door . The staff are pleasant but it is premium economy at best.

title: 2 x 12 hour flights - not a problem
review_text: Simple things done right! You can expect a consistent experience with attention to detail done in a professional manner that fosters a warm aura and balanced experience in terms of food, service and comfort.

title: Hong Kong to Zurich
review_text: An efficient carrier. Service was good and the food was fine. Good choice of entertainment. Over all not quite as good as Lufthansa on the way out from Munich. We travelled on to Manchester which had a tight 20 mins to achieve.

title: flight from Barcelona to Los Angeles
review_text: the flight was full but was still very comfortable the crew was very polite and were constantly taking care of the passengers , i was very happy that they had a choice of vegetarian or meat meals .

title: The Mark of excellence
review_text: This is the ultimate experience of flying with excellence. The luxury you experience is not in the airplane build, or plane amenities but in the service quality of the people and performance of the entire crew.

title: Awesome service
review_text: My mom needed assistance on and off the plan and their care of her was wonderful. Wheelchair service and motorized cart right to the baggage claim area. They helped us collect our baggage as well. Very helpful, friendly staff. We got a nice sandwich on an afternoon flight. Great experience which of course you pay for.

title: Canceled fligft at night
review_text: Unfortunately our flight was canceled late in the evening after a stopover from Porto because of problems with left engine after we had to check in and sat in the plane. Afterwards it was hard to get an alternative flight the next day to vienna. We were lucky. We got a good hotel close to the airport. Only the shuttle took very long especially when many passengers take the same because a lot of them hat to flight tomorrow if the got a flight. The hotel was great. They had a snack for us prepared and the room was very good. Kind regards, Karl

title: BOTH FLIGHTS DELAYED
review_text:
Both our flights from Florence to Zurich and from Zurich to Chicago had long delays. Fortunately we had an overnight stay in Zurich!! Anyway the service on board the intercontinental flight has been quite good and attentive. I forgot to reserve a gluten free meal and our hostess did everything she could to serve me something to eat. 
Delicious chocolate on board.

title: Standing out above competition
review_text: I have been flying a lot recently, and compared to other EU and UAE airlines - Swiss International airlines had the best quality of service. Comfrortable seats and friendly staff. I have made them my preferred airline for all travel.

title: Swiss Chocolate Beats Pretzels!
review_text: We were returning home from a wonderful Danube River cruise and had the good fortune of being introduced to Swiss Air. We boarded the Boeing 777 in Zurich bound for Chicago. Even though we were in the cheap seats, the service, food & drink and amenities were exceptional. If we are ever again given the choice of pretzels or Swiss Chocolate  we‚Äôll go with Swiss!

title: My God so low budget of a Airline Company
review_text: For an international flight what a joke of a airline. You have to pay for alcohol. The quality  of food was poor. Ordered a  vegetarian for the wife did not get her one as they said they did not have one for her. Flight attendants not overly friendly. Would never fly this airline again.
