title: Comfortable Seats
review_text: Comfortable seats on an Airbus 340 on a nearly 9 hour flight departing Boston at 9:30 pm.  The in flight service was very good with a nice meal served shortly after departure and then they came through the cabin at least 5 times with water or other drinks and then again another small meal prior to landing in Zurich.  The aircraft was clean and the ride was smooth. Overall, a very nice flight with a very pleasant crew.

title: terrific for long trips
review_text: It was a great experience to fly with Swiss ALs, the crew is so descent and professional, the food and beverages are awesome. Costs vs benefit make it superior choice

title: Excellence in Europe
review_text:
Flying from Athens International Airport to London Heathrow International through Zurich, was an excellent experience! Fast service during checking,perfect lounge to relax,and have some appetizers before connection flight. Also Zurich International Airport,refers as a friendly smoking,with many smoking areas.
Food during both flights was very good, and service also.
Actually Swiss International Air Lines is one of my favorites !!

title: Worst Customer Care ever
review_text:
Our Flight was cancelled, it was a transfer in a Cancun-Zurich-Madrid flight, without any previous notice. The girls at the desk were rude and tell us there is no possible claim because it was for our own safety!! They put us in another flight with an extra stop in Porto, last row terrible for dizziness, no leaning seat, crowded plane, terrible...
Back in Spain they keep giving us no reason, no refund, so I decided to rise the claim to the Air Transport Authorities here.
Terrible, I will never use Swiss again. I'm quite used to flight, almost in a monthly bases, and I've never met such a terrible Customer Care.

title: swiss is the best.
review_text: i tried other airlines and other tranzit airports, but nothing is like Swiss. i don't know how thay are doing this, but they are the best, much better than any other airlines. correct, clean, good and give you a wonderful value for your money. not more expensive then others airlines. i promised to myself to stay Swiss, after i had other awfull experience.

title: efficient, comfortable - well SWISS
review_text: We departed from YUL with a quick change of planes in Zurich and arrived in Florence.  The 4 planes in our roundtrip were in great shape and the service was efficient and pleasant.  No charge for one checked bag and on carry on.  Pillows and blankets on our seats along with headsets for the free TV and movies on the individual screens.  I will fly with them again!

title: Total opposite of Swiss quality!
review_text:
Flew economy from Newark NJ to Zurich on an A340. The plane was obviously dated and in need of a major refurbishment; seats and carpets dirty, toilets smelly, seat pocket was ripped, entertainment system diabolically poor (rubbish selection, 10+ year old TVs), plane cameras to watch on TV not working. The seat had no legroom due to the in flight entertainment box being right in front of your feet. Service was below average: food wasn‚Äôt terrible, drinks service was small cups of drink rather than the full can... 

Onward flight from Zurich to Birmingham was delayed, along with nearly every other Swiss flight that day. No real information just constant notifications of ‚ÄúSwiss flight XYZ to ABC is delayed‚Äù... useful! Zurich airport terrible, no real shopping or restaurant facilities if you‚Äôre transiting.

Disappointed as you expect quality and efficiency from the Swiss, I would not recommend flying long haul on their dated and uncomfortable aircraft.

title: Swiss air at Geneva airport really bad experience !
review_text: Upon arrival to the check in, we were informed our two standard bike cases were too big to be fitted into the planes cargo space, which is pretty laughable, considering we have flown to Europe and back with them on 15-20 occasions through the years. Every single employee on this day September 26th was a trainee with or without an overstressed supervisor. Therefore we had to trudge over to Swiss Air customer service desk where the trainee was possibly the rudest airline employee we have ever encountered. Once the supervisor showed up, things improved. The end result after two hours of a lot head scratching, was that we had to pay an exorbitant fee for each bike, but miraculously the cargo space was now big enough to handle our bike cases without a problem. Luckily, we had arrived at the airport 3 hours ahead of time and just barely made our flight.

title: Bad expirience
review_text:
Have booked a ticked and paid for seat selection option (selected row 8).
On the check-in however I was told that the aircraft type changed and my selection is not valid, so I'll be checked-in to the row 35 or something.
My thoughts are that Business class was simply expanded to couple more rows and my booking became invalid.
Office was not responsive for complain first but after couple of weeks asked me to send them copy of paper boarding pass. I asked if they can check in their systems, they refused so I gave up.
Toilets on board were of the smallest size I've ever seed.
Chocolate was delicious though.

title: Great business class experience
review_text:
I had the chance to fly Swiss business class on my way from Bucharest to Zurich back in August.
I can clearly recommend Swiss airlines in general, but if you have the chance to fly Business, it is totally worth it. 

Not only the services in Swiss airlines are very good but also the space between the seats is decent.

title: Good Service
review_text: Comfortable Flight from Zurich to Johannesburg. Full flight. Isle seat 35G. Food was good and they had a vegetarian option for me as I did not pre-book due to a last minute change from Lufthansa to Swiss Air. Soft landing at OR Tambo. Friendly flight crew.

title: No flexiblity
review_text: Booked a ticket for their airline,missed my flight check in by 10 mins and then had to buy a new ticket yet the ticket I had said I could make changes. The extra was 350chf and it was cheaper to buy a brand new ticket via the online system 1 hour before than to get help by the service desk. Wouldn't use them again. Even easy jet have helped me more.

title: Terrible
review_text:
Our flight from Rome to Zurich had almost 2 hours delay and we missed our connecting flight to Las Vegas. We got rebooked on the next flight (26 hours later) while they accomodated us in an hotel in Zurich for the night.
The next day I asked about my baggage (that was supposed to be automatically loaded on the new flight) and the personnel at the gate treated me as if I was bothering them.
When we finally got to Las Vegas there was no baggage. They send me my suitcase 4 days later and I wasted another half a day of my vacation to go and pick it up at an airport.
To sum up I won't fly Swiss again and I would not recommend it.

title: Small Country, Big Service
review_text:
Traveling to Thailand the forth time this year and compering with my other (also good) experiences with Lufthansa and Austrian I have to say: Small country, big service! The food (an outstanding vitello tonnato, a perfect grilled beef and a surprisingly good looking dessert compared by espresso and Swiss chocolate) was excellent! And where you get a really good Swiss wine on board?
Concerning the breakfast: What other airlines could learn, you can select at Swiss each thing (no matter if cold cut, yogurt, fresh fruits, jam, eggs ...) separately from the trolley. So, there is no need to decide the evening before if you like to have an egg next morning or not.
Well, the ‚ÄúSt√ºbli‚Äù, the (just) two Business Class rows behind First Class, is - besides the above mentioned things - one of the strongest arguments for me to try to book Swiss in future!

title: Flight was good Enough.
review_text:
the flight was good. but  because it was an  alternative  flight from  Brussels, i encounterd some problems    of my luggage being delayed. However, the Airlines compansted me and that was a very good gesture. Otherwise all went well.

The meals were OK.  Air Hostesses very  welcoming  and friendly..  The seat was Ok.

But   at Zurich AirPort as we were waiting for the flight to Geneva, , I did not like the way the lady on duty treated me.

title: Again .. completely unreliable
review_text: Again, completely unreliable. Flight cancelled, no reason at all given. Pretty sad state this airline. A shame for Switzerland. Look for alternate Star Alliance partner (can not be worse .. bar very low).

title: Best for long-haul flights
review_text: Thanks to Swiss Airlines, I am not terrified any more by the lack of comfort and bad food in long-haul flights. I had economy tickets from Zurich to Singapore and back this September, with comfortable seats and enough legroom (I'm 1,72m heigh), the food was good, both dinner and breakfast, much better than other airlines offer, with vegetarian meals also. The options for entertainment are good, many new movies and good documentaries, also the crew was nice. What I appreciated the most is that even though reserving a normal seat online is pricey, starting 35 euro, in the airport they agreed to change my automatically selected seat on the boarding pass as I was requesting, if possible, to have an aisle seat for the almost 12h flight. For the outbound flight I was even luckier. They agreed to offer me a window seat this time and above that, this one was an extra legroom seat. I really appreciated they were trying to help me have a pleasant flight. And so it was. I travel abroad almost every month, this was a very pleasant flight and I'm a 100% satisfied future customer. Thanks Swiss, you're my top choice now.

title: Incoming flight was delayed; alternative route was horrible
review_text: The flight coming into Newark must have been delayed so our takeoff was pushed back.  But that only left 20 minutes for a connecting flight.  So Swiss Air rebooked our trip from Newark to London to Frankfurt to Venice, not arriving until early evening.   We had dinner reservations that couldn't be canceled, so this was unacceptable.  I contacted Swiss Air, they told me to contact Expedia.  I contacted Expedia and they said that Swiss Air owned the tickets and only they could change them.  Expedia worked things out and got us onto a Lufthansa flight but it was quite nerve-wracking.

title: Happy to fly Swissair again
review_text: Very satisfied with our two flights with Swissair. Seats were the usual size for economy, and aircraft were full, but the cabin crew were very good and the facilities were cleaner than with other airlines we have flown with.

title: O.K.
review_text: Flight was good, however the free snack was only just edible!! no butter on bread and a minimal slither of spread!!

title: Small seats
review_text: We flew to Z√ºrich then on the Florence. The plane from Z√ºrich to Florence was newer and more comfortable. The plane from Boston was terrible. When the person in front put their seat back I could not use my tray table to eat. The stewardess had to ask her to put it up.  Would never fly them again. The airline try to cram in you in. I paid for business on the return flight to avoid the nightmare in the back. The best I have found is Aer Lingus.  They go through Dublin. If you are a little crammed at least is it a shorter flight. Also clear US customs in Dublin avoids the crowds in Boston.

title: Swissair, never again
review_text: Due to technical problems, our flight had a delay of more than two hours and we missed our connecting flight from Z√ºrich to Amsterdam. We arrived in Amsterdam at 15.30 instead of 09.00. According to European law a compensation would be justified. However, Swiss air is not part of the eu and therefore there seems to be no possibility to claim any compensation if there is a delay for any reason. We already experienced a total lack of customer satisfaction during our flight from Amsterdam to Boston, with a delay of 24 hours without any compensation. We fly to the US at least 4 times a year, but we never had such a disappointing customer experience. Therefore we will never fly Swiss air again, and we absolutely not recommend it to anybody.

title: Lx1266, from a commuters perspective,  zrh to Copenhagen
review_text:
Date: 25th September. Main reason for 4 stars: bus gate & late with Helvetic Airline and raw, not ripe fruit 
Alarm off 5:40
Town bus 6:02 to ZRH
7 people ahead of me in the fast lane security,  but randomly selected for checks
In the lounge 06:22, which is very good. There are two automated checkin lanes to the new lounge, which has been refurbished with light stone colours on the walls. There was a small table vacant.
Enjoying on site prepared scrambled eggs with bacon (cubes, not rashes) bread (or choice of full grain roll or croissant) and cheese (2 types)
Boarding indicated 06:43 and walking to bus gate near the lounge.
I got on the first bus. After this a Miles&More Hon circle first class transfer bus and an additional 2 minibusses.
Last 4 passengers boarding 07:05 on the Embraer 190 operated by Helvetic for Swiss.
On this mackine there is a 2+2 seating arrangement, which means 1 + 1 in the business class, where I am after 10 flights in the coach. Bottled water and a tissue is provided upon arrival. 
07:10: stairs removed. The flight attendant provides a pillow.
07:18: a passenger receives a cup of tea (in China), on her request 
07:19: PA Announcement of departure and the travel time of 1 h 40 min, which is up to 20 min slower than for the late evening flights. And a security demonstration.
07:26: Tea cup collected, then rolling on the tarmac. The sun has broken through, clear skies.
07:36: In the air Standard West take off, turning south over Katzensee,  then West over Limmat river, south and west over Hardbrucke, with the airport to the left of A seats at 07:41.
07:41: Belt sign turned off, with PA announcement. 
to leave Switzerland north over Wintherthur - Stein am Rhein and a view of Bodensee from the F seats.
07:48: breakfast served. The kiwi fruit was too raw. The grapes had pips. Otherwise a nice serving
08:02: second serving of bread 
08:05: first collection of plates, second of drinks. My second table was viped down by the flight attendant, so it would be impeccable on the return leg.
(very quiet cabin, 10 in the business class) 
08:15: pa announcement of tax free sales 
08:36: chocolate served
08:43: PA announcement, East of Hamburg, eta 30 min Copenhagen (=20 min late).
09:03: PA fasten seat belts, White Cliffs of Stevns to the left.
09:17: touch down, landing in SW direction, Copenhagen visible from F seats
09:24: walk through gate A14, time for luggage 5-10 min, but I have none
09:29: through the customs.
09:34: on the train from the airport station.

title: Air travel like the good old days!
review_text: Wow! Friendly, patient, helpful flight staff, comfortable seats with some legroom, edible food served throughout the longest leg of the trip. I usually book for flight times and price, but I will be looking for flights on this airline in the future!

title: Replaced by bus
review_text: Should be illegal to replace a plane with a bus. Our 50 minuits flight between zurich and Stuttgart was replaced by a 4 hour bus. It was really painful and we got zero information why. If we don't get our money back I will nerver use swiss air again.

title: First and last time with Swiss Air
review_text: Decided to go with Swiss Air for our trip to Italy because of the reviews. Our first leg was to Florence with a stop over in Zurich. Horrible flight. The leg room was ridiculous. The person in front of my put her seat back and my legs were struggling for space as a result and I am only 5'6. The TVs were poor quality and wouldn't turn off if you didn't want to use them. Multiple people on the plane were putting things over the screens so they could sleep and not have the bright light in there faces. My wife paused a movie at a point when it was dark so she could sleep. I knew when we landed in Zurich and had to get to our connecting flight that our return trip was going to be a problem. We had enough an hour and half for our connecting flight to Florence but we were only going to have 45 min on our connection home. We had to go all away across the airport take multiple flights of stairs and then take a tram to get to our next gate as well as wait in line to pass through customs. Having the extra time between flights is a must at Zurich. Our flight home was the breaking point though. We flew out of Rome to head home and the flight was already listed as 10 min later when we got there. Then as the time got closer it definitely looked like it was going to be delayed even more. No word from Swiss Air though. We just kept seeing the departure times getting moved back. Finally we were called to board. One guy taking tickets and answering questions so by the time we got through that and took the shuttle buses to the plane to depart it was an hour late to take off. So we would be landing in Zurich at the time our plane to Boston would be leaving. No reason given for the delay. They said they would give us an update on the connecting flights 15 min before we landed. We were just told to go to a transfer desk when we got there at that point. Then as soon as we landed I got a text that we missed our flight and would be leaving the following day now. We got to the transfer desk and only 1 person was working and the line was getting longer. We finally got our boarding passes for the next day but were then told to go to another transfer desk where we just got off the plane to get our hotel transfer. At that point we were resigned to the fact we would be staying the night in Zurich so we decided to make the best of it. But not the case. We were given a taxi voucher for a hotel that was an hour away!! Apparently every hotel in the Zurich area was booked. By the time we left that airport and got to the hotel it had been 3 hours since we got off the plane. We were tired and hungry. We planned to just check in and go to the hotel restaurant to eat when we got there. We had a voucher for dinner there. Alas we get there to check in and are told they don't have a restaurant at the hotel!! Only snacks at the bar. The hotel was like staying in a hostel as well. Luckily on our next day everything went ok. Flights were always late that we took and we didn't have the smoothest landings on a couple of our flights. I would never fly Swiss again. If you have the option to fly Swiss with connections in Zurich I would think twice.

title: Overcrowded and smelly business lounge
review_text:
In Lounge A there was no place to sit and have a snack. There were so many people that a stench in the air made it unbreathable. Also, ypu have no possibilty of getting some fresh air on a terace, as with other lounges. 
Otherwise we were very happy with the flight and services on board. Nice personal on board and at the desk.

title: Great flight with great connection. Swiss Quality.  Made in Swiss
review_text:
I had a great trip to LA with Swiss airline.
They have great services on board, great entertainment, very good food and a great wine selection & chocolate.
My flight was from Budapest with a great connection in Zurich less than 2 hours.
Everythig was on time.
The planes was very clean and new (Bombardier CS100 and Boeing 777-300) and confortable.

title: Disappointing. Advertising?
review_text:
Flying SWISS to Athens and back was disappointing. This was on the tail end and at the beginning of our trip to Athens from Brisbane Australia. We had been flying Singapore Airlines until this point of our trip.

We were on the 777-300ER and then the a320 on the return flight. 

The first flight, on the 777 we found the cabin to be far too hot. Additionally the seat was average, and although the IFE was relatively new, there was no remote. No remote is really not the end of the world, however after take off there were numerous ads played, the ad sequence lasted for around 15-20 minutes, and felt like a bad joke.

The food onboard was somewhat decent for a short flight, the meal was tasty, hot and filled the gap. 

The a320 on the return flight was much the same with the advertising.

Legroom on both aircraft was about average, tight but not unbearable. 

The staff were ok, I know that someone travelling with us had a negative experience but overall the staff were also not too bad. 

All in all, SWISS is not great. The advertising is awful, and everything else is about average, though the food was good. As SWISS is the only European airline, aside from Ryanair that I‚Äôve flown I can‚Äôt recommend much else, though what I can say is think twice about flying SWISS, as there‚Äôs quite possibly something better.

title: Fantastic
review_text: Everything happened on time and all went smoothly at every step. The change to another plane in Zurich was like clockwork, including going through customs. Food was good, loved the chocolates and the video selections helped me pass the time quickly.

title: Great care to passenger struggling with ear problems
review_text:
We had over 10 hour flight due to head winds and had great service. Business class had 4 flight attendants taking care of us. I had a head cold and struggled equalizing my ears. They brought me medicine to use, hot water and lemon and checked on me regularly in addition to their normal duties. They were amazing even though English was not their first language. Business class seats had a variety of positions including completely flat. I think anyone over 5' 10" would struggle to lie down. Each seat had it's own screen and large selection of older movies and TV shows. The headsets they supplied were very uncomfortable for such a long flight. We tried just our normal head phones and although they only had one plug they worked and sound was much better and more comfortable. Food was decent, loved the ice cream snack. Seats had built in massagers, foot rest that raised, etc. Still 10 hours was a very long time!!

On the flip side, we flew from Venice to Zurich in business class to connect to this flight. Business class was non existent. They just left the middle seat open. No extra leg room, no extra seat room, but did get free drinks. Since it was such a short flight didn't really bother us, but thought it very strange.

title: Not worth flying
review_text: It was awful. Flight staff not friendly. One staff told me to close my window blind even though it was dark and we were not even near destination. My husband requested special meal for me . They did not honour it. I had to eat snacks. As I had no meal due to them. They took forever to collect people‚Äôs garbgage off their trays. They let kids scream on the plane not talking to parents and staff were not friendly at all. The plane had no air conditioner like a sauna. Never flying them again.

title: A good flight
review_text:
In A  long time we did't have such a good flight.
The service was good, The aircraft was clean.
The service was excelent, the entertaiment was good, and even the food was fine.

title: Dare to call it The Best airline I flew with!
review_text:
I flew with Swiss at least 3 times, and with many other airlines.
Each time I got the best impression with Swiss, they are consistent with their services and quality of the airplanes:
* Always the cleanest - seats/cabin/toilet 
* Always very good meals and service - among the largest variety of drinks I've seen in a Economy cabin
* Always great In-Flight Entertainment, the largest screens I've seen in a Economy cabin
* Always I get very relaxed atmosphere during the flight, even if there are small children (they give them toys and such)
* Legroom is definitely bigger comparing to other airlines I've been
* Also the last seats in the end are actually very good and not worse than seats more to the front. No smell or noise of toilet since it's designed to be opened in the real back, not on the side.

I will definitely prefer them in my next flight.

title: Adventures in Europe 2018
review_text: I arrived at airport in the early evening. Had to wait for on-screen departure information for the correct Terminal for check-in. Utilised the efficient Sky rail to terminal 3 which is on the far side of the main runway. Staff member assisted me with self-check-in process. Easy to follow process through security and customs. Limited choice of food outlets in this area. Great to see airport from Observation Deck on the roof, accessible by lift. Very difficult to understand announcements over loud speakers.

title: Toilet not accessible
review_text:
We went to zurich for one night and had another flight to Boston a day later. We took business because I have physical disability I use crutches for walking and braces to hold me.so the  space between the seats is critical for me. I am ready to pay for my comfort. This option doesn't exist for the toilet. Even though they let me use the first class toilet for me it is hard to get in and use it . If for me it is so hard for person in wheelchair it is impossible. They need to leave the door open when they use the toilet. It is humiliating.
 I don't understand why don't the airline companies adopted the UN declaration about the rights for equality for everyone.

title: Not bad depending which plane you get
review_text: Our first flight was good, very nice plane with good amenities. Service was good on that flight. We ended up connecting in Zurich for our next flight which was a bit more disappointing. You can tell the plane was older not only by the decor but as well as how the tv screens wouldn‚Äôt work in certain time. The flight attendant came by often with snacks which was appreciated. Over all it was okay not too impressive. I would recommend this airline to anyone looking for a flight in Europe.

title: Swiss almost like Ryanair
review_text: Swiss has stopped offering complimentary service in economy, except a glass of water - second glass is charged! If even Swiss is desperate for cost savings coming from a snack and a glass of soda, what is the difference from Ryanair which has even cheaper tickets? Shame on you, Swiss guys.

title: It's hard to find anything that this airline does poorly
review_text:
I recently flew Business Class on Swiss from BRU-ZRH and ZRH-CAI, enjoying friendly, professional cabin service and excellent seating on an A330 from ZRH-CAI in the Business Class cabin.  The lie-flat seating made it almost impossible to enjoy the excellent food and beverage options because I fell asleep.

The Swiss Lounge in terminal E at Zurich is an excellent lounge and among the best in Europe without it being exclusive to First Class customers.  I enjoyed a made-to-order omelette and delicious coffee.

Transit between terminals was flawless.  I had just 50 minutes for connection and I made it from the Schengen zone through immigration, on the train between terminals, and into the non-Schengen zone and still had time to shop and to visit the lounge without hurrying.  Perfection.

title: Good Experience
review_text: My overall experience was good.  On departure took a United flight to Chicago and changed planes to Swiss Air to Zurich.  United is a partner.  My bags were labeled priority. The attendants were plentiful and the service was good.  Had a smooth change in Zurich to St Petersburg.  My return was a different route and all went well with no delays.  On the long haul my seat was roomy and comfortable.  Must mention the flying experience was far different from telephone communication experienced  with Swiss Air the few days prior to my flight.  The phone experience was rude and ignorant.

title: Zurich to SIngapore cattle wagon
review_text: Disappointing small uncomfortable seats on a 11 hour flight. Very pleasant staff. Even with the extra legroom seats, it was still to tight. Swissair swapped our seats at the last minute, without giving a reason. What are they on?

title: Service excellence
review_text: From check-in at I.I Tambo international, my connection in Zurich to land in in Geneva everything was smooth and excellent. The staff is very friendly and the aircraft was clean. Great food service and lots of legroom in the cabin.

title: Smooth flight, again some small delays and flying through zurich is not very pleasant
review_text:
Flying with Swiss is a pretty safe bet. 

We had some small delays but they informed us well of what the timeline was and respected this updated hour.
 
Service on the plane is OK, and the booking system/prices are pretty straightforward with less costly upgrades and services than other companies.

One of the main problem of Swiss is that most of their flights are via Zurich which is not a great airport. Expect huge lines at customs, very pricey drinks and snacks and endless walks through what could be a more compact airport.

title: Bad Experience
review_text:
it was very bad experience with the check in agent,
i had over weight luggage as i was staying a long term in Germany and it was exact the same weight i came with on Lufthansa.
they told me i have to pay for the extra weight and get rid of my laptop bag. As i always travel with my back bag and laptop bag in Cabin but they refused . they told me you are allowed with only 1 bag on Cabin. which is weird as i my back bag holds my personal items and i cant get rid of any of both.
I asked them to upgrade to business or 1st class and i will pay but they refused. they told me we dont sell tickets in a rude way. we are check in agents !!. you must go to travel agent and buy a business class ticket!!!
To make it short i had to throw away my books and cloth so i would distribute my weight on an extra luggage and pay for it.
i paid for the extra luggage as much as i can pay for business upgrade and i would travel easily and smoothely .
i sent a complain to Lufthansa but i got no asnwer

title: Smooth and great flights
review_text: This airlines really knows how to take care of you. The long flights have great food and many choices including gluten free choices. The desserts are special. All,of the flight attendants were very helpful

title: Luxury flight
review_text: I think Swiss Air is one of the best company in Europe. I flown with a Bombardier C100 aircraft and it was very comfortable. The staff was very competent and kind with the passengers. During the trip you can also eat a Switzerland specialities and their famous chocolate!!!

title: Top as usual - typically Swiss
review_text:
These days Swiss operates quite often with its B777-300. The crew was very courteous and professional. Service was very personalised and friendly. 

The aircraft itself is just great to fly on, spacious and not as noisy as other long-haul planes.

title: No meal on 8+ hour flight
review_text: We were near the back and got no meal for the lunch service.  They ran out of chicken.  Offered tomato soup.  Then when they came around with a later flight snack, the flight attendant thought it funny to tell me not to eat it because it was "vegetarian" (making a reference that I didn't want the tomato soup because it was vegetarian).  It was a tomato and black olive pizza pocket.  I like Swiss, but so disappointed in the food and service this time.

title: Swiss Global is a boutique airline
review_text: There is a tradition of hospitality among the Swiss that comes through even on their airlines.  There was not any one particular gesture that left me with this impression, but there was definitely an attitude of taking care of the customers, making sure that they are well cared for, and fully comfortable.  It seemed to be reflected in the little things, dozens of them, that all came together to create a pleasurable experience.  I look forward to flying with Swiss Global again.

title: Sustaining passenger through the ordeal of a long flight
review_text:
With strong headwinds it took Swiss 12 hours and 20 minutes to get me from Tokyo to Zurich. In terms of flying it was an uneventful flight which took of ten minutes early from Narita and arrived 10 minutes late at Kloten. The cabin crew was decided to ensure we had a good experience. They served two delicious meals in a relaxed pace, provided great bar service and on the whole went out of their way to make our flight comfortable. I slept well five whole hours.
Unfortunately, my attempt to get an upgrade to First at check in failed. I had the two e-vouchers but they are not valid if you have purchased your ticket through an other, code-sharing airline (in this case ANA).
 My only criticism is about the plane used for this route, the A340. These are now very dated, and particularly the small screen and the poor sound quality make the inflight entertainment a product below minimum standards.  We landed at 16:45 and I would have expected a bit more support from SWISS ground staff to make it to my very short Geneva connection .. but I made it on my own and was on the ground in Geneva at 17.20

title: Best flight ever!
review_text: The flight itself was perfect! Seat with lots of legroom and good entertainment system. Food and beverages were simply great. Flight crew was polite and pleasant. Flight arrived in time. The only down point that prevents me from giving a big 10 to this flight was the land crew from Swiss check in desk. Impolite, rude and in a bad mood. I would expect at least politeness from those.

title: No Notice Cancellation and Bad Customer Service
review_text:
This is my first review of an airline and sad to say it is not a good one. In fact from start to finish Swiss International have been probably the worst customer service we have ever experienced. At this point we are going to use a third party company to get back the money they owe us for an unannounced flight cancellation that had us, including our infant son at Yangon international airport at 7am only to be told the connecting flight from Bangkok to Zurich had been cancelled and we had been booked on another flight 12 hours later.  This had us arriving a day late meaning we had to pay for a night in a hotel that we didn't use and reschedule an airport pickup. It also threw our child's sleeping pattern off by a lot more as we had planned the original flights to reduce the impact as much as possible. 
Despite all of this Swiss Airlines have been non communicative and after months of trying to get compensation for this we eventually for a form letter with a pittance of an $80 travel voucher offer for flights that totaled more than $1000 each. 

So I will not be flying on this airline if I can help it and Swiss Air will be coughing up the proper amount as required by law.

title: Love flying business class back from europe
review_text: Love the Business class seats on Swiss International Airbus A330.  Seats fold down into the space in front of each seat so that they are completely flat.  Seats are comfortable and even came with a built in massager.  The one disadvantage is that if you're in a side section, crossing over the aisle seat is difficult when it's being used so beware of getting window seats. Swiss International (business class) was so much better than other international flights I've had.  The Business class stewards were absolutely super polite and friendly.  The food was superb.  Went with the Filet Mignon and a good Cabernet.  Excellent wine choices and meal selections.  Deserts were artistic and good.  The bathroom was huge and super clean, I could have easily used it as a changing room.

title: Very disappointed
review_text: Very unhappy with my recent transatlantic trip on Swiss, and frankly I expected much better based on good past experiences. I believe these were the most closely packed seats I had ever experienced, and on an overnight flight a bit of comfort is very important. My wife and I are smaller than average people, yet when trying to recline our legs were in contact with the reclined seat in front of us, and we could not easily move at all - little possibility of sleep. We had an ongoing seating issue for over 2 months - I understood that it was a complication that my ticket was purchased by my company's agency and my wife's was a personal purchase, but months in advance I tried to ensure that we could sit together, even at added cost. Full details would be too complicated, but in 3 separate series of communications, I was assured that we would have seats together, then sometime later I'd notice on the website that this was no longer the case, and we had separate or unreserved seats, and would start a new series of phone calls. Combining the reservations seemed not possible. In one case a representative told me that their notes said that I had agreed in a previous call to the understanding that our seats might not be together! - nothing could be further from the truth, I had always made clear that this was my highest priority, so that anyone who wrote otherwise was either being dishonest or their communication skills were too weak to be on a US customer service line. Again, the full story is very complex, but my short summary is that I do not plan to fly Swiss again.

title: 2018 Vacation
review_text: Good flight and food not the most comfortable seats and, but was fine.  We will take another Swiss flight. Overall average to good B-Class.

title: Sweet Swiss
review_text: Very polite staff ,in everything good service with Swiss chocolate at the end.Aircraft new bombardier with comfortable seats and enough legroom for that flight

title: Comfortable with excellent service
review_text:
The business class seats are perfect for me. After a good dinner I never have any problems to fall asleep until arrival.
I also want to explicitly mention the excellent onboard service, which is always on the same high standard.

title: Economy Class, with excellent service
review_text: For the LX 7 flight (Chicago to Zurich), the seats could have been more comfortable and the in flight entertainment had some issues with the touch screen but overall a good flight.  Again, the flight attendants work so hard and really provide excellent service.  The food was good on this flight.  The trip to Prague was quick and the seats on this plane were most comfortable.

title: Excellent service
review_text: We had the good fortune to bid up to business class during this leg of our trip home from Budapest.  These flight attendants work very hard - it was world class service and top notch food (that just seemed to keep coming).  The lay flat seats were quite comfortable.  I would definitely fly with them again.

title: Perfect Travel
review_text: Perfect travel from Italy to Spain through Swiss. Flights were on time as scheduled, good service both on/off board, personnel on board were very nice, enough seat space.

title: Great Business Class at a reasonable price.
review_text: Flew from Brisbane to Barcelona for holidays on Swiss Air. The flight from Brisbane to Singapore was on a Singapore Airlines flight then Swiss to Zurich and on to Barcelona. Used the Singapore business lounges in Brisbane and Singapore. Both very good but not up to Cathay standard in Hong Kong. Plenty of space, service and comfort on Singapore airlines flight but for a tall person, the small space to put your feet when you lie down is not the best. In addition, you lie at an angle. Swiss Air has smaller seats and less privacy but you lie out straight with plenty of foot room. Service on Swiss not quite Singapore standard but more than adequate. Food was great. I had the best steak I‚Äôve ever had on a flight. A great way to fly to Europe and would recommend it to anyone.

title: Big Improvement in Aircraft Model
review_text: It was not my first time to travel business class on Swiss International from Cairo to Zurich on in return. This time on the flight dated 19th of September,  I was happily surprised by the seats of business class having fully reclining seats with separate screens and more privacy. The meals quality was augmented with having a closer touch of long flights business class quality. I also won't forget the very good attitude of the crew. Timing was perfect without delays. It was really a pleasant experience.

title: Great
review_text: Great services,best air crew very good asian veg food served,comfortable flight would be better if leg space was more

title: Only recommended for safety
review_text:
Safety First. Absolutely trustworthy airline. 
Service onboard 4 stars. 

Service before/after flight + timeliness is an absolute disaster. Don‚Äôt have any expectations for the money you spend.

title: No change since April
review_text: After my flight in April, I said that Swiss was faultless on passenger service and handling, but that the seats, even in Business Class, were narrow. This is still the case. However, despite the drawbacks, on price and convenience, it is still the best option for me. I get to fly into Manchester or Birmingham, both convenient for me, following a smooth, easy transit in Zurich airport. The food is good quality but a little unexciting. The service is good and the aircraft clean.

title: Poor cabin
review_text:
The crew were excellent but were let down by the poor fit out. TV screen was very old and half way through the first movie the entire system crashed
Will not fly with them again until the facility‚Äôs are updated

title: A Disappointing Ride
review_text: Perhaps my expectations were a bit too high for Swiss business class.  The seats were rock-like hard and the food barely edible.  Highly unpalatable and totally uncomfortable are the bywords for this leg of my trip.  The staff was also highly unattentive.  Strange for Swiss, I should think.

title: DEFINATELY BETTER THAN Lufthanssa!
review_text: We were pleasantly surprised with this airline as we had a terrible experience with Lufthansa.  The seats were much more comfortable and the food was very edible.  The flight attendants were always doing things to make the trip comfortable.  This airline I would fly again.

title: Definitely more confortable than EasyJet
review_text:
Obviously we are close to low-cost products, but a bit more expensive than easyJet.
However, you enjoy more leg room, you may take in-cabin for free a carry-on plus a bag when on easyJet it is no longer allowed.
Water and a snack are free.
Punctuality with Swiss is much better.
Two negative points :
. In Geneva the boarding gate is far too far,
. On board stewardess should favor Swiss idioma (French and German) plus Spanish as we were flying to Spain and not bend to the anglo-saxon imperialism and deliver some information ONLY IN English because of a pax pretending not to understand French.

title: Excellent service
review_text: Swiss provided an excellent service from start to finish. Flights were punctual and check-in and boarding processes were simple and easy. On board service was excellent. On board catering was excellent, much more than normal for a European short-haul flight! The thank you chocolate at the end really summed up an excellent experience!

title: Great Experience
review_text: On time, comfortable seats, great flight attendants. Meal service was good and included an ice cream snack!

title: Great service.
review_text: First time for us with Swiss. The waiting area is at the end of the terminal and has only few chairs to sit on so that was negative for us. The boarding was bit disorganized, which is not what Switzerland is known for. After that flight was smooth, service was great. We were served dinner and breakfast and tons of wine. Even included real silverware, not plastic! Food was tasty and not bad for the airline food. Once in Zurich, everything was easy smooth at the airport. Will fly Swiss again for sure!

title: Beter than expected
review_text:
The service from the start was good and friendly. There was enough room for my 180cm, I could easily move is my seat.
The food was tasty and fresh. We realy got enough to drink on this medium long flight.
Suprise at the end we got an ice cream.

title: Disappointed or too high expectations?
review_text:
After a good start, our plane turned back to base (Zurich) for a medical emergency.
Upon arrival in Zurich (a Swiss base) there was very little information available, if you looked for it. For those who just waited in line -as we were told to do - there was NO information at all, other than "wait".
So we waited from 5PM, to 1AM in a queue, to get rescheduled. They brought us one bottle of water in that time, that's it. By 1AM, I was offered a dinner voucher, that turned out to be worthless because no restaurant or hotel served dinner at the time. 
Worst of all: there was no flight for us to reschedule to.
I can't believe that a big alliance like Star Alliance cannot find a plane to work away a stranded long-haul flight. Very disappointing.
Oh yes, i got a 80‚Ç¨ restaurant voucher.

title: Excellent flight
review_text: I have enjoyed the flight a lot.  The aircraft is comfortable with good TV screens, a lot of place for legs, very tasty food and courteous staff.

title: Top friendly and attentive staff - but getting dropped off on the tarmac, transported to the terminal by bus is just ann
review_text:
All staff managed to keep up a smiling face, although too many passengers carry too much hand luggage (carry-ons, extra bags). 
All airlines could benefit from studying boarding procedures. Make sure to load the aircraft back to front, instead of creating total mess as all rows access at the same time. That always creates tension among passengers and between passengers and staff.

title: Excellent Crew
review_text: The seats are more comfortable than most.  The crew was pleasant and efficient.  Due to weather we had to divert to Milwaukee and everyone of course was anxious after 9 1/2 hrs in the air.  The crew kept smiling, handing out waters and trying to keep everyone upbeat. We did get to go on back to O'Hare  after a few hours on the tarmac and after the plane refueled. We were impressed overall with how they handled it all.

title: Business Class- not Great
review_text:
The seat converts to a bed- that is good, although it would be nice if a duvet were supplied, rather than just a blanket. . When sitting on a long flight,  I prefer to have my legs in a horizontal position t.  That is not possible in these seats.
Service on this flight was friendly

title: Amazing service
review_text:
Flying to Sao Paulo from Dublin, with a stop in Zurich, on Business Class, was a great experience, specially for the service provided onboard both flights, very efficient and polite. One negative aspect of that trip (that is not related to Swiss directly) was the awful service offered at the Business Lounge of Dublin Airport Terminal 1 - cramped, with below minimums offer of food, all self-service coffee machines not working, forcing you to be served by a lady in not the best of moods, complemented by mini-croissants that were at least 24 hours old.
All the opposite from the Business Class Lounge on Terminal E from Zurich airport, spacious, with many options of food and amenities, great spaces to work with all privacy. Clean, tidy and well served toilets. Very swiss indeed. 
I took a so-called crown seat for my journey from Zurich to Sao Paulo, and the only sort of negative comment is the extremely cramped leg space when your seat is in bed position. One cannot turn while sleeping without waking up. It¬¥s Ok for people under 1.80m tall, but for me was a little bit squeezed. As for all the rest, they make you feel like a king!

title: Swiss flight review
review_text: We enjoyed a very calm and nice flight back home after over a week of holiday in Apulia. The service was great from the check-in to the boarding and on flight service. Very attentive and friendly staff which made the flight very comfortable.

title: Swiss Air flight
review_text: Best service I've ever had in economy class.Very attentive and wonderful food that was included.Real cutlery  and thick blankets.

title: Very comfortable, efficient and clean
review_text: This airline provided service! The flight was on time, the staff worked hard, the food was better than on any flight I have been on in years. Even in economy, there was adequate leg room.

title: Enjoyed My Trip Home!!
review_text: First timer on Swiss Air. Enjoyed my trip home. Legroom was a little tight but in flight entertainment was great as well as the food! I will use them again in my future travels

title: Won't allow flight changes.
review_text:
Not a great airline.  The cabin was cheap and seats painful.  Tried to reschedule my flight from Sunday to Tuesday 5 days in advance due to a change in the funeral schedule and because the tickets were purchased on Expedia, Swiss Air won't allow any changes whatsoever.  Would have to book a new 1 way ticket and lose out on $900 for an originally $1300 priced round trip.

Never again with Swiss Air.

title: Reliable, efficient quality brand
review_text: You get what you pay for and so this is not the cheapest way to travel. However, Swiss is as Swiss does - efficient and polite. Had a spanking brand-new plane on last trip which had oceans of leg-room as standard, individual mini-screens showing flight progress etc. Complimentary Swiss choccies are always given out - don't hesitate to take more than one! On the BHX to ZUR route a delightful but cold croissant comes on the early flight which is ok when dunked in coffee. Evening flight comes with choice of small filled roll either cheese or, for the first time, spinach (!) Not being Popeye had the cheese. Swiss are as good as anyone in making up delays whenever possible and often succeed very well. Main reason for us using Swiss however is that they offer no-change BHX to ZUR. Only minor irritation is that although you can pre-book a seat they very often send an email saying that for "operational reasons", whatever they are, your seats have been changed. So when you get this immediately go in and see if the new seats are ok and if not re-allocate if possible.

title: Don't spend the extra $100 to get "extra leg room" seating.
review_text:
I had the extra dollars ($100, to be exact) to spend to have "extra leg room" on this flight.  The seat was in the exit door row, stating "window seat".  Yes, this seat did provide extra "leg room".  However, there is no "window" & "seat" is a stretch of the imagination.  The 3 seats in this row are very narrow with the food table tray & the video monitor stored in the armrest.  Thus, the armrests do not fold down, providing extra "seat" space for a bigger booty!
     The person who purchased the middle seat in this row did not fit at all. Fortunately, they were able to accommodate this person in a different row. I cannot imagine what the flight would have been like for we three who paid extra for these seats.
     Myself & the passenger on the aisle spent the rest of the flight laughing at other passengers trying to get thru the pulled curtain on their way to the toilet.  Too funny.  That's the other thing you have to put up with. The extra leg room quickly disappears as people form a cluster line waiting for the toilet.  Our Mantra for this flight was "We Paid To Do This!"
     Here is the last issue to know before you pay extra for this seat, you cannot have your carry-on with you in this space.  So, if you are like me & have snacks, earplugs, books, etc. in your bag, you are up & down getting to your bag in a crowded overhead bin. 
     Ok, point is, if you have a narrow butt, a small tummy & sleep the entire flight, you might be willing to pay extra for this seat.

title: Friendly airline, goor customer service
review_text:
The flight from Amsterdam to Zurich was delayed due to a long waiting time for an empty gate, and no-show pax.
Thanks to the good information on board I was in time for my connecting flight. However, I discovered that somebody else had taken my trolley from overhead Luggage compartiment I was walking around with the wrong trolley. I could leave it in Zurich. Two days later Swiss delivered my missing trolley in Dubai. They informed me all the time in a correct way.

title: Swiss Air service
review_text: Swiss Air was not my first flight l. Have flown with them many times and this time was very disappointed with the service. Inspite of being a flight with a less passenger load, my husband and me were given vegetarian food even though we had requested a non vegetarian meal. The Indian pursur told us that since we were flying to Mumbai they carry more vegetarian meals. So we had no choice but to go without meal and make do with some bread and butter. Not expected of this airline at all. He Swiss stewardesses were polite but could do nothing.

title: Good flight, but unnecessay seat allocation change
review_text: About 2 days before I flew, Swiss contacted me with a change to the seat allocations for me and my wife.  Before the change, we were seated together, but after the change we were not.  Once on the plane, a helpful stewardess asked another person to move, which he kindly did. Most people around us were individuals, not couples, so there would appear to be no reason for the seat change. I do not often use Swiss, but each time I do, they almost always change the seat allocation a day or so before the flight. It makes a mockery of seat selection when booking. This does not happen with budget airlines!

title: New fleet - new seats
review_text: Love the new Swiss fleet, ergonomic seats, smartphone screens above the seat for flight info with same friendly and efficient flight attendants

title: Used to be good - now getting worse every time
review_text: Not worse the money to fly business - service is getting worse and F&B is getting stingy and terrible. Moreover TV screen did not work, not great on a 12 hour flight. Check in on the way back in Switzerland was unfriendly (at business counter) - had 3 bags instead of 2 but below the wight allowance but she wanted extra money despite my frequent flyer card. They do not appreciate their customers and I will never fly Swiss again - we have enough better options

title: surprisingly problem-free
review_text: My main and almost only criterion is punctuality and this flight landed a few minutes ahead of schedule. On a Sunday that is easier but still, I have often enough the other way round.

title: Professional, on time and generous
review_text: This was the best business class experience I've ever had.  Comfy, quite lounge prepares one for the long flight home.  The staff is conscientious, friendly and helpful.  The food was superb and more than I could handle.  It just doesn't get much more enjoyable.

title: Swiss Air review
review_text:
We flew Swiss Air from Zurich to Newark and found the 8 hour flight to be both comfortable and enjoyable.

Our seats were economy but at an exit row immediately behind a bulkhead. The legroom was great (I‚Äôm 6ft and could not reach the bulkhead with my legs). The seats did recline normally too.

Food and drinks were included with at least 3 rounds of drink service, a before meal snack, meal, and another snack (with ice cream) about 1-1/2 hours prior to landing. 

The at seat entertainment worked as intended with plenty of movies. There were earphones, a pillow, and blanket at each seat when we boarded.

title: Great Company to travel with
review_text: Great airline, attentive stuff.  The service on board is really good.  Zurich airport that was the transfer airport is well organized. Only drawback the wifi that is very expensive on the plane.

title: Best short haul flight in years
review_text: This how it should be !   Good seat, good legroom, clean aircraft and genuinely courteous staff.   Return leg was on a Bombardier C Series, my first trip on one of these and it was excellent.  Bright and airy decor, large windows, and decent space.   I know it was short haul but definitely worth the premium.

title: My various flight with Swiss Air
review_text: The thing I like most about Swiss Air is that they are almost always on schedule. The crew are very professional and eager to serve. For someone flying economy I find the seat quite spacious but maybe I'm a small frame person. Plenty space for my legs. The food is good n many kind of snacks that u can have during the long flights. And as for entertainment, many kinds of movies n TV series that u can choose from. The Zurick Airport is modern n spacious with good food.This year alone I've traveled 3 times on Swiss Air n looking forward for the 4th in November. Hope u have the same experience that I have.

title: nice airplane,nice service
review_text: good perssonal, very friendly and helpful .many service provide and much food and drinks by breakfast and dinner on the bord

title: Just okay
review_text: Mediocre business comfort.  Food awful almost inedible unless you order the steak.  Flights were on time and easily made connection.  Going we got to lounge in Zurich and we‚Äôre able to board the plane from there.  Return flight not quite as convenient.

title: No wonder Swiss air has been rated No1
review_text: Great Airline. I fly reasonably often in Australia but none of our Airlines is as good as Swiss Air. Plenty of legroom. Ice-cream for a snack and a Swiss chocolate to top it off. Loved it.

title: Swiss air travel t Greece August 18
review_text:
Great service 
Very happy with the airline and service 
Good food ,VERY clean VERY comfortable setting.
The only problem was we got one suitcase the next day of arriving @ greece -Rodos 
Workers was very helpful @ Rodos airport

title: Whatever... name change
review_text:
This trip hasn‚Äôt even happened yet. I booked a flight to visit my daughter in Serbia for October. I booked through Expedia. I had an Expedia account but have not used it in over 10 years. And I had a different last name. My married name. When I divorced, I changed back to my maiden name. I booked my flight using my corrected last name... which I‚Äôve had for 9 years. But the reservation came through with my married name. Several calls with Expedia rendered me a $50 charge to change my name. I called Swiss Air and they wanted to charge me $150. Neither of these are acceptable solutions. I should not be charged a single cent more to have made a simple mistake! Imagine if I went to the check in on the flight day! 
   I found a great flight and price yet I‚Äôm charged extra when it hasn‚Äôt cost me anything with any other official documentation! I am very displeased and disappointed.

title: No problems for our itinerary
review_text: the flight was short but we could not see any issues. Probably because the plane was a little older? Seats were comfortable, leg room was adequate, food and drinks, decent. Service staff was courteous and helpful.

title: Not much to say....
review_text:
I just want to say that the food is becoming worse. Moreover, from Zurich to Boston, from embarkation till take off the passenger cabin had no a/c!!!!!
Finally, free internet should be offered as other airlines do.

title: Good flight, bad in-flight entertainment
review_text:
In-flight entertainment for BOS-ZRC was useless, not good for 6+ hrs. ZRC-ATH was fine.
Food was excellent on both legs, flight fine too.

title: This airline is not what the old Swissair used to be. This is a low cost of Lufthansa
review_text: Not to be repeated again. Often not on time, the staff often rude. This airline has nothing in common with the old Swissair. It is a low cost branch of Lufthansa. The food is awful it would be better if they didn‚Äôt serve anything.

title: Swiss nightm-air
review_text:
Probably the worst airline ever ! 
-Cancels flights without prior notice and without any compensation despite numerous written passenger claims 
- attributes its failure and malfunction to extraordinary conditions and refuses to comply with EU regulations 
- has numerous long hour delays 
- offers snacks only to luggage carriers and nothing to hand luggage carriers ! This is an international innovation undoubtedly!!!
This airline is a disgrace and a joke  and I am never flying with it ever again and under any circumstances !

title: Good flight
review_text: Swiss Airlines is one of my preferred airlines. I flew them in the past and had an excellent flight. This one had a couple of issues. The seat back entertainment system for my brother did not work the whole flight. They tried to reset it but it never did work. The window seats have compromised legroom from the in-flight entertainment box so my feet were crushed in a small space for 8 hours. The food is good, the attendants are pleasant and they hand out chocolate. We left on time and arrived a few minutes early.

title: Disapointing
review_text: Surprizingly, bus class seats are not made equal by Swiss. Personal space varies, the so-called flat bed (not really flat) is more like a coffin, while some window side passengers are even forced to cross over their neighbours to go to toilet. Hard to understand what can motivate such random seat arrangement, but the short of it is that the arrangements are not properly disclosed to custumers upon purchse or even at check in, so buyer beware of the short straw. Cant understand how is it possible for an airline to sell different specifications bus class seats for the same price on the same flight. Watch out!

title: Very pleasant
review_text: Very pleasant experience.  Flight attendants were helpful and friendly.  We purchased exit row seats for the leg of the flight from Zurich to Miami.  This made all the difference in comfort for us, with the extra leg room.  Hot meal was decent, altho you can upgrade this for more money - we chose not to and were satisfied. Rome airport and Zurich airport were great.  Altho we were delayed for almost an hour out of Zurich, we were only 30 minutes late landing in Miami.

title: On night flight (red-eye), was woken up by flight attendant and made to bring seat upright so passenger behind could eat
review_text:
My wife and myself were flying from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania to Zurich on an overnight flight and my wife was in a window seat. We were in economy but had paid extra to be moved forward to get additional legroom. The flight left Dar at 10:30pm and after the seat belt sign turned off my wife reclined her seat to sleep and was sound asleep when the food service commenced.
Obviously she did not take/get the food service, since she was asleep, but as the attendants were serving the passengers behind us, they came back to our row and woke my wife up and insisted that she raise her seat upright so the passenger behind her would have more room to eat.
We asked if there was a safety issue and why did they have to wake her up.  The flight attendant was very rude and insisted my wife had to raise her seat up for a courtesy to the other passenger, no matter what.  So my wife did, but then asked for her meal since she was awake now and was told that she would have to wait since the meal service had passed her and was serving other people further back.
She finally got her meal, but all of a sudden the head flight attendant/purser arrived at our row, asking if she was going to have a problem with us and again insisted my wife raise and keep her seat upright for the passenger comfort behind her. To say I was flabbergasted (since I travel a lot and have never seen this before) would be an understatement, but then the head purser threatened us before leaving saying I better not have to come back here again to deal with this or then we will have a real problem!

title: If you have an issue .. Watch out
review_text: Good airline, but not great. Service and customer focus absolutely below par. Had an issue with the wifi. They took long time to answer my complaint and then told me it was my fault. the were wrong. For the money involved, this is crazy. I vote with money now. Have book my next 3 international trips and 12 European trips with other Star Alliance partners. They are losing big big time. After I had paid 6,000 CHF for a ticket and complained about a 59 CHF .. they could not handle properly. There loss. I will for ever and again talk badly to colleagues about this customer service situation. Very bad.

title: Comfortable, reliable and good value
review_text: First time flying with Swiss and we flew 4 flights with them on our booking (SIN-ZRH, ZRH-ARN, GOT-ZRH, ZRH-SIN). Flight departed a bit late, almost an hour delay, but it seemed like they buffered for this as we arrived at Zurich on time. Long haul flight was comfortable, seat pitch was fine, and the cabin had a sleepy effect on my partner and I; we dozed off midway through our movie when they dimmed the lights. The 3-4 kids seated around us seemed to have knocked-out too (Yay!) Our only complain was that the cabin temperature was a bit warm on our flight to Zurich, but it was nice and cold on our return journey, when we wore shorts instead. In-flight entertainment selection was good, but be prepared for a VERY lengthy promo video with lots of ads on your flight out of Zurich, its main hub. They gave out a small menu card before supper so we knew our options and what would be served for breakfast - nice. Food service is quite speedy and the attendants are generally friendly and helpful with additional drinks requests. After food services (ie after they clear the trays), they provide bottled water & some fruits in the galley for passengers to help themselves - I liked this as I didn't have to bother anyone. On arrival, it was a huge joy and relief when our bags came out first as we had transited at 2 airports and were very worried if our baggage may be lost; we were on 3 different flights & airlines before reaching our destination. Good value for money, reliable, and an overall good experience flying with Swiss from check-in to arrival.

title: Great food, great service
review_text: The flight attendants were very friendly, food and/or drinks were served every couple hours, which really helped on a 12 hour flight. The foood was pretty tasty, even for airplane food, and hot in many cases. Wine was free. A couple of the passengers were sick, and the flight attendants were very helpful for them. They had many movies and music channels to choose from, and the screens were on the back of the seats in front of us. Very convenient. I would definitely fly them again.

title: comfortable flight
review_text: The flight to Brussles was at time and not fully booked. Thus the crew had enough time for a perfect service. The whole crew was very plesant and mindful.

title: Good for USA to Greece
review_text: We flew on Swiss Air from Boston to Zurich for our trip to Malta. The flight was about 7 hours. We chose to upgrade to seats 23E & 23 F which were at the front of the coach section. This allowed us to put our bags at our feet and keep our feet up and comfortable for the length of the flight. We did the same thing on our return flight. Seats were fine, crew we're OK, personal TVs were old and used the seat remote and the system reset a couple of times while in the middle of watching a movie but overall it was fine.

title: I ate unclean chicken on Swiss Air flight, got Campylobacter food poisoning
review_text:
I got Campylobacter food poisoning from eating Swiss Air unclean chicken. I lost 12 pounds in 5 days and had to go to the hospital. Took antibiotics for 10 days and had to rebuild my Probiotic system in my stomach. 
I called Swiss Air and they declined responsibility, I'll never fly Swiss Air again, if you value your health you should never fly Swiss Air either. 
Swiss air complaint #1807-LX-12231 filed.

title: Excellent equipment Bombardier CS300 give lot of space for legroom, comfortable seat and plenty space for cabin luggag
review_text: Excellent equipment, good service, snack is small but drinks are adequate. A delay on departure but arrived on time.

title: First Class experience!
review_text: We tried first class because of a special offer.  When we went into the aircraft, someone came to introduce himself straightaway and offered us champagne.  There was so much room in one seat as my husband actually drank his champagne opposite me!  Food was very good and because I was not too hungry and wanted to sleep after dinner rightaway, I just asked them to bring the main course.  When I tried asking that when we flew business class, I was told to have the simplified menu, which was rubbish!  The steward also came to make up my bed straight after dinner.  It was very comfortable as we had a real mattress, pillows & blankets, plus pyjamas and slippers to change into before sleeping.  We could also close the 'door' when we sleep, which offers a lot more privacy.  I also love the electric blinds!

title: A good Airline
review_text: This was the first time flying on Swiss and I have to say it was one of the best overseas flights I have ever had.The service on the plane was excellent and the employees were wonderful.

title: Long night flight
review_text:
After spending all day in Singapore the flight to Zurich took off on-time at 11:45 pm. Since it was a 12 hour night flight Swiss Air immediately served a good economy meal with two choices and it was really good. After that the crew only came around twice with drinks and there was an 8 hour wait until breakfast. Entertainment system was reasonably good with moderate selection. Seats average comfort but very narrow as there were nine seats across each row. Leg room was reasonable.
We preferred to fly SIA and they are much better with more attention and better seats.

title: Great airline
review_text: The flight was on time and the service was really good and as airline food goes, it was good.Pilot kept us posted when need be and the stewardesses were friendly and provided great service.

title: Great flight but beeare
review_text:
Flew Swissair from Boston to CDG and connect thru to Naples Fligjt from Boston was great good service and generous with wine We had an hour and half to get connecting flight all went well until we came to customs It was a mob scene lots of yelling lots of anguish because people,like us,had make cpnnections pleading with attendants was useless "everyone in same boat" well not really two women in front of us had a three hour wait man behind had already missed his flight just a total mess

Luckily we ran they airport and our gate was near by so we were the last to board but there were empty seats WHY
The last leg was again great landed in
Naples on time ect
My advice be very careful connecting thru Paris you will need a minimum of two hours to make a connection

title: The "Swiss" touch : excellent !
review_text:
Excellent servive and care. On time. Reliable. Cleanliness and value for money. 
We also used ELDEWEISS AIR, a charter company belonging to SWISS and the service, care, value for money, cleanliness, etc ... was exactly the same excellent prestation.

title: Good but not the most comfortable seats
review_text:
We selected Swiss for its favorable schedule for our holiday in Rajastan.
It is an excellent company, in time, clean, well organized, but seats comfort is not at the best, considering we were flying business class.
Too narrow and you feel the structure of the seat under you, when completely reclined. The quest for lightweight seats, in my opinion, has compromised a bit the overall comfort when seating/sleeping.

title: Stranded
review_text: This flight started out bad. Delayed in Rome, then onto Zurich. Had a little time to get to the next gate and we waited. Time to start boarding and we wait. Then they announce that the flight has been canceled. All they would tell us was a problem had come up. After a long wait in line, we were told it would be five hours later before we could catch another flight. But we were not guaranteed we would be on that flight.   We were given 20.00 to get something to eat and drink. Really?! Have you ever seen the prices of food and or drinks at the airport? A cola was 4.50 and the cheapest thing we found to eat was a burger at one of the restaurants that was near by. Our total bill was 48.00. This was the last time I ever will fly Swiss Air again. Always seems to be a problem

title: Total lack of care and service
review_text: The flight out of Copenhagen was an hour and a half late. The local handling agent Aviator had two desks open for hundreds of passengers so there was a 2-3 hour wait to even get to discuss re-routing.(On complaining about this I was told "best you take a nap")  In the end the plane arrived in Zurich just as the Johannesburg flight was boarding - no effort was made to rush me through - just told that I was rebooked on the next day's flight. Instead I ran for the gate and made the flight - good thing because the next day's flight was also delayed and I would have been back at home 2-3 later. Shocking lack of care and concern and zero effort to assist.

title: Not the best airline, but quite good
review_text: Very good flight: good service and excellent meal. The only downside is that the space and the seat were a bit old...

title: Reliable company offering good service
review_text: Swissair traditionlay offers good service to the passengers. Like chocholate very much. Was not happy with placing us in the last row of the cabin without windows. If I was told that situation will be like that at the check in maybe it would be more fair.

title: Pleasant staff; comfortable aircraft; great food.
review_text: Great experience; very nice crew; great food onboard, even though they were short flights with a stop in Zurich.

title: Poor value business class
review_text: No place for hanging suites or jackets on board. Uncomfortable seats, no on board entertainment (3.5 hrs flight). Very poor meal. When i complained about the terrible quality of the meal, i was offered the brochure with the sandwiches, which are for sale at economy class. Asked for a red wine - the flight attendant had no idea what is the wine, just brought me one glass. It was not great and there was no offer to change it. All in all poor service on board. Avoid flying Swiss to Moscow. Aeroflot is 100 time better in all respects !!!!

title: Overall amazing experience
review_text: Even though this airline might not be the cheapest option, it is worth every penny. Amazing service and even on a short flight of 1hr 20min we got served refreshments and snacks. Staff are very attentive to your needs and even with a 6hr overnight wait for a connection the whole experience was enjoyable.

title: New plane but very little legroom
review_text:
We have been flying with Swiss for a long time and have noticed the meals offered are not quite as good as they used to be but the planes have always been comfortable with nice leather seats and plenty of legroom. That is, up until this time. We were on a brand new Bombardier aircraft and unfortunately the space between the rows of seats was so narrow that it was impossible to put the meal tray-table down flat. Now, I am overweight, but not so huge that I can't normally put the table down so I was not best pleased. it was the sort of thing you would expect from a penny-pinching budget airline, not Swiss! Time to take a few rows out and create better space. 
Another thing was that on the outward flight we were changed from the 2 seats we had booked in advance to a row further back without any proper explanation. We later realised that our original seats were by an exit door and there must be a policy of not allowing people of a certain age to sit there (we are both 60 plus). If so, why not say so? To be fair, it was a different aircraft to the one booked (which had a technical fault). Shall we just say it didn't add to our flight enjoyment!

title: A nice & good airline
review_text:
An efficient airline In flight good service.
A perfect and short connection in Zurich.
However they should consider improving the leg room in the plain.I assume it will attract
more Loyal clients.Thus,it will have a positive  long term effect in terms of cost-benefit.

title: sardines have more room
review_text: the flight attendants were nice enough - the planes have had the seating space reduced to the point of absurdity. the sales travel staff were less then worthless

title: friendly , efficient , clean
review_text: From check in online , seat selection, to sitting in cabin all smooth . Friendly welcome good mixture of professionalism and casualness ( the right balance) Clean cabin .Great meal service with tasty hot food, and more important after meal cleared tables quickly . The connection was "tight 40 mins" but a breeze, you get gate numbers on seat screen while taxing to the gate , meet by ground staff . Zurich airport clean and super easy to navigate . Second flight as in the first .

title: Pay a little more for better service
review_text: This airline is amazing for anyone who is looking for that old fashioned customer service. I normally fly with the orange airline but il be traveling more with Swiss air from now on and no more crying kids

title: Excellent business class service
review_text: Swiss Airlines remains very reliable regarding the service offered in business class. Of course, for a short flight, the most important is to enjoy the lounge, the priority boarding and the empty seat in the middle.

title: One of the worse
review_text: The seats were the tightest of any airline. They have bathroom issues. After takeoff someone had to use bathroom and they yelled at her to get back in her seat. No room to move with food carts; they closed all bathrooms 1 hour prior to landing and announced that the bathrooms were cleaned and could not be used for the remainder of the flight. If you have any physical issues, this is the worse airline to use from my personal opinion,

title: Punctuality at its lowest
review_text: This flight was a disgrace. Arrived 15 minutes late and managed to leave with 30 minutes delay. Later, after an aborted landing due to another aircraft occupying the runway, we finally landed 40 minutes late. For a flight time of 50 minutes...

title: Works like a clock
review_text: You just know what will happen, when you board a Swiss airplane. No worries, no surprises and on schedule arrival. Add nice pursers and airhosteses to perform good service.

title: Great trip
review_text: We were treated very well before and during this flight which went via Geneva. The in flight food was quite acceptable and we were given Swiss chocolate football's. (We travelled during the world cup.)

title: Missing lagguages
review_text:
From Budapest to Madrid we had to stop at Zurich to take other flight which was same company Swiss Air to get in Madrid. We had two lagguages - one on them we payed extra money- and none of them had arrived in Madrid. They left them in Zurich. After 4 days were carried to us.
I wasn‚Äôt happy without my clothes and thinks!

title: Mostly good
review_text: It was a pleasant flight. The snack and drinks were ok nothing fancy. Personal is always friendly and courteous. the plane was quite new.

title: Pleasant and clean!
review_text: I had 4 flights flying from TLV to JFK round trip. I had the Economy Plus seats. Food was great. Comfortable seats. I want specifically to praise the cleanness of their restrooms. They kept them clean, fully equipped with all the necessities throughout the whole flights! Something which is missing in many other airline companies.

title: A very ersatz experience
review_text: This service on this flight was totally devoid of any quality what soever,  This is not a Swiss Airline any longer, The breakfast was totally dismall.  The seats were incredibly uncomfortable and the airconditioning was running far too warm despite our requests that it be made cooler.
