All in all this was a really bad experience for a long haul flight

title: Extremely small leg space in economy
review_text: Short leg was comfortable, but the food was inedible. Staff on most legs wasn't very friendly, not a smile on their faces. Leg space was absolutely unbearable on the long leg, no foot rest, very narrow aisle.

title: Comfortable, pleasant, roomy, punctual - a delight
review_text:
A remarkable flight.  Due to circumstances beyond the airline's control, it took off 30 minutes late but, due to flying at a higher altitude than normal, arrived more or less on time.  I will leave it to the reader to deduce the extra fuel cost needed to achieve that.

Food was a little disappointing, with only a cheese sandwich or some unappetising-looking quinoa on offer.  There is usually a ham sandwich alternative.  As usual on Swiss, there was free beer or wine.

The cabin staff were delightful, as ever on Swiss.  The crew on my return flight gave me oxygen, when my cluster (or oxygen-deprivation) headache started on descent.

Flight time was only 60 minutes (should normally be 90 - 100 minutes), so there was no need for in-flight entertainment.

title: Excellent breakfast choice
review_text: Having a early morning flight from Zurich to Stockholm we were expecting croissant, yogurts, fruits and a cold plate with cheese and meat it was all perfectly served. The surprise was the choice of 2 different hot breakfast in addition to the normal business class breakfast, well done!

title: Enjoyable with a little stress flying experience
review_text:
The only stressful situation is that they only allows 23kg and a piece of checked in luggage. Coming home from a 14-days travel in Italy, that is very demanding. I misread the print and thought that it was for 27kg so you can imagine the stress I had to endure to relieve the weight when this time I decided not to carry a carryon luggage as well so less space available.

It was a Boeing 770 so it was pleasant although it was just economy (I was worried sick actually since it is a 12-hour flight) and with a crying baby throughout but it was ok. There were choices for food and we could choose a vegetarian unlike our experience with Lufthansa coming.

Flight through out was on time and no delays, we transit in Zurich and that was pleasant as well.

Thank you and will consider Swiss again..

title: Really cramped window seat and toilets
review_text: I was in the forward business class cabin which comprised of two rows only. It was a sandwiched arrangement and I really disliked every moment of it. I am short and found it hard and rude to jump over my copassenger each time I wanted to get out. The seat itself is not as roomy but this is the case with all business class seats I have traveled so far. I do not recommend a window seat on a full flight if you need to step out a lot . I missed lunch as I was feeling clausterphobic and sick. The pre landing meal was a huge disappointment - just a salad. The amenity kit was nice but could be better.

title: Swiss flight to St. Petersburg
review_text: 3hour flight, good food and drink provided. Cabin crew friendly and helpful. A great flight despite late takeoff, on time arrival

title: Just perfect
review_text: I had the chance to be upgraded to Swiss First and I can report that the hype is true, this was truly an awesome experience. The bedding is awesome, the service detailed, attentive, non obtrusive but always there when needed, just before you ask for it. The food was ex√ßellent, I did not think they could cook something tasty in the air like that. My pasta was as good as if it was in a restaurant, I was blown away.

title: Reliable Connection to Basel via Zuerich
review_text: Convenient return flight from holidays overnight. Early arrival in Zuerich with train connection to Basel with the chance to use the full day after arrival. The connecting train could be faster, but anyway, it is a good alternative to a short distance connection flight.

title: Excellent!
review_text: On time flight,very nice employees, good food,everything you can expect from an economy class trip!!!

title: Fantastic
review_text: Kids love the many entertainment in screen so they wont be bored cause long flight. The food also good. The flight attendants are nice.

title: Worst passenger service ever
review_text:
We are very experienced travellers and have travelled with most airlines around the globe. My partner is 1.85 and even though seats are closer to each other than before, he had never had a problem to fit his legs by his seat. 
When we boarded Swisss airlines yesterday we noticed that that plane was even more cramped than usual. A common that could be heard throughout the plane by most of the passengers. When he tried to sit we noticed that for his legs to fit he had to open his legs and place his knees in an angle in between seats. As the trip was going to take 12 hours, we pledged to the crew to help us find him another place. We even offered to pay for an upgrade, as traveling like that would be excruciating. The promptly said that the plane was full and there was nothing they could do about it.
He is still limping today from the pain caused to his knees by those tight seats. 
If you are tall, be sure to NEVER book Swiss Airlines!

title: Easy and fast, almost like riding the bus
review_text:
This was not the first time we flew with Swiss Air. Everything went well, on time and as planed and nothing got lost or damaged. No complaints. Only praise! 
The only thing I felt was different this time was, that the personal at the airport check in and on the plane where not as friendly/ nice .... I got the feeling that they didn't enjoyed their job.
But that is just me. 
I still would recommend this airline.

title: nice. efficient
review_text: I really wish that Swiss air went to more places.  The service on the flight was great and the plane was very clean.  my flight was a short one, but none the less, very good experience

title: Could have been better
review_text: Flew from PRG to LAX via Zurich. Like the service on board and the flight attendants were friendly.  The ground staff at PRG weren't very nice and insisted that I needed to check my carry-on luggage to LAX, when it is just a standard 22" carry-on that my wife and I have used for numerous trips and never had problems with other airlines.  And that's the only luggage I had!  Other than that, flights were timely and everything else was decent.

title: Cabin Attendance's attitude is very bad.
review_text: Japanese's cabin attendance's attitude was so bad during the flight between Narita and Zurich.  Though I have been using many airline companies such as roughly twenty companes, I have never had such worst attitude except one of Americal company.

title: The King of the Gougers !
review_text: We asked for a window seat AT LEAST a Dozen times from the time we paid for the flight up until the day of the flight & all we got was crappola - we'll Never Fly this Airline again -

title: Narrow seats and short leg room
review_text:
We paid extra for "additional leg room" and found out that this was to "sit at the front of the cabin" where they "expect less noise". 
3-4-3 combination with very narrow isles so if you like an isle seat (like I do) you get bumped by everyone that goes past. 
We knew it was going wrong when we saw the Business class seats. Everything was fine except the damn narrow seats and short leg room.

title: Economy Plus seats a rip off
review_text:
Knowing that we had a longer flight and having some tall people in our party of 7, we decided to pay extra for economy plus seats. I can't tell you how disappointed we were when we reached our seats. I have never not can I imagine a smaller seat. Economy plus?  Plus what??!'!  Plus nothinging and a pure waste of money. 

On the return flight we got the 6'3" person in our party a bulk head seat so he'd have more leg room. It was actually cruel to see him try to cram into the E+ seat.

If you are trying to decide if paying extra for exonomy plus on Swiss Air, take my recommendation - save your money or look at a different airline.

title: Swiss Hospitality lives up to its standard
review_text: Swiss are know for their hospitality... and the airlines continues the tradition... the Airline crew .. very warm & the food taste good... high up in the air as well :). Long flight... so they ensure you are never hungry... they treat you as soon as you board & before your landing . Swiss chocolate was a surprise. Had a comfortable trip... the temperature inside the airplane was maintained & the airline was clean. Both the trips i.e from Mumbai to Zurich & return were equally good.

title: Comfortable seats, decent food and Chocolate!
review_text: We had a very good experience flying with Swiss Air. Our seats in economy were comfortable and the food served was tasty. As intercontinental flights become less and less of a pleasant experience, our flight stood out as being a much better experience for economy seats. And of course the chocolate was an added bonus!

title: Thoughtful consideration!
review_text: On our return leg we were flying Swiss Air from Zurich to Mumbai. I was flying back with my children aged 10 and 14. At the Geneva Airport the boarding passes were printed when my 10 year old girl made a request for window seat. Without saying a word and with a smile he allotted fresh tickets and tore away the earlier boarding passes. Also, as a thoughtful consideration i was given the front row with extra leg room. The food and entertainment was also ok as we were flying economy class. Will love to fly Swiss Air again.

title: Thoroughly proffessional airline
review_text: From the moment you get to the departure gate until you deplane at your destination these guys are fabulous.

title: Good airlines , was fun
review_text: The staff was really nice , airplane was clean , service is great , check-in was smooth and easy , food is good and the entertainment System was super great, with a lot of new movies  , was really cool ! Was a round trip with Swiss airlines and it was really good ! We were a group of 8 people and we all shared a good experience :)

title: Top airline
review_text: I booked the flights throw Lufthansa To London from Sydney, all very good but the food was to die for, fantastic and  the service great .

title: Lovely flight
review_text: We flew from Boston to  Barcelona in May.  The flight was very comfortable with a stop in Zurich.  The trip was uneventful which is a good thing.

title: Too tight is getting ... smaller
review_text:
I know that airlines want to give even less space available to customers for their cabin size baggage, so they can charge them for a checked bag, but this is getting out of hand. Somehow those overhead compartments were way too small for anything. If I wasn't one of the first to board, I would have found no space at all for my bag (the same one I used to always travel with, when going "light"!.
The on-flight service was good though. They still give you some food and water üòã

title: Airline
review_text:
Service was excellent Staff very helpful and meals were satisfactory for airlines these days
Would recommend and use for another trip to Europe

title: Perfect flight
review_text:
Th√© stewards are excellent : speak many languages extremely polite et very efficient.
The food is excellent, seats confortable.

title: Abominable customer service and accountability
review_text: In flight service was pretty good but the airline sent our checked bags to Bordeaux, France (from Zurich) rather than to Palermo. Took three days to get them to Palermo, but most frustrating was total lack of accountability for their screw up and total stonewalling on information. Would not admit the mistake as to where they sent the bags and once they arrived in Palermo, it took another 6 DAYS to deliver bags to us. It was virtually impossible to contact anyone who could provide information or take responsibility to get our bags delivered to us.

title: awesome experience
review_text: awesome service plus plane was so clean and had more leg room and also food was great. awesome seating

title: First flight on Swiss Air
review_text: Would like to say that the service from the onboard staff was exemplary. They were on hand throughout the night offering delicious food and drinks. When I changed my flight date home they did it without charging me an addional fee. Thank you SwissAir it was a pleasure to fly with you.

title: Best flight!
review_text: Swiss Airlines was comfortable, attentive, on schedule and just one of the best international flights I have taken! I will definitely try to use them again!

title: A wonderful and safe experience
review_text:
The seats were comfortable, food,drink excellent. Free wine and after dinner drink. Flight attendants were attentive. Plus we need wheelchairs and were handled very well.
Will fly them again

title: All went well, both ways
review_text: Good flight, no problems  good selection of movies  Free earbuds. food and snacks were good. would use them again

title: Seat Design Needs Work...But Great Service!
review_text: Service was very good, as were the dining and beverage options.  Couldn't have been happier.  However...the "lie-flat" seats in business were very low/narrow and I was surrounded on both sides by the center console and a solid arm rest.  I felt like I was in a coffin. Not particularly pleasant.

title: An excercise in discomfort
review_text: One would think that comfort would be integrated into the design of a new 777, but with 16" wide seats in a 3-4-3 config...this flight was nothing short of excruciating.  Thank God for Xanax...

title: Great Service
review_text: Great service, good food and a very comfortable seat. Would highly recommend Swiss airways. Service wasn‚Äôt over done or rushed. The flight attendants were professional, yet relaxed. Thank you Swiss Air for a great flight.

title: The Brand is not anymore as it was. Has nothing Ton doch with SWISS Qualit√§t! German low cost carrier
review_text:
Thanks to the german management you are seating in economy with no space between the seats! This has absoluty nothing to do with SWISS quality!
12 Hours flight with uncomfortable seat and seat configuration 3-4-3 per row and no space for people taller than 1.75cm. There are many better wars to fly to Singapore! Use Singapore Airlines or any other airline. Most of them habe better seats and better row configurations! Check seatguru.com.

title: Fly Swiss. LH or Austrian
review_text: Business class seats good not the best. Seat 12, 10, 8 and 4 A the best however need to wait until 48 hours before flight to get these for free. Food OK - I do not choose the airline on a culinary scale. Service efficient and friendly

title: Lovely service
review_text: The food was Pretty good for an airplane meal. Had the ravioli with tomato sauce and my boyfriend some meat with r√∂sti. The served some drinks and they turned the lights off in the evening. Had a pleasent flight!

title: Flying Swiss Coach
review_text:
The flight was good, but economy class offers limited leg room, and so, sleeping can be a little difficult.
The dinner served was ok, and breakfast was very limited.

title: Supervisor at the counter was rude and unprofessional.
review_text: Supervisor at the counter was rude and unprofessional. I reached Airport/ airline counter approximately 1 hr 45 mins before flight arrival and when I check online flight was showing 35 mins late and supervisor rudely said you guys are late and you know ‚ÄúF‚Äù what time it is but he checked us in. While he was checking me in an providing the boarding passes I asked for a supervisor and I was told he is the supervisor and I I want to complain I can call customer service nunber.

title: customer service
review_text: Apart from the lay flat 6 feet beds in Business class, we experienced a malfunction of the computer of the entertainment system about 8 hours into the flight the cabin staff tried hard to fix but in the end had to give up. We were compensated with a box of Swiss chocolates and a voucher each to the value of 600 Swiss francs to be used on our next flight with Swiss. The service on board and meals was excellent and could not faulted.

title: Swiss precision
review_text:
This was our first experience with this carrier; all our expectations were well met. The aircraft was an Airbus A320 - departure from Copenhagen was punctual and arrival in Zurich a little ahead of schedule.
In-flight service on this relatively short sector was friendly and efficient. We would most certainly use Swiss again. The airline's links with the Star Alliance network was an extra bonus as it brought frequent flyer points with our "home" airline, Air New Zealand.

title: Allways excellent flights with this company
review_text:
Quick check ,wonderful crew,quick baggage claim.The seats are just so good I would stay on the plain for some more time.Food was very good.What I like best is the crew,efficient and friendly .All this applies for the many flights i have already had with Swiss.The lounges at Zuerich airport are very good,above all Lounge E.

Michal Rambau

title: Cost effective flight to London
review_text: If you are looking for a convenient cost effective flight from Cairo to London with a short transit and can withstand a night flight, the night flight from Cairo through Zurich should be your choice. You will fly after a full day in Cairo and start a new day in London

title: Food I actually enjoyed....
review_text: We recently returned from the south of France on Swiss Air through Zurich. What a nice flight! Normally I order something from the menu and eat very little of it. I had the chicken dish (parmesan coated) and my husband had the beef. We both marveled at how good our dishes were and ate the whole dinner. Flight attendants were great, very attentive. If I were to criticize something it would be the business class seats... very hard and uncomfortable. If they were to improve anything, it would be to offer some sort of padding for the seats (similar to United)‚Ä¶ But you cant go wrong with the food!

title: Updated, comfortable planes
review_text: This was a very good experience. The plane was updated and comfortable, even in economy. Flight attendants were kind and helpful, and who can beat ice cream and chocolate for snacks?! The whole flight was very smooth.

title: Rudeness at the gate beyond believe....
review_text: I have flown Swiss many times, always in either Business or First Class.  I have to admit their on-board service has improved yet the rudeness encountering the gate area is incomprehensible.  I fly almost 300,000 miles a year and no airline policies carryon's as Swiss.  On a recent flight, the supervisor even wanted to call the police as I was arguing that the 8kg restriction she was showing me only applies to coach passengers.  She would just not listen and took my European size carryon with a very nasty tone.  As a businessman, having to wait at the destination for my luggage is just inefficient.  So, if you want to take your carryon on board, forget the chocolates one gets on board and fly another airline!

title: Lost luggage
review_text: It was not a direct flight, but with one stop in Zurich. The plane from Belgrade was late, and we had to run for check in for flight to Amsterdam. At the destination point we found out that our luggage didn't arrive. we lost at least 2 hrs waiting and declaring the lost of our luggage.

title: Even on a short flight, cabin crew do their very best
review_text:
Smooth check-in, easy transfert on Z√ºrich airport, clean plane, flight time as scheduled and even on a very short flight cabin crew makes you feel comfortable and at home (drinks and sandwich/chocolate). No complaints !

Lugano airport: smooth and efficient security and luxury boarding (you literally walk to the plan), you don't have to worry about your cabin-luggage as you can leave it at the aircraft.

title: Fraud with checked baggage
review_text:
There was no option to buy the standard 23 kg checked baggage in their online check in webpage. Unlike any other plane companies, where 1 checked baggage is included for free. Here you have to pay, at the airport with penalties. What the hell? I had to pay half my plane tickets price to get the standard checked bag on the plane. 
Organised fraud to steal money out of the customers. NEVER FLYING SWISS AGAIN!

title: Very new aircraft and efficient crew on board.
review_text: Good flight from beginning ( check-in ) till baggage delivery ( on arrival ) without any minimal problem.

title: Really nice flight crew, decent food
review_text:
Really enjoyed flying this airline.  Crew was top notch and very polite.  Video selection was fantastic.  The food was a 6/10, but no complaints.  The back on my seat broke so it was slanted the entire flight and they said they'd get it fixed immediately.

Their chocolates were delish.

title: Food never stops
review_text: The food never stops on this flight. There is a snack, then lunch, then another snack then another meal, then ice cream. All the food is good. The plane is a little small and so are the seats for a 10 hour flight, but otherwise just fine.

title: Excellent flight, except luggage lost on last leg of journey
review_text: The trip was wonderful,  but luggage missed a connecting flight.  It wasn't delivered, until several days later, by an utterly insane subcontractor.  He had trouble finding my apartment (on Fifth Avenue!) at 11 pm,  and then was abusive and threatening.  Horrible service.

title: Smooth, comfortable flight
review_text: We flew London to Zurich, the whole experience was very slick and professional, the staff were professional and courteous, the flight was smooth. We took off and landed punctually, the luggage was delivered quickly. All in all, a good experience.

title: I ma always satisfied
review_text:
Everything you need when you fly. Confort, relax, taking-off and landing in time. Nice Price.
Who can ask for anything more?

title: Best airline I've ever been on!
review_text:
This was, hands down, the best flight I have ever had!  Seats were roomy(for economy), good selection on the seatback tv, and the food!  It seemed like they were feeding us every time we looked up!  Not only that, but it was TASTY food!  We even got ice cream!!
When was the last time you were in economy and got ice cream on a plane?  The staff was great, the flight was great, the food was great.  I wish I could fly Swiss everywhere I went.

title: Carefull with Strategic Alliances, they are not worth a penny
review_text:
Care full by contracting EU Carriers to non EU destinations, EU carriers are no responsible for any thing they relay to the Montreal Agreement. 
And this is what happens when you fly SWISS , as YOUR CARRIER to a second non swiss destination with a a STAR-ALLIANCE MEMBER - SOUTH AFFRICAN AIRLINES at the end THE CLIENT IS STUPID! and please pay business for commodity 
Strange answer from SA to a client that is claiming to SWISS, the contracted Carrier, after what should I say, 2 Months?
In very, very short words:
Neither SA took care about anything  because their  agent in Victoria falls, was unable to do so, nor the main Carrier, SWISS, STARALIANCE and  SOUTH AFRICAN AIRLINES  are in charge of anything.
As the client did act by his own  to rescue my connecting flight from ZH to Pereira, that I had with (Brussels Airlines)! STUPID CLIENT!
At the End; ISS, STARALIANCE and  SOUTH AFRICAN AIRLINES , are not responsible for anything, if Passengers do act by their own, this what they say and do!!!

title: True to its Brand Name
review_text: We travelled Economy Light.  Its worth the price, travel is so smooth and on time. We are on the front side of the plane, leg room is enough.  Toilet is clean.

title: Need to try harder
review_text: We flew to and from Europe using Swiss. I developed an issue flying and kept over heating and on the flight over passed out and had to be given o2, felt I couldnt catch my breath and anxiety because of this was not good. When you feel you cant breath and need to get some air it panics you. I happened to have the same older flight attendant there and back and she was not kind ! I found the only way to regulate my temperature was  with Ice I used a cloth on my face and neck to help me thru. I asked for Ice twice on the flight and she called be a hypocontriac said I had issues, god lady It was just ICE. The last thing I wanted was attention I just wanted to get thru it. Found some of the other staff a but blunt, I have seen other reviews about Swiss sating the same

title: Pleasant flight, nice crew and good food
review_text: It was a pleasant flight from boarding in Bangkok to de boarding in Zurich. The crew was great, the food very good. Excellent service even with a full business class.

title: Very Good flight from JFK to Zurich
review_text: Very Comforatble, The Kosher food [made in USA] was excellent from JFK to ZRH. But on the connecting flight from ZRH to TLV the Kosher food [made in Switzerland] was a disgrace to the manufacturers and to the airline which served it.

title: Excellence has a name :  SWISS INTERNATIONAL AIRLINES
review_text:
For me still one of the best airlines all over the world. Comfortable, clean, professional staff, excellent food. Hard to beat!
Nevertheless I think wifi access should be free of charge at least in the first class, but they charge you a lot of money. Please change this policy to improve from 95 to 100% satisfaction !!

title: Nice to fly
review_text: Nice fly...the crew was very professional. In the aircraft you have plenty of space for the legs and was very clean.

title: Service Good, Food choices Not So Good
review_text:
Service on the flight was attentive and the seats were comfortable as usual.  Food choices were rather limited especially for my partner who is a non meat eater.  
Her choice for entree was a side dish of lettuce leaves and for the main a pumpkin curry comprising a piece of pumpkin in a mush resulting in a bland tasting concoction. 

We have travelled Swiss a number of times and enjoyed the experience and the food, so hopefully this time it was an aberration.

title: Swissness
review_text: Decided to get the extra legroom. worth the additional charge.  I always use my now noise cancelling headphones since I find I'm much fresher at the end.  The flight was delayed by about an hour so got in rather late.  Another touch that I personally think is well worth it is to get a gourmet meal 30-50 Swiss Francs.  I went for the steak.  A good meal & served before anyone else's.

title: The Most Stressful Experience EVER!!!!!!!
review_text:
We booked flights in February for an upcoming trip in October to Seville. The Swiss Air flight is from London Heathrow to Zurich then Edelweiss Air (owned by Swiss Air) from Zurich to Seville. 
When filling in our APPI details (luckily 5 weeks before flying), I noticed our LHR departure time had changed from 8.50am to 6.00am with no notification! Rang Swiss Air to find out why this has happened, we have yet to receive an answer to this question. We were told we'd been informed by e-mail of the changes only to find they have the wrong e-mail address, we gave them the correct one as we received e-mails from them however someone has input a 1 instead of a T into the address.  Next, our seat reservations didn't exist for the outward journey so they allocated seats to us free of charge. This took 3 hours of phone calls/checking websites to resolve. Next we rang Edelweiss to confirm our seat reservations with them as the flights had changed and surprise, surprise, no seat reservations despite us  having e-mailed confirmation of our seat numbers and charges . Now after another hour I'm off to check through credit card statements!!!! Suffice to say I will never ever use there services again!

title: friendly service, relatively old equipment, biz class at best "ok"
review_text:
Aircraft in use for this flight was an A330. You could see and feel that it was a bit of an older type - the upholstery in the business class was a bit worn out, the screen of the entertainment system was really small. 

Sleeping comfort in Business Class: limited, at best "ok". If you have a window seat, you need to climb over the person next to you - probably sleeping. The "bed" is relatively small and - despite a massage function built into the seat - you wake up with back pain the next morning. 
Yes, you can stretch out your legs, but they fold underneath the seat in front of you and the space there - particularly for your feet - becomes cramped. 

Flight was punctual. 
Entertainment: screens are too small, a few more documentaries would have been nice - but ok. 

Service on the other hand was really great - authentically friendly people, very agile, very focussed on service.

title: Comfortable and efficient Business Class flight
review_text:
To get a flight from Crete to Madrid at a reasonable hour during the day was tricky. The best option was Swiss from Heraklion to Geneva, and then on to Madrid. We flew in Swiss' new Bombardier C-series aircraft, and it was nice and new and clean, and the service was friendly and efficient. The seating is 3+2, with the same seats in Business and Economy. But in Business you get 1 of 2 or 2 of 3, so you get the extra room and more legroom. However, pack a book and put some music on your phone because there's zero in-flight entertainment - just some really small screens in the roof showing the flight path. Didn't worry me as the flight was relatively short, and anyway I had a heap of classical music on my phone.
For the transfer at Geneva we went into the Business lounge - nice and clean, with lots of drinks and some hot food as well. And, as would you expect from the Swiss, the toilets were scrupulously clean!

title: Our best yet Business class experience
review_text:
My wife and I  have flown Swiss in Business class on 4 occasions now, most recently, last June flying from Rome via Zurich to Singapore.

The experience on each occasion was outstanding.

The Swiss Business class lounge at Zurich airport is excellent.  It's spacious, with 
 comfortable areas for work as well as relaxation and has great views from its large windows.  There is also an outside balcony area overlooking the runways and the mountains beyond,

Food selection is excellent and can sometimes even include a steak cooked to order.

Drinks include just about anything you might want.

On board service from the Swiss cabin crew was impeccable from start to finish.  Food was excellent  and the lay  flat seats were very comfortable.

There were also plenty of options to amuse yourself with from the entertainment system, although I found the music menu limited.

Deciding to fly Business class means that you'll be paying several times more than an  Economy class ticket, so you expect certain things in return for the premium fare you have paid.

You expect access to a good quality lounge in the airport, preferential check in,  boarding and disembarkation, comfortable seating on board , good in-flight service and food.

We definitely felt that we got all of those things and then some flying Business class with Swiss.

No hesitation whatsoever in recommending Swiss to other travellers.

title: excelent
review_text: great - stewards were fantastic, they anticipated every need. The food was above average for airline. I loved some of the wines they served; not expensive but well chosen

title: Excellent Service
review_text: Excellent flight;  All services on flight worked fine.  Good entertainment on board.  Food was good for airline food.  Good customer service.  Will use them again.

title: Lovely flight
review_text: First time flying with Swiss. Pleasantly surprised.  Clean leather seats and spotless aircraft.  Flight attendants very friendly.  The complementary food, drink and chocolate was just gorgeous.  Prices vary considerably though.  Very very cheap at the start and then rise to an affordable price.

title: Awesome flight
review_text: The staff was so accomodating and friendly. The service throughout the journey was exceptional. The plane was very comfortable, No seat backs that were so worn you couldn't find comfort. Clean bathrooms. The meal was typical airplane meal but the staff was all so pleasant and provided whatever anyone asked for. The movie selection was all new movies. GREAT FLIGHT! Will use them again.

title: Terrible experience
review_text: Had a terrible experience with them, they treated me and my boyfriend horribly, our flight was cancelled and the whole situation was handled very unprofessionally. After spending 5 hours for some response from the airline, we learned that the next flight was scheduled for the next morning. Their staff laughed in our faces after we told them how we waited for several hours in a line. We had to spend a night in Zurich, we were first sent to a wrong hotel by the air line staff and then we had to walk in the middle of the night to a different hotel. And after all that, we were compensated with 80 euros. What a bloody disappointment. We are never flying with them again.

title: Good but I have expected more in customer services
review_text:
I had quite great experience with Swiss airlines definitely better than BA or Iberia. 
During the flight, they serve some soft drink and a nice panini. Unfortunately, the compensation if they lose your luggage is ridiculous. The rest is better the BA and Iberia.

title: A pleasant surprise
review_text:
I was a apprehensive about this flight having read previous reviews. My travel agent had asked me to select my seat when booking and pointed out that certain seats marked with a cross required an extra payment. She had never seen that with any airline in business class. I was interested to see why the extra charge was required. It turned out that it was a single seat but rather than it being a wide seat it was exactly the same size as my seat despite taking up the same space as the two seats. You had a console on either side. Definitely not worth the additional cost. As it turned out I didn‚Äôt have a passenger beside me so no issue getting out at any time. 

The service was very good and the food was well presented. The flight took off and landed on time which was great as I only has 50 minutes to my next flight.

title: Tight connection made OK
review_text: This journey had a very tight connection in Zurich which was seriously endangered by a late departure from Manchester but staff at Zurich were expecting us and in the end there was no problem.

title: Zero Client Orientation
review_text: Swiss lacks more and more Client Orientation. If everything goes well, it can be a nice experience (see also my previous report on a recent flight), but as soon as there is an issue you will experience a "service desert". A mistake was made on my arrival which I understand can happen. What is unacceptable is the way they dealt with it. First they wanted to tell me I made a mistake, then they told me to be more friendly otherwise they would not speak to me (I was not rude but just nervous), and finally they said everybody can make a mistake and I should not make such a fuss....instead of a small excuse this is the way they treat their premium customers. I also realized they treat their staff very nicely, greet them etc, but ignore you as a frequent flyer and first class passenger. It is a pity, as it could be a good airline, but with this attitude they will lose more and more customers. And the difference to premium carriers like Singapore, Emirates, Qatar etc is getting bigger and big...

title: Terrible company
review_text:
Terrible customer service!!!!!!!!!!
They lost my baggage and they ignore me not picking up the phone or hanging up on me. They don't care at all! 

When they realised I don't give up until they find my baggage they just told me they sent it to me with Lufthansa now call them. Of course they never did!!!!!!!

title: Great airline; great flights
review_text: I was so happy with this airline and the service that was provided.  Everything was smooth and easy and the flight was uneventful and enjoyable.  The time passed quickly.  Highly recommended!!  World class!!!

title: Flying with Swiss International
review_text:
I flew four times with Swiss in September 2018, and I have mixed feelings towards Swiss International Air Lines:
- service on-board was very good, and snacks were tasty - even in economy class
- communications from the staff / pilot were good, and all needed information were always provided
- three flights out of four departed late, and four flights out of four arrived late, and this was the worst flight: it was announced as leaving Barcelona 20 minutes late, but actually left 30 minutes late; it also arrived 30 minutes late in Zurich, and it made my connection there hard to keep - I had to rush from one end of the airport to the other.

title: Good service
review_text: I chose Swiss air because of the quality of the food they serve during the flight. In my opinion they are the best, together with KLM. For the rest, stewards and hostess are very kind, the business class chair is comfortable, even if not like the new Lufthansa one. The choice of movie is honestly not satisfactory even if the screen and the headphones are very good. Very good also the gift they offer you: a pochette with cleaning items.

title: Excellent service, excellent airplane
review_text: Excellent staff, flight on time, seemingly brand-new Airbus A330 with no lack of entertainment and a high level of comfort even in Economy. Extremely clean.

title: Slightly delayed, but service was excellent
review_text: Swiss is an excellent airline - and their service is exactly as I have come to expect it of them. The staff is extremely friendly and while the flight was slightly delayed, it did not appear that anyone missed their connections.

title: Best Flight high standard
review_text: was the plesure and the grew was great. Thank you very much. the Services was excellent. A nice space to seat.

title: Close to perfection from beginning to the end
review_text: What would be nicer than to start a vacation, travelling in Business Class? That's exactly what my good friend Paddy and me did last month. We enjoyed Business Class in the newest, most state-of-the-art aircraft that Swiss uses for their longhaul flights - its Triple-Seven. In fact, we were assigned seats in the very first row, just behind the First Class cabin. I am pretty well aware, that the reviews of this aircraft are mixed. Particularly bad ones for Economy-Class with 10 seats crammed in one row where premium airlines, such as Cathay Pacific or Thai Airways only seat 9. Also Economy offers way too little legroom for longhaul flights. Anyway, I should write about their Business-Class product. It is brilliant. Excellent seating arrangement, space, Innovation to detail and comfort which makes a long journey simply short. The crew, mainly male attendants, were extremely friendly and helpful. They even addressed us by our names. The meals served were simply excellent (for airline food), in presentation and in quality. Only downer that partially disturbed my personal experience and that the crew did nothing about, was this bunch of three young Israeli men who forcedly talked so loud in the aisles, waking me up way too early, that I would have loved to "silence" them.

title: outdated entertainment system and no leg room
review_text: Living in Switzerland, the airline of choice should be Swiss. On transatlantic flights I try to avoid flying with Swiss because they do not have any economy comfort options like many of the US carriers and Air France and KLM. On this recent long haul flight I was reminded again just why - the entertainment system was very outdated and not even working at some seats, the legroom is an absolute disaster, and for people tall like myself, you can barely see the display because it can-t be rotated out enough to watch from the height of my head, and if the person in front reclines- forget it.

title: Rude Welcome!
review_text:
LX180 on Sept. 10, 18 ZRH-BKK

COMMENT:-

I sat at 5C and I boarded before my son.  My arm hurts and asked a steward to help placed my luggage onto the overhead bin... guess what he said? 

‚ÄúNext time I‚Äôll ask you to check in your hand-carry! It‚Äôs NOT OUR JOB to help lift everybody‚Äôs luggage!! What an attitude!  I dread to think how Economy passengers are treated!

title: Nice flight
review_text:
Nie and short flight
Nothing to say everything was fine, service; timing; Snacks etc
Checking was fast and attentive

title: Horrible!!!
review_text: Terrible!!! I am shocked that Swiss was going to be that bad. They charged me for everything on top of it they do card fraud !!! Terrible, disgusting airlines. Never again I fly with Swiss

title: Best flight ever.
review_text: Ok, this is a 12 hour flight non stop and that is a long time for the crew and passengers.  Crew was exceptionally nice, even when they were tired and wanted to go home also.  They had already been flying a lot before this flight.  Food was very good and I ate vegan.  They understand quality, taste and calories, not some stupid remove the meat or provide some carrot sticks and hay attitude.  Value was there for the food.  Plane was clean and in good shape.  Taking this flight was one of the best parts of our month long trip.  I will definitely fly with them on my next opportunity.  The only part that was disgusting was the Delta flight from SF to Seattle that was run under SwissAir.

title: Non respectful attention
review_text: Besides of charging luggage even for star aliance Gold member, inside the plane attendants were not friendly at all. I was seating on economy right before the "business class". When the plane reached cruise altitud the attendant came and shut the curtain to the business class. She didn¬¥t say anything. Just unpolitely came to my seat and closed the curtain. The same to open the curtain right before landing in Rome.

title: Disgusting on board service
review_text: They do not respect Star Alliance Gold status and charge luggage. 25 Euros if bought on the internet. Besides that the service was terrible. We were offered a single croissant that was served by the attendant using bare hand. Disgusting! Based on this experience I will never fly Swiss again.

title: Swiss Outstanding Airline
review_text: This was our first time flying Swiss air but it will not be our last. Excellent service with the most attentive and outstanding flight attendance that really enjoy their jobs. Excellent food and very comfortable seats.

title: Getting better
review_text: Swiss was fantastic until an American CEO ran it into the ground (naturally collecting millions for his efforts) and Lufthansa bought it. After that it was downhill all the way. The past 2 years it seems to be improving. Hopefully the trend will continue. A far cry from its independent days but better is always welcome.

title: Decent
review_text: My boyfriend and I flew to Switzerland from Miami with Swiss airlines. The flight was pretty smooth but the economy seats were pretty uncomfortable. We paid for the extra leg room which was nice to have but the seats definitely need to be updated. Luckily we didn't have anyone that was reclining in front of us but the seats that did was left with no room. They do give free wine which was a plus! The food wasn't too bad either.

title: Great airline but no access of wifi at Zurich without a cell phone no
review_text:
Swissair meals are boxes of salt or sweety hot quiches or sandwich with a salad.
The choice and unlimited access to Movies seems nice but the menu of available movies included only mediocre films like the Avengers..great for teens that want to see action scenes with little of a story or credible characters. I would recommend some good independent Cinema. The Vegan Eggplant Meal was nice. The free red wine also.
Zurich Airport, like Shanghai, require you to have a cellphone in service to get free wifi service..That s low Vibration and when you have four hours of wait time, it wouldhave been nice to have wifi without strings or this uber mercantile Mindset .

title: The best airline in the world
review_text: Excellent airline with good quality service Highly recommend flying with this company Excellent food The seat is really comfortable and the best that the flight attendants provide excellent service The money you pay for this service is very worth

title: Very ok
review_text: Everything is fine nothing to report. Personell is professional, aircraft clean, and the flight was overall pleasant.

title: Broken stroller and none care
review_text:
Hi there, the 3rd of September we flew from Brisbane (Australia) to Madrid (Spain). First flight to Singapore with Qantas, second flight to Switzerland with Swiss airlines and third flight to Madrid with Swiss too. 
Once we arrived to Madrid, 3 of our 4 luggage didn‚Äôt arrived: 2 suitcases and my baby‚Äôs stroller. 
I went to claim my lost baggage and I was told that i would have them back in 24h. 
24h later I had everything back, but what was my surprise when I opened the stroller‚Äôs bag and realized that the stroller was broken, exactly the piece that make it to open and close. 
I called the lost baggage phone number and they gave me another phone, DOLFI1920‚Äôs phone, is the one who deal with the broken baggage. 
I told them how important is for me to have a stroller, I have a ONE YEAR OLD BABY, Who weights 13KG, and can‚Äôt barely walk. They told me to answer an email that they would send me and in 48h max. should be fixed, because they understand that the baby stroller is very important for us. 
I replied their email within 2h and next day they told me that I need a paper from Swiss airlines in which they gave their phone number. And that I also need to fill up the broken baggage form in Swiss airlines website. 
TWO DAYS ALREADY PASSED AND STILL WITHOUT STROLLER. 
So I filled up the form in your website the 6th of September. And today, 8th of September, already evening, I‚Äôm still waiting for an answer. I don‚Äôt have stroller, and none care...
Could you please help? Or what else I have o do???

This is my claim in your website reference number 1809-LX-02575. 

This is the reference in dolfi1920, id carrito 1216606. 

And here also the file number that Groundforce gave me when the baggage was lost: MADLX13483/03SEP18/0753GMT.

title: Deliver as advertised.
review_text:
We had a terrible experience on the above flights.

 

Lounge in ZUR was packed with standing room only. A rude agent at the desk told me ‚Äúwhat do you expect its lunchtime!‚Äù. What I expect is what is advertised. A tranquil area to relax before my flight.

 

The flight ZUR-PVG delayed from the gate 2.55mins. Missed an important meeting in Shanghai as a result.

 

Seats on the plane old, dirty, with a terrible IFE.

 

I paid approx. $100 for a ‚ÄúThrown‚Äù seat for my wife and I.

 

We had to move due to 4 very loud, from my perspective drunk passenger shouting at each other.

 

My wife asked for the salmon option only to be told there was none left?

 

I would expect a full refund for this, and compensation for not delivering what is advertised on your website, and the 300EU for the 3 hour delay for both of us.

title: Child friendly!!
review_text: We have traveled overseas on over a dozen different airlines but none were as child friendly and child conscious as Swiss Air! They truly cater to the needs of families with young children. My son is want feeling well and cabin crew from not only our section but from business class would stop by every 45 minutes to an hour to check up on him. Unfortunately he ended up vomiting during the descent and the head crew member came over made sure my son was ok and started cleaning away. I felt horrible but he was so amazing and told me to please not worry and that all that matters was how my child was feeling! We will definitely be flying with Swiss Air again.

title: Good experience
review_text: It was good service, even though the return flight was delayed due to bad weather in Germany. The airport in Zurich however is complicated to navigate in.

title: Lovely Swiss hospitality
review_text:
Lovely service and a perfect flight! The seats very super comfy and since the cabin was less than half full, I used up multiple seats - 1 - for lounging and dining, 2 - for sleeping, 3 for working. Had a 11 hour flight and it was super productive, I ate what I should, did almost 5-6 solid hours of work (helps to have laptop charger and power plug), and got restful ~4 hours of sleep!

I wish I had more videos to share at this time but all I have is a video of the perfect takeoff that I recorded enroute this voyage - you can search for "A Lifetime of Travels" Youtube channel and look up the "Swiss LX 196 Airbus 330 Takeoff from Zurich Airport" video for the beautiful weather, skies, greenery, clouds and just a perfect happy day!

title: Swiss Air improves any airport that they have a presence
review_text: my experience was quite good.  the staff are friendly and speak multiple languages.  the food was tasty and pleasant as were the beverages.  I thought the seats were perfect.

title: Average Airlines
review_text: had heard a lot about Swiss Airlines but the service and the aircraft was quite disappointing , food was also average and the service was OK. seats were average and more like premium economy seats

title: professional staff
review_text: good service even on partner airline Edelweiss. on time arrival and departure, efficient and very professional staff.  Good food was served on board

title: Good overall
review_text: Good experience , used united lounge for breakfast at terminal 2 , onboard good service & nice snack , legroom just ok , connected in zurich new lounge pleasant with movenpick ice cream & nice quiet zone , easy transit to next flight & similar good service to first flight, cost was very little over economy at time of booking so made for a relaxed journey at fair value

title: Flight
review_text: Good flights and the crew was nice, tickets not expensive, loved üòç the chocolate bun in morning flightüòã

title: Amazing experience with Swiss airlines
review_text: Great flight, friendly and nice staff. Pretty good treat of some traditional Swiss cake and delicious chocolate. We didn‚Äôt experience any delays of the flight and the plane itself was pretty new and comfortable.

title: Disoriented
review_text: With a colleague we decided to use this company to go to Brasil for business. the seats are very poor. I can understand to gain space, but to have the same space to go out of the seats equal to the one of the economy class is not acceptable. 180 degrees bed, but with the legs under the seat in front of you. It seemed to be in a grave, with difficulties in moving. The two stars only for good entertainment with a lot of movie in Italian language and nIce personnel

title: Great experience on Swiss Air
review_text: We flew to Zurich with a connecting Swiss Air/Helvitica flight to Florence. The flight left on time from Newark and landed on time at Zurich. The connecting flight left on time also. The flight crew was great and the food and drink were excellent. I arranged through Swiss Air to have a van meet us at the Florence airport to take us to our hotel and then meet us at the end of our stay to take us back to the airport. All went like clock work.I would highly recommend Swiss Air for international travel.

title: Great Swiss ice cream. Average flight, nice staff.
review_text: It is a short flight so the tight seats are bearable. The flying-crew attitude was professional and very friendly. The ice-cream though was exceptionally good! Would fly with them again just for the ice-cream :)

title: 6 hours delay and over 4 months no compensation
review_text: Very poor service, the flight was at 7am and the machine had a technical defect from apparently the day before. So we had a huge delay, I missed a work opportunity and there is no way to get in contact with SWISS. I finally was promised the 250 Euro for my delay (after 100s of emails), but within the promised 14 days there was still no money on my account. I keep chasing them, by now over four months are gone and I have still seen no money. I will defiantly avoid SWISS, worse than Ryan Air but three times as expensive.

title: From Barcelona to zurich
review_text: flight from Barcelona to Zurich round trip, the round trip 30 minutes delay due to problems at the Barcelona airport. Flight at 95%. Price paid: ‚Ç¨ 83. light food and free drink. Good service and online check

title: A bit disappointing beforehand
review_text:
We were a bit disappointed with the airline. We had booked a vegan meal beforehand, but were told at the departure gate that it had been applied to our first flight (Florence > Zurich), even though short-haul flights don't receive meals (and we didn't receive one on board either)! The staff member was smiley but seemed completely uninterested in helping us or suggesting something, simply telling us 'no, you won't have a meal'. This was extremely frustrating. On board, the staff were friendly and tried to cobble things together for us, but all we ended up eating on the 12-hour flight were bread rolls and fruit. 
As a side note about the plane, as it was fairly old, the legroom was appalling. My partner is 6"6 and is usually ok in economy seats, but these were so small, his knees were wedged against the chair in front, so we had to tell the woman sat in front that she wouldn't be able to recline. We had tried to purchase the legroom seats, but they had all sold out within minutes.

title: Unfortunately disappointing
review_text:
Traveled with Singapore airline, return leg was operated by Swiss.

Did not think negatively when i saw the booking confirmation. Plane was uncomfortable, food was bad- not even the kids ate it.

The attitude of staff did not help to improve our experience.

Unfortunately we had a really bad experience, we will not travel with them again.

It is hard to live up to the standart that singapore airline provided.

title: Disappointment..
review_text:
We traveled from Singapore to Zuerich vmwith singapore airlines, unfortuently the return leg was operated by swiss.

At first i thought it will be fine. Turns out it is not. 
The high standart of Si gapore airlines could not be meet by the crew and plane operating the service. 

It was a bleing 777, no legroom, food was not good at all, even the kids refused to eat it.

The attitude of the crew did not help to make this journey more comfotable.

Shame, i always thought swiss was a great airline. 
Maybe it was just my trip that was    disappointing, but it is enough for me not tto travel with them again.

title: Freindly crew and comfortable flight
review_text: The cabin crew were very kind, friendly and in smart uniforms. There is a duty free service on board with a good selection, particularly cosmetics. And the prices are very reasonable. The food was very good with a good selection of wines. The business lounge is confortable and has a smoking room but the selection of vetebales and fruits is rather limited.

title: Super rude station Team from Swiss/ LH
review_text:
Don‚Äôt fly Swiss from BCN if you don‚Äôt want the Police on you!

Swiss made everyone weigh their luggage and even with 0.1 kg above 8kg they made you check it. If you don‚Äôt follow, they told everyone call the Police on you. 
They treated all passengers as they were offenders of a crime and had some pay 55 EUR as a penalty they said.

We explained that we are LH Senators/ UA 1Ks and never had this on any flight in the entire system. The station personell responded that we should shut up, or they call the Police on us. We had to calm them down even.

I am ok if someone explains the terms and let‚Äôs us resolve the situation, but this was thrown out of proportion!
We expect an apology from the local team.

title: Great 1st Class Lounge at Zurich.  Nice seats in Business Class.
review_text: Very nice service and food selection.  Great entertainment system.  Travel amenity bag is adequate but nothing extra-ordinary compared to other airlines.  Would be nice to have a parting gift like KLM does with the miniature dutch delft houses.....they offer swiss chocholate on the flight...however the could do more as a personal touch for business/1st class guests.

title: Not very special
review_text:
Overnight business class flight. Choice of food for supper limited - ham was offered but when I requested cheese with it, the flight attendant had to go and ask if it was possible.
The seats pull out into beds but are very narrow and not so comfortable. Nothing very special about this sector Delhi to Zurich. The Zurich to Barcelona was even less appealing. Small plane, three few business class rows at the front. Again the food on offer for breakfast was merely adequate. I am used to travelling on Singapore Airlines, so probably I have been spoilt. This was entirely unmemorable. Booked Lufthansa but the carrier was Swiss.

title: Excellent experience as always
review_text:
Swiss has been an excellent choice for travellers from Thessaloniki at least since 2007 when I first flew with them.
Good service, quality snack and convenient times. Easy boarding for families with young kids and courteous staff. 
Overall, one of my first choices from/to SKG.

title: Swiss are really great except for the 777 in economy
review_text:
I fly weekly with Swiss and from time to time take long haul flights mostly almost exclusively in economy class, 2 to 3 per year and fly long haul with other airlines too.

Up to now I would say I am a fan, 9 year frequent flier, the 777 in economy changes that, it is a truly horrible experience.

The seating is too tight in all dimensions.
The food tray is too narrow and the under tray cup holder design is a recipe for disaster combined with the lack of leg room.

I short Swiss usually get it right this time they got it totally wrong, even with my status, almost senator I will avoid this aircraft option at all cost.

title: Very professional
review_text: No reason to fault this flight at all.  It got me where I wanted to go at a reasonable cost.  Staff were all very professional and efficient, offering us supper and breakfast, and getting my vegetarian order right.  I groaned when I saw my seat number, 52G, right at the back, nearly in the toilets.  Often I've found that you cant lean back in these seats as they are right against the wall, but there was some space and it was fine.  I managed to sleep and that always helps the time go.  And I had a gripping David Baldacci novel to read, the cheapest in the airport at 9.99 dollars.  I would rate this flight as 'good' if TripAdviser gave us the choice.

title: nice short trip with nice hospitality
review_text: I experienced a nice flight. everything was in order and I really enjoyed my trip.we were served a snack and beverage which was nice.ice cream and Swiss chocolate was also served.

title: Zurich Transfers from out of Schengen area countries to out of Schengen area countries
review_text:
ZURICH AIRPORT TRANSFERS

The system in place for transit from arrivals from out of the Schengen area countries transiting to an out of a Schengen area country was the best we have experienced in Europe. We arrived from the USA (Chicago-O'Hare) on our way to the Russian Federation (Moscow). We only had to go through one security check and at the departure gate we had one document check(Passport and Visa) and did not have to go through multiple passport control checks and multiple security checks as we have experienced in Frankfort airport during transit from out of Schengen area countries to out of Schengen area countries.

Arriving at a Concourse E gate you are quickly directed via clearly marked signage to a shuttle train that moves you to the point in terminal building 1 that had connections with B gates. Our total transit time from arriving at gate E19 to gate B32 only took a total of 55 minutes. I had been concerned with only having 120 minutes between flights at Zurich Airport since we have experienced 3-4 hour transit times when flying through Frankfort airport with the same itinerary.

I highly recommend using Zurich as a major transfer point for trips to out of European Schengen area countries from the United States.

title: Brilliant airline
review_text: Flew to zurich for a wedding. Flights on time both ways. Website makes it so easy to check-in on line. Use phone for boarding passes with no problems. Spacious seating with loads of leg room. Free pastry and soft drinks. No hardcsell from staff. In flight entertainment for kids.

title: First and possibly Last time I will travel with Swiss Airlines.
review_text:
I travelled for our summer holidays to Turkey via Swiss Airlines. The first was to Zurich and then a connecting flight with Edelweiss to Turkey. Both planes didn‚Äôt have inbuilt TV screens but room space on both was sufficient for a simple plane. Food on both planes were quite insufficient and lacked in portion size. The first plane provides travellers with a hard cold croissant (tasted as if it was defrosted) and the other provided cold cuts of meat with some pickle potatoes and green beans with a small chocolate moose. There was no vegetarian options for those that had dietary requirements (Halal) and were told they had to have requested this upon check in. We were unable to check in online but to have no veg options is quite disappointing. My flight in particular ....... had so many passengers complain as veg options were requested via online check in and yet undelivered in service. This is not only inconvenient but not acceptable. Staff tried their best to deal with the situation by offering lots of bread but couldn‚Äôt and didn‚Äôt have the facilities to offer any other alternatives. They dealt with the issues in a adequate manner and this therefore raises concern on behalf of the airline which needs to step the bar up if they wish to have any further bookings from customers including myself. Travelling to a Muslim country where the possibilities of Halal is a requirement and not providing vegetarian options as an alternative for the non delivery of this is just plain stupidity. 

Another note is that Switzerland airport is very limited especially if you have a long transit period. There is one cafe that serves hot food and is very expensive; 25 Euro for a burger. There around two convenient stores to buy some drinks and light snacks. My ad ice is to bring stuff otherwise you will starve and die of boredom.

title: Swiss Air delivers!
review_text: I was delightfully happy with my flight on Swiss Air. I was expecting a long, tedious and uneventful flight from Vancouver to Zurich but was pleased with the friendly customer service, free items such as headphones and use of pillows and blankets, movies in front of your seat, and food. They offered 2 choices of dinner a couple hours after takeoff, which consisted of a platter including salad, unlimited buns, drink, entree and dessert. It was delicious as well! They offered ice cream, cookies and coffee in between this meal and breakfast. They had people close windows and turned down the lights to help everyone rest. I felt very well taken care of and quite enjoyed the overall experience with Swiss Air!

title: first time with swiss
review_text:
first time for me to fly with swiss comoany, departure one hour dellay 
(season reason), service inside was good . gap between chairs comfort, the stuff was efficient, served a good meal, back home was on time and the service was good.

title: Excellent - London-Zurich and Zurich-Lugano
review_text: Four flights recently with Swiss (including a code share with Austrian from Zurich to Lugano), slightly delayed leaving Heathrow but still made connection in Zurich, 10/10 all round apart from the slight delay, and the best cabin service in Economy I've had for some time.

title: Comfortable flight, good service.
review_text:
I was on my flight from Changi, Singapore to Zurich. The flight was pretty comfortable, service was alright (could be more warm and attentive). Meal service was good, tasty and filling. The swiss chocolate and guyure cheese  choice in the meals do add some extra touch to the meal.

The inflight entertainment can be improved. The selection of movies are not the latest.The flight takes around 12 hours. It will be an upper hand if the airline will invest in the latest movie to let either family or business traveler to catch up on movies during the long flights.

In terms of punctuality, the flight was slightly delayed due to runway congestion at Changi airport. We were glad that our baggage arrived at the destination in good condition. Only one of my friend's baggage was damaged. Swiss International have done a good job on compensating for the damage after the trip.

Overall, it is an value flight, all the basic necessities were all fulfilled, I will recommend Swiss International again.

title: Excellent from booking to landing
review_text: Easy to use booking system, Online checking simple and able to print boarding passes or have on phone for this and the onward flight with Edelweiss. On flight drinks and snack good quality and served by a smiling and helpful crew.

title: First Class flight in First Class
review_text: Difficult to rate? No! Because I was travel in a pretty new 777 with the new first class layout. Very good Screen, amazing food served 30000 feet above - really, no joke I had the Ribeye Wagyu Steak and as it was so gooooooood. Before landing, I ordered a Sandwich with Angus beef - just yummy! This is how flying is enjoyable - but once again, not really difficult to rate since you expect this when you book first....

title: Zurich to JNB
review_text: Not impressed! The plane was obviously old and tired, seriously needed updating. We were in business class so how bad can it be? Well shortly after we get in the air for a long flight they turn on the in flight entertainment, ours does not work. We tell the flight attendant and she tells us the plane is old, well duh! She says she will reboot the system and when that does not work, she shrugs. We flew with no in flight entertainment. The food was uninspired at best and overall the flight would have been totally miserable in econ.

title: Not trhe best communication and experience
review_text:
Well we first dealt with bad weather effecting our departure, and Swiss Air changing us to another airline Delta. So as we were waiting for our plane in Boston and when our plane taxi into the gate it clipped the wing of another plane. So they flew another plane for Detroit to Boston to get us over to a connection in Amsterdam to Rome. We did it, but had to run with our luggage through customs to barely catch our flight. Also Delta would not give us assigned seats for the connection because it was with Royal Dutch, so that delayed us too. Not a pleasant flight, and it took a lot longer than originally scheduled.

Then on our return we had trouble checking in on-line, so we tried the Swiss Air Italy number and that kept connecting us to a private number. So we tried the Boston Swiss Air number and after getting through they were extremely helpful and checked us in. When we arrive three hours at the airport the next day we went to get our boarding passes from Swiss Air and we were told we hadn't checked in yet. The woman checking us in was extremely rude and while she was helping us check in she was in a very loud and angry conversation in a lovers spat. She most likely figured since we were american and speaking english with her we wouldn't be able to understand her conversation in Italy. Not the case! 

Long story short, not only was she one of the most upsetting service people that I ever have the unfortunate opportunity to deal with, but on our flight from Rome to Zurich she seated my wife in row 4 and me in back of the plane in row 38. So there was huge delay in meeting up with my wife to run to our next flight. Plus there was a 30 minute delay boarding and then we had to wait for a gate in Zurich. We barely made the plane, but the good thing that happen was two very nice people moved to our our separate seats and offered us their seats. I guess the karma needed to change, and Swiss Air was definitely not offering it. Just those two good souls who offered us their seats, so we could sit together.

Oh by the way, the Swiss plane was old and didn't have the wifi capability to purchase.

I guess our experience was extremely bad, especially their customer service and we'll never fly them again.

title: Short flight efficient and timely
review_text:
this flight takes a tad more than an hour, so we chose economy. A bit cramped and operated as a low cost airline, but honestly did expect this. Because everyone  avoids check in bags as they cost a bit, the cabin baggage area gets overcrowded and your bag may be not near to you. The plane was small and seats were not very comfortable space wise.

Very efficient and timely service though. Cabin attendants were polite and competent.

Overall above average, but not too great!

title: The Best Flight Experience offered to my family by Maitre de Cabine-Renato Zanella
review_text:
Right from the moment my family entered the aircraft to the moment we landed, we were lucky to receive Renato‚Äôs superlative services.
Not only was he efficient in his duties as Maitre de Cabine, but his nature of going ‚Äòabove and beyond‚Äô for the passengers under his purview is what we appreciated the most.
He took pains to tell us about the wonderful sightseeing places we could accommodate during our visit to Hungary. He also told us what we could do on a visit to Switzerland.
Also as it was football season football shaped chocolates were given to all passengers. The moment Renato knew how much my children enjoyed the goodies, he gifted them an entire bag full and wished them happy holidays!
There should be more pursers like Renato Zanella to make Air Travel a pleasurable experience!
~Felicia Variava Albert, Managing Director, Blaze Tours & Travels Pvt. Ltd., Mumbai, India

title: Business lounge Geneva airport
review_text: What a dump.  I would not feed the food on offer to my dog. Absolutely disgusting. Limp soggy sandwiches and virtually nothing on display.

title: Impressed!!
review_text: I had heard that Swissair was a low budget airline.  We had economy tickets and I just hoped for the best as I'd never flown on Swissair before.  Without question, the best economy flight I've ever flown.  The flight attendants were very personable and friendly and attended to everyone's needs - the best I've witnessed in years.  Plenty of food, drinks, and snacks which were all good.

title: Swiss Air - Don‚Äôt care/ DON‚ÄôT WASTE, TIME, OR MONEY, RESERVING SEATS
review_text:
I Paid for 3 seats in advance, the money debited my account and I have printed confirmation of our seat numbers. It would have been good customer service, if I had received an email, or telephone call, explaining my seats had been given away. But, I only realised that my seats had been allocated to other passengers when trying to check in.  
I complained at the checkin desk and was told to request a refund, which of course I did.  This was over a week ago. Why am I not surprised, that other than the standard email acknowledging my complaint, I haven‚Äôt received anything else. Seems they‚Äôre very busy with all the other complaints and i‚Äôm in a queue.

title: Manchester to Tell Aviv madness
review_text:
I travelled with Swiss on 27th of February from Manchester to Tel Aviv via Zurich.

I was originally supposed to catch the 10.45pm flight from ZRH to TLV. But due to the late arrival of the flight from Manchester(10.43pm), I was informed that I would only be able to travel to TLV the following morning.

Upon arrival in ZRH, I was informed that I would not be able to leave the airport and I was therefore shown to a room within the airport. The room can only be described as marginally better than a prison cell. It was extremely small, had no open able window and was hot, stuffy with no A/C or other ventilation.

The corridor in which the room was located was likewise small and was subsequently locked  for the night.

There was one public toilet and shower in the corridor, with no personal toiletries provided. When I requested deodorant in the morning I was given a used can that had to be returned after use.

I was given a voucher to buy food, but there were  no open shops at that hour.

I was unable to contact my family in England as there were no telephones provided in the locked corridor in which I was ‚Äòimprisoned‚Äô.

On the flight to TLV the following morning, I received a seat towards the back of the plane. I had reserved myself an Exit seat on the original flight to TLV. In consideration of the fact that I am 6ft 2in tall being denied the Exit seat I had originally booked caused major discomfort.

I received no apology from any of your staff.

I missed an important event that I had to attend in Israel on the 28th of Feb, due to arriving there 12 hours late.

title: Well thought flight food
review_text: The plane was clean and the schedule was tight so that one doesn'r have to wait many minutes to get a new connection.  The service is good and very efficient.  While I missed the connection at Zurich due to heavy rain in Shanghai the new flight was already booked and vouch for compensation etc  were just outside the arrival gate to pick up.  They serve good vegetarian food prepared by  the oldest vegetarian restaurant in Europe.

title: We were not impressed
review_text:
We were not impressed.  The seats were small and there was very little leg room.  Even the pockets have little room for our stuff.  

One annoying thing was that the cup holder was on the underside of the tray table, just above knee height.  Twice I got wet from the water in the glass.

The touch screen was very sensitive and when one got up to the toilet in the night it was hard not to knock it and flood the area with bright light.

The cabin crew were indifferent and seemed more interested in joking amongst themselves.  

Food was awful.  The omelet at breakfast was a square of egg and solid.  The bacon was cold.

title: My favorite airlines
review_text: The most confortable and safe airlines,very good service ,super staff ,the airport lounge is perfect , I hope they don‚Äôt use smaller planes like Lufthansa which is not confortable at all as usual type of planes.

title: Flight to J'berg via Zurich
review_text: Great flight, the flight crew were very helpful and professional. Zurich airport was very clean and plenty still open

title: Comfortable Day Flight
review_text:
Aircraft was a day flight on an Airbus A343 jet leaving Narita at 10:10am.  Flight time was 12.5 hours and passengers were encouraged to sleep after the main meal was served even though it was daylight outside.  Food was good and varied with a wide selection of wines.  Two meals were provided for the duration of the flight.

The centre aisle seats we had were comfortable and allowed ready access to the aisles. They were not as wide as some other airlines but the seat controls were simple to operate to setup the flatbed configuration. 
 There was a limited range of premium new release movies but enough choice to wile away the time.

title: 5 days out and still no luggage,
review_text: My wife and daughters and underage daughters took this fligh and five days after their return to San Diego they still haven‚Äôt gotten their bags...  We call and they don‚Äôt seem to care much...  The problem started in Bordeaux and they had to spend their night in Zurich without their stuff...  And then take their long flight to San Diego with their same clothes... Very unpleasant, uncomfortable, and not professional at all,

title: Muscat to London
review_text: A reliable service,clean aircraft and toilets,up-to standard cabin service. Cannot complain about the seats we knew what we were getting (checked on Seat Guru).Overnight flight so slept most of the way.Zurich Airport is a fantastic hub,easy connections unlike other European hubs where walking a mile is common.

title: Great experience
review_text: I flew with a partner airline (SAS) from Stockholm to Zurich and then with Swiss from Zurich to Beijing. It's been a while since I've been on a long haul flight, but I was really impressed. SAS were excellent for short haul (I got the Zurich to Stockholm Swiss flight back and it was bad in comparison to SAS, and delayed!) and Swiss were excellent for the long haul. The food was great and didn't taste like plastic, although I couldn't eat a lot of it due to my wheat and dairy intolerance. They gave a nice pillow and blanket, which helped. The tea and coffee and water / free drinks and wine was great and offered regularly. The movies and headphones were great and the service was good. OK, the legroom wasn't fab and I'm only 5 foot 2. But it was nice only being trapped in a window seat with one person between me and the aisle rather than 2. Overall, very positive and punctual experience. Plus they upgraded me for free to business class on the return flight, which was just lovely and amazing.

title: Poor long-haul experience
review_text: We just had quite a poor long haul service experience with Swiss. The problems started when we checked in online and realised that our family of four (including two young children) were not seated together. When we got to the airport we were told that the flight was over booked and there‚Äôs nothing I could do. Same we got to the gate. We then tried to negotiate with individual passages that couldn‚Äôt make it work so we were left with threes groups of seats for the two adults and a nine-year-old and three-year-old girl. Needless to say this made the (overnight) flight very difficult for us all, and Swiss didn‚Äôt seem overly concerned to help us. Now I didn‚Äôt not even think seating children away from their parents was legal and most airlines pre-seat families in groups to make sure this doesn‚Äôt happen but it would seem Swiss is more interested in making short-term money by overbooking the plane. In the 40 overnight long haul flights I‚Äôve taken with the kids this is never happened to me before so I‚Äôm very disappointed with Swiss. To make matters worse they then served me an inedible dish again didn‚Äôt seem too concerned by that. That definitely heading for the budget end of town but without the ‚Äôcustomer hunger‚Äô that the budget airlines often have. Recommend considering alternatives, or expecting second class performance.

title: Best regional flight in 13 years of travelling in Europe
review_text: We've flown EasyJet, KLM, Air France, Lufthansa, British Airways and an obscure Belgian airline but Swiss wins hands down.  In fairness, KLM comes a close second.  What we found with Swiss is that they are good value for money, the standard package is more than sufficient, they are more reliable than the budget airlines, there are no hidden costs and the aeroplanes are clean and modern.  I was also very impressed by their awareness of diversity and inclusion - both BME and gender, in the cockpit and in the cabin.  Our outward trip was a shambles with delays at Heathrow and the associated knock-on effects but the crew went out of their way to be friendly and helpful.  The big surprise on the way back was when I asked for gluten-free snacks.
