I was offered a chocolate muffin on the first leg and it wasn't bad at all and a quinoa salad on the second leg that was frankly delicious.  Anyone who is restricted to a gluten-free diet will know the perils involved and I was astonished and so impressed by what I was offered as well as the smile that accompanied it.  I was also impressed by the cabin staff who were able to effectively handle a very rude young punk who demanded booze before take-off.  They were firm but made no fuss and his behaviour improved although not his personality.  Well done Swiss - if you're going where we're going, we're going with you.  Oh and did I mention that I am over 6 ft tall and legroom was sufficient as well as the rather cheeky and very tasty little swiss chocolate bar that you get on each flight?

title: Very little leg space and poor service
review_text: This year we flew with this airlines from Brussels to Denpasar (flight from singapore to Denpasar carried out by singapore airlines). In advance we booked chairs next to each other (a paid service). By boarding we found out that the chairs where very small (we're average height and weight). When sitting down your knees almost hit the chair in front of you. When the person in front of you is putting the chair in sleep mode then it's even worse. This makes its almost impossible to have a meal. During flight (night time) there is water and snacks available in the pantry, but with sleeping people besides you that's not very convenient. One's and a while there someone walking around with water. For the return flight we tried to chance our reserved chairs to chairs with extra leg space. (Started to email as soon as we arrived). After several emails (where they asked me to call the service centre, which is very expensive from bali) we received a email with the following solution. We could cancel the first reservation for chairs (next to each other) and make a new one for extra leg space. We would be charged for the full cost, the paid amount for the first reservation was not refundable. Conclusion: never ever again are we gone fly Swiss air. Very bad service for changing of reservations and horrible seating.

title: Short trip
review_text: This was a short flight from Florence to Geneva but was ok. Received  Swiss chocolate which was nice.

title: Baggage BS
review_text: Flew from Malaga to Heathrow via Zurich. Bags didn't arrive in Heathrow. Had to wait two hours for the next flight to arrive. Next flight arrived. Stood at the carousel for another hour still no bags. Three hours and counting I will never get back because they messed up my transfer. Not happy

title: Economy class as it oughtto be
review_text: Many airlines are now making economy class a penny-pinching experience, with grumpy service and meals that taste like spongy cardboard. Not Swiss: efficient  from departure to arrival despite a near full flight, speedy meal delivery service, drinks and coffee appropriately placed rather than a nasty afterthought, simple but tasty food: meat that had taste, nice veg, simple but delicious moussey desert, real bread roll not just a nasty water biscuit...comfortable seat, fault-free movie system ( though both movies and classical music somewhat limited in range). Would happily choose them again after this.

title: Again a great experience
review_text: From A to Z a great experience. Starting with a friendly check in, fantastic lounge (the Swiss first class lounge in Zurich is one of the best I have ever experienced- definitely top at the moment, great food, great service, and of course great design). The flight was a treat all the way, super friendly staff, excellent food and wine, great sleep thanks to very comfortable seats / beds, and the arrival is fast and efficient in Sao Paulo. I wish every flight was as good as this one (unfortunately short haul flights are much less impressive with Swiss).

title: Flabbergasted
review_text: We had to get an automatic car in Brussels, return French Side, Geneva return. Arrived French Side, returned car. No Swiss taking bags, only Swiss side. I needed a wheel chair. Called Geneva assistance, took a half hour. Told to take a taxi to Swiss side with baggage. Arrived Swiss side. Finally took bags to Swiss Airline person, told we were two minutes late and was told we could not board. Gentleman from Assist attempted to explain the delay due to stupid lack of coordination between Swiss and French side. Swiss not taking baggage and wait for wheel chair. Told to return the next day. Stuck in Geneva to look for a hotel and loads of baggage. Swiss person at desk refused to board us for two minutes late! Rigid, no empathy for an elder in a wheelchair.

title: Fantastic flight
review_text: I had the pleasure to enjoy a fantastic flight from Zurich to Bangkok. Warm welcoming on board, excellent food and beverages. The crew was great, always with a smile. Flight time was too short!

title: expencive .
review_text:
when i bought the swiss airline tickets from copenhagen to zurich and return,i payed more for one bag for each person.but the first leg operator was SAS.i had bag.but not for the return leg which was swiss airline.i should pay for each one separately .
for online check in i tried both .i dont know why.since i had bought the ticket from swiss airline but because of different operator i should do my check in through sas web site.
it is an expensive airline but dos not have priority to other europian airlines.

title: Great experience
review_text: Although normal seats the leg room was ok. All the staff on both flights were great and made it a good experience. I left my tablet on the second flight but it wad handed in and I was able to get it.  The food was ok and the cheese wad lovely and tge swiss chocolate is always very welcome.  Although we left Manchester late we arrived in Zurich on time and I wad able to make my connection.

title: A two class system in business class
review_text: Last Monday I was travelling from Zurich to Shanghai in Business class. There was a choice of 4 meals available (Beef, fish, chicken and vegetarian). Did order the Beef. However, after 15 minutes I was told that there is no more beef nor fish left. As per per the Airlines internal regulations, priority is being given to Honorary circle- and Senator Status members. All other passengers have to eat "whatever is left".

title: Swiss
review_text: Efficient from start to finish. Comfy seats with sufficient legroom, certainly for a ninety minutes hop. A complimentary glass of water was welcome but it felt a little mean. The small chocolate bar will go down well with my daughter

title: What a gem of an airport
review_text: We were travelling as assisted flyers due to a medical issue, every aid and assistance was offered to us. The whole airport could have been a holiday on its own Zurich airport was amazing, huge the place to indulge and watches well it is Switzerland.  The airplane was new  feeling clean and staffed with the most friendly  warm caring staff. Many thanks for looking after us especially my wife.

title: Superb Flight- Swiss Air Rocks
review_text: Swiss Air provides an excellent travel experience even for economy class. The seats were very comfortable, the staff were helpful, and the inflight entertainment rocked. Although a 2hr flight, I was provided a meal service which was a nice treat. At the end of the flight, having a delicious Swiss chocolate capped off my flight in a uniquely Swiss way. Swiss Air makes economy class feel like first class. I highly recommend to fly them if you get the chance.

title: It's not a matter of the airline, it's the matter of their ground handling staff
review_text:
Swiss/Austrian/Lufthansa, you should either chose another ground handler or train the current one(s) at CAI airport. Two recent experiences are not in favor of the airline(s). When checkin in mid July with my wife, the agent informed us that the flight is heavily booked and he would accept our hand-luggage to be checked in free of charge. We re-arranged our stuff and noticed, that the trolley we wanted to check in would be more or less "empty". So we reconsidered, repacked and took our 2 trolleys along to the aircraft. The aircraft was NOT full, more than 20 (!) seats been empty. During this "event" my mobile phone got lost and despite filing the issue at the airport police there was no result.
Checking-in on another flight on 17.08. this agent was more than relaxed, actually he was "hanging" in his chair, not sitting. He did not say one single word (maybe due to the fact that he had been talking too much privately on his mobile phone).  My wish to be seated to the front of the aircraft in a seat either at the window or the aisle ended like: Sitting in a middle seat in the very last row of the aircrat from CAI to ZRH and from ZRH to FRA again a seat in the last row. No, i was not one of the last passengers checking in, according to the numbered forms for immigration, i was passenger 28 checking in. 
Today, departing from STR to CAI via ZRH the LH agent asked me to pay for access luggage. I checked in 1 bag with 25.5 Kg, = 2.5 Kg above permit, I had been charged Euro 75,-- 
Again Swiss in the near future? I doubt, my next trips will be either on MS or TK...

title: Budapest
review_text: Delay delay delay. Like a cheap flight. Poor service. I do not know what happened with this company. Looking for other partner!!!!!!

title: Very dissappointed with Swiss air
review_text:
I am writing re the customer care and after flight services Swiss air give. They lost our luggage from Malta to New York and left us without for 3 days. I asked for a compensation in July and till this day even though they have agreed to compensate me after presenting all necessary documents we still haven't received funds.
They promised a 14 day time but more than 30 days have passed and what's worse I keep sending them emails to their customer care and they don't even reply. In addition they have a very poor English used in their emails making it difficult to understand what they mean. I suggest one is super careful with luggage when flying with them.

title: pleasent
review_text: This trypi was very pleasent because we have a long,long tryp to do. I travel with my daugther for the first time in a international fly. So, it was really necessery to be a good fly. In the moment when we arrive in New Delhi it was raining and the abord to the land was great. Lique a soft wave.

title: Simply the best business airline
review_text:
Flying frequently with Swiss for business I can just recommend it on this class of travel.
The professionality of service and the quality of the food served has no equal, surely no comparison with Lufthansa or Emirates.

title: Efficient and well run Airlines
review_text: After a very long time I flew SwissAir again. Right from the check in to the flight itself, it was excellent with typical Swiss efficiency. The Business Lounge at JFK Airport was functional and catered to your needs. The Business Class seats were comfortable and everything was located well. The onboard services was handled with typical Swiss precision. The food was good as were the snacks. The Business Lounge in Zurich was good and served all the needs of travellers on long flights. A very good experience.

title: Extremely corrupt airline
review_text: I called Swiss airlines to change my flight less than 24 hours after my initial booking. I told two separate agents that I did not want to change my flight if I would be charged an additional fee. I asked them multiple times on the phone to confirm that I would only be charged about $700 roundtrip for my ticket with no additional fees and both agents said "Yes" multiple times. Because they assured me I would not be charged additional fees, I asked them to change the flight. Therefore, I was shocked when I noticed I had been charged $700 + an additional $700 for a new ticket. When I called to complain, they told me they would be unable to reimburse me, despite their agents telling me incorrect information and persuading me to change my flight. I read several reviews about Swiss Airlines taking similar corrupt actions and should have listened. I will not fly with this airline again and would advise anyone else who is thinking about flying with them to reconsider.

title: Just a short 1 hr flight but good
review_text: First time on Swiss, short 1 hr flight, plane was nothing special but staff both on aircraft and on ground were very friendly and helpful. No meal of course but they did hand out a small bottle of water and a delicious square of chocolate (please please double the size of that chocolate! It was just a tease!) after reaching cruising altitude.

title: Food was terrible
review_text: Everything was nice except the food which was some silly chicken thing which I found oliy and flavourless but the airline it's self is good

title: Good and Bad
review_text:
We landed in Zurich for a connection to Boston. We went through Customs and got our passports stamped. We then went through the security checks. We went to the gate for the connecting flight. Then we needed to wait in another line to get our boarding pass stamped. Back in line to board the plane. 

Is this only a Swiss Air thing, or a Switzerland thing? This was the first time I‚Äôve ever had to get a boarding pass stamped. I also got tagged for the extra ‚Äúbehind the curtain‚Äù treatment. 

The flight...

Large plane, friendly/attentive crew, good food. 
The crew went out of their way to make sure the passengers had a good experience. Food, drinks, etc. 

The ONLY negative...

All seats have a TV screen with a great selection of movies to watch. 1 hour in to an 8 hour flight, not all screens were working, so the system needed to be rebooted. 1 hour later, it still wasn‚Äôt working. 2 hours later, the TVs started working. Very important to a long flight.

As compensation, we got extra chocolates. Also, a voucher for something the next time we book with Swiss Air. Great gesture, but most of us aren‚Äôt faithful to a single airline. We look at price and convenience.

I will fly with Swiss Air again.

title: Very good quality Airline with friendly staff
review_text: We fly Swiss often and I have never been disappointed with a long haul flight. The are always fully equipped and have a very friendly and helpful staff. Even the food is pretty good especially for airplane food. It is alway clean and the flights are barely ever delayed. One bonus of course is the Swiss milk chocolate they give out at the end. It has always been a very safe and comfortable flight and the new seats allow economy passengers to lean back more than they used to. If you are very tall I recommend picking a seat close to an exit for extra legroom but for people up to 180cm the legroom is good.

title: Horrible
review_text: Our flight from Oslo to Zurich they changed my husband's seat as we were walking onto the plane. I paid extra for specific seats and they didn't care. Then from Zurich to Newark, NJ was just a disgrace. They set up customs booths at the gate yet didn't give anyone information on what to do and this delayed the flight over an hour. Once we went through that we thought we were done, but no they made us have our passports checked for a 3rd time while boarding the plane. They ran out of bottled water on the plane. The seats are extremely cramped to the point of having to recline your seat if the person in front of you reclines it because you will be smacked in the face. The bathrooms were absolutely horrific and they ran out of toilet paper. Since they were late taking off we didn't have a gate landing and sat on the runway for 45mins with no communication what so ever. Took forever to get our bags from baggage claim as well. Will never fly them again.

title: New Swiss B-777 seat configuration: Terrible!!!
review_text: I am traveling for many years and I have performed more than 20 long haul flights with various airlines. Swiss is an airline that I am using a lot. Unfortunately I was completely disappointed with the seat configuration of the new Boeing 777 from them. For this price, it is unacceptable to have the current seat configuration in an long haul flight. There are many more options at the same cost with much more room and comfort.

title: One of the best airlines
review_text: Was supposed to be in business but flight was overbooked so got demoted to economy. Was later moved to the front of the economy cabin and the airline addressed the issue properly. It‚Äôs not about having no problems but to address them appropriately when they occur. Other aspects were excellent as well. Lounge was clean, wine was tasteful, food was well cooked and services were warm and professional. Will recommend.

title: Claytons business
review_text: If you are looking for a business class experience this is not the airline to do it with, the seating is economy seating with the centre seat blocked  out, we only booked it as we had a connecting flight, so we have nothing to whinge about, as we knew what we were getting however, others be warned, know what you are getting.

title: Hostile and poor customer service
review_text: The flight was delayed for 2 hours and after another 2 hours of waiting on board, it was cancelled. Ground crews were extremely rude. No hotel accommodation offered but a hotel conference room with sleeping bag! Refused to compensate according to EU261/2004 at all! What a disgrace! Terrible Swiss hospitality. Never travel with Swiss!

title: First rate service
review_text: Boarded almost as so as the gate opened. Served tea and croissants  and landed on time.Fairly comfortable seato with reasonable  leg room.

title: A very average Business Class
review_text: Flew to Europe on mixture of Business Class firstly Singapore Airlines than change to Swiss Air.  No comparison, Swiss Air basic sitting, not much room and not very comfy, service was not great, would never chose them again

title: Most Enjoyable Flight
review_text:
Very comfortable and clean New Airplane, with 11‚Äù state of the art no.1 Entertainment System. Many new releases, and fair selection of older movies. Subtitles in many languages (including Hebrew) ‚Äì great for kids.
F&B like Business class of other airlines. And above all ‚Äì The inflight service is so good. I would choose Swiss for my next flights.

title: Nice service, good flight.
review_text: We had a nice flight. It was a Boeing 777, with a very good inflight entertainment system. Nice food and enough beverages. Even some ice cream and chocolates. Good service.

title: Fast, efficient great luggage compartments in cabin
review_text: Flew  London to Zurich, seats comfortable, overhead luggage compartments were deep and easily fitted baggage. Tasty snack provided. Pleasant staff and chocolate before landing.

title: Very good service
review_text:
We flew on a short business trip with a subsidiary of Swiss, Edelweiss. The flight was excellent with plenty legroom and we even had a free snack ! Take a lesson low-cost airlines.
Check in at Zurich was about the most painless for an economy flight.

title: Great service, on-time flights
review_text: We flew economy class, yet we were treated very well and received everything we asked for. There were a ton of movies from which to choose as we transited across the Atlantic. All the cabin staff spoke perfect English, too. I would recommend this airline to anyone.

title: Very poor customer service and their employees are very rude
review_text: They lost our bag  and we could not talk to anyone to trace the bag after many emails it was delivered to us two days later with no compensation Mae had to buy whole lot of stuff since all belonging were in the bag and on our way bag they chatted us 60 euros for for our bag  the employees are very rude and unprofessional,I will never use them again

title: Efficient
review_text:
Well I expected nothing else than a no nonsense hop from Geneva to London. Check in was a doddle and the aircraft cabin was clean and clinical. A complimentary glass of water and chocolate raised the experience a smidgen of an iota of a scintilla above easyjet and ryanair. Mostly harmless.

The only pain was ¬£4 for a bottle of pop prior to boarding.

title: Flight delays, broken entertainment systems, and lost baggage - will never fly them again
review_text: One of the worst flight experiences.  The flight from Boston to Zurich was delayed nearly three hours and we missed our connection to Florence - finally got to Florence but total travel time was more than 20 hours.  The flight itself was mediocre (nothing special) but the seatback entertainment systems were broken.  The flight home was also delayed and total travel time was 19 hours (seems ridiculous for going transatlantic).  Then Swiss Air lost our luggage, and had no idea where the bag was - said they would look for it and "might" find it within 5 days.  Also, customer service regarding the lost bag was terrible - on hold for 45 minutes, and then were told that Swiss Air was "looking for it," but had no further information.

title: Better than I expected....
review_text: I was worried about flying Swiss from Zurich to San Francisco because they fit 10 seats versus 9 in their 777s.  But I have to say, the experience was not too bad.  The seat was a bit narrow but the service was very good.  The food was good and they offer complimentary alcohol (not just beer and wine) in economy.  Thye did not have power at the seat on the 777 and I wished they did.  They did have a usb port next to the video screen.  They did have good entertainment screens and system.  I watched some decent movies.  I would fly them across the Atlantic again.

title: Keeps up the good work
review_text: It is not the first time I flew with Swiss. Staff is attentive and kind. The flight departs and arrives on time. They have in flight entertainment when other airlines stopped having it on flights from Europe to Tel Aviv.

title: Horrible first experience
review_text:
My wife and I traveled to Switzerland for 3 weeks for our honeymoon. The first flight from Boston to Zurich was between 8-10 hours. The connecting flight from Zurich to Geneva was under 1 hour.

My original impression with Swiss Air wasn't good, but it wasn't anything out of the ordinary based on my experience with American or United. I originally overlooked this (and wasn't going to write a review) but our return trip was so excruciatingly bad that I now find it necessary to inform the public of each and every aspect of how poor our entire experience was and how badly Swiss Air handled the situation.

During our trip to Zurich, the service on the plane from Boston to Zurich was simply not friendly. This was surprising to us given all of the glowing online reviews of the airline. More importantly (especially for an 8+ hour flight), we were on an extremely old plane without even the simplest of present day commodities (no outlets or USB ports to charge our phones). Some might not think it's fair to write a review based on the fleet of the airline, but I believe that's absolutely something that reflects on the airline.

On our return flight after a wonderful 3 weeks in Switzerland, we had a nightmarish experience with Swiss Air. We ordered our tickets through the Swiss Air website which included a connection from Geneva to Zurich before flying from Zurich to Boston. Due to weather issues, our flight from Geneva to Zurich was unable to land on time and we circled the airport until the weather was more appropriate for us to land. Let me be the first to say that I am perfectly understanding of issues like this. I would rather be safe on my flight and weather is certainly a common factor that jeopardizes that. However, the way the airline handles the situation afterwards, in my honest opinion, is what makes or breaks the airline. In this case, Swiss Air failed miserably. Prior to landing in Zurich (around 5:00 PM), the Swiss Air flight made an announcement regarding the connections. We were told on the flight that we needed to make our way immediately to our gate (as our flight was departing at 5:30). Our plane landed and we deboarded at 5:22 PM, giving us 8 minutes to get to our gate. Upon deboarding, there was literally nobody working for the airport or Swiss Air within eye shot to inform we were on our way. Because of that, we began running from gate A22 and needed to get to gate E23 in 8 minutes. Due to airport logistics, we needed to traverse numerous escalators as well as take a tram. We arrived at the gate at 5:33 and our flight was still sitting outside, though the gate had been closed. Thus, we could see our flight but were unable to board. The fact that Swiss Air didn't recognize there were 2 guests late due to a connecting Swiss Air flight and didn't hold the gate open for even just a few minutes was astonishing to us. We spoke with a Swiss Air representative and they told us that there was nothing they could do and that we would need to get in the transfer line to obtain more information. We stood for about 30 minutes in a transfer line in terminal E behind a couple of other folks with the same issue as us. After getting to the front of the line, we were told we would need to go to the transfer line in terminal A for any issues with connecting flights. Again, we waited 30 minutes for absolutely nothing due to poor guidance. We walked the 10 minutes to terminal A and then saw the size of the transfer line. After being in line for about 30 minutes, I started a timer on my phone. At this point there were hundreds of people in line and only a single station was open for economy flights. We were in line for another hour and a half before we were able to talk to someone. It was now about 8:30 PM when they told us they would get us a hotel for the night with free transportation and vouchers for dinner since there were no earlier flights to Boston. I will admit that the hotel was actually nice (once we actually got there). When I looked online, a standard room was booking that evening for about $198. I'm sure it costs Swiss Air a lot less with their bulk discount, but it was still better than most. However, actually getting to the hotel was another process in and of itself. I had originally expected that "transportation to the hotel" would have been a taxi for my wife and I, but it was actually a shuttle service which was another line we needed to wait in. Actually, this line was more of a mob without any organization. The driver arrived and first went to a different hotel. When he returned about 15 minutes later, there were even more people pushing and trying to get to the front of the mob so they didn't need to wait. Again, this shuttle service probably has reviews of their own, but the fact that Swiss Air is utilizing them just continues to reflect poorly on them as well as the process that we needed to go through to get to the hotel. Once we were finally able to get to the airport it was about 10:00 PM. While we were told that the "dinner vouchers" were a $20 voucher for dinner, they were actually for a buffet that was setup at the hotel which we believe was exclusively for the airline due to so many issues. While the dinner was decent, we had expected to actually be able to buy our own dinner (although lets be realistic, 20 CHF per person gets you a salad in Switzerland). All that being said, our entire day was wasted and we didn't even get to enjoy a day in Zurich because of how long the process took.

In the morning, our flight to Boston was 12:55 PM. Everything was mostly seamless from the hotel to the airport. We got checked in with Swiss Air and waited at our gate. I spoke with the gate attendant to try and get our seats upgraded on the 9 hour flight, but they kindly informed me that this flight was "full" and that there were no available upgrades. When we eventually boarded the plane, we at least had USB ports for phone charging, but my wife was amazed at even how old this plane was. She has flown on numerous international flights with Qatar Air, Emirates, AirAsia, and even other local flights to Hawaii, and she was simply confused (maybe based on our experience in Switzerland and how nice the trains are) why they were using such old planes for international flights. According to her, every international flight she has been on has been "really nice". She didn't have the same kind things to say about Swiss Air. Unfortunately I wish I could stop my review here, but there's just one more item worth noting. Our flight didn't leave on time because we were waiting for a late couple to board the plane. This was simply the icing on the cake because Swiss Air couldn't wait 3 minutes for us the day before and yet here we are at 1:04 PM on a flight scheduled to depart at 12:55 and now we're sitting here waiting for a couple? Because of the fact that we needed to wait for the couple, our flight was then delayed further since we needed to get back in the taxi queue at the airport. Just ridiculous.

All that being said, we expected a whole lot more out of Swiss Air. I can safely say that we will never willingly choose to fly with them again. We specifically chose them due to their online reviews, but I feel it necessary to inform the public of how bad our experience was with them to allow others to make educated decisions moving forward. A hotel room for a few hours with a buffet dinner is hardly worth the fact that we lost an entire vacation day the next day. We really would have expected at least a class upgrade on the next flight, but even that wasn't something they were willing to do. I would avoid Swiss Air at all costs for international flights unless you enjoy antiquated planes and have no connecting flights.

title: Stress Free Travel!
review_text:
Brilliant airline!  Extremely courteous and friendly staff, food was the best of any airline by a mile, lots of water on offer throughout the long flight which was much appreciated and great choice of entertainment. Check-in and baggage reclaim was stress free. 

Altogether a brilliant experience.  Would definitely fly with Swiss again!

title: Return Home
review_text: Very comfortable flight back from the New York (JFK) to Florence (Italy) via Zurich. The two planes were very clean, the quality of life onboard was very good.

title: Business class from Geneva to Malaga is a disgrace
review_text:
Swiss used to offer great service in business class and still do IF you travel out of Zurich. One wonders why customers traveling from Geneva do not receive the same standard of service - are they not as important? Is Swiss trying to lose its customer base from Geneva? If so, you are doing a great job; Easyjet will no doubt be happy.
Meal offer is the same as in Economy except that everything is free and customers in business class are offered a hot dish, which is now is served without a tray. 
The cabin staff is friendly and the aircraft itself is very clean, but this is something that should be a given from an airline like Swiss!
It's the lack of that "little bit extra", which is still being provided when flying out of or to Zurich, that I find so appalling. Swiss should provide the same level of service to ALL of its customers, regardless of which airport they are flying to or from!

title: The meal spoiled the experience
review_text: The flight was on time and because it was packed, they took our hand-baggage voluntarily. The seat pitch is very good for economy class (the exact same with its sister-Lufthansa) and the small screens above our heads with all the connections are very helpful (not even LH has got that). Service was good and they had a variety of drinks but the food was awful (check the picture).

title: Easy flight Nice to Zurich
review_text: Good flight from Nice to connect with our flight back to Dulles Airport.  It was almost pre-breakfast for flight time but they treated us to a nice simple breakfast.  Three across in business but they always leave middle seat empty.  Left a bit late; arrived more or less on time.  Good flight.

title: Not th real Swiss one would dream of
review_text: Departed late from Venice, arrived at the time of boarding to the next flight but no shuttle available and had to walk for miles. Few clear indications at Zurich Airport. Airplanes decent, meals not so appealing to an Italian traveler. No comparison with any of the Middle East or Asian airlines...

title: amazing
review_text: it was a real amazing experience. the staff was really helpful. the seat were extremely comfortable. good service and smooth flight.

title: Swiss efficiency despite flight cancellation
review_text: Flight LX968 was cancelled by SMS message as we were on the train from Luzern to the airport. Within 35 minutes (while still on the train) I received another SMS informing me of our rebooking onto a later flight the same day. At the airport I raised the issue of our now long delay at the airport for the next flight and was promptly given a CHF40 voucher which provided us with a basic meal. The overall service was far superior to the shameful lack of effort by Ryanair who had cancelled another of our flights about a week before.

title: WORST AIRLINE EVER!! If you plan on eventually leaving your destination - do NOT use them.
review_text:
PS NO RESPONSE FROM AIR SWISS YET - will gladly update if any response is received 

Upon arrival in Zurich we ran to the gate for our next flight LX288 to Johannesburg only to find that this was delayed by 1 hour. We then waited until 00:00 until boarding commenced. We then boarded the plane settling into our seats. The plane was extremely hot, upon our request for air conditioning we were told that it is broken at this point. At 1:30 we were asked to disembark the plane as the flight had been cancelled. We had to wait for the business class and first class passengers to disembark first and remain in the uncomfortably hot aircraft. Once we got off the plane we were given a plastic / disposal blanket and a toothbrush with no toothpaste and told to find a corner in the airport as they do not have hotels. How is it possible to cancel a flight and expect paying customers to sleep on the floor. We were told the flight would be rescheduled for 9am the next morning. 

We returned to the boarding gate at 8am after minimal sleep on 4 July 2018 to board our plane to Johannesburg. We boarded the plane at the proposed time, however we were delayed by 45 minutes we were not informed why the plane was delayed. After roughly 1 hour and 30 minutes in flight the pilot announced on the PA system that the aircraft air was contaminated and that he had no choice but to return to Z√ºrich. We then returned to Z√ºrich. Before landing he pilot informed us that he had to circle a few times first and engage the landing gear early as to burn off fuel as we are too heavy to land and will have no breaks upon landing if the plane doesn‚Äôt burn off the fuel. Upon landing we were taken to a Hard-stand safety/emergency area where a bus was waiting the plane was surrounded by emergency personal airing out the breaks. This was terrible and traumatic  as we were watching the emergency staff such as fire man and police trying to cool down the planes brakes. Other passengers were shouting and screaming because they were exhausted, angry and frustrated. This was even more traumatic to us! We then got into the bus and returned to the terminal building. We then continued to wait for 3.5 hours to get a new ticket to return home. This is after the second cancelled flight. 3.5 hours waiting in the terminal building with the poorest service I have ever experienced. We were then given a flight get from Zurich to Munich to Johannesburg scheduled for 5 July 2018. Upon arriving at the airport we went to the Swiss air help desk and they informed us that the flight we were added to was overbooked and they could not get us any seats unfortunately. Thus, Swiss Air knowingly booked us on Standby just to keep us quiet. Eventually we were booked on a Qatar flight. Arriving more than two days later than we were supposed to.

title: Economy felt luxurious
review_text: I can count on Swiss to provide service, during the flight you receive little snacks and chocolates, which make the time spent relaxing. However because the airport is small, if you arrive 2 hours early you cannot check in before the flight in front of you. Which means you sit around waiting in line to find this out, to sit around and wait in line again. This aspect of waiting can be improved with information on how to board with luggage. I appreciate their professionalism and thank them for giving children gifts and attempting to keep them occupied. Wish they just had a 'nursery' for families :D

title: Feels like in Disneyland
review_text:
I fly over 150'000 miles a year, 95% on SIngapore Airlines, all over Asia and Australasia, the smallest aircraft is the A350-900 as I remember, flying in this "miky mouse" aircraft, where the legroom is quite good but 2 and 2 seats is for the "grown" mid Europeans rather against human well-being, one less seat would be comfortable

The SWISS Chocolate given for free, holy moly what a sugar bomb, the Swiss (air) and the Swiss Chocolate are going down the hill

The great pat was, the flight was on time and that's why I gave a higher score

title: Very classy and pleasant flight
review_text:
I took a very pleasurable pair of flights to and from Zurich with Swiss. The flight out was on the new Bombardier C300 aircraft and it was excellent. The cabin is a 2+3 configuration and the seats are a lighter design, look great and are comfortable. It is a long aircraft so the capacity is higher than the A319 I flew back on.
Service is great - drinks and snacks are served in economy with a breakfast croissant and afternoon cheese roll and options for drinks (plus extra croissants later in the morning flight). Being Swiss, you also get a complimentary piece of very nice chocolate. The cabin crew were happy and helpful on both legs.

title: Shocking service
review_text: Stood in a queue at the gate for over an hour only to be told the flight was cancelled. We weren't told in any detail what we had to do next. Stood in another queue to re-book a flight for an hour when I received a text message saying I was booked on a new flight that would reach my destination 24 hours later than I initially booked. When I finally reached the desk, I explained that I needed to get to Dublin immediately for my brother's wedding but they didn't care. No passenger was told what was happening. Finally when I accepted the bad news I went to collect my boarding pass and was told my ticket was invalid. No passengers would be receiving meal allowance either, the passengers would have to incur that cost. Don't fly with them and also don't fly with Lufthansa (who constantly change their flight timing and fly greyhounds to China for meat).

title: Great airline for the price
review_text:
I am flying this route frequently and can recommend it without hesitation. He aware however that Swiss is not particularly flexible when it comes to luggage restrictions.On one of my recent flights my suitcase weighed 5kg less than the max allowance, my carry on 2 kg more. Normally a simple redistribution of items would have solved the problem but the check in employee has already tagged and put my suitcase on the conveyor belt.
It took a lot of arguing before I  could take it on board.I understand there is a safety issue and would have gladly complied, but the employee had made that impossible.  In Zurich the gate agent offered to check larger cabin luggage for free.

title: Very good customer service, average comfort.
review_text: Swiss Air always does a nice job. All flights were on time and the boarding process went smoothly. The staff was friendly and helpful. Meals and alcoholic beverages were included in the cost of the flight and the food was good for airplane food. Sadly, however, economy flights on most airlines are getting more and more uncomfortable and I just could not find my groove so I didn't get much sleep.

title: Punctual and safe
review_text: Very punctual, as always! Arrived on destination even few minutes earlier. The crew was friendly and helpful. I would have expected a meal to be served - in a 2+ hour flight - rather than a snack that was actually served. Food is definitely an area of improvement for SWISS. Other than this, everything was great!

title: Comfortable Journey, Excellent in flight food and service...........
review_text: Overall services were satisfactory included food, in-flight entertainment and service of stewardess. Cabin is clean, seats are comfy. I really like their outbound midnight flight from HK. I can always have good rests on the plane. Online check in is very simple and fast. Bags drop experiences are very smooth as well. Swiss Air is my first priority if I fly  to Switzerland.

title: No problems - very good service
review_text: Absolutely nothing to complain about.  Aircraft & crew were excellent, as was the dining & beverage options. Definitely would choose them again.

title: Comfortable flight
review_text: The flight was very comfortable and relaxing the food was good and the crew were very kind and efficient.The flight was puntual, boarding was fast too.

title: Delayed twice
review_text:
Second time in a week and my second time flying with Swiss air!
No announcement 30 minutes and people standing in line. For my first flight, flying from Geneva to Nice it was canceled 1 hour before flight. Had to fly to Z√ºrich and there to Nice, 4 hours delay. I think I will choose another airline next time.

title: Excellent experience
review_text: Everything that you want in your 'economy class' flight. Enough comfort, attentive and friendly staff taking care of you, clean place, direct flight without delays. Everything went smoothly and the passengers were informed of every detail needed.

title: Excellent service, cuisine,  EXCEPT...
review_text: A wonderful post cruise flight home was ruined for my wife and me by hyperactive, noisy children two seats away. For eight solid hours the peace and quiet were disturbed by two preschool age kids who could not be kept quiet. When one pays for a premium business class seat, there is an expectation that the place will be something better than tourist, i.e.quiet and serene, enough to do business or sleep. In other words, kid-free. There should be a policy that kids do not go first class or business. They should travel in a kiddie cabin with other children. When we brought the situation to the attention of the cabin attendants, they essentially said there was nothing they could do. Travelers like us will look for airlines that apply common sense by restricting their premium cabins to adults.

title: Scoundrel, Cold and Arrogant
review_text:
Swiss Flight  for 2 persons in Business, both Star Alliance Frequent travel members of Miles and More for many years, origin in Malaga ‚Äì Zurich ‚Äì Johannesburg ‚Äì Victoria Falls, and return same airline and Star Alliance. One person has to continue his journey to London - Bogota ‚Äì Pereira at arrival in Zurich.
The flight down to VF was excellent and we really enjoy our well organized trip and holidays. The nightmare stared at the return flight:
‚Ä¢	Same conditions and same Alliance StarAlliance. At the airport after check in to Johannesburg, SA 040 following to the Check in employee was on time so we checked our Luggage to be send trough to Malaga.
‚Ä¢	All of the sudden SA040 was shown as Diverted in Transit area, but no more comments
‚Ä¢	No further information for more than 2 hours, no airline employee to speak with no info, Passenger where obliges to get out of the Transit area and find out at the StarAlliance airline what was going on, but with chance you got a smile and a quick response, ‚Äú I am not in control of the Situation, Johannesburg is taking care, so please wait‚Ä¶..‚Äù after 3 hours the information that the flight will arrive at 16.00 h and will depart around 18.00h, our connecting flight to Europe gone.
‚Ä¢	Finally we are allowed to eat something after several trips through customs, security  checks and Airline office
‚Ä¢	At 18.00h the Airline lands, at the same time all passengers are requested to join the gate for an important information, Airline employees announces that the company has send a smaller plain and 48 passengers must stay in the city, the remaining will be sorted out to take the flight to Johannesburg. 
‚Ä¢	We were lucky, as our agency in Spain did arrange for us an option with KLM from Johannesburg to Amsterdam the same night, to continue to Zurich, but as we lost the connections we were oblige to stay overnight in Zurich, one person had to head to Rome ‚Äì to go to Malaga, the other on luckier as he could change his flight to the next day to Pereira via London.
‚Ä¢	Our luggage arrived one with the passenger the other one 7 days later in Malaga.
‚Ä¢	No employee from Swiss, was able to arrange any hotel, nor any cover on first necessary hygiene items nor in Johannesburg, nor in Zurich. 
Claim Case no. 1807-LX-12684 is still open since over 30 days. After several correspondences to Swiss no answer, just a word saying that they passed the claim to their Sub contacted company South African Airlines, member of StarAlliance.
The delay and the consequences, including telephone charges to Spain in order to change tickets, hotels, first hygiene items, one exchange clothes, Euros 1.484,60 not counting the Daily for 2 lost days at 250 Euro for 2 persons 1.000 Euro.  Only the tickets alone in B-Class over 5.900 euro.

The claim is very well based: European Airlines have alliances, agreements within Europa and other the world. If you purchase a ticket with Swiss, Lufthansa MEMBER of STARALLIANCE, is the ORIGIN company in charge for delays, substitutions, claims, etc.
In our CASE no. 1807-LX-12684 Swiss and STARALLIANCE is in charge but still try to avoid the problem passing the matter to their partner company. After many claims no one is moving.
Unfortunate, Scoundrel, Cold and Arrogant

title: No direst flight. Only through hub in Zurich-which means any delay-forget it.
review_text:
Planes all left late. There is not enough time set up between flights to assure you that you will get to your destinations on time. Going through hubs stinks. Saves the airlines money, but affords no direct flights.Would pay more to avoid the hubs.
NO direct flights at all from Venice to Budapest on any airline. Horrible. Bus from the airport is probably better.

title: This refers to customer service in USA
review_text: Tried to make a change this morning to a Swiss Air reservation I have.  Called their US service number: 877-359-7947.  Got the usual recording that my call is very important to them and will be answered......Waited 21 minutes; an agent seemed to come on line but then disconnected.  Dialed again. Waited this time 34 minutes with nothing but recording. Gave up because I have an appointment to go to. So...55 minutes waiting and never talked to anyone.

title: Couldn't have been better
review_text: With a long flight such as this one, you want to be comfortable. Swiss air was everything I needed and more. The staff were so friendly and helpful, on and off the plane and there was a sense of professionalism in every aspect. The plane itself was clean and spacious.  Although there was a slight delay on the flight, they did everything they could and more to help and thus nobody was annoyed or uptight about the delay.  An excellent airline, couldn't ask for better!

title: World‚Äôs worst airline! DO NOT USE!
review_text:
Words cannot express how angry I am with this pathetic excuse of an airline. Essentially, they are thieves.

We had a roundtrip flight from Zurich to Athens in which we were unable to make the first connection due to bad weather in the states. Swiss air cancelled our whole roundtrip flight and we were essentially stranded in a foreign country. We could have made the second connection as it was days later, but they took our money and refused to work with us in regards to giving us back at least the flight back to Zurich from Athens. We spoke to 3 different supervisors in which one shrugged her shoulders and said, ‚Äúyou can file a claim online, but it won‚Äôt do you any good.‚Äù When asked for their corporate address and phone number for us to contact them, she said that they didn‚Äôt have a corporate office. Really??? You have got to be kidding me. No corporate office for a airline? What a joke. By the way their corporate office is listed (with the phone number) on trip advisor. I just hope my misfortune can help someone else.

title: Family Trip
review_text: Swiss Air is extremely professional, attention oriented with frequent snacks, meals, and beverage service. The airbus was new and clean. I will definitely fly this airline again.

title: Swiss Air, below average
review_text:
Swiss Air was late, twice!  Never "apologized" it seemed they were trying to pretend it was not happening even though the delay was 1/2hr, then an hour on another flight. No attempt to help you make your connection was made.
On the transAtlantic flight, there is a bar in between the legs of every other passenger. This means one of your legs is sharing a space with a stranger's leg. I have never flown on such a plane (and I hope I never will). At the very minimum, I would like to count on my own leg-room.
Service and food was mediocre, service-item pick-up sluggish.

title: Cramped, unfriendly, and could not wait for the flight to be over
review_text:
Very disappointed in the quality of service and comfort of my recent fight on Swiss Air. Not only did the person in front of me practically sit in my lap the entire time, the flight attendant spilled coffee all over me, only acknowledgement, was a sorry.  
It is very likely I will never choose to fly this airline again.

title: Love Swiss Airlines!
review_text: I love Swiss Airlines. My wife and I were scheduled on SAS and our flight from Stockholm was cancelled. They booked us on Swiss. I flew Swiss round-trip to Europe last summer and was thrilled. The service is great. We got lunch and dinner. Both were very good. They came around with coffee and water several times and also served ice cream as a snack. They also came around with chocolate a couple times. How can you not love an airline that gives you chocolate? We were in economy and the seats were comfortable and the entertainment offerings were good. They also include alcohol. Like I said - I love Swiss!

title: good flight from GENEVA airport to London
review_text: Flight was good. Service on the aircraft was excellent. The seats were small and leg room was cramped.

title: Great Airline - Clean efficient and great service
review_text:
Swiss airlines as you would expect with anything Swiss, are a great airline with a very high standard of customer service and care.
At the airport the check in was smooth and the bags were also delivered promptly in Zurich.
The planes are very clean and new with comfortable seats and a good variety of inflight entertainment.
The food on board is pretty good by airline standards too.
I would certainly fly with Swiss airlines again and would recommend them.

title: Most Incompetent Airline By Far
review_text: On a recent flight from Phoenix to Amsterdam my suitcase got left behind in San Francisco. That was four days ago. Due to severe storms in Amsterdam on Thursday my connecting flight got cancelled and I had to spend the night in Z√ºrich. When I went to retrieve my luggage I noticed that my suitcase was missing. I handed my claim tag to a Swissport agent and asked her to locate it for me. Her response was she couldn't do that, because Z√ºrich wasn't my final destination. She could only tell me that my luggage had not arrived in Z√ºrich. Since SWISS did not have a flight available for me to get to Amsterdam on Friday either, I was rerouted to Brussels where I finally filed a claim. This company is aware that I am leaving Amsterdam by train tomorrow morning. I have no faith they will manage to deliver it to me in Germany either. The customer service/support or lack thereof has been unacceptable. Forget trying to call them. So far I have only received a response when I posted on their FB page. Now I am allowed to purchase some necessities at my expense, submit the receipts, and they may reimburse me. Did you know the reimbursement amount for a passenger traveling in the economy class is at $100 versus $500 for first class? SWISS International Airline is part of a network of 28 airlines. Why is it not possible to see to it that my suitcase gets delivered to me as quickly as possible regardless of the Star Alliance airline used? Shouldn't that be a priority? I am absolutely livid and will never fly with them again.

title: Convenient and punctual flight to Singapore
review_text:
For direct flights to Singapore from Zurich, you have 2 airlines to choose from. Our choice is SWIISS on a 777. We have flown twice by Swiss and we had good flights both times. The ground and cabin staff were always helpful and friendly. They recognised a family of 5 traveling 12 hours is never that easy!
Departing late evening allows for a full days work or a less stressful time to prepare the journey.
Good food and entertainment is provided. Flights are normally on time like a good Swiss watch!

title: Leave you stranded!
review_text: I am generally very satisfied with Swiss until my last flight. Due to a system error they have cancelled my return flight on a Friday evening. Even though they acknowledged it was their fault, they made me buy a new ticket at over 400 CHF one way on standby and then lost my suitcase. Yes they reimbursed the max of 1500 USD but that does not even come close to the value of the suitcase and its contents (RIMOWA metal suitcase of about 1000USD, designer suits and shoes etc). No formal apologies for the flight cancellation or compensation.

title: Swiss Quality - Left Swiss International Airlines
review_text:
First)  14min to change a reservation (lack of staff service)
2nd)   another 7min on the phone for nothing at all, (lack of staff training)

3rd)  no one's advised me   Swiss New Business Class Service
        you don't get a different menu - but you choose from Economy Class Menu.
        without having to open your wallet. 

4th)  At arrival you get an airport bus for Business Class passengers
        but your bags, labeled Priority, arrives with all others bags or even later.

NO WHAT YOU EXPECT FROM SWISS AIR LINES

title: No proper AC in economy
review_text: This was a older jet and it was sold out and very warm the entire flight.   I realize airlines make it a bit warmer so customers sleep (my guess) but this flight was warm the entire time.  It was so hot I took my shoes and socks off as I was boiling.   The only time the AC went up was when the lights came on 1.5 hours prior to landing.

title: Escape from Moscow
review_text: We were so happy to leave Moscow.   We had aisle seats for this sold out flight and they were fine.  Only probably was we had to waste 20 minutes circling Zurich until we could get in the landing pattern.   You would think a daily flight would have a smaller window for delays.

title: Either tghe lack of staff training of rules or the need to make some extra cash?
review_text: I flew from Nice to Luxembourg with no hitch. Used my hand luggage bag I fly every airline with with no hitch and they told me it was absolutely perfect to fly with. Now suddenly on my return flight my baggage is too big and I need to pay to check it in? Why would they let me leave my home country with it but have an excuse when I have no choice but to pay for it or leave it behind. It seems like a money making scheme to me. I fly all the time and will make sure I never use this airline again. Hope the baggage discrepencies between countries and the 40‚Ç¨ extra you made is worth your loss of clientelle? Well done Swiss air

title: Everything is decided for you
review_text: Whilst I am sure the food provided in the Business Lounge is very healthy and well cooked by the chef, the range of food was very limited.  The airline has obviously decided that it will provide healthy food, but essentially it has limited he choice to pasta cooked by the chef, take it or leave it.  The lounge is best described as clinical, and as expected, everything works, but it lacked any feeling of comfort.   Zurich airport has an advantage as it is very convenient for the city and the cost of the train into the Hauptbahnhof is very reasonable at about Euro 3.60.  The journey only takes about 10minutes.  The flight was excellent and the crew could not do enough to help.  Also the food was well chosen.  Overall an excellent package, but a softer less clinical approach in the business lounge would, in my opinion, have made the experience better.

title: 4 Long haul flights - all as bad as each other
review_text:
Recently had 4 flights with Swiss from India to the US and back.

The flights were all horrid.

Firstly, the IFE had not been calibrated on 2/4 of the flights so choosing anything became impossible.

The IFE screen would turn on automatically after 30 minutes or so, considering this was a night flight it meant the planes were constantly lit up.

When starting the flight they decide to play a 30 minute video about the airline and Zurich airport - this has bright white screens after every few minutes, again lighting up the whole cabin. It is also impossible to skip this, so you're unable to choose something to watch.

Food is mediocre - but didn't expect much else.

They served alcohol non-stop to people who quite clearly didn't need serving any further meaning my 2 legs from the US > India were full of noisy out of hand guests.

The attendant tried to get me to move from my aisle seat to a window even after I told him I was claustrophobic and hence had booked this exact seat.

The worst thing, they have removed 4 toilets from the back of Economy, which means you have hundreds of people sharing 4 toilets, on a long haul flight. It is disgusting.

Honestly there was loads of other stuff I should have done 4 individual 1* reviews.

Will never travel swiss again, hopefully.

title: Solid service.
review_text: The service is solid. The airline crew was friendly and welcoming to do their best. However, you can feel the airline is looking for cost savings. E.g., the quantity of the food is limited. It would cost not much to go around and ask if someone would like to take another piece of bread after the meals are served.

title: Compensation for delayed luggage
review_text:
I would like to know and have confirmation from the Airlines
What compensation does a passenger receive for non-delivery of baggage
IATA general rules? or every airline has their own?
In this case, with Swiss - I arrived in Tel Aviv on July 3rd departing from ZH
At arrival - NO luggage. No track!
No real information given by local handlers.
Not even received a tootbrush‚Ä¶...
Spent 3 days in Tel Aviv at Meetings with no clothes.
Went shopping for some change of clothes, finally.
My luggage was finally delivered to my home in Geneva , once I returned, July 5th
After claiming the small expenses incurred, Swiss would only repay 50% of my small purchases!
Is this common? and general rules
After numerous e-mails & discussions - SWISS finally confirmed compensation of total purchase.
PLEASE let the public know - the real rules

title: Nothing left of the "old glory"...
review_text:
Nothing left of the "old glory". Once, Swiss was one of the best airlines, but now no longer. The plane that we flew was Airbus 330-300. He was not in a very good condition (first of all, I'm referring to the comfort of the passengers). Some seats could not be adjusted, tilted or even worse sitting part of the seat, which literally slid under you. The video touch screen was imprecise, it took a lot of time and nerves to choose what you want from the video menu. The food was more than ordinary, the choice of drinks is common. The only service remained at a high level, is a flying staff !!! They were precise, quick and very helpful. For them the highest marks!!!!!
Everything else was at the level of a lot cheaper airline  !!!

title: Zurich to Delhi Business class
review_text:
Connecting from London at Zurich for Delhi.  

The trip Zurich to Delhi by itself was uneventful,  but Zurich as a transit airport I will surely avoid.  The Airport has very little for transit passengers,  and no signs to guide them clearly - the sign only showed arrows to the gates or passport control.  This was even more complicated as we had no clue about our gate on the boarding pass and nor on the display board.

We could only know about the gate at the lounge.

Food was OK on board as we had opted for Vegetarian meal, thank fully we had talso taken some snacks.

Movies - hindi options were good even though the titles were not hits.

title: Great Check in,  Smooth Web Site to get all done
review_text:
Early Morning flight - please make sure you have sufficient time to check in as the counters only open at 4:00 am for all the star alliance flights.

As I was at the terminal a day before - I collected by boarding pass and on the travel day could go direct to the counter to hand over the luggage.

The counter staff was extremely helpful on both the days. 

Thank You to Swiss team for their support.

We could take any of the snacks they offered as they had nothing for vegetarians  even though we requested for a fruit platter.

title: Smooth, comfortable Flight
review_text: Excellent smooth overnight flight from Chicago to Zurich.  Plenty of room on the flight--I had a window seat and the middle seat was open. Flight attendants were extremely nice & courteous.  I'd fly Swiss Air again!!

title: Much better than many others companies...
review_text: Safe good meal in time nice people and so on ...Even during the bad weather the flight  got very little time late.Thank  you very much Swiss Air!

title: No holes in this Swiss Flight
review_text: It started well with us being bumped into first class and then it never abated. My coat was hung up to start with, the service was excellent, the food was not food but cuisine, the wine from actor Depardieu's Ch√¢teau de Tign√©, was much appreciated and all in all I cared not for the flight to end. Will fly Swiss again for sure.

title: Great Buisness Class
review_text: Flying to Stockholm via Zurich. Wonderful service on the ground and inflight. Staff very attentive and really ensuring you were well looked after.

title: Appalling
review_text:
I went to Zermatt for a week with my 2 children.  On Thursday evening I received a text advising that our flight home the next afternoon had been cancelled.  I rang their call centre immediately & was rebooked on to a flight leaving 2.5 hours than my original flight.

Under Swiss‚Äôs published policy all 3 of us qualify for compensation as the rebooked flight left more than one hour before or original flight would have.  In addition, we were now going via Frankfurt and not direct. 

I completed the online claim form that Thursday evening and since then....silence.

I called a week later and was asked to wait until 10 days had passed.  Who takes 10 days to reply to a claim that meets your criteria??

I had still heard nothing after 10 days and so rang the number provided online.  The call handler today told me that the call centre cannot advise on compensation claims & that email is the only method.  I asked her to confirm the email I needed, she actually said that she did not know what it was & could only refer me back to the website.  It was like talking to a brick wall.

I have flown Swiss for over 25 years, 3 times in the last year.  Am I likely to fly them again?  The jury is very much out.  

Our indirect flight home involved an overbooked / delayed flight to Frankfurt involving a go-around, then a delayed flight from Frankfurt to Birmingham due to weather.  Completely understand that Swiss cannot be held responsible for the weather but poor customer service has been a surprise.

title: No clothes in Europe
review_text: Nothing is worse than going on a 10 day European cruise with no clothes. Yes, that is correct. Both my husband and I lost our luggage for our dream cruise by Swiss Air and we still do not have them returned. What is worse is that my husband's diabetes meds were packed in his suitcase. Swiss promised our concierge every day that they would be delivered to the next port, and then, the next port. Well, we still don't have them and we lost many thousands of dollars in cruise wear and also, lost many ports filing out paper work and trying to get clothes for us to wear during our trip. Swiss Air ruined our vacation and caused us incredible amount of stress and $$$$$$$.

title: Flight to Geneva, great new plane
review_text:
Great flight from London to Geneva on Swiss, flying their new CS-100 plane. The cabin was very spacious, clean and modern looking. Takeoff and landing very quiet, much better than Boeing or Airbus in that respect.

Cabin crew efficient and being a full service airline, drink and snacks were provided as well as a very tasty Swiss chocolate.

title: flight from Miami to Vienna
review_text: We flew business class from Miami to Vienna, the service and food was great and the seats are comfortable.Flight was on time.Lounge in Miami and Zurich was well equipped.

title: Excellent airline
review_text: Excellent service, comfortable seats, variety of food/drinks/snacks and warm fresh rye bread offered with main meal turned a long flight into a positive experience

title: Swiss Air Business Class - good but not great
review_text:
I booked a last minute rewards Business Class ticket through United to see family in Johannesburg. 
Check in at Newark was ok. If not a little rude. They failed to tell me I could use an expedited line for TSA. I eventually asked after seeing how long the line for security was! (Hint - if you don‚Äôt have priority - allow a lot of time for TSA)
The lounge was under construction and was small and crowded. The drink and food selection was decent but not extraordinary. Boarding, however was quite smooth. 

This was my first flight with Swiss and I was actually quite excited to try it‚Äôs Business class product on an A330. The seat itself is nice. I had a single seat on the side with direct aisle access. Similar to what I‚Äôve flown on Delta One, Asiana, Alitalia and ANA. A good product! 

The FA‚Äôs were polite and the service was good. The meal was decent and after watching a movie I reclined the chair into bed mode and grabbed a few hours sleep. At 6‚Äô2‚Äù sleeping on planes - even in Business Class is not always a guarantee! So I was happy to get some good rest on this plane. 
I woke to have breakfast and before I knew it, we had landed in Zurich. Deplaning was a breeze. 
This is where Swiss is really good. Zurich airport is awesome. Clean, modern, greatly styled and super easy to navigate. The new Swiss flagship lounge is so cool. Plenty of places to sit, dine and stretch out. I didn‚Äôt use the showers as I was going into Zurich for the day to a hotel - I had a 12 hour layover. 
Passport control and customs were efficient and I grabbed a cab and headed to Zurich for the day. Which was an awesome way to spend a 12 hour layover. 
The second leg of my journey to Johannesburg went equally smooth. I left though a different terminal. This lounge was not as nice - but still good. Boarding was easy. 
Once again the FA‚Äôs on this flight were really good. This time I was in an older A340 - which is a plane I quite like. But with the same retrofitted hard product. Another decent meal, followed by a good night‚Äôs sleep and I was in Johannesburg! 
I would absolutely recommend Swiss Business Class. Solid product, great service, awesome lounge and getting to experience Zurich Airport is the cherry on top.

title: Swiss all the way to the alps
review_text: Few on Swiss for business from lcy to gva in May 2018 they never fail to deliver a great service . I wish other airlines were this good and value for money

title: Very good crew
review_text: The crew are awesome, they have good space between seats, I will use this company in future for sure.

title: Friendly folks
review_text: They were great with our infant son and gave us a little travel pack for him.  This in spite of there being some glitch with adding his name to the itinerary (we arrived at the gate about 25 minutes before departure, due to a late connection, and the gate agents bent over backwards to make sure we all got on).

title: My favorite airline.
review_text:
Always on time, great survice. Real food on intercontinental flights.
Used them 3 times in the last 3 years.

title: Both outgoing flights delayed once onboard
review_text: Flew to Zurich then onto Sarajevo with swiss air , both flight were delayed but only after we had boarded. Not great. Staff were usual flight attendant standard, no complaints , optional donut was like paper not that I eat paper . no frills flights but no complaints

title: Swiss as usual great
review_text:
The only Europe flight that offers lie flat on short haul flights. Food very good, service was below average,  very rude flight attendants. 
IFE very good, great new movies. Lounge in Zurich E terminal wonderful,  great selection .

title: Deteriorating experience despite higher prices
review_text:
I fly Swiss quite frequently (business and economy) because I am based in Zurich and the airline often simply offers the most convenient option to get nonstop from A to B.

However, I‚Äôm increasingly disappointed with the experience. 

Many of the airplanes need a cabin overhaul and on a few flights this year the decade-old entertainment system kept crashing.

Annoyingly, Swiss is increasingly copying pricing models of low-cost airlines despite being a normal, market-rate carrier. For example: on a recent trip Zurich to Boston I had to pay USD 35 (one way) to reserve a seat and USD 75 (one way) for a single 23kg check-in suitcase. I was travelling with my wife and 2 small kids. Our tickets already cost USD 1,400 each (round trip) and Swiss wanted to charge another USD 200 per person for us to sit together as a family and take check-in baggage on an intercontinental flight? Ridiculous!

The miles program has almost become useless and I recently cancelled my Miles and More credit card, as other programs just offer more value.

The food is still ok and the service tends to be good, with staff generally being well-trained. The business lounges in Zurich are excellent

All in all, it does feel like Swiss is increasingly milking its customers and that it is abandoning its status as a premium carrier. That may be a dangerous strategy and it also annoys me to see that a company priding itself with its ‚ÄúSwissness‚Äù is increasingly failing to provide the level of quality one would expect from a company carrying ‚ÄúSwiss‚Äù in its name.

title: Reliable connections and cholate taste travel
review_text:
I flew Swiss both on short and long haul flights. They have very good connections - one hour time to take corresponding flight - sometime seams to short - but newer was lost.
Very good professional service, almost like with Lufthansa, but they serve swiss chocolate on each flight so the have taste of swiss chocolate.

title: Terrible Customer Service
review_text:
Swiss managed to misdirect my suitcase on the very short hop from Z√ºrich to Bordeaux!
It turned up after two days in London and took another 3 days to finally arrive in Bordeaux (after a total of 5 days) just in time to pick it up at the airport before our delayed! flight home.
The customer experience was terrible! Didn't receive a copy of the report (with the contact details!). Calls to the local representative of Swiss were not answered or very difficult due to language problems, promised return calls were never made (neither to me nor the hotel, which tried there best to help me, but also failed). 
The international Swiss help desk is certainly not able to help you out. They just hide behind the excuse that this service is outsourced. They are not even able to give a contact where to get more information.

title: Family vacation to Roma
review_text: Very nice airline with great staff, from the pilot to the flight attendants.  Food is good for airline food service in the economy section.  The movie and entertainment selections are good and will keep you entertained if you can‚Äôt sleep on a plane flight.  The biggest complaint, which I  sure all complain about are that the seating has gotten smaller and smaller, making it almost impossible to be comfortable on a long flight.  Got to love the airlines, they squeeze more and more into a plane and wonder why they have more disgruntled passengers.  How about a little more comfort for the people who can‚Äôt afford the first class seats.  Overall a good flight, just tired of flying like a sardine.

title: Swiss Budget Airline
review_text:
Every country now  has their airline and their budget airline.
Swiss quality tends to be generally good and seems to be true with this airline.
Comfortable  and less restrictive than other budget carriers.

title: flying on a reputation is always risky
review_text:
First of all, my comment is not to the team, nor to the quality of the Aircraft. Both were excellent. The new Bombardier C Serie is just amaizing, more room, better sitting quality than all of its competitors. Particularly the Airbus which is now aging.
My comment is about the commercial pratice of SWISS. I bought my ticket at the price offered with absolutely now option regarding the F&B during the flight. Therefore, it was more than a surprise for me when the crew member told me I wasn't entiteld to a vulgar sandwich because of my airfare!!!!! The cost of such a basic food cannot exceed 1‚Ç¨! so why on earth such a discriminative policy making the passenger unconfortable. When you are in a competitive market, your best best to win is to be better not by being cheap! Flying with the Swiss Cros on your tail means you have some obligation towards the country it represent. Even if the principal shareholder is german!!!! I'm very desapointed as I like flying with SWISS, for the quality of its crews and Aircarfts. I sincerly hope this note will contribute to change this ridiculus commercial policy!PS: congratulations to both commandants who both give us terrific lendings, smooth with great breakings. TOP

title: Swiss Air First Class
review_text:
I have flown Egypt Air, Delta, KLM, Lufthansa and now Swiss Air. Of them all, Swiss Air was the very best. The service is extremely polite and the meals superior to other airlines I have flown. The aisles kept clean, the bathrooms spotless.

Sadly, I make an effort not to fly with any USA carrier which offers frequently rude hostesses and rude general treatment, loud passengers, sometimes unpleasant calamities which are poorly resolved, if at all. Now it seems young girls are unsafe to fly these USA carriers. But that is a separate commentary.

title: Dreadful Customer Service
review_text: I made a booking via the website last Monday. I subsequently read something on the website, which made me wonder whether I'd booked my luggage allowance incorrectly (I'd booked an additional item of hold luggage for my snowboard but subsequently read that the max length of the additional luggage wasn't sufficient). I tried 2 different ways to contact Swiss Air (same day as making the booking) to discuss, but couldn't make contact with anyone. When I finally got a response via Facebook (of all places), they advised me to book an additional item of luggage, on top of the 2 items I'd already booked. Now, 6 days later, they're telling me I actually only needed to book 1 item in the first place and the cherry on the cake, is that they're going to keep the ¬£100+ that I've paid in error. As I understand it, I could have cancelled the entire booking without penalty, if I had been able to get through to them within 24 hours of booking and establish these facts, but I was unable to do so because the only person I could reach in the UK contact centre couldn't speak English and no one replied to the message I sent via the contact form on your website (and still haven't). Terrible airline to deal with and I will be taking them to court, as a matter of principle.

title: Multi flights
review_text: Manila to Hong Kong to Zurich, no real problem although the Business Class is not anywhere near as good as other airlines. Transfer in Zurich for Birmingham was easy but the aircraft was poor, old and dirty, definitely not business class in any way. At least my bag popped up early on the arrivals carousel, always a worry on flights with transfers.

title: Poor Poor Poor Horrible customer service
review_text: We traveled from Newark to Florence and had to change planes in Zurich. They lost our bags and it took a full 2 days for the bags to be found. We were traveling with young children and not having any baggage was a disaster. The worst part about it was the airline never bothered to return any phone calls, emails or filed complaints. There was never an apology or offer for compensation. The worst customer service of any airline and we fly international often. Shameful customer service.

title: The only way to fly
review_text:
Classy, attentive service. Excellent food served as in a top restaurant. 
Wonderful, comfortable seats. 
Fantastic  departure lounge and chauffeur driven service to the departure gates. 
That is why I have reached senator executive level membership with Swiss. Few airlines can equal it for overall quality.

title: Pleasant clean flying experience
review_text:
Pros: easy online check in & notifications, good communication between pilot and passengers, excellent passenger safety video, A 320 Airbus, good ice cream snack pus small chocolate bar, drinks. Friendly staff.
Part of Star Alliance.
Cons: nil

title: Should have flown from Birmingham
review_text: We were supposed to fly from Birmingham but at the last minute it was changed to London....strange as we met  people at our hotel who flew from Birmingham on the flight we were booked on with plenty of spare seats. Heathrow is the pits.

title: Flying Swiss Airlines ....... a very good expetinace
review_text: It is my first time flying Swiss Air..... trip was on time as the Swiss timing ; crew staff were so friendly and highly professional ; hospitality was average for the flight; plane chairs were average .... I would recommend üåπ

title: I wish to travel againüòÄüëç
review_text: i had a flight from Prague to Geneva.I heared about this company a lot so decided to enjoy the service.flight was very comfortable.ofcouse it was expensive compare to other flights but there was free water & ball ‚öΩÔ∏èshaped chocolatesüç´ üòÄüëçfor the all the passengers. route was very beautiful & panormatic to capture the Alps.i was nice experience with baggage & check-in no difficulties.staff was friendly & guiding for all. good experience.üòòüòÄüëç

title: Nothing Special
review_text: Typical airline with typical airline service. If you‚Äôre in the economy section you are not getting anything but basic.

title: Bad website design (in this day and age) and arrogant cust serv
review_text:
How can airlines have such bad website design these days? Nothing is intuitive and you must hunt for the right button to click. Little things which collectively irritate...
