Drop-down menus should recognise where you are (the URL is /gb!) rather than default to CH. Why can't the cursor move on to the next box on its own once filled in, like with some bank log-ins. No one in web-team has really done a 'customer journey' walk-through of the process. Same with Lufthansa site mind you - lamentably luddite, both of them
As for Swiss customer service ... well.... you need to experience it yourself... a deep-seated yet unmerited sense of self-respect.

title: Swiss Air cancelled my boyfriend's ticket
review_text:
Good Day

I was unable to access the Feedback page and kept being redirected thus am writing on this forum.

I have just completed a round trip from Singapore to Warsaw and back, and have some Feedback regarding the trip.

In-flight services was up to standard for both trips. The crew was extremely friendly, helpful and courteous. There was a wide selection of food served, and beverages were given out frequently. On the flight back, there was a passenger with an infant and the crew paid utmost attention to both Mother and infant, ensuring all their needs. 
Overall I am satisfied with my flight experience with Swiss.

However, this was not the case for my boyfriend. We had booked tickets for this trip together but due to unforeseen circumstances, he was unable to take the flight from Singapore to Warsaw and instead, booked a separate flight at a later time. Due to the airline's 'No-show Policy', his return flight from Warsaw to Singapore was cancelled.

I understand that this was stated in the terms and conditions and admit that we did not read them thoroughly before making the booking. We were not aware of this cancellation up until the night before our flight. 

I am disappointed with the Singapore customer service that we received when we phoned them to do a check. Staff on the line was not the most courteous nor helpful which did not help our situation. I do hope that in the future, your staff would be able to empathise with passengers and deliver politeness even if it is the fault of the passenger. In addition, for return flights, I would suggest informing passengers that their entire itinerary has been cancelled so that it does not cause confusion nor panic.
Last but not the least, I implore you to review the 'no-show policy', as it is not the nicest to take off with passengers money and deny them a flight.

Have a good day

title: Sometimes things go wrong; Recovery is everything
review_text:
On Aug 1 we had tickets to fly from Zurich to Budapest on Swiss Air. As we were checking in our luggage, we were told that our flight had been cancelled and we had to go to the special assistance counter to find a solution. 

While waiting in that line we received an email that we had been rebooked from Z√ºrich to Nuremberg to Frankfurt to Budapest. It would‚Äôve taken all day, and we would‚Äôve arrived late in the evening. Luckily, the gentleman at the service counter was able to book us from Z√ºrich to Vienna to Budapest. We still arrived nearly six hours later than our original flight but at least we made it in time to still enjoy dinner. 

The flight itself was impressive, compared to our American airliners. Despite being on a short flight, and in coach, we received two rounds of drink service and a sandwich as well. 

Despite arriving much later than anticipated, I would still give them 4 stars. The only reason I wouldn‚Äôt give 5 is because the seats were incredibly small and tight, and therefore not very comfortable. Granted we were in the last row because it was the last two seats available, but it was quite uncomfortable nonetheless.

title: Good flight
review_text:
First time travelling with this airline. Check in was a little time consuming but airport was fairly busy. 

Once at gate, boarding was prompt as was take off.
Seats were comfortable with the usual space between seats ie if you are tall as we all are , your knees touch the seat in front of you.

Staff polite and helpful and smiled lots which is always nice.

Free movenpick ice cream was the snack provided , as were cold drinks and tea / coffee. 

Flight smooth and bags waiting at carousel by the time we disembarked.

Would definitely fly with this airline again

title: Singapore - Zurich - Athens
review_text:
We flew Swiss to Athens from Singapore via Zurich. The aircraft used Singapore to Zurich was a Boeing 777 for a flight that lasted nearly 12 hours. The crew seemed a little aloof and going through the motions however once we took off their professionalism and hospitality came to the fore. Supper was delicious and served promptly, as departure from Singapore was 2330 local. The seat is impressive with ample amounts of storage and is very long, however it is a little narrow, which made getting to sleep a little awkward - having said that I did sleep undisturbed for nearly 8 hours. Breakfast was served prior to landing in Zurich and it was a wide selection of cold options - fruit, muesli, cold cuts and cheeses as well as warmed bakery items and hot omelet. 

The lounge in Zurich Terminal A / B for intra Shengen flights was rather congested - it should be bigger for the volume of customers it is serving. The Silence Area in the top section of the lounge was a great idea, however due to congestion it acts as overflow and promptly becomes the 'Non-Silence' section. Also important to note is that there are only 1 set of toilets in the lounge which are in high demand. Overall it is stylish lounge with a decent offering of food and beverages; I just wished it was bigger 

Zurich to Athens was operated by an Airbus A320 and the 2hour 30 flight to Athens was attended by bright cheerful crew who were made a final leg of our journey to Europe wonderful. A light breakfast was served with scrambled eggs, fruit and yoghurt.

title: Flug mit Swiss nach Dubai
review_text: Flying very often to Dubai and Abu Dhabi I have the opportunity to see differences between 3 airlines. Best one for me is certainly Emirates as well as I preferred the former aircrat types. Swiss aircrafts are in a way old fashioned. The technical and electronic equipment for customers in business class are not at the newest standard and especially the seat regulation should be improved or replaced. Service was very nice as usual. Food rather poor in comparison to Emirates and Ethiad. Overall it was a nice flight. Not really to complain about anything.

title: very good crew on board
review_text: The flight was wonderful and the crew was great. leaving fron the Swis terminal  at Newark on TSA pre check not good. the screens on the plane had a funny wayof working no good.

title: Very efficient
review_text: A very nice experience. Staff was relatively large and was working with a professional attitude. The snack we were offered was ice cream. Left CPH almost on time

title: Good as always
review_text: Always good and always professional and on time. The chocolates handed out is the highlight on each trip.

title: Lost our luggage and zero communication
review_text: We had 4 Business Class tickets and thought they might look after us a little better, given we spent a small fortune on the tickets. Swiss Air lost our luggage, which happens. They said they'd deliver it the next day, but then they just vanished. I tried to call them dozens of times, emailed them multiple times and got NOTHING. No one will answer the phone, they replied to my message 3 days later to ask if my bag had showed up yet! If you fly with these guys, buy a lot of insurance for lost/delayed luggage, and don't expect any customer service. The silence is quite amazing - they couldn't care less about helping you find your bags.

title: Swiss precision, quality, fairness-gi'me a break.
review_text: On the way from Tel Aviv to Zurich with LX253 on July 18th we had a 50 mins delay and arrived quite late in the evening. Had to cancel programs. Online check-in gently suggested by the airline didn't work as it should, 23 hours prior to departure but much later. The same story with the return flight. Online check-in  didn't work at all. Didn't get a seat even at the  check in counter but at the gate. Delay: 50 mins. Instead  of the regular A330, a smaller and tighter A321 waited us at the gate in Zurich on July 31st.    Matter-of-factish, families with small  kids  wanted to stay together. There were some misunderstandings between passengers. Captain and service chief came to resolve it since the aircraft had to take off in 5 minutes otherwise the flighht would have been  cancelled. I assume because of the delay. Landed late in Tel Aviv and had to sit and wait in the plane due again  to some timetable snag. The worse is to come. Waited one whole  hour for the luggage. More than 50 frustrated passengers were hit by the fact that Swiss didn't load all luggage into the smaller aircraft. The airline didn't advise the public about it. However, have seen crew picking up non-challantly their stuff.  After a full hour of standing on your feet, together with families with small children, the whole pack rushes then  to "Lost and found" where a large queue was greeting the already exhausted passengers. At 82 and endowed with aching legs, I didn't fill out any mandatory  forms and just  rushed home to send the necessary info by fax or email. Wonder whether it will work. The luggage supposed to arrive in the wee hours of the morning was expected for the evening hours. I regard the lack of transparency and the fact that the passengers were not advised that not all luggage was loaded as an unfair act on behalf of Swiss. It caused big frustration among all passengers especially to families with kids and seniors like myself. I fly Swiss quite often and basically it is a fair airline. I find this series of mishaps as a sign of alarm for both prospective passengers and Swiss management.

title: Worst service ever! Luggage lost!
review_text:
We travelled from Seattle to Heathrow via British Airways. No problems at all. We retrieved our luggage no problems. We went to Swiss Airlines got our baggage tags for our luggage. Lined up to check our bags. Told we could not pay for our luggage there but had to go to the ticket counter to pay. We waited almost 2 hours to pay. We checked with baggage again and were told we had to wait. Eventually we were told we didn‚Äôt have to wait in the regular ticket line. We were getting concerned we would miss our flight. As we checked our bags the Agent said there was trouble with the belt. She assured our luggage would meet us in Athens. We took SWISS Airline from Heathrow to Z√ºrich then from Zurich to Athens. 
When we arrived  in Athens we waited till everyone had gone and no luggage. We reported our luggage lost with others in the airport. This took several hours. We filled out the paperwork. 
Finally at 4 in the morning we left for our hotel. 
They had told us they will call when the luggage was found. It‚Äôs been 5 days and we have had to contact them every day.
Apparently our luggage MAY have been found but we still have not received it. The tracking website shows different airports where our luggage is. This has basically ruined the first part of trip. We have spent so much time on the phone as well as shopping for clothes/bathing suits. On the website it states they will reimburse $100 per person. 
It‚Äôs ridiculous to think we should be without anything for at least 5 days. The service has been dismal.

title: As it should be
review_text: Good legroom and good service for this short flight. However seat comfort was not good. Even if the flight was short, it felt like you have flown for hours. I think it was that  built in cushion at the front of the seat that made this.

title: Poor communication from Swiss Air
review_text: Our family of 4 travelled to Switzerland for a one week holiday. Our bags were left at Birmingham airport. Swiss air told us they would be on the next flight and delivered the next days. We waited 3 days! The worst was the lack of communication. We tried and tried to contact them and actually speak to a person but all we got was an automated response telling us they were too busy to answer phone calls. And I thought the customer always came first!

title: One of the worst
review_text:
Being frequent international travelers, this was a very nasty surprise. We flew form Marseilles to Zurich of which the first leg was great on Lufthansa up to Frankfurt. Then there was a 1.5 hour delay, with NO announcements at Frankfurt airport right at the gate. Then the flight was further delayed and we sat in the aircraft for 30 minutes in what looked like an 80's aircraft. Already our plans for the day were ruined. There was no tea or coffee (NO HOT DRINKS SERVED!!).  The icing on the cake was: then one of our bags were lost. So we spent another 1 hour waiting for it then reporting it (another family from the US had a similar but worse fate with two of their bags not arriving). So my 10 year old son had to wear MY CLOTHES in order to be able to go to the snow mountains as his bag had not arrived and he had no clothing to wear!!! Swiss air delivered the bag after 24 hours, and DID NOT compensate us for this trouble! They should be ashamed and revamp at least their customer service if not their airline service.
I hope other travelers do not meet this fate!

title: Bad from start to finish
review_text:
Flight was delayed from London City and finally left about an hour late but was clearly overbooked. Paid to select seat but they didn‚Äôt assign me one until the last minute. Got to Zurich and my bag never arrived. Was flying back to London City two days later and figured I could pick up my missing bag at London City after talking to their customer service people who were great. However, Swiss Air canceled the flight and sent me to London Heathrow two hours later. Still not there and still no bags. 

Not the Swiss Air I used to know and not at all representative of what I used to expect from them. I fly all the time and they are now the worst airline ever. Should have seen it coming based on my last flight, but never again.

title: Comfortable Flight
review_text: Very comfortable flight on Swiss Air from London (heathrow) to Geneva (Switzerland). Flew aboard the new Bombardier C- Series jet - which is very clean, spacious and comfortable. First time on this aircraft and was very impressed with the cabin (more comfortable than Airbus A319 - 321), fit, lightening and finish. The flight was on-time, service was friendly and the flight was very smooth. Very positive impression - would fly Swiss again based on this flight experience.

title: Smooth experience from Copenhagen to Zurich
review_text: as part of my 1st leg to the final destination in Mexico in July 2018 I had my 1st experience ever with Swiss International Airlines. I used the Swiss Int Airlines app and it worked just fine. First I could associate all 4 passengers travelling together, enter all passport information and check in to receive the boarding passes electronically. On board the staff was friendly and even served a small sandwich, beverage and Swiss chocolate even though this is a flight under 2 hours in duration. Seats were OK, I am 183 (6 feet) and I can just squeeze in, but this is also aligned with my expectation for economy class seating. Before touchdown we would get on screen information of which belt the luggage could be picked up at (not relevant for us as it was checked in all the way to the final destination). You could also see at what gate we were arriving and the connecting flights were listed WITH departure gates. Wow, excellent information level, I wish all airlines would do this. I hope this is not the last time I get to travel with this great airlines.

title: One of the worst flying experiences of my life
review_text: The flight was fine but they managed to get our flight a 45 minute delay and also get our luggage lost. They said you will get it back in 24h and then after 24h there was no contact. We went online to try find your bag and it had not even a single thing about our bag, They have no idea where it is. There were also quiet a few other bags missing from our flight too. So try to avoid Swiss air at all costs.

title: Flight delayed but once airborne comfortable and good service
review_text: The flight was delayed by 35 minutes but we then sat on the ground for another hour (due to bad weather around London). The flight itself was comfortable with friendly and efficient cabin service. Seating was comfortable for this length of flight. Having said this, all four sectors on Swiss which we undertook in the week were all late departing for one reason or another.

title: Trip to South Africa
review_text: This is a along flight to take with a stop in Zurich and about a 12 hour layover. Nevertheless, the flights from Miami to Zurich and from Zurich to Johannesburg, were both right on time and with very good service. On the way there, we went to Zurich center for the day but on the way back (only about a 6 hour layover), we decided to stay put and go to the Swiss club which was very well equipped and had good food. I would definitely recommend flying Swiss, we have before and it was just as good.

title: Short but great flight.
review_text: Just a short 1 hour flight from Munich to Zurich. The plane was clean, the service was friendly and the piece of chocolate they gave us was to die for!

title: Kiev
review_text: I will give you a short synopsis and you can decide.  Cancelled my flight in Vegas then they rebooked a latter -20 minutes or so.  FYI  I had a 3 hour and 15 minute layover in Toronto to catch Ukrainian air- flight to Kiev. Then the delays in Las Vegas started- amounted to about an hour.  Landed in Toronto about an hour and 20 minutes late.  We then were delayed on the Tarmac for about another hour.  We then had to go to customs which is a mess in Toronto.  We had no Air Canada Staff there to expedite.  The staff there could care less.  Ran to a different terminal and of course Ukrainian air had closed.  Took another 2 to 3 hours to find any AC staff to help.  Finally got us a room for a couple hours of sleep then a flight the next day to Zurich- then a flight with Swiss Air to Kiev.  This would put us in Kiev a day late.  Remember prepaid rooms in Kiev.  Got to Zurich the next day and then the flight to Kiev.  We landed in kiev with no baggage.  We finally got our baggage in kiev 5 days after we left Las Vegas.  Very disappointed with Air Canada and Swiss Air.  Very disorganized and nonchalant about other people's money.    I will try to avoid both airlines in the future.

title: Holiday
review_text: Travelled with Swiss Air and the flight was perfect, air crew was friendly and professional on time and enjoyable

title: Flying the new 777 in row 2 - a very nice experience
review_text:
The new 777 first class cabin is more boxy than that of the Airbus 330 but offers a lot of privacy with compartments that almost fully close off.
I personally prefer the airbus configuration. It looks and feels nicer, less bulky more cozy.
Cabin service and food are of remarkable quality with a nice, Swiss-typical personal touch without the unnecessary and tiring fanfare offered by middle eastern and Asian airlines.
Probably still one of the best ways to fly!

title: Risk to loose your return if you don't take the departure flight ?!!!
review_text:
Risk to loose your return if you don't take the departure flight ?!!!
I figured out when i was making my reservation, that it was the same price to take a go and return flight or a one way only, so i took the 2 ticket. Gift to my parents, but only one of them would take the 2 flights, cause the other was in an other place and could not take the departure flight and would come to thailand through an other way . But i wanted them to be in the same flight for the return (450 euros  each go/return ticket).

... The company charged me an extra 300 euros "to cancel" the departure flight ?!!!!!!!!! 
Cause i could not only ask them to cancel the departure, but had to cancel the full ticket to take a new one way ticket. So from 450 this ticket came up to 750 euros !!!!
Shame on you ! First time and first company to do this in my 20 years of flying.
Europeen companies have a serious lack of sens of service !

title: Good flight
review_text:
Used swiss air for a weekend away & i was pleasantly surprised. Good airline, good customer service, prompt flight timing & check in was very simple..

Keep up the good work

title: Good service and good business class seats
review_text: We travelled business clas from Kennedy Airport to Zurich then from Zurich to OR Tambo in Johannesburg. The seats were the usual business class lay flat seats. Easy enough to sleep in but could have been wider. Row 5 had narrower aisle seats than other rows and was near the bathroom. I changed my seat to middle seats for subsequent flights.Do not book the aisleseats on sides where there is also a window seat. These seats have significantly less space and if you‚Äôre in row 5 people stand there while waiting to use bathroom. The seat on that flight was also very hard...not so on the following three flights. The food on the flight was okay. The food in the terminal business lounge other than in NY was excellent. The staff was attentive and professional. On my return home our South African Airlines flight from Victoria Falls to Johannesburg was delayed eight hours causing us to miss our flight home. We had not booked this as one flight but Swiss put us on a flight then next day in business class at no additional charge. My friends on Air France paid significant additional fees. All in all I was quite pleased with our flights. We even got to tour Zurich during our layover.

title: Worst airlines
review_text: Always delayed and cancelled flights. Costumer service is very bad. I will never use this airlines again

title: Lost Luggage-SWISS Nightmare
review_text: Unfortunately, we were redirected through Swiss due to a cancelled Delta flight.  We left Atlanta on 7/17/18 and arrived in Amsterdam in 7/18/19 where we were supposed to fly direct to Florence.  Delta cancelled our flight and rerouted us on Swiss through Zurich.  We are now 9 days without luggage.  On our trip, we have scrambled to find clothing, toiletries, and other necessary items, but feel incredibly taken advantage of by Swiss Airlines, customer service, and staff.  Each time I call to discuss the whereabouts of the baggage, they give me a different answer.  One rep told me my bag was sent to Costa Rica.  Other reps said they couldn't view the information and I just needed to file a complaint on the site.  Guess how long it takes for them to respond to a complaint? 30+ days.  We are checking the World Baggage Tracer almost by the hour, and have been told to submit receipts, but have received ZERO, I mean ZERO, communication after repeated attempts to receive help.  It has been a nightmare.  Our bags were not registered in the system for numerous days, and now they are claiming they have been delivered to a hotel in Rome, which we stayed in over 3 days ago.  DO NOT RUIN YOUR VACATION BY FLYING WITH THEM.

title: ok-ish
review_text: This is a very average company. If I would be taking luggage, I would be charged for it, - this is quite a disadvantage. So they appear high in searches, but then there are some add-ons, like low costers do.

title: No room for big people, and no help with inconsiderate passengers
review_text: The attendant took pity on me and offered me a seat in the front row but my hips still were wedged into the seat, and despite the adjoining seat being empty, the arm rest does not move completely out of the way.   The trip Bach was worse, and the mother decided she needed to recline into my knees to the point I spent the majority of the entire flight standing in the agile.   Enough already.... they cant squeeze people like this. The way the seats are constructed you cannot even buy the seat next to you for the added space, forcing you to fly 1st class if you want any semblance of comfort, at an extra charge the works out to mor3 then 300$ per hour your in that 1st class seat if you go that route

title: Good service
review_text: We flew Swiss air to Florence from Boston.  We sadly did not receive one bag for 3 days as it was lost during a layover in Zurich.  I understand that baggage issues in Florence become a separate domain from the airlines, however I still hold Swiss accountable for the initial separation from bag since our other two arrived with the flight.  That being said, the flights were on time, the economy seats were roomy enough that my knees were not jammed up against the seat in front of me, food was tasty and plentiful and there were several drink services as well.  Staff was very friendly, and overall, we found flying Swiss Air quite pleasant.   I do wish they were more generous for upgrades.  We offered to pay $600 per ticket to upgrade and they still refused even though business was nowhere near filled.

title: Very good food, service and entertainment, not much leg room.
review_text: Flew from Las Vegas to Zurich and transferred to Oslo.  Flew affiliate Edelweiss Air Lines from Las Vegas to Zurich, remote check in was impossible.  The flight was pleasant, very good service and food.  The economy seating is very crowded, not much leg room, upgrade available with more room.  Great entertainment each seat has own screen with many movie and TV programs to choose from.  Would fly with them again.

title: Assigned 2 passengers in same seat, I need to get out of the plane
review_text:
I‚Äôm the passenger who completed the online check in for the below flight on 24 July, system assigned me the seat number 9C. On 25 July 2018, I have completed all security, check in procedure for boarding. The staff at London Airport told me that the seat was changed to 11D. Before the flight taking off, there is another passenger came to me with same boarding pass, same name and same seat number! Every passenger should have their own passport number, can you please tell me and check how could it be happened?! At the end, the flight has no extra seat and your staff requested me to get out the plane and took next one! The guy gave me GBP10 voucher for food and drink at airport only for compensation ! May I give you GBP10 back and let me stay on the plane? I have paid the money for the below flight not next one ! Did you sell my ticket to 3rd party ? How could the flight overbooked? I believe all airline should handle all procedure in professional way ! Besides, my luggage now is missing ! Your staff on the plane LX0325 guaranteed and told me that my luggage will transfer to next flight LX0327. When I reached Zurich airport, the staff told me that the luggage is still in London ???!!???? I spent time to queue and question the staff and finally I wasted a lot of time because of someone‚Äôs mistake ! Please check who should be responsible for this mistake! ! I would suggest to provide training for all check-in assistance to become more professional! I really cannot accept this issue and bring me a lot of conveniences!  Most of My family and friends are frequently traveller with your airline . We believe your airline should provide professional service to all passenger. Kindly Please give me reasonable explanation and compensation in this matter.  I look forward to receiving your feedback in 5 days and also please check my luggage‚Äôs location. (I have important gift in the suitcase to a very important person). I wish your airline could compensate all my lost . Thank you !

Br
Miss Chow

title: Another late departure. Otherwise, great aircraft and comfortable.
review_text: First time on a C Sries (Bombardier CS1/Airbus220-100). Flight arrived late and left 40 minutes late (all 3 (of 4) of my current travels have departed late so far). The flight itself was short. Seats comfortable and service adequate for such a short flight. I liked being met by a separate business shuttle bus and to note that business class passengers bags were first off at the carousel. As such, I recommend.

title: delays and lost luggage rioting !!
review_text:
Our first sign that the trip home was doomed was the neighboring gates passengers loud clapping and yelling! they had been there All night!! trying to get to Greece.
Out flight was delayed 3 hours which made our connection Impossible! When we got into the terminal in Switzerland, only 2 personal to deal with a WHOLE  plane of people who missed connecting flights. One for 1st class and one for all economy class.After 2 hours several other passengers starting yelling  and  clapping loudly to get more employees to re-book us all..finally 2 more showed up for over 100 passengers.  Now the fact is they KNEW before we landed they were behind the pilot  told us it was a computer issue the Day before! which set them behind schedule and he admitted to the HUGE " his words" delay. Once we got up to customer service employee we kindly asked  looks like your day is as bad as ours.  She was kind but had trouble using her computer so needed a supervisor to talk her through our booking. we  had to spend the night is a hotel take a train to the hotel walk 3 blocks to the hotel. we got meal vouchers to give the in hotel restaurant. Once the waitress saw we had vouchers we were told we only  had 2 options to eat, or pay for our meal less the 20.00 franks ...we took one of the options and never saw her again! Our luggage was lost!!! we waited 3 1/2 hours and finally found it ourselves sitting on a cart in the hallway! It took and extra day to get home needless to say and we are self employed! which means we lost a business day!! We arrived home at midnight jet lagged and exhausted...

title: very good trip excellent service
review_text:
very good service at check in , the new lounge is nice but nothing more actually is not so much space , the drink come from a big bottle so if you want a tonic water or you are the first or is flat .... for what we pay .... i think we can have better service 
all the rest just perfect thanks

title: Perfect
review_text:
Friendliness of hosts, comfort and punctual flight.
Good coordination on boarding
Plenty of room for cabin luggage

title: good flight, no problem what so ever.
review_text: Departed late because of a storm in Zurich, flight was good, food was ok, no issues at all, they don;t let you pick seats online unless you pay but sat all together anyways.

title: Swiss lost our luggage
review_text: If there was -5, I would give them that. It is the worst company so far I have traveled with. They have lost our luggage in transit between Zurich -  Vienna - Belgrade, and when we have called asking about our luggage they are rude and not willing to help. Our luggage is still lost, and no person is willing to help. I will never travel with Swiss air and we will never recommend this company to my friends. Swiss please just find my luggage and send it to Belgrade.

title: Booked a flight with Singapore and got a co chair with swiss
review_text: When I checked in at the airport I was told that my luggage would not be checked thru to my  final destination witch was Phuket. I had to pick up my lugguge under duress, running around like a mad man trying to pick up my bag and catch my next flight. It was a total mess. Since I booked with singapore airline which has a contract with the airline flyng to phuket I should have my bags checked thru. I was not a happy puppy.

title: Bad experience! Terrible!! Never again!
review_text: My first time flying with swiss air, and will never again! The sits are bad, not enough space for legroom, food is bad, and expect bad manner from the stewardess. Very very disappointed!

title: Terrible
review_text:
Not a first flight with this airlines. But ok, for short distance they are really very good, but for the long one as from Zurich to Singapore if you have an economy class is just terrible.
The sits not enough space, food awfull, service nothing special. I was really very dissapointed. 
Not my choice to fly with them unfortunately. Not good at all!

title: Pleasant short flight but nothing special.
review_text: Disappointed that my chosen flight (on Helvetic and the Embraer 190) was switched to and A.320 with no explanation as to why! Nevertheless the short flight was acceptable.

title: Enjoyable flight although my preferred window seat not allocated. Departed late but made up the time.
review_text: Flight was almost full even with a scheduled 06.00 departure. Flight left late but arrived on time. Seating adequate for this shortish flight. A bun and a cup of coffee was adequate but almost not worth having. Staff were efficient but I was disappointed not to be able to chose my preferred seat - the airline pre-allocated my seat before I had even tried to check in on line. Nevertheless recommended.

title: Switzerland Holiday
review_text:
We decided to travel via Swiss Airlines for our holiday in Switzerland. The flight attendants are very pleasant and we had a comfortable flight to Geneva. We were given chocolate footballs on the way which was a lovely gesture! Flying over Lake Geneva and the Swiss Alps was an amazing experience too. 

On return we departed via Zurich Airport. Our flight was unfortunetly delayed by 2 hours which set us back, but once the plane took off it was a pleasant journey. We were given drinks, a nice sandwich & chocolate too!

title: Dissapointed
review_text: The check in was good apart from the seats we had been given, they were different to what we had chosen when we booked and paid for them. We did not mind to much as we thought they might have had to change them but still give us a window seat liked we had booked, but when we boarded the plane they were totally different and no window seat and the seats we had booked were filled this was very annoying as when we booked hardly any seats had been booked  not a good service no explanation given. Other than that everything went well. I expected better from an airline like Swiss

title: Great Service
review_text: Our flight from Venice to Zurich was delayed and we were running to our connecting flight to San Francisco, which we were sure we had missed when out of nowhere we saw a customer service agent waving us down asking if we were the last two that needed to board the SF flight.  Big Smiles and thanks to Swiss Air for waiting for us and even making sure our luggage got on the plane!

title: Barcelona to Zurich
review_text: We traveled from Barcelona to Zurich on swiss air. The seats were booked and paid for in Australia at a reasonable cost. The flight was only 1 Hour and 40 mins. The staff friendly and helpful a drink service was available.

title: Bravo Bombardier and Swiss!
review_text: The Borbardier was convenient, much better than the Airbus. I liked it. And we had nice time at Zurich airport )e.ge. March√© restaurant).

title: Excellent service
review_text:
A great way to fly.
We were very tight on timing in transit, and the personal bus delivery through customs, and then delivered directly to our aircraft was incredible!

title: Comfortable, friendly and free chocolate!
review_text: Once again another flight back from a visit to Italy. Although the outward flight was with Lufthansa (just as good), the return was with Swiss (via Zurich). Big bonus with this is that you can take advantage of "proper" Duty-Free (yay!). A usual, flight crew very friendly and attentive. One nice touch with Swiss is the small tablets of chocolate that they give out after the snack service. The first time this happened I thought that it was a Christmas thing (as the flight was during December). However, subsequently discovered that it's part of the normal service. A clever touch on this trip however as, probably due to the World Cup being on, instead of the usual tablets/mini-bars, we were given mini football-shaped chocolates. Nice! All in all, a pleasant experience, as usual. One small comment; maybe a little more variety with the snack/sandwich would be nice.

title: Keeping the high level...
review_text: SWISS (Swiss) precision wins again. The flight was with Bombardier CS300 - quite new with enough space for legs. The snack (the flight was at 7:10 am) was really tasty. The cabin crew - helpful and really friendly. What else should you expect?

title: Swiss precision...
review_text: The Swiss precision is said to be legendary. It really is - you can really count on SWISS International. Good flight with Bombardier CS300 (the plane was quite new) - really enough space for legs. Nice and friendly cabin crew. What is more - if you need any additional info about your flight, ask on Facebook - they reply really quickly.

title: Good quality, kind service
review_text: Not the newest aircraft but in good shape, clean and comfortable seating, very good catering for eco class and attentive friendly flight attendants. Another advantage is the outstanding Swiss lounge at Zurich for status clients, excellent!

title: Cancelled seats and meal choices
review_text: We reserved our seats and some special gourmet meals 5 months ahead. We get our boarding passes we board the plane, we get middle seats and we had reserved and paid for window seats. This plane has only 2 seats on the window side,  very comfortable. Plane fully booked, can‚Äôt change. We show proof of purchase confirmation, nothing can be done. Same thing on our second flight from Zurich to Naples. We were told to correct the situation ourselves upon arrival. Through more than 12 email exchanges and 2 weeks of travelling, the mess was finally corrected. Swiss just cancelled our seats and our gourmet meal selection. This was in May, I asked for a refund then and it‚Äôs now end of July and there is no response from them at all. One more month and I will go to small claims court. We have strong consumer protection laws in the Province of Quebec.

title: Business or posh Premium Economy?
review_text:
So 1st time Swiss Air Business on their new 777. If this is their flagship long haul business offering then......the Asian and Middle East carriers have nothing to fear!! Woeful! And that could be a bit of an understatement! Seating.....different...not super comfy, food offering was dire and the staff were disjointed and maybe not sure of the procedures! Plent of them but no co-ordination.
Anyway nothing to sing its praises in any way shape or form. I have seen better in other carriers Premium economy!  If you think that Swiss Air are the slick watch like precision expected of Switzerland then think again! 
When you pay the extra for a bit of comfort, style and superior service......it would be accepted that this is what you receive! It seems like Swiss Airways are cramming in the Business class seats to get the additional income without the Business class service!
Will find another more comfortable business class service!

title: Swiss flight
review_text: Clean and comfortable aircraft, service extremely good. Friendly cabin crew. Toilets well maintained.

title: Bad organization of passport control in Geneva
review_text:
Swiss airlines provided decent service and kept a schedule. The negative comment is related to the organization of passport control in Geneva. Connection time was ~ 1 hour 30 minutes, Short flight from Zurich was on time, but when I came to outgoing passport control I was in ~100-150 crowd and few very slow immigration officers It was already boarding time and people in the crowd were very nervous. 
Long flight Geneva-JFK was on time, but 40 minutes waiting for a gate afterward.

title: Disappointed that they switched our seats at check in
review_text: We were booked for our flights 75 days prior, and every time I reviewed on line, we were in our 30A and 30B seats, right up to the moment we checked in on line, we were moved to the center row of 4 seats, I.e. no longer in the two set by the window, our preferred choice.  I phoned and asked why we were moved and the agent could not explain, advised me to ask when we dropped our bags at MIA.  The Swiss Air rep there was unhelpful, and claimed we had not paid enough for those seats.  These were not any type of upgrade and at no time were we approached on this before check in.  This was not a change in the type of aircraft, seating plan was exactly as it always had been.  Very disappointed.  Thankfully we did get at least get these seats on our return flight.  As this was an international flight being in the wrong seats is a big deal.  Even worse, a small boy in the seat behind me kicked the back of my seat vigorously for most of the trip.  His parents did nothing to stop that, or his high pitched screaming.  Had we been in our booked seats we would not have had to endure this for 9 hours.

title: An average legacy carrier
review_text:
Travelled Swiss sometime ago. No complaints whatsoever but nothing to write home about either.

I think its an average legacy carrier. Your expectations will be met.

title: Nice service and crew
review_text:
Take 8 times this year in short and long trips. Leather seat in short and tartan style and blanket in the long trip. I love that detail that make the difference even in the economy class (with the price of course).
Crew nice and informative speak many languages. Many kids on the long trip and all quiet. Fresh fruits and cakes at disposal on the long trip and some yummy Swiss specialities like cheese or chocolate.
I subscribe to the airline member but haven‚Äôt seen the avantage yet, as a silver member from another airline of the Star Alliance no transfer seems possible between the two too, have to investigate that point.

title: Friendly and attentive crew.
review_text: This was a long flight of some 12 hours from Zurich to Singapore, following a shorter flight from Prague to Zurich. Business class seating was comfortable but not as spacious as other airlines (i.e. Singapore Airlines), which for such a long flight, almost all at night, would have been a bonus. That aside, the crew were attentive and friendly and the food was first rate.

title: High quality airline
review_text: We flew with Swiss from Oslo to Athens with a stop in Zurich. The flight attendants were nice and professional, and we even got a small meal served even though the flight was barely 2,5 hours. The flight was slightly delayed, but we the airline were quick to inform about this and we landed as scheduled.

title: the swiss should stick to chocolate.  airline are long way far from been good
review_text:
we flew from Melbourne to Madrid.
my luggage did not arrived .when I asked to speak to a Swiss air representative, but it does not exist in Madrid .
the swiss air logistic are far from good. 
they need to do a lot of work to keep up with others like Singapore air, Turkish air , even jetstar are far better than swiss air.
verdict is , Never again

title: Awful Customer Service (pre-flight)
review_text: Booked four tickets to Europe (Greece) for myself, my wife, and our two young boys (7 and 4). Flight to Greece was with Air Canada, and return with Swiss. Air Canada was amazing! We called to inquire about baggage, and they (on their own initiative) wanted to ensure we would be sat with our kids - and booked us all together. Honestly, did not even think it was a possibility that ANY airline would seat young kids away from their parents...they did recommend that we contact Swiss for the return. We called Swiss thinking it would be just as easy and "charge free". Nope...Swiss wants a seat assignment fee, and claims there is no way around the system, which is "pre-programmed", and there is apparently nobody that can override "they system"...Ben was sure to also let me know that no supervisors were available (unprompted, as though he knew what I'd be asking for), but could call back every half hour or hour to see if one becomes available. I guess that makes sense...supervisors must be the busiest people at Swiss, trying to calm down angry customers at their ridiculous policies. Perhaps we will let the boys sit separately from us, and let the rest of the flight/passengers know that Swiss' "policy" thought this might be a good idea...

title: Trip to prague
review_text: Nice flight. Connection through Zurich was smooth. Terminal information was clear and efficient. Flight food was good. Will use them again in the future.

title: Jumping the alps
review_text: Very comfortable to jump in 50 minutes over the alps to the adriatic sea. Flight was crowded and many Pax had to much carry on bags... the Crew did it's best! Window seat recommended, exceptional view over the alps and before landing.

title: Fantastic flight attendants
review_text:
We flew to Las Vegas from Budapest (Hungary) with Swissair on business class. We had to change the flights in Zurich. We had only 75 minutes to change - but it was more than enough, because the Zurich Airport isn‚Äôt too big, and there is a fast train connection among the terminals. The short trip wasn‚Äôt a special experience - the airplane was small, business class only meant a bit comfortable seats and some food. The intercontinental flight was huge instead, comfortable (and convertible to bed) leather seats, fine food and drinks, wide range of movies, and very nice and attentive staff: they accomplished all of our requests.
On our way to Vegas there wasn‚Äôt any delay, but the return fligt was late: it departed two hours later because of a storm, so we weren‚Äôt able to catch our flight in Zurich. Swissair rebooked our tickets, and we had to go to Brussels from Zurich, than to Budapest. It meant 4 plus hours, and a horrible low-budget-like flight with the Brussels Airlines. This was the worst part of our trip. 
The business lounges were superb in Budapest and Zurich, but very simple in Vegas an Brussels. But still better than the public areas...

title: Very comfortable!
review_text: Usually, I`m very afraid of flights.  But on the flight with Swiss Air I have felt  comfortable. The takeoff and the landing, the service and the food, the entertainment - everything  was  excellent!!!

title: smooth flight to Mallorca
review_text: At Departure small delay not really important that the pilot caught up practically.. everything went well. no problem encountered. Only down thing, the staff .. for the first time on Swiss they were not smiling .. a young stewardess was even a bit rude with people (not using bad words but harsh).. On the way back it was a different story and a courteous staff was there again (as Swiss is used to have)

title: Cattle Call
review_text: The flight was crowded, most are these days.  the flight crew must have had a long day.  It was pretty much, "get on, get your seat, lets go."  The seats were extremely small.  I am not a small person, but I am not a plus sized person either.  I had to force my body into the seat.  It was a long uncomfortable flight.  Once in Zurich I had to go through passport control 5 times including TSA, I never left the terminal and was only transferring flights from one crowded long flight to another.

title: Like sardines
review_text: The plane, altough is new, had very small rooms for legs and arms. Terrible. I wll never choose this company again.

title: Not comfortable journey
review_text: Not a enjoyable flight. Very cramped between seats. Food was not good. Long flight (10 hours) evening flight, no snacks served after dinner. No comparison to Emirates Etihad or Qater airlines.

title: Super airlines
review_text: I have really good experience with swiss airlines. Flying from Barcelona to Geneva we were late and check-in was already closed. From the Swiss airlines desk, they provided us with tickets to next flight we just paid for date changes.

title: Good service
review_text:
Courteous members of staff at the airport as well as crew. Good service and information provided on board. 
However, quite a treck to the Business  Lounge at Zurich airport as previous one being revamped, so alternative one is beyond passport control and not easy to find.
Better choice of food  and beverage in business class from Zurich to London compared to flight from London to Geneva on this occasion.

title: Making long hauls easy
review_text: Recently returned from France, flying Swiss Airlines for the first time - spotlessly clean, friendly helpful staff and food that surpassed anything I have eaten in a steel tube 30,000‚Äô above the ground. Such a good vibe in the plane!

title: Wonderful service...and the food kept coming
review_text: After a hectic bus ride to our gate, because the tram in O'Hare was broken, we were greeted by the friendly Swiss Air crew. The flight was smooth, but long...however it seemed shorter due to the food, wine, and snacks that kept me occupied. The inflight movies had a huge selection, too. We arrived in Zurich, refreshed and ready for our 15 days in the Swiss-Italian-French-German-Austrian Alps. Mahalo Swiss Air

title: I like the service
review_text: I just love the service of this airlines. enough leg space compare to other airlines. loved the service.

title: That snack!
review_text: I am usually very satisfied with Swissair. I appreciate tht they give a free drink and a snack even on such a short flight. But the sandwich I got was ridiculous. It was just plain bread. The steward was very nice about it and asked if she can take my sandwich back, which obviously Iwas not going to eat, to complain to the catering. Hopefully next time a better snack ;)

title: they are extreamly punctual, clean and professional, new aircraft and well trained crew
review_text:
They are puctual,friendly and efficient, not petty regarding hand lugguage size or weight, the aircraft are new with the best on board entertainment available. the food is good and enough, service avaiable all night. 
I often fly business class for the company, this is a real first class experience.

title: Not really exellent on tue everage
review_text: Nothing was really wrong but on other company Planes there was more frequent service (drinks and food). Seat is standard size. TV screen was new.

title: A stop in Zurich
review_text:
Great flights even if the weather was awful above the alps. 

A steward took the time to speak with a woman who was in panic and assure her that all was ok. It has been really helpful and helped her tolerate the big turbulences.

The flight was 1h late in valencia because of the weather but even so they've managed to win half an hour (on a two hours flight) and the plane in Zurich has been waiting for us the others 30mn because it was the last of the day (23h).

The second flight was really quite and as always i've enjoyed the Bombardier CSerie 100 (i love those planes).

title: I've flown better...
review_text: Flight left and arrived on-time.  Food was fine.  Friendliness of flight crew was average.  Best thing about the flight was I had a bulkhead seat.  More legroom than I knew what to do with. There was nothing great or terrible about the flight though.  Like my rating says...average.

title: Short flight
review_text: Make sure you have at least 2 hours connecting time in Zurich between arrival of inbound international flight and departure outbound within the EU.  My connecting time was too short and I barely made my connection after sprinting through Zurich airport, waiting at Immigration and taking a bus to the plane on the tarmac.  I made it to Berlin on my flight,  However, my luggage did not.  In Berlin they would not allow me to pick up my luggage from the next incoming Swissair flight from Zurich.  I was told that was not possible.  So I waited not knowing if my luggage was even in Zurich. I arrived at 1000 hours and my luggage came to my hotel the next day at 0600 hours.

title: Great hospitality the entire time
review_text: I had never flown Swiss before, I thought Lufthansa was nice, this has beaten them. Every single worker was so friendly and helpful, they were all on the same page in regards to comforts, timing and attention to customers. To me, these seats were more comfortable, everyone had a screen console with optional movies, tv, maps, games, etc. The food was delicious, they were very loose with the beer/wine, they came around 7-8 times offering drinks and just as many times to offer water/juice. We later had for breakfast a hot pastry puff and they came around with Swiss chocolate. And..we purposely chose this flight because it was the cheapest when booking, so it was great. You have to pay for wifi, so we did not do that...they could have had more new release movies, but I didn't even have time to finish the movies I had planned to watch.

title: Solid, comfortable economy class travel between JFK and Switzerland
review_text: My family (four of us in total) traveled between the US and Switzerland this July on Swiss. The service was efficient and comfortable. The cabin crew worked diligently to make their passengers comfortable, providing a quality dinner service along with plentiful drinks. Meals were tasty and there was ample legroom on our flights. The seatback entertainment system has a ton of good selections to keep all of us occupied. We'll try to make Swiss our go-to for future European trips

title: Wonderful Experience!
review_text:
The flight was a wonderful experience with great service and fantastic staff.

I was traveling to England on June 29, 2018, with two other family members, for my sister's funeral and our luggage did not arrive until the evening of July 2, 2018, which was after the funeral.  We had to purchase items.

title: Horrible seats
review_text:
Flew back with the beautiful 777, but in economy i can tell you that is the worse experience. The seats are narrower, smaller and for the one that is the middlemseat, there is not space for nothing.
Flight was relaxed and entertainment was great.

title: Worth the money
review_text:
Smashing airline 
The short haul flights use the small air buses , bombardiers I must admit the return flight on the bombardier was delightful a smashing plane with plenty of leg room as is the airbus, if you book direct with Swiss air you can reserve your seats and they send you your ticket by email 20 hours before your flight they are easy to use.
The air crew are great the speak both German and English they are helpful friendly and attentive I will be using Swiss air in future for some of my European trips

title: Very Good Airline!!!
review_text: From check-in to baggage claim in Washington, DC to baggage check out in Dar es Salaam was very smooth, without any problems. The flight was very comfortable, good service and wonderful staff.

title: Comfortable plane but noisy
review_text: Nice flight from Geneva to Lisbon and back. The Bombadier plane is spacy and comfortable but quite noisy. No delays what is quite rare.

title: Above average and reliable
review_text:
I have been flying back and forth between these two airports for over 40 years and this is the most convenient and reliable airline for service, flight schedule, and plane condition.
Everyone has their video screen, the planes are new and clean, the captains are informative and give regular flight updates.

title: Great Airline
review_text: Flight from Z√ºrich to Barcelona and back and as well to Oslo, were great. To Oslo i had a business ticket. I enjoyed the business lounge at Z√ºrich airport. The meals and drinks are good.

title: Baseline functional
review_text: SwissAir serves baseline flight service functions. The only exception service during the red eye flight was the buffet spread of snacks and drinks for passengers to help ourselves. What annoyed me most was flight attendants who kept bumping into my shoulder when I was seated along the aisle without any apologies.

title: Very good flight
review_text: Exactly as a flight should be. In time, smooth, good service on Board. It was a holiday trip and I had my golf bag. No problem, everything managed perfectly. The Swiss golf traveller card is very convenient and offers a perfect service for golfers.

title: Excellent Service! Full refund after wrongful booking!
review_text: Accidentally booked a wrong flight, they gave me a full refund and let me book the next flight! Excellent service!!!!!

title: Swiss efficiency in flight
review_text: The plane was super clean and the service was super efficient and professional. The crew was helpful when asked, but otherwise let passengers to relax on their own.

title: Punctual and Comfortable
review_text:
Our overall experience was great!  Roomy seats, accommodating staff, the food was decent and each of our flights was on time.  One can't ask for much more.

Tips for US citizens:
1. When the airline states that you need to be on the plane 30 minutes before takeoff,  be on that plane 30 minutes before takeoff (we made it by two minutes and nearly missed our flight - the staff was very strict)

2. Baggage tips for those who want to travel without checking luggage:
The airline allows 2 cabin bags onto the plane.  One personal item (think laptop bag or grocery tote) and one larger item which cannot exceed 46 liters.  (Measurement expectations are: 56cm x 36cm x 23cm with a maximum weight of 7kg) 

My husband and I chose to try "one bag travel" for our three weeks in Europe and selected the Osprey 46 backpack which for the long haul flight was fine. (Whew!)  

However, when we arrived in Zurich for our connecting flight we noticed the airline staff measuring the bags using the metal crates many of us see at airports in the states but never use as many of the US based carriers are relatively lenient.  While the Osprey certainly met the over-all size requirement, it was a little deeper than the 23cm requirement which meant we ran the risk of having to check our bags. (No thank you)

What saved us?  Packable totes.  

I cannot recommend these enough.  They allowed us to remove a few key items so we could shift the rest of our belongings and easily fit the required measurements.  They also allowed us to keep things like laptops, phones, tablets and other toiletries we wanted access to under our seats while our larger backpacks were stowed in the overhead compartments.

In short - while some Swiss Air staff may not measure the cabin bags, be prepared with alternatives in case they should decide to do so.

title: Nice experience
review_text:
First experience of LCY which made the whole thing more user friendly, not the long drag and hassle at LGW or LHR, also no "duty free" to negotiate.
Bag drop was quick and easy, had their own desk, and the process through to board was so much easier. Once on board it was quick up and away, friendly staff and complimentary snack and drink. Likewise on the return trip
Would recommend and use again

title: Weekend shopping
review_text: Swiss fly to Tegel Airport how is near to the Center of Berlin. And from there you just in 20 minuets in the heart of Berlin.

title: On  time and perfect execution
review_text:
Flew from Geneva to Pula on Swiss via Z√ºrich.
Both flights were on time, even leaving and arriving early for the last leg.

GVA to ZRH was on a Bombardier C Series 100, now called Airbus A220-100, great aircraft with large windows. Service on the 30 minutes flight was water and a chocoloate, quite OK given the fligh time.

ZRH to PUY was an Eldeweiss A320 and they served a sandwich as well as beverages.

I noted that on both flights I had enough leg room to sit straight, even if I am average height this is not the case on all airlines.

Fare was very reasonable. Great job Swiss!

title: Good
review_text:
I flew Swiss air business class on the short haul Amsterdam-Zurich-Amsterdam sector. Since it is a short haul flight, it is not really business class in the true sense - the seats are up front, a bit more leg room than economy and the centre seat is kept empty. Both ground service & in-flight service were absolutely top notch.
On the return journey, the flight was delayed because they were waiting for a crew member to board (she travelled as passenger, presumably to catch her working flight out of Amsterdam). The wait for her was for about 15 minutes, but since we missed our departure slot, we had an additional 20 minutes delay.

title: Almost felt like first class ;)
review_text: This was my first time traveling to Europe, so I don't have any comparison, but I thought it was fantastic! When you got to your seat, a pillow, blanket & headphones were waiting for you. There were a lot of great choices for movies - many of them very recent releases. It seemed like they were feeding you constantly, and the food was excellent - I think that was the most surprising thing! When they weren't feeding you, they were walking around offering water to anyone who was awake. The seats weren't as wide as first class, but they were comfortable enough. I loved that you could watch on the screen what you were flying over and how much further you had to go. All around, it was a great experience.

title: Swiss & partner Helvetic Airways
review_text: Unfortunately the pope delayed flight but was kept informed all along and pleasant staff throughout. Never felt worried and all was well

title: Great Airline for international travel
review_text: Great flight and one of the nicer airlines I've flown overseas. Although we departed slightly late, we arrived on time. In flight were numerous meals, personal tvs for watching movies, drink service. Crew was professional and helpful. Multilingual staff. If you have to be on a plane over 8 hours, this was one of the better flights I have taken.

title: Worst Customer Service
review_text: I flew Swiss Air recently.  I am a Star Alliance Gold member.  I fly over 100K miles per year for the last 10 years.  First (and last!) time flying Swiss Air.  Customer service was horrible, flight attendants were liars and the food was disgusting.  I fly carry on only all around the world.  The gate staff and flight attendants both lied and told me my bag had to be checked because it exceeded flight restrictions.  Baloney!!  There was plenty of room for my bag and many passengers had larger bags.  Despite being one of the first to board, they said it was a full flight so my bag must be checked because it was too big (despite Business Clasd check in desk clearing my luggage for carry on when I checked in).  I fly carry on to save me up to an hour wait for when I land.  Do not upset your Star Alliance Gold members - especially by lying.  We fly alot and know the damn rules.  I will never fly Swiss Air again because of dishonest staff and poor flight experience.  Shame!

title: Not happy with Swiss Air
review_text: We flew from Sydney to Singapore then had to change over to Swiss Air for the rest of the journey to Geneva. I was terribly disappointed with the standard offered to their business class customers. Only 1 staff member was able to smile at the customers. She was lovely & I wish I had her name to say thank you. The other staff members made us feel like we were an imposition! After flying Singapore (which is always exceptional) this was a serious downgrade! The set up & service felt like a bad effort at matching premium in Qantas or other top tier airlines. The bed was cramped & uncomfortable. Had to clamber over my husband to get out of the cubicle when he was lying down sleeping. Literally had to stand on my seat to step over him. Ridiculous when you look at the money we paid. Not good enough Swiss air. Would never choose Swiss again. Unfortunately, we have to fly home with them in a couple of weeks. NOT looking forward to it.

title: Continually our vacation
review_text: DW and I were traveling to Florence the access to board the plane was by walking on a tarmac and boarding a bus, maybe I‚Äôm just use to terminal and gangways.

title: on time- and very good value
review_text: spotless clean aircraft on both flights, kind service, excellent coffee and a very good value for a airline for very often overpriced Switzerland- axcellent. And on both flights not one minute delay

title: BEWARE - Swiss Air do not adhere to CAA recommendations
review_text: Swiss Air deliberately ignore CAA recommendations making unaccompanied minor fly alone, in total disregard for their own policies, risking health & safety. When challenged by "s√∂p_Schlichtungsstelle f√ºr den √∂ffentlichen Personenverkehr e.V. " they refused to admit their deliberate act of non-compliance.......fly at your own risk...!!!

title: Europe Vacation
review_text: This is the 3rd time I have flown Swiss Air Business Class form Hong Kong to Zurich in the last 12 months and each flight went without a hitch. I flew to Hong Kong from Auckland on Air NZ Business Class so the comparison would be interesting. Firstly the seat/bed; Air NZ has everyone beat with their completely lie-flat bed that is very comfortable with a separate padded mattress and is surprisingly spacious; definately  the best I have experienced. Swiss Air has a seat that slides forward to a nearly flat surface but it is uncomfortable and very cramped; your feet/legs end up in a small tunnel under the seat in front which is too small and your shoulders/arms are not supported; only an average experience. The service and food on Swiss was very good, and the plane seemed modern and very clean; excellent friendly young cabin crew were helpful and efficient. Their uniforms are smart and stylish, much better than Air NZ‚Äôs frumpy looking multi coloured outfits that look old fashioned and certainly don‚Äôt make the crew look professional. The plane took off on time and landed on time. Check-in by the way was well policed strictly holding back economy passenger who tried to join the business/first passengers queue. The Swiss Airline has a great range of Duty Free items in a comprehensive catalogue on board so I purchased a watch each for my son and daughter. The TV screen is large and easy to use and the range of movies etc is comprehensive; headphones and not noise-cancelling which was a disappointment. Drinks selection was OK with a couple of white and red wine options. All in all, not a bad experience but I would probably not chose them for future long haul flights.

title: Good intercontinental flight
review_text:
I took the flight from San Francisco and back for business.
Flight was punctual (on both flights the plane landed within 15 min.s of the scheduled time).
Flight assistants were quite polite and on-board service good even in economy flight
On board entertainment was mostly aligned with other European companies: on-seat screen with a variety of movies, documentary, games (mostly old-fashioned),...
Aircraft (it was a 737-300ER) proudly displayed a Wifi simbol on the door but of course Wifi on board is extremely expensive
Also on Swiss site you can down-load magazines prior to your flight but if you fly economy your choice might be limited to a single item.
Also be aware that in economy your hand-baggage allowance is limited: you are allowed a single item with a weight below 8 Kg. However you can take in addition a laptop bag (it is not clearly mentioned in the page).
As with other airlines the smartphone App had some issues. For some time I was unable to log in with my Miles&More ID (same ID worked on Swiss Web page); also on the return flight I was able to check-in on the app but for some reason the boarding pass did not show up in the app itself.
However it has been a good choice for the destination

title: Don‚Äôt fly #Swissinternationalairlines
review_text:
DON‚ÄôT USE Swiss International Air Lines!!!
This airline DOES NOT respect it‚Äôs customers. We have arrived to Cairo 14 days ago with a 2 weeks old infant and 7 BAGS that we didn‚Äôt receive any of them! Including the carry ons that hold precious things and all the baby‚Äôs medicine, food and clothes!
We did endless number of calls and complains with no answer they just send an automated email that they will get back to us which they never do!! Even Z√ºrich Airport refuses to give us any info for our missing luggages.
They do not have any system or take any responsibility of the situation.
SWISS how do u expect to build customer loyalty or expect us to pay thousands of dollars to fly with ur unrespectful airlines again?!!
#swiss #swissinternationalairlines #swissair #lufthansa #donottravelonswiss #badtravelexperience #zurichairport

title: Terrible customer service
review_text: I lodged a complaint with the airline five weeks ago and I'm still waiting for a response (let alone some resolution on the issue). The worst customer service I've ever experienced. They're parading as a reputable airline but having some basic professionalism when it comes to dealing with complaints would be helpful.

title: Great service
review_text:
We flew from Zurich to Boston on a A340 aircraft. The aircraft itself was pretty old and the entertainment system had to restart once because it froze.
The crew on the flight was wonderful. Very professional but still laughing with the passengers.
The food onboard was the best airplane food I‚Äòve ever eaten. There were 2 options. Chicken with a lemon sauce and Gnocchi with a tomato and olives sauce. The second (vegetarian) option was made with the oldest vegetarian restaurant in the world (Hiltl in Zurich).
The legroom on the flight wasn‚Äôt bad but not outstanding. You get a blanket, pillow and some headphones. I would recommend to bring your own (if possible noise canceling) because the aircraft is pretty loud.
Our flight was perfectly on time (we landed 5 min early). This was due to transit passengers in Zurich. Without them we would probably have been about 20 min before scheduled arrival time.
At the airport in Zurich everything was really smooth and fast.

title: Acceptable
review_text:
The seats lie flat but they are very narrow. There is no remote for the entertainment so you have to sit up to touch the screen. Service was so-so. My husband would be served on his side but I wouldn't be served on mine. So he would get a glass of wine or whatever, and I wouldn't. I'd have to ask. There are 2 aisles so we were both on an aisle.
There was a screaming toddler on our night flight so sleeping for the entire cabin was impossible for most of the 10 hour flight. It was quite a miserable flight. We left at 7:30 PM and I had hoped to get a good nights sleep, but it wasn't to be. Luck of the draw, 1 tiny person made life very miserable for a lot of people.

title: Swiss international Air Lines
review_text:
Punctuality,, polite and efficient staff.  Looking forward in flying with them again.
I also give credit to the travel company Wingbuddy who made all my travel plans, well; they could not have chosen a better airline.  Keep up the good work.
Canadian,Torontoian

title: Loved the Service and Punctuality
review_text: I was highly impressed with the service in received in the two flights I was in June. They are professional, kind, and punctual. I was particularly impressed with a member of their crew from Zurich to Florence. They were giving chocolate in the shape of soccer balls in celebration of the World Cup. My friend told him how much my Dad loved it, and they gave us several extra ones. There were other instances in which the staff was responsive to our needs. Needless, to say, all flights left on time. Thank you for the experience, Swiss Air.

title: A Swiss flight that could have been better
review_text: The flight from Zurich to Johannesburg was plagued by small annoyances. On a long flight one would like to sleep. The entertainment systems had to be shutdown to a malfunction. This also disabled the seat recline. it took quite a while to get the seat to recline and reduce the rest time. The meal was average and below the standard that Swiss usually maintains. The breakfast was served in an odd sequence with the warm meal served long after the tray was set on the table. Frankly, Swiss is a very good airline. I guess not flights can be of the same standard

title: The staff was the only saving grace on this flight
review_text:
Let's start with the bad: My main complaint here is the aircraft itself. I have never in my life been so crowded in a seat. I'm not sure how old the equipment was, but my sister and I were incredibly uncomfortable. We're average to tall women, but we are otherwise average-sized people. I couldn't imagine how badly significantly obese people or taller than average people would feel. 

The legroom is minimal (again, shortest distance I've experienced) and when the woman in front of me jerked her chair back, she was nearly in my lap. Not to mention it just fell back without any resistance, so it nearly spilled my tray of food all over my lap. (To boot, she was a jerk about it, particularly to the very kind attendant). I also had to be careful with my seat recline, come to think of it.

On that note, I will say the attendants were among the friendliest I've encountered. Particularly on the NYC‚ÄìZurich leg of the trip. Thanks to them, we were not miserable despite our discomfort in the seats. So, big kudos to the staff. 

Regardless, I will not book Swiss Air again, thanks to the seat squash situation. Unless I'm flying first class (sadly unlikely).

title: It was a nice flight despite weather conditions
review_text: Despite weather conditions on Zurich airport and a delay for more then 1 hour, I have a nice flight. Cabin crew was friendly. Plane was like new and in very good condition. Each sit had a screen showing how much left to the destinations. This I liked a lot.

title: pleassure
review_text:
just in time.   super  good  team   attempt  and nice
also the   fly was   comfortable   and   quiet
and the stop in zurich  was  very  nice

title: Very satisfied with Swiss air
review_text: Great service and crew. Entertainment was great as well. I was flying with a broken toe. I contacted the airline before hand and they accommodated me with extra space. The good was good as well and u usually don't like airplane food.

title: Uncooperative thieves
review_text:
I had to change the date of my flight for business reasons - one day later.
I had booked via Opodo which I believe was set up by a number of airlines.
Opodo refused to change the ticket and said it was not their fault but that the airline refused to do it as it was a low cost ticket.
So I lost ¬£400
I will never use Opodo again and I will never fly Swiss again.

title: worst airline. They lost my suitcases
review_text:
My parents flew flight #LX2021 and #LX0038 (MAD-ZRH-SFO) on June 29, 2018, however, their luggage (Claim ticket #SFOLX10164) did not arrive with them - nor has it yet arrived 9 days later on July 8. I have contacted Swiss Air Lines at SFO, ZRH, and MAD on a regular basis, but neither has made any effort to find the bags - instead simply claiming another airport or country is responsible.

When I call ZRH airport and Swiss Air Lines at ZRH, the response has been very rude with claiming they have nothing to do with the issue. Your Swiss Air Lines office in at SFO simply gave me a number (+1 650 222 8755) which is only an answering machine. The message on the machine states Swiss Air Lines will contact me ASAP, but of course, I have yet to receive a response - 9 days later.

Like most air travelers, I have experienced misplaced luggage before and the airline has always worked with me to promptly and satisfactorily resolve the issue. To say Swissair‚Äôs customer service and response with this issue has been poor would be a vast understatement. I don‚Äôt care which Swiss Air Lines office, which airport, or which country is responsible. What I care about is my parents‚Äô luggage was lost on a Swiss Air Lines flight and SWISS AIRLINES is responsible for assisting in resolving the problem promptly.

title: Baby Flight
review_text: Flew from Los Angeles to Florence, Italy via Zurich.  Flew with my wife and a 6 month old baby.  On the overnight flight from LA to Zurich we requested the baby bassinet that attaches to the bulkhead wall.  This was a lifesaver and so helpful that he could lay down and sleep for most of the flight.  Also, it was just a 10% ticket price for the baby bassinet instead of buying him his own seat!  Also love that Swiss Air is part of the Mileage Plus program so I can continue to get miles.  Baby was also given a stuffed airplane and a bib. Bassinet is only good for baby up to 8 months or around 24 pounds.  Also adult traveling with baby gets free upgrade to bulkhead seats in premium section although did pay the extra amount for the 2nd adult seat.

title: Avoid any Swiss flight on the 777-300ER - very narrow seat in economy
review_text:
Unfortunately Swiss have made the 777-300ER economy configuration 10 seats per row.
This makes for a narrow seat. You will almost certainly be touching/pressing the shoulders of your neighbours for the whole flight. And as the 777-300ER is long haul e.g. Zurich-Singapore it makes for a very uncomfortable experience.
I have flown it twice and now I know what it's like I always like for an alternative.
Swiss generally are a pretty good airline but not in 777-300ER economy.

title: Vacation started when we boarded!
review_text: We were treated with great service from the minute we boarded until we landed in Los Angeles.  The food was great and it kept coming. We were even served a small bite on our connector flight from Milan to Zurich and it was great. The business cabin is well laid out and lacking nothing!

title: Good service but almost always late...
review_text:
Unbelievable that the Swiss national airline in a country that is so incredibly well organised, is 85% late 20-50 minutes...  Even more astonishing is that Z√ºrich is their main hub! Low cost airlines always are on time here...

The service though is mostly impeccable!

title: Quality straightforward
review_text:
If you can get one of the single seats on the left hand side of the plane - you get a first class experience as end up with a desk - work space either side of the seat. Worth it!
Attentive service, decent food. 
Have also flown first - and frankly not much difference to the business offering, other than the First lounge, and transfer service in Zurich is the best in the world

title: Not Cheesey
review_text: Swiss Airlines does everything right; their flights are scheduled around quiet hours at the Zurich Airport, so you don't arrive before dawn in Europe and after dinner in the US.  While that may be a problem for making connections, the leisurely attitude is much more accommodating than other carriers.

title: Excellent airline with personable, attentive attendants
review_text: Very clean aircraft manned by very personable, attentive attendants serving excellent food.  I highly recommend flying Swiss Airlines

title: ZRH - BCN Delay with Poor Communication
review_text:
During our European trip, we took 3 flights on Swiss Air.  The first 2 were great with no delays.  On this last one from Zurich to Barcelona, our incoming aircraft was delayed.  We went to the gate but there wasn't any information given.  We just had to hang around the gate as they adjusted the time.

In the end, our 1 hour and 40 minute flight was delayed 2.5 hours.  Once on board, the pilot told us it was due to weather around the Zurich area.  Then, air traffic control placed a hold on us taking off.

I wished there was better communication from Swiss Air regarding the delay.  When I asked the gate agent about more information, she said she did not have additional information and did not even know if the gate would be the same and just told me to check the board.

However, having taken 3 flights total on Swiss Air, I would not hesitate to take them again.  The seats had pretty good leg room and they always served drinks and sometimes a snack even though it would be a short flight.
