title: Fly Swiss Air ...for friendly service and surprisingly good food!
review_text: Swiss Air provided full service on this international flight....even flying economy, I was given hot meals, good wine, fresh croissants for breakfast ....and the best surprise of all....Swiss chocolates( ball shaped chocolates with a soccer ball foil wrap! ) after breakfast! You got me with the croissants...and kept me with the chocolates! Such friendly, professional service! I will fly Swiss whenever I have the opportunity!

title: Good quality business class flight
review_text:
- there was a slight delay 
- speedy boarding 
- comfortable seats, flat bed
- back massage (nice but not effective)
- good service 
- good food selection and quality 
- dated entertainment service & old screens 
- good selection of movies 
- quiet flight 
- overall above average

title: Flying to New York with pleasure
review_text: excellent flight, well-assisted and with good choice of food and entertainment, flight attendants extremely kind, as usual with Swiss.

title: One of the best airlines I've flown on Europe
review_text: The CS300 is an amazing plane with awesome features, legroom is really nice and service is really good. The economy class catering on the two flights I made with swiss where really good for an European flight.

On the way fly back to Switzerland from New York with Swiss International Airline, I felt it's a company with racial discrimination. This woman from my back seat used her knees to push my chair back. She even put her bare foot on my armrest. I couldn't even adjust my chair back a little bit. 

My husband asked her to remove her knees so that I could adjust my chair but she refused. So we called the flight attendant. They didn't even asked her to do something but laughed at me for wanting be sit next to my husband. They asked me instead the one who put her knees on my chair back to move to the next seat. ( we both got an empty seat next to her and me.) Sadly, no one around said anything to help me and I was the only Asia woman at this place. 

I wondered why I paid extra to reserve a seat next to my husband and got bothered  but the flight attendant asked me to move, not her. If bothering other people has right to stay where they are and keep bothering others, and the one who got bothered and complained is the one to blame, then Swiss International Airline will be my last choice! 

No more Swiss International Airline!

title: Consistently excellent
review_text: In the past, I‚Äôve written about an very special ‚Äúover the top great‚Äù customer service experience on Swiss air. Putting that great experience aside, I fly this route round trip a couple of times a year, and I‚Äôm always happy with the experience- the business class seats are lie flat, there‚Äôs enough room to be comfortable, the entertainment system is very good, the food is better than most, and the staff is always pleasant, professional and efficient. I have a number of options to get to my Europe destination, and always choose this Swiss air from Boston through Zurich.

title: Wait and see ..
review_text:
Flight starts from gate A56. somewhere rear bottom, little room. In time then passengers are filled in the bus for transfer to airplane. Outside temp: 32¬∞C. Then in bus beside airplane: nothing happens. Airplane not yet ready. Temperature in bus goes up. After about 20 min: crew arrives. Then further 10 min later: passengers may enter the airplane. Then next messages from captain: they were late arriving from Geneva, sorry for waiting in the bus,..then: next obstacle: wind from east, lots of airplanes... we have to wait another 40 min..
Even with warm temperature: crew keeps cool, keep passengers satisfied.

title: Not the clockwork precision expected from Swiss
review_text: Sloppy, uninterested, unavailable for comments or criticism. That is how we experienced Swiss. Booking went wrong and although this was solely their mistake they were able to only offer me a much (!) more expensive ticket. My complaints had the impact on Swiss like water on a duck skin. Result, I had to search myself for a cheaper ticket (which I found btw) and we were not able to sit together during the flight. On the way back a boarding card was automatically generated for my son but not for me. Again I had to save the situation myself, although the BC that should‚Äôve been sent to my mobile never arrived. I‚Äôm tired of Swiss, literally! ‚ÄúThank you for choosing Swiss Airlines‚Äù they concluded every email but it‚Äôs first and last time for me. There are much better airlines out there!

title: Two-segment european flight in the summer
review_text:
Used Swiss as a return flights from vacations; 2 daytime segments with 5 hour stopover at Zurich.
Planes were good, rather new and clean. Though headlight above my seat sometimes dimmed for unknown reasons. Crews are perfect. Economy breakfast and dinner were kind of simple, but offered wine, beer, juices without any restrictions.
Flights were almost as scheduled (little 30 min delay for second segment).

The only strange thing is seat selection. When I checked in, I selected seats 9A/B and got the boarding passes. But just before the gate, airport staff quickly re-printed new passed for the 8A/B seats. Nothing to worry, but seems my 9-row seats were just given to someone else. That's strange and it probably could be worse. Both rows are the same class and no emergency exits at them. The reason, perharps, is overbooking, but nobody told us any info about changed seats.

title: Just the aircraft was SWISS
review_text:
I was flying with my family with an infant for Swiss Holidays and have chosen Swiss Airlines because of their direct connectivity. The airline i flew with some years ago was known for its quality and standards but i was not aware that they are rapidly downgrading themselves.
Quality of flying/Aircraft & Cleanliness was all good.
In flight services and boarding experience was  just a compromise.
No priority boarding with infant given at boarding time from Zurich and made us stand in a long queue, although priority was given on Delhi airport

Zrh-Del , infant food only given once when asked again it was finished. Thank god we had our own arrangements.

Seat with more legroom refused to us on Del-Zrh flight like row 22DEG but when on flight saw one seat went vacant and the other person was a single flyer who neither paid for it.

Coming to crew everybody is full of attitude.

title: Outstanding flight from Zurich
review_text: I recently flew from Zurich to Tel Aviv on Swiss Air.  While it was only a 3.5 hour flight, everything was flawless. I particularly appreciated a hot meal even in economy class. The flight attendants were kind and professional. I have become a fan of Swiss Air.

title: Transit at Zurich airport
review_text: Zurich is a nice place to change planes - nice and clean airport, not too big and not too small and Swiss is a good airline to fly with, member of Star Alliance, lots of destinations inside Europe and elsewhere, courteous team, excellent entertainment on board, always on time.

title: Nightmare trip
review_text: As usual with flights out of Zurich, this flight left 45 minutes late. Minutes before landing in Malaga, with the wheels out, the plane restarted the ascent. It went circling around the coast. The pilot informed us that this was due to tail winds faster than what is the legally allowed limit for a plane to land. After about half an hour we were diverted to Granada, where they refuelled and after another interminable wait we finally left for Malaga, where we landed a whooping 3 and a half hours later. While in Granada, the pilot told us (what I don't believe a second) that there were winds from the North and from the Sounth. Also, this was the only diverted flight, all others landed without incident. I am also wondering how come that the pilot realized about the tail winds just when we were about to land. Usually, the control tower communicates this information to the aircraft in advance before the landing. An extremely poor experience

title: Delayed one day
review_text:
Was going to a Formula 1 race i Austria, and had booked Swiss air, with a switch in Zurich. Plane from Copenhagen kept getting delayed, and we ended up sitting in the plane on the tarmac for almost an hour before take-off. When arriving in Zurich our connecting plane was long gone, and the queue to the transfer desk was way over  hundred people, and with only 2 (!!) persons serving, we were in for a long wait.

The only thing they could offer us at that late point (when we were finally served), was a night at a local hotel, and an early flight to Stutgart, and then another plane to Graz - arriving in Graz almost 20 hours late.
The explanation from Swiss air was, that the winds in Zurich airport made everybody delayed? All planes where leaving on time while i waited in the never ending queue.

The only redeeming factor was that Swiss Air booked and payd for a nice hotel, transfer to and from. and part of a meal.

title: SWISS international Airline is always on time and keep you inform  if any problem  before flying
review_text:
Great Airline. Very classical. Excellent services  Great food and wine.
Always on time.
Business or Gold Card Senator give you s special registration desk . A speedy line for immigration and check in.
 Mile More is a very rewarding system with swiss, many advantage upgrade  is extremely easy and it work most of the time

title: short flight from Muscat to Dubai and return
review_text:
the tiket was reasonable, it seem like no too many passengers using the swiss air ..
my plan to spend two days in Dubai and return during the weekend, so my time was very tight, the swiss air make it more tight as they delay my in and out trip one hour for take off and two hours for my return ,,,,
no meal provide only small portion of cookies and drink,,,, 
the crew are nice and no other concern regarding the service and the condition of the airplane.. all were nice

title: Good food in the sky
review_text:
It was our first time flying business class to Europe. We flew from Zurich to Los Angeles. The seat configuration is 2, 2, 2.  The seats are a bit on the narrow side but they were quite comfortable and lay completely flat. 
The food was surprisingly good and better than British Airways First class. It was a full flight and one of the passengers (a few seat away from us) was Paris Hilton and her fiance. We only saw them when we were about to disembark at LAX and at the luggage carousel.... they traveled with 35 luggage!.. no kidding. 
Anyway, in flight entertainment was pretty good. Overall it's a good experience for us.

title: Longing for the days when Swiss Air was flying
review_text: Limites leg room, 50 euro for one piece of luggage and not a very pleasant crew. The flight was late (why??) and we got to  Nice almost 90 minutes late

title: Sensational service and food
review_text:
Unfortunately we had (by the way great) dinner in First Class Lounge in Terminal A at Zurich Airport, so I could only eat the starter and dessert. The champagne and desert wine were very tasty as well as the chocolate candies. Seat, LCD (huge!) and service were top, so I slept very well for 8 hours.
Swiss provides much better service than Lufthansa, better food and drinks. I‚Äòd like to point out the great whisky bar located in Senator Lounge in Zurich.

title: Saving cost at the expense of customer safety
review_text:
Our flight was scheduled 3 July 2018 to depart from Zurich to Johannesburg. The flight was eventually cancelled due to a problem with the caterers supplying foods/drinks for the flight. Such circumstances are not out of the ordinary. What is out the ordinary is that the economy class passengers were told that hotels around Kloten, Zurich are fully booked and that we will receive an 'overnight pack'. So here we having to sleep in Zurich Airport with some low quality 'blanket' from 23H00 till 6H00 the next morning. I have a wife and two year old.

We took the next flight at 9H00 the morning, only to be advised one hour into the flight that there is 'contaminated cabin air and as a safety precaution, we need to return to Zurich. The captain of the flight advises that the WLAN will be switched off to prevent passengers from communicating to the media (the captains words). Arriving at Zurich Airport, all of a sudden +200 hotel rooms are all of a sudden available!

Although I do not have the ins and outs of what went on behind the scenes, it seems that Swiss Airlines is on a cost cutting expedition. The aircon on both flights were not working.auxiliary power issue. We received the cheapest 'blankets'. Although EU regulations make provision for hotel accommodation for cancellations. long delays, Swiss Air seems to ignore this. We received water and some granola bars for dinner in the airport.

When the passengers on these flights started to vent their anger and threaten to go to social media, all of a sudden we were good enough to receive hotel accommodation

title: Brilliant Service, food, great comfort!
review_text: I flew the airline from Geneva - Zurich Johannesburg. Had a great experience, good legroom, the was airline on time, the food was good, staff very polite and helpful. Would definitely fly the airline again.

title: Hoping for better on our return leg
review_text: Flew from Sydney to Madrid. Poor co-ordination of transport request for travelling with an 85year old and another passenger with severe tree nut  NOT legume (that is peanut allergy). Although having tried to advise airline prior to travel there was no special menu available for our anaphylactic flyer although she could have a "bland mean" or a Kosher meal or vegan meal or whole range of other meals but not a nut free one?! It was a code share flight with Cathay and Swiss Air but no communication between the airlines. Very disappointing- the ineternal macchinations are not the passengers' issue this is an airline administrative matter. Anyhow at no point was the between flight travel assistance for my 85 year old mother evident to her, myself or savvy 16 yr old travelling with us. Hopefully I will be ale to tell a different tale on our return leg from Madrid to Sydney via Singapore with Swiss Air this time a code share with Singapore airlines. The return sector is business class not economy as on the route to Europe.

title: Extremely hot. Not enough food for everybody.
review_text:
The most annoying thing about this flight was the heat! AC was out of control! My shirt and shorts were pure sweat! I had to change clothes half way because it was disgusting traveling that way.

Leg room is OK. Seat keeps inflating and that kept waking me up and that was really annoying.

Movies are somewhat nice but they don't give you any KB to use the Wifi (like Iberia).

The person taking diner orders was really anti social and was showing he was extremely annoyed. He was complaining that everybody wanted fish.

Toilets were clean to a certain extend.

They don't have a line for business check in. Boarding business and coach are separated but the result mess is nearly the same.

Food and beverage WOULD be good if they had it. When it was our (mine and wife) time to order food, we couldn't choose because they didn't have any left of our options.

title: Swiss at its best
review_text: Punctuall leaving Zurich and punctually arriving in Singapore after 11 hrs 45 minutes, this was a SWISS flight as you expect them to me. Great lounges, smooth boarding, and personalized service on board. Example: Swiss offers the quick meal service for those wanting to sleep immediately, but I did not like the dishes on offer, and asked for quick service of the normal meal, starter only. No problem and I was asleep an hour after take off.  Staff was friendly, helpful and had a sense of humour, luggage delivery as it should be : premium travellers first.

title: Nice experience on a quick trans-atlantic flight
review_text: The business class cabin was full, yet, the flight attendants efficiently and quickly got the drink and meal service underway.  No complaints with either.  The biz class seats are in a staggered configuration and the foot-well space was a little tight, but OK.  I was able to get 5 solid hours of sleep.  My only two complaints were they only offered a cold breakfast, which seems a bit lacking in business class; my second complaint was upon waking, they had blocked one of the two business class lavatories exclusively for crew use.  When you have 45 people waking up and preparing for landing, blocking one of the two lavatories is just plain dumb.  So, overall I would give it a 7/10.  Food was good.  Bed was acceptable, End of flight bathroom situation was unacceptable.

title: Everything on this flight was excellent.  the crew, food, drinks, etc.
review_text: Could not have had a better flight.  After a flight with Canadian Air going over to Budapest, this flight was certainly welcomed.  Canadian Air was not my favorite airline.

title: Top
review_text:
Our Swiss Air experience was brilliant. 
Where to start? Comfy, excellent, personal yet professional service. 
Tasty and adequate meals. 
I could go on...

title: Nice flight
review_text:
The company provides a good service at airport and onboard of the aircraft.
The crew is polite and helpful but the ground handling is the problem. My bags reach Tromso just in next day.

title: Very enjoyable, totally relaxed on a long flight
review_text: Swiss airline were very kind and helpful,plenty space on the aircraft, food and entertain ment very good, I would fly with again.

title: DO NOT FLY SWISS!
review_text: Do not fly Swiss!   Their customer service is horrendous and not willing to work with you. Go elsewhere

title: Good Hospitality but food, seating & entertainment bad
review_text:
I travelled Air Swiss from Mumbai to Zurich and then Zurich to JFK. I found the hospitality very good. They make you feel at home. However, seats are cramped, food not up to the mark and inflight entertainment absolutely bad. As it was code sharing with LH, I was forced to compare where LH scores on almost all counts and is my favourite airline.
V Shankarnarayan

title: Good flight and almost on time
review_text: Check in was OK, but personally don‚Äôt like the self check in option but it meant we only had to bag drop which was quick.  We boarded on time but had to wait half an hour before we took off. We were all given a chocolate before take off and just. Before landing. Also included was a snack, cheese or meat roll and a complimentary drink,soft or alcoholic.  Leg room was good and the cabin crew were friendly and efficient. Landed at Manchester only five minutes late so result all around.

title: One of the best
review_text:
Swiss is for me just HOUSE :-) of course you will not find the same "luxury service" like Emirates or Qatar, but believe me Swiss is reliable, food is good, planes Always clean and the entertainment really good

Crew very friendly, check-in easy

Sometimes you find extremly good offers online!

title: Great lounge at E gates
review_text:
This is the second time I‚Äôve visited the Business Class lounge in Zurich at E gate for Zurich- Montreal flight. 
I thought this time I should review it. 
The lounge is a couple of years old. It‚Äôs modern and bright, and there‚Äôs lots to offer. 
There is a nice seating area with plenty of charger space. 

The first time, we arrived for the dinner hour and had I think a stir Frye at the Srit fry station. This time, it was before noon so was an omelette bar. Either way, the made to order food was great!

There‚Äôs a large coffee/ expresso/cappuccino/got chocolate station, a candy station, and a freezer full of ice creams. 

Washrooms are very clean. 

The in flight service on Swiss in Business class (international) is really good and is one of the best I‚Äôve experienced. And of course the service ends with the provision of gourmet Swiss chocolates from Sprungli.

title: Good value-for-money and in-flight experience, ground staff not as good
review_text:
The great:
The flight itself was great: the food was excellent, the drink selection was good and the cabin crew were friendly and personal (even in light of the fact that the business class cabin was quite large for a European flight and fully booked). There was plenty of legroom for a European flight and the cartoon shown on the screens was adding an entertaining g background ambience. Although I only had a very short connection from a delayed flight into Zurich, my checked luggage was successfully transferred onto this flight. I was positively surprised that the priority tags on the luggage really did seem to have an effect and that Swiss‚Äôs airport operations at Zurich were very efficient in this respect.

The not-so-good:
Boarding at Zurich airport was rather chaotic and it almost seemed as if the gate staff had never handled this procedure before. It was as if everyone was pushing onto a local bus service; gate staff were timid and did not take control effectively of the situation.
The flight was also delayed (as were many flights that day at Zurich). The captain told us that this was because of weather/wind-related capacity restrictions at Zurich airport, which according to the captain, were rather common. This is certainly something to bear in mind when choosing a connecting flight with Swiss on this route via Zurich.

title: Perfectly organised baggage drop off
review_text: We flew in the morning, arrived to airport with train. Just couple meters from train platform we were able to drop off our baggage, and then immediately proceeded to security upstairs. Very useful, especially when you travel with lot of baggage.

title: Good Flight
review_text: My flight to Zurich was okay. I started out in Miami and the baggage service was average, however, the lady who handled my baggage at Miami literally threw my plastic suitcase on to the conveyer belt. The plane was an Airbus A340 which was a bit old but a large aeroplane with 4 engines. The service was okay, nothing too special, the food was about average and didn't think it was good. The IFE system was a bit outdated and had very little new movies. Overall, I got to Zurich alive so I was satisfied that I was able to burn some time which made the flight shorter for me.

title: Good experience
review_text: Pretty good in-flight cabin service. Good food by airline food standards (and they gave me Evian Water). Good selection of movies and games.

title: confortable even though full
review_text:
Swissair offer good space in economy and manage the overhead baggage well.  The first leg was full but it was an easy load and pushback ontime.  

Be aware that hand baggage limit is 8Kgs which is lower than mainstream competitors like BA so their basic fare will be a challenge to pack for a week, but having a checked bag makes it easy 

Breakfast roll was low quality but still providing free beverages

title: Carry on bags only
review_text: Flew Swiss airlines from London City airport to Belgrade. The connection in Zurich was easy on the way over but both flights were delayed. The return flight was delayed into Zurich and I only just made the London flight. This flight was then turned around due to a mechanical fault. The only flight on offer was to Heathrow that evening. This flight was also delayed and I found once at Heathrow and after 2 hours at pasdport control that my luggage was lost. Once a lost luggage form was completed the underground was closed for the night so I had to navigate the London night buses until 3.30am. I would chance this flight again to avoid the chaos of Heathrow but would do it with no checked luggage. My bag is currently at Heathrow and will hopefully make it to me in Australia.

title: Ok
review_text:
We had heard many good things about Swiss but found economy to be pretty typical 
Seats were small, but plenty of refreshments were offered, though food was just typical "airplane food"; looks like they do a lot more for upper classes.
We had ordered a children's meal but they decided to fuss over the family in front of us (with obnoxious kids who wouldn't stop getting up) and told us they were out of kids meals
Not timely on the return flight and we taxied forever because we were late getting in.
Plane was clean and pillows and blankets were offered
Not sure why they had euro headphone jacks on the way there but standard on the way home (annoying since we had then bought adapters)

title: Starving passengers and lying to them !,,
review_text: Our flight fron Nice to Zurich on conecting flight to Moscow was delayed for more than 2 hours... arrived at airport Nice at 17:00 to catch flight that was scheduled for 19:00 ... they keep postponing it and finaly at 21:20 we take off to Zurich... in Zurich i lost my flight to Moscow that was suppose to take off at 21:25...airplane BUSINESS clas was a joke !!! We landed at Zurich at 22:20 ...at the airport they rebook my flight for next day and provide me with hotel voucher with dinner and breakfast... but there goes surprise ..hotel restaurant closes by 22:00 NO FOOD IN HOTEL ...no ROOM service ...so from 17:00 till next morning on DIET flying business class Swiss air you can lose waight or have serious problem like me with my diebetis !!! If you wand to starve FLY Swiss air !!! NEVER AGAIN ..why they lied to me that they provide dinner and breakfast if this is not true ???  LYERS !!! Hotel staff offered some good forbids food remains to eat...it looks like i am hamster or what !!! NO ROOM service afterr 22:00 !!!

title: Horrific customer experience for hundreds
review_text: The flights were not the issue.  The 6 hours standing in a transfer line with hundreds of other travelers highlights a company that has serious problem with unscripted events.  Travelers appreciate weather delays are a part of flying and in most cases will understand the airlines are making the best of a bad situation.  This airline made matters exponentially worse than they should have by providing very little information or misleading statements at every opportunity. The worst customer treatment I've ever seen from any company regardless of industry.  This flight was missed and had to be rescheduled for the next day.  Many of my fellow travelers on that 6-hour line indicated Swiss Airline will be a last resort booking if they‚Äôre even considered at all.   Would love to book Swiss again as the flights were good.  I just don't trust them enough to actually do the simple things to get me on the flight.

title: great experience.
review_text: We flew with 3 children on a long flight. The staff was helpful and friendly. We really enjoyed. The plane was also very comfortable. looking forward to our return flight with them.

title: Used to be a lot better....
review_text: Swiss used to be our favourite airline. Classy, clean aircrafts, polite stuff - just marvelous "Swiss" experience. However, the seem to have scrapped complimentary  croissant/ beverage. In their defence, the still  so provide complimentary water and chocolate. They also seem to have copied all the atrocious North American airlines (and the lowest of the low of Europe - Ryanair) in splitting up customers /families just to milk them for more money. Sorry Swiss, you've gone down in our estimation..

title: Longer delays than the flight time
review_text: The trip was terrible. We had 1 hour delay from Nice to Zurich, where circling above Zurich for 30 min due to strong wind, which made it a bit shaky. Many people asked what will happen to their connecting flight. Cabin crew members shouted that we should not ask, they know nothing. Fortunately, the connecting flight became delayed by more than two hours. Overall, we had more than 4 hours delay for a flight time of two hours. The explained that it was due to the strong wind. On the way back we had no wind at all, thus they made it with only 3 hours delay. We arrived back only after midnight. At the Zurich airport they refused to sell us water for Euro currency. In the heat, with nothing to drink, no information it became really hard to wait. Constantly unfriendly cabin crews and only very rare information from cockpit.

title: First longhaul Swiss
review_text:
I flew economy on Swiss from Zurich to Montreal on an A330-300. 

The experience started off with a disappointing wait at passport check at the gate, which one finds in many airports in Europe. There were two lines, and the other line was processing passports efficiently. However, in my line, an indifferent agent took ages to get her act together, and when she finally started to take passports, she only gave me a blank and cold look. 

The seats on this aircraft are really tight. I am not that tall (170 cm short) and yet the distance between my knee and the front seat was ~5 cm. I cannot imagine how taller people would feel. 

The controller for the IFE is in the armrest, and they have a hole in it to allow the controller to be visible. However, this hole makes the armrest uncomfortable. 

Food was not bad. Not great, but good for economy. 

Service was ok, but I felt a difference from the Swiss intra-European flight I took earlier, which was very warm but professional. 

In short, not bad, but in the future, I probably would avoid economy in a longhaul Swiss flight.

title: first Swiss
review_text:
I flew economy on a Swiss A319 for an intra-European flight. The aircraft was slightly aging, with no IFE on the seats, and small screens at the front. I also noticed some crumbs on the seats while I settled in. 

I snagged an exit row seat, which seemed to have more legroom than other seats. The 15 cm distance between my knee and the front seat made it comfortable. 

Aside from the old aircraft, the service was very good. The cabin crew were very professional but warm and polite.

title: Easy flight
review_text:
Gracious cabin crew constantly on the move to ensure the guests are well taken care of. Menu acceptable; seats roomy and at the push of a button positions range from  sit up to laying down. Towels, when passed, were tepid to cool rather than warm. Entertainment channels offer a good mix. 
Flight from LAX to Tel Aviv was via Zurich. Airport clubs a must to take advantage of. Wheel chair was requested . Wait was inevitable.

title: Swiss style travel
review_text: Flyed from Naples to Zurich and transferred in Zurich to JFK. Both flights were ok. First plain was a little late and I was worried about because we had only 55 minutes to transfer in Zurich. The nice touch was a ‚Äúbusiness class only‚Äù bus taking us from the plain to the terminal, so we did not have to wait for all the people in economy. Passport control was packed with people, however it went fairly quick. Zurich to Jfk flight was on A 330 airbus; plain was not new but very very clean, service was very good, food was just ok this time around as well as selection of wines.

title: The most disgusting flight ever.
review_text:
Despite the flight was delayed about 30mns to Oman, the aircraft hasn't been cleaned at all ! Food on the floor, pillows clearly been used, earphones not replaced, blankets all over, a total mess ! The crew was nice though.
Schocking !!!

title: Very nice flight
review_text: We always fly with Swiss because they have a reputation for safety, cleanliness and being very organized. Didn‚Äôt disappoint again on this occasion. Nice touch having Swiss chocolate onboard!

title: Great, efficient service from check-in to landing
review_text: Although only a short flight, the travel experience with Swiss was great. Although it was an extremely busy day at Brussels airport, Swiss check-in was fast and efficient although there had been a technical glitch with my reservation not allowing online check-in. Airline representatives were very helpful and friendly. The in-flight service was great, nice food and drink selection for such a short flight. Upon landing there was a separate business class bus bringing passengers to the terminal, so being parked away from the terminal was no inconvenience. Highly recommended airline.

title: Nice Flights; Chaotic Airport
review_text:
First of all, the individual category ratings below will not register, as is the case with all Trip Advisor Reviews.

Flew from Barcelona to Venice via Zurich whilst on a holiday. The flights were excellent, good food and air crew service. Amongst the best food on a European short haul flight I have had. First Flight 1953 to Zurich, then another hour‚Äôs flight on 1662 to Venice.

Due to overcrowding at Zurich Airport, over worked and a prey to strong winds, we did not leave Zurich until after the flying Get was due to arrive in Venice. Just boardedcand then sat in the plane at the terminal at the prey and whim of an overburdened flight tower. Awful and spoiled the whole experience for me. Swiss International were great, just avoid Zurich Airport like the plague. A disaster.

title: Just lie the swiss watch
review_text: Just like a Swiss watch: always on time and always tight - unfortunately for me - the legroom. But is good to fly with them.

title: flight attendant was rude
review_text: Well, my daughter was walking to the bathroom and there was a flight attendant who bumped into her which is totally fine. But then, as she was walking back, a flight attendant had a tray in her hand and my daughter went to move out of the way but, instead YOUR FLIGHT ATTENDANT ended up legit pushing her into the bathroom. I have never seen such disrespect on an airline before.

title: Best airline trip I've ever taken!
review_text: Efficiency, competency and genuine care for the customer, that's how I define the service on Swiss Air. I have flown to and in Europe numerous times, and also across the U.S., and my flight from Zurich to Chicago O'Hare was the best one I have ever taken. Not only were meals served promptly, but the food was flavorful, and the menu choices obviously put together with care. We even were given beverages every 3 or so hours, along with snacks. On top of that, they brought warm cloths to clean up with before deboarding. I didn't expect all this pampering! My husband said, "Why get off? Can't we just keep flying?" This was Economy Class, BTW.

title: Another pleasant flight
review_text:
It was a very pleasant C class flight with Swiss. Sat on 14K which is unusual but who cares at the end of the day when the whole crew does a great job. 

I like flying Swiss. To TLV it‚Äôs the only option for me.

title: This is service
review_text:
Swiss is swiss:) This is one of the reasons why I prefer to fly with Swiss. Customer first.
Online - at the Zurich airport and in the plane. No overbooking, good food, clean and fresh.

title: Excellent all round
review_text: Everything went well on both our outward and inbound flights.  Both were spot on time and all staff were polite and happy.  Breakfast was a croissant and drinks and was included in the ticket, we didn't have to pay extra for it.  On our return we were offered a choice of sandwiches and drinks. It reminded us of 'the good old days of British air travel' when you didn't have to pay extra for food, luggage etc but this was Swiss travel and it puts some of our airlines in the shade. No inflight entertainment but as the flight was only 2 hrs ish that wasn't a problem.  We'd definitely go with them again.

title: Wonderful service, great flight
review_text: Our first time in business class, travelling with friends and a baby. The staff were very helpful and the aircraft seemed quite new. Views of the Alps were terrific.

title: Very Bad don't bother
review_text:
Old antiquated planes, very cold on board with paper thin blankets.  Was so cold that I became sick and spoiled my holiday.
Staff only interested in business class passengers.
I wanted to purchase an item from they magazine and they didn't get back to me?
Lost my luggage transfering from one Swiss flight to another Swiss flight.  They gave me no help at all with this or any other questions i posed.  They just didn't care.  
As a result i suffered financial costs and stress as was going on a 3 week cruise with no clothes.  It was cold and raining in england and i had no warm clothes.  Became very sick.  No one would help me contact the luggage delivery man.  
Boarding gate numbers were hard to locate and nearly missed my connecting flight.

Paid for extra leg room but when i got on plane was given standard seat with no leg room.  this happened on two flights and currently seeking refunds.

title: Good Service
review_text: Make sure you get to the airport way in advance. The checkin lines are long in economy. The service at the counter is great. Give them a smile and you get that back...no need to complain... I got a great seat at the exit row and enjoyed this comfort in economy. There always seemed to be food and drink available. I would fly Swiss Air again.

title: Swiss airlines good to fly with
review_text:
Great flight, good flight attenders, good food with complimentary swiss chocolates. Nothing to complaint at all. Would recommend to add good collection of movies though.
Would love to fly with them again.

title: Great Service and Plenty of Food
review_text: Both ways, from Miami to Zurich and our return, were wonderful flights. Because of weather, we had to land in Ft. Myers on our return but that was not Swiss International's fault, of course. Our service in both flights was wonderful. We had friendly, multi-lingual flight attendants who were more than accommodating. Even when a customer in the seat in front of me had an issue with his food (he was being obnoxious and had not pre-ordered a special meal), the flight crew and the supervisor tried by all means to help him out. My friend and I sat in 35AB and we had our own space to spread out. Although we always wish there was more leg room, it was adequate. What I think distinguishes Swiss Air above most of the rest is the plentiful and delicious food. We never went hungry, as they were always passing out either a snack, an entr√©e or lunch (on our return). They also passed out ice cream, chocolates and to wrap it all up, a hot towel service. I have flown Swiss before and would continue to do so. Highly recommend.

title: Great service, good food, very pleasant attendants - foot room not so postitve
review_text:
We flew from Zurich to Boston.  Great service, good food, very pleasant attendants made for a nice trip.
We paid for extra leg room on the flight and got it however there was this box under the seat in front of us that severely hampered room for my right foot.  My wife had a similar issue with this box on the flight to Zurich and she wasn't so happy either.  This was very uncomfortable and a minus for an otherwise comfortable flight.

title: heavily delayed (airtraffic control restrictions) but most crew members on board were friendly
review_text:
On Tuesday evening 26 June I took LX735 from Amsterdam to Zurich. Departure was delayed by roughly 1 hour and 20 minutes due to late arrival of the aircraft (which was due to delays on earlier flights of this aircraft (HB-IOK, A321-111) which was caused by congestion and air traffic restrictions in parts of the European airspace that day. Boarding took rather long and I think part of the problem is that legacy airlines, such as Swiss (and many other European airlines) have all adoped (many elements of) the low-cost model and included several types of economy tickets, whereby hold luggage is not included in the tickets at the lower end of the spectrum. So even though there are restrictions on what passengers can take with them as hand luggage, if there are too many passengers bringing on board the maximum carry-on luggage allowance, there is just not enough space in the overhead bins. This causes additional delays. 

The aircraft cabin was clean and looked relatively new/fresh (despite the age of this aircraft which is somewhere between 19 and 20 years, according to airfleets), so it seems that Swiss takes good care of their aircraft (cabins). 

My seat (29D) was ok and legroom was sufficient. 

Despite delays, the flight itself only took 1h10, so less than the scheduled 1h30.

title: Very comfortable experience
review_text: Swiss air is a class act. Very attentive personnel. Water and beverages offered regularly. Food was decent and entertainment selection was very good. We enjoyed our flight experience.

title: Great service and great food
review_text: We got a new 777-300 as Plaine. M√∏re than enough legroom, adjustable headrest, earphones, blanket, cushion,... We had by far the best food we have had On a long haul flight. Both the gnocci and the chicken with lemonsauce were super. Also the starter and dessert we Very good. Far better than what you expect On a Plaine. We Also got plenty drinks and new movies. Just perfect !

title: Great service and a clean plane!
review_text: Swiss Airlines provided me and my friend with good seats, I had used my United Airline miles and when I called to get our seats, which we paid a minimal upgrade fee, we were able to get bulkhead seats which provided us with extra legroom. The customer service person was incredibly helpful and polite. The service on the flight was also positive and upbeat. And the best feature yet was that the plane was clean. There are so many times when I get on one of may US planes and they just are not cleaned..., so it feels cheap and a cattle car. So thank you Swiss Air for making it a nice trip.

title: Great flight
review_text: My flight was a great one. Seats had good leg room for me and the seats were comfy. Even managed to get a bit of sleep which is a hard thing for me to do! The crew were attentive and friendly.

title: Sweet chocolate and good service
review_text: We were 5 people and I didn¬¥t make a reservation for our seats prior to 24 hours. I did not want to pay extra, but it all worked out just perfectly. I made an online check-in 48 hours before because it was already open for online check-in (not the case with Lufthansa however). Pleasant flight with a good meal, M√∂venpick ice cream, swiss chocolate bars, free wine etc.

title: Very good service and rarely any delays, but could improve food on board
review_text: I travel with them usually on short distance, as I use more Delta or Singapore for long flights. They are quite easy to fly with when you purchase the option with carry on. No delays have I ever experienced with them, and always affordable prices.

title: Excellent flight experience
review_text: Great experience with full service on a wide body/twin aisle aircraft from Zurich to Tel Aviv with individual on-demand entertainment system, a full meal service (actually one of the best I've had in economy class in a while on any airline) and attentive cabin crew.

title: Never again!
review_text:
The most primitive arrogant staff I have ever encountered in my world travels.

Disorganization was the motto for this airline since the beginning of our travels in Europe.

Although we were flying in Businees/First , their behavior was below acceptable.

From: unfriendly attitudes, to boarding us in the wrong bus to the plane (Warsaw instead of Zurich).....to no desire to help as the plane was over 1:45 minutes late.....thanks SWISS yeap I missed my flight with Delta going back home.

title: Perfect chocolate,  cabin crew and service
review_text:
I really like the chocolate they served as snack ,  cabin crew was good and good service.

Except the flight condition , I think it was old plane fokker 200, i think it ok for short flights.  Like MUC to ZRH

title: Weekend away
review_text: Efficient and good value for money. Staff were friendly and courteous and helpful regarding baggage.

title: Worst travel experience ever
review_text:
The flight was supposed to fly from AMS to ZRH with 1.5 hour transit time to catch the next plane from ZRH to HKG. However the flight was already delayed for over 2 hours. Upon arrival at ZRH, the stewards all claim that we can still make it for the next flight and we should run to the departing gate. 
Together with another pair of travelers we tried to catch the flight, do note that there is a transit train in between the two gates and it was well over midnight by the time we arrived. After finally getting to the gate, the plane was still there but the gate was closed and the stewards refused us to let us on board. Nothing can be done and end of story. 

Then the transfer desk only option is either by Aerofloat (older plane so not recommended by service agent) Another option is through Delhi. Again 2 hours transit time and 2 hours delayed. Upon arrival went to the transfer desk and agent noted on boardingpass gate 14 and told us to run. After going through a ridiculous security check, we ran all the way to the west wing (20 min) just to find that the gate was incorrect and that we were supposed to gate 7 all the way to the east wing (another 20 min). As you can imagine that I was travelling with my elder mother for the first time, this was the worst travel experience that she can get. 

I am glad that the customer service of Swiss airline decided not to provide us any timely reply or adequate compensation, so we can determine and keep our promise not to travel again with this airline and not to recommend this airline at all

title: Limited ventilation and chaotic baggage pick up
review_text: On flight unbearable due to limited ventilation. The girl beside me got panic attacks and was given a paper bag with no other assistance. On landing, no info re baggage as it took more than 1 hour to clear customs. Had to join a long queue of passengers to get basic info resulting in the cancellation of my pick up. Will not fly this airline again if I had another chance.

title: Never again
review_text: What can I say. We left Melbourne v to Singapore. Great service and comfortable seats with Qantas. Unfortunately we had to change to Swiss air to travel to Zurich. What a let down. The staff were disinterested and bordering on lazy, but it‚Äôs the seats that really made it the worst flight I have ever had. After paying so much extra to upgrade to business class I expected to at least have comfortable seats. They are hard, small and when you try to lie down to sleep, well that is just worse. We had to fly back to Singapore with this airline, and whilst the staff were much better, the seats again, horrendous. Luckily Singapore airlines took us on the last leg and WOW. This is an airline that looks after their passengers. Take a leaf out of their book Swiss Air and get newer and upgraded facilities. Would never recommend this airline.

title: Great Airline even for a Short Flight
review_text:
We had a short 45 minute flight from Zurich to Luxembourg.  The plane was clean and the flight was on time.  Even for a short 45 minute flight, there was beverage service with Red and White wine.  And of course they brought out the basket of Swiss chocolates which are always a treat.

We have Star Alliance Gold so was able to board the plane first.

title: Pleasant flight in Economy
review_text: The staff was attentive, courteous and friendly.  The airlines provided blankets, pillows, multiple inquiries for needs (food, drinks etc.)  We were delayed for two hours on the runway in Zurich due to weather and they distributed snacks, drinks and provided access to in flight entertainment.  They also periodically kept us informed as to status of the delay.

title: A forgettable experience
review_text: The airplane was a old A330.  Seats were terribly cramped.  Food was not good. In flight service was not good.  In flight staff were standoff ish and arrogant.

title: Swiss Air - The worst airline...never again!
review_text: Swiss Air - Seat assignments not honored, gate personnel rude...reserved aisle seat and when got to airport I was moved to a middle seat. I am reporting as this is the third trip it happens...and last time.

title: Good airline
review_text: This was my first time flying with Swiss and I was very pleased with my experience. The worst part of the process was checking in at JFK. We were on line for over an hour and the ticket people kept grabbing people in the line to go on front of us. We got there 3 hours before and ended up only having about 45 minutes to get food before we boarded. Other than that our flight experience was pleasant. We had a layover in Geneva and it was a smooth and easy process to get back on board. The attendants were polite and attentive. The seats weren‚Äôt very comfortable for such a long flight and the meals weren‚Äôt good but they offered plenty of alcohol to make up for it. Would recommend to people.

title: Wonderful Caring service
review_text: Another great Swiss flight! Pillow, Blanket and earphones provided by the airline. Found that on the flight tracker channel they have 2 camera options to watch, forward and belly. You can have the view of the pilot or have the downward view of what we're flying over. It was great before we got too high and then as we started to descend I could see the icebergs in the water off the Canadian coast. Dinner was delicious as was the wine that I had with it. They offered coloring books and plane stuffed animals to the kids on our flight which I thought was a nice touch. The flight attendants were again wonderful! They also served ice cream as a snack and then to wake us up warm towels followed by a pizza pocket. They even made a flavored coffee for the guy next to me!

title: Great Service
review_text: Short flight from Switzerland to Poland but they still offered beverage service and had small  sandwiches complimentary. I had a free Swiss Beer, a water and a sandwich! Service was so friendly and they are so attentive! The swiss chocolate was a great treat too!

title: Non-stop attention in Economy!
review_text: Red eye flight to Europe. Arrived on board to have a pillow, blanket and headset at my seat. Shortly after take off they came around to offer beverages. Then the food service started. Two options for entree all of which included wonderful a wonderful swiss cheese and dessert. Wine, beer and spirits like vodka and baileys are complimentary. The flight attendant made all passengers adjust their seat backs so they were not in the lounging position during meals which was great it gave me more room. Food was very good, I even took an extra roll. I settled in to watch a movie which they offered plenty of. They also had TV shows, documentaries and the typical flight path and info channel. I awoke to them passing out warm washcloths just before the breakfast cart rolled through. I was shocked that they would offer us two meals! They gave me a bottled water along with my coffee and the person next to me asked for milk which they did not have on their trolley. She figured that was the end of the milk but 5 minutes later the flight attendant arrived with a small milk for her! I was thoroughly impressed with the airline!

title: Seating is great flight attendant service not so much
review_text:
Recently flew on Swiss Air as a partner to United Airlines.  The outbound business class service seating was great in both directions. The cabin service by flight attendants from LAX to ZUR was really great. They didn‚Äôt have special meal request correct and really worked to ensure I was well taken care of.
The problem came on the return back ZUR to LAX... business class service was terrible! Flight attendants were rude, rolling eyes if you requested ice with your water, tea or soda.  And absolutely no use when it came to meal time and this time I made sure special request went through.  Don‚Äôt understand how two flight crews in business class can be so different.  Beware if you fly partner airline of United via Swiss Air!!!!

title: Nearly bounced out
review_text:
I was bounced by Easyjet because of alleged thunderstorms. So why could Swiss fly in?
The automatic checkin was not very well signposted and I needed help to find it.
When I arrived at the gate staff were trying to buy people off the flight s it was overbooked. There was an unruly thumb. Especially as no one seemed to know how to queue.
There were arguments and some acrimony.
The flight was uneventful but not one that I will remember with pleasure.

title: Hard to fault
review_text:
A trip in Business Class from Zurich to Singapore on a Boeing 777-300ER.

Excellent friendly and efficient service, very good food, and good physical facilities ‚Äì seating 2-2-1 which worked out well. 

Very happy to travel with them again.

title: Uncomfortable flight
review_text: Airline seats are cramped enough these days. The cabin for this overnight flight was way too warm - to the point we were.so uncomfortable we couldn't sleep.  Service and food was good. computer monitors and entertainment selections were a plus.

title: Disappointing service
review_text: Very disappointed, expected more from Swiss air. On both inward and outward journeys our pre-booked paid seats were changed at 24 hours notice, too late to change. The visa machine was broken on the outward leg resulting in 200 Swiss francs having to be paid cash for a purchase. The refreshment trolley ran out of options early on. Not cheap at ¬£380 pp return!

title: excellent choice
review_text: Excellent choice to travel. Friendly, smiley and above all professional staff, nice menu and the air of safe make your trip unforgetable!

title: When did Swiss decide to become cheap like Easy Jet without the cheap tickets??
review_text:
The reason I don't fly Easy Jet is due to the seat size for my legs (5"11) and having to buy water and coffee. Now SWISS thinks ok to do the same without at least lowering their ticket cost. My mistake to maybe not have read about the change but on my trip to Athens I got a meal, water etc included in my ticket, but on the way back No. I somehow became Economy light rather than classic... no idea how this happened. Plus, the stewards have a smirk when they serve the guy next to you his complimentary "meal" (it looked horrible anyways) and just give you a glass of tepid water. I really don't care about eating plane food, it was only a 3hr flight. But the whole attitude about it, and the way they treated you was abhorrent.  
After that, Swiss (well Switzerland in general) is usually known for efficiency... we didn't get that as we were 40min was late, and late again. No excuses, no explanations, no apologies, Nada.
I used to fly Swiss a lot, but the new changes in the way the crew treats you, the ENORMOUS bins with the MINUSCULE screen. Plus now having to pay for a cup of coffee with an early morning flight. I'll look for any other ticket before I go back to Swiss.

title: Great service, new seats
review_text:
Nice new seats with very good food from Zurich.  (I felt that there was too little food offered from Bangkok to Zurich)

Service was really good too.

Entertainment is too little though.

Business and First should have some free wi-fi time.

title: Rude air hostesses
review_text: I travelled for first time with Swiss air, from Amsterdam to Zurich in the mid of June and my experience was not the best one. The crew was not polite at all. Next to me was seating an old woman who was not speaking German and English and 2 times she tried to tell the crew somthenig and they just ignored her. Really disappointed from the crew.

title: Love flying Swiss Air...great service and super efficient
review_text:
Flew to Vienna with my family for holiday and Swiss Air again did a great job.  Their service is great, food is decent and the whole trip was very efficient.  I love flying Swiss to Europe as I can usually book Business class for a reasonable amount.

Only real area that they need to work on is the business lounge in Chiacgo As it small and crowded.

Recommend Swiss!

title: Excellent
review_text: Very Good Airline. High standards. Been on this airline a few times and I can say that their service is excellent

title: Loose weight if flying economy
review_text: On A340. Had purchased seats with extra legroom but plane changed to the 340 . Very very tight seats and very very uncomfortable. 7 plus hours to Zurich were the worst. Zurich to Athens and return to Zurich easy flight but breakfast food was not very recognizable. Return to Boston plane was A330 far more comfortable. Service was very good and very Swiss

title: Perfect short flight
review_text: Perfect flight in the Swiss A330 with the new seat configuration which included 8 first class. The seat is comfortable and can go up to a flat bed. The eating/working table is very large and you have 3 hublots - a big difference with Business Class.

title: They will leave you on land and will blame you for it. It's great!!!!!
review_text:
I‚Äôm writing this for everyone to know the great airline and great customer service that Swiss Airlines offers, so that, this does not happens to any of you.

EVENTS
On Monday 21st of May, I had a flight with Swiss from Madrid to Singapore returning on
Thursday 24th :

‚Ä¢ Madrid -> Zurich
o Flight #: LX2033
o Terminal: 2

‚Ä¢ Zurich -> Singapore
o Flight #: LX176

So, I checked in at 17:30 at terminal T2 for my flight for Zurich.

When I was going to board the plane at 19:55 (it was quite late, the plane was delayed for over 40 min) I was told that I could not board that plane. The reason being:
‚ÄúWe have detected that you were going to miss your connecting flight due to the delay on this plane and
we have booked you a new flight at 22:30 to Dubai with Iberia and from there to Singapore. Therefore,
you should go downstairs - Room 6 - pick up your luggage from belts 11 or 12 and go to the Iberia counter at the T4 Terminal‚Äù.

The person from Swiss that actually told me this, wrote it down for me in my boarding pass and was ‚Äúnice‚Äù enough as to give me a voucher for 7 ‚Ç¨ on drinks for the trouble (attached pictures).

So, I decided to go downstairs to get my luggage and from there go to the Terminal 4.

After some 45 min of waiting I was able to retrieve my luggage and I went to the Iberia‚Äôs counter at
Terminal T4 as I was told, just to find out that, the girl from Iberia had absolutely no clue of what I was talking about. I asked her if Swiss might have booked the flight for me directly without her knowing and told me that: ‚ÄúThat is impossible since Iberia does not fly to Dubai‚Äù. So, she suggested that I should go to talk to Emirates in case Swiss had booked me with them.

I decided to go to the Emirates counter and I had the same response from the attendant there. She told me that:
‚ÄúSwiss had been sending people to Emirates for delays all day but that I had no reservation under my name‚Äù.

She decided to call Swiss in Terminal T2 and figure out what was going on. After some back and forth, it seemed I had a flight with Qatar Airways (?!?!?) at 22:35 but I was not able to take it since it already was 22:10.

The person from Swiss also notified the attendant from Emirates that she was finishing her shift and
that she was leaving for the day but that I could call the following numbers (they show on the boarding
pass picture written by the Emirate‚Äôs attendant):

‚Ä¢ 902 883 882 (Not available 24h)
‚Ä¢ + 49 6986 799 799 (24h)

So, I decided to call the second number to get some information and see any alternatives I might have
had, to my surprise this was the phone number for Lufthansa (?!?!?) and they told me there was nothing
they could do except give me the Swiss phone number:
‚Ä¢ 901 116 712 (Not available 24h)

After this, I decided to go home and call Swiss first thing in the morning. When I called them, I was told that, I needed to ask for a refund. But in order for me to do that, I had to call American Express (since I made the reservation with them and that there was nothing they could do). Also, they
mentioned to me that in order to get some sort of ‚Äúofficial explanation‚Äù I could use for work related
reasons I had to email them in order to obtain it.

So, after 1 month of waiting I was told that they just do not care and that they did nothing wrong and that if I want something that I should just involve my lawyers (which I will absolutely do) and I will publish the resolution for them to feel ashamed of themselves since they do not care about their customers and/or their reputation.

I recommend for you guys to never use them since I was lucky that I was left in Madrid and I could return home but I'm just afraid of what might have happened if I was left in another country where I did not have anyone or anything.

title: Excellent In-flight Service; Awful Tiny Seating Space
review_text:
Strike 1: Lufthansa, through whom I booked this flight, told me that I needed to be at the airport 3 hours ahead for this flight. So I arrived at 3:30am for my 6:30am flight.  However, the  Swiss Air employees do not arrive to check people in until 2 hours before the flight. So a group of other customers and I sat/stood there waiting at a painfully early time for the employees to arrive to check us in.
Strike 2: I got onto the plane in Athens to fly first to Zurich for a 6:30am flight. I asked the attendant for a blanket as it was cold. He asked to look at my ticket. He said, "No blankets for economy class." So I froze.
Strike 3: I changed planes in Zurich and got onto a brand new plane. I am a 5'5" tall woman, under 125 pounds with a small frame. My knees were knocking into the seat in front of me the entire flight (all 11-hours). Anytime the person in front of me leaned back or tried adjusting his seat, his chair hit my knees. It was painful and distracting. The slim 6' tall guy sitting beside me literally had to sit with his knees to the left and to the right and was spilling over into the other seats just to fit his legs. Embarrassing that the airlines have stooped so low as to provide clients with such an uncomfortable experience. 
Strike 4: The food was less than mediocre.
Plus 1: The staff were incredibly friendly and helpful--some of the best I've encountered.
Plus 2: The online entertainment worked perfectly with no delays, with exception to headphones that did not work but were immediately replaced by staff.
Plus 3: I asked for a toothbrush and eye-mask and was promptly provided with them. However, international flights used to include this on all seats upon arrival. 
Plus 5: The pillows and blankets provided were comfortable.
Plus 6: The actual seat itself felt comfortable; it was just entirely too close to the seat in front of it.

title: Worst experience on an international airline in my 45 years of flying in Africa.
review_text: Because I fly to Africa frequently (for the last four decades), I have flown on many major airlines including United, Delta, South African Airways, Virgin, British Airways, Air France, and Lufthansa -- and even years ago on Pan Am and TWA.  All my experiences with those airlines was either good to excellent.  So I was looking forward to flying on SWISS AIR for the first time.  What a miserable experience I had last week flying from Johannesburg to Zurich.  A real torture trip on an ANCIENT Airbus that had the tightest seating of any plane I've ever been on.  I even paid $40 for choice of the worst seat I've ever had on an airliner. The entertainment system still used remote controls that seldom worked. The food was laughable.  My dinner was boiled pasta with a dollop of red sauce.  I kid you not!  Breakfast was one crescent roll with two pieces of cheese. (They gave you one little piece of Swiss chocolate as a token).  The crew was very friendly, so it's not their fault that the company goes CHEAP.  Maybe they're improving from what I've read of other reviews, but avoid SWISS AIR on the Johnnesburg to Zurich route.  And the trip was 10 hours of misery.  Everyone was grumbling about the pathetic so-called dinner and ridiculous "breakfast" and torture seats.

title:
Lack of information 
Unprofessional
review_text:
I have taken a flight at the airport they advised us that the flight will be delayed by 1h no reason given 
Afterward we have been advised flight cancelled rebooked on a following day flight 
They told us that compensation will be given as per European law and they could not take us what it‚Äôs the issue 
But when you apply they reply negatively and telling it‚Äôs an exception of the law as engine failure 

When you ask to take report to prove their claim 
They are ignoring you 

Not taking your customers for fools and not lying to them will be a great start

title: Excellent services as always
review_text: Swiss International Airlines provide always state of the art services. Kind staff, clean cabin environment, and tasty snacks

title: Singapore to Zurich - Amsterdam, and London to Zurich - Singapore
review_text:
My experience with Swissair has been nothing but fantastic. The flights were on time, the cabin crew excellent, and the entertainment adequate. 

I would like to give a big shoutout to Beatrice and the team on flight LX176, on the 20th of June. This for me really defined Swissair from the previous airlines that I have flown on. 

I was originally assigned an aisle seat when I checked in at Heathrow, and when I was in transit at Zurich, I tried my luck asking the gate attendant if a seat at the front row was possible as I got a really bad cramp from the previous flight. He told me yes, and changed our seats, but to my horror, he had assigned me a seat right in the middle of the plane, nowhere near to the front, nor an aisle! I highlighted this upon entering the aircraft, and this is where Beatrice's professionalism came in.  

She tried valiantly to find us a seat at the front, but when it was not possible (again the gate attendant should've just said no), I grumpily sat in the middle, mentally promising myself to write a 0 star review for Zurich Airport. She could have easily left it as that, but she continuously spoke to other passengers, and eventually found a passenger who was willing to move (as he was travelling alone), and shifted me to the aisle seat. 
That really made the flight for me, changing my entire experience. 

A huge thank you to Beatrice and the team for taking care of this grumpy old man. 

Disclaimer - I am a rather large person, hence when possible I always ask for an aisle seat/front row seat if possible. My displeasure only arose from the fact that the gate attendant pretty much screwed everything up.

title: It is all about the seat in Business Class.
review_text:
Since I often travel on Lufthansa flights back and forth to the US, trying Swiss in Business was a nice variety.

I arrived at the airport with plenty of time to spare and check-in was done in a rather fast manner. I headed through security, which was also done pretty fast, which is unusual at LAX. I went straight to the Star Alliance Business Class lounge and enjoyed the outside terrace. 

At check-in, I was awarded seat 17K, a seat in the very last row of the Business Class cabin. At first, I thought "I don't want to sit all the way in the back", but it was good choice. I booked the flight on the morning of departure and didn't get a chance to preselect a seat. So, I got one of the throne seats with not paying an additional fee. Usually, Swiss charges a fee if you select one of those seats. 

As for the seat: the throne seats have plenty of storage space since they have a console to both sides of the seat. While it is nice to have so much storage space, the seat gives one a little bit the feeling as if you are sleeping in a coffin. The space around the shoulders is great, though. Despite that mixed review, I managed to get a good night sleep. 

The flight attendants on that particular flight were friendly, but not really engaging. When i ordered a tea, I had to wait for more than 30 minutes to get it. Also, the meal service was done from carts rather than bringing out the tablets individually. The dinner service started from the front of the cabin, which made the bathrooms inaccessible during that time, since the carts were blocking the aisle. Lufthansa does a better job on their meal service. Breakfast service started almost two hours before landing, which I thought, was way too early. 

The entertainment selection was great and Swiss opted to install decent screens on their Boeing 777-300ER. Since I always use my own set of headphones, I cannot judge the provided headphones. 

Overall, I think Lufthansa does provide better food and better service on their flights, but Swiss shines in two areas: I prefer their business class seat over Lufthansa's and connecting in Zurich is much easier than in Munich (soso) or Frankfurt (horrible).

title: Late and late
review_text: We left for Copenhagen via Zurich from Florence. The first flight was delayed by 35 minutes which left us with barely enough time to make The connecting flight which did board on time. We then sat on the plane for an hour before we could take off- late again - twice in one day.

title: A Comprehensive review of  SWISS / EDELWEISS Airlines overview of flights between Costa Rica and England via Zurich rate
review_text:
A Comprehensive review of  SWISS / EDELWEISS Airlines overview of flights between Costa Rica and England via Zurich rated on a scale of 1 ‚Äì 10 , 1 being Terrible , 10 being excellent .
Punctuality.
We used four flights on this particular trip with Swiss Air or its share code partners , of which NONE were on time according to the schedule , an average of 1 hour late on all of the flights with NO real explanation given.
However it is blatantly obvious that the reason for this is down to bad organization , bad management and planning . Rating  5/10
Quality of Service .
We had never flown via Swiss Airlines previously and probably will never do so again as the experience was NOT good , having previously used British Airways , Air France , Iberia ,and Klm we would certainly chose any of these before using Swiss Air the reasons will be mentioned in this report . 
Our first bad experience was an email request to Swiss Air for assistance about our booking ,we NEVER had a reply to our request even 14 days after it was put in the only reason we ever did get an answer was because I obtained the email directly to Swiss Airs CEO.
Swiss Airs customer service is located in Fiji believe it or not and they obviously have zero interest in replying to customer enquiries , probably the worst customer service we have ever seen for a service industry provider .
On board the aircraft the service you will receive at best can be described as average you as basically treated as cattle in economy class , probably a little better in economy plus or business .
BEWARE OF HIDDEN COSTS . NO free alcoholic beverages in economy class you will be charged for a beer or glass of wine with the SMALL meal you will receive and the average cost is around $10 per drink, all of the other mentioned airlines offer alcoholic beverages as a courtesy to their customers. Rating 3/10.
Comfort on Board and hidden extra expense in Economy Class .
BE WARNED for a long haul flight the seating setup is probably the most uncomfortable we have ever experienced on any long haul carrier .
The seats are much smaller than other airlines we have used in the past , the seats are very tight and small little of no room to move and we are only small bodied people 1.64 and around 70kgs .
The seats are only just big enough to sit in , very  very close together I would estimate around 5cm space between your knees and the rear of the seat in front of you I.E. zero leg room very tight fit .
Your seat will only recline around 8cm therefore you are basically upright , however when the person in front  of you reclines their seat you will be boxed in no room to move .
To be able to consume the small average quality meal you will receive no choice offered ( usually you will get 2 options but not here ) you will be expected to perform a contortion act to be able to consume your food .
Although the aircraft are new and clean the comfort level in economy class is extremely bad and we would not recommend it . Rating 3/10 

Hidden Extra Costs Involved using Swiss .
BE WARE .  If your baggage is just slightly overweight 23kgs max you will be charged an excess baggage fee of approximately $200 per suitcase , most other airlines make allowances for a little extra weight on long haul flights NOT Swiss .
Also as previously mentioned only soft drinks are free in economy class , a beer or glass of wine with your meal will cost on average $10 each .
Because of the terrible seating configuration in economy class you will be offered the chance to upgrade to economy plus or business , the average cost for economy plus is $120 per person , business a little over $400 per person  , it appears the configuration is set this way to obligate larger framed people to pay the extra cost to up grade .
This would then mean that you make no real saving on Swiss Airlines slightly cheaper fares as in the end you will end up paying the same price as other carriers who offer a better more comfortable service with no extra cost  and whom are on schedule , please take these hidden extras into consideration before booking Swiss Air .
Also note that on board all though being a flight originating from a Spanish speaking area NO instruction‚Äôs on board are given in Spanish if you do not speak German or English you will have no understanding of what is being said over the on board speakers  I would consider this dangerous and maybe even illegal when coming down to safety instructions . Rating 3/10
Excess baggage charges .
We paid excess baggage charges for a suitcase that was approximately 4kg  over the weight limit , the cost of this was around $200 which we considered excessive but that is the rules with Swiss Air .
However when our luggage was delivered in Costa Rica my suitcase was completely destroyed , split open , missing contents , it is obvious that something very heavy had been put on top of it or it was ran over as even the metal supporting frame inside was all bent .
NO Swiss Air representative was on site so that I could make a claim or report  ( excellent customer service hahahaha ) 
Therefore we paid excess baggage for a case that was returned to us in an unusable condition , with items missing , I filled a report with Swiss Air via email with photographic evidence and now they state I will have to wait while they investigate , they had no problem charging me when the case was booked in but now I am out $200 excess baggage and around $400 for anew case and the personal items missing due to Swiss Airs  baggage  handlers they have to investigate  that goes to show you the type of service you can expect from Swiss Air . Rating 3/10
Overall Experience .
We would strongly suggest using any other carrier option rather than Swiss Air , as the service you will get is well below that of other carriers available to you .
Not something you would expect from the Swiss as usually their service and quality is of the very best and high standard however not the case with this airline .
Recommendation GIVE SWISS A MISS .

title: Outstanding service and comfort.
review_text: We took Swiss Air return from London City to Zurich and couldn't have been more pleased with both legs. The service was crisp and efficient as well as very respectful. I recommend this airline.

title: Mr Ronnie Chan
review_text:
I took your flight on LX388 on 3Jun 2018 ZRH TO LHR. We were four of us. On arrival to the boarding gate , we were surprised no staff was at the gate 50 minutes before the departure. We went into the boarding room and found the room empty and there was no plane docked at the gate. Smelling something not right I then checked the Screen and noticed a remark in a Swiss language that I don't understand. I checked with one airport staff and she said the flight is cancelled. Then I asked her what I should do since there is no LX staff. She gave me directions where to go. I had to clear immigration control myself and find my way to the transfer desk.
At the transfer desk was a long Q and no LX staff available to give assistance except the handling agent staff busy with their work. No information given to passenger about the flight cancellation . This is really chaos. Before that I had to pay for my excess baggage and the staff showed me direction to make payment. I had to walk a few hundred meters to another building to make payment. This is ridiculous making passenger very inconvenient and even then LX has separate counter for payment. One counter for cash payment and another one for credit card payment which is another distance. Never understand why LX is so disorganised . I will never fly again on LX not even in transit in Zurich. Is total chaos.

title: Disappointed
review_text:
Pros: punctuality, cleanliness on board, luggage delivered in reasonable time. 
Cons: (1)while asking for seats being next one another, our extra leg room seats (with extra price) were riassigned. We were not told that at the check in counter and nothing was done on board except for being given a name card to ask for reimbursement. We'll go through the process and we'll see. 
(2) average quality food, (3) NOT friendly staff. During the Night I stood in the area next to the kitchen for more than an hour to stretch and stand.  I was asked once if I felt OK, and then the staff simply draw the curtain for all the time and not engaged in a talk. Surprisingly they don't even ask if you want a drink or something. I CAN'T possibly say that they were friendly, warm or welcoming. Opposite feeling. Definitely a disappointing experience.

title: Top notch service.
review_text: Check in was efficient. Fast tracked through immigration. Nice lounge in terminal 2. On board the staff were superb. Food wasn‚Äôt substantial but the flight was only 55 minutes. Really enjoyed this flight and would consider using swissair again if travelling there.

title: Routine but professional flight, except for the horrible PA system
review_text:
This was a routine, short flight (1 hour).  For "food" we got a croissant and a soft drink. 
It was totally uneventful.  However, the PA system used by the pilot and the flight attendants was HORRIBLE: very loud and difficult to understand.  In 2018 it is possible to have a much better PA system.

title: Short flight
review_text:
Small AirPort, easy check-in. Outside the terminal is a nice bar with terras where you can eat something or enjoy a wine or beer while you can watch Some small plans

Boarding went fast. Only very anoying that they changed my seat. I wanten to be in front of the plane because a transfer. They had an excuse that because of the weight they changed my Seat. From 4 all the way in the back to 18. Later I saw that somebody else was sitting at my place. So bad excuse.

title: Good service
review_text:
Flown several times with Swiss the last weeks.
Overall a good service on board, professional and friendly.
Planes to Middle East are mostly very old and it's about time to replace them.
Lounges in Zurich are very good, great food and cold drinks

title: Well worth the upgrade
review_text: Once you have purchased an economy (Classic) ticket, Swiss offers the option to upgrade to Business Class for a flat fee (baggage allowance stays the same as on original fare). On flights within Europe, Business Class seats are much the same, but the middle seat remains unsold so this gives additional space. We felt this was a good choice because leg room on their flights is already ample compared to US airlines, and the upgrade allowed us to use priority check-in and security stations as well as the airport lounge.
