We also had a very nice Business Class meal on the flight. The original economy fare was quite reasonable, but the fee for checking an extra bag Euro64) seemed steep for a fairly short flight.

title: Very good service!
review_text: I have only good things to say about Swiss. We got very good service both on board and also in the airport. Swiss Air first class lounge in Z√ºrich was very nice and our experince on board was perfect.

title: Always my first choice of airline!
review_text:
We were flying to Naples via Zurich, from Birmingham. Check-in was very quick - we arrived early and there was no queue at all! 
As I was using a walking stick, we were given priority boarding and asked if I was able to cope with steps etc on the way to the plane, which was nice.
We boarded more or less on time but takeoff  was delayed due to French air traffic problems but we were supplied with water and a small chocolate bar while we waited. Eventually we took off about 50 minutes late. We were rather concerned as we only had a 45 minute slot to transfer in Zurich. There seemed little information and when we arrived in Zurich we assumed that we had missed the connecting flight. However on the transfer bus screen we could see the flight also listed as delayed/ held.  So a fast dash across the airport and we made it!  (Another time I think I would ask for assistance across the airport)
Flights were comfortable as always with onboard drinks and a snack included (unlike certain other airlines), a good allowance for both hold and cabin luggage, free seat reservations  available online when we booked.  Prices compare very well with other airlines which charge extra for all of the above!
We much prefer to fly from Birmingham even if we have to change planes, as it is much more convenient with easy access from M42, much better than driving a long way to Heathrow etc and Bristol has such poor access anyway.

title: Not bad, neither not good.
review_text:
We were flying on a strike day, so I'm going to ignore the delays around our flight (about 1 hour for take-off and 2 hours to check in our luggage) 

The plane was a really new Bombardier CS300 aircraft with really clean and 

The seats were really uncomfortable, like they were forced frontwards so they made a really straight L shape and when reclined, they adopted the angle other airlines qualify as "straight". The legroom was non-existing, I wonder what would happen in case of forced landing as putting your head against your knees was impossible, only a child would fit in that legroom comfortably. 

There wasn't either in-flight wi-fi nor film projection and staff was about average

We were greeted with a small bottle of water and a cold sandwich but any other drink or food would have to be purchased.

title: No nuts on a long haul flight
review_text: The Newyork to Zurich flight departing at about 6 pm in the evening did not serve any nuts alongwith drinks in business class, service of nuts in business class, I think is pretty much standard across airlines. On requesting the cabin crew was informed that they had none on board.. very surprising !!

title: As always an absolutely enjoyable flight
review_text: We got spoiled to the maximum. The food was superb, the wine exquisite and the service splendid. All in all a wonderfull way to travel.

title: Reliable and friendly, strange catering
review_text:
Do both flights were more or less on time (tiny delay due to a thunderstorm).  Flight fine, crew friendly

The onboard snack arrangement was wired, business class get fed and wine etc and that‚Äôs fine.  Some economy passengers get a sandwich, others do not.  I think it‚Äôs to do with how the ticket is booked.  We all got water and a chocolate so it was fine

All good really

title: Best service for cheap flights
review_text: We always try to travel Swiss Airlines, or British Airways when possible. On a short flight with Swiss, we get free coffee or tea or soft drink, a hot vegetable quiche or apricot tart, and a small bar of Swiss chocolate before landing. Usually on time, well organised and we feel safe and comfortable. Best airline for us.

title: The trip to Bangkok
review_text: I have heard abouth good service and good food, but it was not more then ok. The food boring have fish for main course the tast was poor and in the folder is say chees plate but only two small thing. The not ask one time if you like to have more wine or coffe, bread. After the dinner not ask if you like to have coffe and a stronger choice. I think is poor, You pay top money for the ticket.

title: First remains a top notch product
review_text:
Booked a first class ticket for my return flight, from Miami to Z√ºrich. The Swiss First Class product is top notch, there are always issues, but they are easily forgotten if you look at the overall experience. 

One of the issues is that Star Alliance strangely enough shares the lounge in Miami with the LATAM Airline group which is associated with the OneWorld Alliance. Service is good in the lounge but it's still a bit strange.

On board cannot complaint too much, other than that the lavatories are small in size and definitely not up to First Class standards. Food is great, although I took starters as I wanted to go to bed as soon as possible. Breakfast was very nice and plenty.

Only as of July 1st Swiss will also have chauffeur service like its parent company Lufthansa has. Otherwise, facilities are great, a very nice First Class lounge that you can use if your intercontinental flight was on First. Took a shower and had a short drink after which I caught my connection to Amsterdam

title: Superb international first class flight
review_text:
Fantastic in-flight experience with Swiss. Great seat and one of the better ones even among first class suites since I get crazy heartburn at night, and the Swiss product lets me find a comfortable slightly head-up position. Best part of the flight was the fantastic crew, who were attentive, super friendly, and genuinely warm. One of the best crews I've experienced flying in premium cabins. Contrast this to my recent Air France La Premiere flight where, despite being friendly, the flight attendants were just absent. Saw them very few times in the cabin, and my call bell remained unanswered such that I had to physically track them down in the galley to order dessert.

Food on Swiss was all right but nothing spectacular (surprisingly, BA catering still takes first prize for me on transatlantic flights because they source from Do&Co). The ground limo service for some reason did not materialize; I think they are just starting this up for the summer '18 season. Wouldn't hesitate to fly Swiss again, though dollar-for-dollar, BA First probably offers the best value since they are quite easy to book using AA miles.

title: Pretty good.
review_text: At first I was horrified when I saw the plane that we would be flying in. The plane held 80 passengers and had propellers. We had to be bussed out to the plane on the tarmac. The flight was actually run by Austrian Airlines, but we were booked through Swiss. To my absolute amazement it was a very pleasant flight. The crew were absolutely amazing and had a free food trolley that you didn't have to pay a cent for. I thoroughly recommend this flight and airline.

title: Flight cancelled with no assistance provided
review_text:
We booked our flights with Swiss, operated by Edelweiss air. Airline sent me email while we were on holiday that our flight is cancelled. Person at the airport told us they cancel and change flights all the time. Beware that if airline does so more than 2 weeks in advance, they have no legal obligation to cover any extra costs to passengers (except amount paid for ticket or alternative flight if there is one). We had to call them many times as well as parent company Swiss Air. Our schedule was not flexible and they refused to cover changes in connecting flights we had booked separately. We had to wait 1 day at the airport for our connecting flight to Zurich.

The food served on board Swiss air flight (we have taken instead) was one of the most disgusting I've seen, only matched by American Airlines probably. The photo shows small amount of slimy pasta served with white tasteless sauce (not cheese) and few bits of frozen vegetables. No herbs, no seasoning no good ingredients. Disgraceful meal has been defined. I estimate that the whole meal platter was prepared for about 2 CHF, or about 0.2% of the price we paid for our flights. 

Avoid this airline if possible. Swiss and all it's daughter companies are providing bad service for high prices and are desperately needing more competition from Zurich Airport. How many managers we have to feed with  money paid for flight tickets, when all is left for the food budget is about 2 CHF or so?

title: Not Happy!
review_text: We had this flight booked for over 9 months. We had two aisle seats for the entire time UNTIL we checked in. We received a window and a middle. I asked what was the reason and they could not tell me except, "things happen". I flew another airline 777 a month before and the seat configuration was 3-3-3. Swiss squeezed another seat 3-4-3. It was incredibly hot the entire time. Most passengers were using the safety cards as fans! I certainly hope that this is not the norm for Swiss Air but it is not a good first impression.

title: Fairly good for a short haul
review_text:
CDG-ZRH regular ecnomony in a Bombardier C 100/300

Aircraft clean and new-ish. Legroom good, but ‚Äúslim‚Äù seats not so comfortable  (no back support). No IFE. 

Star alliance lounge in CDG T1 quite small and unimpressive. No showers, no place to print documents, reasonable selection of food and drink for a small lounge.  

Swiss service good as usual.

title: Appalling customer service
review_text: We flew to Lisbon from London via Geneva today. Swiss Air lost our bags and seem unable to trace. Customer service passed on a number that no one answered and another agent suggested we should have packed more in our hand luggage. If that‚Äôs the best business travellers can expect. I‚Äôd advise booking with another airline

title: Swiss business class
review_text: Flying from Dar El Salaam home to Prague via Zurich with my wife have enjoyed the Business Class of Swiss Air, friendly personnel ,good choice of beverages and wines , and good choice of movies.

title: Pleasant surprise on European Airline
review_text: Very friendly, nice approachable and willing flight attendants with generous drinks, snacks and meal service. They don't usually serve hot meals on short flights and out of main meal times on long flights but when they serve hot meals, it was very good. Didn't expect this kind of good service but was excellent. Will definitely fly again with them. - Recently ditched membership on another well known airline. Swiss air is definitely a winner in terms of service.

title: Love the Airline and its hospitality
review_text: Swiss has one of the best service I have experienced. They take care of small things which passengers might need. Our holiday experience to Switzerland was so fantastic and it began with service of Swiss Air. For the price tag of a low cost economy seat, you get service at par with any full service carrier on a long haul flight.

title: Embraer190 ....
review_text: good that this flight only takes 35 minutes because what Swiss offers with these Helvetic owned E190's is NOT SWISS standard ... the seats are probably the most uncomfortable experience you can get ... un-ergonomic and no space for your legs ... try to avoid this Swiss operated transport

title: Comfortable flights
review_text: There was a very good offer to fly from Amsterdam via Zurich to Moscow (and back) during the period we wanted to visit Russia (May 2018). Everything went smooth: from booking the tickets, receiving confirmations, checking in, boarding, flights and transitions. Staff was friendly and efficient. Snacks during the flights were fresh and good (in view of the ticket price). Seats were OK, but did not bother us too much due to the short flights.

title: Large people warning
review_text: I am an average weight person of 140LBS and height of 5'5'  but Since Swiss introduced their 777 planes to their Zurich/San Francisco route, I have looked for other alternatives to Flying Swiss.  It is bad for me, so I can't imagine the torture larger people must endure.  Swiss believes if you have good entertainment on their flights and keep you busy eating you will not notice that they have shrunk everything.  The toilet is tiny, the aisles are tiny and the seats are tiny. So much so that you are strapped in with little space to move for over 12 hours, a practice that should be considered by human rights activists as travel torture. Not to mention that there so little leg room that when the seat in front sets back almost on top of you. How sad that with this Airline's push to make more money they would resort to treating their passengers so poorly.

title: Go the extra mile, Swiss!
review_text: On the whole all well, in spite of a delay because one handicapped passenger came with his motorscoot and it turned out the battery had to be dismantled for security reasons. These things happen. What should not happen is: a cluttered and random boarding procedure because the microphone was not working (so the old fashioned rush to the plane happened, instead of an orderly boarding with business class first); allowing too much bulky hand luggage onto the plane, creating havock once inside; and disorganized meal and drinks service as items like glasses did not fit the trolley. If other airlines can serve a full three course hot meal on a 1:10hr flight, then drinks and a plate of basically cold snacks should not pose such a problem.

title: Nice airline for a long distance economy flight!
review_text:
Economy air travel is unpleasant, no matter what airline you use. The seats are too small, the isles are too narrow, and everyone is packed in like sardines in a can. But since I can‚Äôt afford the business class option, I look for airlines with the best possible seating situations. 

I chose to travel on Swiss Air after reading very positive reviews. All of my flights were on time, the flight attendants were accommodating, and the seats were ok. The meals were actually pretty good and the Swiss chocolate was a nice touch. 

My only complaints: First,  is the very long layover in Zurich. Maybe it is because they only have one flight out of Zurich to Athens a day - but I am not sure about that. We did take advantage of the six hour layover on the flight to Athens by taking a train into old town and spending a couple of hours there. But on the return we just wanted to get home. 

Second, the weight limit for carry-on luggage is very low. It is approximately 17 pounds. I travel very light and only take a carry-one suitcase for trips. Even with a light weight suitcase, I still had to check my carry-on, requiring me to deal with collecting baggage after the flight.

title: Unable to sleep due to lack of space
review_text: The seat assigned had very little space to the seat in front of me which meant that: when the person in the front seat reclined it, the screen was less than 30 cm away from my face, the fixed metal box under the seat in front of me (no warning about it) was causing a continuous pressure on my leg, it was impossible to sleep and very difficult to move. I enjoyed the airline before, but this experience was pretty bad.

title: Disappointed
review_text: We paid Swiss Air a premium because of relatively quick transit time between Vancouver and Florence. It turned out to be anything but quick.  Endless delays missed connections etc. I could go at length but realize these things do happen when you travel. My disappoint comes from Swiss Air's complete lack of resources and strategy for dealing with these things. Particularly when their employees tell me they are common place. When you are 30 plus hours into what should have been a 13 hour trip you don't need to be told this common and asked what are you complaining about. My advice would be to give Swiss Air a pass and avoid any connections through Zurich. Likewise with the Florence airport which seems to have frequent wind issues preventing many aircraft from landing. Land anywhere else and take the train to Florence.

title: Great Service, poor lounge
review_text: The flight was excellent and the service too. Champagne and white wine were too warm, but the bed was really super. So in the air Swiss is really great, but not on the ground. The Senator lounge in level D is really poor. Amazing what Swiss offers in their main hub. There is literally nothing to eat, no peanuts, no cheese.

title: Yop Swiss !
review_text:
I've been flying with Swiss only these past years after being completely disgusted with EasyJet  and finding out that Economy class on Swiss was cheaper than EasyJet and allowed you more luggage, free snacks and beverages, room for my legs, and Swiss quality.
The landing in Z√ºrich was a good kiss-landing. The best so far on Swiss. I must say that my first landing with Swiss was a disappointment. The plane landed so roughly we were hopping on the tarmac. It reminded me of my first flight to England back in the 70's on an old plane which landed on the grass in Gatwick and bounced valiantly on the "cows' path".

title: Hosed every time
review_text: I don‚Äôt fly Swiss often but every time I have I come to the airport to find I am hosed in some unexpected way. On this occasion I signed up for a premium seat, and though I checked it three times over seven months somehow it disappeared when I checked in so probably will lose most of the trip to exhaustion after thrown in a middle seat in the back. This was quite an expensive ticket as well, for which I am getting zero FF points. Last time it was unexpected baggage fees even though I am star gold and it was only one bag. Lame rules about carryons being too heavy if they don‚Äôt float. This is a pirate airline company.

title: Good service
review_text: I hate flying, not the being in the air, the being stuck in one place for hours and Swiss air I have to say is probably the best short trip service I've used. Wouldn't question using them again.

title: Wonderful service in business class
review_text: My wife and I have physical issues which require us to fly first or business class for long trips.  After considerable research we selected Swiss International Air Lines for our trip to Israel.  We flew through Zurich both ways and had access to their lounges.  I really don't have any complaints.  The seats were comfortable and lay flat.  We were both able to sleep for a few hours.  The meals were excellent and the service was superb.  We will certainly try to fly Swiss internationally in the future.

title: best flights
review_text: This was the 1st time I ever flew on swiss air and it was the best flight I have ever been on. The seats were comfortable and the stewartess were great

title: European business class downgrade
review_text:
We discovered in shock the new catering protocol on European Swiss flights. We knew that in economy you are offered sandwiches and drinks for a price (√† la Easyjet) but we didn't know the same menu was used on Swiss Business. i.e. same stuff sandwich, muffin etc but for free. Great message, flying business gives you access to 8CHF sandwiches for free, what a privilege.
What a shamble, even the staff onboard said they don't like it. Only one warm dish, no baby food, children food (except junk crisps or similar). One expensive choice, guess what 2 pax in front of us had it, sorry we have no more, ha ha ha
What a disappointment, how can one treat premium passagers like this?

title: A LOT FOR NOT VERY MUCH!
review_text:
Flying to London for a symposium meant electing to pass via Heathrow and Swiss offered a midday flight which met our needs.  For such a short flight, we booked economy but, on seeing that an upgrade to Business Class would cost a mere $55 more, we opted for a seat up front and the pleasure of a couple of drinks and a pleasant meal.  We were allocated row 1, a row which we shall avoid in future as the bulkhead wall is just in front of one's face and leg room is highly restricted.  Hand luggage must be placed in the overhead locker, putting it well out of reach. Not helpful when it contains phone, tablet and other travel essentials.
The huge shock came in terms of in-flight catering.  Alcoholic drinks are served in small shot-glasses which can just about take the contents of a miniature bottle but which leave virtually no room for any mixers.  My gin and tonic certainly scrubbed away any scales from my eyes!  Then comes the food, which must be chosen from a standard bill of fare which is common to all passengers.  There is a choice of sandwiches and salads, all of which are very cold, dry and really unappetising.  In business and regular economy, these are free of charge, but low-rice economy travellers must pay.  It is quite simple to calculate the price of such a meal: drink with mixer $6, sandwich $7, cake $3, so a total of $16 against an upcharge of $55, not to mention less legroom and limited overhead storage.  Maybe it is good, after all, to sit right up front as it allows you to disembark first.  One would expect this sort of treatment from a low-cost airline which is fundamentally more honest in not having a Business Class.  Swiss seem to be counting just a bit too much on their traditional reputation for excellence in order to push through the new master plan dreamed up by some anorexic economist locked away in an obscure basement office.  At this rate, Swiss will be losing customers hand over fist.

title: Surprisingly good experience
review_text:
I flew Swiss couple of years ago. The inflight entertainment and seat comfort were quite outdated and low. I was hesitant to book this flight again. However, when I boarded the long-haul flight, which was the HKG-Zurich, it was a comfortable experience! The seats were renovated, with the inflight entertainment up-to-date. The food was better than before (they served the bread/bun hot). 

I must say the MOST impressive trait of this flight, both HKG-Zurich and Zurich-Athens, was that upon landing, there was ZERO disturbance. (I flew other Asian airlines and felt my neck almost broke when they land!) Such a smooth experience!

title: Short Hop
review_text:
Not flown on Swiss for 10 years and this occasion was jest as good if not better than before. City airport is a joy to use as both an outbound and inbound passenger.

Never flown on the Bombardier aircraft before, what a pleasant experience. Extremely comfortable, great legroom, Lavatories, lockers, windows the lot. Add in two excellent crews both ways, a really good experience.

Served a croissant and drink service on the way out and drinks and sandwich on the way back.

Check in staff excellent at City and Zurich, will definitely be booking again.

title: SWISS refuses to compensate passengers as law requires
review_text: My husband was at Brussels airport when SWISS e-mailed him, flight was cancelled (fuel leak). They said they would rebook him. They didn't rebook or contact him again. He called & was told he had to be rebooked by SWISS's agent at airport. He told them SWISS has no agents at Brussels. We were both on phone with them nearly 5 hours, finally supervisor admitted there are no SWISS agents in Brussels. I found flights and got him rebooked but he was stuck overnight, with no baggage, and was told to pay hotel and meals and request reimbursal from SWISS. He arrived 15 hrs late, so is entitled to compensation of 600 Euros (Reg EC 261/2004) plus expenses, but SWISS refuses to reimburse or compensate. They claim "extraordinary circumstance" even tho' EC law & subsequent court decisions are clear that a technical/mechanical problem of the aircraft is not an extraordinary circumstance. We have e-mailed them numerous times during nearly two months and, as of today, they refuse to fully reimburse expenses or compensate him for the 15-hour delay. This is the 2nd time SWISS has done this to us, having claimed "extraordinary circumstance" a few years ago on my claim for a 5-hour delay that caused me to miss my connection, and was absolutely due to a mechanical issue-- they kept us on the plane for hours, on the tarmac, while they worked on one of the engines. Again, a mechanical issue, not an "extraordinary circumstance." I tried for several months to get compensation and they refused. We will never fly SWISS again.

title: Old style flying with the best inflight service in Europe
review_text: Flying with Swiss, even on a two hour intra European sector, is like going back to what flying was like before the invasion of low cost operators. The crew are trained to the highest standards of service, the inflight lunch was served without rush and really professionally, passengers addressed by their name, the wine bottle (full bottle not quarter size ones) presented before being poured, a choice of hot lunch (both were of excellent standard) and lots of nice little touches and personalised stylish service. It was very impressive as was the return where a choice of hot brunch options was served.

title: Delayed
review_text: Check in counter opened late for some reason then following check in, we were told to go to the wrong gate which caused some confusion with a few passengers. Once on the plane we were delayed by 40 minutes due to weather at Frankfurt Airport.. Not their fault though so can't complain. Service was average though and flight was really bumpy pretty much the whole way.

title: I wish I could give a lower score
review_text: Absolutely terrible flight from start to finish. Cabin crew, whilst friendly enough were disorganised and did nothing to resolve issues, people were served the wrong food, One man had ordered and paid for the more expensive menu and did not get it. Drink was spilled over a passenger and one lady who had paid and booked a particular seat found it occupied by someone else and this was not resolved either. Food was terrible, I have had better food on short haul flights on budget airlines. They turned the lights down and hour and a half into the flight when it was neither night at the place I was leaving nor the place I was going to making it impossible to read or do anything that required light without having the peircing, blinding seat light on. The entertainment system, if you can call it that was old and mostly broken and the plane was small and cramped for a 12.5 hour flight! On top of all this, as a disabled individual, I had booked disability assistance and whilst it was provided it was the worst that I have ever experienced anywhere I have travelled in the world and with any airline. The amount of things I could complain about it would make this far too long but to sum it up, I was taken into a lift and my family were supposed to be meeting us at the bottom of the escalator but the assistant put me straight on the shuttle without waiting for them and then abandoned me alone in Zurich airport without any assistance to find my family and told that it was their responsibility to get me to the gate, not to ensure that I was safe with my family and refused any further assistance with finding my family or even with wifi so that I could send them a message to tell them where I was as they were looking all over the airport for me. Will never, ever fly Swiss Air again and will discourage anyone else from doing either

title: I love the airline but next time please check the plane correctly before letting people board
review_text: Due to some technical difficulties with the aeroplane, we had to change aeroplanes and there was a lot of delays I arrived in Madrid 2 hours late but thankfully safe and sound

title: very good airlines
review_text: the flight was from cairo to zurich then to dusseldorf and every thing was nice and went totally fine

title: Overall very good experience although the choice of seat can make a difference.
review_text: Pleasantly surprised for my first experience with SWISS long haul business. In the two flights to and from Bangkok I travelled both in the individual/single seat, the 'throne' and the double seat. The difference of privacy and storage space between the two is remarkable in favour of the 'throne'. It is of personal appreciation if it is worth the extra money SWISS is asking to reserve that seat (189‚Ç¨ for each way). The seat itself (in both cases) is comfortable and offers good sleeping space for average height. Very nice cabin staff and one of the best quality meals served in business. Presentation, taste and choice was excellent! The choice of wines, especially the whites, a bit less.Very good choice of films.

title: Best airline in its network
review_text: I travel a lot in the travel in the Lufthansa/Swiss air system and Swiss has been consistently good for the last 2 years. This flight was no exception. The staff on board are the best part of the trip - they are excellent and always try and accommodate while being cheerful, kind and cooperative. Swiss air is usually punctual and if here are delays, they do apologize not like other airlines. The seating and planes are normally very decent and there is a lot to eat and drink. Principally they are dependable. I highly recommend this airline.

title: disappointing long distance business class flight
review_text: Boarding completet allowing on-time departure. Captain announced waiting time 15 minutes before roll-back from gate. In reality the delay was 45 minutes. Besides the welcome drink after boarding no further refreshments during the 45 minutes were served nor was any explanation for the hefty delay given. After reaching cruising altitude drinks were offered and the meal service started. Meal quality was good. Meal time over service also ceased to exist lest Pax activated call button. My seat 6 K in front of gulley. Curtain was never completely shut and the light emerging from the gulley caused inconvenience. No purser in sight throughout the flight. Breakfast was a disaster. By the time the service trolley reached my seat 7/8 of content was gone. (Only 2 very tiny slices of ham in appearance. Yoghurt was not offered although stocked on the lower trolley shelve. Had to grab it before trolley moved on. Consumed food was not replenished. Cabin attendant (Japanese lady) made no effort to improve situation. Before landing first officer (why not the captain ??) made and almost inaudible announcement (concerning landing procedures) and that was "all she wrote". Pax were not individually bade farewell (normally Purser's task) - which considering the flight in general terms could not be expected......The shortcomings of this flight are the same I "endured" on  the last 4 business class flights to South Africa.  Swiss the world's best airline ??? One positive item however is the airline has a good safety record and makes it eligible for recommendation. Negative also is the aircraft type - A340 - when are Swiss going to introduce the new Boeing 777 on this route.

title: Very nice plane and staff!
review_text: We chose not to buy business class tickets since it was a short flight. Glad we didn‚Äôt. Seats in Economy were the same seats. They got a sandwich in business class. Not worth the money.  The plane was a Bombardier C100/300 and appeared to be new. It was very comfortable and modern. Swiss Air staff were very nice and pleasant and the flight itself was very smooth and on time.

title: Expected more
review_text:
This was fully booked flight where it was still on gate on pretty unpolite way requested from the passengers to check in their hand luggage as there would not be enough space for all bags in the cabin. I offen fly ith Lufthansa and despite the plane is almost always full something like that was never requested from the passengers.
Flight was 1 hour delayed with departure, cabin crew not very polite, food acceptable. Choice of drinks could be better - they didn't even have tomato juice in their offer.

title: Perfectly on time
review_text: The 14:35 flight was quite busy but we departed soon enough to arrive on time.  We were served a delicious mango sorbet during the flight.  One of my favourites.  Check in and processing at Zurich airport was very efficient -as usual.

title: Short, beautiful flight!
review_text: The view was magnificent on that flight, had an extra room because no one was sitting next to me. Very quiet and pleasant flight.

title: Great flight, comfortable seats and surprisingly tasty food
review_text: The plane was new, comfortable and relatively roomy. The service was great and food was tasty. Had to take another Swiss flight and everything went well at the airport.

title: Upgrade!
review_text: We chose Swiss Air as they're part of the Star Alliance of which we are Gold members. The flight was full & we were lucky to be upgraded to business. We have flown economy with Swiss previously & found them to be efficient & friendly. Business class was also excellent. The crew did their best to seat us together & were very pleasant & helpful despite a very busy flight. Lunch was excellent as was the choice of a glass of wine. Great service on such a short flight. On time too. Reinforced our high opinion of this airline.

title: Pefect-from check in to baggage claim
review_text: Check In in Tegel, Security Check, flight, service on board, baggage claim: all without objection. Tegel-very efficient airport; therefore I hope the new BER one will be opened not before 2030. We started and landed in time. In between the flight attendendants made their best to make the stay on board comfortable. Perfect service - even with low ticket prices.

title: Brilliant as always
review_text:
Our preferred airline over all others. The well educated staff are multilingual (3 languages minimum) and extremely well trained. 

Food and drink options never disappoint. It's especially nice to have included in the wine list Swiss wines, which are hard to find and excellent. Prefer this airline especially for long hauls which, in this case, was 10 hours.

title: NICE FLIGHT TO ZURICH
review_text: Nice flight from Greece to Zurich. the flight go almost one hour late but we arrives to our connection. thay also give food for 2.5 hours inside europe its not regular

title: That‚Äôs how it should be
review_text: From check in to boarding all went smooth.  Seemed a newer bombardier plane with 2-3 configuration. This would have to be the best eco seat in a short haul flight. Great legroom. Even got served a small tub of Movenpick ice cream. Landed on time and waited less than 5 min for my luggage. Impressive all round and staff very professional.

title: A great trip to Paris
review_text:
As always a trip with the Swiss airlines is a pleasure. Never faced any problem but in the return flight (645) something happened which annoyed me...
The flight attendants probably were very hungry and they wanted to take home some sandwiches for themselves (mainly the veggie one), because when they offered snacks to the passengers starting from the front, many passengers didn't even take a sandwich... (my husband was sitting about 12 rows in front of me and he noticed that). 
Then, when they came at the back of the aircraft, the pass my row, and didn't give anything to us to eat. Then the next attendant came and offered drinks and that's when I realized that the former attendants forgot to give us the sandwich...
The couple next to me and I asked for a sandwich and they came and gave me one with meat... I told them I don't eat meat and they said...sorry we run our of cheese ones! Really, half of the plane didn't even eat... and you run out of veggie sandwiches??? Then they offered me a cous-cous salad but I refused it since it looked like vomit.... So disappointed by the service of this flight!

title: Perfect flight on Swiss Air
review_text: It was just the perfect experience. Clean new plane, good seating, timely departure and arrival, good food and pleasant and professional service.

title: Horrible Check In Process
review_text: I had a multiple leg, multiple airline trip to Greece. I have flown 4 different airlines. With all other airlines, it was easy and intuitive to add bags. Swiss Air is the only one that was not easy nor intuitive. Arrived at the airport in Athens thinking I would just pay for bags at the counter. No, that would be easy and intuitive. After standing in line and getting to the counter, they sent me to another counter to pay for bags. Had to wait in that line. Then, after paid for bags, back to the other to then complete the boarding process. Well, Swiss Air is going to be a skip it in the future for me. If I wanted poor service at a better price, I would have flown Ryan Air.

title: Great service and food
review_text:
With the exception of what appeared to be a good deal of disorganization on the part of the ground staff in Dublin which caused a departure delay it would have been a perfect flight.

Onboard staff were polite, friendly and efficient.  The flight is only a couple of hours but they managed a beautiful lunch service which was as good or better than any meal we ate on the cruise we had just left.

Although we arrived a bit late we (and our luggage) made our connecting flight to Vienna.

Swiss definitely left a good impression.

title: Fair, but lousy onboard service
review_text:
ZRH-LAX standard economy on a 777-300 ER

Flight was OK-ish. Got in late ‚Äì some medical emergency before takeoff, parking spot problem in landing. Captain was good in updating us with what was going on, though. 

Seats reasonably comfortable, legroom OK. IFE OK, screen was reasonably sized, fair selection of movies, smaller selection of TV programs than I recall previously. 

Onboard service was not great. Most crew were not exactly pleasant, and certainly did not go out of their way to help or even to be polite. Zero marks there.

title: Punctual Airline
review_text:
Great punctuality, easy online checkin and friendly staff. However, the food is very average, we left most and wine selection is just passable.
The planes are getting old and do not have charge points, USB points or decent screens to watch movies. I will be glad when they soon update their fleet. Swiss ice creams and Swiss chocolates are a nice touch.

title: my favourite
review_text:
It is always a pleasure flying SWISS; however, the quality of the services differ from flight to flight. This time the food was not as good as it used to be.

One more thing: flying from Nairobi to Zurich means that you first fly to Dar and from there back home...... almost 3 hours more than it should....the advantage is that you have more time to sleep without interruption

title: Unbelievable business class service
review_text:
Who would ever believe that SWISS is serving sandwiches on business class flights out of Geneva?
A poor food selection (pompously called Swiss Saveurs) is now paid for if you fly economy but that same food selection is served on business class albeit for free. No service distinction whatsoever!
Best choice (and the cheapest) is to fly economy light and purchase your food on board if you really need to. 
If you expect to be pampered with a Business class service out of Geneva you will be deceived. It‚Äôs a pure scam!!!

title: Below expectations
review_text:
Long haul, 12 hour plus flight - so in business class, I have high expectations. Impressions in sequence:
Lounge. The lounge in Terminal E at Zurich is first class. Spacious, plenty of room in different seating areas and configurations, numerous food and beverage options, clean bathrooms. The weather was wet, so regrettably the outdoor deck was closed. 
Boarding. Delayed 20 minutes, departure about 30 minutes late. At 11.00 pm this is mildly irritating. Arrival in Singapore about 20 minutes late.
Seating. I was curious to see the 1-2-2/2-2-1 reverse seating configuration that elicits both positive and negative reviews. For couples wanting to sit together AND have a window view, this is one of the few options available with many airlines moving to 1-2-1 configurations, meaning that couples must sit together in the middle of the plane on wide body long haul flights. I‚Äôm still undecided. It felt constricting and enclosed and I felt slightly claustrophobic in the window seat. On the other hand, I probably had the longest duration long haul sleep for at least a decade - 8 hours out of the 12 hour flight time. (I was tired after travelling for 5 weeks and I was heading home.) We chose the smaller business class 777 cabin directly behind first class - only two rows in this micro cabin between first class and the galley. Our seats were in the second row - row 5. It seemed as though the window seats on the opposite side of the aircraft in row 4 up against the bulkhead provided more room/pitch. In any case, I‚Äôm going to forego the window seat in future.
Service. A shambles. This micro cabin is really not thought about by the cabin staff. We had to ask for a first round of drinks when it appeared that the rest of business class had been served their meal (judging by the loud bangs, rattles and clinking of crockery, cutlery and glassware from the nearby galley), dessert never arrived despite being specifically requested at the end of the main course, and we had to ask for a drinks top up part way through the meal. We must have been served at some point during the flight by every cabin attendant on the aircraft who did not seem to know or care about any requests that we had previously made. Thoroughly disappointing. I chose not to take breakfast prior to arrival, although the staff appeared more organised and efficient for this meal service.
The food. It was excellent, particularly the salmon starter with beetroot. No dessert (see above) - that‚Äôs ok, as I really didn‚Äôt need any more food! Wines were excellent as well, notably what was described as a white merlot (?).
Connections. We had a one hour connection time due to the late arrival of the flight, and the captain provided connection gate information for about 4 of these flights. Our connection was one of those mentioned and we took note. However, when we consulted the terminal information boards after disembarking, we noticed that our connecting gate lounge was different to the one advised by the captain. It was further away from our arrival gate, so we did not visit the lounge and headed directly for the departing gate. We boarded and at the very last minute a few passengers from our earlier flight arrived very annoyed and flustered - they had been waiting at the gate lounge advised by the captain on our previous flight. Not the captain‚Äôs fault, but a warning to passengers to double-check any information provided during flight when on the ground.
Overall - somewhat disappointing. I would need to travel more on Swiss to determine the optimum seat; however, due to my experience on this flight I‚Äôm not likely to choose Swiss again if there are other options available.

title: Ok, but not great
review_text: Cramped and uncomfortable seats which once reclined for the bed were like sleeping in a coffin. This Airbus, though bigger than a Dreamliner, felt smaller. The food was OK, the service good, the trip uninteresting.

title: Excellent cabin service and meals
review_text:
Cabin service was excellent and so was the food. The airplane was quite recent and therefore showed no wear and tear. 

For once, there was no noise through the night as we travelled from Montreal to Zurich. And although we left 45 minutes late, we arrived in Zurich only fifteen minutes after scheduled arrival.

title: Good flight, bad arrival.
review_text: Swiss Air operates the 777 EC on this route.  The flight departed a but later than expected but after that went as smooth as a 9.5 hour flight can go sitting in coach.  Hey, it was my last flight using frequent flyer mileage.  The food was fine and the service very good.  I crew was great.  OK, the bad stuff.  We arrived in Chicago about the same time as two other large jets originating outside the US.  Customs was jammed with at least 750 people.  We were herded into a vast room with serpentine lines that eventually brought you to a kiosk that no one knew how to operate.  If you can read English you eventually figure out how to operate it.  It is supposed to replace the old customs from but we had to fill that out anyway.  Then get into another line and see a customers officer who did his normal job.  Took almost 2.5 hours to clear customs. Total screw up on Customs and Immigration part.  The Europeans are so much better at this than we are.  Leaving Switzerland was a breeze.

title: Free chocolate!
review_text:
A good flight, slightly delayed in Manchester, but the crew gave out small bottles of water, which was very welcome.
Good cabin service, you get a free snack and that all important Swiss chocolate. Saves messing around with currency. 
Special assistance is good in Zurich.

title: very tight leg room
review_text: Can't reserve any seat when you purchase ticket online unless you pay extra so it depends on your luck.

title: Flight was diverted due to medical emergency
review_text:
Connecting in Zurich. On the way, a passenger had a medical emergency which forced the plane to land in Istanbul. After offloading the passenger, refueled and took off again after 2 hours. This meant that a good number of passengers missed their connecting flight, including me.

What was bad was that they re-booked me on the next flight which was 8 hours later, without trying to find me an earlier connecting flight on another alliance airline. When I asked if I could find an earlier flight, I was told to go past immigration to a transfer desk. Just a note of apology with no form of compensation for having me wait 8 hours at Zurich airport. Trying to get help, most of the staff were nonchalant.

Not something one would expect from a full service airline.

title: Quick flight in business class
review_text:
We had booked a round trip international flight through Lufthansa, and Swiss was the carrier for the Zurich-Frankfurt leg of the trip. It was very short flight, less than an hour. We were in business class, which meant we had the window and aisle seat in the first row, with the middle seat left empty.

The Zurich airport is very easy to navigate and efficient. There is a large duty free shopping area that feels like an upscale mall, and the waiting area near our gate was a bookstore with comfy chairs and tables.

The flight left on time and onboard service was friendly. We were served a small meal, even on such a short flight. Would recommend Swiss!

title: Flight Nurse
review_text: Horrific Economy flight. Zero leg room (and I'm 5'3"). Once person in front of me reclined he was basically in my lap for a 10 hour flight. Arm rests do not go up so no way to make additional space to the side. Food. Poor. Couldn't even lean forward to sleep... vertical due to proximity of seats. Overhead luggage bins deep set so difficult to access once everyone is seated. Horrific experience that I shall not want again.

title: Standard flight normally full to Johannesburg
review_text: Swiss is no diiferent form most flight between Europe and J.burg. It is almost full. The food is ok, but nothing more. Drinks are late. The seats are small. But the most important when you choose to fly economy class is to get somewhere as cheap as possible and on time. Swiss delivers as you can expect.

title: First time with Swissair.did not disappoint
review_text: Cabin crew very friendly and efficient. Seats A &C in business class very close together and the seats felt narrow thus we requested seats D&F on return flight . Mush more comfortable. On short hop flighs to Rome and from Dublin the crew were amazingly friendly and all crew made sure to speak English to us unlike other airlines we have flown.This was our first time with Swiss and would recommend. One big failure was difficulty accessing Swiss airlines transfer desk in Zurich airport. Took an hour and 2 bags searches and asking 3 people before we found it. Signage very poor.

title: Always late departure!
review_text:
Don‚Äôt like to give negative feedbacks but this is the situation when it‚Äôs impossible not to share. 
Travel Zurich-Amsterdam frequently, once per 2-3 weeks. The departure and arrival from both countries are always late!! Time to the destination instead of 1.30h is 3 hours and more.
Annoying and frustrating..

title: Bad client experience
review_text: Crowded dark lounge with dry sandwiches, big delay, passengers treated like cattle, seats uncomfortable...how can you treat customers like this?

title: Lucky to have one of those single seats in Business Class...
review_text:
The staff was very attentive , specially the most senior in the Team which was more active and effective than her colleagues, she really made a difference. Most of my experiences with SWISS have been in Economy where the treatment by the Cabin Crew could be similar to the worst airline ever as their awful attitude in Economy is completely different to Business. 

Seat comfort in Business is great specially if you get one of the single seats with access to window and aisle as well these have more space. Food service was very good. 

Lounge at YUL is the new Air Canada Lounge which is excellent but also crowded in the afternoons as European flights are happening at that time.

title: A good airlines  except for typical problem of taking passengers to plane before plane is ready
review_text: The qualiy and sincerity of the Swiss personal is much higher than average.  The flight also serves a good lunch without extra cost. The only problem we had was one which is typical for many airlines, who allow passengers to pass boarding control before the crew has fully prepared the aircraft for boarding. So, what happened is we were taken by a bus to the door of the aircraft and left like animals for about 12-14 minutes standing in the bus until the crew allowed us to board.  When I mentioned it to a flight attendant he exclaimed ‚Äúthis is not our fault! It is the fault of the boarding gate!‚Äù  Clearly the boarding gate also is comprised of Swiss personnel and clearly, like many other airlines, they prefer to let us wait to gain a two or three minutes in boarding time than to coordinate between aircraft and gate personne to allow a seamless experience.

title: Very Nice Flight
review_text: Much better at ontime departure from Zurich than my last Swiss flight out of Bari, Italy.  The plane and restrooms were clean, the staff were great, food was great, the entertainment was very good, the seat comfort was fine, cabin temperature was fine and no complaints at all.

title: Ran on time (Italian Style)
review_text: The boarding process was amuzing in the Italian manner.  Very slow and inefficient and the staff said to ignore our seat numbers as this flight would be free seating.  Then they went into work slowdown mode and it took 3 buses and about a half hour to get the passengers to the plane for about a 45 minute delay. Once aboard, the cabin crew said they never heard of the free seating and began to enforce seating as about 15% aboard had assigned seats.  So the fun began with passengers moving forward and backward and repositioning their luggage as each busload of passengers arrived.  Ah, but we were not done with the fun - after we played musical chairs, the plane sat for another 15 minutes.  At least the pilot made no excuses and told us we would be delayed and SWISS rebooked the poor folks who missed connections.  As for the rest of us, we got to learn the the sport of sprinting to make our connections in Zurich.  I credit the Italians with this adventure in flying as I don't think it was a Swiss Miss.

title: Excellent service
review_text: Swiss are my favourite airline company from the moment I was using their services. It was 2015 - July. Excellent service in the airplane, very kind staff, punctuality and cleanliness.

title: Great service with a big heart
review_text: The service on board is always excellent. Unfortunaetly, both flights to and from Amsterdam were delayed by around an hour each. To Amsterdam the delay was due to a personal tradegy of a person on board. We were already in transit for takeoff, when the plane returned to the gate to inform the passenger about it. I thought that was very nice and an unusual thing to do for an airline. The second delay was due to late arrival of the plane.

title: Just an other flight
review_text:
This time it was Swiss airlines for my travel to Europe. 

My Journey to and from Dubai with Swiss airlines was good. Did not find anything special with them except they offer good Swiss chocolate inside the flight.

It was Airbus, seating in economy was very good. You can have one good nap before you land. Spacious leg room and seats have good reclining facility. In flight entertainment wasn't bad. Programs will keep you engaged. As usual i opted for Asian veg meal and it wasn't great. Service level in all touch points weren't good or bad.

It was just another flight without anything exceptional

title: Not a Swiss clock at all ...
review_text:
Flying regularly with Swiss just because of convenience, I had just once in more then 3 years a flight that was departing and arriving on time :-(
Where the Swiss public transports are really an example of punctuality, Swiss Airlines is everything but punctual ... 
Some might argue that it is no longer Swiss since several years ...

title: Flight from Z√ºrich to Singapore
review_text: It was a nice flight. The service was good. However, the seats on the plane can be tad bit small for a long haul flight. The flight duration was around 12 hours. The food was really tasty, especially the Vegetarian meals.

title: Swiss International Air Lines Experience
review_text: We booked passage to Switzerland on Swiss Air because it was the best deal economically.  That being said the flights were on time and smooth sailing both ways.  As with many long haul air crafts the first and business class cabins have been expanded and the economy cabins reduced, with seats being smaller with less leg room and overall space.  Consequently our travel was hampered with full flights in economy class.  The flight crew were fine providing many snacks and beverages in between the two meals commonly served during long haul flights and the entertainment selection was good.  But the bottom line is the more cramped the economy cabins become the less pleasant the experience.

title: The most unhelpful customer service ever
review_text:
Where to start? I bought a ticket Swiss wirh a long lay over in Rio because i know how it works over there so 2-3 hours between flights is good to do think with peace. I was changed to Edelweiss without asking any permission leaving me with an 1h40 minutes lay over. And here starts the problems: first the online check in is unavailable because as stated on the Edelweiss website with a code LX you need to check in through Swiss air website, except that on Swiss air Rio‚Äôs airport is not within the options to choose from... ( first major flow) 

At Brasilia airport they couldn‚Äôt print my tickets because there are no agreement between Latam and Swiss or Edelweiss. So you know you have 1h40 and you are flying without tickets... Then comes the funniest part; you try to call them for over 3 hours, you probably gets the whole damn service because of the number of the calls you have to make... They gave a Swiss number where no one ever picks up!!! I mean thanks for the international calls! 

And everyone is telling you don‚Äôt worry you are already registered. You then wonder if it is a bad joke or their staff is so stupid they can‚Äôt process the information...  If i‚Äôm checked in why can‚Äôt you send me my boarding cards through email? And how can‚Äôt they understand that without a boarding pass you cannot go through transit but you have to get out of the airport? The fact that i‚Äôm checked in doesn‚Äôt change the situation; I had to exist Rio‚Äôs airport to go to the check in counters to get my boarding pass to then pass all the security checks etc...  
When one of the staff member do try to help, they actually send an email without pdf with a full disclosure about what type of adobe is necessary, so pathetic!!! 

My fianc√© spent 3 hours trying to get these tickets and dealing with their extremely unhelpful and unprofessional staff. When i complained to the ground staff at Zurich airport, the woman thought she knew it better than me... Even telling me it wasn‚Äôt 3 hours, sorry for them but we have the proofs... 

Also one of their staff told my fianc√© that Swiss could not send my tickets because the booking was made through gotogate. So basically even though it is the airline, it is the agent that need to do its job! Because everyone knows that in every airports you have systems to support all the sites selling tickets on top of the ones from the airlines, yeah right... So it is as if I go to Mercedes to fix my car and they tell me they can‚Äôt because i bought it in another garage... Please

So congrats Swiss Air on your such unhelpful staff! I mean calling your services only costs me a lot of money and generated a lot of stress! But for the solution I found it alone by running like crazy in an airport! Maybe it could be helpful if they put a disclaimer on their site, stating that if the passengers want solutions they better find it themselves without calling because they only will waste time... 

Ground staff also told me that it is like that with every airlines. Sorry but it is not the same with all airlines, i do Bsb- Bru 4 to 5 times a year for 3 years now and I used all major companies you can think of without ever having a problem with online checking or tickets. As a matter of fact, my last trip was late April with KLM, amazingly they could get me my tickets in Bsb... and even better i could do my check-in online, flying first with Latam... impressive right? 

Finally, the staff blamed it on Edelweiss! I booked it with Swiss, their internal problems are none of my business...

title: Great customer support after a delay from USA
review_text:
Was never admit customer support that really want to help and be there for you.
My mom who doesn‚Äôt speak English and with no phone missed her connection in Zurich after delay in a flight from USA. Swiss did everything to make sure to help her and update us that she is on the next connection flight. Amazing company

title: Asian Vegetarian meal on Swiss
review_text:
I am traveling frequently on Swiss Airlines.
I would like to make some serious comments on Asian Vegetarian meal served by Swiss  Airlines on long haul flights out of Z√ºrich.
Swiss takes pride in saying meals are prepared by Z√ºrich restaurant named Hiltl and keeps praising Hiltl in information brochure given along with the meal.
Swiss Airline‚Äôs  Asian Vegeterian meal served out of Z√ºrich is one of the worst meal on any airlines.
In the main course Hiltl serves a 65% plain white rice and the rest is a okra carrot vegetable prepared in some Awfully Tasting condiments.
Asian Vegeterian meal is mainly targeted towards Indian Vegeterians. I regret to say the meal served by Hiltl is no way close to Indian meal.All my Indian friends are complaining the same for AVML served out of Z√ºrich.
Swiss must replan  this menu with help one well known Indian chef and get it served out of Z√ºrich and if necessary replace Hiltl if they can not adapt and follow.
Thank you for listening Swiss Airlines and we would appreciate your response.

title: Never again
review_text:
I have flown with many airlines but this would have to be the most uncomfortable.  Yes, we were travelling over 30 hours with 3 stops but that doesn't change the fact that the seats were hard and narrower than most and the meals were average.  I am only just over 5 foot but I found it hard to cross my legs in an attempt to change to a more comfortable seating position.  My husband commented on how comfortable and wide the seats felt in Singapore Airlines after changing planes in Singapore.  We used Swiss from Singapore to Zurich, Zurich to  
St Petersburgh and then Moscow to Zurich, Zurich to Singapore for the return flights.  Be aware, .....Swiss Airlines (domestic) WILL  weigh your bags and if they do not fit in the metal holder, they WILL be your carry on bag in the hole.  Although we were carrying NO extra items and only had ONE carry on bag between two people and it weighed less than 7 kgs and we had 30 hours of travelling in front of us, the cabin crew took our bag and booked it through to Australia.  Yes, I was able to remove medication from the bag but we only had our pockets to put things in and a plastic bag from a shop.  This bag has travelled on many airlines and we have never had to put it in the hole.  And it wasnt locked.

title: Efficient and friendly service from end to end
review_text:
We booked our business class return trip directly on the Swiss web site, which functioned perfectly.  I was able to look at the seating plan in each plane and reserve our seats at the time of booking.  There are some single seats by the windows, and among the double seats there are some in the middle which have a bulkhead between them and the aisle, giving more privacy. 
The transfer in Zurich airport between the London flight and Sao Paulo flight was easy in both directions - a train connects the E gates where the intercontinental flights are with the D gates where the London flights are. In the train one is entertained by typical Swiss sounds including cowbells, an alpine horn and a cow. 
In flight service was friendly and efficient on all the flights, and food good - in particular I enjoyed range of Swiss wines available as these are not easily found outside Switzerland. 
Easily accessible and spacious Star Alliance Lounges in London and Sao Paulo; in Zurich there are Swiss lounges in areas E and D - the one in area E is particularly impressive with panoramic windows offering views over the airport and beyond.

title: Cooling one's heels
review_text: LX317-LX1662. It was a two-part flight, via Zurich. The flight out of London was late enough to warrant being concerned about making my connection. No time was made up. Zurich airport, compact and of a nice size, is excellent. As it turned out, I had time to stop for an espresso, which was very good. The flight out of Zurich was even later, also delayed, meaning that my arrival at my accommodations in Venice were over an hour late. The thing that bothered me most on both flights was the lack of communication from the airline staff at the terminal. It always makes a difference, but was lacking. The planes were very good.

title: Good service , but not on the top of the electronic - audio visual systems
review_text:
Very professional and kind crew. Adequate food choice, properly served.
The plane was brand new but the electronic system to serve video to my seat was not working at all. They could not fix it.

title: Captive demand...
review_text: There are not many alternatives but flying with StarAlliance carriers to/from Hamburg to Athens/Greece. Therefore, we (my family and I) are frequently using Swiss and Zurich airport as transit. We think that the service is 'overpriced' but as we are 'captive demand' Swiss charges high prices and offers minimum service. However, some of the crew-members (not all) could be slightly more polite and treat passengers as customers and not as 'captives'. They could also manage embarkation a bit better by calling rows and sections, but 'why bother?'.

title: travel by swiis
review_text: Great morning smooth  flight, good hospitality by the staff, and most important it was  on time,  clean

title: First time Swissair customer
review_text:
Our travel agent arranged our flights and we had never flown Swissair before. It was a 777-300 and we were in business class.Going to Zurich we had seats 10A&B and we found them very tight fit especially when laid flat..On our return we chose 2 in the centre and there was more room between seats. Cabin staff were excellent and efficient.Recommend Swissair..
D

title: Fabulous luxurious business class. Seats turn into beds for sleeping!
review_text: I have never flown business class but have heard about my sister's experiences in business. Swiss has wonderfully engineered seats that turn into incredibly comfortable beds. Loved our flight and the service.

title: Surprise, surprise
review_text:
Nice surprise: The aircraft used to TLV wasn't the usual A330-300 but Swiss's long haul aircraft, the B 777-300. I sat on 4A. The cabin of the B 777 is very spacious and the set up very state of the art. Lot of room to stow your belongings. But: the adjustments of the seat can't meet the ones of the A 330-300i. They are more flexible.

But that's only a detail. I was impressed of the overall product on the B 777. Food was delicious and the crew did their job very well.

title: Short hop to connecting flight great trip
review_text: Super clean and modern aircraft. Nice food and beverage  exceptionally friendly staff. Helped us make our connecting flight when we were delayed out of Barcelona.

title: Swiss Flight from Geneva to JFK and back
review_text: Check-in services, as welcome by the crew on the plane was excellent. Further the announcements by the Captain were instructive. The beverage and food servicing was very professional. They should really be congratulated

title: Disappointing
review_text:
Very disappointing experience on Swiss. The Eco on their ‚Äûflagship‚Äú  777 is very tight. 3-4-3 is not comfortable at all. And I felt sympathy with the crew serving in this very tight aisle. 
However the crew was unprofessional anyway. Boarding commenced 10 minutes prior scheduled departure. So for sure 300 + passengers were not seated when the plane should leave the gate.  So the crew started to yell to passengers to move faster to their seats and take a place. Very funny if you keep in mind, that you can‚Äôt pass anyone standing on the aisle due to the configuration.
So the flight started badly already.
It does not become better when they serve food. They made a whole service even departure was at midnight. None of the crew members was able to speak in an adequate level to the passenger nor even had eye contact. Just rude and unpolite. It remembers on former LH times. However they have improved significantly.
Quality of food was ok. Entertainment also ok however with the same content as LH, so after 2 longhaul flights within 1 month your done with your choice.
To make it short ‚Äì I was disappointed and will not focusing on LX at all in the future.

title: Unpleasant Trip
review_text:
I would not recommend this airline if you are flying as a couple. The business class seats on the side of the plane mean you have to step over the person next to you. The room for a business class seat is smaller than other airlines. The entertainment system did not work on the leg from Singapore to Zurich (12 hours) and the staff were unable to fix it. The staff were not pleasant and everything seemed too much trouble for them.
On the leg from Zurich to Lisbon they ran out of food choices after delivering only 10 business class meals. We were unable to order on line for the food choice. Stewardess delivering the food was very abrupt and rude. This was not needed, especially after a 12 hour over night flight.

title: Excellent Service
review_text: Flying long distance in economy, especially with a layover and connecting flight, is never anyone‚Äôs idea of a good time, but the cleanliness, efficiency and a few extra touches make Swiss International Air Lines better than most other airlines.

title: Professional service
review_text:
Swiss crew was very professional, but not really warm, friendly or engaging.  The pilot did his best, but had to deal with air traffic delays and incredible headwinds which delayed our flight, through no fault of Swiss. Good movie selection, not many music choices. Slightly better than average seating, this was an Airbus 330. Dinner was airline chicken early in the flight, with a warm tomato/ cheese wrap as a snack later, no charge for drinks or wine. 
They delivered exactly what was required, but with a sort of cool feeling.

title: Jammed in the Back
review_text: As a 6' 3" person I don't understand how European airlines expect me to comfortably sit in a coach seat with 32" of pitch.  There were no options for an upgrade since this was a once class airplane with no "Economy Plus".  The stupid strike by French Air Controllers delayed our flight by over an hour.  It was a miracle that we made our connection in Zurich.

title: it's the  low cost airline of the star alliance
review_text: A full flight. Not the cleanest airplane. service very mediocre. Food unbelievably horrible especially the "egg powder experiment as an omlet". Seat convenience moderate. As always I realize that I should have chosen the big sister Lufthansa instead. Really not worth spending a dime for seat reservation extra as I have done.

title: Good Flight!
review_text:
We had a very pleasant Flight from New York to Z√ºrich and back to New York! The JFK/ ZRHFlight was at night the return a day Flight! The Service was very good and friendly!
We had a nice Dinner and B/ Fast on the way to ZRH & Lunch on the way back!
The Lounges are Good with a good selection of Food and Drinks( a bit small in New York)For us it was a bit different to see a Dog sitting in Business but it was ok the Dog was well behaved!

title: Pay for an upgrade
review_text: I am a very frequent flyer in the U.S. In my opinion it is worth the premium to upgrade to Business Class while flying in Europe. The money you will save in baggage fees can be put towards the upgrade. We also enjoy access to airline lounges and "fast-track" by-pass if long security lines.  Our experience on Swiss Air was very good.

title: Pay the extra
review_text:
Great airline. Food and service wonderful but seats way too tight. When I go to Europe again I am paying for upgrade of som kind. 
The number 5 review only reflects that concern. Otherwise a 10

title: Excellent!!
review_text:
We haven‚Äôt flown with Swiss Air for a long time, and when we recently flew with them from Geneva to Porto, we were reminded of how good they really are.

We had booked directly with the airlines through their website online and everything was a breeze. Due reminder was sent to us once the flight was opened for online check-in, and we were able to print both the Boarding Passes and Luggage Tags from home. Baggage drop at Geneva airport was smooth and so quick. As we had printed the tags from home, all we had to do was to get the plastic covers for the tags, fixed them to our bags and voila! All was done without wasting more time at the counter.

Legroom was spacious compared to all other airlines in Economy seats. We had not paid for anything extra. Crew was efficient and polite. Luggage allowance (23kg) + hand luggage (8kg) + accessory was generous.

Our flight experience was so good that now we are trawling their flight paths to see whether we can fly with them again for our next trip!

title: Switzerland
review_text:
I thought Swiss Air was pretty good. No troubles, on time, meals were ok and it was on time. 
However, the flight attendant did spill water all over me, first thing, but whatever. I expected a free drink, but didn't get it. Just a smile and napkins.

title: No problems
review_text: Excellent check-in, in-flight service, value for money, friendly staff. Overall a very good experience.

title: Its really hard to say...
review_text:
on one hand, Swiss airlines are well serviced and maintained, updated, and safe - and that's why I can recommend the airline with 4 Stars. I will therefore always choose Swiss over another airline if I can - even though they are really expensive. Service on-board is also friendly, well trained and smooth - professional, formal  Swiss hospitality.

On the other side, service before and after the flight: horrendous, unacceptable, frustrating and painful. Some of the things that I encounter over and over again (I'm flying once a week):
- seat change at gate (even though I paid extra for an exit seat) to any seat
- no online checking possible for code share partners incl checkin machines
- loooooong queues at checkin/baggage drop with very few counters open
- Swiss App works about 50% of the time (sometimes I receive my App Boarding Pass 2 days after the flight)
- Call Centre agents: no clue about flights booked on Swiss but operated byu others ("you have to call Lufthansa, I cannot help you")
- Miles&More really only makes sense if you have monthly business class tickets (I'm flying Swiss 2x per month for 2 years - still haven't reached Silver) and I'm always booking super-flex tariff (Y-class)
- regardless of your booking class, ticket changes (date) are chargeable

Overall, it is very complicated and Swiss-centric to do business with them. Very little customer focus or demonstrating a customer attitude.

But they are safe.

title: good flight
review_text:
Great cabin crew.  I have flown many airlines and I'm most impressed with the Swiss attitude.  You get the feeling that the crew is happy with the job;  that they are not bonded to it.  So they smile sincerely, give good eye contact and carry themselves with self confidence.
It's great to fly with a happy crew.  And it seems so with every flight on Swiss.

The food wasn't bad, but wasn't the best.  The chocolates at the end of each meal is a charming touch.

The cabin interior was clean.  The toilets always clean on this 12 hour flight.

Good legroom.  32" pitch?  Adequate seat width.  18"?

title: Swissair still shines
review_text:
Swissair has always stood for the kind of hospitality you expect from the Swiss - genuine, eager to help and a bit dated in a comforting kind of way. This flight was no different with one exception - I had purchased a "premium" meal and a half bottle of wine for about $40. Not surprisingly, it wasn't on board. I asked to speak with the Purser who sent a message to the base in Zurich that confirmed it hadn't been boarded, and what's more they had no record of it despite the receipt I printed. What happened next would only happen on an airline like Swiss.

The flight was extremely crowded and so there were no business class entrees available to serve to me. The Purser came back to me and said she'd find me something but I had to wait until everyone had chosen their meals. Seemed like a reasonable approach. As it turned out she was able to deliver me the business class appetizer of smoked salmon tartare, and the first class veal tenderloin with wine from one of the cabins in a real glass. Bravo Swissair.

A couple things to know - they still operate A340s which have no power at the seats and are somewhat tired looking on the inside. The other is if you're a Star Alliance Gold member (United etc) you can use the Swiss lounges which have great food and drink (they use Lufthansa's lounge in Boston).

All in all it was a very good flight delivered by a cabin team that cared.

title: Fly back from TelAviv
review_text:
good flight, no problems with weather or turbulences
personnel was nice, meal ok, all in all ok, now to get it to 100 ....

title: Good economy flight
review_text: Swiss airlines maintains a bit more attention to detail.  A menu, more pleasant, ready to provide a drink and the entertainment had more choice.

title: A Wedding
review_text: It was a good flight and smooth and I was glad to have used Swiss Airlines. Glad that I could go from Manchester rather than London

title: Good pleasant flight
review_text: Flew Lyon to Zurich in economy. Boarding was delayed due to air traffic controllers strike in another French City meaning delays in aircraft arriving. Furthermore there was a sudden change in boarding gate as we were already in line at another gate. Slight delay in takecof, but the staff handed out a Swiss Air chocolate bar as an apology. They also handed one out prior to landing. A snack of an apple turnover was offered (very tasty) plus the usual hot/cold drinks. Staff efficient and very friendly. Seats were OK for economy class.

title: Issue at Samui airport with Business Class booked with SWISS
review_text:
We booked a business class in direct with Swiss. We had a massive issue at Samui airport because the company (Swiss international airlines) confirmed that the tickets were booked Business for the entire journey. This was confirmed over the phone. In fact we were informed upon checking at Samui that it was after our first changed in Bangkok. This created an issue with our luggage because the supplier company has different conditions. So we raised a complaint and the company could not assist us at any level. 
We raised it to the client service but nothing has been done and no action as been taken to solve the issue. It was just a poor booking experience. And a poor service from SWISS.

title: A learning experiance.
review_text:
We were on vacation trying to get from Basel to Prague.  Swiss Air has a program to take a train from Basel to Zurich then a plane to Prague (this also applies to multiple other destinations).  This is booked together through Swiss Air.  What I didn't read in the fine print is you can take any train that day.  Also in the fine print they will pick up your luggage at your Lodging for an extra charge and check it in on your flight.  The train ride takes about an hour and half and is very scenic. Some trains make more stops than other trains.

What they didn't explain is this train is an economy/commuter train.  There were more tickets sold then seats.  The cars did not have any space for luggage except for overhead bins.  People were standing in the aisle or in the area between the cars.  Also there was no explanation that the train goes to the Zurich train station and you have to take another train to the airport.

If I were to do it again it would be less stressful as I would not have to spend a significant amount time trying navigate the trip.  I would definitely upgrade to first class on the train portion of the trip.  But I am not sure how or if you can upgrade to first class with out having to upgrade the flight to first class.

The plane portion of the trip was uneventful and nice.

title: Delay and no compensation
review_text: Very poor customer service, very stingy, for a 6 over delay I got 10 CHF, a water aline is 4.50 and a salad 18CHF. Airport in Geneva is very unorganised, got sent back and forth with nobody knowing where I should go. For sure my last flight with swiss.

title: On-time and customer responsive.
review_text: The journey was London-Zurich-Shanghai. Both flights on-time departure and arrival. Ground and in-flight staff were cheerful and highly responsive. In-flight meals pretty reasonable too.

title: Exciting
review_text:
Check in difficult online. Easy and efficient at airport. Request for a particular aisle seat given with understanding and care. In-flight entertainment ordinary. Non vegetarian meal not available in the last rows. Transit time minimal. No help given to passengers to go long distances between gates in Zurich. Immigration in Zurich adds to problems.
Return flight was even worse. BCN-ZRCH flight delayed.  Had to be transferred by van from one aircraft to another. Baggage left behind. Delivered three days later.
Meals problem remained.  No choice.
Chocolates after every meal.

title: Pleasant Airline to Fly With
review_text:
