The second leg of my flight from Heraklion in Crete to London Heathrow was on Swiss Airlines after an overnight stopover at an Airport Hotel.
Hadn't flown with Swiss Airlines before and certainly not since the financial re-organisation of the Airline after it went belly up a few years ago.
The aircraft was an A 320 which is not my most desired aircraft but was certainly OK for the short flight from Zurich to London.
Seating was the typical 3:3 leather Europe Club Economy style layout with the middle seat left vacant and a table placed over the squab. This enables the airline to move the barrier along the aircraft separating BC and Economy depending on the number of BC passengers flying
Overall pleasant flight with good food ( certainly not exceptional) and efficient and pleasant FAs.
The only drag was that we were delayed by about 20 minutes leaving Zurich which meant we lost our position in the queue both leaving Zurich and on arrival in London necessitating being put into a Holding Pattern over London.

title: Usually brilliant but on this occasion - terrible
review_text: We were no more than 5-6 minutes away from London City airport when we received a text message from Swiss advising that our flight was cancelled and that we were now booked onto an early morning flight the next day.  This was a major inconvenience as it meant I was now going to miss a pre-paid appointment that had been booked a month in advance and my wife was not going to arrive at work until lunchtime.  We travelled back to our accommodation and waited for the next day.  We then received a second text message early the following morning informing us that our second flight had also been cancelled and we had been automatically rebooked onto a mid-afternoon flight.  This meant my wife now missed a whole day from work which led to her having to loose a days holiday entitlement.  There was no direct apology, no overnight accommodation offered and no compensation for the cancellations and subsequent delay.  Very poor service Swiss!!

title: Heartless
review_text: Even with a 6 hour stopover at Zurich airport, we were not offered any refreshments, leave alone lounge access. Most European airlines are heartless anyway, but Swiss takes the cake. All middle eastern and most Asian airlines would offer you a meal coupon you can redeem in an airport restaurant. Moreover, the immigration (passport control) as well as the security queues in Zurich now take 45 minutes each so be prepared to rush if you have a connection in less than 90 minutes.

title: Excellent flight and on time!
review_text: To start with a good flight a journey is always wonderful. We experienced the SWISS flight LX1830 as a good beginning of our ten days holidays in the Peloponnes.

title: Pleasant and relaxing
review_text:
Pleasant and relaxing
The flight crew was very friendly and attentive.
Wide range of entertainment and food is more than fine for an airline.
I can only recommend the economy class for longer flights.

title: Swiss Chocolate Before Landing
review_text: This was my first flight with Swiss Air, and everything was great! I had to transfer in Zurich. I really enjoy both the short flight from Geneva to Zurich and the long flight from Zurich to Chicago. There are a lot of entertainment options, the crew were very friendly, and everything was clean. Food was great, and the crew were active in serving snack and drink a number of times. They gave out swiss chocolate before landing, which was very nice.  I will definitely use Swiss Air again.

title: Best flight from/to TLV so far
review_text: Highly recommend! The most laid back and comfortable flight I've ever had. Seats were spacious, every person had their own entertainment with TONS of new (still in theaters) movies and new TV shows, as well as nature docs, docs on Switzerland, etc.. The food was delicious (they served ICE CREAM and a bunch of Swiss cheeses and chocolates!) and the flight attendants were very attentive and accommodating. Also--they were super lax and accommodating with my excessive (and heavy) suitcases; even sent my carry-ons underneath as a courtesy. From now on only flying Swiss, worth the extra $100, especially when it's such a long flight!

title: Comfortable journey
review_text:
The crew was very attentiv to the flight guests.
Comforable leather seats, a freshly made sandwich of high quality ingredients, perfect offer of drinks.

title: Good Airline
review_text: I had to fly Swiss Air from Geneva to Zurich. Would have preferred the train, but needed to be in Zurich earlier than train would have allowed. Glad I did this as the flight was on time and efficient. Got me to my meeting early. Stewards were friendly and flight was quite smooth.

title: Worst Business Class Ever
review_text:
This was just pure disappointment.
Service on the ground and on board - almost not existent.
We were treated as unnecessary ballast.
No real taking care of the passenger.
Worst than economy class.
The seat controls were broken and the staff were not able to fix it.
Comfort of seat was like sleeping in a coffin. 
Food - disgusting.
Never again!

title: The only canceled flight
review_text: We were going on our honeymoon at Christmas time and Swiss airline ruined and shortened our 1week holiday, because flight from Heathrow was canceled , the only flight from the board canceled. They transfered us to Luthansa airline via completely different city and they didnt have same day connection. So irresponsable! I was choosing to fly via Zurich on purpose. And this is not the only time Swiss air canceles flights to people that I know! Never again with Swiss Air!

title: Reliable & good
review_text: Had a good, no fuss flight. Nice service, reliable, efficient. Good, small meals. Flights on time. Would fly again.

title: Completely unreliable on certain routes
review_text:
My reisdence is in Switzerland; therefore I use SWISS regularly for convenience. While I am, in general, satisfied with their service, I am very frustrated about their reliability for the Lugano-Zurich route, where they are the only provider at present.
Out of 4 confirmed flights, which I reserved over the last 2 months 3 have been cancelled at the last minute. 
Obviously, this causes problems for reaching connecting flieghts. I am not the only client suspecting SWISS to cancel flights, when they consider not having enough passengers on the flight.    Very bad publicity.

title: Fantastic
review_text: First of all, a brand new plane (Bombardier CS 300) I have never seen such big windows in an airplane!! Secondly we got seated on row 3, with a lot of legroom. Thirdly the flight attendants were very serviceminded, and the plane was on time.

title: Very good as usual
review_text: Very good flight as usual, in time, clean Aircraft, comfortable seats and very kind and efficient on board service by the crew. Be careful whenever you have connections in Zurich to have enough time to reach the connected fligt, sometimes Swiss is reducing a lot this time.

title: First Class Zurich - New York
review_text:
As always flying Swiss First class to NYC is a dream. 

The fast track pick up Limo from home to the airport then fast track through to the Zurich airport VIP lounge (not swiss first class lounge) this lounge is something else and the staff are amazing it is much better than the Swiss first class lounge. 

Fast track to my first class seat and all the comforts I could wish for. 
The food and wine are second to none and the staff pay attention to all your needs.

One of the best first-class services to NYC.

title: Flight to Berlin
review_text: From check-in to boarding, flying and baggage claim - everything was good. Nothing to complain about. Drinks and food served (nice sandwich!).

title: Business class Okay.
review_text: I didn't find the flat beds very comfortable, also a pain to set up. As I don't sleep well on any flights I found that the cabin crew kept getting annoyed with me for asking for service in the middle of the night.

title: I took swissair because it had a direct flight to zurich.Knowing the swiss hospitality i was expecting a great inflight.
review_text: I am not giving a good rating to this flight as the attitude of the flight staff is not good.The meals served were also poor in taste and quality.

title: flight
review_text: they only offers cheese sandwiches but i am allergic on cheese. So there is nothing they offer! No Swiss chocolates onboard anymore - cost savings obviously.

title: Lost bag
review_text: Bag lost and nobody cares. Checked in my wife's bag then my bag at Vienna airport. Both bags left on the conveyor belt together. Only one arrived at Zurich airport the other has arrived as well but not in this load. Sent from terminal A to terminal B and told it would be ten minutes. After three ten minute periods I was getting frustrated but told these things happen and just wait. Thirty minutes later it arrived, no apologies, poor customer service.

title: Terrible airline !
review_text: First, the seat was to narrow. I could barely move, second, food was terrible, we had a kind of sweet and sawer chicken that I was uneatable and last but the less, the movie selection was very bad. I was attonish about the quality of this fight.

title: Always prompt and friendly
review_text:
Swiss still provides , included coffee, juice and depending on time of day croissant, filled roll or ice cream. You can even get a free beer if you ask.
 When so many others  are cutting this service and making a charge but still their flight costs are not reduced - like BA I chose to fly with Swiss

title: Reasonable price, safe flight, polite staff, minimal customer service.
review_text: The price was ok. The aircraft was clean and the hostesses were very polite. The food and beverage served was minimal. No in-flight entertainment. Overall safe flight.

title: Paerfect, as usual
review_text:
Perfect, as usual.Swiss staff never impose themselves but is reacting quickly and correctly when required. Though, during this flight they have left me without sugar for tea, even if sugar was asked for.

Still, everything was fine, even if it was for the first time (they did not help me with sugar) in my 30 years perfect experience of flying with Swiss.

title: Very good
review_text: We have only travelled once with Swissair. A smaller plane than usual, very comfortable seating, a small snack, drinks and a Swiss chocolate. The stewards were very pleasant. One of our best flying experiences.

title: Best Airline for short haul flight within Europe
review_text: It wasn‚Äôt the first time I used Swissair and never been disappointed.Sometimes on business,occasionally on economic class.I received the same friendly,smiley service..The fights were on time,which there‚Äôs days became a bonus.Swissair still serves complementary drinks and sandwiches in economy class,they haven‚Äôt lose their touch like BA or Br√ºssel Airways.Seats are comfortable and flights are smooth..I can‚Äôt find any complaints...I would definetely reccomend

title: In time, fantastic information about my next flight.
review_text: In time, fantastic information about the next flight, from Zurich to Lisbon (LX2088) about the gate and terminal.

title: Normal
review_text: Nothing really good or bad to point out, unless the meal served on board that is very poor compared with other air companies.

title: Too expensive for the comfort received
review_text: The "legendary" service of Swiss doesn't apply in Economy. The quality of the food was very bad, the seats extremely uncomfortable and the reclination angle of the back rest is simply ridiculous. I booked the ticket for half the price on United Airline's website and still flew on the Swissair plane.  The same happened on the way back, I booked via United's website and sat in a Swissair aircraft. It is outrageous what Swissair is extorting its passengers. Likely the same price discrimination applies for business and first class passengers.

title: One of the best Air Carriers!
review_text: I love Switzerland, the red colour, the white cross,  chocolates, and fondue! Swiss International Air Lines is part of my preferences!

title: Agreeable experience
review_text: Punctual, pleasant and comfortable flight. Good food, good service and a polite, cheerful crew. Only the long (6 hour) layover was a bit trying. But that couldn't be helped I suppose.

title: Flight home
review_text: On time boarding and departure. Arrived 10 minutes early. Good in flight service except for special meal request. We had a confirmation of our request for special meal, however, it was not on roaster of in-flight service. For 12 hours flight, it was disappointing.

title: Transiting through Zurich is fine
review_text: I pre booked the single seat on right hand side and find this best. 1.5 hours transit is fine and Zurich is easy to navigate unlike some. Sleeper seats not as comfortable as others but also fit for purpose

title: Boarding chaotic, Flight quite good
review_text: Flight fulfilled everything you expect from a European Airline. Only problem was that Business Class passengers boarded through the same bridge as Economy Class. This led to quite a queue.

title: Good trip
review_text: Despite the flight being slightly late due to a bird strike at zurich the flight was excellent.  It was comfortable, friendly and the staff were extremely helpful.  A snack and drink were served in flight gratis and despite running out of vegitaian rolls the crew managed to find an alternative - We would fly with Swiss again.

title: Event Free Flying Experience
review_text: It happens to be one of the best flying experience in over 26 years. Very few airlines compare to the in-flight entertainment services, take off and landing expertise and comfort of the aircraft.

title: Friday night flight
review_text:
It was a Friday evening flight,  before a long weekend, so the flight was full until the last seat. In these circumstances, I do not understand why we allow all these people to board the plane with a suitcases, even if they have the dimensions allowed. It's chaos if you are one of the last to board the plane.
So given the conditions, the hostesses were charming, smiling, very professional, and the flight, quite short arrived on time. It was ok but it was not a pleasant flight.

title: still one of the best airlines on long distance flights
review_text: friendly helpful personnel, sufficient leg space, good seat comfort, good entertainment program, good meals and good cleanliness

title: Amazing airline
review_text: Friendly staff and amazing service. Boarded on time, took off on time and the captain made a few helpful announcements as to where we were and when we were going to land.

title: Planes kept breaking down
review_text:
Plane from Nice was late due to storms which meant we missed our connection.
The plane in Zurich broke down and didn't even get to the runway.
The replacement plane also broke down.
Some Swiss Air staff were very pleasant and helpful. One male member of staff was so rude to my wife and 11 year old son I almost assaulted him.

title: Emergency Flight back to the UK
review_text: I had to book a flight very quickly back to the UK in April and the only flight out of Spain on the same day was Swiss Air via Zurich to Heathrow.  From the Boarding, inflight service, connecting in Zurich to arriving in Heathrow, the overall experience was amazing and I would highly recommend anyone having the choice to fly Swiss Air.

title: Great airline company
review_text: Fantastic service onboard the flight. Only drawback. To little space in seats in economy class. I payed for extra legroom on the flight back from Miami. But it was very cold by the exit door.

title: punctuality, excellent service also for short flight, skilled personal
review_text: one of the reliable, best airlines in the world. Good aircrafts, skilled personal aircrafts are good maintained and they are almost all very young. Easy to find one`s way and board

title: Excellent Business Class within Europe
review_text:
Treated myself on a Business Class trip using my M&M miles for a roundtrip Warsaw-Malaga.

The flight from ZRH to AGP was on time, the business class was almost fully booked (7 rows!).
The service was of a very high quality as well as the food and drinks offered. We could chose from several dishes and I selected the steak.
I had not expected to receive such a great steak in an airplane, given the circumstances that there is no kitchen on board the quality of the steak was really very good. Enjoyed every bite!

Flying Swiss Business Class, even within Europe is worth while.

title: Hamburg to Athens
review_text:
I took the economy flex option, so that I can select my seats.  Unfortunately on all legs of my flight they changed them, as the notification said "regret to inform you that you are re-seated because of equipment change".... No options given... but you are re-seated.  Perhaps, they should have refunded the extra I paid for to get the flex..  Nope they did not!

Not very impressed with their boarding announcement, not the gate crew.... seems like they feel... that they are doing the passengers a favor, instead of treating them as a paying customer.

Would not fly Swiss again.

title: Nice Croissant!
review_text:
There were not too many people on the flight from Zurich to Bordeaux as the flight was very early in the morning. 
Service is as usual. I was served a cup of coffee and a croissant. The croissant was nice and crispy.

title: Reliable, punctual and comfortable
review_text: The check-in and boarding experience was flawless. The aircraft was a new Bombardier 100, with comfortable seats, and less CO2 emissions than the other planes of similar kind. Crew members were very helpful and kind, and the departure and arrival were punctual almost to a second.

title: Seating too close
review_text: Itc was ok. Nothing special. Not much room between seats. Service ok. Seat confortable. - Trying for 100

title: Outstanding!
review_text: I have not flown Swiss First for some time. I was pleasantly surprised as to the improvement since my last flight. The excellent service was still the same but the food has vastly improved. Good variety, excellently presented and every dish tasted delicious. Probably the best airline food I have ever had. Well done to the Swiss team!

title: Great flight one of the better airlines
review_text:
Comfortable with friendly flight attendants.
Always on time with no delays.Clean aircraft and smooth flight

title: Exellent flight with good service
review_text: I has two flights with SWISS. First was from Lisbon to Zurich and second was from Zurich to Saint Petersburg, Russia. The quality of flying was excellent.Take off and landing were perfect. There were not turbulence and shaking during the flights. The food and drinks in the second flight were quite good. Breakfast in Swiss style was with tasty vegetable and egg casserole (like omlet with vegetables), piece of cheese, dried prunes and apricots and something in between sweet yogurt and cottage cheese with cream. The portion size was not large, but sufficient to enjoy the meal.

title: Long delays, significant re-route, with no responsibility taken
review_text:
We were delayed with more than 24 hours due to hydrolic issues. The service was disappointing and shocking. 
We took off 2 hrs late, and had to turn back. On arrival in Jhb there were no clear direction from ground staff of where to go or what to do. 
Dinner was NOT served on the plane, and the hotel informed us that the kitchen was closed (it was after mid-night). 
Passangers had to give their telnr and email addresses for further communication but nothing was received. Paper letters were circulated with a number in South Africa - that had an answering machine stating that it could not help - and a Swiss number. It took significant effort to get through to Swiss air and in the end, after an almost 30 min conversation, we got a flight via Dar Es Salam and Doha (instead of the direct flight booked). 
It was a nightmare! 
On writing Swiss a couple of days after they took no responsibility, as they said the flight was booked through Expedia and Not directly through them. 
On further investigation it also became clear that although Swiss acknowledges EU Reg 261/04, their interpretation of it is different from the rest of EU, leading to little / almost no successful claims. 
The claim service orientation, but the experience was shocking - and sadly not my only frustrating Swiss flight....

title: First time sleep well during long flight
review_text:
The flight was on time and very steady. 
I used to be hard to sleep during the flight but I could sleep well this time.

title: Always customers in mind
review_text: When I fly with Swiss I always have the feeling that the customer is in the foreground. As appreciated by frequent flyers a very good feeling

title: SWISS deserves its solid reputation
review_text: If you are looking for gateways into Europe, flying SWISS into Zurich could be a good option. I flew Singapore-Zurich (instead of using the traditional London or Paris gateway) and found their service excellent. Newish aircraft (Boeing 777), friendly helpful staff, on time departures are the norm. And the very modern, easy to navigate Zurich International Airport is very appealing compared to the outdated Charles de Gaulle or complex Heathrow. I flew onto Spain from Zurich and found it stress-free.

title: Perfect First experience on Swiss
review_text: I flew on Swiss International airlines - Airbus A330, from BOM to ZRH. This was the first experience with swiss. I went to Toronto, but had a connection at Zurich from there i was shifted to Air Canada. Swiss is really an amazing carrier. Right from Check in till arriving at ZRH, it was just an awesome feeling. The crew members were fabulous, great service. The seats were so comfy for a flight of approx 8 hrs. Food quality was just fabulous. Inflight entertainment 10/10. Aircraft was so clean and was really amazing. Seats arrangements was amazing with a good legroom. and my most favorite part of flying Swiss is they thank the passengers by giving delicious swiss made chocolates, that was really delightful. To sum up It was just Perfect.

title: An unpleasant surprise!
review_text:
We all have a presumption about anything from Switzerland: that's a great quality!
That's what I thought about this airline company. Until...
It was a flight that lasted almost 12 hours.During such a long flight, it is very important, among other things, that the level of entertainment is at a high level in terms of selecting movies, series, documentaries, games ... in order to pass the flight as "painless". As soon as I settled down, I realized that my screen did not work. I signaled it to the flight attendants and got the promise to react as soon as the flight took off. After an hour and my new complaint, another steward came and offered me to change the seat. The offered place was much worse, in the middle and far from my friends with whom I traveled. Since I refused a replacement, I could no longer complain. They tried to cheer me up, they tried to be humorous and polite more than with others, but I already had enough! And then the air conditioner also took care to "put the road ahead": the temperature was below 12 ¬∞, we covered it on the head, and the explanation of the staff was that the fault has existed for some time! I wondered what else was not working on this plane and prayed to reach the destination safely.
Unfortunately, great meals, drinks, chocolate ... everything was in the shadow of this.

title: Swiss Air poor customer service
review_text: Having paid a premium for Swiss Air my family holiday was ruined by Swiss Air deliberately separating our family on the return flight such that my 9 year old son had to fly on his own despite promises and assurances that Swiss Air would resolve before take off. Three months later the matter is not resolved.

title: Efficient - as you would expect
review_text: Swiss Air was fine, arrived and left on time. The planes are slightly small - 2 sets of 2 seats, I had to sit on the opposite set of seats to my wife going out to help balance the load (the flight wasn't full). Coming back the flight was full so no problems with weight load. You get a free drink and croissant and a little bar of Swiss Chocolate (nice touch). The flight was uneventful, the staff were all friendly. The price for this flight is reasonable if you book well in advance, but as the travellers are mainly business people, Swiss Air really clobber you if you try to make a late booking (over 4 times the price) so they are taking advantage of business people that haven't got a choice but to book. I would fly with them again - no problems. But make sure you book well in advance!

title: Good flight, poor food
review_text: Main choice on Zurich - St. Petersburg and Zurich - Moscow routs is between Aeroflot and Swiss. Swiss is often cheaper. Aeroflot has better food an sometimes newer airplanes (like USB-chargers in each seat and iPad holders). Swiss is often late on Moscow route (so keep extra reserve of at least 30 min on arrival). For Moscow Swiss flights to Domodedovo which is OK, but  Aeroflot to Sheremetyevo and Sheremetyevo is a poor choice. Swiss seems to be less ready to handle troubles - had once 1 hour delay due to manual boarding when computers broke in Zurich airport.

title: Swiss - Consistently good flight experiences
review_text:
Swiss does everything well. Food is decent. The entertainment options are excellent and the seats are comfortable.

Only thing I do not like about this flight is the airplane only has middle of economy toilets - which is inconvenient if you are near the back of the plane as one must wait for the various services to complete before going to the bathroom.

title: Swiss Air Line - Overall good experience
review_text: Overall a positive experience. Food was good, service good and the landing in Zurich exceptional compared to other landing experiences with a first bump

title: Like flights used to be less than a decade ago
review_text:
Reasonable seats, reasonable entertainment, fine service, very punctual.
Swiss breakfast (it's just the Swiss way - don't expect much).

title: Nice crew, very tasty food!
review_text: Swiss airline are good airline in general but we do not like the seats. There werent very comfortable and plane seems to be old fashioned inside. Arline crew were amazing, very friendly and attentive, always happy to help and served refreshment. Food was really tasty. Anyway price for this flight ticket was very good, so we do not want to complain at all :)

title: It's a good Airline
review_text: I have a chances to travel by Swiss air, it's quite a good Airline over all, the only sad thing for me is that I can't travel both way direct and they should change their cutlery to normal ones instead of the plastic one.

title: No Hassle
review_text: Use the flight when we go to Switzerland. The 08:40 from Manchester arrives before midday local time, leaving enough time to access any resort in the country. Good reliable service. We normal take an late afternoon return flight, again meaning that getting to the airport isn't a "crack of dawn job"!

title: FROM COLD TO INDIAN HEAT
review_text: Great flight with warm welcome. The only weak point is business class passengers treatment on arrival with no special support.

title: Great airline
review_text: Very comfortable, clean aircraft. Attentive crew. Smooth flight with good announcements from the cockpit. Food was a little basic but very short flight so not an issue.

title: Geneva  - London with Swiss
review_text: Very good service in terms of online booking, the flight was on time, even on short distance drinks and bretzel is served.

title: classic flight with low quality meals
review_text: You get on board at 1.15 a.m.. A (low quality oily wrapped) snack is served immediately after the take off, until you have the breakfast an hour before landing. The food quality on night flights of Swiss is terrible. Instead of serving a fresh snack (fruit juice, fruits, salads, healthy snacks), you are only served ready made meals (a sandwich) and a "normal" breakfast. Except higher quality from Swiss.

title: Flying with Swiss Air is a pleasant experience, hostesses are friendly and accommodating. Food and beverages good
review_text: The trip to Shanghai I have made several times over the last years. The direct flight from Zurich brings me every time well on time to Shanghai. The flight is easy going and well served by Swiss Air. It saves me a lot of headache to get there well rested and relaxed.

title: Always a pleasure !!
review_text: Traveling with Swiss is always a pleasure. Always on time, new planes, clean. Food is really good and latest movies. Arrived in Chicago fresh as it was a 2h flight.

title: ZRH-MLA : short and classic flight but with professional cabine crew
review_text:
Efficient Check-in in ZRH, boarding as well !
The flight, even short, was very nice with a good snack and a good cabine crew contact.
Not a new plane, but the seats were correct.

title: Flight
review_text: Very short flight, but with a Boeing 777. Nice experience to see the insight of the cabin of this long-distance plane. Service perfect, coffee and croissant. But also to say, economy-class very narrow, ten seats in one row. Must be a stress for passengers flying 8 and more Hours.

title: Swiss airways - Excellent Food
review_text: I flew from Barcelona to Delhi and it was my first experience with Swiss International. The flight was going okay with a good assortment of entertainment but what really stood out for me, was the food - Completely unlike the food you'd expect on an airline.

title: New plane and very good service
review_text:
I was on a short trip with friends to London and I was pleasently surprised with the plane and the crew. It was a short journey but enjoyable nevertheless. The Bombardier plane was spacious and very comfortable with leather seats. The interior design was very well thought of. 
I have traveled with Swiss before and it was always mediocre and lackluster. But it has picked up and becoming the airline it used to be in the 80‚Äôs and 90‚Äôs again.

title: There may be cheaper airlines.
review_text: There may be cheaper airlines. But if I consider Taxi-fares to the relative airport, or parking fee, or that I had to take a Hotel in Basle, because there was no connection to my home in a little county, and if I consider, that the cheaper ones fly earlier, or later as for me convenient and that Swiss usually get there on time, it is by far cheaper for me.

title: Confident and reliable
review_text: Clean plane, attentive team, clear. As always, it's nice to get small Swiss chocolate¬†bars as a compliment from the airline

title: Nice
review_text: Check in and security was a breeze! The flight was fine.  They had wine and beer, decent food and good service.  The in-flight movies were current.  Everyone got a pillow and a blanket and they were clean.  The cheap seats were pretty tight.  Glad we're short.  The lack of space is the only reason I didn't give 5 stars.  I'm only 5'3" and couldn't bend down to pick something up if it fell.  I can't imagine a large man sitting in those seats.  We connected in Zurich- quick and easy transfer to our Madrid flight.  Wish there was a economy plus option.

title: SFO-ZRH Direct in style
review_text: SwissAir Business class direct San Francisco to Zurich is a *very* classy flight.  Business class seats offer all the comforts you need including: massage, lie-flat, in-seat power outlets, a closable shelf/drawer for your small valuables and plenty of overhead space.  Food options are fantastic and the service is well above American service.  Flight left on time and arrived early.  Typically Swiss: under promise and over deliver.

title: Eye Contact
review_text: Flew business class both ways.  Seats were excellent in business class and was able to catch some sleep on the way over in close to flat position.  The cabin crew both on the way over and the way back were very personable.  Made good eye contact so they knew when you needed or wanted something.  Was able to watch recent movies.  This is hardly a complaint but if you are traveling with someone you have to look around a small obstruction to speak to them.  Of course, if you are by yourself and don't want to be bothered that is actually a plus.

title: Disappointing
review_text: worst flight so far, the service on board  was very bad.. 12 hour flight and the crew was so hectical and unfriendly...

title: My favorite airline to and from Europe
review_text: Swiss Airlines makes my frequent travel to Europe easy and affordable.  Thanks to their B777 airplane used for long haul and to the FAs who are warm and friendly.  I am always looking forward to the delicious food on board.  My Zurich-Prague flight was memorable flying on business class.  Quick flight yet excellent experience.

title: Smoothest landing ever!
review_text: It was an OK flight but what I was impressed by was the landing....from London to Geneva was horrible but from Geneva to Athens was the smoothest one ever . I didn't even realise we landed....

title: Long suffering passengers
review_text: In a word. TERRIBLE!. The Business Class was less than that provided for Premium Economy in other airlines. Overcrowded and cramped. The food was on par with the very poor service provided by cabin staff. I would have no hesitation in saying that I would stay at home before I would accept another flight with Swissair.

title: Good choice
review_text: Good service and polite Cabin crew. Food is bad, Croissants are not fresh. But this is a small thing for the OK impression of the airline company.

title: Long weekend holiday
review_text: A satisfying flight with good service and refreshments ,can  recommend to all my friends in Europe and elsewhere of the world.Nothing can compare a clean and friendly staff at Swiss Air

title: Not so great
review_text:
Heard a lot about the airline's service, quality etc. but did not feel any better or different. 
Staff was polite and helpful though some were completely ignorant of safety procedures when the cabin supervisor decided to have manual safety demonstration.

title: Excellent company
review_text: They still have a excellent service, you become some food and for drink. Also you become chocolate (what's else). This company works like all big companies some years ago. Newspapers, food, beverages,... Stewards still very competent and cabin crew inform you normally 1 or 2 times where you are at moment and indicate cities or interesting points you can see at landscape at this moment.

title: Always the best
review_text: Such a friendly welcome, it is always like coming home early. Comfortable seats, good service, good food and wines.

title: Glacier Service Experience
review_text:
While the flight was uneventful - great equipment  (Airbus 330), clean cabin, food food and beverage offering, the service experience while onboard was one not expected on SWISS!

The Chief Purser, Swiss calls them Maitre de Cabine, had an attitude which I had not experienced for a long time. She verbal communication was defensive and had a lecturing tone.; as cold as the Swiss glacier water! Actually re reminded me of Frau Blucher in the movie Young Frankenstein.(A movie worthwhile watching)

My recommendation to her would be to remember that the passenger is always (almost) right. The passenger does not need to be lectured. After all, its me who pays her wages!

Thats the reason why I love Emirates. They tread you like a king - prior, during and after the flight!

Buckle up Swiss

title: Economy
review_text: Flew from LAX to Luxembourg Via Zurich. I did pay for extra legroom and the fight from check in through change over went really well. I only had 1.5 hours to catch my flight in Zurich but everything was very easy to find and I got to my gate with 20 min to spare. The crew was very helpful but the plane was packed and seats seem to get smaller every year. Hope to fly Business one day :)

title: Really comfortable
review_text: First time flying with Z√ºrich, my outbound flight was delayed by 1 hour but Swiss provided regular updates via their app, email and text message. The flight was spacious with the unusual seating arrangement of 3 and 2 split giving extra room. Complimentary snack, drinks and some Swiss chocolate was welcome.

title: Enjoyable flight to South Africa
review_text: Enjoyed the flight fron San Francisco to Zurich.  Good meal and lay flat bed allowed for 5 plus hours sleep. In flight entertainment was average and in need of updating.  Lounge in Zurich was great and helped with the long layover.

title: Great experience - this time
review_text:
My best flight for a long time !

Apart from the lousy room situation in the plane ( as with every other airline in eco as well ) it was a great, almost shocking, experience.

2 times service. Tasty, real food served in a well designed box. Everything fast, friendly and accurate. I felt like in a TV show were I was the one to be fooled. It was really great. 

Then I saw the reason - a master steward was on board testing and training the crew and it worked miracles. The way to Athens was lame, unfriendly and with dry sandwiches. Here it worked and - wow - it felt like back in the 80¬¥s when flying even eco was still fun. 

I am happy to pay a few bucks more for that to return !

title: Economy Class
review_text: 4 adults traveling out on Friday back on Tuesday 8am flight out 5 pm flight home so nice times give snack and a drink both ways flight crew very pleasant. Although had booked and had boarding pass on return we were issued with a seat change which resulted in me sitting on my own and weirdly had a spare seat next to me rest of my family on a different aisle. Booking in fine in uk but did have problems obtaining copies of boarding pass for way home. There was no inflight entertainment but it is a relatively short flight 1 hr 45mins something like that.Have used in the past and would use again

title: little stressful
review_text: well went I read the others review I felt I was in a different plane lol, was too small to be a almost 8 hrs. flight. not to bad but not good service inside.

title: Swiss Air Business Class
review_text: Flew Swiss business class, Zurich to Nairobi, excellent service, great meal. Seats were OK, could have been a few inches wider. Airbus 330-300. Same plane coming back, 12 days later. Meal service out of Nairobi has lot to be desired.

title: Airline going downhill
review_text: Paid $2100 for BOS-ZRH round trip, and I'm long-time Star Alliance gold member.  For these two flights (53/52)  I got very little for that.  Swiss is one of the worst when it comes to seat pitch.  While others seem to reverse the trend a bit, for an average guy like me (5'10) it's virtually impossible to sleep because my knees bump into the sharp edges of the seat in front of me. No power at the seat.  No way to open a small (13") laptop when front seat is laid back. Poor food (both the chicken and the pasta).  Old plane (A340).  On the ZRH E gate they managed to have 2 big flights to board on opposite gates at the same time, creating boarding chaos.  On top of that a security firm that performs extra searches with incompetent personnel.  Swiss is the only non stop BOS-ZRH, but next time I'll rather take a real UA flight, even if it takes a stopover.  I'll have an eco+ seat and will be treated better.

title: Great Experience
review_text: Our check-in agent was exceptionally pleasant and efficient.  After spending several hours in the Tom Bradley International     Lounge, where they had some lovely food offerings, we boarded LX 41 Business Class to Zurich.  Champagne cocktails were presented prior to departure.  The flight attendants were gracious thoughout the flight.  Since I am unfortunately Celiac, I had ordered a gluten free meal months in advance.  The flight attendant was nice enough to advise me that my gluten free meal was aboard,  prior to takeoff.  After dinner we made use of our flat sleeper beds and were able to get about six hours sleep between dinner and breakfast.  We had a couple hour connection in Zurich before our LX 556 flight to Bordeaux which we spent in the first class lounge using their wifi and a serving of salad.  The flight to Bordeaux was fine, flight crew pleasant.  We waited about 45 minutes for our baggage in Bordeaux after immigration.  Afterwards we proceeded to our Hertz car rental and a prebooked airport hotel to overnight before driving to our rental home in the Dordogne valley.  It was a long but enjoyable journey and I would highly recommend Swiss International.

title: Perfect
review_text: Just perfect! On time, on board service was nice and discreet, so in a few minutes a was able to take a nap. Comfortable and almost luxury sittings (compared to low-cost airlines). I'll definitely consider it again if they manage to became cheaper :)

title: Swiss air is ultimate luxury
review_text: I absolutely love flying Swiss airlines. I‚Äôve now had the opportunity to fly Swiss twice and both experiences have been excellent. The cost is high to fly business class over $6000 round trip from Los Angeles to Zurich and back. For the comfort, however, it is completely worth it. The seats expand so you are able to recline completely and actually sleep! When you wake up, you‚Äôre in Switzerland! The return flight wasn‚Äôt timed quite as conveniently, but the comfort level was there. The food was very good, especially for the number of people being served. The flight attendants were pleasant and attentive.

title: Standard SWISS
review_text:
Take flight from Zurich to Vienna.
Flight was a few minutes late but according captain reason was heavy air traffic.
On board  service was ok, in comparison to Austrian , Swiss are better.
So everything OK standard short flight. 
Aircraft was Airbus A320.

title: Poor Seating Planning & Rubbish
review_text: We booked business class flights through air miles to go away for our babymoon. We had automatic check in the day before. When we checked our luggage in at the desk, we specifically asked if we were sat together, and the check in lady responded yes. When we arrived to our seats we found that we were sitting on either side of the isle to each other. Considering that we booked the tickets in one purchase, i have gold status star alliance and we asked specifically at check in, I found this is be poor standard from Swiss. Luckily the kind gentleman sitting next to us agreed to move to a window seat so that we could sit together. Though this meant that he got all my gold preferences, such as first choice of food selection. Which meant that as we were sitting on the last row of business class, there were no options that were suitable for my pregnant wife. There were actually no options even on the menu for the starter that were not raw. The crew didnt come up with a solution so we had to ask the them if there were any suitable options in 1st class. Once we had asked again the cabin crew manager came to see us and apologised to us. She also got my wife a soup from 1st class. My wife's seat was also not cleaned properly, with rubbish from the previous flight in the pocket in front. There was also no washbag on her seat.

title: Terrible experience
review_text: It was a 15 hr flight and the service and skills are terrible. The staffs don‚Äôt have a good temper, one of them even told me to look inside the guide to find my answers and solve the problems myself and throw back the guide at me, and when I requested for some drink and the food I‚Äôve missed, I wait until the plane landed and it never came, and landing skills are not so good, I had my first plane sick with SWISS.

title: Great surprise
review_text:
I usually fly to Dubai with Emirates but this time I decided to try Swiss Int Airlines... and it was the best decision I made.
Very very kind staff, very comfortable seats, punctuality, good food.. 
I will repeat.

title: An excellent business clas sflight on Swiss
review_text: We flew on Swiss from Montreal to Budapest. The transfer in Zurich airport was easy and the comfort in Flight was very good. The meal service was excellent and the choice of wines very good. The crew is polite and bvery helpful. The comfort of the seat when changed to a bed was good.

title: Nice and easy flight
review_text: Easy flight, good service on board. Boarding was a bit complicated as there were two flights (one to Geneva and the  other to Zurich) and bus captains seemed confused where to take us !

title: Top Notch service with Swiss efficiency
review_text: If you are planning a trip to any part of northern or central Italy, skip the finicky, snobby  and flighty Alitalia people and go with the Swiss!  I have flown to Europe many times for business and have used Alitalia, Luftthanza and Swiss Air, and I find Swiss Air the most accommodating, friendly and personable airline of the three mentioned.  Zurich Airport is also very clean and well-organized.

title: A long weekend in India
review_text:
Decided to fly with Swiss instead of AF for once in order to fly with my friends 
Check in in Geneva was easy and on Wednesday morning definitely not busy. But due to a misunderstanding with the lady that check us in, we ended with seats that were not was we were expecting. I asked the lady in the lounge. It was difficult but at the end we managed to get our seat selected 24h ago (23h hours should I say with Swiss ) ...beginning wasn‚Äôt that smooth!
Transit in Zurich is easy and efficient as few people. The terminal for international flights is in the middle of the airport with a terrasse all around. Quite nice I would say to get fresh air and look at planes taking off or landing. Lounge is ok, but choice of newspapers and magazines is rather quite limited as well as the food choice. (AF lounges are ahead by at least two notches )
Boarding was ok but they would gain efficiency by setting up clear lines. Nevertheless it went smoothly 
Seats are quite old and screen small (my iPad screen is bigger !) compared to new business seats at AF, British Airways and Lufthansa. Choice of film is rather quite limited too. Old seats but allow you to have a real flat bed if needed. 
The amenities kit (made in cooperation with Victorinox) offered on the way to Mumbai is composed of a small pocket and on the way back to Zurich of a metal box which could be re-used to put pencils. I prefer the kit offered on the way to Mumbai as small grey pocket in tissue , nit, solid and in a nice grey color. I like the red socks üòé in it
Food: good but nothing out of the extraordinary. Plus the tray and plates,.. are not in line with the business standing. We could think we are at the cantine ! They have to improve this. Bread could be improved. ( on point : Croissants offered in the flights from Geneva to Zurich and Zurich to Geneva are either not fresh or were kept in a far too cold area. Quite dry and Not testy.). The omelette for the breakfast on my way back to Zurich from Mumbai was perfectly cooked and tasty. 
Staff is nice, available and ready to help each time you ask something. Both time, on the way out and in. 
Overall impression is that everything went smoothly but level remains one notch below what AF has to offer for the same price. 
two big differences nevertheless: Swiss crew are rarely on strike if never so highly likely you will reach your destination without much hurdles and Paris CDG hub can be sometime quite messy even if I have to confess some improvements have been made those last few years but more needs to be done

title: Direct flight to Bangkok
review_text:
my wife and I have flown to Thailand on 3 previous occasions, every time traveling via a short stop over in UAE. This time we decided to fly direct, reducing the traveling time from ca. 15 hours to 10.5hrs. The flight was very pleasant (although not a 380) and the flight crew took care of our every need. The legroom could have been better, however it was not any worse than any other economy flight.
To cut down on traveling time I would certainly fly with Swiss again.

title: service for families good
review_text: Boarding in Zurich was good and quite efficient, better than Dublin where families were asked to board together with all others, what is certainly not the best way

title: Great Flight - Useless website = online check-in
review_text:
upgraded to Business class as Swiss had an offer, which meant the round trip was cheaper than Easyjet/BA as Swiss do not charge for skis and boots.
Plane was late into LHR by about an hour which then padded out to 1.5 hours late into Zurich.
Food going out was fantastic but the food on the return was only fit for the bin - so the Zurich caterers let the airline down.

title: Basically almost all good
review_text: The only thing I've to criticise is the fact, Swiss copied low cost airlines by selling the seats, especially the ones XL . Has a person a choice to be tall or tiny ? For me ,this is discrimination !Recalls times when black people had to sit in the front of the bus.

title: Always lives up to expectations!
review_text:
Living in a city with a large regional airport opens up many international destinations without the expense, time or hassle of having to travel to London. For us a taxi to the airport costs about the same as bus and train and is a lot more convenient as it's door-to-door.

Swiss offer two flights a day direct from Birmingham to Zurich, one at either end of the day. The planes are usually full but mainly with business people. The service is almost always on time and onboard there is alway complementary hot and cold drinks and a croissant - oh yes and an individual mini bar of luscious Swiss chocolate on take-off and landing.

In Birmingham the plane is usually on a stand quite close to the departure hall and in Zurich it is often parked a distance away but departure gate is again close by and a bus ferries passengers out. 

Last time we flew smaller planes were used (Embraer 190) operated by Helvetic Airlines.

Both flights arrived on time.

title: Really nice airline
review_text: It was really nice experiance - new aircraft, helpfull cabin crew and good snacks (sandwitch and swiss chocolate). I really liked the experiance.

title: Flight back from Heraklion to Geneva
review_text: Nice new C Series plane, comfortable seats with decent leg room. Tiny baskets for holding personal items. Good snack and decent white wine.

title: Reliability Counts
review_text: After we were already ready to board the bus, to bring us to the plane, the flight was cancelled - due to some unknown obstacles - no information was provided. When being at the transfer desk we learned - the flight will go. And then there were Thunderstorms, but thankfully instead of landing in Miland the pilot decided to wait and with a slight delay, we arrived savely at home.

title: Horrible!
review_text: We thought that the Swiss was famous for their service. Once we boarded the flight they had a difficult time matching the passenger's to the list.The entire crew counted the passenger's up and down. Still couldn't get it right! Finally a manager also came on board. After much discussion she finally matched the numbers. Of course by then we had to wait for clearance to take off. The flight that was supposed to take of at 12:30 p.m. took of close to 2 p.m.! This is the second time it happened.  think what they need to do is have the list as we board the plane and check our names against the list, like in school:)

title: Just Swiss quality
review_text: Great service, very friendly cabin crew, the planes are very clean and comfortable. Food is pretty good. There's nothing negative to say.

title: late flight
review_text: the flight was delayed by an hour due to some strike somewhere else. the airline did not provide that information before check-in, only when already boarded.

title: SWISS Business Class on B777-300ER - Great as always
review_text: As always great service, amazing hospitality both on the ground at the THAI lounge and of course onboard the long flight that lasted 11 hours and 30 min.  The flight is operated with the Boeing 777-300ER, the newest of SWISS long haul fleet.  Those who may know, the new business class product that was introduced in 2016 is still top of the line among other leading airlines, a great classic and worm design, with a big personal touch screen, large Varity of newest movies, series, music channels and more.   At Your seat you will find A full flat bad, operated by a remote control, an amazing food service ‚Äì top swiss chefs are preparing the monthly menus, that also included Ice-cream for everyone in business class. So next time you are looking for a great way to spend your long flight, either to BKK or elsewhere - Do try to cheek out SWISS , I promise you wont be disappointed  :-)

title: Perfect flight - almost
review_text: I flew to TLV last week in C class. As always it was an excellent flight. Seat great (7K), food as well. But this time I have to point out that one flight attendant seemed to have a bad day. I don't like to name people on the net as this will be my first time but Mrs. Hurt was beyond my imagination of being friendly and up to the service level Swiss usually provides. She was rude, rolled her eyes and was quite harsh in her tone. Not only to me but to other passengers as well. She complained in the galley about "the crowd" on the flights to Tel Aviv. It has happened the first time to me that an attendant has shown such an attitude. And I simply insisted on my Kosher meal which I ordered in advance. But she said very harsh that I wasn't on the list and therefore did not put a sheet on my table for lunch. When she and her colleague came around for service her colleague wanted to prepare my table but  Mrs. Hurt turned to her and said that I didn't want to eat. I shortly explained my situation to her colleague and shortly after my kosher meal was served.

title: One of the best flights ever
review_text: Cabin crew of this flight was fantastic. One of the most professional and friendly I have ever experienced.

title: HORRIBLE EXPERIENCE
review_text: DO NOT BOOK ON SWISS - the customer service and care for passengers is horrendous.  They DO NOT CARE about their passengers.  They let contagious people fly on their airlines instead of rebooking them.  They don't respond to letters, emails or phone calls.

title: No longer a premium airline
review_text:
I am flying the NYC - ZRH - NYC route multiple times a month. In the past I have always found Swiss to be of better quality than your average European or American Airline. Not quite as good as the Asian or Middle Eastern carriers (Emirates, JAL, Korean, Singapore, Cathay) but still solid. 

Lately I find they are slipping:

Customer service in the US is still mediocre. Ability to reach someone and get someone on the phone who knows what is going on is terrible. 

Miles & More webpages and reporting is mediocre. Intransparent and just generally as user unfriendly as something like this can be. Shouldn't be that hard. milage account numbers change, account security is clumsy, transparency is screwed up. 

Ground staff (both in New York and in Zurich) is clueless. No announcements on delayed flights until passengers reach the gate. staff in the lounges are clueless as well. They have an attitude and focus more on how many devices are allowed to use the wifi per passenger than on trying to help make passengers feel welcome. Seriously? you need to limit the number of wifi devices?  

On flight crews are focused on selling duty free items and making sure they get their breaks.

title: Phone service needs help in flight service is great
review_text: In the last 12 months I have done 4 round trips flights on Swiss.!When you call the customer service line they barely speak English. Today she could not even understand me. I was trying to book seats because the website was down I am a business class passenger and she was trying to book me in economy. This happens every time I call Swiss. I think this is my lady Swiss flight.

title: Enjoyable
review_text: Serviceminded airline, continuous info about the flights, great service, great and friendly staff. Serves Swiss wine on the flight... Gotta love it‚ù§Ô∏èüá®üá≠If not the best, at least one of the best airlines to fly with.

title: Good Value for the money
review_text: it was good flight between Dubai and Muscat and it was really cheap, 190 $ for return flight. every thing was clean and comfort, the only thing which is make me think before i booked this flight again that its mid night flight.

title: Montreal-Belgrade via Zurich
review_text: This was my best flight from Montreal to Belgrade, everything on time, short stop in Zurich but enough for transfer, service in the plane was perfect, overall experience is completely satisfactory.

title: Extra Leg Room?
review_text:
Worried about enough leg room, I paid extra for seats with extra leg room on both
LX728 to Amsterdam and LX729 back to Zurich. I am not so tall but in both cases, it
would not have been possible for the person in the seat in front of me to let his seat recline! I don't know what would have happened if I had not paid extra!
On the positive side, the free sandwiches and soft drinks, plus some Swiss chocolate,
were a pleasant surprise.

title: en easy and comfortable flight
review_text: Everything went very smooth, as to be expected from a swiss Company. There were no delays, thanks God for that (althought the airlane could not be made responsable for that). Service good, stag friendly, so what else do you wish.

title: greate airline, maybe the best one
review_text: Everything was just perfect. From the purchase of the ticket to the completion of the flight I can not find one comment for improvement. Everything is accurate, clean, the times, the plane, the staff, the food, and the price. pleasure. Any destination I can fly with Swiss in the future is my preferred option. Highly recommended.

title: Happy flight
review_text: My first trip on Swiss is excellent. I sat two rows in front of the bathroom in the first leg of my journey (Newark-Zurich) and there was no odor. Legroom is plentiful and meals quite delicious. My seat in the second leg of the flight (Zurich-Hong Kong) is more cramped but still manageable. Crew is very courteous and efficient. Both flights arrived on time.

title: Good airline
review_text: Courteous flight attendants. Comfortable seats. Food however is not upto the mark. Did not like it. Beverages serving is great.

title: Just awful
review_text: The seats are jammed together. Thre was not enough legroom to begin with, but after the man infront of me lowered his seat, I could not move. In fact, to get out of my seat, I had to twist and rotate and climb on the seat next to me.  I was miserable until I fell asleep.  I never want to fly Swiss Air again.

title: Always good
review_text: I have flown this route many times and Swiss provide a slick service albeit that departing Lugano flights are often cancelled in poor weather conditions.

title: What wrong with Swiss nowadays?
review_text:
The seats were extremely narrow (more than previous flights?) that the service trolley had trouble going down the aisle without bumping into the seats all the time. 
The toilets were not well kept clean throughout the flight either. 
The worst was the attitude of the cabine staff - very unfriendly and not even the slightest smile throughout the entire flight. Banging down the trays and snatching them afterwards without a word nor smile, this was not the Swiss service that I have known for years. Worst of all, the staff obviously had some disputes amongst themselves and they were arguing in front of passengers. Very embarrasing indeed!

title: Daytrip from Z√ºri
review_text: Return leg of daytrip from Z√ºri to visit Armani Outlete in Vertemate Como IT.  Great fast track at Milan Malpensa. FANTASTIC new Lufthansa lounge at MXP which beats new Senator Lounge at MUC T2 Satellite! Brand new CS300 aircraft. Highly recommend Swiss!!

title: Short hop to Milano Malpensa
review_text: Daytrip to visit Armani Outlet in Vertemate Como IT Nice aircraft,  efficient crew and total lack of Senator/Business lounges at A Gates At least wifi code from ZRH-TLV LX 10 days earlier still working!!

title: Widebody to/from Israel
review_text: I always fly Swiss to/from Tel Aviv.  Ben Gurion is one of the best airports in the world in my humble opinion Good Dan Lounge friendly service which is efficient on ground on boatd and on arrival in Z√ºri.  Recommend dayflights rather than the redeye flight into outof TLV for fantastic views Today Seat 4A throne free for Lufthansa Senators like myself.  No free upgrade to First with Business service this flight, unlike my flight 9 days earlier.  You can use the lounges if connecting to shower etc Highly recommend and widebodied aircraft to/from Europe are basically only operated by Swiss Lufthansa stopped A340 MUC and 747 FRA to TLV years ago

title: Only Swiss to/from Tel Aviv!!!!
review_text: I always fly Swiss to/from Tel Aviv connecting in ZRH.  Wide body A330 comfort is rare on this route to/from Europe.  Great E Gates lounges, solid service on board and First Class seats with business class service for free if connecting to/ from First Class at ZRH and sometimes free for Lufthansa Group Senators Luckily today Seat wasreassigned from 4A Throne in business to 2A in First What a great way to fly!!!

title: Comfort on the 777300ER
review_text: Great flight from SIN-ZRH to connect to Tel Aviv Preassigned 7A Throne free as a Lufthansa Senator First time in C on 777 last time was in F Good food great service on board masses of storage space in throne seat and the most attentive Maitre d' Cabine who checked with me throughout 13 hour flight is all was good and if I would like anything Highly recommend Swiss Business far ahead of inferior Lufthansa Business!!  My only criticism is the seat is too narrow to sleep on back, disappointing given the width of seat and both sidetables is about the width of the First seat. If yoy arrive in ZRH in Swiss Business makesure you use either the EGates Business and or Senator lounges and the Swiss Arrival Lounge landside!! Will fly again!!!

title: Exellent as usual
review_text: No problems, as usual with Swiss. This company is certainly among the best in Europe. Probably, except of food which is offered on board. Even taking into account the flight which is more than 2 hours.

title: Damaged my suitcase without compansation
review_text: I used to consider Swiss International Airlines (SwissAir thereafter) one of the best airlines. Not any more! I took a SwissAir flight from Chicago to Lisbon with a transfer in Zurich on April 18, 2018 (arrived in Lisbon on April 19). My suitcase was checked in all the way from Chicago to Lisbon. After arriving in Lisbon and picked up my suitcase, I saw my suitcase was cracked badly to the level that it was no longer useable. I went to luggage office in Lisbon Airport and waited for almost 30 minutes before someone could talk to me. A lady asked me what happened and looked at my suitcase, then filled out a claim form, explaining I needed to call the phone number on the form the same day. I did and asked to get a replacement suitcase before I leave Lisbon in 4 days. It did not happen. It turned out that SwissAir contracted to a company to handle damaged suitcase issues and there is no way to contact SwissAir. I have emailed the company, which handles damaged suitcases, but still have not got a replacement suitcase. It has been 21 days since I first reported damaged suitcase, but SwissAir or its contract company has not done anything to compansate or replace my damaged suitcase. I cannot believe this is how SwissAir treat its customers.

title: Sure value with a small "but"...
review_text: Although the cabin was not really well decorated, the service was exceptional. Food, wines, amenities - everything was top notch. The only thing that we may object is that we were flying to Osaka in Japan and were only transiting via Shanghai. The hostess was not able to give us precise information about transfer in Shanghai airport. We were given wrong forms to fill out (the yellow ones instead of smaller blue forms used for transit gates). She wasn't sure and promised to come back to inform us properly before the landing but she never came back. We had only 2 hours and we almost missed the connecting flight to Japan. This is the only disadvantage we can mention, everything else was excellent.

title: First time on Swiss Air
review_text:
We flew from Montreal to Venice via Zurn,
Great airline, so well organized boarding. Comfortable seating, exceptional service.
Puts US air lines to shame.
Will absolutely be flying them again.

title: Family trip to the states
review_text:
Great airline, very laid back and friendly staff.
Good ariline for the longer flights. Will travel again

title: Excellent Airline
review_text: First time flyer with Swiss Air but it won't be the last, an excellent Airline, smooth and pleasant flight, friendly and  professional staff.

title: What were Swiss Airlines thinking?
review_text:
Travelling to Miami from Zurich on March 30th, to commence a family holiday in The Bahamas, I had been looking forward to the flight with Swiss. I have used Swiss Airlines many times, to travel to the UK, South Africa and parts of Europe. I live in Switzerland and have, where possible, checked out Swiss first of all for my trips. They are usually dependable, punctual and the service is good. 
Imagine my shock, therefore, when my family and I took this flight to Miami. The Airbus A330 was full, it was the holiday period. However, my main criticism was the layout adopted for this route. In economy, there were no toilet facilities at the rear of the aircraft. Instead, there was a huge galley. This meant that the four toilets, situated midway in the aircraft, two in each aisle, were constantly blocking the route to and from the other part of the cabin for the crew and anyone else. The crew jealously guarded their galley area with a heavy curtain/screen. I have never, in 45 years of air travel, encountered such an inconvenient aircraft layout. Even two toilets at the rear would have been a blessing. 
Furthermore and unusually, the meals loaded at Zurich were next to inedible. Now, I‚Äôm quite used to airline food from all manner of airlines and, unlike many, quite look forward to what is being served. This service really disappointed and the vegetarian option ran out before it reached us but seeing as it was ‚Äúpasta with pineapple chunks‚Äù that may have been a blessing. 
The crew were efficient and pleasant but, overall, the flight left me questioning whether I will use Swiss for my forthcoming trips to South Africa, which is a direct flight or use Etihad or Emirates which entail a stop.

title: A let down
review_text:
Swissair is usually a really good airline. But on this occasion, I felt let down by them.
My plane was so delayed leaving Belgrade, that I missed my connecting flight. When we eventually arrived in Zurich, I was told that I had to report to the transfer desk, which I found difficult to find. 
I felt that I had been dumped at Zurich airport, without the assistance of the airline on arriving at Zurich airport.
I did eventually get re routed, thanks to Swissair, but arrived at my destination over 4 hours later than I was expected.

Hey ho, the joys of air travel!
I

title: Disappointing entertainment but good flight otherwise
review_text: Friendly crew and excellent take off and landing. The aircraft was a little older than I usually fly but comfortable enough. Food was good, and served quickly and without fuss. I was disappointed in the entertainment, not a good selection, and the earphones don't work well. All in all acceptable flight though not spectacular.

title: Highly recommend
review_text: This flight was probably this best flight I have had (and I hate to fly).  The seat were comfortable, the selection of movies or TV shows were good, and the food was actually good!  Every time you turned around they were feeding us.  The entire staff was friendly and courteous.

title: Thank you, Swiss
review_text:
A perfect and comfortable flight.

The crew was friendly and the comfort in Economy was better then expected. I enjoyed the little meal.

Loved the small chocolate treat towards the end of the flight.

title: Good on-time airline, in and out of Zurich
review_text: Flying from Zurich to Nice, the plane was right on time. Friendly service with Swiss chocolate treats. Comfortable 1.5 hour flight. Also was able to use the Swiss Air lounge at Zurich - very nice accommodations with light food and snacks. The airport is easy to get in and out of and would highly recommend a trip downtown if you have a layover over 3 hours.

title: Good Service and comfortable planes
review_text: Departed on time and good cabin service.  Food was very good. Movie selection was current.  Comfortable seating and lighting levels for dozing (who can sleep on these overnight flights?). Ofcourse lots of chocolate!!  Air attendants came by frequently with water, juice, etc.

title: efficient polite good in flight service and cheaper than BA
review_text: missed my flight due to confusion of gates and the fact BA closed their door 25 mins before departure so I had to buy another ticket at the airport and as it was the last flight back I had to wait in the airport all night. The flight itself was pretty empty. The plane was clean and left on time. The crew were polite and the in flight service better than BA.

title: Very comfortable
review_text:
Arriving from Geneva, we noticed that the new lfirst class lounge in Z√ºrich was rather full, so we decided to transfer immediately to the lounge in Terminal E. This was very convenient and not crowded at all.
We appreciated the very warm welcome in the plane, as well as the comfortable seat/bed. The meal was excellent, as were the wines. The service on board was so good that we didn't find the flight as long as it really was.

title: Wow, the food was fantastic
review_text: Flew with Swiss last year on this same flight on our way to Belgium and France.  It was a normal business class flight, nothing special to report so to speak.  This year, we received the same excellent service, but the food seems to be kicked up a notch. We both had the Halibut and the fish was excellent.  Good portion, and plating was perfectly match.  Tough to make a good fish dish on land, never mind for plane service.  I also recall very good bread as well.

title: Friendly crew
review_text:
A Swiss International Air lines Airbus A319 (LX318) flight journey from Zurich to London:

The business class reclining seat was of leather upholstery. No cushion was provided. The legroom was comfortable for an average height adult. At 3-3 across seat rows, seat B and E were not assigned to any passenger to give free space.

A set of three very small dishes well presented on a ceramic tray was served: To my disappointment, one of the savoury and the sweet dish were far too rich to be consumed whilst both hot and cold drinks were of good quality.
 
The flight steward and stewardess were smiling and friendly.

The plane left Zurich a minute earlier and arrived London Heathrow Airport at 10:53 am, over 30 minutes ahead of the schedule(11:25 am).

A pleasant short haul flight!

title: First time with Swiss but not the last. They now are on my top 3!
review_text: Flight was on time, very nice and smiling crew aboard. Airplane was very clean. I was in business class and the seats were very confortable with plenty of space. The meal was hot and more than excellent. The cheese platter and port as well. They even served ice cream mid-flight. I've adopted them and I will fly again with Swiss as often as I can.

title: Swiss hospitality
review_text:
I travelled on Swiss International Airlines from Zurich to London Heathrow in March 2018. 

I‚Äôd taken the train from Oerlikon to Zurich Airport which only takes a few minutes. Swiss check in desks are located in the airport train station, which was a quick and easy way to check in my suitcase and get my boarding pass printed. 

LOUNGES

My flight was departing from one of the D Gates and whilst the lounge was fine, it was crowded, relatively small and lacking in occasion. 

As there was still 90 minutes befor my flight, I decided to venture out to Swiss‚Äô flagship lounge in the E Gates, which involves taking a train. If you‚Äôre familiar with Heathrow, think of the train between T5A and T5B albeit with video and sound effects! 

The lounge agents were surprised to see me, although I explained I‚Äôd read about the E lounge terrace and was keen to see it in person! I was given a puzzled expression but was told it wasn‚Äôt a problem! 

The E lounge is best reviewed elsewhere - and with various pictures - however, I thought it was great, in particular the terrace overlooking one of the runways. The bright sunny clear weather helped as did the Leica binoculars! 

The drinks selection was the same as the D lounge, although I stuck to still and sparkling water. There was a greater variety and quantity of food. One of the centre pieces by of the lounge is an open Chef‚Äôs kitchen which makes food to order. This included (amongst other things) wok fried vegetables, dim sum and pasta. I had some fresh pasta with tomato sauce and grated cheese - basic but tasty. 

A couple of tips from anything thinking of doing the same: when you arrive at the W Gates keep heading up until you reach the concourse. My mistake was to confuse the arrows for straight on instead of upwards.....! You will need to take a train back and go through security - it was very quick on this trip but give yourself plenty of time. 

Departure was from gate D31. I waited a few minutes for boarding, but it wasn‚Äôt worth going back to the D lounge. Boarding was late due to late arrival of the aircraft, but I was onboard for 18:25. As it was a completely full flight Swiss were offering to check-in additional bags free of charge. The aircraft was an Airbus A320 in Star Alliance livery. 

ONBOARD EXPERIENCE

I was in seat 1A. I think this is a good seat as it has two windows, extra legroom and is usually the first to be served. By comparison, 1C is very close to the galley and subject to all of the aisle traffic. 

Unlike my outbound flight, there was no water or refreshing towelette on my seat, but both were offered from a basket once everyone was onboard. 

Door 1L was closed at 18:52 and take off was a few minutes later with good views over the city and Lake Zurich in the distance. 

A light meal was served on a tray. No menus were offered (so I can‚Äôt be precise) but it comprised a small plate of seared tuna with vegetables, two types of Swiss cheese and a small cheesecake like dessert in a glass pot. It was pretty tasty, but I‚Äôd suggest eating in the lounge beforehand if you‚Äôre hungry. I‚Äôm glad I did. Bread rolls were offered twice. The crew were proactive with drinks and I managed a couple of glasses of champagne and Swiss red wine during the flight - the latter being surprisingly good. I was never offered tea or coffee; perhaps it came round when I was using the bathroom. 

ARRIVAL

Landing was at 19:18 UK time. My bags were quick to arrive with the priority tags intact. 

In summary, this was another great Swiss short haul flight with a very good ground experience and level of onboard service. Constructive thoughts: in the absence of printed menus, it would be good if the crew could proactively (very briefly) explain what you‚Äôre eating. WiFi would also be a nice addition. I look forward to travelling with Swiss in the near future.

title: Average, but too warm!
review_text:
I get that Swiss culture doesn‚Äôt include copious amounts of air conditioning but is it too much to ask to have the air vents on an 8 hour flight?
Overall the flight was no better or worse than any other I‚Äôve taken but the fact that I couldn‚Äôt get a little air blowing made the trip very uncomfortable. I‚Äôll likely look for another carrier on my next trip over.

title: I love their Business Class
review_text: The Business class lounge in Zurich provides excellent breakfast and was convenient for this flight.  Preboarding was congested due to passport checks prior to cueing to embark.  The business cabin has 2 areas, rows 4 and 5 are by themselves between the  1st class cabin and the main business class cabin. Rows 4 and 5 are definitely preferable if you can get them. Meal service was excellent and my John Dory fish selection was moist and not over cooked. Movie selections were varied and the seats very spacious and comfortable.

title: Favourite Airline
review_text: Again I had a very pleasant flight with SWISS. The staff is very friendly and warm. This overnight flight included a delicious dinner (with salad, cheese and desert) and a breakfast. Drinks are refilled as wanted. And to keep warm and cosy every seat had a blanket and a pillow ready. Of course the legroom in economy is not great but I nevertheless was able to catch a few hours of sleep.

title: Swiss are good - plus chocolate
review_text: Swiss was very efficient - take off and landing on time.Good food - actually, I was a bit surprised. Plus they handle out Swiss chololate (!) to make travel a bit sweeter.

title: One of my favourites
review_text:
An over 12 hours Swiss International Airlines Boeing 777-300ER (LX139) flight journey from Hong Kong to Zurich:

The business class seat was of medium soft fabric material with a leather headrest; with massage function; at a touch button control converting into reclining chair and a flat bed. There were a cushion and a blanket provided. The flat bed was sufficient for an average height adult but rather tight for width.

The storage at reachable level, other than the overhead tray, was sufficient.

Since this flight took off just before midnight, I had a cup of camomile tea, skipped both quick meal and dinner for a good night sleep.

It was not easy to have a sound sleep on a  full business class flight, but with its adjustable eye mask, seat belt on top of the blanket across my body, I managed an eight hour undisturbed close eyes.
 
Breakfast was served with a good spread of food and drinks. It was hard to fault their delicious cold cut of meat and cheeses. Their bread was equally delicious.

The plane touched down Zurich at 6:19 am, only 9 minutes behind the schedule, doing pretty me for a long haul flight.

Plus points: Quality food, drinks and toiletries, clean cabin, comfortable temperature, almost prompt departure and arrival time.

Negatives: Narrow width flat bed; short of attentiveness; asking me to go back to my seat while another flight stewardess standing in the way; and returning my jacket to another passenger at the final hour before arrival.

In general, it was uneventful and for the fair rest and delicious food, I would have given LX 139; 5/5 rating but taking account of its short of attentiveness, a very good was justified.

Swiss International is one of my favourite premium airlines, I will fly with them again.

title: Very inconsistent
review_text:
Swiss delivers inconsistent service, I recently had several flights with them in various flight class, unfortunately not all flights were satisfactory.
