My last flight from Paris to Zurich was really disappointing. The check in was a disaster, not only that all went wrong, but what worries me most is they are arrogant and do miss client orientation. And if you want to complain they ask you to do it online instead of speaking to you. Also lounge staff and staff on board were not very friendly but more arrogant. Overall an unsatisfactory experience.

 I once read an article here that stated if something goes wrong there is lack of client orientation, and I must say I agree. In addition they don't care if you are a good customer or not (my star alliance gold status is very often completely ignored). It is a pity as sometimes they really deliver excellent service (see my previous report on a first class flight), if they were more consistent they could really be one of the top airlines.

title: Splendid Swiss Service
review_text: Some of the best onboard treatment I have ever gotten to receive from altitudes going way high-in-the-sky.  A relatively unknown-by-name airline where I usually can expect my departure from (YEG), though will definitely be recommending as one lead choice in business service, Swiss Air was impeccable with quite possibly the friendliest service I have experienced in a very long time (both on-or-off the ground).  The aircraft itself was pleasant in comfort & design, & both the regular as well as the special lacto-oco vegetarian meals were nearly perfect in what you‚Äôd expect from actual restaurant availability.  A bonus point goes toward having quite the rather large selection of beverage options available with the emphasis for Swiss products which I thought was a nice little touch worth mentioning.  Bravo all-around & overall.  Thanks!!

title: NEVER FLY ON THEIR airbus A330 OR A300 AIRPLANE
review_text: OMG never but never will I fly with their airbus 330 airplane. The seats were so jammed closely together that when the girl in front of me leaned back, her head was practically in my lap! The screens were not sharp and it was very difficult to enjoy the movie. That said, the service of the stewardesses was very good. They came instantly when I pushed the button, always found a solution to the passengers' problems, and were very efficient. So I WOULD fly Swiss again, but just not on that horrible airplane again. It pays to ask your travel agent what kind of plane you will be having (yes, he can see it on his computer). I flew United in the States and it was also economy but there was lots of leg room even though it wasn't a preferred seat.

title: We had an amazing view of the Swiss Alps
review_text: Very nice service on a Bombardier CS300, we sat in the economy and were offered some nice snacks on a plane that was spacious and clean.

title: On time and friendly - as usual
review_text: We've chosen SWISS again for our European short haul flight from Zurich to Prague - and back. Check-In was fast and very friendly. During flight (even for 50min only) kids got something to play and draw, very friendly staff. As arriving our suitcases arrived very quick (also thanks to Prague Airport).

title: very good, not perfect
review_text: The cabin crews were very good, although their English was not perfect. Service was excellent. The seat/beds were as good as they get, but the food was less than good. Breakfast was next to inedible and dinner only fair. The wines were very nice. It was not much better than what is usually called "airline food." The flights were mostly on time and business class was fast check in and off the plane.

title: Ok flight for a European airline
review_text:
SWISS was one of the better European airlines that I have flown. However, it was much worse than many Asian airlines that I have flown.

For the long-haul flights from Singapore to Zurich and back, the seat was a bit narrow (3-4-3 seating in a Boeing 777-300ER). However, they were very comfortable. The legroom was good. Because of the good design, I was able to straighten my legs even in a middle seat. The touchscreen IFE was easy to use and clear. However, the movie selection was very limited. The food selection was limited (a meat and a vegetarian choices for dinner and only one choice for breakfast). The taste was good but the portion was small. A small piece of Swiss cheese was offered even in economy, which was a nice touch. The meal service was quite slow. The service was not as warm as in Asian airlines but right to the point. Whenever I asked for something, they would always get back to me with it (sometimes after a while).

The transit at Zurich airport was very efficient. The short-flights from Zurich to Heathrow and back were ok. The food was standard for a European airline: a sandwich or a bread and some drinks.

title: Flew Swiss due to Air France Strike
review_text:
I‚Äôd rather fly Air France. Swiss‚Äô seats are so close to the front ones that my knees were sore for 3 days after arrival. Eating on that small area you‚Äôre left in is almost impossible. On the other hand, they charge what they want: We travel with our dog in the cargo area, and always pay $200.00 Canadian. They charged me $500.00 Dls instead. 
On the good side, the cabin personnel were very nice, and the flight was on time.

title: Another Great Experience with Swiss
review_text:
First, Zurich is the best airport to go through. Small, efficient, easy to handle
.
Second, Swiss business class is one of my favorite. Even on the tired Airbus 340, it is still one of the most comfortable options both in Economy and business. the small "private" cabin in rows 4 and 5 is great.

Third, somehow, they're able to make airplane food enjoyable. Gluten free beer was a nice surprise onboard.

Fourth - flight attendants were checking up on you during the flight, which is very helpful for the sleepless like me.

Overall, recommended, if you could get an affordable price for your budget and requirements.

title: Weak information
review_text: The information from the Swiss personnel at the gate was very bad (31. March 2018). Only few people has realised that something was wrong with the flight/plane. People who were sitting got no information, only people near the exit to the gate. From people who were closer to the woman I heard different reasons what happens and what to do. Very confusing.

title: The best airline
review_text:
We are really traveling a lot. This was the first time we flied with Swiss airline and it was our best flight ever. First of all, the seats are wide and comfortable,  and there is enough space for your legs. The service is a first class one, in all domains. Food was delicious and the flight attendants offered drinking through all the flight. The entertainment on the screen in front of you was with huge selection. 
All of these and more really made our flight with Swiss airline the best.
I'm sure we'll fly with this company again!

title: Excellent service
review_text: I always enjoy flying Swiss: compared to many other airlines, the service is more professional and the on-time arrival record (in my own experience) is better. The one downside is that, even though I am a star alliance member (and with a gold status but with another airline), I cannot select seat when booking a code-sharing flight through my airline. This is a bummer because sometimes when I travel with family, we end up sitting far from each other, and we would not know until we are at the airport. I wish the airline could at least allow families to call in advance to arrange sitting together.

title: This didn't feel like 7 hours at all.
review_text:
I have just sent the last week in New York. I flew with Swiss Air from Geneva Switzerland to JFK in New York. This is the first time I have flown with Swiss Air and I really enjoyed my flights. The flight crew were very friendly and helpful, and the food was great. 

If I had a few complaints, it would be the entertainment system. I have flown a lot of international flights recently and some airlines have amazing in-flight entertainment and some airlines have free wi-fi. The entertainment system was very outdated and there wasn't much in the way of selection choice. But apart from that, everything else was exceptional. The other complaint was the lady who served us at the Swiss Airlines counter. She advised us that we had to check in one of our carry-on bags. Her excuse she that was instructed by Swiss Air to do this as the flight was full, and there was very little overhead bag space left. We are not sure why she said this to us, as the flight was far from full and there was a lot of space left in the overhead space, even after we placed our bag up there. 

I would have no hesitation in flying with Swiss Air again.

title: Like clockwork
review_text: Clean and fresh plane, good service and good food. Everything went very smooth and I had plenty of space for my legs.

title: Just a common service on the business class
review_text: The travel was not bad, but if I compare the services between Swiss, Emirates or Etihad, they provide much more and better service for almost the same price. In Swiss you can lay down the seat fully for sleeping, but there are no walls or barriers, so you will hear all noise especially if they serve the food, but you want to sleep instead.

title: Too hot!
review_text: My husband and I we‚Äôre on a 11-12 hr flight from Zurich to Lax, flying back from our honeymoon, and it was one of the most miserable flights we‚Äôve ever been on. It was sooooo hot! We couldn‚Äôt sleep because it was so uncomfortable. The service was good and the food, but the temperature and the tight space made it a bad experience. We probably won‚Äôt be flying Swiss again.

title: Excellent service
review_text:
I flew Mumbai - Zurich - NY. The flight was on time and would highly recommend - pillows and blankets provided were very comfortable, meals were provided at frequent intervals, cabin lights were put off and passengers were given ample time to sleep/ rest. Flight attendants were very courteous and attentive. The return flight was just as perfect.

Only flip side - I missed my air miles!

title: Hard seats but the price is right (sometimes)
review_text: Flew Swiss as business class seats were $2000 less than other airlines. Neither the flight going over or the return left on time and there was no explanation from the pilot. You just sit there on the stand and wonder. My seat was hard as a rock and I couldn‚Äôt get one armrest to move. Still I got some pretty good sleep each way. The food was ok but not great. Bags came right away. Swiss can have some great fares but to limited places and sometimes they make no sense. Right now you can buy round trips in business class from certain US cities to JNB, New Delhi, and Mumbai for $3400-4400. However from the same US city to Zurich the seats are $8,000. The flights to JNB, New Delhi, and Mumbai all go to Zurich first.

title: A pleasure to fly with Swiss
review_text: My flight experience with Swiss is always very good. Despite minor delays on the outgoing and return flights, time was caught up during the flight so that we arrived not too far from the original ETA. Cleanliness is always spot on from my experience, and it was great to experience the newer Bombardier CS300 aircraft. The staff were extremely friendly, and it's great to have a complementary snack and drink! Couldn't complain.

title: Shame no upgrade
review_text: It was my husbands 70th birthday and we asked at check-in if we could be upgraded.  They said no.  20 years ago we asked British Airways who thought it was a wonderful idea and said yes.  Otherwise good flight.  Shame though..

title: Disabled and vegetarians, be aware
review_text:
Check in at Chicago was like being in the NAZI era. The lady was growling, two revenue First pax, did not enter our frequent flyer numbers, ignored my request for wheel chair. Swiss. Com manage my booking is useless. Despite having entered the request for disability, vegetarian meals - none existed
On Board - no special meal so we remained relatively hungry and, loaded with carbs (bread) since no vegetarian option available. Maitre D said would report but never bothered to ask any queries. Saving grace was the kind lady who was at zurich airport with a wheel chair and, the two onboard flight attendants. Shame, swiss. Teach check in people some customer service, please. Maybe a Dale Carnegie School

title: COMFORTABLE. LIMITED MEAL. CO-OPERATIVE STAFF
review_text: the flight was overbooked due to the peak season. even then, the staff was on their toes to cater everyone's needs. the flight had nice variety of in flight entertainment. meals could have been better.

title: Simply: Swiss
review_text: Another flight with Swiss. C class product on European routes is fine. Food is always delicious and the crews do their best in taking care of their customers.

title: STILL NO RESPONSE FROM SWISS
review_text:
There still has been NO RESPONSE from Swiss Air Lines (only from customers reaching out with similar terrible experiences).  It has been weeks and we have tried contacting the airline numerous times with absolutely NO RESPONSE.  

With so many choices available they are known not to care at all about their passengers.  (We wish we would have known before booking our flights online with Swiss).

title: irresponsible food
review_text:
3 tablespoons butter on a pretzel to make this taste of anything is not a responsible snack....
but the plane is clean and the service is nice if there is any given...turbulence over the alps seems to be the norm on this leg..

title: Faultless on service and passenger handling, but narrow seats
review_text: This was a satisfactory journey as regards punctuality, service, passenger and baggage handling and food, but with quite narrow seats that convert into narrow beds on the second, long-haul leg. The transfer time in Zurich was comfortable, just long enough for a coffee in a very impressive lounge. Mattress pads and duvets might make the seat/bed width more acceptable. The staff were good, friendly and efficient.

title: comfortable flight with professional friendly staff
review_text: very comfortable flight with smiling friendly professional attendants. helpful for anything we needed during the long hours of flight. short layover at Zurich and easy transfer at the airport. baggage handling was very good and no problem for delivery.

title: You just feel comfortable
review_text:
Actually we chose Swiss because of the relatively lower price compared to Lufthansa. And ..... we did not regret it.
Check-in was easy. The airport terminal (E) at Zurich is very comfortable though you have sometimes long walks.
At the gate everything just went fast. 
In the plane:
Service was very good, flight attendants were always looking if everything is right, served lots of water or other liquids.
Food was comparable to other airlines much better.
Overall great flught

title: O K, just about average
review_text: The seats  on the Zurich- Changi leg were the narrowest I have been squashed into on any airline. The staff, food/drinks, in-flight entertainment were all acceptable.

title: Outstanding
review_text: We didn‚Äôt have high hopes after our Lufthansa fight but were delighted with the professionalism of the staff and the whole Swiss experience. Thank you!

title: service
review_text: the service on this flight was very average I think we would have got better service in economy the staff appeared to not know what they were doing they ran out of menu,s choice of food not up to business standard only half the passengers on our side got bread rolls you pay a lot of money for this class the return trip Zurich to Hong Kong was only slightly better cannot recommend after flying with Qatar,  Cathay and Singapore

title: Simply a high quality and classy airline
review_text: Although this flight is just a short one hour long... I must say that from the moment you step into the aircraft, it is simply classy. Clean interior and top modern aircraft, the C-Series. A neat silver lining on the seats, warm and welcoming crew on the flight, and lovely Swiss chocolate for every guest. You can‚Äôt help but just feel at home. Such a lovely experience. It really is wonderful flying with the quality airlines of the Lufthansa Group. Whether long or short haul, they are simply a class above the rest. Keep it up!,

title: Best airline
review_text: Hands down the best service I've had on a flight. Plus, their the only airline I've been on that still provides snacks (good ones at that) for a flight that is less than 2 hours. All of the times I've flown with them I've either gotten a croissant or a buttered pretzel (by far the best thing I've ever eaten on a plane). They're my go to for flight to/from/within Switzerland/EU.

title: small things add up to big problems if you don't pay attention
review_text:
We had a family emergency that necessitated booking a flight on Swiss International from Shanghai to London - via Zurich.  We've only flown LX one time in the past and it wasn't so bad... but that was with some planning and we were able to get upgraded to Business.  This time we were in Economy and the experience was not the same.

First - here are the GOOD things about the flight:

- It was (for the most part) very smooth...but that's the weather and not the airline
- The cabin of the plane was incredibly clean - for an older plane (A340-300) the seats, between the seats, the overhead bins, the lavatories... any place you could see or touch - immaculately clean.
- The seats weren't too bad.  It was a family emergency - so we had to take what we could get and for it being Economy the seats were comfortable and the recline angles were decent enough to rest with no problems.
- The crew were all very courteous and professional

(So far you've read this and wondered - what else could there be to diminish your feelings about this fine/proud flag carrier?)

Well...

- There was no wifi.  In 2018 is it really such a big deal to put wifi in place on a 12 hour flight?  As a contingency, the inflight magazine outlines how you can access data on your phone or tablet from terrestrial antenna ...but only one TWO kinds of aircraft - and not the A340.  :(
- The inflight entertainment was pretty good... until you tried to switch it off - you can't really switch it off.  You can take everything from the screen, but it is still being backlit.  Again, on a 12 hour flight it would have been nice shut the screen off completely.
- there are no power outlets to charge your phone or tablet in-flight.  Again, in 2018 this is a necessity for most travelers - a sad but true fact is that people's lives are growing more and more power hungry.  That lust for power has to wait until you land on an LX flight.

and now for the one thing that was almost very problematic for me
- I ordered a special meal on both legs of our family's journey.  From PVG - ZRH the meal was perfect:  fresh, tasty and for the fact that it was a vegan meal (and that vegan meals are usually quite 'blah') even imaginative.   SADLY on the leg from ZRH back to PVG it was NOT a vegan meal and instead a vegetarian meal.  The difference between those two things being one has milk and cheese and the other doesn't.  That is a critical error for a person who can't digest dairy - ESPECIALLY on a 12 hour flight.

The good news is that I saw the error and was able to 'adjust' my meal to prevent getting and upset stomach at 37,000 feet.  The bad news is that the way I adjusted the meal was to avoid eating half of what was served.

It is a small detail - a tiny detail.  But for however small a detail it is - getting it wrong meant the potential for a very unpleasant flight - for me.

For a potential flyer on LX:  call and call AGAIN to make sure that they get the message about your EXACT meal preference.

For anyone from LX reading this:  reinforce to your teams that even a small difference (imperceptible to most people who it doesn't effect directly - especially in such a strong dairy culture (no pun intended) as Switzerland) can mean the difference between a "VERY GOOD" rating (what you would have received), and only "AVERAGE" ( what you got instead.)

title: Wonderful flight
review_text: Great service from the flight  attenders, specially from Bettina! Wonderful person , smiling, service minded, good to take care of passangers. Easy to talk!!! The seat was very comfortable ! One minus on this flight was the food! Not tasty at all but They have  delicious wine on board!

title: A Pleasant Experience
review_text:
Excellent in-flight service, food is good and there are plenty of drinks to choose from. Even in economy class there is adequate legroom and even on a long haul flight I didn‚Äôt suffer any discomfort.
Overall I would thoroughly recommend Swiss Air.

title: I feel welcome
review_text: A good service from a motivated crew. I always like to fly with Swiss. And in the most of the Fly, between 6 and 30 per year I do with Swiss I get a good service.

title: Swiss Airlines service not so Swish
review_text:
I recently travelled to Johannesburg on Swiss airlines in business class. As my wife had an injury to her knee and transfer time at Zurich was very short we requested a wheel chair or preferably motorised buggy. We were told that a wheelchair can be organised. However when we arrived at Zurich no wheelchair was available. So we had to walk to Gate E for internatioal transfer.
On the return leg the seat no 5 A and B had one slot for shoes for both of us. There was only magazine holder for two of us and that was so cramped one would require a bit of strength to extricate the magazines.
My wife had a salad and fish and was violently sick following morning.
I asked for a gin and tonic but was told that they have run out tonic water however after a bit of remonstration the drink arrived though belatedly.
The dinner menu very expensively produced mentioned that the a choice of desserts would be available from trolley. However only one dessert was available with no choice.
The business  class lounge at Manchester and Johannesburg was a poor cousin to Emirates sumptuous offering.
In my opinion it was a poor value for ¬£4500 fate for two of us.
In future I will think twice before travelling by Swiss Air.

title: Top service
review_text:
No problem at check-in, flight arrived before schedule.
Top class service on board. Excellent food. Very friendly crew.

title: Top airline
review_text: Absolute top class. Fast check in, bright lounge (E Dock) with a great selection of food and drinks. WiFi fast and free, efficient fast boarding. Friendly efficient staff, felt cared good during this long flight.

title: Short Flight From London City to Geneva
review_text:
Flight excellent.
Except  the seats, which are hard (very) plus the plane judders when on landing approach. This is particularly bad when landing at the London City Airport. 
The current plane (Brazilian) is not a patch on the old BAE 146 that were originally used.
A real step back! As I make around 20 return trips a year  I can only hope that the promised Bombardier plans are in place soon.

However Staff are friendly and helpful.

title: A nightmare flight handled quite well, but as often lack of communication
review_text:
Check-in was great as usual with miles-and-more companies. No issue at boarding. The first announcement was to let us know that the weather at London City airport was poor and that we had to wait for 45 minutes. We eventually took off after 20 minutes, which was a good surprise However, as we approached London, we kept flying around without any further information. After approximately an hour, the pilot told us that we had to be diverted to Stanstead airport, 50 miles north of London and said it would take 20 minutes. We kept flying for about an hour without any further explanation....As we lander there were no stairs to get off the plane and we we got them there was no bus....The whole time no announcement from the steward to let us know what was going on.....

GOod point: we receiver an sms from Swiss letting us know that we could get a free train ticket

title: "Your seat has changed" - the typical Swiss email
review_text: LX2150 is anyway a flight to avoid as it is very often late, esp. when the rotation before is ZRH-DUB-ZRH which Swiss is unable to execute without delay. And what upsets me even more is that they charge you for a seat reservation and then send you an email that because of aircraft change, they have reassigned you - even if this is a complete lie as was the case on 17 April when they again at the gate reassigned me for a second time - by one row as they were too lazy to move the curtain between business and economy. And this should be a premium airline? You are kidding me! And by the way, I am Senator (and in the old days Circle) and don't think for one second that they take better care of you! But luckily, Ryanair via Laudamotion now enters this market at a fraction of the price. Goodbye Swiss to Palma!

title: Always efficient, always polite, service with a smile
review_text: As always the aircraft was spotless, the staff helpful and efficient. The main criticism of these short haul hops, and it is one that could be considered a general gripe with all the providers to a greater or lesser degree, is the miserable food and drink. The cheese roll, form a nation with world class bread and cheese was an awful dry chewy concoction and the coffee was luke warm and tasteless. Its a real shame, as the general impression is till one of true care and class, but the food is a nasty experience all the time now.

title: Locker space is a premuim!
review_text:
Not an impressive Business class seat but then the flight was only 55minutes. Everything was clean and the staff were charming and helpful. We had breakfast which was a tiny bowl of mursli, tiny bowl of cut up fruits and a smoked salmon roll. Teas, coffee or soft drinks plus champagne (not offered but there if you spotted it).
Took a while tomget the flight loaded as everyone seemed to be searching for overhead locker space. They should do what other airlines do and tag customers smaller hand items for placing under the seat. This ensures that only larger items take up locker space. They have coat hooks on the side of the seats. These should be used. A good experience otherwise.

title: Ok. Packed flight
review_text:
This was super full. People were slow to board; fiddling around in the cabin and had loads of hand baggage. Result was an inconsistently applied standard for hand baggage; if you have a trolley bag, expect to have it tagged and put in the hold. Plane staff were really supportive when I voiced my displeasure at how this was applied.

Swiss service is efficient; nice enough snack and the usual drinks.

Passport control was easy and bags came out quickly. 

This airport is a good distance from the centre of the city. We had an hour on a Sunday, as a main road was closed.

title: My Personal Favourite Airline
review_text:
How can I begin? Our flight with Swiss was arguably one of the best economy class experiences in the skies. We took off from Zurich bound for Hong Kong at about 10pm local time aboard one of Swiss' brand-new 777-300ERs. The dinner was served promptly and featured an incredibly satisfying meal that you'll find on any Lufthansa Group flight. The entertainment on board was fantastic. A great selection of films and tv series meant I was kept amused throughout the flight. Also I must mention the in-flight maps. There were so many to browse through, giving all sorts of details, keeping an aviation geek like myself, very happy. The seats were comfortable and the blanket definitely helped me get off to sleep. Even as a 6-footer I had enough room to stretch out since I was seated next to an aisle.

Overall, a very clean, fresh and comfortable experience with Swiss. Will be looking to book with them again next time we fly.

title: Impressed with the new Bombardier C-Series 300
review_text:
First time I flew the Bombardier C-Series 300 plane. Most impressive the powerful engines. Even with a full load, the plane took off like a rocket. The 2/3 configuration is pleasing. The aircraft is as roomy as the Boeing 737 or the Airbus equivalents.The ZIM seats seem to be slimmer than the ones on Boeing or Airbus planes and feel more comfortable with good pitch, not much personal storage space, however. The overhead compartments on both sides accepts the standard on-board luggage cases. Finally no more in-seat entertainment screens. Guess, most people use their own smart phones or pads.Only tiny 2 1/4 x 3 3/4 displays in ceiling over the window seats for "Fasten seat belt" and "No smoking" messages.
The young Swiss crew was very friendly and attentive. They served a rather dry ham or cheese sandwich and non-alcoholic beverages or a small bottle of wine. The small Swiss chocolate bar was a must as dessert.

title: First flight of the year to Kiev
review_text: The 11:55 March 26 was the first flight of the season to Kiev. No delays. On arrival we had a salute of water jets.  Guess they were pleased to see us.  The checkin/security/passport control system at Zurich always seems to work like clockwork even when very busy.  Started in Basel -by train to Zurich airport - bookable via Swissair.

title: WORST CUSTOMER SERVICE CONTINUES
review_text:
Swiss continues to be the WORST customer service we have experienced in the travel industry.  We have written to the airline numerous times both in the US and Zurich, still with NO RESPONSE.  Swiss told us to email their "customer service" area and NO ONE REPLIES.

We have taken numerous flights since the last posting (on various US domestic airlines and a couple overseas) and each of these flights (not Swiss) care about their client's flying experience.

title: Good airline but not as perfect as I would have thought
review_text: Had to go for business and chose Swiss. It was a good experience but not as good as I would have thought about a Swiss product. The gate check in was a chaos. People pushing left and right and no lines for business class. The seats are nice but a bit narrow. The food was ok but I had better on other trips. The service was very good in the beginning but degraded towards the end. They forgot me at the breakfast so there was no time left anymore.

title: The best airline
review_text:
Swiss airline is my first flight in Europe new aircraft and wonderful services with wine and chocolate nice staff on time and smooth flight 

I will choose for a next time for sure xx 

13/February /2018
Seat 16E,F
ZRH-FCO
LX1736

title: SWISS Business Class - Business Class.
review_text:
I flew on Swiss across to Zurich as a code share with united. You will know form my other reviews that i am a big fan of the United Polaris service which they have introduced and so I was a little skeptical about being bumped onto SWISS.

I did not need to be - SWISS is very - well Swiss, it is a beautiful manifestation of everything that the Swiss brand is, super high quality without being showy, everything you need beautifully efficiently delivered, without any noise or fan fare. It reminded me just how subtly high quality the Swiss are. Understated luxury.

As i sat in the little seating pod it reminded me a little of the interior of an Audi car, I find those upon first impression a bit tight, slightly cramped, but then you realize as you settle into it that they are perfectly proportioned and supremely well thought through. The seat is comfortable - although i had a weird experince where my seat kept inflating - there is a setting in the seat which allows you to make it harder or softer via a button in the arm rest, for some reason my seat wanted to help me have it at maximum inflation all the time - that was the only problem i had the whole time.

I like that the arm rest comes down it creates a lot more space when you are in the flat bed pose, the blankets and bedding, again without all the Saks of 5th branding or Partnership with Westin as you get on American carriers was lovely, like really lovely. I put my head in the pillow and remember thinking - wow, now this is just what i want to sink into, that feeling of beautiful, Swiss luxury. 

The Personal video collection was great, a large screen with a very impressive array of content - perhaps the best i have seen in fact especially if you are interested in films from other cultures, whereas American Carriers will major on US authored content the Swiss have a good selection of Asian, European Art House and Bollywood movies to complement the normal Hollywood fair.

Food - well I was flying from LAX to Swizerland and i think i suffered as a result of that. I got a menu which was for the Swiss to LAX flight and it looked awesome - salamis from La Valais, traditional Swiss cheeses and really thoughtful dishes, i suspect that they have not quite managed to get the same mojo going the other way - the food was probably the least impressive part of the service - I ordered a cup of Cheese and Broccoli soup, it felt like i was consuming some kind of artificially thickened MSG laden gloop, bland and flavourless. I ordered the beef it was 'soggy' soggy steak is horrible, it feels like it has been hanging around, if you are going to serve steak on a plane then make it decent, otherwise serve Pork or Chicken and avoid the trap of serving bad steak. The Cheeses - which i really had high hopes for - were either hard in the case of the mountain cheese or rubbery in the case of the Brie.

I personally dont really go on planes for the food - if it is not good then i am happy to forego it, but if food is important to you on a flight then you might be disappointed here.

But generally I found it an impeccable flight - service was thoughtful and careful, and the journey was restful.

No pajamas though - apparently you only get them in First Class, so my United Polaris Experience still comes out on top -

title: Good quality of service
review_text: Our first experience of Swiss business class (we also did the return LX 161 flight with connecting fights to LHR via Zurich).  In most respects our experience was very good.  Just a couple of points to note so that next time it will be excellent.  There are 3 types of long haul business class seat and we seemed to get different seats from those previously booked (i.e. not so good).  Unfortunately the seats we got were not ideal - the person in the window seat has to clamber over their companion - but seem to be in the minority so you will probably only find yourself stuck with these if you are unlucky (and we did get our preferred pre-booked seats for our return flight).  I am gluten intollerant and like with many other airlines the standard of catering is never up to scratch whatever class you travel (e.g. BA 1st class is also poor on this front).  You never get a choice (and you never know what you are getting) and the food is often very bland.  Swiss was no exception on this front unfortunately - I think they ought to look at how they cater for business class special diets as it could be made a unique selling proposition.  Our other grouse is that for inexplicable reasons you have to go through security procedures again at Zurich even though you are in transit - this means that if you have bought duty free liquor it would be confiscated.  Swiss NEVER warn you about this - which is a serious omission (but my companion had previously transited Zurich so was wised up).  Apart from these negatives (and the business lounge at Zurich being a bit small/overcrowded)  we were very satisfied: the crew were very attentive and we felt that it was certainly worth the price we paid for the extra standard of comfort (and the priority baggage off load at the destination).  We booked the seats because they represented excellent value for the price paid and we were not disappointed on this front so would consider Swiss Business Class again for another long haul flight if convenient.

title: Better last year ....
review_text: The lounge at Zurich airport, WiFi did not work and the staff could not help me either. Another passenger was having the same issue. They need to staff at least one IT guy in there. The lounge itself is gorgeous, totally 5 stars. The flight from Florence to Zurich was full. Even though I was a Gold Star Alliance member, no upgrade or nothing. Very disappointed. From Zurich to NY, one flight attendant dropped food on my lap when serving the breakfast, and she said, "oops, sorry, but nothing happened, no spill, no leak, so you are ok", then walked away. The passenger sitting next to me looked at me and said "wow", and yes I felt the same. I simply returned the food without touching them. The aircraft itself is ok, the flight was on time, and my checked-in luggage came out from the belt so quickly, thanks to the Gold member card. I flew Swiss last year, and my experience last year was so amazing, so I guess I set the bar too high this time.... I hope to see better service next time.

title: Swiss does not charge for ski's
review_text:
Great flight. Boston to Geneva.   We take the same flight every winter to go skiing in Chamonix France. Boston to Zurich then Zurich to Chamonix.   We usually take the changeover that has a 2 hour layover rather then the 1 hour layover since we always fly in winter, its a long first leg of the flight and 1 hour just isn't enough time in case there is a slight delay taking off in Boston.  We love the fact that Swiss does not charge for ski's !!

We fly economy but we upgrade to the extra leg room seats!

title: First time experience, I'd try them again
review_text: This was our first time flying Swiss Air - staff were genuinely enthusiastic and had a great attitude.  I thought the accommodations in economy were quite comfortable.  Most of the food (with the exception of one item) was surprisingly good (I don't have high expectations for airplane food).  I would definitely try flying them again.

title: Manchester to Zurich then to Hong Kong
review_text:
I was impressed not used before, trip from Manchester was good but late and as we had a tight turnaround just over an hour I thought we would have missed the connecting flight but it was held to meet us, but still landed on time in Hong Kong. Aircraft were great all you would expect to see and have in Business class, service was second to none and the food ( currently running a program of dishes and service in conjunction with some top Swiss restaurants) I must admit the best food I had had for some time on any  airline.
All all a great experience and will certainly use again.

title: Cabin crew: excellent - company's policy on transparancy of booking class needs urgent review
review_text: It was my understanding, and up to a certain point of time my belief, that Swiss, one of the best carriers diachronically speaking, employed a clear and transparent policy as per the booking class of its tickets, namely to inform potential pax, before a ticket was issued, whether its booking class is eligible for mileage accrual or not.  Evidently, this is not the case, for one has issue a ticket and then speculate as per his/her mileage tracker.  How absolutely pathetic!

title: Used to be better
review_text:
I have been flying with Swiss on this same route up to 3 times per year for the last 30 years. Plus many other flights from and to other detinations. Once in a while buiness but mostly in economy. This used to be the best airline by far, however things are changing for the worse. Prices are still premium ($1,600 round trip in economy) but the service overall is getting worse. Before Swiss was part of Lufthansa it was a lot more personable and flexible, allowed last minute upgrades with miles or good deals of upgrades for purchase at the counter when business class was not full. All this is gone. Big corporate took over and all the little things that made Swiss so special have disappeared. 
You should think that for the high economy price they serve at least a decent meal but not so anymore. The pasta was overcooked, the salad of the poorest quality with a "pudding" dressing not necessarily liked by Swiss people and instead of a dessert there were Oreo cookies that seamed to come stright out of a chemical plant. At least for dinner they still serve with real silverware. But then for breakfast you get a carton box full of packaged goods plus plasitc knife and spoon. Cheap stuff and lots of trash that is being created. I am very dissapointed. The staff however was nice, overall flight comfotable.

title: Price was right, seating wrong 777-300er
review_text: I wondered the whole flight if there was any padding in the seat. The staff are great. Food was so, so. I would fly the airline again, just maybe not on a long haul.

title: Great service, staff and FnB
review_text:
I was traveling from BOS to BOM via ZRH and was bumped up to Business, even though I was using my JetPrivilege number for the trip. 
The staff was super friendly and made sure we were comfortable in the flight. The seat and entertainment system were really good, as well. The food options were diverse and the Swiss chocolate is the cherry on the cake.
Look forward to fly with Swiss again.

title: Excellent service
review_text: The staff was very friendly and we were more than well taken care of. For being Economy we had plenty of snacks, drinks and decent food!

title: Never fly Swiss
review_text:
In summary, I can effort the cost, Swiss cannot effort losing me and people like me as business passenger!
It all started yesterday arriving to London after a two weeks business trip in South and North America, happily  using American Airlines, British Airways, LATAM and even Aerolineas Argentinas.
An arrogant Swiss agent name: chalion Braganca in LHR did not have enough experience, knowledge or brain cells to understand that I cannot run the risk of traveling to Lugano to a board meeting without my suite and tie and that is why I have to travel with my small piggy bag on board. He really placed me between a rock and a hard place. Had no choice but to take the risk of arriving at 7:00 pm to Lugano without my documents and my suite (one can be executed for arriving to a board meeting without a suite and a tie in Switzerland...)
Today when I am arriving to check in, on my way back to London, an un pleasant lady behind the counter made me pay CHF 45.00 for the ‚Äúaccess weight‚Äù (on the same piggy bag) and once I paid the sum- the security risk is gone.

As I told the unpleasant lady behind the counter I am too old for stupid arguments, I can effort paying the 45 Swiss franks, it is Swiss air that cannot effort losing me and my friends and colleagues as business travellers!

Thanks God, there are other airlines looking for business.

title: Never disappointed with SWISS!
review_text:
I always fly Swiss and am never disappointed. The quality of the service is always good, flight attendants are nice, the flights are are rarely late. They usually give you a small sandwich and one drink during the flight, and also delicious Swiss chocolate.
Planes are perfectly clean. You can still choose your seat without paying.
I would not recommend flying from City Airport at early times during the winter though. SWISS flights from City are small aircrafts, so often are the first affected by fog or snow. 
In case there flights are cancelled, the refund process is very efficient.
It is my favourite airline!

title: Better not be hungry
review_text: Very good flight, nice staff, but the food... On a long flight, you may get hungry at times, and you expect some good food, or at least, just normal. What they served us was just... not eatable!

title: A bit disappointing
review_text: I flew to Zurich from Singapore with Singapore Airlines and everything was top-notch. I knew Swiss wasn't quite up to that standard, but I was still disappointed. The only reason why I choose to fly back with Swiss is the timing, as the SQ return flight is a day flight and I'm usually super jet-lagged after that. Still, I was looking forward to the flight. But then it didn't start of well. Check-in was slow, the lady didn't really know what she was doing and had to ask a colleague for help. This should not happen at a business counter. The lounge in Zurich is pretty nice though. The service on the flight itself was very different from what I experienced with SQ the week before. The staff never addressed us by our names for example and the lady who served my drink just pulled out the table and started preparing for dinner, obstructing my view as I was watching a movie. I know they have to do disturb you while doing so, but a pre-warning or even a short excuse would have been in order I think. It just seemed loveless, getting the job done no matter what. Not very pleasant. Also, I felt like the staff doesn't turn down the volume when speaking to other passengers at night, when others are sleeping. That's probably why you get oropax! Which brings my to my next point, the travel/amenity kit. This was very nice! A beautiful pouch from Victorinox with a toothbrush and toothpaste, lip balm, a sleep mask and oropax. Food was nice, although I think the breakfast selection is a bit meagre. Seats are not too bad either. Bottom line: service needs improvement.

title: Swiss Vacation
review_text: Flying today is getting the best flight to get you to where you want to go for the best price.  As with all airlines in economy - the seats are small and the restrictions are many.  That being said the staff at Swiss Air were friendly and accommodating.  You receive blankets and ear buds for an international flight.  Food is better than other airlines I have flown.  I would not hesitate the fly Swiss Airlines in the future.

title: Perfect flight
review_text:
Great experience from A to Z: 
Very friendly and efficient check in at the First Class counter. The new Swiss First Lounge in Terminal A is done in a very nice way, great design, friendly staff. Own security check at lounge so bypass the regular security check. However the lounge is very busy and small so it can get a bit crowded. Lounge E great As usual with great staff. 
For the boarding there is unfortunately no one bringing you to the aircraft so you have to queue like all other passenger. Vey friendly welcome on board.
Very comfortable seat with enough privacy. Service on board is extremely professional, client oriented and also super friendly, the make sure every need is completely satisfied.
Food was excellent, best food in the air! And great wine as well - restaurant level!
Nice amenity kit and pajama.
Definitely one of the best flights in a long time, Swiss please continue to have this great level of client orientation!

title: Very non-Swiss
review_text: Swiss failed to load my 2 bags and the promised in London to deliver them the same day. Neither bag has arrived and they have not been in touch! From searching on-line it seems that one bag is in Greece and one in London! Shambolic service and they should be thoroughly ashamed.

title: Swiss Air is one of the better airlines
review_text: My flight was late but that happens. Overall Swiss continues to impress me because the planes are clean and well kept, the staff are friendly, they serve free food and drinks even on short flights, and the top it off with chocolate. I wish the US airlines were as committed to a good air travel experience.

title: Great to fly with them
review_text: As many other flights. Great to fly with them. Good service, quite new planes and free swiss chocolates at the end of the flight

title: Best economy seats row 51 AB
review_text:
I had a pleasant flight from Sao Paulo to Zurich on a brand new Boeing 777-300 mostly because I was able to get the seats for 2 people on the last row (51 A and B). 
The legroom is OK, but there's extra space on the left side near the windows to stretch your legs. 
The in-flight entertainment is the standard with good touchscreen. The food is nice and they serve delicious Swiss chocolate at the end of the flight!

title: The staff were amazing
review_text: We travelled close to Christmas and decided to fly after the train wanted crazy money. We went to the Swiss Air office in Zurich and the staff were incredibly helpful. Despite a huge line at the airport the check in was efficient. The staff onboard the flight were equally attentive and despite the short flight we were served delicious Lindt chocolate. It was our first time to London City Airport and it was very convenient.

title: Most comfortable connection between Tel Aviv and central Europe
review_text: Swiss flies with an Airbus 330-300 which is a very comfortable plane, even more in Business class. Flight was more or less in time with a good Service during the flight

title: Perhaps the best airline in Europe!
review_text: Recently I had a very nice flight experience with Swiss from Zurich to San Francisco on a 777-300ER equipment. I‚Äòm a Star Alliance Gold member and that‚Äòs why I could visit one of their really nice lounge facilities at ZRH airport. Both departure and arrival were on time. The flight crew was friendly and attentive all flight long till the doors openend at SFO airport! Usually I don‚Äòt use the IFE on board, but on this flight I enjoyed it pretty much, as they had a good selection of movies, documentaries etc. and the screen was quite big on this airplane type. During the flight they offered lots of food, altough I travelled in Economy class. After takeoff they offered some drinks before they started with their food service. You could select your main course out of two dishes. I decided to eat the delicious vegetarian pasta made after a recipe from the famous vegetarian restaurant Hiltl in Zurich. The entree was accompanied by a side salad, bread roll, Appenzeller cheese and a cake as a dessert. Furthermore they offered during the flight Movenpick ice cream, choice of vegetarian and non vegetarian sandwiches and small snack before approaching the destination. Additionally they had a self-service snackbar providing drinks, apples, soups, crackers etc. and of course the famous swiss Ricola candies. I felt very safe and comfortable on board at all times! I‚Äôm already looking forward to another flight I booked with them in September and I definetly will consider flying with Swiss on upcoming travels in the future!

title: SWISS B777 most terrible long-haul flight in economy
review_text: The aircraft B777-ER itself was relatively new and the interior design appealing, also the entertainment system in economy was high quality. Still, the flight experience on the long-haul flight from ZRH to LAX was anything but pleasant - it felt like a torturous 12-hour trip in a suburban train. The seating is incredibly narrow and uncomfortable. The new seat shape and tilt adjustment are OK, but seats are far too narrow, hard and uncomfortable and the aisles and corridors are too narrow. 10 seats per row with far too many rows is too tight even for Economy and absolutely terrible. Keeping a relatively normal posture during eating was virtually impossible, the flight attendants could hardly reasonably circulate through the corridors. I have not flown that unpleasantly for a long time and will next look for an alternative to this SWISS B777 aircraft with its terrible seating structure. Compared to the A340, SWISS has further devalued economy with the B777. I strongly advise my family and friends not to use this SWISS aircraft for a long-haul flight.

title: Space optimized but great service
review_text: SWISS 777 is very modern plane with lots of multimedia equipment on board. Flying Economy class in such planes is usually very cost optimized. As a 1.80m+ guy space is used and to fly long haul in a middle seat a terrible pain. However, service and food was quite good and you get the SWISS feeling on top. If you can afford choose business or other airline offering premium eco, otherwise you will be completely dependant on your seat neighbours how enjoyable the flight will be. Ground service from Zurich did a great job and everything was on time.

title: Avoid Swiss International Airlines
review_text:
I would recommend that you do not take this airline !!!! 

I am now in Paris Charles de Gaule airport where my flight is delayed therefore missing my 2 connections in order to arrive in Siem Reap tomorrow.

The only alternative they can offer is to leave 3 hours later from Paris and then stay over in Zurich and leave the next day at the same time. They cannot find another alternative !

The result is that my family and myself are loosing 1 day of our  very short vacation in Cambodia and are also paying for a  very nice hotel room in Siem Reap for nothing .

This is the first time I am taking Swiss International airlines and definitely the last !!!

title: Great if you book direct
review_text:
Swiss is one of the better airlines to fly from the West Coast to Europe. 
Planes are cleaner, newer, and the staff seems to have a moderate amount of concern for the flyers. 
First Class lounge in SFO is with United, it's clean and comfortable with a few choice food and drink (alcohol included) options. It feels a bit small but it works. 
The first class cabin is setup more for the solo traveler, and you get a sense of your own "space" on this plane more than most. It's open and comfortable, yet can be made more private. 
The staff was considerate and helpful at all turns. The food was a notch above many other international first class options (so far). 
My only complaint comes from the Zurich airport & Swiss Airs guidelines there.
Even if you are in the first class lounge here (which is spectacular) you will have to go through a SECOND security gate, where technically there's a separate line for first class customers, but honestly, everyone is in it and it doesn't go anywhere. It made for a rather stressful start to our flight out.
Also, as we learned, if you've purchased your ticket through any other service/airline (such as through United, as we did), even IF you have a fully labeled First Class ticket, you are not technically supposed to be allowed to use the Swiss First Class Lounge. You will be asked to head to the Business Class Lounge. 
We found this out AFTER we'd been shuttled over in a private car from the main terminal & security, brought up the elevators, and then rudely informed we weren't welcome after all. (Managed to get them to let us in, but it was a rather intense argument)
So book with Swiss, or perhaps don't fly through Zurich... apparently that's the only city they block you from the full First Class experience. (And it's easier to make changes when you've done this)

title: Great airline staff.  Ok ground staff.
review_text:
Somewhat indifferent land crew, but super friendly and attentive aircraft staff. 

Even though only a 90 minute flight, a very tasty mini-meal was served. 

Our flight was fairly late departing but much of the time was recovered in air, and we were kept informed of the connection issue by the staff

title: Breakfast was bad and the flight was overbooked (Air India + Swiss operated flight)
review_text:
Flight overbooked
completely full the plane
Service nice
everything in 3 languages (Eng-Swiss German - Indisch) which is a bit annoyingly when you watch a movie
The Breakfast special the eggs was one of the worst breakfast i ever got somewhere in the world...
if you interested about the problems by check for this flight, then read my review to Air India Flight Goa to Mumbai 
Save flight best wishes

title: Always good flights, very good service & comfort
review_text: My favorite air company. Flying from Amsterdam to Tel Aviv with a very short break (90 minutes) in Zurich. Good price, very nice crew. Flexible times. Got once free upgrade to business class, just by surprise. Recommended to you.

title: As good as it get in European Economy
review_text: We snagged an excellent fare flying from Barcelona to Newark (via Zurich). The food was above average; there was a good selection of free drinks; our bags were marked (and given) priority because of our very tight connection in Zurich. The staff were efficient, friendly, and competent.

title: A chance to everywhere
review_text: The best connection to Tel Aviv and overseas. Swiss and Star Alliance flyes everywhere. Some cabin lauggage is not accepted. Strict checking hand luggage controls at boarding gates

title: Very friendly and comfortable
review_text: My first experience of flying with Swiss was absolutely positive. The staff make you feel right at home. Very clean and comfortable plane. All passsengers were treated with a nice Swiss chocolate, a small detail but a nice token of appreciation. Very friendly cabin staff. Perfectly on time. Great experience!

title: Over booked
review_text: Flight overbooked, So was waitlisted. I let a young lady on the flight as she needed to get home before me. However airlines should not overbook flights.

title: Great flight
review_text:
upgraded to business, excellent service and very courteous staff.
the seats are relatively comfortable & well equipped but a bit narrow

title: Money grabbing, pay for a seat or you stand
review_text: Good luck in getting a seat, if you don;t want to pay for one upfront, They make elites wait until 23 hours, and then you are told to get early to the airport because NO ONE ever answers the phone and their site is down. Absolutely no excuse for this oor service meant to get more money so you have to pay for a seat. NO other airline treats Elite members like this. Shame on you, Swiss, too many holes in your service.

title: Swiss Airlines - Service with a Smile!
review_text: Flying with Swiss you can expect excellent service by the entire flight crew! Great food on the return flight, not so much on the flight leaving Newark.

title: Missing Item of value $1000
review_text:
During check in and security at Changi which has the most reliable and smooth check-ins in the world perhaps - medicinal/cosmetic items worth $1000 missing from hand luggage. They
 found it their property to take without asking. Be careful - low theft doesnt mean no theft. 
Unfortunately SNG airport authorities would also be not liable for misdemeanour and theft by check-in staff of flights, so best to keep guards up even at one of the safest airports in the world.

title: "Great Flying Experience
review_text: Self parked in the long term lot at JFK and took the air train to the terminal, very easy connection. Check-in was a breeze, security was the usual hassle but manageable. Boarding went smoothly. Cabin crew was the best! Very friendly and accommodating. When you show them the respect they deserve, things go smoothly as can be. They have a job to do, a if you let them do it, treat them right they are your best friends. Service was great, flight was very smooth, Economy tends to be tight on space with all airlines so you have to make the best of it. Beverages were good and plentiful. I have travel with Swiss Air before and have had a good experience every time. I would rate them among the best in customer service and on time performance. Baggage handling is also very good in my estimation. We arrived on time in both directions. All and all a great flight experience.

title: Nice short flight
review_text: This short flight from Z√ºrich to London Heathrow started at noon and we landed 1 hour and some minutes later in Terminal 2. Announcements from the cockpit were clear, the cabin staff friendly and efficient. Food was very good. Leg room is okay.

title: Great Sercvice
review_text: Because of heavy winds in NYC, a lot of flights have been canceled and many travelers were asking for an alternativ flight. Even though the check in was quick and the stay in the Swiss lounge relaxing - good food and nice drinks. The flight in the business class was superbe and the service even better. The stuff was so friendly and making everything for a great flight experience.

title: Clean and friendly
review_text: Swiss International Air.  Stewards came around quite a bit to check on comfort, any drinks needed, etc.  flight was on time.  I did have issue with a piece of luggage that was damaged; the airline resolved it very quickly.

title: world‚Äôs best airline
review_text: very comfortable seats even in economy, the service was excellent and the food was very good for airline food.  Would take Swiss air again in a heartbeat.

title: So far, no flight was on time this year
review_text: I really do not know that this year the Problem is. So far I was on 3 trips with Swiss and NO flight was on time. Each flight/way was upto one hour late. Whenever I can, I fly Swiss for years. But this gets now really annoying.

title: Great service, great facilities in Business class
review_text: I've flown Business class only once before, to New Zealand, but these flights, a round trip from Montreal to Tel Aviv were outstanding. Not only was the service excellent with smiles all round, but the armchair/bed was most comfortable, adjustable to my comfort level, and enabled me to sleep. Highly recommended in spite of the expense.

title: They survive until when?
review_text:
The Emirates airlines Dubai-London-Zurich-Dubai was over Aed 21k for Business class and Swiss was little over Aed 13k for business class hence decided to fly Swiss. The Lufthansa lounge at Dubai airport is bad. The overall in-flight experience is not even close to competitiors from middle East. Transit at Zurich airport I had to go thru 2 full blown security checks??? My suggestion they will be good as a budget carrier!?! I also found 3 old boarding pass of other passengers on my plane seat? Cleaning? Swiss business class does not have fast track access in LHR unlike some other airlines.

The last time I travelled Swiss was years ago Mumbai-Zurich-Mumbai...it was bad... wrote my feedback to Swiss and nobody cared to even reply so you know why they continue without improvement!?!?

title: Excelence is slippig ?? Wake up Swiss !
review_text:
Flight  was very pleasant, Crew fantastic, food excelent and tasty, Connection in Zurich smooth.However, delay  2-3-hrs of the connecting flight due to a technical problem,was demanding. To place the international call about the delay was impossible neither from the gate nor from the business class lounge;there a receptionist gave me WiFi code to use my computer. To my surprice,passengers waiting there are not informed about their departures;the repair was shorter and I missed the plane.I arrived to Prague 4 hrs later. needed to take taxi, compensate my friend for useless 2 trips (each 2hrs) to the airport. Expenses $200.
You might face a compromise assistance in the case as mine at the Zurich airport, it could be very rocking.I experinced poor Swiss's Customer Service,located at Fiji Island. Employees are cute,very polite,but the professional skils and knowledge is not sufficient if existing.Be prerare for long lasting calls.
I was always impressed by the Swiss airlines.Pitty, they are skipping to average since they fused with the Lufthansa.Crew,service ,curtesy in the cabin stil excelenton on their flights.Passenger's care is focused on the service for 1st and the business class passengers. Less is true for passengers of economy class. C'est la vie! The economy seat comfort and legeroom are compromised. Sorry to differ from my previous contribution. Hope the next time I will be using only superlatives.

title: No complaints....well a small one
review_text: My sister and I flew on Swiss recently. The flights were all on time.  Business is quite nice. Much better than other airlines I have flown. The flight attendants were all cordial and accommodating.  The only very small issue I had was unbeknownst to me, our seats were changed without being updated as to why. I would definitely fly Swiss again.

title: A terrific airline
review_text: Wonderful, gracious service at all times; unlike the typical perfunctory, bordering-on-rude service found in business class on the U.S. airlines.  Best lay-flat seats in the sky too.

title: Comfortable flight from SF to Berlin
review_text: Swiss offers a convenient evening flight to Zurich. The airplane is modern and very clean. The seats in economy class are comfortable, although the space is quite limited and the flight is normally full. Food is ok and flight assistants are very kind. The flight was outrageously expensive, but it was a business trip.

title: It was a good experience.
review_text: It was a great flight. Everything went well.  No problems. Everything was smooth.  Flight was smooth. Comfortable k

title: Would not fly them again
review_text: We took a direct flight on Swiss Airlines from JFK to Geneva, Switzerland to go on a trip with our ski club.  There were 52 of us in the group.  Most of us brought our ski gear but 10 of our group did not receive their skis and 1 did not receive her boot bag until 3 days later.  It was very frustrating for the people who didn't get their gear as they could not talk directly to someone to find out the status of where their bags were.  They could only go to a website which told them when their bags were delivered.  I met one woman who was staying at a nearby hotel but came to ours desperately looking for her suitcases.  Apparently it said on the website that her bags had been delivered but she couldn't talk to someone at the airline to find out where they had been taken.  Our travel agency was the same as hers so the travel agent recommended that she check with our hotel.  As it turned out, her bags were indeed delivered to our hotel.    The other issue was that my husband and one other man in the group almost didn't get seats on our outgoing flight even though the trip had been booked 6 months before!  The two of them were given standby tickets until they were given seats at the gate.  My husband was fairly hysterical not knowing whether or not he would be able to go on the trip.  The last thing I would say that there is no leg room in the seats next to the windows. I'm a normal size adult and I was really uncomfortable, especially when the person sitting in front of me leaned back so that the back of his seat was only about 7 inches from me.

title: Smooth flight SFO to BCN in economy
review_text:
We had a very smooth flight round trip. On the new 777,  I'd certainly recommend the last row of seats in economy. The configuration changes from 3-4-3 to 2-4-2 in the last 2 rows of the plane. I pre-reserved seats 51 a/b which do recline and have extra space around them. The bathroom is nearby but around the corner so it is not an issue in any way. 
Also, the airline gives plenty of snacks & hidration opportunities. Food served was good. Mid-flight there was also a snack-bar set-up to help ourselves. The entertainment was also quite good. Thanks Swiss!

title: LA to Zurich in 10 Hours
review_text: Swiss Air flies direct from LA to Zurich in about 10 hours which is a nice change from having to go through London and and a layover making that travel time around 18+ hours.   I found the crew to be just as friendly as United and British Airways.  The food is the same quality.  The inflight entertainment was good.   They do have a special first class option where you tell them what you want to pay for a seat (during the reservation stage).   On my return I wasn't able to do it at the airport - I believe they said you need 24 or 48 hours ahead of the flight.  But, I flew on a very 'off peak' day and surprisingly I had a whole 5 row area to myself.  Quite a treat.   You can also get frequent flyer miles.  So, all-in-all, it was a great flight and I would fly with them again.  :)

title: Wonderful
review_text: I had originally booked economy plus but opted for a bid for business class.  I offered $500 and bid was accepted.  The trip, service, food, bed....everything was great!!

title: Truly excellent
review_text: The Swiss are pretty much on time If you arrive early at the airport, visit the business class, where you will find the Whiskey Bar, serving many many different kinds of whiskeys. Bartender is well versed about the whiskey they sever and you get a chance to try as many as you want. Swiss has a nice seat configuration and try to get the individual seats. Service is impeccable and food is quite good. So is the entertainment. All in all, a very comfortable flight

title: Great service
review_text: Most major american companies are trying to get what Swiss has. The service was great, food was delicious, seats were comfortable. We were in Economy, but it was still very nice accommodations. Although it was a long flight and we slept a good portion, the multiple meals were served at the beginning and end of the flight to allow for people to sleep in the middle. There must have been at least 5 languages I heard the staff using with other passengers! It is worth a drive if you can get to a large enough hub where you can fly direct with them to Europe.

title: Wonderful
review_text: Wonderful flight.  Left on time, arrived on time.  Smooth ride.  Very clean.  Lot's of movies to choose from.  Great drinks selection.  They provided games and snacks for the kids.

title: Would fly them again
review_text: We were upgraded from Economy to Business Class on a return trip home. It was superior service with champagne, chocolates and excellent service. I know that it is expected to be that way, but to experience it was a treat and we're flying business again in the future. Traveling has long lost its "fun" but this reminded us of what it used to be like on most airlines, coach or first class.

title: Cross Atlantic Flight
review_text: They are constantly bringing you some sort of food. It was delirious. The television at my seat did not work. Crowded Plane.

title: Economy and Convience
review_text: Traveling Swiss Airlines out of Montreal was a very good bargain for US passengers who could drive to Montreal and use a hotel‚Äôs park and fly package. This was substantially less expensive than flying all the way from the US. Swiss Airline itself is still at or near the top in terms of customer service and a very good flight experience.

title: Very nice flight
review_text: Had several flights with Swiss Air that day and have nothing bad to say.  Lunch was very good Chicken and Rice Curry!  Small piece of Swiss Chocolate too!  Really great staff!

title: First Class Heaven
review_text: I sleep better on Swiss First than on any other seat in the sky. The service is friendly, polite and attentive without being obtrusive. The lounge in JFK is ok but nothing special.The First Class lounges in Zurich are beautiful.

title: Overrated
review_text: The boarding process was efficient. Flight attendants were not very friendly. Food was nothing special. Probably the worst amenity kit.

title: The recline feature in economy class
review_text: Generally we received good service, but the recline feature on the flight from Zurich was poor. That was because my neighbor had very little leg room on account of the fact that the passenger in the row in front of him pushed his seat further back than should have been allowed.

title: Smooth connection at ZRH
review_text: Flew from LHR to JNB in C class. Both sectors punctual. Long haul product was comfortable. On the A340, the only thing that seemed to show it's age was the IFE. The screen was very poor quality. Also surprised at what seemed like only 2 toilets for 45 passengers, so at peak times there was quite a queue. Food was very tasty. Connection in Zurich was very efficient. Landed and departed from the E gates so transfer took 5 minutes.

title: A321 for pampered Swiss customers awful
review_text:
I flew to TLV on C class. On the way to Israel they exceptionally used a narrow body A321... Long story short: not my most pleasant flight as use their A330-300. Crew was fantastic.

On way back usual A330-300 aircraft. Service, food and crew fantastic and i could get a decent nap on my 4K seat which is in the two row compartment right after first class.

title: Solid C product
review_text: Flew Swiss in C class and have nothing to complain about. Their product on European flights is very good from check in services up to baggage delivery.

title: Professional and reliable
review_text: This is my go-to airline because of its punctuality and high standards. It‚Äôs not cheap and in economy there are no frills, but no unpleasant  surprises. A wide choice of films, from Hollywood blockbusters to classics, art house films and Bollywood hits makes the transatlantic flight tolerable. My only major criticism is that the customer service agents reachable from the US have poor language skills and little authority, so making changes or solving problems can be a nightmare.

title: Flyrail luggage service reduced
review_text: We have used Swiss Air from various London airports to Zurich for our ski trips, mainly to make use of the fly rail baggage service with the Swiss railways to our ski resort. This year we again had good flight service on the flights to and from London City airport, nice to still get food and drinks on a European short haul flight. Whilst you can still check-in your luggage to resort, you can no longer check-in luggage at the resort for the return trip, you need to collect it at Zurich airport railway station and then follow the standard check-in procedures.

title: Horrendous
review_text: It took Swiss 3 days to fly me from Budapest to Newark. In Budapest, there was a long delay, which they said was due to stormy weather all over Europe. Interestingly, a Lufthansa flight at the next gate had no problem flying in Europe. I got to Zurich late and missed my connection to Newark. There was horrible chaos at the Swiss gate and the line to rebook the flight didn't move for hours. The next day, or flight was diverted to Chicago instead of Newark. Again, total chaos at the desk; I couldn't get a hotel voucher, so I got in a can and booked a hotel myself. The next day I finally got a flight back to Newark in the evening only to find that they lost my luggage. This is despite the fact that they charged me $25 for checking my bag after already having paid for the entire trip. I sent them all my receipts (hotel, food, cabs, etc). They reimbursed me for about one third of the amount I paid. I will not use Swiss in the future.

title: "The Food Kept Coming!"
review_text: I had great service, good food, and comfortable seat on Swiss Airlines.  The trip from LAX to Zurich was a nonstop flight and was great except for the narrow aisles.  It was topped off with Swiss chocolate.  The return was from Zurich to SFO which I didn't care for because i needed to get back to LAX and I had wished I paid a little more for a nonstop flight back.  Nonetheless,  for the return trip, the food kept coming.  First, we had a snack and beverage.  Following that was our main meal and beverages.  Next, we had ice cream.  Then we had a sandwich.   It ended with a "hot pocket" type of snack topped off again with Swiss chocolate.  We all had individual screens so you can watch a nice selection of movies and land in no time for this 11 hour flight.  My only complaint was the narrow aisles trying to get to the restroom.

title: One of the best
review_text: Great traditional service from a polite smiling crew. One of the best airlines out there,highly recommended

title: Zurich Unique ‚Äì the name obliges.
review_text: Swiss opened few days ago a completely new FIRST class lounge in Terminal A of Zurich Unique Airport. Besides the usual for homebased airline amenities, like direct access, private security check and direct lounge entry, you may experience some unique surprises: wonderful tastes' combination of a ‚ÄúPower Breakfast‚Äù: A composition of the fried farmhouse bread, avocado, cottage cheese, oyster mushrooms, nuts, dried cranberries toppings, small salad with a tasty sauce. Truly unique experience. I recommend you highly this palate pleasure. Great start of a day. B.

title: flight attendand was flying a level lower than the airplane..
review_text: The impression was, that Swiss was reactivating "older" flight attendants that were not fully up to date how work can be organized efficiently.

title: Classy Service
review_text:
Comfortable Economy space .
Excellent hospitable staff.
Travelled from Prague to Zurich where i had a time to relax on flight.
Free coffee and Swiss chocolates.

Relatively quiet and relaxing experience .
Highly recommended

title: Relaxing Fligth
review_text: Business Class of Swiss keeps his promises. Fair Champagne, delicious meal and very friendly staff. Easy and relaxing even on a very busy flight.

title: Swiss efficiency
review_text: I arrived at the airport in Geneva 9 hours before the flight, and was able to check in immediately, allowing me to go and enjoy the day in Geneva.   The very short connecting flight time in Zurich was made much easier by the airline putting a notice on all our tv screens before we landed, of all the connecting gates and how to get to them.  Despite having to move by a train (very cute, complete with yodelling and cow bells) between the domestic and international terminals, and clearing customs, I easily made the 50 minute connection in time.  The meals were more than adequate, snacks and water were easily accessible during the long overnight trip, and Swiss chocolate Easter eggs were a highlight!  Polite and efficient staff.

title: Nice flight
review_text: The flights were fine.  The longer leg was on an A340. I was generally comfortable. The food and drink service was good.  The shorter leg was an A320 which was cramped but it was a short flight. The only real complaint I have is that they made me check my carry on.  I did not think it was any larger than most of the other 22 inch carry ons.  The connection through Zurich was Swiss efficient

title: Excellent cabin crew
review_text: A late-March snowstorm resulted in cancellation of my Lufthansa flight and re-booking on Swiss. Though the A330 cabin is a bit cramped and the seat slightly less comfortable than on LH's 747-8 (and here's an odd thing: only one bathroom for the cabin instead of two), the food was excellent and the crew both courteous and experienced.

title: Efficient Swiss Air
review_text: This was our first round trip on Swiss Air. The flight was comfortable with adequate leg run for someone 5'9". The service onboard was good, the food was ok nothing memorable.  Just be aware of the carry-on luggage regulations, which they are very strict. Especially flying out of Switzerland, while waiting to board someone came and weighed and measured our bags.  The weight must be under 8kg or 17lbs. They charge the extra luggage fee if they place it in the baggage compartment. Their fees are very high, just check their website.  In economy you get just 1 carry-on item no personnel under seat bag.

title: Poor service, bad food and terrible drinks
review_text:
Usually I like Swiss airlines, but this trip was pretty bad. Flying from Zurich to Palermo, the tea tasted like dish water, disgusting and the coffee was equally bad. On the way back from Palermo to Zurich, the staff was pretty rude. I saw one steward snap rudely at a passenger when we landed, and he had in general, a bad attitude towards the passengers. 
I also asked for a cheese sandwich but was given a beef sandwich by mistake. When I asked if it could be replaced by a cheese sandwich, the stewardess told me "only if there are any sandwiches left by the time I offer them to all the other passengers." That is not really quality service and should not happen on an airline which is always expensive and which boasts about giving high quality service and refreshments.
