Overall I'm very disappointed with my experience and think that the staff should always be pleasant, friendly, helpful and accommodating to all passengers. 
1 star service.

title: We loved it
review_text:
It was our first time flying with Swiss airlines and we were uncertain of what we would find. We had read online that in their A330 the legroom was small, but that was quite the opposite. Such a spacious seat and amazing recline.
I must point out how good the service was. The food was excelent, they served hot bread (which is not normal in economy nowadays), and instead of plastic they had silver wear. Such a nice detail!
Plus, the whole cabin crew was very attentive and caring and was always giving out drinks and making sure everyone was ok. Can‚Äôt wait to fly with Swiss again!

title: EFFICIENT
review_text: The airline staff is efficient but could show some more warmth..a few smiles for example They just go about their job rapidly so they can return to the back quickly when they serve meals..slow down..Seats were comfortable in economy however the WiFi was out of order ( 11 hr flight what a pity) In flight entertainment should have better choices of films

title: No leg room! Food ok.
review_text:
This has got to be one of the smaller seats/legroom area that I've had, even worse than Lufthansa. I am only 5'2", and had so little room, I felt terrible for those people who were so much bigger than I.
The food choices were good both directions, better tasting than the Lufthansa to Boston flights (Boston to Frankfurt food is unappealing).
On the Boston to Zurich leg, after the lights were out in the cabin, it was hard to get the attention of an attendant for those of us who can't/don't sleep on a plane, but these seats did have a USB port, where the Zurich to Boston leg didn't.

title: Worst customer service in my life!
review_text:
My husband and I recently flew from Singapore to Barcelona. We got an e-mail saying that our seats were changed and that if we weren't happy with the seats, we could request fora better option at the check in counter. Take note, we PAID for the seats and were given ones that were further back with no leg room. 

When we got to the airport, two staff couldn't help us and one of them said in Malay (thinking I didn't understand), "Let Zurich deal with the problem". Seriously??! Your customers are problems? How offensive! We were also told that our seats were SOLD to other people. 

We then sent an e-mail to customer service asking for something to be done (at least a refund). It took 3.5 weeks to get a reply. Their reply was just an apology and that they cannot do a refund. 

I cannot believe that this is there service we get from an airline which country is known for hospitality. Truly my husband and I are both very disappointed and felt cheated. We will NEVER fly this airline again.

title: I like the chocolate
review_text:
Swiss Airlines is a decent airline operator. As allways with an economy flight, the main thing is that the flight is in time and that the staff is friendly. And this was both just fine.
And I like it that you get swiss chocolate during the flight

title: Great Pilots
review_text: Great flight I love flying with Swiss air , the pilots seem to know where the bumps are and avoid them , which is great if you don't like flying. Sadly on this flight i had someone spill hot coffee on me so watch out for the stupid cups they keep giving out. they don't seem to use recyclable cups only throw away plastic one. the air hostess never smile but you get the service that you expect from a long flight. and they are never late

title: No support whatsoever for reaching connection after initial flight was delayed
review_text: The problem was not the service on board but the lack of service upon reaching London Heathrow. The Swiss flight's departure was delayed because they waited about 30 minutes for passengers coming from Beijing, thereby reducing our layover in Heathrow from the scheduled 70 minutes to a mere 40 min. Upon arriving there was nobody to help us and no buggy to take us to our onward flight (Air Canada). We had to sprint over long distances at this huge airport.  As both airlines are part of the Star Alliance, one would expect better service from at least one of them. Conclusion: if the airline waits for arriving passengers, the onward travelling passengers should not have to pay the price.

title: Small meals and seems this airline has a problem with flatulence.
review_text: The meals seemed smaller and worse than ever on the flight.  I am not sure if their cabins are not properly ventilated or the problem is with the Swiss customers, but I have flown 3 times internationally on this airline and every single time the cabin had a miasma of flatulence through the entire trip.  I know it is hard to believe but it was unpleasant enough to cause me some difficulty sleeping.  I think they need to crank up the ventilation and not feed the passengers bulgur wheat salads for dinner.

title: Good food, real silverware and good service- in economy!
review_text: The food in Swiss economy is nearly as good as the food in United's domestic first.  I was very impressed with Swiss, and hope to fly them again soon!

title: Completely full flight, but still better than American carriers
review_text:
We took this same flight back in December of 2017 and we had an abundance of room.  The center seat stayed open and we felt like it was one of the best flights in recent memory.  No snarky or surly flight crew like on most American carriers. 

Sadly the flight was completely packed so that meant all over head bins were full and the under seat space had to be used; that should read as "ZERO legroom"

The food was pretty darn good and the bonus of the complementary Swill chocolate definitely helps!

title: Simply the best
review_text: I'm writing this review to thank excelelnt and absolutely professional team of people working at Swiss Air. My daughter is disabled (on electric wheel chair) and frequently travelling around the Europe. In case of her travels I always book Swiss Air only, as the proof of quality, professionalism, strong support and assitance provision. Thank you for that!

title: To Hong Kong
review_text:
The trip was via Zurich.
No problems with either flight. Both were on time, or early, and my bag got to HK.
Boeing 777 from Zurich to Hong Kong was no the most comfortable trip I've had. Seats were a bit hard, leg room short, although there was an empty adjacent seat, so I could stretch out.

title: Very Good Flight
review_text:
Great Flight with new airplane which was equipped well, and excellent service.
The flight departed on time without any delays.

title: Long flight. Impressive Service and meals.
review_text: Long flights. Service and meals were especially impressive. Head and shoulders above other airlines.

title: One of my preferred airlines
review_text: Always on time, service is good, business class seats are very comfortable , flight to all locations I am used to fly

title: Business class food on the flights is disappointing
review_text: The convenience of flying into London City is great.  The business lounge in Moscow is extremely poor, but the one in Zurich made up for that during the 4 hour layover.  However, the food on the flights, especially given that it was a business class flight, was virtually inedible.  Most disappointing.

title: Easy flight on Swiss
review_text: Swiss is known as one of the top airlines in the world and it didn't disappoint. Large clean plane, good service and food, and great entertainment - up to the minute movies. Flights on time and efficient. One the way home, my bag was damaged. They promptly replied and sent a reimbursement check without my even having to provide a receipt!

title: Poor service and info on delayed flight
review_text: Sat waiting for an update on flight which was to leave at 12:20 and were sent to a gate at 1:30 only to be given a cheap voucher for 4 GBP. No details on what gate or when flight would leave. Booked Swiss Air as I know BA cancels flights from City all the time, but expected better service from Swiss Air.

title: Great experience!
review_text: Great service! The food was delicious! Flight was on time as well. I would definitely fly again, if prices get lower.

title: WORST CUSTOMER SERVICE AND MANAGEMENT
review_text: We booked flights to Zurich two months in advance.  A day before our flight my husband came down with the flu and had 101 degree temperature.  Our doctor prescribed Tamiflu (and told us he would provide a letter stating that my husband was very sick with the flu, 101 degree temperature and highly contagious).  We contacted Swiss Air Lines the night before and sent a copy of the actual prescription medication.  We sent letters to the CEO in Zurich and the US.  They responded once saying that they won‚Äôt do anything for our lost flights even though we stated that we would pay the $300/ticket change fee and any difference in fairs for future flights.  Swiss Air Lines doesn't care that he was contagious and we lost our entire amount of our tickets.  We have tried emailing them back and NO RESPONSE.  This is OUTRAGEOUS.  Our friends had similar experiences with Delta and United and they were given a year to change their tickets.  Swiss Air Lines gives you NOTHING and still NO RESPONSE to our emails.  DON‚ÄôT USE THEM ‚Äì (United and Delta are much better choices for non-stop from NY ‚Äì they care about their passengers).

title: Not good as expected
review_text: In-flight entertainment is poor. There is no WiFi. LED Display is small. Movies has limit for Chinese customer even this flight heads to China.

title: Good Flight Experience
review_text:
The flight was about 11 hours but time passed quickly due to the entertainment on the monitors (movies, games etc). The flight experience was a nice one with friendly staff on board. I would fly again with Swiss.

The only thing I did not like was the food. Portion was very small and time between first and second meal was almost 8 hours. This made me starving.

title: Great Flight
review_text: Flew the short distance from london to zurich and the flight with swiss was great the staff are lovely the seats were good the in flight drink and snack service was good and the whole flight in general was ace

title: Worst airline. Avoid by any means
review_text: After a cancelled flight from LHR to ZRH a system failure in Hongkong. Let the passengers wait for hours to do a manual check-in of passengers/lugguage. Do not even offer a glass of water to the waiting passengers... To be avoided by all means. Just complacent and no service attitude.

title: Excellent Business Class Flight with Swiss in Europe
review_text:
We flew with Swiss aboard one of their A320‚Äôs from Porto back to Z√ºrich in business class.
The airport in Porto offers fast track security check, so its a pretty painless journey through to the airport lounge.
The lounge itself in Porto is also good with a wide selection of beverages (including Port Wine!), as well as cold buffet and even a couple of warm dishes.
Swiss offers priority boarding for business passengers, so we got on the aircraft fairly rapidly.  Once onboard, crew were vigilant ensuring the economy passengers were not stowing baggage in the business class lockers so there was plenty of overhead stowage space.
The aircraft was clean and passenger areas well maintained.  Takeoff was delayed by 30 minutes and we were unable to make the time up on the journey; I don‚Äôt recall the reason for the delay.
The meal service on the plane was most excellent.  Because the segment from Porto is over 2 hours, they offer a full meal service consisting of Salad (W√ºrst K√§se Salat), Hot Main (the ubiquitous Chicken or Pasta), Dessert (Carrot Cake), Cheese.  I selected Champagne to accompany my meal and although the beverage served was indeed champagne, it wasn‚Äôt all that good.
Service was overall very good and staff on the flight were friendly (not always the case with Swiss) although the Ma√Ætre de Cabine seemed more intent on talking to the Pilot deadheading in seat 1D than serving Business Class passengers which caused an undue delay to coffee & cognac.
A few years back I would never have spent additional money for business class on segments less than 4 hours, but I have to say, the product, and in particular that of Swiss has really come a long way.  I won‚Äôt pay any price for the higher service level, but the offering (fasttrack, lounge access, priority boarding, additional carry-on entitlement, full meal service) is certainly worth something.
Overall I would rate the service quite excellent and I will enjoy future regional flights with Swiss in business class.

title: Excellent food, Excellent service
review_text: The Cadillac of Air Travel!  The best Airline experience we have had yet.  We really enjoyed the food.

title: Worst So Far,
review_text: Although i had two row seats at the back of the plane and ticket was bought 7 months ahead,when i checked in for my flight,they said it was overbooked and if i would like to upgrade to business class for $700.00 each,i said NO not realising they switch my seats to a 4 row and wife in another row.I showed the FA my seats that was given when i booked months ago,she said they can't do anything once i board the plane,i then went to the head FA(a guy)and he told me to sit in the assigned seats and after take off he will see what he can do,well he did nothing than to offer me a glass of red wine from first class.then came the food,took one bite and spit it out,good thing we bought snacks in Delhi to take on the flight.They were also stingy with their wine and liquor.Will never fly with dem again.

title: Poor punctuality and poor confort
review_text:
Arriving late is always a bad experience, but for a company which carries "Swiss" in its name (although owned by Lufthansa) this is even worse, as most of us associate Swiss with punctuality. 

Unfortunately, both my outbound (LX 1582) and inbound flights (LX 1579) were late, with one of them delayed by almost 45 min (over a travel time of 1h 10 min) - i.e., 65% of flight time. Like most companies nowadays, Swiss not only artificially inflates the scheduled travel times (so as to be formally "on time"), but cannot respect even such "inflated" schedules ... a real shame which shows how much consideration they have for the time of their passengers. In fact, despite being late, the aircraft never exceeded 720 km/h, although able to reach 850 km/h. Obviously fuel consumption is a more important concern than your lost time ...

Worse yet, as with low-cost companies, you have to pay for checked luggage. So most passengers embark with hand luggage, which adds other delay during boarding. 

Besides this, the new Swiss aircrafts (such as e.g. A321) offer only cramped sitting room, where one can barely fit, even if the passenger in front of you does not recline the seat. 

The only positive aspect was the good service offered by the cabin crew. Yet, overall there were too many drawbacks and an inadequate price-performance. 

In conclusion, if you can, just avoid flying with Swiss ...

title: Plane has shrunk
review_text: Flew the other day from Heathrow to Geneva. The plane was a Bombardier with a 2 3 configuration. The leg room has shrunk making even this short flight uncomfortable. Swiss must have put some extra rows in. Makes using the airline less enjoyable.

title: Excellent
review_text: Great seats with plenty of storage and legroom.  The attendants were prompt and courteous.  Food was delicious.  I would gladly fly again.

title: Don't fly with Swiss International Air Lines! Worse customer service ever!
review_text: We have requested compensation for a flight delay of over 3 hours due to a technical fault as per EU law but our request has been rejected without any valid reason. We are going to take the complaint to the CAA, it is sad that the airline denies our rights and we have to go through such process! Really poor service!

title: Comfortable seats and space
review_text: Good quality food. Wide selection and good quality. Wine was ok. Seats and seat space were very good -  a330-300. Professional and friendly check-in and flight attendants.

title: Nice Service on a Smooth Flight
review_text: After a short waiting in a nice lounge we left on time Tokyo. Nice drinks before departure and aftrwards great food, good champagne and nice Swiss red wine. The service personal and friendly. Fine selection of movies and other entertainment. Cleanand ordery toilet. Arrival on time aand rapid bagage service.

title: Nice Airline
review_text: Nice lie flat seats, very good service, on time airline.  Food could have been a little better, but I would fly again

title: short connecting flight
review_text:
The Crew from Swiss was very helpful and friendly. The flight time was just over 2 hours, connecting us in Zurich. 
To my surprise, the business class seats are normal economy seats, 3 in a row with more legroom and the middle seat was kept empty.
So not very comfortable.

title: OK, fairly good intercontinental service
review_text:
ZRH-BOM standard Economy on an A330-300

Aircraft showing it‚Äôs age a little ‚Äì quite clean but a little shabby. Seats fairly comfortable, legroom OK. 

IFE is dated ‚Äì 8‚Äù screens, old and not too clear. A wide variety of movies but a very messy menu arrangement for them. USB power port. On board service was OK, food OK. 

The flight was delayed by almost an hour (maintenance issues, alternative aircraft was used) ‚Äì Swiss did not communicate this well enough on the ground. On board, you usually expect the captain to at least say ‚Äúwell, we‚Äôll make up some of the delay‚Äù (by increasing speed) ‚Äì nope, nothing of the sort‚Ä¶

title: Good
review_text: Pleasant and smooth flight overall. Food and legroom were ok as I'm Asian with a smaller frame. The stewardess weee friendly throughout the flight! Recommended!

title: Late arrival caused problems
review_text:
We were told the departure would be 25 mins delayed and with Swiss efficiency it was correct. Flight uneventful but arrival was a disaster. Many had connecting flights but we parked at a stand and bussed in. Good news is they parked the bus close to stairway unlike some other places. But those who travel to Russia or LHR are used to bussing BUT as we got off the bus we had to go through a security line. We should have been notified so people could be prepared.  Only one line open. The 25 mins delay made some close connections  and I'm sure done missed flights. Not really Swiss fault. This was inefficiency of Zurich Airport. Sad. They should do better
I was allocated 38f although many open rows up front. Not amused when jet lagged from earlier flight. Crew were kind to reseat me. Strange meal.

title: Budget low cost airline ? Make up your mind Swiss
review_text:
I am a regular business TRAVELLER - silver card status but am so fed up of inconsistencies relating to carry on luggage and having a small handbag 

I have the right size suitcase carry on yet every time I travel I am pulled over even when traveling with colleagues who have carry on and handbag and shopping !

When I challenged the gate staff my last trip after being pulled over again ! why no  all other travelers are pulled over and pointed out  (more than 50% of flight traveling with more than one bag I was ‚Äòrudely told don‚Äôt worry about them we pulled you over‚Äô I told them  then if you have rules be consistent !

Discrimination 
Male passengers are able to take their briefcase and small carry on - no issues 
Female passengers - one small suitcase OR Handbag  

(Paying a full fare should entitle passenger - to fit travel size suitcase overhead locker and bag at feet)

I am beginning to feel best to travel budget airlines as you pay for what you get

title: Gracious and generous food service
review_text: I was pleasantly surprised by the good service, friendly crew, and generous food service on this flight.  The flight attendants were all kind and cheerful, which is sometime not the case on other airlines, particularly some of the jaded union members of US airlines.  The meal was tasty and they were generous with their drinks and wine.   The mid-flight snack was a hot cheese torte and a cold creme brulee ice cream, which were very good and much nicer than the small dry sandwich and ice cream cup you get on United.   There was another snack that was a small swiss chocolate bar - that was a nice surprise.    The TV screens worked very well, and there were many empty seats, which is nice for the passengers.   I was disappointed that they wanted to charge me just to have a reserved seat - seriously, only discount airlines should do that, it's tacky and cheap.  So I had refused to pay and was resigned to getting a bad seat when I arrived at the airport - but in fact there were many available seats so I got a center section aisle with two empty seats next to me.    Worked out very well.

title: Noisy cabin on CS100 and CS300
review_text: The cabin of both CS100 and CS300 are outstandingly noisy. My App on the iphone registered at seat 6A of CS100 91-94 dezibel.

title: Uneventful and Cheap
review_text: This was a pleasant flight for a surprisingly competitive price. Amsterdam airport is always very nice with very good shopping opportunities (also before check-in).

title: Comfortable
review_text: The flight was very comfortable, the service excellent i would recommend the line again.  The plane was very well kept up.

title: My favorite airline
review_text: I had a great international flight with SwissAir. They were very nice. I highly recommend flying with this airline.

title: Almost hits the spot
review_text:
Swiss almost makes it, but not quite. My big problem with the flight was how hot the cabin was. When I tried to lay down for a nap, it was too hot and uncomfortable for me.

European airlines will never, in my opinion, be able to compete with South East Asian airlines for customer service, although Swiss tried.

The food was plentiful (if not too much), the entertainment was however limited.

I would fly again, but now understand why they are on of the cheaper long haul options.

title: Family Holiday to Switzerland
review_text: Good Flight out from Heathrow - flight coming back was with an airline partner - delayed by 40 mins and not up to the standard of the crew of Swiz air

title: Brilliant
review_text: I fly a lot, and have seen the quality of some airlines deteriorate over the last few years. I was most pleased at the service and treatment on this Helvetic Airways flight and would recommend this as first choice.

title: A Swiss Nightmare - with a little help from Austrian Airlines...
review_text:
The return flight on March 2nd to Zurich turned out to be the worst customer experience ever encountered. Original departure 8.10 pm was delayed without any communication until midnight. No drink, no snack, no information, absolutely nothing. A couple of strange excuses, machine arrived too late, but is soon ready, technical issue, new machine will be ready soon, etc etc etc. Both gentlemen Mr. Slamenik and Mr. Scharvier were helpless and actually looked like they knew more, but were not allowed to tell. After midnight passengers were told to gather outside in the cold snow and wait for a bus. After an hour in the snow, a first bus came. But we needed two. At 2 am we arrived at a far away suburb hotel. No drink, no food, just one concierge to check in 80 hotel guests. All guests were booked on a return flight for 6 am the next day, so back to the airport at 5 am. No breakfast no coffee no sandwich nothing.
When trying to make a complaint, Swiss turns to Austrian and Austrian keeps very very quite - have not even received an answer to my complaint until today.

So if you plan to fly a quality airline because of the customer service, consider twice....
If a Swiss Manager reads this and would like to apologize, my e-mail is martin.kanwar@bluewin.ch

Kind regards, Martin

title: Hassle free flight
review_text:
Punctual and hassle free boarding. Seats quite comfortable  with enough leg space comparing  to other economy flights.
Only drawback was the entertainment which was a shared screen.

title: Not bad but also not good
review_text:
I am glad I did not book and pay for business class. The service and snack might have been different but the seats were not. A joke. The flight to berlin was ok and fine and the on line check in worked very well. The staff at Swiss friendly. However the toilets 2 for the entire economy class were so tiny especially as you had to go through the board kitchen. During service it was almost impossible to use the entry door to the toilet.
On the return flight it was worse. The flight was operated by Helvetic Airways and they used a very small Embraer jet where seats like baby seats. I am of average weight and height but could barely fit in. On Line check in was limited to the boarding pass could not print out the luggage tag. Bad service at Berlin Airport which is really a Banana republic airport not worthy of the Germans Capital airport. Toilets on the flight for midgets only. And to top it off upon arrival in Zurich no fingerdock the jet was too small.
But the price was high. What a rip off really. Next time I will take the train.

title: A little better in seat 11 near exit door
review_text:
IT is a bit better leg room in the seat 11a on the A320 I think it was . It is the exit seat so there is nobody in front of you and I was also lucky that the middle seat was empty so I could use us for my coffee and coke.

Staff are great generally on Swiss. Sandwich and drinks provided which is nice. Compared to other airlines, it is good

title: Seating is becoming really bad, squezze them in
review_text:
Once again it is a real nightmare when you have so little room. A few centimeters more would suffice and yet they are better than some.

You at least get a drink and a "sandwich". You have have wine, beer but I don't drink so I took a coffee and coke.

The staff are friendly. We were delayed first as they had to wait for two passengers and then we had a further delay for a fault that showed up and finally a delay due to fog or something in Barcelona. The communication was just OK.

title: Reliable, efficient and worked like clockwork!
review_text: Reliable, efficient and worked like the proverbial clockwork - an entirely appropriate comment to make about a Swiss airline.  The service was courteous and polite, the food excellent and the flat bed offered a good night's sleep.  There was only 40 minutes time to change planes at Zurich Airport, to go on to Vienna (our final destination) but for such an efficient airline, and such a well-functioning airport, this was ample time.

title: Excellent flight
review_text: We paid $55,00 extra dollars to upgrade our seats.. Excellent service. Staff very professional and attentive...Highly recommend Swiss air...and YES we are going back to Montreal on Swiss Air

title: Helps set the standard for European short haul
review_text:
travelled in business class on Swiss Airlines from London Heathrow T2 to Z√ºrich. The flight had a scheduled departure time of 5pm. 

Check-in and the priority security line were very quick; I was airside within 10 minutes of arriving in the terminal. 

As I‚Äôd arrived about 3 hours before my flight I decided to try two lounges in Terminal 2B. I REALLY enjoyed the United lounge and the choice of various travel themed cocktails, notably the ‚ÄòGrand Diablo‚Äô which is the first cocktail I‚Äôve tried with a warning label: ‚ÄòWarning: incredibly hot‚Äô was clipped to the glass. I didn‚Äôt try the food. 

I also had a short but pleasant visit to the Singapore Airlines lounge, which was largely empty. I really enjoyed the Malaysian Curry with sticky rice, as well as a Singapore Sling made from scratch and a sample of Cherry brandy.....! I left early to navigate back to T2A, but found the Lufthansa Lounge pretty poor by comparison and left after 10 minutes. The emphasis definitely seems to be on functionality rather than any wow factor. Departure was from gate A16, and a clear priority line was in operation. I was onboard within a minute or so of arriving at the gate. 

The aircraft was an Airbus A320 and I was sitting in 1A, which I‚Äôd picked online a few weeks before. This is a good seat as it has two windows and extra legroom. There was a fair amount of drama with a passenger who had put his coat in the overhead locker and insisted that no other items were placed near it. The coat eventually ended up in the middle empty seat next to him. 

The flight pushed back at 5pm exactly. A short announcement followed in English and German: the flight time would be 1 hour and 15 minutes. Take off was at around 17:15. A light meal was served, although my strong recommendation would be to eat in the lounge if you‚Äôre looking for anything substantive or hot. Food was served on a tray which comprised (amongst other things) three slices of roast beef, some salad and a separate plate of Swiss cheese. Plenty of warm white and brown bread rolls were offered. The crew were proactive with drinks and champagne was served from a full size bottle. I was quickly brought a peppermint tea on request, which was served with Swiss a Airlines branded chocolate. Further chocolate was offered from a basket around 30 minutes before landing. Landing was at exactly 6:30pm UK time. Disembarkation was via a remote stand, but there was a dedicated business class bus with special seating to take us to the terminal; a nice touch. 

My suitcase was already on carousel 23 when I reached baggage reclaim. I was in a Oerlikon within 15 minutes of leaving Zurich airport. 

In summary, I‚Äôve previously found that Swiss sets the standard in short haul European business class and today‚Äôs experience only reinforced that opinion. I very much look forward to travelling with Swiss to London in two days.

title: Quality Airline
review_text: I used this airline for flights from Manchester to Zurich,Zurich to Singapore,Hong Kong to Zurich and Zurich to Manchester. All the flights were very good,really comfortable and roomy seating,very nice courteous and attentive staff. Lovely meals.

title: Swiss air
review_text: We flew by Swiss Air this march and it was good experience, very very very welcome staff, very good and kind service! We loved to flew by this company!

title: I liked it!
review_text: It was a good flight and all the staff where very friendly and helpful. We didn't travel in executive or first class so I would say that the service was very good for economic.

title: Aborted flight to snowy Birmingham - great customer service saved the day !
review_text:
Flight on #snowmaggedon day !! we took off from Zurich and when we got to London the pilot announced that Birmingham airport was closed :-(
he gave detailed info on the process and we ended up flying back to Zurich.

once we were off the plane we were escorted back to customer services, handed a ticket for a flight the next day, dinner, and a hotel room ... all done in 15 mins ...

great smiling faces in Zurich, great customer services ... very impressive considering the hell others were going through

title: Can't Reserve a Seat on Code-shared Air Canada Flight!
review_text:
Other travelers should be aware of this issue:

I booked a series of flights for a family vacation on Air Canada's website on flights operated by its alliance partner Swiss International Airlines. I tried to reserve seats because families like to sit together. Neither of Swiss nor Air Canada allow us to do this and each informed us we would have to wait for check in 24 hours before the flight. Swiss says it can't do it because it's agreement doesn't allow it to charge. Air Canada says it can't do it because it can't access Swiss' systems. I complained to both airlines on their customer service lines and in writing but to no avail. Swiss customer services in particular was very unhelpful and difficult to understand, the function has clearly been outsourced and the representatives are difficult to understand. 

I have made an additional complaint to the Canadian Transportation Agency on the basis of discrimination (our tickets are being treated differently than either Swiss economy or Air Canada economy). 

I have flown before on Swiss (always business though except short hauls) but I have not yet flown on the above flight. I wanted to share my ongoing frustrating experience because other travelers should be aware.

title: don't trust that you get the seat you paid for!
review_text: Five out if six times, Swiss sends me 48 hrs before the flight an email stating that the seat booked and paid for has changed - and claim change of aircraft type even if this is not the case! Nice way of making money - and not delivering what is paid for, even if you have Senator status! Furthermore, the new CS100 seem to fall apart already, see my photo of the wall panel. And 10mins before departure, the captain announces that he just had to call for an external power unit to help him start the engines. Who buys planes in the 21st century which cannot start their engines on their own - and then askes for the power unit so late that they cannot met the departure time?

title: Pleasant & efficient
review_text:
For SWISS - our national carrier - we always have high expectations. 
Nice flight, on time, pleasant service, took fast dinner to sleep. Happy.

title: Happy to fly the again
review_text: The crew was very friendly on this early morning flight. The service was quick. we had a quiche lorraine and drinks. The crew was very nice and young. the plane was very clean and the seats spacious and comfortable. I am looking forward to fly them again.

title: Comfortable flight, on time, good food and staff, bonus from Heathrow T2
review_text:
Very satisfying flight, all went well, easy to book seat wanted, no extras needed with middle tariff which included a normal baggage allowance of hold/cabin luggage.  Booked through Swiss airlines and checked in on-line.  Staff friendly enough and Swiss chocolate handed out at end.  T2 better to depart from than arrive due to distance from plane to bags in the latter is long.

Information on my ratings:

5* I give relatively few. Has to be a place I would either go to regularly and consistently provide a cut above the rest, or a place that I may have visited just once and offered a particularly memorable experience or be exceptional value.

4* is a place I enjoy and would tend to go back to if the opportunity was presented. Probably a good level to aim at for a catering/hospitality business, as too many 5* suggests you may be underselling/undermarketing.

3* places - are adequate and I would sometimes go back to but other choices are generally preferred; normally there is obvious room for improvement, usually in the offering and value. It's a brief stop off but worth 30mins or so to look around.

2* places - have issues that make the experience below par,

1* places - hope I don't end up in one of these!

title: convinced about the this good airline thats why it  brings me back to fly with them
review_text: excellent service, pleasant flight, comfortable aircraft. As usual. No wonder Swiss is having a great success lately. They do something for the passangers.

title: Efficient and pleasant business class ride
review_text: Excellent airbus aircraft, efficient and pleasant crew, way better than average airline food.  Comfort and entertainment ok - on time arrival

title: Not expected
review_text:
I really had to say that I expected better service but although staff was friendly but there was no entertainment on the plane no screens or radio
I would expect them to improve it as it‚Äôs long 4hours trip

title: So far a very good airline without luggage and seating tricks
review_text: Good airplanes, very good food&drink service, great assistance in case of a short connection. In the times when airlines try to maximise their profits by charging more for luggage, for sitting together, the approach of Swiss is highly appreciated.

title: Swift to Dominican Republic
review_text: Flight was awesome. Comfortable seats. Friendly crew. Good drinks. Definitely would fly Swift again.

title: Nice and Easy
review_text: Swiss both out and return. Both flights went without problem and to time. Pleasant helpful air crew and ground staff

title: Just perfect
review_text:
From Check-in to smooth boarding, warm welcome at door and in no time a refreshing towel and a drink to choose from. Top boarding!
Lunch service from attentive cabin staff 
Excellent first course and  main dish 
Wine service right on time and glasses were filled correctly
dessert / coffee service and clearing just a bit slow.
Very comfortable seats 180¬∞
Entire staff very pleasing

title: Very Good
review_text: Nice flight. Really good. I had lots of service and a perfect Swiss organization and timing, and it probably took me to one of the most fun cities in the world. Being truthful, I flew to Miami in 2014, but I really want to review it.

title: the way people used to fly....
review_text:
Having taken cheaper flights for many years, I was pleasantly surprised to find a cheaper price and service the way it used to be on Swiss Air. I had my own TV and watched recent movies and I ate with real cutlery, not plastic - they served food that I did not have to pay for! The staff was polite and kind and there were pillows and blankets. I even received an offline text to my phone informing me off delays - even though the delays were of 10 minutes. The next time I book a flight, if Swiss Air has as a good a price as others, I am going with them. 
BTW Everything else in Switzerland - at least in the airport -  costs an arm and a leg!

title: Excellent Service
review_text: Flight was excellent. Service from the beginning to the end was excellent.    Food was very good for an airline, seats extremely confortable and flight attendants extremely helpful.  Excellent experience.

title: Abandoned
review_text: SWISS AIR. Never again. Thanks to a defect plane we had a nine hour delay from Pristina and eventually arrived in Geneva at 22.30-ish with the result that I missed my  connection to Amsterdam, or any flight to Amsterdam. Guess what...noone there from Swiss Airlines..at all (despite being informed that there were several passengers in my position). Only a lady who kept saying that since my through flight was with KLM, it was not the responsibility of the airline.., so  left too find a hotel room all on my own. And, better still, probably no compensation (1. because Swiss not covered  by EU regulation and 2 because flight originated outside the EU). Eventually crawled home some 23 hours late! So be warned!

title: Waiting for check in to start since 40 mins
review_text: Really disappointed. Waiting at the checkin line to start. Only 2 hours now for the flight to fly. Still no sign of them starting the checkin at Milan airport.

title: Perfect and professional es always
review_text: Folks it's getting a little boring for you but I only can write what I experience on board of LX aircrafts. This time it was Helvetic  Airways. And it was a nice uneventful flight with the expected levels of safety and professionalism.

title: first choice to Zurich
review_text: I travel regularly from London to Zurich for business. I try to book Swiss over any airline as I find them reliable and punctual. Simple and free snack with a nice piece of chocolate. So well organised that it nearly feels like a routine. I'd like to use them from Birmingham instead but tariffs are often far too dear.

title: Good flight, good service, "you get what you pay for"
review_text: Nice simple flight, en route to connection for Cape Town. Seating arrangements worked well (ie automatically sat together, which is not true of some airlines!) and reasonable service. The "snack" (served free, along with alcoholic drinks) was a cheese roll. Refused by 80% of the people I saw served - but at least it was free!

title: The advantage of a direct flight
review_text: The most important reason for selecting Swiss is that they had the cheapest direct flight in Business. Service quality is good, but not better than competition. The 2-2-2 seat configuration is less good than some of their competitors which offer direct aisle access to all seats without extra payment. Departure lounge was excellent.

title: Friendly service
review_text:
check-in in BKK was smooth and flying business you get the priority lane for passport and customs control. Flying Swiss Business you can use the Thai lounges, which are nor really great in comparison to other lines' lounges.
Boarding etc. all smooth and on-time, the business seats are comfortable and go down to be flat beds. Unfortunately you cannot adjust the backrest separately, which you can in all other business seats I have flown in; hence not full points for the seat. The movie/tv programme is okay, but the menu rather tedious for choosing what to watch.
Food was okay; the Swiss as well as the Thai stewardess and the chef de cabin were very friendly and it was a pleasure to fly with them.

title: Pleasant trip
review_text: When coming from Paris, we have a stop at Zurich, and just wait for two hours for the second flight. Seats are comfortable if you buy extra length seats. We had a really nice time and no delays. Food was quite good and we appreciated the Swiss chocolate given after each meal.

title: Bad experience from carrier all the way to the service on the plane
review_text:
I am a frequent traveler for the past 20 years and this was once of the worst I can remember.
The plane was old and didn't provide the service you would expect for a 12 hours flight in business class. Food was below any airline standard. Service was reasonable but couldn't cover up for the overall bad experience. In addition the flight started in Tel Aviv to Zurich and Swiss decided to put me on the Israeli airline flight, they took no responsibility and on top of it didn't give me the mileage for my star alliance frequent flyer since the Israeli airline is not part of star alliance group. When I contacted customer service they had no help and just moved me from a person to a person until I gave up. I am doing this route every couple of months and needless to say that I will never use Swiss Airline again

title: Comfort and clockwork.
review_text:
While it's obviously not the case, you get the sense that Swiss is immune from delay or complication.

Obviously, as a European short-haul airline, it's going to get turned over by weather and air traffic delay. but there was something about the aura from online check-in to disembarkation that said they'd thought of everything, organised it, and had in hand preparation for the unexpected.

It made for a comfortable flight that ran like clockwork, with free snacks and drinks.

Same space, legroom, aircraft as most others, it just felt lighter, brighter and more efficient.

title: Cool Simple Efficiency
review_text: As one would expect with Swiss - Calm, cool and efficient. Everything was fine but nothing especially friendly or exciting. The food was fine. The staff were pleasant. We left on time. We arrived more or less on time. Price of ticket was reasonable. The flight was not uncomfortable. Nothing was remarkable. These days this is good and I would fly with them again.

title: Ok for a Cheaper Business Class Option
review_text: My Swiss flight was OK for what you pay for it's Business Service.  On this trip I flew Swiss, Qantas and Cathay and of the three, Swiss would have been my least favorite.  The beds are narrow, half the seats do not have privacy screens and for me I find the Swiss menu a little on the heavy European side.

title: First and last
review_text: Bad service, rude employees, so cold we and the other people in the back seats had to wear our jackets and hats, bad food, dirty toilets, just horrible.

title: One of the best Companies in Europe by far.
review_text:
I'm writing this comment because of some weird comments I saw above.

I always try to travel Swiss what ever happens. My last flight was the GVA - ATH flight where I upgraded myself to business class, but I usually fly economy. The flight in business was obviously amazing but the objective of my review is talking about SWR in general.

Not only the cabin crew are very friendly, but also the pilot and f/o are very nice and passionate about their job. The food is great compare to other airlines. Swiss is usually on time or with acceptable delays.
They consider any of your requests and (while respecting the Swiss tradition perfectly about rules and safety - which I am looking for when flying) they tend to be understandable when possible (for cabin luggage for exemple).

I could not be looking for a better airline when traveling from Switzerland. I'm young and travel often for pleasure and I always try to fly Swiss.

The only reasons that would prevent that is when they have no direct flights from GVA (for exemple GVA - TXL) so I would take EZY to SXF, when an other option is really cheaper (that unfortunately happens to often) or to go to my original town in Spain where my only option is Iberia.

To be travelling with many companies (now "down under" since the beginning of the year, discovering other companies that I never took before), I can def say we are really lucky in Europe, especially with Swiss (from Switzerland at least). Swiss is much better than BAW, IBE, KLM (or KLC), ....

I would consider Air France nowadays (2018) though, they did become a very good airline to travel with for long haul flights and Lufthansa (talking about European companies).

To conclude, Swiss is an awesome company when it comes to my needs when travelling. Good Safety very friendly crew. Food and beverage (wine!) are great. Could need improvement in the entertainment system but the "new" A330 and B777 are amazing. Obviously flying with their new C-Series is a pleasure.  

Cheers,

A.

title: Business is really Fine !
review_text: The Business class of Swiss is really Fine. The food on this flight wasreally good . The bed. is completely flat. And I skeptisch very good !

title: Economy
review_text: There is just not Enlight Space in Economy ! For 10 hours flight . The food and Drinks were regul√§r served and were Fine ,

title: Delay of over one hour due to technical problems
review_text: The aircraft arrived with a delay of over one hour coming from Zurich. Apparently due to technical problems with one of the aircraft wings.... It happened with an Airbus 321. Legroom as usual very limited, same applies to seat comfort. Forget reading a newspaper when the seats to your right and left are occupied. That‚Äòs why it is recommended to take your tablet with you with all stuff downloaded before.... For longier flights I usually book business class but for such a flights the fares are just outrageous! 316 366 021

title: They feed you all the time
review_text: I felt the aircraft was clean. The seats were small but the seatbelt was quite long. There isn‚Äôt enough room between rows, especially if the jerk in front of you wants to fully recline the entire 9 hour flight. The flight attendants need to be more aggressive about telling passengers to sit down so we could take off instead of leaving 40 minutes late. Also, they had no control over the cabin, people were constantly standing in the aisle and constantly walking from one seat to another to talk. They feed you a lot of food and drinks but I agree with another review that the food was salty.

title: Punctual, excellent service
review_text:
I flew return from Tel Aviv to Miami, with a stop both directions in Zurich airport. I was quite concerned about the long flights, as I had spinal fusion surgery 18 months ago. 
The seats on the plane were comfortable, and everyone had a pillow and a blanket, which also helped. The only difficulty regarding comfort was that the aisles are very narrow, so when I wanted to stand for a while, I was obstructing the pathway.
The food was very good, there was plenty of it and it was tasty.
The entertainment system was also good, there were individual screens with a wide range of films and tv shows on offer. The entertainment system turned on before we took off, which was a nice perk.
The toilets were kept clean throughout the flights.
The stewards and stewardesses were very friendly and responsive.
Every one of the four flights left on time, and we actually landed before schedule - this was really helpful on the return, as I was a bit anxious about having only 90 minutes between flights, we landed early so I ended up having 2 hours between flights. We also got off the plane by the same terminal that my connecting flight was leaving from, so I didn't need to run frantically between terminals. 
Zurich airport is really pleasant, there are plenty of shops and eateries available. Plenty of chairs for everyone. For the smokers among us, it's nice that they have smoking rooms dotted throughout the terminals. 
I really can't fault the airline at all and I'd definitely fly with them again.

title: Not the best flight
review_text: This flight had two legs.  The first leg from Montreal to Zurich was alright.  We were in business class and had a bed.  The service was good and the food was decent.  The first problem started in the Zurich airport where we were pointed to a so called Business Lounge which was one of the dirtiest airport lounges I have ever seen.  The carpet was soiled, there was dirt on the walls and furniture.  The next problem was our flight from Zurich to Paris.  Again we had business class tickets but the plane was small and very cramped.  My friend flying with me uses a cane and has a lot of trouble with stairs.  We had asked for assistance at CDG.  We had to disembark on the tarmac , and although there was someone with a wheelchair waiting, she could find no way to enter the airport without stairs.  My friend then had to climb two flights of stairs.  This was certainly no business class flight in my estimation.

title: Great SWISS Air Lines !
review_text:
I fly SWISS since many years and I have been always very happy with their services.
The airport of Zurich is very easy and convenient for international connecting flights.
The SWISS cabine crew are very good. 
I was organizing a group of 23 pax and everybody from my group was happy with SWISS.

title: Have lost my trust in them
review_text:
Upon embarking on another voyage to the USA, I booked my flights on UNITED, with the first leg being operated by SWISS, from Tel-Aviv to Zurich. Since I know how tight their economy class is, and since I have injured my knee recently, I decided to spend the extra money it costs to reserve in advance an extra legroom seat in the front row of economy. SWISS gladly took my money, and I was set for seat 23A. 
During the next two months or so, whenever I checked my booking, it was always seat 23A. Until the moment I logged in to perform my online check in... 
Suddenly my seat is.. 33E! I managed to ‚Äúimprove‚Äù it to 28A, but my seat was taken. To cut a long story short, I had word with SWISS on Facebook, with their office in Israel, with their online check in support in Capetown.. I was talking with people all over the globe, but all could only suggest I try and resolve this at the airport.
The person in Capetown mentioned the seat was reserved for someone else for medical reasons. 
I found it extremely rude to pull one like that on me. They could contact me and try and resolve it politely, but instead they delay the information until it‚Äôs too late to do anything.
When I got to the airport, I was very annoyed. I travel light, no checked bags, so I tend to arrive around 2 hours in advance, zip through security, then to the gate. Now I needed to get there earlier, run around, find the person that might help, she was not very service oriented, putting it mildly, and only after I became assertive, suddenly my seat was free for me to have. Just like that...
This leads me to believe it was no medical reason, just someone getting preferred treatment on my account.

So, SWISS still serve ok food, their FAs are professional, their seats in economy are not for anything longer than 4-4.5 hours, even in the A330. But now I‚Äôve seen a very ugly side of SWISS, and will most likely try and avoid them, because they breached our agreement and lost my confidence.

title: Nice Change
review_text: Flew with Swiss on a recent trip to Switzerland. Good quality service, fast check in, complimentary snacks & drinks, free ski carriage. Nice touch to have a small swiss chocolate bar handed out. No delays. It was a nice change.

title: Excellent service comfortable plane...just what one needs on a 12 hour flight
review_text: Enjoyed the plane and crew.  Always attentive and keeping you comfortable. Ive flown on this plane previously my only criticism was that the plane was too warm.  I did ask if they could do something and shortly after the temperature dropped to a pleasent level.

title: Old Airplane
review_text: The seats are very slim. We had the seat with leg freedom for CHF 100.00 more each flight which was great. But the seat is very slim, I know I have a few kilos too much but I could hardly fit myself in the seat comfortably and there was no room left or right. And there was hardly any room to enjoy the food when the table was pulled up in front of my stomach. My friend which is very slim also thought that the seats are very slim. I think SWISS should take this old airplanes out of the active duty and replace them with newer models.

title: The worst flight experience in my life.
review_text:
It was a long story I cannot write all details here, I wasted around 1000 euros all created by the actions of their station staffs and customer service who is evidently poorly trained.

Though, I paid upgrade business for my 2nd-leg flight(ZEH-PEK, 10hrs), the interiors are so old and tattered, dirty carpet, overlaid veneer under screen was broken half, the door of life jacket case broken too, made noise for the whole trip because of vibration during flight. 
Meals are horrible too, every main meal is salty, super salty.

Honestly this is the worst trip in my life, I paid a lot of money and deserve nothing. I will never, ever choose this Swiss airline in the future.

title: Outstanding service and comfort
review_text: Outstanding service on this evening flight was the best ending for a busy day. The cabin crew were caring and efficient, even with the little details. The acoustics were super. Low noise in the cabin and perfectly clear announcements. Seats were A+ for comfort. Still have to work on the food offerings though.

title: Comfort
review_text: First of all, and airline that hands out complimentary chocolate on all its flights has to be doing something right. We found the service and food to be far better than what we have experienced on US air carriers. I think the airbus is also a much more comfortable air ship. The flight crew was courteous, professional, and efficient. I would recommend Swiss Air without hesitation.

title: Excellent Flight, Courteous service
review_text: Excellent flight, on time going to Zurich and return flight arrived one hour early to chicago. Food decent, they could do better on the entertainment choice in economy class. Not too many movies to chose from.

title: First time FIRST CLASS
review_text: It was a really great experience and for me the 10cm (lenght of the bed) made a biiiiig difference to business, what we normally fly. The service was excellent, the food was excellent and really much things to choose, the drinks were also from a great quality and enough to choose, and also the private contact from the stuff (smalltalk and real interess) came from heart, they love their job and the passengers can feel that. It was the first time we (6 friends from our comany Swiss Shape) flew First Class and it was really exciting, to receive a own sleeping-dress, also like everything we received (food and tools) was SWISS QUALITY ;) - THANK YOU SWISS FOR THAT GREAT TRIP!

title: Excellent flight
review_text: I had an amazing flight coming back home from Zurich, the Aircraft was a Bombardier CS300, the first that swiss air received, the plane was simply amazing. Super comfortable, the noise in the cabin was below the average in a small body airplane. The service of the crew was absolutely fantastic, very kind and efficient, the food was better tham any other I have ever tried on a plane. Can‚Äôt wait to fly once again with Swiss Air

title: Excellent
review_text: One of the best airlines I've traveled, by far. The comfort during the flight and the good service on board stand out.

title: Amazing service, on time almost all the time, the best airline for skiers
review_text: Every year we fly to Europe to ski, no matter what country (Switzerland, Italy or Austria) we only fly Swiss. Not only they have very good service, their luggage allowance for skiers in second to none. Highly recommend!

title: Good flight, excellent service.
review_text: The flight was rather good, leg space is comparable to Lufthansa. Flight attendants were really nice (my colleague was given whisky from business class when it ended up in economic). The only problem I had was the lack of English subtitles in american movies. I use it to better understand the dialogues (and what about the people with hearing disability?). Altogether it was a pleasant flight.

title: Nice Business Class seat
review_text: The seats on this Swiss air were nice and clean. A little tight. Staff was friendly and smiling. The food was cold and the steak was very chewy. Overall very good flight and the airplane was clean and new. I prefer the Air France seat configuration in Business and First Class. But this was by far better than British Airways.

title: Complete OCD
review_text: Swiss are undoubtedly the most tedious short-haul airline I have ever flown with. I have flown with them several times (I am trying to avoid them but needs must when you need to get to Switzerland sometimes, unfortunately), and what you must know is that they have an obsession, and I mean total, ridiculous obsession, with your carry on luggage. At the gate their staff are equipped with hand scales and they wander round looking for people to hassle about the size of their carry on luggage. I was able to fit my cabin bag (designed by Samsonite to meet airline standards) into the doohickey designed to measure whether it is an acceptable size, but the SwissAir employee told me that I had to put it into the hold because it did not go in frictionlessly (and it has happened 3 or 4 times). OCD does not even begin to describe it...they‚Äôre petty, bloody-minded and unfriendly in the way that only they can be. They keep telling everyone that it is for ‚Äúyour safety‚Äù but in truth I feel they just enjoy being fastidiously silly and bullying. Aside from that, their cabin crews are also an unfriendly lot, their flights are often delayed, and they stick you in the back of the plane no matter what you try to book (and my flights are usually the highest cost category). I am a business traveller trying to get to Switzerland with my cabin sized luggage...I really don‚Äôt need the hassle of flying with an unfriendly, late airline that is obsessed with taking my luggage off me to store in the hold. Avoid if possible.

title: Naughty and arrogant ground staff
review_text:
naughty and arrogant ground staff. I had probably the smallest luggage with me in comparison with other people at this flight. I was forced to leave the luggage and had to held my laptop during the flight in my arms.
In the future I will book only Lufthansa or Austrian. Here the staff still has manners.

title: Very good service and smooth flight
review_text: We flew from Zurich to Miami Intl Airport for our honeymoon in November 2011. Although I have to admit I was terrified due to the long flight time (10.5 h), it was a pleasant experience and the service was very good. I was pregnant at this time and they took really good care of me. The food was good, too and I felt in good hands with the Swiss Airline.

title: Nice flight
review_text: Always a pleasure flying with Swiss, since they offer a good service, punctuality and without worries.

title: Stuck because employees lack compassion or common sense
review_text:
Terrible customer orientation.  I was on a flight connecting through Zurich to Boston.  My inbound flight was late.  However, I sprinted to the gate and made it while the plane was still there and while the door was still open for boarding.  When I arrived, the gate attendants refused to let me board.  At first, they told me that the door was closed.  However, this was shown to be false because someone else boarded the plane 10 min after I arrived at the gate.  Then they told me that they had automatically rebooked me and that I had no choice but to stay in Zurich overnight and take a flight the next day.  

My seat on the flight was still empty, I had not checked any luggage, and if they "rebooked" me once, rather than rebooking me back onto the flight, they spent 15 total min arguing with me about why I would not be allowed on the flight.

If you've traveled extensively internationally, you would have been as outraged as I was at the sheer lack of any ... common sense? Compassion? Ability to think on the spot?  The word that came to my mind as I spoke with the gate agent was "close-minded" (there were other choice words that came to mind).  There was no reason  for me to miss 1 extra night away from my family.

To top it off, I contacted customer service.  They took 2 weeks to "respond" and basically told me "whatever, it's not our problem."

Avoid SwissAir (I know that I have).  The absolute worst airline, the worst customer service.  I sincerely hope the airline goes bankrupt.  I even more sincerely hope that one day these customer "service" people end up in a similar situation as mine and get treated exactly as they treated me.

title: Just OK
review_text:
Departure airport is very nice and well organized.
Flight has been smooth.

Good service.
Meal not so good.
Economy seat entertainment is a bit old and they have NOT USB charge possibility.
Aircraft is old

title: Bunch of Cretins
review_text:
Absolutely appalled at the experience I had with Swiss Air - in the air and afterwards.

Below is a complaint I sent to Swiss Air a month ago which they have not bothered to address. These losers don‚Äôt care about repeat customers. 

On Friday 23 February my partner and I flew Swiss air to Singapore via Zurich, from Amsterdam.

This was our first time on Swiss Air, and given the experience we had will likely be our last.

Firstly the flight to Zurich was significantly delayed however our connecting flight was held waiting for us. We ran from terminal A to terminal E - a significant journey which left us sitting wet and sweaty for the duration of the flight to Singapore - not a great feeling.

When we arrived at the gate, a staff member crudely remarked that it was lucky we ran because they were just about to leave without us. The massive issue I have with this remark is the fact the delay was in no way our fault, and there was no assistance by Swiss Air to assist us in the significant journey from one end of Zurich airport to the other. In fact, when I mentioned we were on a connecting flight to the air hostess on the first flight she said to us that it was out of her control - there was no effort whatsoever to call us off the plane first. We waited close to 10 minutes for 20 rows of people to get off the plane before we could.

The second issue we faced was we explicitly asked the gate staff of the second flight if the bags from our flight had been transferred and loaded on to the plane, we were told "yes, of course". This was a lie as when we arrived in Auckland a day later - our bags were still sitting at Zurich airport. Not to mention how this has greatly affected my partner and I in regards to work clothing, toiletries, make up, we now know we were lied to by a member of staff.

Thirdly, when we arrived on the plane - dripping with sweat and puffing, we asked the air hostess if we could please have a small drink of water. To which she replied that she could not give out any drinks until the plane had taken off - we had to wait an uncomfortable 30 minutes for a drink of water. A small consideration could have been made we believe, given the huge effort made on our part to get on this flight - a delay which was not of our doing.

This same air hostess ignored us twice while doing the drinks rounds, and we ended up calling another air hostess to provide us with additional glasses of water.

This was not a great impression for us of Swiss Air, and we still feel very uncomfortable with the situation we found ourselves in.

title: Excellent Service, Comfortable Seats
review_text: Really surprised and impressed with our flight. Very comfortable seats, friendly and good service, tasty food...and all of this on a flight! Way better than any North American airline we've flown lately. What a nice surprise!

title: Happy to fly
review_text:
Swiss has done a good job on flying me to Miami.
The plane was in a decent age, clean and modern equipped even with mood lightning. 
The food was delicious for Eco but the portions are way to small. Also with alcoholic beverages this company seems quite greedy.
IFE if good for an 11 H flight. There were no delays and all has been in order. 
Generally speaking its a good feeling to fly with them.

title: Very pleasant flight
review_text: Our flight with Swiss from Zurich to Miami was very good. No turbulences and service on board under Maitre de Cabin Mrs. Freiermuth was perfect. I would like Swiss to replace the A330 with B777 but the service and the entire flight was great.

title: Fly with no hassle
review_text: I have travelled with this airline a number of times.  Friendly crew, good service, light refreshments served according to time of day free, comfortable seats - what more could you ask for.

title: Second leg of journey
review_text:
After a disappointing first leg the second leg or the journey from Zurich to Malaga was even more of a squeeze, very little space for 3 in a row and small amounts of legroom.

I also hand my seat changed without me requesting it so I ended up in the first row behind business class with the annoying curtain swinging in your face and making it claustrophobic.

Very disappointed overall with Swiss Air apart from the baggage going straight through from the first leg to arrival back home.

title: Reasonable
review_text:
I fly a lot for business and experience all airlines my first journey with Swiss Air was a bit of a let down.

I am 6ft 3 and struggled with the legroom, just as well it was only a 40 minute flight.

The coffee was OK and the service of luggage right through to destination was perfect, did not worry about anything from that perspective.

Comfort was the only real disappointment.

title: Great flight but old plane
review_text:
It's so nice being able to check in at the Swiss counter in Zurich.  The service is friendly, fast and without hassle.

The flight attendants were courteous and very helpful in finding spots for the carry-ons on this very full flight. I was happily surprised to even have a meal served on this short leg of my trip. 
It must have been quite an old plane as the even smaller than normal washroom showed definite signs of overuse and the by-fold doors were so stiff I had to use my whole force to open and close them.  But at least it was nice and clean.  I have flown with Swiss before and have been satisfied. But if given the chance to choose between Swiss and Edelweiss,  I would always choose Edelweiss!

title: Nice as always
review_text: Flight was nice, crew very friendly as always with Swiss. Even the price was quite fair compared to the quality of service, most probably due to the high competition on this route. Food was good but nothing special (sandwich). On Time. Recommended.

title: worst seats ever experienced
review_text: Cramming us economy passengers in worse than ever.  Food average at best.  Service fine.  First time flying this airline.

title: Cancelled flight
review_text: The original flight was cancelled within 2 hours of departure (08:00am), then rebooked to a different flight from a different airport 2 1/2 hours drive from it, i lost my connection flight, the 2nd flight was delayed, my connection flight was delayed as well, in total i lost my whole day of at the airports as i got to my final destination almost at 18:30 pm. The airline refused the lawful compensation under EU law. They not even apologised for the inconvenience done, they just didn‚Äôt care... I advise not to use this airline as they treat the costumer like nothing.

title: Not too bad
review_text:
Swiss International Air Lines is a little bit higher than the low average level of most part of the European Airline Companies.
Space for legs is wider than expected, quality of food is decent and the staff is friendly. Even small things, but unfortunately missing in most part of the European Airline Companies.  At the end it is not too bad, and probably I'll choose them again.

title: Never again on a long flight in Economy
review_text: I booked this flight because it was the only direct nonstop on this route but regretted it. My employer wouldn‚Äôt allow Business Class and Swiss doesn‚Äôt offer a Premium Economy type of product. Eleven hours is definitely too much for this type of seating, I really wished I had flown via Frankfurt or Milan on another airline and traded length of trip for more comfort inflight. Service was friendly, food was ok as were the inflight movies. I no longer live in Switzerland and would book Swiss only if it‚Äôs the most convenient and least expensive option - on short flights.

title: Straight forward and efficient, no more, no less
review_text:
Night flight, no amenities given so I was happy I brought my sleeping mask. Not the greatest legroom, ok inflight entertainment. Airline breakfasts are rarely good and this one was as standard as they get, i.e. roll, squishy croissant, yoghurt. I‚Äôm not sure it included the usual ice cold cut fruit. Service was ok in that it was efficient.
Luggage delivery in Zurich was speedy, even special luggage which was not only fast but delivered carefully (I brought my friend‚Äôs two cats).
Decision for this airline was based on the charges for the cats being much lower than on Emirates and I got a good deal on my ticket.

title: Economy Class tight seating
review_text: I recently returned from a trip to Europe on SwissAir. At 5' 10", 170 lbs., I consider myself to be of average height and weight. Leg room was marginal at best; when the seat in front of me was reclined, I had little room to even wiggle. Seat width was far too narrow, as my shoulders were literally pressed between the window and the passenger in the middle seat (also average sized male). In order to get into the aisle, both aisle and middle passengers had to completely move from their seats to allow me access. I remember a time when I could just step past them...that was also when I could sit comfortably in my seat without feeling like a canned sardine. This is the new norm for airlines--they cram as many seats as possible and reduce the number of flights so they can book to capacity, regardless of the sacrifice to passenger comfort. It is the world in which we live, so there is not much one can do about it, other than paying for all the "extras" which used to be standard. I can only suggest that one researches seat and leg room as part of the criteria for determining an airline. Though price is usually the determining factor, it isn't a bad idea to pay a little bit more for comfort and service...again, which has declined on almost every major airline that I've flown, both domestically and internationally. After adding the additional "options," most flights increase by an average of 25-30%. Bare-bones fares don't offer much, but I at least expect quality service, not halfa-ssed service along with an apathetic attitude by the flight attendants, who are well aware of the changes to airplanes, but don't have the time to provide sympathy toward the many passengers who experience the lack of comfort. Of course, this should not be their job; therefore, corporate executives need to re-assess their business model(s) and consider offering an alluring experience to outshine the competition. It appears that they are all in accord with the fact that people are going to put up with the concessions if they want to continue to travel; hence they really don't give a rat' sass about anything more than the bottom line. To this, I raise my middle finger as a salute.

title: Only Average First Class
review_text: Arriving in Z√ºrich with short Connection to Beijing there was no special service although travelling in First Class. I had to go the regular transfer into Terminal E then realizing that boarding was delayed but not long enough to wait in the Lounge. When boarding started, the First Class was not ready yet, so the First passengers had to wait the longest and board the last. On board there is enough space but somehow the service was only second class. The lunch took very long, although I told them I would like to get it quicker to get more sleep. But finally I skipped the desert as it would have taken another hour or so and got to sleep. Compared to the other First class passengers however, my bed was then made to get me some sleep to arrive somewhat relaxed the next day. Quality of food for dinner was first class however, so was the breakfast. But having only one small toilet in first class is no luxuary either and not standard any more in this class.

title: 1st class service with free swiss chocolates
review_text:
when travelling with kids every little bit of help is a huge help.
The swiss staff assistance services were there to direct us and assist with baggage.
offered free swiss chocolates which was to say the least divine.

we had comfortable seats with onboard entertainment that catered for all.
kids had toys and puzzle and kids meal which they enjoyed.
i must say for a short flight i expected maybe just a little sandwich.but we got a good sandwich with extras crackers and cheese and energy bars and more chocolate

title: Good member of Star Alliance family
review_text: Nice quality service. Friendly cabin crew. Great wine. Tasty milk chocolate (better than Lufthansa one).

title: Comfortable seats in Business
review_text:
The seats in business class almost rival those on the best airline I‚Äôve recently traveled on, Japan Air. And the service from the attendants was excellent: smiling, attentive and courteous. The selection of movies is merely ok. The food was above average in taste, with the Swiss cheese taking the honors. But something I ate did not agree with me and caused part of my journey to be troublesome.

I was dismayed to be awakened by a very polite flight attendant who informed me that I had to get prior permission to use my small CPAP machine on the flight. He offered to try to get permission for me, but I declined as I didn‚Äôt expect I‚Äôd be able to fall sleep again. The rule strikes me as stupid, but I guess this is to be expected on an airline that is run with such precision. 

Declining food and with permission to use the CPAP, I‚Äôd not hesitate to fly Swiss again.

title: Reliable, Punctual, Improving Service and Good Value.
review_text:
We travel with Swiss in Business on-average twice a year, for the last 35 years
You can set your watch by their punctuality - in fact, I cannot remember ever being delayed.
Business Class is very good in comparison to other airlines, but not exceptional (like Singapore or Emirates).  However fares are cheaper, which makes it very good value.
Entertainment system is very good, but the Music selections have slipped recently.
The lounges in Zurich are great.
We have noticed a major improvement in service this year.  The flight attendants smile more than ever and are more engaging.
Thumbs up !

title: Never again!
review_text: All lunch flights cancelled through out the week, but BA flew. No service per phone in Britain, had to call Switzerand.Waited 15 min. just to speak to someone. Wrong information!! Called again, same thing and finally had to travel to Heathrow to leave 6 hours too late. Just one big bother.

title: Is Swiss loosing it?
review_text:
All things considering (especially the weather conditions on 1, 2 and 3 March) one may still expect airlines to cope with special circumstances better than Swiss did on 4 March (when weather conditions were back to normal, but Geneva airport, with its under-capacity and only one runway, was obviously overstretched. My 15:45 flight to Zurich finally took off at 18:30 (boarding at 17:00) and it would have been better if Swiss had rebooked me on the next days earliest flight with  connection to Amsterdam .. as it was now, I missed my connection and had to stay overnight at an airport hotel in Zurich.  Leaving all this to the side, I observed that:
1. we spent an hour at the tarmac before take off and it did not occur to the crew to at least offer drinks.
2. there was no information on connecting flights prior to landing and the ground staff announced by the cabin crew to be at the gate was not there.
3. the fate of my checked in luggage was nebulous until I was told to look for it myself on some carts where stored luggage had been collected.
There should be protocols to deal with these situations better than Swiss did yesterday.

title: My first time with Swiss -pretty good
review_text: I flew on LX391 Manchester to Zurich and changed there to LX8 for flight to Chicago. Because of weather delays flight was a little late which made it tight in Zurich but I made the onward flight. It was my first time on this airline and the service was good.  Alcoholic beverages are served in Economy on the short leg as well as the Transatlantic flight. Service was good - I will definitely fly them again.

title: Nowhere near good enough
review_text:
This was my first Swiss Air flight and I was travelling in Business Class.  The end to end experience was nowhere good enough, the experience very much reminded me of why the flagship carriers in europe are struggling to keep pace with the market demand.  I left the flight feeling that it was the best Economy class service I could remember, the only problem was that I had flown Business class.  

The seat was uncomfortable, the bedding was thin and did not keep me warm, the pillow was flat and offered no support.  The food was disgraceful, the evening meal was served in an odd manner, starter was delivered with desert.  The salad dressing was frozen and the olive oil was congealed, the salad was going brown and the cheese was dry and stale.  The main course was underwhelming but was edible.  The breakfast reminded me of a short haul business class flight in europe - I left the flight feeling quite hungry to be honest.

The buttons to control the seat were positioned right under my elbow on the armrest and were flush, so on several occasions I accidently placed my arm on the buttons and the seat lunged to adjust.  It seems like a silly design error

The staff were friendly but certainly lacked polish and professionalism.
