I strongly implore someone in Swiss Air to do some market research on your competition - buy some flights with carriers like Singapore Airlines, Emirates, Qantas and even British Airways etc and take some flights.  It is evident that you need to experience what your competition is offering.

title: Great flight with Swiss hospitality...
review_text:
I am a frequent traveler and fly over 300.000 miles a year. In Europe I always try to fly Swiss, Lufthansa or Austrian.
Out of all three, Swiss has the most personalized and graceful service.
The food is also tasty and the choice of wines as well. The screens are very large and the seat/bed extremely comfortable with a real duvet and normal size pillow.
Definitely my first choice for European airlines for long haul flights.

title: Best 1st. class the air.
review_text:
Excellent flight.
Private transfer to terminal E via exclusive customs.
On board Swiss First is a class of its own.
It may not have the bling but it has class.
It was fish speciality.
I did not try it but it looked fantastic.
Just a shame they dont. value customers from the French speaking region.

title: Stay Away
review_text:
STAY AWAY FROM SWISS AIRLINES.

You have been warned. Never had such disrespect in my life. Cancelled flight without an explanation. Wait time 40 mins each time you call. They put me on hold to find an alternative flight and then hang up. Been on the phone for 5 hrs already.

title: Hand-luggage Chaos
review_text: I flew from Zurich to Athens. The flight had an initial 30min delay.  I was surprised by the chaos that ensued with the hand-luggage situation at the boarding. The limited storage space made the boarding rather slow and when it became full, suitcased had to be taken away by the flight attendants, causing more delay. The rest of the flight was fine and the food was okay. It is great that Swiss will carry your ski/snowboard for free.

title: Consistent and attentive service
review_text:
I've been criss-crossing the Atlantic on Swiss for years now and have come to appreciate its consistent and attentive service. As some other traveller correctly pointed out, Swiss crew makes you feel welcome. In this day and age this is quite an achievement, IMHO. Kudos to Swiss!
The hard product is certainly not world class but OK in both Economy and Business. Swiss' long-haul fleet is relatively young, especially if compared with decrepit US carriers' fleets. Made exception for a few remaining old Airbuses 340, Swiss operates a mix of 8-year old Airbuses 330-300 and a dozen brand new B777-300ER. A solid choice and generally good value for money.

title: A matter of luck!
review_text:
As it is now a days, it is obviously a matter of luck, when one flyes! This time I was lucky. All went well and without any problems. The time of the day is of course a big issue to make a good start. With immigration, security and all the prelimery procedures one is often so stressed, that flying can be a very stressing business.
Not so this time. All went well, efficient and on time. The plane was full, the crew however very friendly, motivated and helpfull. 
There is one thing I often question, which is the food offered even on short flights. Is it really necessary and if the question is yes, why does it have to be consisting of mostly convinience? I would very much appreciate an small array of moist finger sandwiches,
as served for high tea. Other than that the flight was perfect and I could only wish, that it remains like this.

title: I felt like a welcome guest rather than a passenger!
review_text: This was my first flight on Swiss - I flew Swissair many times in the past but have not had the opportunity to fly Swiss in the last few years.  I was very pleasantly surprised with the onboard service, the can-do attitude of the flight crew, and the comfort of the seat.  I will be more then happy to fly them again.  It was as if I were flying back 30 or 40 years ago when flying was fun!

title: The way things used to be.
review_text: The flight experience was exceptional from check in to landing.  I haven't been on a Swiss Air flight for many years but if this was typical of the way they treat their customers I will go out of my way to try to fly with them again.  The check in agent was very pleasant and helpful.  The flight attendants were wonderful.  They actually seemed to like their jobs, they were very attentive and kept coming by to see if they could do anything else. That's the type of service I expect in business class which I sometimes experience, but rarely do you see it in economy.  The food service was better than I've experienced in some time.  I can't recall having ice cream for dessert on an airline before.  The earphones left on the seat before you even get there, the chocolates after the meal, these are the little extras that customers appreciate.  The weather in Montreal was very stormy when we arrived but the landing was very smooth and once we landed an announcement was made about connecting flights that was very helpful.  Due to weather delays the flight was 10 1/2 hours long but the entire experience was pleasant from start to finish.  I even enjoyed watching one of the movies available on the entertainment system even though it was in German with English subtitles.

title: 40 minutes flight
review_text: Quick 40 minutes flight Zurich to Venice. Left on time. Flew on the CSeries aircraft, which was great. Drinks were served by the courteous cabin crew. All in all good experience.

title: Excellent Service!
review_text: Swiss airlines does it right. Very efficient, the best business class trip we've ever taken. Very comfortable and on time. The staff are very friendly and efficient. Would definitely fly with them again. Thank you!!

title: Better than usual economy.
review_text:
This was my first time flying with this airline but my husband and daughter's second time. 
Economy was empty and we each had a row to line across and catch some sleep. 

Entertainment was great I watched 4 films.

The food was of a good quality and we ate healthy on the way over as my daughter was on her way to compete.

I especially liked the bathroom as it was so clean with facial spray freshener and hand moisturiser.

I would definitely recommend this airline and am hoping that the return flight is also empty so I can catch some sleep on the way home. First class sand business were rammed and technically had less space than us as a result.

title: Reliable airline
review_text: The airline is reliable. If flying coach class, don‚Äôt upgrade for extra leg room. It is uncomfortable for a long trip. I upgraded for extra leg room and was very uncomfortable. There was nothing in front of us so no where to put your personal belongings. The seat wasn‚Äôt comfortable at all. I traded in my extra leg room seat when returning. Good food and flight attendants were attentive.

title: Comfortable and on time
review_text:
I travel a lot with Swiss between London & Zurich.
They are usually very punctual and the staff are always friendly.
They serve a sandwich and drinks on these flights which is  more than most airlines and you get a chocolate as well!
My only criticism is I cannot seem to check in until 22 hours before the flight.
As I normally fly in the evening, I end up checking in the morning before the flight and have  very limited choice of seats.
A small price really

title: Great Hardware and Service
review_text: Overall Swiss (LX) exceeded my expectations by far. The seat was very comfortable and spacious and the service throughout the flight was impeccable. I've been flying mostly Asian carriers (CX, SQ and TG) for the past years and was skeptical flying anything else, but Swiss delivered.

title: Just what you'd expect of a Swiss brand.
review_text:
The aircraft (a Bombardier) looked brand new and I liked it, compared with the usual Boeing /Airbus choices, very comfortable and quiet.

Food and beverage included in the fare.  Hooray!  And the traditional chocolate.  Top marks for being different.

This was a dki flight for us and checking in Skis in Geneva on the way back home was an absolute b****y nightmare.  Had to queue (and queue and queue) to go to the desk to get a tag, whereas everything else was self service and very easy.

GVA was heaving with people.  Nightmare.  Be prepared to Queue and queue for a long time.

It's good that skis are free to carry, but not easy to check in.

Great service in a nice jet, but forget the skis.

title: Came through for us
review_text: due to problems in Amsterdam, we had to leave from Zurich rather than Basel. We were given the last seats available and were apprehensive about the flight. The 13 hours in the air were made easier by the accommodations, which not luxurious, were relatively comfortable. The air crew was exceptionally helpful and readily available. Even sleeping was not a great problem.

title: Good experience but nothing special
review_text: Good experience but nothing special. We took the flight from Manchester to Athens via Zurich. The breakfast was only a croissant and coffee. The lunch was cold dish and generally the portions very small. The white wine was good. The wc very small and difficult to manage!

title: Long haul from Shanghai to Zurich then onto Manchester
review_text: It's the first time i have flown with Swiss air. I usually travel back to the UK once a year as I have school holidays as a teacher. I thought the cabin crew were really friendly and the entertainment system and food provided were excellent. The only problem i had was with my headphones as the connection was faulty and I had to move seats. As I had booked an aisle seat and with long legs I had to move into a spare chair in the middle of the plane. Everything else about the flight was good and we arrived in good time.

title: Better than last time but still nothing special ....
review_text: Well I upgraded them from poor.  Because at least this time the staff weren't barking.  This was only a 3 hour flight and as I wasn't in the bulkhead row, it was more comfortable than my previous flight with them.  But it still wasn't great.  But it was on time and uneventful, both of which are good when it comes to flights.  The entertainment selection wasn't good but at least there was one.  They served one meal, which was ok, but surprisingly there was no choice.  Well I guess there was - take it or leave it.  And I wasn't near the back, so it wasn't like they had run out of both options.   Nothing else to say - they got me and my luggage from A to B.

title: Never to use this Airline
review_text: I cannot tell how much I was cheated and disappointed by this airline, My misery was when I made a trip Cairo Barcelona via Zurich on the 28th of January. I was supposed to get to Zurich and get connected to BCN, I get to Zurich the connection left without me, don't ask why? anyway due that I lost an important meeting, I get to Barcelona at night, to discover that my suitcase is missing, or should I say stolen. they ask me to wait and wait, pls make a claim, contact us later etc.... and till now, and after more than 3 weeks nothing. By the way their planes are awful, chairs are awful, plastic cutlery, cold food from the fridge. this is by far the worst airline I have ever used in my life, don't fall for their name and the reputation thing they are trying to pull the legs of innocent customers. Other airlines are much better

title: Pleasant Jurney
review_text: From booking the flight to arriving at Z√ºrich Airport in Switzerland using Swiss Air was a pleasant experience. I had a little concern though as I could only do the on-line check in and down-loading of the boarding pass 23 hours before the flight. I am used from other airlines to be able to do the on-line check in well in advance of the flight date but now that I know how Swiss Air works I would recommend them for their overall service.

title: 4 hours trip
review_text: Comfortable seat for a small Airbus A321. Small meal with warm hot quiche. The flight attendants passed twice with the drink trolley. I was thursty the last hour of the flight and walked back to the galley to ask for some water. Very small and poor toilets in the back!

title: Superb customer service
review_text: First time flying Swiss International Air Lines, and boys oh boys they are a step above the norm, easy, user-friendly. great seats not cramped, you are offered light refreshments, and a snack, which was most welcomed as it was a very early flight, and just before we landed we were presented with swiss chocolate which was very nice indeed. The staff were very friendly and I  have to say next time I am flying I'll have a look at Swiss International Air Lines. ~ "Thank you"

title: Business trip
review_text:
The aircraft was clean the service was excellent. My problem is about the booking procedure: I wasn't able to buy a ticket on the website of Swiss... After I wrote a message they send me exactly the same form to fill up which I have already sent them. It was awful and I had to buy the tickets by using another website (and spend +10.000 HUF).

After all the flight went well, the on board service was above the average. I hope they can find a solution for the web-payment.

title: New B-777: Uncomfortable Chicken Coop
review_text:
The new Swiss Boing 777 is horrible in the Economy class!!! There is no space at all. As a normal European man (175cm with 70 Kilos) the risk to get a blood circulation disorder is at 99%. 
If you‚Äòre unlucky enough and your front neighbour reclines his chair, you‚Äòre probably more comfortable in an air animal cage!
Never again, it‚Äòs a shame for the Swiss Airlines!

title: Old old old
review_text: The plane was old, dirty, cramped. The seats weren‚Äôt comfortable. The TVs were so useless that I tried for 2 minutes but the image was so bad, so I just played games on my phone instead. I think the airline needs to renovate old planes if they plan to use them still. Also, business class didn‚Äôt look appealing at all. If I had paid for that ticket, I would have been very mad. The one plus I will give them is that the food was pretty good! Overall, it was not a pleasant experience. Sorry Swiss, but update your planes!

title: Exelent air line!
review_text: This is a great air line. The food is good and you can always choose 2 types of meals (with meat or with out meat). Also I love the chocolate bars that they give at the end of the flight. The service is very good.

title: Always top marks
review_text: I fly quite often with Swiss air and I am never disappointed with the quality of customer service. While the flights from Zurich to London and vice versa are rather short, you will always have on board snacks and drinks. Toilets are clean and the crew is always pleasant. I have swapped to other airlines only to come back to Swiss air.

title: little less than expected
review_text:
when planning to go to Zurich it naturally comes to one's mind that swiss air would be a good choice, considering the standard and image of everything that's swiss. but unfortunately, that's not so. after flying in Qatar Airways and Emirates several times I thought the Swiss airplanes would be a better experience but I was disappointed. it was a small and congested plane, there was no in-flight entertainment and they don't have veg food! what else does a person want in a plane?
however, the two stars that I gave is for good and friendly staff and the Swiss chocolates that they gave during the flight! but I wonder if that was because of Christmas or do they offer it on regular basis...?

title: No inflight entertainment!
review_text:
My head phones socket was faulty so the inflght entertainment system could not be used. This was really disappointing for a long, long 13 hour flight.
The crew could not help except offer me one small box of the cheaper brand Swiss chocolates.
So, I thought, this is the value Swiss Air put on the inflght entertaiment for 13 hours in Business Class.
Very poor!
So try your head phones socket before you settle in .. if you intend to use them.
It's goodbye Swiss Air for us,we are  off to an airline who cares.

title: Not what it was anymore
review_text:
Flight via Zurich and Singapore; all on time, seats as booked; all ok but not outstanding and seats are not as comfortable as Sing airlines (at least for me).
And, would prefer A380 on the long leg.
Food ok, staff ok, no real shortcomings, still, just remember it as 'somewhat more outstanding many years ago.

title: Very Bad experience
review_text:
Very bad. Was standing in the que after immigration for final boarding and all of a sudden staff came and took the SMALL (About 5kg) from my daughter and gave a bag ticket to be collected at the final destination. Was very rude as did not even ask or inform us and why us of all the people. Had medicines and other important things that was required for the long flight but when approached to the duty manager was advise accept it or leave it. Have never been treated so badly and am a frequent flyer. This time was on a world tour - infact Air China that I had opted for the other part of our journey in comparison was 5 star. AVOID SWISS AIR. I felt was discriminated for our skin color. Will not advise to anyone unless want to be humiliated.  The official complaint that we emailed was responded after 6 to 7 weeks and that too was not sorry. 

I understand that sometime action has to be taken but their is a proper procedure for it and not rudely - our way or highway.

Will be interesting to see how swiss air respond or WILL they ?

title: Shame about lack of commuincation.
review_text:
As I like to save money I went from Heathrow to Hurghada Egypt via Zurich with Swiss and there sister Edelweiss . This is a review for Heathrow to Zurich and reverse .

You get given a large cheese roll and drinks on the short service which is nice as the price is included with ticket.

However my issue is with the fact that we were left at Zurich airport with no explaination . With my own investigation I found out that it was due to both French air traffic control strike and 70mph winds in  London. When we boarded the flight it was a smaller aircraft so no hand luggage for me and some others, Seating plan out of the door so I was sat right at the back with two gentlemen blocking my way . The noise was really loud . I always book aisle due to my mental health problem as I get panicky.

title: Great Servicd
review_text: We had a very pleasant flight with Swiss. Service was excellent and the quality of the plane was nice.

title: Consistently good service
review_text: Swiss is one of last few European airlines, which is not charging for food while still maintaining competitive prices. You have a cheese roll, wine and a chocolate served with a smile. What not to like for a short flight? City airport is so easy and Zurich is fast too. Why go BA? I see no reason.

title: A smiley service
review_text: Flew for business. Flight on time, good bag allowance at 23 kg, Crew were excellent  Plane modern, clean and spacious for economy seating. entertainment range can be wider but all and all enjoyable and would use again.

title: Great service
review_text:
Flew with family LCY GVA for ski trip on Embraer 190. LCY very easy airport to use. Flight on time, good bag allowance at 23 kg, paid for pre booked seats. Also a bottle of champagne pre ordered on website for in flight consumption. Crew were excellent and kept filling our glasses from the galley and gave us a bottle to take with us to enjoy at resort. Had a good laugh with them. 
Plane modern, clean and spacious for economy seating. Enjoyable and would use again.

title: Mostly, I hated where the tv controller was located.
review_text:
The airline is fine.  We flew a 1 hour flight from Dubai to Muscat with them,  So we were ok for a long haul.  The plane is comfortable but tight in the middle rows.  Mostly the location of the entertainment control,  Infuriated me.  It was in the armrest,  So to use it you had to move the other persons arm to get to it.
The food was good, and seats ok.  1 flight  ZRH to ORD was much better than BOM to ZRH.
However, for what we paid, less than 650 rt  I can not complain at all.

title: Good.
review_text: Decent flight with fair service. It was not easy to compete with the excellent service of Tap Portugal (in previouse flight) but it was O.K.

title: What a fantastic airline
review_text:
We flew Manchester to Rome recently via Zurich with Swiss Air. A fantastic experience from start to finish!! The planes were immaculate. The crew both impeccably turned out and very efficient and approachable. I was impressed with the tasty Swiss snacks that we were offered whilst on board , a free beverage and of course the essential Swiss chocolate before landing! The landings were the smoothest I have ever experienced and it was lovely to meet the captain at the end of the flight who lined up with the stewardesses to say goodbye!!
Will definitely choose them again!!!!

title: Swiss a Pleasant Way to Travel
review_text:
Very efficient and professional service, throughout the flight. Meals of good quality in comparison to other airlines using the same route.

I suggest that Swiss Airlines introduce,  SOONER THAN LATER, an Economy PLUS  section for travelers needing more leg room than  the present Economy Class can offer..

title: The perfect combination of efficiency with a really warm and friendly service.
review_text: I had a secret premonition that I was going to enjoy this flight from the very moment that I saw my air hostesses's warm and friendly greeting when boarding the plane. Swiss Airlines have recently introduced a fleet of new Bombadier 100/300 jet airliners and these offer a most comfortable ride. In addition to the excellent service, the food provided the biggest surprise of the day (even on Business Class, most airlines have "boil in the bag" cooking standards), but this flight proved to be a very welcome exception - the food was superb.

title: Always happy to fly Swiss
review_text: With the flight we had nothing to moan about. Personnel very helpful and attentive. Unfortunately we did not find the food very special, especially for business class. Would expect a bit more finesse.

title: Free ski equipment carriage and competitive fare
review_text:
Swiss do have limited slots in and out of Gatwick as opposed to Heathrow and City airports but it is great to fly on a scheduled airline with agreeable travel times to suit the passengers and not the airline.
The flight was in one of their Bombardier planes, which I understand are fairly new, and it seemed clean and comfortable with reasonable leg room. Very basic refreshments were provided on the flight but a simple buttered roll is very unexciting and not very palatable. On the other hand, the flight is only 1 1/4 hours so this is not really an issue.
Swiss are one of the few carriers to carry ski equipment free of charge in addition to normal baggage allowances, although their allowance is 23kgs and not 20kgs. Free are skis, boots and helmets (although I would not recommend that the latter goes separately in the hold). When I looked at the package price (ski equipment included) compared with other airlines, whether national or budget, I found that Swiss was by far the most competitive for my preferred departure and arrival points. I have now used them on several occasions because of this.

title: Full flights, not enough space for hand luggage
review_text:
We flew LHR to Rome via Zurich return. All four flights were nearly full so some bags were taken and put in the hold because of lack of space in cabin, fortunately no charge was made. The plane seemed a little old and seats not very comfortable (compared to Austrian Air for example).
Cabin crew were efficient, polite and friendly but the food was basic (croissant and coffee and sandwich and coffee which seem standard for short flights).
Zurich airport is very expensive.

title: great flight perfectly on time with good servie
review_text: enjoyed the flight which departed on time and arrived slightly before time (which is for me the most important thing on short haul flights). service was very friendly and all efficient.

title: LX64
review_text:
Seat 50 JK are the best seats you can get in economy class.
Make sure you pay for it when reservating your trip. Some forums say because of modification of B777 armrest doesnt go up, thats not true. Tables are stored behind seat 49row. You have plenty of space for legs. The down size is rudness and lack of food on this flight. Dlight attendantd were rude and unprofessional. Food was terrible and lack of. I would seriously think about booking Swiss again. Maybe the leg space would do it but otherwise no.
Flight LX67 from Mia-Zur was terrible also. Plane was very old, dirty. Staff was rude and snapy. Seats were broken.
Sad.

title: Comfortable Cabin with pleasant crew
review_text: The business class seats are comfortable and provides privacy. The collection of movies is good. The choice of food is excellent. The staff is helpful on all the sectors.

title: Stockholm to London City in Business
review_text:
Stockholm to London City in Business Class via Zurich. The flights were enjoyable, clean and on time. 

The downsides to Swiss are the lack of choice regarding meals. There is one option and that it is. 

Flying into LCY is big plus for me and the 1 hour stopover is more than made up when the end time saving.

title: Smooth travel on time and schedule
review_text:
Our trip to Zurich and back was without any delay or kind of trouble.
We had a pleasant trip with good seats even though we flew economy.

title: Nice airline but read my problem
review_text: We travel back and forth regularly from Birmingham UK to Orlando and have done so for 11 years. However whenever possible we traveled United Airlines changing at Newark. Unfortunately United have ceased this route. So we shopped and found a flight with Swiss Air. Good points are:- Fab price.Easy flight from BHX to Zurich, Nice clean plane. Easy connection to 2nd plane. Great staff, good food, drinks by the bucket load, nice seats. Bad points: The 2nd route from Zurich took us 11 hours and so with our flight before and door to door time we were traveling 23 hours. We need a rethink.as going back we have a 5 hour stop over (there was no choice). Fab except for journey time. The only direct people flying from BHX is Thomson on certain dates (usual kids time- when we don't want to go) and they very rarely do anything but two week flights. We travel for 4. Still journey via price just about cancels out but we will be shopping around Keith C

title: Short haul flight almost on time
review_text: Usual Swiss flight: overall high standards; usual issues with slow boarding and insufficient space for carry-on luggage.

title: Swiss efficiency and no frills
review_text:
For the last thirty+ years have flown Swiss to Zurich then onwards by train to the resort for winter sports. 

Swiss pluses: efficient, cheap if booked well in advance; good bag drop off after on-line check-in 24 hours before. Uniquely? for little extra, hold bag can be given to Swiss at Heathrow and they will send it, in parallel as you travel, direct to the hotel in Switzerland - a great bonus if changing trains or with children; only failed to arrive the same evening once in thirty+ years. Swiss rail (SBB) unbeatably efficient.

Swiss minuses: Normally flight slot late in queue at LHR - up to an hour delay this time - but mostly they manage to catch up the time in-flight. On this occasion having booked two specific seats (extra charge) the airline arbitrarily changed the seats without notice.

Altogether recommended.

title: Totally disappointing
review_text: husband and I had a return ticket Zurich-Cancun. The plane has very little space, not very comfortably. we were looking for a place to have both places. food on the plane is terrible, no taste, I have never eaten until the end, just so much to get hurt. Alcohol must be paid in addition, and I have not seen it anywhere else if the flight lasts almost 10 hours. I would like to praise the always smiling steward Samuel [-], who is always at the service. and critics would definitely give the stewardess Severine [-]. I have never seen such insolence and disrespect for the passengers so far. the flight to Zurich was delayed for an hour, I went to the plane and saw a few packs of small water bottles. I asked her to have one because I had not felt very well before, but she said they did not have them and I can not get the water. Later on she was asked me in a very disagreeable way to lift the seat for meals, when I asked her to do this and the traveler in front of me, she turned her eyes and she hardly did it. a very unpleasant experience that I have not met in all my travels so far. a good thing I can mention is that we get a voucher for food due to flight delays. There are a lot of better airline companies!!

title: Wonderful trip
review_text:
I want to take you under the wings of Swiss International Air Lines (SWISS). This is not my first time flying with Swiss International Air Lines. My first experience with this airline began at the age of 4 since the days it was known as Swiss Air.  You could say that I‚Äôm no stranger to this good airline and its hub at Zurich airport. For more than 3 decades, I have flown with this airline to Switzerland for leisure, family visits and academic purpose. 

Swiss International Air Lines operates one of the youngest and most modern fleets of aircraft in the skies today. Since the planes are so new, they are really clean. Swiss International Air Lines has won all kinds of airline awards.
In September 2017 of this year, it was another calling for me to fly under the wings of Swiss International Air Lines once again. This time, my trip flying with Swiss International Air Lines started from Bangkok to Zurich, and return on the same route. The service on the ground was excellent. The SWISS team at Bangkok office Mr. Stefan, Ms. Napaporn, and Ms. Prangthip were nice and service-minded people. At the check-in counter at Bangkok International Airport, the staffs were very energetic and the process ran smoothly. 

After checking in at the airline counter, and having passed through the emigration process, I headed for the Royal Orchid, a nice lounge with a variety of good food and quiet atmosphere. I would say that it was a perfect place to relax, and grab some drinks. Then it was time to board the Swiss International Air Lines aircraft. This one was a Boeing 777-300ER, pretty new and clean. This aircraft had 3 classes configuration: First, Business, and Economy. 

On the way from Bangkok to Zurich, I tried the Economy class. While I watched a movie, my meal was served and was delicious. During the night, there was the mini-bar where passengers could go to take snacks and drinks. 
On the way back, I gave Business Class a try. 
At Zurich Airport Lounge for Business, passengers were offered a luxurious experience equaling to any five-star boutique hotels. I enjoyed a lot of the new facility in the new lounge! It became my new favorite airline lounge that had everything you could possibly think of: comfortable chairs, many food stations, free Wi-Fi. 
Prior to takeoff, the flight attendants passed out amenity kits that have earplugs, lip balm, cream moisturizer, no-slip socks and an eye mask. The planes had mood lighting which helped you sleep better. The toilets were clean and bright with large mirrors. The seats also had built-in massagers. There were power outlets for both plugs and USB and no adaptors were needed.
Swiss International Air Lines' in-flight entertainment system was superb. You could have personal seat-back television screens. Each seat had state-of-the-art entertainment systems with various entertainment options‚Äîmovies, television, video games and music. The seat was comfortable with its automatic massaging functions.
While having a nice welcome drink before taking off, I could choose from assorted menus accompanied by plenty of Wines choices to go along splendidly with the meals. Then dessert and snack came later. Meal and beverage on the flight was excellent as usual. Later, I walked to the galley and picked up some snacks and drink from mini-bar.

Overall, I find Swiss International Air Lines delivering great service onboard. Cabin manager and team provided wonderful service. It was a good opportunity for me to meet with the nice and friendly Cabin Manager, Ms. Vanessa Ehrhart (flight Bangkok to Zurich) and the Cabin Manager Mr. Martin Nussberger (flight Zurich to Bangkok) who both took care of me during the flights. They are both very friendly and good service minded. I can say that with personnel like them in the airline business, they can be the benchmark for all other airlines to see them as role model. 
Two things which I must not forget to mention are the delicious chocolate pieces served on board and the merchandise of SWISS bags at Zurich Airport which were adorable. It was a pity that I had no time on the way back to buy some. 
I've always believed their services to be superior to their rivals in the world and nothing on my trip has changed my opinion that Swiss International Air Lines have by far the best cabin crew and ground staff around. I've already booked future flights with this favorite airline.

So in conclusion, I recommend you the ultimate choice of Swiss International Air Lines when flying! :-)

Best regards,

Dr. Vorravee Pattaravongvisut
Man on the Move

title: Nice Flight
review_text: I travel a lot from MAN back to Switzerland. The staff at MAN airport was unfriendly as ever. The people at the security check is very unpleasant and way too picky! The flight was on time and very fast. The service and staff was great as ever. Unfortunately the airplane  dosen‚Äòt connect to the Gate, it waits in the middle of the strip and you have to take the bus to the gate, every time. Swiss provides a very fast Bus exceptionally for business travelers, that‚Äôs as good as it gets.

title: Good Flight
review_text: Flying a lot from Switzerland to Manchester. I like the ZRH Airport due to short waiting times at the lines and the clean environment. The flight was a bit delayed but could catch up in the air. The service is great, with good food and decent room to work. Very friendly staff!

title: swiss efficiency
review_text:
Very efficient and friendly service, clean aeroplanes : a flight as it should be.
Too bad they're the only company operating the brussels-zurich connection, which makes the flights quite expensive

title: Love Swiss
review_text: Swiss has a promise to deliver the best service on board and to offer the most comfortable flights and they always keep their promise. I became frequent traveller flying only with Swiss international airlines and their service is amazing. The flight attendants are super friendly, the welcome you personally on board with your name. The food is really great in business class and the seats are very comfortable. The seats offer a lot of space and privacy due to their design. Swiss is my all time favourite out of every airline I‚Äôve ever flew with. The entertainment on board is great, they have great wines and the food is always local from Switzerland what I truly love because of the amazing quality. I never had a delay with Swiss international airlines :). The lounges in Z√ºrich are very good and offer a variety of food and drinks. I can always sleep perfectly on an over night service and wake up relaxed. Swiss keep it going like that you‚Äôre the best!

title: Not good Business classon short haul
review_text: Business class on this 2 hour flight was non-existent.  It was the 1990's style 3 and 3 with just a little more legroom and no entertainment.  Long haul Swiss are very good, short haul not good when you pay for business.

title: Interesting Seating Configuration
review_text: On the ground and in the air this was a totally uneventful flight, as you want them to be.  In business they have an offset seating layout so that you can get a flat bed.  I didn't particularly like it as when you tried to make the bed flat it felt like you were in a tunnel.  Otherwise everything was fine, plane was good and lounges were good.

title: The best airline i have flown so far
review_text:
Airplanes are new, we got even one right from the store.
Staff is nice and helpful, we had great experience.
They have toys for kids on the flight. Space is good, not to cramped.

title: Swiss Oficiancy!
review_text:
Our flight(s) from Tel Aviv to London Heathrow (Via Zurich) were great! Check in at Ben-Gurian Airport was easy, simple and non stressfull, followed by our 1 hour wait to board the flight. We had plenty of time on our hands to visit the washrooms, and prepare before our journey home. This took a lot of stress away from the journey, and very much appreciate that. 

Flight number 1 was on a reasonably large aircraft, (the A330) offering a TV screan , with a veriaty of movies to watch in a veriaty of languages , a main corse meal (lunch) with pudding, comfy sheets and plenty full of legroom! Swiss Air has givin me probably the most legroom on an Ecconomy seat ever! The flight was smooth, organised and was truely a pleasure to be onboard. When landing in Zurich, from the moment we touched down the runway, we were disembarking the plane into the airport terminal with in 5 minutes- this is an example of Swiss Oficiancy! The only ‚Äòdown side‚Äô to the flight was the food- which to be frank, did taste horrible- but the excellent service made up for it!

Flight number two was short-haul ,and was from Zurich to London Heathrow onboard a medium sized A321. This did not offer a TV screan, nor a meal, but the seats were comfy, and by that time, I used the comfy atmosphere as a chance to sleep. My younger sister was feeling very airsick, we informed the cabin crew, and they invited her to the back of the aircraft to eat chocolate! This somehow cured plane sickness..

Baggage claim is another example of Swiss Oficiancy! By the time we reached Heathrow Terminal 2 baggage claim, our bags had already been put through the convertible belt, and Heathrow staff collected them, and all of them were on the ground! This saved us lots of time, and I am grateful fo4 this!

title: Ok flight
review_text:
Short flight- lots of people- stuck in the middle but quick flight so tolerable
Like the free snack drink and chocolate- Iberia take note please.
Friendly staff

title: Outstanding experience
review_text: The Boeing 777 was in great shape, clean and the leg room was OK. The boarding was smooth and there was enough overhead storage space. The amount of food was impressive. They served dinner, sandwich and pizza pocket throughout the flight. In addition, the food was available in the kitchen area for the duration of the flight. I had 5 sandwiches and countless cookies. Lots of bottled water. Great experience.

title: Excellent SWISS Service
review_text:
SWISS service with charm is difficult to match!  We experienced excellent charming service along with A-1 selection of food and drinks. 
This A340-300 was spotless and we find the side by side two seat/bed configuration more spacious/comfortable than the single seat/bed offered by other airlines. It is worth remarking that the washroom on this aircraft was very modern and spacious.

title: Uncomfortable and bad service
review_text:
I don't expect much from economy, but this was worse than any other recent flight. The ,Dreamliner' should be called 'nightmare liner'. The seats are hard and uncomfortable, so much so that I would call them not fit for purpose (this is a 12 hour flght), we had exit row seats, which are even narrower. I am tall, but not particularly large and hardly fitted in the seat.
As for the service: worst ever. Other than the meals, no service at all. Never again with Swiss international!

title: Comfortable and Classy
review_text: We booked through United Airlines but were placed on a Swiss Air flight as they are Star Alliance members.  Swiss Air was comfortable, classy and affordable.  The flight staff was friendly and welcoming and their entertainment system offered a lot of selection, which was nice for the long trans-Atlantic flight.  The best part?  They give you Swiss chocolate on every flight!

title: Overnight between flight
review_text: Flew from Malaga to Zurich.  Flights were on time and comfortable.   Crew was very pleasant.   The snack and beverages that wete served were excellent.   Our connecting flight was the next morning therefore we had time to visit Old Town .  Took the train in.  Excellent way to get a taste of Zurich!

title: Excellent service
review_text: Despite a 10 minutes delay on arrival, due to heavy snow in Zurich, the flight was excellent from start to finish. Personalised service, an excellent hot breakfast (which included two options, one of which was vegetarian), extremely nice and efficient staff. This was an experience to remember. Thank you Swiss!

title: Good service - on time
review_text:
Quite comfort plane (airbus 330) good service, flight left an arrived on time.
Had no problem with the luggage for the connection flight (as well with Swiss)
The only minus is the early time of the regular flight from tlv (5:20 am)

title: Great Flight!
review_text: The flight was great, good food and beverages and good service. The plane was really clean, it was an A340-300 because they changed for one day the type of plane or else it would have been an A330-300. I still flew very well and really comfortable. I went to the Business and Economy Class to see how they were and they were as clean as the First Class. The lounge at Mumbai was really clean and I had good service to get my connecting flight to Venice and also that flight was really clean and I took Helvetic. I will take Swiss again in the future.

title: Stressful
review_text:
Unlike most European airlines Swissair operate a vv strict 8kg hand luggage policy.  I had some v valuable items which I didnt want to put into the hold.  It was stressful at check In so I had to put some of those items in the hold luggage.  I bought some duty free and a blond lady SwissAir operative then wanted to weight the bag again and insisted on putting it in the hold. This was galling as there were other people with larger cases than mine and the man infront of me me had 2 bags when the policy is 1 bag which I had adhered to.  My bag was well within the size required.  It wasn't just her doing her job it was her whole attitude.  She was just so rude.  I understand having a size requirement as the bag has to fit into the overhead locker but if the bag weighs slightly over 8kg there shd be some understanding.  Infact I wd go as far as to say that the 8kg policy shd be abandoned.  I only weigh 52kg myself so how is that fair when I was sat next to an 95kg man.  
The only food offered was croissants and cake.  There was no wheat or sugar free alternative.  I dont mind paying for food but I wd like a non grain choice

title: Great service of the luxurious class - and non stop!
review_text: Excellent, charming service, good food. super drinks and great on board entertainement. After a good night in a spacious bed-seat we got a harty breakfast served by a Thai flightattendent bringing already a touch of Thai hospitality in our morning - great we are looking forward to fly Swiss again.

title: ‚ÄúLike clockwork‚Äù
review_text:
Booked online via a comparison website, they beat BA price because they took skis and boots for free whilst BA charged!!! 
The plane was an Airbus, nice and comfortable nothing flashy. You get a roll and a drink with a nice Swiss chocolate as you leave the plane. 
One word of advice, if you check in and get your boarding card online go straight to baggage drop off desk at the airport. Don‚Äôt try and use the computer consoles in the airport this will mess up your seat booking!!!!

title: Good trends - Keep working
review_text: The new 777 is well equipped with technology - even though I still wonder why WiFi is getting disconnected over India!? The overall comfort is way better than it used to be in the old aircrafts that 777 are now gradually replacing. In order to get to a higher ranking globally you still need your staff to be consistent in service quality. You've got some really grumpy stewardesses ...

title: Smooth flight
review_text:
Polite and friendly Personnel.  Drinks and food durong The whole flight
Swiss has among others single Seats, which are as spacious as two Seats
Fligh was on time.

title: Great airline if flying to Europe
review_text:
We flew SwissAir to Prague, changing in Zurich. Great flight with lots of good food. Flight attendants were constantly bringing food and drinks and handing out chocolates.  Beautiful and friendly attendants, clean plane, and on time arrival were also benefits. 
Will definitely use again. The fare was also great‚Äîunder $800 rd trip in October.

title: Just Perfect - Great experience (always)
review_text: We travel a lot and coming back home to Switzerland starts when we enter the Swiss airplanes. The unbeatable "Gr√ºezi", the smile and professionality of the staff create the right trstworthy feeling of being home. We had again a great experience when flying back from DAR (8th of January), many thanks to SWISS, special thank you to the cabin personnel.  We are very grateful!

title: Overrated with terrible service
review_text:
One of the worst long haul flights I‚Äôve been on. I was flying solo with my toddler and am probably being more brutal in this review as I flew with Cathay Pacific, long haul, also a 10+ hr flight , the couple nights before, and in comparison, they were amazing!

Will never pay for Swiss again. The only thing good about them was the (extra ‚Ç¨70 ) for the business lounge.

Cons:
* did not prioritise my boarding although I was with a 2 year old toddler 
* did not assist with my hand luggage when embarking on the plane (Cathay rushed to my assistance and helped me with all they could!)
* they did not serve me my vegetarian meals and were inconsistent with the children‚Äôs meals
* rude flight attendants 
* need customer service training 
* old, outdated fleet 
* plus the food was unhealthy, bland and processed. I mean, I don‚Äôt expect much from flight food but this was pretty bad.
*awful entertainment selection. Glad I loaded up my own iPad for my child 
* no kids pack given out during the flight 

Pros:
* the lounge
* on time and got to our destination early
* baggage was quick to receive back 

Of all the things, the way I was treated with a small child on a long international flight was appalling. They didn‚Äôt make it a smooth and enjoyable flight and for that very reason, I will stick to Asian airlines on long haul flights! ANA, Singapore airlines, Cathay Pacific etc. all know how to treat their customers. I‚Äôd rather pay more for quality. 
First and last time for me with Swiss.

title: Pleasant uneventful flight
review_text: I have always liked Swiss Air and this was a pleasant flight with good service and very reasonable food. No complaints.

title: Best Airline to travel to Europe/ Good meal/ Top Lounge services
review_text:
Swiss air is our favorite airline company to use when comes time to travel to Europe, the meal quality and services during flight are excellent, and if you have any problem they will usually fix it quick because they care about customer and wants to keep them.

Swiss Air Lounge is upon my favourite lounge to use; service, variety, amenities, are exceptional and I think this is the Swiss Way of doing business and always keeping a high standard on everything which is very appreciated by travellers. Swiss Air Staff are reliable, efficiency and you can see they love what they do.

Swiss Arrival Lounge Zurich:
We were travelling on business class, this was the 2nd time using the arrival lounge in Zurich and the high standard and quality remain the same, very practical, if you like to sleep a little more before arrival and have breakfast at the lounge or waiting for your connecting flight.  The lounge has great variety to choose from for breakfast including cheese, cold meat, croissants, pastry, scrambled eggs, sausages, yogurt, ice cream, several choices of juice, coffee, hot chocolate, etc. The arrival lounge also offers showers, cabin if you want to get some rest before your next flight, free Wi-Fi and some isolate cabin (working areas) if you need to get some work done. They also have several computers which you can use at ease. The staff is everything you would expect from Swiss people, they are nice, happy to see you, and very helpful. I wish Swiss Air will congratulate the following employee for the outstanding service while using the arrival lounge in Zurich; Catania Gabi and Aeschlimann Anna.

Swiss Departure Lounge Zurich:
For the first time, we decided to use the Swiss departure lounge in Zurich, nothing more than WOW and perfection on every aspect, something you would expect from Swiss Air, Pasta bars made right in front of you, rice, meat, small sandwiches, soup, salad, nuts, fruit, cakes, ice cream and a large choice of beverage; alcoholic and non-alcoholic beverages. The Swiss departure lounge is definitely a great place while waiting for your flight.

title: Experience you can rely on
review_text: If you want to have predictable experience in flying,  this company is good for it. Stuarts tend to smile more than others but than again maybe its just me :)

title: Friendly professional cabin crew
review_text: Everything on the flight was well organised , right from the booking experience, the flight itself and the in flight entertainment and diembarking, well planned and the metals were great. All round good service

title: Pleasant flight
review_text:
No delays and problems with check in beside the fact that the security level in Valencia was on red alert caused by terrorist attacks in Barcelona.
Pleasant crew on board, friendly with kids. Very tasteful juice.
Fantastic chocolate on each flight - great custom.
Only negative remark - they didn't give some small presents for each kid on board, although they had given to some.

title: Premium Airline - Low Cost Service
review_text:
I travel a lot and am Star Alliance Gold Card Holder. I fly Swiss regularly and have to comment that they gradually deteriorate. Staff do not really recognise Star Gold status to start with: no priority seating on board their aircraft, no lounge access at City Airport etc... Check in is standard, cabin crew are acting like robots, seats are hard and not ergonomic and my seat was full of breadcrumbs from the previous passenger.

Moreover my luggage was lost on this SWISS direct short-haul flight LX 451 from LCY to ZRH. When reporting the loss at your SWISSPORT office in Zurich Airport the staff asked me to step back and not approach the lost luggage counter (claims have to be done at a self-service-machine now). Being a Star Alliance Gold Member I vainly looked for a specific line for Miles and More or Star GOLD card holders. The reception of staff was rude, ineffective and perky. I was not the only passenger being very upset towards your staff and their tone was DISTRESSING myself and other passengers. The situation was about to escalate when a fellow passenger was close to lose his nerves when a member of staff informed him that ‚Äúthe airline Swissair has closed down years ago ‚Ä¶.. ‚Äú - he had referred to Swissair instead of SWISS INTERNATIONAL AIRLINE.
I have to admit that I have rarely seen such a disastrous and indifferent staff behaviour with ANY airline in the past years. I felt shame for the airline when I saw how little bad behaviour can kill the image of a renowned international air carrier for an entire group of customers waiting to be helped in a desperate situation like this, regardless of their frequent flyer status which  was NOT respected anyway. 
I only got my luggage back more that 24 hours later which was annoying - however I will never be able to forget the scenario at the SWISSPORT counter at Zurich Baggage Hall a few day before Christmas.

Upon complaining with SWISS customer service I received an answer almost 6 weeks later with a shot apology. No reimbursement for costs that incurred, no good-will gesture, nothing. 

In future, I will only fly SWISS on routes with no competition and if I absolutely have to.

title: Smooth Landing
review_text: Everything about Swiss was great, from the airport terminal to the comfortable flight. All the Staff were very professional and helpful. The flight was one of the best landings yet, so smooth didn't feel a thing. Would definitely go Swiss again.

title: Swiss does its job to perfection
review_text:
Once again a superbe flight out of TLV. As mentioned in previous report i appreciate the fact that Swiss uses its A330-300 on this route on the morning/afternoon leg. ZRH - TLV - ZRH.

Great food, good cabin crew and the seat just nice to take a nap after dinner.

title: Love Swiss Business to TLV
review_text:
Swiss is one of the only airlines which fly to TLV with wide body aircraft. So no matter wether you fly Y or C class you can enjoy Swiss long haul product as its best on a A330-300.

Seats long enough, food top, crew efficient though sometimes a bit robotic. But good interaction with pax. Food is nicely presented and of good quality, especially the desserts are always divine. Nice special treat depending on the Flight Attendant: Nespresso if you ask for.

title: Same crew as day before
review_text: What a surprise to see the same crew on my flight one day later to Barcelona. Again superbe service and the crew even had time for a little chat as Business wasn't full. On time departure out of Zurich and landing on time in Barcelona.

title: Great hospitality
review_text: The crew was very professional and friendly. The flight itself was uneventful and the landing in Zurich on time. Boarding in Berlin startet a bit late due to late arrival of the aircraft but the delay was short enough to speed up and as mentioned we landed on time in Zurich. As Senator luggage comes with priority tag and in Zurich that works just to perfection to come out first.

title: Avoid at all costs
review_text: After almost a year, I am still trying to get Swiss Air to pay out under EU Regulation 261/2004 for my wife and I - something they are legally obliged to do in our circumstance. The customer service has been truly shocking - including just resending previous emails instead of responding to us. What made it even worse is this was the start of our honeymoon and Swiss Air did their best to ruin the first 48 hours. We would never recommend for anyone to use Swiss, in case they have to face the unfortunate situation of dealing with their customer services team.

title: Totally satisfied!
review_text: The most polite, smiley and helping cabin crew I've ever met! Delicious (free!) coffee and snacks (**tasty vegetable tarte!).. Excellent, quiet, fast and uneventful flight.. Recommended for sure!!! üîù‚úà

title: MAKES BA LOOK LIKE AN EXPENSIVE AIRLINE  WITH NO FRILLS...
review_text:
I was shocked at the price BA was quoting for a London Geneva flight so I tried SWISS. Not only were they MUCH cheaper but we were very pleasantly surprised by everything. Courteous service, free drinks, something to eat rounded off by a piece of Swiss chocolate before landing.  To top it all, SWISS transport your skiing equiment
free of charge unlike rip off BA who charge 65 Pounds each way.   From now on, SWISS is my airline of choice on my 6 return trips to Geneva per annum

title: The Bad and the Great Service
review_text:
Our flight from Madrid to Zurich was excellent on Swiss Airlines.  We were in a new airline & their seating space was very good.  The service was very good also.

The flight from Zurich to Johannesburg South Africa was very different.  We will start out with the bad - We had selected exit row seats for this very long flight.  When we were boarding the plane, the local crew advised us (with no advance notice of any kind) that they had moved us to another row.  They did not provide us with any explanation as to why we were moved (we did find out later that it was to accommodate a young family with an infant).  We were put in a row near the back that had the worst legroom due to the entertainment box under the seat in front of our row. It would have been better customer service had they at least had the courtesy of advising us of the need to move us.  Also, they could have actually moved two other singles to accommodate that family had they actually checked first.  The good service on the flight was the actual flight crew.  I had a medical emergency within 15 minutes of our departure from Zurich that resulted in a possible an on-board doctor advising that I be left in the back of the plane (in a crew member's jump seat with my legs propped up for the entire flight).  The crew was very accommodating & attentive to my situation.  So, I will give them praise for this excellent service.

title: Swiss International Air Lines
review_text:
Flight(s) on time, great service, super friendly and professional crew, nice food (relatively). However, the seats are super super tight, although I upgraded for extra leg room, it wasn't comfortable, specially for 17 hours flight (overall). 
The entertainment plan also have room for improvement.

title: Superb Food & Service!
review_text: This was our first trans-Atlantic flight on Swiss in many years. Quite frankly, it was the best flight experience with regard to excellent service from all cabin attendants to very fresh and delicious food and Swiss wines. We definitely recommend it highly!

title: Above and beyond customer service!
review_text: I have never written a review, but I feel the need to share the amazing experience that I have had with Swiss Airlines. I was flying Swiss from Tel Aviv, Israel to JFK, NY during the big snowstorm in NY on Jan 3, 2018. This caused my connecting flight in Zurich to be delayed and my second flight to NY to be rerouted to Chicago, where I was stuck there for a night. Swiss Airlines customer service, the whole way through, even from pilot to desk associates, was absolutely OUTSTANDING. I was so impressed. Despite the inconvenience of the storm (which is completely outside of the airlines control), the tiredness of travel, and ending up in a different final destination, I felt so taken care of and in such great hands the whole time. During our short 3 hour delay, they gave our whole flight a lunch voucher, and when we were stuck in Chicago, they put everyone up in a very nice hotel and also provided a voucher for breakfast and dinner there! I can't think of anything that they could have done better. Many of my friends were flying that same day, but through United, and they had a very different (unpleasant) experience. I hope to fly Swiss whenever I travel internationally!

title: fab service
review_text: always flying Swiss is bliss! the crew, their service are excellent. the plane we travelled in, an airbus was an older model, but still very comfortable for a night flight.

title: Smooth and punctual flight, very Swiss!
review_text: This was an early flight leaving at 06.00. With prior on line check -in which was very easy,  the baggage drop was quick and efficient. The flight moved off the stand on time and arrived in Zurich on time which is what you expect in Switzerland! The in flight refreshments were as good as most other airlines with the addition of a small packet of Swiss chocolate for each passenger which is a nice gesture. There were only 2 toilets for the economy class and one of these had a faulty door which would not close properly! In addition, the sink would not empty in the normal way. Fortunately, the flight was less than half full but if it had been full, there could have been difficulties on this A320. Otherwise the plane was clean and well presented.

title: Strange seating system
review_text: I booked this flight way in advance, and paid extra to reserve seats up the front of the aircraft, just behind Business Class. These seats were confirmed by Swiss at the time of booking. The day before we were due to fly back to Z√ºrich, Swiss sent me an email to say that unfortunately they had to re-seat us to way down the rear of the cabin. We took the trouble to drive to Hamburg Airport at the time of a Swiss flight, the day before our flight, and the kind lady managed to re-seat us again where we had originally booked. What is that all about? This isn't the first time we've paid for a service with Swiss, that has been changed at the last minute. Strange things are happend since the Germans took over.

title: A business class flight that could have been much better if the aircraft was more modern
review_text: I usually fly Lufthansa but took the Swiss flight from Delhi to Zurich to try out this airline this time. The services and food were very good, as expected, but the flight was somewhat marred by the rather aged airplane model that they deploy on this sector. Seating comfort and display screen technology has improved by miles since they built this aircraft and its a pity that this one is deployed on this otherwise rewarding sector. Also, the wine choices are fewer than on other airlines in the same class. Next time I will be back to Lufthansa, which is matchless in comfort and technology.

title: Swiss Precision & Quality
review_text: Swiss Air is one of the classier airlines. They are very committed to on-time operation, just like a Swiss Watch. The planes I‚Äôve flown are newer models. They are very clean. The seats didn‚Äôt hurt my back - like most other airlines‚Äô seats do. The food is good quality. Inflight entertainment was high quality, although the selection of movies in coach this last trip was pretty stale. Their luggage allowance is stingier than most, particularly on international flights. Fares were competitive & they offered good flight connections to a number of places that I needed to go, like MIA & LAX. I liked their pet policies too. Most of all, the entire cabin crew & staff were so nice, so thoughtful & so cheerful. Perfectly groomed & attired.

title: Fantastic
review_text: It was my first flight in business class and it was just perfect. The moment you arrived at the airport you feel special, the lounge etc. During the flight, the food, the wine, the staff and finally the seat that can get in bed, just wow!!!

title: Gina
review_text:
In 24/06/2017 I got a ticket geneva Zurich - Zurich rome with Swiss airline. I raised complaint 1707 Lx-02972 for the  airlines because of the consequences that i faced  as a result of the delay of departure of both flights geneva Zurich and Zurich rome due to technical problems in the aeroplane. 
I missed my flight rome Beirut and Instead of returning to Beirut on 24/06 an I was obliged to book a hotel and pay fees for amending my ticket in addition to transportation fees. 
At first they promised to refund my ticket then they said they‚Äôll compensate the hotel, several emails concerning this issues with customer service and refund department and quality department, and they insisted that they transferred to my bank the amount of the compensation , however in January 2018 they sent me an email that they won‚Äôt compensate  cause they realized that there is 2 ticket # under my name due to problem while reserving my ticket, how come shall a person buy 2 tickets for the same flight. 
Bad experience in the flight itself and in the service. 
I was looking to see more respect and understanding For the troubles that I faced in being stuck in airports and in  extra expenses that I had to handle.

title: Good and reliable
review_text: Flight was as, almost each time,  on time.  Good Service on board,  easy online  check in, friendly staff at gate. Swiss is known for ist punctuallity and prices it again and again.

title: Great aircraft, great staff, bad computer managing
review_text:
The Bombardier airplane is State of the Art ! Wonderful, spacious, and a beauty.
Staff is first quality in kindness and education.
The flight was quite late (over 30 min) and I though we would lose the connection in Geneva; but local staff was waiting there to guide us through a shortcut to the boarding gate ! Amazing, we arrived ahead of schedule !

The bad side: they changed our seats (row n¬∫9) for the bottom of the plane (row 38) on the seconf flight, and as I demanded an explanation they said "it's automatic computer planning" ! 

Checking in at both airports was extremely fast and comfortable, no waiting in line

title: FLIGHT
review_text: Everything about flight, plane, service was very good. First time flying with Swiss, would recommend it as a budget flight.

title: Best Business for flights within Europe
review_text: Real Champagne Duval (while other airlines serve you sparkling on EU flights), 4 courses meal with hot main dish and cheese and dedicated bus service for business class passengers at Zurich... thanks to SWISS for considering business class passengers as passengers paying AND requesting more for flying.

title: good flight but can be more better
review_text:
good staff but the chair were uncomfortable , and my TV screen was not working .
otherwise good flight and on time

title: Bad flight
review_text: Flight had 1 hour delay. The plane was a Turbo prop. DH8 and therefore very noise and unstable. Although ticket was in Business Class there was difference between economy or business and the flight was operated by Austrian. Swiss has to take care of their passengers and give good quality service. This time was really bad quality.

title: Just Irritated
review_text: My thing is if you are going to have a rule on cabin baggage, be consistent! I have been flying with the same cabin baggage on SWISS for the last 6 months. My trips are normally quite short and mostly for business and usually on business class just for that extra convenience of zipping in and out. Imagine my irritation when I get to the gate just now and they tell me the same bag I have been using on their airline for the last 6 months as carry on is not permitted because the flight is full. Mind you, I have been sitting in my seat on the flight now for the last 10 mins, I have seen countless bags, much larger than mine come on board....AND, most of the seats and overhead storage around  me are empty.

title: Swiss quality
review_text:
This is one of my favourite airlines for short haul flights. The website is very intuitive, the check-in is very simple and fast. Also the on-board service is very good and friendly. What is important - the seats and the toilets are always clean. 
All togheter flying with Swiss is always a good experience.

title: Crossing The Pond To Switzerland
review_text:
Leaving beautiful tropical sunny Florida, to arrive in the Swiss Alp Mts in the wintertime, is a culture shock. You must be prepared to enjoy the cold brisk mountain air, the feel of snowflakes on your face, and winter gear to stay warm. 
But, it is a marvelous time of the year to spend the Holiday time, and ride up the gondolas in the Engleberg "Titlis Ski Resort" to the top of the 14,000 ft. summit, to enjoy what Switzerland is all about.   Hear the jingle bells, drink the hot cocoa, and Vino, to stay warm. Swiss Airlines is #1 professional, and staff is seasoned.

title: very good flight and a very nice aircraft
review_text: generally very pleasant flight in all aspects. Very impressive aircraft: brand new Bombardier. Comparable to the usual A319 in size but feels much more roomy and comfy. Smart seats configuration. Wider aisle. Elegant interior.

title: Continuosly getting worse without dropping prices
review_text:
Flying CH-Canada multiple times per year for over 7 years, as well as plenty of other European flights, the airline offers less and less for the same price.
While pilots and their information are always topnotch, I agree that Customer Care at Swiss is non-existent. This time upon arrival in Zurich at around 6am (on-time), exhausted passengers waited around one hour for their luggage (usually in Zurich luggage arrives after a few minutes already), with no information at all. After about 5 minutes of saying 'luggage delayed', the flight disappeared completely from the luggage indication screens. Slowly but surely people asked each other what's going on, and I asked two airport employees about the state of our luggage  - they rudely told us they wouldn't work for Swiss International Airlines and thus not care about the situation. After my partner went off to find somebody at the Missing baggage counter, he came back with the response that this is due a Computer System Issue, and after I recommended that a PA announcement might be a good idea, they announced a problem with their system by speakers.
Also, apart from several broken / randomly reclining seats on this flight (has been like for years), they now force-feed Breitling-advertisement on you by IFE system (which during ads you cannot turn off), and even worse illuminate the dark night cabin with three screens constantly sliding ads by. To top it off, the IFE now has a (quite insensitive) touch screen next to the (good hand controller), thus your seat wiggles each time the passenger behind you tries to control its IFE. And yes, trying to contact Customer Care usually takes ages. But - flight fare has not changed over years.
Recently we even get split as the machine assigns far from each other seats even if you're a couple making a joint reservation (ZRH-BRU).

title: Swiss hospitaliy
review_text: Gonig back to the UK with Swiss is always good. Automated check in ensures that check in goes quicker, cabin crew are ready for you and the flight departed on time. Service on board on this flight consists of a Sandwich and a drink. The wine is ok, the sandwich with cheese is better than the Sandwich with non descriptive meat (Turkey). As always you get the little Swiss chocolate - we always ask for two, one for now and one for later :-) Groundstaff in Manchester aren't that interested in working and rather talk between each other on our return flight - contracted staff, not Swiss own employed

title: Precise like a Swiss watch
review_text: Shortest layover ever! Very good website, easy online check-in. It is easy to navigate at the airport in Zurich. The seats were comfortable, the crew was really nice, the food was good. Good selection of movies.

title: Delayed luggage for 2 days spoilt holiday
review_text:
Flight from London delayed by 40 mins. Then at Zurich it was a mad rush to get to the gate to catch connecting flight now only 20 mins or so away. No Swiss air ground staff to help navigate from one terminal to another which included a train ride. To make matter worse a security check in between manned by one staff. Chaos and passenger arguing with everyone late for their connection. Eventually out of breath we get to our gate to find out its delayed. In fact a delay of nearly two hours as apparently there were not enough de-icers to clear snow from the plane. So overall our flight was late nearly three hours. And matters got worse as our luggage did not arrive and we were told to come back to the airport two days later for the next flight.
No luggage and no clothing. We asked for some compensation and were told we could spend $100 per person and had to claimwith receipts. For two days clothing and toiletries this was not adequate and it cost to travel to and from the airport. In addition we were booked to fly Zanzibar on Wednesday morning which we had to cancel as we had no clothing. We had to pay to rebook the flight and lost one days paid hotel accommodation.
We have submitted a claim but so far have received holding reply saying Swiss air are very busy with queries and they will get back. 
Not a pleasant experience.

title: Inconsistencies with Carry on Luggage
review_text:
Traveling on Swiss Air .. I found too many inconsistencies with carry on luggage!!! 
At the gate they told me my bag was too big & made me check it .... I explained I had breakables in it they told me to remove them ! Quickly I removed what I could ... I said this bag had no ID on it ...‚Äôwe will take care of that ‚Äò & GUESS WHAT!!! 
This resulted in ... not 1 but 4 missing bags !!! We arrived in Dubai with no Clothes!!!! No bags !!! & In the same clothes for 2 days ... 
Totally disappointed üòî in Swiss Air ....they really need to lift their game ... carry on baggage is a joke people got on with much bigger bags than mine ... when I approached the staff I was met with blank stares... they didn‚Äôt dispute it .... I hope the bosses at Swiss Air read this

title: Get consistent with Cabin baggage!
review_text:
Very disappointed with Swiss Air ... and their inconsistent approach to Cabin baggage... which resulted one of my bags being taken off me & put through with 1. No identification tag on it 
2 . Breakables in it and as a result.. Broken ... no lock on it 
When I got onto the plane I see bags way bigger than mine on board . 
AND ... you guessed it ... missing bag ... not just 1 but all 4 bags my husbands as well .. arrived in Dubai we were 2 days with NO clothes .. NO underwear or tooth brush .... 
Just be aware fellow travellers of the inconsistencies with regards carry on luggage.... be aware once you get to the gate they have got you ... lift your game Swiss Air ... this is letting you down !!

title: Brilliant Experience
review_text: Brilliant short flight experience. Was nice to get a drink and snack included in the price of the flight along with a chocolate. We were also able to include our skis in our baggage check in

title: Old plane and poor service
review_text: The plane was old, the service was poor and the food was horrible. Generally for over 10 hours in business class flight you would expect a much better service

title: Not as good as people say
review_text:
We chose Swiss Air as it is supposed to be a very good airline to fly with - but on this particular journey from Manchester to Sydney we had the chance to do a direct comparison with Singapore Airlines Business Class .
We initially flew to Zurich - a short flight and so did not expect a lot . Our connection was a 5 hour wait and so we used the lounge, which was lovely and had a quiet zone with beds so you could rest . 
Our connecting flight then took us to Singapore where we changed to a code share with Singapore Airlines onwards to Sydney . 
The seats and space on Swiss Air in Business Class is not huge ( larger than economy but lacking in a feel of luxury) . We were initially separated on the flight but managed to rearrange seats together . The seats are material and the foot well allowing you to stretch out when reclining into a flat bed is very minimal. As a result it is not easy to turn.
Food arrived on a plastic tray in bowls ( not always plates) .  On the way out we didn't sleep much but these issues became significantly pronounced upon our return - asking for a cup,of tea necessitated having to mime what a cup of tea with milk was after asking for several times . Speaking English by the stewardesses was not a priority , which was surprising on an international flight and the staff frequently spoke over us inGerman as if we were not there. 
By contrast Singapore Airlines was superb - broad leather seats and plenty of space around each seat . The service was superb. Food was delivered in a personalised way and individual tables set beautifully and nothing was too much trouble . Bathrooms were clean and well stocked . The staff made your 'bed' up and this included a mattress and duvet once the seat was completely flat. I would on balance definitely go for Singapore Airlines for comfort and good service - especially when you are paying Business Class Rates .

title: Nice flight with good crew
review_text:
we flew back from Malaga after visiting Granada and enjoyed the flight with an excellent crew.
The warm lunch was tasty and nicely presented. Clean and welcoming cabin (in Swiss is always the case). The Maitre spoke a good Spanish and the entire crew was friendly and attentive.

title: Excellent service and time keeping
review_text: We booked this as part of a winter break , the whole experience was one of being pleasantly surprised We had never used this airline before the Staff and Service were first rate they even meet us at the airport to ensure we caught our connecting flights the baggage was also transferred seamlessly

title: Terrible Customer Services Department
review_text:
Do not fly Swiss if you want all your baggage to arrive. They purposely left our ski equipment off the flight due to weight issues, along with various other passengers luggage, which apparently is commonplace, as they use a tiny Fokker 100 aircraft.

It took them 2 days to deliver the missing baggage, despite them telling us it would be delivered the following day.

The only way to contact them to make a complaint and a claim is via an online form, which does not work, so basically, you can't contact them. Absolutely disgusting behavior from an airline like Swiss. Shame on you. Looks like I'll be sending a complaints letter the old fashioned way.

title: Denied boarding and forced me to buy connecting flight with Emirates
review_text:
Thanks for the birthday gift from Swiss Air. I was denied boarding at JFK airport and forced to buy connecting flight with Emirates (from Dubai to New Delhi).
I was told that I have to have Dubai visa in advance even I told them that I will be taking baggage transfer only (at Dubai airport) and not enter Dubai (I showed my connecting flight tickets with Indigo from Dubai to New Delhi). 
But staff refused to even acknowledge the Indigo Airlines and laughed at it saying "what is Indigo". After this, staff said I have to get visa for Dubai and I can't take baggage transfer at all, so I also showed the staff documents stating that if I have a valid US visa and I am an Indian citizen then I can get visa on arrival (as they were forcing me to exit the airport at Dubai).
I also shared information about my friend's tickets (Names are Dhruv Verma and Shatadiya Saha) and documents who traveled with the same Swiss flight day before I and Swiss let them go and Dhruv Verma took on arrival visa and Shatadiya Saha took baggage transfer.
After an hour-long discussion, Swiss staff at JFK forced me to but Emirates ticket from Dubai to Delhi and only then let me board the flight.
The behavior of the staff at JFK was really rude, even the staff manager (a lady) was so rude that instead of listening to my problem and help me she told me on my face that I can't travel at all.
This whole incident cost me (a student) 1000$. 
After reaching Dubai, I took normal baggage transfer and traveled with Indigo to New Delhi. (I didn't have to take any visa but due to Swiss air staff's arrogance at JFK I faced serious discomfort which also costs me 1000$).
This was really a bad experience with people from Swiss Air, I will recommend all of my friends to not travel with Swiss now on and I will do that too. I will also post my reviews everywhere online so nobody else has to face the rudeness of Swiss staff.
-----------
After more than a month I got an email saying all the lies of SWISS ground staff at JFK that I forced them to check in my baggage till delhi and that is why they forced me to buy a ticket with Emirates as they don't have any pact with Indigo Airlines.
