First of all I never asked for my baggage to be checked in till Delhi (I am uploading a ticket where I checked in my own baggage before going to airport for weighing them at counter and it shows that I checked in my baggage till dubai only) instead they said that I only have that choice, secondly if they don't have any pact with any airlines that how come its a problem of customer ? they should have handled that.

The resolution provided was just mare a formality for the sake of providing it.

title: UNCOMFORTABLE AND NARROW
review_text: I am so sorry I took a Swiss Air flight to Bangok.. It seems that the company has absolutely no respect for its customers. We spent hundreds of euros only to find out that it was not worth it. It was an absolute torture with so many people on board, too many and too narrow seats. Never again on such a long journey (12 hours), the company needs to do something about it.

title: used to be premium, now average
review_text:
As a Swiss, we once were really proud of "our" airline. For good reason because it used to be a premium airline that set standards. Feels like this is a long time ago. Don't get me wrong: Swiss isn't a bad airline, it's just average and nothing special. Main reason for me still using Swiss is that they have direct flights from Switzerland to many destinations. 
My recent experience with Swiss, a flight from ZRH to MIA, was rather disappointing. No leg room, old and worn entertainment system. This time, I only had problems getting stereo sound. On other flights, the whole system didn't work. Not having too much choice on new movies, well, this is Swiss on A340. A seat in my row was simply defective - before we even started. Since it was obvious and not a hidden problem: why didn't somebody fix it or at least not book a passenger on this seat? The flight attendants were ok but no better than this. 
All in all, Swiss would better have a look at some other airlines like Singapore, Air New Zealand, Emirates... Latest technology, quiet, spacious, friendly service. Oh, and since Swiss/Lufthansa obviously don't see a need for it: Premium Economy IS a requirement  these day and it IS very well booked. Some tall guys like me are more than willing spending a few extra bucks for more leg room but aren't willing or able paying for business.

title: No complaints
review_text: I enjoyed flying Swiss, pre flight process was smooth, no problems there. The flights were on time, clean and comfortable. The flight crew where friendly and very attentive throughout the flights. The food was good too. Zurich airport has quiet spaces to sit, good shopping and restaurant options.

title: Reasonably priced, Better Luggage Policy, NO LEG ROOM
review_text:
We were pleased to have a direct flight from Zurich to SFO.  Swiss air treats you right with individual tv/movie screens, above average meals, and friendly flight attendants. They even accepted our oversized snowboard bags at no extra charge.  My only disappointment is in the absurd closeness of seats in economy.  I am 5'4" and when the seat in front of me went backI could no longer use my laptop.  They had to put the seats up to eat meals.  It really felt like I had a seat in my face the entire trip.  

I will fly Swiss again.

title: Fly Swiss
review_text: Flights were uneventful like I prefer them. On time, service was good, seating was comfortable. The food isn't what it use to be but getting some place with luggage these days is a win.

title: Good and right service flying Economy
review_text: Swiss has the ‚Äùright‚Äù service for economy customers. You get good food and what you want to drink. We flew Z√ºrich-Miami in an Airbus plane with bad (hard) seats, not suitable for an 8 hours flight! Flying back, it was a Boeing plane, with far better seats. This goes not only for Swiss, but for other airlines long distances: Is there an issue about poor seat quality in Airbus planes in general? One minor drawback: Many films and series, but few and interesting documentaries. And perhaps not all find that documentaries about Switzerland is what they would like to most to watch....

title: Very good, but...
review_text:
I really liked flying with them and I'd probably do it again. The price was excellent, the comfort was average considered I travelled in economy class. 
The only think I didn't like was that they rescheduled the return flight. They put me and my group on SAS planes, which were also very good but I arrived two hours later, while my friends had to wait 6 hours in Bruxelles before reaching their destination!

title: Flight
review_text: Excellent service . Comfortable and enjoyable. Was able to sleep most of the flight . Had a tight connection in Zurich made it to the gate as boarding was started . Do highly recommend. Usually fly direct from Rome to Boston on Alitalia. Have flown several times Lufthansa Rome Frankfurt Boston . Service better on SWISS Air

title: Be careful if you have to make a change
review_text: I booked  a return trip but had to change my departure from London, I phoned and was given some ridiculous price which I refused and booked another flight. I kept my return.  I told the agent in a call center in India (not 100% sure of the location) what I will do.  I even phoned again before the departure date that I will not be using my seat so they could allocate it to someone else.  When I went to the checking in Geneva, they told me my ticket was not valid as I did not take the outbound trip.  Very fortunately , some lady was extremely helpful and let me used my ticket without charging me another ¬£220.  The Swiss Air call center is very poor and I would like to make sure that you do not make the same mistake as me.

title: Punctual efficient
review_text: Excellent efficiency and punctuality with great, attentive on board staff and fantastic food.  The attendants were always sensitive to their customers needs. Easy boarding and exit.

title: Efficient, Punctual, Professional & No-fuss As You'd Expect
review_text: I opted for Swiss Airlines as our flight was in January and I have discovered in the past that Swiss Air fly whatever the weather (often the only ones). Our flight was on time. Check-in was smooth with automatic check-in in advance (boarding pass sent by email). The flight was professional and calm and as comfortable as a long-haul economy-class flight (with stopover in Zurich) can be. Staff were pleasant and everything went well and more or less on time. What you expect from Swiss. No frills but super efficient and professional.

title: Bad service and ridicules cabin luggage rules
review_text: Swiss has now new rules for cabin luggage which allows only one bag with exactly 8.00kg (precise like a Swiss watch), which makes flying with them much less attractive than it was. In my last flight, between two flights, at the gate, the air hostess walked with a hand weight and checked all hand luggage , both of the people cuing and the ones sitting nearby (also those flying to other destinations were disturbed). They crew at the gate was quite hostile and cold, very unpleasant experience. As this is a new rule that nobody knew about before, many people had more than one bag, and even a hand bag was counted as an extra bag.

title: Business Class it is
review_text: Business Class was very comfortable. They had good food choices and the beverages were excellent. The FAs were very friendly.What is pretty amazing is when they ask you what language you want them to speak. Kudos to the flight crew.

title: Great flight
review_text: This is the third time I have flown Swiss air.  I paid extra for my seat on the aisle which this time I got. The flight was very fast to Zurich with an 80 minute layover.  The only problem is that you get to your final destination in the evening. This time it seemed that the seats were closer together with less leg room, but the food was very good

title: Distinguished and excellent
review_text:
Excellent and distinguished!  What more to say!
Food is excellent and ploliteness is at the rendez vous.

title: Decent
review_text: I flew with Swiss Airlines on January 23rd, 2018 from CAI to JFK with a stopover in Zurich. The staff were friendly. I sat near the emergency exit and had enough leg spacing. The staff were friendly. The only con I have is for the WIFI its very expensive and I'm not wasting $30 USD for 50MB. Otherwise good airline.

title: 11 hours of hell
review_text:
My husband and I had reserved and paid for an aisle and window seat hoping the middle seat would not be occupied.  Unfortunately, it was not to be.  The flight on a Boeing 777 was entirely full and the middle seat was occupied by a very polite but bulky athlete so very little room.  Very difficult to move around and get exercise so my feet became swollen.

I am 55 years old and have travelled to over 100 countries and have noticed the gradual deterioration in quality and service on all airlines, people are treated like cattle unless you have the funds to fly business or first.

title: Great Airline
review_text: This is our 2nd trip to Europe on Swiss Air and the level of service is just the best!. The seats are really nice with plenty of positions that make the long trip easy on the body. The airport lounge is very nice and provides everything you would want.

title: Customer Service completely incompetent
review_text:
I am outraged by the services of Swiss Airline. A real incompetence. I asked for an invoice following a flight on January 15th. A first employee told me to send an email to contactus@swiss.com and I should receive a response within 24 hours; 5 days after, still no answer. I called the French customer service, I spent 20 minutes over the phone (I have been charged 20 ‚Ç¨ for the call) with a person barely able to understand French who was unable to find my tickets and ended the conversation by telling me that she would contact her managers and call me back as soon as possible. I have never been called back, a scandal. I called again the customer service today and this time they told me that the request must be made through the website and it will take less than 24 hours. I still do not have this bill. I am trying to make an online claim for reimbursement for telephone charges but the contact form does not work.

I am outraged with these services, for a simple service such as billing request that any other company is able to provide through their website, and I would strongly advise you to choose a different company if you are doing a business trip.

title: Best Airline for foreign Travel
review_text:
Booking is always easy. Fares are more than competitive and the flight is almost always on time and comfortable.
We fly at least twice a year from BOS-WAW thru ZRH. Zurich airport is a Bonus reason to fly SWISS because this hub is easy to navigate and customs is quick and easy. Once you fly SWISS you will understand and be a customer.
The SWISS chocolate that they hand out is also a nice touch. Have a nice flight

title: Night flight
review_text: A friend and I flew to Z√ºrich with LX, a 330-300. USB sockets in chair in front of you. Average food and service but better seats than "low price" airlines.

title: Amazing service, clean and efficient
review_text: Swiss is an amazing airline, the staff from the minute you check-in to the on-board staff are always friendly, warm and profession. They are also very child friendly. An airline that actually cares about quality customer service. Oh yes unlike many other airlines, they provide free food and alcoholic drinks for short haul flights. Perhaps other airlines should take note. This

title: Excellent Service, good food
review_text: Staff is very friendly and tries to help wherever they can. Food was ok, the sandwhiches a bit dry. All in all a nice experience.

title: COMFORT OF FLYING WITH SWISS
review_text: GREAT AIRLINE As Swiss as can be. great comfort and beyond - Tasty food. service is wonderful. I have been flying Swiss since childhood and over the years they are Sweet as a good Swiss chocolate!!!

title: Good airline
review_text:
Flew to Barcelona via Zurich with swiss. Layover was short - 45 minutes but everything was well planned so i had no problems to catch next flight.
Staff is polite and chocolates amazing :). If you like them you might ask for more.

title: Always among the best
review_text: Service, food, atmosphere, everything is very good or even excellent. You may pay a bit more but you get a very good value for your money

title: New first choice to Europe!!
review_text: This is now my first choice airline to Europe. Flying on a Bombardier aircraft, the luggage space and seat space (I am over 6ft) is the best I have experienced. Service onboard is second to none. FREE ski carriage an additional benefit.

title: Holiday year end 2017
review_text: Comfortable flight,nice food and good friendly attentive crew staff.Flying more than12 hrs hrs was easy with the good movies inflight too.

title: Great flight experience
review_text:
On this flight from Zurich to Barcelona the seating was in the middle of the cabin on the left hand side.

All flight attendants have been very friendly and professional.

Is this a helpful review? Then please give me a "Thumbs up Thank FrankGeisler" by clicking the button below.

title: Swiss quality has no bounds
review_text: The Swiss Lounge at Sofia is been renovated and there is a lot of space for travelers xxx Service is at Top Level on the ground as well  as in the air xxx and it is not only for business class but for  the economy as well xxx Prices have slightly increased but are still very competitive within the Star Alliance Group xxx The staff is very well trained and speak at least English, French and German xxx Constantly offering food and beverages in Business Class and talk to the clients to meet their needs at any point of the trip xxx

title: A rare free upgrade!
review_text: I was pleasantly surprised this time to receive a totally unexpected free upgrade to business class upon boarding. Free and unexpected upgrades are hard to come by these days, so, good on Swiss for still doing things like that.

title: Good but falling behind
review_text:
Flying Swiss always feels a little bit like coming home - for the good and for the bad. If you are used to Asian service levels, you would find the service in SWISS ok, but you‚Äôll miss the charm and the smiles. 
The seating arrangement in Business Class is one of the better ones, the seats are however not the widest in class. And on other airlines you get a sort of bedcover for the night rather than just a blanket. 
When it comes to the entertainment system, that is where SWISS is currently not just falling behind but outdated. The choices are minimal and the screens small and old (in the A340). 
On the positive side, the catering is quite excellent with a nice Swiss touch. It‚Äôs in fact one of the few airlines where I am looking forward to having something to eat!
Overall it is a decent offer and a good choice if your final destination is Switzerland or nearby Europe, also because Zurich Airport is convenient for making tight connections.

title: Swiss perfection
review_text: What a pleasure to fly on Swiss International airlines . Polished , efficient staff, new aircraft made the journey seamless and pleasurable.

title: Quality Starts with Timely Response to a Customer
review_text:
At the airport when I got to the check-in counter, I was told that the flight had left-this was 40 min prior.  On questioning this it was claimed that the passengers had boarded-typically it is 20 min before.  Then I was referred to the re-booking queue.  At that point I was a no show.  I was not going to be able to make it through security, etc. 

There were five other people referred to this line after me that were supposed to be the on the same flight to Zurich-I spoke with them.  It follows if I was a no show anyone that got to the check-in counter after me for the same flight had the same status-no show.  As I stood there waiting for a manager that I was told over an hour later would not be coming, the other people were reissued tickets, no re-booking fees or penalties.  I needed to pay re-booking fees and penalties equivalent to the price of the ticket.  The next day these fees were over $800.  An observation, they had checked in online and were not minorities.

The response from Zurich customer service, be patient quality is important to them.  That was seven days ago.....  Quality starts with timely response to a customer delayed for 10 days that had to get another ticket, staff were quite rude.  I was at the airport for 5 hours and I thought a resolution was reached.  In that time other unpleasant observations were made.

title: Relaxing
review_text: Nice seats, plenty of room for personal items. I enjoyed my bed very much. Nice selection of food and drink.

title: Good service, leg room limited though
review_text:
Swiss uses the new bombardier CS 300 airliner. The positives are: good service, very polite and friendly staff, clean cabin. Good champagne and wines. Nice chocolate service !
For the rest: leg room is very tight in business class. The D seat in front sticks out and at the boarding and service times, it is pretty uncomfortable to sit there. The tight galley for the crew is also visible as they seem to struggle with the tight space around them. The bathroom was clean but the wash basin is very badly designed - when you wash the water inevitably spills out onto the floor. 
Boarding was poor - aircraft was late and we were left standing out in a queue for sometime before boarding started. No effort was made to board families or children first. There was a back door available for boarding and I do not know if that was used as it seemed every passenger came through the front door - hence the uncomfortableness in the front business class seats. Best to board the business class later when everyone has settled in. 
Food - no choice of meals. It was good but there was only a meat-potatoes meal available. 
As usual in Geneva airport, you wait hours for your baggage.

title: Lost my Luggage
review_text: Whilst getting there I had no trouble with my luggage. But whilst coming back I had done some shopping for Christmas and had a few expensive items in the bag. So coming back from Swizterland they lost that bag of mine. I waited and waited for it to turn up, checked each and every single abandoned bags in re-claim baggages and went to report it missing. I was told after filling out the necessary forms that someone should get into contact with me within 5 days or earlier if they find my bag! Of course they did not.. So the next thing I had to do was fill in yet another form regarding the missing items. Within days of filling the form in I got a text message saying they have found my bag and will be deliverying it soon.. They had to rather then fork out. It only costs them around ¬£100 to have my bag delivered then pay up. Really made me laugh. But I still gave them Average as I had no trouble flying in and out it was a plesant flight just that they lost my bag and it was during christmas time and all the gifts were in there. So that was the painful part!

title: One bad experience offsets previous average experiences
review_text: The weather might be really bad, or the Swiss Airport might be really unprepared for the cancelled flight chaos caused by bad weather But the airline could have helped probably by arranging its customers to the next available flights with a staff or a temporary signboard directing customers to go to certain gates, instead of asking customers to line in an disorganized queue that's mixed with long-haul and short distanced flight customers. With more than 500 customers, but with only 5 counters handling flight change arrangements, and each counter spent 1 hour on one long haul flight customer. I find this to be annoyingly unacceptable. I spent 8 hours standing in the queue, got my turn to the counter and arranged the last flight of the day to Brussels 30 minutes before the flight. It sounded almost fortunate in the unfortunate day caused by weather and human. However my luggage was not on the same plane. Only got my luggage received at where I stayed 20 hours later.

title: 1 of the besr
review_text: Excellent customer service throughout Nothing was to much trouble We have flown with some of the so called big names but they out shone them hands down

title: Best Airline in the World!
review_text: Swiss Airlines is the best airline I have ever flown with.  The service is outstanding, the food and beverages were flowing throughout the whole flight!  The planes are very clean.  Will definitely be flying with Swiss Air whenever I can and I highly recommend them to everyone.  Thank you for a wonderful flight.

title: Long Haul to India
review_text: Well maintained planes with good seats and excellent food service. This is not Emirates but its certainly close with plenty of space and good staff. A good positive experience but their dynamic pricing and trying to charge extra ( like seat preference) is an irritant

title: Very good, comfortable, flying assistant very nice
review_text: Very good airline company, plane was on time, flight was comfortable and enjoyable. My son got some sweets at our arrival on the plane that the airline assistant called "vitamins", that made us smile and was certainly a nice way to make us welcome and feel relaxed.

title: Very friendly staff and new plane
review_text: The staff was so very friendly on the plane, which I must say is not always the case with Swiss, I've also had very grumpy stewards and stewardesses before. On top of it the plane was brand new and it all felt very good. The food is ok, neither great nor bad. Time wise, all on time so that's another bonus point.

title: Just OK
review_text: The food and service were both very good, however the seats were less than good.  We were right next to the bathroom, so we were bothered by the constant coming and going of fliers.  It was also quite warm which mad things less than comfortable.

title: actually: "Swiss Global Airlines": do not recommend their Boeing 777-300
review_text:
The Boeing 777 - 300  Swiss Air has very narrow seats, little legroom and narrow aisles.
Everything is calculated to transport as much passengers as possible.
The configuration  in seats: 3 - 4 - 3 is over the top, especially for long distances.
In our case more than 12 hours non stop.
Sitting at an aisle watch your elbows and feet!.
Of course Swiss wants to make a profit, but this is over the limit for adult passengers.
Woud not step in this plane again.
We booked with United Airlines, but the flight was operated by Swiss:  result not at all possible to reserve seats, not even by payment en not  even by upgrade!. Only  customers who book directly bij Swiss have that privilege!

title: Flight Home from Italy
review_text: We flew home from our vacation on this airline.  It was a 777 so it was modern, which was nice.  The in flight entertainment worked well and had plenty of choices, I never ran out of shows.  Flying economy isn't ever real nice but this was one of the better experiences I've had.

title: Swiss chocolate
review_text:
One poor quiche (quite good indeed) for lunch and a glass of water when your flight takes off at 11:40 you expect a little more than this...
Friendly but not very caring staff.
Swissair is long forgotten!
